sequence: Without a doubt , the biggest waste of film of the year . This movie is poorly structured , sadistic , uninteresting , boring , and , at times, extremely boring . And this is only the first of three films that make this year an absolute waste . The only real redeeming feature in all of these films is that the acting is generally bad . It's good to see an actor who's good and has talent , but in this particular case , this is just a way to keep the budget down . This movie should have taken at least 2 to 3 times the amount of money to make it good .

I did have some expectations from this film because 1. It was a Yash raj production 2. When the songs were first shown on TV, they seemed catchy 3. The star(??!) cast was new. Well, I must tell u that I just couldn't sit through this movie. Uday, (with his red lips-what were the make up artists thinking???!) tries hard to look cool but fails miserably. I won't even get started on his acting (if u can call it that).

Right... so you have a dam, tons of water (that seems to flow really really slowly) and a small town that happens to be right underneath the dams path of destruction. Throw in a profiteering glutton, an apparently mentally unstable and disgruntled architect and his son, and then to spice things up you add a weak plot and bad acting. All in all, when you have a look at this film from a paying customers point of view... I would feel extremely peeved off if this was a pay-per-view film. If you want a laugh... then you really need to watch this film.

It is n't TOO bad , but ultimately it lacks the quality that the Australian series has.The jokes are few and far between , the songs are generic , the acting is the worst i've seen and the special effects are rubbish , i don't think it will get any better. I don't even like American television, but I can not watch this show because the plot is so stupid. The plot is that three people in their 40's meet at a diner and decide to try to have an orgy. They meet at a place where people don't go.

This film hits the heart with a reality like no other I have seen. It shows what us what we, in a democratic society, take for granted, and just what we are lucky enough not to be experiencing. The acting in the film is superb, sometimes you have to remind yourself that the movie is a dramatization, and not real life. Mr. Rickman does wonders with his role (as he does with all roles) making the interrogator fully dimensional and human. The set is incredible. It gives the feeling of 'in the round" theater.

I did n't understand the people who rated it over 5 . I think it 's a horrible film from start to finish. The way it's shot and the way the story is told, it makes me feel like I don't want to see any film. But if you can overlook that it has a lot of great scenes, great actors, a good plot. I recommend it, but only for those who are looking for a fun film that isn't too deep. I'll try to keep my review to that.

This is a movie that deserves another look -- if you have n't seen it for a while , or if you want to re-examine it for whatever reason, go for it, but do so with an open mind, and if you do, please also consider that there are a bunch of things here that I probably don't understand. If you've read my other posts about this movie, I'm not sure you can tell much difference in the way I see it, but there are a bunch of other people out there who see something entirely different.

There is something that one of the characters (the aging film director who pretends to be dead) says which may summarize all the film: "In Italy it's the dead who rule". True! This is a country without a future, in the hands of old and jaded men. And Bellocchio's cryptic portrait of the country, pivoted on the apparently senseless story of a director who has to film marriage parties to earn a living, manages to say a lot about what is not working here. But foreigners may miss the point, as it's not clearly expressed.

'Identity . . . . I am part of my surroundings and I became separate from them and it 's not possible to become one with something that is not alive, is not part of the world, that is not part of me,' he said, referring to himself in the third person. 'The only way of being one with something is by living it, by sharing it, by being part of it'." "The only way for me to be one with my own self is to let the self become one with something else.

With David Arquette starring you would immediately think this to be a stupid movie . Well , it is a great movie , and for the rest of this review I am going to tell you the whole story of why I thought it was a waste of time. In my opinion, this is a film that has very little to do with the events that unfolded in Dallas the other night and even less to say about how we should all act after what happened. But this is one of the few times in my entire life I have seen a movie so bad I could have actually cried for it.

I saw this movie with a friend who ran a marathon with me, and we both had the same feeling about it: it wasn't terribly motivating, and didn't even broach the idea of what a training schedule would look like, so that non-marathoners could have an idea of what it would take for them to train and run one. In fact there was almost zero technical information at all. I didn't expect this to be a tech-heavy instructional video, but when that info was near zero then the film just wasn't balanced, and wasn't particularly useful to non-marathoners contemplating their first run.There were other problems.

The best so-bad-it's-good movie ever made. Rudy Ray Moore is my personal hero. Whether dealing with day to day life or pimping ho's down the block, I can always look to him for inspiration and guidance. When it comes to blaxploitation, Rudy's the man. Nobody is meaner. Watch Dolemite as he and his army of all-female kung fu killers take down Mr. Big and Willie Green. Awesome plot, huh? There are so many one-liners that multiple viewings are necessary to improve your vocabulary. If you say a couple of lines from Dolemite, you are instantly cool.

I thought this movie was perfect for little girls . It was about a magical place where Genevieve and all her friends would come and play. It is a beautiful story, but the story was told as a movie rather than a song, which I find disappointing. However it is a great children’s movie that I would recommend to anyone, including grown ups. I love this movie, even though it is so short and it ends so soon. I had never seen the movie, but this was my first time ever to see this song.

It 's out of question that the real Anna Anderson was NOT Princess Anastasia . Apart from very distinctive differences in features, the portraits show two different women. How to find the real princess? The real Anastasia had no brothers, sister or any family relations. Anna Anderson was born into the British royal family on May 15th, 1869, to the youngest of three children. The first of her siblings, Princess Alice was born on November 23rd, 1870. Her father was George III and mother Princess Alexandra of Denmark.

In case you dear readers never heard, this movie was the main inspiration for last year's Samuel L. Jackson-Eugene Levy clunker The Man. This 80s-drenched buddy action-comedy pairs short 'n stubbly Billy Crystal and the late Ethiopian Shim-Shammer Gregory Hines together as some witty Chi-town cops who don't play by the rules. That's pretty much the extent of the movie. Interest is somewhat peaked by Hines' line delivery that is spookily similar to Will Smith's and by cameos of now-more-famous actors like Memento's Joe Pantoliano and "NYPD Blue's" Jimmy Smits.

I read a few reviews of the movie and got the impression that it was not as good as the previous Karate Kid installments. Although my favorite is still Karate Kid II, I felt this fourth installment of the movie series was consistent with the others and had some important lessons to share. Unlike the previous versions, the karate student is a female teenager who takes a somewhat different learning path, rather than a male teenager. Maggi finds this a little more challenging, but rises to the occasion. The plot twists are believable and predictable.

This is the Australian TV series . It is a classic . The stories and actors are excellent . Who is your favourite? Well I did like it a lot . The cast was good . I don't know who I would choose for a favourite but I liked them all . How can you describe the plot? I liked it . I think it was a bit slow . I thought there was a lot of plot going on but there wasn't really enough . It did get boring towards the end . I liked it but I think it had a lot of faults .

Following is an intriguing thriller that requires constant awareness to be completely understood. The plot has many twists and uses displaced chronology. The event sequence complicates following Following. If you are willing to pay attention, it is an exciting movie full of noir earmarks. With the running time at 70 minutes, there is a lot to take in, but the fast pace helps to keep the viewer enthralled.Bill is a lonely, untidy fellow who takes up shadowing people and seeing where they go-what they do. He is a bit too conspicuous, however, and eventually gets caught by a well dressed, clean-cut bloke named Cobb.

This movie must be exported to the rest of the world! An absolute masterpiece, with a both bizarre and grim film about four different stories from four different locations in Sweden. The one with the newly renovated hotel with the improper wooden figure of an old finance minister is absolutely the best of the four, odd story about love or career. I would love to see all four as a film on their own they can be so much more extended. Also the unique pause in the middle is something I've never seen before.Can't wait for the series (if they're doing one) or the extended DVD.

Ted Nicolaou made a lot of great horror and fantasy films . I am looking for all his films to be available for viewing. I have been unable to locate the films myself on DVD and Blu Ray. The films I am looking for should have been made with HD and I want all his films to be available. Please let me know if you have any of my films available to be viewed and please respond to my e-mail. I will need all of his films and not just some. Thanks for any help you can give me I have been trying to search for the films but without any luck.

This really is by far the worst movie I 've ever seen in my whole life ( I 'm approaching 10, but I don't think this is going to count). I have watched it twice, in theaters and online and would like to never go to see it again unless it comes out on DVD. I know that most of the review will probably be about how bad the film is, but I 'm more concerned with why I 'm so much against the film . So here it goes:

THE FILM: It is hard to believe that this movie actually was made.

Sometimes there's a film so bad that you just keep watching in awe. This is one of those films. Of course I can't help that I'm biased. I'm from Chicago so I watched the scenes closely for accuracy and I don't find Billy Crystal funny at all. And I can't stand all that English style photography(Tony Scott etc) with the smoke machine working overtime and all the flourecent, soft lighting. I suppose we're supposed to believe that Billy Crystal is really from Chicago because he wears a Cubs jersey. Oh and the plot.

In this approximately 34-second Thomas Edison-produced short, we see Annabelle Moore performing the Loie Fuller-choreographed "Serpentine Dance" in two different fantastical, flowing robes.Moore was one of the bigger stars of the late Victorian era. She was featured in a number of Edison Company shorts, including this one, which was among the first Kinetoscope films shown in London in 1894.Loie Fuller had actually patented the Serpentine Dance, which Moore performs here in robes (as well as entire frames) that are frequently hand tinted in the film, presaging one of the more common symbolic devices of the silent era.

First of all , I believe that this movie is much more appreciated by viewers who have actually read Joseph Campbell’s work. I think he was one of the most profound thinkers in my lifetime and his theories and writings on the importance of symbolism and symbols are one of my favourite subjects in film criticism. Also, for a film with a central theme that focuses on the importance of a symbol, the significance of a totem, the importance of symbols in our life and the meaning of dreams and symbolism in our lives is important.

Komodo vs. Cobra is not going to set the world on fire. It's not a hallmark of cinema history. What it is is a group of underfunded filmmakers trying to make another movie, make another paycheck, and continue to support themselves and their families. As such I give these efforts a lot of slack. I mean, come on, it has to be hard to be a Russian special effects technician. Not a lot of big budget films getting made there. BUT-- they are a dedicated bunch and more than willing to throw their all into whatever lame American monster flick needs affordable SFX.

The TV announcer who introduced this late one Saturday night said it should have won Oscars . Quite a statement. That’s because the scene is just about perfect and, if you think of it rationally, is the only thing that’s really interesting in the film. In the real life version of this movie, it might have been better to do something a little more conventional. In the TV version of The Killing (which I had not watched before I wrote this), the main story line is basically about the disappearance and presumed suicide of a wealthy and famous woman.

I love this movie, first and foremost because of Mark Wahlberg is in it and secondly because the end justifies the means. There is something about this film that sucks you in and allows you to feel all of the emotions the characters are feeling. Jen Aniston is great as the girlfriend in this movie. It takes a look at the Rockstar lifestyle that so many hardcore rockers lived back in the day (perhaps these days they have gotten just abit smarter). It takes through a rainbow of emotions and has a lot of subtle facets to allow the light through.

It's unlikely that anyone except those who adore silent films will appreciate any of the lyrical camera-work and busy (but scratchy) background score that accompanies this 1933 release. Although sound came into general use in 1928, there are no more than fifty words spoken to tell the story of a woman, unhappily married, who deserts her husband for a younger man after a romantic interlude in the woods.The most vividly photographed scene has the jealous husband giving a lift to the young man for a ride into town, proceeding to drive normally until he realizes the man is his wife's lover.

In the 1980s in wrestling the world was simple. Hulk Hogan would take on Roddy Piper, or Bobby Heenan's cronies or Ted DiBiase and come out victorious more often than not. Occasionally he would get an ally like Randy Savage in 1988, but mostly it was all about Hulk Hogan vs Bobby Heenan, and that's the way it should be.But on this night that was about to change, a new champion, a man who the WWE thought would be their man for the 90s was crowned. It didn't work out.

Nemesis Game is a mind-bending film filled with riddles, death, mystery, and philosophy. In it's simplest sense the film is about seeking answers and what happens when you've finally found them all. The search for answers leads Sarah Novak down a path that gets darker as it gets more compelling. The final answer seems more dangerous than it is worth, yet Sarah is so close to understanding it all. What would you do if you were offered the ability to finally make sense of the chaos of life?The movie was written and directed by Jesse Warn.

During filming, was Vanessa Redgrave taking mogadon? It was like she was reading from an autocue. I've seen more life in a wooden spoon. Or perhaps that was all part of the character? whatever, it was very very annoying, I kept wanting to shake the screen to hurry her up. I read the book a long time ago & didn't like much about it except that Septimus's descent into madness was very well done - but I don't think Rupert Graves showed this very well, his acting was all on the surface.

This film is absolutely appalling and awful . It 's not low budget , it 's a no budget film , it has been shot on the cheapest of cameras , the worst sound system ever built by man , the worst picture quality in movie history , the worst audio , the worst sound effects in movie history , its a terrible film , one of the worst ever made , but its worse than most, I say it is the worst ever made, but most of the time it is just bad , the worst film in the history of film .

Not good . Mostly because you do n't give a damn about what happens to all these people . Some of the worst and most tragic things happened on this earth when we did not give a damn. But you, like so many others, refuse to take any responsibility for what you did and you refuse to feel shame for it. You just can't face up to the reality of what is really happening. You are just going along with it all and hoping that nothing bad will happen. But there's a chance it will.

Hubie -- like Stanely the troll from Bluth's A Troll in Central Park -- lacks the spark of personality to be the main character that carries an entire movie. We're supposed to like him because he's nice, but that's about all he is.His character design is unappealing. The top of his head is a sort of dome that is narrower than the pudgy bottom half of his head.And penguins should not have teeth. I know that Iago the parrot in Aladdin had teeth, but maybe that worked because it made him look more like his voice actor, Gilbert Gottfried.

Over the GW is a near failure of a debut feature , and not because it 's not without trying and some interesting ideas but for a variety of reasons : 1. the plot is un-engaging or even a drag at times 2. it is over-long in spots and not nearly interesting enough in others 3. at times the writing just doesn't feel that compelling 4. the writing is too heavy handed at times 5. or is it just that the story just doesn't "click" so to speak and the ideas don't click with the characters ?

It may be , although there are still two or three I 've missed . This film constructs an interesting situation for the director , with a little story , a little atmosphere , a good cast , and a few clever twists and turns . the film features , among others , the talented and engaging michael dorn ( as he is at the time ) , who gives a strong performance . dorn plays an insurance salesman who , after one too many too many accidents , gets out of the business , and takes up residence on a lonely stretch of coast road .

I'll never understand why when a studio like Universal buys a musical it then butchers it when bringing it to screen. My first thought when seeing Ava Gardner and Robert Walker were starring I would be seeing something from MGM which did musicals best at that time. Boy was I wrong and disappointed.One Touch Of Venus which starred Mary Martin, Kenny Baker, and John Boles on Broadway ran for 567 performances in the 1943-1945 season and Gardner, Walker, and Tom Conway play the roles that Martin, Baker, and Boles did on stage. The Kurt Weill-Ogden Nash musical with book by Nash and S.J.

This is a film by Oshima , the director of the notorious `` In The Realm Of The Senses '' ( 1989 ), about a young boy's encounter with his dead parents' ghost in a hospital where they were taken in an ambulance for surgery. It's an unusual film in that there's nothing particularly scary or supernatural going on. Instead, the ghost of his mother and father is an important character, and a kind of mentor figure to the young boy. The film seems to suggest that it's better to take your chances with a bad memory than to suffer a bad memory.

This is one of the most stupid and worthless movies ever. It really does not qualify for movie status. It is VERY cheap (apparently shot on videotape), horribly acted, and just plain rotten. I could not believe how cheap and inept this piece of crap was. It looked like a home video! I mean I believe a guy I know a few houses down must have dug out his video camera and made this crap in 2 or 3 hours. It is that bad. I noticed the name from whence this cameAsylumand I will NEVER rent anything with that name on it again!!!

the worst sequel I 've ever seen . really awful songs which is upsetting considering how fantastic the first films were

I really enjoyed this series. I think the movie was very good for the most part. The music was excellent. It had some pretty good songs and the animation was very good as well. I think the problem with this movie was that it took the story and characters in the original movie and just didn't give them any more depth or development. It tried to keep up with the plotline but didn't know how to develop them anymore.

The most notable feature of this film is the chemistry between the actors , the sense of camaraderie in their friendship , the humor and the sheer joy of being in the presence of actors and actresses who at least appear to know what they are doing. The acting is very good and the direction is excellent , even if the story was written by a man and a woman, so don't expect anything other than the standard Hollywood product. I will definitely recommend it , but I think it would work better for a female audience.

Well I 'm not the world 's biggest Sondheim fan , so although I have the cast album and I think it's worth a listen, it's only when you get to the end that you really get into him. But when you 're really in to it, he is just magic. I 've seen him several times in concert and he's simply one of the best interpreters around . . . in the history of musical theatre . . . of any kind. I 'd love to see him play a musical I wrote myself, and I 'd also love to see him perform his songs on Broadway .

I would not recommend it whatsoever. It was like getting stuck in the middle row of a theater, so I couldn't leave, and watching a part porn movie (except they didn't take their clothes off - it was the body language and definitely the language). I have to say I was embarrassed. Filming was very low budget, no good dialogue. Yuck. Actors stunk except The two best characters who got killed off (?) and they were David Carradine and Dennis Hopper. The trailer for this film promised a new twist on the zombie genre : setting it in the Old West. In fact, it's a remake of an old movie about a zombie apocalypse. It also promised to have an American hero. The first thing that you'll notice is that the film has no American protagonist. There's a British character (played by Sam Worthington) but, by and large, most of the characters are foreigners. They come from different backgrounds. One character is from England and speaks with a British accent (that of a young John Cleese).

I cant believe it ! I thought this is a good sequel when Jim carry in the film has a bad attitude. It's still an enjoyable and interesting watch. Jim is a fun guy to watch, but you really get to know what the heck he thinks and feels. And it's great to see that he still can have some bad days as a character and still be a kick-ass man. And it's still a good action flick, with some good fight scenes and good camera work from the cast, including Jim.

I had never heard of this film and only got it because I am a Martin Sheen fan. Now I am stunned as to why it did not receive the praise and recognition that it truly deserves. The four characters all make you feel for them, the father trying to assert his authority, the mother still clinging to traditional family values and both trying to keep up appearances despite the total fragmentation of their family, the daughter wanting her own life and the son haunted by his experiences in Vietnam. One felt that this was a scenario that must have been played out in thousands of 'ordinary' families after Vietnam.

'The 4th Floor ' is a decidedly mediocre film starring Juliette Lewis as a young interior designer with a heck of a lot of attitude who is forced to become a babysitter to her boss' children after he goes off on a business trip in New York. This movie, with a running time of nearly two hours, is probably the worst I have seen so far this year. The story is fairly thin, and has a running time far too short to properly explore the characters or to explore the setting. While it is set in New York, it is entirely shot in the style of Los Angeles.

For me, this is another one of those films that I got to see off of the Los Angeles based "Z" Channel when it was in service. And it was another one of those movies that I saw when I was young...and learned that there was a world out there...one I did not want to accept.Moving to Los Angeles and getting to watch international cinema became quite the guilty pleasure hobby of mine and to date, no premiere channel programming has matched the "Z" Channel in its showing of international films.

Many experienced and excellent actors mixed together in an ongoing plot of an untold part of world war II on the eastern front. Characters well portrayed and unforgettable. One episode leaves you wishing for the next. Pay attention to the closing credits were the thousands of Shtrafbat battalions are listed. An untold story involving hundreds of thousands of individuals. Sometimes brutal, sometimes romantic, always filled with real people and dialog. Produced with excellent sets and camera work. Heroes and villains, criminals and priests, patriots and traitors. Portrait of people struggling to survive and overcome a most terrible time.

I found it hard to care about these characters , who were either annoying or insipid , all living their own lives , I just couldn't understand the reason for this plot , I can't say that I didn't enjoy it . However I must say that I did quite enjoy the last few episodes of the season , and even more so the ending of it all . It is the beginning of a new series , but with the new characters the show will have a chance to grow into something else . I hope it will , because right now all we've got is a formula show that is boring .

A friend brought me this movie and at first I was hesitating , the pace in the movie was so fast , it felt like the story was so slow . I watched it anyway and was surprised , the pace was really great , I would rate the movie 8.5/10. The only complaint I had was the storyline was a little bit unbelievable , for example , the scene in which the main character met his wife on the beach while on a date was quite funny and the next scene was a little weird and unrealistic .

`` Garden State '' is another of these `` indie '' -type pictures that supposedly skimp on production values for the big bucks. But, in reality, there's no way that you can find in the history of the movie business that anyone could have ever spent $10 million making something like Garden State. It's about as big and bold as a $5,000 can of beer. I mean, it's got a good soundtrack, a decent plot, some decent acting - and then there's the scene where the guy and girl hook up.

I do n't know what it is exactly , but the film is happily sitting on my shelf , with n't on top of it for some time to come ! The film is about a woman who returns to her childhood village because the son she had with her childhood sweetheart years ago has returned. When she returns, she discovers an old house that is full of secrets. One of the secrets is that her father's family is in fact from England , but her family did not want to tell her. Instead they decided to keep the secret so as to protect the family.

This film is the most traumatising and painful horror film I have ever seen in my life . To know that you have seen it and now can't stop looking at it just goes to show how wrong the British film-maker who created this film is for the horror audience . The movie is very slow in parts and there are several scenes of extreme violence but it's still very shocking to see some of the graphic violence that is present in these scenes . It's not enough to make me sick , I have seen some sick horror movies in my time but this is the worst and most disturbing of the bunch .

A film by Almodovar- sends a tingle down my spine every time. The capitalized print which opens the Spanish auteur's latest feature instantly induces memories of salacious nuns, gentle necrophiliacs, wisecracking transsexualsand I haven't even got as far as the infant-terrible's critically reviled early work. And after a beautiful opening montage, with the camera roving across a wind-swept graveyard animated by a hoard of widows feverishly scrubbing tombstones, I thought Pedro had me again under his wicked spell.Yet once my nostalgia had subsided, there was very little to fill its place.

This is a entertaingly bad b-movie . Actually it really is much better quality than a lot of b movies . The acting is so bad you can really see it . The script is pretty crap and I dont think they will be doing another one ever . The story is one I hear a lot from a lot of the people that go see this shit . I have no idea what the movie is about , but the acting and script are not worth the money . What can I say, I'm really happy I found this site, this is my first comment and my first time posting a comment .

So I decided to watch the entire Puppet Master series, and had just watched parts 1-3, which I thought were ALL excellent. They had a unique charm to them, and a certain intelligence that I really appreciated. About a year ago, I even saw Puppet Master Vs. Demonic Toys, which of course was bad, but still a terrific guilty pleasure and fun to watch.From the very beginning of this film, I knew it was in trouble. The cheesy Power Rangers-style Egyptian skull villain who watches the Puppets 'Rita Repulsa-style' through his pyramid glass came straight out of left field!

I saw this movie when I was about 12 when it came out . I recall the scariest scene was when the character played by Jack Nicholson is driving to a gas station to get a beer. At the end of the movie , we see his car drive away and he doesn't see the girl that he was going to get the beer with. At the time, I thought that meant that the woman he was going to be with would get killed. That is one scary scene . The movie was called "Poker Face."

This movie is a disaster within a disaster film . It is full of great action scenes , which are exciting . But the whole movie is dull , boring and uninteresting . I don't know what it is . I feel that this movie will be boring , I don't think this movie will entertain me . I really feel this movie to be un-entertaining for all . The script is not very good . The movie will not be great . I can see the story and the script and the action , but it is too slow. The cinematography is also very bad.

This was one of the slowest movies I have ever had the displeasure of sitting through . After the introduction , the film starts with a brief history of Nazi Germany . It then goes into the story of two young Americans who work in an office for Hitler's SA . I did not know what the SA did, but as I have said before , it seemed like it would be something very bad . The first two acts were very boring , which is probably why the rest of it was boring . When they come back to America , they work with the Allies .

One would think that with all the lavish care and expense that went into this made-for-TV movie, it would reflect something of the taste and manners of the upper class couple--Wallis Simpson and the Prince of Wales--instead of being a mawkish, unappetizing historical romance.Nor is it helped by the fact that JANE SEYMOUR and ANTHONY ANDREWS give stiff, rather uncomfortable to watch performances in which the events move much too slowly to hold attention.It's hard to understand why a star of OLIVIA DE HAVILLAND's caliber would wish to play the supporting role of Aunt Bessie since the role is so colorless she just about fades out of sight.

Abderrahmane Sissako may have known what he was doing when he made `` Bamako , '' but the rest of the continent, including the West, may not. The first two-dozen words of the movie, which premiered in Paris on Tuesday, are a description of a country in the throes of political and economic upheaval: `` Africa is in the grip of war. '' When the movie opened here, Sissako himself, dressed in a blue track suit and a black baseball cap, looked every bit the fighter, standing on the red carpet beside his wife and his brother, who have both played roles in his career.

If you thought NBC 's 10.5 was stupid , you 'll be happy to hear that FX reached into the deep end of television for a "reality" TV that 's actually a hybrid of reality TV and scripted series. In the world of reality TV, there 's always one thing everyone can agree on: That there is no one single best reality TV show, and no one single type of show. So it was with "Project Runway All Stars", the first reality TV series of its kind, and one of the most well-received series of the fall.

this is one of the stupidest movies ever, not THE stupidest mind you but one of the stupidest. This is 96 1/2 minutes of sleep inducing material. Probably Jim Varney's worst movie ever. The last 30 seconds of the film is the best and funniest part but hardly worth sitting through the whole movie for. On the other hand, if you are a die hard Jim Varney/Ernest fan, then like me, you must add this film to your collection. It does have brief, rare moments of humor, although they are few and far between.

Ineffectual, molly-coddled, self-pitying, lousy provider Jimmy Stewart is having a bad marriage to Carole Lombard. After falling on hard times, he endures a demeaning job, a fault-finding, passive-aggressive, over-bearing live-in mother who is in dire need of an epic smackdown, and an endlessly-crying baby. The movie trowels on failure and squalor to no discernible end. Do you want to watch a couple bicker with his mom for ninety minutes? Many scenes feature a shrieking baby. The movie fails to elucidate why we would want to endure the mother from hell, or why Jimmy Stewart can't grow a pair.

this movie is so bad and Hellraiser part 1 to 3 are so great. Nothing is good Bloodline... a lot of gore but without meaning and the majority of time without originality. the movie is about the past, the present (1996) and the future of the puzzle box. The creator of the box and his offspring fight against some demon but nothing link up seriously the 3 stories. Pinhead is in the movie...but it isn't Pinhead, he is just a boring bad guy who kidnap kids and kill bird, and the worse...he talk too much.

I am not familiar with the producer's other works, but this movie is a piece of crap. I never saw the MST3K version, but I can tell you, Mike and the Bots probably didn't save it. I love a grade-z movie as much as the next bad movie fan, but this was almost unwatchable.There was no credit for who did the voice of "The Dark One". Sounded a bit like Patrick Stewart at times.A group of high school students who found a junk super-8 camera in the trash heap could make a better movie than that.

"Christmas in Connecticut" is an absolute gem, and a must-see for Christmas! Elizabeth Lane, a precursor to Martha Stewart, is a magazine columnist and the ne plus ultra of homemakers--the perfect wife, mother, and domestic goddess. Only thing is, she is none of these things--a total phony. Unfortunately for her, she is about to be found out. Her publisher, Mr. Alexander Yardley (a brilliant comic turn by Sydney Greenstreet) gets the bright idea of inviting a famous war hero to Elizabeth's "perfect farm" for the Christmas holiday.

Set mostly in the back streets of Toronto NG is a dark , mysterious journey that takes the viewer into the dark , mysterious back streets of Toronto, Ontario. This is a tale of two worlds. On one side is your average everyday Joe, and the other is the underworld. It will take a little bit of an explanation to make this whole thing real, but we’re going to do our best to get you up to speed. As most of you will know, there are those in Toronto who have made their choice for the worse.

Where would Hollywood have been without Fredric March as Robert Browning or Dennis Price as Lord Byron , famous lovers of their time in the United States of the 19th century ? March was a pioneer of cinema in France and later a film director, writer, producer, and an actor. He was one of the first directors who worked for the studios and directed more than 100 films for the most renowned French studios. During that time, March created many memorable movies. His most famous is probably The Tenant (1934) and its sequel Le Cri du petit homme.

Based on the comments made so far, everyone seems to either hate this movie or love it. I think it would be fair to point out that although this is not a GREAT movie, it has its interesting moments. For one thing, it was filmed on location in Colorado (was it Breckinridge or Telluride? I can't remember, but it is in the credits). The location is absolutely stunning and spectacular. It's beautiful, even to me who lived in Colorado for several years.Next, it has Disney's penchant for wonderful character actors.

This film is terrible - honestly. The acting is terrible, the script made me cringe, the effects are completely lousy (which I usually don't mind for older films, but this was made just two years ago), and everything about it just annoys me. A few friends go out on Halloween into the woods and meet a witch and her cannibal son. Of course, before that it has the cliché "You really believe that? Ha ha ha, it's just a story" routine dragged out for a while.

This movie is a haunting telling of the life of the author and poet , Mishima . It jumps around a lot in time and places. In one place, it is at night in the forest . In another, it was the night of his murder. It is a film that explores the darkness within us and also the darkness of nature. This film gives us a real look at how people live on the outside without having to think about what it means to be alive or dead. There is no judgement, no blame, no evil, just love.

This movie is an abortive, stillborn attempt to stitch together several bad movies and make some sort of extra-bad movie. It fails at even this, since there's way too much "plot", and not nearly enough goofy puppets and ridiculous gore. Seriously, the puppets are sweet, and the guys in suits crack me up pretty good. The performances are C-grade at best and lame throughout, with special props to the Spec-Ops guy who spoke some sort of bizarre East Coast/Venusian dialect that was almost impossible to decipher. Not that you really care what he says, as only the curse words are distinct.

I enjoyed the prequels, and found the relationship between Tucker and Chan previously hilarious. RH3, however, was a re-hash of the first two without the charm or humor. I think I may have laughed once - and it was during the NGs. Tucker was exceedingly annoying in this film, and his character didn't seem to have any purpose other than to bungle everything up in the most irritating way possible. Chan is always likable, but he seemed tired in this film. I was able to predict EVERYTHING - who the villain was, who the girl was, (SPOILER ALERT) who the good-guy-turned-bad-guy was, etc.

Im warning you people out there , this is just a waste of your time . I am being honest , you have to take my word for it . I dont care about this stuff , I have been on the site for several years . They do this all the time . They are like vultures , sucking on your soul . You know you are being lied to , but do you want someone to come after you ? Of course not , that is why you are being ripped off , because you dont know who they are . So dont fall for the lies .

And obviously I did n't see it ! But looking at the cast and seeing that Doug Masters is back we'll see what that's all about. I hope that he will bring some excitement to the role he has. There have been a few others I'd like to see in an action movie. This guy may be the one ! I'll be surprised if he does not , because he can act and be believable as a man . Yes, he's been around the block, and he is a good actor. He will bring some energy into a movie.

This movie and several other movies from the 1950s with a religious overtone , such as The Robe , Quo Vadis (in which a priest is played by Peter Sellers and the movie's plot is a commentary on the story of the Holy Grail) and The Man Who Couldn't Say No (1956), have been adapted for screen. This film was written by Philip Kaufman, produced by Jerry Juhl and directed by Robert Stevenson. It was filmed in New York City in 1957 and on location in Ireland and on a soundstage at Universal Studios.

A man in blackface lands in a spaceship and meets a girl who lives in some sort of shack with a monkey. He hooks her up with a telephone, and she teaches him how to Charleston. Then they fly off in the spaceship, leaving the monkey behind. Cringe-inducing blackface aside, this short film makes no sense. I think that's the plot, but I'm not sure by a long shot. You can't tell that this is Renoir at work, despite his characteristic humanism. Good use of slow-motion, though.

Why would I say that? Because when the movie ended, I was in a good mood. So many people exclaim at the end, wow! Bruce Willis can be funny. For those of you who believe he learned how to act after the sixth sense, you must be very new to his career. He won an emmy for best actor in a comedy series before he did Die Hard. It's like saying, wow, the sky learned to deposit snow on the ground just because it's your first winter in life. The movie was hilarious.

This comment is meant mainly as a warning to the people who might be attracted to the title by its (temporarily)high user rating which I find frankly puzzling. The reasons why I didn't like this title are following:1. The directer must have had some doubts whether to make a Jackie-Chan-type of a flick or a dark Oedipian tragedy. As a result, in terms of genre, the film falls between two stools, as the tragic and comic elements clash and cancel out each other rather than make a harmonious whole.2. The characters' motives and behaviors are incoherent and unconvincing.

Rowan Atkinson delivers an unforgettable performance as the clueless Mr. Bean who never goes far without his Teddy Bear. The appeal of Mr. Bean is largely his childish behavior and innocence. We don't know if he came from the sky or another planet. He is the kind of strange character that you can't make up quite easily. He is often alone and used to it. He has a hard time communicating through speech which might be why we only hear his grunts at times. There are other characters who speak to him and he responds. The character of Mr. Bean is a mystery and still is.

I was at a friends house for Thanksgiving and watched a DVD of the movie , Eddie Monroe . I have not seen it since I bought it but it still holds up very well. This is one of those movies that has a lot going on and as much as I wanted to love it I just did not have the stomach for it. I was not bothered by the fact that it featured a black man as the main character. He was in a lot of scenes but there was so many that he did not feature that I could have done without.

A good movie for horse enthusiasts and most others . It 's a horse racing movie , and it 's a racing movie . I 'm glad to have seen it , because it is a very different horse racing movie than any I have seen yet , but also a very good one . You may not like it , you may hate it . You will enjoy it . And if you like racing as much as I do , then you will love it . The movie is a great mixture of comedy , tragedy , drama , drama , action , suspense , drama , and even drama .

Anyone who complains about Peter Jackson making movies too long should sit through this CBS "event". There's about 45 minutes of story padded by 2 hours of unnecessary subplots, featuring bland by-the-book TV drama clichés. Bad science is a staple for crappy weather disaster movies, so I'm not going to complain about that. Silly science can be fun to watch if it's executed in an amusing fashion. What kills this movie is it's 10 subplots... all of which could be excised without destroying what is supposed to be the central plot.

In the European TV industry, movies like this one are called "stickers". TV stations buy them and air them because when they wanted to buy broadcast rights to, let's say, Titanic, some not-really-blockbusters were a part of the deal.14 Hours is a story of a hospital, its employees and patients who have to face the worst flood slash storm ever. Unfortunately almost from every scene or shot one can tell that is was a low-budget film.Newborn babies are very obviously not real, there is no background action and probably the worst thing is the doctor-acting.

Okay they tell you it's real. They don't list any screenwriters or directors, but one viewing of this movie will prove to anyone - It's not real in the way you were hoping for. The speaking rarely sounds like real natural talk...but also down not sound to be scripted. (possibly loosely scripted). To me it sounded much more like they were always trying to ad-lib. (which they almost always did poorly). Therefore, they knew they were making a 'movie', not just collecting real natural footage.

This movie is about pathetic, spoiled, ego-driven winers who think they have something interesting to say, performed by pathetic, spoiled, ego-driven winers who think they are interesting. Straight from the coke-filled gutters of New York's arty farty incestuous drama scene.How so many viewers get tricked into making them think this carries any substance remains a mystery to me. Maybe they secretly long to belong too to this overpaid and overestimated 'actor guild' or maybe they have never seen a decent movie?Get out, put your hands in the dirty earth and get a real job.

Almost no cinema experience can beat a good thriller with a sense of humor . Geena Davis is a schoolteacher in New York. One day she meets a man at a party. He is funny and charismatic. She falls hard and starts spending her free time at his place. They meet often. Their relationship grows and she begins to notice he has a strange habit of sleeping with her father. One night he asks her if he may sleep with her. Geena accepts and they begin to have sex. Geena soon discovers she is pregnant and she has to decide what to do.

Please...if anybody gets the chance to read this BEFORE watching the movie, if it can be called so, refrain from it... do not waste your time!!!! I too watched this film right after finishing the book, and was seriously disappointed... the main character is basically a new made up Fanny, for she shows NO resemblance whatso ever to the book...she's so lively and laughing all the time... if there was one thing the author wanted to set on this was that she was a very shy, introverted character.... please!!!!!

This is probably Wayne 's poorest movie ; at least the poorest in which he had a starring role . This is the film that I think most of us were waiting for , but for different reasons . I didn't really understand what the fuss was all about at first , as it was only just beginning to take on life . But I soon saw why I should have seen it before I did , and I think I still like it a little , despite being a little bit let down . I just think it's an excellent film that has had it's ups and downs .

Much of the commentary on this board revolves around debating the validity of some comparison to R DOGS made on the DVD cover. Forget about all of that... This film-- er-- home movie is utterly horrendous. How can anyone with a shred of credibility claim this as being 10/10??? There is no plot, none. I couldn't believe that I spent money to rent this (more on that later) and that I had fooled myself into believing that this (based on box cover art and some sort of film fest award blurb) had potential.

Six students at a convent do the unthinkable - kill a nun who was overbearing. Now, eighteen years later, the nun's spirit is back and getting revenge for her murder.Yea, basically that's the short of it. There's more to it than that, but I still have no clue what it is. The only really cool thing is the effects on the spiritual nun, as I was pretty impressed for being a more low-budget flick. I'm also confused as to whether or not it's in English.

the boys were the most appealing things in the entire movie . the girls were lame and pathetic , i really wish the boys made a comeback and got a few good movies with them . the girls were the best part of the movie but i didn't like the story or the acting and i thought the acting was lame as well and the storyline was lame

i was bored by it and i wanted to see it on a bigger screen . but the only problem was i couldn't . it had a limited screen so i watched it for only 15 minutes then put it back .

This movie deserves a 20/10 if I could give one. "THE HOLLOW" is a great Hercule Poirot novel and the twist at the end fools most people. I am overjoyed that this movie stayed completely faithful to the novel. There was no major difference that I could spot. The only difference was that Poirot was introduced into the story earlier that in the novel. The acting was superb, and the music, as usual, was amazing quality! David Suchet is perfect in his role, and the rest of the cast is perfect in their respective roles either.

The world now seems to be in an odd stage of downsizing, in which objects such as DVD and CD players are steadily decreasing in size. It is obviously much cooler to have a smaller iPod than a larger one. This is not so with theater screens, as is the case with the IMAX, the enormous, widely-known theater system that has stunned audiences upon its release, and to this day. As long as the material's right.The main problem with 'Magnificent Desolation: Walking on the Moon 3D" is that it uses the huge screen as its main advantage.

Ken Russell directed this weird ( Not very ) erotic thriller and if I had n't known that I would have thought he made it up! I thought he was gonna make me watch the movie but he turned out to be surprisingly entertaining! It's just a weird plot, a weird concept and I found it oddly compelling. I don't want to give anything away other than that there's a love triangle at the beginning and it develops into a story of a man who comes home to discover that the wife of his dead friend has returned.

A couple of clarifying comments are in order . Herschell Gordon Lewis contributed a brief introduction to the video release of the documentary “Citizenfour” , and has asked for the video not be released. She is right to ask, and I agree that this is something that should be kept secret for now. Here is an excerpt of my response:

I don’t want this film to be a public relations exercise. I want people to have access to this information, because I want people to know what it is, how to use it in their own communities.

Oppenheimer was a GREAT series ( it was the first thing I saw Waterston in ) and it is too bad he is not still with the team, he might be one of the first to see the writing on the wall and that is the end of an era, but I am sure the team wants to keep him around for another year or two, at least to help ease his transition and allow him to get to a more important level, and that might be true, I have not heard anything to the contrary but who knows maybe the team wants him around for more than another year or 2.

Before we start , may I say I hope you 've already eaten when you 're reading this . Why? . Because it would make you a little crazy to think that I could have already written this and that I still need to do some more on the topic . It's true, after all, that we are talking about the food industry, but also about how we eat, about the food and drink we put into ourselves and about the choices we make when buying and eating those things . It could be any other food product and we'd all agree it's worth thinking about.

In watching this off and on for a few seasons , two things come to mind : One - wondering about the future, about the fate of this program. And two - watching the same guy do everything at once in his life and career. There are many things that one could say about him. That he's just like a coach, but that's not what I mean. I feel like one could say that he's the epitomy of a multi-dimensional coach. He's not a typical coach and never will be. He's got his strengths, and he's got his weakness's.

I've lost count of the times I have seen this movie, but I love it and find it very funny each time I see it. The facial expressions, slapstick humor and the timing on the jokes makes it great. The characters, especially "Nitro", "Sonar" and "Stepanik" are hilarious. I thought Kelsey Grammar, Rip Torn and Bruce Dern did a great job. In fact, I think this movie was perfectly cast. I think it does need to be released in DVD before I wear my VHS version out.

Back in the 70's, a small-time Texas filmmaker named S.F. Brownrigg directed a handful of surprisingly decent low-budget drive-in horror flicks which seem to have developed a small cult following over the years. Before viewing his first film, Don't Look In The Basement, I wasn't too sure what to expect, but I sure as hell didn't expect it to turn out to be the only Texas horror I thought was better than the Chainsaw Massacre. I don't know, this might actually be my all-time favorite horror movie.We begin in an isolated insane asylum.

I doubt whoever wrote this screenplay has ever actually read Mansfield Park ... or if they have it was not the book they adapted, so they probably didn't know who wrote it, much less who wrote it well, so I don't think they'd know what to do. I also doubt whether they'd have the confidence to put in a scene that's supposed to make people uncomfortable but which actually has the effect of making them think about a book they know very well, and a book they know even better. I think they'd want to write something that wasn't about the book.

Creepy facemasks and slasher movies have gone together like cheese and chives throughout the lengthy lifespan of the cycle. People often assume that it was John Carpenter that started the trend, but as is the case with many of the genre's clichés - the Italians did it first. Movies like Eyeball, Torso and Blood and Black Lace were the originators of a hooded maniac in a murder mystery. There were also a couple of American pre-Halloween slashers that warrant a mention. Classroom Massacre, Keep my Grave Open and Savage Weekend clearly pre-date 1978, whilst The Town that Dreaded Sundown is widely regarded as one of the first teen-kill movies.

Frank Sinatra starred in this odd little short from RKO that is now in the public domain. The film came out at about the same time the war ended and is a nice plea for religious tolerance.The film begins with Sinatra on stage singing. After leaving the stage, he walks out into the alley and finds a group of kids picking on another because of his religion. Instead of yelling at the boys (or helping them for that matter), Sinatra delivers a nice civics lesson on religious toleration and equates prejudice with fascism.

This movie was a sicky sweet cutesy romantic comedy , just the kind of movie I usually dislike but this one didn't let me down at all

I'm sorry but this movie is not up to snuff and the only reason I gave this five stars is because of its cute story but I've seen a lot of movies like this where the story is so sweet that it ruins the fun but this wasn't that case and it was such a good movie that it made me want to watch another movie with it

I'm sorry but this movie was not worth your time at all.

`` The Dresser '' is perhaps the most refined of backstage films . The film is brimming with wit and charm. This is a real treat, especially for people with no familiarity with musical theatre. It was made as a vehicle for Mary Martin, who won a Tony Award for her performance, and the performance is spectacular . It is the only film in which all the cast sing in musical style, and in this respect this is perhaps the greatest of all live performances. It also makes a fascinating study of the pressures of being a showman.

I saw Heaven 's Gate on its opening week nearly twenty years ago . Tickets were sold in advance based on the idea that the tickets would be snapped up almost instantly, but, in fact, it took a little longer than I'd hoped. In fact, more than three years later, I still don't have my ticket. So, here is my account of Heaven 's Gate 's first week at the Palace and what went on there in the days before it opened to the general public. I arrived on Friday morning just as the sun was going down.

BIG FAT LIAR , in my opinion , is an absolutely hilarious movie with a moral to it . When you are looking at this movie from the perspective of someone who had a very strong religious upbringing , your eyes will be closed and you will probably have tears running down your face , because the film is so hard hitting , so heavy handed and so real . It is not easy to be made fun of as a teenager , especially as a young man in a new religious environment . I remember my mother telling me the same thing , when I was around 11 or 12 .

The submarine used was NOT Varangian ! 'It ' was in fact two boats , P614 and P615 , both of them being commissioned on 20 March 1940. They were not Varangians , but had been converted for service in the Russian navy in the Kola Bay area of the Baltic and Black Sea, respectively. P614 had been converted to a Type I submarine, but did not get this designation until after P614's launch. P615, by contrast, received the Type I name at the same time as P614 and thus became the first fully Russian-built Type I submarine in the Baltic fleet.

I understand the purpose of the director to tell stories that aren't stories, but the way he tried to show time passing by (the couple of joggers, who first appear jogging together, than jogging with a stroller (sic! ), than the man alone...) and to link the "adventures" of the characters (the final scene, with the maid climbing a mountain seeing the big black guy on another cliff, and then seeing the boat with her former employer and saying "Oh, a boat!") were awful.

This film, for what it was set out to be, succeeded. It's a short tragic film. Although my choice of film are ones that really develop characters and their relationships, this film is meant to just give a taste, leaving you with the "what happens next" factor. After watching it, I really was wanting more, more of the characters back story, what influences they had to make them into the people they were. I think thats what the makers intended the viewing audience to think. The acting is amazing.

I really tried to like "Saw." The story was good, and I admire the breakneck pace of the way the film was shot. However, there were too many clichés and elements that while they may have looked "cool," they really made no sense.First, what I liked about the film was the overall tone of the story, and I thought the premise was fantastic. The character of The Jigsaw Killer was intriguing and reminded me of vintage Dario Argento. Danny Glover was excellent in his role as an obsessed detective, and Monica Potter was good in a thankless role as a doctor's abducted wife.

I worked on this atrocity ten years ago. Luckily for me, no one knows it because I didn't make the final cut. And when I saw the movie in the theaters, I was glad! My agents were driven nuts by the (apparently first-time) filmmakers, rewriting the script daily and changing their arrangements with the agencies just as often. They later told me that, once back in California (we shot in Atlanta), these "professionals" had 4 1/2 hours worth of footage! Even edited down to 90 minutes, it's at least twice as long as it needs to be.

`` The Love Letter '' is a somewhat pleasant , very very low-key romantic comedy in which the use of the letter "l" may be considered a running gag. "Love is just a feeling, not a thing of reason. You have to have the heart and the love of your life to know if you have it or not. And in my book, I would say that the most important element to love is passion, not love. The love affair is just an adventure, not a romance." "This movie is a must see for any fan of romance.

Now I did watch this when it first came out on VHS, and all my friends and I thought it was a pretty good movie, but then again, we were teenagers. But honestly, not that good of a movie in retrospect. Sort of a hair metal, Dokken version of Carnival of Souls. But a bad movie does not exactly mean it is unwatchable; however, this one seems to lack the charm a lot of the regular Mst3k fodder usually contains. But if it was on cable, and I was bored and drinking beer--sure, I'd watch it again.

Well , great costumes and a wonderful ` feel ' for Pre WWII Italy . But what happened here ? What is the truth about Italy’s World War Two (WWII) casualties ? How much did the Italian people pay in blood and treasure to defeat the Germans and their allies ? Why did many Italian soldiers go over to Nazi Germany in the summer of 1943 when Italy joined the alliance against Germany in September 1943 ? Why did some Italian soldiers remain faithful to the Axis side and fought with the Italians against the Allies ?

Young writers, young auteur, young cast, busload of producers, what could go wrong? Everything. Even lame is too good a description, that suggests that three of four legs were functioning, when actually, none of them were. Barely enough recycled plotline for a 48 and a half minute television hour, gratingly stretched to ninety minutes. The audience was talking back to the screen, so bad was the story. Dirty cops steal drugs from the evidence locker. How many thousands of times has this been done on television? Bad cops frame good cops.

This movie is a disaster within a disaster film. It is full of great action scenes, which are only meaningful if you throw away all sense of reality. Let's see, word to the wise, lava burns you; steam burns you. You can't stand next to lava. Diverting a minor lava flow is difficult, let alone a significant one. Scares me to think that some might actually believe what they saw in this movie.Even worse is the significant amount of talent that went into making this film. I mean the acting is actually very good.

It's hard to work up any enthusiasm for this awful cartoon-like epic that for some reason has become a cult classic. It certainly can't be because of the totally artificial look of the set designs or the limpid acting of an all-star cast. These days it's shown much too frequently on Fox Movie Channel or AMC.It pains me to report that veteran actors like Walter Pigeon and Joan Fontaine are even cast in this muddled science fiction travesty, none of which rings true. It's like watching an expensive budget being spent on a Saturday afternoon kiddie show full of cardboard characters and unconvincing dialog.

I missed the full four hour version when it was originally released in theaters because it played one week. I had to settle for seeing the shorter two and a half hour version a year or so later and was left stunned by what I saw. I left the theater thinking I had witnessed a masterpiece and wondering what the full version was like.The full version is mostly good but it has sequences that are so incredibly dull that the whole movie is pulled down and almost sinks beneath the waves.The problem is entirely in the editing which should be labeled as the final word on excess.

Unfortunately a boring flick, and obviously the only way to see it is the butchered bootleg Public Domain version, which is so blurry and dark that at times you have hard time making out where the screen is. The leading actors are a nuisance. The man spends most of his screen time trying to appear nonchalant, charming and sexy, forgetting totally what the film is about and that he is a murder suspect because of some dame who played him for a goose to start with. The dame herself merely walks through the flick, being dignified if she's not busy appearing cute.

Stealing is a crime, and these guys, Kenny Yakkel and Corbin Bernsen look like their going to get away with it. I haven't even seen this film, but not only do i know it sucks, but the fact that it steals the story of another film, or 2 films for that matter, is such bull crap (and if IMDb would allow profanity much more than just bull crap) that I become filled with rage and feel as though I should just throw myself out the window and just end it all. O.k that's a little much but stealing is worse.Ever seen Pontypool?

Pilot Mitch MacAfee ( Jeff Morrow ) sees a UFO while test flying a plane -- but nothing shows up on radar. So MacAfee decides to keep the flight brief and to the side of other planes. Just as they are taking off for their test flight, something does show up on radar! A mysterious craft with no identification on its side appears from the south, flying directly overhead and heading straight for the plane. Then the unthinkable occurs. As the alien craft passes the aircraft on its way down, a loud noise is heard coming from within the craft -- a screeching noise as if from a dying engine.

When a movie called Hell Ride comes out you expect a certain amount of biker cliché . With character names such as "The Big D" , "Slim Pickens", "Hellboy" and "Hangman" . You expect a lot of violence . And not just a bit of it , a lot . Hell Ride is supposed to feature a lot of it . And the violence itself is more of what we're used to in films of this type than any other genre . And this is the story of how Hell Ride comes to be .

I don't leave IMDb comments about films but this.... this film was bad. very bad. I fast forwarded through most of it, stopping where I hoped the acting had improved since the last scene, only to continue with the fast forwards. Formula plot -- once the obvious murderers were discounted, there was only the one left. And that was in the first five minutes. Scene by scene it felt as though I'd already read the script before because there were no surprises, no mystery. The Tori character... bad bad acting.

This picture hit the movie screens on June 6th 1980 , starring Stephen Macht as Sergeant Thor , Avery Schreiber as the Lieutenant , Steve Bartlett as a new guy called "Ziggy " and Steve Forrest as his best pal "Joe." You have to admit this was the most anticipated film for anyone who has been reading comic books for a number of months. The book "Captain America" was published in February 1979 and the first movie was in development at Warner Bros. as early as December 1978. They started filming in the last months of 1979 but it didn't go beyond principal photography in June of 1980 .

Great subject matter, director, and cast somehow adds up to a truly abysmal film, told in that flat, semi-documentary style that was so popular around the time this film was made. (And hello, this is NOT a film-noir!) The lackluster, overly complicated, over-populated story has no arc, no focus point, little excitement, and staggers from one scene to the next with no discernible purpose, other than as a valentine to the supposed and highly doubtful cooperation between the American and Mexican governments on the issue of illegal immigration.

This piece of Crap is actually the BOMB, as in Bottom of the Barrel. I can't figure out which is worst; Norris' dull portrayal of anonymity (not a great trait in an action protagonist) or Christopher Neame's hysterical overacting. This film doesn't deliver on any level what so ever. The action sequences are tame, the plot is paper thin, and the scenes that are supposed to be horrific look like a cliché from the fifties. You can't just fill a room with smoke and men in rubber suits, and expect the audience to scream in terror.Visually the film does nothing for me.

Excerpt from TV GUIDE : This week on THE LOVE BOAT , Captain Stubing has his hands full when a young lady asks for his assistance with a matter. But the question is what does Stubing do when the young woman’s life is on the line? Excerpt from TV GUIDE : In this week’s edition of THE LOVE BOAT , Captain Stubing’s first time in New Orleans has him wondering if he can find his place in this world when it is not quite what he expected. However, it won’t be for a while.

I am a longtime fan of the original of this movie ( Bella Martha/Mostly Martha ) , and everything that I have watched in the last two weeks of it, have been so good ,that I cant wait to start the 3rd movie. It is the 3rd book to a series of books that have been made into films. The series of books was released in the US in 2008 , and its first movie in 2009. The second movie was released in 2010. But I guess this movie doesnt need a third movie, at least I hope it wont be the same story as the previous two movies.

I never comment on a film , but I have to say that this was one of the worst films I have seen in quite a long time. The problem is that the film is a mess in all aspects of the production and that it is not even entertaining. The film opens with the main characters, a middle class couple, driving through the hills of the hills in their sports car. When they stop to rest the film cuts to a car accident and then the characters enter a hospital. We learn the couple has been to the doctor for some kind of health issue.

Was excited at the opening to hear part of `` Chevaliers De Sangreal '' but wanted more so I bought a copy for my wife and child who have never seen a Chevalier before in their lives. I hope that they are as excited at this time to learn more about the Order of the Sangreal as I was to finally see one. I hope that others will enjoy reading this as well. I will be glad to give a copy of the book to anybody that I know that has not already read it. Thank you for your kind words about my books.

well, what can i say. WHAT THE F**K? There really isn't much to say about this, really. The only way you would like this is if u, like me, like bad bad horror to laugh at.ACTING- VERY UNCONVINCING! Just watch the last scene with the main actresses running! Rip-off of Texas CHAINSAW MASSACRE! but in a bad way! Just awful!Gore- Really not believable. In one scene they use one of those knives which have a chunk cut out of them which fit over a body part etc.

I remember seeing this film when I was 13 years old and I fell in love with it and I was a big fan of the film and the characters I adored. My favorite character was Stacey (Heidi Holicker), because she made me laugh when she showed no interest in Fred (Cameron Dye) who really liked her and I was hoping that in the end that they would get together then her boring boyfriend, Ralphie (Christopher Murray)because he ignored her and hung out with his friends. I love the cast and the story.

This movie is a must see for any war movie buff. One of the greatest movies of all time and loaded with great quotes such as:Kilgore: If I say its safe to surf this beach Captain, then its safe to surf this beach!Kilgore: Smell that? You smell that? Lance: What? Kilgore: Napalm, son. Nothing in the world smells like that. Kilgore: I love the smell of napalm in the morning. You know, one time we had a hill bombed, for 12 hours. When it was all over, I walked up.

I usually seek to find good in movies , even the bad ones.Unfortunately this movie is one where I fail . I would recommend you to not watch it , it is just bad . There are lots of movies like it on the net , don’t pay too much attention to bad movies because bad movies are going to be over , you know , there are so many good movies you might want to watch , then you know , it will be a great experience . But this movie is one where if you watch it you’ll feel a bit like , why is it bad ?

When the noble Hanabusa clan is decimated by the usurping Samanosuke clan , loyal retainer Kogenta ( Jun Fujimaki ) is assigned by his master to lead a group of assassins to kill the head of the evil Samanosuke clan. However he finds himself at a crossroad between loyalty to his master and loyalty to the clan . When a young samurai Kogenta makes a deal with one of his childhood friends to help him out in his family’s attempt to restore their power , Kogenta discovers that the man he thought was a friend has betrayed him .

This movie deserves a 20/10 if I could give one . `` THE HOLLOW '' is a great Hercule Poirot thriller set in France in the late 1930s . It's about the mystery of the mystery woman. It's about the murder of a friend, a friend's death by poison. It's about Poirot, but it's not really his murder. And it's about the detective himself who, as usual, does all the heavy lifting . This is all well and fine, it's what Poirot and the detective do. It's the mystery story that Poirot does.

Hilary was great as julie, and Pat was once again magnificent as Mr. Miyagi, but there should have been more references towards the other three movies! I mean, come on! First off, Where's Daniel!? Miyagi makes a very brief mention of him and that's it. Daniel was his best friend and should've at least made an appearance in the movie. He could've helped Miyagi train Julie-San! On the flip side, the music stayed true to the movie though, with a little more instrumentation(Fretless Bass)to accompany the wonderfully played Pan-Flute!

The many other comments about the film say it all - just like to add that we showed it last night to a couple hundred people, and it was wonderful to see how people's reactions changed as the film progressed. The first 15 seconds or so were pretty standard, but when things start to get a little heated up, it really took the crowd by storm - and it was a great way to close out the month. Thanks to all of you who came out! And if you'd like to see it again, you can see it in full in the video above.

The first feature-length adventure of Jim Henson 's beloved muppet characters is a very competent musical comedy vehicle as Kermit the Frog and Miss Piggy meet a new, young Kermit the Frog in the guise of a college professor. "You have to go to a party and get the wrong girl. And the wrong Kermit," the professor explains to the two Kermit (of course) at the start of The Muppets Take Manhattan, the first feature length film based on the muppet characters. "You just can't say that." Kermit protests. And Kermit is always right.

This is one of the worst movies I've seen in a while. The acting was just soooo bad. Anthonie Kamerling is usually a fairly good actor, but in this film, he sounded like he was reading his text from a piece of paper. Especially his voice over was extremely wooden. Beau van Erven Dorens was completely over the top as frat boy Fraser, although this probably had more to do with the crappy dialogue. 'Ik ook van jou' is an adaptation of a book, and it seem like the makers of the film forgot that film dialogue follows different rules than literary dialogue.

The Quick and the Undead is , finally , the first movie to actually render its own storyline null and void. I’m talking about an event that occurred during production of The Dark Knight Rises (and probably The Avengers, but we’ll get to that later), when Christopher Nolan was asked what was going to happen at the beginning of the movie to set it up, and he answered, “I think we’ve been doing this for seven years now. We know what happened in the first film.

This movie is not so good as I thought it would be. There is no story whatsoever, no characters and some dialog would have been nice. The gore effects are good and it gets quite bloody at times but nothing over the top. It starts with an autopsy on a man and when that is over the scene with the girl starts. The music is a classic score and fits the movie very well. They should have made a 90 minutes version in which they could have had some time for character development so we can feel sorry for the person on the autopsy table.

Let me first state that I REALLY REALLY wanted to like this film . For the most part the actors were good but there was no chemistry and there were lots and lots of close ups which ruined any chance for me to feel that the director was interested in creating a meaningful story. In hindsight I would have liked the characters to have been more complex and have been able to see what was happening to them. I could see what the main character's were up to and their motivations. As for the secondary characters, they were just a bunch of people who needed to know what the plot was about.

"Jefferson in Paris" is a truly confounding film. It presents Thomas Jefferson (Nick Nolte) in the most unflattering light possible, painting him as a liar, racist and pedophile, yet offers not a shred of condemnation for those sins. This is the way he was, the film seems to say. End of sentence, end of movie, the door's behind you.After arriving in Paris with his daughter Patsy (Gwenyth Paltrow), Jefferson proceeds to win the heart of Maria Cosway (Greta Scacchi), the wife of a homosexual English painter (the criminally underused Simon Callow).

Conquerer of Shamballa shows what happens when creators of an Anime fail to understand what their fans want. I as a fan did not want a 1920's Evil Nazi movie. What I would have liked to see is a real final showdown between Ed and Dante, as we don't REALLY know what became of her. I also would have liked to get Ed back to his world much sooner and have him stay there, to finally get a chance to be normal. You know, raise a family with a certain blonde mechanic, that sort of thing.

Well, it took them 4 tries, but they finally got it right! In this 4th sequel to the Karate Kid franchise, the producers really hit a home run! Well first of all I applaud them for finally getting rid of Ralph Macchio. I felt he never did service to the role of the Karate Kid. I would have rather have seen Danny 'Ralph Mouth' Most in that role. Macchio turned out what proved to be the best movie in the series, and look where his career is now! Instead they put in a girl!

An obvious cash-in on the *Insert Monster Here* On A Plane gimmick, Flight Of The Living Dead is about what you'd expect it to be. The film has little or no plot, which is what you'd expect from a film of this type. Although, it is fun in parts, I must say. The Zombie-action is particularly entertaining. Once the film picks up, it never stops; the pacing is solid.The practical special effects are pretty good, but the CGI is terrible and distracting. The ending seems to leave the film open to a sequel.

Most people will consider that Yul Brynner 's greatest performance was as the ruler of Siam in THE KING AND ME (1963), but his performance was far better than the film's. To understand what makes him so remarkable, watch the film. It's worth the trip. He has been an inspiration to me ever since. The man is my all-time hero and role model. In my personal experience, he stands as the greatest man in cinema. "They say we're the same in everything, but you're just wrong, you're wrong.

I just finished up this unofficial adaptation of H.P. Lovecraft's "The Lurking Fear" that was shot in Louisiana. Outside of a few changes (names, setting), this follows the short story point by point for the first 70 minutes but then tries to inject its own "twist" ending that you could see coming from a mile away.
