Either way, it is a much better adaptation than Full Moon's THE LURKING FEAR. Too bad it is a terrible film. Director David McCormick shoots the thing with all the flair of an industrial short.

Lt. Claude (Claudio Cassinelli) and several prisoners from his sunken ship wash ashore on an island owned by Edmond Rackham (Richard Johnson). Following a few random prisoner deaths, Rackham takes in Claude and his two remaining prisoners. Luckily for everyone, Barbara Bach just happens to be on the island too! Unluckily, there are some crazy fishmen who like to kill people.This Italian produced exploiter seems to have it all - a touch of CREATURE FROM THE BLACK LAGOON mixed with DR. MOREAU with a dash of WHITE ZOMBIE voodoo and Atlantis stuff.

Having worked professionally with young girls on the run , I found this film surprisingly authentic . I would never claim to be a feminist, but the message that girls are powerful , that they should be able to be anything they want and that they are loved no matter how they look is a message I am all for. While I enjoyed this film more the first time through, I am sure there is much more to it than that and would recommend it to anyone with a strong stomach who is willing to take a few chances. This is a great film.

OK the box look interesting , the opening have great music and its kinda original , to that its all good ,but there is only a problem with the bass , there is alot of bass , the bass sound a lil bit weak, its ok, but you will hear a little bit stronger bass when its in live mode , its still a good box i think, the box is light , but it has alot of bass . all in all a good buy ,

If I had to give a single, I would say its an OK box with a good bass.

I have always loved old movies but this is one of my top ten favorites ... it has all the ingredients to be just right for a movie. I have watched it twice now. It was not a favorite, but is now my favorite of all time. The plot is simple enough for you to get the whole story. It makes you love the characters and the actors. The acting is superb, you really feel the pain of every moment. I love this movie as it makes you feel the beauty of the world that we experience in our lives.

With its few touches of surrealism , LWHTRB works as low-grade horror , but as a major follow-up statement to his debut, we can't help but wonder if it actually does the same thing in a more effective way. The story follows three friends as they explore an old abandoned house in a small town. After an unfortunate encounter with a strange man in an elevator, they realize there may be more going on than they first believed. As they venture deeper into the house, the walls start to close in and their friendship begins to fade.

I first saw this movie in the theater. I was 10. I just watched it a second time and I must say it was amazing. The music, the dancing, the acting. It is a great story and told extremely well. I fell absolutely in love with Treat Williams when I was a kid after seeing him in this movie. One of my favorite parts was when his mom kept yelling at him to give her his pants, and then finally said "how much do you need"? (money). That was classic. ; ).

Is it possible for a movie to get any worse than this ? There 's a bunch of apes wandering in the wilderness and they need to build a school for them but it turns out the school is made of stone, so they start to fight with the stone and things start to go awry. How they get out of their predicament is left up to the viewer but it does have to be one heck of a watch to see it all unfold in such a fashion. This isn't even the worst movie of the year but it's quite the embarrassment.

I just called my brother Paulie on the phone and he said he was watching Hoods and it was funny. So, like I said, never go against the family! The demand for more lines is OK since I like to express my own opinions quite frequently. If something is misspelled it's most likely my eyesight and not my brain. This gives me yet another chance to take my shots at "The Departed". When one knows exactly what is going to happen in the last scene with no prior knowledge, that usually means it wasn't all that suspenseful.

Naturally Sadie sucks big time , I have no idea what the people were thinking about when they wrote this but they sure did it to good effect

__________________

The difference between a real man and the man without a gun is the man with the gun is faster... and has more bullets

I think they did a good job on this, but the ending is kind of lackluster, IMO. It seems that there were a lot of loose ends left hanging for at least half the book to wrap up and resolve, which is not exactly the case in this book.

This was a nice film. It had a interesting storyline, that was executed pretty well in the later part of the film. The storyline kinda reminded me of The City of God. But this one is done in a more nicer way in comparison. It had what i really loved:a tinge of surrealism. Some pretty interesting cinematography (thru the wooden camera) I'm not sure if it was culturally correct, but it definitely widens you're view of south Africa. The actors were good (for 1st timers, most of them anyway), i especially liked Estelle character, which made this movie pretty enjoyable.

Distributor: GOODTIMES home video Plot: A pretty high school student is marked for unrelenting terror in this suspense filled made for TV movie. Gail Osborne is new in town. She makes friends, has a boyfriend and everything seems to be going her way. That is until she gets an ominous and frightening phone call while babysitting. After more and more phone calls, she is raped. throughout most of the movie, she tries to find proof that the person did rape her.Audio/Video: This 1987 VHS edition from Goodtimes stinks.

THE AFFAIR is a very bad TV movie from the 1970s starring the then-husband-wife team of Robert Wagner and Natalie Wood, and produced by and starring James Goldstone and James Earl Jones, who starred in it. I’d seen this movie on DVD many years ago when I was too young to remember anything about it, and had no recollection of it ever bothering me or giving me much concern, until a friend asked me recently if I remembered it. “I remember this from way back!” I said. If you’ve never seen it you’ve missed out on something pretty special.

I was so excited to finally watch "Pulse" after receiving it from Amazon, and I have to say I was utterly disappointed. I perhaps think I was too hyped up. I had expectations set by its fans that simply couldn't be met. After loving other Asian horrors, I thought I knew this would find a place in my heart.The story was slow, painfully so. I am a diverse fan of horror. I love the brutal, bloody craziness of "The Devil's Rejects" and I love equally the steady, growing macabre of "A Tale of Two Sisters".

I am appalled to see that so many people have given positive reviews for this `` film '' . This is one of my all time favorite movies from the 70s. It won an Oscar, it is one of the best horror movies ever made, it had great music and soundtracks that just make the film all the more special. This is why the movie will be one of the top 20 most watched movies of ALL TIME. The film starts out in San Diego in the mid to late 70s, and is based on Stephen King's famous novel The Shining.

Another movie that makes the story of The Beach Boys worse than it is . I especially remember the scene in the movie in which Brian Wilson is playing a piano with his mouth. In real life, he was constantly doing that. That is why when someone would call him for something, he would always say, "I don't know, what do you want me to do?" because his voice was coming out all weird. I know people that love to talk on the phone. I never like to talk on the telephone, however, I enjoy listening to music over the phone.

This is a rip-off of already crappy hollywood movies like Scream and I Know What You Did Last Summer. The story is classic, some high-school students tries a prank on the class' asthmatic misfit but something goes wrong. Terribly wrong. When you watch the movie you know what'll happen before it happens all the time, not good if a movie tries to be scary. The actors are quite ok and the girls are cute (after all, they're asian) so i'll give it two out of five on the mojave'o'meter.

Well Folks , this is another stereotypic portrayla of Gay life however , the additional downside includes poor acting , in addition to bad writing and the plot is so contrived that even the characters are too bland . So what do I really mean with this? Well , first , it is just a shame for the gay community that there are still such people out there who think that a gay male can be a real life , complete man in all respects and yet have no understanding of what homosexuality really means in terms of self respect and dignity .

In the twilight years of his career, Charles Bronson forged long-running partnerships with several directors, most notably J. Lee Thompson and Michael Winner. He did two films for one-time Bond director Peter Hunt too - the first being the decent 1981 actioner Death Hunt, the second being this indifferent political chase thriller. Assassination is pretty dull if truth be known, and come the end you'll find yourself longing for something with a bit more passion and pace, like The Wilby Conspiracy for instance (which, plotwise, this film resembles).

The Detonator is set in Bucharest where some sort of ex CIA Government agent named Sonni Griffith (Wesley Snipes) has tracked down a arms dealer named Dimitru (Matthew Leitch), things go wrong though & Dimitru finds out that Sonni is working for the US Government. After a big shoot-out most of Dimitru's men have been killed by Sonni which the local Romanian police force are unhappy about, top man Flint (Michael Brandon) decides to send Sonni back to the US & at the same time protect a woman named Nadia Cominski (Silvia Colloca) who is also being sent back to the US.

I have no idea why people are so crazy about the show. It is so boring. The jokes are not even close to what we usually say funny. It's like, Alex say something that is not funny nor interesting and then suddenly there's a laughing sound background. My friend and I just looked at each other with blank look as if we asked each other, "What's so funny?!!". Seriously, every time we watched that show, you wouldn't hear any laughing or coughing. Just a blank look. So we stop watching it.

Rarely does a film capture such intense drama and emotion . What makes this film so unsettling is that the viewer is left with the feeling it is happening right now . The only thing that will make the film tolerable for those who are not sensitive to it is if the film can be played in a darkened theater . This film would have to be for those who want to have nightmares . For anyone that has never watched this film before , the film is a must see . This film is a must to be watched . The fact that it is not rated makes it even more horrifying .

Without a shadow of a doubt this is and probably will always be the worst film i have ever had the displeasure of viewing in my life. i have a lot of anger in this review, the first paragraph of this review is an excellent example of how much anger i have over what i just saw. i don't care about this movie, i was never a fan of this movie even though i had never watched it, i was always an avid fan of the tv show because i wanted to see how far they could take this storyline. but this movie just sucked.

The film successfully gives a graphic portrayal of the suffering of forced sex labour , but nothing more . The film itself may have been a political statement but the film was nothing more . Instead , we get a movie with a good story line but lacking in substance . As far as I am concerned the film was made for the masses to watch . It is a film which should have been taken up by all news channels . But why did the makers choose the wrong channels ? Why did the makers miss the chance to do something which would have got more coverage by the channels ?

Aside from the fact that this movie was filmed mostly in Rockport MA, which is a beautiful town where my mother once rented a small storefront and I spent many a pleasant summer as a child, it is fun and cute little film. I must admit that I had no desire to actually see this movie even though I have a weakspot for romantic comedies (I don't know why). The trailers I saw were not appealing, the cast did not look that interesting and I had no idea what the plot would be about.

A few years ago I saw The Scent of Green Papayas by the same director . My feelings about both the movie and the book are so complex and complex. I love the book. I think it is a really great story, full of interesting characters. I like this movie so much that I am not even going to bother discussing it, because I know you will hate me. I am sorry if this means that my review will be a mess. Let’s just move right along with this review. But first let’s get the plot started.

This film has some pretty gorey parts like a boob getting bit off and a other big bites . Castle of Crows was very creepy and you can see the monsters in this film. I liked this film and I enjoyed it a lot. I think that if you want to watch a really good horror movie with great special effects and well directed, then this film should be on your movie list. I’m looking forward for the next movie in the series. I’m not sure about some of the reviews that say that this movie has no plot and no action.

I would assume that this film would get rave reviews in Canada--particularly in Quebec. That's because the Canadians have traditionally loved hockey and the Montreal Canadians were like gods in Canada for decades. As an American, the closest thing we have to them are the New York Yankees. If you are a fan, then they are the greatest and winningest team in history. If you are not a fan, then they are Satan's team!! Well, at least that's how it was as I grew up in Washington, DC in regard to the Dallas Cowboys.

I saw this last night in Fort Lauderdale. In general it was funny and I liked the characters especially Sabrina. The acting is good and the story line was OK except for the ending which left way to many strings dangling and we were like (what?) I wanted to know what happened to the characters and it was a strange ending that could have been done so much better.The film did portray rule life really well and we laughed throughout. It has flaws that is for sure but for a first time film for Ash Christian I thought it was good.

Ben Marshall , a teen ager from a religious background , is made aware about the financial situation at home and decides to run away from home to see the world. But he finds that his family is not who he thought they were, and he has to find a way to live a normal life after being away from home for a long period of time. It's been 3 years since I was forced to quit smoking and I have been doing very well. After I quit smoking I have never smoked a day since. I had been feeling so depressed after I quit for a couple of years.

I'd heard about this movie, but didn't see it until my daughter, who saw it on a flight to Australia, told me it was a great movie. I was interested in seeing whether Rupert Grint, away from Harry Potter, was showing the promise you see in the Potter movies. I wasn't disappointed. He's become a fine actor, showing a range in Driving Lessons from a shy boy being beaten down by an over-bearing obsessive mother, to a young man finding himself to be worthy of his own, and other's, esteem.

Probably because this is Columbia's first film in color, the colors look different specially in the indoor scenes. They seem to be stronger, sharper and the result is a bit unrealistic, but very pleasing. Randolph Scott is the sheriff, a good guy but the real star of the movie is a very young Glenn Ford, who is an outlaw that wants to change. Evelyn Keyes is the woman that starts falling for Ford and Claire Trevor is the Countess that runs the saloon. There is a funny character called Nitro that does not think twice before blowing it.

As the metaphoric flies fled this steaming watery stool of a film i found myself longing to join them.From the opening sentences, you quickly gather that the actors are talentless. The script editor was probably dead and the director should be. To be honest I didn't manage to finish this film because about twenty dismal minutes in the sight of the main actress scuttling across the floor like a Shetland pony that has been shot in the ass was too much for me to stomach.I have never, and I mean never, seen a film as sweaty as this one and I watch tons of crap films.Turd.

Heftig og Begeistret ( Intense and Enthusiastic ) is a documentary-like story of a male choir up in Berlevåg in the north of Denmark. The film follows the choir through their lives, from childhood into adulthood, taking the viewer on a rollercoaster of experiences in their quest of creating their own music. Their music is characterized by the choir’s very unique sound, but also the characters they share, and how their stories are interlinked through the choir. Story
The story takes place mostly in a group of five boys from a very religious and well-connected family.

Okay , so writer/director Larry Bishop obviously has some important connections and knows the right people in Hollywood in order to get a movie made. But does he have the talent and vision to get a great movie made? Let's look at some of the talent attached to the project, shall we? Alfonso Cuaron

Let's begin with Mr. Cuaron, the director of Gravity, Gravity and Gravity 2. I'm a big fan and have seen every one of his films, but his directorial debut has yet to be a hit in theaters.

I have to say this is the worst movie that I have ever watched in my life, I cannot believe that I wasted $10 at blockbuster ; this movie should be burned and who ever thought of it has issues. Who ever actually spent money to make this movie was insane =D This movie has TERRIBLE actors and some of the scenes make absolutely no sense. Well, the whole movie doesn't make sense. Also the part where those "men" come into the diner ( department of national securities )that happened to be the worst part of the film.

So what is one to do if you are a porno star with fading looks? I know, become a pop star! This documentary - and I use the term loosely - follows the trials and tribulations of Colton as he tries to transform himself from a gay porn star into a singer of electronic (read: dance) music. I only wish Mr Ford's voice was as muscular as his arms...sorry to say his vocals are painfully thin. There isn't much interesting going on here but Mr Ford and friends are eye candy.See him record a song that sounds exactly like every other mindless dance tune.

Ever since I first encountered the Divine Ms Merkerson as a sex therapist in Spike Lee's "She's Gotta Have It" I have been sold on the range of this exceedingly gifted yet terribly underrated actress. She received an Emmy for her portrayal here and to say it is well-deserved is a masterpiece of understatement.Here she simply shines as THE guiding force and hand in her community. This was especially poignant for me for I grew up in this very same time period. The production detail was phenomenal and evoked wooooooooooooooonderful memories of life and times during the 50s & 60s and of women like Ms Merkerson portrayed.

This movie was a major bait and switch . I rented it because of Rebecca St. James , a popular actress , who plays a sexy femme fatale who has to seduce the men she encounters in her daily life. I wanted to see if it would have worked as a movie. The movie has everything that a woman could want except a loving husband . So what does that mean in the real world ? It means being a free woman with no strings attached. This movie starts off with Rebecca in her bedroom , naked . She has sex with two guys , one in the street and the other at her apartment.

A lot of 'alternative ' comedy in Britain in the 1980s was insular , misguided , overly-political , and unfunny . It all went hand in hand with the rise of the Thatcher governments of the 1980s and 1990s which saw the demise of many of the traditional liberal arts institutions on which British cultural policy was based. Of course, it's only fair to point out that, in many ways, the cultural policy of the present day is not that different from the cultural policy of the 1980s. So it's hardly surprising that there's still a great deal of humour to be found.

Everyone knows that late night movies aren't Oscar contenders. Fine. I mean I'll admit that I was a bit tipsy and bored and figured I'd get to some skin-a-max. It's pretty bad when the info on the TV guide channel makes fun of the movie in the description. It even gave it half a star. To be fair, I did sit throw the whole thing cause man it was soooooooooo bad. I couldn't stop laughing. I mean the words coming out of these people mouth and how they were trying to be serious.

This is a magnificent , and in many ways impressive film . I saw it on TV as a little kid, and was so fascinated that I asked my mother to buy it for me. When I finally managed to take my mother to see it, I was amazed not so much by the story , but by the acting and the film itself . Now that I have seen it , it will stay with me for many years to come. . . The opening scenes are spectacular . It starts off with a shot in the desert where the sun sets on a group of people walking across a desert landscape.

Five Fingers relies heavily on barbaric, shock value Hollywood tactics to elicit apparently a positive movie-going response. This is where this movie fails throughout, primarily because it is too graphic to be taken seriously. I was repulsed and disgusted that Five Fingers was even made, and essentially had to force myself to continue watching it. Torture in and of itself is gruesome. Even the sounds coming from a room where someone is being tortured are gruesome. But obviously the makers of this stinker of a movie felt that was not enough.

This film is supposedly about three young idealistic people , two of whom join the Naxalite movement and blah blah blah. In fact, its a movie about three young idealistic people who get themselves killed by Naxals. So, if you thought the first half of that was a movie about a bunch of idealistic people murdering people, you are wrong. You know, it's true that the first half of the film is more about a bunch of idealistic people murdering someone. But it's true that the film takes on more meaning if you take on the context of how the three idealistic people interact.

This is so bad it will be my contribution to the next bad movie party I go to. It is clear from the start that Steve Gutenburg was taking this role seriously.... the other principles were walking through their lines. I think they got a whiff of how much it stank early on and they were going through the motions for their paychecks. Sean Bean "acted" as usual but was spared sharing space on screen with any of the principles till the final scene where it was like an actor walking onto a high school stage that is how defined the contrast was.

Love and war did happen on the other side of the iron curtain and by looking losely at it love will have a much more difficult time finding a place to grow and bloom. There's an old saying about how there's no shortage of love and hate in life. But, there is always a shortage of the things that matter. In fact, the closer you live to the things that matter the easier it is, but it's never easy because the things that really matter are always so close you can only dream about them.

The movie was very good. I'm an avid mystery fan and I usually figure out who is going to be killed and who did the killing. While I did figure out who was going to be killed I didn't figure out who did it. I wasn't happy with the portrayal of the Gerda character but given the year the movie was supposed to take place it is possible the woman would have been that 'cloying'. Please know that while these Poirot movies are good, they just don't have the same dynamic to them as the series does because they don't have Japp, Ms.

Never I have seen a movie so terrible that i've gone insane. It was a HUGE waste of time seeing this crappy film. There are a lot of things i hate about this movie: The songs is so terrible (yet a little bit catchy) i hit my head on the wall(especially from the song 'Grandpa is gonna sue the pants out of Santa' which i hit 10 Times *shrugs*), the character design, and that evil, greedy, and Bitchy cousin Mel.I cannot stand her for one second, she has got to be one of the most bitchiest person i've seen.

Wealthy horse ranchers in Buenos Aires have a long-standing no-trading policy with the Crawfords of Manhattan, but what happens when the mustachioed Latin son falls for a certain Crawford with bright eyes, blonde hair, and some perky moves on the dance floor? 20th Century-Fox musical has a glossy veneer yet seems a bit tatty around the edges. It is very heavy on the frenetic, gymnastic-like dancing, exceedingly thin on story. Betty Grable (an eleventh hour replacement for Alice Faye) gives it a boost, even though she's paired with leaden Don Ameche (in tan make-up and slick hair).

The book is great. It's one of my favorite books ever. The film, on the other hand, is amazingly insipid and bad! When I heard Damon would play Ripley, I knew this production was doomed. But I didn't expect it to be this bad. The actors go around and act very showy. Except for Law (and even he is guilty of some showy acting), all the actors here are near amateurish. Speaking Italian and moving one's arms or hair about shouldn't be considered as acting. Damon is miscast.

This film is one of the best of 1986 with creepy , yet intriguing performances from Crispin Glover and Dennis Hopper . Troy ( Glover ) is a man with a past who’s about to make a choice that could change his entire life. He goes to a diner to meet his estranged daughter, and in order to make up to her for what happened, he has to let her know everything about him and his father that she’ll never know. When she comes to visit, Troy is ready to reveal everything about his family and what happened.

Al Pacino was once an actor capable of making a role work without resorting to constant use of profanity . He was a gifted performer, one who possessed a wide range of skills. That range of skills was demonstrated through his role in " Scarface " when he played Al Capone . He took on the role of this ruthless gangster, a man so powerful and intimidating it was easy to see why he had to be portrayed by someone so talented as Pacino. Even though Pacino had been an actor since he was a young boy, he had a reputation for making a character work despite the constant use of profanity.

You know , before seeing this film I had little sympathy for those caught up in criminal cases . I was a big supporter of the American judicial system until I read a couple of books about the corruption within that system . I think that this film should not have had a happy ending , because its not a fair fight . I think that this film was a big waste of money , but I have to admit that I had an emotional attachment to one or two of the characters . I think that this film was very good .

This movie is not so good as I thought it would be . There is no story whatsoever , no characters, just a bunch of stereotypes. It just is not good. I did not expect any more from this kind of movie. I am not a fan of westerns . And the movie is full of stereotypes of the west. I did not get it at all. I would be very sad if someone would like to do this with my money . The story was good and there were a few good performances . But this is the end for me .

Bad, bad, and did I mention bad? Aside from the comical monster terrorizing the workers the funniest part of the movie was when surveyors are in the desert and one comments that they have an hour of daylight left, but you can clearly see by their shadows, and the bright sky, that it's probably only 2 or 2:30 in the afternoon. Talk about consistency. READ THE SCRIPT director!The only cool part of this movie, besides the rack on Clara Bryant of course (as another reviewer mentioned), is the phantom skeleton horse that the Bone Eater rides on.

I'm a bit spooked by some of these reviews praising A.K.A. Not only do they sound as if they were written by the same person, but they contain all kinds of insider information that surely you could only find by reading the press book from cover to cover. Please don't tell me that the director is writing his own reviews as that would just be too sad to contemplate. Afraid I'm another one of those who hated the film and was surprised by its unapologetic amateurism. Great idea, shame about the execution.

Okay, sure, this movie is a bit on the hokey side. It's difficult to take characters from comic books and put them into movies with any credibility (Dolph Lundgren as The Punisher, anyone? ), but this tries very hard. I've never read the actual comic book, but that doesn't really matter, I suppose. I judge a film mainly on its merits, not on whether it is a faithful retelling of someone else's idea. (Unless its a film based on a true story, that demands at least some attempt at truth and accuracy.)

This is a fantastic film. The acting is some of the best I've seen. Tatyana Samojlova is obviously very beautiful, and she automatically draws you into the film with her believable acting. The The cinematography was extremely ahead of its time. Watching it, I could see parallels of cinematography used today. This is truly a groundbreaking film. Because of the cinematography and acting, the audience can feel the change in tone from beginning to end as the tone in the environment in the movie changes. It's a very touching and powerful piece.

I feel privileged to have accidentally seen this movie . I actually ran across this movie by accident . I found it on youtube but had no idea what movie I was watching . I went in search for a movie and ended up finding this one . I thought how odd . I saw this in a different country and it was dubbed . I was shocked . I have to admit , I cried the first time I watched this movie . It was just so beautiful . I wanted to cry . You will not find another movie as beautiful . It really took me by surprise .

Lucio Fulci was famous for his Italian splatter movies , mostly his undead films like Zombie or The Beyond . But what many don't know is that he also did a few horror-thrillers in his early career. In 1971's Night of the Demon and 1972's Night of the Blood Monster , he had a bit part as a detective. The latter one is his debut into horror and he did it so perfectly that it was nominated for Best Screenplay, along with the other two. The story is a simple one, of a man who is trying to find the ghost of a woman he lost years before.

One of the better movies to come out of the 1980 's , this based-on-fact movie tells the story of one man's escape from a Nazi camp. The story is told by many different actors (from many different backgrounds). I thought it was ok. I just can't stand "The Goonies". I would have to think about it. I don't know why it bothers me so. The movie was better than expected. It's a really good movie. It's a very well written movie, that I believe a lot of people would get a lot from.

Nightkill stars Robert Mitchum as a world-weary private eye probing the case of a missing industrialist (Mike Connors). He is hired by Jaclyn Smith, the anxious wife of the missing man. What Jaclyn fails to inform Mitchum is that she knows full well her husband's whereabouts. After all, she was the one who helped her lover James Franciscus dispose of her wealthy hubby.What more would expect from a rotten slasher film with Robert Mitchum? Mannix goes western, monkeys are abused, models lean against classic cars, and Smith is constantly upstaged by Sybil Danning until a giallo style wrap-up brings the whole sorry mess to a bitter end.

The slightly overlong set up episode of the previous week paid off in no uncertain terms with an episode that was both emotional and action packed. After watching it, I was left thinking, “Why did I ever not watch the first season?” I mean I know the main premise is very similar to what I’ve seen a few times, but I was a little disappointed that there were a couple of things that did not gel quite so well for me. As the series unfolds, our heroes are introduced to all new characters.

I really wish Hollywood would come up with some new ideas and quick . Instead they go around and recreate the same old formula and nothing ever changes. And I don’t blame them. There really is nothing fresh anymore and it’s getting to the point where people don’t even remember what they’ve seen recently. I really wish Hollywood wouldn’t have to go with the same ol’ script for decades. There were a few good ideas here and there but they usually come out a few years later.

If you just want gore, and nothing but gore and torture, you've come to the right movie. If you want a at least a sliver of good acting, logic, story, consistencies, or even a good guy ending, go elsewhere.I couldn't help but to think to myself, "Jeeeez, are those people mentally challenged?" Example, after being chased around and seeing other people mutilated, the main actress meets a police officer and spills out her story to the cop with tears and everything and told him about the psychopath that drives in a yellow truck.

Another Son of Sam is definitely not an Oscar winner. Technically, it's horrible. The acting is not too good either. But there is something about it that makes you want to watch more (sort of like a car wreck). The ridiculous close-ups of the killers eyes are more funny than anything. If you are looking for a scare...this ain't the flick for you. It's very obscure and nearly impossible to find. I'm sure there's a reason for that. For a while, it was titled HOSTAGE.

What a waste of talent -- although it appears that Crudup in real life is a lot more like the one in the movie. I mean, the guy has got to be one of the top two or three writers on the show. How could he be so incompetent as to write this? I guess if we're going to nit-pick (and we should), then we should nit-pick the episode title, too, but that's about it. It's not a bad title. The show does have a decent title sequence (in fact, that was probably the only thing they did well).

It is sad that some find this film worth watching. I am Russian, and I am disgusted. There is nothing in this film that deserves praise, except cinematography. However, I am not one of those who find beauty in death or perversion. I think this film is poorly designed and directed. There is nothing more irritating and even enraging than shameless speculation in art (if you can call this garbage art). Balabanov wanted to shock the viewers by pervasive evil, and he succeeded in creating a hopelessly dark film. But the biggest shock is Balabanov's primitive directorial work.

Charles Bronson has given the viewers lots of great moments on the screen . But this movie lacks everything that would make a great Bronson movie. That’s not his fault. It’s Hollywood’s fault as well. The script and direction, and the whole cast just don’t bring you the Bronson you’re looking for. They’re just so different in everything from look, to acting styles, to storyline that you wonder if you’re watching the wrong movie. This film was made as a direct-to-video release.

Let 's summarize how dumb this movie is with two details : Arnold to Antichrist : `` Let 's see who's dumb now. He killed millions of human beings. He killed millions of them, by the millions, and what did we do to him? Nothing! Why? We had no problem with killing him. We didn't know he was coming here, and he came here. But you had nothing to do with it. Nothing. He just killed a million or so people, we killed him for it. That's all it is.

I absolutely hated this movie. Even though the movie wanted to transmit some kind of social message, it was done in such a cliché ridden and melodramatic way like a Mexican soap opera.Also the acting was terrible especially Charityn and her son. That's one of the problems with dominican movies, they use celebrities that can't even act just to attract the masses. I'm even more ashamed about the positive reviews here which sadly means Dominicans are just being condescending to what's done here instead of giving honest and critical opinions that will help our film industry base itself on quality.

oh well... its funny. should have been a sadistic comedy, a lot of horror movies lack common sense,but i think a retarded caveman would weasel his way around this situation. Don't really expect Hitchcock or anything close to this. this is a good one for friends,but i wouldn't recommend it for anything else.this movie lacks all the substance of a true horror movie,the suspense,the shock,and good characters. the killer failed to be the unstoppable force that i expected him to be,and he seemed to be the average angry "D" student able to outsmart only stupid people.

I am sorry to rain on everybody 's parade . Just a little background about me : I like and love to play the piano. I'm also self taught so I have very little experience. I would be glad to practice for hours if necessary! I have experience with music in general, I've played all kinds of instruments, from mandolin and guitar to piano, drums and more. I'm good with music theory (but no one in particular!) and can play pieces by Bach, Mozart, Beethoven, etc.

This movie was sooo bad . It was n't even funny at all . Not even the sarcastic scenes were funny . The only good part i can say is the last 2 seconds . The movie is a total waste . I want to watch this . It will never work as a movie . It will never work as a movie . The people who should sue this movie because this is their fault . I've seen this many many times since i've had the chance. Everytime i watch i get so angry that how can anyone be like this?

I saw this film many years ago, and absolutely hated it -- I could not wait for it to end, and would have walked out, but there was a girl sleeping on my shoulder. You know what? I have never forgotten this film, and more, I would say that it continues to haunt me with its images and music over the years. How many movies have I wept over and laughed over in the moviehouse, then forgotten as soon as I hit the street, like ... you see, I can't even think of one!

Look, don't get me wrong I love independent films but COME ON! I could barely sit through it without wanting to kill myself. the director had absolutely no talent and he turned something that could have been OK to a F***ing Nightmare. I am a punk enthusiast myself and even the music sucked. the acting was crap.I am usually a bleeding heart for these low budget films but this one, this one didn't even try. Please don't waste your precious time and money. I am sorry to be so harsh but come on!

Although its plot is taken from the history of ancient Rome, 'Caligula' is not made in the style of sword-and-sandal epics like 'Spartacus' or 'Gladiator'. (That style of movie-making was out of favour in the late seventies). Rather, it more closely resembles a cross between a soft-core porn movie and a video nasty. At least, the shortened 150 minute version does. I have never seen the full 210 minute version, but to judge from the descriptions of it on this page, it would seem closer to a cross between a hard-core porn movie and a video nasty.

Seems like a pretty innocent choice at first- the name "employee of the month" might ring bells with "Office Space," and the show "Office Clerk." I think not. This isn't even a dark comedy. The director of this movie, whoever the guy's name, was a complete jerk, and has a sick, perverse mind. There is no pleasure in being lured into feeling sorry for a complete loser who cheats on his wife, steals from his top-notch job, and lies through his teeth 24/7.

From the dire special effects onwards I was absolutely gob smacked at how bad anyone can make a film . . . and that is still true today. The first thing that hit me in the screening was the fact that I had seen every Batman film ever made, and I was amazed that I remembered them all (I don’t really, but I thought I did), and I couldn’t believe what I saw in this new one. Then I got to see how far the characters had come and the worldbuilding that went into the making of it all.

If you wondered whether Disney could broadcast a show with a character more spoiled than Paris , more shallow than Paris Hilton , and more obsessed with sex than Paris, here is your answer . A show about sex. The show “A Very Sexy Christmas” debuted on Sunday night (November 26) on Fox Family Channel. This is the second year Fox Family is bringing sexy holiday special programming to our screens. It’s all a little weird, though. It starts with Fox Family Channel announcing that, “a very sexy new comedy” will premiere at 8:30 pm ET on December 2.

It carries the tone of voice that narrates the book into the jungle of Vietnam and into the wild-eyed look of Martin Sheen and Dennis Hopper and the mystical morbidity surrounding Colonel Kurtz. (I don't say Marlon Brando because after watching the documentary, "Hearts of Darkness," I am skeptical as to how much credit Brando is due for that quality). The tone of voice I'm talking about is brooding and dramatic without being overbearing: "Everybody gets what he wants. I wanted a mission, and for my sins they gave me one.

Pure schlock from beginning to end . The average 12 year old might find that it has an interesting take on the world, but I enjoyed it so much because it was a completely different perspective than anything I thought of when I was in kindergarten. This book would be great for a middle schooler (or anyone else, really) who loves reading. This book was great! The characters were well written, the illustrations were gorgeous and the story was exciting. Even though I was a young adult when I read this book I was still able to understand and enjoy it as a young adult.

Anyone who knows anything about evolution would n't even need to see the film to say `` fake '' . We've all seen or heard about it in the news , on television , and read about it in science books . We have heard it called the " Big Bang " story . We know that the Big Bang happened some 14 billion years ago . But , the truth is, no one knows for sure . We just don't know how it happened . It could have been the result of a star that exploded . A supernova .

This flick was the introduction for a lot of us to the works of K Gordon Murray . That 's because it was so good ! The characters were very real , and the acting was very good ! This movie was released a couple of days after I got out of the hospital for the third time. I was feeling better and ready to do a lot more acting . I didn't get any more acting experience after this film . I only did two more movies . One thing I would say is that the movie isn't too long. It's just right .

I have no respect for IMDb ratings anymore . I think a bunch of Mormons flooded the website and voted the Mormon movies top . I don’t trust any ratings that are given on IMDB and I think the best way to go is to go to the IMDB website directly. I really don’t understand why they allow you to rate a movie by clicking a thumbs up button. If I could rate it I would give it 5 thumbs up. And if I had a dollar for everyone who rates a movie with a thumbs up, I would give it $2.

I have to be honest and admit that this movie did basically nothing for me except baffle me completely . . . and in a good way, I mean . . . it took the cake . . . that was probably the best thing about this movie . . . the cake . . . just the icing on the old . . . cake . . . well I'll stop now . . . anyway this was a lot of fun, I guess . . . I'm not too sure what it is . . .

Based on the comments made so far , everyone seems to either hate this movie or love it . I personally have loved this movie for many reasons , but one of the major reasons was the way the final scenes were filmed. In my opinion, the best scene is the part when she's on her death bed and you can hear the tears rolling down her cheeks. That's why i will be watching it again, just to see how she looks when she's dying and what she says, and what is written on those pictures.

There was a recent documentary on making movies , that featured a long list of actors and directors talking about the challenges of getting their films made and how they were able to overcome them. In one of the actors’ case, the challenges were a result of getting cast in the roles they were in, getting cast for the parts they got, and getting paid to do their films. The other actor in their case spoke of a different problem. That actor pointed to what he believed were obstacles in the process of directing and creating films, but was unable to fully articulate what those obstacles were.

I looked forward to watching this film since I loved the David Lynch version . In my first attempt at watching it , I was a little disappointed, but in the second , I found the film is a great movie, I really liked. This movie was very different from the original, in fact, this movie was more of a story of a man who had lost his way. But he wasn’t just a normal person, he was an alien, and he was able to be close to human beings, but he was still alone .

A vg Brit rom-com , one to watch if you can get your hands on a copy . Quirky and entertaining , it tells the story of a single mom of four who decides to try a new school . Unfortunately she is paired up with an overachiever who she feels is not a good fit for her children . As the story unfolds we learn about her life and family . It's a quirky , quirky story and one I think a lot of kids would enjoy . My only complaint is the music . It's pretty good but I think the story is better without it .

This is one of the best films I've seen in the last years.Belmonndo and Deneuve shine in their respective roles, he as a naive plantation owner and she as an enigmatic trickster.Words won't do this masterpiece justice,suffice it to say that this is a movie that explores the darker side of love and the pain,humiliation and capacity for self-delusion that go with it, although it's dressed as a film noir. Forget that feeble remake with Jolie and Banderas, see the genuine artticle instead and treat yourselves to some moments of great cinematic beauty.

This movie reeks . No money , no acting , no nothing . I caught this on on the 3am cable last night and didn't think i'd be able to write my review when the credits rolled

I think i'm going to have to re-write this. I don't know how to word it . The story is great . This is a story about people and about how they are and how they act , but it is one of those rare movies that takes you inside a person's mind . That is the most accurate way i can describe it .

Oh f * cking hell , where should I start ... First of all ; this show is just another example of how dumb America is ... America needs to be made to take a good hard look in the mirror and admit what it is ... a nation of two classes (rich and poor) ... I have been saying this for decades , America needs a new revolution ... But , I guess that is the type of thing that needs to come from the likes of Glenn Beck and those people ... that is all it is right now , its all that is left to them and they should be ashamed of themselves ...

I was really beginning to enjoy this show . It just started out slow and it was n't given the time or attention it deserves . But after the first 4 episodes it was getting into the swing of things . The show really took off in episode 3 or 4. And I'm looking forward to next week's episode as well . I'll be sad when I have to miss this show when I have to fly to Australia to visit family . I'm only going for a short visit . __________________
