i love watching the Jericho mile. i mean watching peter Strauss run the mile is like watching usain bolt sprint the 100 meter. i think peter Strauss is a excellent actor and should do another running movie. he is lightning fast has great energy and can run a mile in under 4 minutes and that my friend is amazing. no man alive can out race rain Murphy i mean the man runs 80 mile a week no one does that but him. i've watched the Jericho mile 100's of times and will watch it 100's more.

As I watched this movie , I felt as if a plastic bag was slowly closing in around my head , and that I could hear a voice as if coming from behind my closed eyes

It was the kind of movie that makes you think and wonder , but then you have to watch the movie to find out what happens . And it will happen . It is very strange , but a great movie . But I am afraid that it is a very weird movie

This is my third time to see this movie and each time it is a different experience .

Possibly the worst movie I ever saw. The person who shot this movie probably never learned not to film directly into a shining light. You can't see anything in this movie. It is way to dark. The parts where you can see something the camera is directed straight at a light source so you get big lens flares. So you still can't see. This movie should have been a radio play or something. Some parts of the movie are actually edited upside-down for some kind of crap effect. Low budget movies can be done so much better then this.

Take your video camera , turn out all the lights in your house and film people running around with flashlights and you'll probably end up with what you've seen in the video. A lot of the time , it's very dark , and you are not able to distinguish between people , objects, or other people that may not be able to see you in the darkness. This is an example of ambient light. So the question that we have to ask ourselves when we think about ambient light in our world, is what is light , actually?

I attended a screening of this movie. It was wrought with clichés and very unfunny jokes and set ups. I think the other comments were by people who must've worked on the movie or been family members of the cast. I'm amazed this movie cost $3-$4 million without any real stars. Where did the budget go? It obviously didn't go to writers for re-writes. Nice thought to bank on the success of Big Fat Greek Wedding, but a major miss. There was little or any spark between the main characters and the inciting incident was a bit flimsy at best.

This is a movie that should be viewed and treated as a piece of art . This is an oblivious film , one that makes you aware of the human condition and then lets that awareness become a cathartic catharsis. If you are looking for a film to take your mind and soul away from your daily life and put you into a more introspective and meditative place, you could do worse than watching this movie. You have to know that this is the movie of the decade. Every film released this year has been considered the best.

O boy, was this really bad.I saw this on videotape.In scenes that had soundtrack music, it was hard to hear the dialog. In this film , we 're invited to observe the descent into a moral and emotional funk of someone who 's had an affair with his workaholic sister, his wife, and his daughter. I think there 's a lot to be learnt from this film that you haven ' t experienced yourself, so we 're here to tell you what we 'd do differently in our relationships. It is really important that you do not rush this process, otherwise this will never work and things will spiral out of control. To me, the movie is not about an affair.

How could anyone who liked the previous JP movies even stand to sit through this 1 hour of drivel? There are so many stupid things about this film it's mind boggling!! I remember when i went to see JP as a kid it was my favorite movie and franchise, the acting, the SFX the Music, the direction! all fantastic, JP2 in my opinion was OK pretty much the same apart from some really stupid moments (like the gymnast girl kicking a raptor..please!) but on a whole a watchable and reasonable cinematic experience.But the the third one has no point!!

I just saw this film at the Sidewalk Film Festival in Birmingham , AL , which was actually a really fun event to be at. It was a lot of fun, and it’s a cool film that is worth the watch. This film is really really bad , it is not very well done and is a lack lustre attempt at what should be a much better idea. The film has many flaws . The acting , the plots , the cinematography, the special effects . It would be a much better idea if they just filmed it and gave it a theatrical release. I think that it is not the best idea for this story in the world. It is a shame that a film like this should be made for $30 million dollars.

I have only seen this movie once, when I was about 14 years old, but I was thrilled that they made a movie about the 45th Division. Being from Oklahoma and especially now that both of my sons are members of the 45th, I would like to see it released on a DVD. I may sound a little bias but the 45th Division sometimes does not get the recognition it deserves today. The History channel always talks about the other infantry divisions when it talks about WW2 and Korea but you rarely hear it mention the 45th.

OK , last night I saw the world premiere of Paul Schrader 's The Exorcist : The Beginning at the Toronto International Film Festival. For some reason, I have a soft spot for horror movies , but I never thought that this particular film would ever see the light of day. I saw it last night , though, and my opinion of it did not change one bit , it just opened up my mind a little wider to see how this kind of film has been done. The film is about the making of the 1973 film of the same name.

This is one of the most unoriginal, cliche-ridden movies I have ever seen. Even if you didn't like this film's antecedents, 'The Bad News Bears' and 'The Mighty Ducks,' they are bound to have done a better job than this one. From the moment the new teacher greets her class and they tell her, "Don't bother with us, we're all losers," you can see everything that's coming twenty miles away for the rest of the film. All the usual suspects are here.

Michael Bassett's film 'Solomon Kane' (based on the character of the same name created by Robert E. Howard) is a disappointing Fantasy Action-Adventure film, that despite having a few scenes of genius falls flat with its awkward pacing, poor characterisation and general dullness. Solomon Kane (James Purefoy) is a mercenary of Queen Elizabeth's army fighting in Africa, where he comes face-to-face with the Devil's Reaper  a demon who collects the Devil's debts i.e. souls  refusing to go to hell just yet, he evades the Reaper and starts a new life in an English monastery.

Asmali Konak has arguably become one of the best TV series to come out of Turkey . With its unique take on modernity, it’s also a very personal and intimate portrayal of women’s lives and issues. The show is one of the few shows I actually like to watch because the actors are so strong and talented. The show follows two sisters, Hayriye (Habiba Kavakci-Pamuk) and Hayriye (Gul Duman) as they deal with the consequences of social and family pressures. The series is based off of real life events the two sisters had to face.

Saw this film during the Mod & Rockers fest in August . I was so inspired and touched . Harry’s love for this character is so powerful in the way it is shown and read . I am not a big Harry Potter fan, but I did have to see this film at some point to show my daughter , and now I am hooked , I want more Harry Potter . You have given me such a wonderful opportunity to read this film for my book group , so thank you. I’m so glad that you are enjoying it so much as I am.

'Blade ' would be an extremely above-average comic-book , vampire-hunter action/horror if it were n't for two minor flaws . First off, the artwork in the first issue was, to put it kindly, lackluster . It's obvious from looking at the book's cover that the artist had limited experience working in comic-book territory (he was doing the comic for his own publishing company, though, which is not unusual for self-pubbed books these days). But beyond that, he had little to no idea what he was doing with this material.

I really wanted to like this movie . Great cast  Walter Pidgeon in a role that reminds us of Gary Coopers in To Have And Have Not . The script is excellent , with a great plot twist in the last act . But the plot twists are overused in this type of movie . It should be more like The Maltese Falcon or House of Usher . You get the ending and that is that . But as I mentioned in my review of the previous film . Im glad that the film has made it to DVD , and I look forward to seeing it when the DVD arrives .

It was not entertaining, it was just plain awful . . . i could not believe how they just went ahead and filmed it and then just edited and released it . . . The story of this movie was just . . . well . . . nothing. I felt like they were trying to force me to watch something they wanted to show me .

Historical movies always take liberties -- conversations are concocted where no one could actually know what was said , customs are invented for the sake of dramatic effect, and there's a good chance the people involved may not be who they claim to be, let alone who you think they are. But there's a simple truth that we all accept: the people who go to the trouble and expense to record history aren't making it up. They're making it up about people who have been in the past -- and that's why historical films always seem to turn out the same way.

The Calu-what now ? Yeah , I thought it was a stupid name as well . Chris Carter remains blissfully ignorant of the facts surrounding it all . If he did , he'd know it was a total flop. I have been a loyal Calu user since the 1.0 launch. I own all Calus of all kinds and have yet to encounter a game that I would not have purchased from them on the day I opened my wallet. I am one of the biggest Calu collectors in the world! The problem, as I see it, is Calu's pricing scheme.

Pretty lousy made-for-TV sequel to the Roman Polanski classic . Rosemary 's son Adrian has grown up and is embodied by Mark Strong in this tale of a young man on the run who must learn to survive a world of organized criminals as they chase after him. The film opens with Adrian (Mark Strong) getting picked up by a local gangster named Johnny (John Hurt in a cameo role) who is about to have a showdown at a baseball game with his former gang, which has since disbanded. The game quickly degenerates into a bloody one-sided melee between both sides and Johnny's men grab Adrian and hold him hostage.

You thought after "Traumschiff Surprise" that German comedy can't get worse? It can. This comedy is yet another attempt at perpetuating stereotypes of gay men masked as a nice comedy. The initial concept (openly gay men in soccer sports) would have been a great opportunity to erase some stereotypes, but... The real intended message of the movie seems to be in what way gay men are oh-so-different from straight men. Absolutely silly, of course. Even gay sex is treated as being of less value than straight sex. This movie only tries to serve straight audiences wanting to laugh about stereotypical gay men.

Have you ever wondered why these guys -- Seagal , Stallone , Willis , et al -- manage to survive and thrive in the world they inhabit? You might have noticed, for example, how Seagal and Stallone are in the news constantly. The former is making movies in the U.S.; the latter is in the middle of one, The Expendables. A couple weeks ago, I was watching The Expendables on my computer at home when I realized I wanted to see it again, even if it was only for fun.

By far the most racist and ghettoish cartoon for children 7+. Kids who watch this cartoon will most likely try to dress, talk, and act like the characters portrayed. I am disappointed in Nickelodeon and Nick Jr. for agreeing to air this terrible program. The Wayan's Brothers may be good in movies meant for the young adult viewers. They should stick to the movies and not make any more episodes for this cartoon. Usually The young celebs start off working in movies and doing voice-overs for cartoons and then as they grow older, they move up to programs for young adults.

Low-budget murder mystery about a Public Defender trying to clear his client of a murder the man had been convicted for. I was watching the news on TV and thought I’d seen a man with long brown hair go by my office. When he walked into the lobby, I asked my receptionist about him. It turns out he was in the building. “Hi. How are you?” he asked when he sat in the chair next to me. “Hello. What’s up?”

“You have a short hair, like me.”

“Not really.”

“I thought so.

An untidy man , known as Bill , lives in a small dreary flat , with a poster of Marilyn Monroe on the wall . He is an untidy man , with dirty clothes and his hair all over the place . He lives with his wife , and they have a son . He works very hard , and his wife earns a living for the family . He has always lived a clean and orderly life , and he looks forward to his future life . He hopes that life is going to be much happier and better than his present , and he also wishes that he can have a happy and prosperous life .

If you're in the middle of a ferocious war and it's still not clear that you're going to come out on top, among the things you'll be concerned with is to keep up the morale of the civilians...to demonstrate that our troops have the bravery, the resourcefulness and the dedication to overcome all the odds in a noble cause. And that's just what director Anthony Asquith provided the British with 1943's naval war film, We Dive at Dawn. After more than 60 years, it's not surprising that some of the movie is dated.

This failed exercise in satire or commentary on the human condition easily earned a place as one of the 10 worst movies I've ever seen. I have watched THE ROOT OF ALL EVIL with the avowed object of refuting this so called scientific atheist . One of the problems with popular culture , especially when discussing the popular culture of the 1970s , is that it can sometimes lead people to believe that certain things were all over the place at the same time and that it was only the cultural zeitgeist of the 1970s that caused everything that happened that decade. But it certainly was not all over the place or all the same thing. This tendency to believe that everything was all over the place and nothing was the same is why it’s difficult to have coherent conversations about popular culture. The same problems exist when trying to find coherent arguments against popular culture.

I loved the first movie, the second one was okay, disappointed John Cleese wasn't jean bob anymore as hes my favorite character. But the third one...what happened to the animation??? it looks low budget like a sat morning cartoon! except for the flashback which was taken from the first movie. They really should have stopped after number 2, this just makes the rest look bad!! Derek's voice has changed but its not as recognizable as jean bob..Rogers also looks very strange. I also don't understand where Rothbart came from.

I watched this movie three times at different ages of my life and always did enjoy it very much indeed. I also enjoyed it quite a bit when re-watching it to my teenage years. So, it's kind of a nostalgia trip to watch this again. My only complaint is the soundtrack could be a little better. I can't say I ever watched the film in any particular order. I didn't mind watching it twice in order to find out what happened but I don't think I would've liked to watch it again to find out any further plot.

The opening scene really got me into watching the movie . However , not more than 5 minutes later , I stopped it and went back to tv and read a book . I don t know , it might just be me , but I get more out of this one than I do most films . So , what do you think of this one ? It is not a bad movie , just not as great as the first one . Not sure I would like it again . So , I am not saying it is the worst film . I really liked this one a lot better than the first .

If all movies had to be destroyed and only one could be spared, Death in Venice would have to be it. It is a monument in movie history. Much criticized for being slow, boring and too obvious in stating it's point (an old man discovers beauty in a young boy and is tragically destroyed, first mentally, then physically), we should appreciate this movie for what it is. 'Morte a Venezia' was shot over 30 years ago, and it portrays a period even further back, at the beginning of the twentieth century.Life was slow then, compared to now.

I fail to understand why anyone would allow a sub-par director to put drivel like this onto celluloid . This movie is an insult to every human being on this planet. It is just plain disrespectful. This movie made me think of a scene from The Godfather, where Joe Pesci's character talks about this movie. He's in Italy, and I forget what movie it was but it was some kind of western, and he said something like, "You know, I've got this film in Rome. You know the one, you know I've got this one in Italy.

Forget the lousy acting , that can be forgiven in this sort of film . Or even the terrible , at times boring screenplay . This is the story of the last of the great Indian heroes of World War 1. A man who was an inspiration to every man, woman, and child who had the courage, strength and determination to go into battle on the side of the British Empire. He was one of the unsung heros who fought on the right side. A true patriot and a man of courage. One of the few who went out and sacrificed his life to fight the enemy.

Any chance to see Katharine Hepburn in something I haven't seen or from her early movie career is a treat, and on that level the film is amusing, but she's horrible miscast as a Hill Billy. Her famous New England enunciation slips through, making lines like, "I'd better rustle up some Vittles" pretty ludicrous. She's so pretty and so young it almost overcomes this major flaw. The story is an old fashioned melodrama, and there fore, a younger generation may think this pretty corny stuff, but this was the staple of American Entertainment well into the 1940's.

This is without question one of the worst movies I have ever seen . However , it is also one of the most entertaining . Based off of a book, written by a former president , of America , it is a drama , political satire , romance , action , comedy , family drama , fantasy , and a very entertaining movie , I can go on all day . It is one of those , if you don't have time to read the book , then this will work as a substitute , and it does .

What a cast...and what a waste of it. Seriously, when a movie has Gabriel Byrne, Jamie Foxx, Thandie Newton, Stuart Townsend, Hal Holbrook, Melanie Griffith and Sylvester Stallone in it you would expect some quality. The movie is however one big mess with a unlikely story that can't seem to stop putting twist and turns in it. Yeah, I think that they thought they were really being clever with all of it.The story is not only messy and unlikely, it also isn't exactly terribly original. It uses elements from earlier and much better poker game based movies.

This movie contains the worst acting performance of all time. Spilsbury lacks energy to say the least. Energy is what Clayton Moore gave us in spades. I never felt once in this movie that Spilsbury was anxious for anything. Revenge, love, justice? Not in this guy's portrayal.There is also no chemistry between Tonto and LR. If the plot did not force them to be friends, you don't get the impression they want to hang out with each other. Plus, the sidekick has the more interesting personality.

It really is a great film ( after being able to ignore Blake Edwards Pink Panther references which he appears to be having a good time with ). I loved it. I have no qualms with it being a parody, as it seems like the kind of thing I'd like from the original Pink Panther cartoon. It's only a movie that was made to make money, but for a good time. The characters, the cartoon and the actors all blend together and make one of the funniest movies in recent memory.

I had a bad feeling when I saw the cheap title work. It only took a couple of scenes to confirm that this movie is a real stinker! The only enjoyment I got out of this was to laugh at the technical flaws (example - the background "car sounds" audio just disappears during the scene with Danny and Dog in Dog's car). Production shows a total lack of imagination (example - slow motion machine gun fire repeats many times). Sandra Bullock plays essentially a bit part, completely unnecessary to the plot.

The untold origin of the Lone Ranger. It shows who he was and how and why he became the Ranger.Legendary bomb. The idea was not a bad one--reinvent and introduce the Lone Ranger for 1980s audiences. Right off the bat though there were problems. The studio ordered Clayton Moore (the original Ranger) to stop appearing anywhere as the Lone Ranger. It led to a nasty little battle that made headlines. I know of people who refused to see the film because of how Moore was treated. Also they hired the awesomely untalented Klinton Spilsbury to play the Ranger.

It's a puzzle to me how this turd of a film ever got distribution.Sure, it's horror and there's a fair share of nudity, but by god, the production value is the lowest I've ever seen, the equipment used is worse than standard home equipment, everything is overlit, giving everything an amateurish look, bringing your thought to America's worst home video's or whatever that show was called..Please people, is it too much to ask that you actually do an effort when you expect to waste 90 minutes of peoples lives watching this?

When a group of businessmen start dying in the presence of the mysterious Mr. Coulomb , FBI agent Dick Martin is assigned to the case. He soon suspects that the man they are being held against their will is actually their former boss, Dr. Marcus Brody. The problem is that Brody is dead, and the only one who can tell him is the man who was supposed to have killed him. With no other choice but to help them out, Martin must decide how far he can trust his former mentor and also whether or not to allow the group to escape.

I have to say this is one of the best movie i have seen so far for naruto. the action was a lot better then the first movie because it had a lot more fight scene and it came to u at a faster pace. it was amazing, the choreograph was excellent as well as most of the visual effects.the story line is something new to naruto. but it is basically the same as the first movie. in the series u see them fight against other ninjas,but in the movies (1+2) u see them fighting against machine of mass destruction.

I doubt whoever wrote this screenplay has ever actually read Mansfield Park...or if they have it was not very well. None of the characters are what they should be: Fanny is lively and conscious of her mistreatment, while Sir Thomas, who treated her very well, seems to have accidentally fallen into Aunt Norris' personality. Additionally, a first person narrative by Fanny is highly inappropriate to both the story and her character. Fanny is not an entertaining heroine, and I would contend that she is not meant to be.

The worst film I have seen in the last 12 months . The plot of the story was uninteresting , the characters dull ,the acting lacking . I felt like I had just seen an average low budget horror film . That said ,the special effects were decent , the script a bit weak , the music could be better . I give the film two out of 10 . The only thing I did like about it was the special effects . The special effects were decent , but I can’t really take too much of them seriously .

This movie is something horrible . I was laughing all the time . I was forced to stop in some part of the film . I have had enough of terrible movies . This movie is just horrible . I have never laughed at a movie so much I had to stop. There's so many things wrong with this movie , that it makes me sad to know I have wasted money. It is so bad , that I will never ever watch it . I am glad I stopped at the point of the movie , cause I know the ending .

This is the second movie about 1985, the other one was 'The Wedding Singer'. Whilst the 'Wedding Singer' was portraying the pop side of the 80's, 'Rock Star' is all about metal.Mark Wahlberg plays a talented singer in a tribute band of some famous rock act of the time and Jennifer Aniston plays his girlfriend. When his fixation rewards him, his whole life changes in a day.The story doesn't get too dramatic and it only scratches the surface of the life of a rock star. Sex and drugs are very limited in this movie, but it is full of Rock'n Roll!

I feel that this movie is different from so many others in that it shows a family of girls who don’t have it all together. And we’re talking about the same girls in different generations, and different places, who live in different environments, and in completely different ways. And they’re the characters, they’re not the characters of the film. (Laughs.) And we’re the characters, we are the film, and we do have everything, but we’re not perfect. They are perfect. [Laughs.]

Ik know it is impossible to keep all details of a book in a movie. But this movie has changed nearly everything without any reason. Furthermore many changes have made the story illogical. A few examples: 1) in the movie "Paul Renauld" really meets Poriot before he dies (in the book Poirot only gets a letter), telling him he is afraid to be killed. This is completely stupid because if Renaulds plan would have succeeded, Poirot would have known that the dead man would not have been Renauld. (Poirot was in the morgue when Mrs Renauld identified the victim).

First of all, I personally adore Demons and Demons 2, I saw them although it was hard to find good horrors without good official movie distributing here in Russia when I was a kid, and that is an unchangeable part of my boyhood. Then I heard nothing about Mr Bava. Then I saw his Ghost Son. Well, it is certainly not a good coming back! Why was the leading character, whom we never really knew to at least like him, in accident in the middle of an empty road? Why do African servants say so dumb and stupid things about human soul?

If this movie would have been in English, all critics would have trashed it. The language is extremely bad, the scenes are awfully directed and it's not at all funny. After the movie I thought that this movie could have been written by an 8th grader, at least if you consider the lack of believable characters and the fixation on certain male body parts. (oh, on dogs as well...) The story is just plain nonsense compared to the more mature Vingar av glas that premiered almost at the same time. Of course the public chose Jalla! Jalla!

"De Dominee" is based on the life of a real dutch gangster,Klaas Bruinsma! In the movie he is called Klaas Donkers! I have my doubts that events presented in the movie have something to do with what really happened! But that doesn't really matter! Because it failed to grab my attention! This movie bored the crap out of me! It lacks substance and style! The substance part could have been forgiven if the acting was any good and if the director tried to do something original! Without the substance you at least have to bring some style or decent action!

Follow-up to 1965 's `` My Name Is Barbra '' , and shot in brilliant color , `` Color Me Badd '' (1972). She plays a singer with a big voice and a dreamy demeanor, living in her apartment in San Francisco, with no job, no prospects and no boyfriend. One night she gets invited to an "after hours" show by the bandleader ( Jerry Garcia ) who takes her all around the club with him , and she finds out that he is the hottest new star she has ever heard of.

Oh what a disappointment this movie is. I can't believe it was directed by Wajda. There's practically no plot and 90% of the movie consists of various people walking in and out of the screen, weakly trying to interact with each other while talking about the Katyn massacre. The most interesting part comes right at the end, but by that time I simply stopped caring while trying to suppress my yawns.Almost the entire movie is filmed with a hand-held camera, which is supposed to convey the feeling of "personal immediacy" but there's nothing personal or immediate about most of the movie.

Having enjoyed Neil Gaiman 's writing ( especially his collaboration with Yoshitaka Amano in `` The Dream Hunters '' ) and I think he is one of the most under-rated authors out there, I have to say I think that Neil Gaiman deserves to be considered as more than just an author. I think he is a truly gifted artist. He is also a poet. His stories are masterful, he can weave an entire plot around a few words. When he tells a story, there is a logic behind the story, and there is an emotional core to every character.

The first episode of 'Man to Man with Dean Learner ' that just aired was at least up to scratch in all the right places. That's not to say there wasn't something to complain about, of course. It wasn't always clear whether Learner was playing the role of the Man himself, or a character within that role, but whatever the character was, he was an excellent actor who did his job right and got the right performance out of his cast. There is a great scene where Learner goes out for the day to find himself an interesting woman.

Matt Cvetic is a loyal communist in a Pittsburgh steel mill who works to recruit workers into the party , and is in good standing with the Communist Party in the state. He told me of a conversation he had recently with a man at his office who wanted to know why I would work with the Communists. He asked me how long I’d been involved, and when I told him a full decade, he told me that, for many years, the Communists had been the good guys on the streets, and that now he was working with the bad guys, so what did I think about this?

Don't get me wrong, I love most of Paul Schrader's movies, so it was with sheer excitement I was able to attend at the "Rolling Thunder" screening at the Parisian french cinemathèque with surprise movie on the 17th Dec 2004. Of course the surprise movie was The Exorcist and most people were there for that (I was too). The film was then finished but the score, so P Schrader used excerpts from The Return of the King and some other movie I forget (Was it Conan?). Anyways, apart from that the movie was finalized.

I enjoyed it. There you go, I said it again. I even bought this movie on DVD and enjoyed it a couple of more times. Call me old fashioned but I prefer movies like this to garbage like Die Hard 4 which hold up the box office and get critical acclaim just because you have some old guy saving America. Van Damme moves well for a guy of his age(47 I think), delivering kicks that reminds one of Kickboxer. If you like old school action and and explosions, this is the movie to watch.

Other reviewers seem to have held this film in high regard . For something made by an eighteen year old , I thought it was very nicely done and I was interested to see it . I liked it for what it was, and for that, I'll give it 2 stars . If you're looking for a well made teen flick , this one's right up there with the best . Not just a great movie, but a great movie that could very easily become a classic. I'm not sure if its a classic yet, but I will give it that much .

Ben Marshall, a teen ager from a religious background, is made aware about the financial situation at home by his domineering mother Laura. She suggests him to find a temporary job in order to contribute to the household. In fact the family has taken a widower, to board with them. Robert Marshall, the father, is a pastor at the local church; he'd much rather be in the country watching birds than tending to the souls entrusted to his church.The job Ben applies is with an older actress, Evie Walton, who wants him to do things for her around the house.

Secret Service agent Jay Killion ( Charles Bronson ) has been assigned to protect the President-elect 's wife , the President's daughter ( Elizabeth Hurley ) and the President . After Jay is injured in a fire fight he is whisked away from the hospital by the Secret Service to a Washington hospital where he dies as the President is informed that the President will be shot at any moment and there is no time for an autopsy. After his death a grieving President ( Tom Berenger ) is informed that his wife ( Jessica Hecht ) was killed in a plane crash.

Sorry for all you guys that are not family with the Lynches.My sister in law asked me how you can live so well without money?I thought she had a lot of sense but she is a very nice woman and the rest of the family know they are lucky to have her and her husband as well as me and my two boys. We are all well settled and it is not a struggle to live a good life. I have friends that do have a lot of money I just can not understand it. My friends are always on the phone complaining about things that are going on in their lives.

This film is one of the best of 1986 with creepy, yet intriguing performances from Crispin Glover and Dennis Hopper! The Reagan years were pretty bleak for a lot of people, not just teenagers, but this flick really captured the desperation and despair. Well-directed with great script (apparently based on a true story), I don't really see any weaknesses in this. The opening shot was brilliant.Keanu Reeves was decent for a change and Miss Skye was right on the money. Hopper had three other great performances that same year (Blue Velvet, Texas Chainsaw II, and Hoosiers).

If you've ever been to Ukraine, this movie is absolutely hilarious. From teenagers wearing gold chains, listening to hip hop and break dancing on the side to jokes about air bags in cars and waitresses in total shock over meeting a vegetarian, this movie really captures bits and pieces of Ukraine that you would never know unless you went there. I spent most of the movie nodding my head and thinking, "Yep. That's exactly right." It's a lot of fun if you understand Russian too because the subtitles just don't always do it justice.

..."Flight of the Living Dead" sports production values that belie the substandard script from director Scott "I'm a producer, can'tcha tell?" Thomas and two hacks who shall remain nameless because I feel sorry for them having to attach those no-names to this turkey. Apparently actually shot on film, this direct-to-DVD release has almost nothing going for it that you haven't seen or heard a hundred times already.Despite the presence of a number of recognizable character actors like Richard "Three O'Clock High" Tyson, Erick "Stargate" Avari, and Raymond J.

Larry Clark is not renowned for his talents as a writer or a director, but he has made some undeniably important films. Kids, Bully, and to a lesser extent Ken Park all achieve their intended purpose: shock, revulsion, and even disgust. These films are uncompromising in their content and use their controversial nature to expose very serious problems in modern youth. Kids exposed us to the proliferation of A.I.D.S. and sexual promiscuity among the young. Bully touched upon similar issues. Ken Park dealt somewhat ham-handedly with sexual abuse and suburban ennui.

Negative numbers are not available to convey how bad this movie is! Wooden acting coupled with a story line that has been rehashed dozens of times. Everyone in this movie should attend Overactors Anonymous. You would think an original story could evolve from the general concept. Young men at a prep school are tying to come to grips with the Pearl Harbor bombing. It does raise interesting questions, but the manner in which they are conveyed make it more of a joke. The typical characters were present including the zealous jock and nerd (glasses included).

I did n't expect much from this movie , it was just one of those movies I thought I 'd like more than I did , and this movie was one of those good ones that didn 't do much for me either way . this is one of those movies you can only really appreciate if you have seen all of the previous installments , and even then you have to admit that not much happens here , there are a couple of cool setpieces , a couple of good jokes and some great character work , but you have to admit it never amounts to much more than that .

This representation of the popular children 's story on film is pretty pathetic to watch . I know it is just a kids 's story , but come on , kids would know better than that . The kids should be thinking of themselves when making a movie about the lives of their ' friends . How many kids are really going to sit there for 5 minutes and watch a film like that , or more . This film is a disgrace to the movie makers . I can not wait for it to be released on DVD by Disney . The movie will be a bomb , and it is already out in the world .

George Zucco was like Boris Karloff in the fact no matter how poor the film he appeared in was, he would always maintain a sense of dignity and turn in a fine performance. "The Mad Monster" is no exception to that rule. It is by all standards a poor (if entertaining) film. The filmmakers obviously didn't know how to make the most of their low budget and the script seems as if it was turned out in one or two days. Still, Zucco is fine and believable as the mad scientist.The film itself is enjoyable on a camp level.

Found this film for one dollar ($1.00) and the film was a complete waste of time. Reb Brown,(Mark Hardin), played a military adviser in South America and was successful in capturing the leader of rebel soldiers operating out of the dense jungles. However, Mark joins the opposite side after some horrible tortures were inflicted or women and men. In one scene as Mark is having a drink in a hotel bar, his eyes catch the glimpse of sexy long legs Sandra Spencer (Shannon Tweed),"Dead Sexy",01.

Of course I am going to think it was a great movie. I recognized several people I didn't see during filming also. I was the one playing the guard about an hour into the movie in the death row exercise yard asking for a light for a cigarette. I also changed this one scene. They had originally had it set to go into the rec yard and straighten out the inmate and turn him around and walk him out. The Director said "It is taking to long, what would you do Gower."

I wish I had read the comments on IMDb before I saw this movie. The first 1 hour was OK, though it did make me wonder why everything was centered at Chicago and why no one reported any weather anomaly from outside US. Isolated acts of nature (of this magnitude) are unthinkable. But beyond the first 60 minutes, the movie just drags on like a never-ending story. The screenplay is horrible. As for the actors, very poor choice. Only the people hired to run in panic stick to their roles.

The only good either of the Problem Child films caused was bringing together Amy Yasbeck and the late John Ritter. Aside from that, the flicks are as demonic as their hero. In this basically unnecessary sequel, freshly separated Ben (Ritter) and his little hellraiser Junior (Michael Oliver, who never needs screen-time ever again) move to a new town infested with willing bachelorettes. Ben eventually picks Lawanda (played by the most underused original SNL-er Laraine Newman), whose Blanche DuBois tendencies don't suit Junior in the least.

Awesome Movie! Great combination of talents! I'm a HUGE fan of David Duchovny and he is outstanding in this movie! I would love to see him in more movies of this nature. His talents are definitely under-used and has SO much more to offer besides "Agent Mulder" (although I'm a huge fan of that series too), Anyway, I want to see more of him. He is easily the Cary Grant of our generation. If you haven't seen this movie, you MUST! Great love story that shows love never dies... it's with you forever.

This is another Sci-Fi channel original movie staring Rhys Davies where its hard to decide whats worse , the acting , or the CGI. We dont even get to talk about the story of course , its all about one man trying to figure out why he has to go through life without knowing why he was made to live this way . There is a big twist in the ending that will leave you guessing till the end as to whats going on. The movie is very interesting with lots of twists and one liners. The only thing that was a little disappointing was the editing.

One would have expected Hitchcock's return to major studio filmmaking to err on the side of chastened caution. Surely few expected his most riotous, unrestrained film, a gleeful melange of vicious black comedy, exciting suspense, mocking manipulation, and astonishing flights of fancy. But that is precisely what they got: STRANGERS ON A TRAIN.What is remarkable is how much Bruno's transgression disrupts the world of the film. Much has been made of the masterly crosscutting motif, but its immediate effect is to completely obstruct the straight line of progress Guy is making of his life, and hence the society he represents or is eager to join.

I'm not sure if this is a comedy or not, but I found it pretty comical. Isobel is possessed by the devil. Somehow a perverted priest and the gardener are gonna' fix that. Part exorcism and part soap opera, you'll at least get some laughs. There's the paranoid jealous dad, satanic sister, Valley of the Dolls mother, and then the cowboy boyfriend; all there to help the skirt chasing priest fight the demons from dear Isobel. It sometimes felt like a Jerry Springer episode, but I actually paid to see this.

Bad , bad , movie , so bad it is worth watching . As long as you watch this movie , you ll get to know a little bit about who she is . This movie is very very very bad . A very very very very bad movie . Very very bad , very very bad, very very bad . Very very very bad , very bad, so bad i will never see it again. very bad, very very bad , very bad. very bad, so bad, very bad , very bad, so bad .

Dear Readers, 2001: A Space Odyssey is Kubrick at his best...although I really can't say that as Space Odyssey is his only film I've ever watched. But still, it's a good film. Strange, but good.The movie is in three acts, much like the novel...which is unsurprising since the author wrote the screenplay. Anyhow, we first start out with the simple yet spectacular opening with Also Sparach Zarathustra blaring on the speakers. Then comes the boring beyond belief 'Dawn of Man' sequence.

While many pass this off as a B movie it is, indeed, a first class comedy that is well-written and acted. Red Skelton is great as Wally Benton better known to radio fans as The Fox. Ann Rutherford is perfect as Wally's fiance Carol Lambert. Conrad Veidt leads a very well cast gang of criminals. I read one account of this movie which states that Vincente Minelli directed this film, not unless he changed his name to S. Sylvan Simon, who directed all three of the Fox movies. This is a very entertaining film made when imagination was encouraged.

This is quite possibly the worst film I have ever seen. I would think you could get that from the title. Also, there is a particular love scene that could be the strangest in the history of film. I can't even remember why I saw this film or when. Only that is an absolutely horrible movie-viewing experience. On the other hand, if you are looking for the absolute weirdest movie to waste two hours of your time, then by all means rent it. Good luck finding it at your local store though. I doubt this movie is in a very wide-distribution.

In Moscow, the young couple Veronika (T. Samojlova) and Boris (Aleksey Batalov) are in deep love for each other. With the World War II, Boris volunteers to join the army and is sent to the front on the day before Veronika's birthday, and they do not have the chance to say goodbye to each other. While waiting for news from Boris, Veronika is raped by Boris' cousin Mark (A. Shvorin) and they marry each other. However, Veronika does not forget Boris, and keeps waiting for him.

Burt Kennedy both wrote & directed this western taken from a novel . Kennedy was a well known good writer/director/producer during the early days of TV, and it was not until about 1960 that the western got a second generation of directors and producers. As a kid in the 1930s it seemed to me as if a good movie had been made every week and there was an abundance of it. You could just walk into the drive-in with your friends and find a movie playing (or better yet, watching on a giant TV screen).

I mean really , really , REALLY high and this movie has a shot at entertainment . I do n't think they could pull it off as well as they have in the last 2 months , but let me tell you , you will see a great movie on the big screen , and you can tell by the trailer that you will be glad you paid for it and your friends did too! I will try and get some pictures at the theatre to post when I can, so check back soon if you're interested and let me know if there are pics. Thanks!

Oh , Yawn . Not another chick flick where the men are all pigs and the women will get even if the movie doesn’t end up working out . This one was made in 1998 but I remember seeing it and thinking, what the hell were they thinking? I was right, I don’t know why it got made or what it’s trying to convey but I was wrong. It was poorly done but it didn’t suck , at least it didn’t to me. It did suck , it really sucked, and when you’re wrong , your wrong.

The movie is apparently based on a popular French horror novel, by Arthur Bernède, from 1927. Not that I had ever heard about it before but Belphégor has been a popular subject before for movies and mini-series. The first movie got released way back in 1927, simultaneously with the novel. Arthur Bernède was a part of a group of writers who wrote and produced films and novels simultaneously. The character Belphégor is one of his best known creations.Once upon a time Sophie Marceau was a promising new European actress who would conquer Hollywood. She has now however dropped back again to movies like this one.

Okay , so this series kind of takes the route of 'here we go again ! ' Week in , week out , month in month out , it really is like that . In fact , one can argue that since the last year or two there has been not much new in the way of 'news' of this type . In other words , its a series of rehashes . And this time the topic is not of the day - but , this time it is not the month or even year . It is , this time , a topic that is way out of date !

Okay , it 's a movie for children , and it 's not one of those movies that adults will enjoy. And that's ok , I don't mind too. I can appreciate the movie for it's very good story. It has been years since the first one was made and a lot of people have taken the same movie and have made changes, adding more to the story, adding things to the plot and also adding more characters to the plot. But that is where it is at and that is what a good story is.

As embarrassing as it is to admit , I was listed as production manager on this film ... my very first one (and I was thrilled and honored to do it). Here is the script by my friend and "production manager":

“Carmen, you were there on the night they murdered the three people in the room you’re looking for. Don’t bother to tell me what it was. Just tell me where they took him.”

It was a summer night, early evening. The air still. The lights still.

MR. BASEBALL is a film of paradoxes. Written and filmed as a "light, sports comedy" it truly has a heartwarming core as human and universal as some of Capra's finest. At the plot level, you have the paradox of baseball, a fine old American game, as it is played in Japan - turned around, with American values cast off and Japanese values imprinted upon the game. (Some of the superficial "sports comedy" results from Jack's uncomprehending disbelief at how "basa-boru" is played in Japan.)

Wrestlemania 6 , is an entertaining Wrestlemania , if not an entirely successful one . The Ultimate Challenge , is the event , but it’s also the Wrestlemania main event . The main event is the one to remember . If you missed it , here’s the video recap from WrestleCrate . In this recap, we have a few thoughts on the event , and the future of Wrestlemania :

Ronda Rousey and Johny Hendricks put the best performance of their careers at WrestleMania 6 and were rewarded with a decisive victory over Asuka and Bayley.

and there are not many in cinema history . `` Rouge '' seems to be a bit of a hope-theatre-type movie, which may have been good for this film's production. But it will take more than hope to get it in the cinema. The audience should have more of a reason to attend the movie than they did. In fact I think it might be best to wait until the first film, `` A Night At The Opera'' is released. I'm glad I was not wrong about `` Rouge. '' I have to say that I liked it much better than I thought I would like it.

I am a fan of bad horror films of the 1950s and 60s -- films so ridiculous and silly that they seem like parodies of their own genre. But I've never actually seen one I liked. I think I've seen everything, but even I don't know which films I have seen and which I haven't. I'm hoping this list will help put a name on the unknown films I've never even heard of. Note: Some of these films were made in black and white; others in color. All are on DVD, though most are presented in the original theatrical aspect ratio.

Breathtaking at it 's best , intriguing at it 's worst , Francis Ford Coppala 's groundbreaking epic 'Apocalypse Now' has its detractors and fans. It has become the quintessential Vietnam War documentary. But there are other works by the same director which have more in common with this one. One of Coppala's first and most iconic films was 'The New World' (1959) in which he made a film about a utopian world without poverty and war, but in one of the first films about a world without the need to go to war, 'Apocalypse Now' is more in keeping with a world without war .

The movie is great for Venezuelan tourism , birds , birds and more birds . Only 1 piranha . Nice to watch the movie when there are piranha around the boat . So we can watch the movie and enjoy the moment . The movie was a hit with the kids and grown ups . We are enjoying it now while walking at the beach . This movie is great for tourists and a lot of them love it because of the beautiful and beautiful beach and the beautiful scenery. We have been swimming a lot since we arrived here and this movie makes us want to go back to the beach more and more.

This is one of the most laughably bad films I've ever seen. I cannot believe whoever wrote the review above was serious. Perhaps he was connected with making it. It doesn't have anything going for it. There is no suspense, the acting is dire, the direction hopeless. The music score (?) is three trite notes played ad nauseam. The plot (?) must have taken all of five minutes to write. The dialogue is what a 10-year-old would come up with if asked to do a homework project.

This movie didn't do it for me, an avid SNL fan for the past 14 years. Jamie Gertz' portrayal was OK, but there was something so off-putting about the movie itself. The facts presented in the movie are totally skewed. But Merv Griffin produced it, so that would explain a lot. He was never on SNL, nor had anything to do with it. The points in her life when she was on SNL are backwards. When we first see her on SNL, walking through the studio with Lorne Michaels, the logo on the wall is circa 1988-1989, not 1975.

FBI Agents Mulder and Scully get assigned to probe the mystery of what happened to an Arctic drilling team , and begin to suspect a sinister cover-up. But what exactly is at the heart of that mystery and what is the truth about the missing scientists? Mulder and Scully go back in time to investigate what really went down in the oil drilling operation on Alaska's north coast, where a strange and deadly explosion took place. But what happened to the missing scientist team? And why did Scully's ex-boyfriend show up on her doorstep one day and ask for Scully's help in getting his daughter back?

All I can do is echo the sentiment already expressed by some of the other commenters . This is CITY OF LOS ANGELES POLICE , NOT SAN FRANCISCO POLICE. I am sure you will all be glad to know that I am a proud Los Angeles Police Department (or LAPD) officer and have never had an encounter with San Francisco Police in the past. I have a great working relationship with the LAPD and respect and appreciate that they have a professional police force that does a terrific job in providing the highest quality law enforcement service to the residents and businesses of San Francisco.

Every time I see a film like this I get sick to my stomach . When I watch a movie with a story like this I feel a sense of shame. This film is a disgrace . I would love to see this movie put on a big screen and for everyone to see it . I know I'm just being a little bitter and jealous because I want to see this movie myself , but still I can't see this movie being a movie . It's a movie that makes you cry and you know it's not going to change your life , that's all .

This great film never showed up in my town, so actually I didn't have any opportunity to watch it until the late 80'es when I caught it on German television. I was expecting something of a disaster, and found instead a well-acted grand western with superb location work. The tiny tube couldn't really damage it and there's almost not a dull moment in this 4-hour film, so I hope to see it once again on the big screen. What a spectacle that would be! Don't miss it, if you ever have the chance.

Being a former MST3k watcher, even I found this movie unwatchable. The awful attempts at humor-heck the awful attempts at acting. Nobody needs to read a harangue on this piece of junk.I just like how all the positive reviews were clearly written by cast members or family friends. Just click on their other reviews and wow--they are all reviewing Modern Vampires. Give me a couple of bucks and I can make a movie better than this. One of the most incompetent pieces of film-making I've ever seen and that's saying something.

This movie made by the NFBC was made in honor of the Montreal Canadians dynasty years in the 50's,60's and 70's. My 5th grade teacher played this in class in honor of my 11th birthday in 1987 and also to celebrate my return from a serious facial injury in 1986. I have been a Canadians fan for 29 of my 30 years of life. on a scale of 1-10, I give this film a 117. All hockey fans should see this as I hope it will be placed in the Hockey Hall of Fame in Toronto and shown at the Bell Centre in Montreal or here in Edmonton at Rexall Place.

Demon Wind is about as much fun as breaking your legs. It is definitely an awful example of a film. So awful in fact that I don't even consider it a movie. I describe it more as a thing ... a monstrous thing. A thing that must be stopped at all costs. My friends and I first discovered this ... thing buried under a big box of video tapes at my friend's house. It was a late night and we had nothing better to do so we decided to watch some cheesy horror movies (we unfortunately picked this one.)

CAUTION: SPOILERSAlthough this film moved a bit slow at times, the brilliant scenery, richness of the characters and powerful themes make `Morte a Venezia' a rewarding experience. I have not read Thomas Mann's book, but I am certain that Visconti's visual splendour, musical score, and powerful evocation of conflict and desire must do it justice. The study of Gustav von Aschenbach alludes to the human tendency to rationalize and quantify our emotions, behaviour and passion. This tendency is demonstrated in the scene in Germany between Alfred and Gustav when Alfred describes Music as being both mathematical--i.e.

I have just seen Today You Die . It is bad , almost very bad.1 ) The direction and editing is bad, so is the writing .2) the characters are horrible. There are only 3 so-called "good ones" in the whole story. I don't want to tell how they are really , but their behavior is not realistic. They are not like the real world people.3) There are some people I know who have read it , who tell me they can't finish it because they don't like it. That is their problem not mine.

As I said , sometimes low budget is good . You get to see a good movie without a lot of money but sometimes that's not the best thing. If the movie is better than what a few people say is good , then everyone is going to say it is good even though there is no audience for it . the movie is great but it's the people who think its great who are wrong . if i had to give a list , i would give it to you first , i would start with this , and i would end with this .

Haines is excellent as the brash cadet who thinks West Point will really amount to something now that he has found his destiny. He’s as much of a romantic as his father was, too. His first kiss is as tender and sweet, as well as a little rueful. A lot of what he is going to learn has to do with love and loyalty. Even so, he’s not entirely sure if he really wants to go there. He’s about to be the youngest captain ever.

I first saw this movie at least thirty years ago , and it remains one of my all-time faves ! It’s a great movie that will not be to everyone's taste , but the plot is unique , and it will bring you to the point where you think to yourself , ‘ Wow ! I have seen that type of movie before!’ And so you go back and you go to the movie house and you sit back , and it’s a great movie to watch , even though it's not for everyone .

For this movie , based off of a TV show , and a serious finale . I thought that it was very good and I enjoyed it a lot and it was worth watching . The movie was good , but a bit overrated . I thought the whole movie was very well acted and had great scenery . The only thing I thought it needed was some action scenes . And it didn't have too many of those and they were very short and only came in the climax . I really don't know . I just didn't feel like it had too much action .

This is one of the worst anime series I have ever seen. When I watched the manga review in a magazine, I thought it was maybe interesting, but when I got the chapters I realized it was a complete stupidity.OK, the first 2 or 3 chapters are OK, and the series have an standard. But as the plot advances, it becomes totally incoherent. The series tries to show some mystical based upon the Christian mythologies, but it's a total stupidity. It features some demons and stigmata scenes... Totally nonsense.

I finally watched the third film in Mehta 's trilogy : `` Fire '' . To begin , I 'd like to tell you how I became aware of the movie : it was on TV the day after it was aired on CNN. I did not pay attention to the movie. I saw that there had been a new release on the same day on VHS, and I did not think anything more about it. But later that night, I watched the film and was completely mesmerized. The plot is about the life and the death of Bollywood actor , Ashok Kumar in a small town.

A small-town schoolteacher ( Geena Davis ) slowly begins to realize that she has suffered amnesia and really use to be a different person in the past. Now a widow living in the idyllic town of Arcadia, New Mexico, she's got everything she needs to forget her past. Unfortunately, she has no idea exactly when the events of her past happened or how to forget them. Her past is about to catch up to her in an all-out assault from the past, and she'll soon discover that she may not be able to survive another memory-erasing experience.

The centerpiece of Lackawanna Blues is the character Rachel "Nanny" Crosby, who runs a boardinghouse and provides unflagging support to a young boy, Ruben, the narrator of the film. Based upon the experiences of writer-actor Ruben Santiago-Hudson, the film lovingly recreates the upstate New York boardinghouse and evokes the cultural climate of a world in transition in the 1960s. The first half of the film is virtually non-stop music. The second half addresses more completely the various characters in the boardinghouse. Nanny's ability "to take fragments and make them whole" affects everyone within her sphere.

The first of the Italian rip-offs of the French soft porn blockbuster (though it might be interesting to note that the boot-shaped country actually got their first with Cesare Canevari's 1968 IO, EMMANUELLE starring Erika Blanc) is a very different kettle of fish than the sleazy sequels provided by the late, questionably great Joe D'Amato. It is much closer in spirit to the now very dated Just Jaeckin film from 1973, taking a pokerfaced look at male/female relationships, questioning such then hot topics as fidelity and jealousy, all in luxurious exotic surroundings.

This movie had very few moments of real drama . After the opening minutes the film descended in a spiral into an inane mess that would make a child cry. What I actually liked was the movie's characters. They did not get enough screen time to develop into the people they would become in the future, but I could forgive that for the lack of screen time. The acting was not very good at all, but I guess that's a good thing, since there wasn't much to be said about that.

Wow... I suspected this one to be bad... But now I find myself just at a loss for words... Honestly, no words of mine can do this movie any justice...I'll try to say something anyway...This truly is one unique gem. One of the worst kind.Lash La Rue - given his background as an actor - doing a whip-fight with a Toltec sorcerer-zombie during the movie's climax...??? A true stroke of genius, without a doubt.It rarely happens that I laugh out loud when watching a movie alone.

As an ex ( nuclear ) submarine officer I must admit this is my favorite submarine movie ( even exceeding the movie submarine movie from the 80’s) . I watched it as a child I was about 13 yrs old . I’ve never seen anything like it . It has all the great things of the original . It is full of adventure and has great plot twists . It’s one of those “ I know what I’m doing and I am going to make it” movies . I can tell you exactly what will happen before the movie starts .

I'm sorry, but this really does feel like a modern day Apollo 13 knock-off. Totally implausible (at least Armageddon FELT like a comic book! This felt like a bad High School film project), acting was about as cliché as one can get, and....landing a space shuttle on an LA freeway? Come on. Seriously. Jerry, what were you thinking? And all the clichés: The pregnant astronaut's wife, the nosy reporter who gets in everyone's way, the stalwart manager with "Go Fever".

In Reunion Island in the Indian Ocean, the owner of a cigarette factory Louis Mahé (Jean-Paul Belmondo) is engaged through correspondence with Julie Roussel and he does not know her. When Julie arrives in the island to get married with Louis, he waits for her in the docks but Louis does not recognize Julie in the passenger vessel and finds that she is totally different from the picture she had sent to Louis. They get married and Louis shares his bank accounts with her. When Julie's sister writes a letter to Louis asking her sister to write to her, Louis discovers that the woman is not Julie that is missing.

Dr. Marnie Bannister ( Magda Konopka ) is a horribly disfigured woman . When one of her colleagues discovers a mysterious scar on her face, she must decide: is it the face of a serial killer or a medical miracle? As she struggles to face the world, Magda begins to question herself: can she trust her doctor, or her faith? Can she believe her heart? And when the unthinkable happens, what is the point of believing in something so far from the truth? Can she save a child from death? And what will it cost Magda to accept the truth, if she ever discovers it?

This is the only movie that I can think of where after it ended , I was seething with anger. Why was the director such a dick about it? I watched the movie 3x a week after it first came out and had no idea about the issues it faced. It made my life better, it made the movies better, it made my experience as a movie goer better, it made me think I should make more movies, it taught me things that I didn’t know and I didn’t know what it was that I had learnt.

Naruse is typically considered one of the 3 master founders of Japanese film , the other two being Ozu and Satō. Born in Chōshi, Kanagawa, he graduated from Keio High School, after which he entered the Tokyo School of Theatre. He then went on to study theatre at Tokyo University's department of drama, graduating at the top of his class in 1925. He won the Japan Art Academy Award in 1928, and in 1933 the Noh Drama Scholarship, the highest honour bestowed on a Japanese performer. In the same year he became a professor at the Tokyo College of Music and Dance.

Apparently this movie was based on a true story . I 'm not sure how accurate it is , though , I think I 'm a bit disappointed . I'm not sure what happened to this guy , but he has to be in his 60s by now , and he really is an interesting man . It's the first time I read about this guy, and now I have to see this movie . I don't want to ruin the ending , though . I'm not a fan of the book , which is not surprising . The movie is based on the book of a different kind .

Dolemite is one of the best movies featuring a pimp as a hero, who takes down the man, meanwhile hooking up with all the finest women that the ghetto has to provide. Mind you that these women know karate, and are fine foxy ladies.SPOILER--the end fight scene is pretty crazy, with Dolemite ripping the heart out of Willy Green. Make sure your copy is unrated.Plus there are a cast full of innovative brilliant characters like the Hamburger Pimp, Reverend, Mayor, Queen Bee, and others. The apparel is great, and the sets are full of 70's style.

Supposedly, a movie about a magazine sending journalists to investigate reports of UFOs with one being more or less tolerant or agnostic about the whole affair and the other an Aussie, a hardened skeptic who laughs at the UFO nonsense. It's all a crock, some kind of money making racket.Turns out this movie is actually a deceit, and a trap to actually promulgate Christian teachings and the Christian explanation of UFOs, one I've heard before. This is an ad hoc explanation that is itself not at all biblical but invented by certain modern theologians who can fit anything and everything into their mythology.

Now here is a movie that does something that has n't been done in a long time . It take's a standard issue horror film and gives it an edgy twist that is sure to get people talking and making them look at your movie. This is an awesome movie that takes a standard genre and takes it to another level. As a movie reviewer it's my job to bring something to the movie review table. I like to give my opinion on all things horror. I like a good gore and if you're not afraid to go there in your movie then I'm happy to be your reviewer.

As a rule, I try to find as much in films as I possibly can to enjoy them. I made no exceptions with "Tart", doing my very best to appreciate it for what it was. But no effort, no matter how great, could possibly redeem this pitiful excuse for a movie.It failed for a number of reasons. Firstly, the cinematography was directionless and ineffective. Secondly, the script reached depths of 'poor' that took it well and truly beyond the 'so bad it's good' category. Thirdly, the acting left mind-blowing amounts to be desired - it was appalling, it really was.

This film 's a big bore . It has a plenty of Predictable plots & endless sentiments from the start . The dialog is a bit weak & the characters weak . The music is ok , but is lacking a bit . The climax has nothing to do with the rest of the film . This film is a failure . It is a very predictable film with a lot of dialogue. The dialogue is the best part of it, but the whole thing is very slow paced and has no energy. The characters are all the same, and that's what I dislike about a lot of this film.

I believe I share the same psychological outlook on the world with Kieslowski. He is Polish, I am Dutch, yet we share a synthetic mind: the world is not void of the metaphysical amidst total coincidence. Hardly ruled by man or perhaps by a poet-prime minister, so that as a social and cultural 'low pressure area', Poland could play the role it did in WWII, being critical yet Christian towards the Jews but often not less critical toward oneself. There are innocence and guilt in Kieslowski's world view, as the symbols in Catholicism: the White versus the Black Madonna.

This was such a great film . It was done with such beautiful design , such symmetry . I love this film so much , i think you should remake this movie . This is my first review . I am from Pakistan . This movie was made in 2008. I watched it in 2009, but it was not in English . I watched this movie in Hindi. So this movie was not released in India. But now in 2015 this movie is released in India. Now you should download this film in Hindi. I like this movie so much.

I am very open minded . I watch all kinds of programs to the end ... good or bad ... I have to find a program which I can not live without I have to see what is on . There is a reason they call them tv shows. They tell the truth. I can see right through all of you. There are people on here who think they know more than they really know. What they are really doing is trying to be something they can't be. There are people who watch tv all day who don't know anything about anything.

This is a haunting short film. Both James Franco and Rachel Miner deliver performances that hurt, ring true and stay with you. Since this is called a tragic story this isn't much of a spoiler. But I wanted to change the outcome, even though it is right for the story, because I had already come to care about these people. I can only think of a few short films that have had that effect on me. Beautifully shot, acted, edited. High caliber work all around, even to the use of just the right sound and/or music to advance the story.

Wrestlemania 6, is an entertaining Wrestlemania, if not an entirely successful one. The Ultimate Challenge, is of course worth the price of admission alone, but once again as with a lot of the early Mania's, there's too much filler in between. The crowd pops for almost everything, and as always, giving us the reliable announcing team of Gorilla&The Body. Having a Face vs Face match as the main event for a Wrestlemania, was absolutely unheard of at this time, it only made things that much more tense. Matches.

OK , I saw this film through Mystery Science Theater 3000 , but I did see the movie , so it is not my fault, I think. The movie is just the movie. I think the only part of the movie worth watching for are the last 20 min of it. I do agree that if it was not for the music in the beginning, and the first 20 min, the movie would be a waste of time and money. I thought the movie was really good overall, and the music really added a great deal of entertainment to the film.

Is this a good movie ? No , certainly not . But for Jolie lovers it 's must-have . Her body , her voice , her hair and eyes , her grace and her talent made her the perfect actress to play such a complicated character as Cleopatra 's wife . It 's also amazing how Jolie has made the role of a Cleopatra so believable , not only in appearance but also in acting skills . I don ' t expect to see any Hollywood movie that 's more authentic , more real , more realistic than Cleopatra and Cleopatra 's Revenge .

`` Rouge '' is part of a trilogy , but very much stands on its own . It is n't really a companion to Rouge, but it has much in common with it . And if you know anything about the Rouge books, then you won't be surprised . The story begins when a man comes back home from a war to find his little daughter gone. She's been kidnapped and her mother's in the hospital, barely alive . Now, the man is faced with the most horrifying task he could ever imagine: to find his kidnapped daughter, rescue her, and make sure she's okay.

This is easily one of the worst movies I 've seen in a long long time ( and I 've seen quite a few). I don 't mean that in the sense of the movie, the film, the movie 'cause it was okay-ish, but I don't like the idea of people like that in real life. There are only two things that bother me about this movie. One of the two things is that this movie has no redeeming value in my eyes, as it's like the first time when I read a novel that was so awful, and it had no redeeming value whatsoever.

I'm rating this pretty high just because of Sam Elliott. I could've done without the female nudity but I'd sit through almost any nonsense in order to see Sam strut his stuff. He gets to spout wonderfully cynical witticisms, many of which I agree with, and it's a joy to see him in a role in which he actually gets to emote instead of just standing around scowling and looking virile as can be. My boyfriend opined that this movie is in a couple of ways similar to a film in which Ed Harris had a Hispanic partner (in the police sense of the term!)

Well, I'm an Italian horror big fan and I love movies from directors such Argento, Fulci, Bava Sr and Bava Jr, only to quote the most famous. "La villa delle anime maledette" is one of the most unknown movie of this genre, shot when this kind of cinema began its crisis that continues still today, and director Carlo Ausino sounds totally new to my ears (althoug he directed six movies... this is the price Italian directors have to pay to not work in Rome...) . But the film is not so bad.

Okay, so writer/director Larry Bishop obviously has some important connections and knows the right people in Hollywood in order to produce his own film and fill up the cast with eye-catching names. Good for him! Now what he really still needs is inspiration and talent in order to come up with an actually worthwhile scenario rather than the overly pretentious and wannabe convoluted crap he penned down here. "Hell Ride" isn't a movie; it's a hectic and hopelessly inept fan-boy endeavor to bring homage to the notorious biker-flicks of the 60's and to the recently revived Grindhouse cinema formula in general.

First things first , I am by no means a picky movie watcher . I 'm not one of those guys who will only go for films with good story lines and great acting . All I want to see is something fresh and new , which makes the whole viewing experience a pleasure and gives me a new reason to re watch a film after watching it for the third time . And I 'm usually willing to change my opinion on something , if my initial reaction is something new that I have discovered in the last few days .

This movie spends most of its time preaching that it is the script that makes the movie, but apparently there was no script when they shot this waste of time! The trailer makes this out to be a comedy, but the film can't decide if it wants to be a comedy, a drama, a romance or an action film. Press releases indicated that Shatner and Hamlin made this movie because they loved the script (what were they thinking?). If you like William Shatner (I do) see "Free Enterprise" instead.

This has got to be the most god-awful piece of cinematic crap I have ever watched. It makes Mel Brooks movies Oscar-worthy by comparison. Jim VanBebber needs to be publicly slapped for trying to pass this off as ANY form of entertainment.While some may say that this movie is true to the low budget genre of such classics as "The Texas Chainsaw Massacre" or "Night of the Living Dead", the production value is not in question. It is VanBebber's ability to cast and present a plausible story line. The casting is deplorable.

Given the acting roles he played in the 1940s (Casper Gutman, Signior Ferrari, Mr. Peters, Jerome K. Arbutny, Ex-Superintendent Grodman, Count Fosco, Titus Semple) it surprises many of his fans to learn that originally Sidney Greenstreet made a name for himself in comedies in the West End and Broadway. He was usually such a total villain, or serious actor to the public that his comic talents were ignored. In fact he actually did make four comedy appearances (one a spoof of his villainous portrayals with his villainy partner Peter Lorre in a cameo appearance).

I couldn't stop watching this movie, though it was far past my bedtime. Comparisons to Hitchcock are deserved -- this thing really plays with you. It walks a wonderful line between real, immediate suspense and a dark, distancing humor. Like many of Hitch's heroes, our doe-eyed mute witness has innocently stumbled into something truly horrific -- and we are taken on quite a ride with her, at turns identifying totally and feeling her fear, at turns watching in thrilling suspense as she is placed further in jeopardy.The filmmakers have put in a lot of tender care in working this out.

This movie has all the ingredients of a great horror story and loses it in the last half . Few scenes in the film are well constructed, but the plot itself is so predictable that it would be a better movie if it was a remake of some classic movie instead of a remake of a horror movie . The whole concept of the movie is laughable . A group of friends head to a remote cabin to watch some horror film but they don’t know that they are in a very dangerous place , and the group is going to be the prey .

Nothing about this movie is any good. It's a formulaic predictable "romantic comedy" geared to make females force their significant others to watch. In other words, it's a predictable chic flick that is neither comedic or romantic and is extraordinarily forgettable. If you like watching the same thing over and over then this movie will fit just perfect. I was also forced to watch this with my g/f at the time and it's no surprise we are no longer together. I enjoy great movies that are wonderful to watch, while she just wants to see the same thing over and over again just with different actors.

A Chicago couple, Dillon and Dougherty, are falsely accused of killing their daughter. People begin to wonder if they did it. The police investigate and find suspicious evidence. The couple are maligned by the public and accused in the press. The cops speculate that they are Satanists and have ritually murdered their own daughter. They are charged and brought to trial. They are represented by publicity-seeking lawyers who give them bad advice and bill them for $100,000. The evidence presented against them is twisted or hidden by the police. Fabricated intimations of sexual abuse are presented.

I just watched it for the second time today and I must say with all my heart it is about damn time they made a movie about us as people not as spiritual beings. Such a waste of human life as this story was maybe some good will come out of it. And Eric is hotter than ever. To often in the movies First Nations people are seen as other than everyday people.
