We are always portrayed as chiefs or medicine people. Hey we are just like everyone else. And this movie showed just that. We hurt when an injustice is done and we can win in quest for justice.

The threesome of Bill Boyd, Robert Armstrong, and James Gleason play Coney Island carnys vying for the hand of Ginger Rogers, a working gal who sells salt water taffy. With the outbreak of World War I, the threesome enlist and pursue Ginger from afar. The first half of this RKO Pathe production is hard going, with the three male leads chewing up the scenery with overcooked one-liners and 'snappy' dialogue that quickly grows tiresome. The second half concentrates on action sequences as the US Navy pursues both a German merchant cruiser and a U-boat.

I don't know what some people were thinking when they said this movie was bad. It Was Great. Classic Bruce Campbell, yes it was low budget and the special effect showed this but that is not what you see a Bruce movie for you watch it for Bruce. Also Ted Rami was excellent. I found this movie hilarious and entertaining I still crack up when I recall Bruce on that pink moped. Now I will admit this movie is not for everyone if you don't like B movies you probably won't like this one if you crave big budget effects and actors steer clear.

Perhaps I was just in a really good mood when I watched this film. but, for whatever reason, I really liked this film. Was it terribly original? No. Was it a bit predictable? Yes. And so what? It was still a really nice movie. I've always liked Bruce Willis (well, almost always, there was Hudson Hawk and The Fifth Element, after all), and he portrayed a selfish, sarcastic b***ard perfectly. Maybe this movie isn't Academy Award material, but it sure is feel good material.

Everything everyone has said already pretty much rings true when it comes to 'The Prey'. Endless nature footage, bad acting - Aside from these elements, this is a watchable film for slasher fans that in some cases, is considered a cult classic.Jackson Bostwick and Jackie Coogan play pretty well off each other. There's also a three minute banjo solo that shows off Bostwick's skill behind the instrument. Not too bad if I do say so myself.The last ten minutes of the 'film' are its saving grace. The ending still haunts me to this day.

I 'd liked the Takashi Miike films I 'd seen so far , but I found this pretty disappointing . in fact , I felt that , even if the acting was a bit more overrated than usual , I ' d be happy to see a film like this over a year after I 've seen it and , of course , it 's a movie that can only be called a rip-off ! it ' s a movie that 's so boring and so stupid that the director is in danger of turning in to an Oscar candidate .

The film Soultaker is essentially an older form Final Destination in which several car wrecked teens have their souls separated after being hit by cars. The plot follows a group of teens who become lost in a small town after getting their cars smashed into in a car wreck. They then become stranded with no idea how to find the others. After they meet up, they realize that they are not alone, as their souls are separated and there is no way to bring back the others. As the film progresses, they each discover that the soul of the person they lost is trapped inside of their car.

Simply put, Paul Bettany and Jennifer Connelly were remarkable. The movie is less about the raw science of Darwin's beliefs, and holds the focus very strongly on his relationship with his family, primarily his wife, Emma, and daughter, Annie.Toby Jones gives a wonderful turn as Thomas Huxley, the great defender of Darwin's beliefs, and the rest of the cast is up to the task of sharing screen time with Bettany and Connelly.But it is those two who carry the movie. Their real chemistry is apparent from beginning to end, but develops transcendence as Darwin grapples with his demons.

It's just when a band tours, and only has one original member. It's not the same as the classic line up. All new actors playing the main roles of Rag, Scotty, etc, with Ashby as virtually the only returning face from the first movie. And he was of only minor note of the first flick, serving as the only redeemable group of the three guys that Scotty was trying to assist in meeting females. The film is poorly written, featuring the dumbest dialog this side of Armageddon. Even for a T&A movie, this one is a turkey.

Maybe it's just that it was made in 1997, or maybe whoever managed to get this up to a 7 has a soft spot for kids with AIDS. But really people, the maniacal laughter & mayhem during the withdrawal scene? Did you not see that coming? I'm surprised there was no baby crawling across the ceiling and sickboy addressing the camera. The acting was fine, sure. But to me this is just one example of a movie from a time when situations and subject matter could pass for cinematic language. Things happen, but that's it.

First, what is really great about this movie: - Ryan Reynolds, great acting! There are very few actors I really like and for now he is one of them. He has an amazing skill to impersonate characters. - The soundtrack! Very good music played at the right time. - The idea of a nine lost in his own world, incapable of leaving. Still, I give it only a 3 out of 10 for certain flaws: - Horrible second part. It seems that the director was very eager to make something new, but despite of the efforts it was really boring - Very annoying character Melissa.

Anything Park Chan-wook creates is guaranteed to be unique , brilliant , and very twisted at a minimum . Well I guess if you judge it by the last movie , I’m sure that it is very twisted . I mean I saw it and it’s probably one of my favorites in his whole career . And the last movie was awesome . So , I decided to give it a watch . And from what I saw , Park’s movies are very twisted . He always creates a different kind of story . And I loved his twist at the end of his movies .

As much as I love the story of David Copperfield , I can not claim to have enjoyed this movie as much as I would have hoped. I have no complaints with the direction of the film. It is good enough, even in its weaknesses. I do however have a problem with the screenplay. I have not read it, nor have I seen it. I am therefore going on what I know from other reviews. I do not want to be accused of bias. So here is what I know of the film. I have no intention of discussing the plot.

Earth has been destroyed in a nuclear holocaust. Well, parts of the Earth, because somewhere in Italy, a band of purebred survivors--those without radioactive contamination--are holed up in a massive mansion surrounded by lush grounds, waiting for the next opportunity to go hunting for those with polluted blood. The Final Executioner is the story of one of their would be victims, Alan (William Mang, who looks, not surprisingly, a lot like Kurt Russell), and his efforts to take down the legally sanctioned hunters, who are led by Edra (Marina Costa) and Erasmus (Harrison Muller Jr. ).

Unreal !!!!!!!!. After reading the initial reviews posted by alleged reviewers ,I was shocked to find that almost all of the initial reviews, 38 , all rated this film a 10. Upon comparison with other great films, these reviewers felt that the Quick and the Undead is a better film than,The 6th Sense(8.2), Saving Private Ryan(8.4), Lord of the Rings( 8.7),Godfather(9.5), Gladiator(8.1) and Dawn of the Dead ( 7.8) to name a few.

There is really no way to compare this motion picture to any other movie because no one has ever made a science fiction story like this before. The movie was so imaginative and exciting, that the audience couldn't wait to see what the final product would be like. After watching the last scene, I didn't even know how the story could possibly continue. This is a terrific motion picture that needs to be seen by everyone. It definitely should be seen by everyone! This film is the perfect example of what not to do.

So, it's Friday night and you want to go watch a movie...all you want is something entertaining, not too artsy, or anything that might require a long night of philosophical discussions. So, you pay $10 to watch the Mod Squad. The trailer to this movie should have tipped me off, but come on...it's three of Hollywood's most beautiful people--eye candy. But that's about it...a string of moving Prada ads. And what did Hollywood producers forget? A plot. Why are these kids running around the streets after some unknown enemy?

My mom and I went to the Ft Worth Premiere mainly to see George Strait, but ended up getting the chance to see the movie premier at Bass Hall. What a wonderful, beautiful film which not only depicts the beautiful Texas landscape, but also had a great feel-good storyline. It was well written, directed and produced and my mom and I loved it from start to finish!. Thank you Jay for giving us the opportunity to be a part of the premiere of this wonderful movie. It was a night we will never forget.

When the film started I got the feeling this was going to be something special . The acting and camera work seemed to be very professional . The film did seem to move at a different rate than the books and seemed to take more time . It was only after watching the first three quarters of the film and getting a feeling that there was something going on that I got to read the comments made by those that saw the films. It is always a shame when a movie fails to live up to its publicity. This film did not disappoint in the way it should .

Assy McGee is an out-of-control, hard-nosed detective based on the countless examples from late 20th century police dramas. The twist here is that Assy is literally a walking buttocks.The cheap, low-brow facade of the show belies its cleverness and hidden satire. That is not to say that Assy is devoid of fart jokes, just that the toilet humor is used sparingly enough to elicit consistent laughs, not groans and eye-rolls. The title sequence of the program demonstrates the clever, subtle humor used throughout. The sequence consists of panning photos of the city set to a jazzy 70s cop theme.

In his feature film debut ` Yellow , ' Chris Chan Lee attempts to enlighten Hollywood 's portrayal of Asian-Americans by providing the first true account of Asian-American actors within the studio system, from being cast to getting cast. He examines how a number of film industries, including Warner Bros. , MGM , Fox , Paramount and Walt Disney , use Asian-American actors in film, and he looks at the role of Asian-Americans in American pop culture by looking at how Asians have been used as an exotic exotic in Hollywood, and in pop culture, from television and movies to comics and television.

I do n't really know why so many persons love this movie : maybe it 's funny , OK , i do not know . it is not the funniest or the most original movie , 
but i love it anyway and i am willing to go to see it , 
and if you like this movie then you can rent it for $ 1 .99 . so go watch the movie , 
and you will enjoy it . yes , i am so happy to see 
that you love this movie , i am very happy to see you like me .

Every time I see a film like this I get sick to my stomach. When I watch a movie I like to see what I see in everyday life. As I go through my day I see blacks, whites, Asians, Latinos etc...How do you cast a film and don't even think of the possibility that other ethnic groups will walk past you? I'm sure they didn't do it on purpose but pay attention. I don't care if it takes place in Kansas or South Central. All I saw was one token black.

This is a joke , right ? This ca n't be a real film ? It 's not even a bad joke ? It is not even a bad joke ? This joke is funny ? Is this joke real ? What is a real joke ? Not to say that this joke is in the least bit original, but it does make sense. I don't really get the point of this film. It is funny and well written, but I don't care about the joke. I'm a film fan but that's why I watch film, not for this particular joke.

Okay , now I know where all those boring cop/homicide TV shows came from . I do believe they can be exciting sometimes but most times I would rather watch a really good cop show like Law and Order , NYPD , Homicide and all those other ones . In my mind , the cop is always at the scene , the suspect always has something to hide , the detectives always have their own agenda , the victims always have a secret to hide . So , the whole thing is always boring and nothing ever happens . And I am sick of all these boring cop shows .

A criminally short lived show that went on to spawn three movie spin-offs (Naked Gun 1, 2 & 3), this is fast-paced, in your face, rapid fire comedy that has more hits than misses. Leslie Nielsen plays Detective Lieutenant Sergeant Frank Drebin, an incompetent Detective who bumbles and fumbles his way through cases, with the capable assistant of his boss, Capt. Ed Hocken.The story lines are spurious, at best, but it's deliberate, as the goodness here lies not in the storytelling, but in the weaving of a constant flurry of jokes along with some genuinely weird and wonderful characters.

In Moscow , the young couple Veronika ( T. Samojlova ) and Boris ( Aleksey Batalov ) are in deep love. They want to build a life together in order to get married. However, Boris feels the urge to leave Russia and emigrate. So, in a last attempt to win her heart, he proposes the idea of emigrating together to Berlin , where he will meet a German woman. Veronika accepts Boris’ proposal but soon finds out that her boyfriend is cheating on her with his secretary. They spend the night together, and Boris decides to leave Russia for Berlin.

Many believe this movie is a baseball movie . Such people are disappointed because it 's about a baseball player, and in the baseball world, there is no "baseball movie". This baseball movie is not a baseball movie . Now, there was a baseball movie. But it's not a baseball movie because:

1) The baseball movie does not have to deal with baseball. 2) This movie is about the real baseball player who does not play in the baseball movies. So, we have a baseball movie with a baseball player. Who is this baseball player?

This was one of the few Norwegian movies I actually looked forward too see . It started of as a little movie about an old guy who goes out on a trip to visit a woman he met on a ferry. When they get to her cabin he realizes he has forgotten his wallet and in his haste he leaves her a note to come back and get it . So he returns and gets the wallet . But when he goes back out on the ferry again to leave the note , he realizes she hasn't gotten it .

There is a serious scene in this movie. A scene that lets you know that his film won't be pulling many cheap punches. It takes place in a crowded train station and the protagonists are ambushed by assassins with automatic weapons. They make a break for it and just manage to get out in a hail of gunfire. The main hall of the train station is now filled with corpses of innocent people that were caught in the crossfire. Some would call that too sad and/or grim to put into what is supposed to be an enjoyable action flick. I call it honesty.

Jack Lemmon was one of the finest actors that had ever graced the screen . He could effortlessly switch from comedy to tragedy with equal aplomb. And I can’t remember a single scene he did not portray with great skill. He was the perfect man for this role. In fact, I would go so far as to say that he is the perfect choice to play this part. He does everything he can to protect his wife, but he just doesn’t want to be a hero and has no intention of letting it happen.

Recently I borrowed a copy of this mess of a movie, which took me three sessions over three days to get through. That's another comment in the making.But what I wanted to comment on first was the carelessness on the special features of the DVD. It included a game of memory, which asks the player/viewer to match up pairs of animals in order for them to board the ark. However, every time it reveals the chosen animal, the screen prompts the player to find (or congratulates the player on finding)"it's mate."

Thursday June 15 , 9:30pm The EgyptianSaturday June 17 , 11:00am The Egyptian '' He spent most of his life in New York before moving to California in the 1970s. It was during that decade that he was exposed to a diverse array of cultures including jazz music from Africa, South America and Asia. It was in New Orleans that he was introduced to the world of music. "He loved New Orleans, loved jazz, loved everything about that place -- it was the real thing. The real New Orleans -- the sound of it" He said.

I have n't laughed this much in a long time - or seen a film so ineptly made ! Talk about being out of your mind. Well, I thought, I will have to get up early in the morning on Thursday. I was going to go to the office and prepare a report. But I had a feeling that something more important was happening in the town. So I got up earlier than expected. I checked out the local news papers, saw the report, and I felt that I had to see what it was about before I did anything else.

The "silver screen" gets freshly polished with this beautiful film about aging happily and enjoying life's rainbows. There's plenty of silver hair on this silver screen, but the film's namesake is more like 85-going on-25 with his energy, humor and lust for life. The story of entertainer extraordinaire Uncle Frank, his devoted wife Aunt Tillie, and the zippy residents of the local area nursing homes inspires us to "live each day as if it's your last" and brings a glimmer of hope to those often-dreaded golden years. A great movie for young and old audiences!

Shot in my former home town by a couple of college kids, this movie centers around some freak named "luther". Luther, recently paroled (revealed to us by an arguing parole board in one of the most laughably scenes of all time), runs amuck at the local Kroger grocery by eating an old woman's neck with his metal teeth.Luther runs to farm where he eats a guy, steals a car, ties up an old woman, and gets chased, and gets killed. Oh, and the chick from the SUPERBOY tv show gets naked.

I had to get this movie , since it did n't come to where I live . I waited patiently for 3 years to watch it , finally I did . Great movie, it had a lot of action , drama and romance . It was a film worth the watch. I have never heard of the film, but I am very glad that you have recommended it. I have never been that attracted to movies, but have really liked this movie in particular. The plot was very interesting and I liked how it was told with different characters and scenes.

You know, this is one of those "Emperor's New Clothes" films. It's like, so off the wall and strange that you're SUPPOSED to like it if you're really into film. Well, I think that's a bunch of bologna. Films like this which hide under the cloak of Dada or surrealism make me nuts. Some person has this bad dream, perhaps brought on by eating the aforementioned bologna right before going to bed, remembers most of it (unfortunately) and then puts it on film and we're all supposed to marvel at their creative genius.

"Valley Girl" launched Nicolas Cage's career and was an 80's version of "Romeo and Juliet." It is a definite example of an 80's teen classic. Nicolas Cage, Deborah Foreman and Elizabeth Daily all have brilliant portrayals in this movie, but it will never top "Fast Times at Ridgemont High" as the ultimate 80's teen flick because if it weren't for "Fast Times," then the 80's generation of teen flicks would just be a big blow to the head. That's for sure.

Laura Gemser plays a magazine photographer who is sent to Africa for a photo shoot . There she is met by a young woman who takes her under her wing and offers to help her in every way possible. The two soon fall in love with each other, and they decide that she will be the woman that they will be able to live without. A few years pass and Gemser finds herself back in America, but this time she's married with a baby on the way. As her marriage begins to fall apart she begins to see her life in a different way.

First off, I'm not a firefighter, but I'm in some kind of para-firefighting unit (the guys who get called if an earthquake hits and the real firefighters need more people for SAR), so I had some training and simulation but I have no real-life experience.But still, there are some points one notices as totally unbelievable. I can understand that they removed the mouth/nose-pieces of the masks and that there is not enough smoke, because the public would otherwise see nothing. But some things defy logic: - No second mask attached to the oxygen.

GOLD RAIDERS ( 1951 ) A dull western/comedy feature with the Three Stooges ( including Shemp Howard at this point ) in it . I don't remember the name of this film or this company. This might have been released by Warner Brothers Pictures as a "feature length cartoon". This was the last film to be directed by Tex Avery, and was made at the same time that the three Stooges was on Broadway. I don't have a set time that this film started shooting, so it may not have been the very last film made, but it was definitely made at this time .

Made with film stock left over from the production of Nana, 1927's Sur un Air de Charleston is described as a holiday film for all concerned, and that's the best way to view it. Jean Renoir seems never to have thought enough of it to even edit the footage together. The plot is a simple reversion of racial stereotypes  in 2028 a black explorer travels to a post-holocaust Paris where a white native girl teaches him the Charleston (naturally he assumes she's a savage whose dancing is a prelude to her eating him before giving in to the seductive beat of 'White Aborigine' music).

I didn't expect much from this movie, it was just one of those movies I thought I'd just watch because it was on television. i certainly underestimated this movie. It's about a guy who kills his girlfriend and brags to his friends. I was very happy with the acting, they had the characters played well. It was a particularly great scene when Feck(Dennis Hopper) and John(Daniel Roebuck) are talking to each other about why John killed Jamie. It's upsetting to hear how he explains that he wanted to feel control and thats why.

Pure schlock from beginning to end. The average 12 year old might find that it has an interesting take on discrimination. Otherwise, it's a pure camp-fest endurance test. Like one of those so-so episodes of Star Trek The Next Generation that thinks it has Something Important To Say.You'll see every plot twist a mile off in this by-the-numbers romp. However, it's worth seeing for its portrayal of drag-king prostitutes, a brothel where young women pay old men to have sex with them (how's that for role reversal), and lesbian soap operas. The ghost of Valerie Solanis lives!

I did n't know what to expect from this hugely popular ( and hilarious ) Swedish comedy & satire team. They were amazing. They have a unique and wonderful way of getting inside and making jokes on themselves. They always had a funny line to say, no matter the subject or situation. I enjoyed this show a lot, especially the first hour. It made you laugh out loud. They are definitely the best comic team I ever saw on TV, ever. I really look forward to watching them on any other show. There is no one else like them, period.

I just recently stumbled upon this show when ABC family had an all day marathon before season 2 premiered . The show had a lot going for it, a young cast, a fresh concept, and a good cast to go along with. I can't help but feel like it's a TV show that is a complete mess and the whole concept seems like it's a huge mistake. I just can't get behind this show. I can't tell you how much it annoys the crap out of me. I think it may be due to the fact the characters are very unrealistic.

This is an unfortunately unrecognized classic.The look is superb, the design, costumes etc are flawless, the post battle scenes and the cavalry charge are both chilling and exciting.The characters are vivid and really human. Ardent is right and Fabrice Luchini as the lawyer Derville steals the movie with his clever pedantic rodent-like performance, delighting in the ups and downs of others' misfortunes. Depardieu is good but perhaps too large a presence for this role.Where the film really excels is the story and also its changes from Balzac's novella. Those changes are editorial in that Balzac has lots of discussion on society and this film breaths with characters.

I hope this isn't a portent of things to come. High-definition camcorders are getting cheaper all the time (although I wouldn't swear that's what was used here), so it's open season for all the wannabe Scorseses and Tarantinos.There is no hiding the cheapness of this stinker, and calling it a 'film' would be doing the industry a big disservice. The photography is of a standard you would expect on a family outing to the zoo. I could build me a new house with all the wooden acting. What's remarkable about that is that nobody stands out as the worst.

This film did not excite me . While on vacation in Turkey I noticed that it was playing at the multiplex that had just opened up nearby . So I went to check out this film . What a disappointment . It was only about 2 hours long and I couldn't really get interested in the plot of any of it's scenes . The writing was bad , the characters and the story lacked depth . There was no chemistry between the main characters and the chemistry between the main character and her girlfriend was not believable .

Almost no cinema experience can beat a good thriller with a sense of humor. Geena Davis is a schoolteacher housewife who suffers from amnesia. She'e even on the PTA! But then an auto accident awakens the woman she used to be, and it's HOT! Samuel L. Jackson is hilarious as the low rent private eye who tries to help Davis find her past, only to find out he's in way over his head. Davis has some hilarious lines too, and the interaction between her and Jackson works surprisingly well.Look for Brian Cox, the original Hannibal Lechter, and David Moorse finally managing to shed his St.

I must have been in a good mood to give this shameful, predictable, embarrassing movie even a 3. What's wrong with it? Let's start with the gratuitous sex although I admit the rotational style of bonking was something I had not seen (nor experienced) before. And I guess they also saved a few bucks by showing the same sex scene three times. Then there are the inconsistencies. The "Oakville Tribune" seems to be in a green part of whatever town it was supposed to be. (Hamilton Ontario???)

This movie was fabulous. It is definitely a top 5 hitchcock film. The directing and camera shots are nearly flawless(aside from the dog scene when he licks the guys hand, clearly in slow motion). The plot is well written and realistic. It was very believable that an innocent man could fall into a trap like that. I would rate Bruno as hitchcocks second most interesting character( of course bates is first). Robert Walker plays a very believable maniac. He didnt overact the part which made it believable(much the same how perkins didnt overact his part).

I do not like Himesh Reshamiya . I do not like his singing too . But his songs are a treat to dance to . I have not heard one bad song in his whole career which is good to watch . He makes songs in a style that most do not even know how to write in . He can sing and perform and he is a natural entertainer. His songs are always in the mood of a love story . I always look forward to the show . His songs are different from most of the singers around . His voice is so good .

The idea behind Dead Silence is great: zombie outbreak takes place during an edgy paranoia radio talk show. There was so much going for this film. Unfortunately, as soon as the zombies made their appearance, all was lost.The film is ridiculous and only those with a passion for cheesy, b-flick horror will enjoy it. The zombies were soooo stupid! They ran around flailing their arms. They looked like a bunch of people putting on a haunted house for elementary students.I know this is a brief review, but I just don't see the need to invest much into this.

A magazine columnist who writes about life on her farm house when in fact she lives in a NY apartment must come up with a plan when she learns that her publisher and a war hero will spend Christmas with her. After a slow start, it turns into an entertaining little screwball comedy, thanks to a fine cast. In a big departure from her previous role as a femme fatale in "Double Indemnity," Stanwyck displays a nice comedic flair. Morgan is smooth as the affable war hero while Greenstreet is well cast as the publisher.

Bonny Hunt scores a coup with her directorial debut . Minnie Driver and David Duchovny have that indescribable something called chemistry that can make a romantic comedy work . It's not easy to find, but it's a skill that this couple displays in the best way possible . For those that think they know who David Duchovny and Minnie Driver are: Don't do it again. This film is an all-out laugh riot that takes the viewer on an unforgettable journey from the depths of the human psyche to the depths of the human soul . It's a journey you won't forget in a hurry.

Wow! After the first five minutes of watching this "film", I was quite tempted to put a bullet in my brain, and end my life. It's really hard to describe what exactly this film is about. I honestly don't know what kind of human being would even finance a piece of excrement. The film looks to have either been shot on video or 16mm. I normally don't have a problem with SOV movies, are shoddily made 16mm films, but this was just so awful. And where did they find these "actresses"?

Yes , I spelled that right . This movie is so predictable , the actual word needs additional letters to be correctly spelt by you so i can read it . This is the movie i was looking for . Sigh . this movie is not worth the time . by
John
/
18th December 2011

If you get a chance, go to see the film. There's not really any way that it can go wrong. The writing is good but the director and actors really don't have a lot of ideas to follow. There's no story to follow and so the movie is really boring.

Enormous suspension of disbelief is required where Will's "genius" is concerned. Not just in math--he is also very well read in economic history, able to out-shrink several shrinks, etc etc. No, no, no. I don't buy it. While they're at it, they might as well have him wearing a big "S" on his chest, flying faster than a jet plane and stopping bullets.Among other problems...real genius (shelving for the moment the problem of what it really is, and whether it deserves such mindless homage) doesn't simply appear /ex nihilo/.

Chick Flick ? Of course .... Been done before ? Many times .... Predictable ? Yes ..... Worth watching ? No ... But it is interesting .... I did not watch it for many reasons and I still have not finished watching it ... It would be interesting to see if he has anything new and interesting in the next 3 hours. I may go to it just to see something different ... It seems like he is not happy with what he has done ? He does not seem like a man that is satisfied .... What he does seems a bit self serving ....

One of my all-time favourite movies . Nothing can beat watching this movie for the first time . If I had to pick one movie for my list of the best ,this one would definitely be in the running . As a kid ,I always had a deep passion for this movie . So when I saw the DVD edition for the movie ,this one has to be number one in my top movies list. I just had to watch this movie many times . This movie is based on the story of a little girl who lived with her mother in a small apartment.

Sony Pictures Classics , I 'm looking at you ! Sony 's got the rights to Harry records -- you know they do. Well, I 'm trying to decide on a Harry record of my own. First of all, let's see if you're as hot as they say you are. Harry 's first album, "Songs Of Faith and Love" is hot stuff. I 'll have to get this on the stereo and give it the ol ' ear test, but the vocals are terrific, and there is a lot of new stuff on here that I think is great.

I am a big follower of Indian Movies especially Malayalam and Tamil.Shame on India for not sending this movie as their official Oscar entry. I have seen this movie and it has clearly revealed to me the maturity Tamil cinema has in its screenplay and narrative which bollywood better catch up with.By the way to all we westerners, Tamil Cinema is more qualitative and very different from Bollywood which is all about good looks glamour and promotion.Coming to the point what was India thinking when they sent a movie like 'Devdas' to the Oscars? That was a really a Masochist move.

The series finally hits rock-bottom with this lousy fourth installment, which was (thank God) the last one. None of the three sequels did justice to the highly entertaining original, but this particular film is nothing more than a shameless attempt to exploit the name of the "Magnificent Seven" and Bernstein's rousing music theme. The production values resemble those of a made-for-TV movie and the characters are forgettable and indistinguishable: in parts "II" and "III" you couldn't remember their names, here you can't even remember their faces.

This has got to be the worst movie I haver ever seen Nielson in. This movie just does not have what he needs to be funny. I think the reasons that the Naked Gun and the like movies is that they did not require Nielson to be funny. He just played the roles as straight as he could while all of the comedy that went on was mostly visual. But when you put him in a movie where he has to be funny, he isn't. The movie had only one good part, and this may be considered a spoiler by some, and that the beginning credits were animated.

The main reason for watching this picture is to savor the brilliant performance of S. Ephata Merkerson. Ms. Merkerson dominates this film with her tremendous presence as Nanny, the woman who believes in doing good, no matter to whom, with no strings attached. This actress clearly shows a range that is amazing.Thanks to director George Wolf for bringing this distinguished cast of some of the best Black Americans actors together. This ensemble group under his tight direction help create the right atmosphere in which the action takes place.Of course, none of this would have been possible if Ruben Santiago Hudson hadn't written his wonderful play.

By Jove , what an unholy mess ! Revenge , incestuous love , mechanical games-like fighting , ceaseless and utterly meaningless ‘dance-fights’ by the women and children of ‘Romeo and Juliet’! What an unspeakable, bloody mess ! Now, if you really must see what this ‘dance-fighting’ thing means , you might like to try out the original film. You won’t find a better time to do it , you will see. That is unless you’ve already seen it. That is unless you’ve watched ‘Romeo and Juliet’ at least twenty times or more .

There is a difference between a `` film , '' and a `` movie . '' A film , regardless of what it is, is a motion picture. A movie is a collection of films. To be a film, a film must have a screenplay, be directed by two or more people, be produced, and be shown on a movie theater or in a movie theater. To be a movie, a film doesn't have to be directed by a single director. It can also be produced by only one or two people.

Philistines beware , especially American ones ! This has all the elements you 'll hate - a langorous approach to politics, a general disdain for facts and figures, a contemptuous attitude toward those who disagree, and an anti-foreigner bias. But most of all, this book is an anti-Semitic manifesto , and I can't be bothered to read it for myself! As a Jew , I was appalled to find that the authors were anti-Semitic . That, I believe, is why so many Jews found the book to be offensive in the first place.

Eddie Monroe is Hooooot. He is a great actor and I could be his girl anytime. He's so fine. I was so sad at the end. I'm not going to ruin the end but wow. Girls are so vicious. His girl was wrong. If Eddie was my man I would never disrespect. Those Mobsters were spooky. The moral of the story is Trust No One. Your friends will hurt u if they can. Oh and Eddie tell your girlfriend that yo mine, she should move ova! I would suggest seeing the movie. Why?

Without a doubt, the biggest waste of film of the year. This movie is poorly structured, sadistic, cruel and filled with unlikable characters. On top of that, and maybe the worst crime, it's uninteresting and vastly predictable. As soon as Bill Pullman's character doodled on the photo changing the word from "evidence" to "violence," I had the entire plot figured out. There are no surprises and there is no compelling reason to watch this trash. The only redeeming feature for me is that I saw this thing for free on my HDNet cable and didn't waste any money.

This film was a huge surprise to me while i watched it at Cinequest in the big California Theatre in the late fall of 2002. I had heard many great stories about it since I was a little girl, but now I was able to hear it from the very first screening. Now that i am back in New England, I think about it a lot. I think of it now as I sit in my studio, trying to perfect the very simple technique that made this movie so brilliant and so powerful.

I rented this movie for about $1.50 - the most complete waste of money (and time) I have ever spent. It's LAME! I couldn't believe how they could come up with something like this.The plot... there is no plot. Everything you'd expect to happen, it does, only in a worse way. The acting was horrible. My dog could've done better. The special effects have no effect whatsoever - except inducing complete disbelief. And the cheesy lines.... I mean, why even bother? The only credit I can give this piece of sh*t are the opening scenes.

Watched this months ago on Netflix Instant and left a review there.Let me say, most of the other reviews are very accurate. This movie was bad writing, bad acting and bad directing. I too, had liked Russell and Pare "back in the old days" and was very hopeful for them. In my Netflix review, I mentioned that I lost interest in the film and proceeded to wash the dishes and make a sandwich, yet still watching the movie from the kitchen. When I did return to the living room, I was very confused as the last 5 minutes of the film unfolded.

Ghilli is the best movie of vijay & one of the biggest hit in his career .... As I had seen this movie many times ... And it's my favourite movie of vijay. I never thought of not watching it ...I just started watching it. It was one of my favourite movies that I never expected. It's a very emotional and funny movie. I was waiting for this movie to come to the theatres. This movie is based on the true events that took place on 23rd December 1979. It also has a sequel which you can check out if you like.

I had never heard of this film till it popped up on cable TV and I ca n't understand why, I was under the impression there was a lot of hype about this movie. I must say that this movie has alot of promise, and I really hope this is a good movie. As far as I can gather, the story revolves around a young man who is looking for his father's killer, he has to find him before the police do. He finds his father and his father reveals his name to the young man who was the one who killed his father.

OK, I've now seen George Zucco in at least four separate horror/suspense films recently as I worked my way through various 50 pack collections, and I have to say, the guy had a limited range, but he was good at what he did. He wasn't Karloff, but PRC was lucky to have him. But the poor guy was stuck in a kind of back-water ghetto of horror films, and he wasn't good enough to take them to the next level of interest....not with the thread-bare screenplays and direction and budgets he worked under. That's the case here.

Terrific little film that stars Mary Astor as a go-getter who works her way up as a struggling paper company, but when the owner has to sell for health reasons, she comes up with a scheme for the employees to buy the company with a jerk salesman (Robert Ames) as the "front" even though she is the brains.Of course he becomes a big success and she becomes his executive secretary, basically still running everything and teaching him class. She loves the dope, but he never catches on as he fools around with a string of bimbos.

My two daughters (ages 11 and 13) and I were lucky enough to see a screening of this movie last night. We were all pleasantly surprised to see how entertaining and funny this movie was. David Duchovny was very appealing as the male lead and Minnie Driver gave her usually competent performance. Some of the scenes are laugh out loud funny - especially one scene Minnie Driver has with a fellow "transplant" donee. I liked the fact that it was a movie that I could watch with my children and I wasn't embarrassed by any scene whatsoever.

With the war not going well for the Soviet Union , Stalin accepted volunteers from the prisons and used the Gulag to create a work force of over 50 million. It is said that around one quarter of the Soviet Union's population lived under the Soviet system of mass incarceration. Gulag was the collective term for the prisons and concentration camps established to imprison, punish, and exterminate the political opponents of the Communist Party during the Great Purge. Its name was derived from the Slavic word for a small house, gula, or from gulas, meaning 'gutters', since the cells had no windows.

With great expectations I went to see this film , Spain 's contribution to the Oscar-race this year . Part of my disappointment comes from not seeing a much loved actress in the leading role . Instead the lead went to a very young man, one of the best actors I've ever seen and I was disappointed that he wasn't given more than 4 or 5 minutes of screen space . I was also disappointed that the film didn't get nominated for best film , it was just a very well made and well-written film with great performances by all and a good score .

It is by far the most definitive film on the police force which I have seen. Although not directed by Ram Gopal Varma, it has all the elements of an RGV film. Dead straight dialogues, blunt treatment of the subject, brilliant direction, and superb performances (even by those with little job to do in the movie). The chemistry between Nana and the Don, even if they are professional rivals, is amazing. And so are the small events like an insider not giving information to Imtiaz even while he is being bashed up in the locker, but only to Nana when he is out.

This movie is simply bad. First of all the story is just weird and it's not good written. It leaves you with questions when you're finished. Sometimes that's OK, but not in this case.The acting is nothing to write home about. The adults does a OK job, but the kids, taken in consideration they are kids, does not a good job. I thought the lead role, Ian Costello as Mickey, was worst. Well, to be honest I'm not sure that was the lead role. Never quite figured who this movie was about.

It 's just when a band tours , and only has one original member . It 's not the same as if they 're not touring , or have two or three new members. But it does happen. In fact , there are more bands with a single member that tour than any other kind of group. But , if the band has one or two new members , it is more like a new band . I guess that's the way I see it. I don't understand how a band with one or two new members and the same amount of time to do tour can become a totally different band.

A film , first and foremost , should be good storytelling . It should be entertaining - and entertaining does not always mean exciting - but it should draw you in and make you smile. A film like this, one that doesn't let you down, might not have a single laugh in the entire hour and a half you watch it . But that's what this film was, and it didn't disappoint . There are some elements of it that should not be taken too seriously , some things you just can't laugh at .

One of the reviewers here wrote : `` Good acting , good special effects , greatlocation . Even better ending. But it wasn't a movie I was expecting . It was like something from a comic book. It was fun but I didn't care.``

I have to say, that I didn't expect it either. I didn't expect any of this. And I'm glad to say I didn't get any of that either. It's an enjoyable, entertaining and entertaining movie. As I said, it's one I enjoyed.

I would like to thank you for giving me a chance to be one of the first to actually view and test this game. I played the beta with my son yesterday, and we both agree this is a very cool game that we can all enjoy (except that my son can't play anything longer than like 5 hours). I don't know if this is a good game or a very good game, but it's going to blow me away because I don't know how I was going to play the beta.

* * * SLIGHT SPOILERS * * * This installment of the Full Moon franchise changes the storyline a bit. When the movie opened, we learned that there was a conspiracy. We then learned that the conspiracy was actually just a cover for a terrorist group to take over the world. And now, we are told that it's all just a ruse. There was never a terrorist threat. The world wasn't on the brink of total destruction. The world isn't in danger at all. There isn't a nuclear power plant. There isn't even one nuclear reactor.

David Cronenberg 's ` eXistenZ ' is a well designed reflection of the philosophy of existentialism . It addresses the question of why we exist . The film is a commentary on how to live in the age of science , in a world in which life-or death-denying technology is taking over from religion , in an age of global chaos . There are two stories in this film . The first is what Cronenberg reveals on the opening page of his script. We are on the planet Ararat in the last days of its life as a habitable world. We have seen it pass through five stages in the evolution of a human culture .

I watched this movie by accident on TV and it was so unbelievably awful I could not switch it off. Every single piece of wit and intelligence has been removed from the Oscar Wilde story by the inept screenplay writer. It barely matters because the dire acting, clichéd camera-work and cloying music would have ruined anything resembling like a decent script anyway. The worst performance comes from Patrick Stewart who comes across as the most hammy, talentless, minor mock-Shakespearean nincompoop as the ghost. "Get thee out of here!" he screams at one stage while waving his arms like a pantomime villain.

As Jennifer Denuccio used to say on Square Pegs , `` Gag me out the door . '' I would be happy to be of help, as I know just where she would want me to be. She would want to feel the pleasure of being able to do the most of herself in all the time she has at her desk to her fullest. I would enjoy doing it even though I know she would hate the way it made my feet feel in my stocking feet. I would not be allowed to do it in public. It would be better if it were to be done discreetly.

This was a fantastic movie about two people, one a young teenage girl, and the other, a middle aged man, who are each looking for someone to help them fulfill a certain emptiness left by former loved ones.Both actors give brilliant performances that various audiences can relate to. The script, although written by Gorman Bechard, seems as though it was written from a woman's point of view. And at the same time, men can relate to the male characters because of how well they were developed and described in the movie.The end of the movie has an unusual but powerful and unexpected twist that leaves you speechless.

Six out of seven people who took the time to comment on this movie have very positive responses . The movie is very funny and the acting is very good . But I still don’t agree with the premise of the movie . The movie has a good message about how our society has become too materialistic . And the main character seems very selfish . I’ve never seen a romantic comedy like this one . It tells you how to get a relationship to work for you . The way to succeed in a relationship is quite simple , you just have to make love with your partner .

this is the worst film i have ever seen and what disappoints me the most is that this is yash raj film so at first when you see the promos you think yes thats definitely another yash raj hit But when you see the film your eyes will water with disappoint the storyline is stupid and dumb we've seen it many times boy is soon to marry and falls in love with a girl blah blah blah. if you do see this pathetic film don't go with you family there is too much exposure and kiss scene. i don even see why you would go to see it on your own.

After an astronaut dies in space , he is brought back to a military base . Inside the man are a few pieces of evidence that will lead to the arrest of someone involved in the death of the space hero . An astronaut died in space during an experiment , and he is being returned to the ground . Inside the man he was found a small box with an unknown object and it will be up to them to find the culprit . An astronaut dies of a mysterious illness while in space , and she is being taken care of by military personnel .

I have been an avid Jane Austen fan for many years . I had never seen this adaptation , so when the movie opened I decided to watch it . . . because I am a Jane fan … . . . but what I ended up watching was a little disappointing . The only reason why I liked this adaptation was because of the casting . I can’t recall seeing anyone who I could even remotely identify with what Austen had written . I am not even certain that her characters are my sort of people .

I read a lot of high hopes from readers of the book that this would be a faithful adaptation of the TV show. So far, so good. There's a great deal that makes this movie work. The cast is a joy to behold: Robert Loggia does his best to be Robert De Niro (as I've come to expect, he's the most charismatic of the bunch, but he's very good in the role), as well as the cast that brings this great story of two men who've grown apart. The acting from each of the leads is also superb.

When I was younger I saw the end of HAIR on TV . I just watched the last 5 minutes of the show because I felt like I was going insane . I was watching HAIR on a Sunday after church because I had just received my confirmation and my husband and I were taking the children to see the movie . We were going in and out of the theater for 30 minutes or so and when we got to the last five minutes I thought I couldn’t take it anymore because my eyes were streaming . It was like I had just been on stage during an audition .

I loved this show. I think the first time I tried rocky road ice cream was due to this show. Wasn't the shop located like right on the beach or something? I actually wrote back and forth with Marci for several years. I lost touch and wish I could reconnect now as adults. Anyone know where she is now? I wish they would put it out on DVD. I seriously doubt that since I think there maybe like five or six people who even remember the show airing in the first place. They just don't make shows like this anymore, do they?

From the English accents to the so unnecessary violence after violence. Showing Moses as a murderer. People who actually believe in the Old Testament will just sit there and shake their heads. I am not a religious person at all. But even i felt as though the writers of this movie were trying to turn us all against God and the Jews.When Moses picked up that rock and threw the first stone at the woman to kill her for committing adultery. I wanted to stone the writers. I can't believe in this day and age that Hallmark and ABC (Disney) would attempt to show such garbage as this.

I think my summary says it all. This MTV-ish answer to the classic Candid Camera TV show features a Gen X (or is that Gen Y) type putting in false choppers and wearing various hats and wigs and glasses, and setting people up in fairly outlandish although often not very interesting situations. Example: Kennedy has a guy invite his parents to his "wedding." Kennedy is the bride, done up in a full bridal gown and long wig. The "joke" is that the parents immediately understand their son is marrying a man who claims to no longer have his "bits and pieces."

There wasn't much thought put into the story line on many fronts. This is a good action movie but that's about it.- The movie states that the lycans were kept to protect the vampires during the day. Yet they are kept in cages and have collars on their necks. So they can't turn into their wolf form or do anything any other slave can't do. How does this protect the vampires during the day? Who are they protecting the vampires from? The uncontrollable lycans? The slaves in human form are nothing more than peasants.- My understanding is that vampires are immortals and don't age.

This was it ! i would have never expected the ending if i did n't already know the behind the scene of the story. (I thought i already knew all there is to know about this one, but reading this one will give a completely new perspective.) I don't know if you are interested in this one, but i wanted to tell you in case it is. I really liked the way the author described and showed the world. (I am a fan of books where all the people have an amazing and unique way of describing their world and i really like this in this one.)

There could be some SPOILERS AHEAD but I doubt it. I have no idea how the screenplay for this one made it past the shredder. It's horrible. Completely unwatchable. I hung in there for 45 minutes (about half the running time) and just couldn't stand it anymore. I was an Elijah Wood fan in the '90s (see "The War") and I learned to enjoy Mandy Moore's shifts from bubbly to serious this year (see "Chasing Liberty" which is surprisingly entertaining). I've seen bits of "Run Lola Run."

This film has it 's heart in the right place , but unfortunately , it is n't much of a movie at all . I think the main problem with the film has something to do with how much time and effort they have to spend on a plot . The film has some good moments and the acting and writing is at a good level but the story is really weak and it just ends up being an average thriller film .The film has really good and well written scenes , and some really good acting and music but the plot is weak .

The reality of the mafia environment is absolutely dog-eat-dog where a gangster will be killed for showing any sign of weakness because they become a liability. I've got no problem with the human side of gansters' being portrayed but Bugsy steers too far in the direction of soft, comical, men. The film is enjoyable but is only light entertainment and not a biopic of a man who, though exciting, was extremely dangerous and fearsome.The acting's all good and the direction very solid. The locations and era are very well represented and the themes very interesting. Did Bugsy really want to kill Mussoulini?

Definitely worth renting! Good clean family entertainment. My 4 and 5 year-olds (and I) loved it. Kept them on the edge of their seats. I recommend parents sit with their younger children to watch this, as it can be quite suspenseful for them. It's not too often you can find movies that you can watch with your children, and so this is a rare find. Some of the acting / realism isn't quite there at times, or maybe is a little corny, but children don't seem to notice or care, they love it.

"The Love Letter" is a somewhat pleasant, very very low-key romantic comedy in which the use of just the right few words in a mysterious love letter unlocks the secret passions and longings of a sleepy sea-side town's inhabitants.It's not for all audiences. "The Love Letter", I feel, benefits from it's simple and quiet tone. Never intentionally wacky and phony like most romantic comedies it's quaint, picturesque, and comfy. However, for these exact same reasons, many viewers will be bored and disinterested.The cast is nice.

This movie is so bad , they would n't buy it back at my local used CD/DVD store . I'm sorry to say , but it is bad , and it's so bad , you can't trust anything that comes from Paramount . But , I must admit , I love the ending . It is sooo funny . And when you think it's really bad , but you keep watching it anyway , you end up loving it . I'm pretty sure that I'm the only one . I can't remember who I was watching this with before we started , but we all got sucked into the movie .

I love this movie ! It has everything ! Bonnie Hunt did a fantastic job co-writing , directing and co-starring this movie ! It is a fun movie to watch with your friends , I think it is the best movie ive watched in awhile . Its just a movie and dont really matter if its a comedy or a drama . You just enjoy it . And its really funny . The characters in this film are really great . And you just love them ! They are the nicest people and you just wish you were friends with them . the movie was funny and had a lot of great funny parts .

"Yesterday" as a movie, is hard to rate. The cinematography is excellent and deserves a 9/10. The story is gritty and real and does not compromise. But the translation of the story to the screen through the actors did not match the camera work.As a person who was born and raised in Central Africa, I appreciated the authenticity of the film's look and the honest depiction of daily life for the Zulu. But this and the camera work are not enough to recommend the average viewer should see this film.

Heh ... I 'm surprised this movie still exists in any form , let alone it being available for rent. Click to expand... I haven't seen it, but there was a time I'd go to a theater with a friend (at least a couple years back) just because he wanted to see it. He's probably seen it more than I have because he is the kind of person that can watch 50 movies in less than a month. The movie was about a young girl who falls in with a gang of kids after she sees a girl get killed in a bar fight.

This is one of the most laughably bad films I 've ever seen . I can not believe whoever wrote the script was paid by a movie studio . . . I really have a problem with any movie like this . . . especially one that is made by a " studio . . . . I don't like it . . . it makes me wonder if people would even laugh at this film or if they'd think it was hilarious . . . there's no good reason to make something that is like this at all . . . . the whole movie is an unoriginal joke .

I work at Memorial Hermann Hospital ( TMC ) and was also working at Texas Children 's Hospital , Women 's Medical Center and Baylor University Medical Center before I moved to Texas . My experience at these places was a great experience and I enjoyed every single moment of it . Memorial Hermann is much more than a Hospital . It is also a place where we go to get better. I have learned more here than I could learn at any school. I have learned to work with people. I learned to have patience, I learned to listen.

I still remember when Frog Baseball first aired on MTV . In some sort of odd , surreal manner , I was not a fan . But I was intrigued . The idea of having a baseball game which was played without bats or gloves , or in the case of my era with no balls . It would be played without any rules . I thought it was great ! Not only would it be awesome to watch baseball in a non physical manner , but I also thought this would be a great way to get kids used to the concept of playing baseball .

I don't even understand what they tried to accomplish with this movie, i mean really. You got this guy running from a bunch of cats, because he's dead, but in order to be really dead this girl has to shoot them? And they leave a corpse even though normal people can't see them because their dead? The script already has a hole in it the size of Nebraska, then you have the main character played by Susan Paterno who just drones up her lines in a monotone, boring voice and with so little emotion on her face she might as well have starred as a female terminator robot.

I just found the entire 3 DVD set at Wal-Mart in the bargain bin for $ 5.50 , so I will probably buy it when it comes back online. It's just as good as they say it will be. I'm not going to bother listening to the audio commentary, unless there are any interesting features. It's basically just the same as on the DVD version, and they don't bother giving you a complete explanation of the production, except to say that this movie was filmed on location and that they worked with the crew during the shoot, etc.

I rented this one by accident . I lifted the video up and looked at the back and thought ``This looks like it would be fun'' . This one was different . I didn't expect it to blow my mind (at least not for a while). The story line in the trailer is pretty good, and the acting was great, but once I saw the first few minutes of the movie and the first few minutes of the movie, I was stunned. I really liked it. I would have given this one an A+ and would be proud to give my money to it.

In yet another case of misleading marketing, this film is included in a 10-movie DVD set called "Women Who Kick Butt", but even in its original cover it seems to promise Shannon Tweed in an action role. Actually, during most of the movie Tweed plays the typical whiny and prissy female character who has to be rescued by the male lead, and even when she's trained in jungle warfare she still has to be dragged around by him! There is one female rebel who is a stronger character, but she's mostly kept in the margins of the movie.

This Blake Edwards film is n't too sure whether it wants to be a comedy , a drama or a crime thriller. It is very easy to tell it is part of the latter category. It opens with a man in prison being questioned about a crime he didn’t commit. The victim, who was shot in the leg in the middle of a street, has already identified the man and says that the man who was supposed to have shot her actually ran away. The police are pretty sure that the man in the interview is the man who tried to rob him at gunpoint.

Do all spoof films require pure stupidity and a lack of ANY sort of intelligence whatsoever to the humour? Is there even just a single genuinely FUNNY parody film anymore? All I see are zero-quality films that look like a couple stoned high school students got bored one day with a video camera. These movies are not funny, they're not clever, they're not entertaining, they're just useless in every conceivable way.The Comebacks was a movie that tried to hide its hideous level of trash by not calling itself "Sports Movie". It's the same thing, though.

I think the manuscript of this movie was written on the piece of toilet-paper. No respect whatsoever to many important details which intrinsically make the movie. For example, the names of some Serbian terrorists (that I remember) are Caradan Maldic, Ivanic Loyvek and Leo Hasse. What kind of names are that? Certainly not Serbian! By the way, Caradan Maldic!!! What a name, I laughed for days thinking about it. Probably an implication on Karadzic and Mladic. Secondly, there have never been any cases of terrorism done by Serbians.

They call this film "euro trash horror". Well, it's not horror. The film takes place in Europe, so yes, it's "euro". Trash? Ah yes, it's trash all right.You know you're in for a great movie when, right at the beginning, the DVD gives you text on the screen apologizing for the quality of the print you're about to watch. Expect crackles, odd jarring cuts, and for the movie not to fit the screen. Plus there's the sound -- at first I thought I was watching a dubbed film.

I grew up in New York and this show came on when I was four-years-old . I had half-day kindergarten so I spent a half day with my parents and then later with my little brother and my father took us out to dinner in the Village to a steak house where my mother would buy us drinks. The show was a huge hit, I don't remember what I listened to when I got home, but I remember the one song that was on all the time, "Cathy". I would listen to that song over and over again.

Well, I've just seen Buster Keaton's film debut in Fatty Arbuckle's The Butcher Boy and-despite the crude way everything just seems to happen for almost no logical reason-I found plenty to laugh at. Like when Buster orders molasses from butcher boy Fatty, Fatty makes Buster come back to pay, Buster says he put it in the bucket that has the molasses, Fatty dumps molasses in Buster's hat and takes money, Buster takes hat back on head as it gets stuck, Fatty attempts to remove it while molasses fall to floor, Buster's feet are now stuck on floor and so on.

Absolutely the most thoughtful , spiritually deep , intense Hamlet ever done -- no other version comes close . Jacobi is one of my favorite characters in literature (along with Shakespeare, and Dickens). He is one of a kind. His thoughts, emotions, and actions, are truly profound and deeply insightful. There are few characters, in any of the great literary works, who can say they are the heart of the story and the soul of it. Even if we know what happens, there are moments that can still make one think, "Why did he say that?"

I walked into Blockbuster, itchin' to watch some good old fashion action movies. So i browsed around the action section until this movie caught my attention because the cover had in big bold letter SANDRA BULLOCK. An action movie with Sandra Bullock in it and it's rated R!? YAY! Although I will admit i prefer her in a comedy but if this is anything like 'Speed' then i was sold. Sadly Sandra really is not in this movie, her role is minor: "Panicky kidnapped girlfriend" (She is in fifth place on the actors listing for Jeebus shakes!)

I just saw this movie tonight. Coming into it I thought it would be good because I like Natalie Portman alot and Susan Sarandon is a great actor too, but it was way better than I could have imagined. You come out of the movie feeling great. The acting was excellent, which is something that can be hard to come by lately. Natalie Portman is destined for great things and me being a college student at NYU, think that it is great that she is going to school instead of just being an actor.

A kooky , but funny bit of diversion . You kind of have to see it from the beginning to really grasp the story . If you like horror stories and comedy , you'll love it . In a world where the dead walk, only a few survive by hiding in the shadows of the human population . The rest of us have to do what we must , to survive . There's a lot of humor to be found here and you might laugh out loud , but not at the right place and right at the right time .

`` Prime Suspect 4 '' continues the exploits of the inscrutable and dogged seeker of truth and justice , Detective Inspector George Sproxton , as he uncovers an old secret of the British Empire , which is the true and ultimate reason for the bloody war between India and Britain in 1857 . After a tragic death on a battlefields during the Great Mutiny , he is charged with finding an Indian woman who could be his wife . With the aid of a mysterious stranger, the detective begins to uncover the mystery of what the war was all about and why so many innocent people lost their lives.

There are bad movies and then there are movies which are even worst . Saw is just that.The movie is very slow paced in the first half and the last half of the movie it just dragged. But what really makes this movie so bad is it's storyline, its characters and its dialogue. The movie is full of lies.The main problem i have with Saw is that there was so much of the story about the killer that the movie couldn't finish properly. In the end it just ends and it's like they forgot about what's going on.

This new movie by Jeskid is awesome ! Check it out and you 'll be amazed . The story of Jeskid is very very exciting . The story is about a young man by the name of Jeskid who has a dream of being a pro baseball player. He starts from his city where he is very very lucky in terms of facilities but is not a very smart person. He is a kid who always gets into trouble because of his laziness and lack of ambition. The story itself is very very funny and I would say it would be suitable to all kids .

After the opening credits over a black sheet of paper with spots of white paint sprayed onto it , oh, yeah, we’re gonna watch the movie. We don’t have to read the book; we don’t have to go to the theater to buy it. We don’t even need a book to watch it, really. We can just open it and enjoy. It’s a movie! We can watch it anywhere. I’ve been asked a lot if there is a best book to watch movies, but I don’t think it’s that simple.

I am utterly astonished at how over-rated "Cemetery Man" is among horror fans! Now, I usually welcome movies that blend two or more kinds of genre-styles into one and I love just about every zombie-comedy I have ever seen. To my dismay, this Italian cult-classic really didn't show me a lot to get too pumped up about... It follows the unusual duties of a full-time cemetery care-taker and his retarded, man-child, Curly Joe looking assistant as they seem to primarily dispose of the recently deceased who pop out of the ground seven days after their initial death.

There were only two redeeming features about this movie; the beauty of Bucharest and its architecture, and the way they depicted the transformation from human form to wolf form. Forget about the plot or storyline from the book - they're completely absent from this movie. In fact, about the only things carried over from the book are the names of the main players. Even then you'll barely recognize the characterizations. If the film makers had made a good movie, even though unrelated to the book, I wouldn't have been so disappointed. Unfortunately, they did not.

I attended a screening of this movie . It was wrought with clichés and very unfunny jokes and set ups that are far too familiar . The screenplay is not bad but there are so many clichés that I feel like I had seen it before in movies that it did not add anything new . The acting is great . It was also quite entertaining , it was a good watch , I will not see any more movies like this one . What can you say? The most annoying thing about this movie is that it doesn't end in "The End!"

Hitchcock 's original classic benefited tremendously not only from the performance of , but also the 'look ' of Anthony Mann , who also played the director, but who had a far less important , but more interesting role . Mann 's 'look ' was as much a stylistic and visual feature as the performance, but he was also one of the primary creators of it . He conceived the film as a noir detective story and had a major role writing the script which he then developed with Hitchcock . Mann did a number of different jobs on the film before finally becoming its director and was the only one to actually direct the picture .

Like some other people wrote , I 'm a die-hard mario fan , and I loved this game . This is not the game that made me love him , because the game didn't change anything for me . I had the original console in the 90's which was the same generation as Super Mario Brothers , I didn't really know how to play that game . So for me to play this game was like a dream , because this game brought back those great memories of playing those games . This is not an easy game . This is Mario 64, and it has a very high difficulty level.

OK so this is about 30 minutes of gore with no story whatsoever. There is no spoken dialogue, no subtitles, not even any real characters. You see three people in the entire movie (that are alive) and two are just there for very little reason. The main guy has no emotion and just mutilates corpses for no apparent reason. That is the entire movie. I love to see very gory movies, especially since in America real gore just isn't very common in modern movies. So yeah the gore effects were pretty cool. But it just isn't really disturbing.

I 'm sorry , but this really does feel like a modern day Apollo 13 knock-off . Totally implausible ( and yes, I've seen Apollo 13 , I know the movie ). In the late 50's or the 60's ( I believe ) a man was killed by a solar flare ( not sure if that was the right term for it ). The man had lived on a farm for many years . A small solar flare occurred which damaged some of the farms solar panels causing them to fail . The farm owners decided to fix the damaged panels .

Very poor quality and the acting is equally as bad. This movie is a prime example of present day england and the mindset. There is no mention of Jesus in this movie nor does the movie feature any type of scripture Christianity as most know it. I am also very surprised because this film is a BBC program and the BBC is quit well known for their quality programing, but it looks like the BBC's attempt to rival the Hollywood psycho/drama films are failing completely. Poor acting, poor plot, poor culture that seems to be without religion.

If you're a long-time fan of the Doctor and you cringed when you heard they were making another series, rest easy -- it more than meets the high expectations of the original. The pacing is much quicker than the original shows, fitting more often into 50 minutes episodes rather than the average 90 minutes. The writing is excellent, the acting superb. The hardest - and best - thing to get used to is the production values of the new series. Compared to the original, it's got some now. (Although I will always have fond memories of bubble-wrap and hand-puppet monsters.)

Saw this at the Hong Kong International Film Festival , over three years ago . I went in with no expectations. I knew it was an independent film but I didn't know anything about its director . What I did learn about him after watching the film was something quite different. I was amazed by the way he dealt with the subject matter of the film and made it very accessible to an international audience. It made me rethink a lot of my own views about Hong Kong cinema and I think he has created a movie that can be seen by anyone.

The Priest , into profound love and suffering showed not the result of love , but the process of love. One day , as he was sitting with the disciples , a woman was praying in front of a temple . She was , to all appearance , very beautiful , and she looked very happy . When she was finished , she went back into the house , and when she was back outside , she told her husband , “ I have done what I wanted to do in the temple . This is where I want to do my work .

This tough-to-see little picture played at the Mods & Rockers 2007 festival . It is a wonderful and loving look into what was going on in this small town in the days of the great war, and it is now a place where the children are still playing and making their music. I am not quite sure who did it, but the picture is by Richard Jones, who also has done many other great pictures for this festival, and who died a few days later. I would like to pay tribute to his contribution by posting a link to it on this blog.

The idea behind Dead Silence is great : zombie outbreak takes place during an edgy paranoia radio talk show . I am glad the film was made in the 90s because the plot was pretty original. The first time I read the script, I did not have the slightest clue as to what it is about. At the time, I was just a zombie movie enthusiast . Now, this is a perfect time for the zombie genre to be revisited in a horror film. I am happy that Dead Silence is one of the few horror films I have seen that does not rely on gore .

Wow ... this is the kind of movie that makes you wonder who 's idea this was and what soup this is. I mean, seriously, this is just too much to take in, this was like the movie you'd make to get out of working, not the movie you'd make with your friends. And the last thing I'll say about this movie is ... 'Hey, we're done with each other' and 'we don't need to do this any more', because that's what it felt like.

My mom and I went to the Ft Worth Premiere mainly to see George Strait , but ended up getting tickets to Willie Nelson as well. We got up to Ft. Worth just as it was getting ready to rain. We walked around looking at shows and decided to get a table in the restaurant where Willie played. I had heard about him when I was in the hospital last summer, but had never seen him. I have to tell you, he is quite impressive. The first time I saw his show was at Dillard's where I went to see my sister.

This is one of the movies having made significant influence on me as a person . The sound tracks are not so great and not very catchy but the movie is very very touching . Well written . Well directed . And well acted . Its really worth seeing this movie . I have watched this movie once in my childhood and many many times again , I hope you like it too as I like this movie and would like to watch more such movies like this one . The movie starts with an ordinary family in a new house which they rent out.

Where do I begin? Let me say that -- after having watched the entire film and the special features on the DVD -- my wife and I watched the whole film again with the director's commentary running. I can't remember having ever before endured more than 7 minutes of such commentary for a film. It's worth hearing.I'm not a southern boy, but I spent some time around Memphis a long time ago, and have a feel for the area. This film almost smells of the South, it's so real.

Right up ( or down ) there with Toys and Jurassic Park 2 and The Phantom Menace.The premise sounded cool, and it looks like the movie will have great performances from some of Hollywood's better known names.The plot is based on the famous novel, "Eve of Destruction.” The movie will follow the story of a young woman, Evelyn, who believes she can see aliens in the sky with her naked eyes. Evelyn has always believed in God; however, after a strange experience, she begins to suspect aliens are real and have been visiting Earth for a long time.

This movie does n't have any pretense at being great art , which is good . But it is a movie , about , what , what ? What are they trying to do ? They are trying to tell us that they think , they can make money off people . That's a no no . They want to use people as , you know , to , to make money . I'm glad I don't have to sit through this . I would not want to sit through this , period . I mean , the acting is terrible . It is nothing but , what ?

Heftig og Begeistret (Intense and Enthusiastic) is a documentary-like story of a male choir up in Berlevåg in the very northern part of Norway, where the weather is cold and hostile, the days are dark during the winter and the towns are faced with young people moving to the more populated parts in the south of Norway, where the climate is warmer and there are more opportunities.The most beautiful part of this movie is the humans themselves. The people in the choir, who are aged from 30 to 95, all have unique, colorful lives and are very enjoyable beings.
