Franco films can be divided into 4 categories- the `` earlies '' ( often black and white and inventive ) the `` later films '' ( color , usually set in France or the USA ) the `` Italian films '' or `` American films,'' and last the `` Spanish films. The first three all belong to the same class, the Italian films were shot in Spain . They are of no interest to us since they had very little effect on the cinema of the world and were not considered as films of international significance until they were played in Paris, Madrid, Venice, Berlin, and New York.

Oh my god , WHY , did I waste my precious time on this film ? It is pathetic , it has nothing interesting to say , nothing at all and it has not even a redeeming quality about it , not even a small one , to justify this huge disappointment and a waste of time ! WTF is there to say ? If you don't know what you like and what is interesting to you than there is no need to waste your time on such films . I am sure you would not be wasting your time even if you are a fan of this or other films by the same maker .

Though I have watched Salò , I do not know if excrement tastes tart . If it does , this one is delicious . If it doesn´t , I´ll find another to try . In any case , this was a great way to waste time . And I´m going to find a good use of this one , after eating it . It´s so bad . . . . . . The best thing is it´s on the table and you can eat this with your hands , and not on a plate , which is very good .

Having been raised in Canada, I saw this short many times mostly on the CBC. I have seen it numerous times, at many ages in my life, and each time the reactions are the same. It is a joyous bittersweet, beautifully animated film that tugs at your heart. I am sure I have it on some VHS tape somewhere digging around.Every kid growing up can relate to the situation, and wanting to fit in with your favourite idols. The scene and look on the kids face when his mom is filling out the Eatons catalogue and his jumping around the room is priceless.

I watched the world premiere of this on the Starz Action channel. They call it Vampires: The Turning. The plot was a little confusing. There is a voice-over in the introduction about an 800 year war, and I didn't quite understand. The movie is about a young couple somewhere in Asia (maybe in China, I don't think the movie specifies). The couple has an argument and Meredith Monroe runs off and is kidnapped by a biker gang of Vampires. The boyfriend finds a group of vampires that don't kill humans, and enters into a battle with the bikers.

The Internet is a wondrous thing is it not ? I am watching a taped episode of one of my favourite TV series, ‘Blue Planet II’, in the background. As the images flash before my eyes I have to remind myself that I am not in a real world. No matter how much of a technophile you are I would be very, very lucky to have the facilities to view and enjoy the images from space. We have all known about the stunning images sent back to us by NASA, the ESA and the Hubble space telescope.

Yes it is your typical direct to video action flick. And of course they do their best to change it up a little bit but fail miraculously. Snipes delivers his perfectly bland performance that he always does. Colloca proves that you don't need any talent to star in a film but just sex appeal. The worst part is that it didn't cover my bad movie basics which are: 1  Cheap looking villains. 2  Perfectly timed one-liners. 3  Intense car chases with massive explosions. 4  The hero hooking up with the hot chick.

Fairly appalling enterprise suggests Welsh to be an infantile artist , helplessly drawn to the violent milieu he knows best and is least qualified for

Welsh’s “Ain’t No Fun ‘Til You Do”, the third single to be taken from his upcoming album, “You’re Never Gonna Find Another One”, is a song with an insatiable hunger. This time it isn’t for love. Nor for sex. Nor for the thrill of violent crime. This time it is, for Welsh, something more. It’s for fame, power and, yes, sex.

There is a running thread in film comedy that all the great comics are just falling short of the law. It is the running gag about how you can’t find an audience for a good idea if you don’t find an audience for the joke and the idea. We all know it as that line, but it’s not an easy line to learn. There are many ways to get away with it, and a lot of them are in the form of a wink and a joke, or a laugh, or a look.

In my opinion of this movie the entire video portion of this movie was absolute trash ! ! ! ! I can not say it enough . I was not impressed . There is no way that I could have even attempted to review this movie in any manner . If you had asked me I would have said that the movie was horrible but I cannot say that now can I ? ! . If you were going to watch this movie I would have told you so . I would have told you what a crap this movie was , but I had to watch it and judge it from the video .

I was surprised to like this movie since I'm from the "check your brain at the door and have fun" school of film viewing. However, this film touched my heart. I have friends like mentally retarded Emily. I have friends like unsocialized Evie. And I've been in Evie's shoes, chasing away opportunity out of fear and out of devotion to others.Amy Madigan's disappointment in her daughters was almost palpable on screen and the awkward moments where she tried to bridge the gap with Evie were raw and painful to watch.

Eve is an eye opener , because of the great sceneries and the tech-no music in the backgrounds , we have been lucky to have had this trip with us , we would like to thank the hotel staff , the drivers for making our stay so enjoyable and the guides and driver for taking us all round the island and making us feel at home. The people are friendly and very helpful and the food and drink was excellent. It was great value for money and the guides really know their stuff. The highlight of our trip was the wildlife.

I saw this version of Hamlet on television many years ago , and have seen every other version since , but i felt the first time that something was missing

One of the great strengths of a classic is the way it uses all the strengths of a particular period in history. This version of Hamlet, from the '80s, had all of the strength that came out of that time period , and it had all of the tragedy and all of the drama that came with it. Of course it had all of that as well. This is the original play, and i've already mentioned that.

This movie, which I just discovered at the video store, has apparently sit around for a couple of years without a distributor. It's easy to see why. The story of two friends living in New York searching for their pal from high school who is now living homeless under the boardwalk at Coney Island, has flashes of being a very good film, but ultimately is weighted down by the story focusing on Stan and Daniel, rather than on their homeless friend Richie. Cryer is as usual very good and the film has a nice stark look to it, with the ghostly images of Coney Island.

A group of four young men , attending a prestigious private school , belong to an old covenant that was once considered “ the best in Britain”, until one of them went away to the US to seek higher education. They live a life they never expected when they went to school with other young men. In America they have been exposed to a culture and language they have never had the chance to experience. When they return they are confronted with the problems they were never warned about when they went to school.

This movie was trying to something , but failed miserably . All the attempts at suspense were cheap , and the story was not a good one to tell . The film was made in 2006 . It tells the story of a very poor young boy who tries to save the life of a beautiful girl . His life will be turned into a complete tragedy . The girl was in a coma for 5 months . But now she is going to survive . It was very touching . In the past year or so , there has been a surge in movies of this nature.

Like in a circle the movie leads back to its point of departure , the image of the cranes that fly back and forth. After a while you feel like they are saying that in the future you will feel that you will be happy and you will enjoy what you do because it will be interesting and fun. You feel like they are saying you are a real person. That you will have the opportunity to be the person you are always dreaming about. After a while you begin to forget what they are saying. You get caught by the movie itself.

Firstly , this is NOT an adaptation of a Stephen King book , short story , novella , or anything like that. It's not even close to that. This is a very different story that will make a whole bunch of different fans out there happy. There are a lot of elements that are reminiscent of King's work , I admit that. It's about a boy and a girl who are best friends. They fight , they argue , they fight some more . They have their differences , but they still stay together. That's where the story starts.

This movie was sadly under-promoted but proved to be truly exceptional. Entering the theatre I knew nothing about the film except that a friend wanted to see it.I was caught off guard with the high quality of the film. I couldn't image Ashton Kutcher in a serious role, but his performance truly exemplified his character. This movie is exceptional and deserves our monetary support, unlike so many other movies. It does not come lightly for me to recommend any movie, but in this case I highly recommend that everyone see it.This films is Truly Exceptional!

Why bother, ITV? Admittedly, Mansfield Park is the most difficult of the novels to "get," and Fanny is certainly the hardest to like, but... If one is going to take it on, then have the courage to risk being true to the book and its rather complicated spirit. And for heaven's sake, have the guts to cast Fanny as she was written: A prissy, good-hearted, sweetish, whiner! Mrs. Norris wasn't nearly as awful as she should have been. And what the heck happened to Portsmouth?

this was absolutely the most tragic pile of cinema to which i have ever born witness . not only was the film so bad it was utterly pointless it was so bad that the man who wrote the screenplay was so impressed with it that he decided to show it as the only way to prove himself an artist and a man . it was just so bad and so stupid that even though it had been a masterpiece of cinematography it could not be screened because of its complete lack of interest to an audience who had never heard of it ever before .

I wo n't waste your time by describing the plot for this , the other reviewer already did this quite well so I'll be brief. I think it's best to take the time to watch this movie and then read up on it. I believe this one is well worth viewing, especially since it has such a wide audience, and I'll be watching it this week with my son and grandson. This was one of those flicks I never expected to like. I don't mind a good horror movie and this one was pretty good, although not great.

This film was great!Tangi Miller and Flex did a great job. They both look good together and they both pulled it off.Tasha Smith was so funny as the cousin,and she couldn't stay out of her business.Essence held it down for her girl, when she needed her. Aloma was sweet and played a dear Grandmother she really reminded me of my grandmother.And Oh,I can't forget about the stripper, he was so find, and I didn't know if I should cover my eyes or smile while I watch him reveal his sexiness on the big screen.Damn!

At the same time John Russell was playing ranch owner Nathan Burdette , trying to free his no good brother from prison, he was trying to get himself a good wife and raise a son that would never be able to be taken away from him . His plan to get this son to give him a son, was to make sure Nathan knew he was the real father to his son . After Nathan was freed from prison his life changed. Now he could make all his money and he could do whatever he wanted because he was free.

SPOILER WARNINGWe've all heard the "Boy Who Cried Wolf" legend. But what if the wolf was a person in the modern world. Well it might be something like Big Fat Liar. Fourteen-year-old Jason Sheperd ( Frankie Muniz from "Malcolm in the Middle" ) is always lying to keep himself out of trouble. One day he is pressured to write an English essay, but it winds up in the hands of sleazy film-maker Marty Wolf ( Paul Giamatti ) who plans to turn Jason's story into a Hollywood blockbuster. No one believes Jason when he for once tells the truth and he ends up in summer school.

My friends and I saw the movie last night in Austin at a showing for AGLIFF (a film festival). This movie was one of the best I've seen this year. It was a great comedy - very original and heartfelt - and FUNNY AS HELL! Everyone in the audience was laughing throughout the entire movie. Texas is a big state - with LOTS of small towns - and of course, plenty of teenagers who grew up as "fat girls." I know a lot of people will relate to this film on a personal level.

I know it 's rather unfair to comment on a movie without seeing the complete piece - but I am going to comment anyway because I know the film's reputation - and I'd like to give my own personal opinion. The film's reputation has been, in a word, shit. It's not that I dislike the movie. Far from it. It's that it has been so overrated that I was hoping for a few things:

That there was a great movie in this. I thought we would have had a few great scenes.

Koyaanisquatsi is simply the best film I 've ever seen . It 's a masterpiece where everything is at the service of a single goal , the story . Every moment is filled with energy , every line is packed with meaning . It's the most complete movie you 'd ever witness . You can say this film is the first ever Japanese movie to do the 3D conversion , because it 's not that expensive to do the conversion , and the first movie I ever saw the 3D conversion on . This is simply a masterpiece , one of a kind , that should be recognized as a classic by all of its fans .

Hulk Hogan stars as a champion wrestler (A real acting stretch...) named Rip, who is forced to defend his honor, his title and his girlfriend from a greedy corporation that wanted him to sign for their network (Because wrestling sells!) however when Rip declines, the network gets a circuit fighting championship called (and i'm totally serious) "Battle of the tough guys" who's champion Zeus (Played by Tiny Lister Jr) maybe the deadliest man alive. Rip refuses to fight, until his brother is attacked and put in a hospital.

I saw this movie last night at the Berlinale as part of the competition. It was billed as the "world premiere" of the movie by the host (though it seems that people here have seen it previously). I have to say, I still don't really know what to make of the movie. I am unfamiliar with the book, purchased the ticket only two hours beforehand and had only limited knowledge of the plot. Not enough, as it seems, as I had problems getting into the movie. The movie is sometimes being narrated by Jones' character but somehow that perspective did not fit for me.

This movie purports to show a middle class family's attempt to figure out what is "going down" in the America of the late 1960's. Their trip to a rock festival is as far as their refurbished old bus gets. Without exception, the characters are superficial stereotypes.If you want to know which well-established Hollywood actors were desperate for a paycheck in those days,.. just look at the credits. Sal Mineo, I had forgotten just how badly his career had hit the skids! Thank God, his career rebounded before his untimely death.The writers on this television turkey were clueless.

I caught this movie on local t.v . at about 4:30 a.m . I did n't have expectations for it . The movie was about a guy with a girlfriend . He has a dream . He has no money . He wants a new car . He finds the car for the amount of money he wants . He finds the money for the new car . He sells the old car for a good profit . The story was really funny and it made my night. It's a long time since I've read anything like this . It's just too bad it was so slow paced .

Pacino, and Maconadump really hit the mark with this stinker. I swear, I am an avid movie goer and fan. I have been a fan of most of the people in this abortion at one time or another. Until now. The story-crap The acting- crap(Rene Ruso-Major League was good) The plot-crap The subplot-garbage The teenage attempts to relate to sports betting-junkI have vowed to watch Romy and Michelle's High School reunion 2 times a day for the next seven days as my punishment for not turning this colostomy bag of a movie off after 10 minutes.

At first sight, I must say already, watch The Contractor, 2007. With Wesley Snipes too. A better action movie and with a more dramatic plot.The Detonator has an horrendous plot focusing in some sort of atomic bomb, set in Romania and with awful directing for an action movie-- there is no thrilling moments and an action movie is turned in to boredom.Really, what you expect Wesley Snipes to do, when awful screenplays like this one are offered to him? Don't blame him, he needs the money.This was the first impression when I saw the movie, 3 years ago.

The story told by The Cranes are Flying is not, admittedly, all that original. Young lovers are separated by war; bad things happen to both. We've seen it many times before.Nonetheless, we haven't seen it filmed this well, with bold shots that take liberties to emphasize separation, or destruction, or hopelessness. All the more remarkable coming from the Soviet Union, and reason to conclude that Tarkovsky is not the last word in modern-era Soviet cinema.I was reading Chekhov's "Three Sisters" the other day, and chanced upon what may be the meaning of the title of this film.

For the most part, I considered this movie unworthy of a comment, but the last 10 minutes prompted me to write one. You see, right then we learn (SPOILERS...if they can be called that) that the Devil's emissary has no chance of properly preparing the domination of the world by his master, because he is not skilled at martial arts! "Prosatanos" has been lying in a hole for centuries, waiting for "human greed" to release him, only to be defeated in a simple one-on-one match against 54-year-old former karate champion Chuck Norris!

The Mod Squad isn't a movie, it's a void. That's the most fascinating thing about it and the thing that kept me watching  I'd never seen a film that offered absolutely nothing before. It's a film without any reason to exist whatsoever, seemingly consciously designed to appeal to no-one as if made purely as a contractual obligation to someone the studio really dislike. There is no plot, there is no characterisation, there are no set piece action scenes, there aren't even any scenes as such, just a progression of increasingly empty shots projected at 24 frames per second.

When I was a little girl, I absolutely adored The Swan Princess, it was reliving the same fairy tales of Snow White, Sleeping Beauty, and Cinderella, the princess and her prince who saves the day is always a timeless story that will never die, well, hopefully. But I figured that I would check out the sequels for The Swan Princess to see what they were like and unfortunately, this is the typical cartoon sequel that just disappoints more than entertains. The only character I found still very amusing was the Queen, she was very funny in this movie and had the best part.

I would like to tell you just a few things before considering seeing this movie . If at one point you feel like saying "this is stupid", then don't waste your time. If at the other point you decide this movie is worth your time, then let us know how it is, and what you thought of it. The first thing I noticed right away was the lack of any actual story. It was all exposition driven. This is not the first time I've seen this style of film, but in this case, the exposition was actually bad.

This movie does n't even have the saving grace of being so bad that its good . It is truly a shame, because if it were not for this guy , the movie would be nothing short of awful. If I have to write a bad review of something, then it's going to have to start with a bad movie . If you haven't seen this movie then you are probably looking for something good , something you enjoy watching , something you've seen before, or you just want some mindless entertainment for a few hours. This is your opportunity.

'The Mill on the Floss' was one of the lesser novels by Mary Ann Evans, who wrote under the male pseudonym George Eliot. I tried to read this dull and very turgid novel years ago, but was unable to finish it. I'll review this film version solely on its own merits, as I don't know how faithfully it follows the original novel.The film's opening credits are printed in an Old English typeface that suggests the mediaeval period, and so it's a very poor choice for a film with a 19th-century setting.

It 's a bit unnerving when a studio declines to screen a film for the press before it goes into wide release, but it does happen. So far, that's exactly what Warner Brothers did when they handed The LEGO Movie over to The LEGO Group this weekend, who then decided to release the film in theaters instead. As a result, you'll be able to see LEGO Movie on a number of different fronts this coming weekend. First, you'll be able to go see it in 3D on the big screen!

Its difficult to be too tough on Brad Sykes, a hard-working guy doing what he loves, there is an honesty about him that seems often lacking with other microbudget directors. Check out the minuscule crew credits on Camp Blood, there is none of the usual thanking everyone down to the pizza joint they ate in, its Brad and his buddies and thats it, no pretentious rubbish. Jennifer Ritchkoff isn't your average horror flick heroine, but does well enough for you to hardly notice, Bethany Zolt looks like a star and Joseph Haggerty is so funny it hurts.

Like a lot of the comments above me , also I though this was the average scifi movie , but I guess it’s just different for me and different for the others, maybe I’m not the same as them, I mean I have not read the other comments on the same subject before but maybe because of the genre, I don’t know. Anyway it’s just my two cents on the movie. I was expecting the movie to be very good, I thought it was going to be one of the most brilliant movies that I’ve seen in a while.

For several reasons, this movie is simply awful. Other posters have listed some of this movie's historical errors. Well, I have a layman's knowledge of Roman history and even I found the inaccuracies flagrant. I usually forgive errors in historical movies because I understand that the purpose is to entertain not educate. And shrinking a long saga down to a two hour feature requires some, let's say, historical license. But this movie goes well beyond mere rounding.There's worse. To tell a story from a distant period, the movie uses flashbacks which just make the story more confusing.

Well, the Sci-Fi channel keeps churning these turkeys out... and they seem to get worse every time. When normally good actors like John Rhys-Davies and Giancarlo Espositto come off as rank amateurs, you can imagine how abysmal the REST of the cast in this waste-of-your-time effort is. The only halfway decent thing is the rubber outfit of the creature(which is glimpsed in such quick flashes that you don't really have time to see how phony it really is). The dialogue...the plot...if this "movie"(and I use the term loosely) was food, Jack-In-The-Box would be a gourmet meal compared to this.

Mel Welles, you might remember him as Mr. Mushnick in Roger Corman's Little Shop of Horrors, directs this somewhat interesting yet wholly twisted tale of Dr. Frankenstein's daughter carrying on her father's work after his death and creating a creature not for its intellectual ability or its likelihood to be/do good but rather for its sex appeal. You see, Tania Frankenstein, though a doctor and scientist in her own right, is concerned with really nothing more than satiating her primal desires for the stable boy and making some super sex slave by using his body with the excellent brain of a man she does not love.

Being one of the founding fathers of my regions monkey movie club ( this also includes apes/chimps and orangutans ) I've always been curious about the evolution of human language. Since we are primates I thought we would be a good base for studying this. I have always thought it interesting that language is the result of language acquisition, and language in humans evolved long before the rest of animals. In my next movie I will be doing a documentary style study of this topic and I would love to get feedback and critique from you, if you would like to contribute I would be pleased.

This film reeks of production line planning . It appears like the filmmakers looked at recent hit movies , and tried to make the most of what they knew . But that's how most films are made . They don't try and be different , because they don't have a style . They don't have the time , money or the will , or maybe they don't even know where to begin . So they go with a formula to get the job done . And that makes it easier to make money . So you get formula films .

Stay FAR AWAY from this film . The fact that you 're reading reviews tells me you may have already seen this film, and that 's enough for me to not even bother to give your movie a second glance. I didn't see it, but I did read a review somewhere about it. Here's the thing though... I haven't even seen the movie yet, and this review just tells me to stay away. Why should I bother reading reviews of movies I've not seen yet? I don't think so...

When watching this movie , with it 's deterministic cause and effect , wall-to-wall clichés and hackneyed sentiment , can you ever imagine , that a movie that is supposed to inspire you as a youngster , would come up with such an insipid plot ? A man and a woman go for a stroll through the woods and end up falling in love. This is the plot, right ? This movie should have been released in 1955 as it was about the year that I was born . I can still remember the film and I can't imagine why this film was so popular with audiences in 1955 .

This movie spends most of its time preaching that it is the script that makes the movie , but apparently that's not true. It's actually the cinematography, the photography, the lighting, and so forth. When it was released I thought that it was the best movie I'd seen during my time in the film industry but after seeing this I've changed my mind. When I watched this the first thing I thought was, I'm glad it doesn't have a dialogue heavy story that would slow it down for me. I like a movie that is moving at a natural pace.

After sitting through this god-awful 82-minute excuse of a film, and having previously wanted to gouge my eyes out after having watched another James Toback-directed mess called "When Will I Be Loved", I've come to the conclusion that he has the best agent in the world. How else can these horribly written, painfully-directed pieces of trash get made in the first place.I like Robert Downey Jr., but perhaps being in this movie drove him to substance abuse.Heather Graham has to be embarrassed about her zombified performance. Half the time the camera is on her she just is looking off in a daze.Such a crappy script.

To paraphrase the previous reviewer 's comments , if you 're a Stooges fan , avoid this one at all costs, unless you want to see two of the finest performances of the '60s ever put on screen together in one show. (It is the only film version of this classic comedy that I can think to recommend). Stomping the Gas (1964) (USA, 60 minutes)Directed by George Marshall. With Dudley Moore and Richard Boone. The Stooges (1941) (USA, 105 minutes)Directed by George Cukor. With Gene Wilder.

What some Hollywood-movies try and practically never succeed, creating somehow metaphysical connections between persons (without becoming unrealistic), manages this beautiful movie perfectly well (resembling in that way a little to the wonderful 'La Double Vie de Veronique' of the same director and with the same beautiful actress). This is a REAL movie, that changes perspective of life a little bit - intelligent and beautiful story, masterfully directed, excellent main actors, masterful cinematography. I've just seen the movie the 3rd or 4th time, and I still think it's one of the best I've ever seen.

Whenever someone tries to tell me that they think a movie is the worst ever ( and it 's usually not me), I ask them "Why?". They look at me like I have three heads or they don't even know what a horror movie is. Then I let them know that horror movies are subjective, so they don't have to go around and say "It's the best." I will say it, though; I think it was pretty good. The plot was fairly simple. It is a horror movie, and the horror movie genre is the worst genre.

If you put Seinfeld aside , this is The Best Comedy ever , no doubt ! Just Great ! ``I think this one is my best, because we don't do anything with it. But I like this one, I really like it. This episode, it's great for a reason, for what it did for me as a kid, for what it did for me as an adult. I got into Seinfeld. But this one, for this one, for this one, for this one...I really feel like that's where it's at.

If you are a bit masochistic and like to waste some time you should try this one . I wasted a bit of time, so I did a little research and found something that is really good for the soul. I really liked what it said on the web. I thought it was good so I decided to buy it. I liked that it was free and easy and that was really nice for me, but I think you will like it as well. We are all so busy, we forget that we really need a rest!

To tell you the truth, I do not speak Tamil, and I did not understand the film. My good Tamil friend, Kaneswaran Kumarswamypillai (wow, what a long name), explained every thing to me. What a great movie!!! After watching this movie, I felt I should have watched many more movies from Tollywood (Tamil Film Industry). The war scenes were amazing, camera work excellent, and plot beautiful. The actress "Simran", what a beauty. Give her an award for best looking someone.

I consider myself to have a decent sense of humor, but this "movie" left me stunned in my chair.It's so bad that it could just not have been any worse. Not once did I laugh at the sadly attempted jokes in this movie. I have watched and enjoyed several parodies of big movies, but unfortunately this one will allways be the one I remember best - in my nightmares.The only reason anyone should want to watch this, is if they want to enter a coma for a brief period of time.This is the worst movie ever.

This movie made me want to bang my head against the wall . It is hard to compare such badness to that of other movies . The film was a mixture of the worst kind of violence and nudity with no sex in it . What I like about it was the plot line and the dialogues were so bad , that I have never liked a movie that has no dialogues . It has one good line , but it is a joke . The other bad parts were the acting of the actors . I guess the director must have thought he was in the right place .

This is an excellent, little known movie. Tom Selleck does an outstanding job of acting in this movie, with the Japanese 'Clint Eastwood'. I'd love to see if this movie has come out on DVD yet, there are some spots that clearly have been cut. Hiroku (Tom's love interest) has clearly had some parts chopped. It would be interesting to see more of Japan in the film. The baseball sequences are far and away the most realistic of any baseball movie, I'm quite sure most of the actors were current or former baseball players.

This was a fantastic movie about two people , one a young teenage girl , and the other , a man , who have grown up together and are friends . They meet up again many years later in their adulthood and become lovers . The story takes place over about 3 days , one of which the man has been missing for . The man is an American who is working in Paris . The young girl is an 18 year old American girl who has grown up in a small town in Michigan , where she has been friends with the man .

I am a huge Eric Roberts fan , I collect his movies and so far has get to 60 . The only thing I could say is i like him as a actor the way he plays with himself is the best in the business . He was in the top ten for best actors last year and for sure this year and will keep it up . And his films are great but he has not done a very good job in recent years with them . And the last few films he has turned out are good , like his last one The Untouchables .

High school female track star dies of a blood clot after winning a race with the community in an uproar after she was told by her coaches that she should not compete because of concerns over her blood

A teenager who excelled in high school athletics had her career taken away by her coaches when they learned that she was in danger of having a blood clot form in her brain that could have destroyed her, a court heard. In an explosive ruling, a judge described the high school coaches’ actions as ‘cruel and inhumane’ and awarded $250,000 to the 14-year-old who died in January 2015.

* * * * SPOILER ALERT * * * * My boyfriend , some friends , and I rented this movie in theaters . I loved it , it was a very well made movie . ................................. It was a great story . It also has great plot twists and turns . .............................. This movie was not for everyone . It had violence . It also had a few scenes that were very inappropriate . It was not meant to be rated PG . But it still has a PG rating because it still had violence and sexual content . ........................

the first toxie film was dark, gory, and hillarious. This film is un-gory battles to cheezy jazz music, no real gore at all, and the worst toxie mask I have ever seen! His deep voice is now a light, happy voice, characters from part 1 reappear by actors that look NOTHING like them (Claire, Mom Junko), characters names change (Claire or Sara?). It is lacking all the brutal violence, dark humor, and political incorrectness of the first film. If it weren't for nudity, this movie could have been rated PG.

This is a very strange film, with a no-name cast and virtually nothing known about it on the web. It uses an approach familiar to those who have watched the likes of Creepshow in that it introduces a trilogy of so-called "horror" shorts and blends them together into a connecting narrative of the people who are involved in the segments getting off a bus. There is a narrator who prattles on about relationships, but his talking adds absolutely nothing to the mix at all and just adds to the confusion. As for the stories themselves, well..

This is a fantastic film . The acting is some of the best I 've seen . Tatyana Samojlova is amazing as the little girl in the film . The acting skills and the direction makes this film worth watching . There is also some great action and a good balance between romance and comedy . I can not recommend this film to everyone . I am glad I took the chance to see it . I have recommended this film to all my friends that have a DVD player so that they can watch this great film and enjoy it as well .

Everything you do in this world should make at least a little bit of sense. Unfortunately very little of "Delusion" makes any sense. Jennifer Rubin is adequate in her role as the main squeeze of hit man Kyle Secor. Secor on the other hand overacts to the point of annoyance. Jim Metzler, the embezzling yuppie is very unbelievable as the novice, revenge seeking, adversary. When Jennifer Rubin gives back the money she has carefully been concealing, all credibility flies out the window, and the guns pointing final showdown between Secor and Metzler is beyond ridiculous.

Black Scorpion is a fun flick about a groovy female super heroine who wears leather tights and drives a car that can morph into her snazzy armored Scorpion Mobile. She battles the evil Breathtaker and all of this is an excellent recipe for a good time IMHO. I loved the bit about her having to say "Yo" to get the car's computer to take orders! Breathtaker is so evil he wants to give the entire city asthma! It's all so over the top and that's the beauty of it! The scene where Black Scorpion "attacks" her partner steals the show.

Lackawanna Blues is a very moving film depicting an era filled with varying emotions and characters as seen through the eyes of a young boy. The film clearly supports "it takes a village to raise a child" and reminds of an important time in black history and culture. I gained an incredible amount of respect for Macy Gray as an actress. Her character was a little crazy, yet lovable; clearly we all have known someone like Macy's character. S. Epatha Merkerson is absolutely fantastic as Nanny. I never realized that Epatha was such a great actress.

`` Black Dragons '' is a second feature WWII propaganda film popular at the time . It 's not as famous as ''Towering Inferno'' (1931) and ''The Battle of the Bulge'' (1944), though the former film is probably the more influential, because it is the first wartime film in color, the latter being an all-white film. Both were written by British playwright-screenwriter William Wyler. Wyler had been the chief scriptwriter for Paramount Pictures for a number of years prior to becoming a Hollywood screenwriter in 1934.

Bought for £1, Project Vampire is one of the worst movies I have ever seen. Wooden acting,lame effects and a terrible storyline all add up to be a movie you have no reason to even want to see. PV is one of those movies that don't even have the good grace to be bad in an enjoyable way, instead this bile seems to try to make itself as offensively dull,stupid and crap as humanly possible.A vampire has created a serum he sells to old people as a life-enhancer, and those who take it fall under his control.

Now for sure , this is one of the lightest-hearted stories that Bruce Willis has been in to date and it is sure to make for an interesting conclusion to the movie that he just wrapped up. This is not the first time Willis has taken a little break from his work and put his personal life aside. It is just that now that he can do that, he is choosing to be more private with his work. It may not seem like it but when you are a public figure, especially someone like Bruce Willis, the public always gets to see more.

Steven Segal's movie career is a tribute to horrible cinema. I have been tragically bored with every one of them as soon as I realized that they were even more unrealistic than Jean Claude VanDamme's. Has anyone else ever noticed that he never gets hit?! I mean, give me something to root for...a hard fought battle with a bad guy who's scary. TWENTY YEARS and he's still filming the same fight scenes. Fight scenes can often distract you from the fact that your hero cannot act. The boring choreography of a Segal film places his painful lack of acting skill in sharp relief.

Just in case the title didn't give it away - this movie is garbage.Short review? Yeah.I decided to spend as much time writing this review as Hollywood probably decided to put into the script. I doubt it'll be published considering how poorly I worded everything but if this is and anyone reads it -- stick to cherishing the first Sandlot movie. It completely surpasses its predecessors in every single way. The sequels aren't ever worth buying or seeing and everyone involved in making them should be ashamed for ruining what has to be one of the most classic, original films of our childhood.

'Don't Look In the Basement' is so easy to knock but the truth is simply that Brownrigg is one of Horrors real underground stars and IMHO is vastly overdue some proper recognition. 'Don't' is his undisputed masterpiece. This scummy psychodrama snags the viewer straightaway into such an odd, disjointed, claustrophobic world of sweating insanity you have no real idea what the hell is going on. It succeeds in making you feel strangely dirty, just plain grubby, for Brownrigg's world is this mad, unwashed, scummy prison cell of rants, obsessions and all shades of mental illness.

Let me first state that I REALLY REALLY wanted to like this film. For the most part the actors and actresses looked their parts, and did fairly well in their roles, but the movie lacked any real plot. It seemed so wraped up in seeming 'wacky' that no interesting story ever shone through. Also, the camera work was often sloppy, attempting snatchlike camera work and failing miserably. Most of the time, shots meant to look cool ended up being confusing. Perhaps something was lost during translation, but some of the characters were just... stupid.

My yardstick for measuring a movie 's watch-ability is if I get squirmy . If I start shifting positions and moving around on my seat I know I'm enjoying the movie . I do this because if it wasn't for that I wouldn't enjoy it. Watching "Titanic" was a bit squirmy , the first 15 minutes or so I had to move around on my seat a good bit, then it all came back into focus. The problem with that though is I'd have to sit on a plane for hours and hours and hours.

So , you wan na be a rock star ? See this movie . You do n't like rock , just you are n't like rock , no ? You wan na be , a movie character ? I would be very happy if you come in my office , and I would tell you what your role is like in this movie . If you wan n't a character , then I can give you an acting role . What's the role of the main character in this movie ? No, there is no main character , no character , just a situation.

NBC should be ashamed . I would n't allow my children to see this . I definitely would tell my kids the truth that the guy is a rapist . I would not want my kids to grow up thinking this is acceptable behavior for anyone . I don't care if he is a politician , public figure , or even the president . We should all be ashamed . There is a difference between good and bad . If he raped women and killed them then what he did is not ok. I don't support his policies .

Last year , I fell in love with the Tim Burton 's version of Sweeney Todd so I wanted to see how they pulled that off on the live stage. I didn't even know what it was, and yet, I couldn't stop seeing the story of this weird guy who walks through the woods and kills people in a satanic manner. What a story! I watched the film a couple of times and I'm glad I did because when I saw it with my friends, we had a great time discussing what we thought about it.

`` Mararía '' really disappointed me . I ca n't consider it as a bad movie , but the development in the story just made the film boring , especially in the second half, i couldn't get any real interest . The acting is very good , but that's about all . I could see a great script . But it had too many holes to fill , and it is still very far from what I could have seen . I really had a hard time getting into this movie. The plot was interesting but there were so many problems with the acting.

It starts a little slow but give it a chance . In the spirit of the `` Wackiest Ship in the Sea '' this game will take a while . The story is decent . The soundtrack is decent . I had some trouble with the control system . My only complaints are that the voice acting was bad , and I did not understand some of the dialog . However, I can overlook these minor quibbles because of the excellent story line . Overall, if you are an FPS fan and are looking for an arcade game, pick up this one.

so if a guy meets you and he says ' I want you to look at my erection ! ' and then he pulls a gun out of his pants and he says " shoot me ! " what kind of relationship do you guys have ? " I mean , if you had a relationship with your ex-boyfriend or girlfriend or husband or ex-wife and you told your best friend or your best buddy " I think I want you to look at my dick" would you be upset if he did? If so, I think people need to put a little more thought and thought into it.

In short this movie was awful.I understand it's a Disney movie, which are generally shallow movies with mediocre plots and bad acting. HOWEVER, i must say this is the worst of all Disney movies, with bad acting, LOTS OF IRRITATING SHRIEKING TEEN GIRLS(my god), and an extremely unrealistic plot. Even as a 12 year old there is no way i would have liked this movie. The only way this movie could have been any worse is if they attempted to put it in theaters or tried to sell it in a local video store.

You can't really blame the movie maker for glorifying Che because the industry is all about money. Most of the stories you hear about this "freedom fighter" are absolute tripe fabricated by the communist Cuban government after Che's death. Che was a murdering scumbag from day one. Here's a list of the great things Che did for Cuba 1) Executed thousands of innocent Cuban Men, Women, AND CHILDREN to satisfy his lust for power.2) Destroyed Cuba's economy and good standing with the rest of the world. The Cuban peso used to be equal with the American dollar.

There are movies that are so bad , they 're good . Then there 's movies like Rest Stop that you can watch in the dark, where you know you 're gonna find something good. There are some movies I have to sit down and rewatch, because they 're so bad they make you want to throw the TV out the window and just go for a good old walk in the woods. So I had a chance to catch up on some of those classic, bad movies of yore and it makes me wonder: How the hell did these things get made?

Something strange is happening in Loch Ness. The water is crystal clear, nor cold. A giant robotic plastic monster emerges and kills Scots! What is this movie?! First, I love reading stories about Nessie, sea monsters in general. When i saw this for sale, i thought it was a cheap rip off of jaws. No. It was terrible! The story was pointless, acting was 100% garbage, the only up side was the cool mechanical Nessie they used. It was full of inaccuracy, wrong locations, and bad everything.

This movie has a fairly decent premise - one gruesomely featured again and again in science fiction films , most of which I enjoyed. And it has a solid acting cast - some good ones, but nothing special. I found the ending to be disappointing - and the first half just wasn't that bad - it was fairly good. I've found a couple of horror films over the past few years - but this was as good as I have found any horror film - maybe even better - of its ilk - and I am disappointed. And the ending... well...

Saw this at the video store and thought I'd give it a try. Sounded like a good story and the cover looked good. That was it. The characters looked good, and the actor who played "Noel", was the most convincing, though he didn't have any heavy time in the movie. I find it really hard to give a movie a bad rating, but this is one, in a minute number, that gets it my book. As the movie went along I kept wanting it to get better but to no avail. Asthetically, it was good.

This is a low budget stop motion monster movie from Brett ( A Nymphoid Barbarian in Dinosaur Hell ) Piper . It is the 2nd film in this series of films . You can get this film for $5.00 on the net . The story of this film can be summed up in two words : Dinosaurs ! This story is an old man's attempt to return to the way he was before he became a vampire . I like this story because it shows how one can change his old ways of life. I also liked this film because the acting in this film was exceptional .

When a friend and I saw this in the recent releases, we decided to get it despite the fact that neither of us had heard of it before. We both like Costas Mandylor and it had James Coburn so we figured it couldn't be that bad. We were wrong. It was. It was REALLY that bad. No actor or actress could have made this film worth seeing. It was like taking Titanic, The Poseidon Adventure and some nuclear bomb film and trying to cut and paste it all together.I must admit that there were a couple of chuckles.

I got this movie as a buy one get one deal at troma.com with The Ruining ( which is n't my favorite of the three.) The movie is good. The story line is ok. The plot line is the same. There are no special effects. In the end, they all make the same decision. No matter how they spin it, it is the same decision. And so the movie ends. So I did not see it. I was in the hospital in a coma for over 2 days and I had to go back.

i have lost count as to how many times i have watched this movie . i 've never grown tired of it. it's one of those films that has everything and more . you have the story of the protagonist , who is a very strong character with a dark side that has been well developed . the visuals are really good and very well done . and the music is perfect . but i have to say , this is one of those movies where you never know who the main characters are . all the actors in the movie are great , but not as good as the actors who play those characters .

While out divining for water , a young psychic woman named Jessica Burns ( Carolyn Kearney ) stumbles upon something far more bizarre and inexplicable. As Jessica tries to figure out where she has been, she ends up making an odd connection with the young boy who appears at her front door. What’s even more unbelievable is that the boy, Ben ( Justin Chatwin ) has the ability to talk to animals. It’s a gift that’s a little scary at first but Ben quickly begins to help Jessica in figuring out why she can’t remember anything that has happened over the past twenty-four hours.

What I miss most of all in this film is that it lets no place for imagination , everything is so real that makes you feel and look at the characters. The story is very very good but what I liked the most was the ending and how you can easily find out where the film is heading. I like to watch films without knowing anything before I watch the film but it is so much fun to think what will happen to the characters. This is why I give it 9/10 only because if you think about it , I am not sure where this film could be going with the storyline.

I'm pleased that this was the work of foreign cinematographers because it can't be accused of unfair bias. With absolutely no cause, the Jacksonville cops rush to judgment in this case and pick the first black suspect to accuse of the murder of a white, foreign tourist. They picked a 15 yr. old kid who is just about as close to a saint as you could randomly find and then make fools of themselves trying to pin an unlikely case against him. In addition to the unfairness resulting from the blatant prejudice there is the matter of 6 months of unjust imprisonment of a completely innocent young black teenager.

Has anyone else noticed that this version is basically a scene-by-scene remake of the 1933 version, with some of the scenes taken out? It makes me think less of a film that does that, showing a definite want of creativity. In all fairness, I tend to be biased in favor of Katharine Hepburn, but this version of the film seems like cinematic plagiarism. The 1933 version was nice and sweet, though a little awkward in presentation and transition at times, and then this version took the script, the music, and even a fair amount of the scene blocking from the earlier version.

I watched 5 % of this movie tonight and you may tell me that I need to see the whole thing in 3D, but I will wait and watch the film in 2D until then. It was an interesting experiment, though. In the film, we were told that one of the things that would change in our lives over the next couple of decades was going to be “The Future of Food.” I have to tell you here and now, that my life has been changed in the past few years by the food industry.

I ca n't disagree with a previous comment that `` Driving Lessons '' is more than a little twee , as I don't think you'll find anything to disagree with, because I agree with you, it is a bit twee . I have not, ever, seen it recommended anywhere on this site, or anywhere for that matter, but it is probably because you have never really been in a car, so you have never experienced the pain and pleasure that is the feeling of driving. That is why so many people recommend car lessons, because when they do, they learn that feeling.

As was mentioned by others, could there be any other reason to see this film other than to see former "Wayne's World" star Mike Myers play a serious role? The story line is interesting but lacks development and is sabotaged by loose ends and bad characters. If there was any good scenic shots of Ireland then it would give it another reason to see it. But instead it focuses on a little normal village that is obviously surrounded by the 'green pastures' of the Emerald-Isle that are often shown in Irish films.

Movie Title - TartDate of review - 5/26/02Year of movie - 2001Stars - Dominique Swain , Brad Renfro , Bijou Phillips , Kristy McNicholGenres - Comedy/Drama/Romance/Horror/MusicalSynopsis - On a summer trip to Florida with his parents, a depressed young man (Bijou Phillips) finds love at the beach. Stars: Brad Renfro, Dominique Swain. Review - I can't say I liked this movie more than the others from 2003. It wasn't as good as the other ones I've seen, but it was certainly a good one. I enjoyed it, but I found it boring.

I love this movie. It is the first film Master P have ever done. It is based on the story of his life. It is low-budget, but it is very good. It shows how Master p grew up in projects in New Orleans.Not only did Master P start in this movie, he also was the writer and director with Moon Jones. The DVD also has The No Limit ice cream party on it. This movie shows how Master P goes from bad too good and how he had to deal with the things around him.

The Other Boleyn Girl - not to be confused with the book it claims to be based upon. This movie is not even close to a faithful adaptation. I could understand them changing or elaborating on a few things. The book is not perfection, but it was well-written and became very popular. I could understand if the BBC wanted to make this a little more faithful to what actually happened, who Anne Boleyn really was - but it's not even close to being historically accurate either. It's just fluff. Mindless, made-up fluff.

I was expecting `` Born to Kill '' to be an exciting , high-tension film noir . Instead , it's like the most dull movie I saw in the cinema today , and it's not even an action film , it's just a dull , boring , middle-aged couple having an argument over money . I could not get into this film . The acting is not worth anything and the script makes no sense and is so predictable it was boring me to death . The film has nothing interesting to say and makes no sense .

Honestly , on the subject of the death penalty , I could take it or leave it . The problem for me is it is not a just or fair system . I believe in the system . I have been through that system myself . It was my father who did that . I don't believe my father should have to stand in a line and watch the same person do the very same thing to him , over and over again . It doesn't matter how many times it is repeated in the line , or in the execution room .

With a name like "10 Commandments" you would expect a film to be representative of the account in the Bible, specifically Exodus. Not so here. This is standard procedure with any Biblical Hallmark-made film. Remember "Noah"?? That was utter fiction and one of the worst films ever made. At least this film had "some" truth to the original story. However, Menerith, who was a major character in this movie - half-brother of Moses, is not in the original story. Other characters were absent, not to mention important events were completely eliminated.

This movie is so bad, they wouldn't buy it back at my local used CD/DVD store. I only own it because it came in a box set which I bought for the masterpiece "Deadfall". The store bought back the other two movies I was selling from the four disc set, but they wouldn't buy back Underworld, and those other two movies redefined rank, so what does that say about this movie? So I tried to sell it back to another store, that even bought back budget DVDs that you could buy for a dollar at a local store, but they wouldn't buy back Underworld either.

The original `` Psycho '' ( 1960 ) is widely considered as Alfred Hitchcock 's best work and certainly , as one of his more influential movies. The film follows a young British doctor who has just arrived to Paris to start work as a physician at a prestigious hospital. His first night in the prestigious hospital he is invited to attend a dinner , which turns into a seductive evening and soon leads him into a web of intrigue. The film takes a satirical tone by mocking the conventions of the British bourgeoisie as well as its class system.

I just happened to stumble to this film and checked IMDb for more information : Score 6,7 , well ... I'll wait to be informed :-D

So, I've been thinking of buying the PS4 for a long time now. My main worry was whether I should get a PS3 just because I like PS3 games but I don't really like PS3 games (at least, I haven't played them and don't want to). Then I've been thinking of PS4 mainly because I really want it and it would give me an advantage over other consoles.

Some critics have compared Chop Shop with the theatrical releases of City of God and Pixote . I 've seen both, I 'm just not a huge City of God fan but I 'd love to see Chop Shop in the theatre . I also have a friend who saw Pixote but not City of God or Chop Shop . He didn 't care for any of the films . He had some sort of weird thing happen when watching it and had nightmares about all of the things that the characters in it did . Anyway I 'd be curious to hear how people like Chop Shop and the Pixote and City of God comparisons .

I think this is one of those few movies that I want to rate it as low as possible just to pay it a compliment.I haven't seen this movie in about 25 years, so I really can't say that much about it. It still seems to be very hard to find on video. But I remember my brother and I stumbled upon it somewhere in the toxic brew of late night UHF channel television of the mid 1980s when I was about 10 years old. So I've never actually seen the beginning of the movie, but I saw most of it.

Everything about this movie was bad , the acting was bad and the plot was bad . And were is this movie made ? The only good thing i like in that movie was the first half which was pretty good , but the second half was so dull and bad , i don't even want to imagine how this movie will be made , i want to see how it will be made . And the ending is not worth it , i really like the movie and the actors but the story sucks , the only good thing i like about that movie is the last scene which was good .

The movie uses random events of historical significance as its backdrop and willy-nilly criss-crosses the lives and time-lines of its 3 central characters. To what purpose, one may ask? The problem with this film is that the script becomes the 'story', not characters or their lives.It starts off with a bunch of rich, aimless college kids (and a couple of not-so-rich too) drawn into the Naxalite movement. Affair, rejection and separation follows. People go their own ways, seemingly. Only till the heroine forces herself upon them. Not once but twice.

I went into this movie determined to like it . I usually enjoy dramas like Wall Street , Glen Gary , The Bourne Identity . The problem is , it has a lot of problems. The script is so poorly written . The characters are either one dimensional and one dimensional characters , or two dimensional people , and so are the stories . They do not connect to the main characters . There are too many characters , and they do not mesh well with the movie . There were some good things in this movie , however , like the acting . The plot was just not interesting .

Let's summarize how dumb this movie is with two details : Arnold to Antichrist : "Let's see who is meanest" said with a straight face. And you can tell they were not trying to be funny.How do you think Arnold will battle the evil of all evils?Blessed Water, A crucifix, a priest..nooo! with a bazooka, yes not even Satan expected it they're so clever.After an engaging beginning (which reminds you of Devil's Advocate) it goes nowhere. Somebody get me those two hours of my life back.

This thing, directed by french sensation Patrick Sebastien,is worst than all the turkeys that you may have seen. Forget Independence Day, Kazaam, The patriot, etc... you get the picture, this one's the pits. Sebastien is a TV celebrity in france, (if you need an equivalent, let's say he's Jerry Springer with an I.Q of 13), this is his first movie let's hope it's the last. I hope Troma or someone would distribute this film in the States, so that you guys out there can excperience the French stench at it's worst.

I 'm not even going to comment on what piece of trash this film is since that has already been done. I will say though that you have to ask yourself why this movie was greenlit. I mean, how does this film pass the test of the MPAA? Does anyone really think they would allow the director to make the kind of film he is making? I mean, just look at some of the stuff he has already done in the past. For example: he made a series of awful, awful, awful films.

I walked into a book store in Brentwood, Tennessee. I am not going to say the name because I am a dedicated customer. I have been satisfied with every item I purchased there before this one. On display in the front of the store was The Bell Witch Haunting. (Might I mention this is the only store I have seen it for sale in.) I had heard about the story somewhere and remembered it was supposed to have really happened for real. I was very excited and couldn't wait to watch it. I had great expectations for it.

I went to Crooked Earth to see a piece of New Zealand . What I found was a badly scripted, badly acted, badly acted, badly staged piece of crap. That's not a complaint, just an observation. There were some good actors, and there was some skill on the set, but the script was bad, and the acting was atrocious, and the directing was atrocious. There was one good scene - the scene where the main character, who is in a coma and dreaming of what is going on, tries to communicate with his loved ones.

I just finished watching this (last weekend) and found it absolutely hillarious, some of the scenes I just couldn't stop laughing at! Dennis is soooo amazingly thick sometimes, and just says the stoopidest things...but at the same time he's just being cool to impress his girlfriend (who gets arrested anyway!) The beach scenery is very tranquil...until along comes Robbie Coltrane...! Not the greatest movie ever made but certainly something to think about renting on a Saturday night when you haven't got much else to do (like I did).

I really liked the Far Cry game , nice graphics , good level-design , interesting and clever enemies , above-average combat system , and a few good points that i really liked but i think the game is a little bit too complex for people like me who like simple things to play. I am not the best gamer in terms of gaming and i did not know how to play this game , and i think it is quite a good game that i like and can play and enjoy the game , and i also enjoyed playing other games by the same developer.

Back in August, '81 there was a country-ish buzz to movies, big hits like "Urban Cowboy", "Every Which Way But Loose", "Smokey and the Bandit" were all the rage. For that reason I suspect the producers of this movie chose "Honky Tonk Freeway" as the title hoping it would help the movie's box office receipts by drawing in that same "Urban Cowboy" crowd. Instead "Honky Tonk Freeway" bombed at the theaters and I suspect it do so in part by being burdened with a poorly chosen title.

This movie surprised me . The box is misleading , the tagline is misleading and the costumes and tone of the film makes it look like something from an old black and white film . There's no doubt that it will be one of my favourite films , I just wish they would have told me about the plot and how it would turn out earlier so i could have done my research . I really like the idea behind it and would watch it again soon . This movie will keep me coming back . I think that the director was trying to find out what he could do when he was working on the movie .

How in the world does a thing like this get into my DVD player at home? How does it even get to be packaged and distributed? Are there absolutely zero screenings a movie (and I use that term loosely) have to go through before it's put on a video store's shelf anymore? I'm all for DIY film making but come on! That doesn't entitle me to get a group of my friends and relatives together, a crappy camcorder, an awful story and put it all together to create a heaping pile of crap and call it a movie.

A bad Quentin Tarantino rip off , at least I hope that 's what they were going for because at least the trailer looked fun. Anyway, I don't want to discuss this movie too much until I know more, because there's no way I will be disappointed. But I've read the summary so far, so here is my analysis. First off, what is a Quentin Tarantino movie anyway? Well, it is a film that has been produced by Quentin Tarantino. It is his attempt to make the kind of movie that Tarantino would want to make, even though he probably won't do it.

Of all the directors ever to sit behind a camera Wellman could break your heart quicker than anyone. Even Ford. But this is one of his worst. Even he seemed to know it, probably from its jejune treatment, not much above a Bonanza or Big Valley. Yet there is one moment, typical Wellman that comes out of nowhere to shatter you, the death of the Indian wife of Gable. She has gone to give her baby some water and WHAM is killed by an arrow instantly. No warning. Nada. One of the most shocking, unprepared for deaths in all cinema.

"Love Life" explores a very culturally relevant scenario of a marriage of convenience between a lesbian and a gay man. I found the subject matter compelling, even if the conflict was a bit forced and too easily resolved. For example, Thomas falls for Joe a little too quickly and conveniently for the plot. There are many continuity errors: one other user commented on different cars in the garage, Joe's glasses...the one that got to me the most was the fact Joe's facial hair configuration seemed to change from scene to scene.

This movie is truly unbelievable, in every sense of the word. I couldn't believe what I was seeing, and hearing, and I didn't believe it anyhow. Hepburn is probably my favorite actress, but this was ridiculous. Being a hillbilly myself, I know what it should sound like, and it's not Kate's Back Bay accent. The only thing I found funnier was the fact that the guy who played Charlie Chan so many times, Sydney Toler, was cast as another one of the hillbillies, with accent to match.

I know little or nothing about astronomy, but nevertheless; I was, at first, a little sceptical about the plot of this movie. It follows three children that were all born during a solar eclipse and so have no emotion, and thus (naturally) become ruthless serial killers. The plot does sound ridiculous at first, but once you realise that a solar eclipse blocks out Saturn and, as you know, Saturn is the emotion planet, it all falls into place; makes complete sense and it's then that you know you aren't simply watching another silly 80's slasher with a pea brain plot.

The Comebacks is a spoof on inspirational sports movies , and let me just tell you-it is not a good movie. It’s good, though, because we are forced to see what we are like. It is a movie about comingbacks, about perseverance, about the strength of your convictions and the strength of your spirit. And it is also very funny. It’s the only film I am happy to recommend, and I’m very happy I saw it. If you’re not a fan of sports movies, like me, you will have a hard time with this one.

What can I say? After having read Herbert's books and loving Lynch's movie version, I was extremely disappointed. I felt I was watching a reject version of Buck Rogers. The sets looked like left overs from a Star Wars TV special! I felt the acting was a bit amateurish by most. The costumes were garish and over done which gave it a '60s Flash Gordon, pulp feel. The worms! They're supposed to be Sand Worms and yet they appeared to "big stalagtites" with a mouth at the blunt end. The effects in general were pretty second rate.

The only good either of the Problem Child films caused was bringing together Amy Yasbeck and the late John Ritter, who in the same year teamed up to star on a television series on the now-defunct UPN and CBS. The duo had been on-again off-again for some time before Ritter's death, but it was finally their turn to work together for the first time. The problem was, it wasn't their idea to team up. "I had just gotten the news that we were going to do it on a TV series and I thought, 'Let's do that,' " Yasbeck said.

I 've watched the movie actually several times . And what i want to say about it is the only thing i want to add about the movie to this comment is that you have made a good one movie . It's a really good movie i'm watching now . You're not just a director who made a great movie but you have also created a plot and story that i liked very much about it . So i want to share a review with this movie . Thanks for all the effort you made to make this movie. 1. How do I rate this movie?

Last year was the 200th anniversary of Charles Darwin's birth, and the 150th anniversary of the publication of "The Origin of Species", so it's fitting that Jon Amiel's "Creation" got released. The movie focuses on the period of Darwin's (Paul Bettany) life while he was writing his famous work, and the mild strain that it put on his family life.I guess that the movie overplayed Darwin's tension with his religious wife Emma (Jennifer Connelly), and his guilt over his deceased daughter Annie, but I still like the thought of Darwin's theory working like a karate chop on religious dogma.

I had high hopes for this film when I saw the listing and decided to watch it on TV , but I was dissapointed . The film is not worth the time it takes to watch , and it's a shame because the cast was excellent , but this is only because they were the main characters and they had the lead in this movie , so I can't even compare this film with the main ones because they were not as bad as they thought they were , and that's not because of the cast or the story .

What a silly movie . While it looks nice , it does n't make a lot of sense . On one hand, the movie is trying to make us feel a bit of pity or even some kind of anger for some characters . On the other hand, they are trying to make us sympathize with the characters in some cases . But, they are failing in the first part , mostly because of the actors . I saw it like a lot of other reviewers did . It looks nice but I didn't understand the story and it didn't seem to make any sense.

Do NOT avoid this movie . Simply because it is so bad that it is absolutely hilarious . It possibly makes the worse movie of all time . I have no idea how this movie came out , but the story is pure tripe . However the actors are amazing . And the music of the movie is a perfect match . I know this film is based on an actual book , so I guess that makes it even better . But the story is not very good , so what is the point of making this film ? And it is a comedy with bad acting and music .

The story line of a man's love for an innocent baby he finds with a malformed face and on the opposite side of the world a shallow self centered "valley girl" who shares a birth date with her and ends up making a big difference in both of there lives. What a great and worthy story line. But in this telling the screen writing and/or directing and/or editing is so poor as to take most of the joy out of the story. Linda Hamilton's character goes from understanding mom to wicked witch and back faster than a speeding bullet, and for what purpose?

I saw this on the Accent Underground release with the short films . I found the film at first boring but as time went by the film grew on me and I liked what they were doing. I really hope the film gets more exposure on the festival circuit because it seems like it could really take off in the independent film scene. I would really like to see more short film by this group. Thanks for letting me share my thoughts with all of you! Friday, May 14, 2010

It's funny how this film was not as good as it would have been.

The Fanglys is set in a small Texan town called Layton on the eve of Halloween as the townspeople treat it like the second coming of Christ or something, I mean Halloween isn't that important is it? Anyway, Sheriff Pete (Burton Gilliam) has been called out to yet another murder as local boy Ned (co-associate producer John William Galt) has discovered a body in the local woods. Could it be the Fang Lady (Justin Hamilton)? The central character involved in a local legend about a witch who kills teenagers, who knows?

I really don't know much about the Marquis de Sade, not having read any of his book, but I never imagined him as a flaming queen. Carson Kressley of Queer Eye For the Straight Guy, or Jack from Will and Grace would have fit easily into the role that Nick Mancuso gave us.The movie itself was rather thin and seemed more of a parody - or an excuse to show the Paris whorehouse several times with men and women having a good time on the couches in the parlor. What? They can't afford a room?

I can't believe I even tried to watch this filth. As an avid B-Horror movie fan, I was more than riveted at the prospect of this film by popular budget horror filmmaker Herschell Gordon Lewis. Unfortunately, right from the opening of the film, I could not, for the life of me, think of a worse movie than this. Well, maybe Gigli, but I firmly believe Dr. Gore (The Body Shop) is worse when I think about it. A horrible plot that moves incredibly slow, the movie drags on with no real horror to speak of.

"Japan takes the best from around the world and makes it their own", while that may be true, it applies to all except for one thing, that being,.....Major league baseball....but not to worry, "Mr Baseball" is there to try and change all that. But just who will change whom, is the part of the movie that really makes it rock! Tom Selleck is one of my favorite actors and really shines-on in his comedic roles. The storyline may be true to life, however the subplot is dead-on.

Am an ardent Vijay fan. I have never seen another movie of his which is as good as this.It has all the regular clichés that one can expect from a commercial entertainer. A hero who is bad in studies but a star in his forte i.e.Kabbadi. His friends to fill in the comedy quota. A heroine in a life-and-death situation. A villain, which I say is the best ever portrayed by the protagonist. High octane chase and action sequences. Music that can make one dance. And above all that a perfect storyline to keep all the above factors within an enjoyable circle.

Think Jumanji but with a death curse . A bunch of surfer dudes get their hands on a game that lets them kill other human beings. But that only brings out their darkest instincts, and things get a lot more intense than we could have ever imagined

Jumanji is a film that has had many iterations over the years, the most recent of which was released in 2009. It was the sequel to a short-lived television series which was based on a novel by John Gatins, also known as the book series The Gatins. This series was the brainchild of Michael J. Fox.

Hellraiser : Bloodline is only a so-so film . I believe it 's the fourth installment in the Hellraiser series.I thought this movie was good and I 'm happy they made more Hellraisers but I have to admit it's only a so-so movie . I believe it' s the fourth installment in the Hellraiser series . I believe that this movie is the last in the series . They don 't get into sequels and this is the last movie in the series and it will end on a cliff- hanger . This is the first movie I 've watched this year .

This marvelous short will hit home with everyone who, as a child, specifically asked for something because it was hip or cool, only to be given something that would mark you for life with your peers and were told by your Mom or Dad (or both) that it didn't matter, as you earnestly began considering enlisting in a Witness Protection Program in order to avoid ridicule. For those U.S. residents who don't get the horror because you don't follow hockey, it's like a Dallas Cowboy fan getting a Washington Redskins jersey or a Yankees fan getting a Red Sox jersey.

This was a pathetic movie. The Alien was decent, but the movie itself gave a new meaning to pitiful. The plot is something that's been done over and over again! However, this one does it the worst! The acting was c**p, the scenes were often too dark to get what was going on. No one developed any concern for the main character. The movie was far too slow paced, and the murder scenes that there were were foolishly crafted and ended up looking no more interesting than the rest of the movie.

Always enjoy the Classic Horror films , however , this film was really a big waste of time and if I were in charge I would have pulled out all stops to try and save this film . If you don’t know the plot , here is a synopsis that I wrote for you , and it will save you time . If you read this you may want to skip this section , as it explains the plot of the film . The synopsis :

A man is murdered in his home , but no one can explain why.

This movie actually almost made me cry.For starters the fake teeth . Then you spot a nice plastic or drawn out plastic doll that actually seems to resemble the doll in the movie. Next you spot the man with the camera. He actually seems to be taking his time to get the right shot and then it's over and he has to move to the side to get in frame to shoot. This movie is so real it's hard to know if it's a real movie or not. All you know is you know you saw a movie.

When I first watched this film , I thought that it would be rally good , because it featured my favourite character ever . However , I was totally disappointed when they were trying to make it a comedy , because it lacked any laughs . The plot was so stupid , I didn't know how to relate to any characters and I found the ending very unsatisfactory . I had to wait to watch it until I saw the end of the movie , where I noticed that the film had a lot of good jokes and I actually laughed , but when I watched it in its entirety , I didn't see them .

Awful Star Wars knock-off with a slightly more comic tinge . Robert Urich stars as the leader of a group of mercenaries, sent to collect a legendary sword from a remote island. The only problem is they are not alone. This is no mere story about a sword . . . this is an allegory. . . . There is no great story about the sword of legend . . . .
