This film was made in 1962 and is still one of the finest examples of screwball comedy ever made .

*SPOILERS INCLUDED*Alfred Hitchcock's brilliant and innovative adaptation of Robert Bloch's novel was an amazing film, unlike anything previous. Every shot, every camera angle, every nuance was PERFECT. He didn't just break the rules, he made up a whole set of new ones.Here's the spoiler: there is absolutely nothing new, different, or original about this movie. Gus Van Sant doesn't just pay a homage to Hitch, he rips off every idea, and does so in a less original, more conventional manner. I didn't have anything against Gus Van Sant before I saw this movie.

A tedious effort from not-yet great director Budd Boetticher and pretty but not-yet un-bland actress Nina Foch, this movie is, as one of the other reviewers notes, is the quintessence of a certain kind of B movie. It's just not the good kind. And a promising premise and an overactive fog machine is wasted.Basic plot -- Nina, a nurse on leave from wartime duties on account of her nerves, has a nightmare. She meets a dashing fellow at the resort where she's giving her nerves a breather, and realizes he's in the dream, even though she's never met him before.

First off , I never got into Dr. Who until recently . Honestly , I never got the opportunity to watch it until I was about 10 years old , and I remember it as just a little cartoon. I never really got to enjoy it as I grew up because I had to share it with other people who would say that they would watch it but wouldn’t tell their friends because they were embarrassed to have to share it with their friends . Then when I came to college , it was on TV but not always.

This show started out okay, but then it turned into a nightmare. The worst part about it was the contestants. Most of them were weirdos. They did stupid things for a living and they also did strange hobbies. In the second season, one guy said he that he talked to his pants. That is sick and repulsive. Also, no one cared about winning money. All they ever wanted to do was make alliances like it was "Survivor" or something. The men were always afraid that the women were going to team up together.

This is one of the best episodes from the entire X-Files series , creepy beyond words . The tension and tension between Mulder and Scully build up to a climatic showdown, and one of my favorite moments was when Scully was trying to save Mulder . I had goose bumps throughout most of the episode. I don't know why, but this scene really made me nervous . __________________
I know the universe is out of control. It's like that old saying: "You can fool some of the people all of the time, but you can't fool everyone all of the time."

This film flopped miserably in the UK , and it did n't deserve to . The trailer of this film is not something which can be taken for granted. This is one of the movies which did not want to be seen in theaters, and the only people who liked this film in theaters was the people who could not bear to miss it. So, if you are one of those who are not willing to watch these films in theaters, do not waste your money. But if you still do not have an option to see them, watch it and enjoy it, you will be very happy.

I just finished up this unofficial adaptation of H.P . Lovecraft 's `` The Lurking Fear '' that was shot in three days on a $12,000 budget. The movie was shot at night to make it look like it was happening in the night. And of course I had to make some things up. It might have even been a documentary. Anyway, it's a good story. I have a few more ideas I'd like to try out, but this was a good way to learn what was possible on a limited budget. So here are a few shots I want to put into the script.

"Son of the Mask" is a terrible excuse of a movie. I went to see this with my friend and I still wish we had seen "Because of Winn-Dixie" instead. I must say that it is partially my fault, as I agreed to go see it with him. Being a fan of the first "Mask" movie (Jim Carrey was hilarious) I had hoped it wasn't as bad as all of the critics said it was.Ten minutes into the movie I knew it was headed for disaster.

As a parent of two girls(14 and 11) I have grave doubts about this show and all the shows aimed at tweens. First, I am always amazed that the living conditions of Drake/Josh, Zac/Cody, Hanna, Carly, Derek, Sunny etc. always make most houses look tiny and cramped. Most people work hard all day to pay for living quarters less than half the size yet on these shows nobody is going or coming from work, paying utility,rent, mortgage or insurance bills, mopping, sweeping, changing lightbulbs, fixing toilets,etc.

I guess I should now comment upon a 4th flick in the MAGNIFICENT SEVEN franchise ; the sequels still surprise and amaze. The plot itself is not particularly complex, and has no real depth, so it's not surprising that the plot twist of the film doesn't seem to stick as much as the original did to me. However, it does not matter, as I was pleasantly surprised with the overall plot of the sequel. This sequel takes place a year after the previous one, and it is told in the present tense.

Frank Sinatra did so many excellent things in the world of entertainment that it 's hard to single one out as his greatest accomplishment. But when you consider all the things he did while still a young man in Hollywood, the list of his accomplishments is nearly overwhelming. When Sinatra died, he left his fortune to a foundation to be used for charitable causes. The idea is that if you love the people who work for you, and enjoy the things that make them happy, you should try to make things a little less difficult for them and help make their work more enjoyable.

A fantastic musical starring Gene Kelly and Rita Hayworth. He owns a nightclub where she dances. She's no star yet, but she gets a big break when she's chosen as a cover girl for Vanity, whose owner was actually in love with her grandmother. When he sees the resemblance, he picks her right away for a contest his maganzine is running. Hayworth's newfound fame at first works wonders for Kelly's club, but her star rises so quickly and so high up that his grasp on her begins to falter.

In this approximately 34-second Thomas Edison-produced short , we see Annabelle Moore performing the Loie Fuller-choreographed `` Serpentine Dance '' that will become her signature dance move. The scene shows her performing on the stage in the New York City Public Library and, in the second shot, she is shown in the studio. The dance was filmed on November 1, 1961. (You know how long it took to film a scene in a dance studio, right? Well, that's why it's been done only twice in a movie so far and that's because they had to stop because it took so long to film.

A truly excellent look at the world and the realities of being a heroin addict . The movie is one of the most insightful and well put together documentaries I have seen. The cast is all excellent, from a man who was on heroin for 20 years to the woman who died of an accidental overdose, to the woman on the run for being with a junkie who was shot dead, and the young girl who became a junkie for a drug dealer who shot her in the heart. It is a must see for all of us addicts out here.

This movie was alright . Mary-Kate and Ashley play twin sisters ( sorry for stating the obvious ) who against all odds are sent by their parents to live together in an apartment on the same floor of a building and work as a team to make their apartment as beautiful as possible. While making the apartment their way, they learn to respect their building and learn to respect others as they discover a lot about themselves. I liked the idea of this movie, but I felt there were a few things that could have been better such as the character of the manager and a lot of the dialogue.

This movie was astonishing how good it was! The plot is extraordinary, and the acting spectacular. At first I thought this wasn't going to be that great because of a summary, but after about the first five or ten minutes of the movie, it struck me that I was dead wrong. I literally cried about four or five times in this movie, and despite this, I must've watched the same scenes over and over again about thirty times in one week! No, the song scenes were not as awesome as they could've been, but the plot is what really gets you.

Awesome Movie ! Great combination of talents ! I 'm a HUGE fan of David Duchovny and he is outstanding as the lead character in the movie 'X-FILES'. This is his first acting performance and it has me very excited. He has a very unique style that I think makes him unique. Also I love the chemistry between him and the other actors and it was very believable to me that they are a team, and he did such a great job in the role. He is very talented in every aspect of his acting and has a very natural way of doing so.

As someone has already mentioned on this board, it's very difficult to make a fake documentary. It requires tremendous skill, pacing, patience, directorial 'distance,' a plausible premise, a narrative 'flow,' and REALLY believable acting (aka GREAT acting). Such is not the case with 'Love Machine'. It starts to show its faux hand about the 20-minute mark (with 60 minutes left to watch), and the viewer starts to realize that he or she is being taken in. It's downhill from there.Director Gordon Eriksen simply peaked too soon.

I have seen many many movies and this just totally blew my mind . The trauma , the suspense is just beyond belief . This is the first time this has ever happened to me but I am pretty sure I saw this movie on video or something. The music was great ! I love the way the movie played . The cinematography is beautiful . I love the way it was all done with great style . I hope it is made into an actual movie . I was very surprised about how much I like this film and even more surprised at how much I love all of the music .

This is a tough film to review, since several factors need to be taken into account. Let's filter the more judgmental..Ok, are you interested in the facts concerning the serial killer of Jeffrey Dahmer? Can you withstand an independent, low-budget film? Are you objective enough to NOT dislike a film solely due to its lack of stars or professional look? Well, if you said yes then you should have a mind open enough to handle this one. This film is an almost 100% accurate dramatization of Dahmer's adult life and subsequent murder spree, and is styled as an autobiography.

It looks b grade and you will probably think there is no reason to rent this film! But do! I expected nothing from this movie, just something to pass the time, but I was hooked from the start! Two interesting premises - A bank robbery gone wrong, a million dollars missing and two girls on the road to start a new life - How will these two stories collide? Just when you think you know what direction the movie is headed, it does a 180 and you are left blown away by the great twists in the plot!

Far from combining the best bits of Pontypool and 28 days this managed to ignore them. Whilst shamelessly copying them. (if that makes sense?) Pontypool was different and got progressively tenser, this just stinks. The Radio DJ, "we must stay on air" spends effectively no time on air. He sits on his bottom and watches the TV for news. This is by far the worst excuse for a zombie movie ever. Is there a single person in the USA or indeed the world who doesn't know what a zombie is? Or ever heard of the word "zombie"?

I was never in the past interested in this play although love Shakespeare and have seen most of his plays (I am not a fan of Shakespeare). But I did read and really enjoyed “The Winter's Tale” which was the story of Perdita as told in the play by a man named Terence. This was my second time reading the play and had a great time while doing so. When I went for my second viewing, I asked if the story was based on a true story of a real person. They stated it was. And that she was a real person.

One of low budget horror schlockmeister actor, John Carradine's more animated roles as a implied Nazi scientist, who is turning humans into zombies to serve the Reich. Mindless scuffling brain dead, only able to obey the most simple of orders....bit like staff in McDonalds.Hitler isn't mentioned by name, since America wasn't at war at the time they was filmed, but it's pretty obvious who the bad guys are working for!There seems to be two types of zombies in film, the traditional voodoo type popular in the old black & white films of the 1930's and '40's.

This is one of those movies that I can watch again and again and not get tired of it. It is by far one of the best comic book adaptations ever. I liked this one even more than X-men. In fact, this movie is sort of a cross between X-men and the matrix and it came out before either. Wesley Snipes does a great job with the character of Blade. He is just not an emotionless super hero. Also, this movie isn't sugercoated to get a pg-13 rating. Sure comic books are for kids mainly, but I like a little more in my movies.

The cast and crew of this cheap horror potboiler are more interesting than anything that occurs throughout the movie itself. As I said, it’s a cheap horror film that attempts to do more than it can. It fails at that too, in the end. I haven’t even finished this film, yet it’s already making me nostalgic for the good ole days when cheap, low-budget horror films used to exist. There was always room to grow, to be bigger and better, but this was the first time that was ever possible. The first time.

I appreciate the effort that the filmmakers wanted to depict the story of Moses and the exodus of Israel, and that the film helps viewers to put themselves into Moses' shoes and gain understanding of the intense burden laid upon Moses' shoulders. As excited as I was to see this film, I was greatly disappointed in the storyline. (I'll leave out the videography, special effects, and artistic ability in this review.) What is most disappointing is the historical inaccuracy of this movie and how it is so far from the historical accounts from Biblical texts.

I made a promise that if ever I posted a comment that was less than complimentary , then later felt I made a mistake , then that I would delete it . I have done that many times . This is one of them . I have not deleted my earlier post because I felt that this was a good opportunity for a conversation to take place on a subject close to both of our hearts . I know that many on this board are more than a little upset with me because I am a woman and am not always right .

I saw this movie last night on HBO & didn't expect to get hooked - I usually fall asleep when I watch HBO. But it happened & you will too. It's a tragic documentary (2002 Oscar winner) about a murder of an elderly female tourist in Jacksonville, Florida and subsequent investigation, arrest, & trial of a 15 year old boy.Watch this movie today & get a feel for how we have progressed as a society. This film was most deserving of an esteemed Oscar - you'll be moved to tears.

OK, I admit that I still associate Sophie Marceau with La Boum. That was the main reason I went to see this film. But it was so boring, that I nearly felt asleep. Sorry, but her talents as actress are not very convincing. Furthermore, this film was presented as having outstanding special effects and CGI. Yeah, for a B-Movie it is not that bad. After having seen her in "Marquise" some years ago (also a very crappy film), I thought that she would play more convincingly.

First things first, I am by no means a picky movie watcher. I'm not one of those people who gets movies just to pick apart the flaws and criticize, I, like most other people, watch to be entertained. I'll basically watch any type of movie of, no matter how bad anyone says it is (sometimes a movie's so terribly made and written that it invokes a sort of pity humor which i get a kick out of). With all that aside, lil pimp was simply pathetic. I saw it on TV and just didn't know what I was watching.

I was looking forward to The Guardian, but when I walked into the theater I wasn't really in the mood for it at that particular time. It's kind of like the Olive Garden - I like it, but I have to be in the right mindset to thoroughly enjoy it.I'm not exactly sure what was dampening my spirit. The trailers looked good, but the water theme was giving me bad flashbacks to the last Kevin Costner movie that dealt with the subject - Waterworld. Plus, despite the promise Ashton Kutcher showed in The Butterfly Effect, I'm still not completely sold on him.

You could have put the characters on the island for any reason at all and had the same movie. The first one had an original story, the second stole one from King Kong, and in the end (I hope) of this trilogy the story seemed to have been bypassed altogether. Drop some people on an island full of dinosaurs and watch them run for their lives. That was about all there was to it. The special effects were decent but not worth 8 dollars. If you have a discount theatre in your local area, wait and see it for a buck.

This movie sucks so bad . Its funny to see what a poor story this has , where two pea-brained people are put in a relationship , where the only thing in common is being fat . I couldnt even figure out how it was supposed to work . The characters were so boring , the story was pointless , and the plot was just terrible . It had nothing to offer . Its a movie of the month . The story is a little bit cliche, the actors are average, and the director and producer have not made one film before.

I rented this movie because it supposedly takes place in a jazz club -- you know, those hip, cool places you might stumble upon late on a Saturday night. Well, there's not one ounce of "cool" in this ridiculous movie. The score is goofy, the original songs are awful, both lead actors' singing is continually off-key (to be kind) and unprofessional at best, the plot is no more complex than "boy meets girl," the acting is laughable, and the only decent cinematic moments are the stock footage scenes.

I was attracted to this film by its offbeat , low-key , 'real life ' story line . That is to say, if you don't want to be offended , then there is no point in watching it . This is a really poor film and not just because it is badly acted but also because of the blatant racism it perpetuates and then uses as an excuse to push through its agenda. I have no doubt that this film would make for excellent TV . It's not just that it's bad or boring , it's just plain wrong.

This is the third movie in a month I have watched that did not go the way I expected. The first two being The Black Dahlia and Hollywoodland, neither of which gave any new ideas of who committed the crimes.I have always had a fascination with UFOs and was so excited to see a new movie on the subject of UFO investigation that was not a comedy. But after about 30 minutes, it all went horribly wrong.I could have stood for the acting, the camera angles, the stereotypes if only there was a good story about chasing UFOs, but none here.

This is the perfect example of how a great book is turned into a poor film . The direction just isn’t there. The acting is all wrong. I’m not even kidding. I mean it is awful. I could not imagine any actor, director or composer trying to make a film out of a book with the level of craftsmanship in this movie. I saw this movie the same day I saw the book and have never read it. But I cannot get over the terrible acting in this movie. This is just bad acting.

The only reason for me for watching this little known Irish film was the question could Mike Myers have played a normal, dramatic character. Well, he could and his acting was pretty good but unfortunately that was probably the only good thing that I can say about this film. In the beginning film follows life of twelve years old orphan Mickey who lives with his brother and sister with their somewhat eccentric grandma. Despite some strong language it looks like a family film but after a while it becomes clearly that Pete's Meteor is a hardly suitable for young audience drama.

What to say about this movie ? A married couple has more then just each other . After playing around a lot they decide to quit their job and try something else . That new thing they are after is to be in a serious relationship. They decide to quit their job and to move in with each other . Will they make it work , or will it turn out being a huge disappointment . And what about their daughter ? She wants to try to get out of their home and move away. Will she find her place ?

I enjoyed it . There you go , I said it again . I even bought this movie on DVD , to watch it in the theater . But I didn’t need it . It was just a silly romantic comedy , made in the 60’s . It was just a very silly , romantic comedy . And I did not like it . The movie was not even worth watching , I tell you . But I still have it , for my collection . Here it is , the first of a two part review of this movie .

When I first saw the previews for this movie on TV I thought that this could be a funny movie. I was wrong. All though I am not totally against movies that make fun of others. Some are actually funny such as the first scary movie. This was one of many that have been made as of late that are not. The humor in this film was anything but funny and was rather dull.I feel the one of the biggest problems is that they poked fun at to many movies such as Varsity Blues, Friday Night Lights, Stick it, etc.

This horror tale takes place in the Namib Desert of Africa. A Canadian systems analyst, Zach Straker(Scott Bairstow)is sent on an assignment for a diamond mining company. Although he hates field work, he finds himself in a truck with a rescue unit in the open desert fighting sand flies and whipping, blowing sand. Four diamond prospectors are found...well whats left of their scattered bones are discovered. During a long cold desert night a shape-shifting monster makes its appearance. Zach and his colleagues are terrified when their truck is stranded and members of the unit are dying horribly one by one.

Yes , it 's a SBIF ( So Bad It 's Funny ) classic . With a budget running into thousands , it's a challenge to make a film in this style , but it 's worth doing . It is a very entertaining , and fun film , especially when the story takes off . The story is based around a man who loses a leg in a car accident . His only companion is a parakeet , who he adopts and takes on the role of the movie star . There are a few issues to be dealt with before we get there .

Step Up is a fair dance film about some kids that get their big performance break. The film is average in every way with little more for the viewer. A jock fights external prejudices to become a dancer with an accomplished partner and a teach who sees something special. The acting was fine, but the dialog and directing had little to add to overcoming a predictable story. None the less you still feel quite good about the outcome of the film. There were some dark scenes and some typical generalizations about dancers that went a little overboard.

I was expecting a lot from Mr.Amitabh Bachan 's role of SARKAR , but am disappointed . Being a Ramayana person ,I was expecting him to act in an aggressive manner. He is too passive to be considered a hero , and it is not that he is not an aggressive person he just did not have the opportunity to be a hero . He has the potential to act in an intense manner. His performance was not that much that it made the film worth it . There are too many actors who can do justice to this role.

OK , when I say `` wow , '' I mean , `` Jesus , please help me . '' I'm sitting at my computer with my family , watching a video of the last year of my life. My son is asking for a new game so I can spend more time with him, but I don't know what game he wanted . I don't know when this is all going to happen, I don't know if I'll wake up one morning and find I don't have to wake up .

There were a lot of dumb teenage getting sex movies of the 80s and a lot of slasher flicks but there were only a handful that were made with thought, made you laugh and captured the time period right; this was one of them. Cage is Hillarious, so is Forman who from her bio unfortuatley has dissapeared from the Hollywood limelight. I'd love to see this released on DVD with in a special version with commentaries by Cage and Forman. Wishful thinking, I know. Ever want to plan a true 80s movie weekend, rent this, Sure Thing and 16 candles and Breakfast Club.

Kubrick may have been the greatest director of all times. He may have made more classics than anyone else. He may have been a perfectionist. But man, was his first attempt ever bad!Kubrick had good reason to try to make this film dissappear from the map: it looks like an Ed Wood film. It has strange narration, cheap shots, bad dialogue, ominous music reminiscent of your 50s sci-fi/horror flick, and what looks like relatives of the cast of "Reefer Madness" going insane for no reason.Sure, you can see an undeveloped Kubrick in there.

I picked up this movie and was horrified to find out that the movie is based on a rape of a 15 year old girl by her teacher. As a result, this movie will have a large percentage of the audience saying something like, "How could anybody think that was ok?" "Why didn't they report it?" "Why doesn't anyone report this? This is a teacher at an all-girls private high school doing something so horrific, how could anyone think that this is ok?" "If I was the parent of this victim, I would be in prison for what happened."

I was amazed at the quality of this film , particularly after seeing pictures of the barely adult director - I'd never seen a director that could have pulled off these kind of effects in such a subtle, elegant way. I am looking forward to the rest of his work. Thank you for posting this film on your blog. Great work, as always. As a former student of Robert Altman, I can't help but think that this is as fine a piece of film as you could wish for. I also feel like I can't wait to watch this.

There was no need for this movie, plain and simple. The original, although hated by some, was something I found to be actually really entertaining, mainly because it was before Jim Carrey started to really lose his touch, and Cameron Diaz was, well, "Smoooooookin!" 'Nuff said. So why make a sequel/prequel thing? Honestly? Knowing that Jim Carrey wouldn't do it should've been clue enough that it didn't deserve to be created. But then they just make mistake after mistake. Jamie Kennedy. Why is this man still allowed to breathe?

It's hard and I didn't expect it... But it's really the worst film, me and my wife saw. Awful dialogs that extend incomprehensibly through time without any apparent reason except to fill time. The storytelling doesn't follow a comprehensive intelligibly way everything is a mess. The action and the dialogs appear at jumps. The thing that disappointed me most was to see Dominique Pinon one of my French favorite actors involved in this uh I don't even know how to describe it without being polite The rest of the actors where at the most poor.

I was expecting this movie to be a stinker but I wanted to see for myself, but I was surprised how good of a movie this was. I know longer movies often don't do well at the box office but why this was pulled and not allowed to be viewed by the public is beyond me. It maintained my interest throughout and the scenery and photography is breathtaking at times. The plot was good and the morality play was a good one. I liked the realism which was along the lines of "Unforgiven". I had to rent this movie to see it but it was definitely worth it.

So I caught this one afternoon as "What Lies Above" and actually watched it because the beginning was somewhat promising. The heroine, Diana Pennington, is a mountain climbing expert...but that doesn't help her when her fiancé Brian gets hurt on a climb. When she goes off to get help and returns, he disappears from the mountain, never to be seen again.Two years later, Diana is still a climber...but she won't go near Snowman's Pass. That is, until Curt Seaver appears and tells her that he can find the body of her lost fiancé with a new satellite program.

Surprisingly good and quick-witted adventure that features Kelsey Grammer (supposedly in his first lead role in a feature) as an unconventional Navy sub commander who wants to run a nuclear sub of his own, however; he has earn it by competing against the U.S. Navy in a series of war-games with a crew of untested, questionable, and lovable men (and a woman, too).Director David S. Ward ("Major League") and his writers have put together a hysterically clever and upbeat comedy that tries to make the film easy to understand, which they do quite well.

It 's been a long time since I have been in the art-house theater and I went to see Douches and I was really excited. It was a little dark, and I was a little unsure about it, but I was quite pleased with it. The acting was good and we got the full story in one hour, but I thought it went for about an hour too long, so I hope they do something about that. It was a nice little movie, just a small film. There is a sequel, which is coming, but it is a really long film, about six hours long.

To my eternal shame, I've never seen a silent movie - not even the mother of all vampire movies, "Nosferatu". However, if they display half the creativity and sheer joy of this effort from Buster Keaton then I'll probably try to watch a few more. This is genuinely funny as well as being a stunning introduction to the world of the silent comedies. The premise, such as it is, focuses around an unfortunate case of mistaken identity as Keaton is mistaken for renowned bad-guy Dead Shot Dan (co-director Malcolm St Clair).

I really love this movie . It has a very real feel to it . I believe it was never released in the UK and is not widely available in North America so it was a rare treat to have it in our local library . I highly recommend this to anyone who is a fan of the books and film . I am very pleased with this purchase

It is a fantastic film that I just can't understand why it took so long to make. I always feel it was far better the book. This is a great film and you won't be disappointed .

DO N'T LOOK IN THE BASEMENT This little forgotten gem holds a special place in my heart and on the list of things I would love to have for my son's first birthday, but until I know more about it, I can't tell you what the heck it looks like. Here's the story: My son and I used to play hide and seek, and we went down to the basement. I would go in and he would follow me. One night I went down to find him, and all of a sudden he disappeared. He didn't even say goodbye!

I'm not really sure where to begin. From start to finish, bad, stinky bad, like stepping into a port-a-john on a 100 degree day. If you force yourself to watch this as I did, keep some Vicodin handy for the pain. I will never understand how flicks this bad make it past the cutting room without the entire reel ending up on the floor. The movie is a cross between Gumby rides Pokey, meets the terminator, meets Wally Beaver playing cowboys and Indians without the cowboys. I've seen better animation in the original cut of the Blob.

Watched this film with an audience of....5 in total! Had a choice between Lakshya and Asambhav...(realized then I should have gone for Lakshya). A typical plot...India v Pakistan..but just isn't cricket as you have Kashmir in the middle. An Indian super hero goes on a mission to save the President of India from some Pakistani rebels who are involved in a mass drug smuggling racket. I left the film half way as it was simply boring and the plot was confusing and all over the place.

I watched this movie three times at different ages of my life and always did enjoy it very much indeed. This Can-Can is an authentic explosion of joie de vivre, like Stanley Donen and Gene Kelly musical, but in French way. And a Jean Renoir nice tribute to his time, his friends, lovers, music and dances. It is at same time a show business chronicle of that age, full of affection and French mood. It is too a clear tribute to the Impressionism (people who likes impressionistic painters will like this picture).

I sat down through 2 hours of pure boredom . I look here on IMDB , even though it is still in beta , I know there are already some good reviews about this movie, but it was a little long , and for some reason I got a little depressed , so I turned back to TV . I decided to try something different today , and watch some of my favorite episodes of the series. I really enjoyed these episodes, and it gave me a lot of ideas , that I might write . So this is how it ends up .

I watched this movie on TCM last night, all excited expectation, having last seen it (twice) in its memorable 1957 release in Toronto. I told my wife, who hadn't seen it before, to watch for the thrilling long tracking shot, no cuts, where Veronika is seen on a bus on her way to find her Boris. In a hand-held frame that certainly predates the modern Steadicam, the shot then pulls back up and cranes (pun unintended) over the street as she exits the bus, and darts among the tanks to cross the road.

i just glanced over another comment posted here in which the writer discusses the disturbing ways the teenagers in this film use the body of their dead friend. one overlooked in this statement is perhaps the most unsettling of them all, no surprise it's what crispin glover's character (layne) does. he is thrilled over one of his friends murdering another friend of his, the killer's girlfriend. not because layne did not like this individual, rather he is excited about her death because it gives him something to do.

Lucio Fulci, a director not exactly renowned for his subtlety, ill-advisedly tries his hand at black humour in Touch of Death, a made for TV movie about Lester Parsons (Brett Halsey), a psycho who seduces and murders rich widows in order to pay his gambling debts.Starting off with a wonderfully gory scene in which the lethal lothario disposes of his latest victim via chainsaw, mincing machine and hungry hogs, Touch of Death starts promisingly enough, but Fulci soon loses control of proceedings, introducing a weird sub-plot involving a mysterious copycat killer and some heavy handed 'comedic' scenes.

at the story . It is reality mixed with Americana- and very original.Emily Grace is a young girl tired of her life and wants to see her family. She gets in a terrible car accident leaving her without limbs and head. She begins to live on her own and has to learn how to survive, as she finds out, she has many other issues to deal with too. And they are issues she has to figure out. There is a lot to deal with. There are many different issues. I hope that you are able to find this story as interesting as I am.

The name of this film and the clips that I saw caused me to believe that this film would have to be a 3-D production. The film was obviously shot in 3-D, because the images are so beautiful. I don't think there is a lot to explain about this film. This film is just a masterpiece. It is just so beautiful and surreal. This film contains a lot of symbolism, which I am not familiar with. Some of these images, for example, can be seen in the beginning, at the end and in places in between.

This wonderful movie captures so many elements of what makes a family comedy funny , entertaining , sweet and memorable. The movie was written by John Lee Hancock in the early 1940's and stars the great William Powell and the beautiful Virginia Mayo as the mother and father. The story revolves around a man who is in trouble and is looking for a friend to help. In order to make a friend he must meet his father and mother and become best friends with the father , and have them help him out in a situation he doesn't have any idea how to help himself out with.

David Cronenberg movies are easily identifiable , or at least elements within the movie stand out as his trademarks . The first Cronenberg picture he made was a short film called " The Zone " in 1987. This story about a man who falls through a wormhole and finds himself trapped in a deadly alien world is an homage to Philip K. Dick's " Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep ? " which Cronenberg would also re-create in his next movie , "Total Recall ." But Cronenberg's most famous work is probably " Drowning " in 1996 .

I knew five minutes after the monster made his appearance where his was going . But when I saw the smoke come from his ears and the flames come from his eyes, it changed everything for me. I knew right there and then that what I had witnessed was a miracle. The fire never left his face. In fact the flames would not come out until I pulled the monster away from him. By that time he would be completely covered in the flames. I held him like that for just a few moments, until my heart had stopped racing.

I would say this is a background movie. Play it the background as your tending to busy work (laundry, checking email, etc). I thought this was a film that was done before Amy Adams became successful after Enchanted. Wrong! It was done in 2009! The screenplay/script is pretty awful. I love musicals but the singing is just average and doesn't move the plot along. Ughh. It almost seems like it's a made for TV movie based on the cinematography. Am I watching a TV show? Even the secretary breaks out into song.

I have always loved The Muppets. Though most children's entertainment then wasn't that likable, The Muppet's was. The Muppet's are very, very funny. They are probably the most likable children's characters ever. Not only did The Muppets have their own show. They also have starred in many films. from The Muppet's Christmas carol to The Muppet's treasure Island. The first Muppet's movie, The Muppet movie, was also, like the show and the other films, excellent.The Muppet movie is about how they all got started.

OK, to start with, this movie was not at all like the book. I read the book when I was 13 and since then it has always been my favorite. When I'm waiting for a different book to come out, this is the book I turn to to fill in the time. I have 3 copies for god's sake. anyways, I knew this was not going to be anything like the book but come on! They could have done a little better than this. I mean seriously if I wanted to watch American werewolf in Paris or London than I would watch those movies.

We get to see who the good guys are. The union. And who the bad guys are, a rich man who steals elections and his spoiled son. The filmmaker forces us to see good from evil. All the characters hate the bad guys so that when watching the film, this can help us along on hating the bad guys. This is the worst kind of film-making - manipulative and childish. The plot centers on a cop who is in-between the good and the bad, and he's stuck in this ugly film. It's boring and pointless.

Well , I think I 've finally seen my last Woody Allen movie ! I read the review in the paper where I saw it on May 17th and I 'm totally disgusted by it! But I can't really blame the writer! I just want to know, is it possible to like Woody Allen's movies or are they so stupid they're worth not even seeing? I'm not saying that the review was good, in fact it was terrible, but I did like the review. He said it was a comedy and that it would probably be rated PG.

Roger Corman has enjoyed his shares of cinematic infamy in his illustrious low-budget career , spanning over 300 movies . For Corman fans, his influence and impact can be seen in so many films that it’s easy to forget just how many of them there were. One can look back at his oeuvre and see that Corman is the director responsible for such classics as “ The Pit ” (1975) , “ The Black Cat ” (1972) , and the infamous “ Army of One ” (1968) , or he’s a director you’ve likely never heard of (but probably should be).

"Carlito's Angels" is a spoof of "Charlie's Angels" that is not afraid to spoof even itself at times, however that does not mean that the film is above criticism by the viewers as well - it is amateurish and juvenile (I think "fast-motion" stopped being funny around 1914). The assaulting rap music often drowns out the dialogue, and the film feels longer than it is, even though it runs barely over an hour! The girls themselves are hot & adorable, with wonderful lean bodies, and even though they never get naked, their outfits leave little to the imagination.

`` Jefferson in Paris '' is a truly confounding film . It presents Thomas Jefferson ( Nick Nolte ) in Paris on a diplomatic mission. He's trying to convince King Louis XVI to join America and the French in a new war with Britain, who's trying to convince Louis to stop using slaves. And it's an interesting question, because while Jefferson and Louis have been friends for a while, there is no way for him to know for sure whether or not he should trust the king and what he might do in his own self interest.

I have some of the older videos and dvds of Dr. Who. I've played them over and over. I adore each of the "Doctors" for different reasons. But due to a man in the BBC hierarchy, Dr. Who was canceled, even though it was still one of the mainstays of the BBC line-up. With the departure of Sylvester McCoy, the Doctor stayed alive through the fans. BBC graciously allowed fans to write books, and cartoons. The momentum of Dr. Who has been steady even after 1989. Then they took a chance with Paul McGann.

Having read the books and seen the 1982 Anthony Andrews/JaneSeymour version, I have to say that this is not good at all.According to the books, Percy is supposed to be a seeminglyfoppish aristocrat when he's being Percy, and witty and cleverwhen he's being the Pimpernel, but here he just looks bored asPercy and mean as the Pimpernel. Marguerite is supposed to bethe most beautiful woman in Europe, not a tired and frumpy-looking matron (she looks middle-aged, probably due tobad make-up). Richard E. Grant has done much better things, andElizabeth McGovern's acting is uninspired and flat.

When I think of a 1970s-period film, this is not what I think of. I don't want a monotonous, one-song Robin Trower soundtrack; I want a soundtrack punctuated with the top-40 bubblegum songs of the day that epitomized the '70s. The generic karaoke-style disco music during the prom scene was especially annoying. The acting (if you can call it that) was very wooden, and seemed just read from script in monotone. The film quality and camera work was horrid; the dialog murky, the script seemed thrown together without much thought and the plot was thin if not nonexistent.

"The Apartment Complex" is a campy comedy full of kookie characters created in lieu of a real story which tells a young psych student (Lowe) who takes a job managing an apartment complex and becomes embroiled in a murder mystery...um, if you can call it that. This low cal watch contains no suspense, no thrills, no drama, no action, precious few funny moments, a dash of nudity, and almost no romance. "The Apartment Complex" is passable, forgettable junk food for only the most needy couch potatoes.

As kids movie it is great. For the family it just sucks. I was truly hoping for something like the Goonies which is a great film for all ages. This movie was just geared too much to the kids with the silly script and characters calling each other little names like booger breath. ??? Alan Cummings was however a delight. And why do people compare Willy Wonka to this movie...just because there is a theme song closely resembling the Willy Wonka song doesnt make this film anything like Willy Wonka.

At Beaverview Cheerleading Camp , the goody-goody two shows Lucky Ducks cheerleading team must get in cahoots with the 'tough girls' to defeat a rival. While the girls try out for the position of Cheer-Off Captain, the boys will try out for the positions of cheer-off Champs and then the team will face down the tough girls all the way down to the final competition. After a tough year for the Beaverview Cheerleaders, they are now faced with an even tougher challenge as they face down the tough girls in the Cheer-Off competition. If they win the competition, they will get to stay in the tournament for the next three weeks.

In a nutshell the movie is about a gang war in the 1950's. Leon, the leader of the Deuces, starts the gang after his brother OD's on "junk". He vows to protect the neighborhood. The leader of the rival gang is just getting out of prison and wants revenge.The movie didn't really do it for me. The "Good Guys" weren't any more good than the "Bad Guys". Very little was shown to suggest that the Deuces really cared for the community. I suppose the writers were going for realism here, but I just didn't care which side won.

Even by the lowered standards of '80s slasher movies, this one stinks. The usual gaggle of oversexed teens heads for a "forbidden" part of forest, which burned in the 1940s and apparently left a sole angry survivor. Fast forward (actually, you'll want to fast-forward through much of this mess) to the present day, where a couple of campers are butchered; the teens follow in their wake, while a semi-concerned park ranger (a sleepwalking Jackie Coogan) and his healthier cohort (who spins a lot of time tuning his banjo) succeed partially in steering our attention from yards of run-of-the-mill nature-footage padding.

I have been looking forward to the release of this DVD ( and it 's follow-up { Female Prisoner Scorpion}) for a few years now. I've watched almost all of it and it has been very good. There are many things I really don't enjoy about the movie (which are mostly minor) but I'll address each one now. For one, the main plot. I have seen this film a bunch of times and have always found it incredibly boring. I don't know why but I never really cared about the plot, it just didn't grab me the first time or the second.

`` Witchery '' is a decent little Euro-Trash horror yarn ! David Hasselhoff is pretty damn funny in this one (I can hear you groaning at the thought). "I think it is really sad that someone would do such a horrible thing and not even try to apologize. That is not a good thing for an actor, not good for the character. It just shows you their true nature"

The fact that he apologized is the biggest problem. Not that he was sorry for the incident in the first place, but rather that he didn't care about the people he hurt by saying that.

I am an avid movie watcher and I enjoy a wide variety of films . However , I found NO WAY to download movies to my laptop without installing software. So my question is how can I download a movie from the internet without having software installed on my machine ? What software I would install ? I want to install something that is simple and can download and install movies easily . I am not asking for downloading software of any sort . I am not interested in torrents at all . I just want my laptop to be able to download anything that has been uploaded on YouTube, Netflix and other streaming sites .

It seems to be a common thing in the 90's to play with cliches. Some manage to do so with great talent. Hervé Hadmar doesn't. On the paper, the movie looked interesting though: the weak plot could have been saved by great moments of comedy, dark humour, and a very "décalé" style. Director Hadmar, unfortunately, kills his direction with his camera angles and his absolute lack of rhythm. Every joke is embarassing as no one reacts in the theater. The movie is incredibly slow, and the actors seem to be wondering what the hell they're doing in this ridiculous mascarade.

As a nice anecdote to one of the above comments : In was in Mumbai about two weeks before the attacks. I went to buy some food from a local restaurant. There was a table next to the counter, there were three men sitting and I asked one of them if he wanted to buy something. He politely replied 'No'. I tried again, this time with a firm 'Yes'. He politely replied 'NO'. I said 'Thank You very much. Please excuse me'. I left and I didn't see him again after that.

Hey what do you expect form a very low budget movie ! ? ! ? Although I have n't seen any of his previous movies, I like the style of movies he has been doing for a long time. I am not one to like them but I do like him. I like his movies (I do not know any other directors)I am very glad I watched him work because it is a very good movie. And I would like to have his next one done right and better than the one before it. I think he should make more like that.

A lot of actors have a multitude of good movie roles in their soul. Some, a handful. Others, maybe a couple.Then there's Linda Blair. "The Exorcist". That's it.When you see "Chained Heat" and watch Linda Blair in it, you have to wonder what, if anything, was running through her mind.Certainly not, "Oh boy: Oscar for Best Actress, here I come! "Just another women in prison film like they used to make for the cheap in the '70s, this one actually has names you may recognize.

( Possible ? ? spoilers included , but nothing critical given away . ) I just watched this classic low budget indie feature with a bunch of young kids. A story about two siblings who play video games and spend the whole day in a room in their parents’ home. In fact, they play games until their parents go to bed and are unable to hear any noise from their rooms. Eventually, the kids decide they should play some more and start playing games all night. Then, they play some more.

I ca n't believe some of the comments here in the reviews . The film is dated of course ,but that is an issue with every film made today . The film is good enough ,but its not the film that the director was trying to create . There is nothing new about the plot . I am a fan of horror films and this one was ok . But I do think the ending is lame . Overall I would have to give the film a 2/5 . The cinematography is ok ,but I just could not get involved in the horror film I expected .

This is without question one of the worst movies I have ever seen. However, it is also one of the most unintentionally hilarious. I like to compare it to Plan 9, in that it can be so bad, so awful,so dumb, and such a waste of time that I find myself laughing out loud.One of my biggest problems with it is that it's a complete ripoff of Robin Hood, and let be honest and say that I love Robin Hood with Errol Flynn, and Robin Hood: Men in Tights.

Like classic Hollywood musicals , the plot is just an excuse . A must see for those interested in French cinema, and for those who remember how great the French cinema used to be . It is really a shame that some of the actors and directors of the time are so poorly remembered today , because they really were fantastic . I would recommend to anyone who was alive in the 80s to catch this movie , just as a classic film . I can not remember a single thing about this movie. The music is excellent though.

The original "Psycho" (1960) is widely considered as Alfred Hitchcock's best work and certainly, in my opinion, is one of the best movies of all time. The decision to film a shot by shot remake is therefore, a little puzzling.The cast in the original was flawless, so the cast of this remake had a lot to live up to. Vince Vaughn as Norman Bates was not a good choice for the lead. He is too much of a pretty boy hunk and is not very convincing as Bates.

Let 's get one thing straight : I like much of Snipes ' work . Unlike his other high-kicking contemporaries, he has never been afraid to show his vulnerability , and he never goes for the cheap thrills of a big action score . He's not a big star , not the kind of star that the big studios love . And he's not a star that I'd love to have as a hero , but I've never found a film I didn't enjoy seeing him star in . It was a real pleasure to find the film I did, in fact .

`` Down Periscope '' has been in our library since it first arrived in VHS . Since then , we've seen new releases from the company and even a sequel to its famous film , but for a long time we thought that it was all in our head . Now we can officially announce the release of ''The Down Periscope Collection'' , the VHS release of Down's famous movie '' Down''. −

This collection contains the entire ''Down'' movie from beginning to end. You don't get to see the opening credits (because they are on the videotape itself!

A killer (John Karlen) with a penchant for really bad disguises (afro wig on a white dude?) cruises around in his van looking for victims. Detective DeCarlo (James Luisi) is on the case and finds the killer rather easily by just hanging out by the local pool and looking for anyone looking weird (again, the afro wig comes into play). Tracking the killer to his home, DeCarlo decides to set up a risky sting involving a female police psychologist.Inspired by the crimes of Ted Bundy before he was caught, KILLER'S DELIGHT is a pretty predictable and cheap serial killer flick.

As I read the script on-line , I thought `` Capote '' needed a trim . Having just seen it on Broadway , I was thrilled by the idea of it having a trim . I think we need to look at the idea of the theatre in America. We are a small country - and our theatre is small. We have one theatre. We don't have three or four or six, but we are a one-off. And it would be nice if in America the theatre has its own trim - its own trim, as it were, and we don't have to do the trimbing by the stage .

Mark Walhberg in a great role , idolises a rock star to the extent of knowing all his songs , even if he hadnt heard the songs before , that's his style of music , a little more subtle than his other more 'rock' inspired songs , he has the ability to be able to sing , as in some songs you can hear all the instruments and all the layers , he even has a very cool way of making his voice sound like it is vibrating on the air , for some of us , it may not sound the most realistic , but to me , it just sounds so cool !

OK, it was a "risky" move to rent this flick, but I thought I had nothing to lose.Well, I was wrong. This is, next to "Bloodsurf", the worst "horrormovie" I have ever seen. Crappy actors, crappy technical output, crappy story and so on. The soundtrack though, isn't to bad. That is why I give it a 2 on the vote and not just a 1. And of course the cats are a positive surprise. By far the superior actors in this movie..... Do not rent or buy it.

Alright! A sci-fi/horror/action B-hybrid directed by Jim Wynorski and in the final scenes we get to see a cyborg with a defleshed metal head killing off multiple people! As with any Wynorski-flick, he throws in a whole bunch of crazy ideas and subplots that mostly don't lead to anywhere. But "Storm Trooper" is more like a two-movies-for-the-price-of-one kind of deal. On the one hand we got the drama/thriller part (as such the film opens) with Carol Alt killing her incredibly annoying & ungrateful husband (a plot that simply leads to nowhere).

I remember this bomb coming out in the early 80 's . At first it sounded like a great idea to put the bomb in the middle of a city to blow up an area, but we had a problem with how we put the bomb in. We had no idea where it would go nor how far. After a few days of bombing a city it had to be relocated, and since the bomb blew up the ground it took a few days to rebuild the area. A few more bombs went out in the next few years, but nothing like that again.

Awful, awful, awful times a hundred still doesn't begin to describe how crappy "Biggest Loser" is. Picture this: take two fat couples with nothing interesting to say, humiliate them, and let them work to lose weight, all on prime time television. Am I the only one who thinks that this isn't something people with IQs in the 3-digit area WANT TO WATCH? Everything drags on forever, with the lumps of lard whining on about how losing weight is going to mean so much for them and their lives. Does anyone care? Do they think we care?

HOW MANY MOVIES ARE THERE GOING TO BE IN WHICH AGAINST ALL ODDS, A RAGTAG TEAM BEATS THE BIG GUYS WITH ALL THE MONEY?!!!!!!!! There's nothing new in "The Big Green". If anything, you want them to lose. Steve Guttenberg used to have such a good resume ("The Boys from Brazil", "Police Academy", "Cocoon"). Why, OH WHY, did he have to do these sorts of movies during the 1990s and beyond?! So, just avoid this movie.

I have heard that Novo was compared to Memento for the simple fact they both rely on main characters suffering to make the story more impactful. This may be one reason why some people who have heard about Memento have said that they don't understand why it is considered to be so influential, especially when many other games, including the original, focus on more traditional action. Memento is a great game in my opinion (I own it), but it doesn't really focus on traditional action. It focuses on telling a story and creating a mood.

I was really beginning to enjoy this show. It just started out slow and it wasn't given the chance it deserved. It is summertime so many people are not at home watching television. I know there are a few talent and singing competitions but I enjoy them as do many other. believe it or not when American idol is done for the year I miss it. Even though this was not American idol I thought it had potential. I feel bad for the singers on the show who wee really starting to grow on me. I wish they would reconsider and put the show back on.

Johnny Crawford is great in this movie of a troubled teen coming of age in a generation that was in a different world than today's. He had a tough adolescence with his mother being in an institution because of her drug abuse, which was the basis of what led to her early death. He grew up and had a tough life, especially with having to deal with his father's drug abuse issues and alcoholism as well. He had a tough life. This movie gave me goosebumps. I was so impressed by the whole cast, especially the lead actors!

After five years in prison, Tony le Stéphanois (Jean Servais) meets his dearest friends Jo (Carl Möhner) and the Italian Mario Ferrati (Robert Manuel) and they invite Tony to steal a couple of jewels from the show-window of the famous jewelry Mappin & Webb Ltd, but he declines. Tony finds his former girlfriend Mado (Marie Sabouret), who became the lover of the gangster owner of the night-club L' Âge d' Or Louis Grutter (Pierre Grasset), and he humiliates her, beating on her back and taking her jewels.

Simply put, there are two parts of this series that made me cry till my eyes fell out. First: The part where he was set to wash the toilet, but ended up drinking the toilet water while imagining it was the hot director giving him a golden shower!!! (I laughed so hard! )Second: The part where he tried to prove worthy of a swimming school instructor. He seemed like a pro diving in, but as expected, he couldn't swim (proper at least^^).

This movie was absolutely terrible. The only explanation I can think of for the good reviews it received from some here is that they were written by people in the cast. It was actually painful to watch this movie. Even my grandchildren (ages 6-13) could not bear to watch it. As far as I know, this movie never made it to theaters and for good reason. It's as if some people were sitting around having a beer and said, "Hey! Let's make a movie. Who wants to be in it?" It's that bad.

Now , I like the Bollywood films and I 'm very glad they have recently gained success in the UK. But one thing about the Bollywood films I don’t quite understand, is that when they are released in India (a big country with a lot of diversity) then it’s just not as good as the films that have just come out in the UK and the USA. Even though Bollywood has always had an ‘Indian flavour’ with their films, when the Bollywood movies are finally released here in the UK and the US, the films seem very dull and boring.

Sorry I could n't disagree more , with the last comments . frankly I thought this was worse than Carry on England and I've seen a lot worse on here before . I know that's hard for me to take and I really hope I never see it in real life though . I love it here and will probably stay for the next 100 years and beyond. The only reason I left was because I had to move to a very small place and I just got fed up being bullied by everyone . I had no other choice.

TDY is probably the single worst piece of trash to ever hit the straight to video selection . They take a great concept and try and make it even worse . The film's premise is simple enough: an inter-galactic warlord decides to destroy the world using his own daughter as a human shield. Well it doesn't really take more than one viewing to realize this premise doesn't mesh with what is usually expected from a straight to video flick. The main problem with this premise is that the only person the movie seems to be focused on is the character's daughter.

It looks b grade and you will probably think there is no reason to rent this film ! But do not let that fool you. If you watch the trailer you will immediately notice a very strong storyline in this film, which will give you a lot of emotions. This film will make you cry, laugh, laugh, cry. In the end this trailer will give you the feeling that you are watching something very personal. I will give the trailer of this film so you understand what I am talking about. If you think this movie is not worth watching, just think again.

I had never heard of this film till it popped up on cable TV and I can't understand why. Geena outdoes Arnold as an action hero in this film! Geena is an ex-CIA assassin who is brainwashed and given an identity as a schoolteacher with a quiet family life in a rural town. She continues that life for 8 years with a husband and daughter. Clues start coming to her that she may have been someone else, especially when someone tries to kill her. It seems that her former employers have discovered that she never died and want to make sure that she does.

It pays to watch Reader 's Digest . Or Time , if it was the original source of the article before it was edited by someone at the Washington Times , and then published without a single correction at the very bottom of the page. You can also check out the Reader 's Digest at the library, and if the Times has an issue with it, you could check it out in person and get a copy for yourself as long as you're not too big to fit through the library doors. And if you see it in a book shop, you can usually buy it for two cents less.

This movie was probably one of the worst movies I've seen in a very long time. A friend of mine grabbed it off the shelf at the video rental store, and all but forced me to watch it, an action we both deeply regret. Ehh... Where to start? The writing, the acting, the quality? All of it, sucked. Quite possibly some of the worst writing ever displayed in a movie. The dialog was worse than I thought it could ever be in the movies. Blatant dialog, such as "how ya doing?"...

A wasted effort . On the surface it 's a typical disaster movie : we 're involved in the lives of people caught up in a cataclysmic global catastrophe. But this is not really a "movie" at all . The story is really just a story about a family 's misadventures when the entire population of a major US city turns into one large zombie. There is a lot of this type of disaster movie on TV , but they are all based on real stories . And unlike most of the zombie stories on film or television , this is actually based on a novel.

It is difficult to compete against classic greatness , but once you make that choice and the decision is in your hands then anything is possible ! There are plenty of players I love but the one in my opinion that I will not forget and who has been a constant in my journey through life is Tiger. I know a lot of you will ask why I love him. Why don’t I just say that I love my dad , my partner and my family and I will always love him. Because you know what the reason is.

This was a modern TV classic! The story goes like this, Bob has a girlfriend named Alicia. Bob and Alicia are in love and want to get married. Bob has a bud named Owen who he works with. Owen is jealous of Alicia. He likes hanging around with Bob. Now Owen hangs around with Bob AND Alicia. Bob and Owen have a secretary named Heather. Heather is very accident prone. She is also, if you haven't guessed it, is kind of lonely. She too hangs around with Bob and Alicia, and Owen.

When a group of escaped convicts manage to flee to a remote island,they soon find that their new home is inhabited by a strangely menacing doctor(Richard Johnson of "Zombi 2" fame),a mad scientist(Joseph Cotten),his beautiful daughter(Barbara Bach)and a horde of superstitious natives.The tribesmen say that the doctor has created grotesque half-human,half-fish creatures for evil,secretive purposes.And though at first the prisoners do not believe this,as they disappear,one by one,they begin to change their minds.

The main reason for watching this picture is to savor the brilliant performance of S. Ephata Merkerson . Ms. Merkerson has the capacity to make every scene come alive as if she is reading the lines to the person in the chair next to her. There is also an added bonus of her amazing eye for lighting which makes the picture look more real than a lot of photography. It's a shame she is no longer with us, as this is a wonderful portrait of a woman, but even so I am always amazed at how well she is captured in a photograph, whether it's still life or portrait.

mondovino is a moving and rewarding documentary. in the world of wine there is a huge different between the big winery and the small one. it's not just about size of of your vineyard but also the amount of money and power you have. if you have enough money to place ads in the wine spectator and hire a so called "wine except" then it doesn't matter the size of your estate. also in business world of today wine often has to mass marketed and suited to people's taste. what is means many times wine filtered of it's origin.

"The death of a performer at a Broadway stage play brings a theatre critic and a police detective together as an unlikely crime-solving duo. The dead performer's niece becomes not only the object of affection for our critic, but also a prime suspect in this death, and some other murders that occur at the theatre. 'The Phantom Killer' sets his sights upon the young woman as his next victim; so, it is a race against time for our heroes to catch the killer," according to the DVD sleeve's synopsis.Milton Raison's screenplay puts a little spark in this low-budget mystery whodunit.

Marked for Death (1990) spends more time on action sequences, than it does with focusing on its characters. After his first two impressive efforts, Above the Law (1988) and Hard to Kill (1989), this third Steven Seagal picture makes the idea clear: anyone who opposes him is meant to look like a fool; the bad guys are just there to make him look good.Seagal had been steadily building an audience that seemed a bit larger than those that follow the kick-'em-up antics of Chuck Norris or Jean Claude Van Damme.In Marked for Death, Seagal tosses aside any pretense at style and heads full throttle into exploitation.

I 've never been a big Larry Clark fan , but somehow , I 've been dragged to almost every game he plays . And I find myself watching almost every game he 's ever been on . And I really have no opinion either way as to who is better or who is worse . It's just that there's this one thing about Larry Clark that I can't help but get into . He's one of the guys I've always been able to talk to and he'll give you the straight goods and leave you alone after about 5 minutes (or sometimes even longer ) so that you feel good .

I saw this movie when I was very young living in Houston , Texas . I really enjoyed this movie . I saw it on a movie night with a bunch of friends and we were all laughing our asses off at the same time . When I was a little older I saw it on DVD and had to watch it a second time . I just can't believe the movie was made in the 60's . I watched it with my dad and my sister . The only movie we saw at the theater was King Kong .

How offensive! Those who liked this movie have probably never opened a bible. I can imagine those at NBC saying, "OK. Let's make a movie to appease those pesky Christians, but they'll never know the difference if we don't have anything factual or in the correct chronological order." Well, they were wrong. Anybody associated with this atrocity needs to find a church and repent for their involvement in this blasphemous atrocity. I only gave this movie a 1 because I couldn't give it a 0.

Forget what I said about Emeril. Rachael Ray is the most irritating personality on the Food Network AND all of television. If you've never seen 30 Minute Meals, then you cannot possibly begin to comprehend how unfathomably annoying she is. I really truly meant that you can't even begin to be boggled by her until you've viewed the show once or twice, and even then all words and intelligent thoughts will fail you. The problem is mostly with her mannerisms as you might have guessed. Ray has a goofy mouth and often imitates the parrot.

I don't care what anyone says, this movie is hilarious! It combines the bleak seriousness of Threads with an anarchic blend of alternative comedy, and the results are a severely dark, but outrageously funny satire on the brinkmanship policies of both the Western and Eastern blocs at the time. You gotta give the filmmakers credit for even attempting to top the real life lunacy of "Duck and cover" or "Protect and survive"!Imagine someone made a movie based on the Dead Kennedys track 'Kinky Sex Makes The World Go Round', and you're pretty close to Whoops!

This movie is #1 in the list of worst movies I have ever seen, with "Lessons for an Assassin" on the #2 spot.The acting is lousy (sorry, Sandra Bullock, but even your performance was horrible! ), the music score could have come from a bad x-rated movie and the story was downright ridiculous. It had this in common with a typical action movie: the dialogues were short and consisted mainly of one-syllable words. But contrary to the average action movie, there was no real action in this one.

Mr. Bug Goes to Town was one of those films that I grew up hearing about, however a copy could never be obtained until now. I just watched this film on DVD and thought it was a delightful and charming film, with wonderful animation, a good plot and great songs. If this film was made by Disney then the film would be considered a classic, however because it was made by a little known film studio that is long gone, the film has slipped through the cracks.The film was made by the Max Fleischer studios at their Miami, FL studios and was released through Paramount Pictures.

This film with fine production values features secrets and how friends use each other. Henry May Long is a very well-acted, dimly lit, depressing turn-of-the-century period piece about a friendship between a fatally ill man and a melancholy, indebted junkie. Talky drawing room dramas are not my cup of tea, and all the crying wears thin. Recommended if you like independent, slyly intellectual, slow-paced Merchant Ivory-type features. I suspected that the main characters were in love, but their connection was so intimated, it didn't really have the emotional impact of 'Brokeback Mountain.'

I LOVE Dr WHo SO much ! I believe that David Tennant is the best Dr the show has ever had. He has helped so many in soooo many ways. He has shown me a way to heal and become healthy. I've seen so much change in my life in just one visit. I love him so much. He doesn't just help you heal, but you can't help but to feel better when he is around. It's the difference between having a friend in the real world and being a patient in a treatment room.

This movie was made by Daiei Studios , known for its Gamera movies . It is about a samurai lord who has been hired to kill a man and a monster . The man has been transformed by the monster and he wants to find out the man's identity and his name . When they meet in a village , the monster turns out to be his servant . In the forest , a mysterious man takes them to an island , where he tells them they must fight the monsters together . The samurai has to find someone to help him kill the monster, and his wife is supposed to be the person .

hello, looking for a movie for the family to watch on a Friday night? Can't find what your looking for? I thought this was an extremely enjoyable movie. Good for the whole family. I found that it had a remarkably rare combination of it being appealing to both adults and children alike. It was brilliant, to say the least. Bruce Willis's acting was top-notch, there was a lot of humor in it and overall, a great movie. In my opinion, it's a must-see movie.

Steven Segal 's movie career is a tribute to horrible cinema . I have been tragically bored with every one I've ever watched, and it's been an ongoing challenge to find a good movie. But the one that stands out as the absolute best thing I've seen this year, that I will probably never tire of seeing, is The Grand Budapest Hotel, written by the director of The Life Aquatic, Jonathan Glazer and a writer who has gone on to write a good many other great works of film, Paul Thomas Anderson .

Yesterday was one of those days we decided to go to the movies . We picked `` Ik ook van film `` because we heard they did the best foreign films . And we found it to be a pretty good film . It was a family film with a pretty good cast . I saw it twice and enjoyed it , though I wish we had seen it in a cinema . It was well directed and acted and made me really curious to see the rest of their movies . I liked the story about the three sisters . Yesterday was one of those days where we went to the cinema.

While trying to build a major mall or complex or something like that , a wealthy landowner ignores ancient Native American laws and acts like he/she has a right to force the Native Americans to abandon their lands so he/she can build a mall , a resort , an arena , an airport , or anything else he/she wants . It's a sad situation that I have to face every day. We are not here to fight and argue with you or to fight you with our fists , because that would be useless . You are right when you say you are not a coward and you do not fear anyone .

I just saw this at the Castro Theatre in San Francisco and had trouble staying awake during this incredibly repetitive, unenlightening little film. It is a 75 minutes film that felt like 175 minutes and has about 20 minutes of modestly engaging material. It's not bad in any offensive way, it just repeats things that have been said many, many times over and more interestingly and provocatively. With only a couple of exceptions, the interviews drone on and on and on, making little emotional contact or context to the whole topic.

I feel extremely sad for some of the people who have been reviewing this film . It is apparent that they have no understanding of what makes a great story. It would seem that they are looking at it from a film that can be rated G. I would like to see this film rated R but only if the rating was changed after viewing. I felt like the film was not well directed and that the plot was not well written. It seemed to take too many chances in trying to be "new". There were a few plot twists that seemed out of place.

Foolish hikers go camping in the Utah mountains only to run into a murderous , disfigured gypsy . The Prey is an adventure story in the vein of Robert Louis Stevenson's " The Lost Road " but is set in an entirely different landscape and set in the early 19th century. It is an eerie, suspenseful trip into the past that combines the best elements of horror, mystery , and suspense with elements of suspense, action, adventure, horror, and mystery. "The Prey" features a richly developed, fully-developed cast of characters , and the story is a masterpiece of atmosphere , suspense, and intrigue.

This was a pathetic movie . The Alien was decent , but the movie itself gave a new meaning to the phrase “I don't want to be a part of this crap “. It was a movie with too many characters , and too many bad ones . The main character is one of the bad ones , he's the only one who doesn't want to see how things will turn out , to be honest I wouldn't mind seeing him in the last reel , because the rest of the movie was very bad .

I tried to give this show a chance , but it really does n't sit well with me . Although this is a show I love I can't believe this is the best they can come up with . And I can't believe they have the audacity to think they have the best show in town . The only show I watched from the beginning to end last year was T.R.U and they had some really good episodes . This show has so much wrong with it . I don't understand what they think is so good about what they do . This show just has too much filler .

I've been trying to write a plot summary for several minutes now and can't seem to do it. But with a movie as bad as Night of the Blood Beast the plot hardly matters. An astronaut crash lands and is believed dead. His body later reanimates, but is found to be carrying the embryos of some strange alien life-form. But how did they get there? And where's the alien that implanted the strange creatures in Maj. John Corcoran's body? IMDb lists the runtime for Night of the Blood Beast at 62 minutes. Is that right? 62 minutes?

This was the worst TV movie I had ever seen. The visuals were so dang choppy it made me dizzy. I hated the constant zoom in and zoom out, and the frequent Black and White to Color switch. I also thought that The story didn't make any sense what so ever, and it was another clichéd Action Movie, with a hero a bad guy, and a few hostages. I could make a better movie than that with my own camera, why? I can hold it steady, something the director couldn't do.

Film about the failure of government and the selfishness of adults . Overwhelming impossibility of dealing with life and the people that live it. People that have to be killed in order to keep them alive so they can live their selfish little lives. That is all I can write about, that is all that will ever be written about in a post like this. The people that live there will never get that kind of justice and never get to see that kind of pain and pain that would be the worst that can happen to them for that type of crime.

A friend of mine loves tacky horror films so I often get to see low budget stuff like this . but i have to say this is not a good film and should not be on a big screen , especially at a time like this when so much good is out there . you see , 
this is a movie about some college kids going to the woods for a drug deal . i have to be honest - i think i am a sucker for a movie like this . i am one of those people who always like a movie with lots of gore , horror , and suspense .

"The Quickie" tells of a decadent Russian mob family who lives in Malibu and...well, frankly, this awful attempt at drama isn't worthy of commentary.Jason Leigh introduces herself to Mr. Mob-guy as being from "Pacific Exterminators" with huge letters in plain sight on her back which say "West Coast Exterminators".
