Eventually the mob-guys get suspicious because she was exterminating in a bedroom. (duh).In another scene Mr. Mobguy plays Russian roulette giving a hooker $4000 to bet whether he'll live or die. She has 5 chances out of 6 of keeping the money if she bets "live".

Mishima is one of the greatest films ever made . Now I think Paul Schrader is the greatest screenwriter of all time, I also think he wrote the greatest crime film of all time, “The French Connection,” which was also directed by Paul. I am going to go back to my previous statement about Schrader, and I will say this again, I love him to death, he is a very smart, very intelligent man. And I will say he is a brilliant writer, and I don’t think he had a better script for a film in his filmography.

Throughout watching "End of Days", I got the sense that the film makers were perhaps trying to make this unique to the average Hollywood action film. They failed, of course, but you have to give them credit for trying. Peter Hyams actually tried directing this time, instead of just churning out another flat action film. He attempted to inject atmosphere into the movie by darkening the lights and adding tons of blood. This method can work if used correctly (see "Se7en") but here it just feels like a cheap trick to try and scare us.

Piranha starts out as expected, stupid white people going to discover new lands and exploit them. I thought for a while it might be a cannibal film. It starts off like so many others, showing nothing but shots off untouched Amazon rain forest. For all I know it could be Florida. At this point you figure some animal mutilation or natives will pop up. Instead you get the acting talents of William Smith, who starred in L.A. Vice and Angels Die Hard. He plays Caribe, an acclaimed hunter, who I would describe him as Jack Palance Light.

I took my 14 year old to see this movie . We left after 15 or 20 minutes . It was too scary for my daughter . The last scene of the movie left my daughter crying and shaking and I couldn't do much to console her . I'm thinking of taking my daughter again . This movie has a very very sad story and some very frightening scenes . I had no idea of what would happen . I thought that it would be something different . I'll give the movie 4 stars because it was very good and I'll watch it again .

I rented this type of `` soft core '' before , but I can honestly say , I was n't expecting such a high quality , the quality of material is perfect . I do think this is a good buy , I will recommend to all of my friend . This is probably the best deal I've seen in the market in a long time . All you need is a bit of patience , you won't be let down , you will definitely be impressed . I received the jacket on time and it was well packaged , arrived very promptly and was delivered without any problem .

I really don't think producer George Lucas didn't really set out to make such a horrible sequel as "More American Graffiti" turned out to be. But in retrospect it was the first crack in his then-seemingly impenetrable armor. Coming straight off the huge success of "American Graffiti" and produced basically at the same time as "Star Wars", this film was the first that Lucas successfully took away from Coppola without having to bother directing it himself. The result is typical Lucas -- far more interesting in terms of its structure and the way it's edited than the actual material.

I can't believe some of the comments here in the reviews. The film is dated of course, and from our comfortable viewpoint in the age of CGG a lot of the special effects are deeply unconvincing now. But even allowing for this, Helen of Troy is so bad that it is almost laughable. The scripting is awful, just awful, with no characterisation at all. The performances suffer as a result, you can see the likes of Hardwicke and Andrews writhing in an agony of embarrassment as they deliver the most ridiculous shallow trite codswallop lines.

I watched this movie a couple months ago when it first showed up on the shelves of Blockbuster. It is officially the only movie that I've wanted to undo watching. Let me start off by saying that I like "B" Movies. I consider "Ice Pirates" One of the best comedies EVER. I'll also note that I'm a writer and that I've met the director/writer of this cinematic marvel.Evaluating the acting: If I was going to pick a bright spot I'd have to point out that Dion Day had an admirable acting debut with his role in this.

As a word of explanation , Disney 's `` The Kid '' has absolutely nothing in common with the Charlie Chaplin movie '' which was based on the real life adventures of Chaplin's son, Jack. A few years ago I was asked to contribute to the documentary series `` The Kid: A Family Story,'' which is a series of interviews with Chaplin's family. Chaplin's son was Jack. Jack was my brother. I was 11, Jack was 6 at the time of the interviews. I was interviewed at my school and was asked what Jack was like as a kid.

A group of scientists in Alaska have drilled something out of the ice core which has for some reason caused them to kill each other.

And one of 'em are bad movies . The title , as it turns out , refers to a killer of crows , who was a real thing, and had a name, and was, and has been , ever since the dawn of time . the first thing you're going to see here , then , is that the movie opens with a shot , as it were , of a guy sitting in the middle of an open field . he's wearing an old-fashioned red coat with long tails that hang down on both sides of his chair .

I had seen this movie when I was a boy (Before WWII) and was surprised that the local library had a copy. Saw it again after some sixty years and forgot how bad it was. This is an example of a movie that was not a "A" movie. No editing, poor script, weak acting and not much directing. Should not even be as high as a "B" Had a laugh at how jaded I've become over the years. Seems to me I thought it was good when I originally saw it.

If you loved the 1993 (erotic, sci-fiction)cyborg film "Nemesis", then you'll love this one. I loved it the minute the Elvis Pompadoured hero pulls out a samurai sword during a shoot-out. Both are police thrillers where the well armed hero must take on well armed rebels, to solve a conspiracy by the powers that be against the unwashed masses. but thats where the similarities ends. The ambiguous mayor in dead or alive tries to keep the masses sedate on the drugs he sells them.

Anne ( Natalie Portman ) tells us about how much she hates her mother , Adele ( Susane Sarandon ) , and she has a very special message for us all: “You don't know how lucky you are to be a daughter! You don't know anything about suffering. You don't know what it's like to feel like a little baby. And you can't even compare your mother's pain with your own. And now I'm a grown-up! So I'm sorry to all my friends, because they always ask me about my mother.

Now here is a movie that does something that hasn't been done in a long time. It take ten or so different elements that we're already familiar with (Vampires, martial arts, a techno beat, top-o-the-line special effects, etc. ), and turns it into something that feels brand new. In what could have easily been merely a combination of "Mortal Kombat" and "Buffy: The Vampire Slayer," Wesley Snipes (no favorite of mine since and mostly because of "Passenger 57") gives a really good turn as the half human/ half bloodsucker.

Set in Venice mainly on the Lido , Visconti 's `` Death in Venice '' is a triumph of filmmaking that was almost universally ignored for years after its release. That all changed with the advent of home videocassettes and VHS home video .

'' Death in Venice , '' which was released in Italy on October 28, 1987, earned critical acclaim as a major work of cinematic art that would not be forgotten or undervalued for a long time, even decades after its theatrical release . The film is set during the Carnival season at Venice , during the 15th century .

I 've felt that Rupert Grint has a lot of promise from that role by which everyone knows him . I 'd like to see Rupert Grint grow into that role. What he 'd do as Rupert is very different from the type of Rupert he 's been portrayed as in his movies. The thing that I 've been waiting for him to do for so long is to break the character. To actually do something a little bit different. To actually do something completely original. But he 's been doing that now for so long that it 's almost like an old character.

This may be the most tension-filled movie I have ever seen.In fact, it's so nerve-wracking, I haven't been able to watch it again after viewing it two years ago, but I will since I have the DVD. There were a couple of scenes in here that are almost too much to watch....so if you've got problems and need to "escape" for an hour-and-half this film will get your mind off anything else. The Russian actress Marina Zudina did a super job in facial expressions alone, which she had to do since her character in here is a mute.

I have heard that Novo was compared to Memento for the simple fact they both rely on main characters suffering from short-term memory loss. Well, that's like comparing The Silence of the Lambs and Friday the 13th as both involved a character that killed multiple people. They couldn't be further apart in ideas.Novo deals with a copier man at a company who does have short term memory loss. He is consistently followed by another gentleman and his boss likes to have sex with him in the office. In comes a temp who also gets involved with him and may/may not use him for sex.

Follow-up to 1965's "My Name Is Barbra", and shot in brilliant color, "Color Me Barbra" has La Streisand alternating nostalgia, clowning comedy, feminine romantic angst, and beguiling seriousness for a crazy-quilt hour of show-biz razzle dazzle. She's a cut-up and a femme fatale, a sprite and an enigma. With her Egyptian eye make-up and ever-changing hairstyles, she's also a chameleon. Her voice is rich and moving, even if a few of her songs are not ("One Kiss", "Yesterdays").

I concur with the other users comment. Hard to believe that this movie actually came out in 1994 because it screams mid 80's. I think it is dubbed because the sound and the picture don't always match up. If anyone can truly say this is a good movie, they need to be locked up. It is so sad how money has so much power over people that they will do anything to get it. I feel I lost intelligence from watching this. I used to have a little respect for Chuck Norris before I watched this but now I just feel bad.

I saw this episode of Masterpiece Theatre and immediately came to IMDb to look it up. I was greeted by a comment from another user, who believed that it was nothing special, a 6 out of 10, and underwhelming. I would feel morally remiss if I didn't disagree.Now, I am an avid fan of Masterpiece Theatre, but oftentimes the stories can be a bit silly on television, for example, "He Knew He Was Right" was absolutely horrendous. "Carrie's War," however, is probably the best I've seen so far.

I can name only a few movies that I have seen which were this bad . This movie has terrible acting, terrible dialog , poor writing , terrible direction , and worst of all , poor story. The main character has no idea of the consequences of his actions. The movie is full of holes which could be exploited. I thought it was pretty bad , but I am not going to name any of the other movies in the franchise. This was a pretty bad film, but for me, not as bad as I thought it'd be.

The plot line is an expose of the under belly of American politics. While the theme seems common, what "makes" the movie is the unconventional way the story is told.The characters are played with conviction. You feel the innocence of the lead, and his innocence lost. The politician is the prince of double-talk, a real snake.The camera work is impressive. It affirms the nuances of the acting and dialogue. Ditto for the music.The story uses a parable-style with vingettes where the message is filled with double-entendres. A very canny strategy by the writer/director.

"Hollywood Cavalcade" is a mildly entertaining 1939 film starring two staples of the 20th Century Fox roster, Don Ameche and Alice Faye, and containing a couple of in jokes.The film concerns a Max Sennett type, Michael Connors (Ameche) who brings an actress to Hollywood, Molly Adair (Faye) and makes her a big silent comedienne, eventually moving her into more dramatic roles. He becomes extremely successful with her as his star. Obsessed with his work, he's absolutely shocked when she and her leading man (Alan Curtis) run off and get married.

First I must say that I enjoyed the first Underworld movie . I was intrigued and curious to learn about the world and the Underworld itself. I was not sure at first if the movie was going to be the same as the books. I got that it was an adaptation and not completely the same. I was very surprised when I did realize this. It was very different and I was very much surprised. The ending left me very confused also. The movie started with a very powerful scene. I loved it and I knew that the start of this movie was going to be awesome.

This morning , I found myself unexpectedly remembering that this movie existed . I found myself thinking , `` Oh boy , this movie really exists . `` The first thing that I thought , `` It must be a movie . `` I then remembered that this movie was made in the early '70s , and the first thing I thought was , `` It must be a movie . '' From there I had no idea what it was , but once again I found myself watching it with no real knowledge on the subject matter . I had no idea what the story was .

Okay , sure , this movie is a bit on the hokey side . It 's difficult to take characters seriously . It really is , the plot is just a little bit off . I had a hard time believing in any of their actions . The characters are all so one dimensional , you really can 't relate to them at all , the plot is just too simple . I have to say though , i really liked the music , it really set the mood . I wish they would have spent a little more time on the character development that the music does , i 'm sure you can figure it out .

I 've seen worse films . This is bad but at least does n't try to be good so it can go down better than many others. That aside it has an interesting premise about what happens in the afterlife and is entertaining for sure. I have to say i was a bit bored the whole way through. It's not that I don't find this kind of stuff interesting, in fact, it's one of the few genre that I enjoy seeing. But in the end, I found myself wishing I didn't watch it and that I was enjoying it more.

I went out of my way to get this film , and was fortunate to get it on VHS . I haven't seen it in quite a while , so I thought I'd see if I can put the movie back on tape . In the process of preparing this post I realized there was a couple of things about this movie which I hadn't discussed before , but they're pretty important to my overall thoughts about the movie and how I think the ending fits into all the earlier stuff I have written about this movie in the past .

I can't believe some of the scores this film is getting on the IMDb website! Have I been issued with the Special Edition naff version? Edited by Dewhurst, produced by Bernard Matthews, this film should be housed in Battersea. I'm sorry for all the UK-centric references but if you're elsewhere and you've got no toenails to cut or you haven't got a beer mat collection to catalogue then this film might just be worth 90 mins of your remaining lifespan (as long as you haven't got any paint to watch drying).

A couple of years before SCREAM spoofed the slasher/horror genre with savvy, self-conscious young things knowing every trick in the book of what to do and not to do in a precarious situation, a little movie produced in Russia hit the theatres without any grandiose pretensions.This movie was MUTE WITNESS. Starring a cast of unknowns (except an extremely brief cameo by Sir Alec Guiness whose scenes were purportedly filmed eight years prior to the actual filming of this movie), it told the story of a mute make-up artist, Billie, who is working on a film on location in Russia produced and directed by her sister's boyfriend Andy.

The minutiae of what 's involved in carrying out a robbery is what makes this one of the best of all time. There is a real element of fear on display here, not only for the victim but for the criminals themselves. And it is not just the money, but the very act of doing it, the fear and anxiety and the uncertainty, that makes it so gripping. But it is also a gripping action sequence, and the way it keeps us hanging on to each detail to make sure that it all works, and doesn't fall apart, is phenomenal.

I saw this movie in the theatre and it was a terrible movie. The way Michael Oliver who now turn even worse in the sequel is the biggest intolerance I cannot bare. Junior upset his father because he would not go to school which got his father Ben madly insane. Also the Crazy Dance ride operator is not fair to Junior for not letting him go on the ride. And that Lawanda Dumore is as horrible as a serial killer to Junior because she made threatening insults to Junior which is why I cannot tolerate this movie.

This formulaic film ( hero 's girlfriend marries the villain ) just did n't move along fast enough given some of the other elements that were put into this film, but that's what happens when you have an original idea. It's not too shabby in that way. 1. This movie is pretty good. There's not a lot to recommend it in the way of acting and writing. 2. The story of the movie is pretty dull, there's no interesting plot, but the film itself has something of an interesting plot to it. 3.

The pace of this movie is quite slow . It takes about 70 minutes to get Katie to China (from the Philippines) to meet her biological father while he is in China, and she returns to the Philippines in about 3 years to meet with her real father. It takes about two and half hours for them to finally meet in Manila. But the story is interesting and keeps you interested throughout. It is not a perfect film, but I recommend it to the viewers who are willing to invest in the story. The plot is good and keeps you interested throughout.

I 'm not a big musical fan , but this is one of the few I really love . Unlike other shows I 've seen , all of the characters are likable and have depth . The script was a bit "overlong", but it really doesn't need much more . The music was incredible and there are some of the best performances out there . If you're a musical lover , or just want a good time , you need to get this show for your collection ! A must see for people like me and anyone that loves musical theatre.

I really wanted to like this film, especially after all the buzz I'd heard revolving around it. But, sadly, it just didn't work for me. Paranoid Park suffers from the same delusion Lost In Translation did--If you use very little dialogue, be heavy on the slow motion close ups and concentrate on pieces of fabric in the setting, then your story will magically come across as deep and thoughtful. Much of the plot line, if you can find a plot, of this film is contrived.

Yet another in the long line of "Don't" films of the late 70's and early 80's yet this one is much more than that. This film is a highly underestimated low budget schlocker with a twist. It has the grainy quality and bizarre soundtrack that is typical of horror films of the time period but it's the highly underestimated performances of the surprisingly talented actors/actresses that make this movie good. A young nurse arrives at Dr. Stephens' progressive mental hospital right after he has been murdered by one of his patients and all is not what it appears to be.

Treat Williams reached a degree of stardom with this movie , and really squandered it . Do n't be led astray. The movie is well acted and it is the only time I can recall being truly frightened in a motion picture . I found myself praying for Williams and his wife . After the movie I looked up the film's producer, Norman Jewison, in the phone book and phoned him to see if he could spare me a ticket for a second viewing. I wanted to see the film with someone I had been talking with for over two hours prior to going to the theater that evening.

So I was sick with the flu one Saturday and the silver lining was that SciFi Channel was having a huge marathon of all their new shows! I had been wanting to see and hear some of them for ages and was dying to find out what was coming up! Well they had a lot and they were really good so I will tell you what I saw and heard. I have seen them all but will just tell you a few highlights! First was The Expanse, which if you don't know was a show based on the New York Times best-selling book series.

It 's not fair . I was really expecting this to be a hilarious , entertaining movie . I mean that in the sense that what it 's trying to tell the story of a woman ' s struggle to cope with her grief of a child who was killed in a car crash . I really wanted to laugh the movie was so depressing . It 's so sad . I was really hoping this was going to be good . But I guess I wasn 't going to get anything funny . It 's like a story of a woman who can 't cope with the fact that her husband is dead which is so sad .

Pretty twisted Horror film , that has a few good moments here and there , with some creepy Blood transfusion scenes , and what I like to consider as a horror film that was made to look as if the director got a lot of money and then decided to make the most of it , because that is what a lot of people did when they were in Hollywood , with a few exceptions, like this one , you have people who just make crap with money , like the guy who did The Last House on the Left , or one of the great directors in this business, the late Paul Schrader .

Not a box office success ; no-one really knows why . It may have failed simply because of its title, and that is not necessarily a bad thing. Afterall, it is one of the greatest films in the history of Indian cinema, so if it is a box office bomb, it must at least be one of the greats, don’t it? Well, here’s why we’d like to believe that, despite being an average movie. And here’s why we’d say no. There was a time when there was a clear distinction between good and great Indian movies.

The only reason I checked this film out was to see the "early" Kim Bassinger. That, and the fact that my TV guide said it was a "gripping suspense", and it was three-star rated. The rating must have come from the man who wrote this drivel because the only suspense in this movie was whether I would finish it or not. Robert Culp turns in what has to be the "disaster" of his career as a cop who is not even close to being believeable. At one point, EVERYBODY is a suspect, including a frail old woman.

I have recently seen a string of caving movies and this film managed to cobble together all the worst aspects of this kind of film. You get very little appreciation for the caving surrounds or the monster that they face, while the characters are clichéd (spiritual guy, leader with tragedy in recent past etc) and the ending was just weak. It really annoyed me that the director kept shaking the camera or showing almost total darkness to create atmosphere. I have read that this movie gave a real representation of caving and yeah, I imagine that caves are dark.

Stanley Stupid (Tom Arnold) and his wife, Joan, like to sleep in bed with their heads under the covers and their feet on the pillows. They have two equally challenged children, Buster and Petunia. One day, Mr. Stupid notices their garbage is gone again....there must be someone stealing it from the curb. He goes off in roller blades after the garbage truck. When he finally gets to the dump, he is startled to learn not only that "other folks garbage" has been stolen, too, but that there is a secret organization meeting at the landfill.

`` No one really knows how the Power came to be . Not even the Book of Damnation recorded its history . . . In an earlier time, when he was a mortal man he had a name . . . The Book of Damnation tells of its history from its creation in the far north to its latest discovery in the desert. In this time, there are few records of its existence but it must have been great and glorious, a world unto itself, a place of power. It must have been a place of power then too, for there were no armies to conquer or wars to engage.

Every time I've seen this movie I get the same impression: some parts of it are so amazingly stupid/bad that they crack me up, they aren't intentional, and there are a lot of them; the rest is just plain bad, stupid and/or irrelevant. A movie like Evil Dead gets credit for being bad at it's own expense because it's the intended result-it' stupid and cheesy because Sam Raimi succeeded at what he was trying to do. This movie doesn't have that excuse, it's stupid and cheesy because the filmmakers failed so miserably.

Franco films can be divided into 4 categories- the "earlies" (often black and white and inventive), the "naughties" (late 1960s/early 1970s often involving Soledad Miranda), the "nudies" (of various periods, but using full frontal female nudity as plot drive)and "the rest".This is part of the "rest". It is not really a cannibal movie at all. It is certainly no gorefest. The few women in the picture dont even lose their loin cloths and there is little full frontal stuff at all.

A real let down, the novel is such a brilliant stomach churning journey into madness but this made for TV movie style nonsense is turgid and painfully slow. Stick to Mike Hammer. I find it hard to believe that no body has made a brilliant version of this book, Kubrick gushes over it on the cover, he should have taken over the reins on this one. Stacey Keach is too soppy as Lou Ford, and the whole thing has the same production values as that seventies TV spin off, of Planet Of The Apes.

Please ... if anybody gets the chance to read this BEFORE watching the movie , if it can be called a movie . I was not expecting much and it did not disappoint . I can say that it is one of the better horror movies I have seen . This movie should not be judged on it's looks but on what the viewer takes away from it. This movie has it all , good horror , action , humor and a very scary ending . I liked the movie and I will definitely watch it again . The movie is an interesting one.

One of the best 'guy ' movies I 've ever seen has to be the Wind and the Lion . The film tells the story of a man (Tony Curtis) who believes he has killed his brother in a duel and decides to take revenge on the entire country . It has to be one of my all time favorites . The Wind and the Lion was directed by John Huston , who had made a reputation for himself by directing classic westerns . There's no doubt about it , the way the story of the Wind and the Lion is constructed is masterful .

this is film is probably one of the best i 've seen so far . i would put it only behind the first one . this is an incredibly well directed movie and the film is a bit too slow at first but gets better after about 15 minutes . ilya shaporov seems to be able to make any film great because he makes them interesting . every time i have watched this film i thought that this film was about to be good but i never expected this kind of film . i know that a film can be good or not but it's hard to see a film when it is not even that good .

Just how bad ? Well , compared to this movie , Cannibal Holocaust is Citizen Kane . There 's the first half , which is a slow burn . There 's the middle half , which is a slow burn that goes on forever . And then there is the last half , which is a slow burn that goes on forever . In the end , we get a movie that's a slow , slow burn , and that 's it . So , what 's it like ? It's a slow burn and that 's it . Cannibal Holocaust doesn't go anywhere in particular .

The main attraction of Anywhere but Here is the superb performance of Natalie Portman. She gave her rather thankless character a lot of much-appreciated emotional depth. Susan Sarandon, a fine actress, is suitably sincere as the mother figure. I thought the chemistry between the two stars was believable, a chemistry that could have been developed more with a more involving script. I am not saying the script was bad in any way, I am just saying it seemed underdeveloped at times. I don't think it was the script writer's fault.

Robert Aldrich 's brutal , quasi-black comedy `` The Grissom Gang '' , a reworking of the 1948 British film , comes to DVD this fall from MGM Home Video. In the new film, George Raft plays the owner of a New York radio station, who has trouble keeping his show from going over the top. When one of his regulars gets murdered, it leads to an investigation of his radio show's most popular host, who in turn becomes a suspect in the murder investigation. It was one of the most controversial and best-selling films of the late 1950s when it first came to theaters.

I watched this movie a couple months ago when it first showed up on the shelves of Blockbuster . It was a box that had a lot of promise, but it just didn't measure up to the hype I was expecting to see. In my opinion, it didn't measure up to my expectations. However, I do have a few complaints of its own about the film's quality, but I'll get to those in another post. The film itself is very well made, and its story is quite good.

This movie, I would like to say, was completely great. I can see how many people would think that it's just a shocker film. This isn't completely untrue, but it's as much of shocker fiction as Chuck Palahniuk's books are. One of my favorite movies of all time, Bijo no Harawata is a certain type of crudely made movie that you can have just about any reaction to. It's scary, funny, silly, gross, full of off-the-top material and to some people, arousing.

THE QUICKIE ( 1 outta 5 stars ) Pretty poor movie ... an old-as-the-hills story about a high-ranking gangster who goes on a killing spree and leaves a wife, daughter, sister and cousin to their fate. As I sat in the dark, I kept thinking I could hear her cry out for help. It didn't help when I had to sit there and watch a movie that didn't end up as a thriller/thriller or even much of an interesting story. No wonder this movie is rated PG-13. If you like a violent, action movie that isn't a total crapfest, this is one to check out.

I 've always liked Barbara Stanwyck who was , perhaps , the hardest working lead actress of the 30 's and . I don ' t know, it ' s the only time I ever felt like a real actress. The sort of "little" film which studios used to excel at but seldom make anymore. Sort of a "soul" version of the more well-known "The Last Of The Blonde Bombshells". Ian McShane is excellent as a DJ and aficionado of soul music who becomes obsessed with the idea of re-uniting the members of a classic soul group, and the film follows his exploits as well as those of the group members; a cast which includes such genuine musical talent as Isaac Hayes, as well as acting stalwarts Taurean Blacque, Derrick O'Connor and Antonio Fargas.

An hulking alien beastie crash-lands on Earth and soon wrecks havoc upon the populace first using his laser ray gun to dissolve into dust almost every human he catches sight off (that is when his aim isn't terribly off) and later his bare claws with which he likes to rip out and eat human spleen! I actually enjoyed the mindless ray gun battle at the beginning and some of the later over the top gore effects.

I agree with several of you that this film was rather boring and dull. I found myself disliking the main character and the following actors/actresses that came in the scenes. I will make up my time by watching the 1999 adaption and hope that it fits agreeable along with Sense and Sensibility; Emma; Becoming Jane; and Pride and Prejudice. The Canterville Ghost ( 1996 ) .The director made this too sappy a production . Maybe it 's the generation gap between this film 's stars and its audience . But the film seems like one long joke on the audience . No matter that the plot is very predictable and has only one surprise in it ( in the end , anyway , there was one). It would have been better served if it was more lighthearted ( but then it was also a very sappy film , too sappy, in fact , and that's not good, either) .

Are you kidding me ? The music was SO LOUD in this show I could often not even hear the vocals. They were so loud that they were the only thing that was going through my headphones. Now, I am not a fan of anything that I can clearly hear but I was shocked! I would have never known that something as important as the vocals was going to sound so loud! Anyway, my point is I have been to this concert and it was a great experience. I am so happy to have been able to experience this concert.

I only wish there was a grade lower than F to give it ! i scored it a 1 in one class and another a 2 and a 3 in two others. i don't know how i scored so well. i also wish the instructor had been able to hear my problem instead of giving me a F on the test. i got a B+ for that instructor. and i got that test back in about three hours. i think that this course is a waste of money. it will only help in passing the course.

`` Rififi '' is a terrific heist movie , and one from which subsequent heist films have drawn ever since. The story follows a group of thieves , led by the titular ' Rififi ' , in their quest to steal an armored car from a rival gang. The film has been released in various formats since its initial release, and the one used here is a region 2 DVD. While the film was made as a budget and time constraint, it's still a great piece of filmmaking . It's also available on Netflix , so there's no shame in giving this one a shot.

I would say this is a background movie . Play it the background as your tending to busy work (or something that is not related to your work) like watching cartoons, surfing or playing with your kids. Beautiful .... that one word pretty much sums up this whole film . Everything from the cinematography , the directing, the acting, the music and the costumes is so perfectly placed that it is almost unbearable . The way the film builds up to the actual ending is absolutely amazing , and i was a bit shocked to hear how it was shot in only one take . What a beautiful movie . There is another film in the same vein, with a similar cast but with completely different story-lines. It is called THE WICKED + THE WIZARD, and was made back in 2010.

This movie twists the facts of Anne and Mary 's lives into something unrecognizable . To make Mary Boleyn , Anne had to kill her father . I can't remember what the real story was but it must have involved her mother dying and Mary having to take over the family. She was not at fault. I know it was part of the Tudor story but how could anyone have been happy about it? The movie has a good ending but it doesn't make it any easier to see. There are no characters in the movie with whom you'd want to spend time.

First of all , I have watched this show since I was a little toddler , and I have always loved Star Wars , even as a toddler . I loved the movie series, and of course, I love the Star Wars films. But , I also have always thought that Luke Skywalker was far too arrogant and foolish , and that Han Solo was far too greedy and ruthless . So , I really love the Star Wars films , and I am not going to talk about them . I am going to talk about an upcoming film .

There is no way to avoid a comparison between The Cat in the Hat and The Grinch Who Stole Christmas, so let's get that part out of the way. Cat was... well, just awful.Jim Carey was cast because he is a brilliant physical comedian, and fearlessly commits to over the top, outrageous characters. I think I can safely say ( without really giving anything away ) , that this movie had no robots, and a whole lot of humans. A lot of humans. 'The Dresser ' is one of those films which are so perfect you really struggle to find something not to like about them. And you can't. In the best way, of course. If there is a fault with them, it is a fault, and in fact a fatal flaw, in the writing. It's just that there's nothing else in any other way. That is why they're so perfect – it's just that they are perfect and nothing else. No other films in the same category can say the same.

Being a fan of Saint Etienne and the City of London, I was very excited to see this movie on the list of the Vancouver International Film Festival. This movie has great shots, an absolutely excellent soundtrack and interesting insights into a 'not so well known' London.The movie is held completely in 'dark' colours, which I personally don't like too much. Furthermore the narration was a little too British and the comments sometimes got a little flat. Other than that, there are some great comments by Londoners and excellent shots.

OK, most of us agree that this is a weak attempt at a remake, but at the same time it's also a different movie in its own right. Don't get me wrong, 'American Werewolf In London' is a superior film, but 'American Remake In Paris' is a decent movie as well.First off, the only real similarities are the TITLE, 2 American BACKPACKERS, and WEREWOLVES. Other than those 3 things, 'American Remake In Paris' stands apart fairly well on its own with its special blend of humor, action/adventure, and horror.

Okay, anyone looking to see a great work of art should NOT watch this film. A sophisticated film connoisseur will no doubt be nauseated by the horrid production values and the sight of watching an excellent actor (Joseph Cotten) whoring himself out for a buck. Mr. Cotten must have either really needed the money or he was too senile to realize that the film was crap. The same phenomenon occurred with Dana Andrews, who late in his career appeared in the campy and awful FROZEN DEAD. I know Mr. Andrews was in the throes of alcoholism, but why did Cotten do this mess?

I know it 's hard for you Americans to find European films on video/DVD , particularly from the 80 's , 90 , and 00 . . . , but we have some very nice ones . . . I would recommend a visit to your local library (or maybe a bookstore), and if the library has a section of film titles, go for it! I have been watching films in Europe for over 30 years, so I am very familiar with them, and I really like the ones I see on DVD. . .

Brit director Chrstopher Nolan now has a career in America, and a reputation for making movies both popular and critically acclaimed; but this small film was where he started. And it certainly showcased his talent, with its striking black-and-white cinematography and achronological storytelling that prefigures his later 'Momento', albeit in a less extreme way. Thematically and mechanistically, the plot reminded me of David Mamet's 'House of Games', but the film still feels fresh and sharp, right up to the final twist of the ending whose flavour was expected, but whose pointedness is unexpectedly delicious.

Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy are the most famous comedy duo in history , and deservedly so , so I thought it’d be a good time to look at them. I love Laurel and Hardy and their characters in their own ways , but there’s something I haven’t mentioned. Their careers have been closely linked with Hollywood and the movies and television shows they starred in. And, not coincidentally, one of the best stories about Laurel & Hardy is, in fact, part of the show “The Adventures of Oompa-Loompa”.

Well well , at last a view of this underrated flick . But you ca n't find a good copy in any film archive . As soon as I saw this scene in this movie , I was thinking about the scene in this movie . So, what is the scene ? Why should I like it ? What are the characters ? Why do they appear in it ? What's the plot line ? I must admit this is one of those movies which I'm not interested about . I'm just curious as to why i like this movie so much .

Another decent offering from the pen of Vince Gilligan.A pre-"Malcolm in the Middle" Bryan Cranston plays Patrick Crump, a deranged guy who eventually hijacks Mulder via gunpoint and has him driving west at high speeds. It has something to do with his severe head ringing (& possible deadly combustion--his wife just experienced it), and the pressure only seems to be relieved by heading towards the left coast. Only Mulder could relate to this guy's plight, and actually bond with his captor before the all night ride is completed.

If I could give this excuse for a film a 0 or negative rating I would. Absolutely awful, I don't even know where to begin. I have no idea why anyone has given this more than 2 stars because I can't think of one good thing to say about it.

I absolutely adored this movie. For me, the best reason to see it is how stark a contrast it is from legal dramas like "Boston Legal" or "Ally McBeal" or even "LA Law." This is REALITY. The law is not BS, won in some closing argument or through some ridiculous defense you pull out of your butt, like the "Chewbacca defense" on South Park.) This is a real travesty of justice, the legal system gone horribly wrong, and the work by GOOD lawyers - not the shyster stereotype, who use all of their skills to right it.

This is absolute drivel, designed to shock and titillate the 60's mindset. The acting is completely wooden, consisting mainly of ad-libbing, which results in the sub standard actors dribbling the first thing they can think of, repetitively. The end result is of a badly written play being read by people who have no idea and couldn't care. The one exception to this is the lead character "Joe" (played by Joe Dallesandro) who spends a lot of the film in a naked stupor (either stoned, or the only one in the piece who can act!)

The first season told pretty much how all elements of the Marine Corps would operate ( i.e . ground , air , and sea ). The story of the 2nd Battalion was how they would come back from the jungle, become Marines again, and start a new chapter of life. Season 1 of the 2nd Marine Regiment

The 2nd Battalion was the smallest battalion in the 2nd Marine Regiment. Its mission was to hold the area that was known as the 2nd Marine District, in which is located the base where all Marine forces were based. This would be known as Camp Lejeune.

`` The Cave '' got released more or less simultaneously with the English film `` The Descent '' , directed by the late Steven Spielberg. Both films were made in 1983, and each was nominated for a Razzies, the first for `` The Descent '', and the second for `` The Cave. +

''''[[TheCaveFilm]]''': ''[[TheDescent]]'' was released a year earlier and got nominated for a Razzies. The ''[[TheCaveSeries]]'' was an attempt to produce a number of films based upon Stephen King''s novels in a different genre.

This movie was terrible. The acting was awful. The script was awful. What was even worse were the camera shots and sound. Half the time the voices did not match up with the actors lips, and different camera angles in the same scene would be completely different hues. The worst part had to be when one of the actors was at the top of a huge cross-shaped building. The building had to have been 50 stories high, and probably 100 feet wide. However, when the actor was on top of it in another shot, they had "recreated" the top of the building.

I admit - I was lured to this one from the hype - and I did n't stop to consider whether it was worth the hype. That's my own fault for being so easily influenced. It was interesting, and it's a well made and interesting film - and I thoroughly enjoyed it - but, as a movie - it was nothing special. And I admit - I am not the first one to notice this.

The Australian public and the Australian film industry are often heard to complain that there are not enough great Aussie films around, or that they are all the same.Well in this case this film is not a carbon copy of other Australian films. It is unique - it will make you laugh out-loud, it will make you cry and it will make you feel really good about yourself.The casting of this film is superb and the acting is second to none. The script and the photography (colour/light etc) is wonderful. But more important this is a great film.

I just found the entire 3 DVD set at Wal-Mart in the bargain bin for $5.50, so I thought I would take another look. Total of 13 hours to watch it all (26 episodes). I was born in 1948 and saw most of them on TV in the sixties. Many independent stations repeated them for many years.Better than I expected actually, time has been kind to the obvious sincerity of it's creators, and to the obvious gratitude and respect they give to all the Allied fighting men and women.

I can get over the political parody; even if this was SUPPOSE to be a "Masters of Horror" flick.But, what I can't get over is the blatant usage of our war heroes (and their sacrifice) as pawns in some washed up horror maker's political statement.To me it was purely insulting to desecrate Arlington, and our heroes. The reviewer in Variety said this was "overwritten and overlong", and I kind of agree with it. It has some events that seem forced and unlikely, like when Cal (Crudup once again as the 'lost, vacant, and kind of dull' male) and Julianne Moore find a map of the US in kind of an unbelievable place. The story is one of those 1970's "guy must find meaning in his life" stories, and I found myself imagining Jack Nicholson in his prime playing the role of Cal.

Red Skelton plays a radio detective known as `` The Fox '' in `` Whistling in the Dark , '' a movie about an unsolved murder in 1970s Los Angeles. The plot hinges on the mystery surrounding an unsolved murder of an actress in 1968 at a Hollywood hotel. Skelton, playing the detective, tries to track down the killer who may have been hired by a movie producer with whom Skelton was in an illicit love affair. The Fox, the name of the detective and his partner, is a parody of Sherlock Holmes, played by Frank Langella, with Skelton playing the part of Dr. Watson.

Looking at the ratings you would assume this is a classic , but yet again its just another example of the media in general. There is a huge difference, however, between being a hero and a hero. Many celebrities are good at what they do. I am a musician. There are a lot of amazing musicians.

Roy Thinnes and Joan Hackett are superb in this 1970 melodrama. The lush settings, the haunting music, and plot twists make it a truly interesting film. I had seen it when it first came out on TV. Once more it aired when I had a VCR, but I did not have a chance to tape it. Would love it on VHS if someone has a copy. Apart from the suspense (which is worked in beautifully) I feel the story is unique, and is pretty much true to the book, MRS. MAITLAND'S AFFAIR by Margaret Lynn.

While this movie is not the most entertaining in the world, I think it is better than most over all. I mean it had it's little laughs and just all around a good feeling. It's not too often we get to see two old geezers just having fun with their age and honestly having a good time with the jokes. Walter and Jack had such a great chemistry together as friends/brother in-laws. Just watching them romancing these women was fun and you rooted for them all the way because wither we have to admit it or not, for their age, they still had game!

Though it's better than most made-for-TV movies, "Buried Alive" is nothing more than a run-of-the-mill revenge tale. There are so many plot holes in this one, it makes you wonder why the screenwriters didn't go through a series of re-writes. The ending has a nice twist to it, but it's hardly believable.The acting by Jennifer Jason Leigh is terrific, as always, but Tim Matheson hams it up with cheesy one-liners that reminds one of Jack Nicholson in "The Shining". Don't bother with this one.

Having just watched Acacia , I find that I have to agree with the negative reviews here . I like the film but I don't feel that it's a masterpiece . I think it's a rather average film . I don't think it's up there with anything else that is made today . I'm sure a lot of people say that they loved the film . I hope that it is appreciated by many people . But I just don't think it's the best movie I've seen . I hope that more people will watch this film .

Next stop on our journey through the calender-slasher scene is... oh yes, "Graduation Day"! All of those seniors, just brimming with possibility and ready to venture out into the real world and become adults. That is, however, IF they can make it TO graduation without having to tangle with the campus lunatic who's running around, gouging the life out of students with his fencing sword... Yeah, it all stems from a the high school track star who drops dead from a blood clot during a race and a year later, her older sister returns home from the Navy for Graduation.

this is horrible film . it is past dumb . first , the only thing the twins care about is each other , second , it should have been more of a family comedy . the actors are too stupid . the family is too stupid . but , atleast the director and the story are good . so , overall , not a worst film of this genre . it is still better than worst family comedy

This film is just so terrible! I was very excited for it. But it is terrible. And it's just so predictable. It makes no sense as a whole.

I awarded this presentation 4 stars . They are all for the script , which has been butchered beyond recognition, as is the story in a manner that is hard to believe. I would have rated the script 1 if I had a copy, which I doubt is going to happen. This is one of the few instances when a film script could have done with an editor. The acting is solid, and there are a few scenes that are simply stunning. As far as the plot goes, I have no idea.

This film is a cash in . A cash in reliant on a rousing theme tune created for an earlier film of the same name, this time, it's a much more straightforward tale of the adventures of a family of six orphans who set sail aboard the titular vessel. It tells the story of how the characters grow up and face the trials of the world around them, along with their own internal struggles. You can read all of the review's from the film, as well as, my commentary about the film, in the film's page dedicated to that review here.

I saw this late at night on a minor channel and I put it on expecting a laugh or two. Guess I got it in the ear! It was funny and it made me happy. I have never laughed so hard or had so much fun on a television program ever. I think it was a good lesson in patience. The only other thing I like about it is that I had seen the same commercial earlier and I was laughing and not paying attention. There are two things that I think I know about people. One, you know what they like and who they like.

I have seen many many movies and this just totally blew my mind. The trauma, the suspense is just amazing. I ended so wound up in the psychological fear and Philosophy of it, and relating it to reality. Movies that play and challenge your mind are movies you don't forget, those that make you doubt your reality. A problem could be the quality, but that doesn't bring down the essence of the movie.The idea it self is brilliant and the ending leaves you just completely shocked and with the question for you to seek the answer. I just totally loved it!

This movie was painfully awful. Most of the movie consisted of people running in the woods, walking thru the woods, or dancing in the woods. More than half, at least. Then two kids who discover two 'horribly mutilated bodies' in the woods, return to the woods the very next night for a romantic walk. ????? There is no time continuity. its day, its night, its day, its really really night, its dusk, its pitch black, its day. All the woods scenes go on like this until you think you will lose your mind.

This movie was so poorly acted. What was with Jeff Bridges accent, horrible and unbelievable. Was it supposed to be French, Scandinavian?The script was lame. To have the heroine trip over the grave of her boyfriend while running from the Jeff Bridges character...are you kidding me? How convenient that Jeff brings his dirty shovel in the house after he disposes of bodies in his lawn. Do these people just not believe in calling the cops? Okay...I'll get into the car with you, why not? DUH!

If a movie ca n't hold your interest in the first 25 minutes , it 's over as far as I 'm concerned. My favourite movie ever was The Shawshank Redemption, and this was probably the single best movie I ever saw in the theatre. It was also the best I ever saw in a VHS format, which made me feel better. It's a good thing I don't own a copy of the movie though, as I feel like I could have watched the complete film at home on a DVD.

The film starts out with a narration of the protagonist explaining certain crimes occurring all over the city and then proceeds with the story as told. It then moves on to the main antagonist of the film being the police inspector. There is a scene where the protagonist visits the police station for an interrogation while the police inspector is trying to get into a room in the station where the protagonist is. The protagonist finally gets into his room and then we get into the second part of the film. This part is where the film takes a darker turn.

The first time I saw a commercial for this show was when my sisters were watching the Kim Possible movie. The commercial showed Sadie and her friend discussing the meaning of the word nothing.It is one of the stupidest commercials I've ever seen. Basically, they go back and forth with lines like "Nothing is a thing, so technically nothing is something,". When I saw that, I figured it would be yet another lame Lizzie Maguire knockoff by Disney. But I had no idea how bad.Fast forward about 3 weeks, when my sister turns on the T.V.

An Asian blowgun assassin takes out victims in Niagara Falls and New York City before getting run over by a taxi. “Hey, hey, hey,” said a voice. I turned around and it was a large, bearded man holding out his hand. I grabbed his hand and shook it, and he gave it a hearty slap. “What’s up?” he said. He had an accent that I couldn’t place, and he spoke in English. “How are you?” he asked. “Good, good.” “How are you?” I said.

It was easy to get lost in the simplicity and light hearted humor of this year 's best family film, Finding Nemo, but we did just want one more reason to like the movie. In an effort to find Nemo, Marlin, who just loves fish, asks his parents to go to the reef. They go to the reef, but when Marlin returns home, his father takes a picture of him standing under the fish tank. Marlin's father says he can show Marlin where to go, and so Marlin goes.

I have read each and every one of Baroness Orczy's Scarlet Pimpernel books. Counting this one, I have seen 3 pimpernel movies. The one with Jane Seymour and Anthony Andrews i preferred greatly to this. It goes out of its way for violence and action, occasionally completely violating the spirit of the book. I don't expect movies to stick directly to plots, i gave up being that idealistic long ago, but if an excellent movie of a book has already been made, don't remake it with a tv movie that includes excellent actors and nice costumes, but a barely decent script.

I only heard about Driving Lessons through the ITV adverts, and to be honest, I didn't know how much I would like it. I switched on the TV last night and was totally surprised. Driving Lessons is a modest, simple film which draws you in right from the start. Rupert Grint plays the part of socially awkward teenager Ben brilliantly. He's definitely one to look out for in the future. Dame Eve Walton is played by the fabulous Julie Walters. I loved the simple plot and the way the actors portrayed their characters with great sensitivity.

There's not a dull moment in Francois Ozon's "Robe d'Ete". It's surprising how much is packed into this short film. While reclining on a deserted beach after a nude swim, a young gay is approached by a girl seeking a light for her cigarette. She invites him to make love in a wooded area near the beach. On returning to the beach. they find that all his clothes have been stolen. She lends him a summer dress to cover his nakedness and requests he return it next day. He rides his bike back to the holiday cabin dressed as a girl.

Jessica Bohl plays Daphne, the sexually precocious suburban teenager struggling with the hell of high school. Daphne's neighbor is Buddy (Richard Brundage), a depressed middle-aged man still angry over loosing his wife. Daphne is attracted to world of prostitution because it promises to cure her of barely legal boredom and loneliness. Once Buddy strips Daphne of her secret, he hires her to help him accept the loss of his wife. The entire film takes place at the Hotel Duncan, yet details of each character's history are exposed through dialogue and flashbacks.

This Is one of those classic American made for TV movies that are just made for watching on a rainy afternoon. Although the script is highly implausible it never takes itself too seriously and neither do the cast which leads to a great tongue in cheek murder mystery / horror film best enjoyed with a bid bag of popcorn or box of chocolates. A big bonus of this film is the fantastic location filming and despite the strange goings on and even stranger residents round Lake Tommahawk I for one would not mind living there!All in all a great film to watch over and over again.

This film has some flaws , and most of those flaws are a lack of anything happening . Possibly the most interesting aspect is that the film doesn’t really give us any real answers. It could be argued that there are a handful of ideas we can take from this, but those ideas all boil down to “he who has the gold makes the rules.” The story of this film is very much about the relationship between these men, and that’s about as far as the film takes the idea of them being in control.

Jacqueline Hyde is a good quality film and does manage to be likable because of what it is . Everyone who sees it knows that the main character is not likable. He has a lot of reasons to make sure his life doesn't turn into what he has seen in his dreams . He doesn't believe in love , he is too focused on what he can get and not on someone else. He believes in a system that is based on money and his own life . And that is a very strong message for young audiences .

`The Last Frontier' is a superior western that overcomes numerous deficiencies in weaving its tale of trappers Jed (Victor Mature), Gus (James Whitmore) and Mongo (Pat Hogan) and their relationships with the army, particularly Captain Riordon (Guy Madison), Colonel Marston(Robert Preston) and Corrina Marston, colonel's wife (Anne Bancroft). Hired as scouts after losing their supplies to the Indians, Jed, Gus and Mungo adjust to living the `civilized' life within a fort on the edge of the `last frontier.'

This movie stars Ben Kingsley as Frank, a hit man for some Russian mobsters based out of Buffalo. He is also a raging alcoholic, and this has caused his job performance to decline. After he falls asleep in his car during a would-be hit, his mob boss uncle sends him to San Francisco, where he is to attend AA meetings and get a job as a mortician's assistant. If you're thinking that this makes absolutely no sense, you're not alone.It gets worse. Well, it actually gets better, but not before getting much, much worse.

I have to admit that I absolutely loved this movie. Of course as I'm sure you know that "Malcolm's in the Middle" star Frankie Muniz, and the ever so sweet Amanda Bynes "The Amanda Show" starred in this children's comedy as two friends that I'm sure that we can all re-late to. The movie is about a boy Jason Shepard(Frankie) and his friend Kaylee(Amanda)going onto an adventure in Hollywood.SPOILERS AHEADAs it begins Jason is a typical 14 year old boy whom lies to get around every day life's problems.

Ice the Limerick : A virus pulled out of the iceJust did n't know how to play nice.If infected you'll turn into an ugly thingYou don't even know how to play nice.If infected you'll turn into an ugly thingJust did not know what I'd do if I caught you.Just did it. Just did it.You did n' did it. You did it.Just did n' did it. Just did n't know if you'd be able to pull it out of the iceJust did n' did n' did it.Just did not know what I'd do if I caught youThat's what they say when you die.You die!

Please do not go see this. I did have several laughs throughout this movie, but they were all due to unintentional comedy.There were only three characters in this movie, so it was amazing how bad the character development was. Pacino played Pacino again and was aggravating most of the time. The scenes in this movie seem like they were put together from 20 other bad movies by a really poor editor. There is no continuity and I found myself wondering why I didn't leave 15 minutes into this.I would suggest never seeing a movie directed by D.J. Caruso. This really was awful.

* * May Contain Spoilers * * The main character , a nobleman named Fallon , is stranded on an island, where he's forced to live in a hut with a young girl he once saved. The girl's name is , and she claims that Fallon is the only thing keeping her alive. When she is kidnapped, Fallon must fight against a man, whose name is , to find her. After he's done, Fallon runs into a couple, who name themselves . They take him to a beautiful temple, where they give him a necklace.

There 's a certain irony in a parody of the Gothic genre being turned into a mess of clichés by an author whose very name is in direct contradiction of that cliché. I am referring here to the late British author Neil Gaiman, of the internationally renowned comic book series The Sandman. Although the series began in 1993, and Gaiman’s first volume (The Sandman #1) came out in 2004, it was not until 2005, when he published his second novel, The Graveyard Book (written with Neil A.aker) that he would become an important literary figure in British society.

i was flipping through the channels and had to stop and laugh when i came across this movie . It really was one of my favorite films i had seen . It was an excellent comedy and i must admit i had no idea who this woman was at the time but i loved her as an actress . It seemed as if i had watched this film and then watched it again . I think i watched this film on the very last day we were there . It was such a great film that i am sure i will remember it for a long long time .

I am sure I 'm in the minority ( I know I am among my friends ) , but I don't understand why the US government wants us to buy more expensive American products. The government is taking in more money from the American people. Why do they want more of our money? Why not take it in taxes instead? It would save us a lot of money too. I have a hard time buying it because the prices are always higher then what is advertised and the quality is not up to the hype.

I enjoyed very much the movie wooden camera. I think it's a little bit influenced by the Brazilian movie "City of God", but maybe this parallelism between the two tracks possible to follow (crime and art) in social neighborhood are a reality. I think the films made by Madiba are really beautiful. I don't think it's unreal that he shoot such good films, because there's a lot of artists that don't have any type of education and can be really genius. I enjoyed very much the soundtrack.

I normally don't like romantic films, but I love this film very much. The story is really touching, and the ending is very appropriate. I feel I really care for many characters in this film. I feel I can feel their feelings. While most romantic films always make me feel detached and bored, this one completely makes me feel involved, starting from the scene of Capshaw running along the beach with Scott until the ending scene. I want to rate this film 11 out of 10, because I want to give an extra one point for the ending.

I 'm not sure whether i like this film or not . I think it is creepy and completely weird.Crispin Glover did an excellent job and the story could have taken a completely different direction . But in my opinion it was not good for children . I recommend it to my children that are at an early age but it might not be good if they are teenagers . It had a good acting but the plot was totally strange and weird .The film should have at least been called a horror thriller or a spook house movie but it was not .

I have to say this is the worst movie that I have ever watched in my life , I can't believe how bad I am . I think the movie is good , it makes sense in the end but it is just awful. The actors are good, its just the story that goes against everything. Well, it doesn't matter how good it makes you feel, that's not the movie's purpose. The purpose of movies is to entertain the masses. Movies are meant to be looked at and be appreciated by the masses.

Very poor script and acting . I was very surprised that the director was able to convince his cast with such a poor script, and that he was able to get such an excellent production on his hands. I have to say, that this film has made me a better person than I was before watching it. The story, and the characterizations were very well done, and the performances were very good, especially by the cast. I can't say that I was impressed with the plot, I just thought that the film was good and fun to watch.

I have no qualms with how the movie does NOT capture New Jersey (like Zach, I'm from there). Fine. Whatever. I lived there WAY long enough. I don't need to see a movie that captures the Garden State.What I do have qualms with is how bad this movie is. Let's make it easy on you. We'll use some bullet-points. There are probably some spoilers that follow. (Not that you wouldn't be able to predict the movie ANYWAY): -The music placement was maddeningly forced and patronizing.

In case you dear readers never heard , this movie was the main inspiration for last year 's Samuel L. Jackson and Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson film, ‘The Avengers‘. And there were some good reasons to see it again this year. Not all movies are made for a reason (see: ‘Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith‘) and ‘Superman Returns’ isn’t like most movies. It was an incredible achievement in many ways, a true testament to the craft and art of comic-book cinema, but on a personal level it was also just plain awesome.

I suggest if you have already seen the original American Graffiti, do not see this movie. If you haven't seen the original, I still don't recommend this, but it will be a lot less painful to watch. The characters from the first film are great, and by the end you fell a connection to them. This movie sets out to show how bad their lives have become. It's a chore to watch!Set on New year's eve in 1964, '65, '66 and '67, we have four stories about the characters from the first film.

One of my favorite movies. I like horses, I like happy endings, and I like Walter Matthau. I miss him and am glad to have a great film like this to remind me why he was so wonderful. Watch it with your kids (or your horse).The story of an old hard boot horse trainer with kids, and down on his luck. If you have ever had or appreciated horse racing you will appreciate the rags to riches storyline. It may be a little below "Seabiscuit", but not a lot.

Early talkie feature based on a popular stage play . A murder has been committed and a bunch of people are involved with the case. It’s a very dramatic movie with a good pace, great performances and great sets. The movie’s a hit with the audience and the critics and is going to be a major blockbuster. However, there are a few major problems. One of them is the ending of this movie. Instead of making you cry for the deceased, it does nothing but upset you. The movie’s not a movie for crying.

Why would anyone make a film like this ? Why would anybody invest in a film like this ? Why would anybody do anything with this kind of money ? These were all very important questions and in many ways, they still are. But as with most things, the answers are not simple. You can’t just take on the world as you wish it would be, and even less, the world as you would wish it would be, if you knew what that means. There is an argument that you can make about whether or not that kind of money is actually worth something.

I'm a big fan of surrealist art, but this film by Bunuel (with some ideas from Dali) left me cold. Bunuel had a life-long grudge against the Catholic church and delighted in trying to offend Catholics in fairly silly ways. This is one of the silliest; almost like what you'd expect from a smart-aleck 18-year-old in film class. The last few minutes of the movie, which have nothing to do with anything else, are a final nose-thumbing at religion.If you read the "scholars" regarding this slow-paced, occasionally amusing film, it's all about how the church and society are guilty of sexual repression.

A man in blackface lands in a spaceship and meets a girl who lives in some sort of shack with a family of six, all of whom wear white clothes. He decides to live in their house after she tells him that she is dying and will die soon, and that she has only one wish: to meet the man in black. "It's better if you just look away," he says, "you can't see it anyway." But as soon as he turns his head he sees her. Then he begins to talk to her, but he doesn't know her name.

Like the above poster , I got burned on the title thinking I was getting the other Piranha ... This isn't the story I originally wanted to read, the story I was looking for was already written ... but it was too late to go back and rewrite the ending, so here we go with what I have, I hope you enjoy reading this Piranha! My name is Kyle, and I live in a suburb of Rochester, NY. For those who are not familiar with my hometown, this area is mostly rural.

How many movies are there that you can think of when you see a movie like this? I can't count them but it sure seemed like the movie makers were trying to give me a hint. I was reminded so often of other movies, it became a big distraction. One of the borrowed memorable lines came from a movie from 2003 - Day After Tomorrow. One line by itself, is not so bad but this movie borrows so much from so many movies it becomes a bad risk.BUT...See The Movie! Despite its downfalls there is enough to make it interesting and maybe make it appear clever.

Jeff Leroy wanted to makes fun of Scientology so built a horror movie around a cult similar to it. The twist is that instead of frail old L. Ron Hubbard as the cult leader, there's a centuries old space monster who turns his followers into vampires. Our hero is a dirty living college student who is doing research into the occult. His landlord is an attractive blonde who tries to get him to clean up his life with the help of the cult. It doesn't take him long to figure out that she's only after one thing: his blood.

I have witnessed some atrocities of cinema . In the past couple of years , it seems producers and directors have gone out of the way to use violence , sex and nudity to get viewers on their side. The result have been a bunch of gore films , horror movies, sex and horror movies , and it seems that it is not going away anytime soon. For some reason , people seem to still find the horror , gore , nudity and violence more interesting than some other movies . So here is a list of 10 movies in the last years that you might like.

Hello all ! I went to this movie without any expectation though I knew Maniratnam would 've given an excellent performance, I was just excited to see a Tamil hero in a lead role and had no idea what to expect of his acting abilities. Well, I guess that is what makes this film a great one ! It's so good I just have to leave out the best bits for the sake of an entertaining movie. I have to say that, I liked Maniratnam's acting but the film didn't impress me the way it could have.

I received this movie as a birthday gift because all of my friends know I 'm a big fan of the Twilight series, so naturally, I had to watch this movie and see what it was about... I thought this was an amazing movie! I loved the story line, the characters, the music and the acting was excellent! I loved the end scene, I could watch it over and over and it was just a great ending. I couldn't put it down! This movie is a MUST SEE! This movie was very good.

All I can do is laugh . Wow . I like Jim Wynorski 's movies , I really do . But , he is the only actor in Hollywood that can get an Oscar out of it . As an aside , I read this interview with him back in 2008 , where he said he was going to make a great movie in the next year or so called ' The Devil In Miss Jones ' . I believe it was called that . It was going to be a comedy about a young boy , with a lot of sex and drug .

I viewed the movie for a second time on September 30, 2006 and thought that it was even better than the first time I saw it. I thoroughly enjoyed the acting, especially "Uncle Benny". I thought that Fred Carpenter did an excellent job of writing and directing this film. The story line definitely kept your interest and I hope this movie makes it all the way to the top. I felt it moved very smoothly between scenes and the surprise twist at the end, well, lets just say I didn't see it coming.

OK , if you are a fan of Mystery Science Theater 3000 and love to mock movies , then you should check out the new Netflix series, Mindhunter , which is very loosely based off the book " Mindhunter ", written by former FBI agent John Douglas, and TV series starring Ted Danson as the lead character. Mystery Science Theater 3000, AKA " The Man Show ", is a popular American television series that premiered on Comedy Central on March 31, 1991, and ran for ten seasons, until February 1, 2005.

The name of this film and the clips that I saw caused me to believe that this film would have excitement and interesting moments. I was disappointed. The desert sands were interesting but this film inched along at a snails pace. It started fine with an underground cave and something coming out but then tried to involve us with the lives of some very unlikeable human beings. As they found dead bodies, or should I say, skeletons with some flesh on them, they began a search for the reason why? At times it became somewhat different as something was following them in the desert.

After watching this movie on a boring Saturday afternoon , I could n't quite figure out why so many people loved this film. I could understand why some liked it. It had its moments, i mean a movie needs to have its moments. But the movie in general had nothing special about it. It had its moments, but it had nothing spectacular to keep you hooked on it. A good movie should leave you a satisfied viewer. This movie failed at all those two. The acting was not good. The graphics were not good.

I loved it . In fact , I watched it over and over and over , and I could watch it over and over. That is one of the great things about books . You get used to them. And then one day you meet a book which makes you go back to it and you want to devour it, just to savor the experience, even though it may be just a little bit dull for you. And that was my reaction to the book. It is a lot like a film. And I was surprised that I liked it.

then the second half of this movie is hard to follow . I got the first part with the Spanish subtitles , and I still found the second half a bit disjointed . It might have made the film better if it had included the first part as a prologue . This movie is definitely not for kids . I can see the appeal of it for some adults with a strong sense of reality . For those who think it is good , you might want to watch the first half in Spanish with English subtitles to get a good idea .

OK, so I'am chilling in my room when mom knocks on the door. I open the door and what do I see in her hands? "SLEEPY HOLLOW HIGH". I thinking it has to be an older horror movie, because there's noway anyone could be stupid enough to name a movie that after The blockbuster hit "Sleepy Hollow" starring Johnny Depp. But to my surprise the movie is at least two years older then the original. That alone should have stopped me from putting it into the V.C.R.

There are so many things wrong with this movie I do n't even know where to begin . The story is terrible and has no plot. The acting has been atrocious and so are the sets. The costumes are bad as well. This movie does have its moments but it also has it's weaknesses. One example is the ending which is so disappointing. Yes there was a cliffhanger there but so were many other scenes. Not to mention there is one character that has been left out. Overall, this movie was horrible and a waste of money.

Comedy? What's so funny about watching an ugly deadbeat alcoholic attending 6 sessions (by the time I turned it off) of alchoholics anonymous? Set off by a woeful script of grunts and mumbles and drunken slurrings. Served up with lashings of Hollywood's religious "God will Save you" redemption drivel Another Reviewer mentioned the "Sassy dialogue" of Tea Leone - well I managed to watch nearly an hour of this boring film and I still haven't seen any sassy yet - in fact my 80 year old grandmother has more amusing comebacks than Tea's character in this rubbish.

This film is one of my fondest childhood memories. Seeing the Muppets (at the height of their popularity) heading Hollywood, singing and dancing, with Miss Piggy googely-eying her beloved Kermit, Fozzie Bear doing his best as everyone's manager, and a generous cast of "extras" delivering a film that turned out to be "okey dokey".Kermit's melancholy ukulele number "Rainbow Connection" was nominated for an Oscar that year, but was beat out by Norma Rae's "It Goes Like It Goes". I'll pick Kermit's song any day!

my friends and i watched this movie last night. it was pretty incredible. by all means, this was probably the worst movie i have ever seen. at first, it was tolerable. it stunk of BAD IMPROV but it was pretty friggin hilarious, despite the scenes being too long & drawn out and the terrible quality (i read $400 budget above... sounds about right) of the film itself.the biggest problem came from the lack of a script; with a background in improv, i know how hard it can be to keep scenes short & efficient.

I 've seen this story before but my kids have n't . Boy with troubled past joins military , faces criminal charges for sexual harassment and assault. He's sent to boot camp and now has to serve 2 year sentence. He is serving his time with a girl who was 16 at the time of their relationship and who has a 9 month old daughter, who is in a state of shock. I am so sorry that your family is facing this nightmare, but they need your help. Please sign this petition, share it with your friends on facebook, email and text it.

Valentine, a model in France is separated from her lover who is abroad, they plan to meet up in England, but seem to be growing ever more distant as the film progresses. One night after declining a pass made by her coworker, she hits a dog named Rita.
