In fact, it can't be easily done. I 've watched the director's films a lot over the past 25 years , so I should be able to recognize the stylistic flourishes Park has been applying on his films. But there are certain things in his work I still haven't quite been able to spot. So I decided to do a little digging. Park has always been interested in music and film .

I gave this movie 2 instead of 1 just just because I am a polite person. This movie made me loose 90 minutes of my life in which I could have done something useful for the human kind or just me. The dialog is poor, the actors never look scared! Even if it's supposed to be a horror movie. For example the scene in which Kurt collects the bones of his former colleague. He should be frightened, but he looks quite normal. The chick of the movie is such a cliché.

Is the Cannes controversy-meter remarkably esoteric , or is that we Americans are so callous and cynical that we never tire of a good scandal? As the dust finally settles on a controversy that was bound to become a huge media circus, there are a few salient questions:

Was there really a plot to discredit the U.S. film industry by targeting a group that represents a growing percentage of the American film-buying public? Why was it that the controversy exploded when a group that represents almost no one except the most diehard moviegoing public is the one that was targeted by the filmmakers, but then disappeared without explanation after the dust settled?

To keep it as simple as possible. This is a very good show. That is well written, and has a fantastic cast. It's not loaded with blood and guts. And centers around a disgraced cop and his relationship with his ex-wife, his son, his former partner (Andre Braugher), his childhood friend, now a priest (George Dzunzda), and lastly the person who happens to get into his hack in that episode. Are you likely to find something like this going on in your city NO. Is this still a good story YES.

What ? - that was it ? The town sheriff ( John Agar ) blows up the mutant gorilla with a grenade in the climax. But there are plenty of other things that could have been said to make for an interesting climax. Here are a few more. Trouble with the Narrator
I think one of the problems with The Dark Tower is the fact that you don't actually know whether Roland is talking to Roland or to Roland's dead father. We know he is talking to Roland, but the fact remains that they're two separate narrators.

well, i may be bias as i grew up watching a VHS copy of this film that is now ready to snap and have just spent the last couple of hours tracking down a DVD copy as a birthday pressie for my Dad. The film is so harmless and inoffensive it suits all ages.... much better than anything Disney ever made in my opinion (and i used to work in the Disney Store!!!). The characters are enjoyable and the award for best scene is a tie between the disrupted wedding (especially the musical talents of Swat, the fly.

Not a box office success; no-one really knows why. It may have failed simply because of its title. It looks as though you need a two-word tough-guy title to attract a sufficient proportion of the idiot crowd - "Die Hard", "Lethal Weapon", "Hard Weapon", "Die Lethal", etc. - talking about "the long kiss goodnight" will get you nowhere. But for once Renny Harlin has made a GOOD action movie. A large part of the reason for this lies in the fact that the central character, Samantha, earns our affection and interest early on.

I remember watching this mini-series the first time in 1984 with a growing sense of anger and indignation. Having read the comments on this title, I must agree with those from the people in Greece. This was produced to coincide with the 1984 Los Angeles Olympic Games and, to me, it seemed like nothing more than an exercise in jingoistic, flag-waving American nationalism in which the American athletes are glorified at everyone else's expense. Some other nationalities would have every right to feel deeply insulted at the way they were portrayed in this series.

The Hell's Angels did come out the losers in this movie. Sonny stated to the director that NOBODY does this to the Angles and gets away with it. His version was the two dudes were to be shotgunned to death, but his suggestion was ignored. They were stoops to even appear, much less be "technical advisers" in a stink-bomb of a movie like this. Hell's Angles on JAP bikes? C'mon! (although in Sonny's autobiography he says, "F$#K Harley Davidson!" and that if they was smart, they would be riding Hondas.

I attended an advance screening of this film not sure of what to expect from Kevin Costner and Ashton Kutcher; both have delivered less than memorable performances & films. While the underlying "general" storyline is somewhat familiar, this film was excellent. Both Costner and Kutcher delivered powerful performances playing extremely well off each other. The human frailties and strengths of their respective characters were incredibly played by both; the scene when Costner confronts Kutcher with the personal reasons why Kutcher joined the Coast Guard rescue elite was the film's most unforgettable emotional moment.

i was lucky enough to read the book beforehand and i do know a little about Tudor england.the writing directing and editing of this TV movie for the most part was truly awful. i felt as if i was watching a really bad drama doc about the period rater then a movie.first there were too many cut's between important parts. And leaving out important events which happened at the time, one is henry's fall out with Rome over his desire to divorce Katherine of aragon which led to england's breaking away from Rome and establishing her own church. they barely stuck to the book at all.

I thought this movie was perfect for little girls. It was about a magical place where Genevieve and all her sisters could do what they wanted to do the most anytime they'd like. Most little girls would like this story, even though there is the thought of death in it. Although no one dies, the king almost does, but little girls would not understand it, so it adds up to make a perfect story. All the events add up, creating a great plot that can have a meaning if you dig deep enough.

I started to take a critical view on this adaptation within the first few minutes but as a dedicated Jane Austen fan and as someone who loves reading Austen, it’s hard to see the movie without loving the book. The film opens with a flashback to Jane’s marriage, which we follow through as we see it through the eyes of her family. There are no surprises here, no twist, no turns, just Jane’s story as it happens. It is refreshing to see how a book that’s considered a classic for so many people is portrayed in a more personal way.

This seemed to be a lackluster film to me that betrays a low budget with poor cinematography and not all that great of a job of editing. It may be of interest to those who know something about submarines during the World War II era, but I recommend that all others beware. Many of the scenes in this film were flat and some of the actors were a bit weak. The story about the men getting called back to duty during a short leave seems realistic enough, but there's no real pacing or tension in the story.

This series is formulaic and boring. The episodes are the same thing every week, simply with slightly varied settings. Some purely evil character does some dastardly deed, Walker goes after him, and it ends in a Karate match. The villains are super-cliché super-stereotypical evil villains, the good guys are all pure, honest and saintly, and the story lines are simplistic and unrealistic. After about 2 episodes, the show becomes totally unwatchable by all but the least discerning fans. Certainly not Norris's best work. His other work may be cliché but it usually does not drag on for weeks.

I find it amazing , that so many people ( probably Poles ) have voted for this movie , giving it a good score of 5.5 stars , but not giving it enough points. I have seen many a movies with a similar story and this movie had an awesome score , but it lacked something , which I cannot see on a big screen in 3D or in 2D, and that is depth. I have seen many movies of a similar genre, which have more depth , and have scored more than 7 . 5.5 is not enough for many people.

This was one of the slowest movies I have ever had the displeasure of sitting through. After the introduction where we are given the backstory of "something" killing a couple people in a farm house, We are introduced to a white looser family that is moving to a farm - AND NOTHING HAPPENS for a looooong time. Then they meet this drifter who helps out on the farm AND NOTHING HAPPENS again for a very long time. Then FINALLY the girl of the family has some plotergeist stuff happens. Then some more happens, the drifter guy goes nuts and the movie ends.

I'm almost embarrassed to admit to seeing CALIGULA twice. The problems with the production are almost too numerous to mention. The script is sub-standard (it's easy to see why Vidal tried to disown it). The direction is worse. Most of the movie consists of long shots inter cut with close-ups interspersed with cross cuts of mostly un-erotic porn (more prevalent obviously in the "uncut" version). The cinematography is especially sub par, giving the whole production a cheap washed-out look that undermines some of the elaborate set designs. The movie should've looked a whole lot better.

Fulci... Does this man brings one of the goriest and weirdest movies ever made? Answer: yes! Cat in the Brain, also known as Nightmare Concert is Fulci's last masterpiece. Yes it is, no matter what some people will say about it. There are few facts why this movie is one of the best Fulci's movies.Fulci make a fun of himself and his movies with this one. Lead roll in this movie is no other then Fulci himself, who plays... well horror-splatter-gore director, who thinks he is slowly going insane.

This is an excellent , little known movie . Tom Selleck does an outstanding job of acting in this movie . The only bad thing in the movie is that I wish that the movie was a little bit shorter . The plot is not bad at all and I don't think that this is Tom Selleck's first movie and this will be his last . And I like his style of acting . He has a great voice , and even if the movie was a little short , I would still recommend to see this movie . Tom is one of my favourite actors , and I would watch anything that he's in .

"Garden State" is another of these "indie"-type pictures that supposedly skimp on production values for the sake of giving the audience some real true-to-life human drama. Oddly enough, the production is very good, so are the performances (by some fairly big-name actors as well). Where the picture is lacking is in Zach Braff's script, which seems mostly culled from situations taken from other movies.When you're as young as Braff is, you haven't really lived enough to use the experience as film fodder. Braff's experience looks to be from watching movies, then repeating the same trite clichés in his own movie.

What bird is that ? A maltese falcon . The only thing remotely funny about this movie is Michael Caines' accent. And he is not even that funny in the movie. He is a very funny guy , but not in this movie. In fact the movie has no funny lines, except the one he comes up with , "I don't eat cats". Thursday, July 5, 2009

There is something about this movie that seems so familiar to me , I wonder if it has ever appeared in a film before.

Sorry to say but was disappointed in the film . It was very very rushed , as I suppose you would expect from a Hollywood release . I am not sure if I would recommend this movie but I will share my thoughts and opinions as they stand . I first saw the movie at the cinema just a few years ago , but have not since . I was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed it . There was a big difference between the two movies I saw and this one . The first was very dark and violent in it's approach to violence .

this movie gets a 10 because there is a lot of gore in it.who cares about the plot or the acting.this is an Italian horror movie people so you know you can't expect much from the acting or the plot.everybody knows fulci took footage from other movies and added it to this one.since i never seen any of the movies that he took footage from it didn't matter to me.the Italian godfather of gore out done himself with this movie.this is one of the goriest Italian movies you will ever see.no gore hound should be without this movie in their horror movie collection.buy this movie no matter what it is a horehounds dream come true.

this really is an "okay" series.. everyone in it is pretty good. but i just can't take Reba. she's trying to be funny but she just isn't and then she got a stupid accent!! if they took her out of the show i would love to see it every day..i have been watching the show in 10 min now and as i said before, Reba IS destroying the show. however the 20 year old guy (dont know his name) but he's soooo funny, and he's really saving it all..so here's the recipe to get a great show.

Ghilli is the best movie of vijay & one of the biggest hit in his career.... As I had not seen the Telegu movie so I could enjoy this movie even more.The story is about a girl wanting to escape the clutches of a local goon who wants to forcibly marry her. Since he is a goon so no body is ready to help the heroine. Vijay who had come to play a Kabaddi match there sees this and decides to help her. The rest of the movie is how vijay helps her & how the girl ultimately escapes the clutches of the goon & the goon's father's political cronies.

This is really one of the worst movies i have seen in a while. It's not funny at all. It simply portrays a lower class Northern British setting. I find it a very sad film at parts, at others cuts are where they shouldn't be. One thing that really annoyed me was the close ups of pointless objects it really slowed down the pace of the movie. I only made it through the movie because i fast forwarded certain sequences towards the end.This movie completely loses the attention of the audience.

It's hard to write 10 lines of copy about this so-so film noir. There just isn't a lot to say about it. It is not memorable enough to add to your collection, and I have a considerable amount of noirs.Paul Henreid plays a tough guy in here. He's not one I would think of to play this kind of role, but he's fine with it. He's a fine actor, anyway.Everything, including the cinematography, is okay-but-not memorable. One thing that stood out: the abrupt ending. That was a surprise.

I watched this movie with no idea what it was about beforehand. I was intrigued for the first whole hour. It was shaping up to be a great thriller. A very talented cast and good dialogue.Then it all fell apart for me at the sight of the first vampire. I couldn't believe my eyes.A great thriller was flushed down the toilet. The rest of the movie from that point was totally awful.I gave it 4 stars for the brilliant beginning alone. I think that's a little generous, but I was entertained for a while.

I think Hollywood should seriously consider NEVER doing another `` Biblical '' film again , if Noah 's Ark is any indicator , or if it hasn't already been a total disaster on every level, and I know it seems like a long time ago, it's actually been a week. And, yes , while we're at it, I have to admit it's been two days. I guess we're supposed to take whatever we're supposed to take . I do have one small hope for a new version, though .

This is definitely one of the ultimate cult classics, and is a must see for all psychotronic fans. Why? It has everything a great 70s exploitation film should have. Over-the-top dialog, bad acting, enthusiasm, sex, sleaze, political incorrectness, violence, and many other elements of a good cult classic are included. In other words, Dolemite is a must-see.As with a lot of these films, the plot makes little to no sense. What I picked up from it is that pimp-hustler Dolemite got framed up for having stolen furs and half a million dollars worth of narcotics.

Tyra & the rest of the modeling world needs to know that real women like myself and my daughter do not have a choice about our bodies and we cannot change them. We have to take ownership and live with ourselves and no one else. If we are strong and take care of our health by eating well, making sure we get enough rest and exercising regularly, that’s awesome. However, when we are told we are ugly, fat, unattractive, etc. that is not okay for me and my daughters and it’s up to them to change.

Who ever put that review as 'of bad taste ' is not all quite there ... its so funny , its just that when someone like you has a bad review of a TV show and yet you defend it to the very end , you just look so silly ! I don't understand what's so funny. I don't really care for the show, but I'm glad I haven't been the target of it. I would have loved to post my review but I don't have enough points. Maybe it would be different if I didn't have the same taste as the majority of the people here.

Sheltered young woman , home-schooled and possibly quite gifted , harbors a disturbed , overly-emotional side which comes to the surface when she is confronted with the realities of life in the United States. This is her story. It is also about the people she loves. In the last year, three things have occurred to me which may prove helpful to those with whom this story opens. They are my experiences of my own life, my journey as a young woman with a history of drug and alcohol abuse and my journey through my marriage to a man I did not love.

From the crash of the opening theme, "The Man With the Golden Arm" is classic 1950's entertainment. No subtlety here, Frank comes home from prison with a monkey on his back and goes right back to the old neighborhood, where the old scumbags still lurk. This is a tale of his dark ride with all of his emotional baggage intact. The performances are all a bit overripe, but that's part of the fun of watching. Darren McGavin and Arnold Stang are unforgettable, and almost steal the show.

Wayne Wang's direction may be the ingredient which made this film much more impressive to me than "Slums of Beverly Hills", which covers remarkably similar ground. The interplay between Susan Sarandon and Natalie Portman is riveting. Real chemistry there. This film succeeded in bringing me inside the dysfunctional life of these two women without dragging me down into depressed frustration. Susan Sarandon's character hammers at all the nerves which a narcissistic parent is capable of touching in an insecure adolescent. She amazingly manages to do this without coming across as floridly insane or intentionally sadistic.

Wesley Snipes is perfectly cast as Blade , a half human , half vampire known the daywalker . He has the perfect blend of sex appeal and strength to be an alluring lead. He's also a bit of a playboy with women. Blade doesn't have any problems getting laid and he isn't shy about asking the ladies where they got their titties done . The first time I met him I thought I was having a heart attack from his intense gaze . He was playing some video game and just stood there and stared at me like I was an insect .

Homecoming; what a HUGE disappointment!! After reading the plot summary (the dead coming back to vote - AGAINST George W. Bush!!!!!) I couldn't wait to see this. It started off interesting and it immediately caught my attention. Unfortunately, though, it slowly descended into a boring political satire that I didn't need to see (I can just watch some good old Aussie comedy for that!). There was pretty much only one or two scenes of horror and they weren't even that scary.

Like a lot of the comments above me, also I though this was the average scifi movie, but unfortunately it was not. I found it rather patronizing, and indeed, preaching.But that is not the only comment. The scenes are very 'artificial' (not as in scifi, as I will explain a in a few moments). (The next sentence is a small spoiler.) The movie more or less represents a discussion between two groups. The physical setting of a discussion typically involves two or three men standing next to each other, the middle one typically speaking.

The director was probably still in his early learning stages when he tried his hand at westerns . Have a look at some of the western films of his to get a sense of the challenges he was dealing with . If you are looking for a fun movie that has some decent western elements then you might consider this . However, this is not a film for the casual movie goer . This is a serious attempt at making a western . There is some action in it , but it is more than enough to hold your interest .

Yeah, what did I expect? I thought this would be a film about young adults at their turning-point in life, something like "Sonnenallee" or "American Pie", which I liked a lot. I wanted to see a funny film, perhaps with an ironic look on idyllic Wuerzburg. And what did I get?Attention, spoilers ahead!This film starts with a lengthy dialogue which gives you a good hint of what will inevitably follow: more lengthy dialogues. Sometimes I thought Moritz Bleibtreu might have forgotten his text and trying to hide that fact by improvising and just repeating what he was saying before.

Largely forgettable tale in which mercenary Kerman & employer Agren travel into the jungle in search of Agren 's missing brother. It is the early 1930's and the brothers Agren are still in their late teens at a time when there's no money and no prospects of any, as the two are sent to find Agren 's missing younger brother who had run off to the jungle after his father and was never seen or heard from again. It is said that Agren 's father is a nobleman. Agren is the youngest of the three, and the oldest of the two.

Some people are born with mourning souls with their song sung singularly until they encounter another soul as tortured and/or as bitterly sweetly beautiful as their own and an unusual magic happens. YOU ARE ALONE is a brutally honest look into two tortured souls that intertwine for a moment of understanding and oneness only to be torn apart by the differences in the oneness between they're pain. Death is explored figuratively and literally. It is what happens when ones soul is dead or similarly too alive, too awake to reality. It is the life NOT which you imagined behind the eyes of passer-by's.

This movie appears to have made for the sole purpose of annoying me. Everything I hate about films is present: fake sentimentality, extreme corniness, bad child actors and more feature abundantly. That's ignoring the fact that it depicts the extreme ignorance of American sports fans, with many of the cast professing that a football is shaped like a lemon. What?! That's a Rugby ball. The story follows a group of no hopers that get a new teacher that they like (who, coincidently, teaches the class in a short skirt) and gets them interested in football.

The plot has something about white hunters captured by a tribe of white women in the African jungle/ plains.Its a turkey and the some. What it really is is wildly mismatched footage from early sound and silent films mixed with badly shot recent(to the release) footage of men on a safari. There are scenes of a man in a gorilla suit, south seas natives at sea (used to represent people in the middle of Africa), women in bikini's, horrible narration and a guy in a loin cloth with make up all over his body (racially insensitive I think so).

I would like to submit the following goof.During the bridge scene, soldiers are seen wading out in the river, asking to be taken away and seeking to escape. Some of the soldiers approach Captain Willard's boat and attempt to board carrying with them suitcases. Soldiers are not issued nor do they ever carry suitcases into a combat zone. They have duffel bags, packs and footlockers but not suitcases. The use of a suitcase in this scene is absurd and out of keeping. Additionally, if you look closely, you will see that the suitcase is floating on top of the water.

Have to agree that this movie and it 's talented director do not receive the plaudits they deserve . Here 's why . First of all the story is boring as hell . Even the main character is dull . Soultaker was written by and starred Vivian Schilling . It also starred Joe Estevez , Gregg Thomsen , and Robert Osterloh . The film had several other stars from television, such as Bob Denver (who had a small role in the film), Richard Boone , William Schallert , Alan Hale, Jr. and John Anderson . In the movie, Schilling plays a woman who has to escape from a group of people who are trying to abduct her and take her into their world. The film had mixed reviews and was only a moderate success with only $5 million in ticket sales .

There was no need for this movie , plain and simple . The original , although hated by some , was a well written film with a good ending . Lackawanna Blues is a very moving film depicting an era filled with varying emotions and characters as seen through the eyes of an older woman. Lackawanna Blues is based on the best-selling non-fiction book by Laura Ingalls Wilder: A Story of the Great Plains, which has sold over 35 million copies and been turned into a number of television programs, movies, and even a stage adaptation and Broadway play. The film’s setting is a fictionalized version of the North Dakota village where Wilder wrote the book in the early 1900’s.

Set in Hungary in November 1956 , this is the story of a group of foreign nationals who were trying to escape the then-communist Hungarian government for the UK. What happens on their journey will make this a film that will be remembered for decades to come, and it's not just for its political and historical context. What makes this work is the characters themselves - their motivations, decisions and thoughts as they navigate the world. When we last left them, the three main characters had travelled together to London and set off into the unknown.

Nothing like this was seen on TV at that time and probably never will again . From the first image released by the French authorities , it was clear there was nothing to fear. There was nothing to be done at this point. And I believe they did nothing at all. There was no reason to suspect anything. I think they knew what was going to happen, but did not wish to see it. I am very surprised by what has transpired in the past six months. What I saw on TV, I saw many times before. It is not so very different.

High school female track star dies of a blood clot after winning a race with the community in an uproar against Coach George Michaels(Christopher George playing him as a major butt-head who is VERY demanding of the athletes under his watch). He'll be canned after school lets out providing the flick with his motive as a possible killer. Some twisted psychopath in sweats(much the same as what Michaels is often seen wearing), using a stop watch to time his executions, murders the members of the track team the dead female runner was a part of.

If you enjoy suspense this movie has it. The fact that Marina Zudina portrays a mute adds to her haplessness and increases the suspense. Alec Guiness's appearance was nice, but didn't really add to the movie. I'm not sure if Evan Richard's part as Andy Clarke was an attempt to add a little humor or if he was supposed to just be a bumbling idiot. I thought the cinematography was excellent. This added not just to the quality of the production but to the suspense as well. The bathtub seen with the water droplets in slow motion was wonderful.

The Outsiders is undoubtedly a classic Australian TV series. Well defined characters, tight scripts, varied and interesting locales, great guest stars and a filmic ambiance all combined to make this series a special one.Sadly, Andrew Keir has passed on & Sascha Hehn from Germany does not appear (unfortunately) to have enjoyed small screen success in his native country. The ABC has repeated the series many times yet a DVD release is yet to happen.The series is one which is timeless. It is as likely to strike a resonant chord with viewers today as it did in its own day.

SPOILER ALERT ! Do n't read on unless you 're prepared for some spoilers.I think this film had a lot of potential. The acting was terrific. The cinematography is gorgeous, and I loved the score. There were some flaws, as I said though, but it had a pretty interesting story. I liked the direction a lot, and the performances were good, even if not top notch.I 'm not too crazy about the final product. There were things that I enjoyed and things that I didn't enjoy. It seemed like the writer and the director didn't really like each other very much.

This is not exactly what I would call a Mad Max film , after seeing Road Warrior and experiencing the movie, the other films that come to mind are A Mad Mad Mad Mad World and War & Peace, which I feel are a bit overrated. Although Mad Max is a good film, it’s a very different experience from Mad Max, Road Warrior or War & Peace. This film is about a family who are trying to survive in a post apocalyptic post war world where there are no more humans, animals, plants, or minerals left.

While not truly terrible , this movie is still largely a waste of time , and paints an incredibly inaccurate portrait of reality . In this story, a woman from a poor neighborhood of a major city goes to work as a cleaning lady at a wealthy man’s house. When her boss catches her in the act of cheating on a man who is paying her a salary that is twice her wage , the boss threatens her with a series of punishments . She is to be beaten every night , and is made to kneel with her head in the noisome garbage can for the entire length of her shift .

Most people will consider that Yul Brynner's greatest performance was as the ruler of Siam in THE KING AND I. Certainly it gave him a wide variety of moods to test his abilities in, from comic, to tragic, from eager to learn to dominating to hateful. It also showed him to advantage as a "talk singer" and a dancer. Finally, as it was also his Tony Award winning performance from Broadway, the film allowed us to capture something of the great Broadway performance as well.But he did other movies that showed his talents as well as THE KING AND I.

The minutiae of what's involved in carrying out a robbery is what makes this one of the best of all heist movies. Then there's the robbery itself, a wordless, thirty minute nail-biter that has never been surpassed, followed by what is probably the cinema's most pronounced example of dishonor among thieves as things begin to spectacularly unravel, and we have what is unquestionably the greatest of all heist movies.This was a tough and unsentimental film when it first appeared in 1955 and it is just as tough and unsentimental today. (It displays some of the edgy brutality of Dassin's earlier "Brute Force").

I worked on this atrocity ten years ago . Luckily for me , no one knows it because I did not want the story known . It was only in my own mind that it was my doing and not the other way round . This noisy, dizzying football film from director Oliver Stone seems to have everyone in the cast - well, everyone except William H. Macy, who could have tackled the role played by Mr. Stone, the team doctors, or the "fruitcake" selling cereal. If you're a fan of the foul-mouthed, there are some great, profanity-laden knock-down, drag-out, put-down phrases you can try-out on two-faced friends and way-ward lovers. The film is sometimes good as lively background party atmosphere, especially during the first two hours; it even features some MTV-styled music video scenes.

Computer savvy John Light ( as John Elias ) goes from Stanford drop-out to successful young Dotcom-era tycoon . But it’s not all fun and games and money. Elias has a secret. And one day he’ll use that secret to go down in history. In 1996, at the age of 19, John Elias left the University of California at Berkeley to pursue the dream of starting a tech company. It’s no coincidence that it was the technology boom that allowed Elias to pull this off. In 1996, the Internet was a science fiction fantasy.

If there's anything worse than this movie I don't want to see it. I remember so many amazing things--a nun dropped out of a coffin to make a raft for a little blond boy; the little blond boy himself adored as a god; lots of stock footage of Peru as an ideal vacation spot. Shining Path and Alberto Fujimori should blast away any notion that Peru is a vacation paradise. The whole thing is so awful that Plan 9 or even Robot Monster is an aesthetic treat by comparison. This film should be bombed and strafed and bombed again.

A very good film, focusing on a very important issue. Fetal alcohol syndrome is a very serious birth defect that is totally preventable. If more families saw this film, perhaps more children would not end up like Adam. Jimmie Smits performs in one of his best roles ever. This is an excellent movie that takes into account a very special family with very important needs. This is not unlike thousands of families that exist in the United States today. There are children struggling with this world wide. The really important point here is that it all could have been prevented.

Okay it is terribly, and I mean terribly, easy to pick apart this film. Yes, B star John Agar is here as a sheriff out to rid the Texan landscape of a robot-like ape from a NASA experiment gone awry. The movie has dreadful performances, dreadful scenery, dreadful special effects, and dreadful lighting.

A film, first and foremost, should be good storytelling. It should be entertaining - and entertaining doesn't necessarily mean "laughs", and it doesn't necessarily mean "light". It basically means you're not bored while watching it. As brilliant as 2001 may be, it is a difficult film to watch, especially for the current (video-game-playing/iPod fumbling) generation. Its slow pace and the sometimes intolerable amount of time it takes for an actor to perform a single action (e.g. the attempt to rescue the crew member floating in space) will stretch your patience.

Wow ! After the first five minutes of watching this `` film '' , I was quite tempted to put it down . It has been a very long time since Hollywood has had anything this interesting . Ever since 1981 , Nintendo has been making great video games such as Super Mario and Zelda . Most ideas and concepts in game design originated with Nintendo but many other developers later copied their work. One of those developers was a company called Nintendo Research and Development, which began as a subsidiary of Nintendo's research and development division, then later became a separate company. When Nintendo launched the NES, its main competitor was Atari. In 1982, Nintendo hired the famous game designer and programmer, Gunpei Yokoi, in his first job with Nintendo.

Leslie Carbaga 's excellent book on the Fleishers tells the whole story of the Fleischer 's big move of their film cameras to England, and the story of their film making. Tuesday, 20 September 2013

It was in 1938 that Fleischer left his native Austria. The film was set to be directed by Alfred Hitchcock for RKO and was intended to be used as a fill in film during the war. Fleischer arrived in Britain by air and took the film on the London to New York ship. They arrived in New York on 8 May. He stayed in America until June of that year.

I first saw this movie in the theater . I was 10 . I just watched it a second time, and again and again. When I got to the part at the very end where he gets to his car and it starts to rain it was just the right ending for me. I could easily imagine myself in his car as I walked through the rain out to my parents house. I was watching this movie at home with a few friends last week. My favorite scene, for obvious reasons, was the first time they were at the store.

Frank Sinatra has one of his best roles as a reformed heroin addict coming back to his Chicago neighborhood after years off the drug. He meets a woman whose life he ruined. Sinatra, who was born in nearby Wrigleyville, got his first acting job at 14. He was discovered by an old friend when he walked into a theater with his mother to see a play. The man who found the young man and encouraged him to go on to a career as an actor asked him to join him for a drink in his basement.

If there 's anything worse than this movie I do n't want to see it . I remember so many years ago seeing one of them and saying "this will never get a movie!" I don 't know how anyone could go on with a movie where a man has to climb into his car to be abducted and taken to a different planet. I don 't even want to see it because it is such a downer movie. Some sort of accolades must be given to ` Hellraiser : Bloodline ' . It 's actually out Full-Mooned Full-Assed and we've only seen the first issue. But it seems the comic is worth every penny of the $4.99 cover price. Not only is the story pretty interesting, but it is written in such an engaging way that it is guaranteed to bring new readers into the book. The art by Mike Allred, who I think is a top drawer talent and the story is just great. I hope it comes out at full-moon too!

A great film . Every moment masterfully conducted by Toyoda and his crew . The actors give credible performances all through the film , especially Takahashi and Kishino . It is a very well directed film . My favorite aspect about it is Toyoda’s acting . When he is not directing, he’s acting . It’s like he’s taking on his own character in the film . You can see him trying to carry out the role of Toyoda . And he tries to make the characters seem real to us , even if it’s not realistic .

This film takes a lot of liberties with the known historical facts.Even little things like Flynn licking one stamp after the other in an attempt to avoid having to take a test (they're not there to help him ace the exam), and then not doing the same thing in the same place as the next stamp, in order to create confusion.That's not an excuse - but it is an explanation of why there are so many differences in his story, and why so many things are not in there. He didn't have any exams to take, so how did you know the questions weren't in there?

OK, so maybe it's because I'm from the North East of Scotland and I talk just like the guys in this film, but I found this great fun. Cheap fun to be sure, but plenty of effort has gone into making the film look great and the actors certainly give it all. I was actually quite effected when they died. In particulare when the Captain finally fell. The script? Well it;s a game of 2 halfs. The opening half of the film is well written and sharp. The last half hour is not so great, with many questions left unanswered.

Dr. Pena ( Giancarlo Esposito ) , a `` crypto-zoologist '' ( fancy term for one of those self-deluded losers who still thinks that bitcoin could be the key to their fortunes) , is not happy with the price of the bitcoin market. This is very clear if you examine his twitter feed. But, he is not the first to have a problem with the price of bitcoin either. In fact, the problem goes back to when it was worth more than $100 and he still believed there was a major flaw in it.

I watched this because a friend told me it was damn good, and I watched a video on it, so I was really into watching it. I watched it, and, damn, the fighting scenes are REALLY good. When I originally wrote my comments, shortly after first seeing this film, I took a critical view, feeling that Lemmon and Matthau had basically "phoned-in" their performances, which paired them in a manner they'd done several times previously.But upon seeing it again, it seemed different, especially in view that neither of the two main mega-stars lived a great deal longer after its release.With the exception of Spiner, all of the eight principals are performers with considerable experience, and likewise unavoidably a lot "longer in tooth" than we've seen in many of their other film and t.v.

Cowboys and Indians is an excellent film. The writing, acting, directing could not have been better. This was a story that begged to be told, and this group of talented individuals and teams did a superb job of doing so. Stories like this one are not pleasant ones, but serve to remind people of the social injustices that exist all around the world. It is my hope that when this film is seen that attitudes and prejudices will be changed. A film that can do that is a rare a special thing.

Well the previews looked funny and I usually don't go to movies on opening night especially with my kids because ......well you never know. Here is a movie that doesn't appeal either to children or adults as the jokes are too perverse for children and falls completely flat for entertainment purposes for adults. I was actually embarrassed to be with my 9 and 6 year old and having to explain to my 6 year old what S H * T spells. Essentially what happens here is a total twisting of Dr. Seuss's classic.

I found West Point to be an agreeable film, although I doubt that I would watch it again. The performances were convincing, with William Haines as yet another obnoxiously amusing young man that has his come-uppance by film's end. It's hard to believe that stardom beckoned Joan Crawford less than a year after this film was made, as she looks rather awkward at times. I would apply the comment made by another concerning Ramon Novarro's "Huddle" (1932) to this film as well. There is a great film waiting to be made here, but there is something lacking.

This movie was very cute and totally little girl appropriate. My nieces have watched it non-stop since they've gotten it, and as a result I've seen it nearly 4 times all the way through. I can't get enough of it. The CGI images are great to watch, the humor is good, and the ballet portrayals are excellent. Although the story line has a few holes, no little girl will pick up on them, and as an adult, the movie is so charming that one hardly even notices.

Just saw this movie on opening night . I read some other user comments which convinced me to go see it. What struck me was how much I was reminded of my childhood and young adulthood. This movie reminded me of the life I lived when I was a kid. The things that I remember about my time in that time were things that I wished that I would have done better of. This movie brought back those memories for me as well. There was a lot that I wish I would have done differently in the way I handled my situation with my mother and my boyfriends father.

Loved this movie ! Kicking it old school ! Love the idea . Love the script . Love the characters in it . Just love the way everything is presented in the movie. Awesome ! And it is a good movie. I really like it . There is a little too much of a drama in the movie. But I love the way this film is being shot . This is a very good idea for a new kind of horror film . There are so many ways to make a great film . The horror aspect of the movie is great to watch .

Mild spoilers below.The prospect of war was clearly on the horizon when TFW was filmed. From the opening scene of European refugees to the final prediction that Naziism will be the death of millions of Germans, this movie is as much a propaganda film as the films made after Pearl Harbor. There isn't a lot of entertainment value here though the footage of the dust bowl is interesting to those of us who aren't old enough to remember it. The rest of the plot is pretty forgettable with the Herr Docktor Coburn - with a pretty bad accent - and daughter assimilating into America with Wayne's help.

Harlan Banks is thief at the top of his game, but, after a successful career, he has decided to settle down with his woman and retire. However, he decides to take one last routine job in Las Vegas. All he has to do is drive the car and it seems simple. Unfortunately someone tips the police and after a hectic car chase he winds up in the slam only to escape and take revenge on those who betrayed and got him there in the first place. A typical action-fest ensues.Steven Seagal plays himself (surprise!)

I 've read plenty of Jane Austen in my time and approve of several cinema/TV adaptations but this one weaves together the elements of several classics in one story. That said, it takes a little getting used to, as the book and screen version are more or less opposite of each other. It also has its flaws, not the least of which are some minor character choices and a couple of things in the script that don't work. But it still manages to hold it's own with all that and is worth a watch for it's own sake.

I always loved this film . The music , story and the action . I especially love the opening and the end . I saw it about 5 years ago, maybe a 6 year old kid . I loved every minute of that film , its not the same as the book , but I still love it . It has made so much difference in my life . It made me who i am now, a strong woman and a proud mom . I have to say that I would recommend this movie to any woman who has ever been a victim of any type of abuse .

They used footage of some real protest spliced with some woman talking about a society with no men to make her case. The point being that women can do so much better and live the lives they want without having to worry about getting knocked up or going to school. When I was growing up, the women my mother taught me had no way of making a living if they chose to be home schooled. If they didn't want to go to school then they didn't have a choice in the matter, they were expected to have a family and take care of them.

Received this DVD from the ACCENT range which is a label which specializes in art-house flics, they released Irreversible and a range of Bergman's opus.The thing that struck me about Alex Frayne's strangely titled film MODERN LOVE is that it is an impeccable film that breathes with perfection and vision, a film that takes us into the mind of Mr Joe Average, replete with voices in the head, visions, and madness. It's set in rural redneck Australia, the film doesn't trivialise or praise the folks like so many Australian movies.

This film is a very beautiful and slow film . There is nothing Hollywood about it . It is very well composed and shot . The actors are good . I do not believe that any actress can do her best in this film . The best thing is that the actors are very natural and are not overdoing the role . The movie is great . The film is about two friends , who have a lot of secrets and try to keep them to themselves . The film has a strong and mysterious atmosphere and a good ending . I like the character of this film .

The Canterville Ghost (1996).The director made this too sappy a production. Maybe it's the generation, but I really liked the Charles Laughton version. There is a time and place for "emoting" and this production does not translate very well. Patrick Stewart, reciting Shakespeare was very good, but still inappropriate. Would neither recommend nor watch again. The close-ups and padded text and sub-plots were lost on me. Adding extraneous material and scenes takes away from a truly great work. The screenplay writer should find another profession in which to misplace his talent, maybe afternoon soap operas would be a better venue.

I never read the book. Now I don't really want to. I had no clue what this movie was about when I walked into the theatre. I still don't really know what point it was supposed to get across, but I do know that a good two hours was wasted from my life. Two precious hours I can never get back.The storyline was so predictable, it's laughable. Werewolves...or something...a very Romeo and Juliet type plot. I predicted the endig within five minutes into the movie. And I was correct.The acting isn't horrible.

When I first saw this movie in the theater I was so angry. It completely blew in my opinion. I didn't see it for a decade then decided what the hell, let's see. I'm watching all hellraiser movies now to see where it went wrong. My guess is it was with sequel 5 that was the first to implement the whole "i am in a dream omg i see weird stuff, oh noes what is happening, oh its a dream, oh its not a dream, oh wait i see something spooky, oh never mind"-sucky storyline.

Boring as hell and kind of a chick flick.It 's the story of a neurotic woman who struggles with the fact that men don't want her (even though they're her husband's friends)and that her life is meaningless.The ending is just the beginning and it's not too long. I thought it was good.I really liked the main character, but I did find the ending to be very disappointing. It seemed like there were some things in her head that needed to get sorted out, but the ending was the ending that really let her off the hook.

I won't spoil it for you. Although you probably could care less if it was spoiled (you'll know what I mean after you watch it) Poor story. B-rated movie quality. Typical horror -stupid situations- rare timing. I should of known, when they try to push a lot of hype in their advertising or even add "quotes". Just tells me that the movie bombed big time. And they are trying to pull in everyone just so they can break even with to cost of making this bomb. I wish I could take back the time I spent watching this.

Mario Van Peebles tries to go the Jean-Claude Van Damme route and play a renegade robotic soldier who goes AWOL and kills all of his fellow crew members. But Van Damme can’t get it together to kill himself. The movie doesn’t go where it should and doesn’t develop the characters. I liked the movie a lot, but there were so many technical problems that I stopped watching after about a third of the movie. And the final half was just dull. If Van Damme can’t kill himself with his bare hands, how is he still alive?

So unfortunately me and my mate watched this!!! It was showing on a Sky channel over here called "Zone Horror" which basically shows crappy B-movie horror films 24/7. It was a boring Friday night, so decided to have a laugh and give this one a look. Apart from the atrocious acting, the awful plot, the dire effects, the shoddy camera work and the brain numbing ridiculousness of it all, it was OK, LOL!!! In all seriousness it was quite a laugh picking holes in it and laughing at the goofy actors.

I can only think of one reason this movie was released . To capitalize off the upcoming fame of Guy Fawkes. The only reason you can't see it for yourself, is if you are caught with it . I know because I was . It has been years since I've read a review of a movie I saw and have since forgotten about . I went to the theater to go see the Guy Fawkes movie with a group of my friends. We were about a quarter of the way through and I was bored. I sat down and thought, what's the point of it?

This film was very different form the previous films and I had to wonder, "Where is Ralph Macchio?" he could have been involved in the plot somewhere as Myiagi's old friend who teaches Julie what he already knows, then Myiagi can come along and add some more! Macchio could've been the love interest for Julie in this film! Never mind!On a serious level, I enjoyed this film because it involved teaching a teenage girl how to do Karate, and her feelings are very different to what Daniel's were.

Years ago, I used to watch bad movies deliberately. Somehow I missed this one. No gesture rings true. No facial expression fits the scene or the action. I've never heard such inappropriate music for a film. At the final scene, I was rooting for the car to run over that ridiculous kid - one of the worst child actors ever.Only one name in it I ever heard of - Wilford Brimley. He must've been very hungry to take this part.DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES, WATCH THIS MOVIE!!! YOU'VE BEEN WARNED!! !

If you Listen to Ween (The Pod, God/Satan), then you know what's going on with "Split" I found that watching the film under the influence of LSD helped to deal with Audio/Video tracers from fantastic editing job. The plot was only important from second to second. The acid helped to interact with the sounds, subliminal and general pace of this masterpiece. Don't bother writing about something out of your comprehension's reach...There just isn't enough of these great independent attempts at expression at it's most raw , amateur level.

A suprisingly good film considering the circumstances of its production . Features performances from no-name actors that rival the top of the range of contemporary British actors . A very enjoyable film . The story is simple, the dialogue intelligent and the acting superb . A film that will please most people of all tastes . A good film , if you care to consider it in any light . This isn't the usual sort of film, I'm sure you know what you are getting, but I found it quite enjoyable in the end.

Swoon focuses on Leopold and Loeb's homosexual relationship - a facet of the case that has been mostly (and unjustly) ignored since their trial, even by Leopold himself in his autobiography. But, even in its treatment of this Swoon over does it by far. Worse, it twists, combines, and straight out alters the details of the case which will irritate anyone who knows much about it while at the same time managing to confuse those who are not familiar with it. While it is an interestingly made film, Swoon stinks.1 out of 10 - awful.

When HULK hit theaters in 2003, it wasn't long before DVDs of the old Incredible Hulk TV show popped up in an attempt to cash in on the craze. We saw a similar occurrence a year prior when Spider-Man cartoons appeared on DVD to coincide with that hero's big screen debut. Companies leap at the opportunity to ride on the financial coattails of a hot brand.So the fact that this picture never surfaced on the shelves of Wal-Mart as its featured heroes clobbered the box office in the summer of 2005 says a lot. I guess everyone involved would just rather forget.

The first time I saw this film I was a kid . I was ten years old when it was released, and I remember how I reacted, as though it was a new revelation in the history of art . It is a masterpiece. When you're young you are attracted to movies like the first time you see it , you can't believe that people actually think like that and act like that. If you look at it from that perspective, this film must be the best film ever made . It is simply perfect .

Without doubt , GRAND CHAMPION has the most impressive cast of `` AAA '' level stars and musicians ever gathered to form a musical ensemble. It is a musical phenomenon in its own right. I can say without fear of contradiction and on the word of one who is a witness, that this band is the greatest band in the world. This is the most magnificent band in the history of musical achievement in our land. I have seen them perform and I have seen them grow, mature and mature even more. The one thing they are known for is their love and commitment to each other and to the band.

This TV series is about a foolish and unconventional English gentleman who gets up to all sorts of merry mishaps.I remember watching Mr Bean with my family back in 1990, when I was still a child. My family laughed so hard at every episode, and the contents of which still come up in our daily conversations twenty years later. The memorable scenes which are still in my head include Mr Bean attempting to get out of his car park, shooting out the lights, counting sheep, and him in the swimming pool. We bought all the Mr Bean videos on VHS, no mater how expensive they were.

There are actually some good reasons, why a person should take the risk of going totally insane by watching this show. The breasts are nice, even though some of them aren't that real, but they usually come in pairs, which is good. Watching the beach on your screen is also a very relaxing experience, as it is an ideal place for just taking it easy and not worrying too much about getting eaten by a rubber shark. It's always good to remember, that David Hasselhoff is a god. Not the god, but a god.

Fred Williamson , one of the two or three top blaxploitation stars . Cynthia Rothrock , one of the two or three most beautiful women to appear in the genre . And one of the most beautiful women of all times . In the late '40s, Rothrock was hired by William Wyler , who was looking for someone to star opposite Robert Taylor in a film called 'The House of Rothschild', in which they would play the title role. The film was never made, however, Wyler's interest was sparked again when Rothrock was spotted by one of his agents and he had her meet Wyler at a party.

Shot in my former home town by a couple of college kids , this movie centers around some freak named Mike ( the guy is called " mike " to save space ) . the movie starts with him coming home from college after a night out with a girlfriend . the girlfriend ( played by the ever amazing rita goldston ) has been drinking and tells him that she cheated on him . the movie proceeds to chronicle all of his attempts to get over her . the movie centers around the relationships that these guys have had with their significant others .

What is this ! ! its so bad . The animation looks so terrible , it looks like a ps1 animation . . . it doesnt seem like a anime , it feels like something out of xmas. It has been an hour since the anime ended and I'm still watching the last episode. In a matter of two seconds, the whole anime went to crap. This is how the anime ended for me:

I don't really know what to do about it. I'll try to find out how to fix it. I feel bad because I didn't like it but I guess I didn't.

I picked this movie up because it sounded like a pretty decent flick , and I 've always been a fan of the character in the movie , from the beginning of his career . in the movie we find out that when he was 5 years old he had a dream , in which his father was trying to take him to heaven , but all he ever wanted was to be on earth again . this is when his father dies , and he goes back to earth for his mother , to take her place in heaven .

After reading some of these reviews , it is apparent that some have missed the point . What is great about this film , is that it doesn't attempt to do anything particularly new or original . The point of a good horror film is not to do what nobody else can do . It should make us want to see what we've missed . But that is not to say the film doesn't try something new , or does not attempt something that is not seen before . There are several good ideas in this film , and some very interesting moments .

The Kid is a really good family movie about a stuffy image consultant, Russ Duritz, who has lots of money, a good job, nice house, etc. The only problem is he doesn't have much of a social life as nobody seems to like him as he isn't always very nice. One day though things are about to change when an eight year old version of himself magically appears. This gives Russ a second chance to make things right. Bruce Willis plays the lead role here and he gives a really good performance. The Kid is a nice, heart-warming movie for everyone.

As we are well aware, movies are not set out to be a direct incorporation of history, but it is a disgrace when a movie is made which has absolutely little to no correlation. I wish the director and/or the screen writer had done his/her research in this topic. All this movie does is create a forum for hate between people, while causing a rift that should not be there. This movie portrayed the Sikhs and Muslims in a very negative manor, while making the third group (Hindus) look as if they were non existent in the brutal killings of the people of both nations.

Who said it had to be believable? Do yourself a favor and turn off your ration before you sit down to view this film. You'll enjoy the experience much more. You'll find yourself forgiving some of the movie's more outlandish plot set-ups, and simply accepting it for what it is--a great family film. I appreciated not having to be concerned about "questionable elements" in a children's film for once. That, to me, is worth the price of the ticket. And it manages to maintain its wholesomeness without being obvious about it--older chidlren will enjoy this film.

I cannot understand why this 1971 Hollywood production is currently only available through an Australian video company,but such is the unfortunate obscurity of this Peter Sellers classic(Leonard Maltin's Movie Guide continues to grant it the same BOMB review they gave it in the 1970's).With so many scene stealers on display,Sellers comes through with what may perhaps be his most hilarious role.It all begins with his discovery of a patient who expired at 11:15AM,but Sellers argues that the corpse is still living due to the fact that the new day doesn't start until noon!

It 's schmaltzy , but then what else did you expect ? The heroine is Cinderella 's younger sister complete with a dress , shoes, and a prince. It 's the same basic concept that made you fall for a series of fairy tale retellings from a young age, so why not do it over again ? Unfortunately , this adaptation feels like the work of someone looking for a fresh idea rather than a filmmaker interested in telling a good tale from the start. There are no surprises or revelations and while the story is engaging enough to keep the viewer interested through the first hour , it ultimately leaves you disappointed.

As a total movie geek with the fortunate job of video store manager, I tend to watch all sorts of movies, from good to very very bad. This was a movie with so many corn-ball lines, cheesy CGI effects and predictable plot points that I ended up laughing extensively before switching it off after 30-40 minutes. The "creature feature" genre of movies has been putting out some pretty awful stuff in recent years (Godzilla 2000 anyone? ), but this movie makes me think the creators weren't even trying.

Well , I did n't know what to expect from 555 . Matter of fact , I had never even heard of the radio before I had this radio in my car . Anyway , I must say I am very impressed with the results that this little device has provided me so far . I am sure it will continue to provide the same quality of sound that it has provided me with so far . And I am really not kidding when I say that I am impressed with the results that this little radio has been providing me with so far .

Carole Lombard and James Stewart gamely try to inject some life and meaning into this bizarrely constructed film about the death of a friend. Stewart (James Stewart) is visiting the home of John Wilkes Booth. When he enters, Booth is just returning from the theater with his wife Mary (Joan Barry), who is also the wife of Abraham Lincoln's assassin. Stewart, of course, falls in love with Booth's widow, but she's not the kind of woman one would choose for a confidant in times of crisis.

As cute and adorable as they are , the story of three singing chipmunks just does n't seem to have caught on in the way they were originally meant to. So, in an attempt to find the magic formula to make them a real hit in the music world, I went out and wrote the story below. If you're a fan of the Chipmunks or you're just someone who wants to see what life would be like if they were real, you should probably read this. I wrote the story down here on this blog, but feel free to read it if you like.

It was September 2003 that I heard the BBC were going to resurrect DOCTOR WHO and make it " Bigger and better " but I'd heard these rumours in the press before and thought that's all they were - Rumours . But it was then mentioned that Russell T Davies was going to executively produce and write the show and then one Saturday afternoon in March 2004 Channel 4 news interviewed the actor cast in the title role - Christopher Eccleston . Yes that Christopher Eccleston an actor I've always been impressed by since watching his film debut in LET HIM HAVE IT and if he was getting interviewed on television it must have been true .

A long time ago, in a galaxy far, far away (sound familiar), water has become the most precious commodity (this has got to sound familiar) and a small minority control its distribution (what a surprise, just have a heart attack and die from that surprise). A group of ice pirates (water renegades? wet bandits?...oh wait, that last one's been used) try to discover the route to a fabled unlimited supply of water with a lovely but spoiled (Druish?)

A group of seven people fear they are the only survivors of a near world ending H-bomb blast . Not even one in 20 Americans has heard about a H-bomb, the largest man-made explosive ever created

The world's most destructive device was used on August 2, 1957, in the second of two tests by the USA and Soviet Union at the Nevada Test Site, just outside Las Vegas

The first test on October 8, 1957, created the largest explosion in history

This is one of the largest explosions in world history. The H-bomb blast is so powerful that it has been called a 'giant atom bomb'.

This film is about a gap that exists between the real world and the world of the dead . There is this gap between life and death, when the body is no longer able to be seen, to be held. When we are in the middle of something and the mind is elsewhere, we are not able to experience it. You have the ability to hold the image of life in the mind, but you cannot experience that image, unless it is a very clear, clear image, and it has been taken away from you.

This film started off really tense when a poor young boy is set upon by a pack of savage dogs and a group of men trying to take him home. We soon realise the film is not actually about the boy and his dog and that they are just being used to make the story more interesting. This leads us to a scene where a young woman (Natalie Portman) and her father (Michael Douglas) have a drink in the bar of a large hotel as the camera pans over to her mother (Sally Field) watching.

This is a serious film about black revolutionaries and not really an action film . Billy Dee plays a young black revolutionary in Harlem who meets a young white girl who he falls in love with and has an abortion . His girlfriend, a black lesbian , runs away with another guy and leaves him to die of dehydration in the ghetto. The white girl eventually dies on her own. I liked the story, but it didn't hold my attention much. I wasn't expecting to enjoy it, because it seemed like more of a melange of two of my least favorite genres.

I had a bad feeling ten seconds into the film as a pair of overworked tumbleweeds ( probably left over from the snowstorm in the first half of the film ) appear in the opening scenes, one after another, making me think that this film might have been going to be somewhat of a disappointment. But in the end it was far better than I expected, and well worth the five stars it's been given. The cinematography of the shots of the snowy cityscape, and the city streets, are both beautiful and very atmospheric. The performances by all the cast are strong and believable.

I thought this series was going to be another fun, action series with some dynamic plots and great performances. I was wrong. While I like Jamie Denton, this show is hardly worth watching at all, unless you enjoy watching some people brutalized and the actions of the agents supposedly warranted under the theme of "national security." The show is great propaganda for the current government, and spews out jingoism as though we talk that way every day. After a couple of episodes, it was boring the hell out of me, and I started watching reruns of House Invaders on BBCAmerica instead.

Chan-wook Park , you have to hand it to the guy . In my eyes , he 's not only one of the best actors in Hollywood , he's one of the best male actors. I don 't want to say , "great" in this case , but he 's the one who can act the most natural, likeable , and relatable . I really admire him . He 's still doing his thing and I love the fact that he's just one of those guys , who always gets his way. He 's just like me , I can relate with him .

Produced by Nott Entertainment, this movie is "nott" very good at all. I sat through the first 15 minutes of the film before judging that the acting is bad, the casting is bad and camera work is bad. As I hear that there is a download of this film floating around on the internet, it is "nott" even worth the bandwidth.Up until the time I wrote this review, the average vote for this movie was an 8.5, which prompted me to view it and there was an average high majority of 10's for it, obviously voted on by liars and shills.

Okay , that was just brilliant . I wish that the rest of Season 1 had been this strong . It would have been so awesome . And it was a lot better . And now the show is even more of an all in show . Because they don’t have to explain everything that happened . Just let the episode do what it did . I mean , they really don’t need to explain . Because you already know everything that happened . The show is the story , and that was a very smart way of going about it . This is why I love the show .

When I first watched this film, I thought that it would be rally good, because it featured my favourite actor of all time. He gives a sterling performance, though it is fairly obvious he didn't have to life more than half a finger to make the róle work. He is the only good thing in it, unlesss you're into explosions and American dream-working class hero trash (which I'm not). I don't get it. How can this film get away with being so naf. That bit with the little boy being rescued, I mean, come on!

I really enjoyed BG Seasons 1-3 and really could n't understand those who did n't like it . But I have no idea why. It was very enjoyable for me and I can say that I felt the character development was very good. So, as much as I liked Season 3, I can see Season 4 being better. Season 3 was a tad bit too slow, too drawn out. I think Season 4 should be faster, more like an action adventure. Maybe the new season could even be a story told in first person.

As a total movie geek with the fortunate job of video store manager , I tend to watch all sorts of movies but have never been big fan of documentaries. When I recently saw The War on Drugs, I could not believe my eyes. What was this movie? Well, the movie is about a group of ex-cons from the ’90s, who go into seclusion after getting out of prison to make their own movie about their drug experience. The whole movie takes place inside a theater, which makes the whole movie very bizarre.

Following is an intriguing thriller that requires constant awareness to be completely understood . The plot has many twists and turns, with the end result leaving one to ponder if he has understood the true meaning of life or if he has missed something. This is an entertaining read that keeps the reader guessing till the end. A story of survival, this is an engrossing novel that combines both genres; suspense, thriller, and science-fiction all in one. The author introduces us to the idea of time travel and explores the concept in this story.

My wife and I could n't even finish the film . Truly , it was rather painful.First , the historical inaccuracy. One scene (the last) was an actual event , that was filmed in 1957 . When the movie was made in 1998 , all of the men who were supposed to have been involved were no longer alive . Then there was the over-the-top ending . And then there were the people who didn't believe in evolution . But , it was not meant to be . I guess that is the only way to make a movie about creationism .

I watch Lackawanna Blues every time it comes on. It brings back happy times for me. I grow up in a big city in the mid-west. It reminds me of when I was a child although my situation was a little different it feels the same. It makes me wonder if all we will ever know about families are lost. The big mama's of day are under the age of 55. Will they see know what it takes to be a inspiration to other. I hope that I was not the only one who loved this movie enough to relate it to their past.

Between the ages of 30 and 51 , when he died of a brain tumour , Zachary Scott made 70 million dollars from a single game of golf. It took him 11 years to break even on a single game, but it was the beginning of his professional golf career. He was the highest paid athlete in the U S in 2016, earning more than $30 million from endorsements . A decade before Scott made it big, he had already become the best amateur golfer in U.S. history and had been crowned the best amateur in the sport in the World Amateur Golf Rankings in 2004.

This is an odd movie. On the surface it's no different to many other d-grade gore movies but in at least a few ways it stands out. Firstly, the main killer character is really weird. How the heck a guy who only ever clucks like a chicken got paroled is totally beyond me. What was that female parole board member thinking: "he's totally reformed and rehabilitated". He clucks! Another problem with Luther the Geek is the script/direction for the women. The daughter is so pathetic and seemingly stupid that if she was mine I'ld slap her.

I 'm just starting to explore the so far wonderful world of monsieur Ozon . I 've seen only 4 episodes but what a show he is ! I'm really addicted to this guy . It seems to me that this man has the ability to tell stories that are very interesting and captivating . I've never seen any other television show to have been able to take me away to another world with his shows. I've never watched a movie that did that and I've watched many tv shows and movies and I've yet to watch anything that I would describe as "magical".

While Disney have been THE animation studio for the past 70 years, there have always been rivals to their supremacy. When this review was written in 2009, for example, companies like Dreamworks and (to a lesser extent) Warner Brothers and Ardman, were bringing out animated movies that could be said to challenge the Disney dominance. Back in the beginning, in that late '30s and early '40s heyday when Disney was serving cinematic banquets like Snow White, Dumbo and Fantasia, the competition was provided by brothers Dave and Max Fleischer.

Let 's get things straight . I was raised Catholic , and in a very religious family , and spent much of my childhood attending Mass and other church activities with my siblings and many cousins . We went to the church every day , and were taught that we should not make our faith into anything other than what we saw in church . As a child , I attended mass on Sunday , and never once felt that the church had anything more to offer me than just what was offered at Mass . My parents were very loving people , and very devoted to the church .

Given Christopher Nolan 's string of successful films , it 's a no brainer for me to want to check out a movie about the Dark Knight , the most recognizable and popular superhero of all time . After all, Batman is not just a character that lives in comic books, he lives in our hearts and imaginations . But is this the best film I can get from him? This review contains spoilers , but don 't let that put you off. I think Nolan has been making good films since his first Batman movie was made.

I'm the first to recognize that Chan-wook Park's Thirst is exceptionally well made, but spending over two hours with Tae-joo(OK-vin Kim)is enough for anyone to tolerate for such a length of time. Sang-hyeon(Kang-ho Song)is a priest desiring to volunteer for experimental studies on those willing to subject themselves to rigorous injections concerning a specific virus which kills infectiously. Instead of legitimately dying, Hyeon becomes a vampire, always yearning for the sustenance blood gives for him to fight off an infectious disease which returns causing the symptoms which flat-lined him to begin with(..bumps/sores, and the body vomits blood).

this movie is so bad and Hellraiser part 1 to 3 are so great . Nothing is good Bloodline ... I will never go back to hellraiser

Bloodline: Hell on earth
I really like it. It's different from all other films I've seen and I can't imagine any other director taking on Hell on earth. The storyline is excellent, the story is a good twist on a horror/thriller genre. The film does have a lot of blood in it but it's very minimal. I feel it's not as gory as part 3 but not as intense as part 1.

Okay, so this series kind of takes the route of 'here we go again!' Week in, week out David Morse's character helps out his ride who is in a bit of a pickle - but what's wrong with that!? David Morse is one of the greatest character actors out there, and certainly the coolest, and to have him in a series created by David Koepp - a great writer - is heaven! !Due to the lack of love for this show by many, I can't see it going to a season series - but you never know?

I was lucky enough for this film to come on TCM , so I had the opportunity to see it before it went out on cable. I really liked it. It's got some good parts, and some real funny parts, and some parts that just make you laugh out loud. Some of the acting is actually really good, like the dog, but some is really bad. There are also scenes that you can't understand because you are watching it on a TV, because the sound system isn't good enough. But I will tell you the truth about it.

THE NEXT KARATE KID , in my opinion , is an excellent martial arts flick . I thought that Eric Tseng’s previous work was very interesting , I like his idea of a Karate Kid version of “The Shining” . In this karate film , we have the return of John Candy “ The Karate Kid ” in a new role . As a result of the film not coming out during the summer , it has a bit of a ” late entry ” date . I did think that the story was about as interesting as it was ” kiddie ” .

Ben Affleck, about to be married, is shaken up by a plane accident and gets involved with one of the other passengers (Sandra Bullock, forcing herself to act insane). Who is to blame for this inept, ugly morass? It is so badly edited, when I looked in the credits it wasn't to read the editor's name--it was to see if the person actually took the credit! Rife with clichés, contrivances, and Sandra Bullock in raccoon eye-makeup, the movie doesn't even concern itself with creating chemistry between the two main characters.

Rock Star is a `` nice '' movie . Everyone is nice . Even the guys who are n't supposed to be nice . Except for one guy who is actually a jerk . And then we find out the whole movie is based on a true story . Plot Summary:

Rock Star tells the story of two aspiring rock stars who go on tour together to promote their new song "I Wanna Rock You." However, upon returning to their small hometown in Ohio, things take an unexpected turn as they soon discover that they now live in a world where rock stars are hated by everyone.

I have to agree with the previous author 's comments about the excellent performances and plot . Started watching this series back in 2009 and I am really enjoying it so far. It is definitely worth a watch for the plot, the acting and the action. I hope to see more stories in the future of this series. I really like the way it is being told and the way things are moving and I hope to see this series through to the end. I hope the next one is a continuation of this. This is definitely one of my favorite shows.

I was expecting "Born to Kill" to be an exciting, high-tension film noir.
