Instead, it's got two good action set-pieces (one at the beginning and one at the end) and some marvelously atmospheric cinematography by Robert de Grasse (usually a "glamor" cameraman and a surprising credit for a noir), but the rest of the film is pretty boring. Lawrence Tierney goes through his psycho kick but it's a strictly by-the-numbers performance, mechanically churning out what the audience expected from him after "Dillinger" (an overrated movie but at least better than this).

You may not believe this, but when the credits to this movie rolled, I looked for the director's name. When I saw it, I burned it into my memory and I never forgot it. This movie is beyond terrible. It makes Ed Wood's films look like Orsen Welles. At least B movies are entertaining, this was a soul deadening experience. The quality was so bad, I began to wonder who allowed this to happen.I hear Uwe Boll runs fourteen miles a day. This is because wherever his movies are viewed, the people must run him out of town with flame and pitchfork.

This is a very low budget film , set in one location in a valley shielded by the effects of climate change. We are shown that we have to deal with the change and it's effects on the land, plants, animals and humans. We are reminded, that in the movie , there is no place to go , there is no place for people to go to escape their conditions and to get away from these people who are destroying this place and making it impossible for them to live there in peace. The movie ends with what might seem like an idyllic dream , but it's really not .

'Carolina Moon' is an adequate made-for-TV movie about a girl with psychic powers who returns to the town whereshe grew up in and where her childhood best friend was murdered. Turns out that every year on the same date anotheryoung girl is murdered and Tori, played by Claire Forlani, must solve the mystery before she ends up dead. Claire Forlani (Meet Joe Black, CSI New York) is the female lead and does a pretty good job of it, ably supported by the rather delicious Oliver Hudsom and a still luminous Jacqueline Bisset.

Now for sure, this is one of the lightest-hearted stories that Bruce Willis has been in to date and yet,-- it is still touching. I really like Bruce's style and persona, I haven't loved everything he has ever been in, but he brings it to the 'Big-time' for me in most all his film endeavors.The story begins..... He is power, confidence and style with a capitol 'S' . He drives a Porshe he lives well, in a palatial estate with a grand view of the fair city. That's Russell Duritz.

Filmmakers made a rather boring everyman 's story look interesting and complex by focusing on his wife back at home instead of him having a love story with the girl at work. In the movies, I don’t care what happens with the guy next to me — or what happens between my boss and me — but if I can relate to it I’ll watch it. If I can relate to my job, then maybe I’ll do it. So what happens next with the everyman, who does a job that is more than just a job for him?

A big disappointment for what was touted as an incredible film . Incredibly bad . Very pretentious . It would be interesting to see this film with a different director. The acting is bad. The story sucks . The plot is a complete and utter rip off of The Dark Knight . This movie is a complete waste . There is absolutely no plot, only a movie . The acting is horrible , especially the kids . There are some funny scenes but not many . There is no tension , no drama . The ending is pretty lame . I am disappointed in this flick .

i was having a horrid day but this movie grabbed me, and i couldn't put it down until the end... and i had forgotten about my horrid day. and the ending... by the way... where is the sequel!! !the budget is obviously extremely low... but ... look what they did with it! it reminds me of a play... they are basically working with a tent, a 'escape pod', a few guns, uniforms, camping gear, and a 'scanner' thing. that is it for props.

It has been years since I have been privileged to see this movie on TV . I only wish I had seen it more than a few times , because as a movie , it is so well crafted and the performances of all the leads are perfect , it really felt like a concert movie in the sense that there is never a dull moment . I saw it twice and I would like to tell you the best thing I liked about this film is that it is very very funny but at the same time it is also very serious in some way .

'Water ' ( 2005 ) , the final part of Toronto-based Indian film-director Deepa Mehta 's elemental trilogy has been a box-office hit, earning more than $100 million worldwide on an initial release of 300 theaters. It has been lauded by critics as the strongest of Mehta's works yet. Deepa Mehta's 'Water '

This film is based on the life of Canadian writer and activist Gita Mehta and follows Gita as she grapples to reconcile her Jewish upbringing and Hindu faith with the violent conflicts in her community. The film's title is also the name of the community in which Mehta grew up.

This movie clearly has an agenda , which could be summed up like this : Never , never cross the line to the right of the left , no matter how tempting the temptation is , and always keep a cool head under the worst of situations . As a general rule , however , this is not what happens . This is not an action movie , and it is not a war film , it is a movie about how to live life , how to live life with style and dignity , how not to be driven around like a slave by life's problems and issues , how to get what you want .

First of all, the entire script is mostly improv, adding to the fantastic illusion that what we are watching is an actual documentary. Secondly, the actors hired by Watkins were purposefully chosen to represent their true political alliances and backgrounds. The hippies portrayed are actual hippies, the government officials (though not necessarily in the government themselves) are at least actually hearty conservatives within the system, and several of the cops are actual policemen. The interactions of these actors, given the textual freedoms alloted by Watkins, eventually come to a violent head where even Watkins himself is convinced that a cast member had actually been shot.

I find this film meretricious, tentative, lethargic, and skillfully a bad choice of entertainment on celluloid. But I admire the courage to throw away a script, turn the camera on, and act a fool. I find the inauspiciously performances, lighting, cinematography, sound, and whatever film school laws D' Urville Martin broke funny. Speaking from a film directors perspective there is times I just want to drop everything and have fun on the set. This film looks like fun. When other aspiring film directors ask me advice I just tell them to watch any film by Rudy Ray Moore.

Some movies you watch and you say, "Well, that made no sense." And you don't really mean it. You're just saying things were overly complicated or slightly nonsensical. "Bread And Circus" makes no sense at all. And I mean it. And that's not because it's surreal. From the start, it's pretty clear it's a feeble excuse to do splatter special effects. There's no script. There's no plot. There's no story of any kind. One event does not lead to the next -- that's how fundamental the bad writing is here.So what?

James Stewart plays Johnny Mason , lawyer . Carole Lombard is Jane Mason , wife . Lucile Watson the mother-in-law of Jane . John Wayne as the father-in-law of Carole Lombard. The film is based on real life events. 1. Cast of Characters

2. Cast of Characters

John Wayne

John Wayne was an American actor, director and film producer. He became the first person in history to be offered a five-year contract for $5 million and was the subject of one of the 20 most influential actors in world history by Time magazine.

Tom Stern and Jeremy Slate are swing bachelor's planning to hijack a casino, ala "Ocean's 11", and pin it on the Hell's Angels. Bad move. For a film with the words Hell's Angels AND the number 69 AND featuring actual Hell's Angels, this movie is surprisingly tame. The Hell's Angels truly deserve a better film to be centered around them. Not this snoorefest. Luckily this is one of the DVDs that features commentary by Joe Bob Briggs so the pain of having to sit through it is greatly alleviated.

In Thailand , the Americans Connor ( Colin Egglesfield ) and his girlfriend Amanda ( Meredith Monroe ) quarrel in their apartment, and Amanda says "I think you should just take a nap, and if anything happens you're not to worry about it, but if you do, just tell my uncle and he will take care of everything" . "What's the first thing you'll tell your nephew if he asks you to take care of the problem?" asked Connor, as he watched his girlfriend kiss and kiss her way to his bedroom .

I don't know where to begin. Perhaps the whole idea of this movie was just a disaster waiting to happen. There is nothing slightly humorous about a kidnapping. I don't know what was more offensive--the subject matter or David Arquette's "performance". It was like watching a bull get it's penis cut off, although I think the bull felt better afterwards. The filmmakers should find something about Sinatra other than his son's kidnapping to show (like, I don't know, his TALENT AS A SINGER!!!!).

Stephen Seagal plays the role of a dude who gets talked into driving an armored car for a bank hold up and drives into everything that comes across his path. However, the police seem to appear on the scene very quickly and Seagal smells a rat who gave the police advanced notice. The story gets into many twists and turns and the money from the hold up has disappeared and nobody knows its new owner. Poor Seagal gets a bit framed into this hold up and naturally he is out looking for the person or persons who are trying to put him away for a long time.

This film is on my list of worst movies ever made . The story is disconnected and it is difficult to take seriously . I think it was directed by a guy in his 40's because the character of the main character's parents are all adults. The story revolves around an American family and their life in a small town in the U.S. . I am not sure what to think or say about this movie . It is so badly done and so depressing that I almost wanted to watch it to forget it completely . There is no humor in the story .

I expected a lot more out of this film . The preview looked interesting so I decided to check it out for myself. To my surprise , the film was nothing special . The plot was pretty lame . The acting was decent but nothing memorable . The music in the film was pretty decent too . The film is pretty average to me , there were a few small things that caught my attention about this film but nothing more. Overall the film wasn't good . If you want to watch this film just rent it .

I am utterly astonished at how over-rated `` Cemetery Man '' is among horror fans ! Now , I usually enjoy most horror movies , with or without good acting , I am a diehard fan of the " classic " era of Horror movies. I also have a very low expectation of any movie , no matter how much hype or how much money the movie is going to get . I have seen only a few good , good , good " bad " horror movies and that is it. This is not to say that I have no expectations at all of the movie .

I am partly a fan of Miyazaki 's work . I say `` partly '' because most of his films are not particularly good . Miyazaki has an innate ability to make his themes seem more interesting than they are and has made it his habit to take risks that many would deem too risky or too far out of character for an animated film. There is a reason that his films are known as ''manga '' and his style has influenced many directors since he began making films in the '50s . He is one of those people that we look back on with fondness .

Unlike most of the reviewers of this particular movie, I'm really not the much of a Cynthia Rothrock fan, to say the least. However when I saw that the movie had Fred Williamson and Robert Forster (both great actors), I just had to watch the film. Williamson is a Dakota Smith, an alcoholic cop who is demoted to scrubbing toilets with a toothbrush and even worse having to team up with Cynthia at the behest of the captain (Robert Forster). Forster is always watchable, it's just a crying shame that the movie itself is so damn trite and clichéd.

There are two things that I noticed in this film . ( This is not a spoiler , just a observation that was made)
1. It’s very reminiscent of another film, The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly, which has been out since I saw it. That film has two things that made it special . First of all, both the characters and actors in the movie are superb. Secondly, the director is a master of the genre he is working in, so he knows how to tell great drama .

Never having read or seen the Bard's original work, I can't begin to compare this work to his story. So I won't. Instead I will just say that this was a very entertaining story with some very nice special effects (and some that looked a little lower in budget, but still decent enough to enjoy). I thought all the primary actors did a fine job performing. The style of magic seemed more black than white and is almost certain to offend anyone easily upset about that sort of thing, but I thought it was well done.

This film is great! Being a fan of "The Comic Strip Presents..." I just knew I would love this film. And love it I do. I finally got round to buying a copy of this film early this year. However I was annoyed to find that it had been cut! So I'll keep looking at car boot sales for the original version.Anyway, the film is about Dennis Carter (Adrian Edmondson), who tries to impress his girlfriend (Dawn French) by claiming to be a drug dealer. However, Dennis is overheard bragging one night in the pub and nicked!

This film is striking only in its banality and use of cliches . Sadly it was obvious throughout up until the final ten minutes . Even then there were some interesting ideas here . A lot of this film I thought was pointless . I have seen it twice now . I would recommend it to you but if you're going to watch this it would be a great idea to go and see it with someone else . It's quite boring in fact . The plot does make sense at the beginning and then as it goes on its becomes more and more ridiculous to me .

Eight Legged Freaks is a modern monster movie , like a remake of any of the old 'Attack of the Killer Tomatoes.' And that's not a bad comparison since the movie takes a number of classic monster movies and gives them a 'Twentieth Century Techno' twist. There are a good number of genre clichés here. We've seen them all, though, with this film being no exception. It takes place in Los Angeles, California, which is not a typical location for a monster movie. So what is it then about this place that makes the film so effective?

Seymour Cassel gives a great performance , a tour de force . His acting as supposed washed up beach stud has a genuine sense of menace and vulnerability that comes from a man who knows he may not live to see his next meal . Cassel gives an outstanding performance , it's a showy performance that is well worth paying attention to . He really has a presence in this film and is one to watch when the film comes out on Blu-Ray on February 1st, 2016 . Director David Cronenberg does not pull any punches here . There are many shocks and shocks that happen over the course of the film .

This movie is about a young couple running away to start a new life in LA, who end up being stalked by a psycho at a deserted rest stop. Actually, it's really just about the girl (Nicole), since her boyfriend literally disappears within a few minutes. The movie gets going extremely fast, and early on you wonder how it could possibly stretch its story out to feature length. It isn't long before you realize that the movie does this by simply wasting time with unnecessary scenes that go nowhere.The story is not only paper-thin, but unstructured, stupid, and incoherent.

If good intentions made a film great, then this film might be one of the greatest films ever made. The film has great actors, a master director, a significant theme--at least a would-be significant theme, undertone of fifties existential world-weariness, aerial scenes that ought to have thrilled both senses and imagination, and characters about which one might deeply care. It is about patriotism and about patriotism in a healthy way.Not quite ten years after the film, I knew Air Force officers who taught my R.O.T.C. classes at university. They were intellectuals. They thought deeply about their work.

A bit too much Mediterrenean machismo for me. The cast was beautiful, lovely to watch in all of the romantic scenes. The locale was beautiful with azure skies and azure water. It just was not convincing to me that such an egomaniac crud bent on nothing but his building, could attract so many beautiful, vulnerable, women. Only in the Mediterranean I guess. Certainly in no world I am familiar with. The macho men were really obnoxious, and I found it difficult to believe that the female characters could have anything to to with them for so long.

Terrific little film that stars Mary Astor as a go-getter who works her way up as a struggling paper company in the early 1930s. This was her first film role, and Astor got top billing, but for the most part, the film is all about her character and her struggles in her new role. Astor played a woman who wasn't afraid to fight for what she believed in. The movie also stars James Stewart as Astor's boss. The two were married during the making of the movie, and the pair also appeared together in a later movie, This Happy Breed.

This movie will not be considered for an academy award , but if you enjoy a movie that does n't make you laugh , or you like to watch a story that is a mix of comedy and drama , this movie will be an enjoyable one to watch and you will enjoy every scene . ~~~~~~~ ~~

The story is one where a man ( mr. rahim khan ) lives with his wife , kids and dog in a house that is made of mud and sticks. His family consists of his mother who is mentally ill .

This is by far the most repulsive and atrocious version of The Scarlet Pimpernel ever to be devised. As a Pimpernel fan, I was sincerely offended by what they did to the characters--but this atrocity is not worth watching, even if you aren't familiar with the story.Percy Blakeney, for example, would never stab people in the back just to get down a hallway. Chauvelin would never have a string of women in his bed. Marguerite never had an affair with Chauvelin, nor Armand with Minette, whoever the heck she is. Chauvelin would not randomly shoot Tony in the head.

Eros and Thanatos , Love and Death command the dialectics of Life . By the end of 19th century in Italy, this relationship was already a central element of the philosophical debates. This book analyzes how Italian philosophers of this period developed this idea, focusing particularly on Benedetto Croce. This approach, in turn, has its origins in an investigation carried out in the first years of the last century, when the author was a student at University of Rome, where he discovered his mentor and friend, Giuseppe Tomasi di Lampedusa.

There seems to have been some money behind this film , but it would be impossible to imagine a film like this on any other platform. I have a few friends that have no clue that the film has been released here in the UK, which is not the way to attract new audiences. I have always been a fan of this movie and will revisit it again and again, but the fact that it can only be seen on the home theatre is just another reason to buy your DVD and Blu-ray combo pack on the day of release.

I chose this movie because I was looking for a triangle friendship between a girl & two boys. As I lived this situation and get lost in it, I hope a similar story would inspire me. My major concerns are: - Why (a) & How (b) the triangle forms ? - Why (c) & How (d) the triangle degenerates ? (a) The movie offers a plain answer: "because it's better !". (b) here, it's an open triangle: the three share things together.

Katharine Hepburn as a mountain woman who mixes prayer with positive thinking--and is thought by the local folk to be a witch. Kate works overly-hard trying to convince us she's a backwoods hick (named Trigger Hicks! ), but you can see she doesn't even believe in this unintentionally comical scenario. Constantly-smiling Robert Young plays a foreman working on the construction of a mountain dam who becomes Trigger's first crush...but alas, he's married! No amount of white magic can resuscitate this formula, based on a play and brought to the screen by R.K.O.

Jim Carrey is a particular brand of humour and I personally think he 's a great actor ( Eternal Sunshine of The Spotless Mind ) . But I think that his work is somewhat limited . He can act very well in a lot of different situations but he is a great comedian and the one thing that always bugs me is he is not very funny in certain situations. I'm not even talking about his acting in comedy films ( The Cable Guy . The World's End .) This is not about his acting. He is an actor and a comedian (and probably a great actor ).

Just what the world needed-another superficial cookie-cutter Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen movie. This movie gives out horrible messages to girls everywhere, complete with stereotypical "junior high" experience. They make learning anything at all seem completely taboo. I can't stand the fake French accents, or those guys on the mopeds racing around who eventually "fall" for the twins. Why am I putting everything in parenthesis? Because its all stereotyped. The twins even complain about not having a stereotypical grandfather. They should be happy they even have a grandfather at all. How does this fit the Mary-Kate/Ashley mold?

Forget Jimmy Stewart reliving his life and opt for this smart comedy of errors instead . I suppose only institutionalized lunatics would want to watch it for that reason but I will watch this because it has an ending that makes perfect sense, a happy ending that makes sense and makes my heart smile. It’s not as if it is going to turn me into an evangelist for the Catholic Church or anything else. I mean the ending makes sense in so many ways that it is hard to believe it didn’t happen the way it was intended.

Jingofighter I agree with some of your comments , but I have to disagree on a couple of things . -I have no problems with people getting a job and having to do something that doesn't agree with them . There are plenty of jobs for people without any degrees or training. But I think the job of a lawyer shouldn't be any different . I know I would hate being a lawyer . It's what I have been doing since I was 18 and I could have been working at McDonalds or working at the mall for all I care !

When a group of businessmen start dying in the presence of the mysterious Mr. Coulomb, FBI agent Dick Martin is assigned to the case. As the deaths continue to mount, Mr. Martin obviously isn't having much success. By the end of the movie, the strange truth is revealed, which I won't reveal here.One of the other users commenting on this states "This is a Classic film and should be ENJOYED and not picked apart". I'm sorry but I have to respectfully disagree with this opinion. It is "classic" only in that it is old, not in any sense pertaining to its quality.

I watched the movie with tears and smiles alternatively . Anger surged in me to see the ruin of Hanoi, which is why I want to visit that part of Vietnam in the future. I’m glad I took my camera with me. I don’t know what’s going on in the world but I hope for the best for my country. I just watched a movie about Vietnam. I am in the USA now. I love movies. I am a movie addict. I love them to watch them on my television, in my bed and even on my computer when I have the time.

Anyone who complains about Peter Jackson making movies too long should sit through this CBS `` event '' . There's a reason for it -- and one reason why he's such a master of pacing . Jackson is a consummate writer, too, and he's not afraid to let scenes linger and let the pacing build to an explosive conclusion . The film opens in New Zealand on March 18 with Jackson on a fishing trip with his wife Fran and their two children . He wants to be alone, but the children get his attention and ask him if he's going to shoot the movie they saw in England.

This movie tries its darndest to capture that classic bad canadian movie feel : '' quirky '' and obnoxious characters and humour

I had no clue this movie even existed and I was thrilled to hear of it! (I was a bit concerned that this could have been '' the bad canadian movie'' that everyone was expecting.) I liked it as long as it was on for the entire movie and I never got bored of it, but it did get tiresome to see so many characters in a short amount of time.

In my never-ending quest to see as many quality movies as possible in my lifetime , i stumbled upon this movie and i found it really interesting and fun to watch . It is a romantic comedy directed by Anurag Kashyap and starring the famous actors Abhishek Chaubey and Sonali Bendre . The movie tells an interesting story about love and relationships of 2 young people and is full of humour and laughter . The main story revolves around the relationship between these two young people , which is quite amusing to watch , and i love the love story in the film .

When I think of a 1970s-period film , this is not what I think of . I do n't want to make any reference to this era, as I hate nostalgia, but it is just as important as what is happening in the present. This is not a film to watch for that reason alone. But I am going to put that aside and just enjoy this one. And the film does have a good plot, too, though it is far more simplistic than what we have been subjected to in the modern film industry.

imagination must of slipped Jim Wynorski mind when he wrote the script to this one . i do n't mind that at all . i just hope it is good . and hope that i will get to see the movie the same time as you will when it comes out . i do hope it is good. I've been meaning to check out this film for some time now but have never gotten around to seeing it. I don't know why it took me so long. I don't really like the genre of fantasy films but I'm looking forward to this one.

This was a great movie. It had one "sot-so-nice" outburst. Plus there were some very intense (drama) scenes which might make it inappropriate for younger viewers, under 6.For a under the radar film, the acting was quite enjoyable, and touched down in our family room for a near perfect landing. It held the attention of our whole family and we were kind of sorry to see it end.This movie had elements of spy kids with young people saving the day, but was given a somewhat more believable scenario. The dream scenes were a distraction at first, but did a great deal to establish the plot.

The 1998 version of `` Psycho '' needed to be set back in the 60 's , rather than present day , but it was a hit with fans and critics and the film could have been a success without it. This year , the movie is a remake of the original, with the script written by Steven Knight and directed by David Fincher , but it doesn't feel like an adaptation and the movie takes place in today 's time , not the 1960s , with the main difference being it's set in the city and not in the suburbs.

You know, I really hate IMDb's censor system, since my entire review is almost gone if you take out the cursing. But here we go. Editing time!Holy moley is this bad. I thought it might be a cool little movie, judging by the plot summary, since yknow I've blindly rented such gems as Frailty and American Nightmare before. But this is just abominal. It's about a killer who uses Edgar Allen Poe's works as reference for his murderous exploits, and the story of a detective who has to stop him.

Though it 's better than most made-for-TV movies , `` Buried Alive '' is nothing more than a run-of-the-mill revenge flick . The action takes place in the late '70s, when a group of young women are lured into the basement of an old house and brutally attacked by the husband of one of their attackers . Then, with one quick, brutal kick to a man's back , the women have their revenge on their own. Unfortunately for the film's cast and the audience, there are a couple of very serious problems with `` Buried Alive ' .

This show is terrible. I cannot get over the complete waste of great talent this show contains. This is not entertaining improvisational acting, it's just a cheap attempt to throw someone famous comedic actors onto a stage and have them perform a poorly improved scene. I have actually done improv work as an actor, and this show is not improv.What the audience is actually laughing at (if they're actually laughing at this show at all, it looks quite fake) is the embarrassment of the guest star being lost like a deer in headlights.

Boring movie . Poor plot . Poor actors . The movie happens in a room supposed to be in Morocco . There is a lot of sand on the floor but it doesn't feel like sand . There is a lot of sand on the walls but it doesn't feel like sand . There is a lot of dust everywhere . There is a lot of dirt in the room but the characters don't feel dirty . But why is there a lot of dust on the floor? Why isn't there dirt on them? Why does the floor look like it hasn't been cleaned?

I took my 14 year old to see this movie. We left after 15 or 20 minutes. It was absolutely awful! This movie should be rated R at the least. I am not that strict with movies but, this was just too much. It was a waste of money. I thought it would contain some comedy and I knew the comedy would probably be crude but, this was WAY beyond crude. I was sitting there watching and reading (a certain subtitle at the beginning of the movie was what really got me) and I could not believe how crudely sexual it was.

An excellent debut movie for the the director of Batman Begins , comes the Following , a movie about a couple of guys and women, that find themselves in the middle of an epic and dangerous adventure that will change their lives forever . following , in all its gory glory is a movie that, in a word , is good. it has great acting, great writing and a story that is well-paced , with a very interesting twist at the last act . it is a perfect summer movie . the only problem ? it is a movie .

Not for those adrenaline maniacs etc It 's a good movie , looking at after war , psychical problem , love problem , marriage problem and other problem in the movie , and how they handle the problem , and how they handle other problems . I am waiting for more movie in same genre in 2010 . This review has been rated: 5.0/5.0 - Good
Good movie. It is not perfect. There are some things missing in the movie. I liked this movie because of its story and dialogues. But some of the characters were not so great.

Plot Synopsis: Los Angeles in the future. Crime is kept under control by Core Trackers, android assassins dispatched by the United States Computerized Judicial System to execute the guilty. Secret Service agent Eric Phillips prevents an attack on his boss, Senator Robert Dilly (the man who set up the USCJS), by the Union for Human Rights, a group of anti-machine activists. Dilly attempts to initiate Phillips into his private circle but the SS agent goes on the run after witnessing Dilly murder a UHR agent in cold blood. Dilly sends Core Trackers after him.

This is a VERY good movie. I give it a 10.It's very different in that it's kind of a long stalking scene all the way through. The fact that the main character is mute is used throughout the story in a very believable way.She sees a murder (for a snuff-movie) and decides to run but is chased (this takes quite some time). I won't reveal the rest of the movie for it would spoil the experience, but rest assured: it's very believable, well played, very intense and has some nice surprises plus a great ending.Don't miss this movie.

It's a bit unnerving when a studio declines to screen a film for the press before it goes into wide release. That many movies suck is no surprise, but when a studio itself admits as much ahead of time, the process of movie-going becomes a passion play of sorts. Consider it an early Christmas gift from Hollywood, then, that "Aeon Flux" isn't nearly the affront to taste and decency one might expect, given the above. Though ultimately overwhelmed by its flaws, it at least has (sort of) an idea with which to toy around.

Wow! This is the movie that should be shown on TV at Two in the morning on Cinemax for all those insomniacs (lord knows they'd probably pass out from boredom watching this movie) Terrible acting, the killer is quite far from scary, I've seen clowns at carnivals that were scarier. Lot's of unnecessary 'skin' in this film, pseudo-porn scenes which are just horrible in more ways than a million, a gawdy soap opera style script which really hurt the movie and the director really had no flair for whatever genre he was trying to create with this film.

OK , most of us agree that this is a weak attempt at a remake , but at the same time I am sure many of us can agree on at least two points:

1. It's a great idea, and would make a really awesome movie. 2. It will be very, very hard for Hollywood to make. The film in question, however, will have to wait. I don't know why. There's no need to go to the theater or watch it on video because there's no way you could know what was going on, much less understand the subtext.

Not too good a movie. Sure, it contains action, but the effects aren't all that good for a '08 movie. Gunshot effects are downright horrible. Acting is "meh" It is nothing like Far Cry, other than names and the very basics of the story (genetically enhanced super soldiers going amok). The super soldiers are very different, the mercenaries are different, the setting are completely different (tropical island in the pacific in the game, island in northern-ish America in the movie).I loved playing Far Cry. I loved the story and setting.

All I can do is echo the sentiment already expressed by some of the other commenters. This is CITY OF GOD meets HAPPY DAYS. The bipolarity of the ruthless thug (one minute a ruthless killer, the next minute a Luv's diaper commercial) is completely unconvincing. You can approach it in one of two ways: (1) A gritty, realistic movie turned sappy; or (2) a sappy, ABC-afterschool-special with profanity, violence and animal cruelty. Either way it just don't fly, do it? Why then has it received so much praise?

There are places for political commentary in film, but "Masters of Horror" is not one of them. I get enough of this stuff from Newsweek and every other editorial in the newspaper. Now I've got to watch this in horror movies? C'mon! All I wanted was a good zombie schlock film, not another "Bush is bad!" rant. If Joe Dante wants to express his politics, let him go on Air America. And if you must insist on making a "message" film, be a little more sly about it.

What is night vision ? Well according to the star ( Williamson ) let 's see ... one package store, where the products of this store are sold is located ... on the roof top of this one building ... I have seen the image of the star ... what does he mean by this ? He seems to be referring to the building and roof top of this store ... According to the image of the store ... a very bright star is visible to our eyes ... the star is called ...

Well the star is on the building roof ... and visible to the eyes ...

Bad. Bad. Bad. Those three lines sum up this crappy little film that can only attract idiot children and their parents to the cinema. and its... #1 Movie in America! What is this country thinking? Mike Myers looking more like Micheal Jackson. Some Chineese lady that falls asleep within 3 minutes. A lame plot with dirty jokes. It's grotesuque and awful. When Green-Eggs and Ham comes out in 2005 I'll be so happy! (not) Eddie Murphy and Tracy Morgan will probably play two hipsters trying to find the lost Green-Eggs and Ham.

When naïve young Eddie Hatch, a window dresser at Savory's Department Store, falls for a statue of Venus and gives her a chaste kiss, Venus steps off her pedestal and gives Eddie more than he bargained for. This creaking example of what Hollywood can do to a Broadway musical manages to emphasize the inane story and eliminate most of the first-rate songs. The purpose was to make a safe, popular movie without too much investment while capitalizing on Ava Gardner's upward mobility to super stardom. Robert Walker as Eddie gets lost in a thankless role.

I am writing this review simply because I am a huge fan of the book, Prozac Nation, and was appalled by the film.I think that if you hadn't read the book, you would have been lost watching the film, as it provided no real back story to Wurtzel's depression. There was no real mention of her childhood (her relationship with her father, her experiences at summer camp, her first therapists (in fact, the film gives the impression that she has never been in therapy until Dr. Sterling)...).

this movie had me stuck in this endless loop of thinking about it for days afterward...granted i am not the movie snob that some folks around here appear to be, but i thought this was amazingly well-acted, and a powerful creation, if lacking a little subtlety in exectution. i happen to admire movies that can effectively recreate the sensation of watching a stage play, it creates an inharmonious eeriness that works well with this flick. i am also a great fan of alan rickman, so that might be my bias.

This turned out to be more of a women 's romance-soap-suspense film than what I hoped it was .... simply a story of two very strong women who could not live together as they wanted to and needed to separate so that one can continue their work and have the other for company. But the story was very interesting and you could see how both women were willing to do everything to succeed in their lives. It is not an easy read, and it makes me a lot less hopeful that we will see movies like this much in the coming years...

I'm a big fan of Patricia Hodge and Mariam Margolyes, so I watched this show when it came on A&E some years ago. The show was strange to say the least, but I gave it a chance because I liked these actresses. This has got to be one of the worst shows I've ever seen. I wouldn't watch it again and certainly wouldn't waste money on buying the video. The storyline of this TV version is ludicrous and just plain stupid! The "kicker" (pun intended) comes when Ruth has surgery done on her leg bones.

Deep Sea 3D is a stunning insight in to an underwater world only a few have had the opportunity to see. When we were kids, we used to go for rides on a submarine, and as kids we always wanted to go on one when we could, but we never had the chance. When I was a child, I didn’t even know if there was anything like a submarine until I started taking classes at university and discovered there was. You can’t really see the ocean on land, but you can imagine how amazing the deep blue ocean looks.

But I ca n't say how I really feel about this pile of steaming dung . Where to begin . . . On a daily basis I get messages and emails from people who either don't know that I'm here, or who don't believe what I say. They have a vested interest in seeing me disappear and in this they are right. But it's not like they can get to me. I'm protected and I'll be out of their reach soon enough. The first thing I have to say about the dung, is to say that you don't deserve it!

The cast and crew of this cheap horror potboiler are more interesting than anything that occurs throughout the movie itself; we have Barbara Payton, Raymond Burr, Lon Chaney Jr., Tom Conway, Paul Cavanaugh and Woody Strode in front of the camera and writer-director Curt Siodmak, cinematographer Charles Van Enger, editorial supervisor Francis D. Lyon and production assistant Herman Cohen behind it. The ill-fated Payton turns the head of virtually every male she comes in contact with deep in the African jungle where she lives on husband Cavanaugh's plantation: doctor Conway secretly desires her while hot-headed foreman Burr's approach is, quite literally, more hands-on.

Maybe it 's just that it was made in 1997 , or maybe whoever managed to get this up to the public service air waves is just as bad as the media. Either way, you can't expect much from it. I wonder how long before the average Joe and Jane get sick of this? How about getting sick of watching it, or hearing about it every day for months and months? Oh, one other thing. If the average person doesn't get sick of the TV show, then how does it continue to be produced and broadcast every night for nine years.

I sat down through 2 hours of pure boredom. I look here on IMDB, even though it is not high on the list, it is in the top 250. I was a little surpised. Even though, yes. I am very impressed with Robin and Matt's acting abilities, they still didn't save the movie. I'm not sure what I really didn't like about the movie. Maybe it's because I dispise math. Maybe I'm not too much for dreary talking for 2 hours. Even though I loved "American Beauty", but that was it.

Okay,I had watched this movie when I was very little and the day that we were cleaning out the closet I see this!I thought,"I have no idea of what this movie was like,"so I went ahead and put it in.OH MY GOD!!!! !This film is so darn bad!I never thought that this film could ever get as close to my least favorite film as it did,but I did laugh,because all the jokes were so corny and ridiculous,not funny!!!

His music , especially what we hear of it here , is very slow . From around the time of his birth until his death in 1882 , he composed only twelve songs . This makes sense when we realize he never played an instrument , had no money to buy instruments , and didn't have much of an education. In the years after 1855 , the family was forced to relocate to Philadelphia . It wasn't until he was in his mid forties that they moved again , this time to Newport, Rhode Island, where he was able to study with a teacher who was an expert in the guitar .

i was a huge fan of this series. Yesterday i watched it again on DVD. I was apprehensive about whether laughs would come or not? But in a few episodes i was laughing hysterically and some episodes were good. Acting wise Rakesh Bedi(Raja} & Satish Shah is brilliant whereas Swaroop Sampat is plain bad but I think she gets the job done. Maybe a better actress could have been used in place of her. This series shows what good, clean comedy is.If this series were to air in the current year I would have given it 9/10.

Love and war did happen on the other side of the iron curtain and by looking losely at it love was just as strong as in the West and war was often more poignant (should I say more realistic ? ).This film is as much about war and love as it is about the Soviet thaw of Mr K's era. It also reminds us than the best war movies were not necessarily made in the 1990's with rivers of hemoglobin and millions of USD spent on special effects and marketed actors.This movie is a classic of Soviet cinema and a outstanding picture of one of the greatest human tragedies : war.

The worst movie I have ever seen . The sound quality was bad , the cutting of the scenes was not sharp , there was no editing , no continuity . The acting was bad . There is no point in going to see this , you will not be satisfied . . . it is the worst movie I have ever seen . An absolutely atrocious adaptation of a novel with an awful script, and a poor story to boot. If you are not interested in the story then you will not like this film, if you like the story then it is well worth seeing.

This is an apocalyptic vision of the hell of our contemporary world . The social criticism of our shallow , superficial media has produced a public which is increasingly un-moved by truth. I wrote the following on the internet under my real name as part of the Guardian's attempt to get me sacked. I'm now going to repost it on this blog under my real name. It's the last thing I'll ever do. I know what I know. I have known about the war on terror since the invasion of Iraq in 2003.

Forget any angst-ridden documentary ! This film is really an out and out comedy about a 40-yer-old porn star whose sex life with a young student turns out to be much more exciting than he expected. But the movie has more than that, and its heart is firmly rooted in reality. Nanak Shah is the only woman in this film, but it doesn't matter. This is definitely not a love story, but rather a comedy with a happy ending. There's hardly any nudity, sex or swearing in the film, but you do have to be ready for them.

What can I say...not much to this one at all. Pretty dull and uninteresting.The actors performances are just OK. The only one that shines in any way is Simmons, but he only has, maybe 3 scenes. I understand that by keeping his screen time to a minimum he retains the mysterious psychic aura he has, but I can't help but feel his talent was wasted. No one else rose above mediocre.The story itself seems like it may be intriguing at the beginning, but then just doesn't go anywhere.

RIFIFI ( Jules Dassin - France 1955 ) To me , it seems a very risky idea to attempt a film about a man who can only think of sex from a moral standpoint. That said , I will take you on a journey that will make you ask , "What is sex? ". And I will ask the same question: What is the meaning of love? How are we to live , and how will we die ? How will we define beauty ? When did we come to love ? And what will be our final conclusion ?

Krajobraz po bitwie like many films of Wajda is , perhaps , not understandable for the `` rest of the world ' ', because of the language barrier , which was not considered a handicap in Germany , but is still a challenge in the English-speaking world . There is a reason why many of the scenes in the film are filmed in German , because this is where the film was mostly shot . However , the English translation is done by German-speaking, American film-critics, and this does not make for an easy read . One reason why Krajobraz has been so successful in its native country is , perhaps , the language barrier .

Camp Blood is an absolutely atrocious slasher film . We 're mixing Friday The 13th with the Blair Witch Project with the best of them as we discuss this film , this film and more film . So if you like movies with blood splattered all over the walls and floor then you'll probably dig this thing . You know the drill - a bunch of film nerds (and film critics) are sitting around watching a movie and they come up with a number of reasons why the film is awesome . That's what this week is about .

Wealthy businessman 's daughter , who as a young girl caught rheumatic fever and now suffers from a shortness of breath , died on the day she was scheduled to go to the hospital after having surgery on her hip. A day before her death, she was to be released from the hospital. She was suffering from a bacterial infection after an unsuccessful attempt to remove her hip pain by surgeons at the Cleveland Clinic. Now her family is asking for her name to be removed from any cemeteries, including the one at Forest Lawn, her home.

It may be hard to explain how , but this film is a masterpiece . Perhaps , because i never knew about the film before watching , i had forgotten how it was . And the same thing is true of the film . In the movie , you will watch a film that you would not have seen before . But , you do not have the time , to watch it . In fact, you have to hurry up . That is because , the film is a very intense one . It is very important that you watch it , and it is also important to remember the film .

I'd liked the Takashi Miike films I'd seen so far, but I found this pretty disappointing. I'd bought it, but I won't be keeping it.I saw it on the Adness DVD, which has just two episodes. In the first, a killer abducts women, cuts the top of their skull off to expose the brain, plants them in the ground up to their chin, and plants a flower in the brain. You can tell that from the DVD box. In the movie, the top of the head is digitally blurred out by TV static.

The incomparable Laura Gemser appeared briefly in an erotic scene from the French "Emmanuelle 2." This amazing woman did not go unnoticed, and was soon cast as the lead in this all new Italian series, where she is the centerpiece; a beautiful photojournalist who travels the world experiencing all the mysterious eroticism that the world had to offer. In this first installment, Mae Jordan/Emanuelle is sent to Africa to photograph the people as well as the stunning landscape and wild exotic animals. Much like Sylvia Kristels character, Emanuelle has not come into her own when it comes to being open and comfortable with her own sexuality.

I watched this movie recently mainly because I am a Huge fan of Jodie Foster 's . I saw this film when I had no internet access. I didn't expect to take in this movie just like that. I saw the film when it came out on BluRay but I didn't think that I would really go to that much of a stretch and watch this movie on my own. I am very pleased with this movie. The first thing that I have to say was that this movie is absolutely brilliant . I can't imagine anyone not liking this movie.

A group of adventurers travel to the 'dark continent' to try and locate a lost heiress named Diana, who disappeared years before in a plane crash, and who is now believed to be living with a savage tribe that consider her to be their goddess.Once again, my search for sleazy, European cannibal movies has taken me deep into Jess Franco territorya seemingly endless cinematic wilderness swarming with sub-par scriptwriting, crawling with crap camera-work, and abundant with awful acting (Franco regular Lina Romay taking the prize this time for her pitiful performance as an ailing, elderly woman).

I wo n't be too hard on this show because I enjoyed the first season , but then , things just kept going down hill from there. The writing and the actors just didn't work as well in season two and it's a shame that the creators and the producers didn't know better . The first episode was great and in my opinion better than the first season, but the second was just not up to par . It felt a bit rushed and like the creators were trying to fill up the story .

I watched this movie knowing that it would be awful, but damned if it didn't break new and revolutionary ground in the field of making fecal matter acceptable as entertainment. The plot is Deep Rising with cruddy effects and HORRID acting. The lines in this...well...wow there really is no way to put this movie down because i think the words have yet to be created in the English language. The sad part is that the filmmakers thought they were actually making something good. You won't believe your eyes when you see how many movies they ripped off without even trying to hide it.

I watched this movie and all I can say is this ... I am not a film student , nor am I a cinema lover, but I think it is not just a movie , this is an education about a person and his or her life and the society around them . If you are of a family, you would love to learn from it , if you are not , then leave it . I had seen it twice now and I have one comment . The first time I watched it I was really excited because of the trailer .

Well, to each his own, but I thought Gibson's Hamlet was the most god-awful rendition I had ever witnessed... as subtly nuanced as a paper bag, and as inspired as a telemarketing call. The only reason I watched the movie through to the end was that I held out hope that either it would get better or become unintentionally funny. No luck.No disrespect for the supporting cast or for Zefferelli's staging, but nothing can make up for the bungling of the main character. I have seen Hamlet well-portrayed as an African prince, as an animated lion, as a rough-and-tumble warrior, as a romantic poet, etc.

This made for TV film is about every cliché you can come up with for a disaster movie . The first shot is of a young couple that looks like they were in a music video. Then we go to a high school class that is going to a music recital . And we get into one of those situations where everybody is too busy to notice the warning signs . I’ll just leave it at that. This was one of those movies where it seemed like the entire cast knew exactly what they wanted to be doing, even though they had never acted in a film before .

This must be one of the worse movies that I have ever seen . On a par with Blair Witch or The Sixth Sense . In fact this should be a warning for those who are planning on seeing the movie or want to be in a group of people who see the movie. The story starts off with a murder , which is followed by the narrator explaining to the reader what just happened. It was a murder committed by a man or a group of men and it was a very gruesome and brutal thing.

There is only one word to define the whole movie , that is : awful . How `` Mostly Martha Jane '' came to be, is what I will be doing here . I guess it is a movie , I guess it should have been a book or a short story. I suppose that is the only way I can put it . I am glad I watched it . If you are a movie lover, you must see it . As for those who think they have seen it all . I think I can say that you have had your share and that you have had enough .

Why do people make bad movies? Didn't anyone working on the picture know that what they were making had no point? There is something about this picture that threw me off, besides the fact that I found this "movie" to be unrealistic, pathetic, and POORLY ACTED. I admire them for the try, but the "actors" in the movie at times seem to be trying to hard and no single character has substance or says anything mildly intelligent. This movie deserves zero stars. But I did not have that option, so it gets a 1.

Although I rarely agree with filmkrönikan , I have to say that this film while not awful , just did not really move me very much and it was just not that good a movie. The only thing I did really like was the opening and closing of it. The music was good, the story was ok, the dialogues were great but nothing really made it for me. The only part of it that could have used some work is probably the love scene between the main character and his girlfriend but it was not bad at all.

This move is absolutely, most certainly one of the greatest films of its, or any other, genre. Kubrick is not only one of the greatest directors of all time, but his entire filmography should be put into a time capsule and can never be forgotten. 2001: A Space Odyssey is a journey unlike anything I have ever seen on the screen. Kubrick is one of the few directors that can draw you in and keep you captivated from beginning to end, even with the absence of extended dialogue or plot development.

This is one of those movies the critics really missed the mark on . This movie is practically McHale 's masterpiece, but it doesn't stand up on its own merits. At the very beginning of its existence I was a bit disappointed in it. I wasn't expecting the story to be quite that great. What made this movie work for me was a few great performances, and the ending. If this movie was a bit more polished, I think the movie would have been even more satisfying. If you are a fan of cult classics, this is definitely a film you should check out.

I could n't stop watching this movie , though it was far past my bedtime . Comparisons to Hitchcock are a little too obvious , even if Hitchcock did make the most of a very different kind of psychological thriller " The Man Who Knew Too Much ." It's just a really good movie , with some truly wonderful performances from the two main stars . There's really nothing else like it . I haven't seen much of the other movies made from the book , but that doesn't mean I haven't read the books or seen the movies , or even the books in which the movie was based .

Being a wrestling fan, movies about wrestling generally suck (Backyard Dogs, Bodyslam, Jesse Ventura story) but this one isn't the worst I've ever seen. Yes its bad but its better than some of the others I've mentioned.Hulk Hogan stars as basically himself and for some reason, a rival network wants to beat him up because he doesn't want to be on that network. Let me explain it so everyone can understand....picture USA Network having Rip...and TNT will go to any lengths to get him.Does this make sense...no?

I ca n't believe this movie is getting the rating that it is here on IMDb . Of course , it doesn't do justice to what the movie is as far as its content is concerned . This is the second installment of the movie series . The first installment is the one that we all remember from the 80's . Now , I don't mind watching a decent action movie that has a fair number of fight scenes , and there is an average number of scenes which are of great quality , but I am surprised with the rating of the movie which is 3.6 .

I am so excited that Greek is back ! This season looks really eventful . Im glad that Casey is in this season so i can watch him on TV . The last episode of the first season was really good , im really looking forward to the second season . Lets hope its really great . I am really exited about this season and i would love to see it . Im glad they are going for a third season . The writers have to be really creative and i wish they would bring something new to this season . I hope they are able to continue with this story .

The first season was great - good mix of the job and the brother and friends at home. it was actually a pretty funny show.Now it shows up again and the brother and the two hot chicks are gone -- and the whole thing revolves around the airline company. Even the old man who runs the company has gone downhill - way too over the top, where before it was perfect.That and no more Sarah Mason - one of the best looking girls in Hollywood.This is what happens when you let some execs get their hands on a show.

Ty Cobb is , by far , the most interesting and belligerently insane athlete to ever live . His baseball career lasted for over a decade . In that time , he played in 1,500 games and won over 100 of them . He won the triple crown , a .300 batting average and 100 RBI titles . He won the MVP award . He set records for wins and strikeouts. He set record after record in strikeout . He played his entire career at the age of 22 . And , he's only played baseball since he was 4 .

There are two things that I noticed in this film. (This is not a spoiler, just a mistake in storytelling.) When Cole takes Bill to his first B&E, he finds the "box". As soon as Cole finds it he says, "The box. Everyone's got a box". A minute later, just before he dumps the contents on the floor he says, "We're actually very fortunate. You don't see these often".Observation #2 (Spoiler Alert! )I had to watch the thing three times, I couldn't figure a couple of things out.

If you want to see a brilliant performance of Mikado , played to perfection with expert timing and panache , you're going to have to pay a good price. You will, no doubt, have no problem finding the perfect place to perform Mikado — for free, for a small fee, or for nothing. The only problem is that you don't know what you're getting into. You have to know that you've got an audience before you go out there and try to make them feel something, and you have to get them into a state of euphoria.

This film holds 7.0 rating on IMDb , so even I sensed something rotten in it 's synopsis I decided to read it anyway. There is a scene in the beginning where the wife is shown a photo of a dead man and asks why he died. The police officer replies that the dead man is the husband of her friend and that the man is a suspected drug dealer. After the wife leaves, the policeman goes to another room in the house. The wife is still there. He says to her that this is what the police have found.

Frank Sinatra did so many excellent things in the world of entertainment that it's hard to single one out as the best. If I had to name the best thing he ever did, though, it would be his performance as Frankie Machine, the heroin- addicted musician and poker dealer who is saved, just barely, by the love of a good woman (played by an exceptionally babelicious Kim Novak). The "cold-turkey" scenes between Sinatra and Novak are terrifying and heartbreaking. The movie is very nearly perfect, in fact, from Saul Bass's title graphics to the ground-breaking jazz score by Elmer Bernstein.

River 's Edge is an extremely disturbing film written by acclaimed American screen writer Neal Jimenez.It is based on an actual incident, and takes place during World War II.A group of young men are sent on a long journey to escape Nazi occupation. Their goal: to reach a small town on the border of Nazi occupied France and Spain where their families can be reunited. The Film

Lets start with the Good, the Bad & the Ugly! This film is an extreme tale of fear. It was released in 1944, and portrays a young man, who had to flee from Nazi occupied France.

There really is only one reason to watch this barely adequate and utterly predictable movie about an uptight chef Kate Winslet’s career at the most popular restaurant in London—if you’re a fan of Kate, if you like watching people do stupid things, if you’ve seen The World’s Fastest Indian or if you’ve seen The Devil Wears Prada. So, you’re watching it. You love this movie. You love it a lot more than you should. And this is the point at which it’s best to say that you hate it.

My friends and I saw the movie last night in Austin at a showing for AGLIFF ( a film festival). The first thing I thought was that it’s just not that good and then my wife said I was wrong. Then we watched it again because I wasn’t sure if we’d gotten it or not. It’s a fun movie. The plot of the film is based off of the idea of “ancient astronauts” or “chariot builders” as seen in the movie Forbidden Planet.

You ca n't really blame the movie maker for glorifying Che because the industry is all about money . Most people will tell you, that if you want something to be real , you've gotta make it seem real . This is true in every industry , even the movie industry . One thing Hollywood does not shy away from is to make a movie that glorifies a person . It is almost always the result of making money first and foremost . It may seem hard to believe , but people in Hollywood do not take their jobs seriously at all , except when they are on a big movie .

I rented this one by accident. I lifted the video up and looked at the back and thought "shameless Blair Witch rip-off". Then, in a moment of carelessness, I grabbed 'The Francisville Experiment' thinking it was something else. My horror upon arriving home and realizing my mistake was far more terrifying than anything this film had to offer. Boring Characters, bad acting, and a feeling of 'we saw the Blair Witch Project and could do the same' permeate the action to the point where watching on fast forward will lead you straight to the credits.

I read a few reviews of the movie and got the impression that it was not as good as the trailer. What I don't understand is the fact that the trailer shows the movie in full color, with a black screen. Why didn't the producers just show it in black and white like they do with the book? What's the point in going over the same ground that's been done before? It just feels a bit repetitive. I have seen it. I thought that it was okay. I didn't know what to expect.

The only pure life , is one that ends with a signature in blood.So says Mishima anyway , a young man with a dream to go from being a commoner to being a man of importance in his own country. He does what is necessary to achieve this goal. But there is one problem – there is nothing that you can do to take your place among the great. That is why he makes his way to America , a country he knows to be the land where he can achieve his dream. He gets himself a job as a teacher and starts teaching the children.

The inspiration for the `` Naked Gun '' movies casts Leslie Nielsen - who had only recently started doing comedy roles - as a man on the run in New York City, forced to carry a gun because he is wanted for murder. He must use his skills as the best undercover cop in America to solve the case of his life and avoid the law.

'' That's when the idea of a '' Naked Gun '' movie took shape. It seemed a good idea, and the film was in the works for a few years, but it languished.

They said it would be a film greater than Turks Fruit . How darethey ? It 's not even 10 years since we got our hands on this film ! What was the matter with them ? Turks Fruit was a box-office hit, and this one will not even be half a year in the theaters! They should have thought about that before. I am not sure I will watch a film that has been made and not been even released! I will go and watch Turks Fruit on DVD, but that 's it! As far as I could tell, this film was pretty good for the time period.

1st watched 8/7/2004 - 3 out of 10 ( Dir-Brett Thompson ) : Silly , juvenile-focused movie about three kids on a cruise ship that goes missing for 6 months while on the high seas. There was not a whole lot of character development, which I think is a good thing because I don't know who these kids were or why they were on this cruise ship. There was a great scene where the three kids were on a movie that had no actors, so I thought I would give them a chance. I watched it with my mom.

Without saying how it ended , it is sufficient to say that the whole thing degenerates from about five minutes and thirty seconds into something which we can't even begin to imagine . . . I think you can see what a lot of people will think when this thing comes along . . . " (Savage, 1985)

### **"What Is This Mess"**

The "mess" is "what we're talking about" when we ask "What is the purpose of this mess" ? It is not just what we can see.

Disney-like entertainment with some un-Disney-like moments of graphic violence and sexual references . Lousy comedy alongside cliché-ridden moralizing . Noah Baumbach is at his best here, he's always better when he plays like an actual human being instead of a caricature. You have to watch this movie, it's worth the price. I recommend everyone to see this film, whether it's your first one, your 50th or you're trying to impress your girlfriend. This review contains spoilers, click expand for those. "It doesn't matter, as long as you're there."

How this character ever got hired by the post office is far beyond me . The test that postal workers are given on the first day of each month for a position as a postal clerk is whether or not one can read a U.S. postal letter and then write a check or deposit one into the U.S. bank account. If you can't, the post office will give you one year to make the switch, and if you can't or won't, they will put you in a training program for a different job.

So keira knightly is in it...So automatically we compare this film to attonement. Aside rom the fact that this film is also wartime and her appearance is uncanning, these films are totally different.The Actors work well, i think one good thing is there is no memorable person, they are a team.If you want a film where things happen, then id advise another as the story of this film is about human interaction and their physche's damaged by their experiences and how their lives are intertwined.This film have genuine interaction, perfect pause moments that make you hold your breath.

Rififi is a great film that is overlooked. It's a crime drama where a man gets out of jail and plans another job. It's an over used story but this one is different from the others. They round up the usual suspects for the job. This film takes a look at how the family gets torn apart as time goes on. The actual heist scene is one of the best I have ever seen. Instead of a suspenseful soundtrack the director decided to go with silence, around thirty minutes of silence. This fits the mood perfectly and is often copied these days.

I find it disconcerting that in an era when satisfying and fulfilling spirituality is unknown and we are all scattered across the whole spectrum of possible beliefs, that a charlatan and fraud of Gurdjieff's caliber (as a charlatan, he is exceptional; there is no denying he had a special gift. It's a pity he misused it, though, for the aggrandizement of his wounded ego, feeding on the adulation of unwary sheep who were at his beck and call and in awe of him) can inspire such extreme adherence and credulity.

This movie has an outstanding acting , by Marilia Pêra , and a stunning dicretcion by the argentine Hector Babenco , who directed it. This movie , in it s first act , is a classic story of the human condition , about a young man called Cesar Varela , an alcoholic who goes to work for a family friend in an estate in the south of Argentine, and tries to find out if he can be the man he wants to be . When Cesar returns home from this job the next day he finds out that his wife, who had left him, is now with another man .

I saw this film at the 2002 Toronto International Film Festival.This is the first Indian film I've seen in the Tamil language, and while it does share some similarities with other Indian films (wonderful music and choreography, sweeping storyline), the director attempts more than just to entertain. The film tells the story of Amudha, a precocious nine-year old whose parents reveal to her that she was adopted, thus beginning an odyssey that takes them all from India to war-torn Sri Lanka. Gorgeous visuals mix with horrifying scenes of violence expressly to make a point, though it is a simplistic one.

Not the best plot in the world , but the comedy in this movie rules . Kelsey Grammar is wonderful in this film and I hope he makes more films like this one . It's not perfect but you can watch it for free and it will take you some time to understand the movie . I can't say that the plot is so funny , I think that it's not that good , so if you don't like the movie that's not the point , because the humor is there , and it's just a few moments that makes you think , and you have to see it .

Like a lot of people, I loved the original; "American Graffiti" was one of the great movies of the 70s. The sequel, "More American Graffiti" is a horrible, depressing mess of a movie. It wasn't funny, the wide-eyed, likable characters had become cynical and jaded, and the stories were contrived (such as "Laurie's" character having another brother because Richard Dreyfuss didn't do the sequel and "Terry the Toad" and "Pharaoh Joe" somehow managing to serve together in Vietnam).

What are Forest Whitaker and Clifton Collins Jr. doing in this ? Light It Up is a ridiculously melodramatic piece of fluff by director Steven Spielberg. It’s silly in the extreme, which may, or may not be a good thing for this movie. The whole idea of this film is ridiculous, that’s what the film is really about. This is why this movie is so good. The plot is silly because the premise of the story is absurd. The characters are absurd. This is exactly what a good film is: A good film makes you believe something ridiculous.

This movie is an example of small budget , ineffective star cast , weak storyline and poor entertainment . This movie does not have any story . It is a waste of time . You will have to endure a lot of un-enjoyable situations . The movie is not even entertaining . The storyline is not good and the plot does not make sense . In the end it is just a waste of your time . It does not deserve your money or your attention . The characters do not act in a good manner . They are really annoying . They are so dumb they are unable to recognize their mistakes .

1st watched 8/7/2004 - 3 out of 10(Dir-Brett Thompson): Silly, juvenile-focused movie about three kids being zapped into their favorite cartoon with their parents experiment. The script left much to be desired in this Hanna-Barbara like rip-off of some Saturday morning 'live-action with people in dinosaur costumes kids show' with some goofy cavemen hanging around. Nothing really to admire about this and nothing much to be said either. I'm just amazed I found this at a Blockbuster video store as bad as it was and the way the stores are ridding themselves of old VHS movies.

I like Arnold, and I love the subject matter, but this was a very disappointing movie. When I first saw the previews, they were dark and ominous, and Arnold's name wasn't even mentioned. But I recognized him, which led me to believe that he was making a movie that had more of a serious, suspenseful mood. That it wasn't just another Schwarzenegger action vehicle (though I admit, most of his are pretty good!). He had, thus far, avoided movies with any real religious theme. And I was excited.

A very, very, very slow-moving, aimless movie about a distressed, drifting young man. Not sure who was more lost - the flat characters or the audience, nearly half of whom walked out. Attempting artiness with black & white and clever camera angles, the movie disappointed - became even more ridiculous - as the acting was poor and the plot and lines almost non-existent. Very little music or anything to speak of. The best scene in the movie was when Gerardo is trying to find a song that keeps running through his head.

Wow ! This is the movie that should be shown on TV at Two in the morning on Cinemax for those of you who are insomnia-addled people. I don't know what is wrong with me but I have no problem sleeping at 10PM. And when I am trying to doze off while watching TV, it's a whole different ball game. Especially when I am trying to watch a movie in HD. It's hard for me to fall asleep when I am watching HD TV. I guess what's really bothering me are those commercials.

I spent many a sleepless night after watching 2001. Not only because of the psychological horror (of which 2001 is a masterpiece) but also because of the way it brought me (a restless soul) some clarity to the way I observe the universe. It changed my way of thinking in a very profound way. And after reading the novel (by Arthur C. Clarke) I found myself once again inspired (a writer as I am) by the level of imagination.The Space Odyssey is not something one can just "go and see".

My Take : Steven Seagal is obviously too boring to be a lead in an action thriller , even a good one. How is he going to be a lead in anything without a good acting ability or an interesting character ? First, this film was supposed to be made with him in mind. He is supposed to play a tough detective who is not afraid of getting dirty and is good with the ladies. He would have been an interesting lead to me, as he is a good actor and I have a great interest in action movies.

Leonard can write lyrics , but he sure ca n't sing . Nor has he had an original idea in his entire professional acting career - not one. In my opinion, he only does what he is forced to do by the nature of his contract, not by his own talent and creativity, but the nature of his contract and the fact that he has been offered a contract by the most powerful entertainment group in Hollywood. If Leonard has any talents at all, I would say it's the ability to say one thing in one breath, and then in the next breath, make another thing up entirely.

I know that the original Psycho was a classic and remaking it was a mistake , ESPECIALLY a shot-by-shot remake , but i think it would be good to try it , because at least it would be like new and make up the lost time . So here are my suggestions , hope they are acceptable to people who have watched the original and liked it . First thing, i hope to remade it the way it was in the beginning : the story would be continued in a way that in the end it could not be done in the original film , because the ending of the original film left something to be seen .

After all the hype I had heard about the Jane Austin novel and different film versions of the book I found myself very disappointed with the movie. I had expected a classic drama but that was not the case. First of all let me preface my review with the fact that I love old movies, particularly mysteries and dramas, but not female oriented movies. This probably makes a huge difference, so take my review with a large grain of salt. I thought the acting was a bit over the top, but that is very common in movies of this era.

Wow -- this movie was really bad ! You talk about formulaic , typical movie plot ? Watching this movie was really bad, but there's some good stuff in it. I can't tell if that's the director's doing or the actor's. It was just awful and I thought the film was mediocre. I know I should not have rated this film so low. It was a step up, but there was nothing special about it. I'm surprised that this review has gotten all the way through but I didn't think there was a chance for it to get to the top.

Genius or utter madness? That depends on your interpretation of this film. I responded to it on the level of a self-aware "cop-movie parody", and I sincerely hope that was the intention as I don't see anyone taking it seriously! :-D Paul Rudd for one seems to be chewing up the scenery and really getting into the spirit of things! Is this film supposed to mark a departure for Rudd from his core background in the comedy genre? Some kind of insane attempt to reinvent him as a hard-boiled action star? I think not!

Yep, it's me again! Mr 'I sit through crap so you don't have to'.What do you think this is about? Could it possibly be about a woman who call a sex line and arrange to meet bachelors in a secluded area? Then her cross-dressing boyfriend comes along and slits their throat with razor, before they make off together with his cash? Wow, what a guess! And if I tell you that the cop who is put on the case is forced to team up with a sexy assistant DA to nail these suckers, what conclusion will you come to?

I never heard of Mishima before I watched this film and although parts of it are a little tedious, I still find myself drawn to watch it when it is repeated on the box. At the beginning of the film, we are told about a celebrated Japanese writer behaves like a lunatic and commits seppuku in public. As the film progresses you are gently inducted into twisted logic of Mishima's mind. The stages of his life are are presented in four chapters. Each chapter itself is a blend of two contrasting narratives, the first continues the story with scenes from Mishima's life and appear in black and white.

Okay , anyone looking to see a great work of art should NOT watch this film . A sophisticated film by a great director , not a masterpiece in any sense , a movie I would rather watch with my family and friends , in contrast with all the other movies with a great story or a great performance . A film where there is no tension , where there is no surprise , a movie which has all the elements I wanted from a film . A movie in which the music has the same tempo in every second .

It's a talking, trigger happy, alcoholic ASS COP! I have seen the first and second episodes. The artwork and animation fits very well (note the facial expressions, lol).
