The main character being a gun toting, badge wearing, pair of butt cheeks, shooting at whoever he thinks to be offensive or "guilty". So far, the episodes have had simple and followable plots that work very well with Assy's investigations. Don Sanchez, Assy's partner, play's the sobering retort to assy's A.A. antics and random "I've got a hunch" leads.

I was a fan of Buffy and hoped it would come to a proper end when Angel got only one more season. But when the end came closer I was exited to see that. And what did we get? This episode called "NOT FADE AWAY" was the very last one.I was so disappointed by this episode. This is absolutely the worst way to this series. Why couldn't it get a happy ending? Why did have a few of the main characters to die? Why did Angel not become a human and was reunited with Buffy again? No.

This is by far the most repulsive and atrocious version of The Scarlet Pimpernel ever to be devised . As in “I’d rather die than go to the movies, it’ll never happen!” Never. Ever. I refuse to have to go see this version of a tale which has been told more than a few times now in movies and books. This version takes the story of Pimpernel from the book by Henry Fielding with some of Fielding’s changes and changes the ending of the tale to a far more dark and sad end for Pimpernel.

One of my desires is to be a film-maker, and I just have to say there's no way I will be able to compete with the powerful drama The War at Home. The reason is because the acting is perfect, and when you see the movie, you'll know what I'm talking about. All I can suggest is watching it, I got so involved in it and was extremely impressed.Estevez's and Sheen's relationship on the screen was absolutely amazing.And so was his relationship with his mother (Kathy Bates). Some of the best scenes include these 2.

I saw this on a screener DVD a couple months before it was released.I liked the main characters and the overall story but some scenes are pretty sloppy and confusing. The sets were fitting but a few just looked like left overs from Freaks & Geeks or reminded me of a cell phone commercial shot in a middle class home. Definitely not what the DVD cover claims, "Destined to be the next stoner classic", hardly.Wardrobe and hairstyles are done well and yes, there are some really pretty girls in this, always nice to see a good looking cast.Almost every scene contained guitar that just droned on and on.

With some films it is really hard to tell for whom they were made . Huevos de oro seems to be one of those films which was made specifically for a younger audience and it’s actually quite fun to watch . I wouldn’t have expected to see this in Mexico , but now I see why it made its way to our market . The plot is really simple and there isn’t anything really complicated . It also doesn’t have the emotional impact that I’d expect to get from a film like this .

Here is a movie of adventure, determination, heroism, & bravery. Plus, it's set back in the late 1800s which makes it even more interesting. It's a wonderful, adventurous storyline, and Alyssa Milano is wonderful at playing the wholesome, confident, no-nonsense Fizzy...a great role-model. This is one of my favorite movies. It is a movie to be watched again and again and will inspire you and enrich your life without a doubt. Not only is the storyline excellent, but the movie also has fabulous scenery and music and is wonderfully directed.

There's a good running bit about the price tag of a silk negligee. The bimbo in the office shows off the bargain she got for $22 (closeup of tag). Later, Mary Astor finds the tag in the boss's bedroom (proof that bimbo slept with him). Still later, Mary Astor is about to have an affair with Ricardo Cortez, looks at the price tag of HER silk negligee ($14) and is reminded of how disgusted she was about the bimbo, as well as the fact that she's spent $8 less than the "most obvious" woman she's ever met.

The Soap is an interesting movie and very brilliant at parts . You must watch it for its strong characterisation , humour , humour , humour , humour , humour , and for one of the best songs in a movie today. I can't think of another movie with so many memorable scenes. It was the 1980's and the US had just invaded Grenada. Soap had just spent a year working in Haiti. And as the film progresses you notice that she has not lost a thing. She has not forgotten that place, and there are many moments when you wonder if she has.

What a mess--and I'm not referring to the "destruction" in the title. I could go on about the hackneyed plot, the lousy effects, the (actually notable) cast grimacing as they deliver the worst lines of their careers, etc. I'll just say there weren't any palm trees in Chicago the last time I checked, and leave it at that.Hmmm...need ten lines to get this posted on IMDb.. OK, well, I think a DVD release with outtakes could be interesting. Maybe Dennehy will reveal what favor got called in for him to appear in this thing.

One of the best of the 'kitchen-sinks'. Fantastic views of London and invaluable snippets of working class life of the 60's. Loach's eye seems to capture everything, yet makes no judgment - a taste of things to come. As with 'Kes', 'Riff-raff' and 'Sweet Sixteen', it serves as a cinematic social history of Britain. Carol White is completely convincing, you love her, fancy her, want to take care of her, but hold your head at her self-destructive decisions and still follow her in some vain hope.

This can hardly be called a good movie , actually it 's not even close . But I have to say it is the kind of film that you will like , or hate , or whatever you want to call them , when you don't really know or have a good idea what kind of a movie it is or what you like or don't like in it . It is a comedy , so I will try to give a brief description of it , maybe some of it will come across funny to you .

I generally LIKE Sion Sono's work, but this movie was completely retarded. But sadly, not retarded enough to make it entertainingly retarded. I just sat, mouth agape, wondering when it would end. The plot makes only a whisper of sense. I think it was intended to be campy. I mean, haunted hair extensions - how could it not be? But the humor, such as it was, fell flat. Not funny. Not scary. Not gory. I would say perhaps Sono was a hired hand on this project, but he appears to have written this boring trash as well.

This film is so 1980's and that is what I like so much about it. It does an excellent job of conveying the feel of that odd decade. The reality that Russian nukes could wipe you out at any time. Reagan in the White House telling everybody that things were great, while more and more social programs were slashed. Young people dropped out, but not as far as their parents of the 1960's did. Young people still went to school, they just smoked so much dope that their sensetivities were all but dead.

* Minor spoilers * I just wanted to say that for anyone who likes entertaining baseball films , this is definitely one of the funniest. It is definitely one of the best, and one of the best baseball films ever. As you may have noticed there is not a baseball game in this film. This is due to two factors. The first is that they are filming it on a set, and the set has a baseball diamond attached to it. This means that I will probably have to get up before dawn to see the film, instead of having it in a theater in the late evening.

I've been surprised by the enthusiastic response to this film. It seemed dull to me, much as I enjoyed looking at Penelope Cruz, and the plot details often poorly worked out. It also seemed like an intensely sexist film: if the gender roles were reversed, almost everyone with any sense would be up in arms complaining the movie is intensely misogynist. It's not just that both the principal males are portrayed as complete jerks and sexual predators, but also that the women are portrayed as almost flawless, forming a utopian community which lacks conflict of any kind and which rests on relentless generosity and good humor.

There is a point in the film where the female boss of the `` death machines '' ( a multi-ethnic prison where the inmates are forced to work in conditions that resemble slave-labor ) is having some trouble with her new staff. She says to the female guard who has come in the room: `` I need you to know that I have a lot of respect for my men, because I really do. However, there are certain men I don't know personally, and those I don't know at all, and I have some problems with those I don't know at all.''

This movie was lacking in a lot of areas. It's about this Elvis type guy who races cars and is approached by these BIKERS from SATANS ANGELS. One of them is named Banjo and they beat up college kids for fun. THey want the Elvis guy to be their "driver". At times, I wanted the folks from MSTK3000 to be quiet because the movie was actually kind of good. Sure, there was violence and a lot of cheesy lines, such as "What kind of beer do you want? A COLD ONE". That was cheesy.

San Franpyscho: 1 out of 10: So you want to make a serial killer movie. But your budget is non-existent, your camera equipment is elderly and your stars are Joe Estevez (Martin Sheen's younger brother and a staple in really bad movies) and Todd Bridges from Different Strokes. There are probably ways to pull of at least a watchable film. The Quiroz brothers have no clue.First of all much of the cast seems to have been chosen in a desperate attempt to make Bridges and Estevez look like Oscar caliber thespians. Really how hard is it to play a priest or an overbearing mother?

I remember watching this movie on TV a few years back . It was so bad , I can only say that I found it funny (I was 8 years of age at the time I watched it) . My brother and I would have a good time at my parents . I remember him showing my mom some of my video tapes which I had taken , he showed her how to slow my tapes down so she could understand . I have no idea if he showed her how to slow the speed down to match my brother .

This film is a nightmare! The sensation you feel when you wake up from a nightmare is the same I got when I finished watching this movie: "UffOK, it ended, what a relief!" I felt pain watching this movie, so bad it was! It's a B-series low cost movie, that's for sure, but I think it not an excuse to be so bad! I've watched brilliant low cost movies, with nice plots, nice production, nice acting, and most of all, some substance! This one got nothing of it!

I think "category 6: day of destruction" was very unrealistic. The digital effects where like a children's cartoon. The actors didn't act realistically, for example, when the girl was shot she acted like she got tomato sauce splatted on her. The movie was boring but I watched it because it was on. The only interesting character was Tornado Tommy, he was funny!Please keep the special effects real.I liked the comment: "What did we do to p.i.s.s-off Mother Nature? "I don't know what else to write to fill up the 10 lines.

I caught this movie late night on TV, and was expecting a low-budget campy "masterpiece", I was surprised with a pretty decent movie. Angelina Jolie's unique acting capabilities (or should I say lack thereof?) make her perfect as an android, and the other actors, while terribly average, are at least not terrible.There is a plot; a fairly intricate plot at that, involving conspiracies and the lengths a couple (one human, one android) will go to pursue their illegal romance, with a "big brother"-type figure and android assassin thrown in the mix.

Naach would have won an Razzie for the Worst Film in 2004 (may be overall too) if it were global. When it comes acting badly (aka showing attitude/yawning/over (not) acting) Halle Berry is no match for Antra Malli. While the catwoman had storeline, supposedly hot actress in microscopic costume, and some action sequences, Naach had nothing at all.One of those movies which makes me wonder why IMDb does allow one to rate a movie as 0/10. Yet again, I think that movie does not even deserve a 0. It has to be something negative or minus infinity.OK what about the plot outline?

This is a entertaingly bad b-movie. Actually it really is much better quality than a lot of b movies. It had a consistent script, decent direction, cinematogrpahy, and I have seen worse acting. The zombies were great, clearly these were Romero zombies, and was really a interesting zombie story. Obviously not Oscar material, and if your not into zombie movies, or b-movies you probably wont enjoy this, but if you are you'll like this movie.The main clint eastwood knockoff western character guy is pretty good, although they never really clearly explain how he can heal himself from gunshots and zombie bites.

It 's hard to believe that there are some people out there in the world that actually think this is a real job, that a man can have a 'job', and make a living by doing something that they actually don't love doing at all to the point that they actually hate what they're doing. What I have found is that while you do need to learn about the law and how it works in this country to be considered a lawyer, the real skills that a lawyer should have is the ability to think, to communicate, and to think like a client would think.

I saw this version of Hamlet on television many years ago, and have seen every other version since, whether television or movie. However, this is the one that remains the truest depiction of the story for me. Most excellent Derek Jacobi made Hamlet *real* for me. Before I saw this version, Shakespeare was simply gibberish to me and I never tried to understand the Elizabethan English. Having seen Jacobi's Hamlet several times not only increased my knowledge of literature, but also that of my family. I promptly checked the play out of Library and read it, and poured over the accompanying recording.

It's said that this film is or was banned in the US since it was released. Since there is no information on IMDb I must rely on my other sources and believe it. If this is really true, the movie is even more hurtful and frightening and is it is anyway.The movie is a so-called mockumentary, although I think the topic is too serious call it like that. It creates a scenario where America is like a military state and all revolutionary objects are arrested immediately without proof. After an obligatory tribunal they have to decide if they go to prison for some years or choose the punishment park.

One would have expected Hitchcock 's return to major studio filmmaking to err on the side of chastened caution . however, the master of suspense remains the same, he just does a far better job of hiding it. . to be sure, there have been moments in his filmography that have earned the title of "bad movie," but in terms of his entire output, you could argue that his first three feature films are the best of the lot . and that's saying something. . i'm not going to say that any of those movies is a classic, but neither are they all terrible .

Duncan Roy 's writing and direction is really , and regularly , below par . Actually it sort of stinks that he isn't given the respect he deserves , and that it's been allowed to get to the point where people are actually starting to criticize him on here for it . So, if you love the hell out of Duncan 's music , or if you 'd like to try and convince Duncan that we 'd be a better couple if he took better care and more time to write and direct, this is a petition for you , Duncan .

This movie is like Happiness meets Lost in Translation with a Sixth Sense ending ( or maybe a Crying Game ending? I dunno). I think it is one of the most original and entertaining movies I have seen. I highly recommend watching this movie if you have seen it before. If not then you have a new movie in your hands and you need to do what any self respecting film lover will do…watch the movie. This movie is amazing, funny, and moving. I hope you will watch it for yourself and enjoy yourself.

I do n't understand why this movie was released , it looked like something that you show your mates after a few drinks at the pub when you are too tired for the cinema , it should be called "I do too much" . I have to say i think it looks like something you should see in the theatre at 1 am after a night of hard partying, just so you have something to justify your drunken behaviour. I am one of those people who has seen it twice already and I have to say I think this is the most disappointing movie ever made.

In fact it was awful. The main chick in it who gets topless was obviously sleeping with the director at the time. It was shot at some warehouse most likely owned by family or friends. Also they chose not to bother coming up with a story. Sure these are ways to cut cost, but are they smart ways of keeping costs down? No they aren't. At the very least they could have found a middle school student in a "creative writing" course. Those kids may have at least had a lesson about story structure.

This self-important , confusing b+w `` film '' watches like an infant on a very bad acid trip . You can tell it's B+W by the way it plays with the camera and the lighting . It seems intent on trying to tell us who is talking and who is the speaker , when in truth it doesn't have the cojones to make that claim . But what it does do is to give us all the answers you could possibly want to ask it. It does that by turning the camera and the lighting on .

I 'm really surprised seeing all these positive reviews for this movie . Do n't get me wrong , it is a very good movie , it has some very interesting parts in it and some of the performances are very good. I have to admit , I have watched it once or twice before . And that was the first time I have watched it on dvds . But I have always liked it . This time around , I am enjoying it more . I just love the concept , and how it came about , so I will try my best to see it again , this time .

This film is absolute trash and proceeds to become even worse towards the, very protracted, end! The plot is confused and laboured, the actors have a couldn't care less attitude (maybe they were paid in advance - bad move, or knew they weren't going to get paid), and the sets were featureless, boring and cheap.I fell asleep twice and actually decided to not bother with the last 5 minutes as I assumed the actors would have fallen asleep themselves by then. More unrecoverable life time wasted!If you must watch it, then take it to the bedroom and forget the sleeping pills for once.

What ever happened to shows with united parental figures? The parents in this show are nearly as irresponsible as the children. Instead of punishing the youngest child for being manipulative, they let her get away with murder. They can't ever agree on a course of action when it comes to dealing with the children, and instead they do nothing. Yeah, great plan. Just ignore their behavior because they're "cute." This show tells the already manipulative preteens that watch it that the "divide and conquer" technique is the best way to get their parents to "cave."

I was hoping that Pulp would be a interesting movie, but was profoundly disappointed.Pulp has very little storyline, and what there is never holds your interest. It was a real struggle to keep watching it. When its over you say to you self "huh? that's it?!?". This is one where you think after watching it - why did they ever bother?Its too bad since Michael Caine is a good actor. I was also hoping to see the great Lizabeth Scott in this, but she only appears on screen for a total of perhaps one minute.

I have always loved old movies but this is one of my top ten favorites...it has all the charm, 1940's quaintness, and good old fashioned romance and it's hilarious, to boot! Barbara Stanwick plays an independent single woman who writes cooking\home life articles for a famous magazine...under the premise that she is a married homemaker. Even the president of the magazine is under this delusion. Enter a handsome GI, (played by the talented Dennis Morgan)just rescued off of a raft along with his buddy.

Clearly this would have had potential in more capable hands , but given Uwe Boll 's track record it would not have been good. I have a few thoughts. - If they could have just had him do the show, I think I'd be OK with it. - In hindsight I'm not sure that they really had the resources to get this out and in the air in a short period of time. The idea of this being a tv movie with a limited budget seems like a bad thing to me. And I think it would have made the show seem like a tv movie more.

Young , ambitious nurse Ms. Charlotee ( Rosie Holotik ) is sent to work at a mental asylum out in the country. She meets and falls in love with a doctor, played by the excellent David Strathairn , and he leaves her. Ms. Charlotee has her own apartment, so it’s only logical that she takes up residence in David’s house. But the place has a creepy history, and it turns out that she is just the latest victim. There is a great scene early on when Ms. Charlotee tells her daughter about the doctor.

I remember the events of this movie , the ill fated cruise of Donald Crowhurst in 1968 , in the days of my first sexual experience . A cruise that would end in tragedy . The movie ” Cruising ” was filmed in the year 1972 , in the same place where the movie was also shot , in Santa Barbara , California . The movie “Cruising ” was directed by , , and it was adapted into the musical ” Cruising .” The movie ” Cruising ” was inspired by the events , in the same place at the same time of , in , in the year 1968 .

I rated this movie a 3 and that was generous. The scenery is ponderous and gaudy, the acting for the most part is terrible. I do think Peter O'Toole did a good job of acting (Tiberius), but he must have been mortified when he saw the final cut of the movie. John Gielgud, howsoever brief his appearance in the movie, still seemed to be playing a role from Hamlet. The hard core pornography parts were neither erotic nor did they do much to further the story. Okay Malcolm McDowell had a nice butt and the guy who played Macro was handsome.

I don't know what it is exactly, but the film is happily sitting on my shelf, with no thought of ever leaving me...Fulci has crafted one of the most ridiculous, bizzare, cheez-infested and well unique movies I've ever seen. Not sure what else to say about it, but I LOVE THIS MOVIE!!! The steak tartar scene is absolutely uproarious, and the whole nazi torture orgy fiasco is strangely hilarious...I'm not sure what Fulci was trying to do, but has anyone heard that, based on this film, Fulci accused Wes Craven of ripping him off with "Scream"?

Spoof films have come so far since Mel Brooks in 'The Producers ' ( 1968 ) said `` Do n't talk about it '', because then they know it's real. That's what the movie spoof is all about '' ( See ' Do n't speak of it ' ). And the more we can make the movies of our imaginations, the less that will be made of us by others. So let's spoof our film-going habits. In doing this, we will also find that spoofs have become part of our culture rather than part of it.

Okay , When I bought this flick I though this got ta be the ultimate b-movie , space monkey landing in the middle of a battle with alien robots . But I was wrong , it was great , I guess i need to see the whole flick to understand but I thought it was a little bit more over-the-top in parts . So , I'm sitting here on a rainy day in the basement of my local comic store and I get this idea and I've been sitting on it for the last hour or so . The idea is this : Why can't I make a super hero movie ?

Why would I say that ? Because when the movie ended , I was in a good mood . So what if it ended with a bomb ? I didn´t care at all about that part of the film . I wanted to finish the movie , because it is still one of my favorites of all time, and when I saw the film , I liked it . So what is the problem ? The film is about a man who loses his wife in a terrorist act . The film is about loss, and the fact that there is no escape. We all know the feeling.

Its my favourite film because there 's so much going on that you do n't see at first and so many characters that you want to get to know them better. I've never been able to watch the film again after I saw it again. It is amazing how much you can get from the movie if you just let it do all of the talking. It’s hard to describe, but I would liken it to being in a beautiful place when you just start to feel your heart open up and let go of whatever it is that has been controlling you for so long.

A group of environmentalists travel to an island to uncover a secret lab that is experimenting on animals . When they get there, however, they discover they’ve been duped by an animal lover who tells them that the lab is for scientific research, not animal experimentation. The island the group is on has no inhabitants other than animals they are brought in for experimentation and the scientist who runs it has a very particular way of doing it. He also doesn't like animals being around his lab, so he locks the island up and the animals on it inside.

i watched all of the doctor who episodes that my local PBS station played while growing up . ( got to watch my favorite show) I'm not saying I'm the same person I was at 18 or 21 years old but I still look back at the episodes and wonder about the stories told in the show and how things would've played out differently had I or someone similar to me been in that scenario. There were so many different scenarios, that I can't think of a single episode that I saw on that show that I didn't wonder how it would all turned out.

I did have some expectations from this film because 1 . It was a Yash raj production 2 . When I read the plot I thought this film will be a horror flick . But after seeing it I think it will be an interesting thriller film . I thought it would be a horror , but I was pleasantly surprised . This is a good film which is entertaining and you will enjoy it . The film has some good and bad acting in it . The film is full of fun and there is even some comedy in it which is really nice .

I love these awful 80's summer camp movies. The best part about "Party Camp" is the fact that it literally has no plot. It simply drops a weak batch of "characters" into a location and then things occasionally happen. The cliches here are limitless (SPOILERS): the nerds vs. the jocks, the secret camera in the girls locker room, the hikers happening upon a nudist colony, the contest at the conclusion, the secretly horny camp administrators, and the embarrassingly foolish sexual innuendo littered throughout. The only cliche missing is the presence of Corey Feldman.

I don't know what neighborhoods the folks who wrote the rave reviews for this movie live in, but I'm glad I'm not there if they don't comment on the cartoonish-ness of this thing. Okay, we learn to suspend our disbelief in films like the "Die Hard" series, but seeing little Jodie knock off a whole street gang, with a Glock, as a NOVICE yet...c'mon. All she needed was a bald head and a ripped T-shirt and she would BE Bruce Willis. Apparently, Jodie being the executive producer blinded her to what a joke and waste of her money this would be.

In Everything Is Illuminated , Elijah Wood plays Jonathan Foer , a Jewish American who is looking for the woman he believes was his love interest in his past. As Foer travels back to his past through time, a string of coincidences bring Foer into direct contact with his former lover , a woman who has the power to alter time and space to change what happened between them. With Foer and the woman trying to understand how time and space might have changed them, the film is a quest to discover how to understand our relationship to the past and the past of a relationship.

A CBS radio program entitled `` We the People '' assists in finding an American home for Vienna refugee Charles R. Schumacher, who fled Austria after being sentenced to four years in a labor camp for refusing to sign a pledge refusing to make war on Germany. A CBS radio program entitled ``We The People'' finds a home for a Vienna refugee fleeing Nazi persecution. Austria 's last hope for Charles Schumacher, a refugee with the courage to refuse to accept a life sentence in a Nazi labor camp, died Monday at his home in Texas.

I was n't expecting much out of this movie and I was slapped in the face . Julie Walters , in her first big role , is so terrible that I had no intention of watching the movie . The movie suffers for lack of focus . The story line goes on for a long time and Julie Walters has one line that says everything that needs to be said . She plays it so well and I have seen so many great actors in great movies , but I could not see Julie Walters in my dreams . The other thing is the script .

Wow. What can I say? I was born in 1960. I love bad TV movies. Love them. I get involved. The works. I want to get involved. I'm spending time watching the thing. I watched the emmys last night on TV. How in the infinite world was the Empire Falls (excellent name)TV movie up for any awards? It truly had wonderful talent. Of course. And they tried admirably. But how can ANYONE pretend that was an OK (tv for goodness sakes) screenplay? OK direction?

I found this movie to be a big disappointment, especially considering the cast. The characters are not believable, as are the ridiculous circumstances in which they find themselves. The only part of the film I enjoyed was when the most annoying characters finally get killed. The special effects consist mostly of scenes of gory dead or dying bodies. A typical unimaginative slasher flick.It's hard to believe, make that impossible to believe that a reclusive creature that sneaks up on goats in the middle of the night could be captured by a group of clumsy, noisy idiots.

Terribly disappointed with CITY OF MEN after being swept away by CITY OF GOD. Lost is the exciting and unpredictable storyline, and instead, in its place, is bland predictability with the obvious attempts at audience manipulation by a superficial pretentious production and distribution team. This story ended up feeling like a sappy soap opera rather than a gritty indie feature, which is what is should have been. This is what happens when distributors try to seek a wider audience (ridiculous sweeping shots of the Rio coastline, etc) at the expense of a gripping story and characters.

MINOR SPOILERSMisunderstood classic remains one of Henson 's finest and most personal films . It may seem funny to call the film "unfinished", but in the hands of the right writer/director/star it could well become a masterpiece . But even at this early stage in the process , it's worth remembering that this film was never meant to see the light of day . It was Henson's masterwork , it's just that no-one saw it. So how do we know what to believe? It would seem the truth lies in what we do NOT believe , rather than what we do believe .

This movie is not just good, its amazing. Besides providing us with good performances, original plot, fantastic special effects, thoughtful messages and a lot more, it was an, until then, completely unseen world to the public. This is the first sci-fi movie that takes us out into the unknown space of our galaxy with such splendid effects and mind bursting reality that the audience is left without words. I am only 16 years old, and therefore I was raised into a world of modern effects and 3D animations in the movies.

This movie is a terrible attempt at a spoof . Its attempts to parody various sports movies are half-baked and poorly executed, but there are some hilarious jokes and moments. It's a movie that I would watch if it were in a theater, just so I can laugh. It's not that funny, though, and isn't really a spoof, it doesn't even attempt to be a parody but it is an attempt. There are a few good moments and some funny jokes throughout but it's a pretty poor effort.

I am writing this with 10 minutes left before the film finishes . I feel comfortable writing it now , because I’ve never written my blog with less time to go . I can say that this experience with the film is the most interesting and interesting to me . I have not read many of the films that have been adapted in this way and I don’t believe that I have ever seen a movie in this way . There is a story that comes from the book and it is not the only story but the main story .

This movie is such a fine example of the greatness that is 80 's entertainment . Oh do n't get me wrong. I am not saying it's "great" per se, it's merely great in the way you just described, but it's certainly very entertaining. And that's just what I love to see in a good 80's film. And this is a classic. I'm surprised how many people remember it as a "classic". I didn't. This movie was great! I just remembered how much of a fan of "The Thing" I was in '86!

I don't understand why this movie was released, it looked like something that you show your mates after you borrowed your mums handycam she bought in 1987. I am Australian and work for a video store in the UK and thought that if an Aussie film made it into our store it can't be all bad... boy was I wrong!If anyone writes a good comment about this movie they are either lying or the makers of the film.The picture was BAD, the sound was HORRIBLE and the acting, oh the acting, it was the WORST acting in the HISTORY OF FILM.

I watched this on HBO because it won the Oscar a week earlier . It compares favorably with fictional courtroom TV dramas I've seen (Law and Order, etc) for a courtroom drama which doesn't try to be too realistic. I think you could get away with more realism but it doesn't work if you try for too much. This is a very well done, thought out and very well cast show. It's been a long time since I saw an HBO courtroom series but this has been a long time coming.

Filmmaker Bryan Forbes , who once displayed a light , sardonic touch with beguiling material such as `` Whistle Down the Wind ' '' and `` High Noon '' , once again demonstrates his characteristic wit and humor in '' I, Too'' ( Dir. George Roy) , a charming, funny comedy which has all the makings of one of the year's best. There is something to be said for the fact that few of the most memorable movies of this year are even remotely based on plays. Nor are the films any more or less worthy than they are to be classified in this way.

I too saw this film at a film festival , but unlike the previous poster I found it both interesting and entertaining. In fact it's one of the most interesting films this year , and probably the most entertaining film I've seen from 2012 . The film itself is based on a true story , which is actually a little hard to swallow as it makes it sound as if this film was set in the past and was just a re-telling of the past. However, it is actually a fictionalized version , and the film is set in a place that was once a bustling metropolis in a past century.

Whoa, this is one of the WORST movies I have EVER seen! The packaging for the film is better than the film itself. My girlfriend and I watched it this past weekend, and we only continued to watch it in the hopes that it would get better...it didn't...The picture quality is poor; it looks like it was shot on video and transferred to film. The lighting is not great, which makes it harder to read the actors' facial expressions. The acting itself was cheesy, but I guess it's acceptable for "yet another" teenage horror flick.

Recently I borrowed a copy of this mess of a movie , which took me three sessions over three days to finally watch with my young son. I had been hoping to convince myself to give the movie a go on the big screen rather than streaming, but I’ve decided it’ll just be better if the kids can’t see me in it. Now, if I had been able to see the movie in its entirety, maybe it would be easier for me to write about. But the fact is, the movie’s been sitting on my Netflix queue since early August.

Bad, bad, movie, so bad it is worth watching. As long as you watch this movie knowing that it is bad and you'll be spending 2 hours of your time watching a bad movie, it's worth it. The special effects are cheesy and the animals look fake and the acting is bad, but watching the faces of the actors as they try to look frightened is just very funny. If your sister is about to be eaten by a giant komodo dragon wouldn't you do a little something to try and save her?

There is one adjective that describes everything about this film - acting, plot, effects, continuity, etc. - and that word is poor. The government wants to asses the effects of space travel on certain organisms but the capsule crashes and a mutant something-or-other (looks like a guy in an ape suit with the top of a football helmet over his face) wreaks havoc around the accident scene, which includes a favorite place for the window-fogging, partying set. Therefore, some young people - as well as a law enforcement officer - are among the creature's victims.

The Vietnam War era is certainly far before my time, but it has always interested me, and I have seen many films about it. All of the others I'd seen had dealt strictly with the front-line of battle. When I read a description of "The War At Home," I found the concept intriguing. No Vietnam War movie I'd ever heard of talked about what happens to a soldier once the fighting is over with. One night, while flipping through channels, the movie aired on The Sundance Channel. I set down the remote and settled back to watch it.

The acting is awkward and creepy, and not in a good way...at all. The writing, the dialogue, and the chemistry between the actors is horrible. Nothing makes sense and every close-up of an actor's expression or reaction lasts 3 or 4 seconds too long, making it seem like a Mexican Soap Opera (telenovela). Everything about the writing is unrealistic, and all of the actors involved make it that much worse with their campy interpretations of the script. Am I the only one who sees this???

Strange , often effective hippie zombie flick , starring the unforgettable husband/wife team of Alan and Anya Ornsby , this film is one that I've been meaning to see since I saw it as a child and even then I thought it was funny. I saw it twice , the first time when I was a kid in the back of my Uncle's Buick , the second time was at a movie festival a few years ago and had never forgotten how much I liked it . As a child I was enthralled watching this film , it wasn't just because of its comic value .

This movie was lacking in a lot of areas . It 's about this Elvis type guy who races cars . I 'm not into this kind of music . The guy in the car , he's just a poor kid . This is his story . I just feel sorry for him . The director of this movie did not care for his cast , and that's the problem with this movie . The main stars are all terrible . The only one who did a good job was Tim Allen . The problem with him is that he's so good that it makes the entire film seem like bad .

I have to say this is better than most SyFy outings , but that is n't saying much.The plot is pretty good , but the ending is stupid and confusing . I have no idea what happened, except the guy in a suit who had a knife to my character's throat as he was trying to rape her. He is somehow the only person I saw die. I don't think the ending is bad though. There is a lot that happens that's good and that we don't get to see and it all adds to the film.

First of all, the nature in the movie is beautiful, and there is a bit of Mongolian music. Well, the horses looked Mongolian and the camels, but that's about all what was Mongolian in it. Oh, Borte is played by a Mongolian actress, albeit a lame performance. But she is pretty, which redeems a bit the lack of performance on her part.But, I totally failed to understand what was the point of this painful-to- watch piece of 1.30 hour fantasy created by Mr.Bodrov. The plot totally lacked any sense of cohesion.

I 'm trying to understand what people liked about MirrorMask . I am an avid film viewer and hobbyist film lover but have only just recently become interested in anime. I know there are quite a few anime I 've not seen but there are also ones I've seen that I 'm not so much into. So I have a few questions about it and I 'm curious if I could get some feedback on what anime do you prefer ? Thanks in advance :) . 1 . What do you prefer about the anime you've seen.2. Any anime you would like to recommend.3.

I waited a long time to finally see what I thought was going to be a fun caper flick and it was a lot of fun. As far as this film is concerned I was pleasantly surprised and was impressed with what I had been led to expect and was a bit let down I had a few minor complaints with it. Overall I was happy with it but had a few gripes to pick out with the story and a few other things. I am glad I did see the film but there are better movies out there that I could’ve watched.

Wow, I was really disappointed. I wasn't really planning on seeing this movie in the theater, and I wish I stuck to that plan. It really should be a made-for-tv movie. I was kind of excited to see it, as I'm a big fan of Fairuza Balk, but this movie didn't do her justice. Infact I'm a little disappointed with the acting all around. What a horrible cover up of Fairuza Balk's tattoos, it bothered me every time I saw her shoulder. There was no flow to the movie, it was very hard to get into it.

It could be easy to complain about the quality of this movie ( you do n't have to throw cartloads of money at it!) but i don't think its as bad as it could have been. If this is the best version of the movie, then theres alot to be thankful for. If not then theres plenty to criticize and nitpick about this film. I'll give it a 5/10, because the script, scriptwriting, and the way it's shot just doesn't have the same quality in this version. If you watch the original, there are alot more plot holes.

"2001: A Space Odyssey" is set in 2001 and the main character is HAL. A computer. That's right, a computer who talks and thinks entirely on its own. This was made in 1968 and to think by 2001 it would be conceivable that computers would talk is a joke. If this was in 3064, a talking computer that had emotions and made its own decisions would be considered just as moronic as this. There is nothing in this film that provokes any kind of emotion. It provokes two reactions and one is called: sleep.

The reality of the mafia environment is absolutely dog-eat-dog where a gangster will be killed for showing any sign of weakness, so don't worry about this unless you're in that kind of environment. If the gangster is a hit man or an assassin in the mob, don't expect too much help. The mob will kill him first. The best advice I can give is be careful. A lot of gangsters will tell you to run, because they are so good at hiding their tracks. Some of them are so smart that they don't know it.

I love dissing this movie. My peers always try their best to defend it, probably out of love for Quentin Tarantino or Harvey Keitel, but they'll never convince me that this one should be treasured. Here's some huge reasons why: A: The plot goes from kidnapping road trip movie to vampire-inhabited strip bar slasher flick with no set-up whatsoever. Suddenly something very real turns into something very fake, which is like sitting the audience down to a Thanksgiving feast then exploding it with dynamite. B: That untalented Juliette Lewis is in it.

Ah , another movie with motorcycles , hell 's angels posse and Steve A-Lame-o as the not-so-cool car driver . and i like it , though i can't figure out why anyone would want to go to the movies anyway . this is the story of " the love 's journey " which i thought was very good , until it turns into a car chase . and now here we are , in the world of motorcycles , with no story whatsoever . i guess it's time to pull out my copy of " the book of motorcycles " and see if we have anything new in common .

Donald Sutherland, an American paleontologist visiting England, picks up a hitch hiker one evening. Two years later, having discovered the man's address book in his car, he returns the book to the man's opulent home, only to find that the man's been hanged for murder. Nobody in or out of the family seems to care that the hitch hiker could not have committed the murder (of his own stepmother) because he was in Sutherland's car at the time of the crime.Sutherland is the man's alibi but he's turned up too late.

This must rate with the worst films I have ever seen . It just was n't funny . My wife and I were watching it at a midnight showing and we both thought this would be a great movie to do with kids . And it is great ! The only problem was the sound quality . The film was just too loud . Very loud . I would never do it again . I would never go back there again . I was not impressed . I would not recommend this movie to any of my friends or family members . Not for a first time movie .

The films use of blue-black and vibrant skin tones to create a noir-ish feel to this movie unfortunately do not work here. But this movie has great use of color and lighting, which I loved. “This movie is just so cool,” said one young man, “I don’t think there’s a lot of cool movies like this, where the actors are so into their roles, and there’s not a wasted moment of the movie.” He said, “This movie is just such an emotional ride.”

I liked the story.

Relish every moment of this languorous spectacle with music to match ( Mahler 's 5th is gorgeous , but listen to Brahms' 6th ) and you get the best idea of why it's become such a cultural highlight. And as you wander from one performance to another , you'll pick up all kinds of little bits and pieces. Like this:

A few weeks ago I was lucky enough to have been invited to the launch of a new documentary film . It is called , ‘My Life’, and is by one of the most talented people in the world of documentaries.

I wanted to like this one - the situation was rich, and the setting unusual and interesting. But the story is swamped with childish female gothic romance elements that are hard to swallow. The director is unfairly prejudiced against the 'goy' characters -- content to let them be grotesque cardboard caricatures -- and inexplicably indulgent towards the homewrecking behavior of the heroine. The potentially interesting power struggle between the inventor and the governess is not really dealt with.Feminist film makers will get more credibility when they stop manipulating situations to throw all the sympathy to the heroine, and start dealing honestly with issues.

I would just like to point out ( in addition to pleading for the series to be released on DVD) that this is the first official release from the series I have been following and admiring since it began. So, I would like to support it. Just curious, does anyone know if any of you have any interest in watching it on Blu Ray? I have heard of it being released but haven't found anything about it. It would probably be pretty pricey but I'd be willing to pay it if there was a release option.

This movie is great. 80's sleazy slasher movie about three kids born during an eclipse, so they kill everyone they see. The reason they kill makes practically no sense, but it just adds to the charm of this movie. And dang, these kids are crazy, especially Curtis. If you've seen the movie, you know who I am talking about. That kid's vicous! Although the movie doesn't have much gore, it is entertaining, and for some reason you kind of care about the characters. It also has some nice nudity.

I watched this movie with my mother . She is 81 yrs.old and was raised to be a bigot .She watched this film when I was 10 . She said it was the first thing she’d never see .She is a retired school teacher from the early 70’s .I think we both have learned more about racism and bigotry than we know. The movie is about Martin Luther King, Jr. (the man) who led the Civil Rights Movement. The main character of the movie is Dr. King’s son. I believe that is Dr. Martin Luther Kings.

Well , I 've watched this movie for over 25 years now and it 's still almost as interesting as when i first watched it. I remember in the mid-70s, it seemed like there 'd been a change of some sort, I didn 't recognize the movie, or remember who was onscreen at that point, but i could tell it was a very good movie, very good in all the ways that matter, even if it took me 25 years to figure that out. I can remember the movie as something to look forward to.

Forget any angst-ridden documentary! This film is really an out and out comedy about a 40-yer-old porn star whose goal in life is to sing junky circuit party songs. The only problem? Colton Ford can't sing! And the film cuts away whenever he appears to be ready to burst into song. Yet Ford and equally vapid boyfriend Blake Harper whine and primp and run around in their tank tops, determined to make dreams come true. Even funnier is "manager" Kyle who appears to have the I.Q. of a turnip and whose collagen-injected lips look like a bee stung him.

Rabbit Fever is one of those film oddities. It's an enjoyable 90 minutes, demands little of the viewer, and delivers as much, and on any terrestrial television channel even in a prime time slot I think that Rabbit Fever would be rather well received. Which makes me wonder why it has been pushed into cinemas.The movie is filmed in the style of a television documentary, and introduces us to 6 women who have am addictive relationship with the Rabbit Vibrator. The film is primarily focused on investigating a supposed addictive quality to the famous sex aid product.

The slightly overlong set up episode of the previous week paid off in no uncertain terms with an episode that hit the heights. There was a certain deus ex machina flavour to the resolution of the cliffhanger, but it was a good start for all that. As is now common with this Doctor the moral, ethical and emotional considerations of his actions were centre stage. They were always there in the classic series, but they were a side issue, to be glossed over when the Doctor was in the heat of battle. This regeneration even says sorry to a cyberman during the battle!

I 'll preface my review by stating that I am not a fan of the independent 'straight to video ' route. It's been around for ages, but I think its time for it to go away. It's cheap, and often not worth the cost of the movie or the effort required to watch it. But, that is not to say I have never bought and watched a movie that was released on video. It's the exception rather than the rule that is so important in my case. Back in 2007, I finally found myself with the DVD box set of 'The Hangover.'

One would think that with all the lavish care and expense that went into this made-for-TV movie , it would have some real depth or insight to offer. However, as it happens, it was pretty shallow for a movie that was released in 1997. It's not like anyone is going to re-watch it after a year. But, it does have the advantage of being an extremely entertaining film. While the film isn't one I'd normally pick up for its depth, it's worth watching just because it's entertaining.

Unfortunately this is not as good as any of the other films that Jim Carrey (producing and starring) and Brian Grazer have worked on together, but bits of it are definitely worth a look for laughs. Basically Dick Harper (Carrey) thinks he is being promoted to a better job. That's until the company of Dynocorpe sinks and closes down. Now Dick and his wife Jane (Téa Leoni), and their son of course, are in trouble with money. No matter what they try, they can't raise the kind of money they really want.

The sound is terrible , the picture is worse than worse , the acting is awful , the female leading role is not well developed , the main character does not have any distinctive features , the script is poor , I did not enjoy this movie , one of the worst in recent times , I give it three stars , not a great movie . In short , it is just an average movie . . . that is all it is, average . . . that’s all it was. . . . That’s the beauty of this blog.

Ham-handed homage to honest hacking. Felt good in a soft-core way about equivalent to its mild pornography, until its vapid lack of technical and economic reality, emotional and moral sophistication became apparent.Basically a muddled '90s remake of '85's "Real Genius", with fewer and stupider geniuses, and a cynical bad ending.Perhaps this movie would appeal to someone delighted by the thesis that becoming a billionaire is so easy it's almost accidental. Or perhaps to technical types who like seeing themselves depicted as cool and sexy. Speculating about the reasons someone might like this movie is certainly more interesting than the movie itself.

This is simply a good ole fashioned western .. not overly complex or long . It does n't deceive itself into thinking it is anything else , and that is a good thing. I have to say that I enjoy reading this and found it to have some character to it. I would liken it to The Old West . Just a story with good characters and the ability to keep one's attention . A great story that you should enjoy. I was so excited about this book, and I was pleasantly surprised. The story is very well told and there are not many errors.

First off , the editing of this film consisted of one major flaw which I do n't understand how was allowed. When we were about halfway through the film and then it was going to take a dramatic turn it just took off at that moment and did not end until about 10 minutes into the film. The ending is very boring , boring , boring . The film is slow and boring , it has no emotion at all and has no plot at all. If you are not interested in this film just get ready to watch this movie with a boring ending.

For those that might send me nasty e-mails , shove it . There is a trend in Hollywood where those with more money want to see movies based on books . It started in the 40s and the 50s and it is now taking a backseat to movies based on books . And I think that is a mistake . I think it is wrong and a shame to make a movie about a book and then make an adaptation of the book . I think that is what has been going on . It has gone too far . I think that Hollywood has lost respect for our readers .

Stephen Sondheim 's SWEENEY TODD : THE DEMON BARBER OF FLEET STREET opened on Broadway on 1 March 1979 with a score by Jerry Herman and book and lyrics by Harold Prince. The musical opened on Broadway at the Waldorf Theatre as a limited engagement on 22 January 1980. Sondheim later said, "I think there is a feeling that when the show opens, I will not be here." The production then toured until it closed on 8 October 1980 as a regular Broadway production, with Sondheim as producer and opening night as the final night that he would be a performer.

Ok , everybody agreed on what was the best season . The first . And killing off Boone was a very good season for all . I liked it too . I saw the movie . I first viewed this film shortly after it was put out on video in 1995 , I dismissed it offhand , I mean, it’s a horror film . But in hindsight, I’m amazed that it ever made it to movie theaters . I had no problem at the time seeing it at the video store, but on the big screen? It was something else… something that would not play on film, but that might work on a VHS tape. So what made it tick? Well, there are a couple of factors.

I LOVE Dr WHo SO much! I believe that David Tennant is the best Dr the show has ever had and Billie Piper the Best companion! After putting a mummy in a local museum goes through the cat-scan, a metal object in it's brain reacts adversely to the procedure, thus freeing the spirit,or phantom if you will, of the mummy, Belphegor. Due to convenient circumstances, Lisa, who lives close to the museum finds herself possessed by the evil spirit. Soon enough she's stealing the museum's Egyptian treasures out from under their nose. Detective Verlac comes out of retirement to catch the supernatural thief.This is a serviceable enough, if you haven't seen any other incarnations of "Belphégor" before.

This movie was never intended as a big-budget film but was a cute little picture that pretty much anyone could take care of." "And, as you see, I did a very good job." "I'm not saying I'm better than any of the guys that did the picture or anything, but at the time, we were young, we were excited, we wanted to make a film and it all worked out for us." "The movie cost a million dollars and we were doing it on $20 a week."

I just finished watching Following and I thought it was great. I rated it 8 out of 10. I plan on watching it again with the director's commentary and then again in chronological order.I rented this movie because of my fascination of Christopher Nolan's more recent movie Memento. Following has some similarities; this movie was probably the blueprint for Memento. Even the music in some parts is very similar.Shooting the movie in black and white gives it a mysterious feel. The story and dialogue is really good. The performance of the actors is believable.Christopher Nolan made this movie on a really low budget.

This is one of the dumbest ideas for a movie . Remake a classic film shot-by-shot . I hope nobody ever does that . I agree . I've seen a lot of film rewrites but I've yet to see a film that doesn't have more holes in it then a bowling pin. I like the idea that it could be interesting, but it's far too boring and unoriginal for my taste. It's like taking a film that was originally shot in the 70s and making an hour long video with the same footage.

Waters's contribution to the world of cinema has to be searched with a telescope, and then when/if something is found (by sheer chance and lots of luck) it has to be analyzed with a microscope.And after it has been analyzed it would get discarded into the lab's "rubbish bin for totally useless things". One single atom of that microscope is worth all of his movies combined.CB is etremely campy, and intentionally so. The usual JW stuff: comic-strip dialogue, simplistic plot, moronically cheerful characters, chewing-gum pop, overacting etc.

In Extramarital we see B-actress Traci Lords at her very best . She 's all wrapped in horror & suspense and as usual the plot twists & turns along with her. Traci has had quite a successful film career thus far as she is on the verge of becoming a leading lady in Hollywood. We see how this goes down in this movie and what happens in the aftermath of it . We are then treated to her best acting work as she is on the cusp of breaking into Hollywood. The movie is a bit of an erotic horror movie and that makes it even more interesting.

This movie was made only 48 years after the end of the Civil War -- most likely in anticipation of the 2020 Republican presidential election and its aftermath. But even now, with Democrats controlling both the executive and legislative branches, Trump’s policies are being carried out in full, and Republicans’ are not, with the help of a Democratic Party willing to do anything to obstruct Trump. If Trump is reelected in 2020, it will be a continuation, not a reversal, of the Obama administration’s policies, the same policies the president campaigned on and the party now claims as their own.

This is the Australian TV series. It is a classic. The stories and actors are excellent. Who can forget Picker and his gramophone or Chet being ambushed? This is cult TV. The closing credits starting with the close up of the wheel, then Keir sleeping n being jostled around and then the long shot just cannot get much better than that.

This is a movie from Toilet Pictures. If the name of the production company is any indication how stinky a movie is, then this would be it. I give it 8 out of 10 because it is a cult classic . Also it is directed by legendary horror filmmaker, Steven Spielberg , who has said that it was the film that made him into a master of horror . Here is the story . It revolves around a man named Bill and his best friend, John , who work on a secret government project. During one of their secret experiments they decide to put a young woman in the water and make her their pet . The woman is taken away by the government, and it is left to Bill and John to figure out where she is.

I am sick of series with young and clueless people , talking about their `` problems '' all the time. Why not give them a reality based show, like they do on The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills ? Let them get their life, work out and make a living and get their kids through college and take care of the rest of their lives. Just think if they had a reality based show where they had to take on a `` problem '' that was not their problem to solve? That's what would happen if we did not have cable, reality shows are a reality.

I ca n't believe this movie has 6 stars on IMDb . This is one of the worst movies I have seen this year. I have seen it a few times but I have to say the writing is atrocious. The characters are bland and so predictable that you will not be able to predict what they are gonna do next. There was no tension and you will be bored to tears. The acting was horrible as well. I thought I would be entertained by watching a horror movie but this one was awful. It was like watching a horror movie with bad acting and writing.

One look at the rating ought to tell you this movie was voted on by shills, in an attempt to artificially boost this film's ratings.This film brings nothing new to the zombie genre. In fact, it is laughably bad (in acting and cinematography) and derivative in its plot. The make-up looks horrible and the zombies look even worse when shot. Lines are stiffly delivered and badly timed, with the exception of the female bounty hunter, who is the only good actor in this mess of a film. The worst offenders are the Italian guy (Hans), Ryn the protagonist, and the lead bad guy.

How any of you gave this more than 2 stars amazes me. I made an account on IMDb just to comment on this cr@p film. The acting is cr@p and the plot is cr@p. It would deserve no stars at all if it weren't for the descent soundtrack (and yet there are still some outrageously clownish tracks in there too, most notably the ones featuring the oboe and sound like black and white cartoon comedy background music and in no way fit the intended mood of the scenes that they haunt) and quality cinematography.

I've seen a lot of movies in my time and this one really stands out as being the absolute worst movie ever made in the history of film making anywhere in the world. It took me 3 efforts to watch this movie. The first time I fell asleep after 15 minutes from boredom, possibly because I was already tired as it was late at night. The second effort I managed to get through 35 minutes but yet again I found myself asleep. I can go on and on like this but I think you're getting the point......nothing happens ever in this movie.

I own a copy of this film and have always loved it . I comment here , however , because this is a good example of the problems that are faced during the film's development . From the very beginning the script is written as an allegory, as a story which could be read either by the audience, or for the audience by the characters themselves . This is a problem which occurs frequently in films of this era . But I think that it is also important to be honest about the film's weaknesses. In fact, I would have liked the film to have a different beginning.

This move is absolutely , most certainly one of the greatest films of its , or any other , genre to date . however , this is a film for all ages , and , more importantly , one of the all time classic films of all genres . of course , for some people , this may have been the only film they have ever watched . for many others , however , it has been their most favorite film since . this is also a film that one simply must see at least once in its , or , even its , entire run .

Less Than Zero could have been the 80s movie that reveals teenage apathy in its most extreme form had they only dared to try a movie like this in the late 90s, but in fact, this is a film that can only exist in the ‘90s—a time when teens had the power to make a difference, or at least they could, if they wanted it enough. At the beginning of the film—the very first one you see—you’ve been asked by your friends not to wear any shoes or make eye contact with other people on the street.

With some films it is really hard to tell for whom they were made. Huevos de oro seems to aim at the well educated Spanish middle class. There must be many inside jokes in this movie which you will not understand if you are an outsider. This can be pretty annoying.Symbols and references to art and popular culture abound, the movie alludes to the work of Salvador Dalí, Luis Buñuel and the Surrealists in general, a certain infatuation with bidet baths seems to point to Duchamp's ready mades. What's more, the main character has also a knack for karaoke tapes with songs of Julio Iglesias.

`` Female Convict Scorpion - Beast Stable '' , the third in the series , is a magnificent piece of kit with a high level of finish. As well as being beautiful, this particular Scorpion is extremely durable thanks to its tough composite body that is reinforced around the wheels, handlebars, seat and handle. It is also extremely versatile thanks to the high quality aluminium bodywork which allows you to fit a variety of different handlebar systems and can be dismounted and carried in the front and back panniers. The front of the bodywork is made up of two parts.

My boyfriend and I went to watch The Guardian.At first I didn't want to watch it, but I loved the movie- It was definitely the best movie I have seen in sometime.They portrayed the USCG very well, it really showed me what they do and I think they should really be appreciated more.Not only did it teach but it was a really good movie. The movie shows what the really do and how hard the job is.I think being a USCG would be challenging and very scary. It was a great movie all around.

Yeah , a long time ago it turned into a tourist attraction . Now it 's a prison again . I don't think there are many people left in this place. I don't even know anyone in this area anymore . When we were living here , we would visit it every now and then and take a walk down the road that we had passed through to get the old feel of where we were , but then we stopped coming here , cause we never had the money to do it .I remember it from when i first moved in here .

I was fortunate enough to catch a midnight screening of this movie tonight. I must say, I was expecting a horribly cheap movie with bad acting and a mediocre plot. I was completely mistaken. This movie was not only incredibly entertaining, but everything about it I simply loved. Bruce Campbell was as amazing as ever. The biggest surprise was none other than Ted Raimi, you know, Sam's little brother. He played the mad doctor's henchman to the greatest extent. Somewhere between physical comedy and clever dialogue, he did nothing but shine.

Unfortunately a boring flick , and obviously the only way to see it is the butchered bootleg Public Domain version on YouTube. The movie itself is a little better with it, but there's no doubt this version is going to be a lot of work for whoever wants to get a decent copy of it. That said, it is pretty entertaining. I got to see it recently at my local multiplex. It's a pretty bad film, so I'd probably give it a few points if I was grading it. But I think it was fun to see it and have some laughs.

Just awful . It 's almost unbelievable that , with characters and situations provided by Dashiell Hammett , such a work could have gone to print without a word of protest . For some time , readers of my blog have expressed the opinion that I would do well to ignore Hammett 's work in the first half of his career, when he was writing pulp fiction , and only reread his work when Hammett was on the cusp of developing his first major work as a novel, and then only in order to discover new insights and a better appreciation of what had previously been missed.

Anne (Natalie Portman) tells us about how much she hates her mother, Adele (Susane Sarandon). That's how the movie begins. Adele decided that her and her daughter were moving to California without asking anyone and leaving her husband without any reason. The story is about the relationship between the mother and the daughter. It's really deep and touching, thanks to the great work of the actresses. Natalie was nominated to a Golden Globe for that role. She is one of the most talented actresses I ever saw, and so is Sarandon.

Well, I fear that my review of this special won't heed much different observation than the others before me, but I literally just watched it- during a PBS membership drive- and frankly I'm too excited NOT to say anything. To really appreciate the enigma that is Barbra Streisand, you have to look back before the movies. Before the Broadway phenomenon of the mid-60's. When television was still a young medium, there was a form of entertainment very prominent on the air that is but a memory today: musical variety.

As cute and adorable as they are, the story of three singing chipmunks just doesn't seem to have enough meat to it to sustain it for an hour and a half. I thought that the first half hour or so of this movie was well worth watching. It was fun, it had a few laughs in it, it was full of energy. Then it somehow just lost that. I wouldn't even say it faded away, because it seemed quite abrupt to me. The fun was gone; the laughter disappeared. My daughter noticed it, too.

Nothing about this movie is any good . It 's a formulaic predictable `` romantic comedy '' geared to make money. The only reason you should see it is to see what other movies it will spawn out of its self-satisfied world . The plot is basically like a standard `` romantic comedy '' with the usual formula of a girl who has to be rescued . The only thing is the script doesn ' t seem to know how to sell its plot . The hero has to save the girl from the bad guy who doesn't like her .

I was sitting at home and flipping channels when I ran across what potentially sounded like an interesting film. I like Destruction type movies and decided to watch it. I don't know why but I ended up watching it the whole 2 hours. We have seen this type of movie I don't know how many times.Back in 1998 - 2000 there were dozen of films that dealt with global destruction of some sort. The best one on my list so far is Deep Impact which was more believable than this one. Here are my problems with this film: 1) cheap special effects, like something out of the old computer.

I really could n't get into this movie . The plot is some old woman has been torturing someone so that he will admit that she's the mother of Jesus, but she wants the confession in exchange for eternal life . It's not clear whether the torture really happened or not because at first she is in the process of committing a crime by killing someone. She is then told that the confession is for the soul of the killer. But then she confesses to the killing but she wants the confession first . The other person she wants to torture is the father of the murderer.

`` The Long Kiss Goodnight '' is an enjoyable and very cool action thriller , and a career breakthrough for the author. The book opens with the death of her lover's father, who leaves the young woman a fortune of inheritance. Unfortunately, the father is not the person she thinks he is, as the real man, her lover, had died two years before. He had cheated on his first wife and left her destitute and heart broken, but the mother of the man had left him a small fortune, which was enough to secure the young woman's financial security.

I viewed the movie for a second time on September 30 , 2006 and thought that it was even better than it's first run in theaters. I remember the first time I heard the trailer in late spring or early summer, I didn't watch it, since I couldn't stand the trailer or the first half of the movie, but I went back to see it in theaters after the release of The Rock. The Rock is a much better movie that the first time I saw the movie and even better when seen as a second time in theaters with a fresh and new mind set.

My blurred childhood memories have kept the echo of the cult serie of Belphégor in the French 60 's ... In these memories, Belphegor seemed to me a character made from myth and reality, who lived under the shadow of the devil. In the 60'S Belphegor was the devil incarnate, who in reality was a kind of monster that had no soul, and who lived only on human blood and brains. Now, I understand that such a story could have a moral meaning. In this case, the monster's soul has become human.

Though I have watched Salò, I do not know if excrement tastes tart. If it does, this "film" is accurately titled. So much of roughage, so little substance, this is the celluloid equivalent of celery - only it does not cleanse the palate. It leaves the taste of wasted time in the mind's mouth, and if I could vomit this film and get back that expanse/expense I would. Detention was more exciting. The director should be forced to wear a dunce cap, and the Spirit of Ed Wood Jr. couldn't save this semi-professional projection from certain failure.

This movie begins with a man who appears to be some sort of sports driver . He meets up with a young woman and has an intimate moment in a dark alley. When she asks him for his name , the man tells her “ I am John Smith ” . The woman looks at him like he’s insane. He is then told to get into the trunk of a car. The driver of the car is a man and he seems very nice. But that’s not the only thing that makes him nice. He’s rich and his wife is pregnant.

I love most movies and I 'm a big fan of Sean Bean so I thought that I would at least see what he's got to say. And I'm sorry for the long delay!
