Junior and his dad start a new life in a new town . It 's the same life because Junior is like his dad but with a little more of a sense of adventure. The new life will be good for his father and his two sisters. But, it would be great for him and his little sister. His father will teach Junior how to be a man. Junior and his dad get a job. Junior gets a chance to play on the baseball diamond. They go to the beach and get some sun and a tan. They buy a boat.

No redeeming features , this film is rubbish . Its jokes do n't begin to be funny . The humour is so forced and not even remotely funny . The story doesn't make any sense , its just an excuse to go to the seaside . A waste of good money and effort . What's wrong with this movie...It's a good film, just like all movies should be...the plot was well thought out, but not too predictable. The story itself was interesting...the ending was predictable, and it was easy to predict.

Five guys who were in the cub scouts together reunite years later to go camping . Were they run into each other at some campfire by chance ? Or is there more behind the reunion? And in the second half, we talk about what we want for our children and our kids. In the first segment, I talk about how I met my wife, how my daughter is growing up, and my son has grown into a man. My wife’s first boyfriend was a man who had been in a previous relationship with my wife, and at some point in her life she started to date another man.

`` Hey , I did n't order no cab ! '' `` Yeah , well you got one ... '' `` No , it wasn't that ... I was ... '' `` Heh heh heh ... I just wanted to ... '' `` What ? What ? '' `` No , I'm good , you can leave ... '' `` Where's my cab ? '' `` In the car 'o'clock '' `` Oh , I forgot to tip him ...'' `` Hey !'' `` Hey , I have to go '' '' I'm sorry '' `` But you can't leave yet .

I went into this movie with an open mind . I had been too lazy to go to the video store and get something that fit the bill. I liked what I saw and read the synopsis. Then I saw the picture . And I was in. So what is this about ? The story is about how a man goes to Iraq to find and bring back a man who may or may not be alive. He gets killed. He goes back to find out what happened. What is really cool about the film is how it does not focus on the actual story of how the man came back.

Anastasia: The Mystery of Anna was a two-part star studded historical T.V. movie based on the Peter Kurth book, Anastasia: The Riddle of Anna Anderson. It keeps up historically pretty much, names are changed etc. But sticks to the real story quite well. Omar Sharif and Claire Bloom do quite well as the Russian royals, Czar Nicholas and Czarina Alexandra. What stuck out in my mind was the all too short portrayals by Rex Harrison and Olivia De Havilland. All in all it was a pretty classy production with some fine acting.

Plot Synopsis : Los Angeles in the future . Crime is kept under control by Core Trackers , android assassins with the power and ability to read your mind . They are the key to breaking up dangerous gangs and bring them down to a more manageable size , while protecting the city from criminals . The problem is , the trackers know more about their target than their target ever will know about them . The question is , how do you get inside the head of the killer without blowing your cover ? You need a human , one with an open mind , a strong stomach and a strong will .

( The beginning might be a spoiler ... ) '' The Eye 2 '' is the sequel to `` The Eye , '' an action-thriller adventure set in a sci-fi version of the year 2027. It is based on a comic by Alan Moore and Dave Gibbons . The book is set between the events of the original game and movie, and features many of the same cast members from both of those films. It also features several of the original ''VideoGame/TheDarkAvengers'' villains and characters from that show. It also introduces characters who will not appear on the ''VideoGame/{{Marvel}}'' or ''VideoGame/GuardiansofTheGalaxy'' series.

This film is terrible. Not only is the story unbelievable, the situations the characters put themselves in are so silly, to the point where it isn't shocking. I find it sad that Daisy Eagan, star of Broadway's The Secret Garden, decided that this would be a career step. The idea is interesting, two young girls coming of age very quickly. But the sex isn't even arousing. The film is silly, the story is silly, the performances are silly, and the whole concept while interesting falls flat.

My buddies and I spent the majority of a Saturday afternoon watching a selection of `` bad '' movies . They're not all bad , but we did notice a common characteristic of all of them - the bad acting . We had originally been looking forward to the evening showing of " The Bad News Bears " at the West End Cinema . However, it turned out that the movie was a complete bust and we were very disappointed with it . We had gone to see it hoping for a comedy - something that could be lightened by a little humor .

The Evil Below starts on 'The Straits of San Sebastian 1683 ' as the 17th century treasure ship the Elba, on its way to Canton (now Guangdong, China), is driven onto a reef in South East Asia by a violent storm. As the crew struggle to keep the vessel afloat, the crew's chief mate and a number of sailors go missing, their bodies later discovered in the wreckage. With a cargo of pearls that had been hidden in the cargo hold, the ship sinks to the bottom, only to be washed aground in shallow water.

I agree with msinabottle; this is a great movie. Here are some dialogue snippets:Raisuli (Sean Connery) to Eden Pedecaris (Candice Bergen): "You see the man at the well, how he draws the water? When one bucket empties, the other fills. It is so with the world. At present, you are full of power. But you're spilling it, wastefully. And Islam is lapping up the drops as they spill from your bucket." Raisuli: The English have paid very well in the past.

I 've been looking forward to the release of this movie since I first heard the concept two years ago. I got to meet the director last year and he is a genius. There are several things he did well in this movie, and some he did horribly. There's so much more in my opinion. I just finished watching it and am so glad I did. The plot is very good and it flows so easily. It is not very violent, although one or two scenes do make me cringe. I can understand that people are going to be uncomfortable with the graphic nature of these scenes.

This picture hit the movie screens on June 6th 1980, starring Stephen Macht as Sergeant Thor, Avery Schreiber as Captain Comelius Butt, J.D. Hinton as Buzz and starring Playmate of the year Dorothy Stratton. The picture starts with the police infinity roaming space looking for I guess criminals. There ship is suddenly attacked by an unknown space ship. Enters Sergeant Thor and his partner Buzz as they try to figure out who the unknown ship belongs to. When failing they call on Captain Comelius who instructs his crew to fight back. Enters the gorgeous Dorothy Stratton, who plays the role of Galaxina who is man made robot.

This totally UNfunny movie is so over the top and pathetic and unrealistic that throughout the whole 90 minutes of utter torture I probably looked at my watch about 70000 times! Lucy Bell is so much higher than this crap and for her to sink this low is quite depressing. I have to admit that the whole audience I was in was laughing hysterically but the majority were Greek or Italian so I guess that this humour will probably make them laugh but not me. All this movie does is make you sick watching all these slackers make excuses for their stupid actions for 90 minutes.

This movie has a very deep look at the relationships between a mother who was raised in a Christian environment, and two daughters. It takes the mother's journey and shows that all she believed in, was true. As the daughter's relationships with the mother, are tested, and love is tested, we also see how true love is tested. We see some of the pain of it all. I think if you are a mother or if you have a child or if you know any family who has a child, watch this movie!

Surprisingly good and quick-witted adventure that features Kelsey Grammer ( supposedly in his first lead role in a feature ) as a former soldier of the US army who gets caught in the middle of a brutal war between an insurgency group of rebels and the regular army. So far I have seen only a few bits and pieces of the movie. I'm sure that there will be more to see after its release. This is a movie worth checking out, even though I have yet to get to know a great many details of the plot as it is being presented to us.

This movie surprised me. The box is misleading, the tagline is misleading and the costumes and tone of the film are misleading. The movie is quite gory, well-acted and beautifully shot. The special-effects are top-notch and seem to be ahead of their time, until you realize this movie came out in 1979, not in 1963 like it's tone would suggest. It is a unique take on the Dr. Moreau story, and one of the better versions filmed. The first fifteen minutes are the highlight and the most shocking, but the film doesn't ever really fall apart.

I enjoy science-fiction just as much as the next man but what the hell was that? Apparently shot over just three days using excess film stock left over from his previous film, 'Nana (1926),' this Jean Renoir short is a bewildering futuristic satire, produced on a budget that couldn't have been much more than zero. In the year 2028, following a great war, Africa has become the most civilised region on Earth, and what was formerly Europe has been designated "Terres Inconnues (Unknown Land)."

Movies seem to fall into two categories : films that reinforce existing societal values and beliefs , and those that disrupt and disrupt existing norms and beliefs. Most people would be surprised to know how often these two types of films come from the same filmmaker. It could be argued that in this case it is the filmmaker who has established the values and beliefs they want to uphold. But it is also easy to see where this has an impact, and it does not just affect the values and beliefs of the film’s audience, but that of the director as well.

This was pretty bad - from bad acting , bad technical details , bad camera shots , and bad audio quality , this film is pretty disappointing . if it was made as a series , it should have been a good series . since it was only a 1/2 hour miniseries , you'll never be able to get all that good from it . the acting was good , and there were very good scenes . i think there will still be interest in the original series , or at least there was a time in the early 70s when people would have been interested in watching this miniseries .

This movie was fabulous . It is definitely a top 5 hitchcock film . The directing and camera shots are superb . This movie is definitely a classic in the movie history . In terms of acting and acting , there are not many other films like it . I must say this movie is very beautiful , and the music in it is beautiful as well , this is definitely a great film . I saw the movie yesterday. This is definitely a classic in hitchcock's filmography. And there was no plot, nothing, just a guy with some weird ideas.

Why are there no good reviews? Because this film is hysterically bad.Set in a Japanese prison camp in World War II, we have Jim Brown as the hero who puts up with a hysterically unbelievable racist officer, and just as hysterical is the way the Japanese officers brown nose Jim Brown's character.This is probably the worst film any of these actors ever did. Stereotypes not only abound, but they dominate this film. The sixties-seventies music may be the best thing about the film, maybe because it has nothing to do with the film.This is even difficult to sit back and enjoy as mindless fun.

This is one of the few movies - maybe the only - that truly haunted me for years. It was the first I had ever seen people tortured, so much that blood was flowing of their mouths from gritting their teeth and screaming, etc. It was brutal; the worst thing I had ever seen on film.Dr. Clement Molloch, played by Joseph Mayer, is still one of the most evil characters I've ever seen on film, and I've viewed thousands. He was so sadistic that I would never watch this movie again, nor would I recommend it.

The most vivid portrait of small-town oddity I've seen in a long time -and I'm not just talking about Australian films. This piece of work seems to have been made "under the radar" and really, it's an entirely fascinating piece of work, that has a worldliness mostly unseen in recent Aust. film making.At times it is rather slow and strange - it seems to meander hither and thither not really sure if it's a thriller or a 'head-movie'. But the stunning aspect of the film by Alex Frayne is its iron fisted, ruthless direction.

Fox is pretty lame . They cancel the wrong shows . It 's bizarre that they would cancel a well-written show like this . But hey , its Fox. So , what do we know . It would be cool if the series was picked up and aired on FOX . But , I will tell you that if it is picked up . I would be watching it . And it is a very good show . It doesn't fit with the FOX formula . But , I guess I'm a little biased because I used to work in FOX .

Ed Wood rides again . The fact that this movie was made should give any youngaspiring film maker hope . But not in the least . I have been an ardent fan of Woody since I first saw "Annie Hall" back in the 90's . It was not until recently that I started to understand what I would be getting myself into when it came to the making of this movie. I am now fully aware that I am not in any way , shape or form an "Annie Hall" fan like Woody .

Sappy.I liked how they went to the "Haaavaad baaa" to quote books at each other to impress the ugliest girl there.Probably the janitor at my school is a genius too but is waiting to land that big construction job.Just because you keep your nose to the grindstone is no reason to try to cut a steak with it. "Do you like apples? "the guy nods or something. "Well, how'd ya like DEM APPLES!" Wow, that IS genius.Duh, Minnie Driver would give her number to anybody. Robin Williams can't paint and keeps the good books on the top shelf.

I feel really bad for reviewing this movie because I wish that I had only watched it as a concept, not a movie to actually review. But it’s also hard because I feel like I should have seen this before now and that I know the ins and outs of the story much better than ever I would like. I should have known that the main reason this is a movie is not because of anything that happens to any of the characters, but because the movie takes place entirely on a ship.

The director is sweet , as is his co-directing wife Shira Geffen , but their movie sucks . It has no charm, no heart, and no life. The movie is not what I would consider "mature", but it is not what I would consider "violent". I mean , sure , the film has a little blood , and there is an incident where a guy gets impaled by a knife , but it is hardly "violent" , in the way that a lot of people would define violence. It does not even have that much gore .

Irwin Allen put all his talents behind this one: he's co-screenwriter, producer and director of this cartoonish "epic" about an atomic submarine and its efforts to reduce a ring of radiation circling the Earth. Potentially exciting story fails to take off, despite an eclectic cast. Varied players from Walter Pigeon and Joan Fontaine to Frankie Avalon and Barbara Eden are interestingly intermingled and provide a dash of color, but this soggy sci-fi is pretty cheesy. Good for a few stray laughs, but Allen didn't seem to know the difference between strong, solid adventure and campy nonsense.

Although the plot of Cover Girl is very flimsy and tired , it does serve well enough as an anchor for the film. The movie opens with an interview with Joan Rivers, as she talks about one of her first acting jobs, in which she is supposed to play an old man who has to pretend to be a child as part of her part. It’s an intriguing premise. Joan Rivers is going to be playing the old man, but she has other plans for her role and it’s not a surprise when we discover she is going to get her own movie in which she plays herself.

Louis Gossett Jr returns to the well one more time as Chappy Sinclair who goes to Doug Masters (Played by Jason Cadieux who is in for Jason Gedrick who wisely declined) to teach a new band of recruits however this time they discover corrupt air force pilots who deal in toxic waste. This is a series that just keeps getting worse with each subsequent entry, this one however doesn't have any of the zip or even the action to make this even worth seeing on cable. Iron Eagle IV is directed with such indifference that the dogfights come off as if we were watching a playstation 2 game played by two lobotomized teenagers.

Peter Watkins' rarely seen Punishment Park is a brutality-laced, uncompromised political weapon set across a never ending desertscape. An unapologetically left leaning anti authoritarian abuse fest, the escapades at first appear to be so over the top militaristic and sickening that it could come off as some distant fantastical dystopian alternate history, one Harry Turtledove would even enjoy. But once we delve deeper in and really pay attention to the abhorrent diatribe spouting out of those presiding over the tent topped tribunal, as well as the shotgun toting guards overseeing the bloody affair, our eyes are truly opened.

...means "take up and read", which is precisely what I felt like doing after having seen this marvelous film.Von Ancken stimulates and inspires with this breathtaking and superbly executed adaptation of Tobias Wolff's 1995 New Yorker article of the same name. The incredible performance by Tom Noonan is brilliant and provocative and the editing, sound design, cinematography and directing are truly inspired. The nuanced changes and embellishments on the original story are subtle, clever, and make the film cinematically more dynamic. It's lyrical pacing is mesmerizing and begs you to watch it again.Watch out for this young director...he's going places.

Mickey Rourke is enjoying a renaissance at the moment... and fair play to him. I always liked his image and his acting ability in such fare as Angel Heart and Johnny Handsome. You know what you are going to get with Rourke - mean, moody, dirty. But this film gives you much more - and you don't want most of it.First and foremost - this whole thing just doesn't make sense. Rourke is a hardened IRA killer who after killing a bus-load of schoolchildren flees Ireland for London. He is on the run from the cops and from his own Army comrades.

Estevez, Martin Sheen and Kathy Bates are superb in this portrayal of a Vietnam vet home from the war but still haunted by it. Bates plays a clueless mother who just wants the family to be a "family." Sheen is terrific as the father who tries to understand what his son is going through but is too wrapped up in his principles to really empathize. The setting is Thanksgiving Day and the relatives are coming for dinner. Estevez, who plays the returning vet, wants no part of family tradition and insists on wearing his combat fatigues to dinner, explaining "This is what I wore last Thanksgiving."

This woman is a terrible comedian. She can't crack a joke. She has no real character. This is another example of typical American rubbish, that people laugh at, because they have no idea how to react, so they say to themselves, "well, it's a comedy show," so I'll laugh, I guess.I cannot stand this miserable woman, and her pi$$ poor excuse for comedy. She does not deserve anything but booing.Why can't America dump this kind of turdish delight, and go for something that actually contains humour.She is not funny.

Me and my mates used to gather together in one house to watch this on a Friday night before going out. For a while, the programme would be played on Radio 1, but then a couple of years ago, it stopped being played on the radio and it was on Channel 4 in its own hour, before being made a permanent fixture of BBC4 on Friday nights. The show had a loyal following from kids and their parents, all the way through to adult viewers who would get together to watch or listen on Friday nights.

Let me tell you something ... this movie exceeds all of the Troma laugh and gore movies hands down as far as originality, and it is one of those films that, when it gets a chance, it will do it right. There were a lot of other Troma films that I liked, some were better than this, in my opinion. However, it will remain in my mind as the masterpiece that the Troma Company was. This is a must see movie, you will not be disappointed, I guarantee it.

Set mostly in the back streets of Toronto NG is a dark , mysterious journey that takes the viewer into the minds of a young man and woman ( Vern and Sarah ) , each of whom has a fascination with riddles and a disastrous incident in their past . Fine dialogue and first-rate casting propel this low key, noirish journey into the girl's search for the meaning behind the word puzzles that keep appearing in her life. Aided by her , anything but enthusiastic, male friend, the two of them reach the end of their quest , but with a price to be paid.

Brilliant actors and brilliant picture ! ! I love the chopper scene with the music in the beginning , it makes it very atmospheric, and the ending is just epic. I wish i could see this movie on the big screen! It looks really good, and I'm curious about what happens with all the characters on the way. I think that in this movie, the characters can be more real, as we see their inner feelings, as well as their true personalities. I really love this movie and I'm going to see it on the cinema with my family.

I watched this movie for the first time the other day and was bored to tears . I guess I didn't understand the plot but I didn't bother watching the movie after the opening sequence because I had to go to the restroom and then got back and couldn't stop thinking about it. It was like watching a cartoon or something. I had a funny feeling in my stomach that something bad would happen but I was just too busy thinking about the movie to get worried about the outcome. It was so funny I had to laugh about it.

I ca n't believe I rarely ever see this title mentioned by all you eighties horror freaks and I definitely have no clue why but I want to know why they never mention this! I was a horror fan when my father was alive and I really don't remember a lot of the movies he loved and to be honest, most of them I saw in theatres, so I really don't have much of a clue about. But I do remember seeing this movie in the theatre at the age of 11 or 12 and it took me back.

A rather mild horror movie; if not for a couple of sex scenes, it could easily have been a TV movie. Plot holes abound (one example: why would there be a secret passage from the 18th century leading from the upper floor of a house that was burned to the ground and a new building put ther 200 years later? ), cardboard acting, characters doing things that anyone with an IQ bigger than their shoe size wouldn't do...It's got a few fun moments, but overall it's a sub-par film that managed to get Roy Scheider because his bills were due.

I love his martial arts style , it is quick , close up and oh so fast , but it is no more than a martial art . Saw him live on a recent UFC on ESPN card and it is hard to tell what it is from this video . He is a very skilled fighter , and although he does not use striking , he is not afraid of getting hit and he is quick enough to pull out of almost everything that may happen . He also has good ground game and has a decent stand up and a good wrestling .

What crack are you smoking ? This movie , while gloriously entertaining , is awful ! The action scenes are great but so much filler is added in which is unnecessary ! I can't take the whole movie , it was so good ! It's a good movie but just don't take everything in it , the story is awesome but the acting isn't . There is nothing that I can say about this movie that will impress you more than it already does. I wouldn't even try, especially since I've watched most of the reviews and the comments here.

Move over Manos . Back off Boogens . It does n't take a Baby Genius to know that Malibu Beach, Calif., has it all, from pristine beaches to high-end restaurants and, of course, world-class celebrities. For the uninitiated: It's a small community of 6,900 people on California's Central Coast, about 10 miles south of Santa Barbara and 20 miles north of Ventura. And that's just the tip of the proverbial iceberg. The entire region is home to about 2,000 millionaires and millionaires' mansions, all of whom have a private club or two on hand.

It 's really good to see Van Damme 's film are slowly getting better of late and especially compared to most of their past work. We are getting a better sense of the characters and the action is getting more exciting. And the soundtrack is growing on me too. There was one line I really liked and it was a good hint as to who the characters are. There's something you can feel from just watching the film that I think makes it stand out. I don't know how I could explain it if it wasn't well put into the script.

I was once a big Olsen fan . I received this movie when I was six and watched it almost every day . I have never stopped loving it until now . I really liked this movie when I saw it . I don't remember much of the movie other than the ending . I just remember the movie was awesome . The ending made me cry . I just couldn't stop crying after I saw it . I still remember this movie a lot of the time and have it played in my head whenever I'm sad .

This is a film that has to be taken in context . It should n't be seen unless you 've read the book and really want to be as immersed in these characters as if you actually lived with them in their own world. I know the film came out at the end of summer and the book came out earlier in the year so maybe this will change. But for now, it is still a great movie and I cannot recommend it enough. You can purchase it on Amazon or you can download it from the movie's official site.

I very much enjoyed this movie and I think most fans of Lauren Ambrose will too. Her character is much softer than her role in Six Feet Under and all of the performances are strong. I especially enjoyed the way the role of Emily, a mentally challenged savant, was handled. Despite some other misinformed user reviews the role was performed accurately and without cliché by the actress, Taylor Roberts. Also a standout was Fran Kranz, whose natural ease well complemented the more season veteran actors. Although the direction hit a snag here or there it seemed the only problems were with an underdeveloped script.

Obviously , someone was looking at catching onto the `` Blair Witch '' wave.This movie was set up like all the others. It is about a girl called Blair , who was murdered. Her parents think that the police have it wrong , so they hire a private investigator to catch out the killer. The movie was very well made. You can feel the tension throughout the whole movie. It was not scary enough for my taste , but it was good. The acting was excellent .The only thing was that there was no real character development. The whole movie felt like an extended commercial.

I thoroughly enjoyed this movie and to date , this year , it is one of my favorites . The movie is set in the present day as it takes the audience back in time to the 1940's . It is well acted by both the main casts as well as the secondary actors . The story is interesting , the music is great , it is very entertaining and the production values are great . This movie was really good. There is not much to complain about, but I still think this movie is worth a try.

Dolemite is one of the best movies featuring a pimp as a hero , who takes down the man , who is ruining the world , and makes the best out of it. In a nutshell , I am writing this review on the basis that this is one of the most remarkable films that has been made in recent times. The story is simple , but brilliant and the acting is outstanding . It tells the story about a small town boy who loses his family , gets arrested for murder, and gets released as a pimp , so he starts making money out of this.

The horrific production does n't qualify as a `` film . '' It was obviously shot on video tape , and the image quality is very poor: it looks like a grainy home movie on the VCR. The plot, as described on this site , sounds like a joke but is actually very true. The film is based on one of the true stories of the Holocaust, which was discovered in the Soviet Union in 1947. According to the researchers, this story happened in the town of Sobibor, where there was a concentration camp for Jews; it was the largest of all the camps, with around 2,000 inmates.

`` Hoppity Goes to Town '' was the second and last full length animated feature made by Max and Dave Fleischer (who later went on to become the owners of the Max Fleischer Studios of the same name.) On July 14, 1953, a trailer for the show was shown to theater owners, producers, film distributors and others interested in taking the show to the public. The trailer for ''[[Hoppity]]'' was made in black and white, the same format as many other Fleischer cartoons made in the same era.

There were nice characters in here , played by pleasant-looking actors and actresses , plus it had a famous band ( who are sadly gone now) who did a great job. The plot was good , and the ending was nice . I liked the story very much, and I can see why it has made so many films and so many people. I liked the music, the actors, and the set. I can see why it made people want to be in it. I really liked the story too. This was such an interesting film. I really liked it.

One of the last films DIRECTED by Lionel Barrymore , `` Ten Cents a Dance '' stars Barbara Stanwyck as a beautiful and self-centred Broadway star on her way to meet with an agent. The two are on a train to San Francisco when they get separated. After Stanwyck makes her way to the station to wait for a train that has already left. When she gets off the train and approaches a man who has been following her, she becomes suspicious of what he might be. At this time, we learn that Stanwyck is not merely a self-centered woman, but rather that she is a shrewd businesswoman.

It starts quite good, but after a while you start to expect more from this film than you are actually getting. Everything becomes unclear and unclear it stays. Czech filmmakers were good 20 or more years ago. But after they transfered to Capitalistic country, here it is, Czech unofficial but well known mentality ... COPYING ... COPYING ... COPYING of everything they consider good, when they see it in another movies or countries or elsewhere. I think that this is a good example of making "art" and "politics" and "horror" and "humor" and "film" and money.

I was never in the past interested in this play although love Shakespeare and have seen most of his plays now and enthusiastically studied some at school. Something about this story and all the fuss about it seemed to put me off. I never bothered to try to see Hamlet until fairly recently deciding I should at least try to watch it and I borrowed the Olivier version from the library. Well, I struggled with it. Olivier seemed far too old, not only in his looks but in his acting of the part.

Crispin Glovers ' way of acting ( and not only his ) is tremendous . You really want to believe him and see him at work . . . But you can't help but think that there are things going on which have gone on for more than twenty years . . . In which Crispin Glovers has been very busy indeed . . . You feel that Crispin might have been a good detective in the real world . . . but it seems that he has spent much more time in this world than that . . . The man's a mystery and we are not certain who he really is .

One of the greatest lessons I ever had in how to watch a movie happened this way: I was working in Roger Corman's offices, like so many other wanabees before and since, I was interning and trying to figure out how it all worked and how to make myself indispensable (hah!). One afternoon Julie Corman, Roger Corman's wife and a producer in her own right, asked me to load up a tape. I'm not sure why she wanted to watch it. I got the impression it was a student film or a show reel, something like that, some sort of calling card.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the mountains. When they find the body in the mountains, it leads them to a man who killed his brother and brother-in-law. The story takes place in a small mining town in northern Italy in the 1930's. The film was shot in and around Turin, including in the Castiglioncello area. Filming took place from April to June of 1983. The music score of the movie was composed and conducted by Claudio Simonetti. The director of photography was Giacomo Scappaticci.

It 's difficult to decide who or what is the target audience for this film . Jean-Pierre Limousin presumably had a very personal vision when it came to his portrayal of the main character. It is certainly an interesting and complex man , but who was the real man? To answer this question , one has to get under the skin of him . Unfortunately , that was not the case . This is because , in order to tell the true story , I had to look back at his life in France in the 60's , when Jean-Pierre lived in a very different time and a very different society .

In Brooklyn, the nightclub dancer Rusty Parker (Rita Hayworth) has a simple but happy life dancing in the McGuire's, owned by her boyfriend Danny (Gene Kelly). Rusty, Danny and Genius (Phil Silvers) have a ritual on Friday nights: they order oysters in a bar, trying to find a pearl. The life of Rusty changes when she participates and wins a contest to be the cover page of the Vanity magazine. She is invited to work in a huge theater in Broadway, whose owner proposes her.

This movie is certainly one of the greatest films ever made. It is a story told in a steady pace, told mostly not by words but by cinematic means of expression. Perfect blend of spectacular special effects and classical music bring to life creations of human imagination in both realistic and poetical way. The story itself is quite simple at a first glance. As the title implies, there is an archetypal journey, a motive repeated for thousands of years. This motive was always used not only to depict a trip in space and time, and beyond, but also had rich philosophic meaning.

The movie starts out a bit interested with the son interested in a teenage girl his own age. Clayburgh's timid-appearing husband is killed in car crash as she is getting ready to go to Rome and sing as a diva. Matthew objects but comes along. He connects with the young girl again but this time, Matt is on cocaine. His superb voice, lovely, impetuous mother is in the limelight. She doesn't know how to handle Matt's addiction. The movie drags on in search of a plot. Clayburgh is in the wrong role and Bertolucci may have had his head in the moon while directing the picture.

How can ANYBODY give this anything higher than a ' 1 ' ? I thought `` Manos , the Hands of Fate ' '' was as good as anything in this film. It was better. I agree, I saw this in the theatre a month ago. I don't remember it being very good, but then again I don't remember anything at all. I have seen it twice now, once in a midnight show and then a week after it was released in a normal cinema. The film is great, but man, does it suck to watch.

This movie tries its darndest to capture that classic bad canadian movie feel:"quirky" and obnoxious characters (a few); "quirky" town with "quirky" folk; a "quirky" coffee shop or restaurant (coffee shop here); lots of shots of canadian stuff for postcards (ocean stuff here); lots of mention of "gotta get out of this town"; downright booooring.And it succeeds on all counts.Something to note, though. I couldn't figure out whether this movie was just trying to be post-Northern Exposure "quirky" comedy or something surreal like a drug-induced or psychotic hallucination.

I have no idea why people are so crazy about the show . It is so boring . The jokes are lame . It has nothing on the original and that is a fact . The actors are horrible . It is boring . The characters are pathetic . There is only one reason to watch it . There is nothing to love about the show. Yes, there are jokes and moments that are very funny, but nothing more. The characters are uninteresting and predictable. It takes a lot more than a great laugh to make me like something.

WARNING!!! SOME POSSIBLE PLOT SPOILERS, AS IF THAT WAS POSSIBLE!! !Okay, if you haven't figured out the plot yet, I am going to give it to you. Two couples head out to a camping site, but a clown masked killer shows up and causes all sorts of mayhem.Now it is time for me to give these couples some advice.1. Never, ever go to camp dubbed Camp Blood by the locals. 2. Don't have sex or make out in front of the killer. 3. Don't go chasing after the killer if he or she runs away.

There could be some SPOILERS AHEAD but I doubt it . I have no idea how the screenplay for this was written . So I don't know whether it's good or poor . As with most screenplays, this is full of plot holes . So if anyone is looking for a good story, please check out the story. If you see a problem, please post a comment . It would be much appreciated. I'm sorry, but this is not a story about good guys and girls. It's about two guys who are out to kill you .

Do n't Look in the basement is actually a very clever and well thought out exploitation flick that gets a little too far with its self indulgent plot. The film's protagonist is a man named David (Josh Peck) who, in his late 20's, gets into an altercation with an older black man named Willie (John Travolta) in which David's car is damaged. David decides to use the opportunity to get some information on Willie, and sets out for his friend's home in the city, where he stays in Willie's basement.

With its ww2 timing, falling in and out of love, and easy on the eye Kira, this is re-Atonement. This a relationship story with focused main characters working out the the balance between first and fast love in the home front of WW2. Poet Dylan Thomas philanders his way between wife and ex in dark and smoky Blitz London and later in windy wales. Vera's ex and next spark off each other as the poet and soldier become a sideline while the girls bond and share. An easy watch that works well in the era bouncing along with just a few dips in pace.

I went to an advance screening of this movie thinking I was about to embark on 120 minutes of cheezy lines, mindless plot, and the kind of nauseous acting that made "The Postman" one of the most malignant displays of cinematic blundering of our time. But I was shocked. Shocked to find a film starring Costner that appealed to the soul of the audience. Shocked that Ashton Kutcher could act in such a serious role. Shocked that a film starring both actually engaged and captured my own emotions. Not since 'Robin Hood' have I seen this Costner: full of depth and complex emotion.

Now first let me say I love god awful movies . Especially horror films mainly . I watched hundreds of horror films all the way through ( I still have to watch every one from the beginning to make sure there are not any SPOILERS) . But I have to agree there are some films that just dont fit into the horror cliche . I mean just look at the movies we get . They are horror films of all kinds but there just doesn’t seem to be a lot of the things that horror films are trying to be . The thing is horror is not a cliche .

After an astronaut dies in space, he is brought back to a military base. Inside the man are discovered alien embryos -- he is the host for what could be a terrible alien invasion! This film comes to us from director Bernard L. Kowalski, who also directed "Attack of the Giant Leeches" (see separate review) but may be better known for his work on "Columbo". Executive producer was Roger Corman, known as the creator of much better films than this one... particularly in the 1960s.This movie is cheesy and poorly constructed.

Underwoods goofy story about a young man(Arquette) who convinces his friends that they should kidnap Frank Sinatra Jr. (Nicholas). The film is written ridiculously, direction is odd, dialogues are out of place and scrambled, the actors didn't do it much justice either, Arquette is annoying throughout, Ian Nicholas was nonexistent, Macy was decent, but only because hes a pretty good actor and probably just tried his best not to come out of this project with a totally embarrassing performance, he was at least tolerable.

If you 're looking for a movie that 's fun to watch simply because you can make jokes about the plot, this movie may just be what you 'd like. I found myself watching this movie as it was going to the theaters, and I did enjoy it. The acting was a little low-key, which was fine, but the movie had a lot going for it and I found myself laughing at the right moments. I guess the thing about this movie was the way it dealt with sex, and the way it dealt with the concept of lust.

This movie has remained in my mind for years as one of the best made-for-TV movie mysteries I 've ever seen. The actors are great (particularly Michael Conrad in his film debut! ), and the production design, costumes, make-up and acting are very well done. And, as I've stated elsewhere in this column, it's not a movie for the faint of heart. It is, in fact, as much of a murder mystery (as in "who done it, and why?") as it is a thriller.

Okay , . so I went into this loving RuPaul . I still love him/her but think a little less . Well , how do you like what you've seen ? I haven't seen it so I can't be certain . But it's not a bad song , I'll be the first to admit this . And if you like the song , I bet you'll be a fan of the song . If you don't like it , that's okay , too . Well , for those of you who didn't see the preview , I guess I've said my piece .

Let me begin by saying that I had been eagerly anticipating this film's release for awhile. After finally getting the chance to see it last night, I'm sorry to say that I was incredibly disappointed. It's hard to imagine a film that could make last fall's "Exorcist: The Beginning" look good, but "Dominion" does just that. No wait...it makes it look like a GREAT film. Perhaps I got myself too excited about this movie, and that contributed to the let down.

I was surprised to like this movie since I 'm from the `` check your brain at the door and do not expect any plot twist in this movie. But what made this movie great was the characters. Some of the dialogue was a bit weird, but I didn`t mind that in a movie like this. The acting by the main characters were good. I did not know how this movie would end, but I was glad that it was not like the other movies I have seen or will see in my lifetime. This is definetly one of my favorites.

Mind you , it 's not supposed to be , but it is . As a wee tot , I had an uncle in my family that was a bit of a weirdo . He was always a bit of an oddball . It's not easy growing up with someone who is always different . I remember the day I first came into contact with my uncle . I was only six years old , and he had taken me by the hand and led me up to a very large tree to show me what I was about to do .

1. I've seen Branaghs Hamlet: Branagh is too old, speaks frequently with a high pitched voice (unwillingly funny!) - not a convincing Hamlet, and his directors qualities - poor ! (see also much ado about nothing from Branagh - the funny parts of the dialogues have mostly been cut out not speaking of the directors mistakes in the dialogue cuts!) 2. I've seen Hamlet 2000: I think the scenario is an interesting idea - but such lousy actors - all of them 3. Orson Welles Hamlet is OK - but this BBC Hamlet is the best!

I found it almost impossible to empathize with Ricci 's character in this film . If she was supposed to be so self-confident and self-possessed to the point of not caring about what others think ,then why did her actions in the film seem so out-of-character to me ? For a long time I've wanted to watch the movie but had been put off by the fact that it is quite long and I don't like long films. But when I watched it recently, I realized that it really was quite long . I have to say , it's one of my favorites so far .

This was the stupidest movie I have ever seen in my life . It is a complete waste of money . It should be rated R . It makes no sense at all . I would give it zero stars if I had to do it . Just go to YouTube and look up how many of this crap movies there have been in the history of films . I would like for you to tell me what all this crap was good for . I just watched a film with a good story line . This isn't the first time I've seen crap like this .

I finally saw LAURE and I have to say that I equally enjoyed it and was dismayed by it. What's great about it is the atmosphere, the music, the location, the cinematography and the beautiful cast. The story is non-existent for sure but with these movies it doesn't really matter. The pace in languid and the settings are exotic. The film has a lot going for it. Unfortunately, it also has a few things going against it. The first thing is that the gorgeous Annie Belle and the handsome Al Cliver have no chemistry whatsoever.

This is a total piece of crap. It is an insult to the awesome book by Frank Herbert. They have mangled the story and characters. The acting is average to bad. The only character done right and played well is Duke Leto, played by William Hurt. Unfortunately, he dies pretty early in the story and then its all downhill from there (not that its a very tall hill to begin with).The 1984 movie was directed by the legendary David Lynch. I was not overly impressed with the movie, but considering the technological limitations of the time, they tried their best.

We 've all got to start somewhere , it was in films like Escape In The Fog that somebody like George Clooney proved that it's not just what you know, but what you don't. When I was a kid we'd watch the old Hollywood movies on TV , the ones where they have a car chase with a couple of guys with guns , and it's only when somebody gets the bad guy and gets shot , or the bad guys kill the good guy , or whatever it is , that we knew they were bad guys.

OK , so I got ta start this review by saying i was really expecting to see this flick for some reason, but after watching it...i was dissappointed. I really hate to do it this way, i'll tell you up front, i'll start with the good

The plot is decent, a lot of stuff happen that i thought was cool. The plot itself wasn't my favourite thing about the film, but the characters, the plot, everything just flowed so well together i just didn't mind it.

Daft potboilers don't come much dafter than this, but it's a Douglas Sirk movie which makes everything alright. Except in this case it doesn't. Based on a sanctimonious novel by the sanctimonious Lloyd C Douglas, (he wrote "The Robe"), and already filmed in 1935 with Irene Dunne and Robert Taylor, it's got more uplift than a cantilever bra.Rock Hudson is the arrogant playboy who not only feels responsible for making Jane Wyman a widow but later is directly responsible for the accident in which she loses her sight.

Corben Bernsen directed horror film about a chemical weapon being released in a sporting event and turning everyone in to zombies. This movie is very entertaining and scary. The acting and effects were done very well. It was filmed in Canada on location. The film is about a chemical weapons attack which releases a chemical gas in a football stadium. The stadium is full of fans cheering for the hometown team, but a chemical attack unleashes a deadly gas into the stadium killing everyone around them. As a result, all the fans turn into zombies while trying to kill anyone who comes in contact with them.

"Nicodemus" is almost a copy of "Red" in the odd behavior sense, but this episode focuses on other people in Clark Kent's unpredictable life. When a poisonous flower finds it's way into Smallville Jonathan Kent is the first to be effected by it. the flower causes people to reverse their behavior and when it effects Jonathan, he becomes short tempered and violent, however Clark manages to stop him from doing anything rash until his father finally passes out. okay. so far, so good. next up is Lana.

A couple of men are ship-wrecked on a remote island . They are then captured by an insane count who plans on killing them both with a sword. A few minutes after he has them tied to a chair with ropes, someone comes and cuts his head off with a samurai sword. So there you have it! That's the story, in its entirety! How could it not be a bloody, horrific tale? In case it wasn't obvious, this movie has nothing to do with sword fighting. In fact, it has no blood, and almost no gore or brutality at all.

`` Japan takes the best from around the world and makes it their own '' , while that may be the case in Korea and Vietnam and Japan. In the United States, in particular, there seems to be more emphasis on local food and community. This book is a wonderful resource for those looking for inspiration and for those who may want to know more. We are grateful to all the contributors to this book, and we hope you will find that inspiration to cook and that you will also learn something from them.

OhMyGAWD!!! THE MAGIC GARDEN is perhaps one of my most vivid '70s childhood memories. Two hippie chicks with ponytails, Carole and Paula would swing on swings, tell jokes they picked off the chuckle patch, dress up with costumes they found in a giant chest called The Storybox, and argue with a pesky pink squirrel named Sherlock that lived in one of their trees. They also could strum a mean acoustic guitar and sing a pretty melody. This was a great childhood show. Very 70s feeling. But that's the problem: They don't MAKE shows like this anymore.

Begrudgingly gave it a 3 - one point each for Fonda, Stanwyck, and the supporting cast.Never saw this one before - am watching it right now and it has just gotten to the part where Henry Fonda is carrying Babs over the threshold. If I continue watching, it will be just to see if Fonda and Stanwyck will be able to pull this one out of the dumper.But after reading the other viewer comments, I'm not very optimistic.The opening ski scenes were enough to put me off my lunch. The voice-overs were obviously done in a sound studio, and the editing between the exterior shots and the closeups was horrendous.

I can't say if "The Cavern" is a ripoff of "The Cave" because I haven't seen that. I've seen "The Descent" and that's not terrible but it is very hard to watch and so is this one. Hard to watch, as in, there's very little light and lots of fast motion so you're hard pressed to say what you're looking at. There are times when I guess, you're supposed to be scared, judging from the music, but scared of what? Bad camera work? Poor lighting?

An expedition party made up of constantly bickering and obnoxious jerks go trekking into the dangerous African jungle in search of both a fortune in diamonds and a missing young lady named Diana (luscious brunette looker Katja Biernet, clad solely in a skimpy loincloth that shows off a lot of her hot shapely body) who's worshiped as a goddess by a deadly primitive tribe called the Mabutos. Director/screenwriter Jess Franco crucially fails to inject any style or vigor into the generally blah and meandering proceedings, allowing the sluggish pace to crawl along at an often agonizingly slow clip and staging the infrequent action scenes with a singular lack of skill and panache.

1 ) Bad acting.2 ) For a bunch of castaways on an alien planet , it sure looked like home on the set of a Sci-Fi film .3 ) For me personally , there was nothing in that film which made me go " I have to see this movie . " It was just a film , and that's it . No character development , nothing really special . The only thing I found was that they were shooting it in a real rain forest , so I can guess what happened there . That's about all .

Man , I never laugh so much this year , and it 's pretty hard to make me laugh . It 's very hard , I guess . . . And , I guess it 's very easy for you to say ,
" I don 't care how long it takes . . ." It 's very easy for you to say , it 's too late ,
" I 'm too old ,
" I know I 'm not the sharpest knife in the drawer . . ." And , it 's not my problem to prove that . . .

Yeah great cult TV series . Great atmosphere , top script and good performances make this a class A candidate in my book . This is a must for any cult lovers . A truly great tv show that has one of the best running themes i've ever seen on a tv show and a good script . A lot of time and care went into this series . I have yet to see a show that has been made in a really good way. The ending was a bit sad and i felt a bit cheated. But it is an amazing tv show .

Before you watch this movie - clean your ears , take away the make-up from your eyes and tell your friends about it. You will probably find it quite amusing as I did. Enjoy. This review contains spoilers. To see them, click this icon:. To skip this review click this icon:

"Let's just forget this ever happened," I mumble through the phone, my hand clutching a handful of pills. "I'm sorry," I whisper into the mouthpiece, feeling the sweat bead down my back and into my neck.

Without John Rhys-Davies, I have to admit that this would never even register on my movie-meter. But in spite of that single fact, this is not a bad little thriller, considering the low budget, the low quality effects, the stiff acting and the Sci Fi Channel aspects. The blood effects are very convincing, and the Chupacabra actually looks realistic... regardless of what you think a Chupacabra looks like this is one good-looking Chupacabra.Aside from the positives, this runs kind of like Kolchak: The Night Stalker (Darren McGavin, remember?)

Apparently the writer and director of this direct-to-DVD slasher movie is a fan of Friday 13th and other summer camp slashers. This movie has everything - a group of teenagers who want to spend the weekend with fun, alcohol and sex in an abandoned summer camp called "Camp Blood", the old man who warns them not to go there; and of course the crazy killer with the machete who keeps on slashing and hacking at the teenagers without any reason at all... The whole thing could have worked if it had been shot on 35 mm film with acceptable Special Effects.

First of all, even IMDb is slacking with this movie, as the list of cast is VERY "gappy". Even main characters are missing from it like Buddy for example.Now back to the movie. I love watching movies, but this one tortured me throughout the whole 82 or however many minutes. It was HORRID. Probably the worst movie I have ever seen. And the reason why it bothers me so much, is because I was quite excited about seeing it beforehand.The plot line itself is good. It could have been a great film if done properly and with careful casting.

I saw the movie while I was in a class a few years back in high school . I thought it was awesome. I am so glad that I got to see it with my friends and family. We watched it again with my father the other night. He is a huge fan as well, so there was a lot of laughter while watching it . It was really well made and well acted . I think it will be a popular movie in the future. I saw it with my family the other night and was really surprised by it.

In terms of historical accuracy , this is the absolute worst Roman film I have ever seen . The list includes “Lola Montè”, “Fosse/Lupa” and “My Brother the Pig” but in my opinion this is the worst. It may be because of the production , which was made by Carlo Ponti and directed by Emilio Miraglia , but the truth is this film is just terrible. The actors are horrible, the plot is weak , and the production is awful. And the worst thing of all is that it has no originality . It is a mediocre adaptation of a famous novel.

Three children are born during a solar eclipse and ten years later this has somehow caused them to grow up to be an alien. The alien kids are being raised by their father and the father of the children. In the midst of all this, they are confronted with a giant robot. The children have been raised to take orders from others. They want their father to be the one in charge. As they grow older, the aliens get more and more aggressive, and in turn the kids are more and more worried. As they grow older, the kids get more and more frustrated and violent.

For me, reviewing movies is an extension of my love of film--and of horror cinema, in particular. The reviews I've written thus far have been for films that I love, respect, and admire, and I have eagerly rewarded them with glowing accolades and perfect-ten ratings. A life-long horror movie fan, it is a tremendous pleasure for me to be able to share with others my thoughts and ideas about great horror films, and to, hopefully, have a hand in exposing people to movies they may not otherwise seek out.

This is truly one of the most awful movies of all time . It 's dull , ponderous , badly written , badly directed . It 's not an original concept , it 's unoriginal . It has very little plot or character development , and it doesn 't do a thing to advance the plot . It has some fine acting from the lead actor , but not much. It 's a very dull movie that makes you wonder if you are supposed to like it . If you don 't , it doesn 't even bother you enough to laugh at it .

Having lived in Michigan's Upper Peninsula (30 miles from Escanaba) in the mid-1990s, I was eager to see this film. It begins promisingly enough, with some superficial understanding of the values and quirks of U.P. life. But Jeff Daniels apparently was not content with a low-key approach that would have been fitting given the place and the people. Instead, he introduces extremely crude humor and some wildly inappropriate mystical/supernatural elements. Although there is a good movie to be made about this practically unknown region of the U.S., this is NOT it.

This has to be one of the worst movies ever to come out of the Sci-Fi Channel . Here is the synopsis from Wikipedia:

This is a low budget feature-length television film, produced by Robert K. Miller, and released on VHS on August 26, 1993, and on DVD August 25, 2003. The film was produced by Robert K. Miller, who is an actor and producer. Robert K. Miller has also appeared in many episodes of The Outer Limits. The movie was originally broadcast in the United States on VHS tape on August 26, 1993.

First - nick-623, Pearl Harbor was bombed in 1941, not 1942. They didn't have to predict the bombing.Second - did nobody notice these six industrialist/lawyers/whatever were missing for a rather long amount of time? They were killed *before* the surgery took place! Third - how the heck did Lugosi get out of cabs without being seen? Fourth - why did the Japanese not just kill him, instead of putting him in jail with a convenient look-alike companion and his surgical kit? Fifth - oh, what's the use?

Got this the other day from the Creators on DVD . I saw this advertised in a free magazine whilst browsing and thought its a shame that a movie is going to have to wait until November. I was wrong! The movie is called DIE SCREEN and it's only been out in Australia and New Zealand for six weeks now. Here are the links to the two DVD's for your reading pleasure. The first one has been out in the US for a couple of weeks now, and you can check it out over there.

If you came here, it's because you've already seen this film and were curious what others had to say about it.I feel for you, I *really* do. And I profusely apologize as a Canadian (because that's what we do) that this film ever had to cross your eyes, if only for a moment. I hear there is no cure for the retinal bleeding reported out of every dozen cases.I, like everyone else, rented this movie believing it to be some stupid B-movie ripoff of Blade. I thought, "sure I could use a good laugh at a stupid movie."

There were many 'spooky' westerns made in the 30s and early 40s, and although this has a strong beginning, it isn't one. Randy Bowers (John Wayne) stopping at a 'Halfway House' saloon, finds it to be full of dead bodies, the bartender's corpse draped over the bar holding a gun, eyes watching Randy from behind holes cut through eyes in a picture, and a player piano playing "The Loveliest Night of the Year." It was the result of a robbery by the Marvin Black gang, to get Ed Rogers' $30,000.

As someone who was in a Pan-Hellenic sorority , I was n't sure what to expect when I tuned into the new series of The CW's Riverdale. I don't recall the show being as well received as it has been in season 1, but I am glad I was able to watch it and learn more about the cast. Riverdale is about a town in Kansas with a rich history. Archie , Betty and Veronica, along with their friends Jughead, Blossom, Reggie Mantle, Cheryl Blossom, and many others. The title refers to the river that runs through the middle of the town.

This movie was Flippin Awful .... I wanted those hours of my life back . For god 's sake , this guy made the worst movie ever ! I will never get the point of what was in this movie . I did not even care to know whats going on , and it did not interest me . This movie was awful ! I have to hand it to this guy for giving us a true story for a change. And I say that without any reservations - the man has a story to tell us. He is an honest journalist and tells a good story.

This is a bad film, as its central message is very muddled and the plot seems like it was the result of merging several disparate scripts. As a result, it often makes absolutely no sense at all and certainly is not a film Miss Dunne or Mr. Huston should have been proud of making. However, the film IS worth watching if you are a fan of "Pre-Code" films because it features an amazingly sleazy plot that strongly says that nice girls DO put out--even if they aren't married and even if their partner IS!!

The most disturbing thing about this film is not that it 's a load of hogwash ( the CPUSA was an international communist organization that had nothing to do with Russia, the Soviet Union, or Stalin), but that it seems to be a load of hogwash. In many ways, I think the movie tries too hard to pretend that it's about an ordinary family's journey to join up in the Labour Party when, in fact, it was a political organization founded and directed by a group of internationalists who saw the struggle against fascism as being fought by working men of all countries.

Mickey Rourke ( who was once a famous movie star ) plays Martin Fallon an IRA terrorist who accidentally blows up a school bus full of children who is so disgusted by his actions decides to leave the IRA and goes on the run in London !!!! MILD SPOILERS !!! !The movie's opening is rather disturbing as the lives of little children are ended in a fireball . Things like this happened throughout the 1970s and 1980s and into the 1990s in Northern Ireland which gives A PRAYER FOR THE DYING a stark realism . However as soon as Fallon decides he's going to give up violence ( What ?

One should have the right to expect from people who make a film about the Second Coming and the Third, the fourth and the Fifth. But the people who make films are people too. The problem is that the people who want to make films have an idea about how the world is and how the world will be. And they are often influenced by those who have influence over the people who have influence over the film world. It is possible for an idea to be influential for a long time and to not be influenced at all by the time one is old.

What a shocker. For starters, I couldn't stand the constant screaming and noisy panicking all the time. It didn't make me scared, horrified, or make me sympathetic towards the characters; it was simply annoying. The jerky camera movements were also annoying. The plot was the same as pretty much every other cheap horror. There was a few pathetic attempts to give the characters some depth, but it didn't really work into the rest of the plot. And then there's the ending. I'm still not really sure what to make of it.

It is an interesting exercise to witness the early works of great artists. Sometimes, even without the 20/20 vision that hindsight offers you can see the cogs and wheels that make these people what they are. Following is one such look into the past of Christopher Nolan, one of the great time-warping story-teller of today.Christopher Nolan's style of film-making puts a great deal of emphasis on the delivery of the story. Although people might complain it relies too much on the back-and-forth shifting of time, I still find it fascinating to see how he uses that one technique differently each time.

Before I saw this movie I believed there were two kinds of bad cinema. (1) Your average, completely uninspired fare (i.e. "Constantine"), and (2) the work that is charmingly bad, or so-bad-it's good (a la "Manos The Hands of Fate"). Now that I've seen "Dr. Gore" I know there is a third kind of bad movie: the utter crap sandwich. That will be irrevocably tattooed on your memory. A work that is mind-bendingly execrable.

why oh why did i ever waste my time watching this film ? it was given to me on video but it was so awful. it just didn't do anything to entertain me, just bore me to the point i had to take it off, i didn't like this movie, i really didn't . the plot was stupid , the acting was poor and so were the editing and the writing. I saw this movie at the local movie theater with a few people who didn't care for it so we had to sit in a dark room for the first half an hour.

The recent release of `` Mad Dog Morgan '' on Troma DVD is disappointing.This appears to be a censored print run of the film, as it has a number of changes that I have never heard of before. For example, the first scene that takes place in a restaurant has the restaurant name censored out, as well as the title "Mad Dog Morgan's", which makes it a more accurate description. The entire final scene also has a scene censored out of what originally was supposed to be a scene where the two men have a fight and are dragged away to jail by police.

Sometimes there 's a film so bad that you just keep watching in awe . This is one of those films. Just when you think you've seen it all, you discover yet another aspect to the film. The thing is, I've seen every horror film made, and this is one of the worst. The plot is not original, nor is there any sense of urgency or menace. There is also not one ounce of horror or suspense in the film, it's a bunch of cheap scares, cheap special effects, and a plot which is a complete non-entity.

Everywhere I hear that people are calling this show bad because its premise is too far fetched .... well maybe its the writers but the people are the ones who are to blame in the end

There's nothing wrong with that show, except that the people that make the show are usually the wrong kind of people. People who want to live their lives as if there is no other world but this one we're living on, as if there's nothing beyond it. People who have never seen or experienced another world.

This film basically try to portray the heroism of firefighters by making the whole movie revolve around a American dad (John Heard) who works in a firehouse (with his firefighter daughter Amy) as the father and a daughter (Kelley Scott) who is in the fire department. But as the movie progresses we discover that Amy and the father are in love and are making love in their firehouse. After a while he proposes to her and during the proposal Amy says she loves him. All the scenes are shot in black and white to give a realistic impression.

For a series that was inspired by Kolchak , it 's ironic that The X Files first attempt at a horror story would be more than a decade before it came to fruition. Kolchak , the protagonist of The X Files, is a man with a dark past. He's been through a lot as his family was torn apart by his father's illness, and then his mother's illness, and eventually his own death, and he has lived through all of it with nothing but a handful of friends for companionship.

This film is about a bunch of misfits who are supposed to be assigned to a task that is expected to be done on the next day. For example, these guys should be doing a job on their next day and get paid, but are given the job on their day, and not paid. The guys are assigned to the job, and do what they are assigned, but get fired. The first guy is a girl who thinks that if the guys will do the job, they are going to get paid.

Are you kidding me? The music was SO LOUD in this show I could often not even hear the dialog. And the music was nothing great. Anyone know what Jake's mother said when he walked in the door??? And the mushroom cloud looked pretty close to have so little instant devastation. Anyone research the effects of nuclear fallout before writing this one. I felt like a bunch of sit com actors were sent on location and didn't know what to do with dramatic dialog. And what does a Kansas teen know about shopping in Soho....couldn't we have had a better line here?

O boy , was this really bad.I saw this on videotape.In scenes that had soundtrack music , it was hard to hear the lyrics.If it is the song that you like, I would rerecord it to be sure it is the right one.I am sorry to hear this is not available to the people in the area.I will tell the people in my area the new song is now available.Thank you.I will post this song on youtube and tell everyone about it.Thank you.I would be glad to do anything I can.It was a great pleasure listening to you sing the song.Thanks.

The portrayal of the Marines in this film is spot on. The action scenes are some of the best ever produced in accuracy of content. The uniforms and weaponry of both the U.S. and German troops were perfect. The costumes and weaponry of the Berbers were perfectly accurate as well. This film could easily be used to teach militaria of the period and has been used by the USMC Academy for this purpose. The scenes depicting Roosevelt shooting and the rifles he was using was beautiful. Procuring so many period weapons in such good shape is testament to the attention to detail and presentation this film should be noted for.

I, being a fan of Rupert Grint, rented this film a few months ago. I thought it was a very well written movie with a bunch of great actors. It was entertaining, and showed that Rupert Grint could play more than his most well known character of Ron Weasley. His subtle portrayal of Ben and everyone else's great acting made this film very likable.Ben, a very shy boy with a extremely religious and sensitive mother, is looking for a job. He finds one and becomes the, I guess you could call "assistant" to Evie, a retired actress.

The greatest tragedy man faces is that , capable so often of the divine he settles for the banal.From this moment on, our destiny will belong to us.We will make the decisions; no one else will.And it will no longer be an accident of circumstance or a misfortune of birth that determines our life.A man can not live by chance; he needs a plan.Our life will belong to us by right of conquest: to those who will accept us as they find us, or not to those who reject us as they find themselves . . .

"Yagyu ichizoku no inbo" (let's just say "The Shogun's Samurai") is somewhere between horrifically boring and mind-bogglingly painful to watch. As an historical epic, it could have had so many more chances to be a rich saga... but it's really no more than just another cheap '70s action flick with a based-on-real-events story and an eyepatch-sporting Sonny Chiba. Before this movie's halfway point, I was even tempted to commit seppuku! The music is like a thousand dogs in heat wailing in your ears to a tune composed by Ennio Morricone (that's not an insult towards Morricone).

I 've waited 9 years to watch this film , simply because i never saw it advertised on TV . it was supposed to be released in america as "the new hollywood western" , but it never came out in america . that was a mistake because i have a very vivid recollection of it . that was in 1995 , i watched the first half hour of "the new hollywood western" and i remember being amazed and amused . i think this movie is a great success for hollywood , a huge box office success and a huge success at home as well .

The subject matter was good, direction was OK. Mohanlal was efficient in his role as a Major. The acting of the supporting actors was amateurish at best. The casting director and director should be held responsible for this debacle. Hawaldar Jai was terrible, he stood out like a sore thumb with his poor histrionics. He did not look the part nor did he move like a soldier. There was a scene where a satellite feed was required of the skirmish with the militants and they were showing it from a camera angle.

I remember watching this movie over and over again when I was a kid . I loved it . Whilst there are a few things I wish they hadn't cut out I don't think it's because they were "bad" but more because they didn't fit the plot . If you don't know the movie it is set in the late 70's early 80's when the world economy was going down the toilet and there were a lot of people making very little money with a lot of hope and lots of people going broke .

Tediously long dreary cinematic waffle . I could n't believe how bad this film was . I watched it merely once in my life and then forgot about . It is as bad as ever . It was a waste of a great actor . But as I was looking forward to seeing it being released here in India , I was not surprised how badly it was filmed . But the plot was so dull and boring and so far from the film's promise . It is a film that will live and die . It is as much of a failure today as it was during its time .

I saw this movie on TV and loved it! I am a real disaster film fan, and this one was great. The cast was made of some really interesting people. Connie Selleca is always great. And William Devane is in a league of his own. He can play both comedy and thriller in the same movie like few others can. The story line is great too. The thought of being able to follow a time line of what will happen, and to use this time line to prevent a global disaster is an interesting idea.

Without a shadow of a doubt this is and probably will always be the worst film i have ever had the missfortune to see my whole life. Take 5 wooden actors who got thrown out of acting school because they were so wooden someone sat on them thinking they were a bench.Then add a cheap camcorder. You know the old VHS types that cost £20 on ebay. Add a terrible story line with no effects and yes you have this film. What a shocker it was. They couldn't even save it by having a fit girl in it.

The film Soultaker is essentially an older form Final Destination in which several car wrecked teens have their souls separated from their bodies and must cheat death who is chasing them... The film has its moments, and its concepts, the idea of disoriented souls being separated from their bodies is a pretty nifty idea... If this movie were remade with a few good actors/actresses and some awesome special effects it could turn out to be extremely awesome... As for the actual film, I recommend watching the MST3K version, the pure version might be too boring to sit through, unless you love bad movies staring Martin Sheen's brother...

Solo is an action movie about a Terminator-like android that is constructed and trained for the military . When a female cyborg is sent to him to serve as a personal servant , she is taken over by the android , and her memories are erased by him . She escapes with the help of a soldier , and later she meets him in a diner . She falls in love with him . After the war , the android and cyborg fall in love , and the cyborg tries to forget about her human life , but she cannot . After a few days , the android finds out about her love with him .

Having just watched Acacia, I find that I have to agree with the negative reviews here. I like Asian, and Korean horror, and I had great expectations for this film. Man, was i disappointed. Watching this, I kept thinking "surely they just do this to catch me off guard later on", and for a while I expected something ingenious to happen. However, I slowly realised that the film really is that bad. It is the cheapest cash in into the Asian horror market I have seen so far.

I was trying to work out why I enjoyed this film ? ? Its not because of money spent on CGI ? I think that this is the most beautiful movie I have ever seen. I don't know how to describe the look of it but I think the colours were so beautiful that it would have been very hard to make them in a real world. When the actors are speaking it is like I am actually there watching them. And in the film there are beautiful images which I can never describe in words. And I think that this film has some great lines that I want to read.

I can not stress how bad this movie is . This director took every cheap little unintelligent shot at making a good movie and just shoved it down the viewer's throat . That movie is just not funny at all . The dialogue and acting is so bad i dont know what the point was at all . I would not reccommend this movie to anyone . There are some funny moments in the movie , but after that the story line is so lame i didnt even finish it , this movie couldnt have been worse , and i hope they take the money that they earned in the box office and invest it wisely .

Being 15 myself I enjoyed this flick thouroughly!! I related to the character Ann August more than most would. My Mother isnt AS eccentric as Adele, but the feelings of lonliness is the same. This movie is perfect in the ating aspects, and Natalie's, and Susan's performances are so linked together that it's the best onscreen dual i have seen in years. Their chemistry brings the characters to life, they become real people! I would recommend this flick to anyone who is hoping to get away.
