I guess I should now comment upon a 4th flick in the MAGNIFICENT SEVEN franchise; the sequels still surprise or amaze meby their sleaze and deliberate _absurdism. They constitute or forge a 4th waynot classic, not revisionist, not Europeanbut a sleaze Americana, kindred to the violent vigilante '70s movies, absurd trash. This installment too is bombastic sleazeinexplicably awkward and even somewhat strange.Now what I find disturbing that these sequels not only have their opportunist fans; but that the fans simply do not sense any difference between the original's style and the sequels'.These sequels are not boring or insipidbut bizarre.

Being a former MST3k watcher , even I found this movie unwatchable . The awful attempts at humor-heck the awful acting , the poor CGI, the unappealing costumes , even the lousy music was just too much to watch . I didn't care for any of it but I still found it enjoyable enough to check out . I was surprised to find out the movie is based on a manga by Haruki Murakami. It was also the first time I was introduced to his work after seeing the anime adaptations and I found I enjoyed it even more.

While caricatures and/or references to entertainment industry people or things or even brands of products is usually a staple in many memes, there have also been memes in which memes are made of celebrities and/or products themselves, usually with the idea that the celebrity is not actually the celebrity at all. In most of these cases, the celebrities are not well liked in their own right, but it still seems like people like these celebrities so much they would have the bad taste to use them for a joke, so they use celebrities like these to make fun of.

Sony Pictures Classics, I'm looking at you! Sony's got the rights to Harry records -- you need to distribute the film and you'll get radically increased sales of his back catalog! Anyhow, this is a great study of a fascinating musician, woefully underknown, full of great stories, greater music, and it could have been 3 hours longer and I'd have loved it even more. Saw it at the American Cinemateque Mods & Rockers Festival at the Aero Theatre in Santa Monica, where it played to a packed house. They were turning people away at the door!

This film's a big bore. It has a plenty of Predictable plots & endless sentiments from the start. It starts good with a classy number but seems lost midway.Surya & Jyothika's on screen chemistry works out really good & a good part by Bhoomika. Why include Vadivelu in it? He disappears totally after a good half an hour!. Santhanam proves his wit again by timing comedy.AR's tunes sure will last for sometime. But he could have done better. What ever be the drawbacks still it's worth watching once if you feel alone at home or looking for a good time-pass.

This is one of the best films I 've seen in the last years.Belmonndo and Deneuve shine in their respective roles.I wish this will get more distribution. I hope it gets the Oscar nomination and wins it. One of the greats and definitely worth watching. This film is not the first film about two women but it is one of the most important ones. I will never , ever forget watching this show around the age of 13 . Even at the young age I was , I felt that this is how I wanted to see my life . When I went to the church for my confirmation , I had the idea of becoming a missionary . I just felt like this is what I had been looking for .

OK, Number one-this "film" is a "90's" version of a crappy show from the 70's that no one remembers! Hahahahah Probably one of the funniest movies i've even seen. Obviously this isn't intentional though. It takes about half the movie for the main characters to realize what the big hilly thing is in the middle of the city is spewing hot red stuff, and the other half spent diverting the lave flow through the city using fire trucks (yer right). Way back at the dawn of human civilization cavemen sat around and made lame jokes, hit each other over the heads with what ever they could grab, and women were never seen and apparently at one time had tails. These cavemen lived in a geographically diverse region with a cockatoo, a camel, a monkey - but no women. This film tells of the "hilarious" misadventures of seven(or so) cavemen - having burned their land with the new discovery of fire - moving on by water to a new land where they find this woman with the extra appendage.

I loved this movie when I was a teenager . LOVED it . It has n't grown up with me , but I think of it every now and again, and it gives me a good kick in the balls every time . It is not for everyone , but those who do have to go, go , go . This is a great movie , and a really great comedy . The acting is brilliant , but the screenplay is just too good , and the humor is just too much . It's so bad it's funny .

(Contains spoilers)People who put a Lonely Heart's ad in the newspaper are often idealists. They try to put into a few words everything they are and expect. The exchange of letters is full of hope...Louis Mahe (Jean Paul Belmondo), owner of a cigarette company on the ile de la Reunion (east of Madagascar) is so affected by the letters of Julie Roussell that he proposes to her. But not the expected pretty brunette comes from board of the "Mississippi", but - Catherine Deneuve.

I've seen several stage and film adaptations of Alice in Wonderland and this one has to take the cake as the absolute worst. My family bought the DVD unsuspectingly and couldn't even make it through the first half. I later went back and forced myself to watch the whole thing (it had been a Christmas gift to me) and was just appalled.The only redeeming factor (and it's hardly redeeming enough to save the whole show) is Mark Lin-Baker playing the Mock Turtle with a Yiddish accent. It's one of the few moments in the piece that has some real charm and can be taken somewhat seriously.

i'm not going to ramble on about it but i'm just going to make it brief. basically for those who don't know how prue actually died........... the first time round the demonic assassin comes hit piper and prue with an energy ball they fly through the wall blood everywhere. phoebe the third sister comes down the stairs, says the spell which send him away but not vanquished. Katharine Hepburn as a mountain woman who mixes prayer with positive thinking -- and is thought by the local folk to have been the inspiration for the movie. I love the character because she's strong and she can face any problem and still get up," she told ABC's "Good Morning America" in an interview to be aired Tuesday on the show's "Early Show." Tarentino should be ashamed to be involved with this awful film. The acting, directing and script are all third-rate - with the entire film playing out like an excuse for writer/director/star Larry Bishop to get laid. The only reason it was made at all is most likely due to his association with QT. The plot of the film is pretty flimsy, and basically tries to survive on not-so-obscure references to older B-movies and some cameos from guys like David Carradine, Dennis Hopper, and Vinnie Jones. Each one is listless in their performance, particularly Hopper who is in full-on paycheck mode at this point in his career.

I 'm not sure where to start with this . In short , it was a disappointing movie . Having said that , it was certainly worth seeing . However , it is not for everyone . It is a bit much in length , and has a few slow parts . It could have been cut down by a quarter . But for me , its worth it , because it gave me a better insight on what the movie world thinks of its actors , actresses , and actors in the industry . As for the movie , it is one that is full of great acting , and great performances .

you've followed this blog in some time, you probably know how much I have

They said it would be a film greater than Turks Fruit. How darethey? It's not even 10% of this classic. Bad acting. The only character i felt sympathy for was the oneplayed by Angela Schijf. It's a shame. There's an interesting idea here, but it gets completely lost in a confusion of Commodore 64 style computer effects and bad storytelling. The plot, such as it is, concerns a bounty hunter of souls. It should be a fairly straightforward hunter/hunted kind of story, but the director and/or the writer seem like they forgot what the movie was supposed to be when they were about three days into shooting. Things aren't helped by the fact that the main baddie looks like he's wearing a cheap Darth Maul mask, which they tried to disguise with flowing CG colors.

There is no way to avoid a comparison between The Cat in the Hat and The Grinch Who Stole Christmas. As I have pointed out, there are differences between the two stories but they are more than just verbal. There is a very real story behind each. The Grinch, as we have been reminded this week, is the hero of this story. The Grinch is the bad boy. He is the villain. He wants to steal Christmas and he can’t stand being told what to do by The Cat in the Hat, the good guy.

a great movie , with a rather unclear political message . it´s shot in a theatrical style , i.c . the movie goes on , i do not understand why it does not do a sequel , it was a really great movie and i would love to see a sequel , but as the movie does not go on , i can´t imagine that the second film will be able to be done as a movie without being a TV movie , but with the new technology it could be done , i would like it if a second film will be made .

Solo is a poor film - that cannot be ignored. The acting for the most part is very wooden (the only exception is Adrien Brody's performance as Solo's creator Bill) and the story is slight enough that you would probably forget it WHILST you where watching the film. That said, such films are more about the action than the plot/acting and, as such, live or die by the action set pieces - that after all is the point of such films - to give 14 year-olds something to smile at whilst the adults watch films of actual substance.

I was attracted to this film by its offbeat, low-key, 'real life' story line. That is, a twenty-something guy flops in the Big Apple and comes back home to live with his parents and even more floppy brother. It just might have worked but there's a problem. And that problem's name is Casey Affleck. Casey Affleck is nearly catatonic in this film. His acting mantra must be "exert as little effort as possible at all times". Or "why speak when you can mutter?" Or maybe "put yourself into a coma as soon as the camera rolls".

This is without doubt the worst movie i have ever seen. And believe me, I have seen a lot of movies. The unbelievable twist the movie makes - going from an extremely bad "Alien lifeforms inhabit earth" movie with sickening bad acting, to a film that tries to spread an Archchristian "Judgement day is at hand, seek Jesus or though shall burn for all eternity in the fiery debts of hell" message - left me stunned after being tormented for 85 minutes. Even religious Christians must be ashamed or furious by watching their beliefs being posted like this.

I found this movie immensely interesting yet a little jaded , it talks of violence and what there doing , I was a bit put off because I think a film should never be jaded but the way the movie is put , I found to be jaded

It was pretty good and it's not a good movie, but it has to be said that a lot of people liked it. It has an interesting plot and some interesting scenes and the editing was good. There is a lot of violence and blood but it isn't gratuitous.

In addition to the fact that this is just an abysmally made film ( imagine giving a camcorder to the elderly and asking if they would like to film themselves walking to the grocery store; they would be offended), it's just so sad. I feel as if the author has given up hope of a decent story and just wants us to enjoy the fact that he is able to say something that makes his readers think. There was nothing in his script to give a reason to care or even to like his characters or their motivations. Nothing.

The only good thing about Persepolis is the shadows created in the German Expressionism-style of animation and a hint of history. This movie bored me. It was about a woman dissatisfied with her culture who tries everything else and then goes back to her roots. Here she finds great discontentment once again and finally leaves for final to let everyone else in her country figure out the situation and what they will do now that she is not there to support them. It comes to no conclusion and leaves us with a feeling that this woman has no loyalties.

This odd little film starts out with the story of Bruno ( Alex Linz ) in a catholic school who discovers he has powers of telekinesis but also of teleportation. He has to decide whether he should continue to use the abilities or give up on his dreams. He soon finds he needs to develop his abilities in order to save people. He finds that he is able to manipulate objects and people with his telekinesis. Soon, he is working for a gang that want him to use this powers for them, but the only thing they care about is money.

This film is just as bad as "The Birdman of Alcatraz". I do not refer to the acting but rather the premise of both films, which try to portray psychopathic criminals as heroic figures. Moreover it disturbs me when well respected, revered actors like Alan Alda (and Burt Lancaster) play such roles, because their status tends to lend credibility to the director's intent to elevate the film's subject, a societal outcast.I was in junior high school during the last years of Caryl Chessman's life and his death penalty appeals and books were very much in the news.

whomever thought of having sequels to Iron Eagle must be shot . In this case once was enough . Iron Eagle II has been done and done right and you can still go on playing it if you wanted to . If you are a true movie buff like me then I highly suggest you watch the Iron Eagle movies . They are just pure fun . The first two films were just fun and the later ones are even better . After watching both of them now you are really craving to see something else because they are just perfect .

Let 's face it.This movie is incredibly cliché , as Korean romance dramas and movies go . First of all , the drama itself was a bit predictable . However it's actually more than that , the story of the drama is actually pretty fresh . I actually liked it and I think that if you watched it from beginning , then the story might become more interesting . It has a good pace and it doesn't feel rushed . Plus I'm glad that we got more than one story in the first half of the film, as it added something to the film as well .

First i got ta say that this film is way less pretentious than The Da Vinci Code . sure , it has a bit of the latter, with a bit of the earlier, with a bit of the latter . sure , there are some really cool things to take note of . okay so if you haven't noticed , i like movies . so here goes ...
