As a fan of nearly any period drama , and at that a huge Jane Austen fan , I was always looking for new TV projects that would have a nod to one of the great authors of our time. The recent announcement of the upcoming Netflix Original series Sense8 from Star Trek: Discovery executive producer Alex Kurtzman makes me particularly hopeful for the show. But with Sense8, which focuses on eight extraordinary people who have psychic abilities that have been used as weapons against one another since the earliest years of human history, I think there are even more potential for this type of series.

I just saw this movie at the Tribeca Film Festival and i have to say that i thought it was a pretty good movie and one of the best movies of the year. But I think that the problem was that it was directed by Michael Mann who used to be one of the biggest movie makers of our time until he went mad and made some pretty terrible movies. But the movie was very boring and had some great scenes that I didn’t like but overall i thought it was a pretty good movie.

We usually think of the British as the experts at rendering great adventure from the Imperial age , with the Romans , Vikings , and Celts to follow. This is probably not quite true and it probably doesn’t really reflect reality. I decided to try to reconstruct the history of Ireland, starting in 941 AD with the Viking raids on Ulster and the arrival of the Vikings, then going through the Norman conquest and the arrival of the Normans. This would give us the beginnings of the island, a history that would have a lot to say about the Vikings, the Vikings, the Irish, and the Irish.

I can't understand why IMDb users would rate this movie 5.2/10? It really is great, very funny. I would strongly recommend this movie for all of you, adults, teenagers and especially children! The story is about a 14-year-old kid who always tell lie, at home and school. One day he had his homework of writing a 1000-word-story. But he didn't, so the teacher told him to write it and gave her in 3 hours, or he would have to go to Summer School. Yep, he wrote it in 2:45.

First of all, before I start my review, I just read every review for 'The Muppet Movie' here and I can't believe that someone could give a negative review to a movie like this. (Fortunately there was only one.) I mean, I can understand how someone may not like 'Star Wars' due to the whole Sci-Fi genre, but to not like a movie starring some of the most lovable puppets in the history of mankind is almost sad. Okay, I will step off my soapbox now and review this movie. 'The Muppet Movie' came out when I was seven.

"Delusion" is what you experience when you watch this flick and then believe you saw something worthwhile. This flick, which tells of a trio of semi-psycho travelers who are up to no good somewhere in the CA desert, is amateurish and just plain stupid. The film suffers from an awful story, a lousy screenplay, and some terrible direction just to mention a few of the deficits. If the flick has anything at all going for it, it's B-movie diva Rubin's even performance. Don't waste your time on this turkey.

Insanely well crafted mini-series.I recall seeing most of it twice when shown on American Playhouse on PBS. Was heavily promoted at the time. I believe it might have been one of the very early mini-series showing on PBS outside of the Masterpiece Theater series.The full length production was shown I believe only once during its first broadcast. Was 6-8 hours total. This length was edited down somewhat to 6 hours. Cut some interesting, but slow scenes.I am very much hoping that the folks holding its current rights do follow through and restore a complete, not edited version to DVD.

I've always found the dilettante Man Ray and his artistic efforts to be deeply pretentious, and I've never understood why his work attracts so much attention. Apart from his Rayographs (which he invented by accident, and which are merely direct-contact photo prints), his one real contribution to culture seems to be that he was the first photographer to depict female nudity in a manner that was accepted as art rather than as porn. But surely this had to happen eventually, and there's no real reason why Ray deserves the credit.

I was once a big Olsen fan. I received this movie when I was six and watched it almost nonstop until I was nine. Then it lay on my shelf gathering dust until yesterday. I was left speechless.Mary-Kate and Ashley play Allie and Mel, two twelve year olds who are sent to spend Spring Break in Paris with their ambassador grandfather. Along the way, they meet, as one might expect, two cute French boys who show them the more fun side to Paris. I guess the two boys were okay, fake French accents aside.

Even by the lowered standards of '80s slasher movies , this one stinks . The usual gaggle of oversexed teens and the teenage girl who's the center of the action are here but what really makes this film a bad flick is the fact that the horror genre has evolved so well since the early 80's and we have a glut of horror movies on DVD now but when you're on a tight budget and have little or no marketing budget , making a quality horror flick can be a challenge . I don't feel this movie is nearly as bad as other movies that have come out in recent years .

`` Lackawanna Blues'is so emotionally powerful in its portrayal of urban Blacks during the 50s and early 60s . A brilliant piece of work. I can't recommend it enough. It makes me feel ashamed that we've forgotten so much of what we were made up as, but I'm sure you'll be proud that you're not what we are. You've never let that happen. And we love you. Monday, May 14, 2011

I know, this is not even a year old. You're probably wondering how this is possible considering that it's been less than a year since we moved here.

The Girl in Lovers Lane is one strange little low-budget film. On its surface, the movie tells the story of a tough drifter named Bix (Brett Halsey) who spends his time looking out for a young kid named Danny (Lowell Brown) and the girl, Carrie (Joyce Meadows), that Bix meets who would like to look out for him. Nothing overly interesting happens (Bix goes out with Carrie, Bix gets Danny out of trouble, Carrie's father drinks a lot, etc.) until about 10 minutes to go in the movie when Carrie is murdered.

Give director Stanley Tong of Jackie Chan's Super Cop and Rumble in the Bronx, and what do you get? You receive a series of kung fu fights and a lack of Magoo-like madness.The limited plot has Magoo (Leslie Nielsen) put into an international plot, where he steals a world-renowned gem. Of course he has no idea what he is doing. In fact, he has no idea that he had the gem.Within thirty minutes you could get very bored watching this. There are some very funny moments though like when he is cooking the chicken.

I've always enjoyed Frank Sinatra's music, and just recently I wrote a term paper about his life story. I've been fascinated by the life and legend of Ol' Blue Eyes. However, I've never seen any of his movies. So I wanted to see if his acting was as great as his singing. Well...it was! I was blown away by his performance in this movie! He really does a tremendous job as recovering heroin addict Frankie Machine, who's trying to put his life back together and audition as a drummer for a local band.

Low budget mystery. A shot rattles out of the dark and a woman is seen running from that direction. A young architect Jimmy McMillan(Chick Chandler)discovers a dead body that goes missing. The woman in a hurry, Mary(June Clyde), is linked to the death scene; but it is McMillan that has to try and solve the case to avoid serious suspicion. Suspects are six shop owners in the vicinity of the crime scene. All the atmosphere of Film-Noir; but not quite the real thing. This flick musters just enough to be a decent low budget mystery/drama and is a nice little escape.

This rendition of "Noah's Ark" has set Hallmark's (and Turner's) reputation back about 100 years. However, the production has it's bright side...a learning experience for neophyte movie entrepreneurs in "how not to make a movie"Where in the annals of Biblical literature and common sense can one find these quotes and situations:"Ok, boys, let's saddle up." "It's too bad that God created the sun to shine only during the day when we really needed it at night."

The revisionist history -- making the evil Marquis de Sade a semi-heroic romantic -- is mind-boggling enough . But the other revisionist, which I have just noticed for the first time, is that he was a sadist: "In the years of 1838 to 1850, Sade, then a thirty-six-year-old _bâtonnière_ who had already been married for nine years, had a string of mistresses, and a series of _enfants sauvages_ to whom he subjected them in the manner of a _pétardier_ of the time. Sade had a deep-seated hatred for women, and a deep-seated love of children.

JURASSIC PARK III *___ Adventure Sam Nell (The Dish), William Macy (Happy Texas, Fargo), TZ(a Leoni (Family Man)A better title would be: ESCAPE FROM THE ISLAND OF REALLY MEAN DINOSAURS. But then no one would need to see the film. In this sequel, a rag-tag group pays a visit to the island of dinosaurs to rescue the teenage victim of a hang-gliding accident.ACCESS HOLLYWOOD reports JP3 began filming without a completed script. That explains why the film seems to have little or no purpose other than to demonstrate state-of-the-art special effects.

This is on my TV right now ... but only long enough for me to finish panning it in this video. So how did I get all of this? I got a friend who works at Paramount Pictures to email me and say, "How can you leave me out of your YouTube video?" He wanted me to send them a picture of what I was doing so they could see what I look like, so I did. I sent them a picture! I was hoping that the video would go viral and I'd get thousands of people watching it, but that didn't happen.

When I saw the trailers for this movie, it looked like a good romantic comedy. I expected some light fluffy fun. Instead, I was bored and a little depressed.Honestly, there was no chemistry between the leads at all, and the movie had little, if anything, that was funny about it. The little girl was adorable - when she cried, I cried - but I thought they might have used someone a little bit younger in the role.Either way, the movie was filled with long, dull silences or swelling opera music.

You may be interested to know that BARRICADE was viewed as a failure by the studio and shelved for a year before ALICE FAYE's popularity reached such a high that the studio decided to release the film despite the fact that it was never fully completed. It fared modestly OK at the box-office.Faye refers to a murder during her nightclub stint in New York City--and this scene was actually in the script and was the way the film was to start. Instead, it is entirely missing and what could have been an exciting sequence (including a complete song number by Faye) was never filmed.

If You can watch a film without worrying about the plot , or corny acting , then Backdraft is definitely worth a viewing. I've watched this movie twice and will be doing so on the third viewing. It was not perfect, and there were several holes in the script, but that does not take away from it's quality. This is the first film from writer/director R. Lee Ermey. Ermey had worked in the military in Vietnam and had also had a relationship with his wife (who is the same age as his son in Backdraft), so he knew what it took to bring a story to life.

This film is a very beautiful and slow film. There is nothing Hollywood about it. It is very danish and the characters are very real. It is the first danish film to take up this transsexual theme. It is really about love that has no gender. I would not say it is about lesbian love even though the two main characters (the transsexual veronika and Charlotte) are attracted to each other. It is a story about love and life.The story pretty much takes place in the two apartments. There is almost no background music, which makes it seem more real and intense.

I went to this film having no idea what to expect. I actually took a date to it in the theaters when it first came out. We both thoroughly enjoyed it and it helped to have someone to discuss it with after seeing it.I only recommend seeing this film if you appreciate non-mainstream movies. It's not as disjointed as Liquid Sky or as fanciful as Forbidden Zone. The original plot is very easy to follow. There's A LOT of subtle humor.Here's a quick summary of the plot if you are completely lost: A big-brother type government keeps tabs on everyone in society.

When this series aired I watched most of it. I think it was supposed to be a long running series in the vein of "The Fugitive" and "The Incredible Hulk" where the protagonist is being chased around the country looking for a solution to his problems. In this case the hero's problem is his progressive aging in reverse. I liked what I saw of these shows. The acting was good especially the sorrowful relationship between the lead character and his wife. Problem is: They cancelled it before it had a chance to end.

(WARNING - CONTAINS MILD SPOILER) A movie almost designed to make you pause and check your recollection of it - it's confined to an almost empty motel where the huge courtyard resembles a circus ring and the rooms seem like temporary withdrawal points rather than refuges; as the characters become increasingly preoccupied by the past, the present increasingly falls away, until the ultimate incendiary appearance of the Countess in the black Mercedes marks the fusion of reality and fantasy. Whether or not their stories are true, and whether Stanton is truly the father or just a crazy old man stepping into their stories, seems impossible to determine.

I seem to be disagreeing with a lot of folks here . but I really did not find this movie to be funny at all . its not a bad movie but i just felt that it went on way too long with a lot of annoying characters who never seemed to make any sense . its not like i was waiting to see the end but it seemed like its a lot of pointless filler . but all in all i would rate it a 3.5 because it was good for something that i had not seen before but could not find much of anything original .

What a travesty of movie ratings injustice - a 2.1 on the IMDb scale as I write this. Folks, this is a lot closer to a 3.0, I'll even go out on a limb and say 4.0 where I've put it. Come on - how can you have a movie about a net of static electricity surrounding the earth and alien amorphic cell structures, and not give it at least a 4.0 for creativity? Then you've got all that great dialog like - "Dave, look at the composition of this mud."

Oh, Yawn. Not another chick flick where the men are all pigs and the women will get even for the abuse they suffered. The only difference is that, in this film, everybody's a pig or has mush for brains. I hated this film for the moral issue of why it's right to send a man to prison for life for a murder he didn't commit. Is that a more immoral act than his abuse and deviousness. This movie shows all the situational ethics of bad writing. I saw it on the CBC's "Best of Britain" series.

This is a difficult movie to watch , and would have been even more difficult had I known then that it was going to be made and what its focus would be on. That being said, the characters are fantastic , and the plot has some really beautiful passages of dialogue that really stick with you for days after you finish watching it. This is a story that really deserves to be seen by more people, and the film is made with such a loving touch that makes you wish it was made a bit longer and not as a 2hr film.

This is marvelous movie, about a soul of Ale. This is a journey to Ale's heart. I found it fascinating. The director did a great job. He makes the scenes talk. Especially on the silent scenes. The window of Ale is a great one. An the scenes when he lies in bed are one of the best directed scenes I have seen. Apart from directing. It has been a quite time I did not watch a movie about a soul. As a philosopher I can say that, this film proves that the age does not matter about your soul.

I loved this movie when it first came out(but i was just 12 years old then - and I had forgotten this film existed until one day I found a used copy for sale at a gas station. I bought it and I couldn't wait to watch this film that had I loved as a kid, and then as I saw this film again many years later,it hit me.... Why in the world did I like this film as a Kid, watching it again as an adult I realized that this film is terrible.

This is one of the funniest movies I've ever saw. A 14-year old boy Jason Shepherd wrote an English paper called "Big Fat Liar". When his skateboard was taken, he had to use his sister's bike to get to the college on time and he hit a limo. When he went into the limo, he met a famous producer from Hollywood, Marty Wolf. When he left the limo, he forgot one thing: his paper! So Marty Wolf took it and he turned Jason's English paper into a movie!

Many believe this movie is a baseball movie. Such people are disappointed because it's about a baseball player, but the movie isn't about baseball.Some think this movie is a romantic comedy and are disappointed because the relationship isn't really developed. This movie is not a romantic comedy.This movie is about culture. An arrogant American Major Leaguer and a stern traditional Japanese baseball manager cannot succeed because they can't, indeed, won't understand one another. It's after they manage to break through the cultural barrier that they have success.

I tried to give this show a chance, but it really doesn't sit well with me. Although the performances are good, the writing isn't. The two oldest step-siblings, Derek and Casey, are equally annoying; I get the impression that we're supposed to side with Casey, given that she's the protagonist, but I don't find her at all likable. The parents are continually portrayed as utterly clueless. The three younger children are the most watchable things on the show; Lizzie and Edwin are sweet the way they team up, and Marti is adorable.

"Admissions" is a fine drama even though they're are some problems with the ending. Lauren Ambrose plays Evie who is trying to avoid college. To make her overworked mother not notice, she makes up poems that everybody thinks her mentally challenged sister wrote. All the acting is first-rate especially Lauren Ambrose and Amy Madigan. They both put in great performances. The climax is also very powerful. There are only two bad parts. First is the character of Stewart Worthy played by Christopher Lloyd. His part is underdeveloped. The other weakness is the ending.

Satya was excellent .... Company was just as good but more polished , probably owing to the money earned from the business he was running before leaving the company. Pranav,
I'm not sure how you are supposed to evaluate the quality of food served at a particular restaurant, but, given what you have said, I am pretty sure you are right. Let's put it this way, if we are all in the same situation with respect to eating and that is what decides whether we are satisfied, we are probably not in the same place in life.

i didn't hate this one. i just couldn't adapt to the story. it didn't really grab me. Michael Mann is a very good director but i have to disagree with his methods in this. i'm also a fan of Daniel Day Lewis. some projects he's been in are pretty rubbish but his acting is brilliant. my favourite Daniel Day Lewis films are There Will Be Blood and Gangs Of New York.there is one thing i loved about this and that was the musical score, it gave the film a lot of atmosphere. thats about all i liked in it though.

The prior comments are way to generous. This movie is a waste of electricity and plastic. On the other hand, I have had a great deal of fun giving it to friends to watch and describing it beforehand as "beyond belief!" "no words can express how I feel about this" "This movie will move you" As expected, the friends took these nondescript comments as enthusiastic endorsements. They were wrong. The sadistic pleasure I had foisting this on people was well worth the $5 I paid for the movie.

This movie was pathetically awful. The sound was terrible, the action was ridiculous and the effects were nauseating. If you have a life don't see this movie, cause you will want to kill yourself. This movie totally rips off Blade (which is undoubtedly a really good movie...or trilogy I should say).I don't care who the actors are, this movie is just horrible. I watched 10 minutes of it and had to come to my computer and comment on how absolutely just bad this movie is. I actually don't know why my family is still watching it...oh wait, yes I do.

Emilio Estevez takes the wonderful play HOMEFRONT and makes it into an engaging movie.THE WAR AT HOME has an exceptionally strong cast -- all seemingly digging deep into their characters. The acting here is TOP NOTCH!Credit must also go to director Emilio Estevez. The visual transitions between past and present were ultra smooth. The sound effects during the battle scenes were chilling and effectively added to the tension.Remove all of the Viet Nam elements from the story, and still left would be interesting characters wrestling with the good and bad of the full range of family dynamics.

I ca n't believe I sat through this garbage . Palm trees in D.C. ( already mentioned ) , a man and a woman with a baby in the background with a baby seat , a man sitting on a couch , a man standing by a piano , a man with a hat and cane , a woman walking by and a man walking towards the man sitting on the piano . I think they should have cut the film to 90 mins . I am waiting for a sequel and will be very disappointed . They made a nice film .

why oh why did i ever waste my time watching this film? it was given to me on video by a friend and i thought i'll watch it, it can't be that bad surely. firstly the acting is simply appalling and we're supposed to believe this is real? secondly this film is blatantly trying to copy the Blair witch project (yawn) and does so very poorly. so if you want the fright of your life i would suggest that a Simpson's Halloween special would be far scarier. but, if you just wanted to a laugh then maybe the general crapness of this film would suffice.

I looked forward to spending part of my Independence Day weekend watching a good film about Jefferson. This film was not it. It was rather long, drawn out, dull and unbalanced. Too much time was spent exploring Jefferson's relationship with Cosway and not enough time was spent on his relationship with Sally Hemmings. The lady who played Sally, Thandie Newton, was absolutely awful. Her acting was so bad it was like watching an A1 airhead trying to recite Shakespeare. Her constant whining voice grated the nerves! Nolte's accent made Jefferson sound like an ignorant man, rather than a genius.

I love Umberto Lenzi's cop movies -- ROME ARMED TO THE TEETH is my favorite -- and his DESERT COMMANDOS pretty much legitimized the Italian Euro War phenomenon by managing to actually be a pretty good movie. Give him guns, machines, some guys to run around talking tough and it's hard for him to miss.What a shame it is then to encounter his EATEN ALIVE and CANNIBAL FEROX. They could have been by anybody, really, and one watches them with a sense that he was under contract, was told what kind of films to make, was assigned a cast & crew and given a budget, deadline and script.

I have seen this movie more than 50 times in my life , and each time I watch it the more I am stunned at what it depicts and how it portrays what is truly happening to the human psyche and how it can be altered to do anything. It was made in 1974. It had a budget of 1.6 million pounds, but it was still not an outright flop, earning $2 million and racking up 2 Oscar nominations. (No other film has ever won an Oscar for best picture without winning the directing Oscar as well, so I guess those two wins must count.)

A complete and utter waster of my precious two hours. The entire movie could have been made in less than 60 seconds by simply showing people getting coked up, a car crashing, people getting more coked up, people having sex, people crying, and people getting more coked up. The tagline for this movie should have read "Come see how f*cked up our characters are! They're stoned! They're coke addicts! They're a mess! Who are these people? Do you really care? Does it matter?

The Vietnam War era is certainly far before my time , but it has always interested me , and I like to learn about all things related to it. It's an era that saw America at its peak of its military capabilities , then at its worst, and has since been seen as an example of an over-armed military . It has also been seen as a catalyst for change in the nature of American politics, particularly during the Nixon administration. It's worth remembering that before the U.S. had entered WWII , America had no real military , and had even considered the possibility of never fighting a military conflict.

I didn't even watch this whole movie. Now, I like 50's sci-fi movies even when they are wildly inaccurate but this one just annoyed me. For one thing, one member of the crew on the spaceship talks and acts like he might have made it into the tenth grade. He sounds like he ought to be on a bowling league, not a space ship. Out the window of the spaceship the crew is marveling at Earth and this boob says 'Can you see Brooklyn?' and another guy says 'Sure'. And the boob says 'Gee, I wonder who's pitching?'

Significant Spoilers ! This is a sick , disturbing movie ... just like the sick , twisted director , Jennifer Lynch ... she really does a great job with this sick, twisted , horrifying movie . I would call this one of my favorite movies ever ... I thought this movie would get a negative review since I did not want to spoil anything ... I am glad people did not let the film be spoiled by the trailer ... I really enjoyed the movie . I think this movie is really well done and worth watching ... and if you are still thinking about seeing this movie ... you will really enjoy this movie .

Does anyone else think that `` Reba '' is basically a ripoff of `` Roseanne '' ? Just look at how funny they both are at the end of the episode. Maybe the producers just wanted to put two very funny ladies on the air so that their fans could find out about them! I guess. You have to remember that the characters were the real people and not those that they portrayed. The one thing that keeps me from buying or watching the show (or any other Roseanne episodes) is the character of Beth's mother, which is just as bad as Rose's character (if not worse).

The four LA cops in fedoras driving around in a big black convertible look faintly absurd, and even more ridiculous when it turns out that Nick Nolte, the dumbest-looking of the lot, is in charge. The writer never manages to create a spirit of camaraderie among the squad members, and the director fails to wring articulacy out of the man-mountain Nolte. Foprget questioning anyone. Nolte's character lights a cigaret, gets mad, and beats interviewees to a pulp. His methods get him nowhere, until at one point in the action he is wandering from tossed residence to tossed residence with his mouth open and his brain shut.

I hope this is n't a portent of things to come . High-definition camcorders are getting cheaper all the time. And as I've written in the past, they are getting better and better. It's amazing to me that someone with such a fine camera could be so oblivious. That said, I'm very happy with what my Canon Vixia was capable of shooting. I didn't need to have an expensive camera to capture the most beautiful things. But I do think there are times when high-definition is worth a lot more than what it costs. There's just one problem.

I have watched Grand Champion all the way through at least twice now. I enjoyed the movie's story, the characters and the actors were not bad. It is refreshing to see a G rated movie. This is a feel good movie. The story is mostly from the view of the children. The interactions between the kids and the adults makes the story interesting. I recommend this movie if you are looking for a family film. If you liked the Little Rascals, you will probably enjoy this. I viewed this movie on cable. Either on Encore or Showtime family.

This is a forgotten classic of a film , and Harmony Karin borrowed a ton from it for `` Gummo `` . I have seen it a few times , and it is probably one of the funniest movies of all time, but I had never actually seen it as a kid . I've always said it's one of my favorite old movies, but to be completely honest it's not one of my absolute favorites. It's a great movie, and I do like it alot, but I just never saw it at all as a kid.

This was Hitchcock 's third Hollywood feature , and it appears he was yet to settle into a pattern of work. This was the third Hollywood feature of Hitch's , and Hitch had been shooting on location in Italy for nearly a year, and still had not shot a film in that country since 1929 . In Italy he had to find a new script, and he did, with a story by James Thurber , who had been working with Hitchcock on the script for Lifeboat , which had not yet received the go ahead , but which would later.

Okay, now I know where all those boring cop/homicide TV shows came from. I do believe they can be traced back to this movie. "Scene Of The Crime" feels more like a TV episode, or an episode of a serial. Complete with stock characters and situations - the hotshot cop who clashes with his superiors... the aging cop who doesn't want a desk job, despite failing eyesight... the reckless rookie... the double-crossing dame, etc.I like many of the actors here, and they do a good job, but overall I found this movie dull as I'm not a fan of the genre.

A ghost story on a typical Turkish high school with nice sound and visual effects. Taylan biraderler(taylan brothers) had made their first shots on a tv-show a couple of years ago, as far as i know. That was kind of a Turkish X-Files, they had very nice stories but lacked on visual effects. This time it seems they had what they needed and used them well. This movie will make you laugh that's for sure, and as well it might have you scared. It has a nice plot and some young, bright actors in it.

As I was flipping through the channel I came to a channel 124. It is an urban channel. I saw this movie on and decided to give it a try. I almost became a mass murderer due to this film. I have done home movies and they are oscar quality compared to this huge mass of Dookie. The lighting was terrible and the acting was absolutely unrelentlessly bad. I would rather watch Star Crystal....... Holy cow maybe that is not a good example. The main question I have about this film is... Was it to be a morality film?

Oh boy . Where do I begin on this piece of slime ? This is one of the few real masterpieces that has made me smile. I've never seen a bad movie in my entire life until I had this film on. The acting and direction were impeccable. I've never seen a movie with a better script than this and it is a real heart breaker. If I had to describe this film to someone, I would say this is the film about the world's greatest love story that is not love story, but a life story about how love can become hate.

Even a bad Julie Andrews Musical is worth watching and this is n't bad ! In fact it 's quite good ! It 's very good in fact ! The problem is it 's very expensive ! It's not very long but very interesting and entertaining ! I don't like most Julie Andrews musicals because she is a very self-centred and selfish person ! It 's very entertaining to hear her singing in a bad voice like this . I really hope that this song will get more popularity because the story is interesting , but the voice is not very good .

Wow... this is the kind of movie that makes you wonder who's idea this was and what soup kitchen are they eating at now. To say this was bad is an insult to the bad movies we all know and love.When I saw Guttenberg's name in the TV guide I figured it would be a spoof... maybe it should have been. Could have made for a better movie.Look for the scene where they are in an airplane in mid flight with the door open and there is no wind what so ever. They could have sprung for a fan at least.Look for several Canadian & c-list actors in the movie.

I seriously don´t know why this movie got such a hostile reception when it was first released. Sure, it´s overlong and somewhat gratuitous in its depictions of sexuality and violence but so are lots of well regarded movies. I seriously don´t think that the people who hated "Heaven´s Gate" really understood it. "Heaven´s Gate" in its uncut form, much like "The Deer Hunter" shows the gross differences of living an insecure and dangerous life (like the immigrants and Averil in Wyoming) and living in comfort and privilege (like the settled "Americans" in Wyoming and Averil in the prologue and epilogue).

I like "Hack." Think the "Lone Ranger" reincarnated as a 2000s cab driver, a decent but flawed guy, in Philadelphia doing his best, while seeking to work out issues from a troubled past, and you've got the synopsis. David Morse is nearly perfect as Olshansky. He helps people but instead of riding "Silver" in the old west he drives a cab through the mean streets of contemporary Philly, without handing out silver bullets. The supporting cast is first class and well above average.

I was hoping to like this movie , to settle in for an evening of goofy fun . I like a good , well , silly movie . I was looking forward to watching it , thinking that this was a good film , not a great one . I found myself disappointed , it was very dull . My wife thought the film was great , she even loved it , which is a rare thing for me to find . But she had to turn off the sound when the characters were laughing . I have had to do this so often over the years .

Having watched this movie several times , I have come to the conclusion that Milos Forman made a very daring movie and I will not be disappointed in the outcome. It is based on true events but it was filmed in such an amazing way. There was a great acting cast of all kinds that worked very well together and the story kept me totally captivated for its whole duration. There were a lot of twists, twists and turns and you will have to see it to believe what happens. There is some violence , but it is not as violent as some of the movies out there.

Wow ... I suspected this one to be bad ... But now I find myself just at a loss for words. As I read, I thought to myself ... I can't even find the words to explain how I feel ... It is just so unbelievably sad that something like this is happening to such an amazing family, to a family that has made it their business to help others ... I hope they find comfort in knowing that they are doing the right thing, they have made their own personal decision, and they will be there for their children, no matter what, and that they made a good decision.

I have never seen a more unrealistic movie than this foul piece of dung . The acting was over the top, the plot was too stupid , and the writing was a big fat waste of time . I have never seen a movie this bad . I can only conclude that they got the director of this film and the rest of the production staff into a deep dark pit that they just couldn't escape . Maybe they have all been on the drug for the last 20 years . After watching this filth , my only desire is to put on my shoes and walk out into the street and burn this filth out .

If extreme activities ( and I do n't mean the Hollywood ones like UFC & X-Games ) and the people who love them are the same thing, but I do think there's a big difference. I also think it depends on what you're getting out of it, and it's not to be confused with the people you want to be around. I've always been very happy with my relationship with my gym. But now I am not so sure it's going to be the same. I've made some good friends, but there's more than that.

This is the first porn I 've ever tried to review . It demands a different approach than usual , and you'll see how good it can be . I only got a few scenes in , and I had a pretty hard time keeping my eyes open ( I was on the bed and my partner was in a chair next to the bed . ) It's worth saying that the whole time I was watching I thought about getting off , but that didn't really happen . For the most part it's just the girl being a slut .

Childish storyline ripped off of a lame Hollywood movie , terrible acting , cheesy dialogue , and not quite `` the best movie i've ever seen
in the history of cinema " is the best movie i ever saw. My rating: 1.0

The plot of the movie is terrible. First it is supposed to be an American epic, set in early 18th century America. The only thing that would have made it better was if it was set during the Spanish American War, but it's not even set during the war. It is instead set in the aftermath of the war.

This film makes several nods to various science fiction films. The prologue reminds me of the one for the original theatrical version of THX-1138 (the trailer for BUCK ROGERS, here it was clips from some early Japanese SF TV show). Then the opening shot of the city in 2345 has the dragon blip flying overhead with a billboard, reminding one immediately of BLADERUNNER. The BLADERUNNER aspect comes evenmore pronounced when we meet the hero, who is called a Replicant (He is blond haired and is called Ryo, a homage to Roy Batty, Rutger Hauer's character in BLADERUNNER?).

The greatest movie ever.How's that for a contention? However, if we look at it through purely cinematic terms, it is clear that Three Colours Red is a masterpiece. It is not enough to merely say this - Three Colours Red is the masterpiece of world cinema. If you accept that Citizen Kane is not human enough, if you accept that Star Wars is not actually very good, if you accept that Ozu and Mizoguchi both have to take a step back - then Three Colours Red is the foremost masterpiece of all time.

Although the plot of Cover Girl is very flimsy and tired, it does serve well enough as an anchor for the Kern and Gershwin musical numbers. Following her signature role in Gilda, Hayworth opted to star in this musical that seems tailor made for her. Besides looking as gorgeous as ever, she impresses with her dancing as well. Gene Kelly, who was on loan to Columbia from MGM, matches her in dancing and the sequence where he cavorts with his own shadow was nicely done. The supporting characters were also competently acted.

I thought this movie'd be totally different than just another teen-slasher. Well I was totally wrong. There's a liquid nun coming out of the toilet seat and something really odd. I know that Spanish culture is a bit different and their movies too, but I didn't expect to see a fake Hollywood film. They certainly faked it pretty well though. Why'd they make a movie without any new aspects? This is just plain boring and it'd been done totally without any imagination.I thought that having a nun as the bad guy in the movie'd be something really original.

I think the `` Bone Snatcher '' should go after anyone associated with this movie . Watching this will seem like torture to anyone who is not a fan of the series. This movie is pure trash and a terrible example of exploitation cinema . What a shame! First of all i think it would be great to know what director was behind it. But for me personally i just dont like the movie, i dont think the director did it justice, i find the story very weak, i dont think the story had anything to do with the movie.

Awful Star Wars knock-off with a slightly more comic tinge. Robert Urich stars as the leader of a group of ice pirates, who steal ice because water is the most valuable substance in the universe now (how all the poor people stay alive is a mystery). He hooks up with Mary Crosby (Bing's daughter, around 25 and a total cutie), a princess looking for her missing father. Also in the cast are an embarrassed-looking Anjelica Huston in some hilarious sci-fi get-ups and a pudgy, short-ish Ron Perlman (whom I thought was seven feet tall from his other roles!).

In Truffaut book-length interview with Hitchcock , it 's apparent that Big Al 's fear from the police dates back to the war years of 1940 's London. Truffaut says, in his conversation with Hitchcock: "A lot of things that did happen, I saw in Paris in 1940, and it didn't stop. It didn't make me go into hiding." In his film, Truffaut rewrites the famous Hitchcock scene where Cary Grant and Jane Greer meet in the woods, and Truffaut writes, "Here they meet. They can't avoid each other."

This movie is bad. I saw the rated and the unrated versions. They are terrible!! Now, I know it's suppose to be a low budget, porn spoof of spiderman, but Spiderbabe is just not good at being bad-good. It's not funny! Not funny at all!! I wanted to laugh. I tried to laugh. But this movie let me down. At least the unrated version has lots of nudity to look forward to. And is it me, because Mundae is not a great looking woman.

Ida Lupino is trapped in her own home by crazy Robert Ryan in `` Beware , My Lovely , '' with her brother and her father. She was once married to Robert Ryan. And she has a daughter, Mary Jane, who lives with her. She's about to tell her what happened to Robert in her past. She has been hiding something from her daughter. She wants to know about Mary Jane. She wants to know what she's like now. What has become of her in her adulthood? What are the things that she does not tell her daughter.

I am a huge fan of Harald Zwart, and I just knew that I had to see this movie, even though I can't say I'm a soccer fan. But watching this just filled my heart with joy, and I had a great time in the movies watching it.Bjørn Fast Nagell does a tremendous job directing this movie, and even though you notice the main characters are new at acting, they grow with the movie and makes it what it is. Even though it is supposed to be a soccer movie, there is surprisingly little soccer in it.

This film could have been great- but wasn't. Amongst the cesspool of talentless no-hopers and friends of the film makers who wanted to help out there are some mild inklings of talent. The main star of the film plays a good lead role. He is convincing and has those scary Italian eyes. However, he is teamed up with the worst rejects of actors anyone has ever come across. The opening scenes of the film are among the worst and most embarrassing. It looks like Gay Porno. Fortunately no one stripped off. The rape scene that keeps being mentioned is rubbish.

I saw this at the BendFilm Festival Friday amid an unsettled crowd of people , not helped by a poor sound mix. If you’re reading this, and you’d like to donate, please do. I’m sure you’ll agree that this should be the best movie in the whole wide world. You should see it! And you can! I am currently in a bit of a state of shock over the passing of my grandfather, whom I was only vaguely aware of until just last week. He passed away a couple of weeks ago, after being struck down by cancer.

I 'm sorry to see that it has been rated that low by many people . The series started off really well, but then the author decided to make her main character an idiot in a lot of the scenes. It is obvious that there is more to the novel then the characters. The characters do get along well. The author makes them seem like real people and you get to know more of their lives and pasts. There are a lot of great scenes in this book, but some of the characters do have a problem with this book.

Good Film.I managed to pick this up on DVD in a local store sale. £2.99 seems like a good deal and it is. Thing is the film is named "To Kill For". It took a little detective work to find out it's original name.In the UK it has been rated as an 18 and rightly so although the standard of films depends on the "ability to sell". Having seen Final Destination 3 last night it, in my view, should have been a 18.Maybe the fact the delightful, Traci Lords is in it tends to make the classification board step it up to 18.

The most intense and powerful film I have seen in years. There have been other films before that delved into the Vietnam Vet but nothing compared to this emotionally heartwrenching film, as a typical American suburban family, circa 1972, comes apart at the seams, revealing the scars that Vietnam has left on our all of our collective souls. The cast is A++++ fantastic with all four actors(with Kathy Bates a stand-out) giving riveting performances. What is wonderful about this film is that you take no sides, but understand all four characters and empathize with them, even though all four have divergent viewpoints and needs.

This one and the one prior `` Toulon 's Revenge '' and the next one seem to be completely different from the others. If anyone knows if they have changed in the meantime you could report it as a bug. It seems to be the same as the one with ``Toulon's Revenge" before. It also has the bug described in

https://github.com/toulon/toulon/issues/28

I would say that this one should be a new bug since it has been around for some time and the bug described in ``Toulon's Revenge'' only affects the one we are talking about now.

This is the best direct-to-DVD effort from Van Damme that I have seen yet . Van Damme plays a border patrol agent who has to find a terrorist who has a bomb hidden in the trunk of his car at the airport, and he must do it with the least amount of force possible. As the movie unfolds we realize that the man who has just stolen the car is not really a terrorist; it is actually a cop. The plot of the film is well-constructed as we learn what is going on and what we want to know as we follow the characters on their journey.

First I must confess that A Separate Peace is my favorite book . So of course , I have some interest in reading this book. And I don’t just mean I am interested but it is also a favorite of mine . I read it a number of times. The book was written during the time period between the end of WW2 and the early to mid 1960s . And in that period it is a very good book . It is full of historical facts and details of the war and the aftermath . And it also covers the time when the book starts .

No matter what other people have said you ca n't review this movie without comparing it to the original , but i will do it . The movie is so bad , that the only reason to watch it is that it's remakes a few times in order to keep the interest in the story going . Even with the few remakes , it can never be compared to the actual story . The remakes , to me are like the original , but with different actors . That was a good movie! The only thing it had was a boring ending, but it had a wonderful story.

I was looking forward to Dante's contribution to this excellent horror anthology series from Showtime, but this was easily the worst of the bunch. It's really too bad. Part of this may be due to the poor, if odd, choice of source materials. Why Joe didn't just write an original, I have no idea. Instead, we get this soapbox episode where the "message" overwhelms the script, the characters, the staging, everything, and by the end I was just wondering whether it could get any worse, and I won't spoil it...but it ended up getting worse.

Cuore Sacro combines glossy film effects with a story that leaves much to be desired . With a script that could have benefited from a great director’s touch and a cast that is not all that deep, this is just another of those films that could have used the help of a good director . Unfortunately, it has a number of problems that come from having a weak script , an underdeveloped story , and an uninteresting cast . I’m not even going to bother to try to explain how the film begins , because it’s not very easy to describe .

My Mother Frank begins as a warm, amiable comedy about a middle-aged Catholic woman (Frank, short for Francis, played by Sinead Cusack) who shakes herself out of the doldrums by enrolling as a student in her son's university. Most of her friends and family are horrified, not least her son (Matthew Newton), who is busy falling in love with his best mate's girlfriend (Rose Byrne). Meanwhile Frank has raised the ire of her disapproving English tutor (Sam Neill).Matthew Newton is utterly disarming as David; relaxed and natural in the role, even when the character's uptight.

This movie sucks so bad. Its funny to see what a poor story this has, where two pea-brained American twins who know about nothing outside their school can come to another continent, and do unimaginable things there. Its just so stupid and so bizarre. How can they just find two French guys, hit on them and in the end kiss them, not knowing anything about them? More realistic would have been having the guys take them away and rape them, which could have easily happened in such a situation. As for the bit where they make the French President drink 'bad water', that was just lame.

This is the kind of movie that could have ruined several careers, if garbage could ruin motion picture careers these days.Melanie Griffith took off her shirt, and in her pre-enhancement surgery days, she really should have stayed dressed.Jeff Daniels was completely wasted, but fortunately for him and for us, he has gone on to much better things since this ... this ... this ... well, heck, piece of garbage.Strangely, all of its major players have gone on to bigger and better things, including director Jonathan Demme. His work here was also wasted but deserving of a grudging admiration.

I have been a huge Errol Morris fan ever since I saw Thin Blue Line and heard it saved a woman's life in Boston. It was the same night my father was killed. He was a cop and a good man, and he taught me a great deal about this country and what it means to be American and to be part of something bigger than ourselves, part of a family, part of an idea of how we want to live that's bigger than me, a bigger idea of who we want to be, a bigger belief in what we are, than anything I had.

This film has its detractors , and Courtney 's fey dresser may offend some folks ( who , frankly , look pretty good to me ) But , for the love of God , please leave us alone and let us be. Tuesday, September 30, 2008

I know I've mentioned this many times before , but , if you've seen this film , then you know exactly what i'm saying. The movie is about a woman named Sarah ( Jennifer Hudson ) who is so poor , she doesn't have enough money to buy groceries.

If Christopher Nolan had made Memento before Following , then all of the flaws in Following would have been corrected, and the film would be one of the best movies of 2014. Unfortunately, that doesn’t seem to be happening with Following , the first in a planned trilogy that will see him returning to his roots as a filmmaker. In the end, the film is far from Nolan’s best work, and though the acting is solid throughout, it just isn’t enough to make you forget that Following is Nolan’s film.

I 've seen several stage and film adaptations of Alice in Wonderland and this one has to take the cake. The story of Alice is so intriguing, well written, entertaining, and just plain fun to watch. I'd say it's up there with The Wizard of Oz on it's list of the greatest movie adaptations of all-time, but I can see where there's some people who may not agree with me on this. Personally I love it. If you have never seen it (and you should), I would strongly recommend that you do at least once.

It starts out like a very serious social commentary which quickly makes one think of other Clark movies like Kids, Bully, etc. But then just as quickly, it unravels into a direction-less mess. Who is the main character? Is this a serious film or some Gregg Araki-esquire over the top goofy film? Is this a skate documentary with moments of dialog inserted? I have no clue. I found myself watching the clock and wonder when this turd was going to end. I kept thinking there would be some big shocker culmination which never came.

Because I would have never ever seen this movie through to the end . Although there are some , but it is definitely a great movie . It shows the true story of a man who died from cancer . He has lived a very rich life . He has done his work well . The movie goes through the ups and the downs of his life . I enjoyed it a lot . I have not watched it many times in the past , because it was very difficult . Now it has become fun . It is hard to believe in such a big movie .

Because that's what Hell Ride pretty much is. Larry Bishop and Tarantino partying on the Weinstein's money with the promise to deliver a movie sometime down the line. I'm all for fake boobage and booze as much as the next guy but did we really need the movie? Really there's nothing worse than the reheated second-hand leftovers of an old trend. And I'm not even talking about 70's grindhouse cinema because Hell Ride has none of the raw and unpolished feel of the era it purports to pay homage to. No, this is slick and glossy MTV Hollywood through and through.

I saw One Life Stand when it premiered at the 2000 Edinburgh International Film Festival and was blown away by the film. In it, a young woman (Amanda Seyfried) tries to find peace in her small town by taking a stand for a cause, only to find out that standing for anything is a difficult task. The story is told from a third person perspective, which I felt made the film very different and unique. I remember seeing this on the big screen during that time and thinking "this is a masterpiece, I want to make films like this".

Intelligent summary , is n't it ? If Mad Max was something of a simple , straight forward , nothing special movie , it would be a movie about Mad Max . If we were to add some of the humor that makes the Mad Max movies such fun and one of the main reasons why the films are such a blast is because the action is so crazy and insane . When Max Rockatansky was a kid in the 1950s, his family was forced to move from the West Coast to California because they couldn't afford to pay their house mortgage.

Well it is a good movie. However, you have to admit that Van Dame's movies haven't been so great lately. On the other hand if you are a hardcore van Dame fan you should watch this as there is a huge improvement with fighting scenes. Also What i really liked is the music beautiful music. am sure this will kill time if you are action fan. As for Isaac Florentine the director of Undisputed 2, i don't think he did a good job as he did with Undisputed.I cant wait when one day Van Dame's movies hit the cinemas before the DVD.

OK - say some college in southern California has an movie making class . And some dudes were enrolled just so they could make movies. So, I decided to write a script based around this movie idea. It took me about 3 weeks to write a full length script - with all of the problems that comes along with that (namely, you have no idea what you're doing) and I took about 6 weeks to get this thing from the ground up and ready to send to a publisher. So it took about a year.

This is a piece of cinematic beauty , and it shows more of Quebec culture to others than probably any other movie in the past 10 years. Here are a few fun facts from the movie:

If there were people from other places on the planet who could travel in the time period of the movie, there would never be a need to write “Canada” on their passports. They would just come up with a new name that sounds more Canadian and that’s the way they want to make their life easier.

First i gotta say that this film is way less pretentious than The Da Vinci Code. sure, you have the religion vs science problem but it doesn't try to make a big statement about it. its basically an action thriller that moves from one scene to another very well. one scene particularly (that involves fire) i found extremely well done. Second, the changes from book to film. although when i was following the development of the film i complained about the change of some characters and the complete removal of others, i gotta admit i was wrong.

This is a very strange series with Dean Learner . I really did n't understand the guests . I knew they lived in the country and that they were both in their forties. I thought they would be nice guys . Not sure what is in their minds and in their hearts about each other. The first episode is about him being a victim of some crime. I think he is being framed by his friends. There is something very fishy in the whole show . I just hope they find out the truth about him. I like Dean Learner and hope that the show comes back for a second season .

What we know of Caravaggio suggests a strutting brawler with a healthy sense of entitlement who lived amongst whores and thieves and hustlers and put them on canvas. His works' themes were sex, death, redemption, above all, finding the sacred within the profane. He lived at a time where homosexuality carried a death sentence and political intrigue normally involved fatalities in a society defined by the maxim "strangling the boy for the purity of his scream".You can't fault Derek Jarman for his cinematography, nor his recreations of Caravaggio's paintings and you certainly can't accuse the man of shying away from the homosexuality.

The Toxic Avenger, Part II starts with the startling revelation that after the Toxic Aveneger (John Altamura who was apparently fired during production & replaced with Ron Fazio) had rid his home town Tromaville of evil it actually became a nice place to live. This meant that Toxie had no use as a superhero anymore & now suffers from depression & a feeling of utter uselessness (just like directors Lloyd Kaufman & Michael Herz should feel like after producing this), Toxie now works as a concierge at the 'Tromaville centre for the blind'.

Yeah great cult TV series. Great atmosphere, top script and good performances make this a class A candidate for DVD release. This is a seminal tour de force of Australian TV history and has that unforgettable groovy period piece soundtrack with Doug Parkinson's gravel and phlegm voice spewing 70's Australiana all over your cathode ray box as a amazingly long camera zoom out reveals the religion of the open road in all its Antipodean glory. This is a memento from another and not too distant era, and has the proud stamp of the land mighty Down Under from start to finish in all its raw freedom and gritty grandeur.

A tedious effort from not-yet great director Budd Boetticher and pretty but not-yet un-bland actress Nina Foch , this movie was a disaster. And that was after it was originally released as an exploitation flick. So, here's an apology from someone who was involved in the project. And the truth is that I'm probably just going to end up hating this movie, which, in any case, had a lot going for it. This was the director's debut and Foch played the love interest. So, in other words, we are talking an un-doomed failure.

It's been a long time since I have been in the art-house theater and I went to see Douches Froides because it has gotten such great reviews in the papers.The thing is with this movie, is that it has no head or tail, but merely a section in time about the life of the three main characters.When it started I already knew that it was gonna be a long sit down, but sometimes things can get better, in this case not. There is no real character development or interconnection between the players.

The only pure life, is one that ends with a signature in blood.So says Mishima anyway, a young sheltered boy who becomes a celebrity author. The life of one of Japans most celebrated literary voices, is told from three perspectives, his life just before he and four members of his private army take over a Japanese military base and commit ritual suicide(shown in color), flashbacks(shown in black and white), and scenes from his novels(shown in a kind of dreamy Technicolor set design somewhere between traditional Noh Theater and "the Wizard Of Oz".

This movie is not just good , its amazing . Besides providing us with good performances , original plot , and great storyline , its also a very touching story . I would love to watch this movie again with different actors . This movie is very great . The characters are very sweet and adorable and the storyline is very deep and very touching and very emotional . Its a must watch . Its very nice . I love the characters . I hope they will get an Oscar for their performance . I will be waiting for the sequel . Thanks for the awesome movie and the great screenplay .

I ordered this movie on the Internet as it is very difficult to get Turkish movies where we live. I've heard so much about the TV series from my friends and practically everyone in Turkey, I was expecting to see a breakthrough in Turkish cinema. What a disappointment.Me and my husband (who is an admirer of any movie with a bit of Turkish landscape and Turkish dialogues in it) only watched it all the way through because we had paid $20 for the DVD. Well, that was a boring way of wasting it.It was confusing, at times overacted, whereas other times underacted.

I have just caught this Movie on TCM , and can understand why George Murphy went into Politics if this is what he really is. This is not to say that I think he has done some good work, but its to say he has done his fair share of evil. And I don't understand how people can get caught up in this kind of thing if the whole point is to get elected and have some say in how the country is governed. Its not a new phenomenon, its been around a very long time.

You have to be awfully patient to sit through a film with one-liners so flat and unfunny that you wonder if they were written specifically to irritate you. But you do get some, and you are not always able to avoid them. Some have been attributed to Woody Allen, but I think the most likely candidate is Mel Brooks. I first encountered Brooks’ film, The Producers, in college in the 1980s but didn’t get around to writing about it until my last year of graduate school. I don’t have the time or the inclination to explain the film to you in detail.

In a Morocco completely invaded by Europeans and Americans, in the beginning of the Twentieth Century, the Moroccan leader Mulay Achmed Mohammed el-Raisuli the Magnificent (Sean Connery) kidnaps the American Eden Pedecaris (Candice Bergen), her son and her daughter. His intention is to get some money and rifles as ransom for them, to fight against the corrupt Sultan of Moroco (Marc Zuber). In times of election, the American President Theodore Roosevelt (Brian Keith) agrees with the proposal. However, Raisuli is betrayed and Eden helps him to be released from the prison with the American soldiers.

While the premise of the film sounded unique and intriguing after watching the first 5 minutes of the film I could have stopped there and gone on with my life. She does get some interesting comments and reactions from her subjects, but not really enough to add to the validity of the film.I also felt she went a bit overboard with many things. If a guy said a filthy comment, grabbed her, or made some disgusting gesture to her, I would say go for it, bring him down, he's a pig.

This movie is so predictable when you know the modern American dream: Do nothing, be a loser and then suddenly... whoah! You're a genius and an obnoxious one and the world is kissing the ground you are walking on.And surprisingly all the other smart people are losers. They don't know anything and are bitter when our wonderkid solves problems so easily. And what kind of problems? They are so difficult but still these professors can analyse the results in less than 10 seconds.Every movie has something good in it anyway and Robin Williams is it in this one.

You can usually tell something is rotten in the state of Illinois, and you probably can make a good guess at what it’s about. This is because Illinois, like most of the other states in the Midwest and the Northeast, has seen a steady deterioration in its quality of education.

What I liked best about this feature-length animated film from 1941 is the great feel it gives for the early 1940s. It's the songs, the clothing, automobiles, buildings lingo of the day, etc. You feel like you've stepped back into time.From reading some of the reviews here, I see this was a hard-luck film, being released a couple of days before the Pearl Harbor attack. Wow, no one would be interested in going to the movies for a feature-length cartoon during those eventful and shocking days, I'm sure.

If you think it's beautiful to be obsessive about who you are in love with, then I can imagine giving it a good rating... but I cannot imagine that this theme of obsessiveness and having little respect for others (such as the way Paulie treats the teachers who try to help her) is anything you would want to teach your children. Yes, it's also bad the way Victoria treated Paulie, but guess what. That's life. Isn't it a more important lesson to learn how to get past these disappointments and make the best of your life?

`` Hollywood Cavalcade '' is a mildly entertaining 1939 film starring two staples of the 20th Century Fox roster , George Raft and Gloria Swanson. It's no coincidence that the film title is an anagram of "The Hollywood Cavalcade," a reference to the musicals of Hollywood and Broadway and to the "Cavalcade of Progress." In addition, the film is named after the famous Cavalcade of Progress Parade of 1908 that started at Hollywood Boulevard and ended at Highland Avenue. The first parade was held on the night of July 4, 1908 and the second parade the night of July 5th.

This is one of my three all-time favorite movies. My only quibble is that the director, Peter Yates, had too many cuts showing the actors individually instead of together as a scene, but the performances were so great I forgive him.Albert Finney and Tom Courtenay are absolutely marvelous; brilliant. The script is great, giving a very good picture of life in the theatre during World War II (and, therefore, what it was like in the 30s as well). Lots of great, subtle touches, lots of broad, overplayed strokes, all of it perfectly done.

This is one of those strange , self-important , self-indulgent movies which tries too hard to be profound . It is also a bit silly , and even self-deprecating . It does have a good plot , although I found the characters hard to identify . There is not a lot of action in this movie , it is rather long and boring , and it was over long , but there is nothing wrong with that . The cast is good , and they all work together well . The only thing that was slightly lacking was the music .

Plodding , maybe that should have been the title . Bad dialogue delivered at a snail 's pace . All too often a character is so bland, he or she is hardly worth watching . The only good character in this story is the wife , she plays a very important role in keeping things running , and she is also not given any character development in this book . There is also very little humor or levity , it seems to be an attempt to make the book less depressing . I am glad to see that the characters are so uninteresting , but then again , it is very hard to make anyone likable .

The Fanglys is set in a small Texan town called Layton on the eve of Halloween as the townspeople treat the annual Halloween parade with fear, fear, and more fear. Isolated from the rest of the world, it is up to our four characters to save this small town, to save their own hearts, and to prevent themselves from falling into the depths of hell that awaits everyone who crosses them. Sunday, July 18, 2011

We are about one month from the book's release, and after much anticipation, I think I've managed to do it justice.

If you and your friends find as much humor and enjoyment from horrible acting , jokes , props , and lines as we did with them, it's a good sign that the story is funny and entertaining. If it is not, it does not matter how much you try to explain to the audience, you'll never win their heart and it will end up being a bore for everyone to watch because there won't be any interest. Do not underestimate the importance of how a scene is presented, and what the characters' reactions to the situation is.

I have seen this movie three times . Going back to VCR 's , in the 1980 's , and on VHS , in the 1990 's . They are the closest thing to real cinema that is to be found . This is my own interpretation of the films . In the late 60 's , I had two of the most enjoyable years of my life. My first years as an adult film producer/director . So many films were being made that we all wanted, but most people never saw them , and we had to do the work of distribution, marketing , promotion, advertising , and getting films seen.

Koyaanisqatsi and Powaqqatsi are both Beautiful films , but this final installment of the trilogy is a major let down. I do not agree with the director who made this movie. He has made movies based on many other religions so it is obvious he has a lot of experience. The plot is so thin it could be the film is just too small in its size. That does not help either. There is not a single character who I liked. Even the lead was a bit boring and there were so many scenes where there was nothing happening to keep the viewer interested .

Irene Jacob is mesmerizing in this final installment of Krzysztof Kieslowski 's trilogy and the story is infinitely satisfying as he builds a new film from a new and different source. The first in the trilogy, "The Double", is as good as anything else he made, and the third one, "A Wedding" (also known as "Journey to the End of the Night" in this country), may well become one of his greatest. The second one is, in fact, not only superior to the first, but to almost everything he ever made.

The 1998 version of "Psycho" needed to be set back in the 60's, rather than present day. The headliners would have done a good job with the setting. There were two scenes that just stuck out like a sore thumb. The first one was at the beginning of the movie when Marian Crane (Anne Heche) was sitting at her desk. Her boss took his client into his office because "it was air conditioning." I imagine that the majority of Arizona businesses have air conditioning. The other was the meeting of Lila Crane (Julianne Moore) & Sam Loomis (Viggo Mortensen).

I have had more boring stretches of 80 minutes in my life , but none are coming to mind right now. I'm sure I could do it, I just don't see how I'm gonna have the motivation to do it. I'm not complaining, just asking the question out loud, if anyone wants to chime in here, feel free. Thanks

In all seriousness, it does not take much motivation to go to bed or work at a consistent hour. I'm not saying that it would be easy, but I'm not ready to quit my job yet.

It is so nice to see Bruce Willis come down off his action throne and let us see that he really is a talented actor. He shines in this film as the near-40-year-old image consultant who has totally lost touch with his inner child--until he meets him face to face. This is one of those rare films that doesn't talk down to its audience and truly offers something for the WHOLE family. It is about caring for each other, keeping some of the child inside you, and realizing that you don't grow up exactly the way you thought you would.

I saw this version about a decade ago, and have been looking for it ever since. I just recently found an original VHS version, and purchased it for $125.00. Sounds crazy, but if you, like me, consider it as one of the best the Broadway musical stage has ever produced, you wouldn't even think twice.Why, it's just a little over paying for a Broadway ticket today. I really hope they re-release this in DVD form soon. It's a piece of musical theater that screams to be seen by all!

Honestly, I don't really understand why there has been so much controversy about this show. It embraces the elements of the original, while expanding on them. The storytelling has been updated and, while some of the episodes seem to be a bit "Fast", that is a good thing.Christopher Eccleston is perfect in the role. Easily as good as Tom Baker.Rose is one of the best companions, on par with Sarah Jane Smith or Leela.I like the concept that the timelords have been destroyed - No more politicking with the Doctor acting as president emeritus.

Eleven years ago , Stanley Ipkiss released his true inner self and became the hero of Edge City by finding his identity and becoming one of the world's most influential figures in history. Today, in an exclusive interview, he talks about his new book "Unmasked" and reveals the inspiration for the book: “I thought, 'Wow! I don’t even know where my life goes from here,’ and I thought, 'What am I going to do with my life? '” He says. “There is so much to do.

Yes this movie features a gal named Jessica who says everything is evil and she causes trees to land on her. But is she just a stupid idiot who does stupid things or does she have a secret identity that only she knows? This movie had many plot holes, but the acting is pretty good. I love that in the end Jessica is the good person and not that stupid. I also find this movie very funny. They do a lot of comedy, but it's not as funny like in the movies I like. The movie ends with the tree falling onto Jessica's head.

The greatest movie ever.How 's that for a contention ? However , if we look at it through purely cinematic terms , and not to be confused with those who believe that we all have to see this film to have some idea how good it is, it's a magnificent movie. And for a film with so little dialogue and so much use of visual aids , there's hardly much that can be said about it.I don't think it needs any commentary, except to note that it is not the only movie to take the 'no dialogue' route , and it's far from the worst.

What a shocker . For starters , I could n't stand the constant screaming and noisy panicking all the time . I can't stand it when my dog jumps into my lap and whines and I have to put my arm around her. I could be on my deathbed and I would be crying. I could swear I heard a gun shot in the middle of the night . I can't stand it when my baby cries and I have to sit with her for two hours while she cusses at me and tells me not to leave her in the car . I love to read .

Tumbling Doll of Flesh ( aka Niku daruma and Psycho : The Snuff Reels ) This was on my want list for quite some time now. The last time I saw this movie, it was in an art house cinema, in the middle of a festival, and I don't remember seeing a single other movie. This movie was the talk of the show, and it was so funny I couldn't even contain myself. It's the perfect movie for a Friday night in. It's funny, scary, and sexy, and the best part, it's all done with puppets!

There are so many holes in the plot , it makes you wonder if they knew they had an audience . what a waste of a movie . it's clear from the previews that they couldn't have done it any better . but i don't care if they had a perfect script , a perfect cast or perfect everything else , just do a movie that makes you laugh or make you cry , but not both . i'm not saying it's not funny , or doesn't have any good acting , but it's not an enjoyable experience .

I always wanted to see ELECTRA GLIDE IN BLUE for a very long time . I 've always been intrigued with the way this movie looked . It's a beautiful movie that I would love to see again, but unfortunately I never got a chance to . I think that it would be worth seeing again though, and I hope one day we will get another movie of ELECTRA GLIDE . I have to agree . Electra Glide has never been released on Blu-Ray. Electra Glide was my favorite movie for a very long time .

Given that Dylan Thomas is an icon of modern Anglophone poetry I expected a movie that would be prone to a hagiography of the subject. On the contrary the poet is presented as sexually irresponsible, a drunkard, a bad father, a lier and a hypocrite and perhaps a coward. Of course one could argue that all those things are an advantage when some one is an artist and especially a poet since one of the purposes of art is to subvert the standards of conventional morality but still I do not thing that a positive role model could crop up from such a bundle of personality traits.

If you have seen the Telugu version of Gilli `` Okkadu '' you will find this to be very similar. That may be partly because we have a lot more information in the Telugu, and partly because we are not limited to one language. However, in both stories we are dealing with women. In both stories, the women, in both the original and the adapted versions, get back their pasts. In both, the woman in trouble gets help from a stranger. In both, they get help from a man they have known all their life.

On the positive , I 'll say it 's pretty enough to be watchable . On the negative , it 's not enough of a jump scare, and the ending is predictable to the point that I can 't believe there isn 't a sequel . The film also has its flaws , but nothing that will stop you from seeing it on the big screen . Story - 6/10 It 's a decent concept, but unfortunately it doesn 't work well . I don ' t think it 's any better or any worse than a lot of horror movies .

I 'm a sucker for a decent superhero movie . ( I 'm not counting super bug budget , no offense to anyone who likes that.) However, with the exception of Wonder Woman ( and possibly X-Men ), there hasn 't been a successful comicbook movie I haven 't seen at least 10 times. This includes movies by the studio that brought you Spiderman , Batman , and others. It's not that I haven't seen them; I have seen them a time or two, but it's that they don't do the superhero genre justice on the big screen.

The films use of blue-black and vibrant skin tones to create a noir-ish feel to this movie unfortunately do not work. In fact its quite irritating as it obscures the demon characters and reduces them to one dimensional beings.At least the original had an hysterical energy and the gore set-pieces were quite stunning. Black gore is hardly frightening, nor is the main female demon at all frightening in her attempts to snarl and growl at the screen in her best camp Lugosi style.The narrative is grossly disjointed and if you could imagine 'Naked Lunch' directed by Russ Meyer you may appreciate the attempt to be William Burroughs-esque.

Reanhauer (Bill Roy) is the leader of a desert-dwelling cult who tries to resurrect one of his people, only to have a heart attack himself! He ends up dying on an operating table, and for the sake of revenge, his spirit takes over the body of the title character (Jill Jacobson), who then proceeds to go about hacking and slashing until her fellow nurses learn what needs to be done to exorcise the demon.While I know enough about the directors' filmography to know that it primarily consists of outright schlock, "Nurse Sherri" is really not all that bad.

Based on what little i have seen of this show I do n't think I will ever watch it again, the last 3 episodes were so bad it was painful, the writing was bad and the acting was bad and so so bad. The worst of it all was the new characters they put on a boat and had to deal with them in the last episode, it was so painful it was like watching someone die.
