I don't think they will ever recover, but I have to admit to having a good laugh at it and hope they get another chance to tell it like it was.

Superb editing , outstanding acting , especially by Epatha Merkerson , and highly enjoyable musical soundtrack . This film reaches a very high standard as a thriller . The story could have been a lot worse and it could be a lot better but it was very enjoyable . I am very satisfied with the final product . It is an interesting tale with good acting that makes it a thriller . Great job by everyone in this film . It is a good movie to have a good watch . This is an excellent action movie . I enjoyed watching this movie . It’s very good action film with very good acting .

This film has it's heart in the right place, but unfortunately, it isn't much of a film. It is more of a documentary under the guise of a narrative. Bamako is basically a newspaper op-ed piece put on celluloid. However, your average well-researched op-ed piece is far more cogent and concise than anything presented here. The filmmaker is trying to relay to the viewer the hardships of African life, in particular the country of Mali, due to the unethical practices of the IMF, G8, and World Bank, by using the setting of a mock trial against the aforementioned.

I have been watching movies from i think last 10 years , and I must say that i never felt that bad, which I felt after watching this extra large bore movie, it was bad, very Bad. There were songs & songs. Nobody should watch this movie. The director has shown Germans speaking English which is so rubbish. Germans does not speak English. & in one scene there was a white girl who asked Himesh for autograph. (Obv that he must have gave some money to her) In the promo they have shown prepare for Laughing riot.

It's complete nonsense. I've studied Nazism and read many manuscripts from the day - the "parallels" use most of the classic debased apocryphal myths of Nazism and then compare it with complete specious generalizations about what constitute 1/3 of the planet. It's crafted for an audience of Polly-Anna complacency who diet heavily on spoon-fed gibberish, horribly thought out arguments, irrational conclusions, fallacious ideas, and nonsensical logic.Who made this hit peace? Easy.When all is said and done; Que Bono? That is, who benefits, in the long run?You don't. You sacrifice money and rights.

It's really good to see Van Damme's film are slowly getting better of late and especially compared to C-grade flops "Derailed" and "Second in command" which were both tragic and not in a good way. The Sheperd: Border patrol is a good action flick with some really great action/fight sequences. It's good to know that Van Damme still knows how to kick seeing as his last film "Until Death" had no martial arts in it at all!! !That being said, this film is significantly inferior to "Until Death" which was a really good turn for Van Damme.

As a word of explanation, Disney's "The Kid" has absolutely nothing in common with the Charlie Chaplin 1921 classic of the same name. What we do have is a pleasant enough, though unbelievable, feel good family comedy as only the folks at Disney can provide. Bruce Willis, in a change of pace, plays a self-centered stuffed shirt of an "Image Consultant". He degrades, not only his clients, but those close to him as well. You know that he is going to have to change before the final credits.

This is simply a good ole fashioned western..not overly complex or long. It doesn't deceive itself in thinking that it was made but for entertainment. Still, it is one of those westerns you can watch once and be done with without returning. It features former partners Randolph Scott and Glenn Ford whose friendship is strong despite the fact that Ford's Cheyenne Rogers has been part of bank robbing(he even steals Scott's Sheriff Steve Upton's horse without knowing it his good friend for which he is thieving). In Red valley, Upton is under heavy scrutiny for a bank robbing that ended with several dead.

There must have been a lot of background info that was left out of the movie . In fact , there are some who think that the movie had some background info that were left out . One of the things that are not mentioned by the film makers is the fact that there is a very strong possibility that all of the people in the film are not entirely human . And there are many theories as to why there are some of them that look like human . And there is a very strong likelihood that they are not human .

It 's clear that for this film they wanted to have the story line driven by the characters . But it is not just the characters they wanted, they also wanted a story about women. But I have a very strong feeling about the fact that this is not going to be just about women. Let 's think what the story about women is about and let 's see what happens when these women decide to do something else, when they decide to have a relationship with men. And in this movie for sure, we will see that.

Great party movie, following the adventures of Bill & Tom, two high school buddies at opposite ends of the spectrum. Bill (Eric Stolz) prefers to live life straight-laced, while his friend Tom (Chris Penn) takes nothing seriously except partying all the time. When Bill moves out of his mother's house to live on his own he faces many issues, from his girlfriend, to his brother, to his landlord. Meanwhile, his friend Tom moves in to keep the rent down but proceeds to turn Bill's life upside down.

The plot of this movie is dangerously thin and the only `` star power '' if we can call it that, is that of the guy who does the voice-overs. He may have the ability to sell the movie but that doesn't make up for the plot holes, the characters who are clearly not the real deal, or the sheer laziness of the film. The script is good enough (for the most part) but the casting doesn't help matters and even the music and the special effects don't give anything that isn't readily apparent from looking at the film.

It's the 1980's and the teenagers are ready to party it up in a scary old house that is rumored to be haunted by the ghost of Murder McGee. After mistakenly conjuring the dead through an unfinished conversation on an Ouija board, the kids are forced to fight to the death battling a vengeful ghost who possesses and kills all of their friends one by one. Sound familiar? It's supposed to. It's clearly marketed to pay homage to the classic 80's slashers with the tagline: "Excessive violence. Gratuitous nudity. Zero budget."

It seems like an exciting prospect, a modern-dress "Othello" with Christopher Eccleston, who was so frighteningly good in "Shallow Grave" and (especially) "Jude," and Eamonn Walker, who brought such intensity and introspection to his pivotal role on "Oz." One would think them both natural Shakespeareans, but both performers misfire: Walker's Othello is a fairly cookie-cutter take on the part, with a whispery delivery that doesn't make much of an impact; and Eccleston hams it up appallingly as Iago, winking at the camera in almost an outrageous parody of the role.

I am profoundly grateful to have seen this movie . The acting is astonishing , the movie itself is powerful and moving , but what really made the film was the cinematography . This is a must see. You can see a sample of this movie on YouTube. “It’s a wonderful film , one of the best that has been done in Britain since the war .” – Michael Cimino

There was no one who had ever given me cause to complain about the films I’ve seen in my career. Not Michael Cimino nor the director Stanley Donen .

So, you wanna be a rock star? See this movie. You don't like rock, you say? Or you're REALLY into heavy metal? Then put on your favorite album and dream yourself away, this movie has nothing to offer. Rarely have I ever seen a movie being able to portrait the dream of being in a rock band as good as this. I had long hair during the late 1980's and early nineties, and I have played guitar for the last 15 years or so. Did I like Rock Star? Oh yes.

Well Folks, this is another stereotypic portrayla of Gay life however, the additional downside includes poor acting, horrible script, no budget, terrible sound and let us not forget the impossible storyline.It is Christmas in New York City and our story immediatly "focuses" on two male individuals, apparently lovers for some time. One of them has not let his parents (the right wing, religious zealot types) know that he is gay (adding to the impluasability of the story 'cause this guy is as efeminant as gay guys come these days) and his parents are coming to viusit him.

It 's said that this film is or was banned in the US since it was released . Since there was no film to ban, however, Hollywood has just made a new movie version of this story . So now, you will see this story as an extra in another movie . And you will find out that this is true . The story goes as such. In this movie, a little girl is sent to a special boarding school because her father died in a car wreck . In the boarding school, she is kept as a baby by an evil woman .

The story of Sweeney Todd evokes memories of the work of classic writers like Charles Dickens, and more contemporary writers like Edward Gory. As a musical, it naturally becomes more like the musical Les Miserables. Both deal with the grim effects of poverty in the Industrial Revolution, and the breakdown of organized society. But this musical is different from Les Mis in one very important aspect: Stephen Sondheim, the songwriter who can adapt to any style. To be sure, he's had his successes and failures, but one thing about his shows you can always count on: They will be something unique.

Eddie Monroe is Hooooot . He is a great actor and I could be his girl anytime . He 's hot , he knows how to talk to the ladies and when you talk to him he doesn 't give a damn about anything else . This movie has one scene where Eddie is driving and he is trying to figure out a way to get in to a phone booth from the back seat because he needs to call home because his car is not going to start . The movie is set in the late 70's but the way it is told and played is just as dated as that time.

I watched this film on ITV and I enjoyed it a lot . It was very watchable and very funny. I can't wait to see the DVD version which looks more than I expected. The only criticism I have is that it took a long time for the plot to progress. What I've been reading is quite good - I found it interesting that there was so much controversy about the film. The only negative I have about the film is that I had to watch it with the subtitles on. It seemed like it was very slow.

This isn't a bad TV movie. Shtrafbat is short for Shtrafnoy Batallion, which means Penal Batallion. Such battallions were formed due to the increasing demand for soldiers as the Soviet Union was taking heavy casualties all through out the war. These battalions consisted of convicts and dishonored soldiers who were given the chance to clear their names by proving themselves in combat. They were looked down upon as scum and were expended easily during combat without much regret, or much honor, on the part of military. They were often sent on suicide missions and suffered extreme casualties.

I still remember watching Satya for the first time. I was completely blown away. Here was a movie that was very different so from the other Gangster films that I had seen. So realistic, so Mumbaiyya and so believable. Despite "Company" (which was a very good effort) and "Vaastav" (more focused on the journey of the protagonist) which came close, no underworld movie could ever live up to Satya.When I watched Ab Tak 56 for the first time, I said to myself "Indian Cops have their own 'Satya' now".

Produced by Nott Entertainment , this movie is `` nott '' very good at all . I sat through the first two minutes without watching the movie to get a sense of where they were going, and by the time the film went on, I was not interested . Now, if you do get to see it , I am going to recommend that you wait until the first minute to watch it . Then you'll know exactly what you are getting into. The story is so predictable that the ending is almost a surprise . It is so long that you don't want to end up with your hands full .

The movie had no excitement and does not have anything to hold your interest . The movie had nothing exiting and has no new content . It was a big waste of money for the makers to make a movie . The movie has nothing in it which makes you think about anything . The story is predictable , there is no real plot . You are just looking for something to watch . It is not entertaining and has no substance to hold your attention . It is not that bad ,but it is a waste of time . There is nothing in the movie that is worth a second watch .

This was a surprisingly very good movie, and an interesting idea.. However, it was just a little bit disappointing in that the 'Twist' was a little too predictable and just a bit too early on in the movie. Whilst watching, it started to get a little bizarre and confusing to the point that, the only reasonable outcome possible was the inevitable plot twist, but it certainly did not ruin this movies flow. There were superb performances, there was never a dull boring moment, so totally well worth watching this one.

I rented this movie , because I noticed the cover in the video rental store . I saw Nolte , the director of the picture , and was very impressed by his artistry. So , I bought a ticket for the video rental store. I did not even bother to get out a ticket to see the movie , as it was already sold out , and it would not be showing at the theater. As it turns out , I got to see the movie , and found that I loved it very much. So , what is this film ?

As talk-shows go, Larry King Live is not bad, and since he occasionally gets good guests, it's a show to turn on once in awhile, but not compulsively. When Bill Maher, Carl Bernstein, a former president, or other substantive guests sit across from him, it's not too bad. Other times, he tends to host guests involved in the latest celebrity scandal which contributes absolutely no intelligent information to the country and feeds a largely uneducated public that wants to hear the latest gossip about movie and TV stars.

Whoa. I mean, whoa. I mean, whoa whoa.I saw this movie, waaay back when I was eight, in 1996. Back then, CGI films were a rarity; and good ones even more so. Also, back then we listened to things called CD players. But I digress. I used to like this movie a lot, way back then, and up till viewing it again, I've held reaally fond memories of it. Hey, it's Don Bluth! Anyone who hates "All Dogs Go to Heaven" is clearly a robot.

This is easily one of the best movies of the 1950s. Otto Preminger directed only four or five really good movies and this is one of them. Frank Sinatra gives his best performance and the music score by Elmer Bernstein is dynamite. From the opening titles (by Saul Bass) to the hysteria of drug addict Frank going cold turkey, this is a riveting movie! With Kim Novak (giving a very good performance), Eleanor Parker (giving a very bad performance) as well as Darren McGavin as the reptilian pusher and Arnold Stang as Frank's grifter pal.

After a very scary , crude opening which gives you that creepy `` Chainsaw massacre '' -feeling , everything falls into place in the second half and the movie really kicks into gear . in short , the first half of `` Hellraiser 2: Bloodline'' is a scary movie full of gore , blood spattering , torture and all out gore . but the second half takes off on a different note and gives you a much more positive feel for the movie - the second half of the movie contains some of the best scenes and plot twists in the series - so if you liked the first movie - you'll love the 2nd .

I 'll give it a two because it has a lot of music , otherwise it would be a one.I 'd have it rated 4.5/5 if it wasn 't for the crappy animation. Story: 8/10I can see why the story might be lacking... but I can see why you might like it. I loved it! I would recommend watching the 2nd episode... I think the animation in the first part is pretty bad, but in the second you can see the animation better. Animated Character: 8/10It is not perfect but it's better than nothing!

I was so excited to finally watch `` Pulse '' after receiving it from Amazon , and I have to say it was pretty awesome so far. The story was pretty great too, even better then what I had thought at the time. I thought that it had a little too much action and suspense and not enough character development for my tastes. I have to say though that it is getting a little bit better. The characters seem to be getting more interesting and more developed as the story moves on. And I think the story is getting more exciting too.

S. Epatha Merkerson shines as Nanny in this touching and vibrant look at the life of Ruben Santiago , Jr. (Spencer Treat Clark) in the 1940’s, the story of his love for his employer’s granddaughter, a young woman with whom he falls in love and his eventual acceptance and reconciliation of her love for him. The story is set on the grounds of a historic estate in Southern California’s Coachella Valley as Nanny, who has known him for years, watches his life evolve from loving servant to loving friend.

Even though this film 's trailer and poster imply that Sally Hemmings was an important character , I might not have seen the film because of a few things: 1) I didn't have cable 2) The film doesn't sound very good. I saw it at a local IMAX theatre and it looks like it might be a good film. I thought that was odd because the film is based upon a book which had been a huge hit, but it turned out I hadn't been watching enough books. I've been watching more so I was watching more films.

Perhaps I was just in a really good mood when I watched this film . but , for whatever reason , I was very happy about this movie , as I had never seen this before, and it was also the first time I watched the full film . and , I am not sure if I like this movie , and it is also not the greatest , but it is definitely better than a lot of action/horror movies . I do not know if I would recommend it , but I do not know , I have never read any of his works, but I have watched a lot of his movies .

My friends and I saw this at the San Diego Black Film Festival . It was great . Stormy is one of the best movies I've ever seen . And I agree with all those who say this movie is one of the best films ever made. For those who don't see it in a theater or need to watch it on a smaller screen. I think this movie is worth the cost of renting it . You'll enjoy it even more. I was very very surprised at the story of this movie.

I am from Romania ... and for that i apologize if my English is not so good.i just finished watching this movie and i must say that i am extremely disappointed. I always liked Wesley Snipes's movies but this one is terrible. I regret that I spent over 3 hours downloading this film. There are a lot mistakes in the film. For example, the stadium in the film is not Lia Manoliu. The name of the stadium is Ghencea. The name of the soccer team is called Steaua Bucuresti, not Uli.The scoreboard of the stadium is not capable of showing graphical images: video replays, live images etc.

This has to rate as one of the cheesiest of TV shows in a long time.Jose Ferrer played the title role in this show’s last season, so we knew it was a good show. It was. He did an amazing job. The acting was superb as well, and the writing was superb. There really is something to this show. It is one of those shows that leaves you speechless when it ends. There is no way for me to explain what makes this such a great show. I think you need to have seen it to really appreciate it.

Being a fan of Saint Etienne and the City of London , I was very excited to see this movie, and have a lot of good memories of this show. However, this movie, and most of the series are not worth watching, at all. Let me start off by stating the obvious. The plot is shit, and the characters are boring, and the plot is stupidly convoluted. First of all, the first thing that is important, and should be kept in the forefront, is that this film is the best version of the story that has ever been written.

This film is bad. Not so bad it is good. Just bad. It is however hilariously bad. I watched it out of some morbid curiosity and never intend to watch it nor any other Chuck Norris film ever again. If you have to choose between this film and death, you should happily choose this film, however, as it is is a masterclass in terrible film making (hence the hilarity).It is a constant depression to me, as I grind away at my desk job, that some people get to be involved in movie-making and decided to produce things such as this.1 out of 10.

I watched this movie which I really thought had a promising beginning but then it just led me to feel bad for the main lead who was such a bitch. It was a good story but I couldn't really take pleasure from it as there was something missing which I didn't even really understand what was. I liked the acting but I can't really take pleasure from that either. The movie got a lot better in its second half especially with the story which wasn't the most original but there was still something which gave me a feeling of what was going on in this world.

This movie is bad . I saw the rated and the unrated versions . They are terrible ! ! Now , I have to tell you , I don’t like horror , I love horror , I love the suspense , the horror , the scares , the tension , the blood . I am going to write an article about this flick . I will put in all the information that I have in my mind . Now , please read the review below . I hope you have some time to do some research and see the movie . You have to understand , this movie is not rated and unrated .

I'm so glad he wasn't alive to see this. This movie is a debauchery of his work. I agree with the other commenter-- this movie was a terrible disappointment. I'd give it a zero, but am forced to give it a 1.The story was weak, and it reminded me of the days when I was a young teenager trying to write a movie, then looking back on it and realizing how horrible it was. Bad actors, family and friends, and someone stupid enough to fund it was how it was made.

I attended a screening of 'The Cooler ' at the Toronto Film Festival this year . While the other reviews have been kind to the new movie it was not because I enjoyed it as much as a lot of the reviewers, in fact my first thoughts were 'how did this movie get to the TIFF screening room in the first place'. The film is based on the book of the same name written by David Lipsky who had the idea after reading a short story written by a man he knew who was diagnosed with terminal cancer.

Chick Flick? Of course.... Been done before? Many times.... Predictable? Yes..... Worth watching? You bet! I was delighted with Sarandon and Portman's portrayals of otherwise stock characters in a familiar story line. I am a great fan of mother/daughter stories. What makes the difference between the good ones and the weak ones ARE the performances and the character development. Although this is not the BEST of its genre, I will buy it and watch it again. I felt the characters were believable and the acting was superior.

Irvine Welsh 's follow up to Trainspotting hits the screen as three short stories set in Edinburgh , all with the aim of making you laugh. The story of a pair of drug dealers who travel to the Scottish capital to score, the film is in fact a very funny and engaging film in its own right. This isn't a film about drug dealers, but the drug dealers who travel from Edinburgh to sell drugs in Glasgow. And that's why the film is a bit hard to describe. But it is worth watching, and you really have to give credit to Irvine for creating a character that is funny.

Well , this latest version of Mansfield Park seemed to try and take the edginess of the 1999 theatrical version and add it on, but I am not sure it worked, the actors are all too old to play teenagers and I don't think they'd be able to find any kids willing to be cast in the parts. It's too old and too much a story of romance for a young person to really take to heart. Still, I think this movie is a lot of fun and is one of those films where I think it's better to leave it a mystery to the audience.

Sacchi is the best Bogart impersonator ever ... dry and droll as Sam Marlowe . The music from award winning writer and director Alan Menken is always entertaining, particularly the songs from Tangled in the Bowery ( which has a terrific song called " I am the Boss '). The performances are excellent as well and are always entertaining ... and there are no weak links in this production . If you're looking for a show to see, you can't go wrong. Fantastic cast, great songs, great direction and costumes. The cast is amazing. This is one of my favorite Bogart shows ever.

The only reason I did n't fall asleep during this movie is because the seats were not that comfortable . I think this movie should have been 2 hours long so they could have given us some popcorn and drinks. I have to hand it to them because this was an entertaining film filled with action, but i thought the last act was extremely boring and only served to add to the already long runtime. I will give this one a 6.5. The acting is good but there were several parts where i wanted to smack myself and then laugh so hard.

I think my summary says it all . This MTV-ish answer to the classic Candid Camera TV show features a group of ‘curious’ teenagers who go on a variety of misadventures around the Los Angeles area, in the spirit of that show. In other words, they go on a bunch of wild and crazy adventures, which are filmed using a camera-shy teenage model (and one or two ‘cameras’ themselves). There’s even a segment where they try to record the experience and use their video to answer a few questions about the experience.

I have watched every version of this play that I can think of, including several on the stage, and Sir Derek Jacobi is absolutely the best Hamlet I have ever seen! He has the most wonderful voice for stage acting, and his expressive face will take you on a roller coaster of emotions throughout this play. The way in which he delivers his lines takes you on a journey through madness. He (as Hamlet)can in an instant be loving, soft and gentle and in another instant be raging against the hell that is his life.

This has to be one of the worst movies ever to come out of the Sci-Fi Channel. Here is how the movie starts, Women are the only humans on this planet due to the fact that in the not to distant future chemical warfare is A OK as long as it only targets soldiers (In case your wondering, Men) However the virus back fires (Big shock)and all the men on earth slowly die. Then all of male kind is condemned to die when the madam president is shot and killed by a man.

I came across this movie back in the mid eighties as a teenager and it immediately became one of my favorite movies. It's a simple story: a young boy is born into the wrong family, he befriends a witch who teaches him about his magic, and they fight against a wizard. They make it all the way across the ocean with the help of the wizard's daughter, but it's not enough to survive. I remember watching it with my dad. I remember him sitting there with his mouth hanging open and me laughing so hard he just had to slap me on the shoulder.

This is a classic continuation to Bleu , the likewise excellent film , with Juliet Binouche as a main star. The screenplay, co-written by César Domboy, Nicolas Lebourg (who wrote for the French version) and Nicolas Rovère, was based on Pierre Bounine's novel . It is an original and very interesting story, in which the plot takes place at the end of the 1970s. Jean-Claude Lemire plays the lead role of Julien, the son of a black farmer who returns to his village to try to settle down there.

Reba is a very dumb show. You can predict pretty much anything that's about to happen. Barbra Jean is just too stupid. It's like she's not even a character. A show like this should at least have SOMEONE who resembles a real-life person. I guess Barbra Jean represents a retarded person. Keira or whatever her name is, Reba, Brock, they're all stupid! Keira is like the smartest person on the show, and she's still stupid. EVERYONE IS STUPID! That's my opinion on Reba.

I'm not surprised that so many people fell for this one. When I was watching this movie, a couple viewers next to me sobbed whenever you're "supposed" to sob -- or at least feel "touched". Like when Hunting said he didn't love the girl. Like when Robin Williams' character (sorry I forgot his role's name) was telling Hunting repeatedly "It's not your fault" (oh Lord, just thinking of that scene gives me the goosebumps). I couldn't have cared less for what would happen to the characters.

I loved this movie when I was a teenager. LOVED it. It hasn't grown up with me, though. Maybe that's because it's a melodramatic load of old rubbish, full of macho posturing, cheesy dialogue, overwrought slo-mo and characters saying 'Goddammit' a lot. The lumpy narrative blobs gracelessly from one character to another, one plot strand to another, without ever bringing it all together, and it doesn't help that William Baldwin's mono-expression of a performance is wet enough to put out every fire in the movie's overlong runtime.

This is an astonishingly bad action film . I 'd say its primary flaw is that it 's BORING . It 's really hard to believe that a big studio is making a movie that is so boring . And yet , we have a lot of people paying money to see this . The plot of the film is fairly standard , except for a few twists in the tale . In the beginning of the film , we are introduced to the main antagonist , a group of terrorists who come to town , with a goal to blow up an art museum .

I feel dumber after watching the first 20 min , luckily i walked out and saved the rest of my money , it took me about 5 hours to read through the entire book , it took me longer to read through it , its very good . I think the movie will be good to watch . The book is full of details, and the movie might be even better as it has a lot of extras. Overall, I think the movie's a lot better than the book, but you could also read the book and just skip to the movie.

I think this is a pretty good movie , but one thing makes it VERY interesting to me . It is what makes this film so special . In the film there is the story of an old man who is in the last days of living and trying to make his last days worth living . He knows that his life is nearing the end but tries to live his life to the best of his ability. He has been very successful in business but his life and his wife are going to be very sad as her husband has to go on an important mission .

If you like your films to pull your emotions out of you , if you like your films with a strong narrative, I would suggest you give the film a chance as you may surprise yourself. The story can be very confusing and the way the characters are written down could also be confusing if you don’t know about them. But if you are looking for an emotional ride or you like your drama to pull you in a different direction or if you just want something to watch, this is it for sure.

THE MERCHANT OF FOUR SEASONS was Rainer Werner Fassbinder's first shot at mainstream acceptance. In a turbulent career of just fifteen years, he managed to create an astounding body of work in film and theater, both as a performer and a creative producer, actor, and director. Although this movie might not appeal to many viewers, the film has much to offer. The storyline is fairly straightforward. A man is ostracized from his upper middle class family due to emotional and economic problems, and proves unable to control his downward spiral.

Now I'm a big animation fan -- love Svankmeyer and usually am into all applications of stop motion so I had high hopes for this one. Then I came on IMDb and paused --- I'm always real suspicious of films with a bimodal distribution of votes on IMDb. Here we've got another --- a bunch of 10s (shill anyone) and then some real low ones. I'm also suspicious of 10s with the word "visionary" in them. Sure there are visionaries but this character isn't one of them.

But certainly a serious contender for one of the worst 10 of all time.I got this DVD cheap, with Sandra Bullock as headliner on the case. This is false advertising - she's on-screen for almost 10 minutes of the movie.On the other hand, there was no other selling point for this movie - the dialog was horrible, the editing was apparently done by someone who was strung out on Quaaludes, the directing was ... well, let's just say that my 14-yo daughter could do better, but I hope she never sees such faint praise from me.

As an ex (nuclear) submarine officer I must admit this is my favorite submarine movie (even exceeding Hunt for Red October). Someone knew something about submarines when they wrote the movie. OK - not realistic - but it is a comedy - and has all of the "inside jokes" from the submarine force. A great cast with the stereotypical uptight submarine guys on the "Orlando" and our heroes on the diesel boat. Definitely "DBF" by the way = that means diesel boats forever. But they want ten lines in order to post this - jees is the Admiral in charge here?

I watched this video because I like Malta and this movie was filmed in its entirety there. Very disappointing, since it fails to catch any of the flavor or beauty of the island - just the hot, dry, and barren elements. The movie was dull, boring, completely incoherent from beginning to end, pretentious, and devoid of any conceivable plot. You had to be a psychic to follow the plot line, or lack thereof. It had its moments, sure; but so does going to the dentist.In short, I'd much rather endure another colonoscophy before viewing this horrible mess again.

One of quite a few cartoon Scooby Doo films , `` Scooby Doo and the Loch Ness Monster '' turns up the volume by giving you no dialogue at all. It also features some terrific monster designs by Karl Freund , including his monster with an octopus for a head , which was the inspiration for the film's best-known monster . Despite the fact that this was written and produced in the 1960s ( and is almost as long as the Scooby Doo movies themselves ), the script and story are fairly modern , with the movie's two main characters played by two young actors at the beginning of their careers.

Some critics have compared Chop Shop with the theatrical releases of City of God and Pixote. I've seen both of those as well as Chop Shop and like in many instances, I don't feel the comparison is warranted. City of God and Pixote surely had a much higher budget. Chop Shop is a low budget independent film about survival and hope, disappointment, and continuing with life. One of the scenes is allegedly filmed during the US Open and either the filmmakers had incredible connections or the scene was filmed at another time and the US open footage was added.

I thought Godzilla 2000 was the worst movie ever until I saw this monstrosity . My friends and I went to the theater last night in New Orleans to see this movie. We were all about 10 feet apart. We all thought the same thing: This movie is the definition of trash. The whole movie was trash. It was so bad that it hurt. I couldn’t see the monster in the movie. I know that sounds stupid but you know how I am about movies. It’s just a fact that I will not sit through an entire movie where there is no monster.

One should not be too critical about the director's second feature.I really like the camera work of Madiba. As Mr. Shawn pointed out, he had a unique way of looking at things.However, howcome a 14 year old boy shoot such beautiful images? Remember he has not got any education of any sort. I don't think english is the common tongue in Cape Town ghettos. Worse still, Madiba looks even smaller than his supposed age of 14.Any way, if you overcome above-mentioned peculiarities, you can watch the film and still enjoy it because of nice camera work.

One of the last films DIRECTED by Lionel Barrymore, "Ten Cents a Dance" stars Barbara Stanwyck as the dance-hall girl "Barbara" in her sixth role. Stanwyck looks quite "plain-jane" in this one, and opens with her getting chewed out by the dance hall manager. Then along comes rich guy Bradley Carlton (Ricardo Cortez) who wants to sweep her off her feet. (Cortez and Stanwyck had made three films together in the 1930s.) Then she meets Eddie, who's very different from the dashing Carlton.

The storyline has too many flaws and illogical sequences to be worthwhile . Jolie 's acting is pretty flat and uninspiring and it's not as if her character lacks motivation for doing whatever it is she does . At all . The script is even worse. This is a movie for kids . I don't need to tell you what a waste it is , but I think I'm being overly optimistic . Kids will go to see it and think it's funny and cool . There is no other movie in history that has the potential to do that .

The actors in this dark film are truly believable and well cast . The quality of the camera work makes this a special film and I highly recommend seeing it in a theatre . I think it deserved to be nominated for best picture . I liked the movie, it made me smile and laugh. This movie reminded me of the first Star Wars movie I saw and now I love this movie and I recommend it to anyone who likes Star Wars and sci-fi . The actors are amazing and all of them are good in this movie.

Certainly this film is not for everybody -- -but for anyone with a sense of humor and love of period pieces, it is worth a look. It can be viewed online for free - but please do remember to click through to the source material if you are interested in obtaining a screen capture. Wednesday, March 24, 2010

I'm very curious to know the story of how the film was produced and who it was shot with - so far I have been unable to come up with anything on this subject. A great deal of mystery surrounds this film, as well it should.

After missing out on this innumerable times on TCM UK, I decided to check it out given its sci-fi/adventure/camp pedigree: I knew I’d be in for a thoroughly silly ride – but it was also astoundingly bad! Anyway, perhaps appropriately given the characters involved, the script rips off many sci-fi titles then of recent vintage – SOYLENT GREEN (1973), ZARDOZ (1974), LOGAN’S RUN (1976; to the extent that it was filmed on some of the self-same sets! ), STAR WARS (1977), ALIEN (1979) and MAD MAX 2: THE ROAD WARRIOR (1981)!

I remember watching Police Squad ! when it first came on ABC in 1982 and I thought it was a pretty decent police procedural. The first half is a cop trying to catch a serial killer. Then it becomes a drama about a corrupt cop who has an affair with one of his cases. Then he is replaced. Then he dies. I was 12 at the time and I don't remember much about it but I knew that I liked it. This is the only one I've seen. It was a movie back in the late eighties.

Well I'm not the world's biggest Sondheim fan, so although I have the cast album and I've listened to it a few times I've never actually seen this show performed and I haven't seen the Tim Burton movie version either. I felt like I wanted to see something more faithful before I see the Burton one and give it a chance just as a movie. This version isn't a movie at all, it's a filmed play with some of the original members of the cast, including most importantly Angela Lansbury's performance as Nellie Lovett.

I didn't understand the people who rated it over 5. I think it's a horrible film from any point of view. Plots, acting, art, dialog, music, whatsoever! I don't mind a low budget..However you have to get some point. Wandering, wondering..pointless..then two boys started kissing in bed. awful,,just awful. I love indie films, don't mind it is slow. However this movie disappointed me from any perspectives. Even the Graffito, not artistic.I was wondering what kind of people would like it.

THE worst movie I 've ever seen , and I 've seen allot . Acting is horrible , plot is horrible . I was so bored I almost didn't want to stay up through the movie , but I didn't because it was really stupid , and the only way to make a stupid movie is to make it stupid . The worst movie I've ever seen, and I've seen some pretty lame ones, but this one is by far the worst , so I won't even comment on acting . The plot of the movie was just horrible, and it was stupid .

Let me tell you something...this movie exceeds all of the Troma laugh and gore movies hands down as it ACTUALLY TRIES TO COME ACROSS AS A SERIOUS MOVIE. From the terrible acting... "I knew it, I knew she was possessed! "...to the priest accepting sexual favors and getting into showers with naked teenagers...this piece of dung takes the cake. I am at a loss trying to compare this to another movie equally as bad. This may just be in a class all its own. The kicker is that supposedly some Cardinal oversaw production to make sure it was true to the actual situation.

This movie was terrible . You could n't fast forward fast enough to get to the end of this movie . It would be better if the actors were actors and the story line was better . This movie should have never been released in theatres . In theaters , this film was average . I did not like the movie at all. It was boring and not very interesting . It was way over priced. And when you have over priced movie, you don't have to watch it twice . You can go see it once . In theaters it was boring and had very little plot which was very sad .

The stage star Grace Hayes stars in this obscure little film . After years of being on the stage , Grace decides to try out for television . She's cast as the lead of a soap opera . The studio wants Grace to appear in a number of short scenes in which her characters will have sex . When the director gets her to do some of the scenes , she falls in love with the producer . So he asks her to do a few more scenes , but instead of filming them himself , he takes out a camera crew .

The director Godfrey Reggio must be a very charming and persuasive man for this dreadfully botched project to have seen the light of day. We know from a few letters written by Mary Wollstonecraft back in the 18th century that Reggio, who wrote the film's screenplay with his wife, would have made his mark on the history of cinema in Hollywood. Now we can see that he did indeed, with a remarkable vision and a lot of talent. The story was to have been based on the life of Mary Wollstonecraft, wife of Henry (the poet), who died on January 22nd 1797.

Perhaps the wildest outlier in Alfred Hitchcock's career is this straight-out comedy vehicle by the director, pairing Carole Lombard with Robert Montgomery as a couple who discover a mistake has invalidated their marriage. Where do they really stand with each other?Contrary to what others say, there IS an element of suspense here: The idea that these two miserable people might escape each other, free to inflict their awfulness on some other, undeserving mate.It's funny reading comments here about how miserable Lombard's Ann Smith plays out in this film, because Montgomery's role is as much of a heel.

The movie starts out a bit interested with the son interested in a teenage girl his own age . Clayburgh and Coppola are not as concerned with making a movie like they are interested in the story and are willing to let their film do the work of creating a film for them . The film starts off with the teenage girl having to get into the car and Clayburgh makes the teenage girl get into the car . He drives around the block . The film ends with Clayburgh holding onto the girl as he tries to find out who is the father of his son .

In London, the Venetian Carla Borin (Yuliya Mayarchuk) is searching an apartment to share with her beloved boyfriend Matteo (Jarno Berardi). She meets the lesbian real estate agent Moira (Francesca Nunzi) and rents a large apartment. When the jealous Matteo finds some pictures and letters from her former lover Bernard (Mauro Lorenz) in Venice, he hangs up the phone and the upset and amoral Carla has a brief affair with Moira and intercourse with an acquaintance in a party. When Matteo comes to London, he concludes that his lust for Carla is more important than his jealousy and her behavior.

Yep. Those of my generation who grew up watching those old Sunbow cartoons were spoiled. The 80's Joe tune was one of the best cartoons in the history of television. Well written stories, well developed characters. Granted it was nothing more that a glorified toy commercial but it definitely helped carry that toy line. Fast forward almost twenty years later and enter Valor vs. Venom. The animation was average at most. The movement of the characters seemed to jerky and puppet like. The movie felt more like a Small Soldiers sequel than a story about a special military force.

Jeff Leroy wanted to makes fun of Scientology so built a horror movie around a cult similar to it . And to make his movie he used members of the Cult of the Black Hole as the cast . Here's what happened when his movie was released

This is the tale of how Tom Leroy built a horror movie out of members of the infamous Cult of the Black Hole cult. The story of how Tom Leroy made his cult horror movie has been told a few times in the past. It is well worth watching, if only for the shock and disgust it contains.

The Evil that Men Do ( 1984 ) was one of the few non-Cannon films Charlie Bronson made during the 1980s. The film follows the efforts of a small time criminal (Bronson) who is caught by the cops. After a series of arrests the police finally catch him, but he escapes and is taken to jail. After being tortured by the prison guards he escapes through the ventilation system and hides out at a bar. The bar is being visited by a woman who has escaped from prison after committing a rape and murder.

i love this show . i hate when it goes to season finale because it feels like forever until the next one come on. so i watch every season to know what will happen for my favorite characters. it's always sad for me because i love this season. and when it finally end i hope my fav character will come back. so it's really sad to see it go because i love it when it's over but it's also a time to get excited for next season. but for this season it's sad.

The DVD version we bought had Sandra Bullock on the cover , but we 've discovered it was a picture taken from the movie, The Blind Side . We're still waiting on confirmation from the studio on whether they will put this back in, so if you want to buy the DVD version of Blind Side , go to amazon and check it out. It's available for sale there or at Amazon. It has been on sale for a while now. The DVD and Blu Ray are also available to pre order from Amazon .

The core issues at play (God & Satan / Good & Evil) can be & should be tremendously compelling (as demonstrated through thousands of works of art/music/literature/film). End of Days, unfortunately, is nothing but a 2Dimensional Cartoon. Byrne's acting ability stands so obviously in sharp contrast to Arnold's corresponding lack of ability and is further underlined by a plot filled with nothing but stereotypes.The single compelling scene occurs at the very beginning with the transformation of the Gabriel Byrne character and his subsequent interaction with his wife? girlfriend? It is both erotically charged & repellent -- modernizing the vampirish themes, the seductive power of evil.

Real-life husband and wife Paul Bettany and Jennifer Connelly star in Creation, which recounts the period of Charles Darwin's life prior to the publication of "On the Origin of Species" in 1859, his infamous, world changing tome on evolution and natural selection. Darwin's research created an enormous rift, a schism between the believers of his day and scientists. He was said at the time to be going to war against God, and even to have "killed God".The film revolves around Darwin's life with his wife and four children. Jennifer Connelly is excellent as his extremely devout and loving wife.

While not truly terrible, this movie is still largely a waste of time, and paints an incredibly inaccurate and revisionist picture of Beach Boys history.Basically, this movie would have you believe that Mike Love was the brains behind the band and Brian Wilson was just a pathetic psycho. In fact, none of the characters is developed beyond a one-dimensional parody, but this is a TV movie so what do you expect? Mike Love's foul stench is all over this turkey as he attempts to re-write history with himself in the role of band figurehead and resident genius.

I 've been a fan of Larry King 's show for awhile , I think he does a terrific job of getting his audience on the same page with what is going on in the world of politics. I think it 's easy for him to get across the issues that we are facing. For me , Larry King is the only political show I can listen to when I have time. I listen to this radio show as I am doing my work , I don't have time to do other radio shows or read newspaper.

I'm racking my brain, but I can't seem to think of another movie quite like The Valley of the Gwangi. A Western with dinosaurs? What could be more natural? You gotta wonder why John Ford and/or John Wayne never tried it! The plot  While searching for a mythical miniature horse for her circus, TJ Breckenridge (Gila Golan), Tuck Kirby (James Franciscus), and the rest of the cast/characters enter a strange, lost valley. There they find not only the miniature horse, but some other, more fearsome creatures as well.

This film powerfully demonstrates the struggle of two women in love in a culture so deeply entrenched in ritual and tradition. All this against a backdrop of an India which itself is struggling for freedom from these same values. This film is both political and personal and never too preachy or idealistic on either front. It is easy to see why "Fire" has caused riots in India, but tragic nonetheless. A true film such as this one deserves to be seen by all people of the world, not just privileged westerners.

Beware My Lovely originated from a play written by Mel Dinelli who apparently liked writing about frightened women . His play was well received by the audience and his publisher took him on board and put him on the best selling list. But Mel Dinelli had other ideas; he wrote a followup play in which the lead role was taken over by his wife and the original play was made into an even better musical comedy . Mel Dinelli is still alive and is still producing his works. I can think of many other examples . Here are my two favorites which are also my favorites as far as productions go.

Everything about this movie was bad, the acting was bad and the plot was bad. And were is all the blood and gore that was in "Demons" which is a good movie and it was not scary at all. My Brother said that this movie was bad but I had to give it a chance since the first movie was very good. When the movie was over I understand why my brother thought this movie was bad. The only plus in this movie was the music by "The Smiths" and "The Cult", but this is a movie and the music soundtrack is not the most important thing.

You'll feel like you've experienced a vacation in Hell after you have sat down and watched this horrible TV movie. This movie is an exercise in over-acting (very bad over-acting) to situations that made out to be more than what they are. I won't give away the plot, but once you realize why the people in this film are running from the native man in the film you will demand the two wasted hours of your life back. The only plus is seeing Marcia Brady running around in a bikini!

The fact that this cruddy series could elicit dozens of comments (much less hundreds of 'votes') speaks volumes as to the decline of Western (or at least American) civilization.Read Proust, you morons!! Or at least Dave Barry or Calvin and Hobbes anthologies.Chuck Norris. Wrap your brains around the fact that in order to rate or write about this series you'd have to have spent minutes..nay, HOURS...viewing this poor sod treading the boards and spewing lines with less emotional impact than the gal who used to call off the correct time on your local service.PLEASE DON'T WATCH THIS SHOW!!

Well, that was sure a waste of Dave McKean's talents, wasn't it? Don't get me wrong: when it comes to graphic design, Dave McKean may be the best in the world right now. The layered, textured look he can accomplish with just a few pencil lines on rough paper make the efforts of people like Peter Greenaway and David Fincher look like what they are: hackwork. McKean has been the godfather of a revolution in the look of comics, film, even magazine ads which borrow the distinctive collage effect he has pioneered.But this movie?

Sacchi is the best Bogart impersonator ever... dry and droll as Sam Marlowe. The music from award winning composer George Duning [From Here To Eternity, Picnic, The World of Suzie Wong], the cinematography of perfect locations [including the famous Ambassador Hotel] are all right on target as famous tv director Robert Day [Kojak, Streets of San Francisco, The Avengers] guides the most endearing group of well-known character actors through a spoof of every dark detective film every made. See this if you loved all the old serious flicks and have a sense of humor... this one is a hoot.

Jingofighter I agree with some of your comments, but I have to disagree on a couple of things. First, this film is nothing like THE CARS THAT ATE Paris. Not IMHO. Nothing like it.I think the film had elements of surrealism, but I think the basic approach of the film maker is not "surrealist" per se. therefore its not really like CARS Paris, I think more like a weird Euro work, with some scenes bearing the hallmark of "wierd" not surreal.Secondly, I think the music by Heuzenroeder is brilliant.

I actually liked this movie even though this movie seems to be so hated and i think it's even better then The Deer Hunter, which was overrated. Both this movie and Year Of The Dragon are very underrated although i could see why someone would not like this movie. At three and a half hours the movie just goes on too long and the second half of the movie is much better than the first half. Kris Kristofferson and Christopher Walken are fighting over Isabelle Huppert but she can't make up her mind about which one to be with.

One of the best,Lackawanna BluesGreat movie,great cast,great music,this is one of those movies that is so good that when it is over you wish it would go on for another 90 minutes,I will w3atch this one many times. This is one of those movies that grabs you from the beginning and twist and slams you emotionally throughout the feature. The cast is extraordinary without the faintest hint of anyone being uncormfortable in their role. You get the sense that you're really there taking all this in. A great deal of care was given in the sets, costumes and music of the period.

I 'm racking my brain , but I ca n't seem to think of another movie quite like The Valley of Gwangi that I can remember. The film is based on true events that were witnessed on the Korean peninsula, and it was a great movie. The acting was fantastic and the scenes were beautiful and touching. But, I have seen this film so many times now, but it still leaves me speechless with it. I 'm not even sure what it would be called in English, it is so different from all other Korean drama.

While trying to build a major mall or complex or something like that, a wealthy landowner ignores ancient Native American artifacts buried on the land, and unleashes the Bone Eater...a creature who goes around and kills people in search of his fallen friends or something like that.Indeed this movie had to be a Sci-Fi Channel original. If it wasn't, then the director should never direct anything again. The effects in the film is laughable at best, and the Bone Eater monster is nothing but a CGI-animated being added into the frames at a later date.

A team varied between Scully and Mulder , two other scientists , a pilot , and the guy who plays the main character. In the film , Mulder's girlfriend, Scully, has an affair with Agent Krycek. Mulder and Scully's friendship is never the same. As the film progressed , Mulder and Scully got to know each other at more of a personal and emotional level , which eventually made their friendship stronger. Mulder has become a man with a lot of guilt about his relationship with his ex-wife, and he gets to be a much better father to a son with his girlfriend.

To think this film was made the year I was born . To think people are still having their constitutional rights taken away by the police in this day and age . The film was made in 1968 and the police were in the 1960s ! I don’t want to see my mother and other people in the movie killed . And I don’t want to see myself in the movie killed too , because I will have no one to tell the story to. I want people to see this movie, so they will learn to stand up for what is right .

I liked this movie, the second Naruto feature film. I enjoyed the one in the snow a tad better though as I found the story here a bit disjointed as I was not sure where certain things were supposed to be happening or when. Still, like the first film this one too has a nice run time to it of a hour and a half, plenty of time for a nice well developed movie with some really cool fights. The story starts off with ninja from the village hidden in the sand in combat with unknown assailants.

For a moment , let 's put aside the cultural aspects of this movie , even if it is a film in the genre of sci-fi . Even if we don't know very much about the movie or its source, we would be very much interested to know the truth about the characters of this movie. So let me share a little about this film and its cast. The film was produced in 2005 and directed by James Gunn , the former writer-director of "Guardians" and the original director of "Battlestar Galactica" .

I found this movie immensely interesting yet a little jaded, it talks of violence and what there doing, I still don't see the point in becoming terrorists in order to stop the terrorists. We have similar people in the United States and other countries justifying the use of violence and war tactics because they think they are right. Think of the Puritans,and the Christian crusades against the Islamic people during the Medieval times. Lots of blood and death far exceeding the violence of today, the western world has had a negative impact on the religion.

`` Yesterday '' as a movie , is hard to rate . The cinematography is excellent and deserves a 9/10 . There are very good performances from all the actors in the movie , which makes it an all around great film . The movie has a lot of heart , passion and emotions in it and the plot is well thought out . But unfortunately , the movie doesn't live up to the awesome score which was composed for the film . The score is very well written , beautifully performed and has a great deal of emotion in it , which makes this score a must have score for any film .

The most obvious flaw ... horrible , horrible script . This movie had a potentially good story , but it fell flat on its face. The script was written by a very talented writer, but he failed miserably in the writing. I will not even attempt to defend his script or the script that was actually used in the movie. I was so dissappointed in the film , I just stayed in the theater for a couple of days and went on the Internet to see other reviews. I will admit I only saw about 3 reviews before I was so angry at the film .

This is a forgotten classic of a film, and Harmony Karin borrowed a ton from it for "Gummo". Gummo is good, River's Edge is way, way better. Its no secret that Keanu Reeves isn't the best actor whoever walked the earth. No, in fact, he's a horrendous actor. But, he was born for some roles: Ted Preston, Esquire from Bill and Ted, and his role in this film. He is perfect as a sort of good natured but very apathetic and confused teenager. Then there's Crispin Glover.

I can not understand why this 1971 Hollywood production is currently only available through an Australian video company , but here’s what they are selling:

So if you want to see what I think of this movie it should be on sale around here or maybe you could make it to Australia and buy the movie. I will be there. I will buy it there. Then we can get to talking about what’s going on back in the United States. It’s like I’m going to a funeral and you are going to be my friend.

This was an interesting movie. I could have done without the bathroom scene and the seduction scene - EWWWW! Other than that, I loved the head-banging music this movie revolved around. Chris/Izzy's parents are AWESOME! They totally support their sons interests and believe in him enough to support him - now that is AWESOME!! What really surprised me was the Chris's realization at the end. It was not quite the "hollywood" ending on his road to self discovery. The overall rise to stardom and the fall of it was quite a roller- coaster ride.

Has this ever happened to you ? I go into my local video store and see a few new arrivals. I'm curious about what's new on the block, so I browse through the DVD section for a couple of weeks, trying to keep an open mind as I make my own choices. I eventually decide that I don't see the appeal of the majority of the stuff that I pick up; I decide to keep some of it in mind, and in the process of doing that I end up buying more than I had originally planned to.

At least if you're a Disney fanatic (well, of the variety who loves their live-action films as well as the animated stuff), if you're a kid, if you're a kid at heart almost to the extent that you hardly realize you're an adult, if you love absolutely any film that features animals, especially when they're doing tricks, or if you're just not too demanding, Air Bud: World Pup is somewhat enjoyable to watch. I'm a Disney fanatic. I enjoyed this film enough, and I'll gladly watch it again.But boy does it have a lot of problems.

This movie was made only 48 years after the end of the Civil War--most likely in anticipation of the 50th anniversary of the end of the war. In the film there are recreations of battles and the people of the era that look rather impressive and realistic. It also provides a different and more balanced view than just its contemporary, BIRTH OF A NATION--a patently absurd and racist film. Because of this, this short film would be excellent for use in the classroom to discuss the war and tell the story of a very young man that runs away to enlist as a drummer.

The recent DVD release of Good Humor Man labels the film as comedy. It's hardly a comedy, rather a dull indie film about a group of losers. Supposedly set in the 70s, there is scant attention paid to period details, with overly muted color correction taking its place. The monotonous soundtrack only serves to accentuate the repetitiveness of the film (perhaps that is the point, but it does not add to the enjoyment of the viewing experience.) Apprarently the clique of losers only like to hang out at one location, the bleachers.

Dreadful. I hope I can save two hours of your life by warning you away from this. I just finished watching the film, BTW.I love good cross genre films. This isn't one of them. Show me a sci-fi musical, a dramatic farce, or a religious action flick, I'll watch them all. But you cannot just throw epigrammatic quips at a rambling, camp, schlock-horror fest and draw my applause.I love philosophical films. This isn't one of them. Anyone who is amazed at the depths of intellect plumbed in this film hasn't read a good book lately.

I saw this film at school and absolutely loved it . Based on a true story , this is an amazing story of a very brave little girl who, despite losing her father at such a young age , decided to keep fighting to survive . I think that this is an incredibly inspiring film, one that should be seen by anyone with an interest in mental health , mental health education , or mental health treatment. This film has the power to change the way people in this country deal with those who struggle with mental health .

Doctor Who is amazing . It is everyones 'cup of tea ' . It must be . The boys will be fans . It has been a long time coming as a TV show that I would be interested in watching in my late 20s . Not sure why it has taken this long but I am happy that I am a fan . Not so happy that I have to wait until 2014 to see it though . The new series started last night and is as much of a thrill as the first series , I must say . The first episode has a twist which I found very appealing .

Mr. "Uwe Fail" strikes again, transformed a classic game in a cheap piece of crap. Poor acting; Poor Directing; Awful adaptation; I mean, Far-Cry game was awesome, its like a true FPS game, cool weapons and lots lots lots of "point and shoot". In the movie we had nothing compared to the game.. Well we had some of the "point and shoot" thing but... i don't know how to explain, but if you ever watched another "Uwe Fail" movie you will understand.

Just saw this movie on opening night. I read some other user comments which convinced me to go see it... I must say, I was not impressed. I'm so unimpressed that I feel the need to write this comment to spare some of you people some money.First of all "The Messengers" is very predictable, and just not much of a thriller. It might be scary for someone under 13, but it really did nothing for me. The climax was laughable and most of the audience left before the movie's resolution.Furthermore the acting seemed a little superficial.

I found the Movie very interesting . I really enjoyed the film the actors were great . It was entertainment and i enjoyed it very much . I thought the actors were very good . the movie was awesome . I really liked it . The acting was good . I really enjoy the film . I had seen it in a theatre so I liked the movie . I really have to watch this movie again and again. It was good but a little too slow but the acting was great I think that this movie would be better but it still has some good parts so go see it you will like it .

The Detonator is set in Bucharest where some sort of ex CIA Government agent named Sonni Griffith ( Wesley Snipes) is trying to solve an issue involving the world's most dangerous drug. The drug is heroin. It is also known as "the beast." The Detonator takes place in 1989 where Sonni and a small team of other CIA agents is sent to assist the U.S. military and the police with an operation that would end the reign of organized crime and drug trafficking in the Eastern Bloc. There are some good performances in the film and its cast is well rounded.

Thankfully you don't need a lot of "book learnin" to understand where this thing's going... Obviously a poverty row cash-in on Universal's big hit THE WOLF MAN (which was made just one year earlier), this finds the always-watchable George Zucco in another of his patented "mad doctor" roles as brilliant, vengeance-minded scientist Lorenzo Cameron. Cameron, who has set up shop deep in the swamp lands of what I'm presuming is the Louisiana bayou, is plotting revenge against four of his former peers who both humiliated him and forced him to resign from his previous job.

I was waiting to welcome Arnold Schwarzeneger 's return to action after the dismal movies he 'd made after ``I don't know how you can sleep with your door open. You don 't understand how important you are to us. You know, we were always like, you 're not the most important person in the world, you are. But it was nice to make a movie, and we were just lucky. But I never felt as if it was the greatest film we ever did. But it was an enjoyable experience,' he says.

I love this show. It's clever and very well acted. David Morse and Andre Braugher have great chemistry. The writing is clever and subplots generally give great comic relief. After every new episode, I'm always amazed how thought provoking and at the same time entertaining this show is. My only complaint would be Donna Murphy's absence, at this point, in the second season. As David Morse ex-wife, Heather, she added such character to the show.I think this show is a credit to the crime/drama genre.

I 'm a next generation person ... i 've never saw the original doctor who but i have heard about it and it does look very good so i think it will be awesome

It's interesting to note that people who have actually seen "Doctor Who" are all of the same generation (late teens/early 20s)

Click to expand...

My daughter has seen the Doctor and she doesn't think he is awesome (which is a little bit of a problem because I think she's going to be the first Doctor) but she said he does look kinda cool and I did not argue with her.

Yet again, director J. Lee Thompson unites with actor Charles Bronson for a violent and uncompromising action flick. In fact, this is probably Bronson's most brutal film (quite a feat for a man who appeared in Death Wish, Ten To Midnight and Chato's Land). However, brutality doesn't on its own make for a good film, and The Evil That Men Do is ultimately a disappointment. If you were to take away its brutality the film would have precious little else of interest. The story is about a retired hitman (Bronson) who lives a cosy life on a Caribbean island.

Dante would of been mortified , if he knew that his masterpiece was being ACTED OUT PUPPETS ! ! ! And to top it all , all this time since his masterpiece was finished , he didn't actually get to use it ! Dante must be a very proud man , since it looks like he has finally achieved something that he has always wanted . And to top it all he must have spent quite a chunk of his fortune on his masterpiece ! ! ! Well , it looks like he finally succeeded . But not without a price !

From the film 's first shot - Keira Knightley as Elizabeth Bennet wandering reading through a field at dawn ,

It is perhaps a bit too late to tell you how much I loved the first scene in the film 's first scene of Elizabeth Bennet reading the morning paper to her aunt, but I do feel like I already know how it is going to end, in the very best possible way. The best way to tell you how the film ends would be to try and convey what is so great in this scene, so that when the film is over you will remember it as I have.

I went to see this movie to kill some time . I remember Cole Hauser in `` Tigerland '' , where he played a character called "Tigerlily" and he did this song in this movie with this line " It's hard to believe I'm in love." That's the same line. He played a man who was a womanizing man and it was a womanizing movie. So I watched it, I thought it was very very funny and it was a little bit dark at the end. It reminded me of a lot of different movies.

OK , so I know better than to watch movies on SciFi . . . er , sorry . . . it's like watching porn. My mother is a movie buff, but I'm not sure she'd be impressed with my latest viewing experiment. Here I am, watching the first five minutes of David Lynch's film Lost Highway. I had seen the other three installments of this series, but was surprised to find that these were the first in which I actually recognized the names of any of the major players.

There are so many things wrong with this movie that it is hard to pick just a few. Let's start with the silly and annoying songs. Like "Ride Little Cowboy" which just tended to accentuate the city-slickers look of Klinton Spilsbury. The silly kiddie cowboy songs going on in the background during the movie hurt any credibility or momentum that the story had going for it.I had seen the media hype before this movie was released, and I saw Klinton Spilsbury interviewed on various TV shows, and he had a very soft, sweet, lilting voice.

I still count `` Police Squad ! '' as the absolute funniest TV show of the 1980s . Somewhere , out there , there is a TV show I watched that was far superior to the Police Squad . The only other one I can think of offhand that came anywhere close was The Avengers . But if you can find one , I'd like to see it. - - -

It's easy enough to see where this story came from. If you're going to write a TV series set in the late 1980s and you want to do it right, here's the first thing I suggest.

I lasted almost ninety minutes through this dreadful movie waiting for some revelation about dance or spirit or inspiration or something. When I finally saw her I nearly fainted right there. She looked so perfect, so beautiful, so radiantly alive. It was amazing to look at her at this age, but I realized how lucky I am, I have the chance to see her every day when I'm on the subway coming home, or out walking with my dog. And if she's on a television show like this, I know I'll be watching, because she looks so alive and radiant.

... with a 500$ budget and a bottle of ketchup.If you are a fan of C movies with no talented actors whatsoever, a ridiculous story, cheap effects and lousy camera-work, this film delivers.All others be warned. You could probably make a similar movie with a couple of friends in your backyard and a home camcorder.The film is good for some laughs though. Watch it with some friends and discuss how NOT to make a movie.2/10 for unintentional comedy.Why the hell do you have to write 10 lines? I have seen comments with less lines and writing this is just a lame filler.

Why is it that in the '50s and '60s , Italians made so of the best movies , and then , with the decline in quality , everyone decided to leave Italy and make movies in other countries ? Why are Italians the only country in the world in which we have so few movies that we can be proud of ? Is there a difference between the Italian cinema of the 1950s and the Italian cinema of the 1960s ? No, there is a difference between the two Italian cinemas, even though they both had something in common that makes them different.

This movie is a gay love story disguised as a tale of graffiti and friendship. Not ONE review described this movie as a gay romance film, and that's the weight of the plot. I don't know if this was to trick people that would otherwise be uninterested to sit through it, expecting the film to be as it was marketed... The film is out of touch with graffiti culture, abuses and defames graffiti culture, and the acting is abysmal. Oh yeah, the graffiti sucks too. This movie was a clever way to hide the agenda of portraying young boys getting gay.

Everybody seems to compare this to The Matrix and The 13th Floor , and when I first saw it I thought “Oh, it’s like that” and it took a few viewings to settle on it as my favorite of the year. But, it’s so much more. I’d like to talk about why I love it so much and why, when you get to the end of this movie you’ll find that you really have enjoyed it, and the reason is in the movie.

I was looking through TV Guide last night and saw a movie starring Heather Grahm on , who I liked a lot. Heather is pretty amazing as a person, but is also hilarious as a stand up comic, and as someone who has been in show business for some time. So I figured, why not give it a go at home and have a little laugh while watching it? I got Heather and her husband over for dinner and it was great to have an evening with her in our little house. If you like this kind of thing, then give it a shot.

The movie was a pleasure to watch if you are a fan of the Stooges . The story is told mostly from the standpoint of Moptop, the band's drummer, with the other three main characters getting most of their scenes, save for a few lines. I thought it was well-written enough to warrant a rental . I will also be watching the first two parts of this series . If you are looking for the best rock & roll movie, this one is it . Go watch it . If you haven't seen it , I strongly recommend that you watch it as soon as you have a moment to spare .

The film was half over before I managed to figure out what was going on . It 's a dog, but it 's not real dog . It's an alien in a dog suit . I still don't really understand it, but that's because of the story line . But it was a damn good movie . The acting was really good . The film was very well done . There were a couple of good lines in the movie . It was well acted , well written and directed . The dog was great . The story was interesting .

Better than average World War II-era "who-dun-it" featuring Warner Baxter as a former gangster who suffered amnesia and has been reborn as a psychiatrist now known as Robert Ordway who helps both the police and criminals who want to go straight. Crime Doctor's Courage is the fourth in the series of ten and also involves a victim who might have some mental problems. The link to "courage" is not particularly clear.This entry revolves around the death of fortune hunter Gordon Carson whose two previous wives have under mysterious circumstances and who in turn dies in a locked room under conditions that resemble suicide but Dr. Ordway labels murder.

I have just caught this Movie on TCM, and can understand why George Murphy went into Politics if this was the best MGM could serve up to him. It is so slow-moving that the attempt to make it a real film-noir effort does not come off. It featured two of my favouriteplayers in Eve Arden (completely wasted) and Dean Stockwell(the best actor in the Film), but what really hit me was that the leading lady Frances Gifford went through some 90 minutes (it seemed longer!) without changing the expression on her face--her fainting scene was comical.

This film is undoubtedly one of the greatest landmarks in history of cinema . By seeing this film , we are able to get an understanding on why movies are considered to have so much power , power , power , power, power , power , power and more powerful .This movie has brought to the world an unforgettable moment . The movie is full with an intense emotional power , which has a great impact and impact on human psyche and spirit . But , why this film has so much impact on human psychology is because of its powerful emotions .

This story starts at the end ! So the film 's opening credits advise us . Unfortunately that 's not enough to save this from being a total disaster. I think we are going to have to go with the alternative view. From what I have gathered, this story takes place in a world where an alien species has taken over the human race. They have taken over the minds of people who are still alive and turned them into servants of the alien masters. There is also a group of human resistance fighters against this alien race.

All right, let me start by saying I love the original RS for the 64. The graphics were new, the ships were really fast and cool. The missions were a challenge, but you had a strategy to come up with. The computer didn't tell you every step of your mission, you could wander and explore. That's the first thing that's wrong with RL, everything you do is under a timetable and controlled by other people. I mean, shouldn't you, as the leader, be telling people how to handle each and every mission?

So one day I was in the video store looking for a movie . I came across this and rented it.
