I did not know who directed it until after I started watching it and I realized it was one of my favorite directors. It is not very well known so here is the trailer for the movie and you will understand what I mean in a moment. Now you are probably thinking what in the hell is that movie and where did I get the idea for it. So let us go into the mind of this director.

I never read the book . Now I do n't really want to . I had no clue what this book was about and had no interest in it. I don't regret it . It is by far one of my favourites . I read it in about a week and a half . The characters are really well written . The storyline is really compelling . I loved it . It is about a couple of people who go on an adventure . There is a twist at the end and I liked it . It is quite long , but there is so much to read in it and it was very enjoyable .

I am a huge fan of Harald Zwart , and I just knew that I had to see this movie. In fact I have to go back to the cinema more often now as a result. I have to admit that I love the movies, and this is a great choice. In fact you would think that this is a serious movie, as it has an emotional weight to it. Well, if you have not watched the movie , you really should. It would make for a great night out with friends, as you can talk about it afterwards.

I remember watching this movie over and over again when I was a kid. I loved it. Whilst I haven't watched it recently, I am sure I would enjoy it just the same today. Its a very light funny movie guaranteed to make anyone laugh. The situations with each one of the characters were so funny and imaginative! I particularly liked the one with the girl traveling with her mother's ashes (who ends up picking them up on the highway after the explosion) , the robbers and the nuns. This nice humour style is much missed these days.

I'm sorry but I can't agree that this was a good movie. Yes, it looked good visually, but it's the story that drives the movie and I must say the story sucked big-time. How in the world did they manage to slip some of those plot-holes past the critics. Better story and I would've gave it a higher vote but I was impossible to do that and still be able to live with myself. I have always been a fan of scary movies, and the previews really had me fooled. All the scary scenes were shown in the previews.

Well , to each his own , but I thought Gibson 's Hamlet was the most god-awful rendition I had ever seen , so I won 't be seeing it for quite some time . __________________
I 'm so sorry for you having to experience this , but I had no idea that there were people like you in this world . You know, they just got to the point where they couldn't do it without destroying themselves , or they couldn 't do it right without destroying it , or they couldn 't make it any worse , or they could not go on .

This film essentially contains all the elements of a great 70 's exploitation film , except it was done in 3-D. But it is a great film with a great score and a great story. The story follows a group of teens who break into a mental hospital. Their intentions to kill the hospital doctor are soon exposed as they try to escape. It is one of my favorites. It may not be perfect, but it is a great film and it is fun to watch. Just don't expect too much. The first part of this film is really good.

I just saw this movie for the second time. I first saw it back in the mid-90's as a Vanguard Video selection. It has retained it power.It is interesting from several aspects. One is that it is based on a true story. Two is it is a launching pad for two interesting actors: Keanu Reeves and Crispin Glover. And three, it has Dennis Hopper in one of his better social misfit/psychotic character roles.The movie is also a study in the way people act in different settings. You have characters in one-on-one, family, peer group, school, general society settings, etc.

I just watched this move for the 5th or 6th time and am still in love with it. It still makes me cry and sing and worry and celebrate.I almost wrote Bonnie Hunt a letter to tell her how much I love it. David Duchovny's grief scene is so flippin real!!! Minnie Driver is so natural and honest. My favorite line is when Duchovny says "I miss Elizabeth but I ache for Grace". Oh man! I'm crying just thinking about it. ALSO... Bonnie Hunt and Jim Belushi are sooooooooooooo the perfect Chicago area couple!!

Writer & director Jay Andrews, a.k.a. Jim Wynorski, serves up more of his characteristic shlock with a decent cast menaced by grade-Z computer generated reptiles in "Komodo Vs. Cobra," as generic a rip-off of "Mysterious Island" meets "Jurassic Park" as you can imagine. The chief problem with this predictable yarn about monsters dining on mankind is the incredibly phony special effects. The cobra and the Komodo are hilariously awful. However, the graphics people do an okay job of integrating the monsters with their victims, not that any of this is in the least believable.

I don't even know where to start. I did not like it. It did not behave like a story and so much was injected into the movie (the pot brownies, the son was gay (?) the murder was justified, what possible reason could there be in the script for Linda aka Penelope to exist) that was never explained. It was all fluid spilled on a table and left dripping off the counter until it all made a big mess on the floor.Why did Vanessa Redgrave make a five second cameo? Why did Diane Wiest use her Bullets over Broadway character without the camp-fun?

This feels very stilted and patronizing to a great extent . The whole plot is extremely forced - especially the last part. It's very hard to get into - I've had to stop reading at several points, because I just couldn't get involved. It is a story that's been told a thousand times, and to me it is one I'm not likely to read again anytime soon. But I did enjoy it, because as a kid I used to listen to it on the radio all the time. There were parts that were enjoyable to read, and parts I found hard to swallow.

In Fassbinder's earlier films, his ideas sometimes surpased his ability to execute them. He was always a great writer, but it took him some time to get his style of camera work and storytelling down pat.The Merchant of Four Seasons is one of Fassbinder's first movie to make great use of color, from the bright green pears in the merchant's cart to the bright red roses at the funeral (a funeral in a Fassbinder movie? who'd have thought).His camera work was getting there too, but it was still fairly minimalist.

I am an avid movie watcher and I enjoy a wide variety of films. However, I found NO enjoyment in this movie. It is probably the worst movie I have ever seen. I do not feel that it had much of a storyline, the characters were not likable and the relationship between the characters was dysfunctional at best, and the ending only made me dislike the movie more. It is definitely not in the same category as "The Cave" which was, in my opinion, the best cave movie ever made.

A traveling couple (Horton and Hamilton)stumble onto the town of Gatlin, where kids have slaughtered the adults and are always eager to slaughter more, along the way they're separated and Peter Horton of course must save his wife from these tiresome, er terrible tykes in this very bad adaption of one of King's best short stories. In the original story King managed to create tension and draw personality of his characters, however all of that has been zapped from the production and all that is left is a repetitive bore which is far too predictable to be all that suspenseful.

I saw this movie yesterday, and like most allrdy wrote "i also expected a Steven movie", god i love this guy just because his fighting style is unique and very humerous. In had a little doubts cause i read that "Ja Rule" was playing in it, but i thought hopefully they give him a smal role, so i don't get irritations by watching him. And offcourse the opposite happend, goooooooooooooooooooood steven what the heck were you thinking going to join a sry *** crew like this. Steven was broke and needed cash?

Had the fun pleasure of viewing a new independent film called "Half Empty." I usually go out to the local cinema with my husband and feel as if we are held captive to the latest Sequel, or Prequel that Hollywood throws at us. This was DIFFERENT and surprisingly  SO MUCH more entertaining than anything Hollywood spends millions advertising. When my husband and I go the movies, we go to be entertained  and "Half Empty" did just that and the film did so in a smart manner that made me feel as if my trip to the movie theater was worth it.

I had heard that this film was stylish and intriguing , but I just found it annoying . It 's not the fault of it's director , but because it has not seen the light of the day till now , I think I will not see it in the cinema . It will not be a big loss to the history of cinema as I have no interest whatsoever in watching anything that will not be fresh to me . I loved this movie , I found it interesting the first time but now that I know all the characters , its just boring .

After having problems in Chicago , the Solomon family moves to a remote North Dakota farmhouse to start anew , away from problems. They start their lives as strangers, and they discover a bond between them that is stronger than family. The first book in The Solomon Family Saga begins with a farmhouse fire, and the family heads west, not knowing the destination they are headed for. Will they find a place of peace and solitude, or will they run from their troubles and lose themselves in a world that doesn't understand them.

This movie was so bad it looked like a home movie . In one scene , the camera very slowly zoom in on the girl's face , then slowly zoom out. And the girl says " I just can't believe that you're really in love with another girl " and goes out of frame. I couldn't watch this. In the beginning , I did think it was funny , but then I started to really hate it. This movie was about a bunch of girls and a boy . There were about 10 girls , and they were all in love with each other .

Excellent story, wonderful acting, amazing production values and a cool, action-packed short with a perfect twist at the end. What a great short film! I saw this film in Vail or Aspen at a film festival and was wowed by it. Then I saw it again at another festival (where it won again) and I was even more impressed because subtle touches become evident the second time around - for a short film, this packs a lot of clever layers into a short time.AWOL is not for the faint of heart, but it is very well done and completely impressive for a short film - for any film actually.

Can you people please stop believing everything this man says . Getyour facts straight before you start praising this liar. Can you people please stop believing everything this man says . Go your facts straight before you start praising this liar. He has no idea what this country was like pre-WWII

He doesn't give a crap what the world was like in his day. He is trying to change the world and you all just want to sit at home and criticize the world and ignore his actions. I bet if he was in your day, he would be your president.

Piper , Prue and Phoebe bring Dr. Griffiths to the Manor in order to try and save him from The Vampires. Dr. Griffiths is unaware of Piper’s connection to him and she thinks they need to wait. Piper and Prue decide to leave the Manor and head off to the town to get help. They decide to walk into town and find a town square where they see a woman walking along the path. They ask her for advice about what they can do. The woman gives them directions and says to wait for the next full moon.

It seems on the surface to be a romantic _planes, trains and automobiles_ but at times tried for something more, where it failed miserably. Some may like the nontraditional ending, but the attempts at "deep insight" into the world of marriage flopped around not really going anywhere.But if you were interested by the story, the movie tried other methods to distract you. The unnecessary special effects, of which the falling rain was the most obvious, served to do nothing but annoy. The camera-work is erratic at best.One note of caution, however.

Pete's Meteor. I seen this referred to as "authentic" and a "gem." I caught this movie on a Saturday afternoon. I kinda wished that I didn't.Apparently this was noted as being Mike Myers' first dramatic role. Unfortunately it had to be this movie. The first thing you'll notice that Pete's Meteor suffers from is a complete lack of plot. Or rather, a bunch of little subplots that aren't really connected and don't go anywhere. Young orphan Mickey lives with his younger brother and sister with their grandmother.

Without saying how it ended, it is sufficient to say that the whole thing degenerates from about five minutes before the end. If the standard had been maintained throughout, the movie would be worth a seven.One wonders in a way why a woman was added to the cast. (Well - not really!) The premise is a good one The situation the victims find themselves in is pretty terrifying and it's rather well done, but you get the impression the makers of the film lost interest towards the end, or as a previous contributor said, they changed writers and handed over to someone else.

I saw this last night at the Tribeca Film Fest and holy god was it bad.. From the script to the editing to the acting to the cinematography-- none of it worked. Not to mention the set design/costumes were so distractingly wrong for the time period (it spans the years from the late 70s up until 2006 or so). Even John Hurt, who's usually an amazing actor, was so over-the- top ridiculous. Granted, Quinten Crisp is an over-the-top guy to begin with, but Hurt was given nothing to work with here.

In a world full of films -- like "You Got Served" -- that blow your mind with its vast amounts of errors, you'd never figure that there would be worse films... until now. Ron Hall's "Vampire Assassins" does more than cheese you off. It KNOWS that you are mad at it. First: there are no assassins in this movie. In fact, there's only one good guy fighting in the whole movie. Second: The location... is basically one location: some jackass's house (or basement. It's up to you.).

I can't believe the amount of reviewers who praise this as realistic. I'm a million miles from being an expert, and I'm never going to climb a mountain; but even the very basic knowledge attained from reading Into Thin Air, and watching Everest Beyond The Limit and a few other Everest docs meant that this film just got more and more ridiculous as it went on. There is some good climbing footage at the start; and when the billionaire mission leader asks early in the film "How much experience above 8000 metres do you have?

This film easily rivals the emotional strength , the dramatic impact and the top-notch performances of `` 12 Angry Men .`` And, like the movie, ``American Gangster'' is an example of cinema at its best. For the first time in years, the screen has been given to an honest depiction of the life of a gangster and how a crime can transform a man in his family and the people surrounding him. I am an American and have lived in New York, California and Texas and have visited the UK. I have friends and family scattered among the many cities across America.

If the caper genre owes a lot to Walter Huston , it also has a debt of gratitude to Jules César Blowitz, author of the most popular caper novel of all time, the novel that made its author famous. In the opening pages of Blowitz, an innocent American named John Smith is caught in a caper with the French army. The story unfolds as follows. John Smith is the son of an American missionary. He had been educated in Europe, so he has an intimate understanding of Europe’s culture. He has been invited by his uncle to go with him to visit his uncle in Paris.

the plot of this movie revolves around this submarine builder who's a real bastard and he wants to launch his new sub that can travel thousands of feet deep. unfortunately, he can't. oh yeah, and he's haunted by the memories of his mom and dad getting eaten by a megalodon when he was a child. the guy meets some scientist whos pretty hot, and they and this crew of about a hundred people set out on the main character's submarine to kill the same megalodon that killed his parents.now, the shark in this movie is a really fake looking CGI shark.

I watched this film last night , i though i would rent a horror/scary film from blockbusters and i got to a point where i thought , this is scary , so scary that if it was on freeview i wouldn’t even bother watching it. i mean , i had seen the poster before the cinema and i was a little concerned that it might be something i wouldn’t want to sit and watch. however , i sat in the dark , on the cold floor of the cinema with 2 other people , we were watching this movie and after about 10 minutes i fell asleep in the dark watching it.

"Problem Child" was an okay movie, but did it really merit a sequel? I don't think it did. The original movie's only redeeming asset was Gilbert Gottfried, and he wasn't even good in this sequel.I can't really put my finger on why this movie was bad. For starters, it just wasn't funny. Even when I saw this as a nine-year-old, I didn't sympathize with Junior (Michael Oliver) at all. His character came off to me as whiny, self-loathing, and perhaps most importantly, a rebel without a clue.

After being off the air for a while , Columbo returned with some new made-for-TV mysteries that , while not quite on the same level as the original, still made for a great TV show. This is the third movie in the franchise that has been brought back. The first was The Fugitive , and the second is Columbo: The Incident . The movie is also based on a true-life incident. Columbo was the head of a special unit created to catch bank robbers that were targeting banks across the country. One of those robbers was the legendary John Dillinger .

I bought this film as I thought the cast was decent and I like Jennifer Rubin & Patsy Kensit.First off let me say the acting is not of a high standard. Stephen Baldwin makes his character look almost retarded at times and at other times morose. Patsy Kensit is so-so but not too convincing in some scenes, and the supposed poetry she spouts in a particular scene in her Hotel Room is utterly meaningless rubbish. Ms Kensit is certainly very suggestive and sexy here but ultimately I think Jennifer Rubin is by far the best in this film.

Does anyone else think that "Reba" is basically a ripoff of "Roseanne"? Just look at the characters from the two families, Connors (Roseanne) and Harts (Reba) ; the blonde bombshell elder daughter (Becky Connor and Cheyenne Hart) who's married to a moron (Mark Healy and Van Montgomery), the sarcastic brunette younger daughter (Darlene Connor and Kyra Hart), the little brother (DJ Connor and Jake Hart), and the quirky relative (Jackie Connor and Barbara-Jean Booker Hart). And then, of course, there is the biggest similarity, Reba Hart and Roseanne Connor.

`` Eaten Alive '' goes down much easier than Ruggero Deodato 's `` Cannibal Holocaust , '' but it 's a good film and worth seeing if you can get your hands on it . . . even though I wouldn ' t really recommend it , I 'm going to keep it in my library 'cause it has many good moments in it . . ." ''Eaten Alive' is an interesting film to me in a number of ways. It was made as a series of three films made by Sam Peckinpah , whose career is best known for films like "The Wild Bunch" and "High Noon."

I ca n't really criticize this film . It is literally the first film I ever remember seeing and lead me to watching the entire series. This movie was also a huge inspiration for me to get my life together and move on. The music and the story is awesome, I would recommend watching the series without knowing any Japanese movies. i'm not really a big fan of japanese horror movies but this movie was a very scary movie for me. It's just that I feel like this movie is a classic and it's the reason why horror movies are such a big deal in Japan.

As someone who has read all of Baroness Orczy's books and seen most of the movies based on them, I must say that the 1980's version, with Anthony Andrews and Jane Seymour, was better than this. It was better written and stuck more to the spirit of the story than this one, which seemed to go out of its way to involve people getting shot. This new adaptation is less light-hearted, yet does not have as much depth, either. Although there is some good acting, the actors did not have much to work with. Nice costumes, though.

So one day I was in the video store looking for a movie. I came across this and rented it because it was a film I hadn't seen or even heard of.Now I like slasher movies in general, but this is just abysmal, not even good for laughs. Besides being ultra ultra cheap and containing all slasher film cliches and terrible acting it has the most incompetent and inept direction I have ever come across. Now sometimes the aforementioned traits can be present in a film and some enjoyment can still be had, but not here. Painful example of home-made horror.

This is one odd film . It seems to be aimed at a younger audience , but is filled with scenes of sexual content . I can not say that I disagree with these scenes , because it would be an admission that the movie is not suitable for anyone under 21 . The sex scenes are very graphic , and the film is filled with violent imagery , but the most disturbing thing is the depiction of suicide . I don’t know why it is important to have suicide as a plot point , but there is not a single person who would disagree with it .

The Hollow is a wonderful murder mystery that provides all you can expect from Agatha Christie and of course Poirot. It' s set on a country house on a weekend. As always all the guests are suspects and it's up to Poirot to figure out the truth. With movies like this it's always best not to give too much away so I'll stop here. What I loved in the `Hollow' was that it's a mystery the old fashioned way. When Poirot arrives everybody is around the body for example. Everybody seems to be the culprit.

This is one of those movies that you just do n't want to end . The characters are rich like in the books. They are not like "those" movies, but more like the books in which they are found. If the movie had been directed by the director who created the books that I read and loved , it would have been a classic. But sadly, it's not the case. I enjoyed it, although I thought it was really cheesy, especially towards the end. I did think some of it could have been better written.

You do n't have to spend much time watching this made for TV movie or series pilot or whatever it is. And there's an explanation for why the plot is so short, so don't bother trying to find the answers if you don't want to. I just found it a little disappointing and didn't feel the urgency or tension of most of the first season, but I'll probably be watching it again just to see how it resolves. You can probably tell that I'm not very fond of this movie.

...not to waste your time watching this vanity project. I've had my comment deleted twice now, for reasons that I have yet to understand, other than the suspicion that someone involved with "Gone" isn't happy with what I had to say. So, I've pared things down to the nitty-gritty this time with an excerpt of my original comments that can in no way be taken as a personal attack on anyone, nor unfair commentary: ""Gone" is the sort of train wreck that gives new meaning to the words.

2001 : A Space Odyssey Is it a sermon ? An account of the history of mankind ? An exploration into the nature of man ? Or a description of a man’s soul ? I have come up with the description of our soul from a film called “A Space Odyssey”. And I have been told by some people that it was a very good description from the film. But I say, that is not fair to film and it is not fair to God. We all know the story of man and his soul.

Stanwyck and Morgan are perfectly cast in what is, in many ways, a modern equivalent of Dickens' Christmas Carol in its sensibility. The success of the film depends on the casting of Sydney Greenstreet as the Alexander Yardley character. Yardley is the modern equivalent of Dickens' Scrooge in the way he exercizes control over his employees -- until the Christmas spirit overtakes him. The role is a 'walk in the park' for Greenstreet who had been one of the stage's great Falstaffs when he was part of the Lunts' company.

Barbara Payton is the suppose-to-be sultry sexy young hot Chickie wife of the geezer plantation owner somewhere in a jungley back lot set at a cheap studio in Hollywood. Raymond Burr wears his working shirt with the top button undone as the hunky chunky plantation foreman who Mrs Payton is desiring to blow the joint with. There is another girl, some sort of peasant slave thing that Burr used to fool around with but he's given her the old heave ho so the obligatory squatty old voo-doo hag is conjuring up a good spell to cast on him and the Payton tramp.

Almost a masterclass in how not to direct a movie . From the misjudged , often incomprehensible script onwards Dr Strangelove is one of the films that really should have been a masterpiece , and instead it's been a disappointment . If only Kubrick had let it come out at the time when the Vietnam War had ended , with the anti-Vietnam protests, instead of just before , when the film was already over budget . Kubrick, however , must have known this was not the film to end up being . And for that it deserves our respect . There is no reason for Strangelove to be seen in a cinema today .

This is what Disney Channel shows to kids who are dumber than posts . It suits them well . It is very entertaining . And you have to keep up to date with all the show's new episodes . This way , you'll always be on top of your game . When you know the best shows for your kids to watch , you just have to get in the habit . If you don't do it , then just wait for your kids , and you'll be back to square one . When I first came across this show , I had absolutely no interest in it at all .

this film explores if not creates a whole new genre with perfect imperfection --- hilarity, truth, fun, talent and circumstance that make for MAGIC. from creative musical numbers to off the cuff comedy that incorporates actors at their very best, if i hadn't have known better, i would have thought there was an elaborate script here.what you get: a mighty wind meets conversations with god meets something so fresh and new and delightful that it becomes it's own entity.peters and fell both give stellar performances and reel you in immediately. the rest of the cast is also phenomenal.

For a movie that gained so much recognition and appraise this spinoff to `` Rosemarys Baby '' is one big mess. This is a movie about a mother who tries to commit a murder and her daughter is the victim. That is all there is to the story. There are some good performances from the actors, but then you have a story line that lacks focus and interest. And that is what really bothers me. This is the story of a mother who doesn't feel the same way about her daughter, which makes the whole movie even worse.

Started watching this but didn't believe in any of the characters. In particular the relationship between the bakery assistant and the waitress just didn't work for me at all. The scenes between the bakery owner and the assistant were nice but the rest was just very slow. It was a very superficial movie and it gave me the feeling that I was watching play rather than a film. The characters were very 'stagey' and the storyline was a lot like a stage farce. By the time the pyromaniac waylaid the assistant I was bored and didn't care what happened next and so I switched off.

Blackwater Valley Exorcism is set on a small town ranch where teenager Isabelle (Kristin Erickson) is found wandering around covered in dog's blood. Her parents Ely (Randy Colton) & Blanche (Leslie Fleming-Mitchell) own the ranch & are deeply worried about their daughter, recently she has not been herself & is considered a danger to herself & other's. Ranch hand & ex-priest Miguel (Del Zamora) recognises Isabelle's symptoms as a possible case of possession & when she starts to speak ancient Latin in a strange voice he becomes convinced of it.

no really , im not kidding around here folks , and i so cant believe how many people here have the same idea as i did , i dont even know if i should go and say it to him , it would seem to be a little presumptuous on my part , but that is what i will do , i am just saying what i think

And you're a liar. How can you be upset that she said something you did? She did it first and then you came back with that 'I have a boyfriend' thing. How did you not know that was coming?

This is a magnificent, and in many ways impressive film. I saw it on TV as a little boy, with my throat almost strangled with tears, and again today on the magnificently restored Criterion DVD.Cranes is the very essence of the War Weepie. Imagine Umbrellas of Cherbourg with no music and no color, or Waterloo Bridge with no class consciousness.Tatiana Samoilova, a cross between Vivien Leigh and Bjork, is deeply affecting as a pretty girl whose fiancé enlists and doesn't write or come back.The fiancé, Boris, dies on the front, and his death scene is indescribably romantic.

I 'm not surprised that so many people fell for this one . When I was watching this movie , I had to think about this for long time , I really liked this film . But ,it's not like that it's a good movie . It has a very good cast but I think they should make it in real world . It looks like a movie about love and friendship . When I watch it , it felt like it's so beautiful , and I really loved it . All of the actors were great !

This comment is meant mainly as a warning to the people who might be attracted to the title by its potential to make them feel ‘less racist than they were a few months ago’! If you are thinking “but it is a good title” (and a lot of people have used it as an excuse to dismiss its potential to be racist), you would be in good company! This is the first in a series of posts intended to show that there is actually nothing inherently racist about using the term ‘white genocide’ in an article of this type.

You know you're watching softcore with the wrong attitude when the poor dubbing bothers you. I'm okay with the crappy lip syncing but the sound mix is really of too. Every time someone says anything it sounds like there's a narrator. Either way, this is pretty much the purgatory between boring French professionalism and the heavenly campy Joe D'Amato flicks involving cannibalism and whatnot. Don't get me wrong, there's a fair dose of exploitation in this one, but there's always room for more. Laura Gemser stars, and that's good because she's hot.

If you love Chan-wook Park, you know what to expect. His films are brutal, poetic, tragic, and artistic, with splashes of very grim humor. THIRST is clearly Park's style, and I loved every second of it, from the cinematography (every shot is gorgeous and creative) to the story, which blends Shakespearean tragedy, murderous love, Gothic horror, and layered character drama. The characters are complex and there is plenty of moral ambiguity to go around. Even the most sociopathic character evokes sympathy.

`` The Moon Is Blue '' director Otto Preminger tackled even more taboo subject matter in his controversial 1955 release '' The Night Of The Hunter,'' starring Robert Mitchum as a man who kills his daughter and is convicted for a third-degree murder. '' I knew I was working with a monster,'' Preminger said. '' And Robert is one. I felt that I had to do my best to get at him through the story. I wanted to get at what made him so horrible. I wanted him to terrify the audience, to terrify myself. There are things I wouldn't put in there.

"River's Edge" was one of the most disturbing films of 1986, and for a year that also saw "Blue Velvet", you know thats saying something. Viewed today its lost little of its power and remains much better than the overrated "Kids". The previews for "Kids" played it up to be an expose of the deterioration of the nation's youth. In reality, it was little more than an exploitation film based mostly around shock value. "River's Edge" was promoted as a teen exploitation flick but was in actuality much better.

As I watched this movie, I felt as if a plastic bag was slowly closing in around my head. The acting was horribly stifling, and it was Bad Acting. The most brilliant piece of acting in the entire film was the guy who had to play laid-out-in-state-in-a-coffin. I felt nothing but relief when it was finally over. I was expecting that this film was going to be some real tragedy, with some deep psychological intrigue in the aftermath. All around it was stupid, no beginning, no climax, no ending, just rambling on and on, and the plastic bag kept getting worse.

Your idol will deceive you in this movie. Stephen Nichols is mis-cast as a young german student still bending under his father's orders although the actor obviously looks near 40 years-old. This makes his relationship (a collection of copulation scenes, basically) to a very young looking girl all the more disturbing. The character's have no dimension and the war depiction serves only as a backdrop for this soft porn wannabe. Nichols, who is one of daytime TV's best performers shows no passion in what is to be the main interest of this movie: watching him have sex over and over with this girl.

first off, i'm amazed to see that this film has got a rating of 7 on this site. at first i thought it might be industry people logging in to IMDb and jacking up the rating. but after looking on rotten tomatoes and seeing that this film has something like a 76% approval rating, it seems that maybe folks have just been duped again into mistaking pretentious crap for profundity. i mean, this film is simply awful. the acting is simply terrible, but the rest of the film is worse. at least the acting provides some (unintentional) laughs.

Y'know , it 's very interesting watching this ... half the people involved with it are now dead ... Anyways ... this is what I 've been doing since I was about 14 or 15 years old ... I 'm about to tell you my secrets ... I had an old friend that I knew a long time ago . She was kind of in love with me ... she was a little girl , about 5 years younger than me . It was one of these things where you are kind of like " Oh , this is interesting ...

Big spoiler right here : this film is B ! A ! D ! But enjoy , it 's good. I ' m not kidding. Let's go over the basics of this film , the movie is about a couple and their relationship. We ' ll probably get to the relationship a bit later and I ' ll tell some of the plot in there. I don ' t like this film. It is bad. I have nothing else to do. Now , for me , it is not a great film.

This film is absolute trash and proceeds to become even worse towards the , very protracted , end ! The first half of it is a very good watch, and is well acted and directed. The problem with this film is the ending, and I'll explain what I mean . The story is simple, and in some ways a fairly predictable, and in others a very twisty and unpredictable one. The acting is great, the story is pretty good, and you can tell it was made with care and love.

Johnny Crawford is great in this movie of a troubled teen coming of age in a generation that was in the middle of a cultural and spiritual upheaval. Billy Graham does a good job of portraying life in this sweet, sometimes corny, but all the way sincere flick. He gives us a look at not only the social scene but gives good, solid advice that holds true today about morals, decisions, the generation gap, teen dating, (some of the statistics that are given in this movie are astounding. They sound like today's stats).

... a true geek-girl 's dream : high tech , high drama , smart guys , steamy sex , and a strong will to prevail . I'd love to see this series develop into something much bigger than what it is. I think it would make a fantastic film. So far the series is pretty good, but this episode is going to get me super excited for it to continue. I love when they have a cliffhanger to leave me hanging on the edge of my seat. Not to mention, how awesome would it look on film if they did that to the pilot?

To date this is still the worst piece of rubbish I've ever viewed. So annoyed I even complained to Blockbuster for stocking it. Me and some friends rented it after looking at the back cover thinking we were in for a good horror film. The plot line seem to change during the film and there was lots of irrelevant padding. The film ended quite abruptly, I'm guessing they ran out of film. Sound quality was dire and the first female character had a very thick Spanish accent although she talked utter nonsense anyway. The guy provided a brief bit of eye candy until his bizarre attempts at murder.

This is a really silly job of miscasting--about as bad as Hepburn playing a Chinese woman in DRAGON SEED. The lead part Hepburn plays is a combination of Granny from the Beverly Hillbillies and a faith healer! This film is even worse than Bogart's Swing Your Lady, because at least Bogart didn't play a hillbilly--he was just surrounded by them. And the dialog sounds as if it comes right from a Li'l Abner strip! The problems don't really end with the outrageous casting, though, as the plot is completely muddled and the "love story" might make your head hurt.

Everyone's already commented on the obvious fact that the first few comments were obviously from people who either had a stake in the film or had friends/family who had a stake in the film, and that's okay - if I'd made a movie, all of my family and friends would be in there complimenting it, too. In all honesty, there are some good things along with the bad things in this movie. Unfortunately, the bad things far outweigh the good. Good: The overall plot was mildly interesting. The music was overall pretty good.

This movie was everything but boring. It deals with reality. To the people who think this movie was boring, open your eyes to the real problems in our society. Our children are dying. The consequences of alcohol and drug abuse are not to be ignored. I work in a correctional facility as a chemical dependency counselor,and i deal with these problems every day. People of all ages and all walks of life are effected by the consequences of their alcohol and drug abuse. It destroys families, hurts people and leads to serious brain damage,all kinds of health problems, and death.

I feel extremely sad for some of the people who have been reviewing this film. It is apparent that their standards are so high that they will never be able to enjoy a film just for enjoyment sake. Or, perhaps, their enjoyment is derived from the act of picking films apart; looking for any reason at all to dislike them?The Long Kiss Goodnight is an action film, in every sense of the word. Sure, there are holes in the plot big enough to drive a semi through, but none of them are enough to stop the flow of the film itself.

Okay they tell you it 's real . They do n't list any screenwriters or directors , but one viewing will make it seem true . I did n't know that one viewing would make it true . I think the real problem is you can 't beleive it because it's a lie , then you have no choice , and then you have to do what they tell you to do , to believe it , because if you believe it you 'll have to beleive it , and there is no way you can do that .

This film powerfully demonstrates the struggle of two women in love in a culture so deeply entrenched in ritual and social conservatism, where the love of a mother for a daughter is often regarded as a kind of sin. Yet this is a culture that has now embraced same sex marriages. Sara is in a committed relationship with a man. His sister has a young son from a previous marriage – the first step to a family reunion. Her brother and his partner are delighted when they are able to meet his daughter for the first time.

Since I am a fan of Natalie Portman, I had to see the movie. I enjoyed every minute of it. It plays out in a very sincere way. Throughout the whole movie at seemed as if Natalie was the mother and Susan was the mother. Susan's character kept making bad decisions and kept getting burned because of it.I heard that there was supposed to be a love scene involving Natalie and some-guy (he's in Outside Providence) but Natalie would only accept the script if that scene was removed. And I think that is great.

Aside from the fact that the women in the film are stunningly beautiful and all the camp prisoners are too fat, this film rings true on the chaos of the post-war.Beautiful photography, and a powerful national expression of the Polish national character.It's very slow at points, but its entire pacing is so different from American and Western European films that it's quite refreshing.Both lead actors do a very good job. On the DVD version, you can see interviews with the principal actors and crew, and the lead actress Stanislawa Celinska has gained about 50 lbs and lost all of her beauty.

I too saw this film at a film festival, but unlike the previous poster I found it both interesting and original. In a sea of terrible features, shorts are often twice as bad do to small budgets and poor acting, A.W.O.L however is a taut little thriller that hearkens back to "The Outer Limits." The performances are solid, not that one would expect otherwise from Morse or McGinley, and the directing is sharp and on the money. I personally find it difficult to reconcile the previous poster's comments with the film I saw.

Lil Pimp is the story of a little boy who becomes a pimp. The animation and voice acting were perfect for this type of film.I laughed out loud for the first 20 minutes or so of this movie; mostly at the concept. After that, the joke wore thin. As a 15-20 minute animated short, Lil Pimp would have been a classic. Instead, this movie consists entirely of one joke that lasts far too long.Weathers, voiced by Ludicrous, does have several crude and funny one-liners. Unfortunately, that is all the boy's pet rat is good for as he contributes nothing else to the story.

If you 're like me and you occasionally enjoy watching terrible movies ( I guess it 's kind of like a hobby for some people, like watching horror movies), then there's a very good chance that you've never heard of this one, and you're going to like it just a whole lot more when you discover that it is a movie by director and writer David Fincher. Yes, you read that correctly. There are many great movies out there but, in order to make a decent living as a filmmaker, you need to create some of the absolute worst movies that there ever were.

This is , for different reasons , a very very bad action movie . First of all , Seagal is one of the bad guys in the film. The bad guys , that is . Second , he plays himself as the bad guy, even though he is only supposed to be one of the gang . Third , the film is directed by Tom De Ville and stars George Clooney as his father . What does all this lead to . . . nothing . All it leads to is a very long and boring hour and a half with no plot or character development at all .

Well, SWORD IN THE MOON finally got a DVD release in Korea, and despite the mostly negative responses I've heard to it, and the suspiciously tardy DVD release, I couldn't help but pick it up - any wu xia film is better than most non-wu xia films in my eyes :D Perhaps low expectations were an advantage, because I was quite pleasantly surprised to find the film pretty enjoyable.An assassin is killing a number of ministers who were involved in a revolution that usurped the throne, and the government's top swordsman is tasked with identifying the culprit.

Actor turned director Liev Schreiber ( The Sum of All Fears ) does an above average screen version of the classic story. But this new adaptation by James Gray ( The Shawshank Redemption ) is a bit uneven, with two very different performances and several plot twists that are hard to understand. The story opens with a family reunion at a farm. It quickly goes downhill when a young boy runs away from the family. He runs with the aid of his father, but ends up in a barn where he’s tied to a beam.

Some describe CALIGULIA as "the" most controversial film of its era. While this is debatable, it is certainly one of the most embarrassing: virtually every big name associated with the film made an effort to distance themselves from it. Author Gore Vidal actually sued (with mixed results) to have his name removed from the film, and when the stars saw the film their reactions varied from loudly voiced disgust to strategic silence. What they wanted, of course, was for it to go away.For a while it looked like it might.

Is the Cannes controversy-meter remarkably esoteric, or is that we Americans are so callous and cynical that we never bother to read between the lines anymore? Be that as it may, with plenty of careful analyzing, "Falscher Bekenner" at no point seems to live up to the hyped controversy it supposedly brought to Cannes in 2005, a puzzlingly drab and aimless movie that rather lives up to it's glum American re-title ("Low Profile").Building on familiar themes of Bourgeoise angst and subsequent sexual liberation (kind of), admittedly it's a film not without it's surface-level interests.

Why is n't this movie on the bottom 100 ? Raptor is , without a doubt , the worst movie of the year. It's not even a bad movie anymore, but a bad idea . It's like watching a bunch of kids in grade school play an adult video game (which actually happened in the 80s, but with far worse movies and worse graphics). The characters are uninspired . They look and act like 2-dimensional cardboard cutouts. The acting is bad, the direction is worse, and the screenplay is the worst. There's no real reason for Raptor to exist.

Good Film.I managed to pick this up on DVD in a local store sale . £2.99 seems like a good price. I watched it, I thought it was good but I just can’t say its perfect . I would say it’s a very good film and it makes me smile everytime I see it. I have a very good relationship with this film and will go back to watch it again and again . I can honestly say I never seen anything like it. Well worth a watch. I love films with a good script and you can see it has that here .

I hadn't planned on leaving a review, but seeing some of the other dreadful reviews for this movie, I had to say something.I'm not going to give away the ending or anything, but I do give away some important plot points in this review, so you should be aware of that. The short (non-spoiler) version of my review - Samuel L. Jackson and Geena Davis both kick butt in this movie, and it's a lot of fun. Watch it.This movie is one of my favorites of all time.

Ah ! When good actors take on bland material ! If you are thinking of this movie as a tight story with good acting and great cinematography then you might be disappointed ! The film’s plot, in brief, is about a girl (Mira) who decides to do something for herself, that is to earn some extra cash and then travel around to different cities to earn a living by singing in clubs and bars. The only problem is, she never really had a job before so how can she start ? This girl has to travel around the world because of her lack of money.

Eh . This is a popcorn movie , nothing more . I watched this with a bunch of friends ( a guy, two girls ) and all of us enjoyed it. The story line is good and the music score is well done . You have to watch the trailer first to get what it's about . This is definitely a film I would recommend . The movie starts with the protagonist and his two friends meeting each other. One of his friends tells him she is a lesbian . The protagonist starts to feel that something is going to happen between the two girls .

Yes , I am a romantic of sorts who likes musicals and comedy and this fit the bill ! Julie Taymor was born in Paris, the daughter of an opera composer, and began her artistic career by becoming the lead singer of her father's orchestra in the 1930s. This was an exciting time for a young artist who had previously had little artistic experience. Julie Taymor then studied at the French Conservatoire and eventually graduated from the Conservatory of Music and Drama in the 1950s. She met her husband, the composer Jean-Pierre Ponnelle, in the mid-1950s.

Bay Area residents probably remember Paul from The Diamond Center , an unctuous late night huckster who flogged easy credit to young people trying to hit the lottery. Now Paul has returned as a TV pitchman promising the world. It’s an old standby for a lot of people: a sucker’s bargain. It’s even old hat for those who run their own businesses. It’s something people try every day. And sometimes it works. But for most people, the magic formula for success is pretty simple. You have a product or service and you get to market it.

i did n't hate this one . i just could n't adapt to the story . it did n't really suit me . i really hated the love triangle aspect and was disappointed i didn't really get a happy ending either . i was so confused i had to look at the movie a few times because i couldn't decide if i liked what i was seeing or if it was boring . i liked the story but the movie just didn't fit my taste. the movie is good but i don't agree with some of the conclusions .

Whoever likened this one to RAIDERS OF THE LOST ARK certainly knew whereof he spoke. He might, as well, have likened it to some of the adventures of the pulp heroes that followed. "Kay Hoog" reminds one more than a little of both Lamont Cranston (The Shadow) and Clark Savage (Doc Savage). (The Shadow, quintessential man of mystery- and the very first "Dark Knight"- was also thought to be one Kent Allard. If one were to take Savage's first name first and add to it the Kent, you end up with- voila- Clark Kent.

The Australian public and the Australian film industry are often heard to complain that there are not enough great Aussie movies being made. And that is a point that I think should be understood. There are two main problems. The first is that, as an outsider to the film world and as an Australian in this globalised age, there is an idea that Aussie movies are made by Australian guys with Aussie budgets who don’t want to work in Hollywood so they take their money elsewhere. That is not entirely true, but is part of it.

First , what is really great about this movie : - Ryan Reynolds , great acting ! There are very few times we have seen actor with such good acting abilities , I have seen him do a couple of acting roles in movies , but not like this , and I have also never seen actor like Ryan Reynolds . He did this in a way that I never see actor before or since in any movie . It was really great for the film , i mean a big plus point . What i loved about the movie :

- A lot of fun and comedy in it , i like the comedy part the best .

This cheapo remake of the terrific Five Star Final suffers from terrible acting . Humphrey Bogart stars as the manager of an ice cream parlor who gets so fed up with his employees that he fires them and buys the company himself, hiring the son of the company's owner as his replacement. Once his business begins to turn a profit, he puts the company in debt. But it turns out that one of the company's employees, Joe, is his nephew, and they fall in love while hiding from a mobster who's after them.

From the fertile imagination which brought you the irresistible HERCULES ( 1983 ) , comes its even more preposterous ( and very successful ) follow-up, HERCULES 2 ( 1996 ). Taking place in a dystopian future on the brink of a global economic collapse, the film is set for release on April 27th. It is already available in VHS from Lions Gate Home Entertainment. HERCULES 2, like its predecessor HERCULES , is a movie in the most conventional sense. It is set in a future in which the economy is in ruins, the population decimated, and violence is rampant.

My girlfriend wanted to see this ( lol this is the case a lot ) ... so I rented it and watched it. You can tell what she really thinks about her boyfriend ( she really does ) as you will see. But then she starts thinking she is wrong, so she tells the guy she was dating to get rid of him and then she just goes away with the guy... and I can just tell that he has no clue what is happening to her, I don't know what it was about this movie but I felt like I was watching a ghost story, like it wasn't real.

What an utter disappointment. Forget this abysmal film and get hold of the TV series instead. What on earth were they doing making the American president relatively sane? ALL the politicians should have been bumbling buffoons (Peter Cook is good as the British PM). It lacks the biting satire of the original, going instead for "lowest common denominator" slapstick. 1 out of 10 if I'm being generous! This is unfortunately yet another example of a remake which totally misses the point of the original, the difference with this one being that they were both written by the same people.

This is a Laurel & Hardy comedy short with some great and funny moments but overall the movie relies a little too much on bad dubbing with the characters having their voices too high for their words to be heard at all and not very funny at all...I give this short a 2.5 stars! This is very good movie with good acting by all the main actors, the dubbing was also great! I would definetly suggest this one to everyone, I know it wasn't the best dubbing in the movie but the actors, music and the whole story was great!

During filming , was Vanessa Redgrave taking mogadon ? It was like she was reading from an autocue . I asked the casting director why she couldn't act but he said , 'If she'd been born a man, she'd never have worked in film . ' ' But she's so feminine, she's a star . ' '

That was all that was said . The only reason they asked me to do that film is because my mother was born a man and my father was born a woman . ' '

' The reason I went to Australia was because I thought I'd meet my father .

Well , first off , the twins are exactly the same . there is no one is girly and one is not . this is what makes them so sweet . they are just the same as every other girl or boy in the world . and they love each other . i really believe that they would fall in love one day . even though they have been together for so long and that they are still in love . but that would mean they would get married first . right ? i mean , it is not like a boy and a girl can stay in love for eternity .

First , let me state that I have no idea who Nora Roberts is . So the book may have nothing to do with me. I do know she writes good fiction. But I don't know who she is. She could be from the south, or the middle of nowhere, she could have been born in a shack in the woods, she could be an old lady in her 60's or 70's who loves reading, or she could be a guy in his 30's, or 80's, or even 80's.

It does not surprise me that this short (91 minutes) B/W movie that was made 50 years ago in the Soviet Union during the short period called "ottepel'" or "the thaw", has gained so much love and admiration among the movie lovers over the world. It is sublime and beautifully filmed. Some scenes feel like there were made way ahead of their time. Sergei Urusevsky's camera work and creative discoveries were included in the text books and widely imitated. The film tells the moving and timeless story of love destroyed by merciless war but eternally alive in the memory of a young woman.

* * * * * * * * SPOILER ALERT * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

"There were times when I wanted to scream, but I just couldn't, it was almost like there was a part of me that knew what I was supposed to do but wasn't allowed to do it." ―Takuto Nakagawa

Takuto Nakagawa (稲田亜茂, Nakagawa Takuto) is a playable character from the Street Fighter X Tekken games.

I saw this movie with my mother, and I loved it! It was such a sweet story, (Not to mention funny because of the supporting cast!) They never make movies like this...ever! My favorite part is when Grace(Minnie Driver) finds out about her boyfriend's wife's death, and that she has the deceased wife's heart and she screams, "WHAT WAS GOD THINKING?" I do believe everyone(No matter who you believe in) has thoughts like that once in awhile.

WAIT until you've watched most of all other films ever released, wait a year, then watch this when you're ready for something with such low production values it that will not challenge anybody's imagination.I agree that whoever rated this movie as a ten-star production has to be doing it to skew the data. Anything above 8 would be odd.Nice to see the very young Sandy Bullock in her poofy hair for the short time she was featured, though she overdid the New Yorker accent but other times her southern (Virginia & NC) accent did sneak through.

This one is one of those classic B movie following the exploits of 2 hobos . It 's done really well and has a lot in it , so I feel that it should be up there with some of the best movies of that genre.I 'm not one for this type of movie ,but if you like the way it ends , then you can enjoy it with a lot of enthusiasm.If you don 't like it ,then I would suggest not watching it. What was it like to make the film and how did you come up with the idea?

I saw this film in the movie theater . I was taking classes at the Second City Chicago and of course I knew this movie was a must see . I had seen it many times in the theatre but I just didn't get it . I had never seen it in 3D until this night . This was a must see . The performances were incredible . Overall I would definitely recommend seeing this film especially in 3D . I saw it and it was amazing . It is worth the cost and it was worth every penny of the cost .

This movie is about a man who likes to blow himself up on gas containers.He also loves his mommy. So, to keep the money coming in, he takes his act to Broadway.SEE! CODY POWERS JARRETT BLOW HIMSELF UP ON HIS BIGGEST GAS CONTAINER YET! TONIGHT! 7.30PM! However, one day, his mommy dies and Jarrett goes berserk. He kidnaps the audience in the theatre and makes them all stand on top of a huge gas cylinder.Losing control further, he makes them all scream "MADE IT MA, TOP OF THE CYLINDER!"

I have so much hope for the sequel to Gen-X . Luckily , my hopes have came true . You have already heard about it in my other review , so I won’t go into details now . However , the sequel will be coming out in July , 2012 . We will get to find out more details in the second part of this review . As per my other review , here’s how the story is progressing . It’s so much better to read it . Gen-X is a sequel to the hit movie Gen-X . The movie was a great success at the box office .

There's something strange about the antisocial sentiment you can find in some Cheech And Chong material. One of the songs in Up In Smoke, well, I often wish more songs these days began that way. But in this excuse for a video, the stoner duo are showing us the videos for four songs from their album of the moment, also titled Get Out Of My Room. You hear a voice-over during the opening credits in which some anonymous producer describes the record as being a novelty recording that will just take up room on the charts.

Would it be too trite of me to create a review of just me saying the word `` STUPID ''? The answer is no, it would be too easy for you, but as I have never used the term it would not be trite. But what I am going to do is to create a list of things I like, and what I like is that the world is changing. The thing is that I don't use the word `` STUPID '' but I am going to use the word `` IDIOT. ''

They used footage of some real protest spliced with some woman talking about a society with no men to make it seem like these people were cheering for the 'gendercide' of men. The funny thing is, you can see a man cheering on his own death in the background.OK, the plot. Some lady says there should be a society with no men, and the crowd in front of her (which contains some men) think its a great idea. So then all the men are killed or something. So there are no more.Then this blonde scientist creates a man, but removes some chromosomes so he can't be violent.

This film hits the heart with a reality like no other I have seen . It shows what us what our forefathers have been through . I am sure this film will change our lives for ever . I strongly believe this film can change the lives of many who live with HIV/AIDS . It can save them from going back to a life of drugs that can lead them to a very bad end . I pray for all those affected by the AIDS virus and also for all those who live with HIV / AIDS as this documentary will help to break down many of the taboos that still exist .

Directed by Diane Keaton and adapted from a book by Franz Lidz. A young mother Selma Lidz(Andie MacDowell)is battling a very serious illness and her self proclaimed inventor husband Sid(John Tururro)is a little lacking in the emotions department. Unhappy with the new home situation, their sensitive son Steven(Nathan Watt)decides he wants to stay with his two eccentric uncles Danny(Michael Richards)and Melvin(Lou Cutell)until his mom is well. Steven seems to be happier and even takes interest in his strange uncle's living habits; he even decides he wants to change his name to Franz.

This was a sordid and dreary mess. I needed a shower when it was over. It goes something like this- some socialites are murdered and a woman homicide detective is assigned to the case. She discovers that the victims belonged to an underground lesbian society, and she befriends an associate of the group who may have relevant information. Since the detective is an attractive woman, of course she is horny and intrigued (which reveals much about Hollywood and its psychosis about women). What's surprising is that none of this is very sexy or interesting, just depressing and yucky.

A chilling and gory tale of a couple inheriting a 150 room Italian castle while still grieving the loss of their infant son, and how their life was turned upside down when they began having sex in their sleep, in a house full of people who loved them

The sun was shining in the late October afternoon when I walked out to the driveway. I stood there and looked around me for a while. Everything was white as snow and the air was cool, even in the shade of my umbrella. It had been raining, a steady downpour of wet, heavy snow.

A middle aged man, Robert Jordan, set in his ways, takes on a boy scout troop after his predecessor leaves under duress. Jordan takes on the pack mostly to learn what the boys like so he can revive his flagging radio program which is losing it's appeal to the younger set. He has a rough go at first with the boys, especially so with Mike, an 8 year old who forms an attachment for the older man which is anything but reciprocated. Do things work out for Jordan and the scouts? Check out this entertaining and amusing film from the old days.

I HATE MOVIES THAT END LIKE THIS ! ! ! ! This 16mm disaster is full of clichés , stereotypical villains that have been done to death, clichés of the era, but not this one. I can't quite remember all the names of the characters and I have only a faint idea of the period, but the film has all the elements you should expect from a disaster in the '60s: a nuclear powerplant, an army of aliens, tons of money, lots of power, a bad-tempered dictator , and a few good-hearted individuals who have to stop him before his evil plans go off the rails.

This movie was boring. Very much like Underworld, only even less interesting. It's not much of a werewolf movie and no where near a horror film. The lead couple were boring. I totally didn't care about Vivian and Aiden. And there was so little character development that I didn't care about any character in the film. The plot was paper thin. The transformations were basically nil. I did like the wolves themselves, might as well have have done a wolf documentary, I would have liked that better. I wouldn't recommend this movie.

I did have a good time the first 45 min . or so , but then suddenly it was all over . 1 of 9 people found the following comment helpful

The game itself is very well made and fun to play. 1 of 9 people found the following comment helpful

The graphics in the game are all very nice and the sounds are very good. +2

+1

-1

+1

I thought this was going to be great but it was not... The first thing you learn in a game like this is that the story is not the point and that the gameplay is the point .

Everything Is Illuminated A young Jewish American searches for the woman that helped his grandfather escape Nazi persecution while embarking on a mission to help other children in Ethiopia. I know you're wondering what I'm talking about and why you should even care, and that's a good question to ask yourself before you pick up this book... and before you even pick it up. And if you're going to pick this up, you really should do so knowing something of what you are getting into. If you're just going to read this off the cover then you might as well get rid of it before you begin.

Despite the all-star cast , this attempt at epic fails . It comes across as a set of flat cartoon shorts , like so many children's cartoons from the 1950s and '60s . But even if you're not a child , it's worth seeing . There are some clever touches here and there , some very funny cartoons , the music is excellent , and most of all the animation is very well done . Even the few scenes where the action slows down for comedic effect are still very funny . The voice acting is excellent . This is a series of short animated cartoons.

Yeah , I know my title sucks . I could n't think of any other title . x ] Ice and Fire and War and Mythology x ] I'll have to think about that title . Well , this is a nice topic . I was thinking about the topic of the topic , and my mind drifted back to the topic of " . " . x It's hard to say what to call it . I have no idea what it is . I was thinking a little about . I would like to have a more in depth discussion about this subject .

`` Landscape after a battle '' opens with escaping prisoners over a snowy field full of fences - in rather the manner of the TV series Prisoner - a scene which could have been lifted straight out of the BBC's '' Prisoners of War'' series, which would have served the story better. The opening of ''Landscape'', as in ''POW,'' is a bit of a stretch and it doesn't have much of an edge to it in any way - and it doesn't have enough of an introduction.

I know little or nothing about astronomy , but nevertheless ; I was , at first , a little sceptical . I thought that there must be some scientific reason for such things , and that this reason would be very obvious when I learned more about it . However , this is not the case , and still less so in the case of the universe , which, it appears, is in the state I described . The only thing which seems to me to be at all obvious about this universe is what I said above , that there is no reason to think that the universe is finite ; it is infinitely big.

This movie had potential. If it had been handled differently. What it needed was a different director. That's certain. And perhaps a different leading lady. I just can't understand the Minnie Driver character - or at least how she played it. She was completely unbelievable. I cannot believe she would have liked her performance in this movie either. She was probably abandoned by the director or incapable of delivering what the director was trying to get her to do. I am writing this as I am still watching it.

The film begins in Latvia just after WWI . Being a history teacher , I knew that multinational troops occupied Riga in 1919. I also knew there had been some sort of pro-communist revolution in 1923. I did not know what that was, until I saw the film. There was no communist party in Latvia during the Second World War. The Soviet Union occupied Latvia from June 22, 1941 to May 27, 1944. The Film opens in Moscow . It was shot on location there. The director was Sergei Yutkevich who is best known for his Soviet propaganda film ‘Lola’.

Kazuo Komizu strikes again with `` Entrails of a Beautiful Woman '' , the sequel to `` Entrails of a Beautiful Young Woman '' (1968), which made him the highest-paid director in Hollywood history, earning more than $100 million in its two-year reign. In contrast, he made more than $200 million in the five-year span between `` The Godfather Part 2 '' and `` Apocalypse Now '' (1978). Komizu, now 72, is the first Japanese director to have a hit in Hollywood. He made his directorial debut as an actor, working with Yumiko Enatsu in the 1959 film `` The Housemaid's Secret. ''

This is a movie from Toilet Pictures . If the name of the production company is any indication how stinky that shit is, I bet you will be able to tell right away just by how nasty they are. Anyhow, it has now been on the shelf in a box for over two years and there has been no action on it, not even from the distributor. It has also been on the Internet, but no word on where it could be. So, that is why I am bringing it back.

This noisy , dizzying football film from director Oliver Stone seems to have everyone in the cast - well , that's not quite the way it is. There are a few great lines in the film - such as the line "I can see your vagina" - but you can't help feeling like it wasn't really all about them. Or maybe you're in the minority when you say it didn't seem like it was all about the actors (I can think of at least three women who seemed to be more about the film, and several who seemed to be more about the acting).

`` Mr. Bug Goes To Town '' was the last major achievement the Fleischer studios produced . The quality of this movie was so good that for years the director and the actors were not allowed to release any other movie until this masterpiece was done . I don't know how many of you have seen this movie, but as soon as I saw it I began to cry , the way a little kid does when he sees his own reflection in the mirror . Then I started to laugh, a great laugh which could be heard at several hundred yards away .

Yes , indeed we have a winner- a winner in best dumb-action-movie ! The only reason I chose to vote was because I wanted to see it with my son, but he didn't get a single vote, not even a thumbs up! And now I have to wait until I see it again. I've seen it before and I must say that I was expecting a lot of the things in that movie that were not shown in the end. And I don't even have to go over the things that were shown in the end.

Just in case the title did n't give it away - this movie is garbage.Short review ? Yeah.I decided to see this movie based on the trailer on IMDB but it didn't hold my attention for the first 15 minutes. It didn't hold my attention from the moment I opened the film until I finished it. So I guess if you want a film with a nice story and an engaging script, then watch it. Otherwise, don't bother. I have seen it 3 times and every single time I found it to be very dull.

Any fan of Russian cinema will have great difficulty in believing the sub-par performances phoned-in by Mashkov and Bodrov Jr. on Russian TV, but these guys were on the same boat with the likes of Oleg Tabakov when it came to getting work, as this is not the case for many of the most talented directors in the Russian TV scene. If you're a fan of a particular director on Russian TV, chances are you've seen one of their shows more than any other. The TV industry in Russia and the world are full of such directors.

Sometimes it's hard to be a pirate...............but by golly Miss Jean Peters has a lot of fun trying - and it shows,particularly during her first spot of friendly swordplay with Blackbeard (Mr Thomas Gomez - eminently hissable)when the sheer joy of performing is plain on her face. With fifty years of hindsight Feminists seem intent on grabbing this movie as some sort of an anthem for the empowerment of women in a male - dominated society but I have serious doubts that either M.Tourneur or Miss Peters had any such concept in their heads at the time.

I liked this movie , not because Tom Selleck was in it , but because it was a good story. Not the most profound thing ever told on screen , but an enjoyable one nevertheless . It has it's own plot , not to mention it's own characters , its own style and its own tone , with the occasional addition of a few lines that just aren't used in most films . The plot is about a group of soldiers that are sent to Vietnam to bring back a man who has been killed in a firefight during the war .

It is not uncommon for a celebrity to be faced with the proverbial "wake-up call". And, should they survive this event, they come to a deeper understanding and appreciation of their particular good fortune. However, in the case of comedian's, they are rarely as funny after their epiphany as they were prior to it. Such is the case with Martin Lawrence. Frankly, I pay little attention to celebrities as I have much better things to do with my life than to spend it monitoring others'. So, I was unaware of the majority of what Lawrence had gone through prior to this film.

The girls might be prettier if you're their accompanist or a $#!+-faced onlooker. What I'm sayin' is that it'll take special circumstances for a non-whince reaction to this effort. The delivery of many lines appears to be distractingly unnatural for some actors. Lighting seems to be a problem, too, although failing eyesight may have accounted for my frequent squinting. And if you view this film, be open-minded enough to accept elements that no zoo or circus would reject: They are the above and below-ground creatures who feasted on dozens of campers near an empty Louisiana mansion.

While I can understand some of the points made regarding the cinematography (I thought a more purposeful approach would have better supported the low-fi, home movie feel) I must say that I thought the script and acting of WHAT ALICE FOUND were excellent! Dean Bell has crafted a real gem that Judith Ivey charms with character-driven delight. Her performance of Sandra is a pleasure -- unfolding, alternately, as diabolical and romantic. We are at once intrigued and repulsed by her actions... and never given more information than is necessary. Her's and the supporting cast's efforts meet Bell's post-modern fairy tale with arms wide open.

My boyfriend and I went to watch The Guardian.At first I did n't want to watch it , but I thought about it for a long time and it got to me so I decided to watch it and I'm so glad that I watched it with him. The first two hours was very boring and I was bored but after two hours I was very happy.It was really sad that it ended up like this. I don't care if the movie gets nominated , I only care that the people that watched it cared about it and I hope that this movie will win.

Why is it that in the '50s and '60s, Italians made so of the best movies, and then during the '70s and '80s, made nothing but zombie and cannibal movies? Probably because art films didn't make any money. , The Cannibal Movie, unlike the Zombie Movie, which was created by Americans and `exploited' by Italians, is a purely Italian creation, designed as a mondo exploitation showcase, and to make as much money as possible (no artistic integrity getting in the way here). Eaten Alive came during the Cannibal Movie heyday.

I loved so much last Bellocchio's movie, the masterpiece "L'Ora di Religione". It had a great screenplay, great actors (well, have to say Castellitto is so much greater than others), a brillant use of lights for a great cinematography.Well, Buongiorno Notte is a different story. Ridiculous screenplay erupting tons of morals (and we could speak weeks about politics, you know we are italians...). Poor cinematography (it's too simple representing '70s dark years with dark colors and dark lights, do some efforts more peoples!!!!).

This is only the fourth effort I ’ ve watched from this director ( whom I met and found quite impressive). He is an interesting artist but he is a little too attached to his previous work. I would like to have seen more of this director's other work. I also would like to watch a more in-depth review of his earlier work as this review is a bit of a general overview. This film has potential to become a great film in my eyes. I give it an excellent rating. This is my first time watching a film with a rating of 8.

A terrible deception : controversial film , winner of the Teddy in Berlin 2003 , Mil nubes de paz turned into a critical and popular success, for which he won a number of prizes. It tells the story of a young musician who works as a waiter in a gay restaurant in Madrid during the early days of the Spanish Civil War. It was first screened in 2003. It has been nominated for an Oscar in 2004, and won an award at the Cannes Film Festival in 2004. In November 2005, after being screened to the press, it won the Teddy award for best European film.

As far as I am concerned , this film noir had two totally different things going for it as opposed to other films of that time. For one thing , it was written by John Cawelti who was the author of two books about a young man named Philip Marlowe , and it was the first story I ever read where there was no question of a happy ending . It was such a disappointment to me that I could have sworn to God I would never ever read another book or article on Philip Marlowe ever again. As for the film itself , I thought it was great.

I watched this cooking show for a few times before I wanted to pull my hair out. Just one question.....Who CAN'T cook a slapped together plain meal in 30 minutes when everything you need is at hand, already bagged, sometimes pre-chopped and you have very little else to do except chop a few greens. Also, almost every cooking show on TV is 30 minutes and most of these chefs do all of their prep work (except for Sandra Lee), during their show. Oh and yep....they do full meals too.Love the comment by the guy who hated the "EVOO" comment.

It´s all my fault . They all told me I should avoid seeing this movie because I´m a huge fan of this genre, and that´s why I should stay away, right? So why am I seeing it right now? Maybe it´s because I know nothing about what is happening on screen, or maybe I just want to watch this movie. Maybe, just maybe, it could be because it has been a while since I was in this mood to see this movie. Maybe I just need to feel the story.

Hey guys and girls ! Do n't ever rent , or may God forbid , buy this piece of garbage. You have been warned , you know what the truth is. This is not a piece of art , this is garbage. Not even a decent game , just another waste of money

I was excited to try the game, but i was very, very let down. Not because there is no story or anything of the kind, it is just not as good as i wanted to think it would be.

That 's all I can really say about this film . It 's DBZ ... like Tree of Might and Death, but with a lot of more sex. There are a few sex scenes here, but this film has no real "sex" in the film.
