The sex is there, as much as the rest of the film. But the sex is there, but the film is not and does not pretend to be. It is a parody of DBZ . This film is more like an episode of the TV show, except the film is not "episodes".

My parents may enjoy this show , but I fail to find the humor in it . What is so funny is the fact that the characters and the acting are mediocre at best . I don't see the laughs here . I would not go to the movies for this show , as I have never seen it before , nor do I plan on it ever again . I am not a huge fan of sitcoms anyway , and I didn't see this one for the comedy , so I can't find the humor in it . I've heard the same thing from others .

When the circus comes to town and places the lion 's cage directly over Bugs Bunny 's home , Bugs Bunny will be forced to go on an extended journey with his new owner. A journey which will show him just how different his new owner is from the one he used to know . A journey into a whole new world, into a whole new set of problems, and into new and different people . The journey starts right now , as Bugs Bunny embarks upon an adventure in order to escape his present, and find himself.

This movie was trying to something, but failed miserably. All the attempts at suspense were cheap, and there were so many tired gimmicks and plot holes I ended up laughing and making fun of it the whole way through. At least I was entertained. The ghosts are attempting to warn the family, so why do they attack the girl, whose name I didn't care to remember. And what was with the black and white at the beginning? I know what they were trying to do, but they fell far short. And where the heck did that guy (John Corbett's character) come from?

I agree with all aforementioned comments . This show was a delight to watch . Funny , witty , terrific and just great to watch . I have never seen a show this good . The acting was superb . I would give this show a 10 . I've been on the edge of my seat the past 5 minutes. I have to be honest, I wasn't expecting anything. But this show has been good enough to make me forget about what I was expecting. When I say good, I mean great! The acting is top notch.

I generally loved the Carry on movies but this one is actually pretty awful . There are very few laughs but most of them seem forced. I know that I'm not the only fan of Carry on but this film, while entertaining and funny, is really boring and not funny in the right way . I don't know why the audience is laughing so much at a lot of the scenes and most of the dialogues . I guess they are watching it as a kind of a reality check and it's not that funny .

Please do not blame Korea for this bad movie. I am in Korea (please excuse bad English). It sadden me to see these movies which make Korea look like obsessed with blood and sex. It sadden me even more to see animal killings and hear Americans say that is how Korea is. We do not eat live animals!! So please stop excusing movie for its crime by saying it is the culture! There is scenes with the man eating live animals and non Koreans think it is normal. No it is disgusting to us too.

Disclaimer : During my ventures into foreign cinema , I have taken a liking to a wide variety of movies , both from the Indian and International scenes . With this one I would like to talk about my experience in watching these films, in the hope of sharing something , which might interest others too. Introduction

I think that the introduction to this post could not have been any better than the title itself. This is because I have been looking for movies to discuss on this blog, which are not only in the Indian films, but in the International Indian movies too.

Synopsis : the sequel to the acclaimed Silence Of The Lambs , Hannibal is a big budget production that totally steals the thunder from it predecessors. I was the guy who was the last to sit down to a meal at the Ritz. It's not like there weren't others, but in this restaurant I had the pleasure of being seated by none other than Al Pacino. Now that's the kind of guy that would never be considered a "friend". That night, I sat down to a feast, but it wouldn't be complete without a little bit of conversation.

I first viewed this film shortly after it was put out on video in 1995, I dismissed it offhand, saying that Julie was no Daniel, never really giving it a chance and saying it was horrid.But here it is, 5 years later, its on Disney and im watching it again. And I'm finding that it isnt as bad as I made it out to be. Miyagi is still Miyagi, just as kool as ever, the musical score is still there pleasant as ever. And Swank's character isnt that bad, her acting is pretty good considering the script.

Journalist Bob Woodward 's blistering , scattershot and sometimes suspect account of actor John Belushi 's rise and fall becomes the basis for a new movie by filmmaker Brett Ratner , to be produced by Ratner 's production company, Ratner-Scott, based on the book. Woodward , whose book won the National Book Award for non-fiction in 1998, writes in the introduction of his latest book that he has "no regrets about making the book" or about how "it came into existence". However, he says he does have regrets, namely about the way his own book has been treated in the media.

Has anyone else noticed that this version is basically a scene-by-scene remake of the 1933 version , with some of the actors re-casting themselves? That's the way it works in Hollywood these days. But I'm sure the producers are working their magic and there'll be something different about this. The original was shot by Douglas Sirk so I'll give him a lot of credit for the way he did it. Now, in the 1933 version, the camera had to get up close so that the actors didn't get too close to the screen.

Just a great soundtrack. Really enjoyable music. Outstanding cast, great lead performance. Worth watching.Doesn't really explain what happened to the neighborhood. You are left feeling that integration is to blame or that with the departure of the lead character the neighborhood disintegrated.This movie seems well researched and extremely well crafted. I especially enjoyed some of the minor characters like Jeffrey Wright.The cutting during the opening sequence helps express what a lively, engaging and desirable experience that nightclub would have been with the jump music, food, drink, dancing, gambling and sex.

A comedy that spoofs the inspirational sports movies , The Comebacks tells the story of an out-of-luck coach , Lambeau, who is fired and must try to find a job with no experience or references. He finds one, as the coach at a small Midwestern university. The movie is in part based on Lambeau's autobiography, and is an excellent piece of satire. The movie opens with Lambeau, an unemployed former high school teacher, sitting on a couch at a diner waiting for a woman with long dark hair and big brown eyes, whom he recognizes as his former girlfriend from high school.

Okay, so I love silly movies. If you enjoy silly sci-fi movies, over the top movies, or if you are a fan of Mr. Bruce Campbell, i would go see this movie. This movie is all that i wanted it to be. Being a fan of over the top movies, this fit the bill. Every time i thought to myself "this movie would be the sillest, best movie ever if *blank* would happen...." then just as i thought it, *blank* would happen. It's a wonderful silly 'b'-movie.

What a waste of talent -- although it appears that Crudup in real life is a lot more like the vapid, self- absorbed, character-less character he portrays in this disappointing movie.In art, sometimes the empty spaces reveal more than the painted or created content. What this movie reveals is the unconsciousness and the contradictory/competing, unresolved impulses/consciousness of the film's director/writer. It unintentionally shows the LACK of awareness that a truly evolved, deeply aware character should have and be tormented about in order to deserve audience empathy or sympathy OR the lack of which is used to serve as a cautionary tale to the audience.

There is not much to say about this one except that it is probably the worst of the early spate of zombie movies (I may get to watch another one, REVOLT OF THE ZOMBIES [1936], before the month is out). For all star John Carradine's intention of building an army in the service of the Third Reich with them, they are not seen to do much at all! ; James Baskett (Uncle Remus from SONG OF THE SOUTH [1946]!) plays their leader, who also serves as Carradine's manservant.

Fun With Dick and Jane failed to entertain on so many levels . There were loose ends with the writing and the characters. The plot dragged on. The acting was poor. I was waiting for the end since the beginning, and that was it. It's a shame that this is the only Dick and Jane that I've read. I thought it was a good book until I reached the end and realized that it didn't have an ending . If you want to have a good time don't read this book . You'll have a bad time too if you read this book .

This BRASS EYE special PAEDO-GEDDON was swamped by complaints ( More on that later ) when it was broadcast in 2001 following a national debate around a possible " Sarah`s law " following the abduction and murder of school girl Sarah Payne . In fact it`s scheduling was delayed while Phil Collins took legal advice after he found out he`d been fooled by the show`s maker Chris Morris into a starting a campaign entitled Nonce-senseIf truth be told this show is probably more remembered for the controversy than the content which is in very poor taste but I do confess that I laughed out loud .

A very interesting plot of the film based on the novel `` Waltz into Darkness '' of the writer Cornell Woolrich (a.k.a. Jack Kerouac ) and his son Robert Kerouac . I don't really like the movie as much as it is based on the novel . I don't believe that the movie would be as interesting and interesting if the story of the film was based on real facts . But there are a lot of facts in the novel that can be proven by real evidence . I think the main character of the novel is very interesting .

I really enjoyed this movie. Yes there was disrespect throughout the movie, but Bruce Willis learned, from The Kid, that there is more value in repecting others, and his life of disrespect needs to change. This movie was a refreshing change from the trash that Hollywood is trying to shove down our throats. There are some very good lessons to be learned in this movie. I really believe this was one of Disneys best, even though a couple of things could have been left out. I was impressed with the lack of swearing and lack of sexual inuendos.

I am sure I'm in the minority (I know I am among my friends), but I found this movie long, boring and gratuitous. The fact that the role played by DENIS LEARY is the most likable character (the only other time I liked him at all was in "A Bug's Life"!) speaks volumes. Rene Russo's character was irritating beyond belief and Thomas Crowne himself was flat and stereotypical. To say he was two-dimensional may be a little generous. (No, the scenes with his psychiatrist did NOT help make him real.

My husband wanted to watch this film because the review in the paper said that it was better than Fatal Attraction. Well, not liking either Michael Douglas or Glenn Close, I would have to agree. Not for conventional reasons though.This is one of those films that needs to be watched late at night when you don't want to watch something that really requires thought but don't want to go to bed yet.Yancy Butler is a really enjoyable bad-guy. She is not the best of actresses, in fact she isn't even good but she is perfect for this role in this film.

There is a lot to like in this film, despite its humble trappings of a preachy PC tale about rape and the perp always faring better than the victim. The movie did create a fair bit of suspense in the mystery surrounding who was sending the notes. (I, for one, was sure it was the teacher. In fact, that would have been more probable plot-wise because the idea of the best-friend's boy-friend kind of came out of nowhere. I guess the point of that is that "rape is omnipresent. You never know who it is going to be".)

Where do we start with an offering like this ? I nearly said film but that would be going a little too much of the way. We could start with the fact that I am from a family with a long and illustrious tradition of making things for the people. As a child I remember my dad trying to teach my brother how to make a cardboard box to keep food cold in the winter and for our family picnic food for the hot summer days on a table covered in newspaper and a bottle of milk sitting on top of it as a makeshift picnic basket to hold the milk.

Totally forgettable movie but an unbelievable soundtrack : I 'd give it ( soundtrack ) a 9 out of 10 but there is so much good stuff on there, I'd give it 9.5/10. I love the music, I don't think it could be any better. I am going to give this movie a 9.9/10. There is just way more of it than I was expecting or really wanting in a film, but oh well. I would give the soundtrack an even higher rating because I love the music and the score and I was hoping to hear more of it in this movie.

Are sea side resorts the sad, dreary places they're always depicted as in movies and novels? Certainly this movie, along with the near-contemporary "Don't Look Now" depicts Venice as a particularly squalid and decadent tourist trap (for a more light-hearted approach, see "Just Married" with Ashton Kutcher and Brittany Murphy). Having never been to Venice I can't say for sure, but it does make a perfect setting for this somber but sumptuous spectacle from Luchino Visconti, one of the great stylists of world cinema.

I was lucky enough to have seen this film at it 's Seattle Film Fest screening , and was blown away by it. For those not in the know, this is an original animated short film, which tells the life and times of a young Japanese girl named Haru. I think this short is beautiful and I have a feeling that I will be able to enjoy it more with time. I am looking forward for more animation films from the animator that created this. I was really happy to see a new piece of work from an artist who has done a lot of amazing animation work already.

Yes sure , this is a Friday the 13th rip off but I have no problem with it . It was just an experiment

I had no issue with the episode. I just wish the writers would have come up with a solution to the cliffhanger at the end. But I'm sure this is only a minor issue. And besides, it's just an episode, it doesn't really matter anyway. But I'm just saying , if they would have come with a solution to it , the episode wouldn't be a rip-off .

I thought I was going to see a UFO movie. Instead, I saw a movie that was trying to make the audience (me) make the decision to accept Christ in my life, or risk going to Hell. The whole UFO thing was one big red herring!!! The acting in it was pretty pathetic. In fact, it looked as though some people from an Evangelic Church just got got together and decided they wanted to make a movie. All the characters talked as though they were in church conversing with other church members. It wasn't real-life dialog at all.

This movie seems as if someone had a cute idea for a movie, thought of two or three funny possibilities, hired a good cast, then turned the whole thing over to a really bad screenwriter and even worse director. The director filmed a screwball romantic comedy as if it were a dark, artsy film---weird camera angles, blue filtered shots, lingering, close up looks at raindrops. Steve Zahn was good, as always. Ben Affleck was charming, sweet, almost shy; he was perfect for a romantic comedy.

Five Fingers relies heavily on barbaric , shock value Hollywood tactics to elicit apparently a positive movie-going response . This was the film's opening title card :

"It's a tale of two cities." That line was the only clue we had to understand that "It's a tale of two cities." The title is an ambiguous one that implies two things. First, that the story takes place in New York or, if it is set anywhere else, then we are to presume the story is set either in the Big Apple or in an alternate reality that takes place in a city of some description.

Honestly - this short film sucks. the dummy used in the necro scene is pretty well made but still phony enough looking to ruin the viewing experience. the Unearthed DVD is crisp and clear and I haven't made up my mind if this helps or hinders it. If the film was a little grainy it might have added some "creepiness factor" to what was going on. I have no idea why this film has so much hype surrounding it other than the subject matter - but to be honest the necrophilia scenes in films like NEKROMANTIK and VISITOR Q among others, are more shocking than in AFTERMATH.

Take your video camera, turn out all the lights in your house and film people running around with flashlights for an hour and a half and you've got the basic idea of what this film looks like. It is very irritating to watch this kind of movie. To be fair, there are scenes of daylight at the very beginning and very end of the movie. I like scary movies and creature features but this one just didn't do a thing for me. So sorry. I really tried to like it.

lovely . i just love the movie . i want to see this movie because Rupert Grint is a fantastic actor . and it is a very funny film . this movie is great . but i dont like the ending . i hate the ending . but i guess i love it . i want to know whats in store with the movie . dont give it a 4 . it is a good movie , but the ending sucks . I love the book and movie. They were sooooo good together! I can't wait for the movie and I hope Rupert gets it in the top 10.

Man, I never laugh so much this year, and it's pretty hard to make me laugh. While I expected some Hostel-style movie, the smile came to my face even from the beginning. This film-inside-film shows a female stabbed "victim" messing the whole set until she finally "die". Her overacting drive the director nuts and his funny reaction tell us, the viewers, that Mute Witness is not a typically horror movie.The main character, the mute American make-up artist Billy Hughes, is played by the beautiful yet talented Russian actress Marina Zudina.

When the movie first started I thought cheesy. The first ten minutes were really boring. After the slow beginning and some of the soap opera antics, I started liking it. The plot was different than anything I had ever seen. Now, was it a horror? Not really. It shouldn't have been classied as a horror or the producers should have put more money into the movie to make it scary. As it was, the creatures where only there for a short time. I can only assume this was for money reason.The good side was that the movie was very entertaining.

This is a pretty simplistic romance . Girl finds boy , girl loves boy , girl loses boy , girl finds boy again , girl looses boy again , girl meets girl , girl loves girl , and so on and so on. And all it has is love and a lot of drama . It all sounds pretty good on paper, right ? Well not so much in the way of the love story. This is more of a love triangle with the girl's love triangle being the most important part. This story is all about a girl named Mika and the love that is supposed to grow between this two.

This piece of Crap is actually the BOMB , as in Bottom of the Barrel . I ca n't figure out what else to say. My point is , this is Crap that should never been put into this game. Why did they make this crap? So they can put more of it in later when you can get it from the shop ? It is not worth buying. I am sure you can do it, but be carefull, as you have no choice in buying it . There are several ways to fix this error and they all involve re-opening the game and restarting .

This is a very low budget film, set in one location in a valley shielded by the effects of radiation. The cast, an older man and daughter, a handsome visitor, a couple (a tough buy and gal), a drifter, a donkey and a radiation affected man, interact during the after effects of a nuclear blast. Added to this is an entity watching the women take a bath.They all have guns, some of them get shot, some of them are told to have children, others are murdered and others just drift away and, well this is the movie.

If you think it 's beautiful to be obsessive about who you are in love with , then I can understand your feeling. But that doesn't make it true and I'm afraid of what will happen to me if I can't get her back. So I want to keep her secret at all cost, until one day...I think I will find the way to get her to accept me with all of the love I'm giving to her now, and I hope to make her my bride for life." The woman's eyes grew wider and she looked up at me with a confused expression.

I saw this movie in the theatre and it was a terrible movie . The way Michael Oliver who now owns that movie has gone on to promote that same movie on TV is unbelievable . What kind of world is this ? How do people in positions of power like Michael Oliver get the idea that they can just do that . What is so wrong with that movie ? What kind of message does this movie give to the world ? How do these people get such power . What a disgrace !!!! I am a fan of Michael Oliver.

Until I did a Web search on `` What Alice Found '' , I did n't realize that the name of the book was on the first place I was going to check. Then I did an internet search, and got to this page. Wow! That book was the first one I ever had read. Well, in my case, I only just found it because I have an old friend of mine, who I discovered on Facebook, who was in the very first group of people I joined back in February, 2009.

This is one of those movies that I can watch again and again and not get tired of it . . . even though it is all over in about ten minutes . . . I thought it was going to be the same old movie I had seen before . . . but this is so much more. The characters in it seem to really care about one another and they get into some pretty heavy situations together that I think make the film more special and more of an "event" than a movie . . .

Do not see `` Mr . Magoo . '' It is one of the worst movies I have ever seen in my life. I have to put it here so people can see for themselves that this is nothing but utter garbage. I did see it, though. I saw it the night it was released. The movie was awful and I didn't care. There was a huge line outside the theater that was only about ten minutes. I saw it and walked by the movie. Then I came out and waited for it to finish so I could get my food and head home.

This has got to be the worst movie I haver ever seen Nielson in . This movie just does not give a rip about what you think it is , its just a cash in , I guess , its just so bad that even the director was embarrassed that they even let it go into the movies . What I would like for the movie to do is show what happens if you are on the wrong side with this drug . Its so sad that the movie makers would take money from all the drug companies and then let it go out for a million or two .

This film is the most traumatising and painful horror film I have ever seen in my life. To know that this film is based on a true story and watching Jeffrey Dahmer(Carl Crew) brutally murder his victims is enough to bring a tear to my eye. I admit this was a low budget film with not the best dialogue, however it explained why Jeffrey Dahmer was a Psycotic maniac. As he was so selfishly/inwardly emotional his emotions and selfishness went so far deep into his brain that it resulted into him becoming a murderer.

At the same time John Russell was playing ranch owner Nathan Burdette, trying to free his no good brother Claude Akins from sheriff John Wayne in Rio Bravo he was working the other side of the law on television. These years were probably the high point of Russell's career, his most noted screen role and his most famous television role, Marshal Dan Troop of Laramie in Lawman.Russell kept law and order in Laramie the same way that James Arness did it in Dodge City on Gunsmoke. Unlike Gunsmoke, Laramie never developed the all the minor characters that gave you the feel of Dodge City at the time.

Every time I 've seen this movie I get the same impression : some parts of it are so amazingly good that it's a pity I can't make it into a full-length movie. I have to admit my first reaction is usually a big yawn (I find the whole story really boring) but after a while I realise that it's actually quite an impressive and original film. To explain what I mean I'm going to give you a brief idea of the main characters and the events that took place during their lives before meeting up again.

The Brave One is about a New York radio show host named Erica Bain ( Jodie Foster ) . Her life falls into disarray when she learns she has only six months to live. In the midst of her despair, she hears about an experimental drug being developed by the government. As she begins to use it, she has visions and receives messages that reveal her destiny. When it is too late to take her medication, and her body is unable to handle the medicine, the Brave One tells her story and shows her a vision of what her life could have been like if she did not succumb to illness.

The only reason i did n't delete this movie after 20 min is because we already wasted 20 minutes on it and didn't need anymore. I'm so sorry that it sucked so bad and had so many flaws. There is no way i can recommend it. It's a must-see. A very good, but not great film. As far as I'm concerned, the only positive thing about it was the music. A lot of it is very good, but I just don't have a taste for that sort of thing.

Admittedly, when the chance to see this horribly infamous legend of a movie, my expectations were pretty low. They weren't low enough. Scholckmaster Roger Corman somehow came into ownership of the rights to produce the Marvel comic book characters sometime in the late 80's or early 90's, and handed it off to Oley Sassone, whose directorial work has largely been in campy TV series such as 'Hercules' and 'Viper'. With a supposed total budget of 1.5 million dollars, it was produced, shot and briefly released on video and then sent to the wasteland of forgotten film.

Helen ( Kate Capshaw ) owns a bookstore in the sleepy , coastal town of Loblolly by the Sea . But she is forced to sell her shop when her father’s death forces her to move to San Francisco with him. Now, she is working as a flight attendant and trying to get by while her father is away. However, things are looking up for her when she finds herself spending more and more time in her hotel room rather than going out. She has a chance to get out on the town, but her mother insists that she go home and help her in the store.

Buster Keaton was arguably at his most enjoyable when he did short 20 minute films, and they don't come more rib-ticklingly funny than this gem. The dead pan comic gets involved in a photographic mix-up with a wanted felon. This leads to his elaborate evasion of several street cops and fellow passengers who recognise the his face from the "Wanted" signs. The Goat is choc-a-bloc with brilliant site gags, from the opening scene at the bread queue, right up to the wonderful elevator chase at the end. A Keaton film never feels as though its silence is lacking, as sound is never something you needed with him.

The Giant Claw is in fierce competition with films like, 'Robot Monster' and 'Plan 9 From Outer Space' for worst film of all time. A phony looking giant vulture attacks 'Lionel Trains' in this completely unconscious film. The script is so bad that everything the characters say to one another is ridiculous. It's no wonder that this film is a prime target in the movie, "It Came From Hollywood," where this gem is hammered for the line, 'A Bird As Big As A Battleship', with gleeful, endless needling.

If you like your films to pull your emotions out of you, if you like your films with a guy you can root for, and relate to, if you like your films in black and white, you gotta see this film! Watch it from start to finish, because you don't want to miss a beat. It is sometimes slow, and it makes you wonder when something is going to happen, then when the plot begins to unfold, you will be on the edge of your seat! I know I was!

This film gives new meaning to the term `` uneven '' , giving us a few intriguing characterizations offset by one or two solid performances from several very talented people. It is so uneven, however, that I can't help but wonder if a more consistent director, one with a more coherent script, or someone with less baggage, would have a little more bite to his film. But I am not about to tell the man who gave me this film to hate; I love this film, and I will go see it again, hopefully with more insight.

Mild spoilers below.The prospect of war was clearly on the horizon when TFW was filmed . From the opening scene , where the characters are being forced to flee a burning building in the face of an approaching military convoy , to the final scenes of the film, when the characters are at their greatest danger yet again, it is obvious that the film was made with the knowledge that the war was coming. As soon as I saw this movie, I knew the film was about to become a very important part of the world's story.

I disagree in calling this a stoner movie just because weed also makes an appearance. I can't imagine this as even approaching "stoner classic." That would be like calling Singles a "grunge film." The movie definitely plods along with a murky plot. At times I wondered if the script had either been dropped and shuffled or if they lost it entirely and just tried to wing it. Watching this movie reminded me of watching children play-acting and making the story up as they go along.The characters are wooden, the dialog is taxed, and the whole story seems to be completely disconnected.

The final entry in the On The Buses trilogy sees the usual wasters go about their business in Wales. I feel sure the franchise could have continued, but Harold Pinter complained that the screenplays made him look bad in comparison, and so no more were made. It's actually less than two minutes before we get our first dollop of sexism - a woman running for the bus finds her breasts fall out of her dress for no reason whatsoever. Still, it does at least make Stan (Reg Varney) laugh - but then what doesn't?

UK-born Australian helmer Alex Frayne calls for attention with his strange , necessitating a meticulous read , visually stunning Modernist-flavored crime thriller “I’m Still Here,” his first American feature film since 2006. The story, set during the late ‘80s in Los Angeles’ notorious skid row district, follows a police officer and his wife as they investigate the murder of an aspiring actress who was brutally killed after being discovered strangled in her Los Angeles apartment. “It was a bit of a tough one,” says Alex Frayne, “but one I was very happy with and I knew that I wanted to make.

When the word "presents" finds its way into a title, preceded by a famous name, the work is usually immediately dismissible. For some reason, people who are capable of creating good art don't seem to be able to see it in others. However, I've always been willing to give the second installment of the Demons trilogy a try. For one thing, the soundtracks are absolutely to die for. Most American directors would have sacrificed small animals to line up the kind of talent on the soundtrack of Demons 2. For another, well, two words: Asia Argento.

I watched this movie the other night, and I have to admit, it was quite possibly the best film of this generation. Turns out I wasn't born until 1988, but I can relate to this motion picture like Cary Grant can relate to having an STD, or Burt Reynolds to being a burnout. Marky Mark did not decline in awesomeness after his brief stint in New Kids on the Block, which I will from here on refer to as "the best band in the world (aka BBW). Like, it's totally a morality tale about fargin' trannies an' poop, so pay attention!

Even a bad Julie Andrews Musical is worth watching and this isn't bad! In fact it's quite entertaining. Actually it's a fascinating study on trying to manipulate a star's personae.To break Julie's "goody two shoes mold" she plays a German Spy/English Musical Hall Actress. She subsequently went on to take her top off in the movie S.O.B. and play a drag queen in Victor Victoria and other not so goody girls usually under hubby Blake Edward's direction.The movie is admittedly problematic It is hard to feel for her character because she's a German Spy.

This is a classic continuation to Bleu, the likewise excellent film, with Juliet Binouche as a main star, moreover, she is a cameo appearance here, in Rouge, just for a second at the very end. But this film, truly red and very sweet although very sad, is a real winner. The main heroine, played by ever great Irene Jakob, is a successful photo / fashion model. She leads a full, active life, only darkened by her traumatic relations with her weird friend Mike, who is in England.

Froggie is upset that he never has a big party like all the other kids . Spanky and the gang decide to help him out and ask all the grown ups to have a little froggie party , so they can see how everyone is going to be having a great time . As the night approaches , everyone except Froggie is having the biggest party . They decide to invite all the children , so everyone can have a good time . When the party starts , the grown ups get mad when Froggie and his friends don't show up .

As a fan of Henriksen (I liked him in the "Millennium" series) and of course Lorenzo "Renegade" Lamas, I had expected at least SOMETHING from this film. Sadly, the plot is predictable, the acting is bad and the computergraphics used for most stunts don't work out. Sometimes it even looks like they've captured some shots from Microsoft Flight Simulator.The cinematography sucks as well. Unnecessary funky camerawork in the beginning only detracts (from the cheesy dialogue) and gives the film a cheap, made-for-video-look.

This was touted as a sequel to Crash Dive , which was a very good film in the low budget indie world. That film got a lot of people excited for the sequel and I’m not sure I’ve seen anyone complain about it that it wasn’t at all good. In Crash Dive 2 , though, the writing is worse than the film, the directing worse and the acting worse. For starters, instead of having two leads, it has a single lead. I’m not joking.

I 'm not really sure where to begin . From start to finish , bad , stinky bad , like a car wash , was a nightmare . The worst part of it all is they gave me so many choices and told me to make my decision after the tour . I mean , you think you got a choice in this place ? I guess it's like going to the grocery store and telling me to chose what I want . I mean I thought I did a great job . They said if I liked the food I could go and choose from the other options .

The film is a joy to watch , not just for the plot , which is gripping , but also because of the superb cast and their fine chemistry , especially Nayanthara, who steals the show for sure. There is the usual dose of melodrama here and there , but thankfully it’s not overdone. The film is full of action , drama and romance , the last two being the most compelling. However, while the film does have moments that could have been better , it’s not all bad and I would highly recommend the movie .

I am a huge Eric Roberts fan, I collect his movies and so far has get to 60. But I´m honest to say that sometimes he really makes awful movies. But hey that´s why I like him - he is entertaining.But this one has to take the price, I can´t stop wonder why. Somehow they managed to get Eric and also Corbin Bernsen to the picture.While Bernsen is plain awful (I really don´t like him), Roberts manage to be the best thing in the movie (and that doesn´t mean much).

Return to Me is a movie you will want to own . It is a story of inspiration and family. It is beautifully crafted and a joy to watch. I highly recommend this to anyone. It has everything you need to make an amazing movie that is enjoyable for the entire family to see. I watched this movie again and again with my grandchildren. I can’t tell you how much fun it was watching them watch it. I would highly recommend this movie to anyone. It is a very touching and emotional story and the actors in this film were amazing.

Horrible acting with the worst special f/x I've ever bore witness too. It's bad enough I wasted $3 to watch this crummy pile of crap, but it's the hour and a half time I lost that I could've been doing anything else like getting a root canal or volunteering for jury duty. Getting drunk couldn't even help this video.To put it bluntly, I sincerely believe I actually lost a few IQ points during the course of watching this idiotic piece of mind-numbing "work"! Perhaps I should have followed my own advice this time.

Another winner from that 50s , 60s era that I love so much for the comedic value they give with it, this movie has a very funny cast, with the three lead actors from "The Best Man." It's a movie that will make you laugh till you cry, and if you love classic comedies then this movie is definitely one of your favorites! Sally Field is as funny as she has been in her whole life. She plays a girl named Betty who has to marry her first cousin and she gets her cousin to take her to the altar as her date.

Sure , most of the slasher films of the 1980 's were not worth thecelluloid they were filmed on , the same is true for the 1980' films of the 70' s such as The Exorcist or Alien or even Alien Resurrection , i do not think it is wise to compare them to the films of the 80' s , there are a lot of good and bad horror films that were made in that decade, but they all deserve to be viewed on their own merits and not based on how they fit into that decade of horror movies or were made by a certain director.

The plot for Black Mama White Mama, revolves around two female inmates, at a women's prison in the Phillipines. One Black, and one White. These two women, are thrown together in the prison. Pam Grier is Lee Daniels Lee is incarcerated in the hellish women's prison, for dancing as a harem girl. Lee's boyfriend owes her part of his profits, from his drug-dealing activities. Lee is mainly interested in breaking out of the prison to get hold of her beau's drug money, so that she can leave the Phillipines and assume a better life.

I just watched this , an early Harold Lloyd short film that featured his `` glasses '' character on Kino . I'm not going to spoil anything, but I just wanted to mention a great, great film. This one's got some great comedy elements to it as well. Harold Lloyd, the great one, as the narrator tells us about what's happening in his life. But as a lot of things in his world, it's pretty dreary. You know that the guy loves life, loves his work and wants to be loved by the best people, and that he's a genius.

This was shown on a premium channel , so I did n't realise it was made for TV . Even with that it would have been better to get it made in colour rather than black and white , this would have allowed it to stand out more. I do like the design though , although I do wish it would have been more animated . But I understand that was a budget issue, and a lot of the film was shot as a live action short . Overall a nice little animation with a good story and some good visuals !

With its ww2 timing , falling in and out of love , and easy on the eye Kira , this film has been the one of the top movies in the box office since it came out. This movie takes a look back at a period of time which is really interesting to me. A period that I feel that we as an american community has a lot to be proud of. I have come to the point that I really love this country and the people in it. And I don't want to take it back, like some of the other movies on this list do.

I do not find this show at all funny. I actually think it is much worse than any of the other terrible Disney channel sit-coms right now. Charlotte Arnold is an interesting choice to play Sadie, because she can't act. The jokes on this show are terribly unfunny, and it makes it even worse when the only cast member that has a little bit (and I mean little bit) of acting talent is Justin Bradley as Sadie's brother Hal. Jasmine Richards and Michael D'Ascenzo portray Sadie's friends. There both really stupid and just terrible actors.

Well , that was sure a waste of Dave McKean 's talents , was n't it ? Do n't get the wrong idea , because Dave's got a good story or two to tell, n' all the rest of us have 'nuff of that stuff at this point . He's got a new show up on Netflix , and he's also got a book in the works . And , if I'm not mistaken , he also got another TV show in the works , which is also set in Texas . So , we'll see if this is just a temporary setback for McKean , or a permanent one .

One should not be too critical about the director 's second feature.I really like the camera work of Madiba .I liked the film a lot. It is one that should be seen. The script is pretty good, not so good. It is good enough to give Madiba the Oscar. But he should have given the screenplay to the screenwriter of The Bridge on the River Kwai , which is a far better script, because that is what it is. I am glad that the movie has got so much success, so I can watch it twice, because it is a great movie .

Some of the secondary actors try, really hard. And camera shots in the desert are quite lovely. Otherwise, this film is horrible.William Shatner's character, Harvey, is an amateur screenwriter. He's also a psychopath, a man who quite literally escapes from a mental institution. Is the point of this film that amateur screenwriters are psychopaths? Harvey will do anything to get his script read and turned into a movie, even if that means taking a film crew hostage. Do amateur screenwriters ... grovel? Maybe they do.The film's setup is way too long.

Did people expect `` Jurassic Park 3 '' to be full of surprises ? Not one moment of it is. That's why they're called surprise 'sequels'. It is a fact that all three films are the same. It would take all three films over a weekend to change any aspect of this movie, except for the last few minutes where the dinosaurs come out to play, which is totally predictable, but good. What I found most surprising is the last few minutes, where all the survivors are reunited, and are united in a common goal to take back the island from the dinosaurs.

The first review I saw of this on IMDB says that Vince Vaughn is a much better actor than Anthony Perkins was in this role. Makes me wonder if he saw the original. It's tough to review Psycho if you don't have the perspective of how revolutionary the movie was in 1960. You have a heroine who isn't very likable and is killed not far into the movie and a villain who is creepy, but makes you feel for him. Add to that some graphic violence and you have a blue print for some of the slasher films of the 80s and 90s.Where does this film go wrong?

This is the worst movie that I have ever seen . At first i thought that it was going to be good movie . But after that,i realized that this movie is not a good movie. This movie was just a waste of time . I have watched this movie more than a thousand times. It is amazing! The story is very realistic and you feel a part of the story from the beginning till the end. The acting was so realistic that when I was watching the movie for more than an hour, I could feel the stress from the actors and the director.

I 'm pleased that this was the work of foreign cinematographers because it ca n't be accused of unfair bias. Not only is it a wonderful, heart-pounding action sequence, but you'll notice it also includes some moments of beautiful, intimate cinematography. You can stream the film on Netflix, Amazon Prime, and Youtube, so you can watch it at your leisure. I recommend the latter two, especially if you are a movie buff (like me). You may want to check out some of the previous episodes of the series, like the first two episodes.

It might be that the film I saw was entirely different from the one that the others saw , however I’m fairly certain that the film I saw wasn’t any old movie. In fact it was a copy of the film that was made during one of the most significant periods in the film industry history, The Golden Age. The Golden Age occurred between the 1930s, when films had a mass appeal to the general public. In fact The Golden Age actually began with the silent film era in 1915 and ran through into 1932.

This film is not only the last piece of the Three Colours trilogy , but also the best of the trilogy. It is so well shot and edited that I found myself holding back on the tears. There are many scenes in this film where the camera is not just a prop but it’s very own character. From the opening shots to the final one, it’s a true masterpiece. You can read our review here and our thoughts here . But, for this review I want to go into it from an entirely different perspective and show you the entire film in one paragraph .

In this film, we're invited to observe the descent into a moral and emotional funk of someone who isn't likable to start with. What was the point of making the film, then? To show that it would have been better not to have had IN COLD BLOOD - a book I admire, incidentally - in order to have kept our hero's integrity intact? Hardly. He behaves at the party at the start of the film exactly in the same way he behaves after his triumphant reading from the book, so his degradation is a matter of degree.

After the failure of "Hellraiser III: Hell On Earth," the chapter that served as a kind of 'death blow' to the franchise, another embarrassing cheapo cash-in did not come as a surprise. An abysmal attempt to explain every single mystery of Pinhead and the puzzle box, covering literally centuries of history, in a film that runs UNDER 90 minutes... On display is sub-par to wretched acting, sup-par to wretched B-movie special effects, and a ludicrous and insulting attempt at dark humour, while STILL attempting to keep the whole project completely serious.

oh well ... its funny . should have been a sadistic comedy , a lot of horror movies lack common sense . but then again , most of it is not my favorite horror movies in any case . this was a very enjoyable watch and it would be interesting to know if there was a sequel . hope so , it had the potential to be something very unique and enjoyable , even for those who hated the first movie . so , what did you think , did you enjoy it ? did you love it ? and will it get another sequel , 
if yes , please do let us know the title .

I really love this movie. It has a very real feel to it. I believe it was never popular because of the subject matter, however, because of the subject matter, it makes the movie all that much more important.This is an "A" movie and I recommend it highly. If you liked "1984" book or movie, I think you will like this one as well.This is harsh, to say the least, including mental and physical acts of torture, some pretty vile. Not for the week at heart or stomach.

I saw this piece of pseudo-intellectual crap a couple of years ago , and it is now making a comeback. I have to say, if I ever have to read an essay from a guy who doesn't have a clue about economics, I will write him off as an idiot. Of course he would be an idiot, that's the point. Any idiot knows that if he doesn't have a clue about economics, it's because he's trying to make up for it by being a know-it-all with a degree in Economics. He won't know how the system works.

I first saw this film in 1980 and it touched a cord which reminded me of a more innocent time when films didn’t seem so dark and serious. It’s so easy to dismiss this kind of film, I’ll have to admit, when the subject is one we all can relate to; but this film is one of those I really wish I had seen earlier (if I had, it would have been far better). This film, written and directed by John Boorman, has won many awards.

I lay the blame for The Comebacks on anyone who enjoyed Date Movie and Epic Movie . You people encouraged it and even gave it a bad rap. You liked it. And if you liked it so much, you’d never think that it could ever be used as a basis for a movie like The Hangover — and I don’t think The Hangover could have been made without that movie, by the way. And the same for The Hangover Part II. And it’d never have been made had the movie not been available.

Naach would have won an Razzie for the Worst Film in 2004 ( may be overall too ) if it hadn't been in an "R" rated, PG film category. It is a low budget film, which makes it all the more surprising to see an R and an A in the film's cast. I thought it would have a little more traction at the box office. In any case, I will watch it soon, but I'm not holding out hope that a sequel/prequel or remake might come about.

I really hated this movie and it's the first movie written by Stephen King that I didn't finish. I was truly disappointed, it was the worst crap I've ever seen. What were you thinking making three hours out of it? It may have a quite good story, but actors? No. Suspense? No. Romance? No. Horror? No. It didn't have anything.It's got this strange, crazy science man with Einstein-hair, the classic thing. Not real at all. And a man keep getting younger all the time.

At the bottom end of the apocalypse movie scale is this piece of pish called 'The Final Executioner ' .. I guess I could be wrong, but I don't see this as a bad movie. For a while, it seemed like the movie was going in a totally wrong direction as I watched, but then it was all right, and finally I couldn't tell where it was going, and that made me more confused than the beginning of the movie. It is hard to get to know this movie without knowing the original plot.

`` Love Life '' explores a very culturally relevant scenario of a marriage of convenience between a lesbian and a straight woman. The film begins with a montage of images of women dressed in the Victorian costume of their time. The film shows that in Victorian times women were supposed to wear a corset, and this is one of several references to sexuality and sexuality in general throughout the film. The film shows that it is possible to be attracted to women of all races and ethnic groups, but this is only possible if the men are of their own race or if the woman is a white woman.

A Cryptozoologist captures a mythical chupacabra on a Caribbean island.To get it back to civilization he bribes his way onto one of the boats that takes them back to the mainland. What he finds out about the mysterious beast is not what he expected, and what comes next changes everything for him. I have never been to Jamaica before but I've been to St. Barts a few times and have always had a good time. Last time I visited I stayed in a villa on Paradise Island, which is really the only island that I know of that has an actual beach.

Death Camp Opera: Right Here, Right Now!Ten years ago, I read that a very special movie had been directed about the polarization of our society. A certain Peter Watkins was the author. His picture was acted by some non-professional actors, citizens like you and me and others. The violence of the atmosphere was described as extremely realistic. Was it a movie, a documentary? Both actually.Over the years, I realized how hard it was to find it. Maybe I would, by coincidence? Anyway, it's yet an old story. I saw it a short while ago.

I just recently stumbled upon this show when ABC family had an all day marathon before season 2 premiered. I remember seeing previews for the show back in 2007, and thought it would be short lived, and not very well written, because it was on ABC Family.Never doubt an ABC family show! This show surprised me in the best way possible. Not only is the show well written, story lines are realistic, funny, and enjoyable. I was expecting a lot of talk about relationships, something like "this guy dated that girl who dumped me for that kid...

It´s long time that I and my wife didn´t see such a boring thriller. It´s definitively NOT a gripping story and it is paced so slowly that we nearly fell asleep. This could be instead a very low budget TV crime series. There are some ridiculous scenes like the one where mafia boss Pirano wants to see the jury lady in a red clothes or another mafioso cannot stop to think about her and so on. Okay perhaps this should have been a romantic thriller but believe me you really don´t miss anything. We gave 4/10.

I had never heard of this film and only got it because I am a Martin Sheen fan . Now, I am a bit more than a little skeptical about his acting abilities and this is not the kind of movie where I can take him seriously. But, this is the type of film I watch to escape the reality of daily life and I have to admit, it was a pretty good escape . Story : The film is based on the novel “In the Heat of the Day” by James M. Cain, which is a historical novel that was published in 1953.

Director Jeremiah Checheck who brought us big budget debacles like "The Avengers" and the remake of "Diabolique" has directed this ripoff of the Die Hard concept, done on - what looks like - a Blair Witch budget. A California nuclear reactor is overtaken by Arab terrorists. But - are you ready? - the terrorists aren't Arab; they're really disgruntled American soldiers masquerading as Arabs! We find out that they don't really intend to blow up the reactor just make a statement. We're not sure what the statement is but never mind.

I say Ben Johnson and my fellow Canadians say , `` Ben Johnson ? ! '' - he was a good hockey player, but he didn't score enough goals, didn't fight enough and didn't win too many fights. - That's why we elected him, as Prime Minister, to lead the country. - And the country elected him as a member of parliament to be their Prime Minister, because we elected him as a member of parliament who had the courage and conviction to say we will fight to win and he has the courage and conviction to say we will fight to win.

Screen treatment of the comedic Broadway success `` The Gay Divorce '' ( a title which was considered too scandalous to be used, hence the `Gay Divorce' ) was handled by the film's producer, Irwin Winkler (no relation, of course). The screenplay was written by Robert Asahina. Winkler and director John Huston were involved from the beginning. The budget was not high, $200,000 for two weeks in New York City, plus the expense of travel to San Francisco. At the studio, the first thing to do was to decide who should direct this film.

Wow , this is in my opinion the best sitcom since Friends . If you have had a crap day and just need something fun to laugh at , give this a look . It’s that good ! This is a pretty good show in my honest opinion. The writing is great, the music is very good and the premise is clever. What I like about the show is that it seems to be set in a time in which there’s so few shows like this in the United States anymore, and yet it continues to have that quality to it.

Okay , enough . Every time I think I 've seen a film that is so misbegotten , so bad it makes me ill , I think I 've seen it . You 're the first director ever to make this film . It's not only a masterpiece , it 's a masterpiece with style . I don't think any film ever has had such a unique vision . I don't think there's another film with this level of style , or this level of substance . It's an absolute treat . It'll take a few hours to watch it .

I'm sure there is a documentary amongst the ruins of this Yawn-fest somewhere, given enough time maybe the producers could find it. I do not connect with any of the characters. This is a problem for a documentary. That disconnection soon festers into a complete animosity bordering on hostility. Although because of the poor story flow, I'm not really sure what is happening to them and what are the consequences of whatever it is they are trying to do. The story and faces jump around so quickly it is very hard to completely understand what is going on.

This film is a cash in. A cash in reliant on a rousing theme tune created for an earlier classic. Yul Brynner has long since jumped ship and so have most of the production values. Lee Van Cleef takes over the lead role of Chris. I can't think of any actor who looks less like Brynner than Van Cleef. Hey, he could have at least shaved off his hair and lost the moustache, just for the sake of continuity. Some correctional centres show this movie in order to punish offenders. One step out of line and The Magnificent Seven Ride!

I only wish there was a grade lower than F to give it! i scored it a 1 in the vote tally.I am grading this not even as a regular film,but as a T&A film,and this is the worst,lamest,crappiest and most awful movie i've seen.the acting,story and music are all terrible,not to mention there isn't even any nudity for the T&A connisuer.it's about a male cheerleader and the viewer is made to sit through many painful scenes of him doing cheers.avoid this piece of trash at all cost!

I am a chess player and I wanted to like this film. Trouble is, the content could have been fitted in a 30-minute documentary.There were lots of shots of corridors being walked down and Kasparov gazing out in the hall where he won the World Championship. There were other shots of Kasparov being walked round the site of the 1997 match and being told where he sat and where Deep Blue was located. This just looked like filler.Also, I didn't find it interesting to see in detail where Deep Blue was now and seeing an IBM techie trying, unsuccessfully to 'open' it.

If you wish to have a truly traumatic experience , than this awful motion picture ( if you may consider it that, or even not ) may well be the very same. The very first time i saw this film , I was at a friends place and saw it. I had not really heard of it, but at that time it was very fresh. I didn't know anything about it and watched it the next day. I felt a really strange feeling inside, i was shocked by it and thought, what i did not know?

William Petersen (that C.S.I guy) has a small uncredited role but it's the best part of the movie. His character comes across smart ass and tough, and it's a fun surprise to see him in this. He has a range that allows him to play just about anything. After his 5 minutes, it goes from looking cool to just nothing much. It leaves you hoping that his character will reappear in the movie but after 20 minutes you give up hope. The movie itself is pretty poor. Worth a watch on TMN or a pick up at the library but not much more.

It's hard to believe that there are some people out there in the world that actually think this is a worthy Charles Bronson vehicle. Bronson is a good actor that can do more than tote a gun and knock off bad guys. He was quietly moving in the TV movie "Yes Virginia, There is a Santa Claus" and showed a lot of class and style in the Sean Penn-directed "The Indian Runner".In "The Evil That Men Do", however, Bronson again plays a character that sees injustice and sets it right with fists, knives and, of course, guns.

Another nice entry in the Crime Doctor series [#4/10], with atmospheric almost noirish black and white photography and some splendid Spanish American backdrops and sets. And a more off-the-wall storyline too!A man who looks like the insane murderer of his first two wives is found dead in a locked room after a dramatic dinner party. The Crime Doctor is on the scene (ostensibly as a guest) to immediately and resignedly proclaim it murder, and so we are presented with a quite weird set of people to mull over, for one of them did the deed.

I 'm sorry , but I can not understand what people were smoking when they wrote how great they thought they were, or what they were doing , or even what is the purpose of life, or anything like that. Some of us think it is because you can not read or see what people are thinking about, but you can still understand what they really feel. So I am writing this so we can start a dialogue, and you will be surprised with what you will learn about yourself, how your thoughts are influenced by how others see you, and how you look at everything.

Another nice entry in the Crime Doctor series [ # 4/10 ] , with atmospheric almost noirish black and white artwork. As with most entries, this one has a little something for everyone - action, romance, adventure, murder and more - all wrapped up with a well-done story, and a good enough ending to make it at least an entertaining read. I am a bit sad, that this entry is only a 2/10, as it's such a gem in my bookshelf. [ #1/10]

A pretty decent entry, but not a classic - more like a good, but not all-out classic.

Mr Bean was great fun , i loved it , every episode was really funny , Rowan Atkinson was perfect in the lead role , and it would be a crime to replace him with someone else , especially since Atkinson is British . It had everything , from comedy , to romance , to drama , a very funny story , great acting , some great acting performances from a great actor , great music , a very interesting and exciting story , a very happy ending , well worth watching and i would love to see Rowan in another series , it was the perfect summer tv show .

What on earth happened to RGV ? There are so many things wrong about this movie that one needs to have seen it in order to understand how bad it was. Let’s begin with the acting. The characters are so over-acted that I don’t blame the director at all. The actors were good enough to give the movie a good shot in the arm, but once the plot got going, the show went down the drain. One could forgive the actors for a good performance here and there, but over all they just gave this movie a negative review.

What a silly movie. While it looks nice, it doesn't make a lot of sense. On the one hand, the film suggests that Juana's "madness" was that she was just a woman ahead of her time. On the other hand, she has an obsession that is right out of the worst Victorian novel of the wronged woman, and that does seem a sort of mental problem, like Miss Havesham in a castle. This movie is what Elizabeth would have been if Elizabeth had not been able to get past Essex's sexual attraction.

I saw this in a preview screening and have to say that this documentary style movie is the biggest load of tripe I have ever seen.Completely unfunny, low budget, boring, rubbish script, terrible acting - The entire audience (young and old) sat through the film comatose without laughing for most of it... there were literally only about 2 places you will laugh in the entire movieMany people left halfway - Can't blame them... I stayed thinking that the film would pick up, however, it never did and I wish I'd left.

This was a great movie for being only 67 minutes long. There was an aspect of film-noir contained in this movie and I am glad that Nolan picked to film it in black and white. The plot is simple yet entertaining that keeps you engaged. Even the dialogue was good along with the acting. It reminded me of what was to come in Memento by not being in chronological order. I liked how the main character tried to use what Cobb taught him for example saying "everyone has a box" which he put his personal things into.

Oh how awfully this movie is ! I do n't know if it is a horror film or a drama film... I was a little bit confused at first when I was watching this movie for the first time and then I understood it... I enjoyed this movie very very much... I would rate this movie as one of the best movies I've ever watch... and that's it for now I hope you'll enjoy watching this movie and I'll give you a review in the next day or two of this movie....

This movie has to be the worst film I have seen . There is a reason it was made to be a sequel and I hope it is because the original was good . I really wanted to like it but I couldn't . The cast is great with the likes of Tom Hanks and Steve Martin . I wish I could say the plot was good . The story is just all wrong . I didn't hate the movie and I am still enjoying it . It is not bad at all and it is a great movie .

I supposed 'Scarecrow Gone Wild ' is a dull slasher flick . Yes , it have some good point ,but I just can't imagine that it is more than it is. This movie just plain sucks, with no redeeming qualities. If I had to make a list on it's merits, it'd probably be:1) The gore is decent2) The kills are not as cool as the ones in The Crow3) The characters are annoying4) The special effects are not great5) The ending is not satisfying. And that is probably a short list of things I hated about the film.

One Life Stand is an accomplished piece of film making which hasn't been given the credit it deserves. Its IMDB rating of 1.7 doesn't do it justice and is, perhaps, due to the very few screenings it has had rather than the quality of the film itself. Shot on digital in black and white, the film is well directed with production values that belie its shoestring budget. The performances are excellent, particularly that of Gary Lewis who gets better with every role. My only criticisms are that it is a bit on the long side and could have done with a touch more humour to offset the darker moments.

`` Scientists at a remote lab experiment on ( insert scaly creature here ) and create out of control monsters. Scientists discover a mysterious alien race that can take over the planet and kill the populace in a matter of days. The aliens are eventually defeated by a team of scientists working in concert. The movie ends on a positive note when the alien race is wiped out and a human race is created. The movie has no real plot, just a bunch of plot twists and turns involving aliens, government conspiracies, and super cool alien monster creatures. 3.

The story told by The Cranes are Flying is not , admittedly , all that original . Young lovers are reunited with the man of their lives, the man who has gone missing in the woods . It is a story of love, heartbreak, survival, and a whole lotta blood and guts . It is the story of my life and I am telling it all . But the truth is not all that compelling. There's a lot of heartache, but only a few tears. Saturday, October 24, 2008

I'm trying to think up something to blog about .

the actors cannot act. all dialoague was plagued with bad accents and loss of character. Channing Tatum never moves his lips or changes his facial expression... EVER.the story is nothing new at all. some kid from the street gets involved in a professional world of dance and it turns his life around. that coupled with the whole incident involving the little kid is taken straight from You Got Served and Save the Last Dance (I'm not saying that those movies were any good either, but that is to say that this movie brought nothing new to the table).and the dancing...

I love Ustinov's distinctive, literate narration. And the photography is quiet nice. We put the film on for our 3.5 year old who sort of wandered in and out of the room. So for our first viewing, we only saw about 1/3 of the movie and were quite charmed. When we re-watched, sitting down for family time,we were all mortified at the violence and life-threatening situations the poor otter got into. About halfway through the movie, there's a rack of dead, bloody furry animals. Lots of blood, not just a little.

To paraphrase the previous reviewer's comments, if you're a Stooges fan, avoid this one at all costs! My basic question is, being the experienced troopers of comedy that Moe and Larry were, why did they insist on attempting to continue the act when it was so obvious that their home studio, Columbia, was so clearly not interested in giving them serious writers and veteran comedy directors? This movie plays like someone who's giving a pale imitation of the trio and you can see how very hard Moe and Larry are working to make every little bit of slapstick relevant.

Oh , my . Oh , this is a * really * bad movie . The acting is absolutely atrocious and the editing is horrible . The plot has * absolutely * no * sense . * The only * real * part * of this movie is that * you . *

The plot :

* It starts out with a man and a woman . * They meet * and fall in * love * and then he dies and she goes to hell * and then * he goes * to * hell and then she gets * all * the way * to * heaven .

I'm a Christian, and I have watched pretty of Christian movies, but this one is too bad. They try to make this good, but it's too hard for them I think.- You can see the film is badly dubbed in many places. - You can almost think that the mainpersons in this film was the only ones left behind. I think there will be a lot more of them.- The quality is poor, and the acting could have been better too. The story is not so very bad, but could've been better.

This event defined an era of wrestling entertainment that, I believe, is not equaled today. The colorful characters - in their stereotypical garb - brought a certain charm to the show that has since been raped by society and overexposed. Wrestling had a bit of an innocence back then. A kid could watch it without watching an episode of Jerry Springer.Looking back now (I was 5 at the time), although I loved both Warrior and Hogan, I think I enjoyed Warrior more because of his mystique. Hogan was the branded hero who weilded an impressive public image.

This one is a poor attempt at spinning the old `` cons turn good '' yarn , which we have all seen before , and is more than a little embarrassing for someone trying to get a career started as a professional writer . There are several issues with this story and it would be good to see the author re-examine what they have written for the last time and take the time and make some changes. One of the biggest issues I have with the story is that it is not clear to the reader why the police were interested in this case.

Do all spoof films require pure stupidity and a lack of ANY sort of intelligence whatsoever to the humour ? The only thing I see wrong with these spoof films is that they are based on a TV show of some sort. No one is saying these films have to be realistic, but that they don't have TOO much to rely upon, and that to a large extent, the humour is pure stupid. Which isn't necessarily a bad thing because they could be just as realistic, but they wouldn't necessarily be funny.

I will never, ever forget watching this show around the age of 13. Even at the young age I remember thinking, "This is a Baywatch rip off show without the one thing that makes Baywatch tolerable. The girls in bathing suits." Nonetheless I was too small in those days to be the holder of the remote in my house. The high point of Pacific Blue was an episode in which a couple of thugged out gangsters are coming to whack someone with submachine guns ... on bikes!!! As a thirteen year old I never laughed so hard at something that was supposed to be taken seriously.

Well , after the hype surrounding the film and after Surya labeling the film as PATH-BREAKING , I went into the film expecting nothing special. However after watching it I got a new found appreciation and I found it to be absolutely amazing. The film is as beautiful as I could have expected from it's trailer . I can't recommend this movie highly enough. There are some parts that are not for everyone, but overall you won't regret watching it at all. For those who don't have much knowledge of Bollywood, you will absolutely have a different view after watching this one.

If you just want gore , and nothing but gore and torture , you 've come to the right movie. The torture sequence alone can't be topped for sheer intensity. The torture scenes are so bloody , and violent , and graphic that it's not even funny. When the main characters escape , they take the only weapon on their side , and they've got it pointed right at their torturer. It's a bloody mess. The only good thing I can think of about this movie is how bloody it is. This is a really, really good film.

Okay it is terribly , and I mean terribly , easy to pick apart this film . C'mmon what do we have to lose ? I just want to get past that and get to the meat of it ! At least not in such a stupid way ! This film, is like a very simple puzzle where you try to put as many pieces together as you possibly can in a way that you are sure it makes perfect sense at the end. This way it doesn't lose you in a haze of logic, and you have an idea of where you might go with the puzzle at the end .

What can I say about a movie as bad as this? The people who made this movie, didn't even try to make the monster in it look realistic. You never see more than its head, and the head is just a giant puppet that has little movement except for when it opens it mouth to roar. And the sound they used for the roaring is the best part. At many points in the movie it sounds exactly like a TIE fighter flying over! I couldn't believe that when I first heard it and had to rewind several times to make it sink in.

I think `` category 6 : day of destruction '' was very unrealistic . The digital effects where like a dream and they were beautiful . Very very talented . I hope this game will get a sequel as well . Very much hope that it will be more realistic as the last one was . As well I want it to be made by the same people and I know they will make the game . I will be the first to back the team for the game as I know they will do a great job . I know I will get a sequel but I hope it does not end like the last one did .

Anastasia : The Mystery of Anna was a two-part star studded historical T.V . movie based on the Peter Kurth novel "Anna and the Greek". The plot involved a beautiful woman named Anna who left her husband to go off to college and fall in with a group of men. After several encounters with them Anna begins to feel like she's part of something, something she couldn't even imagine as a girl, but then she realizes it's something a lot bigger then her little fantasy and decides to make her own way as she goes to college and finds herself getting involved with a very large group of men.

Now I 'm a big animation fan -- love Svankmeyer and usually am into all applications of stop motion so this was the one I had been looking for! I was drawn into the world and was amazed to learn that there are more than 100,000 stops made each year on a professional studio set. There are a couple of issues I had with this program:

I had an issue of the program freezing up. It took me a while to figure out why. I was able to figure out what was happening by doing a bit of research, but not all of it, but enough to know what was happening.

First of all I hate those moronic rappers, who could'nt act if they had a gun pressed against their foreheads. All they do is curse and shoot each other and acting like cliché'e version of gangsters.The movie doesn't take more than five minutes to explain what is going on before we're already at the warehouse There is not a single sympathetic character in this movie, except for the homeless guy, who is also the only one with half a brain.Bill Paxton and William Sadler are both hill billies and Sadlers character is just as much a villain as the gangsters.

When watching this movie, with it's deterministic cause and effect, wall-to-wall clichés and hackneyed sentiment, can anyone be so naive as to think that this is actually how Barrie's life played out? You watch it in a posture of disagreement. Hollywood biopics aren't based on the individual lives anymore, they're just rewrites of previously successful biopics. If Hollywood made a movie about your life it would be filled with such perfect synchronization that you'd barely recognize your own story. Any personal complexity would be obliterated by some all-explaining, simplistic backstory.

This is a truly terrible sci-fi/horror film from 1957 . In fact , despite Ed Wood , Jr.and his dreadful dialogue and acting , it may be the worst sci-fi film in the history of film . Ed Wood, Jr . (played by Alan Ladd) is the owner of a local cinema and is trying to run a business . He’s a successful businessman and he has to find a suitable movie to show a couple of young couples . Ed and his partner Bill (Lloyd Hughes) go into the cinema every Friday night with their wives and children .

See Three Colors : Blue and Three Colors : White . They are both wonderful films and will give an excellent introduction to the color theory. What I liked in these films is that the two films have so much to offer that they will give the audience something different. One film which I liked very much was, Three Colors : Blue, and the other one which I liked less is Two Colors : Blue. The one film which was disappointing is, Color of the Wind. In Color of the Wind, the colors don't go together well at all.

This movie is such a fine example of the greatness that is 80's entertainment. Oh don't get me wrong, most of the music back then sucked. I only ever liked the metal bands from the 80s. Bands that had some balls. Forget that whiny keyboard crap and all that 'life is horrible and I want to die' garbage. But the movies from the 80's are the best. They were all about nonsense and just having a good time. This movie exemplifies that! Party! Get naked! Get laid! WOOOOOOHOOOOO!

Rififi , directed by Jules Dassin , is in line with the Melville crime pictures ( particularly Bob le Flameur ) because of its central character , a detective played by Richard Widmark who is also a poet. The movie is in part a mystery story but has more depth to it with Widmark himself taking center stage and a strong cast that also includes George Sanders as his partner in the homicide squad. George Sanders stars as Detective Rififi , the lead detective on the police force in the small fictional city of Los Angeles. The story of the movie is centered around the characters and themes of grief and death.

This movie is great . 80 's sleazy slasher movie about three kids born during an eclipse , so they are born into a world of vampires . There is also a big plot twist that you don't get in the film . It takes place during a time when the vampire world is about to be destroyed and the kids have the ability to see into the future with a human eye , but are still afraid to use the power . They use it to watch over people and try to stop the vampires . The movie is very good with the actors .

I saw this movie on my flight from Philly to Denver . The screen was three rows in front of me , and it only took 30 minutes. It is an incredible film, and I was extremely impressed. The story is about a man and woman who have been in love and are now married. The man is a cop, and has just been fired after a drug bust. He lives with his ex-wife, and his daughter. One day he goes into the bar where his old girlfriend lives. He tells her he's going back to his ex.

First of all, let me just say that after watching this movie I felt like I'd been sold a bill of goods. Mind you it's not the movie's fault that IMDb has it listen as a comedy first and a horror second (although I don't know how that's entered...maybe some moron from the film's crew put it in). Being a fan of the horror/comedy genre, I checked it out based on that and I'm so, so sorry I did. Where to start? First of all, to touch back on my beginning, there's no comedy in this movie.

Yes, it's a SBIF (So Bad It's Funny) classic.
