I liked the film, I enjoyed it a lot. But the plot was a bit too complex to understand for me.

Found this film for one dollar ( $ 1.00 ) and the film was a complete waste of time . i was so excited when i saw this film for just one dollar but as soon i saw it i knew this movie was going to be total garbage 
when i saw it you would think that it was a hollywood movie . the acting was great , the music was great , the plot was great but unfortunately this movie sucked the whole time . first of all this movie was so boring , second of all i was so excited when i found this for one dollar .

If you had asked me how the movie was throughout the film, I would have told you it was great! However, I left the theatre feeling unsatisfied. After thinking a little about it, I believe the problem was the pace of the ending. I feel that the majority of the movie moved kind of slow, and then the ending developed very fast. So, I would say the ending left me disappointed.I thought that the characters were well developed. Costner and Kutcher both portrayed their roles very well. Yes! Ashton Kutcher can act!

Well , the Sci-Fi channel keeps churning these turkeys out ... and they seem to get worse every time . First, they started with The Outer Limits in the early '70's. They did it again in the mid '90s, but this time they started with the Alien movies and the second half of Alien Resurrection, and the result is a movie called Alien Resurrection , which is very bad indeed. The movie has a plot where the "Alien" is resurrected from stasis, but it turns out the "Alien" doesn't actually want to be dead.

ROCK STAR is a well-told Hollywood-style rendition of the tale based on fact actually on how Ripper became Rob Halford and the stories surrounding his rise to success. For those who aren't up on the band, it's easy enough to see who they play for. This is not your average "rock n' roll band" that you might have heard of in the past; this band is no "rock n' rollers". These guys are not the typical guys who you would think would have been able to play a song like this; this band actually knows how to play.

I recently viewed a copy of this (under the title 'Eaten Alive') Talk about dreadful! Any movie Ed Wood ever put out looks like Oscar material compared to this laughable tosh. To be fair a couple of lines from the script will live long in the memory such as "These people (Cannibals) don't buy frozen meat from a supermarket like us, they get it fresh everyday from folk like you or me" Classic! The mad 'Jonesville' type leader out in the jungle was the best character in the film, he really did look like a nutter.

Such pain ! Pain in the shape that it had promise in its central idea , but it never fully arrived. I would rather go to a place in my mind where the pain has never been felt than to a place where there is nothing but pain. That’s it. Pain is nothing but that. It is not an entity , but rather the absence of something . It is the same with pain in your body. It is not what you feel there in the flesh, but that which has not been felt.

Being a big fan of Stanley Kubrick 's Clockwork Orange there was of course `` no question about it '' that he was the master of cinema. In fact one of his best works is the movie `` Eyes Wide Shut '. It's about a beautiful woman who was betrayed by her lover and was killed by a man who had no idea she was there. Kubrick has chosen as the best actress of his era, Marilyn Monroe, for his new film and it's been a long time since she's starred in a major Hollywood movie.

I 've never understood this type of spoof movies . You get some serious/semi-serious movie that everyone knows about and then you have this movie made by a bunch of guys that have to take some ridiculous/ridiculous plot points that aren't even remotely believable . Then, it ends up having a very bad/very bad ending because all of the stupid plot points make everything else totally un-believable . Like , "I thought that it was all a hoax/fantasy , when it turns out that there actually is a real world/fantasy world that is happening in this movie/comedy movie ?" . I don't understand the appeal to these types of movies.

Christopher Nolan's first feature film wowed critics who saw it when it first came out. Shot on a micro budget of $6,000 this is a student film with real class. The film is shot in black and white, and features people who you assume are friends of Nolan's appearing in the movie. This is not to say they are bad actors because they are quite good. You could see Jeremy Theobald and Alex Haw appearing in other projects but unfortunately they haven't since this was made 6 years ago.Nolan's thriller, much like Memento, does not play chronologically, it shifts the scenes around much like Pulp Fiction.

This movie was probably one of the worst movies I 've seen in a very long time . A friend told me that I need to get off my butt and watch it, so it 's on the DVD . I can't say that I'm surprised, but I 'm sure glad I saw it , I think that was an awful movie . This movie has not a single thing to do with it 's original story , I think it 's supposed to be a remake of some other movie that 's been beaten to death , I mean there's no original story at all , it just rehashes some movie .

Just want to inform you guys that this movie was actually pretty good !!! Thought it was a lame ass movie, but not at all, many moments in this movie wore pretty horrifying. This movie has enough blood, gore, and some sexy make out scenes of course, to keep any horror buff like me 100% satisfied! The cast was also pretty good IMO. Even though its not a high budget movie, the effects wore definitely kinda creepy sometimes. Worth watching if u like a kick ass horror movie thats for sure!

Don ` t be fooled into thinking that this is a remake as in this years remake of THE TIME OF THE DEAD. The concept is original and the story and the acting is very good and if you liked the original you` ll love this one and I do hope that it comes out well. In this new version the plot is just a lot shorter and is not as involved and the ending of the film is not quite what the viewer expects in terms of the end. But this is still an enjoyable and enjoyable movie.

Most American remakes of European films are pretty poor , but this is in a league of its own . If you are a fan of British film , you would be familiar with this one . And I would bet that this will also be the one you will refer to first when someone asks you what kind of films you like . This is one that is often overlooked by film critics , not because its quality is poor, but rather because of the amount of hype it gets . When you watch this film for the first time , it makes it seem like something special .

"Disappointing" is the best word I could think for this film, especially considering the glowing reviews it receives from some other users.One thing that really spoils the film is that it is unabashedly partial(in both senses of the word). Not only does it present a very selective description of the games (focussing as it does on the US athletics team) but it also contains several inaccuracies, most of which serve to exaggerate the difficulties the US team faced.What is even more disturbing is that all the omissions and mistakes (?

What a travesty of movie ratings injustice - a 2.1 on the IMDb scale as I write this . Folks, what was I thinking in adding this film to my Netflix queue in the first place? I mean, it looks good and all, but it's only rated 2.0 stars. What if I can't get to the theater to see this movie?? What if it turns out I really hate it? I watched the film. I'm not saying that it's bad, per se. It looks good.

I can only say this: ee03128 from Portugal, I couldn't say it better. The worst movie I've ever seen... and I've seen lots of crap! When I read you comment I thought only about the thoughts I had while watching the movie. When I saw who was one of the script writers I understood it. Balagueró uses the same tricks in all his movies. And his scripts are not much better either. And, of course, in Barcelona we have tons of temples and churches around the city so we can keep cursed nuns to scare young Americans coming on vacations.

Well , this movie is really `` PLUMPED '' HAHA Get it ? Thats kinda like the attitude of this movie. Thats what made this movie so great. The acting , cinematography , editing & the music is great . But the story is so bad . The movie is really boring & has nothing new in that story . The movie goes on & on about the life of these 2 people without showing anything . It goes on like 3 hours but you don't get a single good story about them. There is only one main story .

I can't really criticize this film. It is literally the first film I ever remember seeing and lead to a lifelong love of science fiction and horror films and prehistoric animals. Fortunately, seeing it again years later, it held up fairly well. Rod Cameron plays a big game hunter whose last safari was wiped out by mammoths. No one believes him, including his best friend, played by Cesar Romero, whose brother was among those killed. And Rod Cameron was the only survivor. The film was shot in India and has some good scenery. The acting is on a high level.

This is n't a bad TV movie . Shtrafbat is short for Shtrafnoy Batallion , which means Penal Batallion . And Shtrafbatnoy is its Russian equivalent . There are lots of good things in it , though . It was a little slow at the beginning , but it soon settled down . The acting is decent . The cast is filled with actors , who have been making movies for years . The story of the movie goes like this . The movie starts with a military police unit in Moscow , which has been set up to catch thieves .

This is an OK adaptation of the breath taking book of Dan Brown. I can't say it is novel or very good but they made a movie that you can enjoy. Given the excellent story, the result could have been better though. The movie is pretty long but at the end I was feeling like some things were missing. Sound effects and sound tracks were very good. Acting was well done but the character development phase was very weak. For people who didn't read the book, things may look happening too quickly.

This film with fine production values features secrets and how friends use each other . Henry May Long is a young man who is having trouble with the police. He gets caught stealing and gets a jail sentence. His father then dies and he becomes an orphan. The story takes him on a long trip through different countries, with his dog and his girlfriend. You get a great feel of the life that Henry has lived. This movie with good story and fine performances. I would recommend this movie to anyone looking for a story that is very touching and sad.

This is an unusual film because although it was made by Twentieth-Century Fox because it's one of the few pairings of Barbara Stanwyck and her future husband, Robert Taylor. Barbara Stanwyck had been making films for many different studios (RKO, Paramount and Selznick) at about the time she made THIS IS MY AFFAIR, but Taylor was an MGM contract player so he only appeared in this film because he was loaned to Fox--something studios occasionally did during this era.The film is interesting because many real-life people have roles in the film, though the piece is otherwise pure fiction.

Low budget mystery . A shot rattles out of the dark and a woman is seen running from that direction. She does not get far though as she crushes to the ground and a large shadow approaches. A man stands up and takes out a gun and points it at her. He then says something to her and says, “what the hell”. She goes back down. Then he says again, as if to make sure. “What the hell?” The woman responds, as she crawls, “you said ‘what the hell'”.

If you believe that any given war movie can make you really feel the war , you need to see ‘Red Dawn’, the ‘Terminator Salvation’ or ‘Rambo: Last Blood’. There is one war movie which is sure to make you see things clearly, and that is, ‘Gangs of New York’ , a true masterpiece, a great adaptation of a great story , one of the best movies ever made , and not just the best gangster movie , but the best film in the whole history of movies.

As far as I am concerned, this film noir had two totally different things going for it as opposed to the film noirs I am used to viewing: 1 - the setting is Paris, France; 2 - there is 28-minute scene with no dialog.Both make this movie a bit unique, at least to English-speaking film noir fans. Actually, an American, Jules Dussain, shot the film, so it's not entirely a European film. Initially, I was disappointed in this after I had watched the first 40 minutes. It's an expensive DVD and I was bored.

This is a very enjoyable , fluffy , glamorous musical from the 40 's . 'Cover Girl ' made Rita Hayworth a very wealthy woman , and her fame extended to all of Tinseltown . But this version of the story is different from the movie version. 'The Grapes of Wrath' tells the story of an American migrant family who come to California in order to seek work. The film has been well received and it is regarded as ' the best motion picture about migration ever ' . So it is not surprising that this new production is not a direct copy of the original .

Solo is a poor film - that can not be ignored . The acting for the most part is very good but the direction is not that of a master . The character development for most of the characters isn't that great . I thought the film had potential . But overall i thought it was good . Just not my cup of tea in the least . The director should have tried to take it to the next level instead of trying to make it work with what he has in his mind . The ending was not as good as i would have liked .

This movie was much better than I expected . ++++ Jean Peters actually does a passable job as a pirate , even though some of the lines are just silly and predictable . To my surprise she did not appear to have a very good voice for the part . The film was actually quite interesting and I look forward to the sequels . But I was a little let down when the ending was spoiled , and I had not read the book so I knew nothing of the story . And I really do not like that the film was not set on a pirate island , which would have been far less confusing .

I 'm not sure if this is a comedy or not , but I found it pretty comical . Isobel , a young woman who works in a bar and loves her job, is in love with her customer . But she can' t tell him that because it is a secret . He loves the girl but her family doesn't approve . They want her to be with another man . She gets into a terrible fight with her family . Now she has no choice but to stay in her job or go to a brothel . The man who loves her takes her to a brothel .

This movie is a terrible attempt at a spoof. Its attempts to parody various sports movies are half-baked and not at all funny.Even things that should be funny - like the female kicker from India who's always wearing traditional dress over her uniform - aren't really funny. The fact that the football team studies and gets good grades which makes the coach mad didn't get any laughs either.The plot of having a traditional loser get one more chance by coaching a loser high school football team really had potential as a spoof. It's a classic and trite sports theme.

Step Up is a fair dance film about some kids that get their big performance break . The film is about the lives of two best friends on the dance team. We watch the lives of these kids as they grow up with dreams and challenges. And we also get to see the journey of a dancer in search of her own dream. As the story is told, we realize the film is a combination of both real and fictitious parts. We start out by watching the dance team practices at school. This is where the story starts off.

At the bottom end of the apocalypse movie scale is this piece of pish called 'The Final Executioner'.. at least where I come from. A bloke is trained by an ex-cop to seek vengeance on those that killed his woman and friends in cold blood.. and that's about it. Lots of fake explosions and repetitive shootings ensue. Has one of the weirdest array of costumes I've seen in a film for a while, and a massive fortress which is apparently only run by 7 people. GREAT job on the dubbing too guys(!)

This film flopped miserably in the UK, and it didn't deserve to. The trailer of this film is slightly misleading, and I guess it mislead critics and audiences into thinking it was "Atonement: Part 2". While the film was marketed that way to capitalise on the earlier success of Joe Wright's BAFTA-winning film, it's very different in tone. It focuses on an imagination of sorts of Welsh poet Dylan Thomas' life during the Second World War as the writer of propaganda films for the war effort, and his subsequent return to Wales.

A couple of friends and myself visited the video shop a few years back and we were in one of the stores when I decided I had better buy a new VHS player. I didn't really buy any other VHS equipment that day so I had to settle for the new VHS player – which I have since replaced with a Panasonic VX-A35 – but the visit to the video store was the inspiration behind the VHS player I'm building for myself. (You can read my full post on my decision-making process here).

For a really wonderful movie, you could also try seeing the movie about Saint Francis of Assisi - good for any audience. Best thing I liked about this movie was the Mexico landscape, & it gets the movie up to a 2. I was surprised that these actors didn't have terrible sunburn, they were so were not desert dwellers. And Moses is said to have a speakING impediment, but certainly not here. Even the "miracle" scenes were contrived & un-believable. And what's the point if you can belief anything in a TV story?

This is probably the best movie from director Hector Babenco. It shows a Brazilian reality unknown by foreigners, which is the same reality that haunts all of the Latin American countries, poverty and a survival instinct. The most affected in this reality is the children usually left orphans, or abandoned by their poor parents have to make it in a "dog eat dog" society many times falling into the gap of delinquency, prostitution and crime. Very well acted and with a "no frills" approach, this movie will get to you, Great story plot, a must have movie on anybody's collection.

While I hold its predecessor , `` Fast Times At Ridgemont High , '' as a standard to which other stories should aspire, I'd like to share with you the one book that I wish hadn't happened. But it was the right choice, I suppose, given how much of a mess it all was and how far it could have turned out. The film was based on James Thurber's 1952 comic strip "Ridgemont High, Jr." (which itself is based on Thurber's 1930 novel "A Smart Aleck in College ").

It was easy to get lost in the simplicity and light hearted humor of this year's best family film...Grand Champion. The story of a 12 year old boy (Buddy) that with the help of his sister, Mom and best friend is determined to raise a Grand Champion steer. It is a whimsical journey to the big competition. After Hokey Pokey is crowned, Grand Champion, he is auctioned for $775,000. to pay for the kids college education. Buddy finds out that the next time he sees Hokey....it would be on a bun!

Ninja Hunter ( AKA Wu Tang vs Ninja ) is pure entertainment from start to finish due to its outrageous and humorous characters, high production quality, and memorable story. This is the story of Wu Tang and the ninjas – two sides of one coin that meet at the end of this tale. You can download the audio version from the iTunes store, or download the MP3 directly from the source below! Story Summary:

“What makes a man a man?”

A man who is a man, or a man who is one of a kind?

Yeah, I know my title sucks. I couldn't think of any other title. x] Ice is a brilliant first season episode. Very interesting idea and good acting as well. The whole worm-looking-thing was really creepy in my opinion. I've never been a fan of insects, so all the insect episodes are creepy to me. x] Anyway, lets go on to the good and bad things about this episode,The Good: The parasite thing. Awesome!Scully finally trusting Mulder. Awww... <33It was a good idea to put another parasite in the ear.

When Hollywood is trying to grasp what an `` intelligent person '' is like , they fail so miserably , they ought to get the idea that a `` human '' is a being who does not want to be made a slave by an intelligent being , and so he has no choice in the matter. He must do the intelligent thing , no matter what the intelligent thing is, but he never gets to choose. He never can. And that is why intelligent people often are not happy with what they are, because intelligence does not make people happy.

The Love Letter is one of my all-time favorite books, so naturally I was skeptical when I heard it was to become a movie. But, I liked it. I found myself grinning through the entire movie. I admit that it isn't a great movie but definitely a pleasant hour and a half. I thought that Capshaw and Scott were perfect as Helen and Johnny. Just as I pictured them. And the town and scenery were just right as well. I recommend this film, but don't expect too much, just enjoy it.

This is the last film of Krzysztof Kieslowski - one of the greatest directors in the history of cinema . The film had a great plot, but the ending left many people unsatisfied .The film is based on the life of one of the characters from the film "Budapest" . It was a film that was produced for Poland in 1945 . It was very successful at that time . In 1954 , the film was released in the United States . During that time , it was released in America , it made a big box office in New York .

As much as 'The Beginning ' showed that we 're still going to get `` classic '' x-files , Drive Me Insane will make it look like we're never getting rid of them . As with any franchise , Drive Me Insane is not a traditional horror movie, and the plot is far from conventional . What the film does have going for it are a couple of intriguing plot lines ( most notably the question of why a guy is in a deserted building full of women with nothing to do , and that's only the first part of the movie ) .

THE NEXT KARATE KID, in my opinion, is an excellent martial arts flick. I thought that Eric (Chris Conrad) and Julie (Hilary Swank) looked good in their prom attire. To me, Ned (Michael Cavalieri) was a real bully. This was because he got Julie in trouble with Principal Wilkes (Eugene Boles). If you ask me, Colonel Dugan (Michael Ironside) was a pure a******! This was because he was a very harsh man who wouldn't tolerate mistakes.

OK , to start with , this movie was not at all like the book . I read the book , loved it , saw it at the movies many years ago , and I was quite impressed . I saw a few parts of this movie , but I had no idea what to think until I got home and saw this film , and I have to say , I was not impressed at all . I really thought the acting and writing was all very good , but the direction , acting , and editing seemed all amateurish to me .

The first time I ever saw this movie was when I was four years old. I remember loving it and everything about it. 13 years later, I am now 17, and decided to watch it about a month ago because I am taking a 1960's class in school. I didn't really know what to expect, since it had been 13 years since I last saw it, but I was completely blown away by it. The actors were amazing, the music was so fun, and I now find myself singing along to every song.

I was 19 years old when I saw first saw this film , in the theater . I have a hard time remembering when I went to see it , and I don't really know what it was about , since I didn't really pay any attention when watching it . I just remember thinking " this is weird , it is dark , the sound is creepy and it is in black and white ." I was very impressed when I found out the movie was directed by Sam Peckinpah . I have seen some of his films before , and I know he is one of the most difficult directors to like .

I simply cannot understand how any Who fan, or just plain anyone could find this awful, lazy, poorly written abomination even remotely funny. It is so embarrassingly below par that it qualifies as a genuine tragedy. The potential for this was huge, it could have been great. What a shame that all that acting talent, the sets, the props, the goodwill of everyone involved was so pathetically wasted by a script that should have been burned.There is an obvious lack of any rigorous production and quality control here.

First, let me state that I have no idea who Nora Roberts is. So the book may have been great, but the movie isn't.I have spent my entire life living in the Peidmont region of NC. I have never heard southern accents as ridiculous as the ones in this movie. I have lived in two small NC towns and Charlotte and Raleigh. On occasion, you will meet people with a strong southern accent, but I have never encountered a town where everyone talks like a bad imitation of Gone with the Wind.In response to Gore_Won from the atheist community.

"The Journey" is a romantic version of the cold war. It's about an English woman (Deborah Kerr) trying to smuggle her former love, a Hungarian scientist (Jason Robards, Jr.), out of Hungary during the Hungary Revolt in 1956. She's on board a bus with thirteen other international people who are trying to get out of Hungary through the Austrian border.Of course, the bus gets stopped by the Russians for a security check. The Russian officer-in-charge (Yul Brynner) becomes attracted to the English woman (Deborah Kerr)and delays the trip.

Brilliant Aussie movie ... A little slow at the beginning , but once it gets going you ca n't stop the fun . the music is wonderful . it makes you feel like you're there . there's a good message here about being true to yourselves . the acting is all on the level . the message is true . it shows you that you can be the best you can be . that you can be successful , if you really believe in yourself . and that you don't need anybody . it shows you that you don't have to look up to someone to do great things .

Film about the failure of government and the selfishness of adults. Overwhelming impossibility of dealing with life and the means the children go to to try to achieve living. Only living. Staying alive in a cruel world. A nightmare world, we are afraid to watch it because we are seeing truth and are afraid to see it. To see a world of despair when we are all so comfortable in our own lives and even complaining about what we have not got when it is so trivial compared to someone else. They, the children of the movie, are desensitized.

I looked forward to spending part of my Independence Day weekend watching a good film about Jefferson . This film didn't quite measure up to expectations, which is to be expected. The story is told from a few different points of view. But what the audience was left with is the impression that this was not the movie we had all hoped to see on this day. The best thing I got out of the movie was a feeling of regret for the way things were and the way they were getting. The idea was a good one but the execution was a lot more mixed than I expected.

As a parent of two girls ( 14 and 11 ) I have grave doubts about this show and all the parents who like this show. The premise of it is so bizarre that it's hard to get into any of the episodes. There were some that I thought might be ok because they did some great things with their girls. One in particular where they have to put the girls in a time tunnel and take them through it and then go in time. What a great show they are. The worst part is how many parents actually like it.

I have seen several Yul Brynner films -- yet this is his best performance as the camera captures his emotions. This movie is a beautiful tribute to an amazing man. Thank you, Yul. A wonderful and touching documentary about the life and tragic death of Yul Brynner in 1977. The film features interviews from all of the major parties involved in Brynner's life and tells the story in his words. The one thing that makes the film a success is the way Yul's father, Jack, tells the story. His story is told in such a way that every time you watch it a new perspective is gained.

This is the kind of movie that could have ruined several careers , if garbage could ruin motion picture careers . what a joke , i could have done that to the first ten minutes , if i had not seen a trailer for this film that made the first ten minutes of my life . it's a story about a young girl , played by hilary quinn , who is kidnapped by a group of hooded teens . she is forced into prostitution , which she finds so revolting , that she runs away with her two best friends .

OK , I 've now seen George Zucco in at least four separate horror/suspense films recently as I worked my way down his web-site. There is no doubt that he 's a talented individual. I 've also seen his work in the past, in fact I was very happy to hear that he was in The Last of Us. I don' t always have a great love of zombie films, but there's something about Zucco that just grabs my attention. On the rare occasion that his name does come up I do pay attention to them.

The interaction between Portman and Sarandon was quite interesting , and I was really sold on the mother-daughter relationship . The mother and daughter bonding aspect was just too much , and I'm sorry I didn't feel it more strongly on my first read through . The chemistry between Portman and Sarandon's characters , though , really drew me into the book , and I really felt for Sarandon throughout most of the book . That's one of the reasons I rated the book a 3 , but this time it was just the right kind of emotional ride for me , that's all .

I totally agree . This is `` Pitch Black underground '' and a well worn plot . The best scenes are in those moments when you think you're losing control. I also love when she's on her knees with blood all over her face and she doesn't even know it . She's so desperate . The ending was predictable enough and I'm sure it'll probably happen sooner than later . In the end I can't help but think that they're going to have to find out what is in that jar because they have to find her and they don't seem willing to do it .

This movie tries its darndest to capture that classic bad canadian movie feel : '' quirky '' and obnoxious characters, bad acting by every single actor and a plot that just sucks the life out of all of your senses. But it does so in a manner that could very well make you think '' that's not very good '' or that '' it was a bad idea '' but you don't have to '' give it up '' for '' another movie. This is not a bad film, not by a long shot, it is just not a film I can see myself watching again in a few years.

Leslie Nielsen hits rock bottom with this absolutely horrible comedy that is the worst mainstream film that I have ever seen. There is nothing to like about this film, as it is essentially a one-joke film, and the joke isn't all that funny. How many times are we supposed to laugh at an almost blind man making a fool out of himself? That's not funny, that's just pitiful. Nielsen seriously needs to start refusing some of these pathetic scripts, and Stanley Tong needs to stick to making Jackie Chan films, because it doesn't get much worse than this.

After seeing NAKED CITY and NIGHT AND THE CITY ( which is still my favorite Dassin ) I was more drawn to the other movies I saw this year. In my opinion there is not much more I would say can be added or subtracted from the other movies. So here are some links to those movies which I am sure are going to be interesting. For me the most enjoyable movies are ones where you can feel the tension building and where it feels like something is on the horizon but you are still not sure when it all will come crashing down.

I find this film meretricious , tentative , lethargic , and skillfully a bad choice of entertainment on celluloid . if you take my point of view , it is one of the bad choices because it is an anti-climax and all it does is to try to draw your attention to how badly this movie is made . when you really look at this film , you realize that it has been made by two men . the director of this film , ted bundlestad ( gary williams ) , has no talent to make a mediocre film , even at his lowest points .

The film is a pathetic attempt to remake Ingmar Bergman 's `` Autumn Sonata '' ( 1978 ) starring Ingrid Bergman . It is far from the same. It does have one of the most memorable sequences of `` Autumn Sonata '' , and the film makes an effort to remind us what the movie was all about. Bergman did a good job of casting Ingrid Bergman in such roles, as she did in other films. But she is so often cast as the femme fatale, rather than the heroine in her own films, like in the `` Winter Night '' ( 1970 ) or `` The Mirror '' ( 1974 ).

I thought the movie was sub-par . The acting was good but not great , the story was funny but not all that interesting , the dialog was not very good , the cinematography and special effects were great , but all in all, I felt it was a waste of time , and I’ve seen worse . There were a few good points in this movie, but it was just not good enough to take home the Oscar. It’s not a bad film, but it could have been better. The performances are mostly fine, but not good enough to warrant the film.

This was by far one of the worst movies Sandra Bullock has starred in. Ben Affleck should stay behind the camera and continue writing scripts. This is definitely his forte and acting is not. I actually lasted 54 minutes into this movie before I was so bored with it I felt compelled to leave the theater. It's a bore from beginning to, well 54 minutes into the film anyway. The premise of "Guess what happened to me on the way to the ...." has been done over and over to death.

Oh my God ... where to begin ? `` Chupacabra Terror '' is one of the worst B-Horror movies ever made, and this time it is even worse ! The movie is so bad that nobody can make it worse ! The movie is such a horrible horror that there are few things that could have made the film even more horrendous. As I watched this movie, I realized that even the best horror movies have horrible endings. There are some movies that I think are so great because of their very nature, that there isn’t enough to give them a bad ending.

Thank God I have fast-forward . I think this is a movie about a guy who rises and falls . A man who struggles with his life and career, and falls in love and dies in a car accident and has his ashes thrown in the sea . Now that's my dream movie . You're right, but I'm not really looking for a remake. So the question is if there is any chance of it becoming a remake, because that is a film which would be worth remaking because of the story, I would think. That's the problem I have with these movies.

I 've just revisited this fondly remembered bit of cinematic madness from my early days , and must urge you to seek it out. It's the film from my earliest memory and one I can still hear in my head like the sound of an old train going through it's final miles . I remember how I laughed so hard I nearly had to sit down when I saw the film in the cinema. In it's day , the film is one of the very best comedy's of its kind . It is an all out riot .

I was lucky enough for this film to come on TCM, so I had the opportunity to see it. It's rather hard to find, despite it being a Hitchcock classic. Unfortunately, it also has its shortcomings, some of which Hitchcock has repeated later. First off, the ending is a little too neat and "perfect". In the last few scenes, until the last five minutes, there is an astounding amount of tension; then, the five minutes just clears everything perfectly up... very unsatisfying. The ending is also overly dramatic, for a Hitchcock film.

Simply put , Paul Bettany and Jennifer Connelly were remarkable . The movie is less about the raw science of how it all went down, and more about the emotional and psychological impact of what it all means and of what was lost in the process. There are no winners in this movie . The scientists lose, the people who worked in that lab have lost what they were able to accomplish , and the public loses its faith in all of the hard work that the military and scientists have put into finding this killer .

Historical movies always take liberties -- conversations are concocted where no one could actually know what was said, customs are adjusted to be comprehensible to modern audiences, etc. However, historical films about actual historical personages should make at least a minimal nod to history. This film does not. The only scene I actually remember is when our hero surprises an assassin who creeps into his chamber at night. He confronts the dangerous intruder with, "I don't remember sending for room service". The main entertainment value is in its badness; I recommended my local video story put it on the "Turkeys" shelf.

Interesting cartoon, included on the DVD of "The Lost Skeleton of Cadavra". I especially like the way the color was used in the background art--very artistic for Columbia, whose cartoon department generally had a very low budget (and the results looked like it! )I do wonder, however, how a certain... um, finger gesture... ever got past the censors. Granted, the gesture in question was seen a lot less frequently in 1937 than it is today. You'd think someone besides the animators would have noticed, though--especially since it's seen three times in the scene in question!

Admittedly , the only reason I watched this film -- since it 's been about a decade since it was released and I still haven't gotten to the end of it -- but I had to watch it. Not because it was entertaining, mind you. I 'm sure the film is far more interesting than what was shown here . I just have to admit, it was refreshing to have a story told with a much greater sense of reality. I'd never heard of 'em until I saw an interview with 'em and then realized they were friends of mine.

Although i do n't like cricket at all and i have seen this movie 13 years ago , I still like watching it . There are some parts that are funny , but they are all predictable and pointless , especially the part at the very end where he says that if he makes a mistake in his life , he will regret it so much because of which he won't live his life with full of hope and joy but will live with fear , so if there is a life to be lived , why should he worry ? .

You do n't have to be a tamilian to appreciate this gem of a movie.I do n't know a word for this, but that doesn't mean you don't know it, and you don't. This film is truly a jewel in the cinematic crown. The best thing you can say is that it deserves its own movie category. There are two reasons for the film's high rating. First, it features one of the best musical sequences ever in a movie and second is it is probably the best film directed by an Asian person. Let's start from the beginning.

Two years after this movie was made, "The Juror" came out. Don't waste your time on this one. See "The Juror" instead. "The Juror" is essentially the same story as "Trial By Jury," with better acting, better directing and a far more gripping aura about it. William Hurt was not believable as a cop-gone-bad, and Armand Assante couldn't be more unlike a mob boss if they had dressed him in a clown outfit. You didn't become involved enough with Joann Whalley's character to be that upset by what was happening to her.

Fairly appalling enterprise suggests Welsh to be an infantile artist, helplessly drawn to the violent milieu he knows best, but unable to resist vacuous elaborations rooted in banal fantasy. The first story is a ham-fisted, meaningless trudge with a B-movie sci-fi premise. The second achieves some poignancy, but only via the outrage-inducing surplus of humiliation visited on its central character. The third and most risible seems to aspire to being a dislocated sequel to Child's Play. The direction is consistently clueless - all whirling sound and fury, a slave to the extreme unpleasantness of the environment; suffocating in an ill-chosen music score and in indifferently flashy acting.

Sam O'Steen , the film editor on the superlative suspense flick `` Rosemary 's Baby '' from 1968 , here on the eve of the anniversary of the infamous murder of Rosemary andits two surviving babies. This is the extraordinary story of Rosemary and how she managed to stay alive for two weeks and give birth to what is considered one of cinema's most memorable deaths, even while her husband was dying of complications from a botched blood transfusion. In fact, the baby she gave birth to is the baby she is alleged to have given birth to; she gave birth to two babies and both died.

This is an excellent film, but Momento (Nolan's other big budget film) is much better . I would recommend people go to see Momento and then if they like that, see this film. THe film is shot in black and white which I was a bit annoyed with at first but once into the film you understand black and white is the best way for the film to be seen. It is extremely gripping and reasonably easy to understand even though the way it is made is extremely clever. Elements of the storyline i think are a bit daft but the film is definitely worthy of a second viewing.

Loosely based on actual events , `` River 's Edge '' is a film , much in the style of `` Titanic '' and `` The Sound of Music , '' that takes viewers on a journey of heartbreak, hope, and redemption. It is about a couple , a boy who loves them , and an old hotel that may be their salvation. On the surface it looks like a romantic story about love and heartache , but the story is really about the hotel and the people in it. You don't know how the story ends , but you will be drawn into the lives of these characters .

I thought this was a great action flick. A very good role for Geena Davis. She is a very versatile actress. One of my favs next to Angelina Jolie. I actually watched The Long Kiss Goodnight right after seeing the new Tomb Raider movie. It got me thinking, Charlie or Lara? Which one would win in a fight??? Either way, both women are very strong, intelligent characters that are fun to watch. Especially when they're kicking butt. I just hope to see Geena in another film soon. Seems like she's been out of the spotlight a bit too long.

I mean , come on ! This movie had such nice potential but it 's like they ran out of ideas and they couldn't do anything to make this movie better ! They should have added more songs in this movie ! I really liked this movie because this time we don't had a heroine in the movie ! I think we should see more action movies in this time because we don't have action in this movie ! I would suggest to make more action movies for the time we have now ! I loved this movie from start to finish !

Chop Shop. Written and directed by Ramin Bahrani ( Man Push Cart). Bahrani specializes in character driven studies in naturalist style films about the sort of little people that get passed by every day, without anyone ever really noticing they are there, in New York. These are people who have been pushed to the very fringe of society. They exist in a sort of grey world, many of them migrants whose legal status in America is appears somewhat doubtful. Where do they come from ? How did they get there ? How do they cope ? Where will they end up ?

Loved this movie! Kicking it old school! Love the idea. Love the script. Love the characters. I really really really loved the Geeks! I was excited to see the silly slapstick horror flicks still being honored. This was right up with my favs such as Saturday the 14th and Pandemonium. If you are a big fan of scary AND silly then this is your movie! Only taken off one star because I would love to have had better sound. Not bad sound but would have liked to have more. Great blood splatters. Great murder weapons. Great costumes!

Predictable , cliche , unbelievable , boring ... what else can I say ? It 's only the caliber of the writing , and the direction , that keeps the book afloat . I had to read this to understand it all , and it is only here , on a few select pages , that I can really say that I enjoyed it . Still , I will have to wait a while before going back and reading the previous volumes in the series . I 'm sure that it will all be worth the wait , just as you know that reading The Lord of the Rings is nothing short of worth the wait .

I have always liked the Carry On films, with their double-meaning sexual innuendo dialogue and moments of slapstick comedy, but I can see why the critics give this one two stars. Basically, many British people are gathering on a coach to go on a Spanish holiday to an island called Elsbels to the Palace Hotel. What they didn't know is that it is not completely built, plus they have to share bathrooms with their neighbours, they have crap draws, and many other complications and complaints that the owner Pepe (Peter Butterworth, putting on quite an amusing accent, e.g.

I remember when they made a big deal about this when it was coming out . They showed clips every so often, and then they showed one or two seconds, then a whole lot of the video. I did the same thing . I just watched it and thought "what is this, how can they do this" , so I watched the whole thing. The only thing I think I like more than the actual story of the film is watching it and knowing it is in the same category as other films like that one.

Sorry about the "extremely clever" summary phrase. I don't know what I was thinking, but I really couldn't help myself.I've been meaning to see 'Bloody Birthday' for a long time and I must say that it was a pleasant surprise to find a copy of this film by accident and for such a low price. And believe me, I live in a small South American village and these things are very unlikely to happen. It's a real shame that some of these 'gems' from the 80s are now almost completely forgotten.

Is this a good movie? No, certainly not. But for Jolie lovers it's must-have. Her non-polished acting and semi-nudity scene will please her fans for ages to come. The current rating however (3.2) is too low. The movie might lack a good storyline, and isn't a great sf-movie altogether but the acting is good enough (and like mentioned before, Jolie's acting is nice and raw), the movie is shot very direct, with a lot of close-ups. The scenery is bizarre. And last but not least, leaving van Damme out was a very good choice.

The first season of Bones is playing in Finland and I can't believe the amount of bullshit that this show puts on - the characters are shallow, poorly directed and clumsy.It's a poor mans' CSI. Or actually, CSI without coherent plot. Although Bones has potential, it fails due to the lacking of the director who hasn't been able to extract the essence of the show from the actors. It's actually sad to see a show throw it all away when it could had been a descent show with just a pinch more thought.

One of the better movies to come out of the 1980's, this based-on-fact movie tells the story of a disturbed high school student who murders his girlfriend, leaves her naked body on a river bank, and brags about it later to his friends. What is just as bad is their inability to FEEL anything about it.Disturbing but incredibly compelling look at aimless and apathetic kids who have no respect for their parents or any sort of authority, who seem almost doomed to live lives of rebellion and recklessness. This drama hits hard and is impossible to forget.

The good news for IMDb is that this movie was so very bad that it compelled me to register and create an account so that I could view it and then write a review of it. In short, it was awful. But it's a good thing, I tell you. The story begins with a group of women who have been trapped in a burning building for hours when they are rescued, and one by one they are abducted. It's an interesting setup, but it quickly takes you into the depths of depravity, even as it presents a solution.

`` Tart '' is a good illustration of old the Yogi Berra saying : `` If you do n't know where you are going, you don't know where to turn''. (1) _Hindu-ism in India_ , Vol. II. (2) _Ibid_., Vol. VI. ## 6. ### SRI VIVIYARAGI YOGA SUTRAS. Sri Viviyaragu was the great master of Yogi Bhajan. In his _Yogapradhatu_ , a great work by his great grandfather Sri Vidyanagar, this great master explains the essence of Yogi Bhajan.

I saw this movie yesterday and thought it was awful; it was pointless and just plain stupid. the supposed plot concerned a prospective bridegroom too caught up in the problems of the world to relate to his bride and the other people in his life. He disappears on his wedding day (in a tux no less) and hooks up with an assortment of weirdos.We saw it with a bus-load of people on the way down to Atlantic City and everyone agreed that it was a terrible movie. It was trying to be profound but it wasn't; it was stupid and offensive.

I'm a fan of the horror movie, regardless of which hemisphere it comes from. I know what to expect from the West, the East and most horrors in the middle. So I received the DVD of 'Acacia' in the post and looked forward to a slow build of ever increasing tension and scary children with odd, disjointed movements hiding under duvets.The major selling point for this film was that it has a far more linear story line than many of this ilk - you get who the characters are, where they are from and what they do.

The film deals with universal themes , mentioning no specific country as its context : it could happen anywhere -- or, at the least, anyone can go to the cinema and see the movie. The story is about two men who fall in love and have to live in a society where they cannot marry the girl they love. What is so fascinating about “Love, Life and War” is the way it manages to combine the very different, yet also very universal themes of human life and human existence. At the same time, it addresses the universal issues of war and peace.

If you 're looking for an accurate portrayal of Che Guevara , the Cuban revolutionary who helped aid Fidel Castro overthrow the U.S. occupation of Cuba in the 1960's, then you should see the new film 'Che' . The movie is set during the time of the Cuban Revolution and is based on a true story. It follows a group of Cubans who travel to Brazil to learn how they can help in Cuba's struggle against the United States occupation. These men are not revolutionaries like Guevara and Castro were at the time they are in Cuba, but they are the only people in Brazil who know him.

There's a certain irony in a parody of the Gothic genre being turned into a mess of clichés by filmmakers who either had no idea what the story's purpose was, or just didn't care. All of the hallmarks of your average family film are present- rambunctious younger siblings, a grumpy teenager who doesn't want to move, unsympathetic parents who are unable to see the apparition, and of course a romantic subplot. The movie has very little in common with Wilde's original story, which was largely written to poke fun at the melodramatic Gothic novellas that were all the rage at the time.

Based on a fairly bland `` best seller , '' this film - like most other Lifetime movies - played to a large number of empty seats; it wasn't exactly the biggest box-office success of its kind. And though the movie does have its fans, I think it's a case that can be made that the best thing to do when watching this sort of movie is to skip it. Not everyone loves it , and it did not get nearly the critical and commercial acclaim as The Graduate , with which it shares a number of scenes and which, as you know, is widely considered a classic film.

Mostly uninvolving biblical mumbo-jumbo that drags on for well over two hours. The only thing that saves this film from God's wreath (and there is only one God, remember) is the unintentionally funny dialog, and a good battle scene which comes far too late in the movie. For most of the two hours until the action scenes there is too much talking; the dialog is so inept that the movie just begs to be spoofed by MST3K.George Sanders is absolutely awful; one of the most animated, overly-theatrical performances I've ever seen.

Saw this last night and being a fan of the first Demons , I had hoped that the sequel would be much better. So, I thought I'd try my own way and write up some thoughts. I have read the comics, but I haven't read any of the movies. The first movie was really good and I really enjoyed it. I thought the second movie was a nice step up for the series and I was hoping the sequel would be much better. So here goes. THE DEPARTURE

Let me start off by saying I was very disappointed by the movie's end.

Another Son of Sam is definitely not an Oscar winner . Technically , it 's horrible . The acting is the weakest in the film , with a total lack of chemistry between two men who play brothers . What makes the movie interesting is the idea behind the film , and the fact that we now have to look at how we deal with the idea of evil within the family . We know that Sam is evil , but how much of that evil is within himself , and how much is within his family ? It is an interesting question to which we have not really had any good answers .

Mr. Bean has always been my favorite. No matte how many times you watch the same thing, the show never gets monotonous or repetitive. Mr. Bean is one of the greatest comedians in the world who doesn't need to even speak to make people laugh. His gestures, his facial expressions and his face itself is so funny to watch. The situations which he faces on the show is simply hilarious and the way he handles them is even greater. There is simply no reason why this show shouldn't receive a 10 because it is fabulous.

`` A research scientist is experimenting with human DNA in an attempt to create the perfect human being . His experiment leads to an accident that destroys the human being's DNA and leaves the scientist with only his own DNA . The movie was released in the year 2000, and the movie was a critical and popular success. It has an Rotten Tomatoes score of 96% , and an IMDb rating of 8.7/10. * * * * *

The plot of the story is very predictable and basic. The movie follows one scientist, Dr. Robert Duncan, who attempts to create a human who will be perfect.

I went to see this because I 'd never seen Tel-Aviv , where the story is set . I was not going to do it at first , and I thought that it is a bit of a joke , but I really liked it and it made me think .I think it was a little too short , but not much , and it had some great ideas . The main characters were well drawn and well thought out . I didn't care for a few parts of the plot and story , but I could not put the book down . I am looking for more books set in Jerusalem .

I think Walter Pidgeon was badly miscast in this film. Just not believable in the role. Barbara Eden was beautiful, and acted her part well enough. No one else was at all memorable. I remember the TV series spun off from this movie when I was a small child. I even think I had a plastic "Seaview" that would submerse and was great for playing with in the bathtub. Long time ago.As for some of the other criticism I've read for this film: It's certainly unfair to judge special effects or science knowledge of 4 decades ago by today's standards.

I have a hard time putting into words just how wonderful this was. Once in a while you see a film that just sticks with you. "You Are Alone" is that movie (for me). The film is constantly in my head and in my heart. I replay the scenes mentally every day and analyze them and go through the emotions all over again, as if I am seeing it for the first time.There is nothing I did not like about the movie. Amazing soundtrack!!! The ending was perfect. Very emotionally stirring!!!

"Chupacabra Terror" is saved from a '1" by the presence of Canadian cutie Chelan Simmons as the heroine. She is a delight to watch, from the front, back and side. Otherwise, what you have here is your standard monster movie, playing like a low-budget, shipboard version of THE RELIC. John Rhys-Davies plays the captain of the ship on which the monster is being transported. And the very nonscary monster is simply a man in a suit. He does commit about 100 senseless, gory killings, at least, so the body count in this one is pretty awesome.

This is the worst exercise in middle class pretentiousness yet to hit our television screens. I unfortunately did not see it when it was first shown but paid for the joy of watching six hours of excruciating drivel - and I'm still waiting for the laughs to arrive. I love Tasmin Greig having been a big fan of both Black Books and Green Wing and therefore know that she is capable of the very best of comedy parts. However, she played this part as well as she was able considering the lack of any decent comedy material provided.

Jennifer Montgomery's "Art for Teachers of Children" is a stunning, disturbing masterpiece. Montgomery's gritty camerawork and cinematography coupled with the brilliantly unemotional performances she evokes from her cast heighten the sense of shocking, raw realism in this autobiographical story of a 14-year-old Jennifer's seduction of her married boarding-school guidance counselor. The scenes between the amazingly uncanny actress playing Jennifer (Caitlin Grace McDonnell) and Jennifer's mother (actually voiced by Ruth Montgomery) on the phone are some of the most intriguing and powerful I've ever seen captured on film. The lesson ultimately learned here?

If you really really REALLY enjoy movies featuring ants building dirt-mirrors , eating non-ants , and conquering the world with flying machines , it is time to go to a film festival. Ants Attack! is coming to South Africa from April 1 – 3, 2010. We will be attending Ants Attack! on the same day that we have a very special event on Saturday April 2nd. On April 2nd, we’ll be hosting a day full of fun activities for all ages at the festival. You can find all the information about Ants Attack! at the official event site.

Well, some people might go to see this to watch a trashy rubber and pvc clad bisexual vampire assassin kicking some ass. If that's what you want, and you wear a cloak, file your teeth to points and think that the name Lilith Silver is cool, you'll see a fine film.If, like most people, an assassin dressed in gleaming, creaking rubber with HUGE cleavage, thick makeup and bad fangs makes you laugh, then this is one of the best comedies you'll see. I laughed so hard I nearly cried.

Deep Water ( 2006 ) * * * * '' It is indifferent ... it 's there waiting for you to pull up the tent pole. It doesn't care if there are three or a million people camped out on top of the highest hill on Mars or whether we can communicate with them or whether they are the same as we are. When you're deep water ... you can't imagine that anything can come between you and what matters. ''' -- Bob Dylan. The Darkest of the Hillside Thickets ( 2005 * * * * '' I didn't want to know about what they call dark.

This must be one of the most horribly titled films of all time. The kind of title that ruins a film because it neither evokes the plot nor the characters. A title like this makes a film flop, even the French title is not much better. Too bad - Truffaut & Deneuve must have been enough to sell it..This is a long film, but largely worth it. Clearly influenced by Hitchcock, we have an intercontinental story about a personal ad bride, her rich husband, a theft, an identity switch, and obsessive love.

You don't have to spend much time watching this made for TV movie or series pilot or whatever it was intended to be to figure out just what lies in store. The incredibly bad musical score makes its debut from the start. Seriously, if this isn't the worst theme I've ever heard, I certainly can't remember it. While the acting talent is available here, from Jeff Bridges to Carl Betz, Vera Miles, and Sal Mineo, the writing is atrocious and the story is contrived, filled with insipid stereotypes, and an obvious ripoff from Ken Kesey.

...out of this movie.Sorry to say, this showed at the Cleveland International Film Festival. Our copy did not have subtitles, so I asked the Festival crew if there was a problem with the print received. "Not so..." I was told. "the director wants it this way". Again, sorry to say, my French is barely high school elective level (more than 3 decades ago). Much of the initial dialog is in French, so I'm sure I missed the nuance and many details in between my understanding of a few key words.

Fox is pretty lame. They cancel the wrong shows. It's bizarre that they would cancel a well-written program like "Arrested Development" and yet they keep this show and "War at Home". I feel that Fox loved that they broke barriers with the then-edgy "Married with Children", but now it's just getting ridiculous. "The Loop" is a pointless and boring watch, and their edgy jokes just fall flat. In order for edgy comedy to work you have to keep the jokes coming. "Family Guy" and "The Simpons" work because there is a constant flow of jokes.

This show is terrible . I can not get over the complete waste of great talent this show contains . . . . . . It’s just not good. I mean, really . . . . really, really bad. And by that I mean “really” in every way . . . and also “bad.” The worst episode of the season. And the season as a whole. (Well, actually it’s the worst episode of the season. I’ll get to that.)

i did not expect to enjoy this. in truth i watched it because a friend knew a friend knew a friend who wrote the script but wasn't credited. knowing Dylan thomas, and really being appreciative of his poetry but aware and rather disconcerted by the man, i didn't feel i needed to see a twee adaption of his lame bohemian life laid bare. and this was not it. critical and yet appreciative it was. it made me cry. kiera knightley was superb, even with that slightly strained welsh accent,and it is a sad tale that they tell.

We get to see who the good guys are . The union . Gritty drama? Emotionally powerful? Blah! The BBC has lost out big time to masterful productions such as The Wire, Sopranos and Carnivale from HBO. Okay, so the budget may be a lot smaller but 'The Street' last night was badly acted, predictable, unrealistic, stereotypical, insensitive and a big fat waste of time. What can be said about a movie about a cross dressing gangster? Not that much. With the average indie style film-making, this film has the timing all wrong. Editing is just awful. As far as the gangster story, it might have been pulled off if the gangsters didn't lack character. Everyone just seemed to be there for some sort of punch line. None of which were funny. The usual suspects in this film are the hooker with the heart of gold, the dying mafia father that wishes his son would make his business legit, the best friend with the "zany" one-liners.

... but had to see just how bad it could get. The plotline was thin to begin with, but it just kept getting worse. A female genetic engineering grad student uses her research on accelerated mitosis to artificially create a male, because a biological weapon used in WW3 killed off 97% of the worldwide male population. The surviving men are either high prices gigolos in back alley clubs, or crazed lunatics in run down football stadiums plotting to overthrow the 'Lesbian Conspiracy'. The entire process resembled the microwaving of a large bowl of jello. Press a few buttons and ding you get a baby.

Larry Clark is not renowned for his talents as a writer or a director , but he has made some of the worst films of the past 20 years, which is saying something. In the last two decades the director has released two films to critical and popular acclaim, neither of them among his better works. So it comes as some relief that, like a good many critics, the man himself feels that this time he has done something right, if not great. So why not enjoy his new film In the Land of Men, and not the rest?

Death Camp Opera : Right Here , Right Now ! Ten years ago , I read that a very special person was going to die . This person is my brother . The story I told you is true . My father , a musician , gave my brother ( my brother died when I was two years old ) the violin and the guitar . After that , I began to play the piano . I can play the piano perfectly , but the violin is harder to learn .

OK. A warning for anyone out there who is a parent or guardian . Be careful about who you see on a public transport system. If you have seen or met the following, it is highly unlikely that they are the good guys:
1. The person who asks if you want to share a blanket with your kids, or if they will take them out for their birthday. (That's the kind of question that should get a "No." It's asking for a free pass into a stranger's bedroom, because they are willing to make an exception.)

With a cast like this, I knew the acting would be amazing. Still, I was cautious, as I always am of sequels. Would it sustain the feeling of the first film? Could they possibly replicate the tension and thrill of the masterful heist of Ocean's 11? We'll never know, because they didn't try. At least, not in the way I expected. Instead, they made a light and truly funny parody of the heist genre. If you want a gripping, logical heist, don't watch this.

Let me begin by saying that I had been eagerly anticipating this film 's release for awhile . After finally seeing this film about a month ago , I am happy to say that it exceeded my expectations. So how did this film hold my attention so long after seeing it? Well, I believe it was because of two major things. One, the main theme of 's movie is the battle of the sexes. In my eyes , this is not just a simple war movie , but a real battle of the sexes .

This is one of L & H 's shorts most frequently cited as the first `` real '' L & H project and it was one of the very first to make a profit in its first year and to sell more copies than any previous film. In fact, it was made to demonstrate that there is no real problem with getting films made and to sell the films. It is an amazing story of life, the movie business and a tale of two directors. It also tells the story of the struggle to become the first independent studio of the post-war American film industry.

This is my first "awful" rating ever on IMDb and I couldn't think of a more deserving film to honor it with. I hoped for entertaining trash and found trash of the saddest, dullest kind. I found a film which no one can possibly have cared a bit about, including its creator. "Hell Ride", directed, written by and starring Larry "Friend of QT" Bishop, has a simple plot about a hidden treasure and a trio of keys, two bands of bikers and a gruesome murder in 1976 which has yet to be avenged.

Just a few words: it's a good thing George A Romero is still among us cause if he were dead, he would be forced to rise from grave to vote against the people who made this 'political satire' And the saddest thing of all is that I actually agree with these people's sentiments. Yeah there's zombies in it and they do have a good reason to come back from beyond the grave: to vote. Oh, and one of them finishes off The Doctor from Startrek Voyager. That's about as scary as it will get, people.

I've been a fan of Larry King's show for awhile, I think he does a terrific job overall and I don't think he ever 'wusses' out, as so many people seem to believe. He's a subtle Scorpio, he gets his zings in when he needs to, just as he managed to do last night with Paris Hilton, during her first post-jail TV interview.The thing about this entire case that has really amazed me is that Hilton is still apparently clueless about why Judge Sauer gave her what she believes was a too-harsh sentence (and what's more, actually MADE her serve it) .

This is my favorite Renoir from the Fifties. It's the story of how Henri Danglard built and launched the Moulin Rouge nightclub; we see the workmen blasting at the site to get construction underway, and the training of the dancers. Finally, the giddiness of opening night and the long sequence of cancan dancing. Financial problems and the ego displays of the performers are described.Gabin is in great form as the easy-going Danglard--see him deal humorously with Nini's violent boyfriend. Gianni Esposito is moving as the wistful Prince who is courting Nini.

No doubt that the indie flick Eddie Monroe is one of the better independent films I've seen in a long time. The highlight for me was the performance of Paul Vario. I first saw Paul, or "Big Paulie" as he was called in Danny Provenzano's hit indie, "This Thing Of Ours". Thankfully, the "Eddie Monroe" filmmaker(s) did the same and utilized Paul's undeniable skills in a principle (principal?) role. Out came a performance (on camera and voice-over utilization as well) that shows worthy of big-budget studio roles in the very near future.

I have witnessed some atrocities of cinema. In the past couple of years, it seems producers and directors are bent on making films that drive me closer and closer to insanity. Hannibal was not an exception. I wasn't expecting much, when I went in to see the movie. The book was ridiculous, and the saying, "The Book is always better than the movie" did not assure me at all that this movie would be anything but trash. But what I came to see was a movie that made all other bad movies seem better in comparison.

Grosse Pointe Blank was really quite a below average film . Its hit man theme is very dry and is one of the weakest parts of the film . The acting is below average , especially for a big name like Paul Blart , and the plot itself is uninteresting . In other words , its a movie with no plot at all . I also really disliked the music . It is generic and really nothing more than a filler for a movie , especially when there are plenty of better films that would have fit this theme . Overall , I thought this movie was a waste of time .

How sad it is when a film as wonderful as "Jurassic Park" slowly nosedives into hackneyed and mediocre territory throughout its franchise. The newest sequel, Jurassic Park III, has given no thought to characters, a story, or pretty much a script, and instead relies on non-stop dinosaur action, which is neither thrilling nor very interesting to watch. The dinosaurs seemed to look incredibly fake compared to the 1993 technology, after 7 years of CGI advancements, it only gives you more of the feeling that the film was pumped out for the summer relying only on its name.

I've been strangely attracted to this film since I saw it on Showtime sometime in the early 80's. I say strangely because it is rather a ludicrous bit of soft-core fluff, a genre I'm not particularly interested in. The dialogue is pompously and nonsensically philosophical (making sense, no doubt, only to it's Franco-Italian producers)and the plot completely extraneous. What it does achieve is a wonderfully hypnotic and thoroughly pleasant mood. The scenery (the beautiful Philippines), soft-focus nudity and wonderful score all contribute to a strange and extremely watchable exercise in a sort of film making seldom seen today.

FBI Agents Mulder and Scully get assigned to probe the mystery of what happened to an Arctic drilling team, in this early 'X-Files' episode that David Duchovny himself considers one of their first "rockin'" episodes. It pays loving homage to the much lauded John Carpenter 1982 theatrical feature "The Thing", and one can see the similarities. Visually, color and lighting schemes combine to give the story a hellish quality. Production design / art direction are especially impressive; the shots of the exterior of the Arctic camp are so reminiscent of the earlier film as to automatically create feelings of deja vu for some viewers.

I saw this movie on TV and loved it ! I am a real disaster film fan , and this is the one I would go to the theater to see. A movie that I would want you to be sitting next to me on my couch to watch. Also I think I would go out and buy the movie for my wife , and we would play it in the den , and when I got home she would say, “you want another drink, I want another drink” , she would never take anything but the movie. I watched it twice.

It looks awful , and they made this movie on a budget . This movie is a disgrace and no one should go and see this . It is so bad that they should have done a movie about Christ , not this . `` Opposing Force [ 1986 ] '' was n't as good as `` Dr. Strangelove '' and it was n't so clever. Still it had the advantage of knowing it was n't funny. '' In a way it was more interesting.

In the mid 1800s , Irishman Dennis Hopper ( as Daniel Morgan ) emigrates to Australia , seeking a share of the great gold rush then in progress. He takes with him his wife Catherine , who had fled from Ireland with her mother and sister in search of a fresh start. Dennis and Catherine travel the country, trying to convince the people of the gold rushes potential, only to find that many are only too eager to sell. At the same time in the United States , a man named Harry Houdini is on the road, travelling the nation lecturing on a variety of magical acts.

YOU BELONG TO ME ( 1941 ) is a example of the 'ScrewBall Comedy ' which started in the mid 50s in the USA and still thrives today. The movie is based on the novel of the same name by William Faulkner, and written by Charles K. Feldman . The author, William Faulkner, is credited to have made Faulkner's novel the best selling non-fiction novel in history, with sales in excess of 2 million copies. Faulkner's book is now regarded as a standard of literature for college students across the country.

i do n't really know where to start here.just imagine a movie that is so bad in every way from beginning to end i would be happy if someone wrote a review about it saying how it is really boring and no one gives a shit. i have no idea if that is what the movie is like. but it is just a thought. it doesn't need to be like that. it has to be bad, bad, bad. but not so bad that people go "wow! that is so bad that i would not even bother to even watch it."

This is a film that has to be taken in context. It shouldn't be seen unless you've seen the first two films, but the sort of people seeing this film will probably own the box set, or at least know someone who does. And you shouldn't go in expecting Blade Runner; the films budget doesn't stretch quite that far, and it's a far more zany ride.Essentially the film is a science fiction set in future Yokohama (shot in Hong Kong as is obvious) about a society where it's illegal to procreate.

This movie doesn't have any pretense at being great art, which is good. But it is a well written script with well developed characters and solid acting. I think if I wrote it I could do without the drama surrounding the wife, but it wasn't distracting enough to detract from the main story concerning Minnie Driver's character. I think that all too often Hollywood abandons an attempt at real quality writing to try and inject more visual drama when, with an adult themed movie such as this, the emotional type of drama is all that's really needed - and probably more believable too.

This film , for what it was set out to be , succeeded . It 's a short tragic film , which in itself is enough for anyone to make the effort to watch . in the hands of an excellent director and an able crew , this film would certainly be better . i saw the film only the other day and there is no doubt that it is one of the most powerful and powerful short films ever made . however it is also a short film made for the most part by three men with very little background .

This movie had an excellent premise, and could have been a fascinating look at racism, attitudes to women at work and male female relations in England early last century. However, it simply turned into a soppy love story. But what was worse, is that the love story was totally unbelievable. The acting was for the most part poor, the direction confusing, but most of all the screenplay and the story were non-existent. The only thing I liked about the film was how dark it must have been before electric lighting. I really got a sense of just how little light one candle puts out.

I remember when this show came out . It was originally advertised as a mini-series . At the end of the mini-series, I had no interest in continuing the story . However, I decided to re-watch it in order to finish it . Needless to say, I did not regret it . I remember the night I decided to re-watch the series. I was in my room when the TV had just finished . I had no interest in continuing the show and the TV was switched on when I turned it off . I went out for a cigarette .
