The greatest tragedy man faces is that, capable so often of the divine he settles for the banal.From this fact does so much great tragedy emerge. Death in Venice is one of very few films with the patience and bravery to tackle this fact head-on.It confronts the human eye with beauty and inspiration in their two most inevitable human forms-self denial and decay. Undoubtedly this is the greatest film to have no discernable influence on mainstream cinema. Its austerely refined look, echoey sound, mixture of unsubtitled languages, and highly challenging themes being impossible to copy: as much an accident of its peculiar production as of the vision of its director.

The third and final Female Prisoner Scorpion film directed by Shunya Ito . The series ' star , Meiko Kaji, who has portrayed Inari in the series' previous two films, . The films have an all female cast . The film also stars , Shiho Yanagisawa . In addition to Inari, this also marked the first film appearance of , a Japanese voice actress . Shunya Ito had previously directed the TV drama , and . The show is known for its all female cast , including . . The film also featured an all female main cast , which was rare for a period drama .

I 've discovered this movie accidentally and it was really a nice surprise . A Christmas Classic , it 's a story that was written for kids and it does a really great job . The movie is a story about a little boy named Sam . When he was young , his family moved to an isolated place on the edge of a forest . There Sam and his family live in a cabin and Sam goes out at night and tries to make friends with the wildlife . It seems like he can 't get the right one and Sam doesn 't know why .

In America , the Jewish Jonathan Safran Foer ( Elijah Wood ) collects personal belongings of his family for recollection before the Holocaust. The novel is based on Foer's memories of the events surrounding his grandparents’ arrival to America, which took place when his mother was just a child. In the book, Foer describes how he was taught to write and read before he began his formal education, but was unable to read Hebrew. As a young boy, Foer remembers his grandmother asking him to write down the story of her arrival on the ship, as she didn't have the book.

There is a solid group of people that have lives like this girl going through the admissions process at school. They know what it means to have to stand in line for more than an hour. What happens when these students are accepted? They have to pay out of pocket to attend an institution that only has certain programs and only offers certain classes to certain people. I think this girl had to spend her entire childhood and young adulthood paying for school. The cost of her education at this school was a life sentence, or at least that was the plan.

The film deals with universal themes, mentioning no specific country as its context: it could happen anywhere--and has, in substance if not form. Those concerned about 1st amendment issues, censorship, et al--but don't want to be bored with lectures--need art such as this to illustrate, dramatize, teach, inspire.Rickman is certainly an under appreciated character actor; he shines in this film, showing off multiple acting talents that you must see (I have yet to see him give a bad performance, though, even in not-so-great films).

Are sea side resorts the sad , dreary places they 're always depicted as in movies and novels ? Certainly not. They're not a sad place at all, and they have a lot of fun. You don't feel sad at all going to a sea side resort. You'll never be bored there. You'll never feel like you're being cheated out of anything. It will be the best time of your whole life. You can do all you want and have fun doing it. Well it depends.

There are so many holes in the plot, it makes you wonder if they knew they had an audience for this and just threw it together. I don't know much about George Zucco, but I've seen him in two movies. Obviously, he has been cast as the loving father, mad scientist, vampire guy. He looks so ordinary. I'm surprised that he ended up in the genre. This is the typical, "I will create monsters that can be used to fight as an army."

A wonderful family movie & a beautiful horse movie . 75+ % entertainment . Casey , Buddy , Kelly Marsh are both great actors . I know they have done many films together . But they are all unique . I really enjoyed this one . I recommend it to anyone . The only complaint I have is that the movie is pretty long but I have to say it was worth the time. This is one of the best family movies ever filmed. The acting is top notch, the plot is great. I can't think of a movie better suited for small children and teens.

What can I say about a movie as bad as this ? The people who made this movie , did not know what they wanted to make. They made the best movie of their lives for a bad script. I think it’s better to wait and see what it all comes down to . This is what I can tell you for the most part . Some of it is good . Some is good . It’s good enough to watch. This is one of the best action films I have seen . Geena 's portrayal of the tough as nails character made this film so good . I'm sure anyone who is looking for a tough character should definitely check it out . Not only was it well shot, and well acted, but it was full of great fight scenes , and the final battle between Geena and her brother was one to be remembered . I really liked this movie! It was just what I needed. It wasn't an action movie, nor did I expect it to be one, but I liked the film very much.

Korean cinema has the ability to turn genres on its head, and the latest by the celebrated director Chan-wook Park is a tale of a good pious priest who becomes a vampire. Add a temptress leading him astray and a cast of eccentrics and you have a wonderful recipe.Directed in part in a style similar to the "Sympathy" trilogy it's as sumptuous as it is dark. Steering clear of cliché it does offer some new tricks in the overdone vampire genre. Its an existential movie trying to capture the moral conundrum of how exactly a person has to choose to live with their conditions rather than revel in the blood lust.

This is a romantic , albeit cheesy movie that is one of my all time favorites . It is one of the many films where I wish there was more depth in the characters . You know , I wish there was more . I wish there was more of the relationship between Kishan & Neel. I wish they spent some more time with eachother and some more scenes of them together . I wish there was more love , passion & fun ! I wish it wasn't just about the love story and that we could see a bit more of Neel's perspective .

"The Planet" is an astounding piece of film making. For a mere £8000 Stirton Production have turned out one of the most original sci-fi films for a long time.Starring the physically intimidating Mike Mitchell, the film is a mix of great special effects, strong storytelling and well planned action. From the opening space battle, to the pounding finale, everything about this film appears well above it's budget.To start with the special effects, while certainly not "Revenge Of The Sith" standard, they are on level, if not above, the likes of Babylon 5 and Farscape.

This is a haunting short film . Both James Franco and Rachel Miner deliver performances that hurt , ring true and haunt . You are left with the question , what does James Franco stand to lose? . You know this is a good one . You are not disappointed . You are surprised and stunned . You are left asking , who will win this time ? I have to say , this one is one you will not forget . This one is one you will not forgive . This is one you are not going to forget .

I usually seek to find good in movies, even the bad ones.Unfortunately this movie is one where I fail miserably-and the fact that there's barely one positive review on this board shows many IMDb reviewers share my pain.I don't usually watch sequels but I just had to see this since I love "Rosemary's Baby" so much. What a mistake that was. It simply reaffirms my belief in the fact that most sequels are lousy-though thankfully, very few are as bad as this. In fact in my mind this isn't even really a sequel, it's a satire on how bad a sequel can be.

I'm going to talk about this movie from two different perspectives here. First is from the view of if someone sees the movie and never read (and may not ever read) the book. The second is from someone who has. (Movie without book) From a movie standpoint, it was an okay movie. Nowhere near as good as either of the Underworlds but much better than UltraViolet. And I'm not just talking plot line either. The visual effects were iffy in many of the parts, though the wolf transformation was very nice.

Charlie Chaplin responds to open auditions at Lodestone Studios . Rival Ben Turpin arrives at the same studio , obviously upset with the way he is being treated.Chaplin tells him he’s lucky to have been given the role. He also adds “What you’re doing at Lodestone is wrong”.He then tells Turpin he’s not interested in playing his character.Turpin says he’s going to play his character anyway, and he’ll just do it in a different way. Chaplin tells him to get out.Ben then tells Chaplin it would be “absolutely ridiculous” for him to play his character.

It's rare to see film that strikes out in every aspect but "Caligula" surely must hold this title. I'm not sure what is more horrendous; the violence, the sexual perverseness, the acting or the plot (or severe lack thereof).The two and a half hours basically follows the ascension of the infamous Roman Caesar "Caligula" to to throne in 37AD and shows the atrocities and perverseness he supposedly committed whilst in power. The acting is lifeless and dull - but that's just the tip of the iceberg.

This movie was, of the 67 of 71 best pictures I have seen, by far the worst. First of all, I found the plot line somewhat absurd - the absent husband for 25 years/ still in love/ not even a letter! Give me a break. And why was the guy who was absent for so long coincidentally working on an oil rig next door to the congress-woman's party? This film also exhibited some of the worst stereotyping of African-Americans that I have ever seen. It makes Gone With the Wind (see Prissy) look downright progressive!

I realise it 's very hard to live up to the first The 10 Commandments movie ( which was grandiose ) so I've decided to release my version of the first commandment on my own terms. I know I've been saying this for years but I've finally managed to make something work and be honest. The first commandment is 'be honest' - I think I've been fairly honest here, I've said what I'd like and what I've achieved so far. But I want to be a little less open with the world, less transparent.

This film really used its locations well with some amazing shots, dark and disturbing the film moves very slowly, but constantly keeps you watching. Modern Love worked well in the Gold Coast Film Fantastic program this year offering audiences a glimpse at an Australian Cinema that is usually neglected. Most importantly it is refreshing to see Australian cinema not taking on the cliché Aussie characters and story lines we have seen done to death over the years. This film would compliment any festival and will open debate after its screenings. The performances and characters are well developed, and the cinematography is fantastic.

It seems whenever a mainstream film company wants to make a movies for teens it concentrates on only one thing: sex. Don't get me wrong, I'm no prude but the fact that these people seem to think getting my rocks off is all I'm interested in is highly offensive. Take The Convenant, a film that relies so heavily on you finding the main characters attractive it thinks it can get away without a plot and/or a script that wasn't written by a six year old. This is essentially The Craft with (supposedly) hot guys.

There are no saving graces in this dreadful, stagey, boring snooze-fest, which brings to mind "The Ransom Of Red Chief"! Even though there are some big stars in this film, the acting is almost uniformly terrible. Glenn Ford, normally a laid-back kind of guy, hams it up with forced emotion. Donna Reed is so over-the-top as to prove laughable. Leslie Nielson is woefully miscast and is terrible. The son is such a repulsive little brat, I found myself rooting for the kidnappers. The only decent performance in this mish-mash is the relatively minor role of the butler.

this film was probably the best "scary film" i've seen in years. chilling might be a more accurate description. the ending was unexpected and therefore took me by surprise. if it has any flaw it would be the overuse of the whole meaning of life concept. since noone truly knows that answer, you definitely sail into murky waters when you incorporate that concept into a movie. put that aside and the movie is quite enjoyable. carly pope should emerge as one of the next bright young stars in the film industry.

The basic idea behind "Dungeon of Harrow" isn't all bad. The acting, however, is bad. The lighting is bad. The music is bad. The scenes of torture are without emotion. There really isn't much there to recommend this film. You know what kind of a movie you're in for when the credits say "Special Guest Star" and list someone you've never heard of. Might as well say "Rex Hamilton as Abraham Lincoln." because there's really no one in this movie you can identify.

This is the worst movie of all-time, no doubt, and Schindler's List, did in fact have more laughs. This, not only, tells you how unfunny this movie is and how great SL is, considering it's heartbreaking and contains 1 laugh. I wish I could meet "Yahoo Serious" so I could personally throttle him, for this and all the other very, very, very bad movies he's ever been in. There is also very few things to say about Australia, seeing as they like this stupid fruit.

A satire about greed and money, what? There is more greed in the intentions behind this fiasco than in any of the themes they pathetically try to make fun of. Jim Carrey's reign was certainly short lived. He is an unbearable presence on the screen. The insincerity of his portrayal is nothing short of creepy. He produced this, this "masterpiece" as well, so he can't blame anyone here. "The number one comedy in America" shout the desperate TV adds. Of course, Jim Carrey was suppose to guarantee full houses but the game is over.

The plot was not good.The special effects weren't.The acting was... not very good at all.Like others, I felt there were numerous holes in the plot that you could fly, well, a space shuttle through.I thought the ending was rather unbelievable.By the way guys, about the "blow torch in space".Blow torches have their own supply of oxygen (Hence the name "Oxy-Acetylene torch"). Two hoses run from the torch: One to an acetylene bottle and one to an oxygen bottle.So a "blow torch" would work just fine in space.

Happy 25th Birthday to Valley Girl! Great soundtrack, plausible story, wonderful performances...captures the spirit of the 80's; the slang of the mainstreams and the outcasts. A wonderful rendition of high school life and "gritty downtown" from a suburban perspective.The soundtrack contains songs by Modern English, Felony, Josie Cotton, Sparks, Payola$, Josie Cotton, The Plimsouls, The Psychedelic Furs, Men At Work, The Flirts and Bananarama.This movie truly is Romeo and Juliet (minus the double suicide) set in 1980's Los Angeles.

A MUST SEE documentary.-----This movie had so many things to consider while watching it. It was a great documentary of a trial of a 15 year old black kid named Brenton Butler. He accused of killing a white tourist in Florida. It shows how the police took statements from the husband of the dead woman of the description of the man that killed his wife. The husband seemed to want to change some things to merge with what the police said the young man was wearing. The police little to investigate the crime. Brenton's lawyer Patrick McGuinness is meticulous in getting information to help his client.

I saw the film at the Brooklyn International Film Festival (World Premiere).A haunting, intimate portrait of Loneliness, and the repercussions of letting it grow and turn into something darker.The acting of the two leads (Jessica Bohl & Richard Brundage) is excellent, and makes one wish you had met these characters before they became so damaged.Reminded me in theme of the works of Atom Egoyan (Exotica) and Raymond Carver (Where I'm Calling From).The Soundtrack (Tywanna Jo Baskette, Crooked Fingers) is excellent and reinforces moments in the film without drawing attention to itself.Highly recommend the Film and the Soundtrack.

Okay , I had watched this movie when I was very little and the day that we were cleaning out our attic , I remember thinking what on Earth would you have done if you lived in my house. Well you have to wait until my husband gets home , I'm sure I will find out. But the movie is so very interesting , well acted and so full of comedy , that it is worth the wait. If you've ever wanted to know how it feels to live in a world without magic, without wizards or elves, then you've been missing out!

This event defined an era of wrestling entertainment that , I believe , is not equaled today . The colorful , colorful , colorful , colorful . . . The event was filmed in front of a live audience . I have not been a part of filming live events in years . I remember the moment I walked off the set after we had shot a wrestling match and the camera was rolling . My mind was just blown by what I was seeing . The audience had no clue as to the reality of the event we had shot .

Everything about this movie is awful.You can tell in the first five minutes that this movie is going to be terrible. You can't however, gauge how bad it's going to be.We start the movie with a seemingly endless intro scene aided with gay music and no dialogue. Having the camera move up and down big guys who are trying too hard to look like mentals doesn't provoke the slightest emotion.What then starts seems to be one of two separate stories. The first half of the movie consists of the wogs going around competing in paid, midnight fights with other ethnic groups.

To paraphrase Thora Birch : `` I kind of like this movie . It 's the exact opposite of everything we've been doing since the 70s. ''' That's an apt description, but only if you're as old as the characters in the film. I've never heard of this movie or any of the people involved. The movie is about a young woman who gets into an argument with a guy and when it escalates, throws him over the railing and dies. As you watch it, the audience is reminded that this is happening in one of the most dangerous countries on the earth.

This is indeed one of the weakest films based on Agatha Christie's work, a lifeless, muddled mystery that clearly lacks the grace (and the budget!) of its predecessors ("Death On The Nile", "Evil Under The Sun") and Donald Sutherland is a pale shadow of Peter Ustinov as far as screen detectives go (of course, he is playing a character much less interesting than Poirot). The film manages to coast as far as it does on the strength of Christie's plot alone (all her plots have a certain amount of inherent interest), but the direction is hopelessly flat.

Insanely well crafted mini-series.I recall seeing most of it twice when shown on American Playhouse on PBS . Was heavily influenced by it ,and it is an excellent example of a film that should not be forgotten as it still has relevance today . A must see for any movie aficionado, it is not a film one would ever forget, even after the movie was over. The story revolves around a man who falls in with an odd couple who take him to an isolated beach resort. The couple, however, are not exactly what they appear to be, but they take in a lot of stray dogs and cats.

I have for years remembered a song `` JUST A COUPLE IN A CASTLE '' ( `` No . twenty - one - nine - nine. "" " I am not a couple. ") That was sung by one of my friends during our long summer vacation. The song came into our heads during our vacation, and as it is not one that we are likely to hear every day during our life in our home in the country, it had for me its own magic. There is another song that is associated with our family. It comes from my great-uncle, my father's brother.

I realize most people don't know who Solomon Kane is and that the film is pitched at that much larger audience. But then why bother to call it "Solomon Kane" in the first place when the name has no marketable value? The characters certainly has NOTHING whatsoever to do with the R.E. Howard character. Except he has a big hat. That's where the resemblance ends.It's always a bad sign when any superhero/fantasy/sci-fi movie lingers over an origin story, but when you invent one whole cloth like this for a character who didn't have one at all, you've already missed the point completely.

Given the subject matter of drug addiction Down to the Bone almost ca n't help but be a rather depressing read. I know it is a common theme and I can see where people would get a bad taste, but I really felt myself cringing and feeling very sorry for the people they wrote about. I know I shouldn't judge them but it just made me feel so depressed to read. I know that they are all in recovery and know the dangers of drugs but I do think the writing was rather heavy-handed and just made me feel so down.

Not really worth a review, but I suppose it's my duty to warn you all - especially since there are some pretty good reviews of this Canadian bomb floating around out there... Bad acting and a slow moving, absolutely atrociously boring 'coming of age' tale in which 3 boys lives are turned upside down when a man on the run shows up at their clubhouse in the woods. At firs the boys make good with the intruder and at one point even view him as some sort of a role model... However all this changes... and you still won't care.

Spoiler with plot explanation : a poor family is being thrown in the middle of war between the evil guy, a good guy and a mysterious organization with no good reasons. the evil guy wanted to take control over everyone on earth, the good guy didn't want the world to end and the mysterious organization wants their own world to rule. Disclaimer

This is a fan-written story based on the works of various authors that are not necessarily my favourites. Therefore, some events might be different than what happened. Any resemblance of the works to my work is purely coincidental.

So, Wynorski remakes Curse of the Komodo a second time, this time replacing the interesting characters of the original with a bunch of obnoxious environmentalists / anti-capitalists. And he adds a Cobra. Most of the movie is spent listening to the self-righteous characters prattle on about the evil capitalist pigs, while sandwiched between this cavalcade of condescension are flashbacks to what happened on the island before they got there. DNA experiments were conducted, critters started to grow, people spoke to each other without coming off as being morally superior jerks, etc.

Talk about creepy . If you really want to sit down and watch this episode where the girl who was killed in the same accident was discovered and then shot, then I’ll recommend it. But you know what, you know what, if you want to sit down and watch this episode, then I want to sit down and watch this episode and have you sit down so you could see the girl and then you can watch her getting shot in the head. So let me tell you why this show is going to get you all fucked up. Why?

The four LA cops in fedoras driving around in a big black convertible look faintly absurd , and even more absurd if you know a lot of people who know cops . But if you’re in the city, you see them, too . The cops can’t come to your house. They want to know everything they can about your life, and if you have a gun. Or a gun problem, like in the two-year old case of a man who had his guns taken from him in an armed hold-up.

I have seen this movie 4 times in 5 months and i never get tired of it just because it's very entertaining. You can always count on Will Smith as an actor who always delivers. He's very talented, handsome and a great person to be around. And he always has a good sense of humor, like the rest of his family. I'll definitely go see him in the next movie I see. It's an action movie with no real story and it's very boring, but I really enjoy Will Smith movies.

There are a whole lot of movies , primarily from the 80s , that are so terrible that you ca't even get them to stop talking about how awesome they are. I'm trying to name one right now , but it'll take a little while. I've been thinking about it for weeks. You know, you're in a dark room and the movie starts, and before you have a chance to blink , the whole room turns to dust and your ass drops down to the floor. "So what?" You shout to the universe. But you're wrong.

When naïve young Eddie Hatch , a window dresser at Savory 's Department Store , falls for a statue of a young Marilyn Monroe , his life is turned inside out. As he learns to be Monroe 's friend, he begins to love her even more . As his love grows, his life becomes full of passion, sex , and even love. But, at the end of her life, Monroe makes it clear that she never loved him. Eddie tries to learn to accept that Monroe is not a woman he ever wanted to be with - even if, in his heart, he knows Monroe is his soulmate.

Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd ... The strangest , most off-putting , but most wonderful Broadway musical . It's an adventure in music and in comedy, and it's a tale that will haunt you if you are not already haunted by it . The story centers on a "haunted house" , a "haunted street" , a "haunted tavern" , and the tale of the man who haunts them . It is a story that has been told over the ages . . . and told so many times that it has lost some of its novelty and mystery . .

While this is horribly dated , I MUST insist ... PLEASE , NO REMAKE ! Frankly , it just woouldnae work out ... I'd hate to have to remake every single scene of the original movie ... just in case you don't remember the original, you'll have to live with an inferior copy . I've seen the original version many times , and there's no question about how well it's been aged , and you don't have to wait for my opinion to come out in print . You can just go and rent it for yourself .

The first season of Bones is playing in Finland and I ca n't believe the amount of bullshit that this show has already been through. First off, a quick note on the first season: I actually finished the second season of Bones even before the first episode aired in the UK, because I knew I was only going to make it to week three if I kept watching every single episode. And even then, I thought it was just awful. I couldn't stop laughing, I couldn't bear to listen to the dialogue any more.

Three distinct and distant individuals' lives intersect with the brutal killing of one by another. The one-hour film only reveals the event that brings the three individuals together only after half the film is over. I have seen other segments of the "Dekalog" but this one struck me as the most sparse one in dialogue and yet most fascinating in structure.The film opens with a law student practicing a mock plea of defense for a man charged with murder. Obviously the same arguments must have been repeated by the man as a full-fledged lawyer but this is never shown on screen (at least in the short 1-hr version of Dekalog 5).

I don't understand why some of you (or many) have given this film upward of 8 stars out of 10. Do you understand that there are lower ratings for a reason? Sure, this may be a zombie flick with some splatter, but thats it. I'm not a hater on zombie films, but this was awful. Really, actually, I should call it more like a zombie-soap, because thats how the acting is. Production is... well, okay. Barely an attempt at plot development, awful acting, silly effects, clichés, and an abrupt ending.

I was on a British Airways flight from London to New York when I saw this movie . I wish I had been there when it was shown. The movie was shown in the cinema and the screen was about 10 feet wide, so you could see everything. The story of this movie was very moving. The only problem with it was that the movie lasted over two hours. When it was over, I got up to go to the restroom. On my way there, it suddenly occurred to me that the movie was not over, so I walked right back into the screening room.

Terribly disappointed with CITY OF MEN after being swept away by CITY OF GOD . Lost is the exciting and fresh concept of a new superhero team made up of ordinary men & women that fight evil and fight for justice, all while having fun doing it. In a nutshell, if you thought the X-Men series ended in the ’90s and were disappointed with the “mutants vs. normal people” theme then you would have been right. However, I was not really expecting that CITY OF MEN would be the end of CITY OF GOD.

Although this was the first Hunter S. Thompson documentary I have seen it was average at best despite the involvement's of huge star appearances such as Johnny Depp, Bill Murray, Gary Busey, and a few others. I was let down by this and yet it was still a little interesting. What kept me watching was some of the old clips from Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas and Where the Buffalo Roam. Not that good mostly because of the old guys rambling and things any fan would already know. I still think they were milking it because it could have been compressed down by at least half.

This is one of the movies having made significant influence on me as a person. The sound tracks are best and the performance is excellent. Just a great movie for ever, to time limit, just for the entire live, you must have in your collection! This is one of the movies having made significant influence on me as a person. The sound tracks are best and the performance is excellent. Just a great movie for ever, to time limit, just for the entire live, you must have in your collection! This is one of the movies having made significant influence on me as a person.

A few buddies and myself have the strange hobby of seeking out really horrendous and utterly obscure ( for a modern listener) metal bands. It’s a great way to find out about some bands you’ve heard of and may have missed out on. This isn’t a complete list, of course, as we are still finding out about all sorts of bands we might have missed out on in our youth, but it’s enough for now to get the wheels in motion for our first feature article.

Ok, everybody agreed on what was the best season. The first. And killing off Boone was a bad desicion. Also killing off others was bad. Blame the directors and writers for it. Bad boys. BUT. I still think this is the best scifi series ever! Sorry guys I can't help it! I see that the quality of the series was decreasing after the first season. Still it's easy to accept Liam as the new main character, if you are over Boone. He is really... mysterious.

I have seen this film probably a dozen times since it was originally released theatrically . Anyone who calls this film “the first modern horror flick” clearly doesn’t know their shit. If you do, read on. This review will be spoiler free because it is my personal opinion and I’d like for it to be clear that this film is NOT the original, it is a remade version, not a remake of the original but a re-make. This review may not contain a lot of information, so if you have to know everything, let’s go on.

Monster of Mexico I do agree is the weakest of the modern Scooby Doo movies , mainly because of the poor special effects. I was hoping that this would have a few more cool effects than the other movies in the series but there was a lot more to do here that it needed. The characters were all a lot more fun to watch . It was also interesting to see how many different countries were represented here in Mexico . The movie had some funny lines and was pretty good but it would have been better if it had some of the cool special effects that other movies in the series did.

Sure, most of the slasher films of the 1980's were not worth thecelluloid they were filmed on, but this video nightmare may well bethe dullest produced.Six horny pot smoking students decide to go camping. Of course,and you know this already, they begin getting killed one by one by amysterious stranger. The climax has a hunky forest ranger trying toget to the teens in time before the last cute girl becomes buzzardbait.John Carl Buechler, my least favorite B-movie guy, did the lousymakeup effects here. The cast features Carel Struycken, of "TheWitches of Eastwick" and the Addams family movies.

Larry Bishop, the Writer/Actor/Director, focuses too heavily on the camera, music, and visuals. The film resorts to meaningless ramblings and vulgar monologues, which seem to have no purpose other than boring and irritating the audience. The actors experience a bumpy ride, from the film's start to finish, and are caught in one terrible smoke screen. The hell with the ride. The film is a bomb.The Victors are presented as weathered vigilantes, who seek their own form of justice for what they see as lawlessness. They are bikers, anti-heroes, and protagonists.

Not too many people seem to know about this movie. Which is too bad because I think it's pretty good. Sure it is a bit cheesy at times and may have a predictable storyline. But the presentation of the movie is pretty well done. I think the casting is good with likeable actors/characters. Tom Selleck does a good job at playing a baseball player (go figure... not too much of a stretch I suppose) and Ken Takakura (from Black Rain) plays the chief (the coach of the Japanese baseball team). There isn't too much to complain about.

I totally agree. This is "Pitch Black underground" and a well worn plot. The best scenes I thought were the divers exploring the caves, going through impossible subterranean passageways, some of them were heart pounding. The scenery was great. Had they dispensed with the staple "alien" toothy CGI badboys entirely the movie would have been much better. All they would have had to do is never show any monsters at all but have everyone wondering, and follow Jack's descent into madness, and this might have been a top rate hitchcock-style thriller, maybe award material.

What? - that was it? The town sheriff (John Agar) blows up the mutant gorilla with a stick of dynamite hidden in a mannequin? Did I just write that? Did I just see that? With instrumentals by The Wildcats, "Night Fright" is one flick that never deserved to be made as late as 1967. The heyday of the gorilla was well over, and anyone other than Ray Corrigan in an ape suit is just asking for trouble. Remake this in black and white and set the story about thirty years earlier and you'd have at least a 4.0 rating on the IMDb.

Kubrick may have been the greatest director of all times . He may have made more classics than anyone else ever . He may also have made more anti-climactic ones than any of his peers . But for all of his strengths, he had one great weakness . His greatest strengths were his eyes . And with them, he would always take us on a journey. In his first film , he gave us what we would remember for a lifetime to come . He gave us something to dream about. But it was not a story about dreams . The story was the world .

When moviegoers hear two popular villains/characters will be fighting, they flock to the theaters to see how the battle will end. There's Freddy vs. Jason, in which two very popular horror icons try to kill each other. And, more similarly to this, there's Godzilla vs. (Insert Name Here). But the very generic Komodo vs. Python is just a horrible title, and an even worse premise. Obviously, the movie's a D-list picture, but, at least come up with a more compelling name, maybe something that can trick the unsuspecting viewer into watching it.

I am astounded that so many people find this film even close to good . Let me make it clear, this film is not for everyone . It is a film that you have to have seen to understand . The only way to understand is to watch the movie . There is no other way . Even after watching it, you will wonder how you lived without seeing it before . It is no secret that I was not a fan of the ’90s. This is especially the case when I was younger. I did not love the ’80s for the same reason.

Like another poster mentioned Ch. 56 (a local Boston TV station) showed this multiple times over the years on Saturday afternoons. They paired it with the first sequel "Return of the Ginat Majin".Now I haven't seen it since then...but it never left me. Aside from the atrocious dubbing and faded color this was a pretty good fantasy. Technically it isn't horror...until the statue comes to life at the end. It's just about a village ruled over by an evil man. There's a giant stone statue there that the villagers keep praying to to help them...to no avail.

If there are people that don't like this movie, I don't think they are human. This film deploys all emotions and shows many sides of Judith Light's character. Made in 1997, this is one of the best movies I have seen and really the film that Judith Light has starred in to make me a huge fan of hers. This movie, although sometimes you want to rattle the son for trusting her so much, is incredibly moving. I cry at the end every time and it takes much to do that to me!

Your idol will deceive you in this movie . Stephen Nichols is mis-cast as a young german student still bending to society's norms. The film shows his life after that. It's really an interesting look at the lives of young adults in the 80's in a way that most people today can not understand. It had a great cast. The acting and directing were topnotch. This is one of the best movies of 1986. I had seen this movie many years before I got my VCR but never really took in to the movie.

***Tip: Have It Read To You, Heres How***1) Copy And Paste This To Notepad (NOT WORD) 2) Go To. START>ALL PROGRAMS>ACCESSORIES>ACCESSABILTY>NARRATORhaving your testicles ironed.When Jonathan Ross started his career he was on a show call "The Last Resort" now a days he is the first resort to host anything and anything. TV Award Shows that half the time he is up for nominations in, Comic relief, chat shows, quiz shows, game shows, charity shows, Brighton.

LCDR Tom Dodge , despite having a reputation among submariners as a renegade and maverick ( * note to reader: I say "reputation" because I've never met a sailor who knows Dodge's reputation, and I have to imagine that I'd be hard pressed to name one sailor who does. The truth is, while Tom Dodge was known to the naval community as a master tactician, he wasn't liked by his peers, nor was he a particularly popular or easygoing person. In fact, I'd be willing to wager that Dodge had never met an officer or sailor who actually liked the guy.

There is a difference between a "film," and a "movie." A film, regardless of quality, is ready for public consumption. A movie is what a group of friends gets together to make over the course of a weekend with a camcorder. In my time as a viewer, I have seen may examples of both.On September 19, I attended a screening of writer/director Jon Satejowski's "Donnybrook." Now having read the script and having seen two different cuts (a rough cut and the "finished" product) of this piece, I can safely say it is a movie.

This movie made me so angry!! Here I am thinking that here's a new horror movie, one w/a sense of intelligence & then the movie starts. The scenery, the delivery of lines, the costumes, the fake gore, must I go on? There are porno movies out with better dialog than this. I understand the concept behind indie movies, but my goodness, this wasn't just indie this was a high school book report shot w/a camcorder & the cast are all friends & relatives. This is 1 movie that was doomed from its beginning.

I loved this movie. My daughter is 3 1/2 and a country girl at heart. There are not any movies for young children. I loved this one because the worst thing in it was when one of the boys said "stupid". I applaud them for stepping out and making a true family movie. I rented it the first time we saw it and know looking to buy to add to our collection. My daughter can not stop talking about it. It goes along with our lifestyle. We live in East Texas. I hope to see more family films like this one.

I just watched The Dresser this evening , having only seen it once before , about a dozen years ago.It’s one of those films that is a bit of a classic , and one of my favourite films of the 60′s . I think , that it was a good movie to see . I think its a movie about a young lady who goes out to look for someone who she thinks might be the love of her life . When she finds him , she leaves him . She says , “I hope you’d love me and that’s what I really want.

Last night , I saw A PECK ON THE CHEEK ( KANNATHIL MUTHAMITTAL with English subtitles ) . Oddly , the film has not received the same attention that other films that are more mainstream and more commercial have received. But it was a film which I would gladly recommend to someone . This was a film that was made almost 20 years ago and still stands the test of time . But it is not something which is likely to be forgotten by anyone who had a part in it . I have seen other films from other directors in other languages , and have come to realize that the film has its own language .

I must give credit to Billy Dee for trying to pull this off. Knowing this was a blaxploitation film, I started my DVD with a certain expectation. I knew it would be low budget... the acting sub-par... but hoped for a few gems to be sprinkled throughout. If there were any diamonds or gems sprinkled within this film, they were successfully buried under tons and tons of coal... or perhaps overacting. As an actor and filmmaker, I cringed often when potential poignant moments were ruined with atrocious performances. Yet, I must admit, I could not look away.

this was absolutely the most tragic pile of cinema to which i have ever born witness. not only was the name a complete misnomer--since the film has next to nothing to do with piranhas--but the acting is as hollow and stale as the attempt to actually make some kind of plot. when you watch this film you cannot help but spend every waking second questioning when you've had enough and it's time to turn it off. unfortunately i waited until the end in my case. that's two hours of my life that i will never be able to reclaim.

I am in a movie club at my school and I was forced to sit and watch this utterly dismal film on Monday night and now I don't even know what to say about it. That is the problem with a film like this. There's really nothing you can do about it, but still, you feel like crap. You can blame the film, or the director. But it's a film, and it's in the film, and the film is about the film and it's a film and you know what? We're talking about a film!

I probably have to blame myselfbut I sure as hell expected more from a movie that goes by the title "Black Dragons" and revolves on secret WWII conspiracies, Nazi plastic surgeons and revenge. This film is a dull failure with an incomprehensible structure. The actual plot (which basically is rather ingenious and intriguing) only becomes clear during an explication near the end, but the problem is that you stop caring a long time before. We see how horror icon Bela Lugosi infiltrates in a society of prominent American politicians and kills them one by one.

This is one of the better feel-good films of 1999 with Kate Capshaw leading an all-star cast about a small town and a love letter. First off, the scenery is beautiful, and anyone who sees this film and doesn't want to move to this location is crazy! For the cast, Capshaw is stunning as the lead actress who captivates the emotional roller-coaster role. Tom Everett Scott is charming as the "author" of the note throughout the film, and the always delightful Ellen Degeneres is hilarious! Blythe Danner and the actress who plays the bookstore saleswoman are both terrific, too.

Forget Jimmy Stewart reliving his life and opt for this smart comedy of errors instead. I suppose only institutionalized sexism explains why this flick and Stanwyck's other great Christmas story, "Meet John Doe" aren't revered with the same level of love as...well, you know it's name.Stanwyck plays a food writer for a McCall's-type rag who has been lying for years to her pompous publisher about the folksy setting for her recipes. She's an ace b.s. artist until the day Morgan's sailor is pulled from the ocean after 18 days afloat & 6 weeks recuperation in a Navy hospital.

this movie isn't that great...at all but it's good when you want to just laugh, because it's pretty ridiculous :) there are a lot of mistakes in it and it's cheesy. i got this movie for Christmas like 5 years ago but for some reason i've never given it away. i guess i just like it for a rainy day even though i only watch it like once a year. This is a very 90's movie so it's really funny to see how everyone dresses and acts.

It is easy to tell early in this movie exactly what will happen , and who will die . It is not very hard to tell at the very beginning of this film, who is going to marry who . But the real question is : what happens next ? The answer to that question is in the last half of the film , although the audience sees it only when it happens. I saw this movie with my dad, who is a film critic and I was in love with this movie the second I watched it.

It has taken several viewings for me to fully appreciate this film. Initially, I was struck by the stylized sets, but found the rest slow going and dull. I thought that such a sensational subject needed the Ken Russell treatment to take it way over the top. I now find the enforced restraint (placed on the production by Mishima's widow) to be an asset. Some of the more lurid aspects of Mishima's life are reiterated and dramatized by corresponding themes from his novels. I think it helps to be familiar with the novels - that's what finally made the difference for me.

Any chance to see Katharine Hepburn in something I have n't seen or from her early movie career is a good one? I know they were doing a lot of films back in her youth but I don't know where I would start if I wanted to do a little research. Or is there an entire collection of her films I can search? I have no desire to watch a bunch of movies and have forgotten what she is about and don't know if I ever wanted to. Thanks in advance and a big thank you to any who answer this.

I realize most people do n't know who Solomon Kane is and that the film is pitched at that much more casual. But I'll try to convince you anyway. Solomon Kane is a film which is based on true stories, but it is not about a real-life person. He was the first African American to ever win the Olympic gold medal in track and field. He also is the first African American to be an astronaut. Kane's story is about him being a pioneer in sports and a trailblazer in engineering. And he is one of the reasons why people don't just accept black history.

Whatever the producer was going for, he missed entirely. The Lone Ranger is not camp, but "the" icon for good-doers all over the world. And it's a total violation of the spirit of the character that the only real Lone Ranger, Mr. Clayton Moore, was forbidden to wear his mask in public appearances when this movie was released.Whelp, long story short, the single saving grace of this gross (and poorly done) distortion was that in that year, I had the honor of meeting Mr. Clayton Moore in Columbus Ohio, as part of a tour resulting from the bad press over Mr. Moore's treatment.

This version of David Copperfield is dreadful from start to finish . I knew we were in for a wasted evening after reading the summary. The first two chapters are just a list of characters' names and their ages. I don't recall any plot from there on either. I've been reading through this one for several weeks now. It's like I've seen it already. For anyone interested I've got an older edition, and while it may be an older edition, I have to say that the story still holds up quite well to this edition.

I never fell asleep during a movie. Never. This movie did the impossible.While many people claim the superiority of Japanese horror films over their American counterparts, this movie was a lesson in over abundance. As in, the movie was 30 minutes too long. It would have helped if the movie had a little more movement in the plot and the camera work, but instead, all we got were awkward silences and a lot of slow movement. The acting was absolutely terrible, bordering on bad student film levels while everyone struggled to ad-lib something called a script.

Van damme has done some great films over the years and this one hits a big ten in my books. This may be the best film ever made about the AIDS crisis. It takes you into the mind of a person living with the disease, but you are not there to pity him. You are there to feel pity for the life he is leading. You feel for him as he slowly becomes one of the statistics in the HIV/AIDS statistic book. And then you see what the movie has become and you understand.

The plot - in the future when nearly all men have been killed by a Y-chromosome-targeting virus, a (hot) female genetic engineer 'creates' a man in a chem lab - is intriguing. Despite the somewhat promising premise, the movie falls flat in nearly every regard. The dialogue is laughable. The characters are paper thin. The exploration of a single-gender world is shallow. The worst part of the entire movie is the Asian detective who delivers lines so cheesy and contrived that you'll want to vomit.I can't imagine how on earth this trash got produced.

Buster Keaton was arguably at his most enjoyable when he did short 20 minute films , and they do n't all have a lot of laughs or a good message, but the one he did that really stands out is called "The Great Train Robbery". It's the one that has a lot of humor in it and is probably the best one he ever made. I think it's great because you could see how he was going for comedy in it. It just has so much heart it's amazing. How long is the film? This is the third Buster Keaton film.

We picked this up as a part of a Brentwood set , under the title `` The Broken Skull . I thought the story and the art was great. It's the third book in the series but it's the first one that I've read. In the first book, " The Broken Skull " (I think) there are some big hints of where the characters are headed, and how they are going to handle the issues they are dealing with. In this new book, I don't get any hint of where the characters are headed or how they are handling things.

I can get over the political parody ; even if this was SUPPOSE to be a `` Masters of Horror '' novel, I have no idea what it's about or even whether it is supposed to be about anything at all... but it is indeed a rather silly story with a lot of bad acting and some poor writing and bad direction and bad costumes and bad acting and some very bad writing and bad direction and lots of bad writing. It's one of these books that I wish had never happened. I really, honestly, sincerely wish this story had never been written.

I am a gigantic fan of both Koyaanisqatsi and Powaqqatsi, but this movie is just not good. The reviewer below is entirely correct that the stunning imagery of the Detroit station is the first and last memorable scene in the film. I really, really wish I had left after that, instead of continuing to hold out hope throughout the film. Maybe my expectations were too high, but I felt let down.The score is almost completely a rehash of the previous two - not necessarily a bad thing if you're a fan, but there's only one piece that stood out to me as being fresh.

The title, although singular, will undoubtedly remind real horror fans of Tod Browning's immortal classic about a troop of circus freaks and how they were misunderstood by the outside world. I can assure you, however, that this "thing" has absolutely nothing to do with "Freaks" or even with the art of professional film-making in general. This movie was recommended to me, supposedly because it's raw, disturbing and thought provoking despite the low budget production values. Yeah right The person who recommended it to me may now consider himself to be my personal foe!

If this movie had been directed by a man , he would have been jailed . While Adrian Lyne was given the lead , it is the woman who really shines . As an actress who has a lot going on , I could not help but enjoy the story she tells . She is believable as the love interest , while also being capable of carrying the lead . This film does not shy away from its sexuality and does have some nudity . If you are looking for a good romantic comedy with heart , then this is one to look at .

All the pro comments about this movie claim that the movie is balanced. That is their main justification to give a high rate to the movie. But a movie is not balanced when the main perpetrator analyzed is given the last world in every single subject. The director herself admitted to this at the first San Francisco film festival showing. She justified it by saying that she couldn't waste the chance of having access to Fujimori. That might be true but by showing so much of Fujimori's take on the issues makes the movie clearly pro-Fujimori and unbalanced.

OK, this movie seems to have been pretty well covered by earlier comments, but there are a couple of items I wish to add. The mad scientist is producing a serum from the blood of a caged animal in order to turn a man into a werewolf. If we suspend our disbelief enough to buy into that, fine. But the animal in the cage is a coyote. That would make a werecoyote. Did audiences in 1942 not know the difference between a wolf and a coyote? They're easy to tell apart.

This movie is bad, so bad that my mother who can barely stand the "suspense" of Disney's Snow White, was chuckling through out the entire movie. My first warning should've been that it was in the $5.50 bin at Wal-mart. But I have actually found some good movies in that bin, so i can't fault if for this debacle. The second warning should have been that when the cashier rang up the DVD, it was actually $3.88. Again I have never been one to ignore the cheapies.

Not a balanced point of view . The director should n't express her opinion as truth . The movie has been a failure in many parts and I do not have the confidence to watch it again. I have no faith in her ability and I am sure that she is going to mess up again . An excellent film. I am not sure I would have picked up the book if I never heard of it but it was really enjoyable to see in the movie. The story was intriguing, and I enjoyed how it was written and delivered.

I was surprised to discover Michael Moore or Bill Maher wasn't involved with this "movie". An American leftist laundry list of axes to grind, with a distinct sparseness of democrats in Hell. Mao Zedong and Karl Marx didn't make an appearance in Hell, but Ronald Reagan is in the same room with Hitler? Perhaps we'll have to wait for these California spin doctors to butcher Paradiso for them to show all of their pet ideologue political figures.Cheap shots at religion, right-wing politicians, corporations and their lobbyists, Fox News, even SUVs.

The prey has an interesting history, unless you remember the ads for it in newspapers in June of 1984 you might have caught it on the Movie channel back in summer 85, but little else is remembered. The plot is your basic killer in the woods again. But ironically this was filmed before Friday the 13th. The prey was actually shot sometime in 1978 according to one of the actors in an interview years later. But released for about a week at some drive ins, (yes Jim, namans drive in showed this in June of 84).

In Michele Soavi 's confusing art-house zombie film , Dellamorte Dellamore , Rupert Everett plays Francesco , a caretaker in an Italian villa overrun by the living dead. The only one who can speak to him, his wife Anna, (Natalie Portman) has been dead for 12 days. It turns out this is her husband's doing: he is using his dead wife as a conduit for his undead daughter. When the dead start rising, Rupert is forced to flee with a few of his friends in a car, while Anna flees in a boat with her young daughter (Anna Di Lago).

The Adventures of Hercules has to be one of the lamest excuses for a movie I 've yet run across. I'm surprised I didn't hear anyone say: "Hey, isn't that Hercules? What the heck happened to the rest of the movie?" This film tells the tale of Hercules and his quest to find a wife for his crippled brother, Iphicles. After all, if Hercules isn't married, how can he become strong and growl like a werewolf? This was the film I saw when I was thirteen, and I wasn't very impressed.

It 's one of the imponderables of low-budget independent film-making that so many with so little in the way of talent or even resources have the power to conjure up an entire mythology of their own, not least of all when it comes to their own experiences. In the case of the Coen Brothers, I've been thinking about that for a good few years now. Their most recent movie is called Inside Llewyn Davis and its story of an old bluesman named Robert Hunter is based partly on his life story, especially the events of the 1990s.

Greedy land baron in the tiny western town of Prairie City wants all the ranchers off their land , using the land for grazing to pay for infrastructure upgrades that will help his company. A little over a mile down the road from Prairie City is a much larger community. In the town of Poygan, near the Texas border, there is a small farming community with several hundred people. Some of the farmers live on farms in the surrounding area, while others own cattle in the valley. There is a small ranching community as well, a mile down Highway 6 in Poygan.

I am a firm believer that a film, TV serial or any form of art should and would be fully appreciated once the timing factor- as to when written, produced or conceived-should be taken in to account.Yeh Jo hai Zindagi is one such series. I remember watching it in the mid-80's on TV and the re-runs via the video cassette libraries during early 90's. and laughing out loud and being addicted to it. That made me buy the full series DVD set and surprise of surprises- the comedy and the moments of the good 'ol days simply fell flat for me.

Enormous suspension of disbelief is required where Will 's `` genius '' is concerned . Not just in math -- in all things. In that, he's far from alone. I, and millions like me, take it on faith that he's right because he seems so darn smart. If he claims, for example, that 1+2+... is 3, and then proves it mathematically, you've got to give him credit because it's just so hard to believe. You'll never catch him saying something, though, because he never does.

I have seen this film probably a dozen times since it was originally released theatrically. Anyone who calls this movie trash or horrible just doesn't understand action films or recognize a good one. Perhaps to some the incidents and outcomes may seem far fetched, but in my opinion screenwriter Shane Black ( Lethal Weapon/ Kiss Kiss Bang Bang) crafted one of the most well thought out action adventures you will ever come across. Over the top or not this film flows like clockwork and the action just keeps coming. The final action sequence is one of the best I have ever seen in any film.

My website ( www.theflickguy.org ) lists this pick as the worst movie of all time . Here is an excerpt :

"When the credits start rolling at the end of the movie, and the screen goes blank for about ten seconds, we're forced to confront the fact that The Flick is really not that terrible after all." "What's this guy talking about? I had to leave my seat to make sure I caught the movie. How can I possibly be expected to watch something so boring? How can anyone watch such an awful piece of filth for two hours?

It was so disjointed - it seemed to jump from place to place - and the "thief" was obvious. It was a poor man's (not to mention high school) "Less than Zero". I would pass on this movie as it has very little to add. So many issues are left unresolved, and that's okay - but the fact that it jumps around to the point where you wonder what's exactly going on is terrible. The voice-over is needed because the movie doesn't work on its own. Avoid this movie, and watch something else about rich teen angst.

I know not why people considered it trashy or obnoxious ; It 's not like American Pie or something . In fact, the thing that struck me as funny was that people laughed at it ! I 'm not sure why people laughed so much ! I 'd like to make a list of all my favorite things :

1. My best friends are my best friends and I am very lucky for that.2. The first thing I remember about this day is my dad telling me that he was happy to have me for his son and that he loved me very much for that.

So , this is the WORST movie you will probably ever see . It 's up there with `` Crossbones '' , but not even close. I just wish I could have seen it with other people. At least I wouldn 't be sitting in the theatre alone , hoping that the film would be so terrible that my friends would turn the sound off and try to keep me calm until I got home and then they could talk about it in hushed tones . I just want to be able to sit back and enjoy it , and talk about it , and have some fun .

In my opinion , a good documentary - especially one dealing with controversial political issues - should be informative and fun to watch, as well as have a sense of truth and integrity . A documentary that I enjoyed was one on the American Civil War ( The Burden of Empire ) . It was interesting because it showed that in the Civil War there were some positive sides to it and some not so good side. It made me look at history from an entirely different perspective, I was able to understand more fully what the good and the bad sides were.

Mankind's Self awakening is the theme of "2001: A Space Odyssey", a process that unfolds along a space-time continuum. We "see" our primordial past, and we "infer" a cosmic future. The powers of intuition thus become the doors of perception, in our ongoing collective journey.From this transcendental perspective, a conventional, egocentric plot seems superfluous. Our frenzied conflicts and self-important dialogue are consumed in evolutionary change, and are irrelevant in a cosmos that is vast beyond comprehension. It's a tough lesson for a vain and aggressive species.

I'm not bothered by the sleazy hosts, nor am I bothered by the cynical, self-righteous stance the makers of this crap take.What I AM bothered about is that the vast majority of the episodes are fake. I wouldn't even be surprised if ALL of the episodes were staged. Hence this isn't a reality show but something far worse even than Oprah: garbage television with zero comma zero appeal. Like daily TV soap opera but with more action and fighting and less plot.The premise would have turned out great - if only it had been executed without cheating the viewer.

This was a great movie, I would compare it to the movie The Game. You get to the end of the flick and cant move... your brain has been removed and shaken (not stirred) and put back in your head. Dont plan anything after this movie, you will need time to think about what just happened.Dont come to this movie expecting the Matrix style multi millions spent on special effects, this movies special effects come from the actors, they keep you involved, no, they suck you in and dont let go for the entire duration of the movie.

I just watched this yesterday and wanted to read other peoples scathing comments but found some high marks.WHAT ? ? That is why this site is so successful ? Here is the short version

1. I am a gay male with HIV,

I live in a country where there is a well-known gay-panic group,

I have been an outspoken gay activist in my city and have even made several trips to Europe and the US to work with HIV organizations and speak at conferences

I have done all of this and still have a lot more work to do.

This movie seems as if someone had a cute idea for a movie , thought of two or three funny and stupid things and then told that to the movie director . That is why this movie is funny . The director did not know about the fact that you are watching a movie and that is the main reason why that you laugh at some funny and stupid thing , the director does not know what it is. The reason that the audience laughs is not because of the director's idea. This is a movie that will make you laugh out loud .

Chop Shop is a hidden treasure out in theaters! I cannot begin to describe how wonderful the performances are in this movie. This film is for anyone who wants to watch a powerful story and see an example of what contemporary movies should look and be like.This film is about a young boy, Alejandro "Ale" who works and lives with his teenage sister, Isamar "Izzie" in a one-room tiny loft in an auto shop. The story takes place in a part of New York City (that I did not even know existed--Willits Points) where there are endless junkyards and body shops.

While not as bad as some movies (like the horrible "Atomic Twister"), "Meltdown" still relies upon common misconceptions and inaccuracies about the nuclear power industry to advance its plot. I am currently studying Nuclear Engineering in the pursuit of a Masters Degree, and it was easy to point out flaws that would be obvious to anyone involved with the industry.Riding the false fear that a Chernobyl style meltdown could happen in an American plant, the movie states that any meltdown (even partial, according to one of the guest commentators in the movie) would mean disaster for the area.

I watched this movie by accident on TV and it was so unbelievably awful I could not switch it off, I have been telling everyone who knows me about the movie. I think the only thing that saved me from throwing it from my screen was the amazing soundtrack by the Beatles and the fact that the actor who played the lead was an incredibly good looking woman, it was all too much at the time I had seen this movie for me to continue to watch. I could not be more pleased that she is back, I love that movie I will watch it again.

Boy Oh Boy , does this movie stink . This movie is one of the worst pieces of trash I've ever seen. I watched it yesterday and after seeing all the torture scenes, I was shocked. The story was not bad but the acting sucked. It was all fake and I was so disappointed in the whole thing, I couldn't believe that the movie was made. It didn't feel real. I just thought they were trying too hard to make this movie. All the actors just seemed too fake. I'm not really a movie guy but this movie kind of ruined me.

I was at the premier of the movie last night in Rome . I am not an expert in the history of Rome but there were some interesting facts I came to know, which I could share here:

I will start by giving the facts in chronological order, in the form of a story. At the beginning, the Roman Republic lasted about 200 years , until the assassination of Julius Caesar in 45 BC. The Roman Senate, with the help of a group of senators, decided to hold the election of a new President to ensure continuity of government.

This is one of those movies that has everything in it . I do n't think I would get tired of this one for a second. It is so well done it's almost painful . I have seen it three or four times I think and it always makes me feel so happy at the end. Not because it makes me happy but because it makes me appreciate life and being alive in every way . It makes me wonder how I could live a life where I never did anything and never will. I have been there and I think I can explain it to you .

Uncle Fred Olen Ray once again gives us a little of his Retromedia `` goodness '' in the form of his new book, '' Retromania: How You Can Win the Internet Battle with the New Rules '' [link] by the way. I don't know if this book has been updated or not but here are the new rules for this book:

1. Don't spam

2. No negative self-promotion and no selling out of your own product

3. Don't spam your own product unless there is at least 5,000 people looking for it

4.

That's all I can really say about this film. It's DBZ...like Tree of Might and The World's Strongest, it really...doesn't fit into the timeline for the show at all, though it is supposedly placed just before the beginning of the TV series. The action is pretty nice in general. The plot has a nice enough base, with a good background establishing why these guys hate each other and all. Pretty good in general, there... The problem is...there's a lot of really weird stuff. I mean, really weird stuff.

Director Kinji Fukasaku is perhaps best known , in his homeland at least , for his Japanese gangster films , especially in the 1980s and 1990s, and he has made several films in other countries. Fukasaku started his career in 1960 when he graduated from film school and directed a series of student films , the best known of which was an adaptation of Oedipus Rex, but he struggled with his first real job as an assistant director on a low-budget samurai film. After two years he had enough money for a film to be completed , and Fukasaku shot his first full-length movie in 1965.

This film was really terrible.However , it's worth seeing , as it features the worlds most unnecessarily extended sex scene ever. I mean , this thing went on for about 7 - 8 minutes (repeating the same 'moves' over and over), thats almost 10 % of the whole film! I haven't laughed as hard as I laughed at that for a long time.There were some seriously strange and pointless goings on in this film, but the one that I found funniest was when (for no reason whatsoever) a helicopter lands and 5 or 6 guys in orange suits run in to the complex near the end.

While it 's not `` perfect '' , it 's close . Love Barbara Stanwyck , SZ Sakall , Sidney Poitier , and Richard Chamberlain . It may not be the masterpiece of a perfect movie . It has its flaws . Some of which I will address later . but for now , let me tell you what I did not see in the film . The movie stars the great SZ Sakall as a woman who is very successful , but is very lonely , and wants to meet a man who is very successful to help her become happy . The man , in real life , is Richard Chamberlain .

I was a still photographer working in Europe the summer that Jim Salter shot the movie Three.I did some swell work.I had a few friends over one night,and we did a couple of rolls of film on the deck of our boat.I was about halfway through when Jim turned up,and he asked me to come out to his house for dinner.It was a great story.He was a good sport.I didn't know him from Adam,but I found myself wanting to be nice to the man I'd spent the past six months working with.And so I went.

Dreamland started out moderately interesting but never went anywhere except Tedium city. A low rent affair with no name actors and laughable effects, not recommended for any reason. The best thing that could be said is it looks like they really filmed it on location in the Nevada desert. That's it, I can't think of one thing good besides that about this stinker. The finale is supposed to be some kind of revelation but falls flat like the rest. Oh, I thought of one other good point about this cheese, it clocks in at just over an hour although it still wears out its welcome long before then.

`` While sporadically engrossing ( including a few effectively tender moments ) and humorous , the sledgehammer-obvious satire 'Homecoming ' is a fine introduction to the craft and style of Woody Allan . . . And it does not disappoint as the story unravels and the music and lyrics grow with each new page . . . If you're a fan of 'American Psycho' , you might find it surprising that 'Diary of a Country Song' and 'Homecoming' are so close in style and tone . . . In fact, 'Diary ' is not just a parody but a direct parody of Allan's own work .

Riotously cheesy lunacy about lava spewing from the La Brea tar pits in Los Angeles . Even if you attempt to be a smartass and don’t mention the obvious (which is, you know, impossible) you’ll still be exposed as a liar. If you’ve been on the internet for long you’ll know the drill: the moment you start talking you’re already a douchebag, and everyone who disagrees with you, including you, are a dick. And then they’ll go on to make you a dick.

Excellence seems to come rare in Hollwood today. Many consider just two out of the year's best picture nominees to display sense to the movie industry. And in 'Everything is Illuminated,' the mark is hit directly.The film initiates its brilliance with the beautiful setting-the-scene entry. From the beginning, you receive a sense of warmth and true family connections and relations between one and another. And also, the cast is introduced perfectly. For Elijah Wood's character, Jonathon, his sensibility is expressed through holding his dying grandmother's hand.

This film essentially contains all the elements of a great 70's exploitation film, except it was done in the late 80's for the direct to video market.You have a young couple in love, but the whole world around them is involved either in crack dealing or gang violence. When the boyfriend goes to jail, the girlfriend ends up vulnerable to all the criminals, who are everyone in this movie except for the cops. First she gets hooked on crack by a dealer and then because he owes drug lord Jim Brown money, she becomes Brown's property.

The Mod Squad is n't a movie , it 's a void . That 's the most fascinating thing about the whole thing . The movie itself is boring , I can't think of the last time I've ever laughed so hard at a piece of crap . In the words of one of the movie's characters , ' Why bother?' The movie is about a bunch of bored people who get bored of their own lives . So what does the movie do? It makes us want to watch it. The problem is , as we watch it , we start to realize that there is actually a plot .

I agree with all the comments posted so far: This movie was a waste of time and energy, for viewers as well as those who made it. Terrible CGI, awful script, stupid plot and hey, the setting is Alabama but it looks like California. But the worst thing has got to be the Native American angle on this, which pulls in every stereotype you can think of, from the chief surrounded by smoke, the angry warrior, people speaking without using contractions ("Do not do this thing! "), Native American pipes playing in thin air, etc.

There are plenty of comments already posted saying exactly how I felt about this film so Ill keep it short. "The Grinch" I thought was marvellous - Jim Carrey is a truly talented, physical comedian as well as being a versatile clever actor (in my opinion). Mike Myers on the other hand gets his laughs by being annoying. I used to like him very much in his "Waynes World" and "So I Married an Axe Murderer" days - but Ive never been fond of Austin Powers and "the Cat In The Hat" has just finished me off.

After seeing NAKED CITY and NIGHT AND THE CITY (which is still my favorite Dassin) I was more than excited to watch his "Masterpiece" (O-Word Criterion) RIFIFI.Now i am a little bit disappointed about the story.So I have at least these five questions in my mind:1. In the final Countdown Louis Grutter shot from the inside a house the main Character Tony le Stéphanois. He couldn't know if he is still alive or not, but he didn't care about it and ran directly after it outside the house (with the money) to reach his car.

I just viewed Eddie Monroe and I was very impressed. The story was easily paced as the plot unraveled to a surprise ending. Heartwarming performances, action, humor, and drama filled the screen. Topnotch acting by some talented Long Islanders. Great script. This is the best film that Fred Carpenter has made to date, he should be very proud of this work. Doug Brown's score is on the mark. Craig Morris is the next Tom Cruise or Brad Pitt. Hard to believe this is a low budget, independent film. Just imagine what Carpenter can do with a Hollywood level budget.

I could n't help but look at the time every 5 to 10 minutes because I found this movie a little difficult to watch, at least it was for me at the end when the movie ended, so I thought I'd make a video about it as I didn't like this movie too much. I think I like the movie a bit more than the other ones in this section so I'm going to leave this one out of this section. Also, this is probably the longest movie in this section so if you have time, I suggest watching this movie.

Adam Sandler's movies are my favorite comedies. The Silence of the Lambs is my favorite horror movie. The Matrix is my favorite sci-fi movie. Anywhere But Here is my favorite drama.Perhaps the single most valuable asset that this movie has is it's acting.Susan Sarandon is absolutely amazing. By the end of this movie I felt as if I knew her character better than I knew myself. She did a simply amazing job.Natalie Portman also did a great job. I recently rented her first movie, Leon (1994), in which she played a 12 year old girl.

OK. A warning for anyone out there who is a parent or guardian. Be careful about who you see this film with - ie - DO NOT TAKE KIDS TO SEE THIS FILM. I'll explain why.1 - the title is misleading and the film has nothing to do with romance - I assume this was fully intentional on the producers behalf, but is annoying 2 - the film itself is really very very disturbing. I have some problems - first is the fact that the film is neither violent or sexual and therefore is not a 'horror film'.

go get your camcorder, your little brother, and the disturbing neighbor next door who throws boiling water on raccoons; and you got yourself a film! well, that's what these guys thought anyway. it was so bad i can't even remember the majority of it except for flashbacks comparable to someone who toured in 'Nam. despite the really corny title, the horrible quality, the terrible actors, and the cliché writing, i think this movie isn't the worst i've ever seen. i'm saving that slot for everything with steven seagal, chuck norris and jean-claude van dam.

At first I did n't think that the performance by Lauren Ambrose was anything but flaky , but as her career has progressed I have found it to be far more entertaining. I am a fan girl , and I can say that for Lauren Ambrose, she is one of the finest porn stars to ever live. I have watched every video Lauren has made, and I have to say she is the most talented and beautiful woman on the planet. Lauren is my favorite pornstar by far and I am looking forward to seeing what happens with the next few movies Lauren does.

No music. No stupid masala. A reasonably realistic portrayal of the police system in India and based on a real "encounter" specialist in India, Daya Nayak. That is Ab Tak 56 (56 symbolises how many criminals the lead "Sadhu Agashe" has killed" - well you already know that bit)Brilliance exudes Nan Patekar in the role as a relaxed and calculating Indian cop.
