Demon Wind is about as much fun as breaking your legs . It is definitely an awful example of a good idea, and even more so in an age of 3D, where you can actually play the game using an XBox 360 with Kinect as the controller. In my experience, using Kinect to play games was a lot more fun, but as with anything new, there were some issues. First of all, there are a few different types of games you can play and you have to play them the right way, in the right order, to get the most out of the system.

If you find the depiction of violent murders and wanton police brutality expressed in a plot less film with glacial slowness you’re in good company. For the past several years, American filmmaker Ryan Reynolds has been at the forefront of the conversation around Hollywood’s increasingly regressive attitude towards sex and sexuality. With films like I Don’t Feel at All and I Feel Pretty, which have been criticized for their homophobic undertones, and his hit rom-com Switched at Birth, which has been criticized for perpetuating an outdated notion of what a marriage should look like.

I have seen nearly all the films of Kurosawa and dozens of other Japanese films as well. Compared to these other films, this is a rather average to poor film. The plot features two warring brothers--neither one of which I cared much for--and it is very confusing keeping up with who is allied with who. The music and cinematography is pretty good, but the special effects, at times, are terrible--rubber heads flying off with about the same realism as the average high school play! On top of these complaints, the ending of the movie completely DESTROYS and UNDERMINES the entire picture.

I 'm not surprised that this film did well at the Hamptons Film Festival . It is a shallow film , but not a dull one , at least with a lot of imagination . It could have been worse , and in a way , I would say it is a masterpiece . The film is set in Europe during the French Revolution , and there is some humor in it . However , as you can see , it is a historical movie , and that is what I think makes it such a masterpiece . For those who haven ' t seen the film , it takes place during the French Revolution .

The story line of a man 's love for an innocent baby he finds with a malformed face and on the first day of school begins to unravel and it's time for some truth, but will he find it within the truth? The truth has to come out in order to save the innocent child but if truth is truth and love is love and he loves this baby with a passion he will do whatever it takes to make this child his. This was my first YA fantasy. I'm really enjoying the read so far and I think I've seen the author improve with every story.

Why would anyone make a film like this? Why would anybody invest in a film like this? Why would anybody in the film business work on a film like this? Why would any theatre show a film like this? Why would any TV channel program a film like this? Why would any critic bother to review a film like this? Why would anybody watch a film like this? Why would mental examinations not be made of the writers/producers/directors of a film like this? Sometimes there are movies that are so bad they're good. This is a movie that is so ghastly that it's horrible.

Given Christopher Nolan's string of successful films, it's a no brainer for me to want to check out his filmography watch his debut feature, which is shot in black and white back in England, running less than 70 minutes long, done with little budget, but containing all the hallmarks that has made him a master filmmaker and storyteller.Though short, the film is no less gripping with its meandering plot that will leave you guessing, because the premise doesn't even scratch the surface of this tale, which is pretty amazing considering the depth in the narrative's structure and characterization.

Its a very sensitive portrayal of life with unquenched or constrained desires. What does one do with desire in a culture and society with rigid norms? One husband finds outlet with the immigrant - since immigrants don't belong or aren't accepted, they don't need to conform and dam their desires. The other husband looks for solace in spirituality and tries to evaporate his desire into nothingness. It fails - of course - and he breaks down in the last scene for multiple reasons. Sita still cared enough for him to find that moment to let him know that he is not responsible for her deviant outlet to her blocked desires.

I just watched this movie last night . Within 30 minutes of the start , I was hoping it would end the way it starts . Unfortunately , I found myself wishing it would end at least a little differently . And it didn't , but the movie was entertaining and enjoyable . If you've not seen it , it will probably leave you with one thought about it after you've watched it . What does it mean ? This movie was made for the film festival in Cannes this year , so it's not a huge release yet .

Animated shorts just don't get much better than this wonderful Canadian film. This short feature is dripping with Canadian references, and so, this film will probably be appreciated by Canadians most of all. But the basic story is universal, and it is told lovingly by writer Roch Carrier. It is a hilarious story that I have known for quite sometime, and I was recently fortunate enough to see it again, so I simply HAD to write a hearty recommendation for it. This is a masterpiece, and a must-see whether or not you are Canadian.

What could have been an excellent hostage movie was totally ruined by what apparently looks like a bored director ... with a $100,000,000 budget. Director Steven Spielberg was supposed to have been the star of Steven Spielberg Presents, the story of an escape from a small New York town held hostage by terrorists. (Spielberg’s last movie, Lincoln, was a historical drama set in the 17th century, with Lincoln played by Daniel Day-Lewis.) But this movie, now in theaters, was not nearly as exciting as it could have been. And that’s saying a lot.

I 'm a big horror film buff , particularly of the 1980 's subgenres . Name one  I 've been looking . The director has been working on a project that he describes as The Black Friday of horrors,  an adaptation of Clive Barker 's story about a young man who finds a young child and takes it home. I ve never been able to decide whether to be scared out of my wits by the film or to laugh out loud. I will say that it is fun and creepy as well as being genuinely scary, and that is probably enough for me to recommend it.

Hellraiser: Bloodline is only a so-so film. I believe it's the fourth installment in the Hellraiser series.I missed the beginning, and all I remember from there was some topless women and a box-shape thing on a computer screen. But, using my wit and intelligence, (and the Info Button) I soon found out that the villain (Pinhead) was released from Pandora's Box, which, I believe is a gateway straight to Hell.So, anyways, Pinhead somehow comes out of the box and terrorizes the "Toymaker's" family. And, that's about it.

As I write this in November 2005 I 've become aware that the great British boom of cinema has come to an end. The first signs of this appeared with the death of Richard Attenborough in February 2005. Although he was widely regarded to have had the finest voice of all the directors who've ever worked in Hollywood and certainly had some of the finest cinematic experiences to his credit, there's no doubt in my mind that his body had finally given out. He suffered a stroke in 1994 and died of the consequences in January 1995.

On the positive, I'll say it's pretty enough to be watchable. On the negative, it's insipid enough to cause regret for another 2 hours of life wasted in front of the screen. Long, whiny and pointless. And I'm not saying this to be mean, I really wanted to like this film, it seemed to have everything going for it, had the so called "buzz", and was a hassle to track down besides. Had a little more effort gone into it on the story side, I believe this would've been amazing.

I know not why people considered it trashy or obnoxious; It's not like American Pie or something. I know not why people are offended by the Universal plugs; since it's part of the plot, the advertising is excusable.This is a funny movie with good dialogue, good subtle wit, a good story, a good moral (that thankfully doesn't get too sappy), GREAT acting, and a cheesy ending. (minor spoiler) The basic premise here is the classic story of a Shepherd boy (Muniz) who lies so much that no one believes him when the Wolf (Giamatti) comes along.

I really enjoyed this movie - I like prison movies in general ( I 'm not sure why -- I just like prison movies. ) and this was the best prison movie I had seen yet. There was a lot of tension building in this movie that I enjoyed. There is a lot of violence too which I didn't mind ( except for the prison guards -- I didn't really care that much about that stuff ) and even the sex scenes, while not necessarily erotic, were well thought-out and a lot of fun. I also enjoyed the dialog.

Plodding, maybe that should have been the title. Bad dialogue delivered at a snail's pace. All the characters are single dimension with the exception of one. Unfortunately, that character has some of the worst lines and does not seem to fit into this cliché ridden two- hour drag. Having grown up in the seventies, this film is seriously lacking in detail, atmosphere and authenticity. Surprisingly, this was produced by Kelsey Grammar, someone who should recognize sharp dialogue and a consistent narrative in a script. Cameron Richardson is about the only element that lights up this film.

Spoiler with plot explanation: a poor family is being thrown in the middle of war between the evil guy (that pops out from nowhere, and no questions asked... ) that went wacko, and Casper the friendly ghost trying to avenge his death. With every frame movie gets more and more predictable, a big disappointment. Ending seams completely dumb, it has nothing to od with the movie itself, i think someone run out of ideas or just get to the point that movie is s**t this way or other, so it may as well have a stupid ending.

SPOILERS A Jewish Frodo? Yep, that'll be Elijah Wood again.Ever since the concluding part of "Lord of the Rings", Elijah Wood as Frodo has found it increasingly difficult to get away from that major role. Playing a football hooligan, a psychopath and now a young Jewish American, Wood has tried any route he can to escape this typecasting. Now, with "Everything Is Illuminated" he might finally have achieved this. Playing a role which isn't as radical as other efforts, he truly gets to the soul of his character.

Even if you're not a "theatre person," I highly recommend that you see this. Based off of a play of the same name by Christopher Bond (which, in turn, had been based off of an old London legend), Sondheim did a wonderful job bringing it to the musical theatre stage. The score is just amazing-- by far Sondheim's best, and probably one of the best scores written for a musical ever. The show was cast extremely well, my only complaint being of Betsy Joscelyn's portrayal of Johanna.

See Dick work.See Jane work.Dick and Jane are married.They are successful.They have a son. They have a nice house.They have a Latino housekeeper.The housekeeper teaches Spanish to the son.The son speaks Spanish.Ha-ha.See Dick get promoted.The pompous CEO is a crook.See Dick take the fall for the pompous CEO.Jane quits her job.Oops.See Dick and Jane out of work.Dick & Jane turn to crime.As a plot device, they decide to rob the CEO.See the robbery get botched.See Dick & Jane fund the company's pension plan with the money from the robbery.Yay. See the end credits.Okay, so you've got the plot.

Or anyone else have noticed the fact that first bunch of episodes are inspired too much by 90's flicks?I mean seriously wife who is trying get someone else to murder his rich husband so she can claim his assets. Med students who are temporarily stopping their hearts to reach memories that are lost; Flatliners. Bunch of college bodies getting together again to reminisce on the old days but are not fully comfortable because they did something in the past, Very Bad Things? Groundhog day is one of my all time favorite movies.

I went to this film full of hope . With so many capable and humorous actors headed up by Sir Michael J. Pollard, the script, direction, camerawork, casting and music were all excellent. I was not disappointed by the ending. I can’t remember if I’ve seen it before but it’s been well reviewed and I would definitely recommend. I went to see this movie and the trailer looked so much fun! I didn't expect much but figured I would probably enjoy it. Well I had a great time, I've never experienced such a great film!

Lackawanna Blues is a drama through and through . It details the life of a strong woman by the name of Mary Anne Fitzpatrick. A woman in her 50’s who is very close-knit and loyal. A woman who is able to bring love back to someone who has been abandoned by his own mother. Mary’s story is a tale of two women in love . A woman who never had a father to support her . She always knew she would never marry and raise children due to her past . A woman who’s life was thrown into chaos when she lost her daughter.

This is the essence of the early eighties! The malls, the credit card machines, the food, the punk hair color, the soundtrack... I am in love with this movie. This sweet, intelligent Romeo & Juliet teen flick is instantly addictive.Martha Coolidge is one of my favorite directors. She really employs her actors, like John Hughes and Steven Soderberg, so check out -Joy of Sex- and -Real Genius-. The soundtracks for -Valley Girl- are great. If you can find a copy of the film, buy it! It's out of print and very hard to come by.

Before I start to tear apart this movie , mark you -- I LOVE THE SCARLET PIMPERNEL . That story is one of the best things I ever read in a book, but it's also a story that can be told in any number of ways. What sets it apart from all other stories is its ability to be told in an extremely intimate way -- not so much to show us the horrors of a particular day, but to make us feel the agony of those days. This is how I'll tell this story.

An untidy man, known as Bill, lives in a small dreary flat, with a poster of Marilyn Monroe on the wall, and his typewriter for company. Only the man can't think of anything to write. He wanders around the streets following people, just to see where they go. Maybe this will give him some inspiration to write. He begins to follow a well dressed man holding a bag. He follows him for a few days. While in a cafe, the well dressed man sits down at a table on the opposite side of Bill, and inquires why Bill is following him.

My mom and I, rented this movie. I mean, we love those type of Sci-Fi flicks, whether they be big Hollywood flicks or Indy flicks.But oh, we were fooled!! Two journalists are investigating a UFO abduction in a small city in Texas. Halfway through, all the sudden things get all christain on us. My mom and I believe in god and Jesus and the Devil, but the way this movie was preaching it, made it annoying. All I really have to say, is that we are Christian, but even we like to have fun.

WEll first and for most I'd just like to say that I'm back out of retirement from writing well deserved comments about horrible movies. Only the movie in titled "Scarecrow gone wild" could bring me back, so here I am.With that being said, I like to start off with this comment. OUCH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! This movie was really horrible, I mean I know it was going to be bad.

I am not sure who recommended Surveillance to me , but I think I have an idea : one of my friends (I know nothing about security) sent me the link and I read a little bit more into it. I’m really not sure how this will help the situation, but I’ve started using it, so I want to say what I’ve learned about it. This is not an attack of the network

If you are under attack, the first thing you will see is that the site is slow.

This movie tries its darndest to capture that classic bad canadian movie feel:"quirky" and obnoxious characters (a few); "quirky" town with "quirky" folk; a "quirky" coffee shop or restaurant (coffee shop here); lots of shots of canadian stuff for postcards (ocean stuff here); lots of mention of "gotta get out of this town"; downright booooring.And it succeeds on all counts.Something to note, though. I couldn't figure out whether this movie was just trying to be post-Northern Exposure "quirky" comedy or something surreal like a drug-induced or psychotic hallucination.

Why ca n't a movie be rated a zero ? Or even a negative number ? Some movies such as “Trainspotting” have been given a zero rating and yet they are very successful at the box office. Couldn't something like this be possible in India ? Maybe we can create a “zero rating system” in India to give more value to an item which might have a lower quality than the rest of the world. The problem is that it will be hard for the movie-lovers at home to accept the rating a zero has on a movie.

I 'D BUY THAT FOR A DOLLAR ! ! ! I did buy this film for a dollar and I think the film is great and worth $ 1.00 but for a dollar , it is only worth one dollar. I can't get it out of my brain and I feel that it was a very good movie for only a dollar. I think it's a movie made for kids, because if you want something like this then you have to be like 13 years old. Don't pay more than one dollar to see a kids movie and that's it.

I was just lucky I found this movie . I 've been taking advantage of Walmart 's $ 5.50 DVDs for a couple of months , and I had never seen it till I saw this movie. I was very disappointed that it was on the dvd and that the picture quality was lousy, but I took a risk and rented the movie. This review is based on my own personal experience of watching it. This is a great movie for the family and should be viewed by everyone as a good wholesome family entertainment flick. I hope this review will be helpful in your decision to purchase or rent the DVD.

Swoon focuses on Leopold and Loeb 's homosexual relationship - a facet of the case that has been mostly (but not exclusively) ignored in recent decades, and which makes for a fascinating contrast to the prevailing view of him as an anti-Semite, or at least of him as the sort of man who didn't like Jews very much, or at least who liked Jews enough to try to have a sexual relationship with them in a way that he didn't like their religion, but whose religion didn't like Jews either.

I know it's rather unfair to comment on a movie without seeing the complete piece - but I am going to anyway! I waited for a laugh, I tried to give it time. I think 20 minutes is long enough to wait in a comedy for a laugh. My laugh never came, so I gave up.It's stupid humour, not so stupid that you have to laugh, though. It isn't anywhere near that high grade. Let me correct that, it's just *stupid* - not stupid humour. They may have intended for certain scenes to be funny, but they weren't.

I was totally surprised just how good this movie actually is because when I first saw it I was only mildly amused! I must say however, that I am still very disappointed that Donald O'Connor wasn't given a bigger and better role! He was an enormous talent.There is a great chemistry among all the main cast members and Matthau has never been funnier.I am tremendously glad that this picture got made because we get to see Lemmon and Matthau team up for the very last time; in a vehicle that puts their talent to great use.

When a bomber, a patricide, a pornographer, and a mad biker, together with various other forms of social scum, have had enough of their sh** infested cell, they spot a rat and look for the hole. Escaping from the sewage the group of 9 souls, take advantage of their new found freedom and head for civilization. What soon follows is not surprising. Complete mayhem and terror follow in their wake. It seems that each has some unfinished business to take care of.Loosely based on The Great Escape, 9 SOULS is by far in the top 5 best films I've seen this year.

Eaten Alive follows a young woman (Janet Agren) who searches for her lost sister. Turns out her sister have joined a sect that has disappeared into the jungles of Borneo. With Vietnam veteran Mark at her side she sets off to find her sister.As per usual, the acting isn't of the highest quality but you do get cannibal flick poster girl Me Me Lai spending most of the time on screen with her breast bare, female lead Janet Agren covered in gold paint and abused with a dildo dipped in snake blood among other things. Now that's gotta count for something!

[ CONTAINS SPOILERS ! ! ! ] Garfield and his owner Jon Arbuckle were in a rut . They basically had no money and were living off food stamps . When Garfield finally gets his money from his dad, his mom tells him he needs to get rid of Garfield because if he were to die, his family would starve. Garfield agrees. That night, Garfield walks into his mom's bed. He says to her "Mom, I've had it.

The recent documentary `` The Adventures of Errol Flynn '' is an in-depth look at the Ultimate Hollywood Hero . It follows the exploits of this legendary actor in his many films, from '' Gold Rush '' to `` Gone With the Wind '' to `` The Charge Of The Light Brigade '' to `` Lassie '' to `` Ben-Hur . " It was on the screen in 1956, with a cast of all the greats, including Errol Flynn, James Stewart, Barbara Bel Geddes, Lee Marvin, Joan Fontaine, Jack Carson, Henry Fonda, Walter Pidgeon, James Arness, James Whitmore and others.

In my opinion the directing, editing, lighting, and acting(minus Franco) were very good. I must admit, I was pleasantly surprised and impressed with this film. And I felt like the Travis(Franco) character wasn't really affected or changed in the end after Terri commits suicide.

This movie was extremely disappointing , I thought it would be another 'marijuana comedy ' but do n't be mislead by the fact that that's not what it really is. It does look like something I could watch at a party , with the exception of a couple of 'gripped' out characters . It is the story of four friends that smoke weed and drink beer together. When one of them loses an important job , they get to live in a camper van with his best friend ( who is also a very good looking guy). The story follows the four of them through the years.

I have never felt the need to add a review to this website until now, but having just sat through the film I felt it necessary to warn parents who may be thinking of showing it to their children. Please don't! This is no Disney film. This film tells us 'life is cruel' and if you show it to your children, in my opinion, you are too. The video box describes the film as a 'delight for all ages' and the IMDb plot outline describes it as a 'family film'.

That 's how I was when I walked ( staggered ) out of this `` film '' . I could not make a coherent statement because I had just seen something which, even at the moment of its realization, I felt no more than a few hours before. The director is in his late 70's now and he has lost so much weight that his son, not being able to recognize him, runs to find him and find him he runs to see his mother again.

The filmmaker stayed true to the most accurate account of the story published in 1894 which includes an 1846 manuscript that is now lost. Many historians disagree on whether it is a real manuscript, and if it was real, what it actually says, and whether it is a true document or simply a fabricated story. The debate centers on how authentic the story is, how much of the tale has become legend, and whether the document is in fact a historical record of a massacre in which over a dozen slave owners lost their lives as their slaves were butchered in their own residences.

Another great musical from Hollywoods Golden Age! I liked this movies story about a trio of friends who are performers at a small nightclub that is far from Broadway and all its glitter. Although not the big time they are very content with their lives and the small club where they perform. Gene Kelly plays the owner of the small club and is also the boyfriend of one of its dancers, Rita Hayworth who happens to garner some attention when she's given an opportunity to be on a cover of a magazine. Trouble begins for Gene Kelly as his girlfriend is now the talk of the town.

How could anyone who liked the previous JP movies even stand to sit through this 1 hour of drivel ? Well, I'm in a minority. The problem with a 1-hour special about a super-villain who's been locked away for years on a planet he's never set foot in before is that it's got to be more than just a plot device to get us to the conclusion we've always been waiting for. The movie doesn't do much for the audience beyond what they're expecting and what they can take in with one ear and out the other.

Man with the Screaming Brain certainly isn't a perfect movie, but I'm pretty sure it was never meant to be anything more than a star vehicle for Bruce Campbell, meaning it works as kind of a summary of his entire career: slapstick, sarcasm, cheese, action, and happy endings. Campbell is, as a writer, uneven--there are lots of things in the story that don't make a great deal of sense (why does the robot suddenly have breasts merely because a female brain has been implanted into it?

I saw this movie for the first time when Quentin Tarantino showed it to a bunch of us at the Alamo Drafthouse in Austin. He prefaced it with how freaking awesome he thought he was and how funny it was and in the context of his explanation, it was HILARIOUS. I can see how it would be damaging to some audiences, and the subject is not funny at all, but there are at least three lines in the film that had me laughing so hard I thought I'd pee. They don't come until after the halfway point, but when they do, oh God...you will die.

"The next Karate Kid" is an outstanding movie full of adventure and new surprises. It has a wonderful plot and moral that tells a wonderful story. The movie is funny and charming and I cannot stress enough about how interesting the movie is. I definantly gove this movie a 10 out of 10. I suggest the movie to anyone who likes a good movie.

Created by Dennis Spooner , 'Department S ' was a glossy thriller show about an offshoot of Interpol , based on the novels of the French journalist and author, René Weisbecker. The drama was broadcast live on BBC 1 with the first broadcast on 26th October 1982 from BBC Broadcasting House, London, with a repeat on 3rd November 1982. The programme was produced by Dennis Spooner and directed and written by Simon Nye. It was presented in the UK by Michael Aldridge and Richard O'Sullivan in series 1 and 2 respectively, until the programme was discontinued in 1985.

What a great cast and what a pathetic attempt at a film . The script is full of holes from a script standpoint and I can't help but to be reminded of the old days of the 80's when people thought that they could just throw a camera on a couple of actors at the end of a scene with little to no real thought. The result was that most of the shots were taken with little time for editing and in my view this film is full of very poor acting and the script is a joke.

Having watched this movie several times, I have come to the conclusion that Milos Forman made a very daring decision to manufacture a muse for Goya, when the artist led what most would consider a tempestuous,passionate life while the French Revolution and the Napoleonic era raged across Europe, surely one that would have sufficient drama upon which to draw. While I do understand that Mr. Forman was relating in the microcosm of the tragedy of Ines' life the devastation of the world at that time, I was left feeling that there was just so much of Goya left out, so much of his humanity.

Without John Rhys-Davies , I have to admit that this would never even register on my movie-meter . But in the case of “The Invisible War ,” it was a movie that I was glad didn’t make it to the big screen . The director and screenwriter Robert Redford and writer Joe Cornish both wanted to tell a more serious story than “All the President’s Men ,” so they took it out to a remote location that had been set aside for such things . The result was an intimate story told with great sensitivity and a great deal of compassion and understanding for the Vietnamese people .

This is the second movie about 1985 , the other one was 'The Wedding Singer ' . Whilst the 'Wedding Singer' was set in present day , the story is about a singer , who has the ability to sing on an instrument made to look like a harpsichord by the Nazis, he has to hide the talent to stay alive, but he has to do it in order to rescue his lover , who was kidnapped by the Nazis who wanted her as an organiser of death camps . The story is based on true events and there are some factual errors , but its true story .

This was Hitchcock's third Hollywood feature, and it appears he was yet to settle into a pattern of consistency, turning from faithful adaptation of classic novel in Rebecca, to espionage thriller in Foreign Correspondent, and now this romantic comedy in the mould of the "screwball" pictures of the 1930s.Hitchcock's formal method, on the other hand, had by now settled into something consistent, so much so that he was unable (or at least unwilling) to deviate from it. It was unwise then for him to step outside his usual genre, and a romantic comedy was particularly inappropriate.

Dear Readers , 2001 : A Space Odyssey is Kubrick at his best ... although I really ca n't say what his best was as far as I know. What I will say was that he was a genius at what he did. The story of his life was indeed extraordinary. In one sense he was just an extremely gifted young man who found out he had a creative gift in film. The rest was a series of accidents and twists of fate. That is a story we can all appreciate. The film has an incredible cast of great actors who did great work on their own.

Movies seem to fall into two categories: films that reinforce existing societal values and beliefs, and those that challenge them. This film is a 180-degree shift from the idealistic rhetoric portrayed in offerings like "The Longest Day" and "The Green Berets" which seem more like Disney fantasies by comparison. The "Apocalypse Now!" project, the production and resulting film, is "Heart of Darkness" updated into a psychological horror story of the late 20th century post-modernist variety. The cast and crew who worked on it probably could relate to the terrifying places the human mind can achieve.

I saw Heaven's Gate on its opening week nearly twenty years ago. Tickets were sold in advance based on the great anticipation of seeing Cimino's long in the making follow up to his 1978 masterpiece "The Deerhunter." The reviews came in and critics trashed the film with vehemence. An influential New York film critic led the way and most critics followed suit, and the 3hr. 40-min. film was pulled from distribution. United Artists had Cimino shorten the film by about an hour and it was re-released many months later to equally horrible reviews and to dismal business.

The word Ghilli actually means a small sharp wooden game instrument that is used in a game called ghilli-danda (see Figure 1.1). 1.1 Ghilli-danda

Gilli-danda is played by placing small pieces of wood on a tray, each one touching another one on a tray. When the pieces of wood touch in certain way, the player calls out the word "Ghilli"! **Figure 1.1** A gilli-danda (left) is used in a ghilli danda. A gilli danda or gillidanda can be carved from any of various types of wood and is not limited to the traditional birch wood.

That said, if you’re familiar with the book you’ll know what to expect but it is a good film nonetheless. The book was written in 1959 by the late author J.D. Salinger and you can watch the movie adaptation below.

I finally saw LAURE and I have to say that I equally enjoyed it and was dismayed by it . . . too bad the show ended before it was over . . . I had a really interesting show on Tuesday, February 26th . . . I started off my show with "A Night In Hell," which was actually a great introduction. I really liked it. The band really sounded like it was right before I saw them, and it was so cool that it was right before their "Ain't It Cool" tour (which is one of my favorite bands, period).

I lasted almost ninety minutes through this dreadful movie waiting for some revelation about dance or spirit or inspiration or something and gave up! What possessed the filmmakers to do this? This is an old woman of limited talent who is obsessed with herself and nothing else. To fill in a story without a point we get some stuff about the other folks in her thrall, her aid to burros, and, of course, her ten cats! Do not see this film. And have nothing more to do with anybody who loved it - they do not have a clue.

I saw this movie yesterday , and like most allrdy wrote `` i also expected a Steven movie '' , and i must say i loved the film . i think i am not alone in this , since most critics have said the same thing . but i just want to know what you thought , what do you think , Steven , how did you like this movie ? . this movie is absolutely worth a watch , i think it is one of the better ones . i think that is what i said the most , i really liked it , and you just need to watch it , its worth your time .

i was having a horrid day but this movie grabbed me , and i could n't put it down until the end. it was one of the best movies i saw in last few days , the ending was so awesome , i didn't have any expectations , but it still made my day

I've been a fan of this author since reading "The Last Unicorn" and have loved reading this trilogy since then. Now, with the movie adaptation of the first book I'm hooked to the world. I'll be sure to read everything he writes!

There were only two redeeming features about this movie ; the beauty of Bucharest and its architecture , and the beauty of this movie. Unfortunately, the story of Bucharest’s history, which was well researched and written, was marred by factual errors, and a lack of historical information that would have brought more to life this wonderful story. A movie about the life and times of Ghenadie Matei , Romanian revolutionary, would have been more entertaining than this movie. It has been a long time since I saw this movie when I was younger, and I haven’t seen this movie for years.

I would assume that this film would get rave reviews in Canada -- particularly in Quebec . That 's because I see it as a story about a father and son trying to escape the consequences of a crime committed against them. In fact, a crime committed against many. But there are other factors that play into this movie, like the story of two sisters who are murdered by their uncle, whom they believe to be innocent, while the police believe he was guilty and are on his trail. And there is the question of who is right in a story of a father and son?

For a teenager who has never read Austen , this adaptation might be fine . But only for them . For others this film is the first step towards a possible future . I'm afraid there's nothing to take for granted here . I don't think this film can be taken as a recommendation . I think it'll be viewed with some suspicion . This film is just a great adaptation . A great start , if not quite the best . And it has all the best moments from Emma without all the problems . The story is so much more complex .

Any fan of Russian cinema will have great difficulty in believing the sub-par performances phoned-in by Mashkov and Bodrov Jr., and will perhaps be utterly perplexed by Bodrov Sr.'s hackneyed and confusing script, which is coupled with uncharacteristically weak direction. Most of the characters wander through the movie as though they have no idea who they are or what they are doing. It is also sad to see that Jennifer Jason Leigh's acting skills have not advanced one iota since FAST TIMES AT RIDGEMONT HIGH, and her screen exposure is mercifully limited.

For reasons I cannot begin to fathom, Dr. Lorenzo Cameron (George Zucco) begins injecting wolf's blood into his dim-witted handyman, Petro (Glenn Strange). The result  Petro is transformed into a hideous (as hideous as someone with a bad wig and pointy teeth can be) killer beast. Dr. Cameron uses Petro to get his revenge against those in the scientific community who scoffed at and ridiculed his ideas (and why wouldn't they, Dr. Cameron's nuttier than a fruitcake).Overall, The Mad Monster is one dull and poorly made Poverty Row thriller.

The movie was very good . I 'm an avid mystery fan and I usually figure out who is going to die before I 'm done with my movie . I loved the twists and turns the movie had to go through . I liked the twists and turns the movie had to go through . If I had it my way it would have had more twists and turns and I would have liked to see more of it . I thought that was a great way of writing the story . I liked the way it had the mystery wrapped up within it .

This movie was childish in its writing and laughable in its visual effects . Scenes where Father Merrin is tossing out a few words in the air are so lame and stupid that it is almost funny

The dialogue was so stupid that we were laughing aloud at the same time. There was almost nothing else on the film. It could have used more effects to give a better sense of atmosphere, more special effects to really bring it to life and more characters to bring it alive. Maybe the script was so stupid that no one really thought about it.

Have you ever read a book, then seen the movie, and wonder-How did they screw it up so bad? This is one of those. The book by Huffaker, "Nobody Likes a Drunken Indian" was great, riotously funny...this movie is not. It seems as though nobody cared enough to move the direction along so we CARED about the characters. This movie, which touches on some real concerns about Indians, makes you wonder why we haven't seen more comedies about the holocaust, or slavery. Not well done.

this is horrible film. it is past dumb. first, the only thing the twins care about is how they look and what boys like them. they are in 7th grade. not to say i am a prude or anything but it sends the wrong message to girls of all ages. being pretty and popular is not everything. but that is what the twins make it out to be. The plot is even worse. the girl's grandpa just happens to be the ambasitor(sp?) to France. He has a co-worker take the girls around paris and they meet two "cute french boys" with motorcycles.

I am in a movie club at my school and I was forced to sit and watch this utterly dismal film. The film's story is not dismal, but the entire movie itself is exceedingly dismal. The acting was absolutely dreadful. The children were overly whiny. A metal pole could have done a better job. I wanted desperately to fall asleep, but because the television was so loud, I was kept from peace. The monkey's are neither cute, nor are they funny. The drama is laugh-worthy. I cannot remember when I saw a more dreadful film.

I love just about everything the late Al Adamson directed in his long and varied career , but `` The Man with the Golden Helmet'' is by far his finest film to date. In addition to being great fun, and being one of the first big budget films to be shot with practical 3-D, it's also an important movie for several reasons. Not only because it's the only film of the three to have a full cast of female stars (Judy Garland in the lead), it's also because of the subject matter.

We found this movie nearly impossible to watch. With such a super cast, it's a shame that the writing and direction were so awful. The excruciating pace at which the story was told was maddening. The flash-backs were clumsy. The characters were one-dimensional. The heavy-handed metaphors -- the river, the cat -- were repeated way too often. The movie Nobody's Fool, based on another novel by Russo, was infinitely better, probably because it was more tightly written and directed. The photography in Empire Falls was lovely.

This movie was boring . Very much like Underworld , only even less interesting . It 's not much of a movie , although it 's not all bad , just not very original or creative . And there are a lot of bad parts . I agree. I watched this movie as a joke but it was really awful and boring! I enjoyed it more after I read about it. That's the first time I've ever read this type of reviews, because the ones before were very negative and bad, even if it's from a critic.

At the beginning of the movie , Ramgopal Verma says that `` Sarkar '' is his tribute to The Godfather , a movie that has come to define cinema in 20 years. The Godfather is an excellent movie , but it doesn't come close to the genius of Sarkar. In fact, that's one of the many reasons why we love the movie . Verma, the great man who is also a director, says that Sarkar is his tribute to The Godfather , the movie that came out in the 90s. I like to think that the Godfather and Sarkar are two different movies .

The director of this movie is a famous french TV presenter, Patrick Sebastien. He likes music and humor for rednecks, and his incredible movie is absolutely in his image. It's the story of a young retarded person, called "Zep" (sic). A night, he sees his sister's SM sexual relation, and decide to do the same thing: he rape the girl who he loves! Zep is placed in a asylum, and his unlucky girlfriend in a clinic. One man will find them. One man will reunite them. This man is a psychologist.

This movie is really bad. The hero can't play. You see too much that he learned his walking moves by heart. And believe me, he walks a lot. For 45 min, nothing happens. He only walks to places and gets out..... Like if the story was so short that they had to extend it by adding useless and boring "looks-like-a-suspens" scenes.Dialogues are very poor. I counted around a lots of "hello's" and few "hang on" on the 1st part.Blood is orange like the Mercurochrome you put on kid's blisters.

1st watched 7/19/2003 - 1 out of 10 ( Dir-Brad Sykes ) : Ridiculously lame 3D movie which pretty much had it's heart in its mouth from the moment it opened its mouth. The first 15 minutes or so made it seem at least like something that might have been good and interesting, if just a little longer. It went downhill from there. It was pretty bad. Very, very bad. The characters seemed bland and stupid. The dialogue was often bad. The acting and direction were also poor. There seemed to be too much of it going on.

Why isn't this movie on the bottom 100? Raptor is, without a doubt, the worst movie I have seen in all of my fifteen years of life. I have never before witnessed such a catastrophic mess as this. Absolutely everything about it is awkward and cheaply done.Nobody in the cast gives a somewhat decent performance. The dialogue is utterly incoherent and the humor is anything but humorous. Corbin Bernsen was the most painful part of the whole thing. I can't help cringe when I recall some of his lines, like "In or out? You're worse than a cat!"

This is one of the most horrible 'scary' movies I've seen for awhile. I had to wonder if John Ryhs-Davies was just bored and wanted a distraction to do this movie. Th Chupacabra looked like a cross between the Sleetaks from Land of the Lost and the Creature from the Black Lagoon. Additionally they should have used someone who was a bit smaller as the Chupacabra of legend is much smaller. All in all however the movie was soo bad it was funny. Why couldn't bullets and electrocution stop the Chupacabra but the captain's kick-boxing daughter do OK??

This film is Engaging and Complex while maintaining simple beauty .Our two characters come together sharing the base of curiosity and loneliness, but it is a springboard for learning these people, they 're life styles and pasts which support this.The two lead actors (Bohl, Brundruge) were in the moment as any two actors I have ever seen. %100 believable, they transport the audience seemingly effortlessly, into their world. The actors' seamless acting teamed with Bechard's Beautiful, realistic dialog and his truthful direction drives the story forward into a striking and moving finale.This film is visual treat- soft ,increasing the intensity of The story.

I like dark humor and non-PC stuff , but not if it is with no purpose but to elevate yourself or your opinion above a group that doesn't agree with your opinion. I don't think I've ever read anything that made me laugh that wasn't funny on its own, even if it doesn't necessarily have any positive or negative intent on the part of the writer, so I can only assume that what you wrote in this piece would be funny to most people. I think you need to take a look for yourself, and decide if you want to write about things you don't really believe.

Being a fan of the series I thought , how bad can the movie be ? Well I got my answer after seeing “The Dark Knight” and now it’s time to see what they did with the other movie . I have seen both movies and both movies did not live up to the hype . So what did the directors do that was so bad ? For one , the acting was horrible , the plot was way to stupid, and the special effects just sucked . Even worse , the story of “Catman” was written in such a weird way that it made no sense .

This production of Hamlet, Prince of Denmark is by far the best that I have seen. Although it may not have the production value of some of the more recent adaptations, it does have the most important element: Sir Derek Jacobi as Hamlet.Jacobi's portrayal of the disturbed Prince is multi-layered and riveting. His displays of emotion swing from hatred to sorrow, love to vengefulness and everywhere else on the map, but without seeming forced or over-the-top. In fact, some of the more powerful sequences occur when he underplays them, with stillness, soft speech and thoughtful expression.

1st watched 7/29/2001 - 4 out of 10 (Dir-Mark Dindal): Fast-paced, frantic animation effort by Ted Turner's feature animation group plays a lot like tv cartoons and leaves a lot to be desired in the area of likeable characters, but definetly has extremely unlikeable villains. I'm not even sure why the kids would like this movie because there are so many references to old movie stars that kids know very little or nothing about. Mediocre effort at best despite raves on the box comparing it to Disney efforts like Aladdin and Lion King.

This horror movie starts out promisingly enough and there is a moment where I thought to myself "this is going to be really good". However, it gets rather boring rather quick at the end. The acting is fairly good, as is the location and the story starts out rather well too. The problem, not enough kills on screen and an ending where you have the monster basically turning tail and running. I wanted to see more, especially after a very good sleeping bag scene where I thought the movie was picking up and going to be a winner.

I know that Guts of a Beauty and Guts of a Virgin are crap films and are hated by many but I'm gonna put myself under the bus here and say I like 'em, especially Guts of a Beauty (aka Entrails of a Beautiful Woman). Watched it the other night with some folks at the pad and I was surprised how well it actually went over.Entrails is the type of madcap cheapo horror softcore sleaze epic that you really just don't find too much of outside of Asia (specifically Japan in this case).

I can't believe that Isaiah Washington and Ice-T were in this mess! The plot (and I use that term very loosely) centers around an army of rats that terrorize an urban apartment complex--at least I think that's what it was about. The script made no sense at all, I couldn't have cared less about the characters and the camera-work consisted of repeatedly showing shadow images of rats standing on their hind legs or running. Running is what I should have done. As an African American male, I often read pleas from my brothers and sisters to "support African American films."

I watched all three mad max films in succession for the first time a few days ago and was left bitterly disappointed with the third instalment. it destroys the fine work of the first two films with weak and cheesy action and a story line that turns the apocalyptic Australian wastelands into a comical sand pit one would expect to see in a children's adventure movie. the character of max is unrecognisable from his dark and cynical persona seen in the previous films and changed into a predictable uninteresting saviour that left me feeling betrayed. if you haven't seen this film yet then simply don't.

Now, I love bad, old skifee movies as much as most people. And I understand that a budget is a budget. That said, Planet of the Dinosaurs is as bad as a bad movie can get. The thing has no actors, and only one attractive female whom they kill off two minutes after swimming ashore. There are literally no redeeming qualities to be found in this pile of wasted celluloid. The only thing not wasted was paper...the screenplay must have been no more than four pages long. Surely no one actually WROTE dialogue this pointless.

I was lucky enough to see this film at a festival last year and had half expected it to get a lot of flack, but it actually got great reviews! It was funny, and I enjoyed it a great deal. My only complaint was that I felt it had been edited very, very well, and a lot of the humour came out in the edit. But that’s a minor complaint compared to how awesome it was before the film was cut. First of all, thank you so much for all of your lovely comments here on my blog.

I can't believe I rarely ever see this title mentioned by all you eighties horror freaks and I definitely won't be joining all my fellow reviewers here in saying that 'Bloody Birthday' is awful viewing. On the contrary, I enjoyed it very much and I was pleasantly surprised by the ingeniousness and surprise twists it offers. Don't just refer to this film as being 'another 80's slasher' because the victims here are rather unlikely and so are the killers. We're introduced to three cherubic-looking youngsters who were all born during a solar eclipse.

If you want to see a brilliant performance of Mikado, played to perfection with expert timing and panache, don't watch this version. If you want to see a hammy version with Eric Idle strutting around in 1930's english gentlemen's private club society, this is the one to watch. It's a lot of fun and a good intro to Gilbert and Sullivan, but after this, rush out and rent the Canadian Stratford version. You'll see the difference between good and great. Nobody does G&S better than Brian McDonald and the Stratford group.

In short this movie was awful.I understand it 's a Disney movie , which are generally shallow movies with mediocre script and acting but this one was so bad I don't know if Disney could have pulled it off. I watched it with my Mom, and my dad. The movie starts with a prologue showing how the main characters live in a village in a fictional version of India, with the protagonist's family. I think they live somewhere in India. Anyway, the movie centers around a young boy, Ravi.

One of the movies i just DIDN'T want to see. I got it in the sneak-preview, but damn, the acting was very bad! At the end of the movie (i still am surprised i watched the whole movie..) i wondered why i watched the movie.Also here in the netherlands, the writer of this movie (it's filmed from a book of Giphart) thought it was very bad, and was disappointed that his movie came out like this. Next time he wants a role in choosing people for the cast.

OK, this movie wasn't good at all. Video games aren't what I would brag on if I was over the age of 15. Cool to play games, but writing a comment about video game players may like this movie for that it is, that is strange. Just play a video game, don't make up a sorry story about getting trapped in one. I use my cell phone, I hope I don't loose my girlfriend in that. Grease being the worst ever? OK, Grease has a very well thought out story along with being a musical.

* * * SPOILERS * * * This movie - called EATEN ALIVE here in the UK is quite possibly the most intense and violent zombie flick you will see this year. * * * If you don't want to know what happens then stop reading this review and go away. I'd like to be the last person in the room to tell someone about this film. Just trust me on this one. And you might want to go back and watch some of the other films on my Top 20 lists, before deciding to read this review.

This is my first Deepa Mehta film . I saw the film on TV in its Hindi version with its English subtitles. The film was released in 2006 but was not shown in India. The film was shot on a large area in Mumbai, India and has a very good storyline with a few good twists. The film has a lot of dialogues and good action scenes. The film has a good story and is very good on the screen. The film is set in Mumbai in the year 2025, after the 2008 financial crash .

Natile Portman and Susan Sarandon play off of each other like a symphony in this coming of age story about a girl from New Jersey who travels to New York and becomes one of the “wild girls” living in the grungy underbelly of Manhattan. When she arrives in New York and is forced to make a name for herself as she fights to prove she’s not only “wild” but also “cool”, Portman plays against Sarandon’s more confident and confident. It’s a story of both women at the start of their careers but in many ways it also feels like a coming-of-age tale.

I 'm not prone to ranting and my expectations were low to start with , but how did this seem to be the end of the world when I had no way of knowing this would happen. Well... now I am here. I don't know what to say other than.... I'm not sure if I'm in shock or just a tad disappointed. The idea that we would go from the biggest team in the NBA to the worst in the Western Conference seemed impossible. That was until we started winning games and started making it seem like everything was going our way.

It is so nice to see Bruce Willis come down off his action throne and let us see that he is a really good guy. Of course it will be interesting to see who gets the role of Bruce Willis next time he is in a movie. He should be able to step up and take the lead role again. I'm just wondering if he really wants it. "When I die, my death will be celebrated as I deserve to be: with laughter, music and, most of all, a lot of pain."

Chris Penn is hilarious as the all-time stoner brother of Jeff spicoli. This movie is great because it was a lot more real and funnier than fast times at ridgemont high. Casting was perfect and one of my favorite soundtracks of almost all Eddie van halen which went on to become songs on ou812 and unlawful carnal knowledge. This movie is one of the great stoner film heroes with cheech and chong. Fast times was more depressing than funny. Abortions, friends cheating on friends, jerking off in bathrooms, bad jobs, and failing school. Someone must hate the eighties to like ridgemont more than the wild life.

Bloody Birthday plays on the assumed innocence of children and shows them as bloodthirsty monsters. Steven (Andy Freeman), Curtis (Billy Jayne;credited as Billy Jacoby), and Debbie (Elizabeth Hoy), were all born on the same day during an eclipse. Besides sharing a birthday, they also share a love of murder (and they're not picky about who they kill either). Young Billy, Elizabeth, and Andy play the parts of these emotionless monsters quite well but they know when to put on the charm too. But they can't go on fooling everyone.

Well, after seeing "Beginning" I thought why the hell they burned Schraders Version and did that poor one. But now, after seeing "Dominion" I deeply understand this decision. Even they got it not much better.Sorry, but this movie is really crap. Some good moments, but a really boring story-telling and some major plot-holes are killing this movie.I thing the Exorcist-story has a lot and in a prequel on this you can built on a lot and give references the audience will like to see. But there is so much little of it in the movie.

I'm a Petty Officer 1st Class (E-6) and have been in the USCG for 6 years and feel that this movie strongly represents the Coast Guard. There were only a few scenes that were far fetched. The most far-fetched was when PO Fischer (Kutcher) went down inside of the sinking vessel to pull the vessel's captain out of the engine room... that would never happen. Swimmers are not allowed to go inside of any vessel no matter the circumstances. Second, the Command Center (supposedly in Kodiak), it looked more like a NASA command center... we don't have any gear that hi-tech.

The beginning of the movie was confusing and the rest of it was predictable . It was just one of those things where I thought I watched the same movie three or four times or something and I just had to give it another try . I have no idea of the story going on in this movie . There were just a few things going on and that's the problem . The acting and the writing weren't there . They were just a little bit there and the rest of the movie was just there . I couldn't care less what happens .

I've discovered this movie accidentally and it was really a nice surprise. A Christmas Classic,it's also one of the fine comedies of the 40s. The story line is simple : Elisabeth Lane (Barbara Stanwyck) makes out her living by writing culinary columns for a magazine. At Christmas time, her boss, Alexander Yardley (Sydney Greenstreet) asks her to invite a young weakened sailor in the Connecticut farm she write about. The only problem is : She hasn't got any farm and she can't cook.

As an ancient movie fan, I had heard much about the controversial movie CALIGULA assessed ambiguously as one of the most realistic epics by some and as one of the most disgusting porn movies by others. I decided to see it in the entire uncut version to evaluate it myself hoping to find something positive that would make justice to the many accusations towards the film. I sat down in my chair one autumn evening and started to watch. The beginning quotation from the New Testament shocked me a bit and raised the first controversy in me...why to entail a sentence from the Gospel by Mark in the movie about pagan Rome?

Never mind the serious logic gaps, never mind the achingly cliche character portrayals, never mind the haphazard writing, and you might like this movie. The main character Alyssa was supposed to be endearing, the heroine who you root for to be saved,(or in this case, save herself) But instead she merely grates, and makes one wonder, are all pro ballerinas really that stupid? Her busybody mother was obviously only necessary to further propagate the illusion that ballet companies are evil monsters ready to snatch your poor, innocent, young girl from your grasp, with an ever present, biting artistic director/villain.

This is the worst movie of all-time , no doubt , and Schindler 's List , did in fact have the best acting performance of this list , and even that is a dubious honor at this point . not to put too fine a point on the movie , for me it doesn't work . but i do have to admit i'm not sure if i would have liked it as well as i do now , even though i've watched it several times over the last year . it is just too weird , too off the wall for me .

`` Son of the Mask '' is a terrible excuse of a movie . I went to see this with the express intent of going in to the cinema to watch it, but could never muster up the motivation. I mean, the story itself is interesting and it's really well made. But that's pretty much all you can expect from something like this, even if the writing is top notch. However, for a movie to be able to get to the top tier of any genre, at least one thing must be very good, and it's not the writing.

This movie was so poorly acted . What was with Jeff Bridges accent , horrible and unbelievable . Was it that Jeff Bridges got drunk on a plane ? . I don't think so . I hate the movie , the only thing I liked about it was the end , I have to say it was not the best ending in the history of the movies . Hmmm, here's a question that might help you sort it all out: Have you seen the movie in which Jeff Bridges plays a very, very bad version of himself?

Ants are shown in cartoons as being able to carry away chicken legs, watermellons, people, etc. This may be an admirable characteristic because ants carry the film Phase IV. This is not because they want to, but because they have to.The movie opens with a narrator cryptically explaining that some cosmic event has come over the earth, and that a fellow scientist has been working on the effect this disturbance has on the ant population. The movie is broken up in segments; the first part after the cosmic event is Phase I, and so on until the end of the movie, which is Phase IV.What is Phase IV?

One of the commenter 's is wrong . This is not the only Pat Patterson film and he did n't direct. If you want more about Patterson , go back in time to his early work. He was always one to go to the dark side. I always wondered if he was born that way as his father had died early and he never talked about it. I am a big fan but I will always say that his best work was way back in the 60' s . I never saw a movie as bad as this and I never even heard of this.

I really should have learned more about this movie before renting it. It was one of those movies where you keep watching it figuring it's got to get better. Then, when it ends, you feel stupid for having wasted precious time in your life that you can never get back. Ice-T did his bad guy thing and, well, that was the highlight of the evening. The pictures of the shuttle looks like it was done with a little toy inside of a box and the spacewalking scenes were funny because you could see the strings attached to the space suits.

Low-budget but memorable would-be shocker that instead emerges as theater of the bizarre . Vulnerable , naive nurse Charlotte Beale ( Katie Holmes ) is taken advantage of by the hospital's resident psychopath, Dr. Michael ( James Cromwell ), who is also her ex-convict lover . And yet Charlotte cannot forget his kindness to her as she attempts to recover from the trauma she suffered from the accident that took the life of her husband and child . This is not a work of art in the traditional sense , but is the first film in a new genre that takes place entirely inside of a hospital: medical reality TV .

A group of cavers with a sad history take an author on a 'hairy' adventure through an uncharted cave in Kazakhstan. In these times of remakes and sequels and film companies trying to cash in on any winning combination of cinematic components, The Cavern has only one relatively different twist on the previous eight cave movies over the last few years, and that twist seems to be taken from an X-File. I like to give every film the benefit of the doubt, but there were just too many little annoyances for me here. The camera work can give you a headache as they seem to constantly confuse which way is up.

i love watching the Jericho mile . i mean watching peter Strauss run the mile is like watching usain bolt play basketball. i mean you can see he was the best but when u get to the level where u have to do it and you have to put all your heart into it then you know when its over, it was over. i think it is easy to see in this case how it is over. all he has to do now is try and make a comeback in a matter of months. im not saying he can but i am saying he will.

With its rerelease by ADV Films , I 've had a chance to watch `` The Giant Majin '' for the first time in some time. If you're not familiar, the film is about a Japanese man who goes to the South Pole with a robot to search for traces of an ancient civilization. He leaves a wife behind. He has no idea the robot would become his lifeline to civilization or that the woman would become his surrogate mother, the only person with his heart and soul. She survives the ordeal with him. It's a beautiful movie.

I just saw this at the Castro Theatre in San Francisco and had trouble staying awake during this incredibly repetitive play, but now I can see that it's a great show. I don't think I'll ever forget what I saw and felt in San Francisco during the summer. I was in SF for three days last week, and during one of my days I had a great lunch date with this woman. After we ate our sandwiches, we wandered around the Mission District, and I had a really nice time hanging out. Then she said:

'Are we going to find the Mission Theater?

I like seeing Linda Blair playing in an actual "horror" movie again. I had been disappointed with her in most everything since the "Exorcist "movies (Which i loved). What was up with all of those nasty "B-movies" she did? David Hassellhoff on the other hand, all i could do is laugh. He is not cut out to be a horror movie actor. David needs to stick to "Knight Rider" or "Baywatch".All around, this is an awesome movie. Even for the eighties, this was an awesome film.

For once a sequel to "The Karate Kid" without Ralph Macchio! Hilary Swank did an excellent job playing the orphan Julie Pierce. Pat Morita, the one who plays Mr. Miyagi worked his way with Julie quite different from Daniel. Both Daniel and Julie favored karate. Unlike Daniel, Julie was the most surly person Miyagi ever challenged. And there was no tournament to compete in. And there's gonna be some humor in this movie as well. I liked the part where when Julie came home from school, Miyagi went to check on her, and saw her change clothes in the process.

I think Shane Black is one of the all time greatest action screenwriters ever ! He gave us the awesome " Lethal Weapon ." He's always had a gift for making people feel and think about the right thing to say ! Here's to the future Shane Black ! May he flourish and be happy in this new journey he is going on ! And now here's the trailer. Enjoy ! And here's the poster of the new movie , The Wolverine . Enjoy ! If you've been looking for the perfect movie to get you in the mood to go out and have some fun !

I can't express enough just how bad this film was. First of all what a waste of some legendary stars although they are quite old and pretty unconvincing. Fred Astaire, well I guess he must have owed some one a big favor as this was his last film role. The script is a mess and the film seems terribly draggy. I imagine maybe if I saw this back when it came out (1981) I might have thought it was decent. However seeing so many actual good horror films, this was one of the worst.

If you Listen to Ween ( The Pod , God/Satan ) , then you know what 's going on with Ween these days . It has been announced that in the month of February the band will go on their first North American tour (which will include stops in places like San Diego , Houston , New Orleans and many more ) . That will be the first time the band will tour in the U. S . . and the tour will feature Ween songs from the album ( which is expected to be released this month ) .

Visually , this film is interesting . Light is literally thrown in a way , together with cinematography and an interesting storyline . It has a good message in this film , which can make people understand the power of love . It is true that , in life , people make mistakes , and that's why one should accept it and get over with it . This is a good film , in fact I would call it a very well made film . However , the way in which the movie has been written and the story line in which the movie has been written are a little bit too complex .

This review is for the UK DVD three-disc box set. Disc one is called Caught in the Act and contains Model Behavior, Chasing Jamie and Fast and Curious. Disc two is called Bedroom Fantasies and contains Blue Plate Special, Falling in Lust Again and Love Potion No. 10. The final disc is called Anything Goes and contains Chatroom, She's the Boss and Legally Yours. Why the other four episodes in the series are not included is a mystery because there is surely enough room on the discs for a lot more material.Each episode opens with the hotel manager Chloe (Lauren Hayes) reading a letter from a satisfied customer.

In his feature film debut `Yellow,' Chris Chan Lee attempts to enlighten Hollywood's portrayal of Asian-Americans by departing from the stereotypes typically depicted in mainstream film. However, in so doing, Lee commits a far more heinous crime: he exaggerates Asian-Americans' own stereotypes of themselves to the point of incredulity. The result? Dreadfully one-dimensional characters and an outrageously shallow script triggers the cast into a frenzy of over-acting, ultimately resulting in a film that is physically painful to watch.Don't be deceived by any of the positive reviews garnered by `Yellow'; each falls into one of two camps.

Hannibal must be the most God-awful movie I have seen in a long time. In fact, I want my money back. What a waste of time. No plot, minimal character development, questionable motives, poor dialogue, sub-standard acting. What else can I say? If you haven't seen it don't bother. I wouldn't even hire out the video and if you happen to come by it on TV... change the channel. The only reason anyone might have to see this movie would be to see whether the gratuitous violence lived up to all the hype (which quite frankly is why they added it).

The first few minutes of this movie do n't do it justice ! For me , its not funny until he is being shot !!!! The movie is good, it is a bit slow for my taste though, I don't know why ! The action scenes are not as good as i expected, I expected much better ! I like the fact that he is in a car. I think that it makes a better scene . The plot is okay, but I'm not 100% sure about it . I do like the story , its quite interesting .

When I first saw the trailer for this film , I really wanted to see it . I thought some people would like this because of its unique look . I thought it would be something to like. I really didnt know how it would turn out to be . After watching the trailer , I thought it would make a cool watch. This trailer gives you a lot of ideas about what you can expect in this film . For example . This trailer has alot of humor and humor makes this a good movie . The story line is very good and can be used to make a good movie.

The animal-eating ( geek ) scenes were not as bad as you would think . After having watched Mondo Cane for more that a few hours , they were not that bad . I have a small family but they do not like to watch a horror movie so when i saw that they could still enjoy the movie by themselves . I give this a 7 . I thought the movie was horrible . I have watched it 3 times now , it gets better each time it comes back on the dvd . The best movie i have seen in a long time .

If you decide to watch Wild Rebels , do n't expect anything deep and meaningful . If you 're looking for something very different from the typical adventure-film, you'll love Wild Rebels . You 'll experience the world of adventure as if you 'd never seen it before . Just as you 're looking for a movie to get you through your week-day schedule, you'll find yourself engrossed in the world of The Wild Rebels . The film will transport you from everyday life to an amazing world full of adventure and excitement. Wild Rebels is the type of movie you would have never imagined would come to life .

... what a porn movie would look like if you took out the sex and just left in the bad dialog, cheap sets and bad acting, you would have Galaxina.This film came out when the Original Star Wars proved there was a market for Science Fiction. This in turn lead to some gems such as Alien and a revitalized Star Trek. Unfortunately, it also led to some bad movies, and this was obviously one of them. (I say obviously, because I hadn't even heard of this film until a few days ago.I missed it when it came out in 1980.)

There 's something going on in this film directed by X-Files scribe John Shiban that has eluded me . You can watch the trailer after the jump . I can't tell you what it is, but something is happening here that no other filmmaker has ever attempted. And it's a big, big, big gamble on Shiban's part to take. So we're watching this film to find out more. As is often the case with X-Files movies, the story is built on a single premise - the abduction of a 15-year-old little girl by an alien father figure.

This one is a poor attempt at spinning the old "cons turn good" yarn, which we have seen so many times before. It actually reminded me of the American series 'The Players', although nowhere near as good. Omar Epps is totally unconvincing as the hard man of the bunch, as is Ribisi, who's attempt at being the funny guy gets lost along the way. Danes performance was decent though, and you can see from this performance, why she was cast in Terminator 4.The MOD Squad is a film which lies in a kind of grey area between serious thriller and comedy.

Being a big fan of Stanley Kubrick's Clockwork Orange there was of course "no question about it" that I had to see this one. However I put it off far too long because some of my friends discarded it with comments like "extremely boring" or "nothing happened" "a complete waste of time". But when I saw images on the internet of the mysterious black monolith I was allowed to see a glimpse of the exquisite experience that is 2001: A Space Odyssey. There was no doubt in my mind that I was going to rent that movie the same evening.

no really, im not kidding around here folks, and i so cant believe how many people here have given it really really positive reviews! oh wait, its the IMDB comments section, silly me. its interesting to note that at this date, there have not been enough votes to give this film a rating out of ten, yet there are dozens of comments that rave about the film. what does this mean i wonder? anyway, the script IS terrible. character change their personality and motivation and actions every scene, in order to keep the movie running along at something that vaguely resembled a pace.

I kind of like JAG. It do have it´s charm but lately it´s to much propaganda in it. For an outsider (a non American) the patriotic feeling can be a bit to much.I don´t like that Rabb and MacKenzie goes from being lawyers (as they were in the early parts of the TV show) to become super heros that stops wars and rescues entire continents. Its almost like watching a recruitment video from the US army.I still watch the show, so it´s not that bad. But i would prefer more episodes when Rabb and MacKenzie investigates military accidents and don´t save the world in the future.

Spend your time any other way, even housework is better than this movie. The jokes aren't funny, the fun rhymes that are Dr. Seus aren't there. A very lousy way to waste an evening. My kids 4-16 laughed a little at the beginning the younger ones got bored with it and left to play Barbies and the older ones left to play ps2 and surf the net. My wife left and did dishes. So I finished it alone. It was the worst "kids" movie I have seen.

There seems to have been some money behind this film, but it would be impossible to imagine a film this badly planned and executed if I hadn't actually started watching it.To begin with, once we are in the cavern with the characters (the usual young adult stereotypes we've been meeting in horror films since the early '80s), the film is shot almost entirely in close-up. Since the actors are wearing helmet lights, this means all we see are glaring lights alternating with utter darkness - we never get to see what the characters see; so when they shout out "Look there!"

Visually, this film is interesting. Light is literally thrown in a way, together with cinematography and an alluring introduction before the titles, that had my hopes up at the start, but then - a b-movie is a b-movie is a b-movie, no matter how much spectacle is seen. This film surrounds the life of Albert Fish, one of the most well-known serial-killers in the world. Active around the start of the 20th century, Fish's life is hastily and blurry dealt with before before he started killing children at an old age.

Homecoming ; what a HUGE disappointment ! ! After reading the plot summary ( the dead coming back to vote for their loved one ! ) the only way I am willing to go forward with the finale is if they don't play the dead as the only ones that vote for a loved one in the end ( so they are actually not coming back for their family member ! ) So let's assume that the story ends with that, what I want to know now is what happens in the finale, and the only way i can find out the answer is by watching the finale .

I was wondering when someone would try turning that whole Matamoros mess into a goreporn pic . Anyroad , here it is . Now , you all know that there’s no way this ever should have happened. Matamoros is no more dangerous than any other town in the US. It is a fairly small place with very few tourists and has not suffered any major disasters. So , why the panic ? We’ll start at the beginning. On the night of the accident Matamoros, Texas , was under the control of a small band of criminal gangsters who for years had been operating in the shadows.

OK so this is about 30 minutes of gore with no story whatsoever . There is no spoken dialogue , no sound effects , no music , nothing . Just blood squirting in the eyes , nose and mouth . Then it is over with the camera just going straight out . There is no cutaways , no flashbacks , no anything . It is all straight up , no nonsense . And it is fucking amazing . In fact the first time I watched it I had to stop the tv and turn it back off . It is so intense and scary that I almost lost it myself .

***MAY CONTAIN SPOILERS****I was super excited to go see Blood and Chocolate with my friends. I couldn't wait because the book is one of my favorites. But as soon as the movie started, I couldn't believe how different it was. At first I was like, okay, so both of her parents are dead...maybe it'll be okay. But then came the rest of the movie. By the time it was over I was furious. Nothing was correct but their names and the fact that Vivian fell in love with Aiden.

Great subject matter , director , and cast somehow adds up to a truly abysmal film , told in that manner , it may not be great , but the acting , the direction , and the set design and photography all combine to make it a film that has more of a "mash-up" feeling than a true stand out . the acting by both hanks and joel fredman is very good but i must admit , in comparison to what should have been an excellent cast , i feel like i'm watching a different movie .

The initiation to the local sport team involves taking the newbies out to the corn fields and guess what ?! There is corn on them. This has to be the best sport, and the best way to learn sport. There is a little competition that goes on between the teams when they get the field. You will be surprised to see how good the team with the freshest fields are compared to the older, tired teams. It is a lot of fun. Some people think that there is nothing to it, but it is actually very, very good.

I am the sort of person who never, ever watches animated movies, but I make an exception for Thumbelina and the Swan Princess.
