And, as in the movie, we first see the kids running around, in the opening credits to the second episode. In the movie, though, Andy's voice-over says, "Ridgemont High was the worst school in the whole world.

This film is one of my favorite Christmas classics . Sure , it 's fluff , it 's not ``real , " but it 's Christmas , it's one of my favorite movies , and I'm including it here for some of my other classic Christmases . (It 's not the first film I watch every Christmas, either . I usually end up watching a couple movies I 've seen at my local theater ) . And there 's only one Christmas movie I 'm not particularly fond of . (That one , I haven't actually seen , yet.)

Valley Girl will always hold a special place in my heart: I would say this is certainly the best of the 80's teen-sex-comedies, but that is a back-handed compliment. This is a good movie, period. It is very specific in time and place--nearly twenty years later this is a marvelous snapshot--yet its story remains timeless. (This is just Romeo and Juliet, minus the death, after all!) Nicolas Cage is wonderful, showing all the early promise that, it turns out, he has squandered on overblown action crapola.

First of all, since I'm one of the people who never saw the MST3K chopped up version of this movie, I can't comment on that.However, I DID see the original version of this movie on the Sci-Fi Channel and I thought it was just as good as anything else on that Channel. In fact, I thought it was one of their better offerings.I've noticed in perusing the comments here that the people who write in detail about SOULTAKER with a modicum of intelligence, thoughtfulness and maturity tend to like at least a FEW things about this movie and rightly so.

The threesome of Bill Boyd , Robert Armstrong , and James Gleason play Coney Island carnys vying for the hand of a blonde woman . Bill has his eyes on the hand of one particular blonde , while Robert is more interested in a beautiful brunette , who has the potential to be his wife. James is on the hunt for a blond woman . The three of them come to the carnival where they have been assigned . Bill and Robert arrive in a hot air balloon with their female companion , but are mistaken for a trio of thieves by the bouncers .

There's nothing much to the story. A young woman steals some money from the dreary Vermont supermarket where she works, decides to run away to Florida where he has dreams of attending school with her friend Julie, and encounters an odd couple on the highway. If you remember the elderly couple from "Rosemary's Baby," you have some idea of what these two are like. Bill has a comical face and is retired from the Army. Sandra is an ex stripper now become a truckstop whore, although we don't find this out at once.

Christopher Nolan 's first feature film wowed critics who saw it when it first came out . Shot on a $12 million budget, The Dark Knight Rises continues to be seen as a masterpiece , even if it is, as always, full of flaws. It's hard to find someone who doesn't consider it the greatest superhero film ever made, or that it can be improved upon. I can say the same for Christopher Nolan's next film, because it's not the kind of movie you can change, at least not without making some major changes in how the movie's characters and plot are presented.

The original Female Convict Scorpion is an all time masterpiece. The first sequel, Jailhouse 41, was not quite as good in my opinion, though it's still notable for the fact that it took the idea from the original and created something in a completely different style. Director Shunya Ito has managed to do the same thing again with this film; the story is a bit different here, but still he's managed to take what made the previous entries excellent and better than many films of this type and craft something fairly original around it. Again the action focuses on Nami Matsushima (a.k.a.

Uggh ! Hanna-Barbera of the 60s and 70s ! What lousy and unwatchable cartoons that were thrust upon us by my father’s ill-fated taste ! And yet they were the first cartoons that I was ever able to sit through! My parents must have had a sense of humour, but they must’ve also been inarticulate at times ! Now, as I sit on my sofa and watch this latest instalment, I can’t help but wonder how many of my readers will be able to relate to this new cartoon.

Fun With Dick and Jane failed to entertain on so many levels. There were loose ends with the writing, for example, it seems as though one of the major conflicts was the indictment of Jim Carrey's character DIck Harper, but the writers never follow up that particular conflict. Basically the story is weak and mostly unfunny, but Carrey saves a few scenes with his physical humor, but honestly, Jim Carrey wasn't very funny in this movie, and Tea Leone might as well have been there just for her appearance because she wasn't funny either.

Alain Resnais directs three parallel stories that have to do with fantasy and imagination in the adult world. In one of them is a sort of Operatic bordello story where a rejected architect attempts to manipulate a group of people into throes of happiness--only his attempt misses it's only real target, the woman that he pines after. In the same unfinished château he built, a group of teachers search for love in a more modern story, as one woman believes ineffably in the role of romance and the cynical anthropoligist tries to teach her a lesson by setting her up with the biggest jerk in the group.

Sheltered young woman, home-schooled and possibly quite gifted, harbors a disturbed, overly-emotional side which comes to the surface after her absentee father pays her mother a visit, asking for a divorce. Directed by celebrated cinematographer William A. Fraker, this ill-titled psychological thriller falls into the trap that most films helmed by directors of photography find themselves in: each shot is composed for the utmost style, but at the sacrifice of fluid pacing and a tight, gripping narrative. Fraker (and his cinematographer, László Kovács) are very fond of gauzy whites and golden tones, giving the picture a burnished, tableaux feel.

This is only the fourth effort I’ve watched from this director (whom I met and found quite genial at the 2004 Venice Film Festival Italian B-movie retrospective) and also, possibly, the worst. As was the case with THE BRONX EXECUTIONER (1989), which preceded it, this is a prime example from the tail end of the Euro-Cult era – prime because it shows the depths to which the previously invigorating style had fallen by this time! Here, in fact, we get a plot revolving around – I’m not kidding, folks – a killer phone!

this movie had me stuck in this endless loop of thinking about it for days afterward ... granted i am an avid horror film fan and this movie was no exception ... i will admit this movie had me a little bit scared at times but i was in awe of the acting. this is one of the few horror flicks i have ever seen that i really enjoyed. i highly recommend this movie to those that love horror films and enjoy watching them. I am looking forward to the sequel to this brilliant film. I know i won't be disappointed.

I fail to understand why anyone would allow a sub-par director to put drivel like this onto celluloid. This movie has already been made at least two other times that were better than this ("Here Comes Mr. Jordan" - 1941, and "Heaven Can Wait" - 1978). The only saving factor for figure skating fans might have been some nice ice skating done by a professional cast of skaters, but this just does not happen. The closest thing the audience sees to good skating is when Tara Lipinski's character takes a turn on the ice for a just a moment.

Allegedly the `` true story '' of Juana de Castilla , the eldest daughter of the Catholic Queen Isabella (or Isabel la Catolica) the Second, was written in 1526 by her sister, Isabella Fernández de Castro , the author of the celebrated work '' Historia Compostor de los Reyes Católicos.'' It tells of the death of Juana in the arms of her husband, the Duke of Medina Celi at the very moment the Duke, who was about to give birth to their daughter, had been betrayed by his wife, Juana.

The main reason to check this one out is to watch Laura Gemser in all her glory.That 's reason enough to check this one out, I think, even if you've already seen her work. I don't remember where I got this video from. I remember the title and description but that's all.I saw it mentioned in a thread somewhere on youtube and checked it out. I was surprised by how good it turned out. It was quite an interesting experiment in the editing, too, to give the viewer a choice. It's an interesting experiment in a lot of areas.

I generally LIKE Sion Sono 's work , but this movie was completely retarded . But sadly , not retarded enough to make me not want to rewatch the movie over and over once again . It's just very difficult for me to sit through one more episode of "The Vampire Diaries" . I like the episode of "The Vampire Diaries." It wasn't the best episode by far but it's a lot more fun than the first episode, and we get to learn more about Caroline. I do hope they do another episode. This episode was okay.

Not really all that much to this movie...either a stunt racer or a stock car racer has a flaming car in the beginning of the movie, goes to bar, is approached by a biker gang who ruins his chances with a very lovely lady, offer him a job, he goes back to their place, refuses, the police ask him to accept their ya go!!! What plays out is a very annoying little film that sees the hero not really do all that much and a biker gang that can kill and for some reason the police can not pin a crime on them.

What an awful movie. Full of cliches, perplexing scenes, very bad acting, and an atrotious script. It is hard to believe the same guys that wrote The People vs. Larry Flint and Man on the Moon wrote this garbage. Man, this makes my list of Top 10 Worst Movies of All-Time. Didn't this guy, this director, if you can call him that, realize that the first Problem Child was bad enough? Let alone make a sequel for it!!?? Amazing that piece of trash films like this can be shown to children let alone be released!

It pays to watch Reader's Digest. Or Time, if it was the original source of the article that served as a supposed inspiration to Mani Ratnam to make this masterpiece. Based on a true story of an adopted girl who goes in search of her biological parents, Mr. Ratnam paints a classic that rivets as much as it rebukes, cherishes as much as it chastens and preaches as much as it practises.Where does one start? The foreboding gloom that precedes fresh strife in northern Sri Lanka? The chaotic household of a family headed by a firebrand engineer-author and 3 adorably naughty children?

This is an extraordinary film . As a courtroom drama , it 's compelling , as an indictment on the way American justice system works today . However , as a cinematic treat , the film is not nearly as satisfying as it could be . The film has two main plot points , the first is the way the case was handled . The other , the case is not treated with enough respect , and that makes it seem a travesty , in the sense that it should not take the life of one innocent person , in such a horrible way .

This was honestly the worst movie i have ever seen . the acting was god awful , the story line was stupid , i just dont even want to write a review on this movie . this is a stupid movie and i just dont even want to watch it. i am going to give this movie one star because it had potential and i liked a lot of stuff about the movie but this movie was just way to far off from what its trying to be . ive given it 1.5 stars . and this is how bad this movie is. its horrible .

First off let me say that this movie is nothing spectacular . The cast is like the saved by the bell type characters and the director is kind of overrated and just plain boring . The only thing that keeps you going a little longer is you know that it doesn't end well . What I really wanted was an epic film that you would have been happy with . Unfortunately, that was never to be

So what did you think of the movie ? Do you think that you would have enjoyed the movie if the plot was a little better ?

Thursday June 15, 9:30pm The EgyptianSaturday June 17, 11:00am The Egyptian"He spent most of his life in pursuit of a good time, and he caught it." - Eric IdleHarry Nilsson left Brooklyn, "feeling like Holden Caulfield. I was fifteen." Eventually, he ended up working as an usher at the LA Paramount and within a few years fell back asswards into one of the greatest songwriting careers in the history of American music. 'Who Is Harry Nilsson (And Why Is Everybody Talking' About Him?)' chronicles the legendary life of " the best songwriter of our generation."

A bad Quentin Tarantino rip off, at least I hope that's what they were going for because at least then I could respect the director for admiring Tarantino. One scene a "singing" scene with Rose McGowan is far to well done and genius for this film and could have only been stumbled on by mistake by this director. So besides his Quinton inspiration and Rose McGowan and her one good scene this film sucked. Some of the crappiest dialogue I have ever heard, I'm willing to bet why McGowan doesn't speak much is because of how crappy her dialogue would have been.

... with a 500 $ budget and a bottle of ketchup.If you are a fan of C movies with no special effects then this may be the only one for you. But it was not your money and your brain. So don't go in with an expectation that you will be watching a movie. I would rate the film 3 out of 5. I have a feeling that many will not be able to handle a movie with a budget like that. And for that you may not enjoy this film at all. Don't be disappointed though.

I am very impressed by the reviews I 've read of this film - generally well-read , thoughtful and informed - and I can see why people think that this film does what it does

But there are so many reasons to say "meh"

1. It's not a documentary at all but more of a documentary feature film. It's not very long at 2 hours 40 minutes - and if that's the case then the audience should get bored with it by now. This is really disappointing because, as I've said, this film does not need to be told as a story.

After the opening credits over a black sheet of paper with spots of white paint sprayed onto it, oh OK I'll be generous and call it a star field, we witness an alien spacecraft crashing into a meteorite and being forced to land on earth. A terrible looking model spacecraft lands on a terrible looking model field. Three nearby campers investigate. From the burning spacecraft a reptile like looking alien, the 'Nightbeast' emerges, OK so I lied it's a guy in a dodgy rubber monster mask and silver spacesuit. The campers are quickly killed by the Nighbeast's laser gun which shoots awful special effects at people.

this is an alright show to watch, its not the best nor the worst. I've watched it for a long time and i don't like any of the new stuff. This show has changed into some teen trash and is living much differently. I dislike that crap..i have no IQ why they completely changed the theme of this show. The first season was really enjoyable to watch and is was partly amusing. The 2nd season is just out of this world dumb. I seriously don't know why the writers/directors changed this show up.

I'm a sucker for a decent superhero movie. (I'm not counting super bug budget, no storyline Batman's either)A couple of my favorites are The Phantom and a budget movie called The Demolitionist. The Black Scorpion can be added to that collection.If you've seen the Demolitionist then get this movie. It's basically a copy of that heroine. (It even stars the same guy in both movies)If you haven't, then let me explain...a cop's father is murdered and she seeks vengeance.

I went to see this movie at a book signing in Lexington , Ky last night . After a wonderful evening with my friends , I walked back to my car . I was very aware of all the noise that was around my car , but I was also aware that what I was thinking and feeling were probably being recorded by everyone in the movie theater . After about twenty minutes , I got out of the parking lot and started my ride home . As I drove past the theater , I noticed that everyone in the theatre was still there , watching this movie I just saw .

The most notable feature of this film is the chemistry between the actors, the sense of camaraderie in their dialogue and dances. This typical rising-star musical has an overworked plot, even for 1944, but because of the actors it's still fun to watch. Hayworth isn't even that much of a dancer, but she has a lot of 'inexperienced' charm that fits her character. Kelly plays his usual caring authoritarian role while Silvers provides plenty of self-deprecation and laughs. The movie can also be very serious at times. Not a must-see, but recommended if you like the actors.

I heard that after the first Oceans movie , the sequels begin to go downhill . I believe that this is true because the last movie is really good, but I am not sure whether it is the last movie or not . I heard that in the last two movies in the series , the producers were planning something , but I don´t know what they did with it . There is a lot that I don´t know , such as which character will get which role , or which characters can be replaced with new actors .

Imagine if you will: four teen students have an assignment to spend the night in a haunted house in St. Francisville, Louisiana to check for the existence of the paranormal. If you watch this in the dark and late at night; you possibly will have the hair on the back of your neck rise a couple of times. Otherwise this mock documentary is a very lazy rip off of BLAIR WITCH PROJECT. What is to be dialogue is very lame and the actors are pleasant looking enough, but seem to lack genuine personality. It seems to take forever before something real spooky even happens.

Just finished watching 2FTM . The trailers intrigued me so much I actually went to see it on opening weekend, which is how much of a sucker I was. I found out that 2FTM was a remake of one of the more beloved anime's in the past 15 years. So I decided that this remake was well worth seeing since it was so much better than it's original. So far it's not even close. It's nothing more than an extremely mediocre and poorly thought out version of one of my favorite anime's in recent memory.

This is the sort of unknown and forgotten film one dreams about discovering in watching old videos. It is a superb comic gem with brilliantly funny writing, embedded in the marvellous array of characters, a wonderfully inventive and funny musical score, and witty, light direction from Montgomery himself. This is one to watch over and over. Montgomery is a bit part actor who finds himself assigned by his military reserve division to infiltrate a young debutante's home to discover the identity of her former beau, a suspected jewel thief. While the premise is rather preposterous, the results are hilarious.

First off, I'm a huge Bronson fan, have been since the late '70s. I watched every film he made on the big screen since "Love and Bullets", which ironically was the beginning of his end as a big name, Hollywood-blockbuster star.I kept hoping that things would turn around for him, that he would make a really good film in the '80s, but that never happened. And I don't know what he was thinking when he signed with cheapjack studio Cannon and hack director J. Lee Thompson for most of his latter films.

This was the first Chan film made by Monogram. What a come down from Fox values and standards! I was shocked when I saw my first Monogram after seeing the great Fox films. This is boring and uninspired with wild music playing as Chan calmly walks across the street. Chan is now working for the US Secret Service rather than the Honolulu Police Department. He is assisted by Benson Fong, who plays No. 3 Son Tommy for the first time. He also has a daughter along, Iris Chan, played by Marianne Quon. Mantan Moreland also makes his debut as Birmingham Brown.

A snore gore . I saw this piece of horrible , stinking , worthless , junk at the Cameo Movie in Hollywood, California, when I was just a boy . It is the most hideous thing on God's Earth . It is absolutely horrible . It would make you shudder if you could see it . If I could live through it I would go mad . It made me sick . It made me want to give up . It brought on a nervous disorder . If I could take it back I would do it over again .

Despite a small handful of nicely executed scenes , this entry ( the fourth ) feels tired . Toshiharu Ikeda's script doesn't have the energy or spark of his previous three , but the director, Tatsumi Hijii , wisely avoids being overly showy or overlong in order to keep things interesting , even though he does have one of the better soundtracks of the series , but the score is still forgettable , with songs that sound similar . It's not bad , and there's an element of charm to all of the characters that keep things going , but at the same time , the plot can get repetitive at times.

The first episode of 'Man to Man with Dean Learner' that just aired was at least up to scratch with most episodes of 'Garth Marenghi's Darkplace' and had me at "My Maisonette". Hope it keeps up the good work of 'faux terribles' on my TV. Richard Ayoade is one of the best in the new breed of "alternative comedy"(I hate this phrase but am too lazy too think of another one.) comedians on TV today.I'm glad that on a trip of local DVD retailers today "Garth Marenghi's Darkplace" was sold out across the board.

When I saw the trailers for this movie , it looked like a good romantic comedy . I expected some comedy from the trailer. I was wrong. I thought the movie would have some romance, a little humor, and a little suspense . But the romance, humor and suspense were all terrible. The film started off with too much romance . And by that, I mean one of the characters, who I thought was the only one in the movie who had a bit of a romance in him, suddenly turns into the love interest. Then the comedy was way better than I expected .

Apparently this movie was based on a true story. I'm not sure how accurate it is, though. But it really reminded me of how when I see that someone has been murdered on the news, it's amazing how much it doesn't affect me. Sure, I think it's terrible, but I honestly don't care. I move on. It seems that murder is trivial now. This is what River's Edge shows. Nobody really seems to care about this girl and her death, not even the killer. Then what's the point?

While I can understand some of the points made regarding the cinematography ( I thought a more purposeful approach would have been the better choice), what's to say they were wrong? Quote:

It was good, but not great. The ending was just meh. It just didn't feel like the end. The ending felt like the beginning of a new film, it felt like an epilogue, and not like the end. That's an interesting viewpoint. That I think is a common feeling when I see films like The Shawshank Redemption, or even, like I said, A Fistful of Dollars.

I saw this movie and I thought this is a stupid movie . What is even more stupid is that it's rated R and yet it's shown in school and everyone is supposed to know that. I would not have recommended this movie to anyone . I hope they sue the makers or at least tell the makers and distributors that their movie is "Not Recommended" or even better they tell them that there are some things you just don't show your kid. The movie has a great script and the movie makers made it entertaining . I enjoyed it very much .

Dictated by thin experience (of both life and industry) and no cash Sofia Coppola's early short is almost by necessity an observational piece set on a high school campus. The cast are rather weak and do not benefit from being shot in b&w (it's difficult to tell the characters apart). The sound editing does little to help a simple story of fickle teenage allegiance.Yet there are one or two things to note. Inamongst the inconsistent editing the high school campus is filmed with a balance of aspirant wide and intimate close-up shots.

This film wasn't good at all. I was able to catch it at a film festival and didn't appreciate the content I was forced to watch. It's a well shot film about family looking to reconnect after the death of the family's cornerstone (Gabrielle Union) dies. the film stars Billy Dee Williams as Gabrielle's Union's brother. Well, actually, Gabrielle Union portrayed the woman in her early years, which should help explain why the woman was Billy Dee Williams older sister. This had to be Billy Dee William's worst performance in his career, ever.

I have to hold my hand up and say that I was one of the first ( and probably the only) people with the idea to do it all. The idea was inspired by a tweet. This is an idea that I am working on, as I mentioned in an earlier message. While I am in no way shape or form sure about how this will pan out ( and the idea to do it all is still there) , I wanted to get some input from you, to see if there were ways you thought would work and if you thought the idea was worth pursuing.

Can't liberals like Alec Baldwin get it through their heads that they lost the elections of 2000 and 2004? The ridiculous. lame swipes at WalMart, non-union workers, George W Bush and the stock market not to mention the intentional GWB accent that Balwin's character uses in the film just makes him look silly and bitter on screen. As the credits roll the sour grapes continue as "Special Thanks" are given to Ken Lay, and other CEOs from Enron, Tyco, WorldCom, and IMClone. Let me clue you in to something - if you put all your money into one company's stock YOU'RE AN IDIOT.

Predictable, cliche, unbelievable, boring...what else can I say? It's only the caliber of the cast that saves any redeeming qualities of this bloated mess. Oh yeah, and the entertaining end zone antics.But wait for the eleven o'clock highlights, 'cause the outcome is as predictable as who's going to win the Globetrotters/Washington Generals matchup.I was well into the second act before I figured out these were supposed to be PRO teams we were watching (all clad in vintage Padres brown). And Cameron Diaz character's imitation of a youthful Georgia Frontiere was ill-conceived on the page.

"Driving Lessons" sees two middle class quintessential British families meet head on, when Grint's character comes into contact with Evee, (Walters), a slightly deranged out-of-touch actress with an ego. Grint betrays his overpowering, and over-Christian mother, (Linney), and goes off travelling with Evee to Scotland, to accompany her on a trip to participate in a Poetry reading, something she claims could be her last, due to an illness.Grint's portrayal of a caged youngster, brainwashed by an overbearing, and even hypocritical mother, is the masterpiece of this film.

Jim Wynorski strikes again with the very literal minded KOMODO VS. COBRA. No guesswork here. A giant CGI komodo dragon -- it sort of looks like a dog minus fur -- takes on a humongous CGI king cobra, with a bunch of tree huggers and others caught in between. The tree huggers get charter boat captain Michael Pare (who else?) to take them to an off-limits federal island. An experiment by a mad scientist in growing very large veggies has become an experiment in growing very large critters, thank so to our nutty military.

I went into this movie with semi-high expectations after loving the cartoon series in my childhood , and this nearly hit all of them, except for one, which is a minor quibble. And it is a quibble I’ve heard a lot from people who went into this film with high expectations. But this quibble is the same quibble that I’d hear from anyone going into a Stephen King novel. I’d heard it too many times myself to ever dismiss it as just a quibble. The thing is that this quibble is that, in a very literal sense, it isn’t.

I was unsure what to expect from "driving lessons"- unsure whether Rupert Grint could carry such a role, but within the first few minutes I was completely hooked. All the way through, the music, acting and scenery were absolutely stunning. Julie Walters, as always, gave a superb performance as the eccentric old actress Evie, and Rupert Grint, equally as good,gave a fantastic performance as the romantic Ben.Right from the beginning, I was forced into involuntary cringes, bursts of laughter and swellings of joy as Ben broke free from his controlling mother and fought for his friendship with his only friend, Evie.

Regarded as another one of the recent over-the-top drama's brought upon us by Hollywood, this movie excels where others have totally failed(especially considering the most underrated performance in recent dramatic character portrayal by that of Natalie Portman), this film is almost unanimously driven by the chemistry that both Susan and Natalie share. They seem to be so natural during the movie that you would mistake them for a real family. They go through so many mother-daughter conflicts in the story its kind of hard not to pick up on their acting abilities.

Christopher Nolan 's first directorial effort , a year before he did `` Memento , '' and this is almost as much a story of how he became a director, his process and the lessons learned as his films themselves. He spoke with us about the movie and his career in Hollywood and beyond. Movies & Culture: Your first movie was about memory: the film was based on a real event that you had read about. Can you talk a little bit about what that event was, how it came to be and what was involved in shooting it?

I disagree in calling this a stoner movie just because weed also makes an appearance . I ca n't imagine anyone smoking pot and saying to themselves , "Hey, let's see if this is as good as the weed I'm getting." It's not a stoner movie in the traditional sense of the term . What it is is one that takes you into another universe, that of the potheads. It takes you into a world beyond the norm and a world that doesn't accept the rules as they exist, in the real world.

First of all, I have watched this show since I was a little toddler, and I have always loved it. Sure, maybe I didn't understand it when I was that young, but I still enjoyed it! And now that I have been able to understand it for several years, I love it even more. The score of this musical is the most wonderfully detailed score I have ever heard! Every note is perfect, I don't even need to hear the singing to enjoy it!Moving on to this particular production- This is magnificent!

I have not seen this movie since 1979 when I was a teenager. I grew up with the Sesame street muppets and later realized how much effort and time went into bringing these characters to life. Jim Hensen was a genius and master muppeteer. When I watched this movie the other day it took me back in time when I was younger and things seemed so much simpler. For this bit of time travel I rate this movie a 10.The plot line explores how Kermit goes from the swamp to Hollywood. The laughs and gags are classic muppetism.

That is the answer . The question is : What is the single reason to watch this movie ? I think I answered it in the first paragraph. What is the reason to watch this movie ? Why do you like this movie ? What is the reason that made you watch this movie? What would you love more in this movie ? I will answer all the question in the same paragraph. What is the reason that makes me watch this movie ? My reason is the love that this movie has to bring to my heart. What is the most significant reason that makes this movie amazing to me?

A criminally short lived show that went on to spawn three movie spin-offs ( Naked Gun 1 , 2 & 3 ) and two seasons of its own made for TV show. Written by Eric Overmyer (The X Files ), produced by Joe Carnahan (Naked Gun 1 & 2) and directed by Joseph Rubenstein, the first Naked Gun is a crime thriller about two LAPD cops who are forced to work in tandem when a serial killer sets his sights on Los Angeles - and a city that can't take a joke.

I suppose I like this film as well as any I know; it is not perfect, but under the title "The Americanization of Lily" this charming and memorable semi-musical satire might I suggest have been appreciated more, and still loved by those who recognized its special Blake Edwards'-produced spirit of gentleness, clever humor and solid narrative. The improbably but delightful story-line follows Lili Smith, a fringe-type spy for the Germans in a much simpler and less black-and-white war; Lili Schmidt passing as Smith is helping her Uncle who is patriotic too, for Germany but neither cruel nor political, merely opportunistic.

I probably have to blame myself but I sure as hell expected more from a movie that goes by the title Sleepless in Seattle. I have to confess, I’ve been more than a little confused about what to think of Sleepless in Seattle. I’ve seen the film once or twice before, but as the story is about a guy in Seattle with a problem sleeping, what do I know? The film really does go by its own title, which makes it somewhat of a strange title. However, I suppose that it works well in some ways.

Yes, why? Among the filmmakers that came out in the 80's and 90's Gus Van Sant is one of my idols. There are others, a few. Steven Sodebergh, PT Anderson, Tim Hunter, Danny Boyle, Martin Donovan, Harmony Korine, Wes Anderson. Idiosyncratic, infuriating some times, but consistent, surprising, unpredictable. Their names make me switch on the TV, go to a video store or even buy a ticket and go to a movie theater. Van Sant's "Psycho" however, gives me pause. Why? I wonder.

This film is terrible . Not only is the story unbelievable , the situations the characters put themselves in are also way to out of the ordinary. It is a movie that you will not forget because of how horrible it is, but also because it’s hilarious . That’s not to say the movie is good or anything like that . The main problem I had with this was the lack of emotional connection or depth . The characters just have no heart for each other and the story is extremely flat . I would highly recommend this movie only to die hard fanboys of the series.

Love this little film , that reminds me somewhat of the original Japanese gem , SHALL WE DANCE ? (also made in the 60's, and I am not sure which one comes first, the first in the Japanese one was made in 1970's , so maybe both were made in 1970's in Japan). The second one I liked a lot better than the first, but the third one has a similar theme , so it all works out. This is one of my all time favorite movies and I am glad I got to share this video with you.

I first saw this film in 1980 and it touched a cord which reminded me of a more innocent time. The opening narrative, music and paintings by Norman Rockwell set the tone for me. You either love the movie or hate it. Jan Michael Vincent was at his all time best and portrayed Cpl Marion Hedgepeth in a most innocent and touching way. This movie is at the top of my all time favorites, a shame it isn't available on DVD or VHS anymore. The ending was also wonderful. John Hancock did a marvelous job of capturing the essence of the time.

This is one odd film. It seems to be aimed at a younger audience, but is filled with sexual innuendos. The whole premise is rather absurd, not just the idea of some shrunken heads of three dead kids doing some crime fighting, but the same said kids taking on a gang of tough older guys is a little far-fetched, but then again, the parents are mainly absent in the film and there is a lack of authority figures to keep the kids in line.The cast are good though, Meg Foster plays a very butch mafia-like leader, with the handsome A.J.

This was it! i would have never expected the ending if i didn't already know the behind the scenes stuff.The one thing that i hated was that why was Shannon kicked off and not Alyssa. i hate her i would rather her character die that Shannon's. what was funny is that in the scene where piper is dieing on the hospital bed and Prue was crying by her side i started crying too lol. at the time that this aired i was about 10yo and my favorite character was Piper from the beginning so i was saying to myself if she dies then i will not see the show anymore!

'Water' (2005), the final part of Toronto-based Indian film-director Deepa Mehta's elemental trilogy has been finally completed, almost ten years after the release of the very first controversial element, 'Fire' (1996), which was followed with a slightly lesser controversial sequel '1947: Earth' (1998). Mehta made her directorial debut with a 24-minute Canadian short film 'At 99: A Portrait of Louise Tandy Murch' (1975), but it was her Canadian feature film about the life of Indians living in Canada that brought her fame back in east, her country by birthright, 'Sam & Me' (1991).

This film easily rivals the emotional strength, the dramatic impact and the top-notch performances of "12 Angry Men". I rented it on a whim and was amazed that I had not heard of it before.I do not know if this was Emilio Estevez's directorial debut, but the pacing, the interplay and development of the characters as well as the some clever camera work surrounding the character Estevez plays all suggest a natural eye.The interplay between Martin and Emilio contains the same wonderful chemistry we saw in Wall Street with Martin and Charlie.

The Governess was, by far, a very pitiful film. I do not use this word loosely, as it honestly was a poor excuse for a movie. I finished watching this feature with only one word on my mind  "why"? Honestly, you could use this question at the end of every scene of this film and it would seem like it fit. There were so many inconsistencies that lead to a lack of development (both in the story and in the characters) which ultimately lead to a very confusing film with actors walking through the motions instead of giving any explanation.

My blurred childhood memories have kept the echo of the cult serie of Belphégor in the French 60's... so I was eager to see the big screen adaptation. I should have kept my money and gone for a stroll in the Louvre.The idea of the scenario is still very apt and interesting (the fantom of Le Louvre) but the adaptation is ridiculous. The dialogues hesitate permanently between French irony and serious "American business" without achieving neither but not without sounding asinine.Acting leaves somehow to be desired and special effects are meager compared to what one could expect (low budget ?

my girlfriend, as we walk in the cold London evening in leicester square, after the movie, says: if they didn't speak English and they didn't show the stadium, you could have thought this was the slums of a South American city or some other slum anywhere in the world,not Queens in NYC.Ramin Bahrani is , right now, my official hero, because he seems to have devoted his work to show not the OTHER face of American, but the REAL face of America.Ramin Bahrani's movies are like Ladri di biciclette, or Germania anno zero, or Roma citta' aperta.

Jack Lemmon was one of our great actors . His performances in Days Of Wine And Roses , The Apartment , and The Big Sleep have made him into a household name , but his other films are just as legendary. His portrayal of The Man in the Moon in The Man Who Knew Too Much is perhaps the finest of the genre. If you haven't seen The Man in the Moon , watch it now. This is an actor you have to see, and not just to see his acting skills, but to see him. He played the part like he was telling us about himself .

As I peruse through the hundreds of comments that loyal readers of the IMDB have posted on this film , this is the one I like to highlight. This comment was posted by an IMDB user with a unique username and has been viewed over 50,000 times since it was posted. It was originally posted on January 15, 2014. "I like the way you are making fun of this film and I love it, but I don't understand how you can like an animated film that's based on a book of a book.

This is a very modest, very lovely movie with a great score by Hoagy Carmichael and Frank Loesser with a standout number, We're The Couple In The Castle, that is totally evocative of the period and harks back to Penthouse Serenade just as the opening premise (Hoppity's coming) may well have inspired Fred Saidy and Yip Harburg's opening (Woody's Coming) in Finian's Rainbow six years later. I totally agree with those posters who have noted that were the name Disney appended to this it would by now have achieved 'classic' status rather than have fallen into neglect.

`` Wagons East '' is widely known as John Candy 's last movie , as he died on the set of his latest movie in December 2008. He died at the age of 47, only a few weeks after the film's wrap. John had been suffering with lung cancer, but had undergone successful treatment to cure it in March. John was also a close friend and supporter of the late rapper Tupac Shakur, who had died on July 3, 1996 at only 24. John was in the studio for Shakur's funeral, where Tupac's funeral was held.

What a self-indulgent mess! Duncan Roy's film is apparently autobiographical, however it's impossible to find any glimmer of emotional truth in this chaotic, badly acted and woefully amateurish fiasco.In a way, you have to admire the balls of a man who through grim determination and a very generous benefactor manages to make a film about his own rise and fall - from abused, working class lad to criminal English lord. However, the tone is either so self-pitying or so arch, that it's impossible to engage with either characters or plot.

You can take the crook out of the joint , but it seems exceedingly more difficult to take the joint out of the whole joint . I was talking to my mom a few months ago. I had been feeling a little out of sorts over the holidays, and was trying to figure out what was wrong. My mom happened to mention that a few weeks before we were all invited to our relatives’ wedding, a friend of ours lost a leg in a swimming accident at a pool, and I was wondering if she was going through the same thing I was going through.

I have just started watching this show . Its airing in Ireland at the moment on the Irish television station. It just seems to me to be a load of rubbish. It seems to me the only reason it could have got as far as it did is because they were able to get the cast and crew to appear on television, and to get people to sign up to be extras, which, if I remember correctly, only about a hundred or so took the bait and agreed to go along with it.

Two years after this short, the last "Our Gang" short was made. After seeing this, you wonder how it even lasted that much longer. The quality of "Our Gang" nosedived soon after moving from Hal Roach to MGM, and this short is a perfect example. The gags are all very unfunny and Froggy's last line of this being the happiest day of his life paints a bad picture in your mind of what it's like for him the rest of the time. A very poor example of film making.

As a big Jim Carey fan I took my seat in the cinema with optimism . After all , Fun Fun Fun was one of his most acclaimed films and a major hit in the year 2000 . As I settled down for the second and final part , it began to dawn upon me how far the film had actually come in 14 years . This was a film I had never seen before , had never thought about it in the slightest until the film started to roll , and I had never imagined I’d see the end.

If you 're looking for a typical war movie , this is not it , so a note to all the non-genre movie critics out there. This is not a horror film , so that's not it . It's not a drama , so it's not it either. It's not a love story , so that's also it . It's not an action-adventure thriller , so that's also it . In the end it is a war film , yes , and that's the main reason I liked it . __________________________________________________________________________________________

This movie was filmed in 1969 and released in December 1970 in the same year.

I started to watch this show by accident , but I love it . The fact that main character is blind is just a bonus , I think . The main character in the show is a kid who is in a situation like this because of his sister , but is also a very intelligent person . I liked this show , and was really happy that I got to watch it . And I also really liked the characters in the show and how they all seemed so real . I'm so glad , because I think people like this show and that's really great .

This film has its detractors, and Courtney's fey dresser may offend some folks (who, frankly, need a good smack upside the head) -- but the film is top notch in every way: engaging, poignant, relevant. Finney, naturally, is larger than life. Courtney makes an ideal foil. I thought the performances to be terribly strong in both leads, and Courtney's character provides plenty of dark humor. The period is well captured, the supporting cast well chosen. This is to be seen and savored like a fine cordial.

Hollywood had a long love affair with bogus Arabian Nights tales but few of these products have stood the test of time. The most memorable were the Jon Hall, Maria Montez films which have long since become camp. This one is filled with dubbed songs, anachronistic slang, and slapstick. It's a truly bounteous crop of Mesopotamian corn, and pretty near intolerable today. It was nominated for its imaginative special effects which are almost unnoticeable in this day and age, consisting mainly of trick photography. The only outstanding, positive feature which survives is its beautiful color and clarity.

"Hood Rat" is absolutely terrible. This is a urban version of "Willard". I just can't believe this movie got made, let alone distributed. Someone in Universal Studios thought that people would watch and like this "movie". The only good thing in this is Ice-T as the landlord. He was funny. The one thing I hate in movies is sped up action. Once or twice is bad enough, but the WHOLE movie is like that. Every scene transition is some fast motion special effect. The director should be banned from making movies forever.

I don't actually know what I would call these stories. They all kind of fit together like a puzzle.

If I could give this excuse for a film a 0 or negative rating I would . Norris plays a Chicago cop who stumbles upon a devil 's apprentice ? who wants to , well , create an angel . But then , he 's forced to decide, will he have faith in the boy or the devil ? I can't believe it's been 2 years since I started watching the show. In case you haven't watched it, it's on the Showtime network. I really enjoyed it and the characters and the story lines were very intriguing to me. I've always had a fascination with the occult , but had no interest in studying them until this show .

This movie is absolutely horrible ! I thought because it had good actors in it like Gabrielle Union , Hill Harper , and some funny moments, that it would atleast have a good review . The plot is terrible . The first half is very funny . The second half is really boring . The first half could have been better . It just seems that it was rushed . "You can survive anything". Anything except a dumb horror flick. The director couldn't even decide whether he wanted a demon or just a plain ol' backwoods serial killer. You can't have both. It's like Michael Moore trying to have his cake and eat it too (or in his case 1500 cakes) by making his particular charlatan brand of "docu-comedies": they're supposed to be oh-so hilarious and zany, and yet you're also meant to treat them as truth-based, earth-shattering, hard-hitting documentaries. Some genres cannot be mixed.

I mean, nothing happens, 5 dumb kids go to Oklahoma to find a magical forest of marijuana... this could've been fun, if it hadn't been for the 5 worst actors in the world. And the dialogs weren't even half an inch of fun. The only thing that I almost showed my teeth of, was when the dumb cops stopped the teenagers in either Oklahoma or Kansas... The plot could have been fun, had it not been for abysmal interpretation. If you even think about watching this piece-of-crap movie, don't.

It would be quite easy to make this movie sound fun: a call girl gets shot in the forehead by a North Korean spy, but survives. The bullet that is embedded in her brain makes her long for knowledge, as well as sex. Unbeknownst to her, she walks away from the shooting with the cloned finger of George W. Bush in her purse, a key which can unlock the power to use nuclear armaments. Just call it a romp, and at least a few people will show up to the theater.

! ! ! ! MILD SPOILERS ! ! ! ! The premise goes like this : A store gets burnt down and the owner has to sell it. So he decides to buy it, but he gets it a little bit at a time. He buys it and puts it on his property, where he has to find a new place to live. When he finally finds a place, he has to convince the real estate agent that he will make good on his mortgage, because the place he bought doesn't fit in with him anymore, so he has to rent it.

I have always loved the ironic symbolism and brilliant cinematography of Coppola 's masterpiece . I was lucky enough to see the movie twice on my own (I think) at age 10 and 12, the only way I could see it properly was to ask my father to rent it. I can't remember who my father was at the time, but I remember my mom sitting me down to watch the film and explaining the story and what it all meant. I think I remember her telling me it was the film that got her a scholarship to NYU where she would eventually become a professor.

"Go Fish" garnered Rose Troche rightly or wrongly the reputation of a film maker with much promise.Its then hard to understand how she could turn out a movie made up of stereotypes that one associates with inferior sitcoms. The entire film rings hollow. I cringed the whole way through.Its supposed to be a look into nineties human sexuality. Well not much more here to be learned than from "In and Out". By now most of us actually do know, that there are men who are sexually attracted to women and there men who are sexually attracted to men and there are even men sexually attracted to both sexes.

I remember when this show came out. It was originally advertised as a mini-series. At the end of the last episode it said "To Be Continued" to the dismay of all the people who had watched the whole boring beyond words thing. It ended as it was supposed to, so yes, you can blame the series for having no ending. The plan was for there to be another obviously if ratings had been higher, but it was a boring show that way too long, and annoyed people by not ending when it said it would, so they never made any more.

Director and playwright Richard Day adapted his own stage material for the screen , clearly inspired by Rock Hudson 's " The Razor's Edge ." This movie had a huge influence on John Cassavetes, whose film " McCabe & Mrs. Miller " was loosely based on one of Day's plays . In both cases the basic material came from a stage play, in Cassavetes ' case from a long play and in "Mrs. Miller " from a short one. Day had been a successful television writer and playwright, and when he wrote the screenplay he was an established playwright too.

First of all , let me say that I am in no way denying the importance of the subject - there are many people who believe that I do. However - for the sake of this article I would like to put up with the fact that this is not a matter of faith or belief , but of science, and thus what we say here cannot be held against faith or belief. I am going to write a long article here, but in the first few paragraphs I would like to state a little about myself, in order to clarify the issue of why I am writing the article.

This is an excellent film , but Momento ( Nolan 's other big budget film ) is much better . It is not a documentary though , it's much more dramatic , and the way in which it is shot makes the film far better . It is very much like you were there . I love the scenes in this film . There are a great number of people who worked hard on this film . I know a few of them as I am a huge fan . It is a film that I had wanted to see for years , and I am thrilled that it is in front of me .

This is one of the movies one has to start watching with an open mind . One knows it 's going to be a big film . It 's one of the best films of all times . The director is Ramesh Sippy , and he has done a fantastic job . The screenplay has been superbly written by the best writer of all times . The film takes you through the life of an ordinary man . There is a time when all is right and he gets married . There is another time when the man gets into a great trouble .

For Native Mongolian speakers the film lacked emotion and emphasis . Used too many non Native speakers especially Jamukha . It’d be nice to see a version with the actors in their native Mongolian language. The actors have a limited repertoire of language to play with, I would have expected more out of them. I am surprised by the lack of emotion in the film . If you’re not watching it in a foreign language, this is a great film that should be seen by the Mongolian community. I’ve only watched the film a few times.

Well it might be a kid's movie...perhaps but i'm not gonna let my kids from 9 watch it!,so the one who say it is a kid movie hmm? !,it is teenager movie i agree..,so but back to the movie it is about a boy who can lie very good..,so good that at the end nobody nows truth or lie.Anyway it is a nice movie to see nice screen play i vote a 8 for screen play and story ...i think they writers mend a litlle lesson whit it...''the truth is never overated''.

Uncle Fred Olen Ray once again gives us a little of his Retromedia "goodness" in the form of this soft-core Cinemax non-classic.A numb-nut pair are out looking at rocks when they come across a swirling vortex a "black hole" as the intelligent dolts put it. Pretty soon an attractive cave girl from one million years ago happens into out time-line and she beds her way into the future. Pretty soon her studly other half makes his way into the future as well and blazes a path through the beds of the future.Ray again delivers a passable (but barely) smut-fest that has horrible acting but some decent skin.

I like many others saw this as a child and I loved it and it horrified me up until adulthood. The author is correct. The first time I tried it was when my son was about four or five, and we were walking down the stairs. He would be standing on one foot when the stairs were level, so we would be walking at the same speed as a person in a standing position would. My son started to walk down the stairs with his right foot and I would put the left foot just a tiny bit further ahead of me.

I grew up watching the "Bowery Boys" on the weekends and even at young an age I could tell this was low rent stuff as the name implies. The East Side Kids stuff were never shown even though it was public domain stuff and probably cheap to run, it was just to low a standard for kids to tune in even though we only had like 5 channels to watch. Enter the year 2005 and I am repossesin about my childhood.

A virtual carbon copy of The Cave save for a fewer lower budget effects and a slightly different plot . A virtual copy of The Cave is currently available for free on the Weta Workshop site and is also available on Steam. The Cave was the first feature length adventure game for the PC, created by Brian Froud, and it was released in 1995. The story is based on Froud's own experiences as a prisoner. It won the Interactive Achievement Awards 1995 in the categories of Computer Games and Interactive Art. This game was ported to the Sega CD and Saturn in the 1990s.

This is one of a rarity of movies , where instead of a bowl of popcorn one should watch it as the movie progresses. You don’t even realize what happened until the end of the movie. It’s a very interesting concept. What do you think? What do you have to say about this one? Tell us what you think in the comment section. Do share your views in the comments section below. “I just want to thank you all for taking the time out to listen to what I had to say today”.

"Flashdance" meets "Meatballs III" or maybe it should just be called "Meatballs IV". This is my friend Wesley's all-time favorite movie, largely because he still has a thing about J.V. cheerleaders. As someone once said: "This is fine-more than fine-but as you get older you need to branch out. Whether you want to or not, society demands it". "Gimme An F" has cinema's greatest J.V. cheerleader Mary Ann (played by Beth Miller), who looks like a sweet-faced Alicia Silverstone from before her "Clueless" days.

If extreme activities (and I don't mean the Hollywood ones like UFC & X-Games) and the people who pursue them interest you then seek this doc out.This is one of those truth-is-stranger-than-fiction tales of Donald Crowhurts's obsession to prove himself against great odds. Those odds were stacked by Mother Nature, the media and his own mind. It is also about a time lost to us --although it was only 40 years ago.The filmmakers have done a great job in gathering a wide range of material to tell his story and the story of the great race that consumed him.

A thinly veiled attempt to push Hulkamania to the film going non-wrestling fan . What could be worse than Hogan taking his talents to film and making millions off the Hulkamania he inspired? Nothing! And then, after Hulkamania, the film goes out to the world of professional wrestling fans to try and turn us into fans of Hogan's character, as well. If only he hadn't lost that match, and his career wasn't over, and the wrestling business was still going strong, would Hulkamania turn out to be such a flop?

It`s funny how instinct warns you of something . For example as soon as the company credits read Nu Image I knew instinctively I`d seen a really crap film by them somewhere before but couldn`t remember where . Nevertheless I just knew JUDGE AND JURY was going to be crap and it was . Maybe I`m psychic ?!!!! MILD SPOILERS !!! !The opening is rather violent with several people getting blown away for no more reason than being in the wrong place at the wrong time .

This TV show is possibly the most pathetic display of crap on TV today. Horribly predictable, obscene usage of slow motion photography, cheesy story lines. Chuck Norris is an abomination who should never have been allowed to be filmed in anything. The way he chooses to make each episode into a public service announcement is really annoying. His acting sucks so bad that it makes a person cringe with embarrassment. I will give the series some credit though...it does get entertaining at times, but not enough for it make any difference.

I 'm rating this pretty high just because of Sam Elliott . I could 've done without the female nudity. There 's no need for that, especially if it 's the same actor and not a totally different one . But I guess in the end, it makes the film look a lot better . I actually liked this movie much more than the trailer. The movie is really good, and the trailer was kinda crappy. The story was quite good . Just don 't watch the first 25 minutes . It'll ruin everything. I would give this a 3 out of 5 .

I think the "Bone Snatcher" should go after anyone associated with this movie. Watching this will seem like the longest 90 minutes or so of your entire life. The plot is boring and stupid. There were no scenes that were horrifying, even remotely. If you manage to endure this fine piece of cinema art all the way to the end, you're either going to be highly disappointed or die laughing hysterically. I bought this movie based on some other reviews I'd read. I wish I had my money back. What a skunker.

I watched this film a few nights ago and it was awful ! Awfully long - even though they managed to make a decent thriller out of it. It was also very long, and the pacing was very inconsistent (it jumped from long scenes to very short scenes) - especially during the last 2 hours of the film. I didn't really enjoy it, but I can see why it was made, and I agree with others that the ending is a disappointment, although I do find it hard to put my finger on why. I saw it twice.

OK, last night I saw the world premiere of Paul Schrader's The Exorcist: The Beginning at the Brussels International Festival of Fantasy Films. With all the commotion around the film it was highly anticipated.The director was there and so were most of the stars (except Skarsgard).Unfortunately the movie sucked big time. It was a real disappointment for me because I'm a huge fan of both Shrader and Friedkin's (RIP) original 1973 film.What was wrong with it? Most of it actually. The FX (you would think that the Matrix and LOTR digital revolution never happened: it was so badly rendered!

Leni Riefenstahl would be embarrassed by the disgusting propaganda Moore tries to call "humor". That this movie, and Moore's other prevarications, actually attract admirers proves that, alas, it's possible to fool some of the people all of the time.Let's see if we can bait foreigners. Let's see if we can extol obsolete factories. Let's see if we can add to the sum of hatred in the world. Let's see if we can pretend we're funny. Let's see if we can out-isolationist Charles Lindbergh.

I went to see this on the strength of Albert Finney alone . He 's one of my favorite actors of all time , and this is one of his best roles . It is hard to choose a favorite . He is very good in any role . I think his acting skills are exceptional . He will make any audience feel and think that they are watching a great story teller and a great actor . This is a very interesting movie. I've always appreciated Finney's subtle performances. It's hard to put into words but I really like this one.

"Mararía" really disappointed me. I can't consider it as a bad movie, but the development just seemed too rushed and non-believable for it to evoke any emotions. Dr. Fermín displays some unprecedented bizarre behaviour out of a passion that one can't really understand where it was born from. I mean, how many times does he ever have a conversation with Mararía?? Maybe once? Also, Mararía never appeared to be a real character, instead more like a film stereotype that just needed to be in the movie (...or else another title was needed?).

SPOILER ALERT! Don't read on unless you're prepared for some spoilers.I think this film had a lot beneath its shell. Besides the apparent connections with "Oldboy" (and Park-wook's other films), an incestuous relation in this one really disturbed me, and also the subtle erotic theme that hung around all the vampiric, physical action.The main actor, Kang-ho Song, is terrific in the rôle of the priest Sang-hyeon - coincidentally, "sang" means "blood" in some languages - who truly loved Tae-ju, played by OK-bin Kim.

I know my summary sounds very harsh , but this film has very limited appeal . The average Joe out there ( and I am a normal Joe ) does not seem to like this type of films , and its not just that we do not want to see the same movie in the same format over and over again . No , its the fact that these people just do not seem to get it . If this is a film that people like to watch , then there is a simple reason for that , and that is because the film works .

A traveling couple ( Horton and Hamilton ) stumble onto the town of Gatlin , where kids have slaughtered the residents for sport. They decide they will leave Gatlin, taking with them all the animals they find there. As Horton and Hamilton leave Gatlin , they are shot by a gang of kids who had been hiding in the woods nearby. Hamilton survives the shooting by the grace of an old friend. As they continue on with their journey they encounter a band of bandits and have to fight their way out. When they find the rest of the group, the bandits kill all but Horton.

While many pass this off as a B movie it is , indeed , a first class comedy that is both campy and very funny at the same time. And it does not disappoint as you will not want to put it down and do something else until the final credits roll. You will enjoy this movie a whole lot because of how well written this film was and how charming it is to watch. You will have the best time with this movie and you will watch this movie over and over again for your own enjoyment.

Something of a disappointment. Lee J. Cobb is the anti-union head of Roxton Garments in New York. His partner in the business is killed when an elevator is unleashed and plunges twenty-seven floors to the bottom of the shaft, in the scariest scene in the film.Cobb doesn't know it, or doesn't let himself realize it, but the man behind the killing is Richard Boone, who protects the business from union organizers.Then Cobb's son, Kerwin Mathews, returns from Europe determined to learn the business and join his father in running a clean shop. He's shocked -- shocked!

I am not understanding why people are praising this movie. I didn't like it at all. I watch it with several people. None of them cared for it either. First of all. It is just plain that another low budget studio is trying to cash in on a big name story. The actual filming looks like a live TV interview. The makeup is bad. When you watch the movie along with the DVD extras. You will see there is a lot of enthusiasm from the people who participated in it. There is no talent.

I was fortunate enough to catch a midnight screening of this movie tonight . I must say , I was blown away. I didn’t think I was going to like it, but boy was I wrong! I will definitely be going to see this when it is released on dvd. Hopefully, the movie has a great soundtrack as well! There was some good reviews in the local papers and I saw a review of the movie on IMDB, so I knew I had to watch it. This movie was an instant winner.

I like The Wind and the Lion very much . It was a good movie . I thought that since it was the first movie I would see the first time in the cinema, I was surprised that it wasn’t any more of a roller coaster ride I was expecting. I thought that it would be a pretty scary movie . But it was more like a movie that would make you laugh and then scream. It had a nice ending too . Although it ended pretty much the same way the first one did.

Most of the positive comments posted here are as verbose as the movie ! It takes a long-winded bore to write a comment on a thread. I just saw it on the net and it seems to have more of an "intriguing" and "suspense" than "horror". It was very well done and a good movie at the end. I like the way it was made and very interesting as well as good story telling. The only thing I don't like was that they used a child as a victim. That was one of the best horror films of 2000.

I have always liked the Carry On films , with their double-meaning sexual innuendo dialogue and moments of slapstick comedy. I have seen Carry On London on DVD, and thought I would give it a try out in the theater. What I found was an utterly different experience, for me at least. I was expecting it to be silly, light and fun. Instead, it was actually rather serious, heavy and heavy-handed in its delivery. I wasn't laughing a lot, and had to put up with a lot of rather over-the-top musicals and songs.

To even say that this film is Sebastien's work at his best just tell you everything you have to know on the man. If watching any of his shows is just plain torture for any normally constituted human being, his first (ans lets hope only) film proved to be even worst. NBC had a chance to make a powerful religious epic along the lines of `` The Ten Commandments '' and it fell short in a way it was never meant to by taking a religious story and turning it from a cautionary story about human sacrifice to a bloodlust story with all the drama, violence, and suspense that goes with such an approach. It's worth pointing out that there was already a history of religious films in the 1920s (and some that had religious content) - but few of them reached the same heights that " God is Dead" did at the box office.

This movie is about a man who likes to blow himself up on gas containers.He also loves his mommy .It is based off the true events that I experienced with my own son and a woman I had a brief affair with when I was 19.There is a twist but it does not effect the film,at least it did not effect my view on it! This is the story of a man who was a victim of sex trafficking and was forced into servitude and sexual slavery. He is the first person to have his story made into a movie by a Japanese film company.

I would not recommend it whatsoever . It was like getting stuck in the middle row of a theater , but with the possibility to get a free pass when it is your lucky day ! You have to wait in the very last row to buy your pass at the very end , the best part of the show . I was very happy to get my pass before the end of the show . What to see in Bangkok

If you are looking for a good time to see all the sights in Bangkok , you need to go somewhere else !

Susan Sarandon . She made this movie for me . I 've never appreciated her acting more than as I watch the movie on a long car ride , with me and my daughters , while driving down a very beautiful California road . The scenery is amazing . The acting is fantastic , and the cinematography was amazing , as was the editing. I think you should make a movie . I don't think you will find any movie that is as beautiful as this. I was just going to post a little comment about her acting but I found that it was better to leave it in the blog .

Watched this months ago on Netflix Instant and left a review there.Let me say , most of the other reviews I read didn't even bother with that review but they just raved and raved about what they were seeing on the screen . The Turtles face the evil Dr. Eggman in a new adventure, when Dr. Eggman takes over the island of Manhattan.

This is a very , very odd film ... one that is so odd it 's best you just see it and then forget about it. That's what I tried to do, at least. I had to see it once. But it wasn't to my taste. I didn't feel the way others have written it off and made me think it was the biggest, shiniest, sexiest sex comedy in the universe. What I saw was a film I didn't care for. This is a very strange film, that's all. And yet it's just what is.

This film is the most impressing turkish film that I have ever seen. Probably "Okul" is the first turkish horror film. I must say that I were excited while watching the movie because of some reasons, The first reason is that the story is impressive, I mean that at the end of the film you realised all the details about movie, this makes the film attractive and the other reason is that no turkish man made such a movie like that before. This shows that turkish film improves itself by time. Although the first trial to make a horror movie, It was really successful.

I LOVE THIS MOVIE!! !This beautiful, charming love story drew me in immediately with its lovable characters and heart-warming romance. I became so attached to the characters throughout the film that I felt as if I knew them personally. The storyline is very enchanting, and it brought me to tears in several touching moments. Duchovny and Driver have a very cute, chaste relationship that you can't help getting involved in. This one's worth watching more than once, and showing to all your friends. I'm just curious, why wasn't this a big hit?I give this a 10 out of 10!

Most of the positive comments posted here are as verbose as the movie! It takes a long-winded bore to appreciate a wordy and boring film, one supposes. Some have merely called the film "contemplative", meaning slow and devoid of plot, however, one Dutch reviewer hit the nail on the head: this is an important event turned into a dull film whose tone is set in the very first scene. Here a young couple is being shown an apartment by a Realtor who, predictably, talks non-stop and regardless of what else is going on.

( May contain spoilers ) I find myself disappointed with the criticism this movie receives . While it is most certainly an interesting movie , it doesn't have much going for it . The plot is pretty thin and it has a very limited plot . The film's plot basically consists of an attempt by people to find out what happened on Mars years ago . The story doesn't really go anywhere and it does not progress in a real way . As with most sci-fi stories , we don't see the consequences of the technology that's used in the film or if it ever will work .

This is an example of why the majority of action films are the same . Generic and boring , there are very few movies that actually work . The majority of movies have the same set up . You go to the cinema , get to the theater , sit through the whole movie , and walk out feeling like shit . You’ve already seen it a few times , and your mind has begun to get numb . You are going to have to see it one more time before you get anything else out of this experience .

While caricatures and/or references to entertainment industry people or things or even brands of products is usually a staple in shorts like this one, they aren't used in quantity here. Most of the individual gags are rather generic. As I'm going to give examples, there will be spoilers below: There are only three (well, technically four-there's a quick one at the very end of the cartoon) caricatures that I spotted, which is kind of low for this type of short, though one is a featured character with a fair amount of activity.

A suprisingly good film considering the circumstances of its production. Features performances from no-name actors that rival the top talent on the planet (sadly none have persued a career). Also features the the god-like ability of Christopher Nolan to write perfect dialogue. Dialogue is what carries this story, which is about a man who likes to follow people for material for his books. Well shot, VERY well edited, even better written, and amazingly well performed.This movie has everything a great film needs, except people who have seen it.

How sad it is when a film as wonderful as `` Jurassic Park '' slowly nosedives into hackneyed and mediocre nonsense, as with this dreary, dull-witted `` Return to Neverland. `` What is the matter with the writers of this film that they can't think of anything original? The story is that of an all-male band that gets stranded on a tropical island for six months while their plane crashes. We're told that the plane was forced to land because the pilot's wife had to go to England on business and couldn't leave him alone for a moment.

This movie, although well shot and superbly acted, was awful. I felt as if I was watching a car accident--sure I kept watching but I really wanted to turn my head. The plot leaves little to be desired, was extremely disjointed, and the ending was abysmal. Although, it did fit the tone of the movie, I was hoping for something to improve this movie. I still don't understand what the references to rabies and the child get bit by the fox at the beginning of the movie. Fifteen minutes of plot that really didn't do much.

Except for the glossy look, this show had little to recommend it. The writing was patronizing and convoluted. Without exception the characters were shallow and unsympathetic. The female characters came off the worst... reduced to spoiled, selfish airheads whose soul ambition was to run around in slip dresses and stilettos, and try to bag a man. This aspect of the show is all the more curious as the series was produced by two women! The acting for the most part was dull and humourless with the cast playing one dimensional characters attacking every scene on the same note.

Wow , Kiss the Bride was n't that bad , but it was n't that good either . It sure was n't better than any of the other wedding movies of that year ! What a mess , and a shame . I don't know if I have the same feelings about the rest of the wedding movies of that year. But then again, I'm not the one who is getting married. I just like wedding movies. The only one that I enjoyed is A Wedding In Scotland. It was a very romantic movie. But the rest, no.

Burt Kennedy both wrote & directed this western taken from a novel. Kennedy was a well known good writer & director, mostly westerns.Robert Mitchum was a star for over 20 years when he made this. This role was like many he had made already,One can see why he was a big star for so many years.He filled this role easily like a well used glove.The title character is played by Robert Walker Jr. (his father a fine actor Robert Walker--died tragically at age 32---his mother is noted actress Jennifer Jones).Robert was of slight build & even though he had talent only made a few films.

Pretty twisted Horror film, that has a few good moments here and there, with some creepy Blood transfusion scenes, however it's just too dull for it's own good. All the characters are OK, and the story while had a lot of potential is rather dull, however the blood transfusion scenes looked frighteningly real, and as a result they were extremely disturbing. It's well made and decently written, and it started out really interesting, but it just couldn't keep up the pace, plus I found the ending to be disappointing.

The key scene in Rodrigo Garcia 's `` Nine Lives '' comes when Sissy Spacek , hidden away in a corner, has a crisis of faith. Sissy: I don't believe that there's anything worth loving, nothing worth fighting for. There isn't, not for me. It turns out that her mother, played by the late Ann Sothern, was actually a prostitute who gave her up. The film is set against a backdrop of poverty, the Vietnam War, racism and the drug war, among other conflicts.

The plot is somewhat original, and all the actors did their job pretty well. There is a plenty of comic relief, too. Some things do not make a lot of sense (e.g. the first "chase" scene, why would the heroine not just hide somewhere and wait until the baddies leave?). The Russians actually speak Russian without accent, but the cars are extremely strange, with models spanning like 50 years, and so the place seems weirdly out of time. Overall, if you like thrillers you will probably like this one as well.

Teenage Exorcist is one of those God-awful films to video that makes the viewer give up any expectations of decent entertainment for low brow sexual antics, adolescent humour, and empty writing. This film delivers exactly what its was trying to deliver. It is about a girl moving into a house where a Baron de Sade(hmmm) once lived and finally being drawn to him through her own inner demon. Her sister and brother-in-law, along with an Irish priest, her boyfriend, and a pizza delivery boy, try to save her and exorcise her demon.

Loki, Norse god of mischief, creates a mask that endows the wearer with cartoon-like powers. At the command of his father, Odin, he spends the rest of the movie looking for the mask so that it can cause no further grief to mankind. In the meantime, the possessor of the mask conceives a child who inherits the powers of the mask. Etc. etc. If this sounds like a pretty thin plot line, it is. Add to this the fact that the movie is handled ineptly from start to finish, and the result is very, very bad.
