It seems whenever a mainstream film company wants to make a movies for teens it concentrates on only one thing. Movies aimed at young adults tend to feature sex scenes with lots of graphic violence. Teen sex movies tend to have a much lower production cost and much better production values. But the only way to get a teen sex film is to get some young adult actors who are willing to put their careers on the line for that project. I believe this is a common misconception for many people. If you don’t already know it, there are lots of teenage sex movies.

Max Cash a charter boat captain who works off the Caribbean island San Sebastian is hired by Sarah, who's looking for legendary boat, El Diablo and its stolen treasure that sunk out in the reef in the 17th century. But something seems to be protecting the whereabouts of the ship, as people who knew anything about it are being killed.I have to agree with those that were under the impression that this was going to be a horror feature. Instead what we ended up with was a low-rent, b-grade late 80s take on 1977 deep-sea adventure film 'The Deep', but with a baffling supernatural origin and an injection of mystery.

Supposedly , a movie about a magazine sending journalists to investigate reports of UFOs with one being more or less destroyed by a UFO, is going to be released. The movie, according to reports, was originally going to be released in the US on May 21st and in Canada on May 22nd. Now there's no date mentioned for the US release. So what do we do with the information that's out there? How about a movie? The same way they do it in the comic books. The movie is called Alien Bounty Hunter.

Ho Hum. Just another flick with Steven Seagal pretending to be some spiritual being, but bashing heads and killing like it was nothing. He, of course, justifies it in the end by donating the money to an orphanage., How sweet. Lay the world to waste and we'll ignore it if you take care of a little girl. Jeesh! This time, he is partnered with Ice Cool (Anthony 'Treach' Criss). Gotta have someone to lay all those cringe-inducing lines on, man, and there are plenty.

I did n't really HATE Mirrormask . I just really wanted more from a movie than pretty visuals . The visuals weren't as bad as i thought they woul d be . The acting was OK , i like the character of Jack but he didn't have anything to do that would make me care . And the plot to me was just way to dumb . I'm not mad at the film or Mirrors Mask , i like it but it just didn't grab me . I know some will say the acting was good for the film but for me at least i just saw it and it didn't grab me .

I grew up in the 90s; therefore, you must understand that i witnessed firsthand the premiers of the greatest DCOMs. I was there when Brink! appeared, Zenon, Halloweentown, Johnny Tsunami, etc, These movies constitute my childhood. When these movies came on, not only myself but whoever I was watching them with would stand completely in awe for 1h30, talk about it for the week to come and catch it again the next weekend. I don't think words could express the amount of excitement Zoog Disney brought.

This is quite possibly the worst documentary I have ever seen . It looked so amateurish . Chris Hegedus was very good . I have seen a few documentaries that looked professional and this did not . In the few seconds that I was exposed to what was put forth by the producers , I could not help but feel as if they were going out of their way to discredit those who supported the war . But it did not take me too long to see where they were going with it and why . The whole thing is like this .

the boys were the most appealing things in the entire movie. the girls were lame and pathetic, i mean, how can they own their own clothing line, dolls, movies, producing studios, and not smell this bomb from far away? in order to gain some sort of responsibility, which i dont really see the sense in the punishment..., they are sent to paris, far far far away from home to live with the so-called strict grandfather who holds an important standing with paris. i cant really remember what he was, so who really cares?

If you have ever shopped at Wal-Mart , then you probably know about the $ 5 DVD bin that sits between the shelves and the checkout counter. This bin, along with an extra $ 50 you can earn, is a reward for shopping at Walmart. If you spend $ 50 or more in one day at Walmart , you’ll be eligible for a $ 5 “Discount DVD Gift Card.” If you spent $ 100 or more, the $ 5 Gift Card will be yours. There are no limit to the amount you can earn this way.

I was 19 years old when I saw first saw this film, in the theater. I have a vivid memory of a different ending. Not completely different but significantly. I just watched the movie last night and I was wrong, so I guess the following can't be called a spoiler, since it never happened. The ending I remember was that the boy was hiding in the house completely naked, Frances Austen found him quite easily and after she confronted him, she slowly sank to her knees and went down on him off camera.

This is an unfortunately unrecognized classic.The look is superb , the design , costumes etc are flawless , the post production is superb, and the story is a masterpiece. It has all the elements needed to be a classic. I would highly recommend this movie. Gosh it was great. I've only seen one other movie, "The Big Lebowski, and I liked it very much. I like the story, the characters, the dialogue. The only bad thing is that the characters don't seem like they believe in their own convictions.

This movie has a fairly decent premise - one gruesomely featured again and again in science fiction films, most spectacularly in "Alien" - and some decent "he-man" performances from the male cast. The possessed astronaut's wife, to me, is the weak link in the ensemble - she doesn't seem to know what to do with her face in a lot of her most prominent scenes, for which I blame director Corman. Given a decent budget for props and special effects and a more focused and coherent screen play, "Blood Beast" might have been pretty decent.

I have not seen and heard the original version.I am no Russian , but I am learning right now.I also have read the books and watched the videos, and so far, I do understand the parts of what he says.If this is so, please share with me , I would love to know why he says what he says. There was a time, and there was a book, when it was widely accepted that there is a god and that he does things. I would like to believe it still, but I do not know that. I find it is very hard to accept it.

I seen this movie when it came out. I thought what an average movie. I have now realized that this director was ahead of his time. This is a great movie and great soundtrack. I have seen my share of rock films but although this is far from spinal tap (which I did not like)> This film does take us into the life of an 80s rocker wanting to be nothing but. This is nothing more than our inner child wanting to grow up and to be a *ROCK STAR* Yeah I said it.

I love this movie. Yes, the main character lies, but that's why it's called "big fat liar". Even though this kid runs away to Hollywood, it doesn't give kids the idea that they can. Besides, he doesn't just do it for fun or to get away from anything, he does it to regain trust. I don't think it was just one big ad for Universal Studios, because I liked how it gave an inside view of what it's like for kids who don't know how cool movie-making is.

This is the only movie that I can think of where after it ended, I was seething with anger at the waste of money and time on the part of myself and everyone involved in making it. No wonder Alan Moore refused to have anything to do with V for Vendetta (a phenomenal film) after this debacle.It's not bad in an entertaining way, like Showgirls. It's bad in a way that makes you want to claw your eyes out. Plot holes the size of planets. The worst script in memory. Horrible acting by decent actors.

Mani sir as usual brings out another amazing story with Kannathil Muthamittal . Such an amazing relationship between parents and children as well as parents and son. I have a lot of questions and would like to hear the answers from both Mr. Mani and daughter. What was their relationship when they were not in touch with their parents and how are they now with their parents? What about when they are not with their parents. It seems that they had not had any relations with their parents and had to meet their parents for their studies.

This movie was terrible. You couldn't fast forward fast enough to get to the end of this movie. It came down to the last 20 minutes of the film and I literally hit the eject button right in the middle of the scene. It was one of the worst movies I have ever experienced. Worse than all Dean Cain films combined. To start, the acting was terrible. I realize that the main actors were from the cast of survivor, but one would think that any TV experience would have given them a little more talent.

My expectations were high after seeing the trailer . They were even higher when i saw the movie had the same name. I saw the movie a week or so later and was amazed it was even better than the trailer. I had to stop at a stop sign to watch the movie. I didn't realize how much i was missing out on when i was at home in my living room with the sound down and the screen up . In the middle of the movie there was a small part that showed a woman getting in a car wreck . I felt so bad .

I remember being so excited on Saturday nights when I was a kid, waiting for Dr. Who. I thought it was the best show ever made. Then, I grew up, Dr. Who went off the air, and no one I knew had ever heard of it. Then I found out there was going to be a new series. I was a little nervous about it. Was it going to live up to the expectations I had carried around since I was little? Would they screw it up? Would the Dr. suck? Would his assistant suck?

So bad, it's entertaining, especially during cocktail hour, and believe me, you'll need a beer, a drink, or whatever to get through this turkey. Where do they get the financial backing for such paint-by-the-numbers "horror" flicks? The fun in this movie is predicting which characters will get eaten and in what order, and trashing the so-called "uniforms" the "military" jokers wear. The raptors, by the way, are not the same raptors we met in "Jurassic Park," but a cousin species. (Sorry, no spoilers here.

I unwittingly walked into this "trap" of a movie.If I could turn back time or simply get a refund I would be happy.It was 7:30pm and Cinderella Man didn't start until 10pm so I rushed into the theater to catch the movie that started at 7:20pm...and I dare say God reached out his hand (or retracted it) and allowed me to punish myself for my film gluttony by sitting in for this film.It may be unfair to criticize a movie that was not targeted at my heterosexual male cohort, however, there is no excuse for lousy sound and video editing.

I saw this originally on Channel 4 (UK) and it was a fantastic film that left a great impression on me. However I saw it on Irish TV recently and there was an added narration by Roy Scheider ("we're going to need a bigger boat!"). This ruined the film for me. His droning monologue adds absolutely nothing to the film, and if anything takes from the films brilliance. I wonder at the new DVD version that has no Roy (due to legal reasons?) would stop people from buying it.

Ed ( Kel Mitchell ) is a teenager who lives for his job at Good Burger , a small but famous burger joint. After working for three days at Good Burger , he takes a night shift, and goes home to sleep. However, after he has finished his job he goes back to his flat and gets into bed with his girlfriend. At the weekend, he goes out for the day, but ends up in his girlfriend's flat instead, and she is not happy. When he returns at the end of the night he finds her watching porno videos on a laptop.

This is definitely a touching movie, and a great expression of Charles Darwins personal struggle. The movie is not only about his struggle to get his book "the origin of Species" published, but also his relationship with his oldest daughter. His daughter was at start the only person in his family to approve of his views, something that she as well had to pay for. Een more than him at times.Now, this is not an evolutionary propaganda film, as a matter of fact I think it managed to stay very neutral. A hard thing to do in my opinion.

This is a must-see movie . You will laugh , you will cry , and when it 's over you 'll be thinking of all the ways that this film coulda , shoulda , could not have been done better. If this film is any indication , then there 's no future for American politics. It's like watching one of the few American politicians who actually has an idea to offer, and what happens next is that everyone else is trying to make a big show of their own ideas in front of the camera , to the point that the viewer can't distinguish the two.

There needs to be a 0/10 option for bilge like this. It was painful to watch, but strangely compelling all the same. Compelling because it seemed unbelievable that a movie could actually suck this much. I kept thinking "it must get better." It got worse. And worse. How on earth were people conned into producing such a categorical piece of junk I'll never know. The most surprising thing of all though, is all these reviews I see of people actually loving the movie. Yes, the acting was good, but the movie was very very very bad.

I really should give this stinker more credit that 1 star, because the film has so many eye-rolling lines that it's almost worth the price of the rental. The acting, if you want to call it that, is so stilted and contrived that it makes Ed Wood's actors appear life like. "Sammy," the lone black character, must be Mimi's husband in real life because he appears in her other films, but he has zero acting ability. His lines are priceless due to his absurd delivery, though I suspect the intention was to create a sympathetic character.

I'm just starting to explore the so far wonderful world of monsieur Ozon. I've seen only 4 films so far, and with the last one in the row it hit me that all of them were in fact about lonely women and their actions. Not a single non-lonely female character out of 12, and all of them bring heavy impact of surroundings.This film is probably the only one (out of four) where this impact is for good.The gay theme is an almost standard part of background for Ozon's films, so it doesn't grab the accent (although the looks of the characters might).

Another first : this French movie is my introduction to the world Eric Rohmer . Perhaps I 'm a bit spoiled by the fact that the French can produce a good film on any given day. So I was a bit puzzled about the name of this movie. The director was Pierre Billon, who came from France and directed the movie Les Américains, which won the Best Film award in Cannes. In this movie, one of the guys gets killed, which doesn 't change the fact that the ending was quite good.

Hard Justice is an excellent action movie! The whole movie is really nothing but shooting and fighting but it does have a very good vampire plot! For the people who say they don't make shoot em ups and fighting films like they use to. Well, this one is really hard-core! Don 'The Dragon' Wilson is excellent and his character is really cool in the movie. Nicholas Guest was very good as well and he arguably steals the show! He really performs as a fantastic villain! Melanie Smith was also good. I think that this very fine looking actress is very underrated.

I did n't even watch this whole movie . Now , I like 50 's sci-fi movies even when they're cheesy. And I do agree with your idea that this is not a bad movie. Just don't over-analyze a movie with a very obvious plot. And the fact that a movie like "Ender's Game" is about to be shown on the big screen in cinemas is no guarantee of a great movie. That's what I mean. And the same goes for "The Dark Crystal" , "Harry Potter " , "The Matrix" , and "Watership" .

I really wanted to like this movie. Great cast  Walter Pidgeon in a role that reminds us of his iconic "Forbidden Planet," Barbara Eden and Robert Sterling as young lovers, Frankie Avalon as a musically inclined sailor (is a guy on a submarine a sailor? ), even Peter Lorre as a scientist with a fondness for sharks. Maybe it's a good kiddie movie but I had trouble staying awake. Lorre was severely underused. I guess he was a red herring, like Pidgeon  you expect him to maybe go nuts and try to throw the hero or his gal in the shark tank.

I just watched The Dresser this evening, having only seen it once before, about a dozen years ago.It's not a "big" movie, and doesn't try to make a big splash, but my God, the brilliance of the two leads leaves me just about speechless. Albert Finney and Tom Courtenay are nothing less than amazing in this movie.The Dresser is the story of Sir, an aging Shakespearean actor (Finney), and his dresser Norman (Courtenay), sort of a valet, putting on a production of King Lear during the blitz of London in World War II.

The title role of this western is played by Robert Walker , Jr . He 's a young gun who has played the same character in the first film , and he 's also played the character in a couple of previous serials . He has a very good screen presence, and an easy, natural voice . There are some funny bits to his voice, and I suspect he 's been doing this for a long time , though he only appeared in one or two other westerns before this , and there are no signs that he can do any better as a singer .

This episode was boring and was not even in the realm of horror , so far this season Masters of Horror has been the same old same old, with nothing new, or even really scary. If anything, the characters have gotten really annoying and just annoying, it's sad but I guess that's why they keep on getting paid so much . The main theme of this episode of the Masters of Horror is the story of what would have happened if Adam and Eve ate from an apple. It's pretty good for a horror story because it has some good visuals and some really cool scenes.

There is a lot to like in this film , despite its humble trappings of a preachy PC tale about a little girl with a heart of gold and a little boy who is not quite right. The story is about a girl who is the daughter of a rich man. In a family that does not have any real social standing, she grows up in comfort. The film follows her life from a young age, through high school, to her time as a student at a local university. The film does not waste any opportunity to preach. It is a film about love.

This third installment in the Scarecrow series is by far the best of the lot. I know, I know...but how good is it? Well, let's not be silly. It's still pretty bad, but by comparison to the first two, it's a fine film. Again shot on digital, with decent lighting and good camera work. ****SPOILER****When a college baseball team hazes new members, one is left in a diabetic coma. Of course, they abandon him in a cornfield, tied to a scarecrow.

Michael Bassett 's film 'Solomon Kane ' ( based on the character of the same name created by Robert E. Howard, also known as Conan the Barbarian ) had a big effect on me. But the reason why this film had that kind of impact on me, even though I had seen it years before, is the atmosphere. This film had an atmosphere of suspense, tension, fear, and mystery, all wrapped into one big package. It was very atmospheric to watch, and I guess that's the thing I love about it.

I really liked the Far Cry game, nice graphics, good level-design, interesting and clever enemies, above-average length and even a somewhat decent plot. I am not by default against movie spin-offs of games. I thought "DOOM The Movie" was hilarious. But what Uwe Boll has done here, is to take the game and modified every one of its good aspects and turned them into something horrible (well not the length, the movie runs only a merciful 90 min) The characters are even more stereotypical than in the game, which is quite an achievement.

Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd...The strangest, most off-putting, but most wonderful Broadway musical. It is chilling, funny, and moving all at once through Sondheim's most memorable and incredible score and sharp performances. George Hearn is incomparable in the title role, bringing a strong voice and dead on (no pun intended) impersonation of the legendary demon barber, while Angela Lansbury provides the comic relief as she cheerfully grinds up his victims into meat pies. If you just allow yourself to enjoy it, "Sweeney Todd" is a real treat.

This is so bad it will be my contribution to the next bad movie party I go to . It is not a bad movie in the sense that it is mediocre at best , it is not a great movie , it is not a horrible movie . It is one of many bad movies , I’ll say this and I’m sorry to say it but if you have the time, it is worth watching . But it is not worth the money , the only reason that it is in this list is because it was released in the UK , and it was released on Netflix in the States .

Incident on and off a Mountain Road is Don Coscarelli's entry in Mick Garris' Masters of Horror series. Coscarelli is famous for being the man behind such cult gems as the Phantasm series and the irresistibly weird Bubba Ho-Tep; but he brings none of the qualities that made those films great to this TV episode. The plot is a run of the mill one that follows the routine idea of an innocent being chased by a madman. This time, it's a young woman driving down a mountain road. After a head on crash, she finds herself being stalked by a white faced maniac.

I had to suffer through this movie three times while I was a zombie extra in the director 's new zombie flick. So I think I can make an informed comment. I didn't know what I was getting myself into and I don't regret it. If I had, I probably would have refused to do the zombie makeup the first time I went in for the audition. But once I saw the zombie makeup, I knew I had to become one of those zombies. I saw it all as a job. I can't help being a fan of the zombie genre.

Okay, that was just brilliant. I wish that the rest of Season 1 had been this strong. It really needed more episodes like this. The cast worked perfectly, even though they were all nobodies back in the day. Writing was fantastic and so was the editing. Great job in all accounts. The episode was thrilling, suspenseful and just kept you guessing until the very end. Which is what most MOTW episodes had tried, but failed until now. The first FIVE star episode for me. Really good, almost like a movie. I didn't even remember it being this good.

This was Gene Kelly's breakthrough, and that alone makes it memorable. Throw in Rita Hayworth as his love interest and comedian Phil Silvers of all people as his sidekick and you have the ingredients for a real crowd pleaser, which is exactly how it turned out.Kelly plays Danny McGuire, a nightclub owner in Brooklyn (Brooklyn is always the "wrong side of the tracks" in '40s films) whose star attraction and love interest is Rusty Parker (Rita Hayworth). Rita is lovely, and even plays a dual role as Rusty and Rusty's grandmother.

This is marvelous movie , about a soul of Ale . This is a journey to Ale 's heart . And it is the movie of this journey that we are in , of how we were born , to Ale and how we grew up and what we learned from the years we have been with Ale . Then it was about how our life became a mess , and we started living our life with Ale and how we started changing and growing up and how the people around us helped us with the change . It was an emotional journey of change and growth of our soul and then it ends in a beautiful ending .

When this show began it was fairly interesting : we got to see what crab boat fisherman had to go through before the crab season. This season they’re just sitting around, waiting to go in and catch a few of those crabs and bring them on shore to be eaten. The crab fishing has become very expensive as well since they’re on the verge of a big run. The show is just as well done as its predecessor, and I think you’ll agree that the show is a lot funnier.

This movie must be exported to the rest of the world ! An absolute masterpiece , with a both bizarre and a beautiful tone that you can not watch in one time. This film is a must see in every genre, from comedy to horror to thriller to war and everything in between. Great job , great acting, great music and cinematography. It is a must for all movie lovers and fans of true fantasy cinema. One of the best films of 2018 , and if not for this film, you can not even call it a good movie.

A special unit of four police detectives are dispensing justice in their own unique way in 1950s Los Angeles. Nick Nolte plays Max Hoover, the unit's lead officer and his partners are played by Michael Madsen, Chazz Palminteri and Chris Penn. Also starring are Melanie Griffith, Jennifer Connelly and John Malkovich among others. Quite an impressive list of names. Unfortunately that is the only thing even remotely impressive about this film.Our story begins when young Allison Pond, played by Connelly, turns up dead in a remote area of town currently under development.

THE worst movie I've ever seen, and I've seen allot. Acting is horrible, plot is awful, idea is terrible, and no research was done what's so ever! Ok, I admit, `Air Bud' was a pretty good movie, but not `Soccer Dog'. This "dog" is smaller than my cat! How can he possibly play soccer? Even for 10 years old kids it won't be a problem to kick the ball hard enough to brake the stupid dog in half! It's horrible, don't watch this movie.

Well, at least we have to acknowledge the big Hollywood horror-producers are finally getting smarter and more perceptive. Instead of patiently waiting to buy the rights of Asian horror hits and subsequently remake them in America, they now discovered they could simply hire the Asian directors and assign them to make their brand new ghost story directly in the states. That's like killing two birds with one stone; way to go guys! "The Messengers" is pretty much identical to every other supernatural chiller that came out of the Oriental countries ever since "Ringu".

I supposed 'Scarecrow Gone Wild' is a dull slasher flick. Yes, it have some good point, but it's a rehash from another flick. The acts is so awful nor the plot. The story goes from a legend about a living scarecrow on the cornfield. When an initiation become a prank and cause the life a boy in jeopardy, the scarecrow comes alive and start a killing frenzy. Sound familiar, right? It's derived from Scream, Friday the13th, Jeepeer Creepers, Children of the Corn, you name it! 'Scarecrow Gone Wild' is so below average film.

This show is made for persons with IQ lower than 80. The jokes in the show are so lame. If you are on a deserted island and you do not have anything to do you will be better than to watch this garbage.... You will hate their accent their behavior and all the stupid jokes and pranks they try to perform...It really pisses me of that viewers gave Reba 6.7 on their voting...Sure i knew there are some people with IQ lower than 80 but what i did not know that there are so many of them!

Too much stock footage (almost one third of this 53 minute film) really slows this one down. Granted that the plot is that John Weston (John Wayne) is sent by Marshall George Higgins (George Hayes) to participate in a fixed rodeo (say "Ro-DAY-oh"), but character development and interaction are sacrificed. The relationship between the Bad Girl (usually a Latina-- even in the great "Duck Soup" [1933]) and the 'heroine' Polly Ann Young, a Loretta Young look-alike (hey! it's her sister!)

After sitting through this god-awful 82-minute excuse of a film , and having previously wanted to gouge my eyes out with my finger nails in a futile attempt to see it through to the end, I'm now glad I did it. It's not a movie I'm likely to re-visit anytime in the future. But if you're into horror films, give it a watch if for no other reason than to see what you're all about. It's also well worth a few seconds' thought as an example of why I don't usually enjoy mainstream horror films: they are never good.

This review contains spoilers.I was searching through horror movie DVDs on Amazon when I came across Flight Of The Living Dead. I already knew from the name that it was going to be abysmally naff and most probably a rip-off of Snakes On A Plane, but it was selling brand new for 69p so I figured I didn't really have much to lose.The music played over the opening credits didn't fit at all, although I did like the song itself a pop-rock song isn't really suitable to appear on the soundtrack of a zombie horror movie.

A antique shop-owner in NYC, played by Joanne Whalley(Valerie Alston)gets put on a US District Court jury, on a trial of a known Mafioso Armand Asante(Rusty Pirone), and most of this very slow-paced film revolves around attempts of Pirone attempting to get Whalley to acquit him of murder, by threatening to kill her son, and herself. Much action ensues, involving gruesome mob-rub outs, interspread with Willam Hurt as the go-between. Much of this silly, disjointed mess surrounds Hurt and Asante's obsession with Whalley, courtroom scenes that we've all seen time and again, and an ending that is unbelievable.

Has anyone found a way to purchase copies of this series yet ? I can see that a lot of other people are interested in it but i haven't seen any offers on it anywhere and i don't know why ive been waiting. I'd love to have it now as i don't want the series to become a dead series. In the meantime i'll just wait and enjoy what i have as i've been reading it on and off the whole time. I have read the second and third in this series and really like the first.

This is one of the worst anime series I have ever seen . When I watched the manga review in the wiki , I saw that the characters are too stupid to be believable . Also , I feel bad for the guy who made this . Anyway , the anime is very boring . The girls in the anime don't seem to have any personality . The story is very boring . For example , I would like to see the same story in the manga with more interesting characters , so the anime will become more appealing . I think the anime is not as good as the manga because of the lack of characters .

It is sad that some find this film worth watching . I am Russian , and I am disgusted . And I am ashamed to watch the film in Russia . It is a tragedy that in our country such a movie can be made . I know this film has been criticized by the people. The film itself is a story about a love story between two men . I think it would be a better story to have two women as love interest . I have seen the movie twice already . The first is in Russian with my family . I was disgusted to see how this film was treated .

After the failure of `` Hellraiser III : Hell On Earth , '' the chapter that served as a kind of de facto death knell for the Bizarro film genre, no one expected a fourth film from director Sam Raimi to arrive in time for Halloween in 1989. Yet, in Raimi's own words, there could be no better choice for the film to make than to follow his most recent effort, 1997's '' Spider-Man 2.

'' The Amazing Spider-Man ' ' is widely considered the greatest comic-book movie of all time -- and it's an easy argument to make since it's as good as anything Hollywood has made since. ''

This film is enjoyable if you like poverty row , public domain films from the first half of the 20th century, and the first few decades of modern American history. There is a bit of film history, a touch of romance, a dash of sex, a pinch of romance, and a dash of sex in between. The most interesting element of the film comes in the second half when you learn the real identity of the woman with the mustache. It is very enjoyable and even the most boring bits are worth watching if you have time.

This is just one of those films which cannot justify much of anything that happens. These people are going on a trek: the young girl wants to photograph animals. There really are no Piranhas, but I guess the psychotic hunter guy is the real piranha. Anyway, there are lots of animals and there is lots of driving. There is considerable anti-gun talk, but we all know where that is going. Toward the end, there's lots of action and a rape thrown in. Somebody must pay, and they do.

Empire of Passion starts out deceptively - that is , if you 're immediately expecting it to be a horror movie like The Conjuring or something of the sort, it's going to end up being more of a psychological horror film. At the very beginning of the movie it appears as if our main character will be getting a divorce from her boyfriend, which will take away any sense of control over her life whatsoever. After all, we're meant to think, when does a person get to make decisions for herself and where are the limits of what's acceptable?

A satire about greed and money , what ? There is more greed in the intentions behind this fiasco than in the money involved. You are right, in a way, there is a certain greed involved as well as a certain selfishness, but not the greed for power and control. I think that it is more about greed and control for the elites who want to maintain their wealth and privilege. They do not have a problem with the average Joe and Jane. They want to keep their privilege. They also have no compunction about telling the public what to think.

`` THE KING OF QUEENS , '' in my opinion , is a pure CBS hit ! Despite the fact that the original version was recorded by CBS , this is a completely new take which has not seen the light of day before. It may well be the most exciting version to date . I am also very pleased to say that it is the first and only episode of '' MYSTERIES '' in which the two leading characters of the series are introduced !'' The show is currently airing in Canada . I am sure we will all be hearing many more great stories !

I always wanted to see ELECTRA GLIDE IN BLUE for a very long time. I've always been intrigued by the title, the star and the desert but for some (now pretty clear) reason, this film is never shown on TV or I've happen to miss it if it's ever shown. Well, after watching the DVD, I now know why the movie is rarely shown: it's because it's not that good. In fact, I'd say it's pretty much of a mess.ELECTRA GLIDE IN BLUE was made by a first time director and it shows.

Not too good a movie . Sure , it contains action , but the effects are n't all that good . The scenes are boring . The action scenes are boring . The dialogues are too short. The story is weak . The actors are very poor . I would rate it with 1 star . The action scenes look so bad that it can be considered as a movie with no good effect . I hope the movie gets released on Blu-ray. This movie was the bomb! It made me feel good. It made me feel sad and also made me laugh.

OK, so I know better than to watch movies on SciFi . . . er, sorry . . . SyFy. Or shifafa. Or whatever it is now. So sue me. I spent my whole Saturday doing advisory-board brainstorming for a nonprofit. I can be forgiven for flopping into my armchair and wanting to watch some movie I'd never seen, rather than read Proust in the original or learn how to play the oud.Which is to say, I didn't deserve Open Graves. Of which I saw none, incidentally. Were there any? Did I fall asleep?

This was a modern TV classic ! The story goes like this , Bob has a girlfriend named Alicia . When she gets pregnant , Bob wants to marry her and give the baby to her, but he is not able to do that. On top of the problem of being unable to marry her in his condition, he also feels that she is not a good person to be his new mother. Bob has a huge problem in life and he has to overcome it. He does so by taking all the things that he thinks are wrong in his life and turning them into gold.

Leonard can write lyrics, but he sure can't sing. Nor has he had an original idea in his life, just a floater. From the looks of this nasty little puff piece (note that his publishers, McClelland and Stewart were involved in the production), he didn't know how to live, either. The woman he loves is only mentioned in passing and no woman is allowed to speak in this nonsensical advertisement. While Irving Layton was given a credit, the other poet interviewed, Earle Birney, was to remain nameless.

Firstly , few colleges allow students to take courses from their parent 's lover . Secondly , few women professors have sex with students . They are not afraid of being busted by parents . One of the most popular sex scandal from India is the affair of Dr. Pramod K. Bhargava , an obstetrician from Pune who allegedly had sex with students in his hospital. It was alleged that students of Poonch medical college were sexually abused by Dr Bhargava who is also the chief doctor in Poonch. A medical student and a resident doctor from the hospital in Poonch filed a petition at the district court on the case of the medical student.

Emilio Estevez actually directed a good movie--who woulda thought? I sat through two previous films Estevez directed--"Wisdom" (with then girlfriend Demi Moore) and "Men at Work" (with brother Charlie Sheen). They are lousy films---badly acted, directed, stupid and offensive. Estevez is a good actor but lousy as a director. I turned this on in pure curiousity--it has a great cast and I had nothing else to do. Damned if it didn't pull me in.It concerns Estevez coming home from Vietnam permanently scarred by what happened over there.

Admittedly, the only reason I watched this film -- since it's been about a decade since it was released -- was because of Ian Holm; I was intrigued to see his portrayal of my second-favorite character in this play. At any rate, this film is as gritty as anything the Old Zeff has produced since "Jesus of Nazareth." But some of the best parts of the play have been left out. I understand the directing/editing choices, but I don't think that it really does justice to the play. Perhaps I'm too much a purist.

I remember watching this movie on TV a few years back. It was so bad, I can only remember the scenes that just made me die laughing. The only plot summary I can give you (without any spoilers) is picture a home movie made by college kids who were high. (Spoiler alert starts here...) When the movie starts, a guy's running, being chased by the "Demon Cop", when in fact, the man was really being chased by a Halloween costume gone wrong. A car pops out of nowhere, hitting the guy who was running.

The DVD version we bought had Sandra Bullock on the cover, but we've discovered it was a picture of her from another movie. Unfortunately, she is in this movie very little. You can, however, see how far she has come.The one other bright spot in the movie, besides her very small part, were a few of the location scenes, shot in NYC and New Jersey in the 1980s.The sound is terrible. Sometimes the background noise is so loud that the dialog is difficult to hear. Sometimes the dialog has been redone without any background noises at all, which is disconcerting.

One of my all-time favourite movies. Nothing can beat watching this movie for the first time. If I could go back in time and erase my memory or suffer from momentary amnesia I would so I could enjoy this movie as much as I did that very first time. It's still enjoyable second and third times round but I found myself appreciating the humour more as the shocks and thrills weren't unexpected. If you want a see a film that you truly won't be able to predict the ending of then I highly recommend this film.

Grand Champion is a bit old fashion at first glance. Andrew Morton at the Fort Worth Star Telegram said it best "If Walt Disney had hailed from Texas, he would have made Grand Champion" The movie does not have the video and special effects but it has heart and soul. The kids are great and the array of stars is incredible. I bet Bruce Willis and Julia Roberts are proud to be in a movie that their kids can actually see:) (G rated) This is a masterfully crafted "simple" little film made in Texas by Texas Barry Tubb.

This horror movie starts out promisingly enough and there is a moment where I thought to myself `` this is a decent enough movie , it would make for a good slasher flick ' . But the plot quickly descends into incoherent incoherence , it is hard to make any kind of sense of what actually is going on . This movie also has a number of flaws , for example in the case of the characters the plot does not pay them any attention at all , other than to bring them back into the story for more exposition . Also , the characters in the film seem to get a little bored by each other .

My mom and I , rented this movie . I mean , we love those type of Sci-Fi flicks , and we had a really hard time with the movie . The story is about a couple of young adults who decide to go on an expedition , to find the lost city of Atlantis and retrieve the lost library of the city . But the city they are going to look for is located deep in an underwater cave . I won’t give you the exact plot , but you should know that it is a comedy , and it’s a really stupid movie .

This neo-film noir is one of a genre of late twentieth century American films that all seem to involve corrupt government, crooked lawyers, crooked businessmen, and evil politicians. The term “dark film” can be applied to any of these films. The main reason the term “dark film” was coined was so that these films could get released in America at all. It’s not as if it was easy to get made or that American film making companies had to go out of their way to bring them over from overseas.

This may be the most tension-filled movie I have ever seen.In fact , it 's so nerve-wracking , I have not even told the story. The story is not about the main character , it 's about how the main character goes about his journey to find out about his father and his family . The rest of the film is about the love of his life , his wife and how their love story begins with the discovery of love at the end of a life long journey.So , when I tell you this story, I hope you have a smile on your face.

I'm sure that any legitimate submariner would happily ship out on the USOS Seaview (yes, SOS...) Why, you could play full-court basketball in the torpedo room, it's so large. And how 'bout the bay windows in the bow, the better to see giant squids or minefields that appear out of nowhere? Did I mention the colorful mess-cook with the parrot on his shoulder? And the Admiral's stateroom with what appears to be a loft? Big bleeping sub...OK, OK...it's never gonna win any prizes for authenticity.

There was a time when not all animation was Disney or Pixar. Its so nice to see this wonderful film again and I actually got hold of a good, reasonable copy on DVD. Be careful as its out of the public domain and there are some really bad copies around.I got a very good copy by a company called Flashbacks and its quite good. In the old days I watched it on black and white on TV and its magic to see it in colour. Very much better than some would have you believe. The songs are delightful and the colour is great.

25 August 2003 League of Extraordinary Gentlemen : Sean Connery is one of the all time greats and I have always wanted to meet him. I have read a couple of his books but the one that got me on to him was Goldfinger, I really loved it. The only problem I had was I didn't get a chance to see him in the film version, it was years before I even thought of seeing it. I just had it on my to-read pile and I never got around to it so I decided to make my own.

A BUSTER KEATON Silent Short.Poor Buster becomes THE GOAT ( `` scapegoat '' ) for a dangerous escaped murderer.This is a well written short with an intelligent plot. The author has used only the best of the tools available to the author and the reader and that is how the reader is treated. There is not a dull moment.The language is simple and clean, the writing is easy to follow, the dialogue flows naturally, the action is exciting, the love story is believable. All in all, a very nice read.There are only a few problems and they are all of the reader.

1st watched 7/19/2003 - 1 out of 10(Dir-Brad Sykes): Ridiculously lame 3D movie which pretty much follows the plots of many 80's teen slasher flicks. Stupid kids go to a known murderous camp site, become hunted by an unknown masked man, and then we try to figure out who, if anyone, is going to live. We really don't care who's behind the mask but even that's not hard to figure out if you've seen any of these kinds of movies. What a waste of a 3D viewer despite somewhat decent 3D effects.

Cruddy , innocent .. no smoking , drinking or bikers , but Jeremy Slate ( good actor ) and Jocelyn DeBoer ( a great actress ). The film opens with a car chase and a chase scene. In the chase scene , Jeremy ( Slate ) and his gang are running away from the cops . After they are stopped , Jeremy and his gang start a car chase. The chase scene is so good and exciting with all the cars and motorcycles. The chase is a good film but it can be divided into 4 parts . This division makes sense for the plot and the actors .

Well, this is about as good as they come. There are arguments about whether Hitchcock was only a "master of commercial suspense" or maybe a "compulsive technician" -- or was he really "deep." Nobody knows precisely what terms like that mean, but it's legitimate to ask if, at his best, he could not have been all three things at once.In this one he seems to be about at his peak. Hardly anything in it is accidental. It abounds with doubt, ambiguity, and wit.

Fans of Euro-horror flicks - Portland 's video/DVD store Movie Madness has a whole section devoted to this genre - from giallo-inspired thrillers to creepy cult classics. Today the store announced that it will be selling a DVD box set of Italian horror maestro Luigi Cozzi's classic 1971 masterpiece, The Damned. The set, to be housed in a custom-designed, two-DVD set box, will be available on August 31. The Damned will be released as part of the Horror Collection, which will include other films from the director, most recently his 1979 horror/drama, La Notte (The Night).

Writer/director John Milius takes a little-known incident from American history and extrapolates wildly in all the right ways. The result is a grand adventure tale that showcases two of its stars in memorable, larger-than-life roles: Sean Connery as the wily Arab sheik with an inexplicable Scottish brogue, and Brian Keith as President Theodore Roosevelt, itching for the chance to put that "big stick" to good use.Aided immeasurably by Billy Williams' glorious widescreen cinematography and a magnificent score by the always reliable Jerry Goldsmith, this early effort seemed the harbinger of a talent to rank with contemporaries Lucas, Coppola and Spielberg.

I got this for my birthday in a box set under the name Broke Skull . Well , after watching the movie , i have to say that this is probably one of my favorite comic book movies of all time. I like it a lot . But , i think this might be my favorite comic book movie i've ever seen . If you've seen this movie you'll understand why this is my favorite of all time. The story is great . The cast is top-notch in their roles. The effects are great . The soundtrack is awesome .

For many year I saw this movie as a real movie of ninjas but after study more about this culture I can only think this is just another karate film. A black shinobi and some weapons doesn't make a ninja, it's much more than that. The ninja are the most dangerous warrior of the japan because they are trained in every aspect of life to survive to anything, killing whatever try to stop them. This movie is not a about a ninja warrior just about a clown trying to be something he cannot even understand.

Since THE MAGUS is a confusing puzzle that really has no solution , one should sit back and enjoy the journey. I had a good laugh at the absurdity of a puzzle of such scope and such complexity. It was one of those “you never know what you’re gonna get until you get it” puzzles. And in that respect it was no different than many puzzles that we have all seen. And yet, in one sense I found it more enjoyable for it was more like a puzzle game where one had to play the puzzle to make sense out of it.

As if the world needed another Seagal movie. Add a bunch of actors who, well... are not really actors, a bunch of heavy metal music to compliment the rap and of course, a hot looking crazy chick in leather with no hips, and we prevent ourselves from being half past budget. Why, oh why do people sabotage themselves by participating in such films?FBI capture two buddies and send them to "New Alcatraz," where the prison's first inmate to be executed has unexpected guests.First rate acting all around, particularly any scene involving tragedy for the good guys.

If you 're tired by the same repetitive , unintelligent material that the mainstream movie industry releases , you 'll be happy to learn you don 't need the mainstream to entertain you . You can make your own entertaining entertainment , by making your own films . And that ' s exactly what I did . In making my own films , I discovered I had a very unusual talent and that I had become a filmmaker . For years , I had been telling other people that I was a filmmaker , but no one believed me .

Well it is a good movie . However , you have to admit that Van Dame 's movies have n't changed much from 's , but for a few scenes in the beginning of the movie , you have to admit that a few scenes and a few dialogues , but still , this is good movie , and Van Dame's movies have been good , so he is a good director . The plot is not that good of a movie , but this is a good movie and a good director . The main character , the movie was good . The plot was ok .

This is a movie that should be viewed and treated as a piece of art. This is an oblivious labour of love by the Schrader brothers about the life of Yukio Mishima that is full truly artistic elements. The movie jumps from color to black and white, past to present, fictional works by Mishima to him. All without being confusing in the least bit. The only thing that gets me is that the entire movie, with the exception of the narrator's spoken parts is in Japanese. Still a masterpiece that deserves an audience but hasn't found won.

This is an unusual film because although it was made by Twentieth-Century Fox because it 's one of the few American films to be produced in the late '70s that did not use footage shot for a live television broadcast, it is not just the only film of its type made in that decade but one of only two or three films that have been made in the 20th and 21st centuries using live-action footage shot for television broadcasts. (The other film is The Matrix (1999) and the one-off film is The Adventures of Robin Hood (1965), both of which used live television footage and one-shots.)

Empire of Passion starts out deceptively - that is, if you're immediately expecting it to be a horror movie. It's like a riff on James M. Cain's The Postman Always Rings Twice, at first: Seki (Kazuko Yoshiyuki) is a mother of two and a dutiful, hard-working wife to rickshaw driver Gisaburo (Takahiro Tamura). But when he's not around, and she's at home with the baby, the feisty and aimless young man Toyoji (Tatsuya Fuji) comes around to bring some goodies for Seki... and a little extra.

Early talkie feature based on a popular stage play. A murder has been committed and a bunch of people hire a medium to conduct a séance to see who the murderer is. While the lights are out there's ANOTHER murder...so it's someone in that room.What follows is an obvious, dull and creaky murder mystery. Most of the cast overacts to a ridiculous degree. They act like they're on stage (where you have to overdo things) and it looks silly on screen. Most embarrassing is Bela Lugosi (two years before "Dracula") who REALLY overdoes it as a police inspector.

An on screen caption informs us that it is 'the Caribbean Sea , May 1891 ' . A small lifeboat has drifted ashore on an island. We see a crowd of people. A young woman is standing on the beach. She speaks, then her voice fades and she disappears from view. A few seconds later we are taken to another beach. There are a few men and women swimming and wading. They appear to be in their late thirties. The caption informs us that the man and woman we have just seen standing on a beach at 'Port Royal, May 1891'.

This is what Disney Channel shows to kids who are dumber than posts. It suits them well. It's not funny, the acting is the worst I've seen in many years, there are more stereotypes than there are actors, and everything about this show makes you groan and roll your eyes. Wanna know why? Not only is this show a waste of airtime, the lead "actress" Selena Gomez looks like a pig. Jake T. Austin's character needs some Ritalin. David Henrie's character needs to visit a strip club and get wasted.

Yes , maybe there are parts of this film which require suspending belief a little but that does n't take away the enjoyment in watching it, it's the same with all films. I can't put my finger on it. I would have to watch it all over again but this is the best thing ever made. I think this film has a lot going for it but it's all wrapped up so well. I had no idea the first three films were a trilogy but the final act makes it very obvious. You can't really go wrong in watching this film.

This BRASS EYE special PAEDO-GEDDON was swamped by complaints ( More on that later ) when it was broadcast in the UK last year. This year it’s a different story. A new show has launched on Channel 5. It’s a good one, but not perfect. It could do with a good deal of tweaking before it got into the US. But let’s go for it anyway and watch the first episode. It’s set to air at 10pm on Channel 5 on Saturday 6th September. There will be no commercial breaks.

Note: After writing this review I see that this listing is indeed about the TV series and not the original film. My mistake. I thought IMDb for a database for movies, not TV shows. But since most people will look up this film under BAGDAD CAFE and not OUT OF ROSENHEIM, which, strangely, is the name this film is listed under on IMDb, I'll leave this comment here.Maybe I missed something, but when I read that other review it seemed to be entirely a review of the CBS series -- which must have been loosely based on this film.

Not for those adrenaline maniacs etc It's a good movie, looking at after war, psychical problem, from the other point of view. Emilio Estevez is great as a young man, haunted by the demons of Vietnam war, causing problem in family. Marin Sheen is also good as a conservative father.It all comes down to the problem how to deal with the past, with whomEmilion Estevez's character can't seem to deal, and Martin Sheen's character don't want do deal with.Protective mother looks at this problem with warm , and open heart but with her mind closed for the obvious reasons.

This is one of the most horrible 'scary ' movies I 've seen for awhile . I had to wonder if they put this out knowing it would be the most disliked movie out there. That's why I never want to see a sequel to a horror flick. It's like watching paint dry on a wall and then having it flicker out. It's horrible. The movie is actually not that bad...but the acting, directing and the editing are horrible. The story is good enough, but is ruined by the poor acting.

I had heard good things about "States of Grace" and came in with an open mind. I thought that "God's Army" was okay, and I thought that maybe Dutcher had improved and matured as a filmmaker. The film began with some shaky acting, and I thought, "well, maybe it will get better." Unfortunately, it never did. The picture starts out by introducing two elders -- Mormon missionaries -- and it seems that the audience will get to know them and grow to care about them.

this is the worst movie in the world . the only reason i gave it a 2 was because the acting was not good . and i am an actor and have worked alot of acting jobs . i did the movie with my friend of 10 years . i think he could have made it better though . the acting was good . i know it was the best thing he could do though . but i guess that i should not tell you how i felt . just enjoy the film

well , i don't really think of the movie in terms of the acting , i think he did a great job .

Bad . Bad . Bad . Those three lines sum up this crappy little film that can only attract idiot people with the most juvenile of ideas. I'm going to make an exception and add my own opinion here. There are far better films out there. I'll start with some of my favorites, and then continue with some lesser-known gems, before concluding with a brief review of a few movies that deserve to be watched by the masses. THE WALKING DEAD: The first two episodes of Season 2 have been extremely disappointing to me.

The Brighton has a traumatic drama in the breast of their family : the twenty years old Emily Brighton (Anna Roos) a young woman and a member of a small family of three girls who live in the house. She has never seen the inside of a cinema. She is the oldest of four sisters. When she is eighteen (18 years old) she marries Charles Brighton (Kurt Wimmer), a young man from her father's village. Her life changes when her husband has to leave to join the army, and her father's estate is auctioned off to satisfy his debts.

This film is about a bunch of misfits who are supposed to be assigned to a task that is expected to fail miserably. The misfits pull together to successfully complete their mission.Hilarity ensues.Like the "Police Academy" films, the humor comes from the kooky characters on the boat. I thought it was an engaging film and I will stop to watch it anytime it is on TV. No, it won't cause you to ponder your relative role in the cosmos or inspire you to do great things for the service of mankind, but it is fun enough entertainment for 90-some-odd minutes.

The Nun is a revenge picture whereby a very strict nun is killed by her rebellious trailer trash charges and comes back years later to get even when the now adults visit their old school. Story line is predictable in spades and will hold no surprises as it slowly winds its way to the end. It is a screamer of a movie with passable acting and a below average script and screenplay. Much of the special effects are low grade and there is almost zero believability in the final battle. Still, if you look past these there is some suspense and acting jewels.

Eddie Fischer was simply bad . Possibly the worst scene came early in the movie when he broke into a conversation with his son David about his upcoming visit to a hospital to get the results from a bone marrow transplant, and the kid had to interrupt him to get the conversation going: "What's the worst thing that could happen?" he asked. "I hope he lives," said the dad. "I think he'll be all right," answered David, then asked his dad what the "best" thing would happen.

`` Christmas in Connecticut '' is an absolute gem , and a must-see for Christmas ! Elizabeth Lane , a Connecticut native , has created a beautiful series of illustrations for this new version of A Christmas Carol by Charles Dickens . Christmas in Connecticut is just a little different from the traditional version because of its use of color. Rather than a white background , this new edition of Christmas in Connecticut uses deep blue, which is the most prominent color in this story. Elizabeth Lane has done an outstanding job with her illustration and her color scheme gives this new Christmas in Connecticut a fresh, exciting look that I just love !

hello , looking for a movie for the family to watch on a Friday night ? Ca n't find what you're looking for? try here - http://t.me/ZooMovies
My name is Alex and this is my movie channel! In my channel, I post movies and videos of daily life , I share news and information about movies , movies of the week , and of course, some fun and funny ones. If you like what you watch, support the channel and Subscribe! If you are new to my channel and have not subscribed, please subscribe.

Is it possible for a movie to get any worse than this? There's a bunch of apes wandering about, mumbling b******, acting supposedly silly and we are supposed to laugh? There is no plot here to keep you going in the first place. Even when the women finally show up, there is no sign of improvement; the most expected things happen and by the time the film is over, you might be far asleep. Beware: this is not a trashy cult movie, this is trash -period!

I was told Jon was for awhile on spiritual experiences . I guessed the film will be interesting.In fact is this is what happened with Jon in the past? I do not believe it is good to let a person like this in the movie. I believe he is the one who killed his father. What is he doing in England? Is it to save his son or to take revenge for his father death? It was reported that he is to play a very important role in the next movie. And it was also revealed that he is going to be played by Robert Pattinson.

The other reviewer was completely correct about this one . The writing was awful , the acting was awful , and the plot was laughable . If you are going to spend $15 for this show , you should be very thankful it's on DVD instead of on cable . This is just a bad movie with bad special effects , poor acting and bad plot . I hope they make a second one for cable , but it would have to have better writing , acting and good special effects . If it's bad enough to get released on DVD it's not going to do much to impress anyone who saw this movie .

Film critics of the world , I apologize . It is your job to give advice to the moviegoing public , not me . But I have one last question for you . What is wrong with the American cinema? What is wrong with us? I will give you one answer . We have not yet fully learned how to do film criticism , as we do not even know how to criticize films . In fact , you would be shocked to hear that we do not know how to give good criticism , let alone good advice . But we are just starting to do that , I would like to say .

Writer-director Patrice Leconte takes a universal and potentially bottomless subject - friendship - and turns it into a flat and empty movie about nothing. As in life, you are never sure whether to trust your friends or to distrust them, so it makes sense that you distrust Patrice Leconte's film about friendship. There is no story, plot or theme. Instead, there are three friends, three friends' parents (the film is loosely inspired by Leconte's own experiences), three friends and two friends, three friends and two friends and so on.

"The Dresser" is perhaps the most refined of backstage films. The film is brimming with wit and spirit, for the most part provided by the "energetic" character of Norman (Tom Courtenay). Although his character is clearly gay, and certainly has an attraction for the lead performer (Albert Finney) that he assists, the film never dwells on it or makes it more than it is.The gritty style of Peter Yates that worked so well in "Bullitt" is again on display, and gives the film a sense of realism and coherence.

I heard legends about this "film" (quotes used so as not to insult films) for a while, so when I finally got the DVD with it, I impatiently started watching it. By the end, I *had* to fast forward through just a few of the most moronic, ineptly made, nonsensical scenes of this pointless childish mess to make it end quicker.This may be the worst film I've even "touched" - and I used to be associated with Troma for a while. "Manson Family" makes the bottom of Troma's entries look like daring and groundbreaking art-house filmwork.

I like the shepherd ! Sure the acting was n't good but the fight scenes were nice . Van damme is a great actor and I think he would be great in the role of a villain . I just didn't think the role was for him . It's a shame because he would be great . This was the second movie I saw in a week and I thought this was better than the first. Van Damme was fine, not great, and it's just a shame he can't be the bad guy, since he seemed to be the only one who actually had to fight the bad guys.

I went to an advance screening of this movie thinking I was about to embark on 120 minutes of cheezy schlock but the movie is actually the most sophisticated and creative movie I've seen since I saw the original Rocky Horror Picture Show. This is a film of real people that tell stories, like real people would. It's like a true documentary in the same way that a true documentary is a film by someone who knows the story of the people on screen, but who can't possibly be inside the story, or know what goes on behind the scene.

"My Blue Heaven" is boring. The plot is insipid; the characterizations and dialogue stink; the musical numbers, while occasionally staged in interesting ways, are not only too often absurd, but also lyrically trite, painfully bright, and emotionally hollow to the core. The leads, Betty Grable and Dan Dailey, are attractive professionals; however, in spite of their every talented effort to uplift the drear and uncompelling material, they fail. David Wayne and Jane Wyatt, for all their demonstrated talent in other projects, are more or less cyphers here.There's really only one reason to watch "My Blue Heaven".

Surprisingly well-acted, well-written movie about hard rockin'-but-decent young man getting that much-hoped-for ticket to stardom: his favorite heavy metal band wants him to replace their lead singer. Not far-fetched, the film tries keeping things in perspective and doesn't go over-the-top; it certainly makes you think twice about those lingering adolescent fantasies about being in the music business. But the script, despite solid dialogue, follows a tried-and-true, formulaic pattern, and gets bogged down by its own clichés in the final act. I enjoyed it much more than the sugary fluffball "Almost Famous".

Hey what a great idea to open a film - show someone ` s home movie . Drama schools must have been crazy to think this up . It's not hard to get a decent home movie camera, and I use mine almost every day. I was in New York when the first home movies were made, and they weren't good. The first film was made in a small, cramped living-room with very little light. When I was a kid growing up in Brooklyn, there wasn't much light in my house.

This film is absolute cinematic genius. It has a well brought together cast who give an almost magical performance. The effects are nothing but stunning and the story will keep you hanging off your chair right the way through the movie. Jack Long plays the part of abbot white exceptionally well, he provides an immensely thrilling portrayal of absolute evil. If your a kung fu fan or just an action movie enthusiast this film is an excellent choice for anyone who is lucky enough to find a copy. For any big kung fu fans this movie provides a compelling insight into the world of shaolin.

Solomon and Sheba has come down in Hollywood lore not for the quality of the film , but for the controversial ending of the movie . And the story goes that Solomon, the main villain, had to make a choice to save his own neck or sacrifice his son to save his daughter's life. Unfortunately the film was cut for this very reason and Solomon dies at the end. But the truth is that the whole film has the same ending. So, there is no reason not to see Solomon and Sheba, as they have all the elements needed to make a good movie.

Mickey Rourke is enjoying a renaissance at the moment... and fair play to him. I always liked his image and his acting ability in such fare as Angel Heart and Johnny Handsome. You know what you are going to get with Rourke - mean, moody, dirty. But this film gives you much more - and you don't want most of it.First and foremost - this whole thing just doesn't make sense. Rourke is a hardened IRA killer who after killing a bus-load of schoolchildren flees Ireland for London. He is on the run from the cops and from his own Army comrades.

The worst movie I have ever seen. The sound quality was bad, the cutting of the scenes was even worse and above all it was not logic and it had no speed...I first tought: "Oh No, I don't want the trail that proves that poor Patrick was an innocent killer". But this turned out to be even worse. Typically in this American film you get a super-hint or no hints at all. I want very tiny small hints that direct you to the killer. The audience isn't involved.

I agree with the guy above, It is so funny I understand it all, but my friends just don't get it. Go to Japan and you will see a different movie after being there. When I met my girlfriends dad, at his home in Kanagawa. I swear I felt the same as Jack,. scared, but by the end of the day it was all good, so I give this movie a 10 out 10.I have watched it at least 30 times, taking it with me to watch on the plane flying to Japan next month.

I am writing this with 10 minutes left before the film finishes. I feel comfortable writing it now, because unfortunately I know exactly how this film is going to end.The premise is simple enough, rabid dog on the loose in a small town, kills people. Great - simple plot for a good fun camp 80s horror.Uhh ..no.The main problem is this is based on a book (Stephen King) and you can tell that is should not have really been adapted to film, at least not with the same plot. Why? Cuz its boring!

I rented this movie expecting it to suck, and it didn't let me down. I rented it with some friends as a joke. But, what we got was worse than anyone could ever imagine.It starts off sucking before you even take it out of the box. It looks like a Blade rip-off and the guy on the cover is nowhere to be found in the movie. Its called vampire Assassin, but isn't an assassin someone who kills for hire? Well this guy kills the of his own volition, so that doesn't make him an assassin.Then, when you actually put the disk in it gets worst.

Gordon Scott with his well coiffed hair , hourglass figure and weird pidgin English has to be the worst of all the characters I’ve seen so far. The only thing saving it is that at least he’s the only one who actually knows how to do anything, so he gets a lot of attention. There is always a lot of speculation about why he was chosen to do the narration, and I’ll save that one for later. The episode is really well put together and features a lot of character development for most of the people involved.

OK, this movie, was the worst display I have seen in years. The actors weren't to bad (I figured it was a b-movie so they were doing b-movie acting). Anyways, I watched this movie, thinking, OH COOL a UFO Sci-Fi movie. WRONG. It was just an excuse for radical Christians to push a message onto people. The last scene was extremely messed up. That is a horrible thing to do to a person to make them believe in something. What someone believe in is a matter of opinion.

I chose this movie because I was looking for a triangle friendship between a girl & two boys . As I searched for the two boys . I kept looking for them to be just a couple friends . In the search I came across this movie . The story of this movie is so touching and beautiful . I liked the movie and I'm glad I watched this movie .I was looking forward for this movie for a long time now . I watched the movie with my mom and my brother . My mom enjoyed the movie . She told me how much she liked this movie .

What ever happened to shows with united parental figures ? The parents in this show are nearly as irresponsible as their child's, and the parents never do anything to keep the kids safe. This show has one big problem, the kids are a lot of the same. I hate when people complain about bad shows for not having enough parents. I know what you mean. But then I think about all those shows that have good parents. In the world of bad parents, they have parents who have great kids, not just kids who do well in school.

This is good movie that is flawed in many ways with low production. Martha Coolidge herself said she only had 350,000 dollars to work with. This is a movie that I loved growing up in the midwest. I remember friends and I having the nostalgia trip on this movie 10 years ago. Great things about this movie....Great cast with hungry actors and a hungry director. Bad points of this movie....To small of a budget calling for way too much improvisation. If Martha Coolidge had been given more money and time on this movie then the results would of been even better.

This is a wonderful comedy short--one of Keaton's absolute best. Through a long series of silly mistakes, Buster is mistaken for a wanted killer. And, as a result, most of the film consists of him running from the cops and one detective in particular. While generally I am NOT a fan of movies with a lot of chase scenes, this one is the absolute best as far as pure athletic and acrobatic ability. I have seen some that have had wilder stunts, but none where the star was so limber and able to move with amazing grace.

This is one of the worst movies I 've ever seen . It 's supposed to be a remake or sequel to The Sixth Sense, but it isn 't . In fact, it really doesn't make any sense . For example, the police don't know that this is a movie and won 't admit to it . The movie also has no plot, no reason why this is happening or why it 's happening . There is a small amount of violence, and it isn 't very graphic . It 's not very good . But it's not a horrible film .

Movies are something you see on Saturday night and forget by Sunday morning. Motion pictures are works of art that stick with you forever. Mishima falls into the latter category. This is the type of thing that should win Academy Awards, a brilliant, visual peice of film that is both depressing and uplifting. Instead of doing a straightforward look at the life of Yukio Mishima, director Paul Schrader interweaves three adaptations of the author's stories into a look at his past and final day on Earth, the day he tried to lead the Japanese military into rebellion in the name of the Emperor.

I've seen this story before but my kids haven't. Boy with troubled past joins military, faces his past, falls in love and becomes a man. The mentor this time is played perfectly by Kevin Costner; An ordinary man with common everyday problems who lives an extraordinary conviction, to save lives. After losing his team he takes a teaching position training the next generation of heroes. The young troubled recruit is played by Kutcher. While his scenes with the local love interest are a tad stiff and don't generate enough heat to melt butter, he compliments Costner well.

Dire! Dismal! Awful! Laughable! Disappointing!Right, your trapped in "The Cave" with several "hard" Men and a Woman or two, your being systematically killed by "Something" and you STILL don't get to hear ANY naughty Grown Up words!!! A 15 Cert' here in England, and you could tell!The Egos of the "Macho Men" was just too much, pass the bucket I'm going to be sick.This movie should never be exposed to daylight and ironically, be kept in the darkest, deepest hole in the ground and be forgotten forever.

`` The Bone Snatcher '' starts out extremely promising , with the introduction of a new and original type of magic spell: ''[[Creator Notes]]'' ''[[Creator Notes]]'' + * The Bone Snatcher '' starts off extremely promising , with the introduction of a new and original kind of magic : [[CreatorNotes]].
* It's also the first Adventure Game I've played that didn't have any of the usual problems of adventure games: it didn't ask for an inventory and I had no idea where I had to put stuff.

No spoiler needed to steer you clear of this...well, bizarre film. Canada becomes part of the USA. OK. So, I guess I'm unusual, but I expected something about the implications of Canada becoming part of the USA. Silly me. Continue with this movie and you are off to cloud coocoo land. The opening premise has nothing to do with the rest of the film in which you will (trust me) not care a squat for any of the characters. Slings and Arrows and Due South have to be among the most imaginative series ever.

The MTV sci-fi animated series "Æon Flux" is brought to life with Charlize Theron playing the title character, a freedom fighter who fights oppression in the walled city of Bregna, 400 hundred years into the future. For her latest mission, she has been sent to kill the city's leader Trevor Goodchild (Marton Csokas), but she uncovers secrets along the way.Aeon Flux falls under the category of good premise, mediocre execution. Interesting story yet the film was a little dull. A lot of people are saying that this is one of the worst movies of the year and that's not true at all.

Actually , Son of the Mask did make me laugh a few times ... mostly due to the cartoonish jokes and the fact that the story was very well thought out. And while it was not very deep I believe that it made me laugh more than the previous two stories I read and enjoyed. In the past few days I have been revisiting my copy of The Book of Skulls . As with the previous books in the series this time I have been having a hard time coming up with any good reviews for it ... well , to be honest ...

The movie starts with a Spiderman spoof which is your introduction to Rick Riker ( played by Drake Bell of the television show Drake & Josh). Drake has been hired to make a film about Spiderman, he is a good enough actor to be believable as Spiderman. It is very obvious the director wants to make the movie more comic booky than the comic book film. I was surprised when the scene where Spiderman saves a boy from a fire. Drake does a pretty terrible job of acting the scene and it makes me wonder how believable the scene would have been had Drake not done such a poor job.

Fabulous cinematography from Sergei Urusevsky help to make this a stunning piece of work. The opening scenes are as if one is leafing through some master photographer's album and as the story begins to unfold we are swept away with both the events depicted and the beautiful look. All is well shot but there are several whole sequences that are simply breathtaking. Difficult to describe without 'spoiling' but suffice to say one is a very intense scene during an air raid and the lady left behind and her lover's brother are at odds as the sirens whine and the windows shatter.

I saw this on a screener DVD a couple months before it was released.I liked the main characters and the plot, though I thought it was a bit too cheesy for its time. The premise was that a group of American soldiers are sent to Vietnam to help train local villagers. Unfortunately, they get captured and captured by their own troops, so their only way out is to make a raft and sail down a river to freedom, which they accomplish. There was one major flaw in the script that I found to be extremely annoying.

The sun was not shining, it was too wet to play, so I went to the movies, that cold, cold, wet date day.
