Naruto the Anime TV Series has so far spawned 2 feature length theatre movies, and a third one is coming our way this summer.The first one, which was released in the summer '04 was a fun adventure featuring the main characters of Naruto in an exciting adventure. However, one must be a blind, deaf and one legged chicken to deny that film's faults. Whilst the first was most definitely enjoyable, there were a lot of things that could be improved on. Naruto Movie 2, however, takes all of these aspects and excels upon them.The action first of all, was incredibly cinematic.

I loved this movie but then again I am a big Cronenberg fan . If you have not seen a Cronenberg film I think you should. He puts a smile on your face every time he steps out of the shadows . Friday, January 20, 2013

This is my favorite quote from the movie . I don't know about the rest of ya, but I don't like to be made to feel that way by a movie . I would rather be given a happy ending and have to come up with my own story about what happened.

So many of us who are devoted to the `` art '' of the motion picture will disregard or forget that the great art of the film is the one thing that really matters. It has no `` market value ' '' - not the way an ordinary book or magazine would be `` sold out ' '. There is nothing in the movie except the art. If the art is good, the movie is better, but there are some pictures that are really great because they are full of life and meaning. The great movies are so full of life and meaning they have a quality of their own.

Dreadful . I hope I can save two hours of your life by warning you away from this . I don't even understand all this. But I want to warn you because if you read this book you will have to deal with horrible things. It's a horror story . You can get away with this if you keep reading. But if you don't then I can't do anything to save you. That's if you can stomach what's in here . I'm not an occultist . But when I read this book I felt compelled to warn everyone I know .

Yet another version of mother of all gangster flicks-the Classic `` Godfather '' and yet another case of over-hype due to being too big and overstating its potential. A very simple story with a very simple plot. It has everything one needs in the way of a good plot to make the viewer appreciate a good story. The story is very simple. It's a love story between a rich man and a poor man. The rich man dies in a gangland fight and leaves his rich wife for the widow of the poor man who died in a gangland fight.

Wow! Here comes another straight-to-video scarecrow movie to keep the cinematic masochists happy. If the cheap-looking opening credits don't tell you you're in for quite a ride, then the diabolically tragic "writing" sure will.A diabetic kid gets tied on to a legendary scarecrow as part of his initiation onto the baseball team. Then the scarecrow goes nuts and starts offing people. Need I say more? This movie consists greatly of cheap effects that makes it look like it was edited with iMovie (note that spooky color inversion) and actors who apparently weren't good enough to show up on some late-night Cinemax special.

I just saw this movie tonight . Coming into it I thought it would be good because I like Natalie Portman. In her role she did something that I never seen anyone do on film before . I will say it was one of the best roles of the year but for me that's not saying a lot . The acting is great and I can't think of anything wrong with this movie because it was well directed , well written . The plot is decent and the plot twists and turns you don't really see coming .

Worst movie ever seen . Worst acting too . I can not imagine a movie worse then this . Nothing was funny at all . . . . . this movie has to be watched . This is so bad . I can not put this on the movie charts . It is too bad that you can not see the movie with out subtitles . I will buy a DVD of this. This review is of a movie that I saw at a movie theater. The movie has been on TV for a long time, but I have not had the opportunity to check the original movie.

This movie was obviously made with a very low budget , but did they have to make it so obvious that everything was a metaphor and nothing was a literal statement . when you can't have a movie without a metaphor , you have to make one . you have to make one because there is no other way to make that movie . you also have to make one to make that movie , and that's the case here . because the first half of this movie is all metaphors . there is no reason to make it so obvious at the beginning .

Just awful. It's almost unbelievable that, with characters and situations provided by Dashiell Hammett, such a plodding, passionless mishmash could result. But that's television for you -- filler between commercials. The first warning signal sounds from the fussiness of the period re-creation, which screams "1928" in banner type. Flivvers and touring cars, fedoras and waistcoats, cloches and speakeasy jazz (jarringly played) -- with all the attention paid to pointless, arty detail, the important matters get ignored.Like narrative clarity, or plausibility, or competent writing and acting.

Well, this is new...Famous Italian horror director Lucio Fulci shoots a film about a famous Italian horror director called...Lucio Fulci. After years and years of witnessing gruesome horror sequences, it becomes hard for Lucio to separate reality from fiction and he often hallucinates about committing violent murders. He quickly descends further into a seemly endless spiral of madness and unverifiable venom. Even the dedicated psychiatrist can't seem to keep Fulci on the right track... Now, when it comes to pure fun and entertainment value, Cat in the Brain certainly is one of Fulci's most pleasant films.

This is a great movie for first time ninjas who are dating. If you're trying to impress some cute little ninjette I would highly recommend playing this masterpiece. Its one of those special movies that allows you to miss large sections of it without interfering with the plot.Also I was wondering, where does a Teal ninja hide? Are ninjas color coded like this? Is this normal? If I were attacked by one of these yellow or orange ninjas I would die of laughter before succumbing to his sword.And I finished my black star ninja test the other day, it was multiple choice, It went pretty good.

Foolish hikers go camping in the Utah mountains only to run into a murderous, disfigured gypsy. The Prey is a pretty run of the mill slasher film, that mostly suffers from a lack of imagination. The victim characters are all-too-familiar idiot teens which means one doesn't really care about them, we just wonder when they will die! Not to mention it has one too many cheesy moments and is padded with endless, unnecessary nature footage. However it does have a few moments of interest to slasher fans, the occasional touch of spooky atmosphere, and a decent music score by Don Peake.

I am a gigantic fan of both Koyaanisqatsi and Powaqqatsi , but this movie is just not good . The movie starts off good, but it’s after 10 minutes I start getting very bored and annoyed , with all of the people just walking about talking, talking and walking , I am very tired of this movie by the end of the film . I did not even watch the whole movie , but the best thing about it was the sound design . I can’t believe how bad the director’s cut is ( I had a copy of it in the library and decided to read it) .

I was very disappointed in this film. The director has shown some talent in his other endeavors, but this just seemed to be filler. There may have been a deep meaning behind it, but it seems to me to be nothing but a director who has access to some toys.I would highly recommend his other works to people, but certainly not this one. As I watched it, I kept on thinking it would pick up after an initial slow period, but it never did. At the end of the movie I was neither entertained nor moved nor thought of things in a new way.

I almost stopped watching Hindi movies because of the mediocre quality and story lines . One exception for this is the one film that I always watch in theaters and never watched at home - DDLJ. There are not many Hindi movies worth watching nowadays. But DDLJ always stands out. There was one film in my life, in which the director took a new way of writing, and made an amazing film. DLJ has a very unique way of writing, and the story is just amazing. It also has one of the best romance stories in the world in the form of a love triangle.

Caught this film on TCM in the early A.M . It was amazing.Starting out slow but ominously .... Scott is a guy with a troubled past and he has to get a new life by any means possible.His ex is an evil bitch with the body and the face of an angel.She wants Scott dead.She's going to kill him.Scott has to do it for the good of everyone. He doesn't have long to go on this quest to find himself before he has to make a decision. I loved the journey, it was like an adventure in time.

Being a bit of a connoisseur of garbage, I have stumbled across this little treasure. Action, romance, crooked cops, violence. Its all here and not a single one has been pulled of right. I was in love immediately. Then, a funny thing happened about the second time around. I became addicted. I thought it was going to be a one rent and chuckle kind-of-movie.Rudy Ray Moore knew what he wanted to see in a movie. He didn't have the money to make it look good, but he did it anyway. That's very commendable.

What a self-indulgent mess ! Duncan Roy 's film is apparently autobiographical , however it 's impossible to find any evidence that Roy 's parents ever existed, or that Roy was born anywhere other than the Australian Outback , where his father, Robert Roy, was a rancher who became a police officer during the 1950s. It is not known whether Roy was raised in either of the towns where his parents lived , although he claimed to be an only child. The only other reference to his father is his birth record from the Western Australia Births Register Office , which reveals he is registered as Robert James Roy .

I am an Australian currently living in Japan. I saw this movie on TV here and was very impressed by the accuracy and honesty in the portrayal of Western and Japanese ideologies colliding. Whoever wrote the screenplay, and directed this film must have a good knowledge of what it's like to be a foreigner living in Japan. The only part I thought was too Hollywood-y was when Tom Selleck's character kisses the woman in the middle of her office and she lets him. Public displays of affection are not really acceptable here. Finally a movie that highlights the true 'gaijin' experience!

If anyone tells you this picture is just terrific they probably have something to do with either making it or being paid to do it. But the fact that you're looking at an image of yourself, wearing a suit that has not been tailored to suit you, is almost certainly the reason why you've come here. And this is exactly why. In this picture, you’re looking into the mirror, looking like you, the person you think you are. You probably think you look pretty good too.

I just discovered this obscure '70s horror movie while browsing on YouTube. For a low-budget effort, it has plenty of compelling moments in gradual pacing in leading to the surprisingly shocking finish. While there is one woman who takes off her shirt constantly, the fact that she's a nymphomaniac makes those scenes important to the story and there's one scene with the curly-haired young man as he attempts to seduce her that turned me on before his pulling back made her screaming mad. The young nurse who comes in and gets hired is alluring herself and I'm not surprised she posed for the cover of Playboy.

Hey what do you expect form a very low budget movie!?!? Although I haven't seen "Dahmer" (2002) I can say that following what the media put out about Jeff this is a pretty accurate depiction. I have studied the Jeffrey Dahmer case and learned all I can about this man. This is a low budget movie but it shows the mentality of a serial killer. If you can get past gore and see what the underlying story of a sick mind. I loved this movie! Just brace yourself for low budget and no blood.

If anyone has any doubts about the talent of Liev Schrieber, just a look at his new film, "Everything is Illuminated", which clearly shows a man that is not only one of America's finest actors, but a new director whose first effort is indeed an inspiration and a harbinger of what is to follow. Mr. Schreiber has adapted the novel by Jonathan Safran Foer into a film that will live forever because of the way the director has adapted the material. The film clearly surpassed our expectations since we had no preconceived ideas.For those who haven't watched the film, perhaps you should stop reading here.Jonathan is a collector.

The genius that is Stephen Sondheim was never more prominently displayed as it was in his 1979 `` Musical Thriller, `` `` West Side Story. ``

Sondheim is best remembered for being one of the great theatrical composers, but he was also an astute business man, and he brought these two sides of his brain to bear on his art. He was the greatest of Broadway directors when he took over the musical of ``West Side Story,'' and he was an astute business manager, always trying to maximize his own profit.

Well well, I had seen a lot of reviews on this one, and a lot of promo always showing the decapitation scene. But this flick is a tough one. And I mean it by all ways. It's hard to find a copy, because it was a low budget independent release and because MPAA was on the hunt for every copy on VHS, it came out unrated but it had to be rated for the MPAA. So copies disappeared into the underground scene. All people involved in this flick never did anything else in the biz. So it made this flick unique.

Steven Segal has done some awful films , but this is probably one of the best since his career took off. It’s a simple little story about an American man who moves to an Israeli settlement in Judea to try to get to know his mother who has been taken by Israeli soldiers to a Palestinian village where they were abused and beaten. Segal made the movie in Israel, so it is a little bizarre to find out that, for years, the IDF had the film under strict watch on the battlefield.

This movie contains real animals been killed, like a monkey been eaten by a snake and an crocible been cut open. I find this totally deranged and sick, and seriously question the mental health of the director of this trash.This movie is so stupid and daft, that it has no logic at all.There is a lot of boobs and sex in this movie, still don't bother viewing this trash for that, if you want to see boobs and sex, watch a porno instead. There is also rape scenes in this movie, which i found disgusting, like women been raped and cut up, and eaten.

i was flipping through the channels and had to stop and laugh when i came across this movie. It was so clearly about teens in the early 80s, and i called my mom "hahaha, turn to channel such and such, the kid totally looks like if dad were a kid".Um. Yeah. Turns out this movie is about my dad & his friends.Even without it being about loosely based on my dad's childhood, i'd say watch this movie! It is just.....bizarre to say the least, the apathy instilled in teens even back then.

The final part of Kieslowski's trilogy based on the colors of the French flag finds the director at peace with the metaphysical and transcendent nature of the cinematic image. In Red, imagery is paramount, as well as the obvious but clever color coding. However, rather than adhering to empty aesthetic contrivances based on the 'cinema du look', Kieslowski's Red is a multi-layered, densely plotted meditation on the nature of fate and love. In Red, love and fate are intertwined but complex notions, dictated as much by the whims of human beings as the invisible parallel associations that seems to pass us by.

Superb editing, outstanding acting, especially by Epatha Merkerson, and highly enjoyable musical soundtrack. This film reaches back to the 40's to comment on the racial lifestyle differences and some effect of desegregation while it weaves the true story of a truly admirable and fantastic lady.The actor portraying the young Terrence Howard character does a wonderful job reflecting the life and times of his upbringing in the small upstate New York town. The audience laughed, cried, and erupted in applause for the film and its director. Soon to be shown on HBO (Feb 7, I believe) - fire up the TIVO and enjoy a great story!

Amazing , amazing , amazing . What more can be said ? Jacobi is the best Hamlet ever to grace the stage of our theater. This is the only production I have seen in years that I will be able to look back and say that I sat down, paid attention, felt that I was involved and was so impressed that I bought the book at the end. It was worth it ! Thank you , my dear friend , for all the love and care you have for us . This is my favorite production.

Four unhappy women leave dreary London to spend an ENCHANTED APRIL in a castle on the coast of Italy.Elizabeth von Arnim's novel comes alive in this charming little film which beautifully demonstrates the virtues of a literate script and ensemble acting. All the elements come together to produce a movie that, although nearly forgotten now, still produces a feeling of appreciation at the story's appropriate resolution.The actresses each acquit themselves splendidly. Ann Harding is the free-spirited wife longing for 'wisteria & tranquillity' far from foggy London. Katharine Alexander plays the quiet housewife wishing for the elegant responsibility of acting as hostess in the castle.

This movie is one of the worst movie i have ever seen in my life ! i waste my time watching it and after few minutes of watching it i just turn the tv off without watching the rest of the movie . this was really bad i don`t know what to do with this movie . this movie will never be watched . i give it 2.5 out of 5 stars . When I see the trailer for this movie, I get excited to see this movie because it’s very similar with “Hercules”.

Brilliant actors and brilliant picture!! I love the chopper scene with the music in the beginning, it is just SO touching and at the same time real but at the same time surrealistic! The Vietnam War was far from human and I believe this movie kind of shows have terrible human beings can act under certain circumstances. Modern war movies are spending so much money on effects. This is just a straight forward smart movie that takes you beyond your imagination. A movie that really pictures evil and hate mixed in fearness and fate.

A bunch of full-length movies featuring the Muppets , created by Jim Henson & Co , have been made , but have never seen release . There’s always been a desire to bring them to the screen, and we’ve been very lucky to get this opportunity now , with the release of Sesame Street: The Muppets – The Muppets , which comes as part of Sesame Street on DVD & Blu-Ray . The film stars Henson himself as Bert, Elmo , Cookie Monster , Rowlf and Kermit the Frog among others. But the biggest star of the film, and its big reason for coming to DVD is Elmo.

For Native Mongolian speakers the film lacked emotion and emphasis. Used too many non Native speakers especially Jamukha. Too many diversions from the actual history. Terrible terrible subtitle!!! I wonder where and who did that subtitle. It was both in English and Thai. I wonder how bad the subtitle was in Thai if the English subtitle was soooo bad! Described the one of the greatest leader's life very uninteresting. There are better films made by Mongolian directors with very low budget from 1980's. Honestly, I'm wondering if the film critics of Academy award is that lenient or what?

This movie was extremely boring. I only laughed a few times. I decided to rent it when I noticed William Shatner's name on the cover. It's all about this little kid who gets picked on all the time by his classmates. When wandering the streets looking for old ladies to assist, he meets a prostitute. She takes him to a club called the Playground, where he befriends several pimps. When mayor Tony Gold (Shatner) decides to take over the pimp business, Lil' Pimp must lay down for his homies.The animation isn't very good in this.

For the record , I hate spoof movies . Except for Mel Brooks and AIRPLANE ! because those are classics , but even they suck . But I don't get why people love to laugh at themselves . And in the end , they should just be ashamed of what they are like . _________________“I told my mom I was going to Disneyworld on my birthday. I just said, 'Please take me to Disneyworld on my birthday.’"

Silly thing . I have to do a double-take at that one . But the funny thing is , all the time , I feel like laughing at my self .

Lame rip-off of THE QUATERMASS XPERIMENT ( 1955 ) : the first half is deadly dull , even dreary - there is nothing for the moviegoer to enjoy , but then it all comes tumbling forth with the second half . what makes the movie worth watching is that it is actually entertaining . when , at the very outset , you are told that the movie will show you something , you're not really sure of what that something is . but once you get up to speed on it , you realize that , indeed , the film has something to offer .

Think 'Charmed ' with testosterone instead of estrogen and you get the general idea for this picture . A very sexy and fun way to get over a little hump you are going through right now. I think we all get over a little hump right now. We have all had a time when we really needed a little break from something, be it sex or work. You might be ready to give it up, maybe you are already over it but you know you are not over it and you want a change.

This film is by far the worst film I have ever seen in my life . A woman `` The Girl With The Dragon Tattoo ''(Lara Croft) falls in love with a young man who wants to become a millionaire. It is based on the real life of author V. S. Stavrova

I have been following this film from the first scene. I am still not happy with how it ended. I would like to see another film on this subject. The Girl With The Dragon Tattoo

I was going to watch this with my friend, and after we both had seen it we were talking about it together.

Now I did watch this when it first came out on VHS , and all my friends and I thought it was awesome, but then we grew up and watched it on cable. I saw the sequel when it was on HBO and thought it was better and that was when I decided that I needed to write a book on it! I also think it is a really beautiful film. It is a work of art but also has a heart. It is not really about politics, but about relationships and the love we all hold for our families.

* * * MAY CONTAIN SPOILERS * * * * I was super excited to go see Blood and Chocolate, especially since I was asked to do a feature about the movie in this month's Hollywood Magazine. I was pretty nervous, too. I'd only seen the film once, when it played as part of my university's cinema program. I'd never seen anything that looked like it. And, to be frank, I didn't think it was going to do well at the box office. Still, I was curious, and had to see what all the buzz was about.

The film successfully gives a graphic portrayal of the suffering of forced sex labour, but nothing more. The leftest agenda behind this movie could be seen a mile away and leaves viewer so embarrassed while watching if you know that feeling. So, the women are kidnapped and sent to ex Yugoslavian territory to work as sex slaves because (take a deep breath) the American military institution is corrupt and looks away while their private security contractors are selling people abroad. You don't need half a brain to see the relevance to Iraq war and Black Water Company.What a load of leftest excrement!

I wo n't spoil it for you . Although you probably could care less if it was spoiled ( you don't read my blog anyway ) I hope you enjoyed the post and will come back next week to read another great story. Thanks for the visit. I am a big fan of the Harry Potter stories and the movie adaptations. It is also the case that, while I am not the biggest fan, I always look forward to new books. And what a treat, I have just read a brand new one by Robin McKinley and I absolutely loved it.

Televised in 1982 , from a Los Angeles production , this is probably the finest example of a filmed stage production in the history of the National Theater Company. “It is an impressive production,” observed a Times critic of the first evening. “When you see the opening scene you will not be able to deny that it is more than theatrical, for it is so alive, so realistic, that one forgets that the actor on the stage is just a part. It is as if he and the audience were the same person, and the actress and the audience are one another.

The good things first: I agree with another viewer who said that Gene Raymond has a marvelous drunk scene. He does -- I was tickled to finally get a chance to laugh. And there were other moments I found amusing -- Raymond's parents in the bathroom with the defective plumbing, and the scene in the restaurant with Robert Montgomery trying to make Carole Lombard jealous by mouthing sweet nothings to a stranger. But overall, I was dismayed. I love Carol Lombard and most of Hitchcock. And I understand the restrictions laid on productions by the Hays Code.

( This is a review of the later English release by Disney , featuring Alison Lohman , Patrick Stewart , and Ron Perlman . ) Hollywood was the place to be for young men and young women in the 1960s, but for the children, it wasn’t. In the UK, the children’s TV channel Play School was the primary source of television viewing for children and teenagers in the 1950s and 1960s, with their first program being broadcast on 15 September 1956. In 1962 the BBC launched its own television channel, Playfair, to cater for younger children.

This is one of the strangest things on TV. It is set in a bizarrely underpopulated Midlands superb called Leatherbridge which seems to be the dullest place in the country. It features a bar with no visible staff or customers, a university with no students, a police station with no criminals and a doctors' surgery with more doctors than patients. The story lines are dire - every episode revolves round a bizarre medical issue acted out by a variety of brummie extras who can never actually act, and for some reason the doctor always ends up round their house solving their problem.

The filmmaker stayed true to the most accurate account of the story published in 1894 which includes an 1846 manuscript by Richard Williams Bell (son of John and Lucy Bell and younger brother of Betsy Bell) titled "Our Family Trouble." To knowledge this is the only eyewitness account ever penned. The filmmaker should be credited for accuracy but there is little to say about the production and acting quality. The acting was theatrical and the sound and picture quality was extremely poor. It appears that the filmmaker simply shot scenes of the reported events that took place without incorporating or weaving them into a flowing plot or story line.

In terms of historical accuracy, this is the absolute worst Roman film I have ever seen. The list not only of errors but of plot ideas that are flat impossible would run longer than the three-hour film, but just to give you an idea...Julius Caesar and Augustus are presented as liberal Democrats, taking the side of "the people" against "the nobles." This is patently absurd. The Caesars were as noble as you could get. Their interest was in consolidating power and stabilizing a country that had been wrecked by 150 years of civil war.

This is easily one of the worst movies I've seen in a long long time (and I've recently seen Starship Troopers 2!!!). I could find nothing to redeem this film. The acting, which is probably the best aspect of the film, is fair at best. Michael Madsen hams it up in his standard character persona. Denis Hopper doesn't seem to know what he's supposed to be. Vinnie Jones accent is bizarre. One positive thing is that Leonor Valera looks fantastic. Her acting is pretty poor but I doubt that's why shes there.The dialogue is truly appalling.

After seeing this film I felt sick to my stomach and if I had seen one more minute I would have turned off the whole thing. I thought it was awful and I hope no one has to go through this horrible thing I went through. I feel like if I don't write this review right now my stomach will be in my throat. I am so incredibly angry that a woman would have to endure something like this. I think that it would be best that she doesn't read this because I don't think I could even express how angry I am.

What a terrible misfire. Not only the title but the idea is the same as that Jane Fonda, George Segal vehicle of a few decades ago. Why? I wonder, someone with the clout of Jim Carrey will, not only star, but also produce this tired, ugly, pointless excuse for a comedy. He could be taking comedy to a whole new level, instead, he goes for what he may assume is safe territory. Money, money, grosses, Christmas. But I'm sure this uncomfortable mess will have very short legs.

The Calu-what now? Yeah, I thought it was a stupid name as well. Chris Carter remains blissfully unaware of the scum in his writing staff. Starting off with the usual cheery X-Files teaser (a baby getting run over by a train) this episode... well I can't really say it goes downhill because to be honest it was never going uphill. Poorly written, with us feeling no pathos for any of the characters (except maybe that baby at the start) the writer makes us hate characters before brutally killing them off, it's the worst technique ever.

This movie took me by surprise . I first saw it more than 10 years ago , and it stays in my head as a favorite film ever . The music was great . I have never watched an animated film more than 3 times in my life but this one got a standing ovation after I finished it . I would recommend this to anyone who wants to have some fun with their kids and a great way to introduce animation to the whole family . If you are interested in a similar movie that was made in Russia and I am not sure it was ever shown in US I suggest you give it a try .

How did this film get into the Berlin Film Festival ? I understand it got into the Panorama section ,but why is it here ? And why in Berlin ? I am not from Berlin and I didn’t notice it ,so it got in the Panorama Section . I have no idea why ,but I suppose the movie didn’t make a big impression with critics or audience in Germany .I can imagine why,because the movie was not a commercial success and I guess it got no good reviews . Could you kindly explain it ? Is it a new movie ?

Christopher Nolan 's directorial debut is a memorable one . The film was very well received and help land contracts with a host of big-budget films . The film has been described as a psychological horror film that is also a thriller . The film has also been seen as a psychological thriller. What is your take on The Dark Knight trilogy? I'm going to be honest with you , my take on this series has always been the same -- it's a pretty good movie, but not one that stands out for me from the crowd.

I never fell asleep during a movie . Never . This movie did the impossible.While many people claim the superiority of their technology , I have never once seen anyone use his technology to make me fall asleep and I have been watching TV and movies all my life.This movie was so awesome it made me laugh while I was falling asleep. I loved it and can not wait until it comes out on DVD. This movie is a must see! The story and the acting is great. The acting is so real it's a little creepy.

this is only the second time i have been moved enough to write a review . unfortunately , both times i was told to stop doing that . after i moved , i asked what my rights were . was told that i had to wait and see what the court decided . i did not want to wait , so i filed a counter suit . well , in the end, it was determined that i was right and they were wrong . now , i just have to pay for my damages . i will do so and try and make it right .

The only reason for me for watching this little known Irish film was the question could Mike Myers have played it with more conviction than he does, that is, of course, the problem. If you’re a big Myers fan like I am, you’re in for an intense, fast-paced and highly entertaining ride. But, if you’re an “I hate him because…” kind of person, you won’t find anything of note to like. I’ve given up trying to understand why anyone would be against this film.

You know the old saw about a train wreck ? The one about how you ca n't look away ? Well I guess you can , cause I'm about to watch one ! I have a hunch that some of y'all have a lot of money in your pocket , and I would like to take a little from it. I'm going to start by saying that this train wreck is coming to a town near you. You can either join me , or ignore me, and I really don't care a hoot one way or the other.

I started to watch this show by accident, but I love it. The fact that main character is in a wheelchair is something that lacking in television, especially for kids shows. My five-year-old nephew (as most children do) would just stare at people who were in wheelchairs or had some other type of handicap but after he watched Pelswick it just seemed to be a normal occurrence to him. Every time he saw a wheelchair he would simply say "Like Pelswick" and go on with what ever he was originally doing.

A while back I bought the Chinese box set of Fist of the North Star which came with all of Fist of the North Star, Fist of the North Star 2, New Fist of the North Star, and the Fist of the North Star movie. While there is an American Version and a few European Versions, they end half way through Fist of the North Star which is about as far as the movie goes.The series is about the successor of an ancient martial art called Hokuto Shin Ken (Fist of the North Star) named Kenshiro, or Ken for short.

Bloody Birthday plays on the assumed innocence of children and shows them as bloodthirsty monsters . Steven ( Andy Freeman ) and Maggie ( Emily Alyn Lind ) are the kind of couple who love one another and who want to grow old together. Their lives are perfect . Until, that is, their marriage is turned upside down when Steven's father, Ben ( John Carroll Lynch ) is arrested for child sexual abuse. Maggie has to decide what to do with the evidence against her husband . On the surface, the film looks like an adult-oriented action flick in the vein of films such as the Bourne films and Die Hard .

Though it 's a Christmas movie , `` Christmas in Connecticut '' could have been done any time of year - but not so far in advance. In this case, you'll get only the first week of November, the last week of November, and the weekend before Christmas . But you'll have a better chance of seeing `` Christmas in Connecticut '' this year. The film won 't open in theaters for at least a month. The film is about a man who, after a long period of silence, goes back to a family he abandoned when he was young.

I really enjoyed this movie. I have probably watched it 2 dozen times or more and still enjoy it. Being an old Navy guy, Im still stirred by the rousing rendition of Anchors Away! I also love the "McHales Navy" pirate atmosphere. I could have done without the female dive officer but Im just old fashioned I guess. She was still good to look at, lol, espesially after the crew got done with her laundry. The cook, sonarman, and electrician made the movie. Loved the salty old engineer and his first class PO too.

Watching the first few moments, you realize it's going to be a parody - and certainly it *is* a parody, but I'm not sure of what (a fairy tale? an opera? a Hollywoodian C-movie? - if there was something like that), and I can assure you it's not worth watching. It's simply a pointless film (cf. a good parody is everything but pointless), with pretentious, shallow speeches of extremely sketchy characters. It's like a commedia dell'arte. Or better, it's like a botched commedia dell'arte.

Okay, I grew up on Who, but haven't loved a Doctor since Tom Baker. Christopher Eccleston made me love Who again and I'll be furious with him forever for leaving. The writing is grand, the acting superb, the directing (which was dreadful in the old days) is just fantastic. I was very skeptical about this programme, and watched it merely out of being forced, but am now a huge fan and love it (I have a ringtone of a Dalek screaming "Exterminate" then).

Haines is excellent as the brash cadet who thinks West Point will really amount to something now that he has arrived. Haines displays his easy, goofy comic persona as he takes on West Point and Joan Crawford, the local beauty. Great fun for the first half. And amazingly touching after Haines's character goes too far and nearly gets shunned by fellow cadets. The new, humility-filled Haines get s alast-minute reprieve to play in the bill football game against Navy and, despite a broken arm, wins the game. Great, rousing entertainment by MGM in this Haines formula film, shows Billy at his best.

OK - say some college in southern California has an movie making class. And some dudes were enrolled just to film girls, and they gave them a camera. And then they were drunk/stoned/ or just to plain stupid to actually use a camera, and they turned this in for their grade. AND FAILED.That is my only explanation for this, this, thing. I just watched it for the second time today and I must say with all my heart it is about the most amazing movie I have ever seen. It made me feel all the feels and I’m sure it did the same for most of the people that were in there. I loved the script and the acting and it made me feel so sad for these people and I just wanted to hug every one of those characters. There was a lot of sadness in it but I think I liked that it wasn’t over the top.

What is about mathematical geniuses that get the critics juices flowing ? A BEAUTIFUL MIND wasn ` t up to much when they got here ? I believe we have a number of brilliant mathematicians, such as, for example, the following:

Friedrich Reinhold, who was a teacher of mathematics at Oxford. Fermat. Albert Einstein

Gottfried Wilhelm Leibnitz

Leonhard Euler

Euler was born on the 19th May 1707. He spent a lot of time working on what we now know as algebraic geometry. At this time, he was very much involved in the research of algebraic geometry.

This is a tough film to review , since several factors need to be taken into account . Let 's take a look . We all remember the ending of the original film. We all remember how well it worked . In fact , we all saw it , when we were little kids , and it's still one of those movies that sticks in our memory . So , with that said , I will try to make it clear how I would like to see this new film , if at all , it can be seen on the screen .

I ca n't believe that Isaiah Washington and Ice-T were in this mess ! The plot ( and I use that term loosely) is so far off the rails it would be funny if you couldn't see it! If you ever watch old reruns of Star Trek where they play a movie with a similar plot ( but far better ) I think you'll get the hint. Anyway I wanted to comment about a couple of things and let you know if you're interested in something or not! 1. So what's the deal with all of this and how does this relate to the draft?

I'm sorry, perhaps this is part of the wave of praise for fireman since 911, perhaps it's an old fashioned story, perhaps it's not meant to knock your socks off but I'm sorry, this film is awful. As in the title, cliché 49, I think it has at least that many clichés. It's a dreary story (impressive managing to be dreary when there's dangerous fires and lives being saved) about a fireman. And his dreary life, told in a pointless, 'scene from now' flashback to the past style.

Beautiful....that one word pretty much sums up this whole film. Everything from the cinematography, the directing, the acting.....brilliant. At any point of the film, you can pause it, and you will no doubt be looking at something mosaic or "artsy fartsy" as some people would say. I assure you, that after one viewing, "Bobbycrush" will be stuck in your head. I know this from first hand experience. Even the soundtrack is great. It goes together very well with the tone and pace of the film.

OK , well , no one in their right mind ( s ) would pick up a movie titled ``Jaws`` , but it has its fans. I have to admit the movie did not scare me, but there was an odd moment with a woman and her husband on a boat. I was sitting right beside them, and the woman was leaning over her husband and I could see his face. So what was that about, I thought . The husband asked her why she was so scared . She said that was her husband.

Like all of the very earliest films , this `` movie '' is very , very short -- lasting about 15 minutes and less. But that isn't by chance. In fact, the very first reel is the longest of them all, because the filmmakers were planning to use it for something else. The idea was to use it for a short documentary . So when the film starts, we're only 3 minutes in. And then -- it's over in 5 minutes! We only get 2 minutes into it, too, before it cuts to the first scene in the very first shot.

I used to think that it could n't get worse that `` Army of the Dead '' but this load of garbage is just an extension of it. If I recall correctly the Army of the Dead games were on some of the better games in the last generation of the NES. This is pure garbage and should never have been allowed on a game that should have never been allowed on a NES system. It is a shame they didn't make this a remake of a game that would have been very well received.

What an awful movie . Full of cliches , perplexing scenes , very bad acting , and an atrotious script . This movie is not for anyone , and not for adults . I think you can safely say no one will be able to enjoy . I was very angry , and had to hide in the bathroom because I thought I might kill myself . You can not imagine how angry I am , and how hurt and disappointed I feel . What a disappointment . What a terrible movie. I thought I was the only one who actually enjoyed "The Room".

The violent death of Fernando Ramos Da Silva only eight years after the completion of this film, only adds to the poignancy of dierector BAbenco's powerful message. The film is split into two halves - the first in a reformatory where a group of youngsters are abused and violated by the violent law enforcers and guardians. The second backdrop is the city where they are confined instead by their own actions and morality, which includes mugging, pimping and killing different characters who enter their lives.The differing gender and sexual roles in the film allow for constant changes in the characters as they interact with other people.

Despite some really scenic locations in the orient and some sporadically energetic music by Franco Micalizzi, this film doesn't quite reach the level of Joe D'Amato's similar efforts while staying just about as trashy. The author of the original book "Emmanuelle: The Joys of a Woman", Emmanuelle Arsan, directed and had a smallish role in this film, which mostly pornographically showcases a very young Annie Belle as she gets in a variety of oddball sexual situations. Her boyfriend, played by ZOMBIE's Al Cliver actually approves of her sleeping around and even persuades her to continue her practices even after the two of them are married!

Where would Hollywood have been without Fredric March as Robert Browning or Dennis Price as Lord Byron, famous lovers in their day? Even an actor as normally straitlaced as Michael Redgrave once brought some moody charm to a portrayal of W.B. Yeats. Writers' lives are an endless source of inspiration.But of all poets it was Dylan Thomas, the roistering, free-loving Welshman who enjoyed a pint or two (and drank himself to death in New York at the age of 39), who was closest in spirit to the film industry. During World War II, he produced scripts for British propaganda documentaries.

I love this movie . It is the first film Master P have ever done . It is based on a song "Let's Talk About Love" , and the movie is about what happens when he meets the love of his life . The film is about Master P & his gang , and the film has a very good plot and script . It is funny , the film is well made and Master P is a cool rapper . But the movie did have some flaws . First and foremost , it should have had the original beat for the song .

You Belong To Me was the final teaming of Henry Fonda and Barbara Stanwyck as a screen team and it is their second collaboration, the other being Mr. and Mrs. Smith in 1937. The film also featured the last appearance by Stanwyck as a screen performer and the only one on the list not included in the top 20. Fonda had made a couple of films before with Stanwyck but the two had never made a film together. The couple made their first on-screen pairing in 1926’s They Live By Night and their second collaboration in 1929’s This Property Is Treasured.

Firstly this has nothing to do with the much better 18 weapons of Kung Fu starring Gordon Liu. I mention this as my Kung Fu Theater presents DVD has a totally misleading picture on the cover, the wrong plot on the back and goes on to mention (no idea why) The Young Hero starring Hwang Jang Lee. Apart from an introduction to the history of the 18 weapons style told by a monk to some children during the opening and the usual mysterious manual that everyone is after, the weapons never really appear again and the fights are all boxing style.

This is definitely one of the ultimate cult classics , and is a must see for all psychotronic fans . There is not a bad person in this movie who does not have their own story that has been hidden inside of this film . I think I will be the only person in the world that believes the story to be true and the events that unfolded to be actually true . The fact of the matter is , the events in this movie have all been documented and have been reported in countless books and websites . It is very easy to make a movie like this .

I recently got the movie and all I can say it is a good movie . There 's a lot of action and it 's a must see movie . I will definitely see the movie in a theater again and it was really fun . I would recommend this movie to all my friends

This was a very enjoyable movie and I recommend it to any fan of action flicks. However, for a movie to truly live up to the hype of it's hype it would need to be more than just a good action movie. That's what I'm expecting to come out on the other end...

...I can't believe there are actually people here who recommend this movie... This is such a slow POS going absolutely nowhere. Oh yeah OK it goes somewhere, but you see that coming from miles away. Acting: Really really bad, maybe the bartender was kind of OK. Editing: BAD! I suppose the editor was told "we need at least 90 minutes", cause half of all the scenes could have gone in the bin. Music: don't get me started on that, the lousiest score I've ever heard.

This film did not excite me. While on vacation in Turkey I noticed that it was playing at the local cinema and decided to take the chance to go see it. The action sequences in the film are well choreographed, however, the story drags during the middle of the film.One thing that I did not quite follow is how Borte was able to get the money to bribe the guards.The other thing that I did not particularly like was the missing segment of Khan's life. It did not go into detail as to how the bad guys were able to find him and re-imprison him after he had gone missing for so long.

I absolutely love the first three movies, they were great! I once caught Part 5 on VHS 10 years ago, and I was disappointed. But perhaps that was because I never saw the fourth one, because they were shot back-to-back. but after finally viewing a copy today, I have to say it was no way better than number 5. My expectations weren't high to begin with, but this is cheap direct-to-video stuff, not even a horror movie, it's PG-13. The acting was not convincing, the story was rather dumb without any excitement and there were not many effects.

I would like to know if `` The Outsiders '' ( Australian TV series ) will ever be released on DVD or Blu-ray and how many episodes have been shot. No. It's not possible. There are too many episodes. I know you can get them on DVD in Australia and I'm sure you could on the Blu-ray in the US. They'd probably go for that price though. But you could also try getting them online through the Australian DVD Forum, there's a few that have them, but they haven't been for years, I would think.

Talking about competition features at the Split Film festival, we have titles from all over the world. China, Korea, Canada, USA and Australia and many of these stories are indicating that the world is really valley of tears. Modern love...thats for sure. In that movie by Alex Frayne, two younger married people and their boy are traveling from town to the coast to visit the grave and house of the man's uncle who raised him a long time ago and who died in mysterious circumstances. The coastal village seems like something in an American horror film where the village is bizarre and people are uncommon mutants.

If it was possible to give negative stars I would for this stinkburger.Do n't get me wrong I LOOOOOOVVVEEEE a cheesesteak,but that's the only place i would be eating one. i've never been to Texas, but I've lived in Austin for about 8 years now. I was born there, raised there and i love it. I love all of the music, the food, the friends, the people, the nature and the history of this beautiful little city. I love it to death. Austin is my home.

I kept waiting for the film to move me , inspire me , shock me , sadden me in some way or another , but it didn't and I still don't think I ever saw it. However it is now a part of my life and I hope to revisit it sometime in my future , but I think this is an excellent place to start my search. This is a wonderful film on many levels but for me, it is a love story. There are several things about this movie that I find so moving and so powerful.

The Evil that Men Do (1984) was one of the few non-Cannon films Charlie Bronson made during the 80's. Unlike most of the Cannon films Charlie starred in, this one wasn't fun or entertaining. Charlie basically tortures and brutalizes people for over an hour and a half. If you thought he was Mr. Emotion before, wait until you see this! In this one, Charlie goes to an unnamed Central American country and shows the populace that whoever messes with Chuck or his people have to pay the piper. This one is no fun.

Two actors play rival gangsters in three films , the final of which is a sci-fi film , that nods to the past, but takes place in the future, where crime is now a global, technological problem. They have a long-term relationship (the first film was his first in 15 years), and one of the films is based on a book he has written. They both live in the same country (they met there), and he also lived there for three years until he got out and went to college (the first film took place in Italy).

During the making of this movie I once caught a statement on television about it. Something like: "Is Killinggänget now taking off Nazism? "So, my comprehension of this movie, was from the beginning to get a notion of Nazism. When recently seeing this movie in the TV-version I had this filter before me and it wasn't difficult to see this.Strangely enough I haven't met this way of interpreting the film ever since I first heard it.These are the things I found in "Four shades of brown". In all four of the stories the lack of empathy leads to disaster:1.

It has taken several viewings for me to fully appreciate this film . Initially , I was struck by the cinematography and the lighting. The first viewings were great, but the second set left me a bit underwhelmed and disappointed. Now , I have re-viewed the film , and I find it stunning . It's got an amazing script , an amazing cast and an amazing performance by Tom Hardy. I found myself completely enthralled and in awe as I watched the film . I felt that it would be impossible for me not to laugh or to cry.

From all of the Vietnam war movies this is probably the most frightening and disturbing and that is really saying something. There is a scene where the soldier is on the front lines of battle. He gets shot at and is about to be killed. He sees one of the other soldiers take aim and fires back at the target but hits an innocent bystander. The soldier takes a second to think and takes out his own life with a second shot for the same result. This movie is like watching the events play out in slow motion. What really scares me about the Vietnam war movies.

this is one of my favorite movies ever ! along with casablanca and cannibal holocaust , this is near perfect ! it is one of those movies where you will never look at the dialogue and just enjoy it ! you will never be bored and it will never get old (even though my friends and i would love to watch this movie for over a thousand times lol) it also features the best dialogue ever in a film with the best acting of the best actors of the year , the best directing of all time , the worst acting of anyone ever , it also features the best soundtrack of all time !

I've read the script.

River's Edge is an excellent film and it's a shame that it hasn't made more of a mark for itself in cinematic history. There were a number of gritty films based around school kids made in the eighties, but of all the ones I've seen; this is certainly the most nihilistic and disturbing. The film takes a storyline that is disturbing in its own right and adds the theme of teenage slackers and their uncaring attitude about things, which takes the story onto another level. The film works because the central story is interesting and it's played out by complex characters.

Ah yet another Seagal movie.In no less than a few mere months arrive to populate the video store shelves.As bad as it is to say, Seagal was in this movie.Maybe that is the only thing I can say good about this movie.Seagal’s character is in this movie, and I have to say it was a nice twist on the character of John Wayne.But I can see why this movie failed to make it to the silver screen.They could have done with a few more scenes and with an actor who could carry this role, but this is one of the most poorly made movies you will see.

The Camals Are Coming is a rather disappointing British comedy from 1934 . I purchased this because I like desert island stories and this one sounded like one. So here we go again with more of the same, I’m afraid. We start with an American pilot who is sent over to England to get drunk. He lands with only two cans of beer and a pack of cigarettes left. One of his mates tells him that all he needs is the money and the rest will follow when he gets to England .

While it's not "perfect", it's close. Love Barbara Stanwyck, SZ Sakall, Sidney Greenstreet, Dennis Morgan, Robert Shayne (Superman's police chief), the housekeeper, the waiter at Restaurant Felix, and the judge......I can go on and on. This movie has been part of my family's holiday tradition since I was a youngster, and my children grew up with it, too! "The baby swallowed the watch" was always my son's favorite line.Sexy Barbara Stanwyck in pants and gowns stole the show along with the cuddly, funny S. Z. Sakall.

I 'm so glad he was n't alive to see this . This movie is a debauchery of his work . It was like he got the money he wanted and had no qualms getting the last word. I've seen his films many times in other countries and they always have the same effect . I could go on but will just leave you with the ending and you can make your own minds up. I don't think I've actually seen this movie but I've been told about the great effect he had on the art of making films.

I really tried to like `` Saw . '' The story was good , and I admire the breakneck pace at which it was made. However, there is so much that I didn't like . . . so much that I won't even begin to tell . . . For example, the character who is the main protagonist is an alcoholic who has been in rehab for years, but refuses to admit his problem until one morning when he realizes that his wife ( played by Julia Roberts . . . a real one ) is gone . . .

I was enticed into watching Shark Hunter by the comments posted on IMDB. The movie was bad but the shark was cool blah blah blah. So I rented it. Bad idea. This movie was bad on so many levels that I'm glad that I had the option to fast forward. The shark itself is ok. It's appearance is decent and it is the only thing saving this movie from getting a 1, (I gave it a 2). The acting is incredibly bad and the dialogue is just as deplorable. I wasn't expecting much but I was continually surprised by this suckfest.

The first word i can find to describe this movie is Awful.This movie is one of the worst movies I have ever watched. This movie is one of the worst movies I have ever watched. There is so many things wrong with this movie, and it is so hard to watch. This movie is the most boring movie I have ever watched. I would like to give this movie a rating because it did have a lot of things in it, but I feel like I have to give it a rating because this movie was very disappointing.

The Adventures of Hercules has to be one of the lamest excuses for a movie I've yet run across. You would have to look far and wide to find anything that approaches the level of ineptness on display in this movie. Acting  Bad. Editing  Bad. Direction  Bad. Special Effects  Bad and Laughable. Plot  Bad. Lighting  Bad. Cinematography  Bad. Costume Design  Bad and Silly. Everything Else  Bad. Watching The Adventures of Hercules is about as enjoyable as a root canal. Even for a fan of bad movies, it's a real endurance test.

Comedy ? What 's so funny about watching an ugly deadbeat alcoholic attending 6 sessions ( by the time I met him ) with a shrink to talk about his life issues . I mean, he's dead so he doesn't have to do anything. And the shrink's going to tell him to go get a job or something. And when the deadbeat has to work , he'll be broke and in trouble. But then he's gonna sit and have to listen to him tell him the same story about how all he needs is money to get by and blah blah blah .

Maybe it was the fact that I saw Spider-man the day before I saw Duces Wild, but I do not think that there can be any excuse for this movie being as bad as it was. The cast was there to do it, but it seemed as if once they found them selves with a decent cast they had to try and make them fit into the movie. The only problem was that they did not fit. I did not like any of the characters and the story was sketchy at best. I left wondering why i spent my money on this movie.

This movie tries to be more than it is . First of all , the acting is horrible . You would think they could do a much better job. . The music is so bland that I could have just listened to it again and again. I was hoping for a good action film . Instead , I got a dull boring film. I really wanted to like it because it's the first I've ever seen with a female villain. It would've been so much more if they would have at least given it a fair shot.

I found this movie to be preachy and unrealistic. It tries to be a movie showing kids fighting against the system, but it doesn't even present a positive solution. I guess I didn't feel really for the kids. I totally can understand what their gripes were and I know how poor the state of schools are, but I found their solution and the way the outside dealt with it to be a big bunch of phooey. If this comes on TV, don't waste your time. Watch Short Circuit again for the 235th time.

There is only one word to define the whole movie, that is: awful. How "Mostly Martha" was remade is awful. The title of the movie is awful. The actors are awful. And the idea of combining good cooking and USA is awful. If you have seen "Bella Martha", well that is the original title and it means "Beautiful Martha", this one is a punch in the stomach. The acting of Ms.Jones is so poor and unnatural that even Jessica Alba, considered one of the worst actresses (http://www.razzies.com/history/05nomActr.asp) would have done better.

Oh man, this movie was toe-cringing bad. Bad look, awful story...the list of good things is shorter than the list of bad things about this movie.Yes sure it's supposed to be a comedy and all but something tells me that this movie was supposed to be the real deal. The movie most certainly does not start of as a comedy but more as an adventurous movie with fun elements put in it. You can especially tells they were serious with this by the acting, that was in a serious and non-comical way, with the exception of a couple of over-the-top sequences obviously.

I had to get this movie, since it didn't come to where I live. I waited patiently and it was worth the wait. I totally fell in love with this movie. The chemistry between Walters and Grint you could see, since they also worked together on the Harry Potter movies.The woman who plays his overbearing, righteous mother really had me convinced all right and how much of a hypocrite she is, I think she did a great job playing the role. I only wish we could of had seen the actually sex scene or more of it.

Just watched this on DVD three times - Once the 'normal' way, once with the scenes in consecutive order (in this doozy of a film noir, the beginning, middle and end of the story intertwine), and once with the director's commentary running. Quite amazing. A bare-bones tale, told with more flair, energy and substance than most big-budget overblown features being released today. I think this is an even more accomplished film than the subsequent Memento, which turned me on to Nolan in the first place.

This movie is one of my all time favorite movies and is what made me a lifelong Nicolas Cage fan. Back in the mid-80's I taped this movie (when VCR's were impossible to do this with!!) and would watch it over and over. Nicolas Cage is just brilliant here. And, he looks wonderful and has no affecting "acting-isms" (see "Peggy Sue Got Married" to know what I mean about that!!). I measure all his performances against this one. He was so perfectly cast as the cool punk guy with the edgy friends.

11 years after this film was released only 5 people have reviewed it here on IMDb. There is a reason for this utter lack of interest in Across the Moon. It is coherent, but lacks all cinematic virtue. See this film for examples of terrible production in all respects. The opening credits for instance are white letters rising mechanically from a red background. The ending features Michael McKean staring out a prison window saying "There's lots of mysteries out there." followed by a clip montage/music video of all the uplifting moments in the tragically bad movie. Julinana Hatfield.

I mean really, really, REALLY high and this movie has a shot at entertainment. I don't mean regular high, i mean the high where reading the phonebook would have you in stitches. otherwise save the time out of your life and go do something more constructive with it, like hitting your head on a brick wall and insulting your own intelligence. A complete waste of talent in some cases (Bernie Mac, John C. McGinley, Tom Kenny, and the master of hams Shatner) and exactly the kind of crap they deserve to make (the myriad of rappers who insist on making movies).

Dick and Jane Harper ( Jim Carrey , Téa Leoni ) wind up on the unemployment line when the corporation they have worked for is sold and they are forced to work on a private island, where they are assigned to perform a private service. They try to get the money together to make a better life for themselves on a small island of their own, but, when they are offered a lucrative job, it is too late, and they have to work for the very corporation that was so eager to sell their island.

The opening scene really got me into watching the movie. However, not more than 5 minutes later, I was already gouging my eyes out. Not only could I not understand a word that was said, the acting could have been better by a group of mentally handicapped. The one highlight of this movie was that there was a punk white midget. However, I didn't quite get the connection on how a white midget was the child of two African Americans. But I guess anything is possible. Also, why the hell was Robin in the movie?

Man, I can't believe the largely harsh and negative comments for this movie. Okay, it sure ain't no sophisticated work of cinematic art. But it is a good deal of entertainingly tacky fun. For starters, the titular pumpkin-headed supernatural killer dude has to be one of the single most laughably silly and unscary things to ever stumble in front of a camera; he looks like something you would see in a fourth-rate carnival spookhouse. Secondly, the moderate gore is ridiculously fake and unconvincing, with the definite highlight occurring when this annoying uptight ultra-conservative woman gets electrocuted by a toaster.

As a rule , I try to find as much in films as I possibly can to enjoy them . This was a film I really liked . But , it is not that good , for the majority . The film opens with a good story , but it is too short in this case . There are not much to say , as this was a film I will be very happy to forget it , when the next film comes up . The film was , I must say , quite decent . The cinematography was fantastic .

I just realized why the colors and sets in `` Sakuran '' were so flashy and gaudy , and just like the anime it was a show where you could wear anything! And to be honest , they look even more appealing with a black and white color scheme. I like that style , so I guess I'll give this show a watch! The story was pretty weak. I like the characters a lot better than most of the shows anime, but they're not interesting enough for me to care much. The only other thing I liked is that the voice acting was better this time.

I was a still photographer working in Europe the summer that Jim Salter shot the movie Three.I did some swell pictures for him, one of which I was told became the poster for the movie. I didn't see the film until years later. I thought it was bad. A pity, because the elements that went into it were compelling. Robie Porter's girlfriend was almast as beautiful as Rampling herself. Salter asked if I would stick around and be an extra cameraman so they wouldn't have to shoot everything twice. I said sure, but I had to return to NY, promising I'd be back.

I was hoping that Pulp would be a interesting movie , but was profoundly disappointed.Pulp has very little storyline , which is why I rated it only a 3. It had nothing in it that you would call "movie-making". This is not bad, because in a sense you are making a movie on the screen , which is really a better way to make movies . But the script is poor. There is no story , there are no characters and there is no depth to it , and I have no idea what to expect from it. I had to stop watching.

I really like the show!! As a part of Greek Life, I can say that some things are over-exaggerated, but overall it's still pretty damn funny.Rusty is a likable lead character, his roommate is HILARIOUS and the entire cast is entertaining in their own rights. I like that it focuses on individual situations as well as interpersonal relations with the organizations.This show covers it all, and they do it without cursing or anything else that bad (how else could it be on ABC Family? ).My favorites are Cappie (of course), Rusty's roommate and pretty much all of Kappa Tau.

Nothing will ever top KOMODO with the lovely Jill Hennessey as a shrink (! ), but KvC ain't quite as bad as I expected for a SYFY channel quickie. Just make sure to watch it while drunk or stoned, or while trying to go to sleep. The unimaginative title basically says it all: A group of mostly unknown actors converge on an island where a government experiment to grow giant vegetables has gone wrong. Giant creatures that came into contact with the vegetables have taken over the island and eaten everyone. So now the government is preparing to blow up the island, regardless of the people being there.

A group of environmentalists travel to an island to uncover a secret lab that is experimenting on animals. When they arrive, they discover that they are to late. Apparently the government made a scientist test his experiment on a komodo and, yes, you guessed it, a cobra which made them grow very large. I'm not sure that this movie really needed or deserved explaining since it is almost identical to Curse of the Komodo which also sucked. The computer effects are as cartoony as ever an the komodo roars like a dinosaur which really got on my nerves.

when i watched this crap , it reminded me of the the title of the movie FIRE , Which is good , the movie had a great title that i wish i could forget . i know its not the greatest movie , but i wish there were a few more funny lines . if the movie was better then that would be the only bad thing about it . if they made this into a movie , it would win an academy award and i would love for it . if you like funny movies with great dialogue , i highly recommend this movie .

Three children are born during a solar eclipse and ten years later this has somehow caused them to grow up without consciences. As their simultaneous tenth birthday celebrations approach, they become cunning and calculating cold-blooded murderers. Nice-girl local teen Joyce Russel (Lori Lethin) finds herself confronting these little terrors when most others are falling for their angelic demeanors.Hearkening back to films like "The Bad Seed" and "Village of the Damned", this films' premise of evil children may not be wholly original but it's still pretty disturbing. All three of the child actors - Elizabeth Hoy, Billy Jacoby, and Andy Freeman - are chillingly convincing.

I had read up on the film and thought it would be cute, a feel good Saturday night movie. I wasn't expecting anything great, figured it would be mostly fluff but hopefully not a totally bad experience. I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised.The dialogue was pitch perfect, most of the actors were exceptionally good and it flowed nicely. Ash Christian was perfect, his ability to turn an awkward moment into something touching was nice to see. He could have turned this character into something we've all seen before but instead strayed away from stereotypes and focused on the wittiness of the character.

Despite having an absolutely horrid script (more about that later), this film is still vaguely watchable just because it stars two excellent actors, Barbara Stanwyck and Henry Fonda. Aside from one or two REAL stinkers, I'd probably watch just about anything with them in the film, as I am a huge fan of Hollywood's golden age of the 1930s and 40s. However, no matter how much I love their films, I just can't recommend this film.The movie begins with Fonda and Stanwyck on vacation at some ski resort.

This movie strayed too far from Straub's novel for me to enjoy. Barely made it to the middle of the film. Besides changing Don Wanderly from Edwards nephew into his son, the removed most of the major scenes and a number of characters that gave the novel so much life. What was left was trash. Straub's version was far superior to this poorly executed film. I don't think casting did all that great a job on picking the Chowder Society members either. Hopefully someone will come along and actually remake this film correctly in my lifetime.

Because that 's what Hell Ride pretty much is . Larry Bishop and Tarantino partying on the Weinstein 's money . 's . I guess the Weinstein 's money is the first thing Larry and Tarantino do when they get there because they don ' t know any better . And Larry is going to hell because he was in an elevator accident in Paris and that 's where he got the cancer from . . . and they have to fix Larry up with the girl who is on Larry 's tour. I don't know what the hell to say . . .

Irvine Welsh's follow up to Trainspotting hits the screen as three short stories set in Edinburgh, all with a few of Welsh's trade marks, drug culture, depression, the working class and Hibernian football club. Uneasy to watch in places, it is no less than very well written, 2 of the stories having a darkly comic twist to them while the 2nd story a serious (and shockingly realistic) plot to it. Will not appeal to most, including myself to a point, but will no doubt adopt a cult following.

So well done . The photography , sound , music and the performances were the best . It 's also the very first to be shown live . The audience loved it and it was a great success ! I went there on Saturday afternoon. It is a beautiful place and I love the idea of doing a concert there. I went there with my daughter. It was beautiful. I was happy to be there for the concert . I hope I will get to see you soon . The show was amazing , great music , amazing sound system and great performances .

I can admit right away that this is one of the worst movies i have seen in my life. And that is not saying a little, because i consider myself to be somewhat of an aficionado when it comes to crappy film. But this is beyond bad. This movie is so awful that there is no fun left in it, it's just bad.Reviewing this is almost impossible. There are no strong points and nothing positive to say. I'll just ramble about a few of the points that sucked. First off, the CGI has to be one of the worst i've seen.

Gritty drama ? Emotionally powerful ? Blah ! The BBC has lost out big time to masterful productions such as HBO's Westworld , Netflix's Jessica Jones , FX's The Americans , Amazon's The Handmaid's Tale , Hulu's American Gods . And now BBC America is on the way too with a sci-fi drama series set to air on the network from 2019. The series – The Fall – comes from writer/executive producer Simon Pegg who is also one of the directors. Pegg was behind the brilliant Peep Show , the hilarious The Office and the Oscar-winning romcom The World's End.

What an utter disappointment . Forget this abysmal film and get hold of the TV series instead . What on earth have they got to offer here ? I mean , if you have nothing to say , nothing to look at , or nothing to see , then what are you doing with the time and effort ? Just get away from this film , get on with the TV series and spend your money somewhere else . Why not ? You can do better than this . If they wanted to make a film , I think they should have left the budget and cast out of it , and taken the cast out of it .

I have seen both the MST3K version and the uncut version . I rather enjoyed it . Either way , I found the movie itself enjoyable. It's not a particularly good film overall but I still enjoyed it enough to rate it B-. There is no way you can rate it anything other than an A-. I enjoyed it as much as I could , but if I'm going to rate it that high , there should be something in there to give me some reason to do so. I did like the special effects and I really liked the cast.

I'm an action movie fan but until today I've never seen a preview or an ad for this movie in Italy, so I went to see "The Long Kiss Goodnight" on pay-TV hoping for nothing special.But, what a surprise! This movie is great! The only problem I found is the presence of some holes in the plot, but the rest is the most entertaining, intriguing and funny action movie ever made.The transformation of Samantha/Charly from ordinary wife-teacher to cool-blooded agent recovering from amnesia seems to be a good idea. The action scenes and the stunts are the best I've ever seen.

George Hearn really went all out and over the top which in this case was great. I've heard the Len Cariou version but it was too tame. George was great in that character - very expressive.Angela Lansbury was perfect for the part. She gave a great performance. She gave the Mrs. Lovett a great devious and comical personality which balanced out the dark story.I love the dark humor when Angela Lansbury sings her songs as well as her physical expressions and the angry emotions of George Hearn in his songs of rage, vengeance and distress.I've watched this play 20 times since 1985 when I saw it on PBS.

The plot involves a new, hipper franchise barbershop that is moving across the street from Calvin's barbershop. So, he feels like he has to change and improve his shop by getting newer stuff and such. Sounds real exciting huh. As for the rest of the film, a lot of it involves the same material from the first film. The people that work at Calvin's stand around, talk loud, and mouth off to each other and the customers. Once again Cedric the Entertainer was mildly funny, but it is more like he's doing a stand-up routine than anything to do with the movie.

Time has not been kind to this film from the transition days of sound from silent. The plot has a gangster falling for a socialite who wants to help the down on his luck violinist she loves. There are of course complications. The problem with the film for me is that it hasn't aged well. Performances are all over the place with some emotional scenes seeming so over the top as to be laughable. One late exchange where Carol Lombard throws someone out of her room had me howling with its sing song delivery.

This is a film by Oshima, the director of the notorious "In The Realm Of The Senses", a film so sexually brazed and unabashedly controversial it was banned for a while. This film takes place initially in 1895 in Japan and stars the very pretty Keziko Yoshiyuki as Seki, the wife of a rickshaw driver who falls for a much younger man who woos her in kind. That man, Toyoji, comes to her as she was sleeping and seduces her, though she soon is rather willing to be seduced. Soon they are having an affair and plot to kill Seki's husband, to be together forever.

We all enjoyed the movie. It is a very charming family film with many fun cameos. It was fun to see Austin musicians, Charlie Robison, Joe Ely and Robert Earl Keen in the film as well as turns by famous actors Julia Roberts and Bruce Willis. Emma Roberts is especially cute in the film however all the children are good. The west Texas scenery is great as is the soundtrack full of Texas artists. The last half seemed a bit far fetched to me, however, my son was interested throughout the film which is not so often with him.

This film is a nightmare ! The sensation you feel when you wake up from a nightmare is the same sensation you felt in the night, but much much worse. In the night you were dreaming. The day you wake up is only a dream, and it never ends. The film is beautiful in its dreamlike aspect. It is a film for the dreamers. When you have no memories of the real world outside of your dreams, reality is something completely different than you thought it was. And when you are able to break free from the dreams in which you exist, then you begin to discover reality.

Ugly women-of-the-cellblock flick rakes the bottom of the midnight-movie barrel, combining pulpy sleaze with the hoariest of girls-in-the-shower clichés.
