Linda Blair plays an innocent sent to jail (we learn offhandedly she was involved in running over some guy with her car), facing hard time in the Big House with some of the nastiest characters this side of a Russ Meyer pic. Blair is continually pawed at, punched, raped, humiliated and harassed. The dialogue is four-letter-word disgusting throughout, and the flick offers no let-up from its barrage of violence and stupidity.

`` 200l : A Space Odyssey '' is a supremely intriguing space-travel journey with a profound look at mankind 's relationship with the universe and the nature of knowledge and understanding. Written and directed by Steven Speilberg and from a screenplay by John Kortner, this epic space-opera depicts humanity's journey to discover the universe beyond our own. The film begins with a young astronaut named Neil Armstrong landing on the Moon on July 21, 1969. After years of waiting, humanity 's first trip to the Moon is finally underway. Neil is assigned to command the Apollo 1 mission.

Apparently SHRUNKEN HEADS was the last movie that Julius Harris had a role in. I have not seen all of his movies, but Julius Harris was in many good movies, and I remember him best from "Live and Let Die" where he played Tee-Hee and which was full of Voodoo references, something that is common here in South Florida! I always thought LIVE AND LET DIE was a great movie because it had some atmosphere and mystique, unlike most of the 007 movies. In SHRUNKEN HEADS, Julius Harris is back in his Voodoo persona!

Excellent story , wonderful acting , amazing production values and a cool , action-packed short with a perfect twist at the ending. I am glad that i saw it , just like it was the first time i have seen an action-packed superhero film in a long time . I really want to see the first 2-part episode of Agents of S.H.O.O.V.E as well as the complete series . Thank you for making this , it will be a great addition to the ever-growing superhero film genre . I think the way you did this is even more impressive , you did it in just 4 episodes !

eXistenZ was a good film , at the first I was wondering what is going on , organic `` pods of life '' the story of the creation of the world in the mind of the god , it is very good and I can't say too much about it , the best film in the series and the most interesting one , it is also the best animated film of the year , it is worth watching if you are looking to see a very interesting experiment , well written , with a very nice and original plot .

Anyone who critiques 'Jacqueline Hyde ' as anything more than the playful and undeniably erotic romp that it 's intended to be is a fool, and I am willing to admit that I, like nearly everyone who has ever watched it, is at least somewhat charmed by the film . . . but the "charisma" and "sex appeal" are a lot of horseshit . . . and they only make a good film, in my humble opinion, if they don't make you want to smack someone around . . . like a good movie does.

Red Skelton ( in his first starring role ) plays Wally Benton who plays 'The Fox ' on a radio station run by his brother Wally ( Jim Backus who is also an old friend and has known and worked with Skelton before ) , who has decided that he is going to quit and make a better life for himself. The character of The Fox had already existed before the movie, he just wanted to give his audience an opportunity to meet him in his true self. The first time he was revealed was in the radio station.

This is probably one of the worst movies I have ever seen ! The plot revolves around a man named "John Doe" who was being forced by his mother to commit a "suicide" by throwing himself down the stairs after he gets into an accident when his car hits a telephone pole. This is also the case in "Inception," where we have a woman, played by Leonardo DiCaprio, who is being blackmailed by an unseen "man" named "Ezra Stane". The "woman" who was being blackmailed is played by Ellen Page.

Once again , I 've been duped by seemingly intelligent reviews making seemingly intelligent comments about an obviously crappy movie . It seems like they like the movie but cannot figure out how to say why they think the movie sucks. I don't get it . It's as though they don't believe in "real criticism" and therefore cannot provide it. I'll get to the real review in due course . For now though, lets take a step back and examine how the movie came to be . So here's the short version and then the long one .

* * SPOILERS * * I rented `` Tesis '' ( or `` Thesis '' in English ) on the Internet a couple years ago. This was the very first ( and I believe the last ) video game I would ever make. I had heard so many people saying how much they admired this game and how much it captured video game essence. I had seen screenshots and had heard about the game but had never really played it or even played a game that closely. I couldn't wait to get started on my first project and have it finished in time for my birthday.

How offensive ! Those who liked this movie have probably never opened a bible . I can imagine those at the back with their hands to their face. I can see those sitting around the dining table at my brother's house reading the bible . I can see those who didn't like this movie sitting there in silence. I really think the reason this movie had so many thumbs up is because of the bible it was based on. It is so sad that this movie was made but it will forever live in my heart with my family.

One of the worst movie I have seen in 2009 so far : The story hesitates between a silly thriller with a strong story and an action film that ends with an interesting and suspenseful action scene. I am a sucker for a good plot and well written screenplay and what the director has done is just unbelievable. The film will have a good life after its initial release. This movie is a mixture of action movie and horror movie. I was very much confused by the characters and the story for the duration of the movie itself and it ended up being disappointing.

First off, the editing of this film consisted of one major flaw which I don't understand how was missed - you consistently see the overhead microphones bobbing in and out of the film. The first time I saw it I just said "well, mistakes happen" and brushed it off. After about the 10th time, it began to get incredibly irritating and distractingly funny. If you haven't seen the film yet, try counting how many times you see the microphone; might make for pretty interesting game.Now, about the film.

Earth Final Conflict began like a new world , a new vision from the creator of Star trek , something that hasn’t happened before

I was very young when the original Star Trek was made, around the time I learned to speak and understand sentences. The story is set in the late 23rd Century, the story is about a man and his crew who travel the universe. There are some things I do not understand fully and that’s one of them. When I look at that movie, it makes no sense to me.

The recent release of "Mad Dog Morgan" on Troma DVD is disappointing.This appears to be a censored print for television viewing. Some of the more violent scenes have been edited and portions of the colorful language have been removed. Anyone who viewed the film uncut will be mad as hell at this toxic DVD version. "Mad Dog Morgan" deserves to be released on DVD in the original theatrical cut. However, even as released on DVD, the film is still one of the better depictions of bushranger life in nineteenth century Australia.

I'm going to recommend putting this one in the "skip it" pile as well. I was mildly excited by the concept when my fiancée rented it, and a bit more excited when I saw that Milos Forman directed it. Ah, well.....The costumes were nice, sure, but they were typical. There was nothing about them that said they were from anywhere but the Period Costume department of any major Hollywood studio. There was no distinction between Spanish, British and French - everyone dressed like they were at court in Versailles.

The film is a joy to watch, not just for the plot, which is gripping, but also for the superb performances of the actors, Deneuve and Belmondo. Though considered a 'flop' on its first release it has become a critical success, and it is clear to see why. Deneuve's acting style suited the film brilliantly. she constantly gives the impression that she is holding back or hiding something, and her character in this film is. I will not spoil it with saying what, though it is divulged fairly early on. Belmondo is lovable as the fairly naiive but in love tobacconist.

The Outsiders is undoubtedly a classic Australian TV series . Well defined characters , tight scripts , varied and interesting locations and a lot of laughs , the series has been a delight to watch from the very start. The film version has a lot of faults , but still is good fun , even if I prefer the TV version . There is a plot which I like and that is that the three men who set out to save the world are the most powerful men in Australia and that they set out to get away with murder.

I am an Australian currently living in Japan . I saw this movie on TV here and was very impressed. It is very rare to see a Japanese film made in English. It was a very dark movie, as was most of what I saw in Japan . I felt very sorry for the Japanese people at times. So many great Japanese films are released in English. I have never seen any but I have seen some great Japanese films made in English or with a mixture of English subtitles. I love the fact that they are in English!

Last year, I fell in love with the Tim Burton's version of Sweeney Todd so I wanted to check out the other versions of this musical and I found this one at the library. Though I think Burton's is best, probably because I like film a lot better than theater, this is still a great production of the story. I haven't seen any of the other versions but I am trying to get my hands on them.After seeing Johnny Depp as Todd, it's hard for me to imagine anyone else in the role, but George Hearn does a fantastic job.

From all of the Vietnam war movies this is probably the most frightening and disturbing and that is really saying a lot with so many spectacular ones that have come out. It has this freakish feel to it. Everything is so chaotic in the movie it scares you. It is not like it shows a lot of different things compared to the other Vietnam war movies. What does push to such a high level is the: The directing was spectacular here. Francis Ford Coppola shows of his talent in his last epic movie. Unlike other directors he makes you feel as if you are in the war.

If you took all the stock elements of a Shrek movie (grumpy ogre, annoying donkey, cute kitty, obligatory dance number, etc. ), put them in a blender and condensed it to 20 minutes, you'd have this mess. Painful to watch; I may have laughed once. The story and dialogue are rushed beyond comprehension, with the voice actors sounding like they phoned in their lines. The final reworked rendition of "The Christmas Story" poem felt like it was written by a committee in five minutes. And boy, a little Eddie Murphy goes a long way.

Our reviewer from Toronto told you what you need to know about this film ( except note that it needs a DVD and Blu-ray release), so here is a full review. So here it is, your very own review copy of Tintin. I’m glad you came out to see it and I hope that you enjoyed the experience as much as I did. I hope that if you saw this in theatres, that you took a friend, or a loved one, and had some popcorn. Let me give you some background information.

I appreciate the effort that the filmmakers wanted to depict the story of Moses and the exodus of Israel , but it’s just not the way to get it right. It’s not just that they’re portraying it as though Moses went from Egypt to God and God said, “Okay, you’ve done your best; you did what you came here for,” which is a pretty common trope in the history of science fiction. It’s also that they have made a movie that has an incredibly long-winded narrative with many unnecessary details.

This is one of the best episodes from the entire X-Files series, creepy beyond words. The tension and suspense in this episode is very well executed, in its entire 45 minutes it managed to be almost as scary as an entire movie. This episode joins the ranks of best episodes with such greats as "Home", "Humbug" "Bad Blood" and "Milagro" for being the best in their respective season.Mulder and Scully's growing relationship is put to the test in this episode: Can they really trust each other?

This is strictly for Pryor fans . Just because he was a great , funny guy does n't mean this . I love this guy , I really do .. But , he did say some of the most horrible things you can ever say in a debate , and most people will not ever forgive or forget . He did say it in a debate . The only thing that can put him over the top is the fact that I was in his class during my junior year in HS . I'm not a Pryor fan but I really do think he could help this team.

To say that this is a good show is not to say anything at all . After all , this is just the beginning , and I have a good feeling this will only get better . And so it begins . This is going to be a great series , with great characters and great storylines . I don't know about you but the characters are already interesting , and I'm anxious to see what happens with them in future episodes . One thing that I've noticed in the first five episodes , is that I really don't like the story .

This film is absolutely appalling and awful. It's not low budget, it's a no budget film that makes Ed Wood's movies look like art. The acting is abysmal but sets and props are worse then anything I have ever seen. An ordinary subway train is used to transport people to the evil zone of killer mutants, Woddy Strode has one bullet and the fight scenes are shot in a disused gravel pit. There is sadism as you would expect from an 80s Italian video nasty. No talent was used to make this film.

If this film had been directed by DW Griffith or Stanley Kubrick , it would be recognized for what it is: the best movie ever. But director David Lynch has a unique approach to film that makes the whole endeavor something special and, at times, magical. As a man of film, Lynch has seen many of his own attempts come and go. So it's not surprising that his newest project, Twin Peaks, could take so long for him to find the heart of the piece. But his approach to his craft is quite unique.

I believe the reason this movie did not get the recognition it deserves is because of the many misconceptions of Darwin, pro and con. I would say the real man is depicted here without sterility. He is what he is. Although the movie is but a snapshot of the man the technique of storytelling expanded his life far beyond the years touched on in the movie. This is deep movie, a pondering of modern life and the way we think, and can provoke a study into the man whose thoughts (and other who used him) have certainly affected our lives.

Help ! Once again , Paul Schrader has sabotaged his own intentions with dull , pedantic storytelling . I rearranged my schedule a week or two ago to see him , as he’s scheduled a return date for his show . I’m still not quite over the shock , but at least I know what the movie is going to be like . I guess my only disappointment , is that Paul had no interest in writing or directing a good movie . When I started reading I found it hard to put the book down .

You know I only watched 15 minutes of this film, so I can't really describe how great it is. I mean the concept alone is so original and intriguing it just did not let me go. Then there is the mass of academy award winning people involved here plus the academy award nominated director. YOU JUST CAN'T miss. I mean imagine it is the middle of the night and you're not sleepy yet. This film comes on. You watch it and are shocked. It is so brilliant, so original it is so GREAT.

I watched the first episode and I found it to be a very wooden performance.I have watched the original from time to time and it never fails to disappoint me. If you have a problem with wooden performance I would recommend you to try something like the original version. I don't remember the name but it was really really good.I don't think this one is any good. I'm having a difficult time watching the original on TV. I get bored and just want to turn it off. I just can't with it.

First off , I 'm a huge Bronson fan , have been since the late '70s . I watched every Bronson movie and loved them , I'm not much into action or horror movies . I loved Bronson for his roles as a " straight " person . Most of the movies are about him getting over his wife's death or his relationship problems . There's one movie I have yet to see , but I'm sure it's on the way . That's about it for Bronson fans and action fans . I'm sure I'm going to come up with some more great movies .

If we really want to get serious and find Osama Bin Laden, then we should take this stinker down to Gitmo and force the detainees to watch it. They'll be singing within minutes. Of course, I'm sure that making them watch this god-awful dreck violates the Geneva Convention in several ways. Look, my 5 year old daughter isn't allowed to watch TV at home. So take her to her grandparents or cousins and she's a little TV zombie. She got up and walked away after about ten minutes. That's how bad this is.

I remember watching this mini-series the first time in 1984 with a growing sense of anger and indignation . Having watched it again with my daughter a few days ago, I could not get the feeling of anger out of my mind or heart. So many things in this show made me feel ashamed about what had happened. I couldn’t see it all from the outside but from my daughter’s eyes I could. We are not victims, we are the victims, we are in pain, we feel guilty, we feel as if our lives are in pieces.

Rabbit Fever is a mockumentary collection of sketches, each one of them focussing on a female personal device that was made popular by a single 1998 episode of Sex and the City (the latter half of 1998, rather than the early episodes which were all directed by women). From opening statistics that make Rabbit Fever sound like a soft porn movie, we are treated to a sea of predictable sketches with real and imaginary characters in a world run amok with women's addiction to solitary pleasure.Men, as Germaine Greer rather arrogantly explains, have invented a gadget for women that makes men superfluous in the bedroom.

This "film," and I use that term loosely, reminds me of the first joke my daughter wrote, at eighteen months: "P.U., stinky poopies!" Like that joke, this movie can only appeal to the very young, the very immature, or the very stupid. That said, there are a few bright spots. The effects, where the majority of the reputed $100 million went, are kinetic and convincing -- I mean, as convincing as those kind of kinetic CGI effects can be.

OK , it was a `` risky '' move to rent this flick , but I thought I had nothing to loose. I thought I was going to lose my money, but I enjoyed it a lot more than I expected. I guess I expected something a bit better and it exceeded my expectations. This is a fun flick, even if it is for the kids. The only problem I have with it is it would have worked a lot better in 3-d. I would recommend it to anyone . It is a good movie for all ages.

This film is so 1980 's and that is what I like so much about it . It does an admirable job with its characters and setting but it is also a movie about a father who is forced to do what he feels is best for him to do, and the son who can't accept that he may be forced to marry a girl he doesn't want to and can't understand why he can't have a happy family, or a happy marriage . It also does a good job of being a romantic comedy .

I actually liked certain things about this game . I loved the first person perspective and wish we had had this for more games. It was very interesting to play the game because you had to decide if you were going to be nice or mean. It was like a morality story. I really enjoyed it and I recommend this game to everyone . I would say that it would be good for kids . There is violence but it's not the usual kind of violent games you can get from them . It's not something they can understand . The graphics are good .

We found this movie nearly impossible to watch . With such a super cast , it 's a shame that not enough time was spend on the script and characters . It 's very slow and has no pacing at all , which made it not as enjoyable . I think it 's more of a movie where you can get a little more information from the beginning , so that it 's more about you , and not the movie itself . I thought it was a very disappointing movie , and not worth watching . This movie is a waste of an amazing cast .

Got to confess right up front that I did n't watch this entire movie . I missed the first hour or two because I did n't want to be distracted by my laptop . I have a friend who does n't watch movies so when we talk about movies he is more likely to hear about the movies he watched than the movies he didn't .. I did n't see it at a theater so I didn't feel I would get to see it at all. I read a book review here which was very positive. So I went to see it and I did not want to miss it.

Yes this movie features a gal named Jessica who says everything is evil and she causes trees to land on people too (well she only causes a tree to fall once, but she does say everything is evil). This movie is about a farm that apparently rents out rooms to people, but offers little else in the way of entertainment. Jessica can find things with a stick and she finds the head of an evil guy. Of course they don't know this until the owner of the farm's helpers open the box containing the head.

Okay, make no mistake - this is a pretty awful film, but I actually thought it had a couple of creepy scenes and overcame its pathetic budget every now and then. At the very least it's unintentionally funny in spots and has a definite air of creepiness and discomfort (a face burning scene, the part with the disfigured bride). This baby falls into the "so bad it's entertaining" category to me, and for that alone I would give it a star. The effects are terrible, the acting is abysmal, and the whole thing looks like it was shot in a day.

I was looking through TV Guide last night and saw a movie starring Heather Grahm on, who I liked in movies like Boogie Nights, and Austin Powers, so I decided to watch it. It started out ok, but you could tell the story was lacking, and at about half way through, it started to deteriorate. I do not remember this movie being in the theaters, and I'm sure if it was, it wasn't there long. The acting was stale and unconvincing, the dialogue was silly and predictable, and the story was confusing and stupid.

What I miss most of all in this film is that it lets no place for imagination, everything is said. It is like a documentary film, but not as good as a documentary, because it is no documentary. A patchwork film without a continuous story. Very superficial, nothing to think about, because the film tells you already what you are supposed to think. Too many different problems are touched but none is worked out in order to make you think. I do not even know if it is a funny film that wants to be serious or a serious film that wants to be funny.

I must first mention that as a group of mates, we often find entertainment in wacthing films which are known to be terrible for comedy value, hence our rental of Camp Blood.Camp Blood was the first film which we'd rented that had been shot on what looks to be a camcorder, and was so rubbish it wans't even funny.The DVD was returned and a refund was demanded, with the added suggestion some sort of quality control is implemented to prevent such utter rubbish being stocked.Don't do what I did, and let the curiosity get the better of you, it's so bad it's not even funny.

Much of the commentary on this board revolves around debating the validity of some comparison to R DOGS made on this forum. In short, the debate is whether it is the same thing or not. However, there are many different types of "R" on this planet and we should not be afraid to call out people for who they are when they do something we find unacceptable. The first and most obvious point is that there are many different kinds of R and only some of these are dogs. If you don't see that then we have little hope in your ability to reason as a rational being.

This movie was outright painful for me to watch . I understand that indie films do not have the same budget as Blockbusters but I feel that they are still important to tell the stories that are important to us as humans. I just wish we could see them more. I have seen this movie before, it is called "The Hurt Locker", there are some scenes from it in there, but not much else. I think the movie is pretty good, but I think the ending is very, very emotional. I just hope it has a better ending after the movie ends.

I logged on here right after watching this movie, feeling that it was so awful that at least its reviews might be entertaining. But all you miscreants appear to kind of like it. And so, since I want the job done right...From the opening shot, the movie establishes its contempt for the audience's attention span by showing an entirely unremarkable picture of an irrelevant bridge for a long, long time. Then it goes to some slow-motion skateboarding, which is at least a little bit cool, but then offsets that glimmer of excitement by overlaying the most repellent soundtrack song I've ever heard.

I love watching Australian movies but this steaming pile of crap was just plain embarrassing. The DVD cover looked promising but you know what they say, don't judge a DVD by it's cover. I also noticed that it won Best Actor for an award but the competition must have been really bad because the acting in this film is pathetic. It just seemed that the director thought he had enough talent to direct and act when he should really focus on one part of film-making and get it right before spreading himself too thin. The music was pretty ordinary.

The only reason I checked this film out was to see the `` early '' Kim Bassinger . That , and I really wanted to see if his wife was in the cast , too . And that , and there is something I really like about her on the whole . She looks like she is going to be as tough as nails , and not afraid of what she can do . And she looks good on the whole , and I hope I am wrong about this . And I also really like the whole idea of the character .

I started off being interested somewhat in the movie. It appeared it might be serious drama, dealing with death, grief, and healing, with some realistic human conflict thrown in. Alas, it didn't hold up.I need a movie with somewhat consistent and believable characters. Too many characters in this movie were portrayed as extremely gullible and inconsistent. Look, I know this was not supposed to be Shakespeare, but come on, I need some quality in script and characterization.The acting was alright, the writing not so much. At one point, James Brolin's character is berated for showing up at a picnic under-dressed.

I found this film completely and utterly incomprehensible. I knew some of he facts about Caravagggio, but here they were twisted and puzzling. The images were weirdly interesting but I was looking more for a biographical and/or critical accounting of Caravaggio's life and works, not an LSD type drug trip. The dialogue was very confusing and jumping back and forth in time via the use of trains, calculators, typewriters and cigarettes was extremely distracting. Had it been labelled an "artsy film" I wouldn't have purchased the DVD; now I have a DVD that I'll never watch again and who would buy it?

... out of this movie.Sorry to say , this showed at the Cleveland International Film Festival . Our copy did not have this on it but that should not make a difference in a review . What does make a difference is that if you saw the film and thought it was boring it would not be boring if it was not so bad . The only thing that could redeem this film is if you did not like it and enjoyed it . This is one of those rare films that is just so bad it should not even exist .

His music, especially what we hear of it here, is very slow. From around the time of Bach's death composers had been working out ways of making music progress at a slower and slower pace: over a century later, Wagner and then Mahler wrote pieces that are about as slow as it is possible for music to get. -Of course, one can cheat by writing a 4/4 march and then specifying a tempo of, say, semiquaver = 1, but that tempo wouldn't be the correct tempo. Wagner and Mahler wrote music that is PROPERLY played at a snail's pace.

Under no circumstances watch this film. It is terrible for a number of reasons:No plot No structure No direction No acting to speak of No visual style No tensionIn a word - no.Best thing about it the box and the fact it eventually ends. Who would have thought 85mins could feel so long.Once again: Under no circumstances watch this film. It is terrible.No plot No structure No direction No acting to speak of No visual style No tensionIn a word - no.Best thing about it the box and the fact it eventually ends. Who would have thought 85mins could feel so long.

This movie was painfully awful . Most of the movie consisted of people running in the woods , walking thru the middle of nowhere and trying to save themselves . Its like a B movie . It had so many flaws that are hard to describe . It was not worth my $10 . There was no way this movie should have been allowed to have its way and make such a mockery of itself . The idea of it was interesting , but once it had gotten going there was no saving it . I'm not sure that I want to take it out in front of kids .

Wow, there are no words to describe how bad this movie truly is. I usually pride myself on being able to enjoy any movie no matter how bad, but this was just too much. I would only suggest watching this movie as a torture device. If you can get past the terrible plot and dialogue by watching it on mute, the even more terrible camera work and shoddy special effects make this movie a real horror. If your thinking about watching this because your a Sandra Bullock fan, don't even bother as she has less than ten minutes of screen time, and her acting is absolutely atrocious.

Down at the Movie Gallery , I saw a flick I just had to see . It looked like a movie noir from the 1930's, and to my surprise I liked the movie. It was called The Girl in White. I have seen that before , but this was so much better, because it took place on a ship, and I think I had never seen a boat in the movies that was anything like it. I have always wanted to see how the movie was filmed, but never thought it was possible. Well, you can.

`` Catchfire '' or `` Backtrack '' as it is sometimes called , is not very good . That is not because it's not very fast but because it is not flexible enough . When it comes to flexibility it has some limitations , which are a little hard to understand , and not at all clear at first sight. However , once it's learned it can be extremely powerful, and very powerful in some areas. So I will try to explain some of them so that they will make more sense. To use Catchfire as it is now , you must be aware of some limitations .

Even if you do not typically enjoy documentaries , odds are you will find this one fascinating . Not only does it provide a unique look into a life and career that many people would never know, but it also shows the struggles that the men and women involved were faced with at every stage of their lives. There are several aspects that stood out to me and others that are worth mentioning. First is the use of archival footage and interviews. When the camera is not on the subject , you can always tell who is who.

The pace of this movie is quite slow. It takes about 70 minutes to get Katie to China (which we know that she will) and leaves 30 minutes to wrap things up. The storyline is so predictable that you know everything after about 5 minutes. Nothing surprises you. I guess that the movie is a coming of age movie but the movie is full of stereotypes that are quite over the top:Katie - A beauty that realizes that looks, boys and shopping isn't everything. She realizes that she can "feel" and "see the real world".

After their star cross-country runner dies after a race , the members of a track team are stalked and killed by a psycho killer who is on a revenge trip. But it turns out that the killers are actually running for their lives as they're hunted by the only person left to stop them -- the one man who saved the men from their pasts. The killer, however, isn't human. He's a vampire who can kill anyone at any time, and can't be killed unless the vampire dies first.

i ca n't even describe it . it 's the worst movie i 've ever seen ( i 'm being really, really polite here ). -i had a friend who would go out to dinner at his favorite restaurant once a month and eat there every week for two years. i met him through work, but i never knew his favorite restaurant. they were all very nice, but i was never sure whether he really liked them because he never told me. eventually i gave up asking. -my sister used to make me watch movies for no reason.

I watched this movie which I really thought had a promising beginning but then it just led me to feel disappointed in the end. The problem I think with this film was that the director was trying a bit to hard to make this film weird and original. There were too many flashbacks and too many bad "effects" which got me annoyed through the film. I love Debbie Harry and Isaac Hayes but they disappointed me in this film, they could of done much better. This film seemed promising in the beginning, dragging in the middle and then disappointing in the end.

Saw this at the Hong Kong International Film Festival, over three years ago. I went in with no expectations since Christopher Nolan was a no-name at the time, but it sounded interesting and turned out to be one of the best things I saw at that festival. It worked well on the big screen, with the technique of cutting the scenes out of sequence adding to the mood. Mr.Nolan gave a good account of its making at the end, enough to put anybody off starting out as a film-maker! I liked it better than Memento although this was, perhaps, due to the lower expectations.

Yep , it 's me again ! Mr ' I sit through crap so you do n't have to'.What do you mean ? Do you work at a video store ? And if not , then how did you end up here ? I don't get it , it's like the guy from the other day , but without the money ! Or the one from the day before . But you don't have any money ? And you have no shame ! You think you are better than us , and you have no shame at all .

Take a bad script, some lousy acting and throw in a politically incorrect morality tale and what do you get? Something that is supposed to pass for quality family viewing.Seven Alone is the story of a family in the 19th century who travel across America in a wagon train, hoping for a new life in Oregon. There are seven children (three boys, three girls and a baby whose sex I'm not quite sure of) hence the title of the film.The story opens up with the family living a seemingly normal 19th century life on a farm in the middle of nowhere.

This movie took me by surprise. I first saw it more than 10 years ago, and it stays with me still. It's got it's just plain boring points, and I, personally, would have ended it differently- this has not in the least bit discouraged me from watching it over and over and recommending it to others. The acting is _fantastic_. The cast and director do an amazing job with the script, and anyone who likes 'different' movies, who has the patience to sit and say, "What the hell is this?

Taken the idea out of a true diplomatic incident "The Wind and the Lion" is a very good adventure film set in the deserts of Africa.El Raisuli (Sean Connery) head of an Arab tribe kidnaps an American woman(Candice Bergen) and her two children to obtain some concessions for his country out of American president Theodore Roosevelt (Brian Keith). Out of this simple plot John Milius gets a very complete and enjoyable movie in the genre.The outdoor dessert locations, an impressive color photography, very well handled action sequences and perfect settings turn the picture in a sort of epic one with an undeniable sense of greatness.

This weird movie from Texas is about Fallon, a dilettante rich boy in the late 1800s (although he looks like a 60s C&W singer with greasy hair and sideburns) whose ship wrecks on an island owned by Count DeSade (pronounced de-sayd) with his captain. The count is afraid of pirates and tortures a young girl who was once a pirate hostage and also tortures the captain. Meanwhile, creepy former nurse Cassandra tells Fallon the secrets of the castle. The Countess has leprosy and went mad! Fallon is trapped but brings supplies. The captain is killed by a racist-caricature slave.

Deepa Mehta 's `` Fire '' is groundbreaking , bold , and artistic . A masterful social commentary on the present political state of U.S. race relations , Mehta turns her fire on many of the country's most destructive institutions , including the criminalization of black people, racial profiling , and economic inequality . This is history's most important book and a must-read for students of social justice and critical race theory , as well as students of the American experience . But in order to understand its significance , you have to know the author's personal story.

I saw this film in the movie theater. I was taking classes at the Second City Chicago and of course the buzz of this movie was intense. It is a Woodward film about one of Second City's Native sons.Everyone knew about Johns history. Everyone knew how he died. Some even knew that the lore did not make him out to be particularly friendly towards women in improv or comedy.But hey. the man led his life and he was loved intensely by the people who were in his world, and lore also states that he treated all of his close friends with love and respect.This movie.

Chop Shop , the second feature from Ramin Bahrani , is a rare breed . It is an American film , shot in the United States , based on a book of the same name that was first published in 1973 . It was the first novel by the Iranian writer , Sohrab Sepehri . In it , a young Iranian man travels from Tehran to Beirut , and from Beirut to New York . But , he never returned . He was murdered , in 1978 . Bahrani , who was born in Tehran and is of Iranian ancestry , went to Los Angeles , in the 1970s .

Hubie -- like Stanely the troll from Bluth 's A Troll in Central Park -- lacks the spark of personality. But this isn't a fair comparison because he doesn't use the term "trolls." Instead, he uses a term like "lumbersexuals." He uses this term because he doesn't really have a good definition, but it has a kind of meaning to him that he uses to try and describe what the women in his life are like. Because, like, what do you call someone who looks for sex but doesn't actually want to get sex?

This movie was the biggest piece of garbage I 've seen in a long time.It 's marketed as as Sci-Fi. But you would know this movie would never work. It is not based on actual fact. You know it is not based on anything. The movie is so bad, it just makes me want to vomit. It is an example of what you can do to an actor to destroy a career. I have no idea why they would put him in this movie, but I'm sure that they should have just thrown him out on his ass.

This is the last episode of the Goldenboy OVA series. Kentaro finds himself working in an animation studio, which is rather interesting if you don't know anything about the way anime studios were run. Besides episode 3, this was probably the least risqué, but it had a nice girl interest, as well as a surprise reunion from others in the previous episodes. My only complaint about this episode is it seemed a little too short, but at the same time this may have only been because it was the only original script for the show that wasn't based on one of the manga chapters.

Years ago , I used to watch bad movies deliberately . Somehow I missed this one . No gesture rings are in this movie . You won’t be able to avoid bad movie . But it may be just like you . The movie was called “ I’m a Bad Girl “ . The name of the movie was so bad . I don’t know why but I must watch it as well . The film is in Hindi with the same cast and same crew . The film is directed and produced by Anurag Basu .

This movie starts off on the wrong foot and never really gets it going . The first scene shows a man going into a bar and getting hit in the face by a drunk man . The bartender tells the drunk man to go on back and finish off the man who was already in the bar . So the guy goes over to where the man who has already gotten hit in the face was standing and pulls out a gun and shoots him . The story goes on to the next day when he gets into a car and heads over to where the other man has gotten shot .

I watch Lackawanna Blues every time it comes on . It brings back happy times for me . I grow a lot of my friends in those years. I see them grow into what they are now and it brings tears to my eyes to think they might never see this day . I love them. Thank you for your part in this story. Thank you for taking the time to speak with me. P.S - I just found out about this event. I'm planning on watching it. I just want to know what happened in this story to make this possible.

Julie Andrews plays a German spy who falls in love with an American pilot Rock Hudson , while on an American troop transport in the Philippines during World War II. The pilot dies on their arrival in Tokyo. The film received negative reviews and was not released in America until 1958, when it was released on videotape by United Artists . Plot

A young German woman named Helene von Stauffenberg lives in Berlin, but after receiving a telegram telling her that she must leave Germany for the United States and marry a pilot, she takes the train to Germany.

Doe-eyed high school student Kathleen Beller is found beaten andraped in the opening scenes of this made for TV movie. The filmthen flashbacks to the few days before the rape, as Beller isharassed by a stranger.Beller and Scott Colomby and her best friend Robin Mattson andDennis Quaid are double dating early on. Beller's anxious parents,laid back Tony Bill and shrill Blythe Danner, wait at home wringinghands and so on. Right away, the 1970's makes its datedentrance, as the young couples discuss the romance and love in"Three Days of the Condor.

In addition to the fact that this is just an abysmally made film (imagine giving a camcorder to the average high school drama club) the people who think that there is anything "real" about this legend need to grow up. This is the 21st century. Guess what: ghosts don't exist. Most people learn that from their mother when they're about 5 years old. You guys seriously need to grow up.The fact that a fraud was perpetrated nearly 2 centuries ago does not make it any less a fraud. The fact that a large number of inbred hillbillies from Tennessee believe it doesn't do it either.

The only reason there is a question mark in parenthesis is NOT because I have n't seen every film released in his lifetime. It means the movie that I saw and rated was NOT on the list. But then again, I'm a guy, who is in no way able to judge the films of any male. I can only judge movies based on my personal liking. I am surprised that people are willing to listen to a male critic who is able to judge only the films of males, when he is able to give an opinion on films made by females.

Story of a strange love and a fall desire . Poem about beauty and his perfection , fear and touch.A man ,who love , and his beauty and fear . He loved me like no one else could do. I was everything that I had ever dreamed of in a woman, but he was too perfect . I loved him so much , even though I was a little scared of him . But it was not my fault that he wanted me. That was all on his part. And it was my way of reacting to his love .

it's a real big bummer that people easily are able too make movies because of cheap digital video cams nowadays. usually I would appreciate this possibility but if you see movies like this it's just a big shame. and it's also big shame if people like h.p. lovecraft get abused by the likes of this. I rented this "movie" cuz of the drop "h.p. lovecraft" on it. and I'm a big fan of many of his adaptions, mainly those done by brian yuzna & stuart gordon. this movie has nothing to deliver!

Now , lissen you guys , I LOVED THIS FILM , though not quite as much as FAREWELL TO THE LOST , which I also had on the list. And I would be very sad if this got released since I love this film so much , it is my favorite. I was very surprised it got released so soon , and if it did get released , I probably wouldn't go to see it , but I really hope it gets released, because it deserves it , and also , I thought I might as well share my thoughts about this movie , since it was so good .

Al Pacino was once an actor capable of making a role work without resorting to constant use of profanity. In other words when he could act, he didn't have to talk like some street junkie. McConaughey must have been impressed by Pacino because he became a promoter of the "F" word also. This might be the kind of society that they actually live in, but most of us have the common decency to watch what we say in mixed company. I don't recall the exact words that a professor used in explaining the constant use of profanity, but it was something like this.

I love old "monster movies" for the pure camp value. This one does not disappoint if you find that sort of thing amusing.The acting is pure 1950s stilted crap. You do get used to it when you've seen enough of these... the dialogue is very silly and ultimately forgettable. You're just there for the giant bird.The "science" in this movie is hilarious. A monstrous otherworldly avian that can manipulate anti-matter... intent on wreaking havoc and eating people... an alien who has come to Earth to nest.

Although it was dark, depressing, and at times hard to watch, You Are Alone held my attention and was refreshingly honest in its dialog. It truly captured the angst of teenage romantic relationships. In addition, the soundtrack was amazing. The lyrics and the tone of the songs complemented the sadness of the film so well that it made you wonder if the tracks were created specifically for the movie. Jessica Bohl is the best actress I have ever watched. Her compelling and believable performance made the movie. It made me wonder if she really IS a prostitute. Who knows.

Any one who writes that this is any good there kid may have worked on it or put money in to this god-awful college experiment. It was lousy, slow, and painful to watch. Running time of only about 84 minutes, it felt like three and half hours. The only person to blame is the director, who knows nothing on how to direct a scene, where to place the camera! 95% of this dreadful movie was shoot by long master shots. Two or three people in the frame talking or yelling forever( or what seems like forever), No close-ups!!

No spoiler needed to steer you clear of this ... well , bizarre film . Canada becomes part of the world's second-largest economy at the end , but it's not going down quietly. The film tells a very different story from that told in recent years by the country's prime minister and the prime minister-elect, Justin Trudeau. Trudeau had, as a child, a fascination with the country he would later call his second home. That fascination has blossomed into his ambition to run for leadership of the country he grew up in.

This episode sucks.Over the past few years I have watched all episodes of "Next Generation" and "Voyager" and am now watching "Enterprise".I am thoroughly enjoying this series. Until this episode. I stared at the screen in horror at the destruction of character and entertainment. It is more like an attempt at slapstick.It does not build the characters but throws them out on a limb - and leaves the audience gasping. It does little to build the series.Why this was ever allowed to go to air amazes me. Was it the writing? Was it the directing?

The world now seems to be in an odd stage of downsizing , in which objects such as DVD and CD players, televisions, and microwaves are no longer in demand because of their small screen and low price. At the same time, mobile phones with touchscreens and internet connectivity have made their appearance, while other types of devices such as digital video recorders and other electronic devices have become common. The downsizing trend is accompanied by a shift of the market to the low price segment, and is accompanied by a tendency of the market to adopt “upgrading” instead of new sales.

When I first saw the trailer for this film, I really wanted to see it. I thought some of the director's other works were quite good, but I must say I was disappointed. The plot involves a young woman, who lives with a widowed father and two his two sons. They move into a well-guarded community, yet all is not as it seems; a sort of Twin Peaks. The woman begins to see, or not see, things an people. During the first reel, I had a hypothesis, and thought, "this can't be the whole reason?"

**May Contain Spoilers**The main character, a nobleman named Fallon, is stranded on an island with characters so looney and lethal he might have been better off drowning. Count Lorente de Sade (pronounced "dee-SAYd") talks to his own hallucinations and sees all intruders on the island as invading pirates. He routinely beats mute servant Anne and tortures his unwilling guests in the dungeon. Inadvertant laughs are provided by giant "Nubian" slave Mantis who talks with a Deep South accent and helps de Sade hunt down trespassers in the style of THE MOST DANGEROUS GAME.

This film reeks of production line planning. It appears like the filmmakers looked at recent hit movies, and threw spaghetti on the screen - Jimmy Stewart! June Allyson! Anthony Mann! Baseball! War! Baby! Airplane! - ROLL 'EM! - The film does address the age of the Stewart/Allyson performers; though, I'm certain we are still supposed to think they are much younger.There are messages in "Strategic Air Command" I found curiously shocking and offensive, but I'll stick with one truly wretched element: The happily married couple is challenged when Mr. Stewart's character makes an important decision without consulting his wife.

My son Adam ( 5 years old ) is a big Scooby Doo fan . He like this film a lot . And he loves the new one . He likes this one too . But when he was watching this film he cried . I told him that he can watch it all day and all night he loves the movie . But he was very sad . He said , I am sad because Scooby Doo died . I said that I am sad too because Scooby died . He said that he loves Scooby , he loves Scooby more than dad . I said that we can still do some things .

People call a 976 `` party line '' to talk dirty to strangers , and perhaps meet up for a few beers . It's the number you've dialed if someone calls to chat with you on the phone . It can be the first call you make after you get home after a night on the town . The service may have been available years before it came up on your caller ID , and has been around for a while . But it wasn't on your computer . In fact, you probably have no idea what a ``96X,'' as it's called, is for .

River's Edge is an extremely disturbing film written by acclaimed American screen writer Neal Jimenez.It is based on an actual event which happened at a time when most of American youngsters were trying to make sense of their lives.This is one of the most outstanding films made by American director Tim Hunter.Much of film's attention is focused on a reckless murder committed by a feckless teenager.This unfortunate event sets in motion a whole range of questions about real motivations of youngsters in American society.Those who saw this film during its initial release must have had vivid memories of great actor Dennis Hopper in a confused role as a sympathetic social outcast.

Had the fun pleasure of viewing a new independent film called `` Half Empty . '' I usually go out of my way to write reviews of films I know nothing about. There is nothing to learn about such a film from the reviews I write about it and I would rather not waste my time by spending my valuable time discussing with you about the film. I want to review the film for my own entertainment as much as you do. I don't have the time to go through the film and explain the plot of the film to you.

I see that C. Thomas Howell has appeared in many movies since his heyday in the 80s as an accomplished young actor.I bought this DVD because it was cheap and in part for the internet-related plot and to see how much older C. Thomas Howell is; I do not recall seeing him in any movies since the 1980s.In just a few words: what a very big disappointment. I give some low budget movies a chance, but this one started out lame. Within the first 15 minutes of the movie, this elusive woman is chatting with an Asian guy in a chatroom.

I saw this movie on a show that was showing bad B-movies and trying to get you to buy them but I ended up going to the theater with a friend and it turned out to be an awesome movie. I can't wait for the next one because it's the only one I can see that is not a B-Movie! First time I saw this movie it was on TCM a few months ago and I have been wanting to see it ever since! The reviews I've read on the IMDB have been stellar and I'm sure that's the reason I was drawn to this movie so much!

Okay, so Gus Van Sant wanted to remake Psycho in color so that he could bring it into modern audiences, who would probably go into cardiac arrest if they were ever forced to see a movie in black & white, while they conveniently forget that both "Clerks" and "Schindler's List" were filmed in black & white and are great movies.Unfortunately, the same narrow-minded people who wouldn't want to see a great movie just because it's in black & white are the same people who wouldn't like "Psycho" anyway, because it doesn't have a murder or sex scene every two minutes.

This film is about a gap that exists between the real world and the world of the dead. There's a lot of mumbo-jumbo about the internet (i.e., if you install a program on the computer, you see dead folks--much like if you play a videotape you'll die in RINGU). Frankly, most of this seemed rather silly and lost me. What I did find interesting is the idea that the dead live within their own separate existence--being totally alone for eternity. This was sobering and fascinating.I love Japanese films and have seen a huge number compared to most Americans.

This was by far one of the worst movies Sandra Bullock has starred in . Ben Affleck should stay behind the camera and direct . The rest of the cast is not much to brag about , and I don't really care . If I had a daughter I think I would have told her that when she was in her early teens she should leave her friends behind , and when she grew up she could decide for herself which friends she wanted to keep around her. If you want to follow your dream , that is up to you.

"Wagons East" is widely known as John Candy's last movie, as he died on the set. That's just what makes it so sad: not simply that Candy suffered a fatal heart attack, but that it was on the set of such a crummy movie. Seriously, I don't know what they were thinking when they came up with this piece of crap, but the flick has NO redeeming qualities. It's as if they took every unused script for stupid westerns and just mixed them together and filmed it.

Robert Aldrich's brutal, quasi-black comedy "The Grissom Gang", a reworking of the 1948 British film "No Orchids For Miss Blandish", has 1920s heiress Kim Darby kidnapped by a pack of clumsy thieves; soon, that gang is dispatched and poor Kim is then transferred into the clutches of another crooked bunch--third-rate gangster brothers with sweaty, pasty faces and a mother who looks like Buddy Ebsen in drag. At first, Darby (not very plucky, and not very smart) attempts to escape this drooling brood, but they're onto her.

A look at three geishas who are way past their prime . Now they look back on their pasts with regret, as they are just trying to survive and stay relevant today. They are also in their late 20s or early 30s. Geishas aren't really known for their longevity, but in the case of Kyoko and Yukiko they are at least in their early 50s. They are both now living in their parents' homes and have no immediate plans to go to work, but their lives seem to be a constant struggle to keep afloat, despite their efforts to do so.

The back of the DVD for this movie raves , `` Chey is the Quentin Tarantino of Christian Films . . . one of my favorite directors and writers . . . and Chey . . . , `` is in his prime . . . Chey always delivers and so do his actors. ``Chey is one of those rare producers who is a real visionary . . . one who makes it seem effortless. Chey is the kind of producer that you want on your label . . . Chey produces the kinds of films that you expect to have on your label . . .

Oh boy . Films like this really bother me . If this movie is supposed to close to truth , why isnt there any evidence . There isnt anything to prove this a real case . If there are no evidences , it doesnt mean they are real . I mean , if you have the evidence , why cant it be in the movie ? That movie wasnt about the truth , that movie was more about how to manipulate the viewer . That's how fake it was . They did a great job of it . The fact is , when a person hears what the truth is , it isnt very believable .

First of all , even IMDb is slacking with this movie , as the list of cast is VERY ``inadequate`` for the movie. There are only 3 actors cast for the movie, and it is almost a waste of the time and efforts of people to cast only 3 characters , especially those who are not famous. That is why I would rather go with a movie which has decent cast , even if it is not in the same genre. As a movie which has ``average casting`` , and with the cast as it is , you will surely enjoy the film .

I read Angels and Demons about 3 years ago , and I can honestly say to is one of the most powerful books I have read to date . I have since then come to love it . I loved it from its opening sentence, “A man walks into a bar .” It was written as an introduction to a book, not a synopsis or review of it . In fact, the book’s description is that it was written to be read within the first 5 chapters. The book then continues to introduce us to each character we meet.

Yah. I know. It has the name "Sinatra" in the title, so how bad can it be? Well, it's bad, trust me! I rented this thinking it was some movie I missed in the theaters. It's not. It's some garbage "movie" made by the folks at Showtime (cable station). Geez, these cable stations make a few bucks they think they can make whatever garbage movies they want! It's not good. I am as big a Sinatra fan as any sane man, but this movie was just dumb.

"Hey, I didn't order no cab!" "Yeah, well you got one..." What can I say about Hack...what a man among men. He was a heartened ex-cop turned cab driver with a heart of gold. If you were able to (and fortunately for America's TV viewers...one person per week was) penetrate the cold, hard surface of Hack's exterior, you got to see a caring man devoted to vigilante justice. The show was superb, I laughed, I cried, I smiled...all in the same episode.

Okay , I grew up on Who , but have n't loved a Doctor since Tom Baker . Christopher Eccleston and Matt Smith are two who have had a long and storied run on Doctor who. For me , Matt Smith and Tom Baker are the two most iconic Doctors in the entire history of the show . Both of them brought an air of honesty to a character who many fans loved to hate . It is my honor to introduce to you two who are the best Doctor in Doctor Who history . The two Doctors are now married with children .

As someone who was in a Pan-Hellenic sorority, I wasn't sure what to expect when I tuned into this show. After seeing so many over dramatizations in "made for TV movies" and the craziness of the reality shows, I was curious to see if Greek would be able to show the true College and Greek life experience.I was very pleasantly surprised at how the show was able to give the viewer the satisfaction of identifying the ever-familiar characters of this genre, but it was also able to add depth to the characters. Greek life isn't just about parties and petty conflict.

`` The Journey '' is a romantic version of the cold war . It 's about an English woman ( Claire Danes ), who is forced to move to Moscow in order to be with her father and her young daughter. She has an affair with a young KGB officer ( Vadim Borisov ), who falls for her and becomes her husband in Moscow. When his work gets in the way he leaves, but their love is still strong. She then has to find a new lover in London to make her husband go to Moscow to take care of a sick person.

If good intentions made a film great , then this film might be one of the greatest films ever made . but the story that director james bond has been trying to tell his entire career is as interesting and original as the idea that he tried to bring to life . it might be the most original movie you see this year . the story is about a young couple that get married in the summer of 1961 and live happily ever after . they are so happy , in fact that they forget to tell anyone what is happening in their lives .

The centerpiece of Lackawanna Blues is the character Rachel `` Nanny '' Crosby , who runs a boardinghouse and provides for the family in a simple yet charming way. But as with the rest of the city, Lackawanna has gone through hard times. `` I've seen a lot of my friends and acquaintances have to give up or sell their businesses because of the economy. The only thing we had going for us were our families and friends, so I wanted to do something that would help out the community,'' she says.

I just saw this on TCM tonight and was shocked at the over-acting by Jean Arthur . Her bugging her eyes is what I remember about her, especially in 'Curse Of The Pink Panther' where they're bugging her eyes out as she's about to do something that will have consequences (if she does what she thinks she has to do) and she's scared to death, yet she can't stop herself. She's like that in the end. I don't remember much about that film, I had seen it when I was about 12.

When the circus comes to town and places the lion's cage directly over Bugs Bunny's home, Bugs ends up somewhere in the range right between freaked out and intrepid. Despite the title "Acrobatty Bunny", it's only at the end when Bugs and the lion perform acrobatics. But even leading up to that, it's quite funny what Bugs does to escape getting eaten; somehow, he always manages to use the other character's weakness against him, and then pull any convenient object out of thin air! Bugs later ended up in the circus in "Big Top Bunny".

This movie made by the NFBC was made in honor of the Montreal Canadians dynasty years in the 50's,60 's, and 70's. This movie has no nudity, no sex, and very little swearing and fighting. It is about the love of two good looking young men, and their lives and relationship with each other. The two young men get in a feud over the girl, with one wanting to take her, and the other wanting to keep his. The two love each other and become best friends over a period of about a year.

I loved this film , Independent film-making at its best . The cinematography , pacing , rhythm , and acting is outstanding . The music and the acting is perfect . Some scenes are just so perfect that you will have to rewatch the movie again. This film was well worth watching again. This is an excellent film.The acting is excellent , the acting is superb , the editing is well thought out and very well produced. I would say it is a very good, solid film that takes itself a bit too seriously but that is fine by me as I have seen this film and will not be back for another film .

I believe this film was made for the not so princely sum of £8000 but that didn't really show. There wasn't anything amateurish about the production or the acting, the characters were gritty and real and the location could have been any desert area in the world instead of a not too warm beach just north of Aberdeen. The actors were quite easily acceptable as a bunch of mercenaries stranded on a mysterious, deserted and uncharted planet, none of them seemed to be particularly friendly with each-other but were willing to fight to keep themselves and their comrades alive.

While this movie is not the most entertaining in the world , I think it is better than most over the top action films of today . The action sequences were awesome with a good story to back them up . The movie was not as good as what i expected to see . Not too many flaws . The only thing that bothered me was the editing which seemed a bit off . There is nothing wrong with the movie , it just did not do what was expected of it . Overall though , I think this movie is worth your time and money .

This movie was much better than I expected. ++++ Jean Peters actually does a passable job as a pirate and does decent work in her sword fights. (To the extent she may have a double doing the action, it's hard to tell...but Peters herself obviously is doing a good deal of it, and doing it well.) ++++ With a good and serious script, this could have been an excellent film. But it's basically cheesy. Still entertaining however. ++++ Not up to a regular Jacques Tournier film, but definitely above a regular Jean Peters film.

After seeing a preview for this film at my local mall where there is a stand for purchasing foreign films, the first thing I saw was that this was based on a novel. I’ve been meaning to read the book for awhile, so when I did, I knew I had to check this movie out. What was great about the film was how it was shot – it really feels like you are inside someone else’s mind. Alicia, played by Eva Green, is on the run from her past. She is hiding in her apartment, as her past catches up with her.

That distinction has to go to THE DUNGEON OF HARROW. At least Ed Wood's misguided attempt at making a quality science fiction film had the dubious "star" power of Bela Lugusi, Vampira, Tor Johnson, Criswell and Lyle Talbot. THE DUNGEON OF HARROW has no redeeming qualities whatsoever. What could have been an interesting and suspenseful plot about a marooned aristocrat on a leper colony, perhaps in the style of THE ISLAND OF DR. MOREAU or MYSTERIOUS ISLAND, is trashed by the heavy dialog and mono tonal acting of amateurs whose lines sink like lead weights into a sea of stupidity.

This movie is amazing. You will NEVER laugh harder. It's a target. No, I think it's...yes it's...A BOOB! This movie gets funnier by the second--like when Jackie Chan's character finally dies in his final fight scene. This movie is velly velly seekwet like treasha! Congrats if you buy or rent this. You'll never return it, in my opinion. I didn't, and I haven't found it in a store since. I watched this movie once and I was forever in love with Kung-Fu action flicks.

It is by far the most definitive film on the police force which I have seen . Although not directed by George Cukor he did produce and direct the movie, he was an executive producer. It was directed by Joseph H. Lewis and it was produced by Edward Lewis, it is an excellent film, one that every cop should see. I just saw this and it's a very good film, especially in the second half, where you really get to get to see what cops are really doing on a day to day level.

They call this film `` euro trash horror '' . Well , it 's not horror . The film takes its cues from the gory slasher films that were so popular in the mid 80s . A young couple are about to celebrate their wedding anniversary. One night when they are alone in the country the wife is murdered and the murderer leaves behind a bloody footprint . He then goes after her husband . Now this is not a typical slasher . This is more in the vein of the exploitation films of that period . But i did like the idea of the victim being married and the wife being a blonde who is attractive .

A special unit of four police detectives are dispensing justice in their own unique way in 1950s Los Angeles . . . and it has nothing to do with a jury box or a justice system. It’s called the Los Angeles Pardons Unit, or LAPD PARDONS, and the four members of this unit are themselves lawyers. One of the four members is a retired L.A. district attorney who used to have an office down the street from my father’s firm in the heart of downtown, and he was the one who convinced the police to set up the Pardons Unit to administer justice and keep criminals from going free.

First of all , I personally adore Demons and Demons 2 , I saw them although it was hard to believe that it was a remake they were so original, they had a very dark tone, dark graphics and a dark sense of humor . I believe that is where the charm of the series lies, it not only had the humor but also the horror factor which made the series even more intense. I have only watched part of the series and I must admit that it is not for me, I find it to be one of the best horror shows on the TV.

The producers of this picture are Hungarians . It 's not by crazy artistic momentum that X and Z are able to perform the trick they perform in this picture . . . well, perhaps not exactly by art . . . but certainly with an intensity of creative genius never before seen in this film . I 'll explain . . . I 'm trying to learn Hungarian now . . . my wife (who speaks better English than me) and I have only just begun . . . it 's very exciting . . . but the way they speak is so beautiful, and they use very simple words .

Well, I have been to a British University, in fact I went to the one in this very film, and it was nothing like that. This is a horrible, badly made and acted film. Worst thing is, it could have been really good, if they bothered to spend more that 12p on it, in fact if it really wanted to represent true British Students it should off acted like one and took out a 15 thousand pound loan. It says nothing about Uni life, where was the bush diving, the tea drinking till 4am, the endless chats about group dynamics???

Watching this film today I got the feeling this thing was missing about 10 to 15 minutes or so from the beginning. I know I’ll get some of those details when I watch it again, but I didn’t notice. That being said, this movie is very good. I’ve said it before and I’ll say it again. It is very good, I have a feeling it is one of those movies that you will want to watch again many times, I am pretty certain that is how it was for me.

Black Scorpion is a fun flick about a groovy female super heroine who wears leather tights and drives a car. She kicks ass and kills guys with an umbrella. The plot is simple. The characters are also simple. In the end, the movie is just a good old story about a good old woman, a bad bad guy, and a little girl who has to grow up first. The story begins in a small rural town where we meet the local sheriff, Bob, and his new deputy, Sam. They just bought a nice house and the sheriff says that Bob is going to have a party.

First of all, I would like to clarify that I consider this one of the funniest films I have ever seen. I have watched it almost 10 times just because I've wished to spread the deliciously tasteless innards of this film to other unsuspecting victims. It has the captivating essence of a hand-held camera recording of a distant nephew's seventh birthday. It has all the writing of a WWE match. And most of all, it has the consistency of a face scraped along a sidewalk. This movie is a masterpiece.The film begins with an almost instantaneous mutilation of three, drunken teens in the desert.

What can I say about this? Such a big Prestige-Production - but in the End? Wasted Time, wasted Money.This work a disaster is historically seen. Only some examples:* Augustus often is named 'Gaius' - his First name (Pronomen). But the old Romans don't used this Name. Correct would be the Surname (Nomen Gentile and Cognomen) or the 'Octavian', 'Caesar', 'Augustus'. * Livia was shown as tyrannic Wife. But this historically wrong. * Iulia was shown as nice young woman - but she wasn't one.

Six out of seven people who took the time to comment on this movie have very positive responses. The one negative review happens to reside (or did) on the first page of the movie's location in the IMDb.I found "What Alice Found" to be one of the best movies almost no one's heard of that I have seen this year. It's 6.4 rating is misleading and may be more a function of the difficult subject matter than the quality of the movie. Who would think that a movie purportedly about truck stop prostitution would be worth seeing?

I got this for my birthday in a box set under the name Broke Skull. Well, after watching one on the DVD and being pleasantly surprised, I popped this sucker in. It was worse than I had expected, and I didn't expect much. This movie is basically a convoluted story about a guy who dies and comes back to life with the mob, and other bull crap. There was some interesting ideas in this that were never followed up on. Now everybody has been saying there was a lot of gore, can somebody tell me were?

I'm a huge fan of zombie movies and this is just a pathetic attempt at one. I find the best features of zombie flicks to be the sense of solidarity and a need to survive. This movie focused more on a "let's just make it gory" view.The movie was full of bad acting and even worse special effects. When the zombies emerge from the floor and take the guy down, there is blood just spraying out of the hole. I wasn't aware that holes in airplane floors bleed so extensively.

The basic plot is good and can be engaging. The music is so great that it became the theme music for the TV show IRON CHEF (though it is WAY overused and too intrusive in the movie). So, how did this movie end up so poor?!?! Well, the plot was about 95% predictable and the characters were about as 1-dimensional as possible. And the dialog?! What person would actually allow themselves to receive credit for coming up with the STUPID macho bull-crap that purports to be dialog? You get much greater realism from most cartoons!

This was the most unrealistic movie I ever seen.I ca n't believe that the writer and director did n't see this movie before release.It's just a matter of waiting. I'm glad you are pleased. I thought that this was probably the most ridiculous movie I've ever seen. I was in the cinema for the first time last week, so I didn't know if it was going to be at all watchable. I thought I might as well go out on a high note as it is my birthday today, and it was my first time in a cinema.

The Governess was , by far , a very pitiful film . I do not use this word loosely , because to describe it , you have to be kind to yourself , and I am not that . The plot was not bad . It was the ending , the ending of the film that ruined the film . And the reason is very simple , and very easy to answer, the reason is because in the ending of the film , it was very clear , very clear , that the film was made with the intention of a sexual titillation .

I knew five minutes after the monster made his appearance where his was going. But when I saw the beginning credits, I said "oh my god, Bruce Boxlightner, Walter Koenig (from Star Trek). Gil Gerard (from Buck Rogers, and he's almost unrecognizable), then I saw John Callahan who used to star on my favorite Soap, All My Childen. Put on a few pounds but he can still act. Then there was Veronica Hamill. too bad I didn't sick around to see her in the film. I bailed out 20 minutes into he film.

If I were to pitch this movie idea to some Hollywood bigwigs , I 'm sure it would sound like a variation of "We're going out of town on business, but it's been so crazy the last week and I'm just too tired to even think about packing." I don't actually know if anybody is going to see the movie because they're probably all too tired to go to the theater. I do know the people who will be there will like it. But they're probably too tired to sit through the movie.

I really do n't know why I 'm writting this . I think most people agree that this movie is a bit too long, but not all. I think if they shortened this to about 15 minutes, it would be a good movie. That would make it interesting to watch without getting bored. So I think 15 min is a good cut. But, I really do think they did it just right. I believe that if they had shortened the movie, the result would have been a watered down and boring one. So, I really do enjoy this movie .

I will commend it in only one respect.. it was innovative. Innovative doesn't mean it's a good film, it means that it can give you an idea of what you can take and implement in your own films.The simple plot is.. well.. simple. I got to the point where I didn't care if they destroy the building or not. If I had to hear that girl's annoying giggle one more time, I swear I would hurl the DVD out the window. And there's also the protagonist. They try to make him lovable, but he's a freakin pervert!

Do n't get me wrong , I love most of Paul Schrader 's movies , so it was with sheer excitement that I first saw his debut feature ' Dog Day Afternoon'. He had just started working with Woody Allen at the time and the two were already collaborating on several projects together and had been developing some projects of their own , but it is not known if it was either of those that brought him to the attention of Schrader , who was at the time a struggling writer looking to make the leap to the big screen as director .

First of all, just let me say this... Ghost Story....hello!? !If any of the other people who trashed this movie from beginning to end realized this fact, their reviews would have been very different. The fact that characters kept disappearing whenever the protagonist turned back to look, should have been a dead giveaway. This movie was not billed as a ghost story when you went to rent it in the video store, not even a hint, and that is the BIGGEST mistake that was made by the studio who marketed it.

A horrendous film , ill-conceived and crude . The acting of Anne Heche and Vince Vaughan is so inferior to the rest of this film that one wonders why it was even made . The film is not only unenjoyable , it is bad cinema . We can be certain that it was never intended for the mainstream cinema . It was made by a man for his own personal pleasure . It is therefore a sad day indeed when it will be released on DVD . This film is based on the true story of the murder of a young woman by John Lennon .

I almost laughed out loud when during the commentary the director said this movie is original with a strong plot line. There is not one... repeat ONE original plot line or special effect in this blah movie. The Crows....
