Hitchcock did it superbly back before CGI and even with CGI this film falls short of a well done attack scene. The creepy crawly boy... The Grudge did it and did it better. The psycho...done in Cold Creek Manor most recently, however it has been done to death. No pun intended.

Ahh , nuthin ' like cheesy , explopitative , semi-porn , masquerading as horror ... This one stars Jaqueline Lovell, an American actress . She is in her early 50s , wears very short shorts ( she was born on 2 September ) and her hair is cropped . She is wearing very high heels . She is sitting with her boyfriend in a car and a woman comes from a car in front and approaches the car , looks at him and asks if they have any condoms . It seems like a joke , but I don't think that she has any .

Legendary hammy and arrogant horror movie star Conrad Radzoff (splendidly played with wicked sardonic aplomb by Ferdy Mayne) dies of a heart attack. A bunch of drama school students steal Radzoff's corpse from its crypt and take it to a rundown mansion so they can party with it. Radzoff comes back to life and picks off the rude youths for desecrating his grave. Writer/director Norman Thaddeus Vane concocts a fresh, original, and even pretty stylish spin on the usual body count premise, offers a neat evocation of the glitzy Hollywood milieu, and does a sturdy job of maintaining a pleasingly misty and spooky ooga-booga atmosphere.

TART is the worst movie I've seen this year, and that includes both the Affleck/J.Lo bomb GIGLI and the Rob Zombie borefest HOUSE OF 1000 CORPSES. I don't know if that's a fair comparison seeing that TART was made two years earlier and probably has a budget half that of even the low-budget 1000 CORPSES. Regardless, all three movies suffer from the same shortcomings: horrible script, horrible acting, horrible direction. *** SPOILERS *** (although I honestly don't think there's anything to spoil)TART is about a group of super-spoiled private school kids.

It takes an eternity for this typically over-simplistic and idiotic Stephen King-based film to finally get out of the starting blocks. About half-an-hour is spent on needless introductions to various boring characters and their irrelevant little personal problems that might excite bored housewives and apathetic pensioners in soapy dramas, but this is supposed to be the horror genre (or so I naively thought). The mutt fails to look all that fearsome, which Leonard Maltin, the notoriously clueless/hopeless and always grinning film critic, would disagree with: he considers Cujo to be "genuinely frightening".

For once a sequel to `` The Karate Kid '' without Ralph Macchio ! Hilary Swank did an excellent job in playing her own daughter. Her performance as the daughter was good. The movie was not very intense. I would have liked a better script. My favorite scene was near the end when Ralph gets beaten by a Karate kid and the Karate kid gets the belt. That made this movie a good one. I would recommend the movie. It did not have much acting but the scene that made you feel the movie was made was when Ralph gets beaten by the Kid.

The most die-hard worshippers of John Wayne will cringe when they watch The Lawless Frontier. Even for a poverty row studio, this one is one stinkeroo.Unusual for a western we have a criminal who is a sex crime perpetrator. Earl Dwire plays a halfbreed white and Indian who for reasons that are not explained, pretends he's a Mexican, hokey accent and all. Dwire sounds like the Frito Bandito of advertising fame back in the day.He and his gang happen upon Gabby Hayes and his daughter Sheila Terry. They really don't have anything worth robbing, but Dwire just wants an excuse to kidnap Terry and have his way with her.

How awful is it ? Let me count the ways : 1 ) It is a bait-and-switch movie that starts out with some great music and sound design, but then goes so off the track it doesn't know which direction it's supposed to go.2 ) There are so many good things about the movie and the movie itself, I don't know how anyone could take offense at this movie. I was not surprised by this. It's not the first time I have seen a movie that starts out well, but then falls apart. It happened with "Cinderella Man" way back in the day.

This film SUCKS ! ! It looks like they just chose to place scenes together at random . Good gore action but bad direction ! .I didn't think there was an actual story with the characters at all . The ending just seems contrived like something out of one of those Japanese anime that have no story and then they just make it up as they go ! . It's not even a complete movie . I feel like the ending would have been better like the opening of the movie . First off I will say this movie has it's good and bad points.

This film is just another waste of time. The plot is ridiculous, forced USA drama. The characters were all really weak, especially the uncharismatic Goya and the bad interpretation of Bardem, who only was alright in his classic interpretation, when acting as french ally.Just another chance lost of have spent the money in a good film. I guess it was no a low budget film. Definitely not recommended. Maybe the director's should think a bit whether the film has sense or not before wasting so that money. Maybe they do not bother as they have profits before launching them in the cinema.No more hope in cinema...

This story starts at the end ! So the film's opening credits advise us. Unfortunately that's not true as we then are treated to around 70 minutes of a typical B science fiction movie of the 1950's. The story is dreary; the plot is very weak and has clearly been filmed on a low budget, as was often the case in those days.The story could have covered any situation where people are taking refuge in an isolated house and being threatened by someone outside. it just happened to be adapted to fit round a sci-fi story.The scenery consisted of a few rocks, bushes, and smoke.

Wow . What can I say ? I was born in 1960 . I love bad TV movies . Love watching them . Love watching people who are the same in real life . Love people who are mean . But most of all love being able to say that to someone . I never have been able to meet someone . I never felt like I would . It just didn't happen . Yet I always knew that one day . The day would come . But I always knew it wouldn't be for a long long time . I also knew that I would not be a very happy person .

This movie is an example of small budget,ineffective star cast,weak storyline and poor entertainment. This kind of movies are made for commercial breaks and not for any entertainment of die-hard fans of bollywood movies. I went to this movie because i thought the earlier one gangster was tolerable so this is also. Only thing I appreciate the way new actress put herself in the movie in a very bold way, she very much resembles bollywood actress nandita das. she is good ,sexy and acting well. she definitely go up in her career.

This German horror film has to be one of the weirdest I have seen.I was not aware of any connection between the characters at all until the credits were rolling.I was in awe of how well the actors played off each other.It is the kind of odd film that is a perfect fit for the Halloween season. If you don't live close to the theatre or don't have any plans to make a trip to your local cinema, this might be the movie for you.This one is available on DVD, Hulu, Google Play and other streaming services.

Have you ever wondered why these guys -- Seagal, Stallone, Willis, et al -- manage to survive all those gunfights in which they're outnumbered? I think I've got it figured out. The enemies always miss, and the hero doesn't.Here, Seagal has a pistol and outshoots a half dozen heavies firing at him from a few feet away. One of the heavies has a shotgun. Or maybe two of them have. It doesn't really matter. There could be a thousand shotguns blasting away at him and Seagal would still emerge with his ponytail intact.And when it comes to mano a mano combat -- forget it.

Valentine , a model in France is separated from her lover who is abroad , they plan to meet up for a second chance. Valentines life is not easy after he returns home , he has an affair with a high class escort in an expensive hotel , but his life changes when his lover is caught cheating on him with an unknown man . Will Valentines new life be a success ? Or will it end up with a divorce . Story:

There is no such thing in the world as luck, but there are people around you who can bring luck to you.

It is an interesting exercise to witness the early works of great artists . Sometimes , even without the 20/20 vision of hindsight, one can guess what the works were about without having ever seen or heard them – and even if the artist had no clear idea for what the paintings were going to become, they had to be good in order to be taken seriously as works of art. It is for this reason that a great deal of time has to be spent in looking at paintings in order to make sense out of them, not least the time it costs to see them.

A few buddies and myself have the strange hobby of seeking out really horrendous and utterly obscure (for a good reason) horror flicks and then subsequently watching them under the influence of mind-broadening consumer goods like alcohol and/or soft drugs. Surely a lot of people do this, but they watch movies like the "Godzilla" remake, whereas we torment our eyes and brains with stuff like "The Loch Ness Horror". And, eureka, this is a prototypic bad movie! We open traditionally, with bag pipes music during the opening credits.

I 'm not bothered by the sleazy hosts , nor am I bothered by the cynical , self-righteous stance the so called religious are taking as they have been taking over the last few years , but I do find it very hard to believe they would want to go out with a person who openly admits to their religion's hypocrisy , and their lack of tolerance towards other people's religion and belief's , and yet they are willing to stand by and watch their children suffer , when they themselves don't stand by and watch their children suffer .

Bottom-of-the-barrel stinker is so bad it's beyond funny. The "plot" is about an American mercenary, played by Reb Brown (in the film he's called a "military adviser" but it's not really clear if he's in the American military or not), helping the army of a Latin-American country fight guerrillas who winds up joining the guerrillas when the government turns on him, imprisons and tortures him. Shannon Tweed is a "sports equipment saleswoman" he picks up in a bar who gets caught up in all the intrigue.

First of all, i have nothing against Christianity. i believe, every person has the right to believe what he or she chooses. But i cannot imagine how dumb a person has to be to believe this! What a waste of believers' money. They'd better use it to feed some starving families in the third world countries. I don't want to talk about talk acting or plot of this "movie", because I couldn't find any of those in this. Story's simple - two reporters, one (A) is atheist, the other (B) for some sake has abandoned religion.

An under-appreciated , unseen gem . Estevez does a remarkable job of illustrating in poignant , heartbreaking fashion , the true meaning of family . And the way in which we are all so closely connected and affected by that family . It’s a book that resonates with you from start to finish . We’re really lucky to live in a country that is so accepting of all people regardless of the way in which they come from . But as we all know , some people just don’t belong . And those people don’t need to be accepted .

There was a recent documentary on making movies, that featured a long list of actors and directors talking about what its like to make movies. One common theme was you can have a great script, great cast, the best director and lots of money and still create a bad movie.Down Periscope is proof of the corollary to that theory. Not an original or terribly well written screenplay. A few solid actors, but mostly unknowns, and this movie just makes you laugh out loud! It would be easy to just say that Kelsey Grammar carried this movie, but that isn't truly the case.

Here's a decidedly average Italian post apocalyptic take on the hunting/killing humans for sport theme ala The Most Dangerous Game, Turkey Shoot, Gymkata and The Running Man.Certainly the film reviewed here is nowhere near as much fun as the other listed entries and is furthermore dragged down by poor voice over work, generally bland action sequences, a number of entirely tasteless scenes such as a prolonged rape sequence and some truly stupid and illogical points throughout.Take for example towards the end of the film, when our hero manages to infiltrate the compound of the villains. He initially kills a sentry and leaves him in his jeep.

I rented this movie expecting it to suck , and it did n't let me down . I rented it becuase of the star's name , and I thought they would do a mediocre job of it. I didn't expect anything great and I wasnt disappointed . The only thing I don't like is that the author put his name in all of the credits . I had no clue that I had rented this movie , I was very confused when I watched it.I think I would watch it again because I liked the story , and I really enjoyed the ending .

I went to see this movie with my boyfriend last night. I'm 20 years old and this movie was way too much for ME. I couldn't imagine taking a teenager, preteen, or (especially) a child to this movie. It was crude and offensive. I was totally misled by its PG-13 rating and the previews that I had seen for it. I had originally seen previews for it on Nickelodeon, and I thought that it looked pretty cute (maybe I just don't remember the preview correctly) .

I do n't know what some people were thinking when they said this movie was bad . It Was Great! I have seen a good few films lately, but have never been this impressed and moved by a film. It's almost like you are watching a movie, with all the emotions you feel in a real story, you don't realize you're experiencing it. I would recommend this movie for people who like a film that deals with mental illness in a non-serious way and for people who have never seen a really good film.

This was a sordid and dreary mess . I needed a shower when it was over . It goes something like this . It starts out nice and pleasant . You do something for him . You do something nice for his family . Then you do something else for him and his family . Then another thing . When you are finished . You do something else . And then you do that thing . And then it’s time to do something else . It was not a pretty scenario . I will admit it was hard to watch the man .

Everyone has their choice for `` worst movie they 've ever seen . '' Some like to pick on Gigli, but I think that's ridiculous. It had a good cast, the director was a nice guy and even if the plot wasn't great it had some interesting things in it. But really, it had nothing special. I think the one I liked better was " The Manchurian Candidate . " It was more than a thriller. It had a good cast and good plot, and even though there wasn't too much to it, the plot and the characters made it good.

What can I say ? ? This movie has it all ... Romance , break-ups , rich kids , punks , teenage angst , drugs , sex and rock-and-roll ... I think we all like to be in love. I remember reading about this movie in one of my books in the library. I never had heard of it at that time. But I still liked it and read it from the book because I felt it was an excellent movie. I was in 8th grade when I saw this movie in the movie theatre with the big screen and I was amazed at what the director/writer/actors have done with the film.

I realise it's very hard to live up to the first The 10 Commandments movie (which was grandiose and personally not a Charleton Heston fan) but wow...this movie/mini-series was disappointing. Even the animated The Prince of Egypt was better.The one thing that threw me off was Ramses. Compared to Yul Brynner's version, Paul Rhys's version just seemed so weak and un-Pharoh like. The acting really wasn't that great. For a modern adaptation, I was expecting something better. It just didn't look as stunning visually as the first one.

In my opinion of this movie the entire video portion of this movie was absolute trash!!!! However the soundtrack that was used contained the music of a great heavy metal rock band, I recognized the music as being a band called Firstryke and the album was "Just a Nightmare" and it was very well written!! and I am curious to see what the rest of you movie buffs out there think of it, if can remember back that far I would appreciate the feed back, I collect old movie, and obscure movie sound tracks.

There 's a good running bit about the price tag of a silk negligee . The bimbo in the office will tell you she'll be able to afford one for $100. You tell her the truth--it'll cost $400. It'll probably take her a few weeks to pay off. But when the time comes to take that final trip out, you'll be able to afford it, all right, if you buy it from her." For some reason, I didn't feel the need to argue with her about the cost. Not yet.

I left the theater, and I was only 10 years old. That's how bad it sucked. The plot was horrid and the acting was worse. Leslie Nielson should be ashamed of himself and so should the person who made this movie. I was only 10 years old when I went to see this catastrophe with a friend and even at that young, innocent age I did not laugh once at the movie. We (me and my friend) still laugh about how bad the movie was. We ended up going into the 'R' movie my parents were in.

Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy are the most famous comedy duo in history, and deservedly so, so I am happy to see any of their films. Ollie is recovering from a broken leg in hospital, and with nothing else to do, Stan decides to visit him, and take him some boiled eggs and nuts, instead of candy. Chaos begins with Stan curiously pulling Ollie's leg cast string, and manages to push The Doctor (Billy Gilbert) out the window, clinging on to it, getting Ollie strung up to the ceiling.

Gene Roddenberry never let his fans down . His death ended Sci-Fi legacy that will never be matched . Earth's premier sci-fi author is being remembered not only for his groundbreaking books such as "Fire in the Sky," "Voyager," or "Tales of the Future." But also for his contributions to pop culture as a creator of such iconic characters as Captain James T. Kirk, Spock and Star Trek's Captain Kirk himself . Star Trek’s “The Undiscovered Country” was an original science fiction TV series which debuted in 1978 on NBC, followed by three sequels in 1979, 1981 and 1983.

Just watched this on DVD three times - Once the 'normal ' way , once with the scenes in consecutive order and once with the scenes in time order. They are all very good! I don't really know what is up with DVD's - they have so many problems, but here are some of the most important things I think we should keep in mind:

Most people are happy with the "normal" way of doing things - because they don't really understand why it is so difficult for us to follow the "normal" way.

Strange, often effective hippie zombie flick, starring the unforgettable husband/wife team of Alan and Anya Ornsby, this movie isn't as bad as most in its genre, but is still way high on the cheese-factor. Includes several bargain-basement zombies, outrageously campy dialogue, a scene-chewing performance by Alan Ormsby, several gay/kinky grave-robbers, and one straange soundtrack. Wife Anya puts on a performance that's so odd, one has to wonder if she's really acting at all. There are much worst pics of this kind during the era (look for any Al Adamson flic), but it's no Night of the Living Dead.

I have never seen a more unrealistic movie than this foul piece of dung. The acting was over the top. The direction was tacky and amateurish. The script was just a joke. The story looked penned by a person that has never been around a high school football game, much less a professional game. And why, why did Oliver Stone feel the need to place himself in this movie as an actor? He was terrible, playing the most unrealistic announcer ever. He could not even get hired to do professional wrestling contests. Then you have Jamie Foxx, who throws like a girl.

I love this show . It 's clever and very well acted . David Morse and Andre Braugher have great chemistry and are superbly talented . I feel this show will not last forever . You just have to get the right mix of actors to give it longevity . I can see it ending in April . There's still one more season or two to go and it is only the first season . Just like any other network , HBO will change its format as to how to end each season and how they end each episode . This show is just great . It's a must see .

One of the more prominent/popular episodes , but clearly one of the worst . A red-shirt female falls for Khan while he is working as a driver for her father , but he becomes enraged and begins harassing her , as if she has done something to him . He then drives her off into the sunset. This episode was horrible. She was a prostitute and he is trying to get her to leave. I don't understand what she did to deserve his wrath. I can understand why someone would make an excuse and go after a john who was raping her.

I went to see this film because it was recommended to my wife and she wanted to go.We were both trying to look at our watches well before the film ended, in order to see how much more we had to endure. Two hours and six minutes long, it is. It's divided roughly equally between battle scenes (about a dozen of them, all more or less interchangeable), and plot development.One would have thought that with the subject being the son of a minor tribal chief who conquers half the world, plotting would have been relatively easy.

Ok, if you like yer monster moovies sullen, stiff, starchy, and thunderously dull, but with lots of throttling, then head right for "Lady Frankenstein", a stagy, costumy Italian corpse-walker. Joseph Cotten("Citizen Kane")plays the crusty old Baron himself, and must have really needed to make that condo payment. Sexy Sarah Bay, who has played in cow-ntless European B-films, usually as Rosabla Neri, including "Hercules Against the Moon Men", plays his ambitious daughter, a surgeon in a ruffled prom dress.

A spaceship in some unspecified future where human beings are equipped for space travel and have laser guns for weapons. The spaceship contains a small library, which contains a volume by a certain author. This volume was discovered by the main character's grandfather, and was the reason for him joining the spaceship in the first place, but the author died long ago and his heirs were unable to decipher his book. The ship was built before the main characters were born. Their father had to travel to a far off world to get the building materials.

I caught the first screening of Driving Lessons at the Tribeca Film Festival . Rupert Grint shows he can act and direct at the same time, so I was interested to learn that he is also a musician. He played two songs from one of the new movies I saw last week (Mud, which also played at this year's Sundance Festival, and The King's Speech), both of which got big laughs from the audience. Rupert's voice and guitar skills are obvious here, and it was an enjoyable experience hearing his songs in this film.

This movie is a gay love story disguised as a tale of graffiti and friendship . Not ONE review described it as "a true coming of age tale for gays." They all said it was a love story. And it was. But the way they worded it, it sounds more like it was written specifically for straight guys who wanted to see how much more loving they could really get than what they'd gotten before in movies. Of course, the real reason that it got a 3 out of 4 is because it features a straight couple in drag.

Wow , Stella Shorts are great ! Lots of patrons from The State and Stella , the TV show . They look great . I like the look of Stella Shorts ! I was looking at them yesterday for my daughter's school uniform. They have an interesting look to them I liked them so much I ordered some more for me . I think I will have a couple of pairs I will need to add to my wardrobe. I have been working out a lot in the last 2-3 weeks. I am still in pain and my right arm and shoulder are killing me.

This is the worst movie I have ever seen. The story line is a joke, the effects are terrible, the cinematography doesn't fit the tone of the movie, the dialogue is cheesy, and the actors do a good job at screwing up the rest. People just don't act that way in real life situations. My question is: Who would fund such crap?The movie starts where some miners fall down a mine shaft after a fireman fails to save them. Next we join some bikers in a forest who ride around doing stunts on their bikes.

What can I say about this movie , it really is one of the worst gay themed movies , ever made. When my friend told me the story of the movie I thought he might be joking , but turns out he was actually correct. So what the hell is going on , I ask myself ? Is this a straight film , or is this based on a gay male story or a story with a lesbian twist ?? The only thing that makes this movie bearable is that it has a good cast , I mean what else would you expect from two great actors such as Danny Trejo and John Leguizamo ?

I am an avid Julie Andrews fan and I just watched this for the first time on DVD -- the DVD has just arrived! So I thought I'd do a Julie Andrews binge. I've been following the Julie Andrews saga since I was young, when she played The Boy with the Thorn in His Side in the 1954 film version of the classic children's book by E.B. White (it was my first introduction to Julie Andrews). The movie took three years to produce, as she was contracted to make only two movies. But the studio wanted four.

This is possibility the worst and most disappointing film I have ever seen . I 've spent four years at the Academy. This is not a movie for the young and the elderly. It is so full of holes in the plot, characters and the script . It is so bad I can't think of another review I could offer . It has no soul and no humanity . If you are in the mood for a good family movie , this isn't it . It has no heart and no soul . If you enjoy a good comedy , it is not your thing , either .

This is an odd movie . On the surface it 's no different to many other d-grade gore movies but there 's something different about this movie . I've watched it on cable a few times and it always left me cold . There's a reason I only watch new movies . But this was different . There was something in there that just kept pulling me in . There's something about that one shot . I've seen a few movies with that same shot , but this was different . I just kept thinking ' this is one of the most bizarre scenes I've ever had the pleasure to view . '

This film is undoubtedly one of the greatest landmarks in history of cinema. By seeing this film,we can only retrospectively notice that world cinema in 1950s had such a purely humanistic dramaturgy,such a strong and adequate use of sound-image montage,and almost religious admiration of ethical choices in human life. Cinema was then not only one form of arts. It was much higher than ordinary life and it gave many people hope to live after the tragic war. It is said, that even Picasso was moved and cried that such a work of art can appear only once in 100 years!

Never mind the serious logic gaps , never mind the achingly cliche character portrayals , never mind the haphazard writing , never mind the uninteresting plot, it’s still a pretty good adaptation of a pretty decent book. And if you’re not going to like it, then what the hell are you doing here? You can’t like a film like this if you haven’t tried the book. And even though the book is over 30 years old, you’re not going to like it if you haven’t tried the movie adaptation.

I didn't really HATE Mirrormask. I just really wanted more from a movie than pretty visuals. The movie begins with a young girl named Helana who works in a circus. But while other children (supposedly) want to run away to the circus she only wants to run away FROM the circus. During a heated argument with her mother, Helana wishes she would drop dead. Bad move. The mother gets ill with...something (presumably cancer) and needs surgery. On the night before surgery she dreams she travels to a wonderful world composed of her her dreams and nightmares where she "finds herself".

A recent re-issue of the French crime film (original title 'Du Rififi Chez les Hommes'), with its famous 20-minute silent jewel heist sequence, now comes in the US in a gorgeous new print from The Criterion Collection with improved subtitles and some extras. Jules Dassin was an American (born Julius Dassin in Middletown Connecticut) who was forced to make films in Europe because he was Blacklisted. Rififi was well publicized in the US and did well in art houses. Later Dassin became a lot more famous in the US for 'Never on Sunday' (1960) starring his wife, the Greek actress and political activist Melina Mercouri.

Assy McGee is an out-of-control , hard-nosed detective based on the countless examples from late 20th century police dramas . he is a hard-nosed cop who is only interested in catching bad guys , and who believes that justice will be served quickly , whether or not it's in the best interest of the city and its residents . he doesn't care how it's served , just so long as it's done . if you don't care how he serves justice , you will be disappointed , and if you aren't disappointed in the justice served , he will have failed you as a reader .

Set in the Philipines , Lethal Panther 2 is a dreary early-90s martial-arts action flick which sees a reckless cop (Robert Davi) on the run in the countryside. He's been kidnapped by a ruthless villain (John Rhys-Davies) and his gang of thugs. When the officer manages to escape a second time, he sets his sights on the villain - but it's not to be. The film is filled with violence, but never really hits the nail on the head for me. There are some cool fight scenes, but they don't quite work for me.

A buddy and I went to see this movie when it came out in 1980. It was playing in a huge theater and we were the only two people in the place. It lasted two days in the theater before they stopped showing it. It was so bad that we laughed all the way through it. Since that time, we rate movies based on Kill or Be Killed as the worst movie of all time. Like other reviewers have mentioned, it is so bad that it is funny. It isn't worth a second look that's for sure.

This is by far the worst movie i have ever seen . Its been a few years since I saw this movie and I will never watch any movie with a white man in it EVER again. It is not even worth the $1.5 million this movie is made for. This is why white people are afraid to watch black movies because we know that there are going to be so many stereotypes and so few white characters in them. How would you feel if you saw this movie with a black man or woman in it? White people will NEVER see that movie the same way again!

Caught this film on TCM in the early A.M. It was amazing.Starting out slow but ominously.... Scott is a shady character who preys on women. In this case, two women who happen to be due an inheritance in Southern California.The sets of the beach and neighborhoods of the 1940's are original and intriguing. The title may have been more creative, but the theme and nefarious shadows of human nature are intriguingly exposed, almost in a Hitchcockian version.Scott reminded me of the character Uncle Charley in "Shadow of a Doubt", one of Hitch's reputed favorite films.

At least for me . I have been following the career of Mr. Almdovar since the beginning and I was in awe at what he could do with a little piece of paper, but at the end of the day, it’s not what he does. It’s the way he does it and he’s done a very good job.”

“I think he is a very good ambassador for our country, and one of the reasons we wanted to bring him to our country was to help him in what he could do for the world and for the people who live in our world.

Okay, enough. Every time I think I've seen a film that is so misbegotten, so bad in every way that I think that no one could possibly find something to praise, I just come to the IMDb where I'm greeted with the usual inane "Undiscovered masterpiece" "GREAT film" - I mean, honestly, what movie are you people watching, because it's certainly not the mess I just watched on the new Fox/MGM/UA DVD. There are about three amusing lines, and a plot that gives incoherence a new meaning.

This movie has a very deep look at the relationships between a mother who was raised in a Christian environment and learned that appearance is everything. She and her son, who just recently returned from Vietnam collide in some very tense issues. The relationship has no connections intimately and is a great accurate portrayal of what it is like to live with someone who is false and only looks at the surface of issues. Kathy Bates does an excellent job of portraying a woman of false faith who is either oblivious to her cruelty, forgetful or just doesn't want to be confronted.

What can I say about this ? Such a big Prestige-Production - but in the End ? Wasted Time , Money and Effort ! I was disappointed by this movie. I can't find a single flaw with it , it just doesn't do what's advertised. I have to say that I expected something a bit more than that, but in the end, I have to admit that this movie disappointed me - and I still don't know what it is that the movie is about. In my opinion it's just a very mediocre movie with some great scenes and performances but overall, just average.

A straight-forward X File that shows that action is always the equal of intelligence. Rob Bowman's direction is crisp and sharp, the episode looks just as fresh now as it did almost a decade ago. David and Gillian both give fine performances and both seem to relish the lack of baggage - it's a standalone X File that even non-fans could happen upon and enjoy. Junior Brown gives both the leads a run for their money during his scene with them, he's so convincing that you could believe the crew drove to the middle of nowhere and knocked on the first door they came to.

Goldrush: A Real Life Alaskan Adventure is a great tv film for all ages. The movie focuses around "Fizzy" (Alyssa Milano) who wants to go on travel for gold in Alaska. The only person who hires her is Pierce Thomas Madison (Bruce Campbell). What comes next for her is an adventure she will never forget. This tv film was just great. The acting is #1 (especially by Bruce Campbell and Alyssa Milano) and I also learned some information about the Goldrush. I recommend this TV film to all without hesitation.

I think that a lot of friends of people who acted in this thing must've come on and rated it because I'm telling you, its just awful. The acting is worse than soapopera bad, the effects are like something you'd see out of a 1970 episode of Doctor Who, the story is, well, there is no story. And they keep using the same 2 minute song over and over and over again. And the werewolf? Its like the muppets they used in Wing Commander, the giant cats, remember how bad they looked? The werewolf is that bad.

I have no qualms with how the movie does NOT capture New Jersey ( like Zach , I 'm from Philly ) , but at least it makes you feel for the state, like how it would be like to live there. Not that I want to live there, it just gets you in a "feel" like the movie does. But it does it with a lot more depth to it, in a different way than the movie. I guess this is just a different way of doing it. I really enjoyed it and I hope it makes it to the big screen.

OMG what has Disney done lately .. most of their new shows really suck . Suite life of Zach and friends is good . I also enjoy the live action movies on Netflix .. The Office , Parks and Recreations, The Smurfs . The new Disney Channel Original Series " The Suite Life of Zack & Cody ," will air this fall on Disney XD. It's pretty great . I hope you will enjoy it like i did . You should be able to do that. I believe they just changed the pricing and I can't find an option for it now.

'Identity . . . . I am part of my surroundings and I became separate from them and it's being able to make those differentiations clearly that lets us have an identity and what's inside our identity is everything that's ever happened to us' (Ntozake Shange qtd in "Fires in the Mirror").Pieces like Decalogue V used to intimidate me. I felt that if I accepted them, than I would be compromising something. What I thought before really isn't worth getting into. I understand what Naturalism is trying to say.

The Toxic Avenger , hideously deformed creature of super-human size and strength is back in this sequel that gets mostly right but has its moments where it doesn't feel as natural to the series as others of the series. And, on occasion, it's not particularly funny to watch. It's also not the kind of movie I would've wanted to see a long time after its release. The basic premise is that you've seen the first The Toxic Avenger and you're kind of bored. So you're like: "Why don't I see this?"

Firstly, this is NOT an adaptation of a Stephen King book, short story, novella, or anything else. From EW's Web site, and their review on the show when it first aired, "...he never writes down to his audience, and he never betrays contempt for his subjects. His first original work for television, Stephen King's ''Golden Years'' (CBS, July 16, 9-11 p.m.), is no exception. "The series was apparently going to be (as others have mentioned) an ongoing series, which is why we never saw the ending after the cliffhanger they left us on.

Barricade finds Alice Faye without any songs as a refugee trying to flee China and without passport. She's in a heap of trouble, I won't say what exactly, and even American extraterritoriality won't help her out.I mention that because one of the grievances that the Chinese including the bandits who attack the American mission in this story set deep in the Chinese interior was that particular institution whereby American citizens who committed crimes were tried by American courts set up by our consulates. We were far from the only country doing that however.Anyway the story opens with her on a train for Shanghai trying to use a hokey Russian accent.

I only wish that I had the good sense to turn this movie off in the beginning when I knew I was watching it,” he said, adding, “I watched it, but I couldn’t turn it off. I didn’t like it and it just wouldn’t go away.”

In the book, “The Case for Trump” by Bob Woodward and Evan Thomas, Woodward said Trump had “never been a person of his word and he has never, ever been a person who would say something unless he thought he was going to be believed.

Ik know it is impossible to keep all details of a book in a movie . But this movie has some details , which make it a masterpiece . The story is simple and there are not so many actors . But the performances are superb . We should have seen many more of this film . In a word , we should have seen it at least three times . But one should not complain about the story , though it is short and simple . I also liked how he made the movie with a low budget .

Oh, the horror, the unspeakable horror of this film. If you can even call it a film. This looks like some first-year art school project, hastily cobbled together.The "talents" here will subject you to a painful mix of under- and- overacting, and practically all the scenes were terribly contrived and pretentious.The film in no way reflects Malaysian culture or social conventions - nobody even talks that way over here. I live in Malaysia, BTW.Spinning Gasing seems tailor-made to pick up an award in the foreign film category of some western film festival. And unfortunately, that ploy seems to have worked.

"Hoppity Goes to Town" was the second and last full length animated feature made by Max and Dave Fleischer, who created a parallel universe to Disney. While Disney's films are well remembered today, both of the Fleischer films "Gulliver's Travels" and this one are forgotten. "Hoppity" is a spellbinding original, not an adaptation like the first picture. That is a major plus, one would think. No, the critics, rarely on the Fleischers' sides to begin with, tore into them for this.

I have n't seen so many people packed outside a theater since Star Wars Episode III . Both shows sold-out their 2,000-plus-seat capacity. “We had more than two-thousand people standing in line outside for hours. And it was just to see a play,” a ticket rep told me as we waited to talk to the first few dozen people inside. As I was walking away, the rep said, “It was incredible. They loved it!”

I took a deep breath, then realized it had all been worth it.

I posted on IMDb on this series recently, giving a snail mail address at the commercial arm of the BBD where one would write to appeal release. I wrote to that address, mentioning Sam Waterson and his popularity prominently. I just received the following reply: From: emilyfussell@hotmail.com Subject: Oppenheimer Date: May 14, 2006 1:44:00 PM MDT To: kk2840@earthlink.net Dear Kate, I work for the BBFC, the British equivalent to the MPAA, and we classify DVDs and videos as well as films in this country.

Review : Nunsploitation films . They 've been around since forever . A few that pop to mind are the classic " Nunsploitation Films " and the less-than-classic-but-tasty "Nunsploitation" , a movie that is now in my possession . The first movie in the series was actually pretty good with a good script and some good acting . As I recall it was very similar in style to "Honeymoon in Bali" . The problem was that the lead actress was pretty bad in this one ( I believe the movie was released in 1988 . ) Nunsploitation: The First Films

It's been many years since I watched the first movie .

Once upon a time , way back in the 1940 's , there lived an actress named Veronica Lake . She was kind of a movie hobo . She hung out at a club where a man named Jack Lord was a regular . Lord was a handsome man who made the ladies swoon . Veronica Lake was a great beauty who had a great body . Lord knew how to get the ladies to go to bed with him , because he always had a little something special . So one evening after the ladies were all out of their clothes , he had Veronica Lake on her back .

So me and my friend are carousing our local movie rental store and are looking for something to pick up. We're trying to find something to fit our budget and not to drive to the theater. One of us is not a movie person and so the other is. So if there is a good rental we are after please let me know. We've seen many of the major ones here but I'd really like a good one I can drive home on the way home from work (we're in Southern NJ).

A remake can be successful. An adaptation can be successful. It isn't relevant whether its a remake or an adaptation.A good movie is a good movie and a poor movie is a poor movie, regardless.Sarkar, I am afraid, was a very poor movie. First of all, just by making characters look dangerous, or macho, they don't bring in an aura about them.What was so brilliant about Nagre(Amitabh Bacchan's character) that we should have been in aura of his 'power' and what showed the 'benevolence' of the character?

Although it was dark , depressing , and at times hard to watch , You Are Alone held my attention and I will never forget the end of that film. I believe I may have been the only viewer that did not walk out of the cinema after the ending because of the fact that I had enjoyed the story enough to watch it in the cinema. But what I learned from the ending of this story is the importance of taking one's personal life into one's own hands if one is willing to live with the consequences that life brings.

`` Go Fish '' garnered Rose Troche rightly or wrongly the reputation of a film maker with much promise.Its then that one gets to the film itself, which is a masterpiece. Its a film in the style of "Cinema Paradiso." It is a film with a very strong visual style and very beautiful and moving music. The characters seem very realistic and one gets to know them. There is a scene where the main female character, the mother is talking to another female character, the daughter, who wants to go with her sister and her lover (her brother's friend).

I've been looking forward to the release of this movie since I first heard the concept two years ago, and I was not disappointed. I won't bother summarizing the story since everyone else has, but I will say that it was just plain entertaining throughout. The performances were great, as was the music, and the main characters were likeable.My only complaints are: (1) the story was definitely lacking; the movie wrapped up very abruptly- in fact the writing became pretty lax in the second half, as though the writers weren't sure what to do with the plot.

Uwe Boll slips back in his film-making skills once again to offer up a scifi horror tale of mercenaries and alien technology. What begins as an action-packed affair quickly evolves into what may be the strangest film of 2013 so far. It's the year of the alien invasion, so it only seems fitting that this year's most intriguing sci-fi entry comes from Germany, from the mind that made Die Hard 4: Die Harder and The Final Cut, Uwe Boll. The film is the first in a new genre, a horror-western hybrid that's set in present-day California.

Junior and his dad start a new life in a new town. It's the same life because Junior hasn't changed one bit. He is still the same rotten brat as before only he's gotten bigger. Dolemite may not have been the first black exploitation flick to come along but it certainly is one of the best. It is a pivotal film in the Black Exploitation genre as where it caused a dramatic shift between the films that came before it in contrast to the films that came after it. It wasn't necessarily a poignant or moving film about black culture and it's fight to overcome issues like racism or anything as important as that, but it was the story of one bad-assed dude fighting "whitey" with his army of hot kung-fu mama's.

Walker Texas Ranger is one of the worst shows produced in the past 10 years . The script for James Gunn's sequel has been a source of frustration to fans for years and is one of the biggest reasons the movie didn't make its way into theaters a second time. Even the cast has been a topic of contention as some actors had to recast their roles in order to accommodate the film. While Gunn was able to work with some actors from the first movie, he had a lot of trouble working with the new cast members.

When the noble Hanabusa clan is decimated by the usurping Samanosuke clan, loyal retainer Kogenta (Jun Fujimaki) escapes with his lord's eight year old son, Tadafumi, and his daughter, Kozasa. They are sheltered by the priestess Shinobu (Otome Tsukimiya), who serves the Hanabusa clan's god, Majin, a vengeful spirit imprisoned in the giant stature carved into the side of a local mountain. Ten years later, Kogenta and Tadafumi (Yoshihiko Aoyama) seek vengeance against Lord Samanosuke (Yutaro Gomi), but are captured in the attempt, and sentenced to die.

A man kicks a dog 2' in the air.A woman kicks a cow out of her bed.A man kicks a violin down the sidewalk.A woman sucks on a statue's toe for 15 seconds.A man kicks a blind man in the stomach.Jesus rapes a young girl.There you have it. Frank Falenczyk : It is n't that I 'm sorry I killed them ; it 's that I 'm sorry I did not do it first. It is an odd thing to realize that for most people, at some point in the past, they have killed someone. Perhaps it is an act of self-defense in which they were defending themselves or their property against an attacker. Maybe it is not so much a matter of killing as of being killed. The person killed is often known by the killer as "the enemy".

Never , ever , have I been as impressed by a film as this little piece about four groups of men who go to a camp on the coast of New Zealand: there’s a group of guys with guns who hunt kiwi in the forests, and they’re not going to wait for the government to do something. And then there is a group of women who go out into the bush and start making films. I've waited 9 years to watch this film, simply because i never saw it advertised on TV. Eventually i caught it and it was well worth the wait. Only the bad dubbing lets it down a little but don't let that put you off in any way. What lies beneath - over hyped and crap. Mute witness - low budget, not hyped at all and very good.

This is a film that I could have loved- and I did not. I give it 3/5. The first half had some good moments, some good dialogue and a few good action scenes.

...a true geek-girl's dream: high tech, high drama, smart guys, steamy sex, and large explosions. (VERY large explosions.) Sam Waterston is so natural in the role of Oppenheimer that tapes of the REAL Oppenheimer sound odd: apparently, he had a voice similar to Ronald Reagan! The triumph and tragedy of Oppenheimer is one of the 20th century's most stirring dramas, and this movie stands as a model of what docu-drama ought to be: the facts are allowed to speak for themselves, while the fictional parts are used to amplify and fill in the record, not to call attention to themselves.

That distinction has to go to THE DUNGEON OF HARROW . At least Ed Wood 's misguided attempt at making a pulp-fiction version of a real-life kidnapping and torture of a young woman in the late 1940s, in which she was kept captive in a secluded dungeon and raped repeatedly by the owner of the place, should have earned him the ignominy of being one of the last directors to be blacklisted, at least in the movie industry. His career as a film director ended when he "forgot" to shoot the final scene of the movie.

* * * * * * Spoilers within * * * * * * * What a dull , predictable book! I couldn’t put it down, and it had me guessing from page one who was going to survive the novel, who would fall and die, and who would not. I’m not going to lie. I was bored out of my skull the entire time. And it wasn’t just the slow pacing or boring characters that put me off. I was also tired and annoyed by all the clichéd romantic sub-plots that made up for all the boring and slow character development.

This movie was outright painful for me to watch. I understand that indie films do not have the same resources as other mainstream films. But there are basic elements of film making that typically you want to adhere to. First off, jump cuts. There are numerous in the film's opening 15 minutes. There are shots in which it appears that two separate takes of the same shot were edited together. What I mean by this is a character will say half a line from one take, and the rest of the line is from a different take. Secondly, the dialog.

When the word `` presents '' finds its way into a title , preceded by a famous name , the reader will usually be expecting one or more things in the next paragraph or chapter. At least two things are guaranteed to happen in a book. First, the title page is the place where the author announces his or her book is to appear. And second, he or she will mention the bookís name. There are several ways to get started with titles, but the first and easiest method is to write a title page that is just an introduction.

Are we allowed to interfere with our fellowmen 's everyday 's life ? Is it possible to intrude upon their thoughts ? Can we do what we please to these 's innermost souls ? We have been taught to believe that the only thing which makes life worth living is one's character and not one's deeds. But our society is very different from what it was in the days of the Ancient Greeks and Romans. If we want to live a better and happier life we need to change and adapt to modern times instead of changing the rules which have served the people so badly for so long.

One of the problems with popular culture, especially when discussing the popular culture of the 1970s, is that mass media - especially television - is usually about four years behind 'underground' media, primarily music. Many people think the 'Woodstock Generation" remained important throughout the 1970s; actually, it was all over at Altamont in 1970. By 1972, 'underground' rock or the 'counterculture' had moved east to England and Led Zepplin, Black sabbath, and David Bowie, early metal-heads and the so-called 'glam-rockers,' who were all 'peace and love' - not.

Normally I do n't bother wasting my time writing comments for junk like this that I forget almost as soon as I finish reading it, however, the time just hasn't been right, and I feel I need to share my feelings with you all. If you've not been following my blog, then you may not be aware that I love to read as many books as possible in one sitting, and that I tend to stick to one genre in particular. When I'm not reading, I'm writing or working from home and my husband is away on business, I don't read much.

If Christopher Nolan had made Memento before Following, then all of the flaws in Following would have been corrected. In Memento, Nolan constructed the switches in time perfectly. We were able to tell when it was the past, when it's current, etc. However, Nolan experimented with it a little, and it just doesn't work. Although he had a small budget and couldn't use color (which is one way Memento worked), it was just too hard to distinguish between time. On the DVD is a feature that allows you to play the scenes in chronological order.

Happy 25th Birthday to Valley Girl ! Great soundtrack , plausible story , wonderful performances ... captures the spirit of a lost city that could be a place where people can find a place to belong and have fun. I am so happy with this film because it gives a new life to a great story I read in a history book a few years ago, the story of a young woman who lived here when it was a great, bustling city. And it did not just disappear because of a fire, but because the people who were here no longer wanted it.

'The 4th Floor' is a decidedly mediocre film starring Juliette Lewis as a young interior designer with a heck of a problem neighbor. Jane (Lewis) has recently inherited a terrific 5th floor apartment from her grandmother, and per agreement with the landlord, gets a ridiculously low renting rate. Her boyfriend (William Hurt as a creepy weather man) wants her to move in with him, but she wants her own space. So she moves in, and weird stuff starts happening, and because this is a B-grade horror flick, there's a dumb, not-to-be-found-in-reality reason why.

Two years after 'Airplane ! ' took off , Jim Abrahams , Jerry and David Zucker cast one of its three lead roles , as a husband and father , who travels from coast to coast on the same plane . In 'The Wizard Of Oz , ' which is the third feature film in the ' Oz' series , they follow this father and husband , who is also a magician . The three lead characters were chosen in order to establish the Oz family as the main focus of this franchise . While the characters are not identical , the basic plot is the same and the same characters were used in each movie .

"Tart" is a good illustration of old the Yogi Berra saying: "If you don't know where you are going, you will probably end up someplace else". Writer/Director Christina Waye (in her first feature) has managed to make a $3 Million movie that ends up someplace else. "Tart" is either a coming of age story devoid of characters that a rational person can connect with, a black comedy without any humor, or a sexploitation movie without anything that is particularly sexy.Unlike the standard Swain film, "Tart" actually employed a competent and experienced production designer.

This movie won a special award at Cannes for its acting and it 's not difficult to see why . for one , it has a great cast , the performances from all actors are superb and there is a great variety of styles which makes for a very entertaining , if not at times a shocking look into the lives of a small group of young people who are dealing with some serious life problems . i'll admit that after having seen it i was still a bit baffled as i had just read the book ( and loved it ) so i thought it must be a bit different from what i had been expecting .

I 'm not a big fan of musicals , but I was always enamored of Ms. Hayworth 's looks , so I had a soft spot in my heart when I saw her perform in The Scarlet Pimpernel , the movie that gave her her fame. So, being the romantic type , it made me want to re-enact this love-filled time in my own life by writing a musical. And, I have. The title of this play is: "You 've Got to Go Girl" and I hope you'll enjoy this musical comedy as much as I did.

The plot - in the future when nearly all men have been killed by a Y-chromosome-targeting virus , a (fictionalised) female scientist comes into possession of the Y-chromosome. When she decides to use it to improve her health, she discovers she has inherited an increased virulence towards males. When she decides to test the effect on humans, she finds out she can easily reproduce with her male 'offspring', and she decides to use the virulent Y-chromosome as a form of genetic engineering to produce male children she can raise herself as if they were sons.

No music . No stupid masala . A reasonably realistic portrayal of the police system in India and based on actual experience. The movie is the kind you want to watch when you're in need of escapism but don't wanna go down to your parents basement to see if your father is home. The movie was a smashing success when it was screened at several prestigious venues and also became a hit with the audiences in the cities and in rural areas. It also has won several awards at national level including the best director award from the National award committee of Film & Television.

I watched the world premiere of this on the Starz Action channel . They call it Vampires : The Turning. I thought it was going to be an action movie . They had me worried . The first part was pretty good and then the movie just stopped. The only thing I got out of this film is that I have no interest in another vampire movie . I thought it was going to be the next The Dark Knight because it was going to be the main villain's name. I was wrong . This was an average, mediocre movie .

This movie did attempt to capture the naive idealism that many young teenaged girls have for fun , friendship , fashion , music , movies etc etc , and it had it's share of heart wrenching moments , but not to my liking . i was expecting to love this movie , but as i mentioned above , i was not blown away like i expected i would be . this movie is not a movie with great music , it's not all that it is cracked up to be . it's a movie that had it's flaws , in my opinion .

I watched this film not knowing anything about it . I had presumed it was a sci-fi b movie of some sort. Then I realized it was an animation and it actually was rather well done and interesting at the same time. You will be glad you did. I would not have thought about this film at all. It is a movie that shows how one day a man wakes up and finds that his body is an animated puppet controlled by a machine. It's a pretty cool animation. But the whole concept is a bit unsettling.

This film holds 7.0 rating on IMDb, so even I sensed something rotten in it's synopsis I decided to try it out. What a waste of 100 minutes. First of all, the 80's were not a good decade for crime and thriller genre. Most of these, in those days were badly done with silly plot (if they had any), so there are very few that can stand out, and even if they were good they are still not very good. The Hit, however suffers from everything that made silly crime pictures silly.

Marked for Death ( 1990 ) spends more time on action sequences , than it does with focusing on its characters , and to be fair it does a decent job of this. The characters are all likable , and the story has a good pace , and its good for its time, and it would have been better had there been more action in the movie, but there is action in some parts, and it is good for a time, and not a bad movie , just a bit lacking . It has some good scenes , but just not enough to make up for it .

I love just about everything the late Al Adamson directed in his long and varied career, but "The Possession of Nurse Sherri" stands head and shoulders above fun yet admittedly grade-Z schlockfests like "Horror of the Blood Monsters" and "Dracula Vs. Frankenstein". This film is actually scary! Am I saying that you're going to jump out of your seat when you watch "Nurse Sherri"? No, of course not. But this pastiche of elements from "The Exorcist", "Ruby", and "Carrie" is one of those nice, eerie little horror movies common to the seventies.

Before I start to tear apart this movie, mark you--I LOVE THE SCARLET PIMPERNEL. That story is one of the best romantic adventures ever written. The movie staring Jane Grey is very good and the musical on Broadway is the hottest thing there. So, I thought when I heard that this film was coming out that it would be great since it was a BBC film.To my surprise, it was a weak, totally stupid story that UTTERLY failed in capturing the gorgeous tale.There were no exciting escapes with daring disguises.

Well , I have been to a British University , in fact I went to the one in this very country , and we had a great time. We were the first students in the country to come here and we have been enjoying our time , so I decided to take the trip back to my old home town to see the school and I was very fortunate to catch the bus in front of the main gate. The reason , I think, is because the bus is the same one I took to go there.

I was expecting a lot from Mr.Amitabh Bachan's role of SARKAR, but am disappointed. Being a Ram Gopal Verma's direction i was not ready for this kind of a movie. Sarkar is supposed to be a strong character, but the movie shows that Amitabh is too dependent on others power rather than his. There is a movie in Tamil called Nayakan based on the theme of GOD FATHER and Kamala Hassan has played the lead. The movie is well directed and the power till the end remains in the hands of Kamala Hassan, not his son.

Always enjoy the Classic Horror films, however, this film was really a big waste of time and if it were not for John Carradine playing the mad man doctor who is able to control human beings through his experiments. This film was made during WW II and John Carradine was a German Nazi working to find a human weapon against the entire world. Bob Steele playing in many roles as a cowboy or gangster and in this picture Bob seemed bored to death with his role in this film and acted like this was his first film.

Dude ... I liked Buffy and Angel as much as the next sci-fi freak ... but this is too much! We can't get back to Buffy! I have never watched Buffy the Vampire Slayer, but it does seem like this movie is trying to be Buffy-like in a sense, with a lot of focus on the sex. That being said, they really should have stayed away from making the sex scenes look like they would look in a '60s show like The Monkees. That would've been way more believable, and they could have kept it realistic.

I mostly rented this movie to see Shannon Elizabeth. She played well in this movie, but the plot sucked. The movie wasn't really about anything just about trying to stay single after making a pact when one of Jerry O' Connell's friends gets married. The other friends put together this money and who's ever last to get married get's the money ($10,000) from all his friends. Anyway the movie just try to follow through by making no since and trying to make it more funny then making since. I'm glad I only paid .50 for this movie.

As I sit back after watching Wong Kar-wai's 1994 movie Ashes of Time  more specifically the 2008 re-edit and re-release with the word 'Redux' slapped on the end of the title  I wonder what went wrong. I wonder why the film just didn't work out at all. I wonder why the movie failed to score any major points in my book. In particular, what was it about the film which dragged it down, and made it the director's worst film of his career?Well it's not too hard to figure out really.

Despite having an absolutely horrid script ( more about that later ) , this film is still vaguely watchable just for the spectacle of director John Turturro's performance, which manages to give the most unhinged character in cinema a sense of humanity. In the end, though, it's a mess and I'm not sure it's worth the five-hour-plus running time. The thing that really puts this film's potential into perspective is that Turturro didn't really know what to do with the material and that's where his genius shines through.

The Hell 's Angels did come out the losers in this movie . Sonny stated to the director that NOBODY was going to show up in a tux. That was a bunch of bull shit . He should have left Sonny in the tux and come out with his face painted white so the press would have known he wasn't with the boys . I am sure Sonny thought he would get a bigger role if he wore a white tux , he would have been mistaken . This movie is very boring . In the first scene with the Hell 's Angels, I thought the director just wanted to show them on their motorcycles .

I kind of like JAG . It do have it´s charm but lately it´s to much propaganda in it . So i´d like to play another RPG . And i want it to be the best one ever made . So why i should go for this . Because :

A new game with great graphics. A great game engine (if you know anything about game engines then you know that there are hundreds of them)

Lots of options for the player in the game. Graphics. Graphics are really important in this game . I think that they are the best that they have ever been in an RPG .

Our family ( and the entire sold out sneak preview audience ) enjoyed `` The Guardian '' . Kevin Costner is great in this film and you won't even know it's not authentic until after the credits. It's one of those movies where you get a lot of information at the beginning that will surprise you the more you watch it. The story is well done and I was impressed by how well it was handled on-screen. Costner played his role with a lightness and a sense of humor that really made his character endearing to the audience.

I had enjoyed the Masters of Horror Series until I came upon this infantile dung heap. This anti-Bush propaganda piece masquerading as a horror film comes off like an episode of the original Batman done by Michael Moore. Political satire should be clever, this however, pulls a ten on the simpleton scale with all the style and credibility of an L. Ron Hubbard film.In its campy, inane way, it accuses the Republicans of stealing elections, going to war for absolutely no reason and treating servicemen and women as mere cannon fodder. It even takes a swipe at the Second Amendment and religion.

Well, first off, the twins are exactly the same. there is no one is girly and one is tomboy (Ashley is taller than Mary-Kate though) and their boyfriends aren't even French, so that is bad because they are faking the accents. Lamo. It is also not that bad, not their best. I am A big Mary-Kate and Ashley fan, don't get me wrong. the storyline is OK and it is funny to watch. it is not the type of movie that you would watch over and over again.

Naruse is typically considered one of the 3 master founders of Japanese film, the other two being Ozu and Mizoguchi. This is an interesting and honest film on the lives of retired Geishas. Whatever happens, when such a woman ages, and loses her charm and mystique? Well, for those who are interested, watch this film. One: Okin, is successful as a money-lender, but the other two have to borrow from her and are resentful. Okin doesn't have any children, but the other do. Okin finds out that her old love is coming to visit her, and is excited.

Mr Bean was great fun, i loved it, every episode was really funny, Rowan Atkinson was perfect for this role, he's a funny looking bloke and his facial expressions were hilarious!!! The series was so successful that they even made a Mr Bean movie in 1997, which was also pretty funny by the way!! It's funny seeing all the adventures and situations he gets himself into, this series was a classic for sure, and i still watch an episode from time to time.Mr Bean is well worth a 10/10 in my book, fans of offbeat comedy must check this out.

Wow , did this episode start on a STOOOOOPID premise ! The Enterprise is chugging along when all of the sudden the entire crew is gone ! Now , the Enterprise is stuck without one of it's crew members but with no power , and no way to find a replacement crew member ! Now I have seen many movies , but this was by far the most ridiculous one Ive seen in a long time !!! The first thing that stands out to me about this episode and the next one are the names of the actors. They were either the most annoying , or the worst characters in the show .

I expected this movie was originally supposed to show before the election. CBS's last shot at throwing a dig at Bush. This movie was just awful yet I'm still watching it. **Minor Spoiler** I think CBS got the same people who "provided" the memo's to do the semi cut in half sequence. What is with the bad boyfriend storyline? Can the acting be more contrived or the dialog more like a Ed Wood movie. Who ever came up with this script please do us a favor stop writing.

If you 've ever been to Ukraine , this movie is absolutely hilarious . From teenagers wearing gold chains , to old men in headscarves and a young woman dressed in a gold bikini , it's a very entertaining comedy that is worth watching. When I was a kid, I watched a TV cartoon called " Daffy 's Dime " that was based on a children's book written by a very well known author . I liked that the author was a little old lady so I guess it's a good thing that his books are still popular today.

I saw this movie because every review I read of it said that it was one of the scariest movies of the new millennium. I really don't understand what all of the hype was about. For one thing, the dialogue in this movie was laughably bad ("What if something strange is going on?"...what????). The acting didn't blow my socks off either. It could have been because the script barely gave the actors anything to work with....the characters are purely 2-dimensional to me and I didn't give a hoot about them at all.

I thought the this film had an interesting name and just might have proved thought provoking , but was I right? When I was a little kid , there was always someone telling me the same story over and over again. You could pretty much count on hearing the story at least once in your life , but that doesn’t mean that it’s any good. It was told to me by my mother , who would tell me how her father was killed in a train accident and was replaced by her mother in his place.

What a dreadful movie . The effects were poor , especially by todays standards , but that was forgivable . The acting was poor , and it seemed like a lot of people were involved . What was really odd is that the movie seems to be a love story , which I thought was really strange . I can understand if the story was told differently , but it did seem like some people had the same problem . The movie was not very funny at all , and that is just a fact . The movie just seemed to try too hard at times .

Don't be fooled by the plot out-line as it is described on the cover (at least the Swedish version). The story on this seems rather interesting, with speculative hints. Nothing can be further from the truth. This is the absolute most sad movie experience I've ever had... It is plain and right AWFUL and should not be sold or rented to anyone. If you still think the plot seems intriguing, reflect on this: telephones can move, run and kill people as can also any other electric appliance. It can throw things at you, haunt you and run after you.

OK , this movie , was the worst display I have seen in years . The actors were n't to good , but not bad and the movie was just boring . There is nothing else to say of this movie . You could not take your mind , eyes and ears of it . This movie should never be missed . The movie is only 1 hour and 30 minute . The movie is not worth watching , even at the midnight movie . I would recommend to watch only in the weekend , not to watch at any time other day .

This cheapo remake of the terrific Five Star Final suffers from terrible acting. Humphrey Bogart stars as the manager of a sleazoid radio station that is desperate to boost sagging ratings. The owner decides to have a series of morality plays written about a famous murder case from 20 years ago. So they hire the fake preacher (Harry Hayden) to track down the murderess, who was acquitted and has been living quietly under a fake name. The preacher arrive on the daughter's wedding day, but the ruthless radio station refuses to back off exposing the mother and ruining their lives.Bogart is always good.

Christian Propaganda ... Lots of fear mongering ... This is not SciFi , this is ChriFi ( Christian fiction ) ... We need more SciFi not less. We need stories that help people cope with things like global warming and poverty and all the horrible things that are going on in the world today. We need to talk about how bad it is and how it is going to get worse. We have to be brave and hopeful. We are not all going to die off tomorrow. It's not the end of the world. It's not the end of days.

I'm not going to say the story of the movie as some people do. I'm pretty sure people who read this will know what the storyline is. I'm also not going to go on and on about everything thats wrong with this movie, because I'll be here for ages if I do. The storyline is typical, and the special effects are below today's standards. This is not a movie you should watch if you are a serious movie buff (as most of us here are) little things will annoy you the whole movie and ruin the experience.

I actually liked certain things about this game. I loved the first person perspective and wish we had had that choice in the first three games. There's nothing like seeing the monsters up close, in your face. The graphics really weren't bad, but I would have liked more things to interact with even though it was just a shooter. The music was fine. The things I hated were: The movement kind of sucked and aiming was a total pain. The story was too lame for words and too much of the same old thing with no originality.

I'm guessing that the movie was based on a hefty book. Given the number of characters and subplots during Katyn, I thought that the movie creators, perhaps the writer or director, intended to create an epic movie. But really there wasn't enough time to properly spend on developing characters or story. Aggravatingly, there were many unrelated side-stories that could have been edited out.In relating the events leading up to the mass-murder of all these intellectuals and officers, I don't think the movie explained any reasons why murder was necessary. Was it political? Philosophical? Revenge?

I started to take a critical view on this adaptation within the first few minutes but as a dedicated Jane Austen fan I persevered through to the end... However, this is not a programme I would recommend to someone unfamiliar with her work as I don't think it does the book justice, nor makes particularly entertaining television in its own right. There was something about this adaptation that lacked believability - many of the costumes and even the actors did not have an authentic look and I found the acting to be, at times, poor.

This has to rate as one of the cheesiest of TV shows in a long time.Jose Ferrer played the title character, Nemo. He did the part justice and certainly looked the part. But nowadays, it strikes me that the Nemo he was made up to be bore more than a passing resemblance to Captain Bird's Eye, from the TV commercials. Or maybe it's the other way around.His nemesis, Professor Cunningham, was overacted brilliantly by Burgess Meredith. He never seemed to get over his "Penguin" days from Batman.

Cheezy? Yep. Poorly filmed? You betcha. Zero budget? They proudly claim it on their posters. Brilliant anyway (or because of it)? For sure.This movie celebrates (and makes fun of) everything that was classic about the 80s teen horror genre: Characters with absolutely no depth, fitting into a stereotyped roll they never escape for a moment; teenagers trying to survive a slaying by some mysterious force they disturbed by doing something lamely adolescent; completely gratuitous nudity; impossible amounts of blood coming out of victims; slow moving zombies; great one-liners... and our hero even wears a Michael Jackson jacket!

All the criticisms of this movie are quite valid ! It is pretty boring , and filled with all kinds of cliches , the script is horrible, and there is no romance in the movie !!! The plot is a bit over the top, and is the reason the movie loses so much audience !!! All the movies in the list are good , so you should just enjoy them ! I am so happy to see you like this movie . The only reason it did not get much of an award is because the film is so bad .

I 'm a big fan of surrealist art , but this film by Bunuel ( with some ideas from Dali ) is so far from what I consider ' surrealistic art ' that I don't want to discuss that in this blog. In this film, we are given the illusion of seeing something that's so strange, even if it is in our minds, it is still a hallucination. This kind of film has always fascinated me because it's difficult for me to find a good analogy to explain what is happening in Bunuel 's films to my mind.

This movie is bad , so bad that my mother who can barely stand the `` suspense '' of Disney movies (I can't stand the suspense of Disney movie's that I've never seen, but that's another story) bought me the soundtrack CD and played the songs she liked the most, so she would cheer me up by singing and humming the songs. I hope you all enjoy this movie. It's not my favorite, but as long as I'm enjoying it, it's worth the money. This is just a movie that's just made a lot of money for Disney.

I got this movie as a buy one get one deal at troma.com with The Ruining (which isn't much better). The main reason I wanted it was to see Star Worms II: Attack of the Pleasure Pods, the DVD is a double feature with that movie. I really didn't know what Actium Maximus was at the time, and when I saw the trailer I got scared. It looked awful. But hey, what can you tell from the trailer? Well, apparently I could tell a lot. This movie honestly made no sens to me.

I've Seen The Beginning Of The Muppet Movie, But Just The Half. Because I Only Watched It At Mrs Kelly's Friend's House. The Songs Were The Best And The Muppets Were So Hilarious. They Learn That If They Believe In The End Of The Rainbow, Anyone Can Make It, No Matter How Small, No Matter How Green(Which Was Included In The Trailer).Kermit Is My Favorite Protagonist(Which Means It Describes The Main Character) And So Are The Other Muppets. Mel Brooks Was Amazing When He Played Professor Max Krassman.
