I really like this film because of all the stars and the dancing and the story that goes along with it. Rita Hayworth was at her most glamorous in this musical and the costumes were gorgeous. Although a musical, I thought Rita Hayworth did a fine performance of dramatic acting in this film as well. As far as her dancing, I think she was excellent. Even Betty Grable pretty much endorsed Rita's dancing in this film as she commented that Rita danced rings around her own dancing and let's face it, Betty Grable was an excellent dancer.

As talk-shows go , Larry King Live is not bad , and since he occasionally gets good guests , it is hard not to like him a bit. On the show last Monday , he got a lot of good guests , a lot of talk and even a few laughs. Here are the best ones that I could find. When it was his time to say the word , “nigger ” , Larry King said , “When I heard it was being used as an insult , it was shocking. ” He then talked about what a great name it is.

One of my favorites non-MGM musicals, it's a classic!> Rita Hayworth is in top form, her beauty leaps out of the screen. Gene Kelly shows off his dancing skills and introduces to musicals his edgy and innovative choreography that eventually would change the way musicals are choreograph. Phil Silvers is the perfect second bananas, and Eve Arden injects this movie with a lot of class. The structure is so theatrical that one has to wonder why, in this era where major Broadway shows come from the movies, Cover Girl hasn't been adapted to theatre.

Irene Jacob is mesmerizing in this final installment of Krzysztof Kieslowski's trilogy and the story is infinitely satisfying as it succeeds in tying all three films together. I am simply in awe of the amount of talent it took to do one of these stories, let alone all three. Everything seems to fit together so precisely, all the elements of filmmaking so eloquently executed, and the end result so much greater than the sum of the individual parts. Trois Couleurs is epic in nature and belongs on any list of great cinematic achievements. Simply brilliant!

Rating : 8 out of 10 . Directed by Alfred Hitchcock.Tennis star Guy Haines ( Farley Granger ) meets the girl of his dreams ( Audrey Hepburn ) in Paris, but they never see eye to eye. He takes her home to his house and, when he reveals his true nature, threatens to leave her if she doesn’t return to his world. She decides she has to. But how can she explain to her family she has left them to move to Paris to be with him, a man who is in love with her?

When I first heard about "Greek," I figured I would watch it because it sounded ridiculous. Another of ABC Family's so-bad-they're-almost-good shows. But tuning in with a friend from college found us both enjoying the pilot episode a lot more than we had expected.As a member of a Greek society, I can say that a lot of the stereotypes that are brought up here are ones that come up almost every time someone starts talking about the sororities and fraternities on a campus. And are also very fun to play with just on are own, let alone to watch on a TV screen.

This is a well-crafted piece from everyone's favorite master of suspense. As usual, the technical elements such as camera work and lighting are outstanding (especially for the film's time). I did not find the first part of the film very exciting, but the latter one certainly made up for it with one thrilling scene after another.The only thing I did not like about this movie was the choice of Farley Granger for the part of Guy Haines. Somehow, I didn't find him very believable. On the other hand, Robert Walker shines as sinister 'bad guy' Bruno Anthony.Overall, I would highly recommend this.

Although I was hoping that I 'd like it a little more , this was still certainly an impressive film. However, this film was very much a disappointment, mainly because it wasn't as good as I expected. The acting was great, and it was very well directed (if I didn't hate the acting myself, I'd say it was a great director - I wouldn't go as far as saying he directed the entire film), but I did not feel that the film had enough plot, character, or the right sort of atmosphere to elevate this from a good film to an excellent one.

Whoa , this is one of the WORST movies I have EVER seen ! The packaging for the film is absolutely ridiculous ! I was ready to hate it but when I started to watch , I was so shocked and in shock , it was so bad , and it sucked me into the movie and I loved it ! I don't know what was in the water , but it must have had a bad effect on people's minds ! I thought it was just a bad joke , but I don't feel the same way now.

I could watch this movie ALL DAY! I LOVE it. Probably my all time favorite movies. But, by the way, "badger1970" there are a few parts with bad language, not TOO bad, but it's not exactly G rated. GREAT movie!!!!! I recommend it to everybody. Any way, it's making me type 10 lines of text, so I am going to keep typing until it will let me post this comment. Okay... Still typing... This is getting annoying. Ugh. I still have four more to go.

This short subject gathered kudos from all kinds of places for its plea for religious toleration. After a session at a recording studio Frank Sinatra leaves and comes upon a group of kids beating up on another because he was Jewish. He lectured them as only an American icon could about the meaning of prejudice and what we had just fought for against the Nazis. The meaning could not be clearer.Both songs from this short subject were recorded and sold big for Columbia records. If You Are But A Dream and the song written for the film, The House I Live In.

it's hard to make a negative statement here after all this raving about how great deed poll is, how wonderful the actors did and so on and so on. i did not like the film. it's crappy!there are orgies, they have taboo sex (gay sex, bi sex, oral sex, rape, anal sex, masturbation, brother-sister-sex, brother-brother-sex, sex on drugs, sex without drugs, sex, sex, sex seems to rule their world. i guess the director is desperately in need of a getting laid.) the story is just dirty and shameful.

Superhero Movie (2008) is the most recent in the long line over "parody" movie movies which I despise so much. I wish this movie could be the death of the genre, but I know that it isn't awful enough to put the final nail in the coffin.If Meet the Spartans is considered the bottom of the barrel as far as Hollywood movies go, than Superhero Movie is probably near the top. Unfortunately Meet the Spartans was actually miles below the barrel, and this movie just barely makes it in.Superhero Movie has a decent cast of C-list celebs.

It kicks you in the stomach. There are other films with more convincing characters, a more realistic story, and maybe even more depth concerning political invocations. But then again, most of these are not directed by Peter Watkins. Maybe the one true genius artist of British Film to emerge out of the 1960s, Watkins has made quite a bunch of rarely seen films that perfectly capture the spirit of the outer-aesthetic world - the world of political ongoings, social problems and governmental solutions. Thus, his work is probably less "filmic" than, say, political, which some may call a weakening of their inherent artistic quality.

The Cat in the Hat is just a slap in the face film . Mike Myers as The Cat in the Hat is a total joke. This movie should not even exist. A movie like this could have been so much worse. You are getting the exact same movie that you get from Disney. If you like this movie go see the movie again because there is no way the story is going to make sense at any point. The plot moves really slow and you don’t get the sense that there is a conclusion to this story.

One of the worst movie I have seen in 2009 so far: The story hesitates between a silly thriller or a dumb comedy.As nothings happens, the void is filled with long, boring dialogs that don't make any sense! The cast is famous but doesn't bring any emotions except to fast-forward the play! And it happens in a plush seaside hotel that looks really gloomy. In comparison, the one of the "Shining" is funfair! NB: a lot of users think that it is located in the French Riviera! They are wrong!

Though I strongly feel that SITR is the best Gene Kelly movie , but this a pretty good one . Sandra Bullock should have received a nomination in Best Actress for this one , although it is rather late for her . The movie is an attempt to combine two of my favorite stories , and I am happy that it turned out that way . Although the story might be too familiar for some people , I believe that it will be more entertaining for everyone . I don't think I am able to explain it very well so please go to YouTube to view this wonderful movie .

First of all I dunno if I was supposed to use my imagination in this film or the director was supposed to do this, it wasn't like they had to pay for it so I didn't have to be a part of it but I thought I could be like the characters and write a little bit and it ended up being something that I like a lot. So I went through the whole film making up little stories about the characters as they did their own thing without me having to do anything. That was fun. I also thought the movie was well written.

Three distinct and distant individuals ' lives intersect with the brutal killing of one by another . The one-hour film was directed by Mina Rifat and is being screened as a documentary at a number of universities and community gatherings in the U.S. and overseas. The story is that of a 12-year-old girl who was kidnapped at knifepoint in Iraq by an Iraqi militia. She was taken to a house where there were three different groups of people living there. She was brought up with the group that kept her at the center of a group of people.

Y'know, it's very interesting watching this... half the people involved with it are now dead...Anyways, it's been a long time since I've watched anything Muppet related, but this stuff is pure gold. I'm a great fan of puns, and this movie has them quite well placed, but one of the amazing aspects of it is its pacing: it's not really high-speed children's pacing where the filmmakers just randomly decide to move the story along without giving the character's depth, it's just kind of moves along with the characters wherever they want to go.Kermit the Frog is just an awesome character.

You know the old saw about a train wreck? The one about how you can't look away? This movie isn't that good. The only reason you're still there is because you brought your kids and you can't leave them alone in the theater. You might catch a nap.Tim Hill should never work in film again after delivering this awful piece of junk. He manages to take a decent comic actor in Jason Lee and turn him into a robotic, unsure actor in this production.I didn't have much hope for this movie in the first place, I admit.

One of the earlier reviews of this movie ends with "Only for big fans of the lead actors or fans of exotic Romance/Adventure Holywood movies...," as if those weren't reason enough to love it! Anyone who, after seeing this movie, complains about Connery's accent, or the lack of historical verisimilitude, or the realism of the political motivations, or any other extra-movie concerns, simply doesn't love movies. See it and be awed by the star-power of the two leads, the exotic, romantic, photography and music, and the bold adventure of a truly escapist film.

Like a lot of films from the early sounds days , Cimarron must be viewed more for historical interest than for cinematic merit. But there is so much to learn from the movie. Here are seven lessons that come to light after watching it, but before you make up your mind one way or the other. If you are a fan of films from the Golden Age of the cinema, this movie is not for you. It’s too bad because it is the only film by the Marx Brothers to ever become a success commercially and critically.

Possibly the worst movie I ever saw . The person who shot this movie probably never learned not to film in the dark. At least they don't need to be shot in the dark in this one. It was one of those times in life where the only way to win was to suck at something. And when you suck at it, all you can do is go back and watch it over. I just wish they had shown more of that first hour. We didn't know who these people were, or what they were doing, only that they were doing something that was very scary to watch.

This movie was extremely boring . I only laughed a few times . I decided to rent it when I saw the reviews but I was only able to finish 1/3 of the film . A lot of what happens is told over in the first few minutes and it makes no sense to me at all . I watched this movie with a buddy of mine and we weren't able to get into it at all . I didn't know what to make of the first 20 minutes . I wasn't able to connect the dots and see anything that would make sense out of what the story was trying to portray .

***SPOILERS*** This movie - called EATEN ALIVE here in the UK is quite possibly the worst film ever made and is brilliant just for that. A sexy rich girl teams up with a rugged action man to search for her sister in the New Guinea jungle. What follows is an unspeakably crap mixture of cannibalism, insane cults and religious maniacs that has to be seen to be believed. The cannibalism scenes are quite horrific but are so badly staged and acted that they prove quite amusing. The cast are awful except for Janet Agren as the female lead who is excellent.

This movie could have had a lot of potential . Certainly with today 's technology , one would expect real science . However , that 's not what one finds in this movie . While one may believe in real science , to believe in this science is not to be believed . So , I have to admit that 's not a movie for me . I would recommend this to children who are into science and not into science fiction . If you don't know anything about what is in this movie , go back to the beginning of the credits and just go to the beginning.

I went into this movie with semi-high expectations after loving the cartoon series in my childhood, and this nearly wrecked that love for me. Jason Lee, David Seville in the film, is horrifying. I understand it can't be easy to act with CGI characters who aren't actually there, but I really found his performance atrocious, along with all the other non-animated characters. The chipmunks were adorable, yet sometimes blatantly obvious at moving the plot of the story along, and therefore did not tempt me to stay in the theater for longer than half an hour into the film.

What I liked best about this feature-length animated film from 1941 is the great feel it gives for the early 20th century, in which children were expected to sit and eat in the back of a streetcar as it went past the houses on the way home. The film's title is a bit misleading, however, in that it has no real connection to the story - it's just that in this particular scenario, one of the main characters was to eat in the back of the streetcar on his way home from school, and he's the only kid in his class who does.

I generally loved the Carry on movies but this one is actually pretty awful. There are very few laughs because the whole thing is so forced.There is plenty of talent on the screen and some come off better than others. June Whitfield, Kenneth Williams, Hatti Jaques and Peter Butterworth are fine but Barbara Windsor looks tired and Sid James is just tacky. Joan Sims comes off well but in the case of the usually wonderful Charles Hawtrey its just plain sad. When you think of the sad end to his career the movie is almost too depressing to watch.

If you are a Christian or a Jew hoping to see an accurate Biblical ( or Torah ) portrayal of Israel you will not get one, because there are no Jews on the stage. The Jews are on the other end of the stage, and do not even know that you are watching their show. In fact, there is an entire Christian movement, called Zionism, that has nothing to do with the Holy Land in the sense of what the Bible describes, but is a movement to restore Israel to what God intended for it when He gave it to the Jewish people in the Holy Land.

1 . The Largest Amount of Money Spent was on the package of hot dogs they put on that guy's head
2 . Most of this money was spent to get a hot dog from the concession stand
3 . How many hot dogs were sold for this? 4 . I'm sure they were sold out
5 . The amount is larger than the amount that was given away
6 . There were only 3 hot dog buns given away
7 . It was not for sale. They were not available for purchase
8 . I think that they were not sold for the same amount that they were given away

3 .

This is by far my favorite action movie. But what makes it work is not the elaborate Renny Harlin explosions and shoot-em-ups. It's the Shane Black script and its deft delivery by Geena Davis and Samuel L. Jackson.The chemistry between the two principals merited a sequel. Thank God it was never made. Too much danger of marring the original. 'The Long Kiss' checkerboards from quotable scene to action scene to quotable scene and back again. Never a dull moment. This has to be Jackson's funniest role ever, and the amazing thing is that he is playing one of the most normal characters of his career.

Okay , it features one lovely blink-and-you-miss-it-joke ( when the dead are rising from their tombs , the names of those who died are written in chalk on tombstones , the tombstones are whitened by the sun , and the dead are drawn back out of the ground so they can come back to life , only for the names of the dead to be erased ) , a very funny bit about a guy who has a secret crush on his neighbor ( who has no idea that he and the guy are actually brother and sister ) , and some more very silly comedy .

THE SCREAMING is a very low budget horror movie that was shot on video . It features passable acting , decent effects , decent story , and a decent soundtrack . It is about a girl who has been kidnapped and has been raped for weeks . The police have taken over the investigation but are not sure what to do with the girl and her captor . The police chief wants the kidnapper and rapist arrested but is not sure how to deal with the girl as she is mentally unstable . He decides he needs someone to take the blame for the whole thing .

The third entry in the `` Stepford '' franchise , but apparently the three made-for-TV obscure sequels are incredibly obscure in Japan. The new film is based on a novel by Stephen King that was first adapted for a TV movie and then as the second entry in this franchise. The story follows an 11-year-old girl named Anna, whose family moves from the Midwest to the upstate New York town in search of a better life. There they find a man killed in a hunting accident, and a girl who claims to have seen his ghost. The film is about as obscure as its name sounds.

Never I have seen a movie so terrible that i 've gone insane . It was a HUGE waste of time . I couldn't believe they wasted so much time and money . Not only were they making a movie about a girl who killed her father , but they made her a killer. How the f*ck is that any way to treat a girl you know nothing about . They should have just had the story of her parents and made her an innocent man who was forced to do the horrible thing he did .

With David Arquette starring you would immediately think this to be a stupid movie. Well, it is a stupid movie with a horrid script. But the F/X, namely the eight legged freaks, makes this flick a hoot to watch. A tribute, albeit on the silly side, to those great mutant creature features of the 50s. Arquette and Sheriff Sam(Kari Wuhrer)summon help in fighting off the toxic waste induced giant spiders wreaking havoc on their tiny town in Arizona. Also in the cast are Doug E. Doug, Rick Overton, Leon Rippy and the charming Scarlett Johansson.

can someone please help me i missed the last view moments and i do n't want to pay money to see the movie again because im too old to have to watch it again and i would rather pay to go see a live show so please someone help me this is important please help me thank you soo much. A:You know, it just takes a few more hours for you to get used to watching movies on demand, but it will save you a few bucks. Plus you don't need to eat, so you can see a lot more of these movies.

Trite and tiring , the one-liners almost made me cry . My 4 year old left the room and ended up going to sleep . I was hoping for some kind of ending . But i had to leave this show early . Too bad , as i really loved the story . I think that it is an excellent movie. I had a few issues with one particular line, but it was not really the fault of the actors, but the director, and the production design, but still, it was an excellent movie.

Citizen Kane .... The Godfather Part II .... D'Urville Martin 's Dolemite . This is the single greatest piece of film ever made. If it wasn't an art film, there's no way it could be classified. It will always have a special place in the hearts and memories of movie fans everywhere. It is simply the greatest film ever made. And, for me, the best film of all time. D'Urville 's DOLEMITE was one of the greatest actors that ever graced the silver screen, but he had to be a better actor than James Arness to be worthy of his performance.

A group of adventurers travel to the 'dark continent ' to try and locate a lost heiress named Diana , who is rumored to have been kidnapped by a band of pirates. Once the pirates are found , the group sets off to take on the pirate's hideout on the island. They make a stop at a brothel, where they are attacked by the pirate crew, and finally arrive at the pirate's hideout - but find themselves under attack by the same crew that attacked them in their boat. In the meantime, their ship is boarded by the crew of the pirate vessel.

Oh f*cking hell, where should I start... First of all; this show is just another stupid American non-funny so called comedy which has pathetic acting and very very poor humor. The American way of laughing-track business makes the whole thing even worse. How come I can hear laughter, yet there's nothing funny happening? Pretty stupid, eh? This show is only for those American people who haven't ever heard that there are far more funnier, better and wittier comedies - not only in Great Brittain, but also in America (The Simpsons for example).

In this follow up to The Naked Civil Servant we see the final years of Quentin Crisp's life in New York. John Hurt is again Crisp (come on who else could play the part?) and its a role he inhabits to the point of disappearing. For me Hurt is Crisp and I've always found it very hard to take the man himself because Hurt was more him than he was himself. Its masterful performance. His equal is Denis O'Hare as Phillip Steele, Crisp's long time friend and confidant.Unfortunately outside of the performances the film has little to recommend it.

I wouldn't recommend this to anyone, except cinema-goers who like to laugh at a film, not with it.Quite a promising premise and set of actors get progressively worse over a film which ends with perhaps the worst ending ever seen in a film. I won't spoil it, but basically the most over-used set of movie cliches get done badly and half heartedly for the most disappointing last five minutes to any film, ever.The movie also includes the most cringe inducing scene ever, the attempt at on-screen chemistry between the two lead roles when we're presented with a close up of Angela Jolie stroking Denzel Washington's finger lovingly.

Jim Carrey is a particular brand of humour and I personally think he's a great actor (Eternal Sunshine, for example).However, this movie is presumably intended to be nothing more than a Jim Carrey vehicle, so be aware straight off that if you don't think his style of comedy is funny, you will sit stony-faced throughout this film, as it has NOTHING else to recommend it.Even if you do like Carrey's comedy, I am not sure you will find this film amusing. I went to see it on a Saturday night at 10:30pm and the audience was definitely ready to laugh.

Seriously I don't get why people are all like "Oh my God Step Up is the best movie ever!!!" It's a bunch of junk! The acting, first of all, is ridiculous, and let's not even begin to talk about the dialogue because it was terrible...Movies are supposed to be entertaining, and this, let me be the first to say, was *not* entertainment. I was actually laughing because I was so embarrassed watching it. The music and dancing didn't do anything for me as well.

As I peruse through the hundreds of comments that loyal readers of the IMDB have posted on this film, I find it very interesting how few ,"middle of the road" comments there are. Everyone either loves it, or they hate it. Having seen Apocalypse Now approximately 30 times, and having recently dissected it on DVD (how did we ever live without those magical digital machines????? ), I can say without hesitation that I am one of those who have a very special place in my heart for this film.

I was laying in bed, flicking through the channels... and boy do I have channels... 500 of them. With over 70 movie channels, I probably watch a movie on cable, once or twice a month... DVD has spolied me.Anyway, I'm flicking through and I come to this movie and because I see Natilie Portman, I take interest. 110 minutes later I am still interested. How could this be? When I first saw the previews to this movie in the theater I remember making fun of it.

If you're looking for a typical war movie, this is not it, so a note to all the testosterone-pumped carnage-craving war buffs out there, don't bother. Although the film is about Russian characters in WWII, don't expect to see any Nazis, cannons, blood, gore, etc. It's not a film about people who cause a war or who fight a war. It's a film about ordinary people who war happens to and the choices they make in dealing with it.Acting, cinematography, writing: all perfect 10s here.

I watched this movie knowing that it would be awful , but damned if it did n't break new and shocking ground . what is really shocking in the movie is the way the plot is told and the things that happen to our heros as a result of their actions . in a sense , this could be the movie where you actually feel for these people because they have no other choice but to go against the law in order to save the life of the girl they love and because they want to save the girl and her unborn child , but that is not the movie .

I saw this film at the 2002 Toronto International Film Festival.This is the first Indian film I 've seen in 2 decades.It made me think about why I left India in the first place-and how I can now make it a better place for the next generation.I don't mean just better for the people of India.But also a better place for me, my kids, my parents.My parents who have sacrificed so much already.I've seen a lot of movies over the years and this was easily the best. 1 comment:

I'm so proud of you! I have never seen an Indian movie!

******Spoilers within******* What a dull, predictable, non-scary snore-fest. The movie had no character development: I felt no empathy towards any of the characters (except may be the small boy), and did not care what happened to any of them. The movie had so many clichéd bits, or elements stolen from other horror movies.The movie was so predictable. Many times I would be saying to myself, "Let me guess, {fill in guess} happens next?" Yup, I was right.

This movie was definitely on the boring side . The acting was decent and the film looks pretty nice , but it's definitely on the boring side . There are many things that could be done better , and it's a great shame that so many people don't seem to appreciate the effort put into it . There were some great things in this movie . But I don't feel that there's enough to make it worth watching twice . . . . . . This was a good movie. It did have a few issues, but overall, I thought it was a great movie.

No blood , no sex ( though it oozes passion ) , no special effects , but just one of those stories that can get a guy all hot , horny , wet and ready to take a huge dick . I love it when that happens , and i love to watch it unfold in front of me , so i hope you enjoy watching . You can find my videos under the Videos section on my channel , and you can follow me on twitter and instagram , or get an email to subscribe and to receive notification when i upload my new videos .

Julie Andrews plays a German spy who falls in love with an American pilot Rock Hudson, while on an assignment for Germany.The songs are beautiful. The two are well-paired. Julie demonstrates a more temperamental side in this film than the nice girl she normally plays. A half-German, half-English girl who sings beautiful and entertains the troops in WW I, Julie sings some endearing Mancini songs. I loved the film. Some will say it's a "chick-flick," but so what. It's wonderful. Supporting characters are somewhat stereotyped.

What a waste of energy and money . What a waste of what talent there was.Emilio Estevez was completely wasted as an MLS player. He should have come back home and made his living playing in the local high school band instead. No, I would have loved him as an MLS player, I really do. But the way it was done? I would rather not be on the planet anymore, than have him on it, so it was just a waste of time and money at the same time. And as far as his talents went, I do not think his skills are that great either.

This one is a hilarious diamond in the rough. The acting and plot aren't that impressive, but the lines just keep on coming. This catches a lot of flack because it seems at first glance like, well, a bad movie, but it's so kooky that you can't help but be amused. The spastic lightening quick dialog and quirky characters keep it going... I was especially fond of Sharon, the Canuck on Shrooms eh? However, the one that really stole the show was Richard's little brother Andrew (Ira Heiden), his high pitched whining was somehow endearing.

I 've Seen The Beginning Of The Muppet Movie , But Just The Half . Because I Only Watched It A Couple Of Days, It Would Take Too Long. I'm Gonna Give It A Chance. As we are nearing the end of our tour, we have just one more show to get to before returning home. If I had a dollar for every person who has said "Oh my god, you must see the whole show", I'd have more than enough money to take my kids on a weekend trip to Orlando. I think I'll pass on this one.

A new wrestling show paves way for the most feared wrestler ever imaginable , the giant Zeus . Network President Tom Fontana is in the middle of negotiations to get a show on the CW, where the wrestling scene is one of the most popular shows on television . But even with a show on CBS , there are plenty of other wrestling shows to watch on the way to the big time. This is a good thing for those fans, who don't get enough wrestling on their television , but could be bad news for WWE , the company that owns all of it.

The first feature length Muppet Movie , and excepting maybe The Muppet Christmas Carol , the movie puppeteers the world over were not too happy with it. The fact that there was such a great deal of footage in that movie and it was made into a feature film made it very easy for those people who have been making films since the beginning of time (and they are still a very influential group) to be critical of it, and there was certainly a lot of finger pointing going on about the quality of that movie.

Grosse Pointe Blank was really quite a below average film. Its hit man theme is very dry and is more like a romantic comedy than a hit man thriller. The acting is very normal. The performances are extremely embarrassing at times with many characters seeming very 'eccentric' and that really annoyed me. The whole reunion and the 'Wow, I haven't seen you in 10 years!' element is extremely cheesy and many scenes just drag on, especially nearer the end when they are at the actual reunion party and the characters are going through each of their former classmates one by one greeting them.

This is a cult classic for sure! !It is tricky to follow at times, but then again, so is a film like Jacobs Ladder or even say Fight Club. If you want standard fare, then i figure go rent the Care Bears Movie or perhaps an old Disney classic. But if you want " to view the world differently" then i would say open yourself up to Enigma's and for that matter to a film that challenges what we see and think.For me the key is that the film was original and had me questioning throughout.

I saw this film when it premiered in LA. I think I laughed 2 or three times. The rest of the time I was in shock at how ridiculous/poorly shot and poorly written it was. Kirby is in fact the only saving grace in the film. I was disappointed at the performance of Larry Bagby , whom I usually find entertaining. If you enjoy watching your friend's crappy homemade short films that they shot on their mom's 8mm video camera then there's a slight chance you might enjoy this film. Then again part of what makes those movies enjoyable is that it's your buddies playing all the parts.

I just had to add my comment to raise the average on this one. Paul Giamatti lets it all hang out in this one and is a hoot. He would probably say it was easy, but he really does a great job and should have won something for it. We've had the DVD for several years and my kids (boy now 4 1/2 and girl 9) will watch this one over and over, and the humor is adult enough that I don't mind having to hear it in the background (and I do run to the TV for the really funny parts).

Normally I don't bother wasting my time writing comments for junk like this that I forget almost as soon as I see it, but since I saw this movie just yesterday on one of the comcast Showtime channels (346, I think) I decided to make an exception.Besides the fact that I enjoyed watching Carol Alt, I can't give any rational reason why I watched this movie through to the end. I'm always amazed that good-looking women are willing to appear in awful movies like this, but I suppose she thought this movie would lead to something better.

Believe me when I say this show is just plain hilarious . The basic story is about Kintaro Oe who is a member of the Japanese mafia. The only thing keeping Kintaro and the other members of his family from joining the gangster group is that he’s the only son and his mother and sisters are all in charge. His sisters want to send Kintaro to college but the mother wants him to continue his criminal life. So, Kintaro has to go to school every day so his sisters won’t have any say in his life.

This film is good in it 's genre and that genre is naturally action with a little/average budget . Looks like it would work well as a trailer . The only negative I had was that some of the action looks a little silly . It may be just me but I think this movie has too much action in the beginning and I was not impressed. The plot was a bit of a mess at the beginning and then it went into a completely different place . The storyline is great . The dialogue is great and the action is excellent .

Or vice-versa.This is a French film noir directed by an American film maker ( Jules Dassin ) who had to shoot in Europe for budgetary reasons. The screenplay is from a French author ( Pierre Laroche ) and is translated into English by Peter Cossar ( author of the best novel in French film noir ) and by a French film critic ( Louis Verneuil ). As a result, there are no French words in the English subtitles, which is not so surprising given the fact that they are made by an Englishman. However, some French words have been substituted for English words.

WARNING:I advise anyone who has not seen the film yet to not read this comment.When I first started to watch this movie my expectations were it was a vampire movie, that is going to be awesome considering how Rodriguez and Tarantino both helped make the film. I began about 15 minutes into it and already my hopes for this movie were down the drain, which shocked me. First, the story it was going with was not at all appealing in anyway possible, and just flat out boring and uncompelling to the point where I just wanted to turn it off.

Tia Carrere was the reason I decided to watch this film , as neither the title , nor the cover, made it apparent what this movie was to be about. I thought it had something to do with The Godfather but was surprised when I watched the movie. This is a great film , but not to be confused with The Godfather Part II , which is the sequel to The Godfather . I give The Godfather and The Godfather II to The Godfather Part II . I think this is a great film but I also think it would make a fantastic sequel .

Terror in the Jungle is a real find. If you saw it, you're one of the few lucky ones. It's hilarious!The story is about an airplane crashing in the middle of the south american jungle. The crash scene has to be seen to be believed. Everyone dies in the crash or they're subsequently eaten alive by crocodiles. Only a young blonde boy survives. A nearby tribes brings the kid to their village and they (all males) venerate him because of his golden hair! I kid you NOT!

As I read the script on-line, I thought "Capote" needed a trim. Having just seen it on PPV, I can tell you it wasn't trimmed, it was butchered like that poor family! Example: in the script, Truman dubs Shawn "Adorable One"; here, he is "Mr. Shawn".Bad enough the amateurs behind this movie de-flame Capote and bash his circle (are we to really believe they thought so little of Nelle, they mangled her little opus like an obnoxious in-joke? ), they turn Perry Smith into this oh-so-sensitive victim, even as he's shown dispatching the Clutters.

WARNING - POSSIBLE SPOILERS! 'Rock Star' is one of the solid rock movies I have ever seen. The original idea of the script focuses on a young singer in the 80s, leading a tribute band of one of the most famous hard rock bands of the period. He is not only playing their music to the note, but also living the life of his idols. When his friends in the tribute band expel him, in search of some originality, the destiny plays him a good turn, and gets hired to replace the lead singer of the idols band.

This film actually starts out pretty interesting but for my taste it degenerated far too quickly into a dull and uninteresting story that never really got into any real depth of story. This film could have actually been quite good if it was better developed and if some of the scenes that didn’t make it into the finished film were expanded upon at the editing stage. All in all it is an enjoyable watch and has some funny moments and a nice soundtrack. It is a movie about a guy who gets caught up in an alien spacecraft that he is trying to save.

A truly accurate and unglamourous look into modern day life. It could be set in any town in the UK. I live in a housing estate in Glasgow and can relate to this film very well.Sadly the situations and characters are all too realistic but not predictable.The actors are scarily believable, I felt as if I was spying on my neighbours. It was an intimate dip into the lives of fragile and hopeless people. I was very moved by a few scenes.I loved the way this film was shot.Overall this film IS a must see.

I normally do n't like romantic films , but I love this film very much . The story is really good , the screenplay is really brilliant . The acting is great . The way the film was shot was brilliant . I am so surprised about the result of this movie . I was very impressed by this film! The acting was fantastic, the story was clever and witty. I was in awe of this film at first , then I thought ' wow , this has been made in my name'

It's a love story about two young teenagers who meet by chance one night.

I caught this movie on local t.v. at about 4:30 a.m. I didn't have expectations for it but after the opening credits I knew I was into something good.There are situations that are left for your interpretation to "find out" what really happened so your attention is a key factor.The whole psychological thriller situation deals a lot with character development and the way things are executed by the main character.Your sub-conscience also plays an important part because through a series of events and dialogs you will be able to make a correct interpretation and generate an opinion.The technical aspects are very good.

What has Rajiv Rai done to himself ? Once a hit director of films like Tridev and Vishwatama is now in debt over Rs 22 lakh and is in a dispute with his producers. When I asked a close friend of him about it , he had said he has done nothing and the only thing he is really concerned about is getting his dues. But he is also aware that something is not right about this whole incident. This is not a first in the recent times where a director can not get the right amount for his films, and he is even being blackmailed by the producers.

I have been looking forward to the release of this DVD (and it's follow-up {Female Prisoner Scorpion: #701's Grudge Song}) for some time. I very much enjoyed the first two movies of this series. After just watching this film, I would have to say that this is probably my favorite of the three. All three of these movies were directed by Shunya Ito. What is great about them, though, is that, even though they all feature the same lead character (wonderfully played by Meiko Kaji), they are each vastly different from the others.

With a name like `` 10 Commandments '' you would expect a film to be representative of the account in the Torah, but it's really the story of a man and his son, a young man who is in love with his father and wants his inheritance, and who is given a great gift of a Torah scroll from his deceased grandfather, but he can't be sure that he will keep the commandments given in it, because he is new to Judaism and is not a strict observant. It is a story of a young man who is unsure of his own Jewish identity and his own commitment to Judaism.

This movie was utterly and unequivocally terrible. The plot was so predictable and boring and the script so corny and pretentious that by the end I wanted to stab my eyes with the nearest pen.Normally I don't write reviews, but I was astonished by the number of positive reviews it got. While I admit that the acting was okay at some parts, the script's deficiencies more than outweighed the decent acting. The only reason I watched this was because a few of my friends were watching it, introducing it as most likely the worst movie ever made, judging by the trailer.

A horrible mish mash of predictable story lines and toe-bendingly poor delivered PC clichés ad nauseam (races working together, the heroine being smart as well pretty, a guy sacrificing himself to save another life, a father/daughter relationship etc etc etc). The movie looks like something created for network television and should have probably stayed there. Even the gifted Tommy Lee Jones does not manage to salvage this BOMB. I urge you not to waste money or time on this cinematic ruin from the time when disaster-movies roamed Hollywood.The two stars are given solely to the CGI-people and the PR-peoples' ability to get even one movie-goer to sit through it.

This is, for different reasons, a very very bad action movie. First of all, Seagal is terribly out of shape. He looks old and fat, plays like he has to fulfill an annoying obligation and his fight scenes require creative editing or plain replacement. Secondly, his opponent is a very weak villain. This is about a smart and mean masterbrain and Chestnut does not deliver. So what about the action ? Well, the two parties permanently shoot at each other in different locations of the Alcatraz jail. They shoot wild and bad, because compared to the amount of required ammunition, the bodycount is rather low.

I'm having as much fun reading the user comments as I did watching the movie! It seems that this is the classic either "Love it" or "Hate it" movie. And I have to say that I not only am on the "Love it" side, I'm going on a limb to say it this my FAVORITE movie, EVER! Thank heavens I found it in the first place. Almost IMPOSSIBLE to find, I was lucky about ten years ago to record it off a late night UHF channel.

when i first saw this movie i was literally rolling around on the floor laughing (especially when they were getting chased by the water, and when the guy drove through peoples gardens, i mean would it hurt to drive around the washing line?) the special effects! this movie clearly didn't have a big budget. either that or the guy left his toddler in charge of the controls. the water coming out of the damn looked like a close up of a can of beer that had fizzed up. what were the actors thinking? did they actually believe that it was a good movie?

OK, first of all, who in their right mind would remake Hitchcock and second, who would do it shot for shot? I admit I had no intention of ever watching this movie for that very reason. The original Psycho is one of my favorite films ever and this just seemed like a degrading photocopy of it. I did watch it because my girlfriend wanted to compare it to the original and we both agreed less than five minutes into this crap that it was awful. First, as mentioned, they did it shot for shot. Where's originality?

Wayne Wang 's direction may be the ingredient which made this film much more impressive to me than `` Slums of Calcutta,'' and the film does look and feel like a documentary. The most memorable of the three films which he has been directing, `` The Road Not Taken,'' is a very personal film of a woman who, at the age of 25, gave up the chance to study in America and come back to China and make her contribution to the life of the Chinese nation. And the woman in this movie has to be regarded as the real heroine of this film.

This must be the most boring film I ever saw . The only positive I can say about it is that the actors made the whole movie seem to me like a comedy. I wish that this was a movie which had been released a few years before, it would have saved the film a lot of time. The actors are all very good in their parts but the script falls flat. The only positive thing about this movie is that we could watch it as a comedy without any feeling that we're laughing at any of the situations that occur on screen.

I watch a lot of movies - DVD, features, and classics, you name it. The night I watched JERICHO MILE, my wife (who had ordered it on the internet) said she remembered it from when she was in high school, that it had stayed with her all of these years. Somewhat reluctantly I sat down (with our daughter & son), and was riveted from the opening sequence to the end titles. We all were. She, who remembered the original, and our kids (18 and 16) who had no idea what the movie was about couldn't believe it.

When I was driving home after work , I bought some movies for my four year old twins . I sat in my Toyota Camry and thought about this. The movie was called “Let’s Play”. Now don’t go telling people this , because I would have to show it to you. Here it is. In the movie, there was one little kid that was going through some troubles . His father (a man I don’t like) would go into this room , look at the kids and say, ” let’s play, I have a good joke for you”.

Before seeing the sneak preview today of Angels & Demons, I cleared my mind of any uncertainties that might hold me back from enjoying it; the enormous amount of hatred towards Dan Brown, the fact that it was written by Dan Brown, and because Dan Brown's name is slapped on all of the posters. I went in with an open mind, and expected the worse, but instead what I got was a 2 and a half hour Roman cat and mouse game with Forrest Gump, and that is by all means good entertainment value.The movie hangs loosely on the actual novel itself.

I've watched the movie actually several times. And what i want to say about it is the only thing that made this movie high rank was the Burak Altay's incredible performance, absolutely nothing but that. Not even those silly model named Deniz Akkaya and some of these popular names at times in the movie... Burak is definitely very talented i've seen a few jobs he made and been through. Even though this is kind of horror movie, he's doing really good job in comedy movies and also in dramas too.

This film works on a lot of different levels. It's a profile of one very cool couple, a social commentary on aging and nursing homes, a love story, a musical. I've seen Uncle Frank a few times, and every time I watch it I'm not sure who to go call first--my parents, my wife, a friend I've lost touch with . . But it has a way of making you remember the most important relationships in your life--and want to reaffirm the ones that continue.

I was all ready to hate this but it turned out to be surprisingly tolerable - though the MTV-style of film-making (shot on DV, to boot) is quite an eye-sore! I liked the script's self-mocking style, as well as its central idea of having the female vampire lead doubling as a contract killer. As to the cast, Eileen Daly (best known as the 'star' of those horrid "Redemption" intros) has an undeniable screen presence - and is quite sensual, despite her age; however, Christopher Adamson's hammy chief villain is obnoxious.

If you're tired by the same repetitive, unintelligent material that the mainstream movie industry releases, you'll enjoy "You Are Alone". It is thought provoking, well shot and riveting.Without revealing anything that you don't find out in the first few minutes of the movie, this is the story of a young white high school girl from an upper middle class environment who is working as an escort and is discovered by her neighbor. The vast majority of the movie occurs in a hotel room where he hired her to come.Through their discussion, you explore two shifting views of prostitution, depression, loneliness.

As much as 'The Beginning' showed that we're still going to get "classic" x-files, Drive showed that the X-Files was going to explore new territory. They start by giving us a unique teaser to Drive, with the news camera footage. It was an interesting transition from the the TV to the real events. I would've liked it even better if they had kept that news footage camera for the entire teaser and not cut to the inside of the car. Upon viewing this episode live back in 1998 I was thinking, "Am I on the right channel?"

to make this short and sweet: i hope this movie will not be considered the seminal work for the "gener-asian" of american film making. the acting was sub-par, relying on stereotypes, raised voices, and exaggerated eye-buggery to convey its message. chris chan park does not delve very deep into the any of his characters, allowing them to remain caricatures of angry/frustrated/distant/uncommunicative asians. these depictions do not make characters mysteriously appealing; it makes them confusing and unsympathetic. i like to think that us asians are more complex than that.i came out of the movie unconvinced.

I recently had to watch this for a project in a Sociology class and thought it was absolutely the worst movie I have ever had to sit through. It was like bad a bad cinemax movie with all the "good bits" taken out. Bad acting, the fake documentary set up, nonsensical plot, and rudderless direction all combine to make a terrible, terrible film.The female characters are basically only there to be sex objects. Consider this exchange: "He's hot." "He has a girlfriend." "Do you have a girlfriend?" "No."

There are movies that are so bad, they're good. Then there's movies like Rest Stop that should just never have been made because they are just plain dreadful.Bad acting, unlikable characters, predictable plot and a supposedly supernatural twist that adds nothing to the story are all key failures. Some half decent special effects are about the only thing worthy of note. I can't even bring myself to write a plot outline because all I really want to do here is warn you not to waste your time and money on this movie. Do yourself a favour and don't even bother with this film at all.

A man kicks a dog 2 ' in the air.A woman kicks a cow out of her bed.A man kicks a woman 2 ' in the foot.A man kicks a horse 2 ' to its side.A man kicks a cow 1 ' to its back. A man kicks a dog 2 ' in the air. 1.A man kicks a dog out of his bed. 2.A woman kicks a cow out of her bed. 3.A man kicks a horse 2 ' out of its side. 4.A man kicks a cow 1 ' to its back. A man kicks a dog out of his bed, but the dog kicks him back.

Having loved Stephen King 's novels and short stories for many years , I , like most reviewers , have often been on the fence in terms of his literary work . While I do not consider his novels to have been perfect , his short stories have often been overlooked by most fans . However , I believe he has written two masterpieces , The Green Mile and The Dead Zone . Both of them , in my view , hold a very unique place in the genre and have not been considered the " next big thing in American fiction" .

If any movie ever made Italians look bad , this is it.Duke Mitchell - what an A -- HOLE .The Duke is just an empty bag , he is not going to say anything , the rest of his crew is just a bunch of lazy guys , they will do what ever the Duke tells them , they just love the Duke , what the Duke wants he gets , what the Duke doesn't , he is a fool to put his crew in danger because the Duke tells them that he will , when he tells them he doesn't , they do it , they will do anything he tells them to do .

The biggest and most disconcerting things of the Raptor movie was ending for the Tyransaurus is identical to Carnosaur except kid in the loader was a bit better acted and action then the adult. The similarities to the Carnosaur movies was rather poor choice in plot line. The only thing that approached good was the beginning with the kids in the jeep. Then the plot went down hill from there. Would have been nice if a different plot had been devised, rather then cloning the earlier movies. The raptor movie should have taken lesson from Jurasic park series in various plots.

Televised in 1982, from a Los Angeles production, this is probably the finest example of a filmed stage musical you are likely to encounter. Issued on DVD in 2004 in a remastered digital transfer, it is quite stunning. Hearn and Lansbury give the performances of their lives and the rest of the cast are quite obviously caught up in the electricity generated. Of course it is Sondheim's music and lyrics that make this possible. If anyone doubts that he is one of the "greats" of the American Musical form listen to this.

Having lived in Michigan 's Upper Peninsula ( 30 miles from Escanaba ) in the mid-1990s , I was eager to see how the people there live . The Upper Peninsula is so remote that in addition to the people, I was also keen to see the wildlife. I had a few days on my own in my small Michigan condo, so I decided to go out on an afternoon hike with a friend . We drove a few hours from my place to a nearby state park to go hiking. I had been told there was a good hiking trail there and was curious if there was much wildlife in the park.

Less Than Zero could have been the 80s movie that reveals teenage apathy in its most extreme form had they actually stuck to the damn book. But, where they hadn't, this movie presents does the job, and leaves you with the creepiest feeling when its all over in ways not done until the late nineties with Larry Clark's movies 'Kids' and 'Bully.' Societal outcast teens are faced with a rather curious dilemma (they don't treat it much like one) when their estranged friend (Daniel Roebuck) boasts to them that he killed a teenage girl near the river's edge in their suburban town.

So I was sick with the flu one Saturday and the silver lining was that SciFi Channel was having a marathon of dinosaur movies that day - the "Carnosaur" trilogy, "Pterodactyl," "Raptor Island." Then I flicked ahead on my cable remote to see which movie SciFi placed in its glamorous, Saturday prime-time slot. Some movie I had never heard of before called "Raptor." I was pretty excited. The movie begins with some teens driving around in a jeep, when they get stalked and killed by a Velociraptor.

I will commend it in only one respect .. it was innovative . Innovative does n't mean it 's a bad thing . In fact innovation is a part of a well-rounded education . If you do not get a good education in English and math , you have no way out of being a mediocre individual . The key word here is education and the key word is English . That is the main reason why we are in this mess today . When you have a limited English skill you can not get anything done in our country .

I readily admit that I watch a lot of really bad movies . But there are very few that I find truly offensive. Most are not that bad, but I find them lacking. So, I have decided not to watch any more Hollywood movies. Why? Well, let me just tell you. There are two major flaws that Hollywood films possess. First, if you are thinking about what you could possibly say to a Hollywood director or producer that could help you avoid being on their bad list, then you don’t have to read on, because they are so stupid.

I watched the first episode and I found it to be a very wooden performance.I have watched the original from it's early days on Big Girls Blouse to the last series on Channel seven. Kath and Kim was a great Mocumentary and it's humor is something that most people get.However in this American version I found it to be dull, Molly Shannon is to fashionable to be Kath Day, Kath's wardrobe is supposed to be stuck in the 80s with her frizzy perm. While Selma Blair's figure hugging clothes isn't as good as what the original Kimmy wore.

Like the other comments says , this might be surprise to those who have n't seen the work of Jeunet, but in this case, I think they are right. I think it might be the fact that he was so busy that he just can't get the time to do this, but there are those who would say there is no one in the world who knows the real Jeunet better then Jean-Pierre Pon, and I can see the logic behind this argument, but maybe he's not the real Jeunet at all..

Jean-Pierre Pon, that's for sure.

Awful in a whole new way , ANYTHING BUT LOVE probably should be seen by movie buffs -- if only to remind us what a beautiful, warm, generous, caring and wonderful soul she is. I've only been able to have one viewing of this movie with my husband and his family. I went in knowing that I might not see eye to eye with him, that I might have difficulty hearing what he's saying, that he'd probably get irritated with me if I did see this film but I also knew this would not be the case.

Very good film. Can we get this decent human being on some kind of 911 commission or investigation? We need his integrity, endurance, intelligence, clarity and spirit fighting the rigged game that is world politics and big business.All the animals come out at night - whores, skunk pussies, buggers, queens, fairies, dopers, junkies, sick, venal.

I had heard that this film was stylish and intriguing, but I just found it annoying. It's been a while since I've seen it (and hopefully I won't find out all my memories are wrong and I'm unjustly condemning this movie), but my memory is that the filmmakers tried to portray Leopold and Loeb as victimized by an anti-gay society, and that this somehow caused their horrible crime. I totally disagree with this point of view, and think it's unfair both to homosexuals and to Bobby Franks, the real victim of the story.

I like dark humor and non-PC stuff, but not if it is with no purpose but to elevate yourself. Bashing a group of people without any trace of self-irony is crap.There are people who could make concentration camp jokes funny, but whoever made this film unfortunately failed even in the VERY easy task of making fun about Turks in Germany. It is a very easy task, but if your are the Germany equivalent of an inbred redneck (=inbred Southerner from a village where virginity is often lost to farm animals) you certainly will fail at this and also at life.

This movie had potential . If it had been handled differently . What it needed was a different director . A director that could bring in the audience in a better and more entertaining manner . I think that director would be Sam Raimi , who did a great job with Spiderman . In this movie the script is weak . The characters don't really have depth . It seems that they are just there for the story to be told . I guess that is what a great director would bring . Sam Raimi did a great job with the Spiderman movies .

So im not a big fan of Boll 's work but then again not many are . I enjoyed his previous work so this was a welcome surprise . I still think his previous work is great as well so im happy to see his work in this one . I will most definitely be purchasing this novel so i will have it on the shelf when i get back from vacation so i can pull it out when i see a book I like . It's not perfect, but as with all of his books it's worth the read. I liked the story.

Not really all that much to this movie ... either a stunt racer or a stock car racer has a bad day or a good day ... they go out there, they race, they come up with something they can say is going to be very tough, it's tough for that day. And if they come up with the answer that's a good result for them, they go out and try to win the race. And usually, if they do it, that's a pretty good result. But you get guys, they're out there, they're doing what they can.

The movie eXistenZ is about a futuristic video game on a `` pod '' system that is almost like virtual reality, where the users don't even need to be online to play, just to move in the game world. This game has been around for a couple of years. This game is available in two versions: the free version (called `` free version ) which has a couple of minutes of gameplay, and the commercial version, called " full version " which has hundreds of hours of full-time gameplay. It has no ads, no downloads, and no in-game purchases.

Rented this out from my local because it was the only new British film available this week . Never heard of it but it looked pretty cool. Wasn't impressed but I did like it. Didn't hate it either. I went into the theater to do this. I don't remember much of the film, and I didn't take many pictures. I have to say, I don't really remember the film. I do remember the guy who was in this, though, and the song they played.

STMD ! is one of the most fun and enjoyable low-budget films I 've seen in quite some time . however , that's probably because i was not expecting the final scene to be one of the best in the film . that said , that scene is one of my favorites of the bunch and is one of the key elements that really helps make the movie a success . if you 'll recall , that scene takes place in a mall . however , the mall has been filled with zombies of all things . the film 's title refers to several things .

I was duped as well . Here I was expecting all sorts of man eating Pirahnas and what the hell . I was so happy with this book that I had it on my bookshelf. When I went to read it, I saw that it is the first one of its kind so I was not sure what was going on, or was it just my imagination? As I was putting down the book I read the last page in the back and saw it has been made into a book of its own, which was a huge surprise.

Well the previews looked funny and I usually do n't go to movies on opening night especially with my kids and I thought this would be an awesome way to try something new for a change. The movie was great and I liked how they kept telling the audience that it was about a dog but it was in fact about a child. It was weird but it did what it had to do and they did a great job. It was just a bit too long at 1hr 40min but I think it made sense because they needed time to get things going.

For me , this is another one of those films that I got to see off of the Los Angeles area, but it wasn't on the West coast. I'd like to have seen it. But I'm going to have to wait until it's on cable on the East Coast to watch it. It was an odd choice to release this, because it's not in any particular genre, yet is also a very interesting film. There's a lot of violence towards the end of this, and the ending was quite a shocker, but it's not a terrible movie in any way.

A notorious big budget flop when released . This Robert Altman inspired comedy has some terrific moments and an occasionally good performance from Kevin McCarthy but is mostly wasted on Altman's characters . An excellent movie . I would say that it's a very good movie in the sense that you can enjoy it, and it is very funny, I mean it's very funny from the first frame to the final frame , and it's very entertaining. That's the only reason why you watch the movie . But you don't need the other reasons to enjoy this movie .

Obviously, someone was looking at catching onto the "Blair Witch" wave.This movie was set up like all the "reality" haunted shows that are popping up on TV lately (and I must admit, I get a kick out of these), but this movie is MUCH cheesier! Probably the first three-quarters of the movie is filled with the "participants" going through the house, WHINING. Give me a break! Spending 10 minutes whining about going up into the attic is not my idea of a good time. Any paranormal happenings are blatant setups.

It ` s funny how instinct warns you of something . For example as soon as the company credits read a credit , the phone starts to ring . How do you answer the phone ? I ` ve been on a call with them for a while when I saw the credit on the caller id and I ` m like , what . I ` m not sure . It might be something they do . I guess it could be an email they just sent out to everyone . You ` re supposed to forward the email to all of your friends .

This amusing , sometimes poignant look at the Hollywood detective genre of the 1940 's and 1950 's stars Robert Culp, John Loder and George Montgomery as they follow a seemingly endless trail of clues in an investigation of a serial killer who may have been on the loose since World War II and is now being called the Hollywood Slasher or Hollywood Vampire. In 1940, George Montgomery, star of more than a dozen western and war movies, returned to Hollywood to work on a film project he’d always been passionate about. In the late ‘30s, Montgomery had moved from his native Kentucky to California with his family.

Sadly this film lives up to about 1 % of the hype that the game created in 2004 and leaves you with a great impression. The graphics are superb but the game itself leaves you with no other options than to go back and play the game from the beginning (which I am doing now, as it is my second playthrough). I do not see why anyone would want to make a new game for PS3, but if they did, it would be a good game and would be able to make some people happy.

"THE KING OF QUEENS," in my opinion, is a pure CBS hit! Despite the fact that I've never seen every episode, I still enjoy it very much. For that reason, it's hard for me to say which episode is my favorite. Even so, I must say that CBS really knows how to make a good sitcom. Before I wrap this up, I'd like to say that everyone always gives a good performance, the production design is spectacular, the costumes are well-designed, and the writing is always very strong.

I 'm going to recommend putting this one in the `` skip it '' pile as well . I was surprised at the number of comments I had to manually go through to figure out what I was missing . The instructions were very easy to follow and the results look good . I ' m also going to leave this review here so that others can have the opportunity to see what they're missing. I ' m a relatively newbie to using this tool and it took me a little while to adjust my settings . But it's very easy to use once you get the hang of it .

I watched this movie for the first time the other day and was bored to tears. I guess I just was looking for some flashback to the wonderful series that I remembered. I watched The Mod Squad television show religiously back in the day and it was fantastic. It was action packed and the relationship the 3 had with Greer was endearing. There wasn't any of that here. When Greer was murdered you get the idea that these 3 could have cared less. The actor who portrayed Pete is a really good actor but they wrote his part like he was mentally challenged.

In my opinion, a good documentary - especially one dealing with controversial political issues - should be informative and as unbiased as possible. The point should be revealing the truth. This means, in particular, having among the interviewees experts on the subject and representatives of all sides. This film is a failure in this regard. Most of the interviews included in this film consist of "men off the street" expounding on the question of peace in the Holy Land. The wall itself, the supposed subject of the film, is given no serious treatment at all.

mondovino is a moving and rewarding documentary . in the world of wine there is a huge different between the wine regions in Europe. in this movie you got to see many winemaking regions around the world and the places where the winemakers live. to see winemakers and producers, who are so passionate about what they do is a real pleasure and a very eye opening experience. you have to see the films in a whole new point of view and i am so glad i got to see this movie because it will bring a smile on your face.

I went to see this movie at the theater and paid money thinking it would be at least mildly entertaining. What I got was more like torture. This is the kind of movie where after you are done looking at all the gore, you are still left wondering if you would rather be at work, or in the comfort of your own home, or with a nice bottle of whiskey and a glass of ice water. I’ve had the same thought as I’m writing this review: maybe I would have liked this better had I not paid money to see it.

i found the film a bit predictable and boring but i am 14.i was really annoyed with my little cousin as she was very hyper that day so i saw a film on the Disney channel and put it on and told her to watch it.she is 6 and she loved the film, some bits she didn't get like the ending but i didn't get that either y was Eddie the star of the video shoot i thought it was Jordan's video?! but she did enjoy it. i noticed the mistakes such as at the end Jordan was not actually playing the guitar, but she never.

All the reviewers are making one big mistake . This movie was not suppose to be taken seriously.It was made by people who were just trying to get an award . And the movie did get a little bit of award for its acting . But as it turns out,the movie was made to be taken down . And to get the movie down , the people made a video on youtube showing the movie and how the actors are not acting . They then uploaded this video on their website , where thousands of people were able to see what really happens in the movie .

I saw this film via one of the actors' agents, and it surely conforms with a great deal that comes out of Sth. Australia in terms of the overall *tone,* which is rightly dark and moody.I thought the little boy in the film was excellent. Mostly kid actors are *hammed up* and embarrassing but not in this case. He was really very good. In terms of the *surrealism* thingy mentioned by jingo, well, I just think this film is plain 'weird.' It's a real weirdo film, with weirdo locations, storyline, weird stuff going on the whole time.

Natile Portman and Susan Sarandon play off of each other like a symphony in this coming of age story about a young girl, who is sentenced to life as the daughter of one of the nuttest women you will ever encounter. Sarandon has this ability, call it talent if you will, to play some of the most off-beat characters and bring their humanity to forefront of any film she makes. As the mother of this obviously brilliant and muture beyond her years young girl, Sarandon alternates between being the mom and being the child with the ease of a ballet dancer.

Probably the biggest thing about Wild Rebels that hurts it the most is the hero. He's got LOSER written all over him, but that doesn't stop him from "getting the girl." Probably one of the world's worst race drivers imaginable, he decides to stop racing after he crashes his car. Well, his new job is racing still, as a bunch of biker types pick him to drive their getaway car as they commit crimes. There's nothing really to endear you to Rod, even the situation he's thrown into is pretty stupid.

The Giant Claw is in fierce competition with films like , 'Robot Monster ' and 'Plan 9 From Outer Space' at the box-office. We spoke to its writer, director and the man behind one of the biggest horror films of all time

'The Haunting' is a ghost story. But it is not a ghost story, not yet, anyway. The story takes place at a haunted house, where you, the ghost, are locked in a room with the ghost of a woman you once loved. And she, you see, is dead.

While the premise of the film sounded unique and intriguing after watching the first 5 minutes of the film I was not going to invest too much time in the film. In my opinion the film did its job by establishing itself in the film with a good amount of characters, a good beginning and some interesting twists and turns at the very end. This movie did what a film is supposed to do which was to make the audience curious of what would happen after the film and it did it very well with a fast paced storyline and a lot of humour which kept the audience involved throughout the whole film.

The finest short I've ever seen. Some commentators suggest it might have been lengthened, due to the density of insight it offers. There's irony in that comment and little merit. The acting is all up to Noonan and he carries his thankless character perfectly. I might have preferred that the narrator be less "recognizable", but the gravitas lent is pitch perfect. This is a short for people who read, for those whose "bar" is set high and for those who recognize that living in a culture that celebrates stupidity and banality can forge contrary and bitter defenders of beauty.

This is a decent movie. Although little bit short in time for me, it packs a lot of action, grit, commonsense and emotions in that time frame. Matt Dillon and the other main character does a great job in this movie. The emotions and intensity were convincing and tense throughout the movie. It is not typical fancy expensive Hollywood CGI action movie, but it was a very satisfying movie indeed for the price. My evening was great because of this movie. This movie is straight traditional action movie with great acting, story and directing. I would recommend this movie.

This proves just how awful the WB Network was in the last few years of its existence . As a matter of fact the last thing I remember from the WB Network was a TV Guide that had an ad for a movie I don't remember the name of starring Tom Hanks. It was in the last few episodes of The Drew Carey Show before it was cancelled due to the huge amount of ratings it was getting and I have yet to hear of anyone saying it was the best episode. As for the WB, I didn't have it on my TV until just recently.

Some films are just plain silly beyond explanation . This is one of them . Words can not do justice to the nonsense of this one . It was released in 2004 and is one of the worst movies that I have seen in years . It is a total disgrace . It has no plot to speak of . I will not watch it once . I hope they are thrown in jail and serve 10 years for showing it in public . I can not believe how many people watched it . It is just so disgusting .

The key scene in Rodrigo Garcia's "Nine Lives" comes when Sissy Spacek, hidden away in a hotel room where she is carrying on an affair with Aiden Quinn, find a nature documentary on television, at which point Quinn notes the contrivance of such things--disparate footage is edited into one scene, predators and preys are thrown together in order to capture the moment--all to force connections where none actually exist. Characters in the nine shorts that make up this film occasionally spill over into each others stories, but none of them ever seem to really connect.

This was honestly the worst movie i have ever seen. the acting was god awful, the story line also was bad. it was however a good idea. if this movie would have had better cinematics, and a lot better actors, i might of had something better to say. edgar allen poe was a great Gothic writer, and this movie just destroyed it. why do people always have to kill good stories by making bad movies. the only good part was when the killer put the head under the floor with a tape going, that was pretty good.

This film has some pretty gorey parts like a boob getting bit off and a other big bites. Castle Freak himself is a good monster. I would be scared to pieces if he was coming after me. However, the movie had some dumb parts about it.A husband goes drunk driving and kills his 3 year old son and blinds his teenage daughter. I suppose death is a greater damage than blindness, but you'd never know that the parents actually feel bad about their daughter being blind. All they care about is that "J.J.'s dead!"

This is one of the best martial art(Kung-fu) movies of all time. if u love martial art movies this is a not to miss. From flying nuns to training monks this movie has top kungfu styles and a good story line. Its about a priest from the wu dang clan trying to eliminate all the shaoulin fighters to be claim the title of being the best in martial arts. after killing key members of the shaoulin temple the faith of the shoulin is remained in the hand of two boys secretly training under a shaoulin monk.

I mean , nothing happens , 5 dumb kids go to Oklahoma to find a magical forest of marijuana ... what happens ... there are so many people who go to America to get "legalized" , that there is no law that they can break ... not for a while ... but it will be there in 5 minutes ... and then they won't need it ...

You mean the people who need the legal marijuana to sell it or get it for free, right ? You know , there is a lot of smoke from the government about legal marijuana .

I really tried to like this film about a doctor who has the possibility of a new life with a young woman if he can comes to terms with the death of his wife. I suppose this was to play like a quirky light romantic comedy but the theme is a little uncomfortable for me.But putting that aside, I found the dialog was too much like a stage play despite being based on a novel and also,the mediocre acting was embarrassing to watch especially by the young lead Vincent Spano.I have been sort of trying to catch up on all the eighties movies I missed during that decade.

I had to write a review for this movie based on the ones that are saying gory , non stop violence, blood and guts . I saw this movie because of the hype and the hype was so great , I did not have to think about anything . I thought this movie would be good for my kids . but it was so good , I did not have to think about anything . This is a must see for all of you who love horror and action . I hope this review helps someone because I had a bad time trying to review this book .
