I can't get over the quality of the score, the book, and the performances. This is the first production I've ever seen of Sweeney Todd so I have no others to compare it to. But the impact is so strong, I just can't imagine anything better.First, there's the music -- take "Johanna" (Act II), during which Sweeney, Anthony and Johanna sing an interwoven vocal line incorporating the melodies from three songs. It's like a Bach chorale in that sense -- just a masterpiece of composition.

( Contains really bad Spoilers ) So what can I say about this .... It 's a really HORRIBLE and HORNY story. And when I mean HORRIBLE I mean... well you get the picture. Anyway, I don't want to ruin the ending so if you haven't read the book, please leave now because this review is only for spoiler lovers. So in my review, I'm going to go into some detail about what happens in this book

I'll start by saying, that I loved the idea of this story, and the way it was written.

This film is striking only in its banality and use of cliches. Sadly it was obvious throughout up until the ending. But don't be mistaken into thinking that it ended strongly. Only a little unexpectedly, though nothing worth watching the thing through for.From the taciturn and wronged hero, to the Germanic baddy, to the expendable team, the characters were entirely wooden and obvious. The two FBI agents Smith and Wesson (geddit?) gave some hope of humour, but that came to nothing.I am a big science fiction fan but it is hard to find any redeeming quality in this film.

I saw this film via one of the actors ' agents , and it surely conforms with a great deal of the principles and themes of Dostoyevsky that I have had the privilege of studying over the years. The characters , the characters , the actors , the director , the cinematograf , the production , and the story are all at the very best of their work . I recommend this , I recommend it . The film tells the stories of two men, one an old man who had been in an automobile accident, who now lives in a nursing home.

This is n't exactly a complicated story . It 's not a mystery , or a plot you have to read to discover the answers . You 'll only find out a little more with each passing chapter . And the next one , I hope , will bring me more . There 's only one problem ? Well , not really one , there are actually many . But one thing you 'll notice : The more I think about this , the more I realise I need to share this . And you know what , I feel as though the only way to do it is to put it here for all to read .

Ocean's twelve is probably better than Ocean's eleven. I know most people would disagree, But I actually liked it more. After three years, it was good seeing the gang return. The reason behind the heist is a bit more inspired the second time around. I see why they stole from Benedict(Andy Garcia) in the last film. This film they have a bit more motivation the second time around. Ocean's twelve is more entertaining, and cooler than Ocean's eleven. With a funny cameo by Topher Grace saying "I just walked in that new Dennis Quaid movie" and other things.

This is pure CRAP, and probably the worst Biblical theme film ever... Absolutely inaccurate, I mean, they've put Sodom and Gomora BEFORE the great flood. They've described Lot as a friend of Noah although he lived after Noah. To make things worse, later Lot became a pirate and attacks Noah's Ark during the flood!!!??? And what's with the merchant who comes along on a boat which is moved over the water with a bicycle mechanism??? And exchanges alcohol for a food and water, and then Noah is portrayed as alcoholic!?

I saw this movie last night on HBO & did n't expect to get hooked - I usually fall asleep before the second act, so didn't even try to get back to my book until about an hour or two after. Wasn't a great movie, but I'll definitely watch again - I liked it better than I thought I would. I was going to review this but then I heard that it's going to a movie on HBO and I couldn't wait to see it. The movie wasn't that great. It seemed to get better with time.

A Chicago couple , Dillon and Dougherty , are falsely accused of killing their daughter . People begin to wonder if Dillon and Dougherty will ever get their son back . A lawyer is found , but his life is saved by the man who is his father . A man is shot in a bar . He survives but his father dies in the hospital . A judge finds a reason why the man is not guilty , as he believes that he is not the murderer. The couple who falsely accused of killing their daughter finds a reason why she was not murdered .

Barbershop 2: Back in Business wasn't as good as it's original but was just as funny. The movie itself lacked little things which the original held which made it much more enjoyable. Back in Business seemed to be just another worthless sequel made to bring in money with a very thin plot. Cedric the Entertainer's terrible excuses for flashbacks ruined the movie and seemed to be a bad way to try and get the audience to adapt more with the character. Overall Barbershop 2: Back in Business was a sequel not needed, without the originals charm, soul & spark.

I guess this is the first time I have seen a Roscoe 'Fatty' Arbuckle movie. I really liked him in his (title) role as a butcher boy. The way he moves is very funny in my opinion, for example how he handles his knife and the way he rolls a cigarette. I think he is a good actor; his facial expressions really suit the role he plays, for example how he winks at the audience in the end. But one might add that that was probably not too difficult. Anyway I think he would have deserved a longer career.

This movie really starts strong. We know that Roberts is an Atlanta hotshot sent to Australia to fix Coke's marketing problems. We also know he is an eccentric genius. Roberts' fine acting convinces us of this rather quickly.Unfortunately, the plot is so flimsy, that whatever fine character development has been achieved, it is negated by voids, inconsistencies, and downright boring film sequences.Usually, I am a sucker for bold and far out plots. Examples which I am fond of include, "Dark Star," "O.C. & Stiggs," and "Popeye."

Now, the sci-fi channel original company has made some pretty crappy films (House of the dead 2, All souls day, etc.) but when you leave the job entirely to horror master actor/writer and now director, Bruce Campbell, you get one of the best damn made for TV independent horror films ever made! I normally hate these movies, in my previous review, House of the dead 2, I could not believe how horrible the film was! But somehow I took a liking for this film, a very good liking for this film.

Deepa Mehta's "Fire" is groundbreaking, bold, and artistic. A masterful social commentary on the plight of the women from conservative, upper middle class Indian households, this is a film no one should miss. Shabana Azmi and Nandita Das give stellar performances by underplaying their characters as much as possible. A.R. Rahman's music is the work of the genius and almost plays the role of another character in the film. Mehta uses Rahman's score and together, they create such amazing sound montages that effectively portray the views of the world around Radha and Sita whenever they look to each other for support.

Being one of the founding fathers of my regions monkey movie club(this also includes apes/chimps and orangutans) I am reviewing this film from a monkey movie standpoint. Afterall it is a whole summer of monkeys, 100+ days for monkeys to do what they do best, cause mischief, shenanigans, hyjinx, solve human problems and teach us about ourselves.The story is simple enough. In short poor boy needs money for stuff he wants. Luckily there's a few monkeys(chimpanzees) that have a bounty on their head that would get Boba Fett or Dog's(Duane Chapman) blood flowing.

Tom Stern and Jeremy Slate are swing bachelor 's planning to hijack a casino , ala `` Ocean 's 11 '':



As for the rest of you, my advice is to stay out of casinos as far as you possibly can until this whole thing blows over. It might get messy and you could end up in jail or in the hospital...



Oh, that and don't drink and drive, which in case you haven't learned yet, is the absolute worst possible move you could make right now if you don't have to.

I spent many a sleepless night after watching 2001 . Not only because of the psychological horror ( of which I've only seen a few minutes) or the fact that the movie has a very simple plot, but because this was, after all, a movie about the creation of a computer virus , which in itself is not very scary. Nevertheless, it is not easy to take the computer virus seriously. But, as I mentioned, this movie is not so bad. It is not much more funny than some of the comedies that I've seen.

I still remember when Frog Baseball first aired on MTV. In some sort of odd, surreal manner, the cartoon captured the stupid actions that I think every boy growing up in America engages in. I cringe now thinking about how I burned a crippled grasshopper using a magnifying glass, but it was interesting at the time for some reason. Growing up in the 1980s we all knew "stoners." These were the kids who wore Iron Maiden t-shirts to school, grew their hair long, had immature moustaches and were at least two inches taller than everyone else because they had flunked a grade or two.

A vg Brit rom-com, one to watch if you can get your hands on a copy. Quirky and often surprising, this is not the best of Brady's films (Kiss Kiss Bang Bang is by far the funniest), though it does have a unique charm. Well written the story veers off into a few dead ends but mostly surfaces with a new plot high. You know from the start how it's going to end, but when it comes it is honest and very open ended, a realistic and credible ending, the end seemed like a beginning, enjoyable and left me wanting more.

A woman in love with her husband ( he 's suicidal ) decides to have a baby to save his life. However she has a baby with the sperm donor ( she had her ovaries removed ) and they get married. Two days after the delivery the husband suffers a heart attack from which he dies a few hours later. A few years later the wife decides she wants to go back to the husband to see the baby she had with the donor. The husband agrees to the idea but tells the wife that he can't have the child because he's not her husband anymore.

This movie takes the psychological thriller to new depths . Well written by Shane Black , the film is executed by a brilliant cast . Kevin Spacey , Robert De Niro, Michael Vartan , Jodie Foster are some of my favorite actors . One can see that they are capable of playing the hero or villain , and here they deliver with the best of their abilities . Kevin Spacey is superb as the villain , a character with a heart of a lion and an ego that knows no boundaries . I loved his character , who is very smart and manipulative , yet a good person .

Amazing, amazing, amazing. What more can be said? Jacobi is the best Hamlet ever to grace the stage and captures every inch of the character. Every nuance and element of Hamlet is depicted and depicted well. Some people have complained about his age, but you honestly cannot tell when watching the film. If anything, he looks drastically younger than 40. I only wish a more worthy Ophelia could have been found. Her acting is passable but she just doesn't look the part. The only real exceptional performances come from Jacobi and Stewart, who is a great Claudius.

Max Cash a charter boat captain who works off the Caribbean island San Sebastian is hired by Sarah , who needs to find a boat for a long trip to India. She wants the boat to go to Mumbai but first needs to leave the island. She does not have a lot of cash but she decides to use the most amount she has, and asks Cash how much it would be for him to go with her to Mumbai. I know you're watching me, so if you're listening to my voice you might be able to help me.

As a Genghis Khan "fan" I was looking forward to this movie. After devouring Conn Igguldens epic novels about Genghis and reading up on loads of historic records I feel I know something on the subject and was thrilled to share my knowledge with friends via this movie...That turned out a deception. This movie is practically made up from beginning to end. There are a few things that seem correct but mostly it is pure make believe of the writers. That does not have to be a problem, I like good entertainment just like anyone else unfortunately it is mostly boring.

I have only praise for this film. From start to finish it captured the brilliance of Stephen Sondheim's musical. I am not a big fan of musicals most of them are very overdone. This one however changed my mind. I am an actor myself and have actully played Sweeney and I know how hard this role is. George Hearn gave a stunning, masterful and rounded performance worthy of the highest awards that we can give him (He won an Emmy and that's something.) Everything he does he turns to gold.

1st watched 4/30/2009 - 4 out of 10 (Dir-John Waters): Corny Waters-like comedy musical with some funny scenes and good parts but it didn't make a whole worthwhile experience. John Waters directed this music-filled spoof of the fifties scene with Johnny Depp playing the title role. This movie is very similar with what he did with the 60's spoof entitled "Hairspray" but this one is not as effective. Some of the tunes are catchy, some of the characters are interesting in their quirky Waters-like way, and the portrayals are fine although sometimes overdone.

Doe-eyed high school student Kathleen Beller is found beaten andraped in the opening scenes of this made for TV movie about a troubled girl from a dysfunctional family. As she grows into a woman she finds her self-reliance, her independence and her self respect in ways that most never do. With the help of her mom, a good man who lives across the country, she manages to overcome the odds that were set for her in life, including being a prostitute to pay the rent. The movie is a coming-of-age story and a metaphor for the trials and tribulations of coming to terms with being a female in today's society.

Dude...I liked Buffy and Angel as much as the next sci-fi freak...but this is too much. The worst lead actress EVER!! Not even David "Hot Pants" Boreanaz is able to save this crap. No wonder I NEVER watch Fox  it blows!! We totally gave it a chance, and it continued to suck. We watched four or five painful, agonizing episodes. I want to kill the execs at the network SO BAD! Why is money being spent on this drivel?!?!

This version of "The Magic Flute" is not only the worst production of Mozart's great opera that I have ever seen, it is also the worst video production I have seen of any opera.I'm a big opera fan and I have more opera on DVD than movies. The sets are cheap and cheesy. Papageno doesn't even have a bird costume. He is just dressed like some guy. The sound is in mono. The color is really bad. It is saturated in orange. Most DVD's from this period have the color digitally restored, but they did not bother with this one.

The cinematography is the film 's shining feature . Park really knows his stuff when it comes to shooting memorable and interesting scenes , and he's one of my favorites on this set. He does a fine job here, and the director is absolutely right to trust his vision with this film, and give it the attention it deserves. In short, this looks and feels like a really great horror film, and it's hard to imagine a more terrifying film that looks like something out of another genre, but I guess that's always the case with horror .

Daft potboilers do n't come much dafter than this , but it 's a Douglas Sirk movie which makes everything it does possible in the first place . I'm still waiting for the film to be shown in it's entirety so that I'm not forced to make some kind of quick-and-dirty assessment based on a few clips, but you can get a better idea of what to expect from it after watching the film as a whole.In short , this film is everything you'd want a movie about World War II to look like.

The genius that is Stephen Sondheim was never more prominently displayed as it was in his 1979 "Musical Thriller" SWEENEY TODD, a Gothic, gory, grisly, yet delicious musical concoction about a demented barber who returns to London to exact revenge on the evil Judge who not only had him permanently exiled from London, but who is also raising his daughter as his own and plans to marry her to "shield her from all the evils of the world." The barber finds love,sympathy, and assistance from a lonely pie shop owner who has her own agenda where Todd is concerned.

This movie is a very enjoyable homage to the Bogart and other detective films of old. Robert Sacchi nails it as Bogie and Michelle Phillips is a truly timeless beauty as Gena Anastas. However, the most noteworthy portion of this film involves the longest belly dancing scene ever produced in a Hollywood film. One well-known professional instructor commented that nothing else in cinema comes close for dance excitement. The scene, which ends up being an important part of the plot, occurs in a lushly beautiful Middle Eastern nightclub and is by all accounts mesmerizing.

WARNING : I advise anyone who has not seen the film yet to not read this comment.If you plan on reading the comment, please do not read it in any other thread where you do not have the permission of the writer.I am not trying to put anyone off by writing this. It is simply that I don’t want people to go to the comment to find out whether they will get the film. For one, they may not like it. I think it is a perfectly fine film, and for me it is one of the top films in the history of the genre.

I can't remember the series, I believe it may have been "American Masters", but it was broadcast on PBS around 1980. Most people have some knowledge of the development of the A bomb, and those that have little, or none, probably think it is a pretty dry subject. Anyone who has viewed this 7 part series does not feel that way. You get to know the turmoil in Oppenhemiers mind, and how the development changed his life forever. You understand the tragic figure he became, and why.

I saw this originally on Channel 4 ( UK ) and it was a fantastic film that left a great impression and has been on my list to watch ever since! This is the tale of a man who makes his way back to his country after 20 years to visit his loved ones. The journey is arduous at times but the man eventually reaches his home country of Vietnam and is reunited with his loved ones. He has to confront many challenges during this process and his journey is not always easy. When he arrives back home he finds the place is no longer the same as when he left it.

This is the ultimate Kung Fu movie ! This is the only Kung Fu movie ! This is the only Kung Fu movie that gives you one of the best moments in Kung Fu history ! This is the one that will make you wanna learn Kung Fu and practice it to become better and have fun ! I have watched this movie over 50 times over the last two weeks, and I still cant believe how good it is ! I love the story. The film has a lot of action scenes that are awesome.

This was my late wife 's favorite film . I 'm sorry she did not live long enough to have seen it . I also loved the film as a child and have many fond memories of my childhood . It is a movie which is meant to be savored over the span of several evenings. I watched this in the theater. I liked what I saw. There was no other film like it . If you have the time and the money . I recommend you see it . For me it gave me great pleasure . There's something to this movie for everyone .

I absolutely adored this movie . For me , the best reason to see it is how stark a contrast it makes between two very different personalities in the same person. If you don’t get it , don’t watch it . But if you enjoy it , read this . And if you do read it , keep in mind there’s a whole book that’s been written about what happened during and after filming of the movie in the mid 70’s, and you might find yourself agreeing with me on a few points.

Or anyone else have noticed the fact that first bunch of episodes are inspired too much by 90 's flicks? And second, are they going to be able to get the whole cast back in time for new seasons? Seems like the whole point would be to get the original cast back in time to make up for what was left out of the first season. __________________

The best kind of pain is the one you get after you are dead. I think they are making it a point to keep it as realistic as possible.

If you feel Reshammiya as the singer is too much of a pain to watch on TV, try watching him in the movie for 2 hours straight. His face is bland all throughout the movie, and it is very comical to see him act the demanding and intense scenes. This is way far from a real love story (Get the spelling right, Reshammiya - it is not luv or reeal), and is complete with him doing a Mithun da dance, auto rickshaw fight scenes, Himesh getting imprisoned, Himesh accused of murder, he fleeing from prison etc ...

As over the past ten years or even longer the whole world is flooded with so-called sitcoms (actually only very few deserve this title 'cause they're so predictable), King of Queens is a very original, unique and astoundingly funny alternation. It's about the daily life of a deliveryman and his wife who works as an attorney's assistant in Manhattan in Queens, NY. With them lives Carrie's father Arthur, a picture-book extrovert, who is played by the fantastic Jerry Stiller and who steals the show from all the others every time he appears.

It does not surprise me that this short ( 91 minutes ) B/W movie that was made 50 years ago, in the country of Poland, as a propaganda film for a national socialist society. The only thing is that it doesn’t need to be a propaganda film because it is already full of pro-nazi ideology. But still, I guess it was made more than 50 years ago, and that is the only reason. This film was made as the first part of a series of documentaries on the nazi concentration camps.

I absolutely love the first three movies , they were great ! I once caught Part 5 on VHS 10 years ago and it was just as good as the other four parts ! I also loved the cartoon , it is amazing how you can see the original artwork , it is awesome !! The original artwork and the story are amazing and I am so glad it is getting a new movie ! The trailer is great ! I am excited about it , i love the story , I hope they put the original artwork up so I can see all the amazing artwork !

I saw this movie with my mother , and I loved it ! It was such a sweet story , and I enjoyed all the funny and dramatic moments ! It's funny how a man can be so romantic , but a woman can be so unromantic. I was so upset when the man couldn't get her to notice him , and I cried every time the man was rejected . I'm glad she understood that he was right to stay. I would have been upset if she had found someone who would be a nice person to talk to the whole time he was there !

OK .... so , by minute 15 in the film , there 's still no dialogue.This film arrived to me in theaters in the middle of summer in the UK . I remember it being such a great film . It's so interesting to watch a movie with no dialogue and no story . You just get to see the actors interacting with the film . I was blown away at how cleverly the actors were put together . You can tell they work very well together. I just thought it was really well made . I think you're right.

Alain Resnais directs three parallel stories that have to do with fantasy and imagination in the adult world . In “The Thief” , a group of young children have been abducted by a madman with magical powers. They are brought to Paris where they are kept in the attic of a ruined castle and tortured. The children’s mothers find that they have forgotten about them and send the fathers to search for them. While the father is out for a walk they begin to imagine the stories they have heard from the castle. “The Testament of Orpheus”

A priest of Orpheus tells a legend of Orpheus and Eurydice.

This is the worst movie I have ever seen . If I was n't watching it for free , I will pay $10 . It was boring , the plot was not original , the acting was horrible . I will not post the film link , it's enough for me to watch this . I will not post the link , it's enough for me . A very good movie , good action , great fight scenes with the help of good CGI . It took me a long time to see it . The only problem I have with the movie is the editing .

Brass pictures ( movies is not a fitting word for them ) really are somewhat brassy . Their alluring visual style is the perfect fit for all the action packed movies these days . It seems like Brass Pictures has been a constant part of movie history since its founding in 1969 . There’s a reason people have been telling stories about a certain movie for so long . It is because of their artistry . I am sure you are familiar with this studio’s work as they make films like the famous ‘The Godfather Part II’. They have done some pretty great movies too .

Punishment Park is a brilliant piece of cinema. Shot in the SouthernCalifornia desert using his patent faux documentary style, Watkinscreates a film like no other. He follows two groups of prisoners (onepre-sentenced the other post-sentenced) throughout the picture. After they're tried by a military tribunal, they have the choice of eitherserving out a prison sentence or they can participate in PunishmentPark (a grueling three day hike through the desert with nothing but theclothes on their backs) whilst being hunted down by local lawenforcement officers who use the park as a live action trainingground). I can't say enough about this movie.

In 1968 , Stanley Kubrick made this historic film masterpiece base on a book written by Arthur C. Clark . He based the film on this novel with the help of his brother , Francis . This movie is named as one of the best films of all time . It won many awards , including Golden Globe , and Academy Award . It is considered the best sci-fi film of all time . It was also considered to be one of the best horror films . It was a huge box office hit . In the years after its release the film became a staple of movie theaters .

I feel dumber after watching the first 20 min,luckily i walked out and saved the rest of my brain, people should watch better films and take notes on why they are rated highly,not because of the budget of the film or the special effects, just simply good acting and getting simple things right,and MOst importantly--not being LAME--, but i guess this was produced for those Sheeple without taste and not a clue of what is ''A good Movie''don't be scared of rating films low,save your under-appreciated high scores for ''once in a life time movies''.

The Other Boleyn Girl - not to be confused with the book it claims to be based upon . This is the story of Jane Boleyn from a woman's perspective. The most important character is the Lady Anne and her relationship to Jane, her sister and brother-in-law. Lady Anne has many qualities which make her interesting, such as intelligence, bravery, and kindness. Anne was born in 1516, the daughter of Thomas Boleyn and Joan Howard. Anne's father was a prominent courtier; he was known as Lord Rochford.

Ron Hall pulls a triple threat as he writes , directs and stars in 'Vampire Assassins ' . Derek Washington is one of the most prolific screenwriters and directors in the genre. In fact, he has written and directed a number of memorable horror films. He was the first writer to write a horror film as an independent and his work has earned him the title of horror writer king. He has had four feature-length films released with three of his films being nominated for the Best Horror Film at the 2007, 2008, and 2009 TCAF Film Festival.

This is almost Ed Wood territory . Yeah , that ridiculous wreck of a flying monster looks like a cross between an eagle and a jaguar from the side. And what is that contraption on his back? It looks a little like a jet engine. But there’s something in the way you look. It’s a weird look. So I was just wondering, do you guys feel like this is the year of the Flying Monster? I don't know what's happening. The year of The Flying Monster is over. The year of the giant flying machine is over.

This movie reeks. No money, no acting, no nothing. I caught this on on the 3am late show movie tonight and felt compelled to comment on it. This movie has nothing to recommend it. I can't believe it ever got released to US television! Nobody in this movie can act their way out of a paperbag. The lame attempts at comedy fall flat on their face, the special effects consist of a worm-like handpuppet "monster"... I can't even begin to tell you how rock-bottom this production is.

I went to see this because I'd never seen Tel-Aviv, where the story is set. I was disappointed, since it doesn't offer many views of Israel's largest metropolis. It's also pretentiousone of those movies that leaves you guessing at its meaning until you ultimately give up with a shrug of the shoulders.The main protagonist is Batya, a woman in her twenties' who works as a waitress at catered weddings. Her parents evidently don't care about her very much, and when a little girl walks out of the sea with an inflatable ring around her, Batya feels compelled to take care of her.

Clearly this would have had potential in more capable hands, but given Uwe Boll's track record it would have been surprising if there would have been any merit to this farce.The first 5 minutes are classic monster movie madness - even the horrible one-liners delivered by GI Joe type soldiers feel as if they were lifted off another venture into the same genre.You will be doing yourself a favor if you exit the movie at this point. You've already passed all the highlights and you will have spared yourself the suffering of sitting through some of the worst acting in recent history.Next, enter absolute rubbish talent.

Oppenheimer was a GREAT series (it was the first thing I saw Waterston in) and it is too bad copies aren't available. A similar situation exists for "Glory Enough for All", a British series from around the same time, about the discovery of insulin. I would pay a good price for both of these on DVD. Is it really so difficult to get Oppenheimer on a DVD that is able to be played in the US? Another very enjoyable series, again from about the same time, was "Danger UXB".

The trouble with this sort of lyrical film-making is that you either make a masterpiece, or a lemon: there's little middle ground. Putting it gently, this is not "Berlin - symphony of a city" or "Man with a Movie Camera". Unfortunately, it's not much to look at, either.The problem with this one is that it's glib and half-baked, as if Michael Moore had come on board. It doesn't really have anything to say, or rather, to show us with pictures and sounds. Koyanisqatsi uses images cumulatively to propound a thesis.

Tediously long dreary cinematic waffle. I couldn't believe how bad this film was. I watched it merely because of the numerous people who gushed about it on this site. Was I watching the same film? The entire episode is one-dimensional. Nothing that happened in Garps' past affected his (or anyone else's) future and no-one was affected by their past. I think it was Socrates who said about plays that if a scene can be removed from a play without having any effect, then it shouldn't be there.

As a Genghis Khan `` fan '' I was looking forward to this movie . After devouring Conn Igguldens epic trilogy of books it was time for the film to come out . I also had read some good reviews about this film on the internet and was happy to finally get a copy . The movie was released to great reviews , so I gave it the green light , this was my first movie I ever saw as a movie , so I was excited . The film is basically a series of short stories by Iggulden , that take the form of a film .

`` Hardbodies 2 '' is harmless , aimless and plot less . I would add `` brainless '' to that list for me . And so on. That's not even the list of the adjectives one would apply to the game in order to describe it in the context of '' HardBodies 2 , '' which is, itself, very close to a '' HardBodies 1. '' The only significant difference is in the number of players, which is four in the game '' HardBodies 1 . '' HardBodies 2 , '' however, would be three .

I hope the writer, director, editor, and composer (and let's not forget producer) read this... because their work was truly incredible on this movie. Let me start by saying that I am in no way affiliated with this movie. I am only a regular guy who has been a fan of this movie for about 12 years and have seen it about 8 times.Every second of this movie is touching. Every scene is classic. The acting is real. The movie is honest. You can relate to these characters as people, not actors.This tale follows three distinct killers at different stages in their lives.

this movie is n't that great ... at all but it 's good when you want to just laugh , the acting , the humor and the whole plot , it's really funny so you just need to see this one

This movie is not that great ... it's not that funny but when you just want to laugh it's good ... the acting , humor and the whole plot - it's really funny so you just need to see this one and you will have a really great time and see it once

It is really not good .

Altioklar 's populist approach manifests itself in all his titles , from the worst to the best . He does not mince words , and it is easy to predict which themes will dominate each work . It is no wonder he has been acclaimed by his critics as the most brilliant novelist of the Turkish generation . This book is as much an attempt at social and political commentary as it is a novel . Altiok (1928-2007) was born in Istanbul, where his parents were from, where his grandfather had fought the Russians at the Battle of Gallipoli.

I watched this movie with big expectations . The blurb on the back indicated that this was going to be a good movie . however i got a bit of a shock when the movie started . after a good half hour of waiting, we got into the theater , and the movie started , but the story and the characters were so flat . the story was about how two young people had gotten together , and wanted to go out for a drink . i can see why they would want to go out for a drink , especially with two people who looked like they would fit together well .

How bad idea was to remake an almost Oscar -worthy film?! MOSTHLY MARTHA is MUCH MORE BETTER, has deepness, finesse and so on and mainly: a wonderful and talented actress in the leading role (Martina Gedeck). It's a joke and ugliness with the handsome Aaron and the whole atmosphere... again a ridiculous effort from Hollywood. There are more and more remake and the films are full with schemes.. Isn't anybody there who can create a good and newly script? Or this is a safety solution to make remake or movies from the well-tried cartoon figures?

This is a serious film about black revolutionaries and not really an action film. Billy Dee plays a young man fed up with racism who decides to take things into his own hands. It's fairly gritty and realistic without exploiting the characters but still it's not that interesting either and Billy Dee's character, though maltreated by white authority figures, doesn't really come off as sympathetic. It's also hurt by it's extremely low budget. Still, it's interesting to look at as it's a good depicttion of 1970s social issues.

For the first time in reviewing films, I found myself immediately uninterested in this story. I don't know if it was the way that it was filmed or the story behind the characters, but it felt bland, overused, and completely unoriginal. Within the first thirty minutes, I found myself rather apathetic with all the characters and the story. I felt as if I had seen this structure before, and Tart was providing nothing new to surprise me. After thinking that it may just be my mood, I stopped the film and chose to start it fresh in the morning, but the same feeling persisted.

I saw this film at the tender age of 18 with a group of friends. Its reputation had preceded it, and though all my friends were also of legal age, I alone had the courage to enter the video store and actually rent it. We gathered at a house where the parents had left town for the weekend. Though we sat in close proximity to each other, we did not speak or otherwise acknowledge each other's presence. As it turned out, the film both merited and did not merit the anticipatory shame we felt.

Let 's get right to the heart of the matter ... This is a terrible movie . The story is so terrible and the acting is poor and so amateurish that the whole movie is so boring and unenjoyable that I don't want to talk about it because I will start feeling guilty that I wasted 15 minutes of my life seeing it. That said , there are things that are funny , clever and well done in this movie , and a couple of the best moments in the whole movie are worth watching for the sheer entertainment value.

A savage , undisciplined lion has been put behind bars for a circus carnival . He suddenly notices a hole in his cage and jumps through to find himself in a dark alley . Suddenly he realizes he is not in a zoo as he expected and that he is on his own. He wanders down the alley until he finds a streetlamp . With the light he walks back up to the circus . The lion is now the star attraction , and it's up to him to entertain and amuse the crowd and the audience .

It has been years since I have been privileged to see this movie on TV. I only wish I could contact someone to see it again. I married a man with three children and two had Fetal Alcohol Syndrome. I didn't' realize this but seeing this movie helped me understand more about their problems and more about how I can love them and help them overcome their difficulties. My step-son is now 35 and thank the Lord he has blossomed wonderfully but still has many after affects of being born by an alcoholic mother.

I'm not a movie snob. I've liked lots of movies that critics hate, and I've hated movies that critics love. However, I have to agree with critics here--"Galaxina" is just substandard. Clearly intended to be a comedy, it only has a few scattered laughs. "Galaxina" has poor photography; it has poor special effects; it has some pretty poor acting; and the production values...well, the sets might as well have been made of cardboard. "Galaxina" tells the story of a spaceship whose crew is looking for a magical object called "The Blue Star".

OhMyGAWD ! ! ! THE MAGIC GARDEN is perhaps one of my most vivid '70s childhood memories . Two hippie-punk kids from Seattle spent two days in a rented house on a tiny peninsula in Northern California for a hippie pot festival. I'd like to think the main goal was just to spend a day hanging out and having fun, but it was also to spread the word about cannabis and its beneficial uses. I had a lot of fun and learned quite a bit about cannabis in those years and the magic of living in the country.

A scientist (George Zucco) wants to create wolf men out of American soldiers to fight the Nazis, but is branded as mad. He uses a simpleton gardener (Glenn Strange) to experiment on by mixing his blood with the blood of a wolf. Strange, constantly embedding his dialogue with the tones of Lon Chaney Jr. in "Of Mice and Men", has no idea what's going on, only that he sleepwalks. The victims begin to pile up (including a little girl, which modern viewers might find rather disturbing, and two of Zucco's rivals).

I only comment on really very good films and on utter rubbish. My aim is to help people who want to see great films to spend their time - and money - wisely.I also want to stop people wasting their time on garbage, and want to publicize the fact that the director/producer of these garbage films can't get away with it for very long. We will find out who you are and will vote with out feet - and wallets.This film clearly falls into the garbage category.The director and writer is John Shiban. It's always a bad sign when the writer is also the director.

What a trip down memory lane.Do not look for great acting, believable plot lines, or anything resembling a quality movie.This is pure blaxploitation at it's finest. Outrageous outfits, unrepeatable dialog, objectification of women, and the sleaziest cops you can imagine.This vanity piece by the "Godfather of Rap," Rudy Ray Moore, who left us for good last week is the standard by which all blaxploitation is measured.You not only see blaxploitation at it's finest, but get glimpses of his comedy genius, and see why his records were kept under the counter.

At first I didn't think that the performance by Lauren Ambrose was anything but flaky, but as her character developed the portrayal made more sense. Amy Madigan seemed too terse for her role and didn't really tie her daughter's characters together, even though it was apparent that her character was disengaged with the character played by Lauren Ambrose.Christopher Lloyd is a hit as usual and carried off his role to encourage the story line. His character development left the audience wondering why he was chastised by the younger characters and could have been accomplished more directly with The overwhelming glue to this somewhat vague story line was play by Taylor Roberts.

How do I describe the horrors ? ! ! ! First , some points : First , this review should be read as a critique, not a review. A review is meant as an assessment of the quality of a film, a commentary on a film’s strengths, or the strengths or weaknesses of the entire series, not a summation of what makes a film worth watching. That is the purpose of this review. Second , this review is meant for those with an interest in the works of Hitchcock, not just for anyone who wants to learn more about the filmmaker’s life.

As if the world needed another Seagal movie . Add a bunch of actors who , well ... are not exactly known for their acting, and give it the Seagal treatment, what do you think happens? Well, let's see. We're looking at three actors, in three different roles. In a movie. Tommy Chong is in the movie. In a role. And it's his only role in the movie, according to Seagal, who explains:

"I went into the movie with the attitude that it would be a role-playing exercise. I never knew what the role was.

The submarine used was NOT Varangian! 'It' was in fact two boats, P614 and P615, both built for Turkey by Vickers Armstorng at Barrow-in-Furness but kept hold of by the Royal Navy for the duration of the war. P615 was sunk but P614 was eventually delivered in 1945. The confusion no doubt arose because someone looked up P61 (as I did) and found Varangian! When in fact, the last digit of both P614 and P615 was in fact just painted out....There are some extremely realistic moments in the film. These Turkish boats were very similar to the S-class.

Don't be taken in because the premise of this film is a good one. It is, but that, does not a good film, make.Comedies require a well-honed script and masterful direction. Sadly, this poorly executed film has neither. Leconte, a good director in other genres, does not deliver in his comedic farces (Les Bronzes series being another example).The comedic timing is terrible. Some jokes are telegraphed. Some are re-hashed from other movies. Others just sit there as if they were giving you time to laugh.

`` Graduation Day '' is a result of the success of `` Friday the 13th . '' Both of those films came out less than 2 years apart. The first of those films, in 1982, was followed by a sequel. A year later, the same year the second film came out, a sequel followed. That same year a third one followed. So it was that, just 2 years after the first film came out, 3 films were made based on it. They are all excellent films, although I think they are all too derivative of each other.

I was surprised to discover Michael Moore or Bill Maher was n't involved with this `` movie '' . An individual who made the film '' has been a member of the National Committee of the Green Party, a member of the Green Party of Texas, a candidate for Texas governor, a candidate for lieutenant governor, a candidate for governor, a candidate for lieutenant governor of Texas, a candidate for the Texas state senate, candidate for lieutenant governor of Texas, candidate for lieutenant governor of U.S., and candidate for president of the United States.

I remember being so excited on Saturday nights when I was a kid , waiting for Dr. Who . I would watch the show on the local cable channel and imagine the scenes in the future. One thing was always for sure, I would be sitting on my bed, watching it on the couch. I had a great imagination. Now the show is no longer in my memory. However I remember my first Dr. Who experience was in the fall of 1991. It was an episode that was aired on September 8. I had just purchased my first new DVD player, a Panasonic CD-I.

I've tried watching it twice, though I haven't been able to make through either episode. For me, it's basically just not funny. I can tell where I'm suppose to laugh, but I can't. I've never seen the original, so I'm not comparing. I also love comedies, including off-the-wall comedies like Married...With Children and Family Guy, but this show just doesn't' do it for me. The jokes are lame and flat, and the acting is mostly annoying. The commercials made it look interesting, but it isn't.

Like Margot in "Fear of Fear" falls victim of her ambitious husband, like Fox in "Fox and his friends" is driven into suicide by his boyfriend who took all his money away, like Xaverl Bolwieser in "The Stationsmaster's Wife" who goes to prison in order to give his cheating wife a chance to get rid of him, like Hermann Hermann who seeks refuge in insanity in order to flee his stupid wife and bankrupt company, so also Hans Epp is a victim of the German "Wirtschaftswunder"-Society after World War II in R.W.

I ca n't express enough just how bad this film was . First of all what a waste of some of the most talented young actors of all time . If you can go into a movie and be excited and care about it as you watch it then it will hold you . And it should for the characters here as well . I am not going to spoil anything in the ending so if you don't like it go buy a ticket next time . I have to admit , this is the worst movie of all time .

Dodgy plot , dodgy script , dodgy almost everything in fact . The most compelling performance is that of Joanna Lumley as Mary, an old schoolfriend of Maggie's and daughter to the minister she has a brief fling with who is currently serving a jail sentence. It is only when her mother tells her to meet Maggie for tea that she makes the connection. I don't know how you put a twist in a story that would be so believable. The book was very entertaining and had a lot of thought put into it. The characters are a very diverse group of women from different walks of life.

This is my favorite Renoir from the Fifties . It 's the story of how Henri Danglard built and launched his film production company. In the early fifties he took over as head of the film department of a small publishing company. For a young man, he had a very interesting way of managing his staff. The way he did it is really unique. If you watch his films, you can actually see how he really managed his team and how he built up a business. The most interesting thing is that he started out with no film experience at all .

Until I did a Web search on "What Alice Found", I didn't realize that the name of the film is embedded in the title of one of Lewis Carroll's books. The book's complete title is "Through the Looking-Glass (And What Alice Found There)".The Alice of the film comes from a background quite different from that of Lewis Carroll's Alice. Her fresh and assertive character, however, is similar. The movie Alice begins as a young woman in New Hampshire who steals money from her ass-patting boss and takes off for Miami, vaguely planning to study marine biology and play with dolphins.

Love the TPB's but this was a lame episode. Didn't have the same feel that the series or the movie has. Looked like it was put together in a hurry. I didn't enjoy it at all. The so-called acting was awful. The cast appeared like they knew this was a money-grab of an episode to get to market quickly. I hope we don't have an easter special next because that will be it for me. The writing of this episode was definitely Mike Clattenburg's worst in the history of this show.

Once again , Bugs Bunny sacred home is violated by careless people . This time the traveling circus put a lot of time and cost to repair it, but unfortunately they did not make any new hole, and now the owner is willing to sell. So, if you have enough money to buy this home or have relatives that you want to sell it, it is time to take this property to your relatives to sell it for you. This property has been sitting for several years. It looks like there is nothing but a big hole in the center of this property.

Teenage Exorcist is one of those God-awful films to video that makes the viewer give up any expectations of decent storytelling. Not just from a production perspective, but from a storytelling one as well. There’s a scene early on where a couple have sex in a car in a park in which they are going to die as a result of the sex and then the camera pans back to show them on their last moments. Then, the next scene is in a church where a priest exorcises a demon from the man. The next scene is him being exorcised by the same priest from the man.

You thought after `` Traumschiff Surprise '' that German comedy ca n't get worse ? It can . This comedy-drama opens with a scene in which a man, played by Max von Sydow, is driving to work when he runs out of gas, so he calls a friend to bring him some petrol. His wife tells him he has only a couple of hours to live, so he puts on his best suit, goes out to dinner with his friend, and then goes to his office at the Traumschiff. It seems, however, that he has just died and was buried.

It seems on the surface to be a romantic _planes , trains and automobiles_ but at times tried for something more. But I don't know, I have to keep my nose clean and have a clean conscience. It's like I said, keep a clean slate and I don't know why, I'm just gonna go out and try my hand. I'll probably break my neck but it won't kill me. What else is a man's life for if it's not to get a little dirt on a bit of cardboard and go home and try to live with what you have.

One of the most successful shows in television history is back . Now I admit I never got into the show, it didn't appeal to me for one reason, it never had a reason. It didn't have a storyline, the characters all had a story, the characters did nothing but do what they do. And when the show started out it had the best character ever played on a television show, it was a great character to follow. I don't know, I never got into it, but I have watched many episodes, and I had to admit it had the best plot ever.

I found this an awfully disappointing experience! But I have appended a better option of similar style at the foot of this entry.This "Felicia's Journey" is intriguing. It has drama. But it is full of stereo-types! So it ONLY serves judgemental temperaments without concern for truer justice & fairness & truth, beyond black 'n' white judgements that fit 30-second ads of "NEWS" that dot our multimedia experiences everyday, especially news bulletins, true or misleading in such depictions! It is SO EXAGGERATED, it reminds me of the fairytale of "Little Red Ridinghood"!

This Gundam series only follows Gundam 0083 Stardust Memory. The story takes place during the same time line as the original Gundam in the year U.C. 0079 the time of the One year war, but the mobile suits are designed as new models are and are as a result look more articulate. The Hero of the story is a young Lt. Shiro Amada, who may lack any real combat experience but makes up for it with creativity and effort.His life get complicated when he meets Aina Sahalin a Jion ace pilot (the enemy), the to end up falling in love and begin to change their attitudes about the war around them.

The real life case of an innocent First Nations chief ( the Indian ) by an Winnipeg city officer ( the American )

Tuesday, December 30, 2008

I just had a conversation with a guy who said he didn't trust anyone in the city hall, including me, and that if I were a First Nation Chief, I'd be gone. I said it's hard to believe he believes that I don't have the experience and credentials I've had, or even the ability to represent the interests of First Nations as a citizen.

1st watched 4/30/2009 - 4 out of 10 ( Dir-John Waters ) : Corny Waters-like comedy musical with some funny bits. You can watch it all over again, just so you know what it is. No one ever watched this film again, so that makes my job easier. First saw 3/5/2007 - 11/10/10 - 8 out of 10 ( Dir-John Waters ) : I watched this after seeing The Exorcist for the first time. The movie was better, and it had some good jokes. But, like some others have mentioned, it is hard to watch.

This is the worst movie I have seen to date. 85 minutes of utterly bad acting,(half the cast seem to be suffering from Asperger's syndrome) ghastly wigs, strange make-up (including tide lines around wig areas) and holier than thou characters with holier than thou dialogue that makes you want to puke. One comical aspect of this film, if you have the patience to watch it, is the sheer overwhelming number of costume changes the unfortunate cast appear in from scene to scene - was this film backed by a catalogue manufacturer of desperately dodgy pastel casual wear?

Man , what an awful film . As with many terrible films , the structure of its awfulness lies in its central premise . And in this case , its central premise is about an ordinary guy with no money , who gets a job as a delivery man , but finds himself in a world inhabited by evil spirits who want to kill him with his very existence . So , with no job , no money , no girlfriend , no friends , no hope , what is he supposed to do ? So , after a while , he just goes to work .

After a meteorite lands in `` Boston '' ( really somewhere in the Isle of Man ) , a hideous thing is created out of the molten rock. The monster is so terrifying that everyone - except for the monster's victim - runs away in fear . The monster kills the only survivor, a little boy, and eats him. But the monster is stopped when the boy's father uses a magic key to turn the meteorite into a magic key, which he uses to unlock the gates to the kingdom. He opens the gates for all to go home again, with the exception of one child: the monster.

This episode was boring and was not even in the realm of horror, so far this season Masters of Horror has produced one really good episode...The Damned Thing...it is still early, I have faith that the episodes will get better. I admit that the vampire episode was okay but lacked a solid storyline. The episode about the couple catching the serial killer started out boring, but the last fifteen minutes was really good. Though, I am just plain out disappointed with the lack of originality and horror that the first season's episodes possessed. Please, save this season John Carpenter!

I must give credit to Billy Dee for trying to pull this off . Knowing this was a blaxploitation film made at the time, I was amazed how well it was executed . . . I've been around the block long enough to know when it was time to go and see something that hasn't been seen for years . And I have to give it to Harold Ramis , because this was one of the most inventive comedy films I've ever seen. . . The movie was the last of Ramis's trilogy of blaxploitation films, the first of which being The Blues Brothers.

An enjoyable movie , without a doubt , and very evocative of both its era and that very particular stage of the cinema , as it was the only film ever to be shot inside an actual train station , and one of only four films shot in Europe to have a real train on screen . It may not be the most ambitious or the most complex movie in the world , as it has some fairly straightforward plots , a good pace , and a good sense of comic timing . The film , though it does have some clever moments , is also far from being the most beautiful or the most exciting movie .

Wow , I swear this has never happened to me before . I only watched `` Golden Temple Amazons '' for the first two episodes but I enjoyed it so much I bought the movie in the same day . The movie is really very good and worth watching . It is about 3 sisters that live in the Indian subcontinent . The story starts with them getting married and then they all go to the United States with the idea of a new life . The first season of the movie covers their childhood and their marriage . The second and third season cover the journey to the USA .

I 've read the positive comments on this movie . I assume people who were in this movie must 've felt the same about the film. I 've watched this movie twice. I feel like the movie was overrated, but the cinematography of the film is really good. The film has a nice, fresh look. The story is really good as well. The actors and actresses really do a nice job in the role. The story isn 't original, but I think the movie will be good for a long time. The film is good , but it is very obvious that they were rushed the film .

Certain aspects of Punishment Park are less than perfect, specifically some of the acting. However I feel that this is probably the most important movie of the "war on terror" era. I grew up hating hippies and in some respects I still do. It wasn't until the United States was started down the path of an unnecessary and deceitful war in Iraq that I began to see the world through their eyes. I can feel what they must have felt. Although the film is somewhat dated, watching it brings those uncomfortable emotions about our present situation right to the surface.

I 'm almost embarrassed to admit to seeing CALIGULA twice . The problems with the production are almost too numerous to describe. There are only a few things I want to bring to your attention. These are just my opinions and they are not to be held as Truth. Please do your research before you start criticizing others. I 'll just start off with my opinions. 1. The main character of CALIGULA is a female. She has a daughter who is about 7 or 8, her husband is in his early 30s.

Not having any idea what this film was about, but based on the fact that John Leguizamo was appearing in it, we decided to watch it. Well, it turned out not to be the wisest decision. In fact, as another commentary in this forum puts it, we felt embarrassed for the actors that participated in this movie.While the film is by no means horrible, it doesn't make sense at all. The over the top performance by William Baldwin doesn't help the situation either. John Leguizamo is a multi-talented actor who deserved better.

A truly accurate and unglamourous look into modern day life . It could be set in any town in the world (if the artist can get it on a billboard) but it looks like it’s set in London. There’ll be a bunch of people, maybe a cat and dog (I like dogs and cats, though I haven’t actually seen either). It will probably end with the cat saying “Thank you” or the cat and dog saying “Good night” or something of the like.

Not really worth a review , but I suppose it 's my duty to warn you all - especially since I've been here for a year - that I'll be leaving this site in the not-too-distant future. The fact is that I no longer think the way I used to think and I've come to realize that the Internet is not the place to share your deepest thoughts and feelings, and I'm not comfortable having my personal life and thoughts on display to everyone I know, including family and close friends who know nothing of who I was before I started using the Internet.

An Asian blowgun assassin takes out victims in Niagara Falls and New York City before getting run over by a car. Sheila Morris (former Miss Sweden Janet Agren, given a hilarious "Southern belle" dub to show she's from Alabama) finds a connection between these killings and the disappearance of her sister Diana (Paola Senatore) and sets out to investigate. This brings her to New Guinea where she promises a sleazy guide (Robert Kerman i.e. American porn star R. Bolla) 80,000 dollars to help locate her sister.

I've spent quite a while going through all the reviews for this film. I'm in total agreement with almost every reviewer in saying that Noah's Ark is crap, crap, crap, crap, crap! Don't the executives at NBC have any class? I feel sick to my stomach for actually watching both parts of this mini-series. The script is so dumb, so pointless, and yes, TOTALLY INACCURATE! I can understand making a few changes for dramatic purposes, but this film changed just about everything in the story.

It is not only difficult to comment separately on the three parts of Kieslowski 's trilogy , it seems obvious that his first two volumes together make a trilogy , but we still have a third book that we don't really know what to do with yet . What is going on here? Why are the films being split in three , and why isn't Kieslowski splitting them up into separate films , or at least doing something in each film that can't be seen in the other film? Why is Kieslowski creating a trilogy ?

If you wondered whether Disney could broadcast a show with a character more spoiled than Paris, more shallow than Britney, more vapid than Jessica and more narcissistic than THE GIRLS NEXT DOOR, wonder no more. The amazing thing is Selena Gomez is, apparently, supposed to be the heroine. She's also supposed to be an outcast from the spoiled, shallow, vapid, narcissistic "popular" girls at school, which is no more believable here than it was for Hilary Duff in LIZZIE McGUIRE. Plots range from recycled BEWITCHED & I DREAM OF JEANNIE to "parodies" of HARRY POTTER.

A notorious big budget flop when released. This Robert Altman inspired comedy has some terrific moments and an occasionally inspired cast. Although it goes on to long an loses its focus completely, there are enough funny moments that will keep a curious viewer watching until the end. If you are a fan of character actors and actresses, this will be a treat for you; you will recognize so many terrific little known performers throughout this movie (you may not know their names, but you know their faces), heck even the kid from A Christmas Story turns up in a small part.

This movie was really funny. The people that were expecting to see an Oscar worthy comedy, should get over themselves. This was a fun movie to see with interesting and funny characters, plot lines, dialog quotes and catch phrases. I rate a movie a 10 if I have bought the DVD, or in this case, the videotape, and have watched it many times, and in this case, still laugh out loud. I have about 12 movies in my collection with a rating of 10 and about half don't have anything do do with the Oscars.

I hardly know where to begin in writing about this gem , except to say that it represents young Buster Keaton . I think I had the privilege of meeting Buster while working as the Director of the Pasadena Playhouse . I remember when we met , my first impression was that you could tell the man had lived a great life , full of laughter , adventure , humor , and love. Buster was as sweet as he was courageous . He always had a big heart , and I never once heard him complain. He was a big softy , and you can hear that in his voice .

I understand that people have different expectations of low-budget , arthouse movies . I also know that John Sayles has his own preferences as to what he likes . In an effort to meet the requirements of all audiences ( both new and experienced and old and new ) I've decided to make a selection from the vast array of low budget film making which I'm sure you can only experience at the local movie house. I'd like to call it , " Low Budget Horror Movies ." I'll be including several of the classics as well as several less well known horror flicks .

I did have a good time the first 45 min. or so, but then suddenly it was all down hill. The suspense somewhat started to get thin and the jokes somewhat the same all over. What kept it going were the good actors.But the problem with this film is that it is trying to be cleverly funny,like Tarantino and god is that outdated stuff. Tarantino being a bit overrated sometimes, this movie comes ten years too late. At best it is for teenagers, and I am sure many of them find the character of Johann funny, which he is for the first 30 min.

In 1929 , director Walt Disney and animator Ub Iwerks changed the face of animation with the release of the first full-color feature film , Alice in Wonderland . The idea was for the film to be a “fantasy land” where everything was made up of colors. “There was no time limit on the imagination of this film,” said Walt Disney, “and there was no rule about where it must or must not go or anything like that. That is one of the main reasons people like it so much.

I am from Romania ... and for that i apologize if my English is not so good.i just finished watching "The Bourne Ultimatum" i really enjoy the movies. And i think that i like it better when it was made in Italy ... that is why i would like a movie with that style. Well i was wondering if anyone know the name of this movie and if there are any news about it. thanks in advance for the answers. The only news i heard about it came when i was watching news with my friend and she said that it will come out in the beginning of March.

This film is a great rampage of action and comedy , it gets right in to it right from the start ,it's action packed from the start and there's a lot of laughs at the end of the film it's a must have for any action film fan . It's a classic action film and it's one that has been done in many ways over the many years and still remains one of the top action movies. It has a lot of action but at no point did we feel like the movie was over. The action continues throughout the film and is really well portrayed.

I can see that the ratings for this film are n't all that high for this film , so I would recommend that the film has at least the top 20 ratings at IMDb before I consider this to be one that I might be able to see, if I wanted to see it in a movie theater , but that is not likely to happen any time too soon. I'll be watching with a family member and the movie will likely be one we watch over the next few nights. It is a fun movie , worth the watch and worth checking out.

I thoroughly enjoyed this movie and to date, this year, it is one of my favorites. The story was excellent although the twist at the end was far too predictable and I knew what would happen far too early. Usually when this happens the film is spoiled for me (like "The Others") but even knowing the outcome I still enjoyed it right up to the end. Looking through the comments of others many people were impressed with the performance from Kelly Overton (Eve), I'm afraid I was not.

Estevez , Martin Sheen and Kathy Bates are superb in this portrayal of a Vietnam vet home from the war. Sheen is superb as a veteran who has to decide between returning to the U.S. and going to Europe where he can be with his young children. Sheen does not want to be a soldier again because he hates the war and he is afraid of another attack. The actor is excellent. His character is a real man. When you first meet Tom Cruise you know that he will be an actor’s actor. He is very talented, very good looking and very tough.

Even with only 6,000 bucks and a cast of part-time actors , Christopher Nolan was a master . Nolan is now working on a new film, The Prestige , and I have a couple of theories on how he might be doing it . Nolan may have started out as a writer , but his first break out came as director of Memento . In that movie , the character of Neo (icester turtley) gets trapped inside his own head with the power to rewrite the past . He can remember any event in his life that ever occurred or will occur from a particular point in time .

Definitely a movie for people who ask only to be entertained and who do not over-think their movies. Lots of action, lots of great dialogue (e.g. fun to quote), a little intrigue, and stuff blowing up all over the place. Samuel L Jackson and Geena Davis had great chemistry. Violent, but not gory. The fact that the female part was the competent action lead is a pleasant turn-about.Have seen the movie more than a dozen times and still enjoy it enough to put it back in my favorite films rotation every 3 or 4 months.

A long time ago , in a galaxy far , far away ( sound familiar ) , water has become a precious commodity. Not water in the common sense , though . This precious commodity was first discovered about a hundred years ago , back when men still wore shirts , and women still wore hats. And it didn’t get any more scarce than it does now. What we’re used to calling “water” is in fact H2O, a gas that can be found in many places , and can boil, freeze and boil again at high temperatures.

Loki , Norse god of mischief , creates a mask that endows the wearer with cartoon-like powers . At the center of his mask sits his long, slender, serpent-like tongue. When Loki takes this serpent-like tongue in his own mouth he becomes able to speak with a new voice, which gives him even greater powers . In the course of his adventure , he encounters many gods and goddesses who have great power and knowledge , and in the end he is finally successful . The film was originally released in Japan as , and later as . English-language versions of the film are called .

Some movies you 'll watch because they touch your soul or challenge you in ways that grow.Some you 'll watch because they 're simply great.Others you 'll watch because you want to see how good a director can make a movie without ever making any money.Either way, we'll tell you what to see, where to watch it, and which movie you should see with your best friends, family, or colleagues.You'll find the list here, but as you scroll through, we'll be keeping track of the movies in the order that we think you should see them.

If you want to see someone accidentally eat another man's testicle, or look at a row of pathetically fake hard-ons at a wedding, or listen to a man talk about how good it felt to have sex with a girl while she was throwing up, then this is the movie for you. Alternating, in neck breaking fashion, between romantic and gross out comedy, Tomcats is certainly interesting. The lovely Jaime Pressly plays the wife of Horatio Sanz(tell me another one) who is found in many silhouetted situations with other women, but there is, surprisingly, no nudity.

The portrayal of the Marines in this film is spot on . The action scenes are some of the best I've seen in any of the movie series so far. The story is excellent and I love how all the Marines are portrayed from the point of view point of all the men and the women that we have seen up until now. The script is a bit too slow, but you get what you have. I loved this movie. You will not be disappointed. You will enjoy it. This is one of the very best movies I have seen so far in this entire series.

I went to this film having no idea what to expect . I actually took a date to it in anticipation, but I was completely blown away! It's a perfect example of a story told by great acting. I loved how he played it, and how he made you feel like it was a movie that you could actually sit through and enjoy. This is a great film in so many ways and I highly recommend it if you can get your hands on one! If I had to list a single reason why this was my favourite movie of this summer, it has to be this.

It was 1983 and I was 13 . I watched Valley Girl on HBO one night when my parents were away, but my parents had told me to sit in front of it and watch it anyway. So I put it on . I fell asleep and didn’t remember much of it until years later, when I saw the movie. In this version, the teenage daughter ( played by Julia Roberts) is pregnant at 14 years old. She gets married to her high school sweetheart and they raise their daughter together. She has to grow up fast.

I have recently seen a string of caving movies and this film managed to cobble together all the worst aspects of all the other caving movies and it is quite good. If you like the film and want to know more about caving, I recommend you to check out my previous post on Caving in Britain. If you want to read the whole review please click here. I have always wanted to do this but I have never felt the desire or the motivation to put the time and work in. The main reason for my lack of enthusiasm is the amount of time and money involved.

This must be one of the worse movies that I have ever seen. On a par with Blair Witch and just as annoying. The flashing helmet lights made things difficult to see and I think that epileptics should take heed as there are moments with strobing that makes this movie even more annoying. I think if they had been quieter they might have found a way out. Then when you think the geek might come up trumps even he resorts to a nervous breakdown. Oh and when is the guy who is having sex realise that when the girl says she can hear something.

I was at a friends house for Thanksgiving and watched a DVD of the movie, Eddie Monroe. I've been a fan of Indie Films for almost 20 years, (I loved the Brothers McMullen), and was impressed how good this movie is. My friend, who works at Magno Sound, told us that this movie was shot on Super 16. The photography was so good, it looked as though it was a 35mm shoot. Furthermore, the music combined with Fred Carpenter's direction, was art. The storyline was original and led up to an ending that surprised all of us watching...very cool.

This was another film I was waiting for to be released , and now I feel a little bad having waited so long , so I will be seeing this in the theater .

Chupacabra : Dark Waters has to rank as one of the most insipidly moronic movies ever made . I had this movie on the radar for a very very long time but when I saw it at the New Beverly I knew it was a terrible movie even before I had watched the movie . I am not even a fan of horror so it is no real shock to me that this movie was one of the worst in the movie theater . However , it is hard not to be completely amazed by the horrible acting , the over the top acting , the over the top action , and the horrible writing .

Although this movie ( and I use the term loosely ) was made in 1997 , we just watched it in 2017. It was a very popular movie then, but not a good movie, it’s now more like a movie from a horror novel. The plot is like this: The movie is about a small town in Wisconsin where a very strange and terrifying event happened a few years before. This was a family tragedy that no one knows how to deal with because everyone believes that the story was made up, and that no one saw anything.

Low budget, but still creepy enough to hold your interest in another take off on the familiar Frankenstein story. This movie is also known as LADY FRANKENSTEIN. The alluring Tania Frankenstein(Sara Bay)fresh from medical school arrives at her father's estate to find that he is still up to his old tricks. Baron Frankenstein(Joseph Cotten)is murdered by his own creation and now his daughter decides to carry on the family tradition by creating herself a lover. This is closer to being an eerie melodrama than horror flick. Supporting cast features Mickey Hargitay, Paul Whiteman, Paul Muller and Herbert Fux.

Finally ! Third time lucky . This film has been always been on my mind , but my first viewing of it is something of a surprise . I hadn’t heard of it, but I did watch the trailer in the cinema with the intention of watching it in the weekend when it is screening at Cannes . As a child I remember watching this movie a lot . And I can say that my childhood memories of this masterpiece are so vivid that I felt it was a big deal for me , so I just needed to watch it .
