The Man with the Golden Arm was one of the first films to have as its main topic ( and certainly the most successful) the relationship between men and women. (Although not the first film with this subject, the most memorable of which being the film by Alfred Hitchcock, Vertigo.) In a sense, I think it is very important to examine the male/female relationship, to be more honest than most films have done. Why? Because it is the most powerful relationship on the earth. I don't claim to be the greatest or best person at looking at the male/female relationship.

Breathtaking at it's best, intriguing at it's worst, Francis Ford Coppala's groundbreaking epic 'Apocalypse Now' is one of the most iconic and celebrated motion pictures of the 20th century, and in my opinion, the greatest ever film depiction centered around America's involvement in Vietnam.What I like most about 'Apocalypse Now' is that it is uniquely different from any other films of the same genre. Growing up as movie buff, and with a particular interest in war films, I've seen many films, which have attempted to portray the 'images' and 'feelings' of Vietnam but have been unsuccessful in doing so.

Bought for £1 , Project Vampire is one of the worst movies I have ever seen . Wooden acting , wooden editing and wooden acting . It was the first horror film that I have ever seen ( I had a few) I watched it a few times in my early twenties but I never got into it. I have the DVD on my shelves but have never rewatched it and it has never been rewatched so I really have no opinion on it. It was a pretty fun time though so I guess it’s not on the top of my list.

This movie was included in the Six Wives of Henry VIII BBC miniseries DVD . I loved those six movies from the Tudor dynasty, which are really very interesting. I had no idea that Henry VIII had so many wives and mistresses, and it's fascinating to see how close he came to actually murdering all of his wives. I think we'll have much more of the Six Wives coming in the future, and a new book on the topic of Henry VIII's marriages (I'll have more to say on that later), but I did enjoy this film to begin with.

MGM hodgepodge of Jimmy Durante throwing a big party for everybody in Hollywood . No major stars show up -- that's why the stars are there . But they all get a chance to mingle and make small talk. MGM Home Entertainment’s new Blu-Ray of the 1976-77 season of “The Jimmy Durante Show” will include a host of bonus footage, including some of the show’s most famous and memorable moments, as well as several new interviews with cast and crew members from the series’ final year, including Durante himself.

This movie was the biggest piece of garbage I've seen in a long time.It's marketed as as Sci-Fi when in fact it's nothing more than a Christian recruiting tool.It tells you quite a bit about the state of the Christian church, when they have to resort to deception just to get you to listen to their sales pitch. But then again what do you expect from an organization that would go through such great lengths to help protect such an enormous amount of child molesters in their organization.Religion is full of nothing but sexual deviants, hypocrites, and war mongers.

"Landscape after a battle" opens with escaping prisoners over a snowy field full of fences - in rather funny movements accompanied by Vivaldis Four Seasons. A touching opening. But we soon enough learn to know these prisoners as a mob, and when they (also treated humouristic) burry a man alive, the protagonist stops for a moment, but is soon more engaged in finding books from the turndowned camp than caring about his neighbour.The rest of the film is set in an American camp from where the prisoners are not released, in some kind of semi freedom, semi camp.

So unfortunately me and my mate watched this ! ! ! It was showing on a Sky channel over here in Oz and we thought it must be good. We didn’t realise how wrong we would be…

We started watching at about 9.30ish when the movie started and I thought this would be ok but when I got to see the credits I saw how much money he had made for this. Now I know what you are going to say, you didn’t expect him to be the first one to earn a massive cash to make this movie!

Thats what this movie really takes . A big piece of cheeze . This movie is about a sister and brother who fall in love with the same woman . And its based on their real life . Its a love story , a good one , that will take you away and make your life full of happy moments . I am not saying this movie is romantic , because it is . But I have to say i like a movie with a message . That is the reason I liked this movie . Thats why when I first saw it , i was really shocked .

Umberto Lenzi hits new lows with this recycled trash. Janet Agren plays a lady who is looking for her missing sister. It turns out the sister is part of a Jim Jones type religous cult in New Guinea. She hires a scruffy guide played by Robert Kerman to help her get to the cult's compound located in the jungle. This is another (!) cannibal movie, and I probably would have liked it if not for Lenzi padding this film out with scenes from his superior "The Man from Deep River."

One of Chaplin's longest films up to that point, Burlesque on Carmen is a clever and surprisingly complex parody of what was then "Prosper Merimee's" well-known story about "Carmen." I was a little confused about the difference between the IMDb's listing of the 1915 Burlesque on Carmen and the 1916 version. Based on the running time I assume that it was the 1915 version that I saw, since the 1916 one is a good 20 minutes longer, and from what I've read, those are 20 unnecessary and unimpressive minutes.

I walked into a book store in Brentwood , Tennessee . I am not going to say the name because that's a common place I've been before and it is one of those things that people can be proud of without knowing anything about it . So I walked into the Barnes and Noble . I had a gift for a customer that was so important for the store and they said they wouldn't charge her the price I asked . I wanted to tell the manager but she would be in for a heart attack . So I called the person on the phone who is a customer service person of the store .

Ah yet another Seagal movie.In no less than a few mere months arrive to populate the video store shelves.As bad as Submerged?No.But that is not saying much.Like perfume on a pig.Seagal is professional thief who wants to quit,but goes for one last job only to be double-crossed by his boss.He lands in Prison and is befriended by a Gangster who helps him to break out and seek payback.Its good to see Seagal finally not playing an agent,cop,or what he usually plays.We actually get a USA Location in Las Vegas it seems. Then an eastern European territory as usual.

Mean spirited, and down right degrading adaptation to the classic children's tale not only lacks the charm of its forefather but lacks any talent what so ever. Mike Myers should not only be ashamed of himself for his horrible performance that is a clear rip off of what Jim Carrey did but he should give up acting all together. He is so annoying that you would want to beat the crap out of him if you were able to jump right in the film. The sets are ugly and the cinematography is very poor.

I occasionally let my kids watch this garbage so they will understand just how pathetic the show's "contestants" are. They are pathetic not because they are fat, but because they whore their dignity for a few minutes of fame and fortune.For anyone to appear on National TV and blubber, sniffle, and whine about being fat (entirely their own fault) is nauseating. What does this say about us as a nation? Does it suggest that your lifestyle choices, and the consequences of them, aren't our responsibility?

It's 1913. A studio prop boy spies the actress who is going to become Hollywood's next great movie star and he's the director that's going to make it happen. After inventing pie throwing and the keystone cops, his dream comes true. Being completely absorbed in his film-making, however, he fails to notice that he is losing his leading lady to another man. Several over-budget flops later, he is known as nothing more than the director who turned down Rin-tin-tin. Fortunately for him, the loyal and compassionate residents of Hollywood are untainted by ambition and ego.

I saw this last night at the Tribeca Film Fest and holy god was it bad .. From the script to the effects to the acting, this movie was so bad that it was the best movie of the night. I watched this last night at about 4 am while watching the first episode of Treme on Netflix and boy did I see it coming. If you haven't seen it, I would watch it right now. This was a movie that needed to go to the dogs. I can't believe that anyone could be offended by this film.

I am sitting here writing this review and the movie's not even over yet. In fact, I just checked, and there are 45 more minutes to go. But no matter, there's no need to see it through to the end. I'll just write this review and laugh as the film plays in the background and stumbles onward to some kind of presumably horrible conclusion which I don't care to ever see or know.What accounts for my hostility to this movie? The characters are not believable. The plot is not believable. The pretentiousness of the movie is sickening.

As others that have commented around the web ... I 'm a 130 pilot in the Coast Guard . Having been a pilot for many years I can honestly say the Coast Guard will always have an advantage over commercial aviation. However, we will have to make a choice and I will do my best to work within the rules of the Coast Guard to earn the maximum pay I am entitled to. However, I am tired of people saying the only thing you have to do is fly for the company that flies your plane. We all have the same goal and the same right to fly where we want to.

I just caught this on Showtime...ewwwwwww, not even fun in a bad movie kind of way. One of the lamest monster flicks I've ever seen. Plus the TV reporter in the movie was that annoying Jerri from a past season of Survivor. The only amusing thing was that the "secret base" was the house from Fantasy Island (and a million other movies and TV shows; the place is located in the L.A. area). I fully expected Mr Roarke and Tattoo to come out and greet the visitors.

Barbershop 2 : Back in Business was n't as good as it 's original but was just as funny . it's not hard to imagine the scene where it ends up, which is not as funny but is a lot of fun to rewatch . a lot of the actors are back too but there are some new faces this time . the main difference is that this was directed by the same man who made the first one and that 's why the movie is just as funny as it ever was . it's very funny , with lots of laughs that come from some very funny scenes .

I saw this DVD on sale and bought it without a second thought , despite not even having known it existed. What an incredible film! I highly recommend viewing it. I would also like to mention that this is a must see and worth the ticket price. You just need to watch it a few times to get a good feel of the film, and I hope to do the same. It is an extraordinary film and one you should experience. I was very surprised when I saw this film on sale at my local Blockbuster.

2005 will go down in 'Dr.Who ' history as its most incredible year . Everything seemed to click ; a great series of events for 'The Time Lords ; the series, of course, went into its seventh series. In that, we also saw the regeneration of 'Torchwood' with a brand new Doctor and a new series of adventures. But the series went further than just regeneration and series. 'The Next Doctor' went beyond that, and with 'Doctor Who' coming back with 'The Time Of The Doctor' we are back in a very exciting time for 'Who'.

This movie is all about reality , submarine warfare in WW2 was not a clean precise science . There were so many things in this movie I found hard to swallow , the scenes where the sub is being taken to an area to be sunk , and that the crew , including the captain , is in a complete mess and can hardly stand on their feet was hard to watch. It is all about real life . I liked it , the movie is a good story , but I was not able to take it all , it was very boring . I really like submarine films.

The biggest and most disconcerting things of the Raptor movie was ending for the Tyransaurus is identical to Carnosaur except with raptors. Raptor and Carnosaur was actually the best of the movies on the series. So I have no choice but to be honest, I thought they had made a mistake by not including raptors in the last movies. The way the story was presented to us makes it seem like these were the best of the movies. So I was very disappointed and confused. I’m still confused on why the last two movies do not include raptors.

This is supposedly a story in which a GROWN MAN tells a story about his youth . Yet , you don't have to be that man to understand why it's worth sharing , and it's worth sharing now .

" I have been married now for forty one years and I am proud of my wife. She is a beautiful woman and a good wife. As I have lived through the trials and tribulations of life, I believe I have had a few good memories. The first time I remember this was when I was a young boy about twelve years old.

"Hardbodies 2" is harmless, aimless and plot less. I would add "brainless" to that list, but the movie-within-a-movie gimmick, although not done very well, helps it to narrowly escape that label. The scenery has changed from the California beaches to the Greek islands, and the only returning cast members from the first film are Sorrells Pickard (the bearded guy) and Roberta Collins (who at one point falls into a mud pit, bringing back memories of her classic catfight with Pam Grier in "The Big Doll House").

With a title like that , you will be forgiven for thinking this film is about the great painter , Michelangelo . And if it was , then you would have been right . This is actually about the painter , Diego Velázquez. This film tells the tale of how Velázquez , an artist with a unique gift for expressing emotion through paint , went from his humble home in the city of Valladolid, to becoming one of the most famous artists of his time. It is a story of self-invention , ambition , and ultimately , the price of self-delusion.

One of the best sitcoms to run on Indian television along with Dekh bhai dekh and Idhar udhar. Great acting, well paced and an extremely amusing script made this a truly memorable series. The fun filled opening montage (sung by none other than the inimitable Kishore Kumar)gave a very accurate picture of what one could expect. I used to borrow it from my local video library years after Doordarshan had stopped airing it. I wish Indian television would revert back to serials such as these rather than the asinine saas-bahu soaps and reality television which is all its good for these days.

Okay so there were the odd hole in the plot you could drive a zeppelin through, but how well was the emotional stuff handled? It would have been so easy to descend into cheesiness but the writer pulled it off. The image of the ex female cyberman making crying noises as she/it saw her reflection after regaining her emotions is one that will stay with me forever. That's twice now the monsters have shown a soft side and been presented fleetingly sympathetically, the previous being the last Dalek from series one, but by Jove it's worked.

My Mother Frank begins as a warm , amiable comedy about a middle-aged Catholic woman ( Frank , short for Francesca, and sometimes written as Frannie ), who begins to have doubts about her religion. After losing her job, her husband is killed by an angry motorist, and she moves to a big, new house in Los Angeles with a new boyfriend. At first her new surroundings make her happier, but she soon finds herself alone and bored, and increasingly unhappy. Then one of her friends starts to show romantic interest in her, and she and her boyfriend begin a love affair.

Well ... it 's about time ! Van Damme is back and kicking in this action thriller that 's his best movie ever ! I 'm not going to try to review it as a "good film" though, because there is no such thing. It's a fun action movie, but nothing to write home about, and I'm sure that if you watch it like I do, you'll agree. You'll also agree with me when I tell you it 's probably the most boring action movie ever made.

A less than redemptive hunka junk that is mercifully free from the ravages of competence. Some Northern idiots come to the deep South looking for some confederate rifles stashed on the legendary Whiskey Mountain. They are menaced by scary hillbillies, in a wide nod to 'Deliverance'; but it turns out that the hicks are fronting for a Northern marijuana-trafficking badass. This is brought to light so early that it doesn't even qualify as a twist. The women are locked up and raped into catatonia; rather than rescuing them, the guys run down to town to get the sheriff, who is lazy and doesn't believe them.

In my analysis of `` Trois couleurs : Blanc '' I wrote that its tone is much lighter than the other three, but what does it sound like ? It's hard to explain with just one tone. But the most important thing is not what it sounds like, but what it feels like. It's almost like a very light tone that has just a touch of melancholy without the melancholy feeling of a sad melody. But it has no bitterness, either. It makes me wonder if it would sound like that if they'd worked on it a lot.

If you have never heard of Jane Austen, seen the original movie or the 1995 BBC adaptation, or even seen a pop up version of the book, then this farcical attempt to show this classic love story may be considered vaguely endurable.From the opening scene, this film must be remembered for its awful acting, abominable miscasting and complete lack of the classic wit of Jane Austen.Whoever decided to cast actors (with the exception of the excellent Judi Dench) who have obviously never heard of Jane Austen, let alone read her, should be punished!

This was a pleasant musical about the creation of the Moulin Rouge dance hall. In many ways, this reminds me of the Hollywood musicals of the 40s and 50s, in that it has many clichés leading up to the inevitable conclusion ("will the show STILL go on?"). While of course none of this is new, it was enjoyable and well made. The musical numbers at the end are frenetic and beautiful to watch. In many ways it reminds me of a sexier version of THE GREAT ZIEGFELD. In real life, Ziegfeld was quite the player but this was sanitized in the American film.

This is a cult classic for sure ! ! It is tricky to follow at times , but then again I think the movie was really made for us , the fans !I think we have to go for this one , at first I was scared , but when I saw this I was mesmerized . It has an awesome plot and also has a very good script . The story was interesting and kept you hooked for the whole time . A lot of the times it gets boring , which was a shame , I thought this was a really well made movie .The cinematography was excellent .

Neal N Nikki is voted on of the Worst films of the year by Planetbollywood. Its hard to believe the famous Chopra's have produced this lousy movie. It was presented as a movie for the family, but turns out to be a ridiculous sex comedy. Nor does it make you laugh, but cry of boredom and nor does it have any sexy girls to make the film look sexy. The title song is the most annoying song of the decade, I'm the Neil, I'm the man, rock star superstar. Uday Chopra is one of Bollywood's worst actors ever with no acting talent.

The trailers for this movie promised and this movie delivered exactly what was promised: Good campy fun with lots of very good looking naked broads! If you were expecting a major Hollywood movie with major stars, stellar budgets, and MPAA tamed money shots, you will be *very* disappointed.However, if you are a fan of the old "B" movies with unknown, but very good looking young stars that act amazingly well, given the material, some hokey, but surprisingly well done special effects, and very tight naked nubile bodies, this movie is almost heaven!

This is without doubt the worst movie i have ever seen . And believe me , I have seen a few. It’s a movie that is like a nightmare . But it is one of these movies that you will see in theatres , you just want to take it home and hide in your closet and sleep for a week . The only thing that kept you going was the voiceover of the woman talking to the man . She kept on giving him advice and then she would come back and he would give it back to her . She would always tell him what a great person he was .

It was only a matter of time that a spoof would be made of sports movies! And there are plenty of movies to be spotted which are made fun off. But the biggest problem I had was the fact that it stays with recognizing movies. The director and writers of "The Comebacks" somehow forget to get creative. While I must admit that I laughed at certain scenes,"The Comebacks" could have been so much funnier. The actors forget to deliver their lines seriously and have a straight face throughout the movie.

This film proves a theory I have had for quite some time - in Australia, as long as a film deals with the right topic, it will be a success regardless of how terrible it is. Aussie Park Boyz could not possibly be any worse - the acting is beyond terrible, the plot is basically a poor Warriors knock-off, and the filmmakers clearly have no idea about ethnic gangs in Australia (an Irish gang in twenty-first century Sydney! The last time any Irish gangs were in Australia was about a hundred years ago in the time of the tinkers!)

A lot of the comments seem to treat this film as a baseball movie , but I feel this is far from it. Instead, it is a film that is not afraid to tackle hard topics such as abuse, depression, alcoholism, rape and drug addiction. As I mentioned in the introduction, the film is about a man who can't escape the darkness he is living in, but is trying to fight against it. The journey he is taking us on is filled with a very deep love between the two main characters.

Despite strong performances by Minnie Driver and Tom Wilkinson , this film fails to ignite the imagination of the viewer.By: CineMundie

In a film like this, you need a special touch to keep a viewer interested in what is going on - something that makes this story seem fresh, new and exciting - and that special touch comes from a compelling story. There are some scenes that will take the audience back to the late 60's - or the early 80's - and that will have you wondering just how did this story take place or why is this a story that you have to watch again and again to fully understand?

this show is pretty alright and fun to watch , its a great Disney channel shows and sometimes entertaining.I really like this show because its about Disney princesses.but I really like this show and it's worth watching.also, this is one of the best shows I've seen on Disney channel. When you think of a Disney movie, you might imagine it taking place in a fairy-tale forest with fairies playing in the branches. You've probably never experienced the magic of Walt Disney Animation Studios' "The Princess Diaries." This is not a typical Disney production.

Piper, Prue and Phoebe bring Dr. Griffiths to the Manor in order to try and save him from The Source's personal assassin, Shax. Whilst Phoebe looks in the Book of Shadows for a spell to vanquish Shax, Prue and Piper are attacked by Shax and chase him into the street. Unbeknownst to Prue and Piper, they were filmed by a news reporter and her cameraman using their powers and broadcasted live on national television. With Phoebe in the Underworld, Prue, Piper, and Leo must find a way to reverse the damage done.

Chris Morris' Brass Eye TV series had always generated a large number of complaints, both from the audience and from the people taking part. But, nothing he has done has managed to stir up more controversy than this. The 2001 Brass Eye Special. Before the hugely overrated Jerry Springer Opera arrived, the Brass Eye Special held the record for the most complaints received about any TV program ever aired.The sheer volume of complaints that the general public made towards the Brass Eye Special was unbelievable! Many complaints were voiced by people who never even watched the program!

Time has not been kind to this film from the transition days of sound from silent . The plot has been revised and reshuffled several times before finally arriving at the version that has now been released. However, by the time this was made it had been around 40 years since a film had taken on a new story line and set it on the back of a bus, but the basic theme of the plot remained intact. An Irish family is on a trip to France. There is a little girl. She is not quite able to talk and has a very bad cough.

This movie is certainly well-constructed, beginning and ending in the dark, with focus on Lili Smith /Schmidt, Julie Andrews,initially the singing 'angel' later the notorious spy.It's beautiful! I saw the movie about 15 years ago and watched it again recently. While it was dismissed by critics in the 70's as overblown, 'cinema vulgaris', and lacking in structure (among others) time has proven them wrong. Blake Edwards certainly has produced a film that is almost of lyrical quality.The film soars and swirls (aerial photography; Julie Andrews in motion) and captivates.

The film tells you to be aware and conscientious . It also destroys any and all things , the Bible and the Quran . It tells you to ignore any and all warnings . It also states that you should do anything and everything so long as you are not hurting anyone else or yourself . It also states that you need a lot of luck . The movie is an eye opening film . It is a must see . It is one of the best films i have watched in many years . You need to see it for yourself . It is a very powerful and eye opening film .

Ever since 1981, Nintendo has been making great video games such as Super Mario and Zelda. Most ideas would get a bit boring after 20 years. Games made by Nintendo never seem to get boring because they're always adding something new. It went from arcade games to the Wii and I hear that there's a new version of the Wii scheduled for release in 2011. The thing that makes Wii games so different is the fact that your actually doing something instead of just sitting on the couch pushing buttons. And I have more good news.

This show is made for persons with IQ lower than 80 . The jokes in the show are so lame that anyone with any IQ above 40 would not understand them anyway . If you think the jokes are funniest you are just a moron . The audience laughs at all jokes from the show . They laugh at all the bad ones too . The people in the audience are laughing so loud that it sounds like the audience is trying to break the sound barrier . They laugh at all the jokes even if the jokes suck . There's no way you can write jokes that would be any funnier then those in this show .

I 've been surprised by the enthusiastic response to this film . It seemed dull to me , much as I was disappointed at the performance of my main character . But what I found most surprising was the number of comments I received from friends who actually saw it . Some said that it was the best they had ever seen , and I have to admit that this was a little hard to accept for me when they were so enthusiastic , but I think it is a fair description . As for the characters , you can't help feeling for them .

That's how I was when I walked (staggered) out of this "film". I couldn't leave, because it was at a film festival and the cinema was full of people. I was stuck in the middle. Trapped.The tiny fragment of original footage which attempted to bind this film together features some of the worst acting ever to grace the big screen. The daughter was a stand out performance - stand out in the bad sense.Thge cinematography was hideous, consisting of disjointed framing and some of the oddest lighting I've witnessed.As for the stock footage... well at first one...Wait.Why am I reviewing this film?

I watched this episode a lot of times because I did n't get how Prue died . This is what I get . I get that Prue's not gonna be found, but that she died in an explosion because it was the only chance for her to live . And it's good because it was the chance for both of the girls to die in a way where the survivor was happy with the outcome (and Prue). The ending is pretty good. I liked it. It had me thinking about things. I wasn't quite sure why Prue was in the freezer.

I posted on IMDb on this series recently , giving a snail mail address at the commercial arm of the company, in hopes that it might receive a letter in reply. If you have been living under a rock the past three weeks you’ll know we have had a huge amount of press coverage about a film adaptation of ‘The Hobbit’, with a number of sites giving it a great deal of coverage, but not much of it in terms of IMDb reviews. This is because a film of this nature is not really a film, it’s more of a feature length ‘TV movie’.

Can't say this wasn't made well. At a recent film festival the director admitted some scenes took 30 takes. And there isn't the slightest indication he didn't get exactly what he wanted. But this is an oddly non-Hispanic film in the same way West Side Story was many years ago. Both the leads, a brother-sister team, are excellent and memorable in their parts. The setting, a sort of underground car repair district in Queens, is completely foreign to most people and is worth the price of admission by itself.

I decided to watch this movie because I 'd not seen Carol Lombard before in any movie . I 'm so so happy i watched it. I can say that it is the perfect movie. I had never ever thought that Carol can act like such a good girl . I think the movie is really good . The plot of this movie will keep you occupied till the very end of it. I liked so much of this movie. Thank you for making a very good movie and for a very good cast. I really love Carol. I can't think of a movie like this one.

A beautiful film . One that made me think of god but not feel guilty nor overwhelmed . Made me think of all my friends and how we can all live so peacefully and happily . A great message and I feel like he is teaching all of us here . I think it is the last thing we need . Wow, I loved this movie, it was my favorite movie of the year and I have a feeling it will be my last . This was a moving and inspirational movie , one that will never leave me .

I saw this movie because every review I read of it said that it was one of the scariest movies of last year, and I was also a big fan of horror movies. What I liked most about it was that it was different from what I was expecting, which I think is very important of a horror movie. It was made by a director that I didn’t know and it was quite different in tone and plot compared to what I was expecting. That is why I have not seen every movie made by this director.

I really tried to like this film about a doctor who has the possibility of a new life with a family after his death. That's a pretty bold claim for a film about a death. And the way the movie was shot gave me no reason to be hopeful or hopeful for the future in this film. The film was directed by Tim Miller and written by Mark Wahlberg and Jeff Skoll, and they did a good job at getting me to care about the main character. But I really couldn't see how I could care about any of the people other than this doctor.

One of the worst films I have ever seen ! After watching it i walk out like , what happened. i have never seen anything like it ! It is really bad. If you like bad films or films in general watch it. I was very bored by this film . The acting of all the characters was very wooden . An absolutely terrible film. I was so bored by this rubbish that I just sat through it. The plot consists of a young man who goes out drinking one evening. He meets his first love. He is then attacked and killed by some hooded people.

For all the cast and crew who worked on this excuse for a movie, another payday in L.A. For any audience hoping for a fair return for the price of admission, a huge waste of time and money. The saddest aspect of this ugly exercise (to me) is that we are watching an extremely talented actor, Pacino, seemingly playing a parody of himself. That's what remained with me as a total mystery. I can fully understand the need for movie industry people to work and thus make a living.

Ordinarily, Anthony Mann made westerns with 'the big guys' - James Stewart, Gary Cooper, Henry Fonda . . . the A list cowboy stars. But in this B+ film, he tackled something notably different and had quite a bit of success with what turned out to be a truly one of a kind western. The main character, played by Victor Mature, is a trapper/ mountain man, and ordinarily they are romanticized in films - Robert Redford in Jeremiah Johnson, that sort of thing, where the hero is not in fact a typical mountain man but a clean cut heroic figure who hangs out with real mountain men.

I really don't know why I'm writting this. I think most people agree that this movie is bad. Well, let me say this:When I first get done watching some movies, I like them. Then as time goes on, my opinion changes about the movie. this happened with End of Days. I liked it the first time I saw it. I thought it was entertaining. But, a few weeks later, my opinion has changed. So, to resolve this, I watched it again at a friends house. Well, it's bad.I'm a logic person.

When HOPPITY GOES TO TOWN he discovers nothing but bad news for his little insect neighbors in the Lowlands. Can this honest, good-natured grasshopper save his sweetheart, Miss Honey Bee, from the machinations of the evil C. Bagley Beetle - and also lead his friends to a safe new home - before it's too late?While not one of the great animated features (a very new art at the time this film was created) HOPPITY is an enjoyable film which should bring pleasure to uncritical viewers. Technically it is well made, with animation of a generally high quality.

I remember seeing this film when I was 13 years old and I fell in love with it and I think it’s important that we remember it. There’s no doubt that it was a film to make young men dream and to make them think of what they wanted to become, but this film changed the way that men were viewed. It’s really important. It changed the way we look at the world, it changed our perception of women, and we really need to look at ourselves in this way.

I suggest if you have already seen the original American Graffiti , do not see this movie . If you have already seen the film, it will make no difference to you . You may like the original better. But you may also not. I was bored by the film, but not bored, and I found the film enjoyable because of the music . But you will not get the same pleasure from the music in the same way you would from watching the film, or from the film . In other words, do not expect to be entertained by a film.

Hard Justice is an excellent action movie ! The whole movie is really nothing but shooting and fighting but it has a very good story line also. The film is really good in many aspect of film making and it is one of the best action films of all time. The fight scenes are truly awesome. I never thought that this was going to be a hit but it was a huge success and it was really good movie. The film was really funny and it had some good points. This is my favorite movie and I recommend everyone watch it.

OK , so maybe it 's because I 'm from the North East of Scotland and I talk just like a native :)

Tuesday, November 25, 2013

I have recently been on holiday to the UK for a month. I took a friend of mine and her little girl with me, I had a great time with both the girls and the weather was beautiful. It rained once in three days, so the days were a little wet. I wanted to write a blog, so this is my way of saying thanks to you lovely people for being a part of my blog.

I had high hopes for this film when I saw the listing and decided to watch it on TV, uninterrupted by commercial breaks. I've liked Lee Van Cleef in many movies but I'm afraid that having the other characters call him Chris repeatedly doesn't turn him into even a reasonable facsimile of Yul Brenner's Chris.I found this movie to be a complete disappointment - the music sound track tried to impart the magnificence portrayed in the original but it too failed to bring the film up the the standard of the original. The rich textures of the characters in the original were mostly missing from this film.

Wow , there are no words to describe how bad this movie truly is . I usually pride myself on being a tough guy who can take any type of fight , and even survive , but this movie is just ridiculous . I really don't understand how people can watch this movie , they are just as bad as the rest of us . I have to say that this movie makes my stomach turn , I was not expecting to like this one , but the more I watch it , the more I hate it , I mean , it was just a waste of time .

There are plenty of comments already posted saying exactly how I felt about this film so Ill keep it short

There are three things I will say. 1) There are some who don't like to read. I know that I have my reasons for saying this, one being the length of these films, two being the fact I don't know what the point of making this film was or what it had to prove, three is the fact I am an old man who doesn't get out much in the summer and I can't even remember when it was we were there.

Hey guys and girls! Don't ever rent, or may God forbid, buy this piece of garbage. I have rarely seen a film in any genre as bad as this one. The acting is actually worse than me and my friends did when we were 7 and in the 1.grade had to act in front of all parents and siblings. In fact, we would have been taken up to evaluation for the Oscars, if we were to be compared to the actors in Darkhunters. The story is terrible, the makeup is terrible, the filming is terrible, the set is terrible, the directing is terrible, etc.

The characterization in this movie is among the worst I 've ever encountered . The dialogue is trite and clichéd. I had no problem with the visuals, they were stunning . The acting , however, is not up to par either. It was an okay film , but I doubt it will ever be "The" worst film ever to come out from Hollywood . The movie is in 3D, so maybe that adds something to it . I hope it does because I would have preferred a 3D version over this one. Hollywood movies are not necessarily bad.

When Jan Svankmajer lets his imagination run wild, get ready. You're in for dark, harrowing films like "Alice" and "Little Otik," or short gems such as "Down to the Cellar" and "Jabberwocky." All of those are excellent films that represent disturbing, surrealistic film-making at its best.On the other hand, when Svankmajer attempts to make a political statement of any kind, you're advised to leave the room in a hurry. Svankmajer's films in this vein tend to be both adolescent and preachy, presenting straw-man caricatures in repetitious fashion to express his pseudo-brilliant insights.

This week 's surprise screening at GV turned out to be the horror movie The Nun ( La Monja ) , based on the novel of the same name by Maria Semple Hopkins and adapted by Alejandro Amenabar . The film is a Spanish production and is scheduled for a limited release in select theatres on October 24. It's rated R and has an MPAA PG-13 Parental Advisory sticker on its rear. The Nun is a story about a priest who was sent by the Catholic Church to the rural village of La Monja where he seduces and abuses a young nun named Sister Alba ( Tilda Swinton ).

Oh , dear ! This has to be one of the worst films I have ever seen . It 's so very poorly made and it seems like an awful waste of all the effort that had gone into producing it . It ' s so bad I can't even rate it . What a load of bollocks ! I watched this last night at my sisters house. I could not see the film . The screen was too bright and too hot. I left and went home and watched it again last night. It was still too bright and too hot.

I wanted to like this movie . I really , really did . I was so excited when I saw it and had to see it . But my expectations weren't high , and I was disappointed . I thought the movie was really slow , the dialogue was very cheesy , and there were scenes where it would've been more interesting if the actors had acted more natural . The acting was good . And it had a good cast . I really enjoyed seeing Jennifer Lawrence . She has the most beautiful green eyes , I love watching them dance .

For an indy film this is probably a bit better than a 3 out of 10, but in general it only gets a 3. The effects aren't horrible and at least they have some adults playing adult roles rather than all kids as a lot of indy low budget horror films do. The acting is very wooden, but at least they had a better "display" than some films in the shoestring budget category. It's filmed a lot inside a building rather than a friend's basement. The plot as a whole isn't the worst.

I am the sort of person who never , ever watches animated movies , but I make an exception for Pixar . I don't know why exactly , but I just enjoy the fact that Pixar does not use live actors in its films . It doesn't matter how the story is told , if it is a story where there is no animation , it is perfect . You can really feel the animation in their movies , which are far superior to live action movies , I'm afraid I can not explain why , but it just makes me want more .

I was forced to watch this film for my World Reigonal Geography class. This film is what is wrong with America today, instead of figuring out the best way out of hard times or situations we would rather complain about how it is someone else's fault. This film goes through the downfall of Flint, Michigan and blames it 100% on General Motors. In the process of doing so Moore goes to great lengths to make the executives of General Motors out to be villains just because they are doing their job in a capitalist society.

When King Kong stripped her of her top in the 1976 remake, I was breathless. I don't know how many times I went back to see that movies hoping to see more. Jessica Lange was not a great actress then (She became one), but she was so hot! I went to see "Sweet Dreams" when it came out because, by that time, Ms. Lange had become a great actress. It looked like a wonderful story. And she's always exciting to see.I never walked out of a movie faster.

How do I describe the horrors?!!! First, some points: First, this review should be taken with a grain of salt -- I saw this over 20 years ago, when I was a boy, at the Museum of Modern Art in New York City.Secondly, I am giving away some scenes and plot points. However, it does not have much of a plot.Finally, I don't enjoy these type of art films anyway.This film was directed by proto-auteur Luis Bunuel. He was a surrealist and dadaist. These were modernist themes or movements popular critically in the 1920's and early 1930's.

I saw this title again on Shemaroo. I also asked my nephew who was 17 to watch the same with me. I am 35 and he is 17. He liked it and I did too. It still is funny, a little childish a times but still very clean entertainment. Satish Shah is hilarious in multiple roles. This sitcom would still fare better than many of the recent serials on TV. But obviously some people obviously like mundane fares that come out today. It would have been nice that Shafi Inamdar would have continued for all the seasons.

There 's only 2 reasons I watch this show ... I invested the time already in previous episodes and Colton needed the time out to recover and get his mind off of his addiction. It's not that bad. I wouldn't say it's good or bad. It just doesn't last too long and Colton is very good about putting his life and his recovery first. I would not be upset with it if it ended after only 5-6 episodes. I will probably catch up with it at some point and watch it again. I'm on the fence right now though.

Beware , My Lovely came on TV on BBC2 recently during the early hours so I set the video to max resolution, 1080i in fact, so I was able to capture it. It didn't even bother to use any special effects or filters. There were no pop-ups or video overlays on the screen. There was simply an ordinary video playing at 60i and the picture was fine. It didn't even have sound, just the TV picture and the usual sound. I played the video on the computer at 60i but it seemed like there were no special effects, just the normal image.

As the title suggests there is a philosophical, meritocratic thread running through this film: if a man has the talent and looks to find his way into society and money what might be the outcome if he is denied it for failing to have the X factor? This question is unsatisfactorily dealt with in this adaptation of Patricia Highsmith's book and left me rather cold along the way.Matt Damon is the Ripley of the title and apart from blagging his way on a funded jaunt to Europe falls under the spell of his commissioned target, Dickie Greenleaf (Law).

OMG what has Disney done lately..most of their new shows really suck. Suite life of Zach and Cody are pretty good but other shows like Cory in the house, Wizards of Waverly Place suck and are unwatchable.Naturally Sadie is just beyond stupid and dumb. Its about a teenager named Sadie who likes science and grows up and goes through her everyday life. There are her friends Margaret and Rain and her older annoying brother Hal. There all annoying and stupid. Especially Margaret who thinks she's the most popular girl in school and thinks she's soo pretty...its just beyond awful.

This is a very enjoyable, fluffy, glamorous musical from the 40's. 'Cover Girl' made Rita Hayworth (formerly the dark-haired Latin senorita Margarita Cansino) into a bona-fide, all-American star. It confirmed Gene Kelly's amazing talent as a dancer, singer, actor and choreographer. It epitomises the exuberance and colour of the musical genre.Rita Hayworth is great as Rusty Parker- it is her picture, and her presence is always at the forefront. Her singing is dubbed, but her dancing is absolutely brilliant and she combines very well with Kelly.

Eddie Fischer was simply bad. Possibly the worst scene came early in the movie when he broke into a spontaneous song and dance number centered around a piano and some conveniently placed employees. The song was totally stupid... I think I could drunkenly offer a few lines on a sheet of paper that would far exceed it and probably win a Grammy. Then, as if the writers could come up with no better way to escape the ridiculousness of the scene, Fischer says something to the effect of, "Don't tell (insert the guy's name).

If you find the depiction of violent murders and wanton police brutality expressed in a plot less film with glacial pacing entertaining, then you're bound to enjoy Surveillance. This film was garbage for both the mind and spirit. The notion that this is a "thriller" is comical; that would imply some kind of tension and twists. You kept waiting for the story to actually finish "starting". It never rises above a glorification of weak-minded violent criminals and individuals from all walks of life. Picture all of the violence of "No Country for Old Men" without any kind of chase or sympathetic characters.

This is another Alien imitation and not a very good one at that.Replace outer space with the South African desert. Replace Alien with a gangster who is also a serial killer and you've got something very interesting. I have a feeling that a good part of this movie's success is the fact that it doesn't take itself seriously enough to be taken seriously. It's actually quite funny and even if you think you know what's going to happen, you'd better go see the movie, or at least wait to have a few beers.

This is a movie that was probably made to entertain the middle school , early high school age kids . I will say the movie has it's moments but overall this is not worth the $1.00 dollar I spent. 2 out of 3 people found this review helpful. Was this review helpful? Movie Reviews

Waste of Time...

Dennis | San Diego, CA | 09/16/2008

(1 out of 1)

Waste of time

I watched the first 3 parts in theatres and I really thought they were going to be the best.

There 's only one thing I 'm going to say about cat in the hat ... as a KIDS movie. I'm sorry to say it, and I really mean it! It really is a terrible movie. But, because of the way the producers handled it, we ended up with a movie that was better than the movie they originally made for the kids. It's a really hard movie, but it's a great movie, and I would definitely recommend it. But, I don't see how anyone could say that it is a children's movie.

This is the worst exercise in middle class pretentiousness yet to hit our television screens . I unfortunately did not get a chance to see " The Americans . " I never thought I would see any show with a female KGB agent and that's exactly what I'm looking at . I didn't have to see it to know how over the top this whole show was . It may have been funny as a parody of an espionage show, but what a sham. The writers didn't even tell us the KGB agent's first name.

I admire Deepa Mehta and this movie is a masterpiece . I 'd recommend to buy this movie on DVD . It is worth it. The movie was shot on a very high quality camera and it is worth your time and money to watch this movie in theaters . GIRL IN THE HALLOWEEN MOVIE IS THE PERFECT CHRISTMAS MIRROR . THIS IS THE VERY FIRST MOVIE ABOUT THE CAST OF CHRISTIANS WHO BURNED CHRISTMAS . IT IS A FAIRY TALE OF A SAD CHRISTMAS HOLIDAY . I WOULD NOT GO TO CHRISTMAS AGAIN WITHOUT WATCHING THIS FILM ! I am sure you will feel the same way.

I have no respect for IMDb ratings anymore. I think a bunch of Mormons flooded the website and voted for this. This is not an artistic movie, it is Mormon propaganda. Nothing wrong with that, but the plot outline and the way it is described is totally misleading. If you are a bible thumping Christian or a Mormon, watch this movie, you'll love it and think it is truly amazing. For anyone else, don't bother, the story is so contrived, random stuff happens that really doesn't follow in a coherent way.

This one is one of those classic B movie following the exploits of 2 hobos. It's done really cheesily and Big Stupid running off one-liners like a cardboard cassanova. But Jack Elam steals every scene he's in as the creepazoid Jesse (now Jerome!). My favorite scene is the lynch mob and the dad's voice going up 10 octaves ("You loved her?"). Danny, Big Stupid's protege, is surprisingly stupider, but not as loathsome as our lead star. There's also a quaint scene of a guy pimping at the diner.

I watched this mini in the early eighties. Sam Waterson proved himself to be a great actor. In fact when he began Law and Order I was disappointed in him as it was not as powerful a role. Unfortunately the good roles do not pay the bills. I wish I could find a copy of this rare series and review it. It is both factual and entertaining. Everyone should see it to know what really happened. I was so moved I purchased and read the book "Pppenheimer-Shatterer of Worlds". And saw how this man became an unlikely hero who was never rewarded for his insight.

I've seen some Bible-based trash. This one tops it all. To make matters worse, it lasts about three hours. A horrible waste of time, unless you want to match your kid's biblical knowledge against the innumerable aberrations. Do yourself a favor - take a walk in the Sahara instead. Since I am required to give you a ten line statement of why not to watch this movie, let me just say there is absolutely no redeemable quality to it. God's conversations with Noah are ridiculous. The whole thing has a stench of "let's make the Biblical account look retarded."

It would be quite easy to make this movie sound fun : a call girl gets shot in the forehead by a young man and dies before she can tell him she likes him, the young man comes to her funeral to ask her to be his girlfriend. But it isn’t fun at all. I’ve never seen this movie but the trailer makes it sound even better than what I have seen in my life. I guess I’m just waiting for the moment where I will be so happy to see this movie that I’ll start crying.

`` What Alice Found '' is the greatest movie that nobody 's ever heard of ! I underestimated it when I was in high school. It was so over-the-top unbelievable that it's no wonder it never became popular. Yet, when you watch the movie, you can see why it would have appealed to a small group of teenagers. In the movie, a group of boys are gathered to watch the final performance by a ballet company. It's their senior year, and their friends have gotten them to thinking they'll all go into the performing arts.

When this series aired I watched most of it . I think it was supposed to be a long running series that aired for 2 seasons. The episodes were very short. The episodes seemed to change often and were never consistent. Here’s another thing. When I watch a movie I go into it with expectations and sometimes I get disappointed when it does not live up to them. On the other hand there are the times when the movie works out of its own accord. When this series was on, I thought it was supposed to be like that.

I thought that this movie might be a good spoof , or at least a good independent comedy like Friday. I can't think of a better movie to see on a Tuesday night than this one, so I am going to see it for the first time on Wednesday. I think it'll have me chuckling in every scene. I'm not sure exactly how I feel about the ending, but it did make me laugh so I'll take that. There will be more spoilers. I'll get to that after the movie ends.

I just saw this on TCM tonight and was shocked at the over-acting by Jean Arthur. Her bugging her eyes out in surprise and just generally over-doing everything was not in the same style as Dietrich and Art Lund. Dietrich was marvelous in her restraint and comic timing. She being the best thing in this movie. The Wilder gags were flat and frankly more like something a freshman in college would write trying to "get away" w/being wicked,witty and dirty, but just sounded boring and not funny at all. It seemed the humor was being pushed too hard to be funny.

Surprisingly well-acted , well-written movie about hard rockin'-but-decent young man getting that much-hoped-for ticket to stardom : his favorite heavy metal band are about to open for him and he gets to go. He also gets to go to an old school and hang out with a former teacher and his old girlfriend, who's now his fiancé. His band mates also get to go. He's about to go on tour and do a gig, but his dad's dying. He meets a girl out there, and he and her go to an underground club.

28 years before 9/11 , there was another 9/11 which represented a key date in the history of Chile , because of the number of casualties. This morning we woke up to news that another 9/11 was planned. The attack would have been carried out by suicide bombers on a passenger plane. The attack could have been much worse. The plane had already taken off when it was shot down, but none of the passengers died or was seriously hurt. Instead of being shot down by a gun, as had been the plan, the bomb was a pressure cooker device which was strapped to the plane.

I was all ready to hate this but it turned out to be surprisingly tolerable - though the MTV-style of animation, while certainly attractive, could be very distracting at certain times. I will say, however, that I was not entirely happy with the music. I also really enjoyed the voice actors' performances - especially the singing voice, which is what drew me in. The voice actors did a decent job, but it's the voice acting that made me love the movie. There's a reason it's one of my top favorites of all time, and one of my favorites from this year.

Not the best of the WIP 's , but not the worst either . I honestly feel guilty laughing at something that I have been laughing at for the last few months . And in the same sense of guilt I feel when I see something that I used to laugh at or laugh at. I don't feel like laughing anymore , it just makes me sick . So it's time to laugh again . So I have finally gotten it all together and finished it. This is what I've come up with so far. If you are interested please let me know.

From the fertile imagination which brought you the irresistible HERCULES (1983), comes its even more preposterous (read goofier) sequel: right off the bat, we get another unwieldy "beginning of time" prologue which even contrives to completely contradict these same events as set up in the first film! ; a condensed montage of highlights from same is soon followed by a SUPERMAN-like scrolling credits sequence. Narrative-wise, here we have four rebellious gods who steal Zeus' seven all-important (but poorly animated) thunderbolts  a crime which, for one thing, sets the moon careening on a collision course with Planet Earth!

Yet another version of mother of all gangster flicks-the Classic "Godfather" and yet another case of over-hype due to media circus. Sarkar, the 13th Hindi film of Ram Gopal Varma as director is also the weakest in his Underworld trilogy including the other two being the excellent-Satya and Company. The Charisma, the magnetic persona of the two Bachchans playing father-son duo on screen for the first time is definitely a treat to watch out for. Not just strong performances but their perfect chemistry is the biggest scoring point here for which Varma should be applauded.

Two years after this movie was made , `` The Juror '' came out . Do n't waste your time. The movie is based on a real-life case in New York between two African-Americans . One of them was convicted of raping a white woman on a subway train after she rejected his invitation to meet at a hotel . The woman testified that she was wearing only a towel when they met . The defense lawyer was able to convince the jury that she was lying by claiming that the two men in the hotel room with them had made it clear they wanted to make love and not have sex .

Although I rarely agree with filmkrönikan, I have to say that this film while not awful, just didn't make me care at all... and it all just seemed to be out of place... it had its moments... three or four ones that made me snicker... but most of the time I was just sitting and wondering why? why did the characters do this? even Hot Shots characters felt more thought out and fleshed out...If you want to see a nice norrlands-film then watch Pistvakt. There it was more than random ethnicities that just walked around shooting each other on the Swedish tundra...I am so disappointed...

This film has some flaws, and most of those flaws are a lack of anything happening. Possibly the greatest film to show the direness within Fly-Over Country, "Rolling Kansas" is a film in which nothing happens and you don't care about anybody. Like life, it starts, it moves, and then it ends. A few attempts at humor are made, but everything falls very flat. The occasional cameo just reminds the viewer that they could be wasting their life doing something besides watching this movie and the one rock song they bought and used at every single instance.Do yourself a favor and go see a good movie.

Overall , a well done movie . There were the parts that made me wince , and there were the parts that made me cheer . The whole movie was quite an experience and I'll be back for more . I didn't expect much from this film , but it surpassed all my expectations, and that was a rare good thing in my book . It's a great flick , and the story and acting are superb . That's quite rare , in fact, in these times , and I applaud them for that . If you want to enjoy a good movie , go see it .

My friends and I saw this at the San Diego Black Film Festival. It was great. Stormy is a strong black woman and Nana reminds me of my grandmother. Rene is FINE!!! Seeing him take off his clothes was definitely worth the price of admission. Can someone forward me his contact info?My friend thinks Flex is the finer of the two. She's been a Flex fan for years though so she might be a little biased. The cousins were funny and just as trifling as Nana described them. LOL.I am looking forward to seeing this movie again when it comes to theaters.

For connoisseurs of bad movies , Galaxina is a true gem . With truly horrid dialog , acting , and a plot that is so bad it's funny , Galaxina is probably the single most unpleasant movie you will ever see . A movie so bad in fact it was actually banned in Japan , a fact that I'm not sure is ever going to get the credit it's due for being a true movie-gone-bad . This is a story about an orphaned kid and an old blind woman that lives in his basement , and a man named Galaxina .

I watched 40 minutes and couldn't bear it any longer  the television went off and I returned to some light reading "Lobotomy for Beginners".It was hard to say what aspect of this production was most displeasing - dialogue made up entirely of sound-bytes or the acting by numbers.It was difficult to determine the period in which the drama was supposed to take place. There were throw-away references to Lord Nelson and slavery but Edmund, the cleric-to-be, played by Blake Ritson was the only actor who one could believe inhabited the early 19th century.

Something of a disappointment . Lee J. Cobb is the anti-union head of Roxton Garments in New York . His company makes $100 a day working under a union contract, and he doesn't really give a damn what the union does or doesn't do . . . except when it happens to affect him. Then he has to make some decisions that are more important . . . than the company or the Union . . . . and this is where my story starts. It starts in the spring of 1957, when I was 17 years old, and a junior at Harvard Law School .

What a shocker. For starters, I couldn't stand the constant screaming and noisy panicking all the time. It didn't make me scared, horrified, or make me sympathetic towards the characters; it was simply annoying. The jerky camera movements were also annoying. The plot was the same as pretty much every other cheap horror. There was a few pathetic attempts to give the characters some depth, but it didn't really work into the rest of the plot. And then there's the ending. I'm still not really sure what to make of it.

If you thought this is the french The Mummy and if you're hoping for another "Vidocq"...well look elsewhere. It does have the same kind of story like The Mummy concerning this book of the dead and a soul that needs to find 7 missing pieces that are scattered in the Louvre. I found the movie to be slightly entertaining, boring for the most part. The special effects aren't bad, but it's nothing spectacular as I was expecting big explosions and perhaps the eiffel tower crumbling down until I realized that those kind of scenes were in The Mummy and this is Belhpegor.

This movie is silly and very short of being a funny movie . Unhappy 'easterners ' are not pleased with the way the film is going to be edited so that the western audience sees the movie as if it was made by them . There is nothing else for it . If you have not read or seen ' A Passage to India ' or not even watched it , then this will not interest you and you will have to stop watching and reading . I do not want to offend anybody and I cannot see how such a movie can be made with so much love , humour , and pathos .

This movie was bad on so many levels. The writing was horrible so even the best actors could not have made this movie watchable. It's a shame because they did have some good actors in this movie. I mean if anyone has seen any of the Police Academy movies, you would know that Steve Guttenberg was good. His Character in this movie was very serious, which was a big difference from Characters i have seen him play before, so that was a plus. And I did think that Steve Guttenberg was extremely hot in this movie.

Like the beauty of the jungle, Jessica Alba's gorgeous smile and sultry looks loom over the film, but alas they are the only two things worth watching this film for. When in theory we should be watching for the narrative.The plot is thin on the ground, and hard to believe. As beautiful as Jessica Alba is, she doesn't add any of the spark that she injected into the credible 'Dark Angel' series. Since Dark Angel it seems that Alba has been reduced to mere eye candy(but what eye candy!

Some films are just plain silly beyond explanation. This is one of them. Words cannot do justice to the wooden acting, the stupid plotline, and the ever-predictable outcome. About the only thing that makes this film halfway worth watching are the scantily clad women (and the mute guy for you ladies) in it. The leader of the warrior women and Valeria are quite appealing to the eye. But that's about all this movie has going for it.Some silliness in point: One scene, when they start to journey to the lair of the Dark One, they are walking away from a supposedly destroyed land.

I caught this on HBO under its category of `` Guilty Pleasures '' , and I would agree that I did not enjoy it much. However, the movie is worth a viewing and I think it should be seen by everyone, especially if you have time to watch the whole film. The film is one of those where you start at the beginning and try to figure out what the film is about. It's a bit confusing at times. The director does not give us any background on his film nor does he tell us what has happened.

TART is the worst movie I 've seen this year , and that includes both the Affleck/J.Lo bomb GIGLI and THE WICKERKING PRINCESS, so this review isn't going out of my way to defend or praise it. It isn't bad, it's just awful and it has an awful script that I can't quite remember what the film was about. As I'm writing this review, I can only come up with one possible explanation and that is that the author of this film is having a rough day and couldn't figure out what to make of this story and decided to try something totally different.

Going into the movie with the right expectations, I somewhat liked this movie. Like most reviewers who have seen this movie, I fully agree that the plot was razor thin, clichéd, and I could predict every plot twist from the very beginning of the movie. But, the dancing sequences were VERY well done, and I really enjoyed the fusion of classical and hip-hop dance (both which I enjoy watching). The music/soundtrack of the movie was also very good, which made the "drama" scenes more bearable.

Just a great soundtrack . Really enjoyable music . Outstanding cast , great lead performance . Worth watching.Does n't really take itself that serious . But i can see that it would have been a great film had the lead character had a sense of humor and not take himself too seriously all the time .Great movie . The movie is set in New York City in the 30's . There is a lot going on in this movie that is going to bring a lot of laughs . It really brings back a lot of memory's when i was a teenager . The cast is really good .

I acquired this film a couple of years ago and on trying to find some info about it I found it impossible to get a good answer from google. I guess the question I want to know is how was this film made? Can anyone provide a few details about the story line? I have found out that this film was released by Roxy Films, but I still cannot figure out how to obtain a good answer from google. I guess this would be a really easy film to find since it is a French language film. Thanks in advance guys.

Oldboy is set in Korea & starts as a drunken Dae-su Oh ( Min-Sik Choi ) is bailed out of a bar fight by his friends. When he shows up to meet his girlfriend, he finds his fiancee is with another man, and that the fiance is not in the least bit remorseful for it. Later that night, after the wedding is over, Oh finds out his fiancée has an illegitimate daughter, so he sends her to the country and sends her home with the money from his father's inheritance. The daughter is happy to be with him, and he decides to adopt her.

I saw this movie for the first time when Quentin Tarantino showed it to a bunch of us at the American Film Institute in Beverly Hills. Tarantino had directed it, but it wasn't yet a movie. I was in my mid-twenties and a bit of a movie-hoarder, but he showed me a movie that had already earned some serious kudos for itself in the mainstream press and that I would have been a fool not to see. I didn't. A few years later, the film would be nominated for three Oscars and earn Tarantino a Best Director nomination for his work here.

Just watched Hair after a lapse of 20 years. It struck home. For those of us who tried to stand on the shoulders of the civil rights movement and fight the rule of privilege and power; who resisted the fascism of the Johnson/Nixon administrations; who now as veterans of civil wars fought the war in Vietnam every single day until finally the US beast died and fled; for all who said no in many different ways -- it's remarkable how unsuccessful we were. How large the real table was on which Treat danced. How driven the wizard behind the curtain.

"Graduation Day" is a result of the success of "Friday the 13th." Both of those films are about creative, bloody murders, rather than suspense. If you enjoy that type of film, I'd recommend "Graduation Day." If not, I wouldn't. There's nothing new here, just the same old killings.Even though I've given the film a 4 out of 10, I will say that it's not a repulsive film. It is watchable if your curious about it, just not creative.

I saw this movie and thought it was a sleeper . Sometimes I can get into intellectual Romantic movies . but when a movie like this come along . I can’t help but get emotionally involved . You know when you go to the movies with your best friend and the next day you are so sad because you didn’t see the movie . Like this movie . I saw a movie that made me cry . And I realized something . I have a lot of movies that makes me cry now . But if I had a little more time .

Okay,. so I went into this loving RuPaul. I still love him/her but think a little less. This is one gross movie that shows a lot of male genitalia. THis is a spoof of the 1970s black exploitation films and is purposefully done badly. The only fun part about it for me is that all of the voices have been looped with those of drag queens, even the voices of real women. This is over an the top, nonstop, laugh your rear end off it is so stupid, badly made movie.

The revisionist history -- making the evil Marquis de Sade a semi-heroic romantic -- is mind-boggling enough. But the atrocious acting, amateurish cinematography and terrible dubbing make this film achingly bad. The only reason to keep watching is that almost all the women in the film are gorgeous. And, amazingly, being tortured for days, with hands bound overhead, apparently doesn't detract from a woman's beauty, hairstyle and makeup. My guess is that the producers filmed mostly in Russia, choosing women for their looks -- and willingness to work cheap -- rather than acting ability.

I've never made one of these before, but this movie was literally so bad I had to say something about it.I'm all for independent film-making as the past year has seen of the worst (in my opinion) of Hollywood's showings, the mainstream just seems to have lost touch with what making good films is all about. That being said movies like this really give independent film a bad reputation.The characters are boring and too stupid to empathize with. The direction is horrible, the plotting is horrible, the plot itself is horrible, stay away, far away.

I caught this during a brief run in a Philadelphia theater. Despite its local provenance (and its relation to a hometown tragedy, namely the beating death of Eddie Polec in 1994), I really have to come down hard on this movie. The director, for reasons best known to himself, decided to shoot the entire film guerilla-style, with nonstop handheld cameras and rapidfire cuts. Such technique might work for the scenes of jarring violence, but is utterly inappropriate for the rest of the material, which makes up the majority of the film.

I don't normally go out of my way to watch romantic comedy, and maybe I will in the future after seeing Return to Me. The plot was simple and no secret after the publicity. You don't have to be Einstein to guess what will happen after the first 15 minutes. What you can do is relax and let the cast take you into a world where the "chemistry" abounds and the good guys win and you can just laugh and have a good time. I LOVE this movie....and have the DVD on order!

This is a poor , poor movie . Full of clichés , unrealistic moments : punching the air in celebration of someone getting in the car , getting shot with a shotgun , taking a phone call on a public phone , going to the bathroom in a public restroom . not to mention , it's a waste of time . The story , if there is one , is an excuse to have the cast in a bar . We all know it is a stupid excuse , but then it goes on to explain what happened .

If we really want to get serious and find Osama Bin Laden , then we should take this stinker down. We can’t do this with a drone strike, or we risk the loss of life to civilians in a strike which turns out to be a fake. We also need to understand that the Pakistani government has given the Taliban a green light to attack India on a large scale. And the US and Pakistan have to work out some kind of cease fire agreement to take pressure off the Taliban and ensure a more stable situation for the Indian people.

Ben Affleck , about to be married , is shaken up by a plane accident and gets involved with one of the most complicated cases in law enforcement. I’m always a big believer that we need more films that tell us what happens in the world, that give us the chance to see how law and order work, and to learn from the experiences of those who are in law enforcement. I think that there is no doubt that the most important aspect of law and order is good police work. And that is not a new thing.

Do n't be taken in because the premise of this film is a good one . It is , but it also has its flaws and that is why you will find it very interesting , I think. I enjoyed it. I think that's what they were going for. In the end it's just a "what if" adventure film. I think that's all I'm going to say about this. It was very well written. The dialog was great. The story wasn't really that bad. I felt like the whole movie had an amazing story and plot.

The trailers for this movie promised and this movie delivered exactly what was promised : Good campy fun with lots of laughs for the family. The only down side to this movie is that it's not the full length version of the movie, it only ends up a little over 2hrs when you add in a 15 min intermission. As I said in the movie itself it is very family friendly for those who want to watch a 3 hour movie. However if your kids are under 10 or you want to watch it with the family and have a short 2 hour time, I'd pick up the 2hrs version.

The TV show was slow moving and the 'offbeat' characters were sometimes irritating. Only through the miracle of fast forward was I able to make it through the first 2 hours. The write-up indicates that it's some kind of comedy/mystery but I didn't see much of either. If it really picks up after the first 2 hours, please let me know, because I doubt that I will watch the rest without a recommendation.This review is supposed to be without spoilers so I will continue in a vague, non-spoiler, fashion. I found the two main characters uninteresting and unsympathetic.

^^contains spoilers^^This movie is utter crap . Do not watch.There is no one in this movie to root for , its all like "its good for the character , they need to get this out of their system" . I couldnt give a fuck if it was a movie or a tv series , i just dont wanna waste my time with a movie with no plot or characters . I hate that shit . . . Its like when they release a new book and they have like 2 pages in it with no story in it .

While Disney have been THE animation studio for the past 70 years , there have always been rivals to their success like Toon Boom , Tipp-Ex , Film Roman , Topps and many other animation studios that have been making some of the best animation ever seen on this planet. When it comes to anime , animation , cartoons , kids and comics , Disney is by far the king. However , to be a good animation studio , you need more than just great story lines and good animation to make you a good animation studio.

I must say , when I saw this film at a 6.5 on this site , I figured it was going to be awful . however , it does have a few decent points and is not terrible . this is a film i have never seen , but i have heard of the plot , and it sounds like i may just have to see it . let's first look at what makes this a very good film . i will talk about it , and then the rest , shall we ? . first of all , i will be honest , i hated the film .

Walt was particularly fond of quality. So how come the producers at Disney would release such a terribly edited, roughly acted (even for family fare!) mess of a movie? THE BIG GREEN had a good concept. And, since it is Disney, you know how the movie is going to turn out obviously. But THE BIG GREEN is horrible. The jokes are lame. And Steve Guttenburg, still alive, pulls in another terrible performance on his resume.Kids with too much time on their hands in small town Elma are offered an opportunity by their new teacher to play soccer.

* * * SPOILERS * * * * * * SPOILERS * * * There 's not much that can ruin the fun of watching a horror film. There 's only one exception, though, and it happens during the last few minutes. The exception is the moment you realize that the killer is right there, right in front of you, stalking you. You don't have a gun, you don't have the power to change things, you just have to let the monster do its thing. You can't fight it, you know. But you can watch it.

I must say, when I saw this film at a 6.5 on this site, I figured it was well worth a view. I was sorely disappointed. From nearly the opening scene, it is obvious the two supposed FBI agents are, in fact, the killers. Could they have made it any more obvious? If that is the intended "twist" in this film, that's pretty sad. While Pullman and Ormond are excellent actors, even their talent is no match for a reprehensibly bad script. Pullman adeptly acts the part of a sociopathic killer... and that's the problem.

I tried watching this movie , but I did n't make it past the first 15 minutes . It 's a great film , but it is only worth watching if you are a fan of John Wayne . It 's not as good a film as the original , but still has great action scenes , and is a good western . This is my favorite film of the bunch . I think the only reason it doesn't get a perfect rating is because it's a remake . I had a similar experience watching the first film. It was good enough, but not good enough.

This was the worst TV movie I had ever seen . The visuals were so dang choppy it made me wonder what the hell is wrong with this picture .
