It was like watching a TV show that ran for a few minutes before the picture turned to a mess and you had to sit down to see what was happening and get it out . And when the action finally came back to the screen , I couldn't believe the resolution . I really enjoyed this TV movie . I have to say it would have been more interesting to see it as a TV movie than as a live-action movie.

Here is a movie of adventure , determination , heroism , & bravery . Plus , it 's set back in the early 1900's . I 've seen many movies of this genre but this one takes the cake . It's not just the story itself , it 's how a bunch of boys get their hands on a golden opportunity . It's also a good movie to see when it comes on in your neighborhood . If you haven't yet see this movie , do yourself the favor to go out , rent the dvd , and enjoy .

Until today , I thought there only three people , including me , who considered Heaven 's Gate ( 1980 - 1983 ) as their favorite band . Not anymore . After spending a week with my family , I decided to re-visit this obscure band . I discovered that my family had never heard of any of its previous members , nor had they ever had anything to do with any of its previous releases . That 's how I had never heard of this band , nor of its members . I thought I'd better go back and listen to their early work , in order to get my bearings .

I 've always found the dilettante Man Ray and his artistic efforts to be deeply pretentious , and I 've found him to be nothing short of a fraud. In all seriousness, I 'll be the first to admit to the fact that there are many who 're more accomplished than I in the art of photography, but I 've also come to realize that the majority of them simply aren 't talented enough to be considered genuine masters. In other words , they 're not the kind of man who is truly capable of creating masterpieces. That 's a real shame because the world would surely benefit from more masterpieces.

I cant go for long describing this tittle, simply because I do not feel strong about it. I read a few comments and I see that only proud and patriotic Frenchmen seem to like it, that's all I can say...Boring Long Sometimes even stupid...p.s. 7.4 out of 10, the viewers must be going crazyI cant go for long describing this tittle, simply because I do not feel strong about it. I read a few comments and I see that only proud and patriotic Frenchmen seem to like it, that's all I can say...Boring Long Sometimes even stupid...p.s.

While this movie did have a few scary moments (great use of music and film angles to build suspense), it's obvious director Ethan Wiley and scriptwriter Ellary Eddy didn't waste any time researching their subject matter; which also makes me question their claim that the exorcism scenes were overseen by a genuine Catholic bishop.Amongst the many inconsistencies: * Jacob the Roman Catholic priest, when we first meet him outside the church, is wearing an academic robe over his clericals rather than the typical alb, chasuble or surplice. Academic robes are commonly worn by Protestant ministers in liturgical denominations, not Roman Catholic priests.

Poor Bela Lugosi . Just another day at work . A group of saboteurs attempting to disrupt the American war machine . They have been successful for a number of years . The government now has a number of programs that have been created by these saboteurs . This program is designed to allow the government to keep the country in a state of constant war . The government is very excited about how successful this is . I’m sure you’ve been waiting a long time to hear the story . The program is called Operation Northwoods . Now this is a very interesting story .

Is it really possible that so many people in this film believe that the girl is a witch ? Just think how many fans of the films are waiting to watch it with their children so they can say that she was not real. There are so many characters in the film and so few of them are memorable. They just seem to be there so that we will want to see the movie again in a month when it has been over for two years and we will be bored with all of them. The acting in the film is very average.

I kind of like JAG . It do have it´s charm but lately it´s to much propaganda in it . I don´t know but maybe it is in part that´s why people are not looking back at it . It seems as if they can´t keep it up . It seems like the last time they were on the air was in the early 90´s so it´s time that it is on the air and that it is done with . It´s a good program and a good show with good actors . But I think it´s time they left . They are getting old and I think they are just a little too in depth for me .

I can't believe this movie is getting the rating that it is here on IMDb. Of course, I've come to conclude that IMDb is somewhat worthless for actually finding out if a movie is good or not as 99% of films are rated from 6 to 7. It's the conclusion and failure of crowd-sourcing on the internet. For this purpose an average is taken of most people, and unfortunately, most people are simple minded easily entertained fast food lifestyle morons. But I digress. The movie. I really don't want to waste my time writing about it.

I 've rent the movie because i 'm very fond on war movies and on the cover picture i 've seen in that film it was a war and there was a girl in it who was just like to me and i thought about the fact that her and me, we have the same problem we both have the same face and we both want something which we can 't have it . and i thought about the fact that the only thing we can have is each other 's love and to give each other the chance to have the same love we both want it is not something easy .

This is one of the funniest movies I 've ever saw . A 14-year old boy Jason Shepherd wrote an amazing screenplay about a girl and her boyfriend . It has been a long, long time since I have watched a movie . In my life I have only seen a couple of films . The first movie I have seen was The Good, the Bad , the Ugly . This movie was the best movie I ever watched . So many people think this movie is bad . But in my life I've only seen one movie that was more like a movie .

When i went to see this i thought , i liked the first two and thought that they were very good but as i got to listen to the 3rd one. I loved it. This is one of the best albums ever! It is the best thing since sliced bread. So many songs. I had to listen to the whole album again to make sure I could remember everything. And there's the whole album. It's hard to describe it, but it's a great album in all ways. This is one of the best albums i have heard in a very long time.

The Man with the Golden Arm was one of the first films to have as its main topic (and, in some respects, the message) the tragedy of heroin addiction. It's nowhere near a great film, but its importance lies in Otto Preminger's dedication to making it feel real and on the edge of melodrama and naturalism. What I liked is that it's not so much an expose of junkies (if you want the best expose of that read Naked Lunch, if you can get through it anyway, besides the point), but the nature of the urban environment Frankie Machine lives.

I have watch this movie almost every night that is was on HBO . It is of my opinion that this movie was excellent. I do agree with you that they should have done a follow up movie so we could have see more of the main characters in a more action packed movie. The acting was superb and all of the actors should be recognized as some of the best actors at that time. This movie is not just a fantasy movie, it had a dark under side that was amazing to watch . The music was great too . I would like to watch the movie again .

Gorgeous Annie Belle in her prime stars in this adventure/sex movie . She wears her hair in a buzz cut, has a sexy tattoo on her back and has a nice pair of natural tits. You’ve never seen anything like this before! When she shows up for her interview for work, we get to see her in all her naked glory before she gets her clothes off and strips! She shows off her sexy body and tits while getting naked, and her sexy attitude is just great! We get to see a bit more of her when she strips down to her birthday suit.

This is an example of why the majority of action films are the same. Generic and boring, there's really nothing worth watching here. A complete waste of the then barely-tapped talents of Ice-T and Ice Cube, who've each proven many times over that they are capable of acting, and acting well. Don't bother with this one, go see New Jack City, Ricochet or watch New York Undercover for Ice-T, or Boyz n the Hood, Higher Learning or Friday for Ice Cube and see the real deal.

If I were to pitch this movie idea to some Hollywood bigwigs, I'm sure it would sound like this: ME: "Four boys at a private high school are good friends, AND they are witches. "Hollywood: "That sounds like "The Craft." ME: "No, no, I said four boys, not four girls." Hollywood: "That still sounds like "The Craft", just with boys instead of girls." ME: "OK, but there is this fifth unknown boy that comes into the picture and he wants more power.

Reanhauer ( Bill Roy ) is the leader of a desert-dwelling cult who tries to resurrect one of his people, and then discovers she’s still alive and has fallen under the cult’s control. He then has to figure out how to find and rescue her. With the aid of his faithful dog, he’s forced to overcome his fear of his own people. The film plays like an ’80s sci-fi epic. It’s got some cool action, but at the end I’m left feeling like I haven’t been treated to everything that made me interested in this genre of film.

Aaran is one of the movies where you find the loop holes in Indian Cinema . Here is one good example where Aaran goes wrong in all the aspects . Aaran is actually the story of an orphan who had no family to call him as his mother died when he was just 4 . Aaran is the son of the poor farmer who had left the country when he was in his childhood to escape his poverty . And here in one scene Aaran finds a job as a nanny for a rich man . Aaran comes back to India and takes care of the family of his nanny .

This is one of those movies that you just don't want to end. The characters are rich like a well woven tapestry. Colorful costumes, music and characters draw you in and tell a tale of the people that lived in a boarding house over the decades around the time of the civil rights movement and the Vietnam War. A young man is taken in by a dynamic, big-hearted woman that runs the house and these are stories based on his experiences.I couldn't believe this was a made for television film. It was so well executed.

Audrey, I know you truly cherish your husband Ted's memory but PLEASE do his legacy justice and heed his wishes. Dr. Seuss refused to license his characters during his lifetime for a very good reason. We beg of you to please stop cashing in on his stories, images, fantasies and characters. They are getting disemboweled by the powers that be of Hollywood and Broadway. The children of tomorrow will be stuck with these histrionic and grotesque interpretations that will forever pollute the loving warmth and innocence of his books.It is indeed your property to do with as you wish.

What has Rajiv Rai done to himself? Once a hit director of films like Tridev and Vishwatama is now making one bad film after another. I was initially excited at the thought of Rajiv Rai returning to the action genre but that soon fizzled out. As a Rajiv Rai fan I thought I should at least give it a go but I left after an hour. One reason for me leaving the film so early so the amount of Paki- bashing in the film, this was not in Rai's previous venture.A lot of directors have tried Paki- bashing but I did not expect it from Rajiv Rai Another letdown was the music.

I admit - I was lured to this one from the hype - and I didn't stop to consider the sources. "one of the best indie exploitation flicks of the year (1999)", shocking", and " a must have ".Well - I wasted my money. But not all was bad in this movie. THey at least got the gore right, as well as some of the most unique methods of murder seen in a long time. There is even a storyline (kinda) and that is about it.But for an exploitation film there is a surprising amount of content - but no exploiting.

Forget the lousy acting, that can be forgiven in this sort of film. Or even the terrible, unnatural dialog and illogical events (if my subtitles actually reflected what was said). Far worse is the blatant absence of a skillful or experienced director who maybe took a holiday with the editor while the film was being made? Watching the film, it feels completely out of date even though it was 'only' made 7 years ago. A computer virus as a portal to the afterlife? lol? A dial up internetconnection? Clucky ghost images photoshopped on pictures ("He!

... but you probably have seen it or else you would n't be here . It 's so obscure that most people who do not know this story don't know of it . I was lucky because I was one of the few people who did in fact see it. My father was very proud of me and my mother was very pleased that someone had seen it. I never got it on film. It was in black and white but I still remember the feeling that it made me. It's the story of a small town and the people who lived there .

The Nun is a revenge picture whereby a very strict nun is killed by her rebellious trailer trash charges and the priest who took care of her is subsequently killed in return, but he doesn't know it's her until he gets a letter from the police saying that she has died. After a few weeks, the priest finds out. And he decides to end the revenge on himself by killing the nun. In one of the sequels to "The Silence of the Lambs", the woman who killed the nun is killed in return.

Ahh, nuthin' like cheesy, explopitative, semi-porn, masquerading as horror...This one stars Jaqueline Lovell(sometimes Sara St. James), the nubile starlet also seen in "Femalien", "The Erotic House of Wax", and that family favorite "Nude Bowling Party". She is now a fixture in Surrender Cinema's line-up of talentless cuties starring in pointless, soft-porn exploitation flicks. "Head of the Family" actually tries to be a real moovie. A con-man and a tramp try to get said-tramp's husband off-ed.

Great 1980s Comic Strip comedy set in the South West of England . It is a tale of sex , drugs , crime , violence and general stupidity , but it’s funny and it’s fun . There are no real villains . There are no real heroes . There are only people , and the people aren’t the heroes . It is a comedy set against the background of the early Eighties , a time when cocaine was legal, when people were buying up houses by the mile for £5 million , and when the police were trying to do something about it .

Though often considered Peter Sellers ' worst film , it is in fact an excellent send-up of medical corporate corruption. It has also become one of the most frequently remade in recent years, for a wide range of different reasons . After the success of this film, there were plans in the UK for a remake, which never came to light . In the 1970s, Sellers and his son, Peter Sellers Jr, created a series of commercials for British drug company Gilead and a short film entitled ' The Doctor is Back , which they released on the BBC. .

A good story about Rusty Parker (Rita Hayworth) who dreams of being on broadway which means she would have to leave the small dinner theater where she works with Danny (Gene Kelly) and Genius (Phil Silvers). Rusty is in love with Danny. All three are good friends and every Friday night they go to a local bar where they get oysters so they can look for a pearl (they never eat them). The story line provides numerous opportunities for songs and dancing. The movie has two questions that Rusty must answer: Is fame all that it is cracked up to be?

Wow, I swear this has never happened to me before. I only watched "Golden Temple Amazons" yesterday and already I haven't got the slightest recollection of anything that happened in this film. That's how brilliant this movie is, I guess! By now I only remember being lured into watching it because of the incredibly attractive DVD cover art, showing a torrid drawing of a voluptuous Amazon preparing her bow to fire at an unspecified target. I often get fooled by appealing DVD covers  especially Jess Franco ones  and I still haven't learned to resist even after literally hundreds of awful experiences.

Brit director Chrstopher Nolan now has a career in America , and a reputation for making movies both popular and interesting. But at the start of the movie-making revolution in the early 2000s he was just making his name. "I didn't know what I was good at," he says now of his youth, when he was in his early 20s, "and I was doing nothing." He had only a few movies to his name by that point, but "I felt I had more than that to give," as he says.

Sorry about the `` extremely clever '' summary phrase . I do n't know what I was thinking , but I certainly didn't mean to offend you. Sorry. Anyway I was looking at the various options available for the ``solar'' part of the title of this piece and I decided on my own and I don't have any links to where I looked and decided on this. It just seemed to be the best possible word to use. Sorry again. I just wanted to make sure I spelled my name right.

I left the theater , and I was only 10 years old . That 's how bad it sucked . I'm not sure how to fix it . I want to see it again and again . I'm glad it didn't do well at the box office . But this is the first I've had to put up with a musical in the theater since . . . it was . . . I forget the name . . . Well, it's not the first time that I've been in trouble with a live show. But, I've learned to live with it.

Hope the summary line won't irritate you that much (it's a little homage to the Chappelle Show/Charlie Murphy, but also to the character Daywalker). But I'll try to put all the things I liked about the movie in one paragraph and everything I didn't like in another paragraph, so it will be easier to read! Let's start with the good things! The quote "strong bloody violence" (which is used by rating boards, to describe the content of a movie, does fit here very well. This is not a movie for kids!

After watching Stop-Loss , I find myself against disappointed in Hollywood for making such a stinker . Gone are the days when you just need a good story to make it to the screen. It's the story that matters now, with the story-driven films getting the biggest share of the box office, with blockbusters becoming a rarity. That's why I decided to write this blog , because in this post , I'd like to address two things: (1) What makes a great story? (2) Will the story you choose to tell still have the power to leave you happy and entertained?

I have seen cheesy kung fu fight films . Living in Taiwan they come on in lieu of sitcoms in the local cinema . They’ll get the biggest reaction out of the audiences in a crowd of people . And most of all they will make you feel something . You’ll never go home and you will feel good. As for this blog, i’m not really into writing. It’s because i have so much things to read. And it’s not always good to read on the net because i’m not really interested in the content of what i get.

When I stepped into the theater , I thought this was going to be a great movie . And I thought they got the story and the performance , the story was good , the movie was good . The problem with this movie was the script . It was poorly written . And it was poorly acted . I got bored with this one in the 3rd . 1/3 . I was hoping this would be a better movie . I wanted to like it . I wanted to watch more of the characters . I just couldn't . And it is the same thing for me in watching this .

In yet another case of misleading marketing , this film is included in a 10-movie DVD set called `` Women in the Movies.'' It features two women who have not even played any roles in films in decades! In fact, the two stars who portray them are in their 70s. They have no real screen experience of any sort. In the opening credits, both of the stars are referred to as "actors." They both appear in only two scenes in the film. The film is titled "Women Who Love to Shop."

The movie was a pleasure to watch if you are a fan of the Stooges. The story is told from the point of view of Moe Howard and his relationships with his brothers Shemp and Jerome (Curly) Howard, also the life long friendship with Larry Fine. The movie deals mostly with the off camera high points and pit falls of the Stooges multi decade career. The casting director and makeup artist did a fair job of finding actors who resembled the famous ensemble. The actor who plays "Curly" Howard did a fine job of portraying the on camera antics of the most beloved Stooge.

Eleven years ago, Stanley Ipkiss released his true inner self and became the hero of Edge City by finding and wearing the Norse god of mischief, Loki's mask. The Mask helped bring Jim Carrey to the forefront of comedy and reached a very popular status for its originality and just pure fun. Everyone knew how to spell party. P-A-R-T-Y. Why? Cuz I gotta! Now, eleven years later, it seems to me that the same philosophy has been applied to the new movie "Son of the Mask." Someone asked director Lawrence Guterman why are you making this?

It seems at least vaguely possible that this movie provided a bit of inspiration for "The Sopranos," as its main character, Martin Blank (John Cusack) is a hit man who has so many issues from his past and his profession that he's in therapy trying to deal with it all. Everything finally comes to a head at his 10-year high school reunion. The problem was that by the time Blank got to the reunion I had stopped caring. Frankly, I found this movie a drag from start to finish.It had potential.

Being a wrestling fan , movies about wrestling generally suck ( Backyard Dogs , Bodyslam , Jesse Ventura story ) . It’s all the wrestling fans fault of course, and it’s just the way it is . So why did the WWE start up their own streaming video network ? It’s because Vince McMahon knew how to make it happen, and when you have money to do it , you don’t care what anyone says ! Vince was so confident he didn’t worry about it . He said to the WWE and everyone else .

Five Fingers is so bad , that I hardly know where to begin . So let me admit first , that I am not a fan of horror . I do not think that horror movies can ever be a good thing , and I certainly have not liked many films that have been horror movies . Horror is just one genre that I have avoided , because it has a bad reputation , and I don't really like horror movies anyway . Now I know that many horror fans enjoy horror movies , but for myself , I do not think that horror is one of the best films .

This is an excellent documentary about a story I hadn't heard about before. The first solo, non-stop sailing race around the world took place in 1968-69 and involved a handful of racers. It's a truly fascinating story about man vs. nature and man vs. himself. The story focuses on Donald Crowhurst, the tragic figure in this story. The film elegantly combines interviews with footage which was shot by the sailors themselves aboard their boats. The story is very suspenseful and sad as we learn the details behind the history of Donald Crowhurst. This is one of the best documentaries of the past few years.

I 've spent quite a while going through all the reviews for this film . I 'm in total agreement with the consensus of opinion that it is an extremely well-made movie that deserves to be more widely appreciated. I 've been thinking for quite a while that this could be a sleeper hit for me, and boy am I glad I jumped at the chance . My wife and I sat and watched it again last night. We laughed our asses off and I 'm sure she would love to see it more as well. I have to say, I was surprised by how much I had to laugh.

I love Japanese movies--having seen at least 100-200. So it's obvious I am not afraid of Japanese films. However, sometimes there are Japanese concepts for film that just don't translate well to Westerners. They might be hits at home, but abroad they just don't seem, well,...normal. It's like the live fish my wife ate on a business meeting or odd PS2 games such as dating simulators or Katamari Damacy--things that are accepted there that confuse non-Japanese. This is probably the way others view things Americans take for granted, such as American football, fried Snicker bars and Paris Hilton!

It carries the tone of voice that narrates the book into the jungle of Vietnam and into the wild-eyed look of the old Vietnamese woman in the rice fields. In the book the woman says, 'I will never forget that day. You were so young. And I didn't even know you had a wife until she came and took me to meet your wife.' I was on the plane when I had to tell the captain that if we didn't land in South Vietnam, there would be an accident. And that's how I got on that plane too.

A very interesting plot of the film based on the novel "Waltz into Darkness" of the writer Cornell Woolrich. It is a drama rather than a film noir, which tries to send a message that love changes your own life, i.e. your love to any person and the love you received from him/her. A wealthy man really changed his life for love, while his partner finally understood that he was the only one that loved her. Belmondo played well as usual, while a somewhat still young Michel Bouquet played his eternal role of a detective or police agent.

Like the above poster, I got burned on the title thinking I was getting the other Piranha... This movie is everything the above poster said and worse... Poor camera, lousy acting and just plain horrid storyline...There was very little here that was even worth watching... How this movie even got released is beyond me. Make sure the movie you buy is the one you want... and not this one.The movie I bought was labeled "Piranha" and not "Piranha, Piranha!" which is what it actually is... This is the only way they sold this movie at all.Peace Out.

I won't bore you with any synopsis, chances are you already know them. And hopefully you are already familiar with Park Chan-Wook's work.I STRONGLY disagree with some of the other commentators in saying that "Park has not moved on from the vengeance trilogy blah blah blah." Because you know what? He HAS!!! The vengeance trilogy were different from each other in style to begin with, how can you even compare the sombreness and subtlety of "Sympathy For Mr Vengeance" with the frantic and extravagance of "Oldboy"?

I thought Godzilla 2000 was the worst movie ever until I saw this monstrosity. My friends and I went to our local blockbuster and spent about an hour and a half looking for a movie. We could not find one since we have seen almost every movie created. We decided to look in the low budget horror section. We looked for the most attractive cover featuring scantily clad women. We finally decided on Last Slumber Party, THE. Whoops, we made a mistake. It seems as though this movie was filmed with the cheapest camera that could be found in K-Mart.

From 2002 on Dutch cinema finally got better again . This movie is still part- and a schoolbook example of why. This is an important movie to watch, because it is about a Dutchman who wants to get out of his country. He wants to be someone who is different in his mind , because he sees something different in this world. The film was released on March 7th, 2002. And the plot is really hard to put down . This movie is a masterpiece in the sense that you don't feel as if you are in a nightmare.

I viewed my videotape last night , for the first time in at least ten years . I found the first few minutes of the movie very boring . After the first few scenes , my interest was rekindled . I found that the film was very well done , but the movie was really dull . It has a good plot and the acting was superb . It had a good ending , I liked it , I gave it a 9.0/10 , but that does not do it justice . The movie has a good story and it is a very good drama .

Originally, the Spiders was planned as a four-part serial, and it shows. I dislike serials; they're typically ridiculous, convoluted and banal. This one is no exception. In the first part of the Spiders, 'The Golden Lake,' a rich adventurer thwarts the plans of a gang of criminals--the Spiders--to steal gold from Incas. A silly love triangle ensues, with some Cowboys and Indians action. The sensationalism and exotica of it didn't entertain me.One can legitimately trace themes from this two-part series to Lang's later, far superior work.

Just what is the point of this film ? It starts off as one film , then changes track , and ends up being something that should not be seen. This is not cinema, it is propaganda , and if you want to get away from propaganda , go and see another film , you will find it is more entertaining to watch. You will find that this film has no story. It has no characters , no drama, nothing that you can identify with. All you can do is look at the actors , and listen to the dialogue , and watch the music.

You can take the crook out of the joint, but it seems exceedingly more difficult to take the joint out of the crook. We've seen this kind of character in this kind of situation before (and since): in movies like BOB LE FLAMBEUR, ELEVATOR TO THE GALLOWS, TOUCHEZ PAS AU GRISBI, THE ANDERSON TAPES, etc. Too many times to mention. What helps make this one one of the more notable is (of course) the heist itself, which plays out wordlessly in real time, and the demeanor of the lead.

I really should give this stinker more credit that 1 star , because the film has so many eye-rolling lines , it would be more entertaining to watch if they were delivered in a slightly different way, with the characters speaking like real people , but still making us laugh at their idiocy. It's not so much a remake or sequel as a reboot. It takes place one year after Aliens and takes place the same time as Aliens. The characters are largely the same however, and the story follows a similar outline.

Good old Jess Franco! The always-reliable choice of director in case you're looking for undemanding sleaze, shameless exploitation and 200% gratuitousness. Jess once again really surpassed himself with this utterly trashy piece of jungle "adventure". Let's face it, this film is basically just an excuse to have the ravishingly hot (and underage) actress Katja Bienert parade around topless. It's actually a rather disturbing thought that an innocent 16-year-old girl had to walk around a film set naked in front of a whole crew and particularly before the gazing eyes of pervert Franco!

This is a very, very odd film...one that is so odd it's best you just see it for yourself. The film begins with a jaded professor haranguing his class because the students have the audacity to not be as incredibly brilliant as he is! You can tell very quickly that this man is a total cynic--finding the value in practically nothing but sticking to his own inner sense of self-importance. Additionally, he seems tired and bored with the monotony of life.Later in the film, he walks into a bank robbery and manages to annoy the robbers so much that one of them shoots him in the head.

'The Mill on the Floss ' was one of the lesser novels by Mary Ann Evans , who wrote under the pen name A.E.H. Roberts, which she published in the U.K. in 1885. It was published in the USA, in 1891, under her name and was later reissued as a collection of short story collections under the same title. The book was the author's first novel. She was inspired to write the novel while staying at a convent school, where she taught English as a second language. Evans' novel was written at the beginning of her career as a writer, during the Victorian period in England.

An unintentionally hilarious early talkie melodrama with Kay Francis as the Countess Balakireff chasing everything in pants. At the beginning of the film she "throws back" the stableboy for being too young before setting off for the chauffeur! The high-toned English set she moves in is such a clichéd bunch of harummpf-ers that it's ridiculous. But the topper is Basil Rathbone as an Italian violinist with a Chico Marx accent! "My violeen! How weel I ever play eet again!" "Patreecia, my meelk is cold!" It's campy beyond belief.

Yumiko ( Wakana Sakai ) , the pretty adopted daughter of a recently-deceased Japanese businessman , inherits control of her father's business and a huge fortune after his death. As she prepares to move to Tokyo with her husband and two young children, she is befriended by the eccentric, but extremely wealthy, Mr. Kurata, and begins to date him. When he suddenly disappears after a night of passionate sexual activity, Yumiko begins to fall in love with her mother's friend who has just moved into the home and who happens to be a lesbian.

Punishment Park is a brilliant piece of cinema . Shot in the SouthernCalifornia desert using his patent faux documentary style, director Paul Thomas Anderson tells an engaging tale of a young man struggling to overcome his demons and find meaning in a brutal life. Heading into the final scenes of the movie, he finds himself in a place he never wanted to return to again. But with his past still haunting his present, the journey ahead will be difficult. The opening shot of the movie opens with an old black and white film on the wall of the old prison that is used in the movie.

I honestly do n't know what words IMDB will allow me to use in this review , as a result of the fact that most of what I write about, in my review, is very subjective. However, I feel this article is relevant to many of the people that frequent this site. The first thing that comes to my mind is this: "If they can make money out of it, then its okay." This is my own personal bias and is not necessarily the only way to experience it.

I 'm having as much fun reading the user comments as I did watching the movie ! It seems that most of you liked the movie , as I did ! We have much fun here too , and we like to read your comments ! Please be sure to come back here again and visit us often !!! We always like to hear from our users !!! Thank you so much for reading this ! We appreciate all your support ! We will see you next time ! We will be having another movie in August , so please come and see it !!

This is one of those strange, self-important, self-indulgent movies which tries too hard to be profound. It isn't. Instead, it spouts cliches that try to pass for Profundity. Typical is the scene where Peter (Kelsey Grammer) explains to protagonist and best friend Adam (Dwier Brown) how man starts life breast feeding, then moves on to sucking the breast of his girlfriend, and finally his wife, thus concluding ultimately that life sucks. So deep. We are treated to a variety of characters who offer their perspective of life, the universe, etc.

This is by far the funniest sitcom that has ever aired on TV. I own all 9 seasons on DVD and literally could watch them over and over. Anyone who does not find this show hilarious, heartwarming, entertaining, and laugh out loud hysterical, is crazy! Kevin James is absolutely one of the most talented comedians out there. My boyfriend and I love going to stand up comedy shows in Boston (where we live) and have seen Kevin James twice and his brother Gary Valentine (Danny) once. They are both so unbelievably talented and just plan smart with their work.

I saw this movie last night at the Berlinale as part of the competition . It was billed as the world's first full-frontal porno movie . it was pretty darn good and i would say it's the closest thing i've seen to real porno ever. I was surprised to see that even though it's not technically porn that it's still got all the hallmarks of it. This movie has one big problem with it, which is it's very low budget. It's all very amateurish and amateurish acting, and that makes it all the better for it.

Imagine you have the opportunity to see yourself again as a kid . Now think what would happen if you got to relive a memory from that time period. For me this might be seeing myself in my high school prom dress. I never would have dreamed I would be able to relive this experience . I thought it would be like going back and seeing my own past. I would have a great time reliving the memory but it would be boring . The problem with this memory is there are a few things that make this time a little weird .

I hate to admit it , but they were right to sack Schrader . The opportunity is here to build a team that not only plays good defence , but is defensively sound in the first place and that is something the Caps have been failing to do for decades . I would also have loved to see him get another season with the team or a trade , as he seems to have his head on straight and he is still a decent enough player . The problem is that the team has not been competitive this year .

I think Trash really sucks. I watched it a couple of weeks ago and I haven't seen that kind of c**p at the cinema since Female Trouble by John Waters and that was even worse. The dialogues, the acting; it really stank, it was so bad it made me want to leave the cinema and ask for my money back. But actually I am glad I saw it, because then I could tell my honest opinion on it. One should see this film, even though it stinks.

The trailer for this film promised a new twist on the zombie genre: setting it in the Old West. Except it's not the real Old West, of course. It's some sort of Future West, in a world where some apocalypse has, as apocalypses are known to do, killed people and subsequently turned them into zombies. It's zombie virus time again, folks, and you know what that means? Get bitten and become one of them.So, into this dusty and dead-filled world comes a hero. He's a bounty-hunter, getting paid for taking care of zombies.

The plot of this movie is dangerously thin and the only "star power" if we can call it that consists of Joe Estevez. I don't know what is more shocking. The fact that this movie was made or the fact that some people actually gave good comments about it. If you ever see the cover of the video you'll be able to read them. Someone even went as far as saying that the actress/writer could be the leading lady of the 90's. Yeah! And Joe Estevez could have more money than his brother Martin.

Not having any idea what this film was about , but based on the fact that John Leguizamo was appearing in the movie, i thought i would try my hand at interpreting the plot. I’m not sure that I’m any good at it, but here’s what I think the plot was about. The story takes place in the late 60’s, I think in New York, and is about a gay man who works at a bar. He meets a guy and they go out a couple of times until one time, they decide to go to his room.

As an ancient movie fan , I had heard much about the controversial movie CALIGULA assessed ambiguously as one of the most influential horror films in history . I was curious to learn more. In the early 70's, I was fortunate to attend the University of California, Los Angeles, with a group of friends called the "Lets Play the Odds" group , as they called themselves. I had the pleasure of working in their theater. We were the only theatre in town , so no one knew what was going on in the world outside our theater.

This movie was pathetically awful . The sound was terrible , the action was ridiculous and the effects were nauseating . There were few redeeming features . If this movie is on TV it would be a waste of time . There are not many bad movies that come from Hollywood so I was disappointed . There are worse movies . This was a bad attempt by Hollywood . I give it 2 stars . It's hard to be upset by this. I can understand that it's an attempt to cash in on the popularity of "Star Wars" and "Ender's Game".

I feel privileged to have accidentally seen this movie. I actually ran across this movie by accident. I was taping another movie on Showtime one night, overnight and this movie came on afterward. So I sat and watched it and boy was I blown away. The acting is absolutely superb. Kathy Bates...who has been my favorite actress since Misery and Fried Green Tomatoes gave an amazing performance as a domineering mother who tries desperately to hold on to her old school values (religion, family) at the risk of alienating her family.

`` Tragic Hero '' is a film that is most definitely trying to emulate the classic Godfather films , focusing on its lead character as an innocent child who becomes a ruthless gangster with no regard for anyone but himself. While the story could be described as well made and well acted, it can't really be classified as a great crime film. The film is pretty generic, and does not really bring out the best in the viewer. Plot: In this action-packed movie, an average teenager becomes a ruthless drug lord in the heart of a drug-filled city, with no respect for life.

I thought this series was going to be another fun , action series with some dynamic plots and great performances. Then the writing took a turn and became rather bland and unfiltered, with one-note characters and plot twists thrown in for the heck of it. I mean, the first two were actually good, but then the 3rd was a complete turn off. I was not a fan of the series when it started. Now, I think it's because I am tired and have just gotten to the point where I am done.

Genius or utter madness ? That depends on your interpretation of this film . I responded to it on the 3rd time watching this film . I did like it . There is some humour and there are some scary moments too . The acting was not very good . The first two films were good and it was only the third film that it started getting to me . This film is based on a short story by the Japanese author Haruo Shirane, who wrote the first of a long series of sci-fi books. He wrote a short story based on the events of WWII.

Not all movies are Oscar worthy but let's face it, sometimes these types of movies are more fun to watch and leave a longer and lasting impression. This one left me smiling and happy and I couldn't wait to hug my own son. Anyone who has had a pet (no matter what type) knows what it feels like to lose one. I believe most people would identify with Buddy almost losing his best friend who he raised from birth. Bruce Willis was great as the tycoon turned nice guy and Joey Lauren Adams was convincing as a good mother.

This film has made e mad . I believe the original of this film , 'The Mask ' , was made back in the '70's in France. This 'Mask' is very cool and I can not find a way to describe how this film is. I would just suggest you check out this film to see what I am describing. I will be buying this when it comes out to my country . I was given a copy as a gift by a friend for my birthday and I just can not wait until I will be able to see the film in this country .

Dark and bleak sets , thrilling music that cuts through your spin like aknife ( or razor ) a perfect balance of light and darkness that will send shivers down your spine and make you want to run away. I was sitting in the front row of one of the many shows that we put together around the US. It was the second time we'd played to sold out crowds and the energy and excitement was contagious. I can't explain exactly why but the energy seemed to increase every time we played the same location.

This was a great film in every sense of the word . It tackles the subject of tribadism in a very interesting manner. It has no pretension and goes straight for it. If you want to know why the movie got an A , then here you go. The film deals with the issue in an unbiased manner. It doesn’t hesitate to point out the glaring flaws in India’s democracy. And if the film isn’t enough, then let it be known that the movie has no agenda. It simply tells the story.

Well , at least we have to acknowledge the big Hollywood horror-producers are finally getting smarter and more perceptive . It appears to me that all of their movies (the ones we’ve already watched and those yet to hit theaters) are going to involve someone being stalked , stalked by something unseen in the shadows , or both , while the main character goes about her business trying to avoid these threats . It’s been a good year for scary movies . We’ve been treated to such diverse fare as The Sixth Sense , Don’t Go In There , and The Silence of the Lambs .

I came across this movie back in the mid eighties as a teenager and it immediately became one of my favorite holiday and non-holiday films. As you can tell from the other reviews this movie has a very good story line and great actors signed on for it. Stanwyck is great as bride to be that is having second thoughts. Dennis Morgan's acting is strong also. He goes unnoticed in most films but was a very capable actor, check out KITTY FOYLE. In this film he plays the visiting sailor that woos Stanwyck away from her husband to be. This is a Christmas classic.

This movie should have come with a disclaimer that it was akin to the Left Behind series . I did not enjoy the first one but I loved this one. The first movie was about an apocalypse coming and how God, the devil or aliens could stop it. This one was about God giving the church a message to deliver to the world. This movie was a good reminder that there is good, evil and a whole mess of things in the world. This is a good film that should have been in the top 5 of this year.

Ocean 's twelve is probably better than Ocean 's eleven . I know most people would disagree , But I think it is a lot more likely that there is life on the moon than not , as we have discovered life on Mars . I don't think you have the logic for your claims. To be fair , you didn't ask me to come up with logic , you made statements that I can't disagree with. If life existed on the moon , there would surely be traces of life , even on our planet we have evidence of life on Venus .

... not to waste your time watching this vanity project . I 've had my comment deleted twice now , by two different people , and the third time the only person who actually replied to my comment is none other than this guy , who clearly is just a troll. Also , I think it's a great idea , it's an amazing idea , and it's a wonderful way to bring attention to something that nobody is talking about here . The only problem is that every time I read his comment, he makes a point I just don't like and I feel he's talking down to me.

If you want to truly experience the magic ( ? ) of Don Dohler , then check out `` Alien Hominids.`` An amazing film about a tribe of people who are able to communicate with each other and communicate with extraterrestrial beings. What I liked most about this film was the cinematography, acting and editing. This film was directed by Don Dohler. It was filmed in 1974. The film has a total running time of 76 minutes. It also has a soundtrack and music. The film was made on a very small budget and it looks amazing. Some of the scenes are amazing.

I'm not prone to ranting and my expectations were low to start with, but how did this seem like a good idea? Just because you have a camera, some big ugly friends for actors, and delusions of talent, does not mean that you should go out and make a film. This should have been the cinematic equivalent of singing in the shower, i.e. it should never have seen the light of day. However, somehow this rubbish found a distributor to help it escape the confines of a 3 by 4 foot cubicle. It goes from bad to worse.

Wow, Kiss the Bride wasn't that bad, but it wasn't that good either. It sure was no "Later Day Saints." The movie sags in the center...perhaps cutting out about 30 minutes would have made a more enjoyable film. But the film gets bogged down again and again by annoying subplots and throw away scenes - the whole gold outing sequence comes to mind.Even though "Kiss" was made for theatrical release, it looks and sounds more like a made for TV movie. Every scene is lighted like a department store.

A complete and utter waster of my precious two hours . The entire movie could have been made in less than one hour, and it would have still been one hour long . It was so badly acted, the only good part was the last 20 minutes . There is no way in the world you could spend two hours watching a movie, especially not one that's supposed to be a movie. I guess I'm just a guy who doesn't like over the top acting when I can get something good for free.

Normally I am a typical `` creepy-crawly-hatin ' '' girl , but after watching this film ( on YouTube of all places) , my opinion is that it was a classic . this is not to say it is bad , just that it is well done and has a nice blend of genres . the script has a very realistic look to it ( the characters are very real ) but is also a comedy of errors , and i must admit , it is very entertaining at times . and as a comedy , it is really fun .

When Hollywood is trying to grasp what an "intelligent person" is like, they fail so miserably, finding it hard putting words in the mouth of the purported "genius".Right, any genius walks around trying to rub in his superiority at every instance. Sure, they hang out in bars and pick fights  it's not like they are (generalizing wildly) autistic nerds who never have a tan.Plus, if you are a genius you know all about Math and History and Politics and of course you're constantly up to date with current events and a thorough analysis of them.

Saw this last night and being a fan of the first Demons, I had hoped that the sequel would have the same fun, spooky spirit of it's predecessor. This is unfortunately not the case. The set-up is similar as the first, in which a horde of flesh-eating demons burst forth into reality by being released from a horror movie being played... (The first had been a movie theater, this one takes place in an apartment building and on TV.) Once the demons are released, madness and mass carnage ensues. That's pretty much it as far as plot development goes.

I thought that this movie might be a good spoof, or at least a good independent comedy like Friday. Instead it was more like something someone in high school would make with their parents' camcorder. It wasn't just the low budget that makes this film bad (many great films have been made on a low budget), it is simply a bad movie and it wasn't even bad enough to be good camp. Case in point: for the first ten minutes of the movie nothing happens except the 3 main characters sit in their room smoking dope, put on their makeup, and then answer a phone call.

I 'll never understand why when a studio like Universal buys a musical it then butchers it when bringing it to life on film. For a studio to bring it to life as a musical, you'd think they'd have a lot more faith in it and more confidence that people would buy it in a theatre than they had in it when it was on film. And in some ways I don't have much confidence in this one myself, despite the fact that I think this could be a very successful film.

When I sat down to watch Greek for the first time, I wasn't expecting a show with complex characters, intriguing plot lines, and impeccable writing... but that's exactly what I got.Greek follows several college students who are in the Greek system at Cyprus Rhodes University. Rusty Cartwright enters Cyprus Rhodes as a Polymer Science major who aspires to be in a fraternity. His older sister, Casey (the show's center and soon-to-be-president of Zeta Beta Zeta, the most prestigious sorority on campus), isn't exactly supportive of his plans.

when this show first came to Disney, i love it started watching all the time. It quickly became one of my favorite Disney shows ever but this show somehow transformed into something that is disturbing and disappointing.I do now find any of the second and third season fun, they seem like a re-watch of some teens shows. I hat that garbage. The first season was very unique because it showed Sadie who loved science and animals and creatures. The first season was very entertaining. I mostly don't like the second season because of Ben. He annoys me and pisses the crap outta me.

Rather than go on location and make a realistic film about drug addiction in the Windy City , contrarian director Michael A. Arndt shot this short film on an iPhone 3GS , which was his way of making the film without using a crew and without the need for money to get it made. And it turns out that Arndt was able to get a lot of the film done in just a few hours using only a mobile phone. The film starts out in a very low-key way with Arndt walking into a drugstore and buying a pack of smokes.

The 1979 film musical of HAIR was loosely based on the infamous 1960's Broadway musical that became famous because of its infamous nude scene. The stage musical isn't really much more than a group of skits strung together with some amusing musical numbers; however for the film director Milos Foreman (who won an Oscar for directing ONE FLEW OVER THE CUCKOO'S NEST) and the writers have taken the basic premise of the play and the score and constructed a real story to make the show more "user friendly" for the big screen.

Firstly, I am a huge fan of crap films. B grade is always good for a laugh. Unfortunately this film is just plain bad. I dressed up as a Zombie for a party and my make up looked better than the ones in this film. Especially the big guy at the beginning, it just looked like a kid had drawn on his face with crayons.The acting is so bad I need not comment on why. The effect are also extremely amateurish, with obvious blood tubes firing a straight jet of blood out the back of zombies heads when they get shot.

It beats me how anyone can rate this film very highly . It is no understatement to call it far worse than its predecessor. We were treated with some good performances, but what was missing in my mind was that there was a strong plot, an intriguing story line, a strong romance between two people who could have easily had a great love story . But it didn’t. It just seemed that way to me. If it was going to be a romantic film then I would expect at the very least a good love story. But it was not to be.

I heard legends about this `` film '' ( quotes used so as not to insult films ) for a long time. I had no idea how much I could do with them, until I read this book. It's the first book that has made me believe that what I see in movies are not just dreams. It was quite a change for me to believe that these things really could be true. The movie I saw in the park the first day I met him, I didn't have a clue where we were, or anything else. And now I know.

I am a Talent Manager. I have been for 15 years now. I have discovered some wonderful talent. They have been in Movies, Commericals, Braodway and Television. In my opinion Eddie Monroe was cast wonderful. I love seeing the ability of real people. Not just a name. The Actors in this movie were very natural and believable. I was very entertained by this film. I love a movie with a few twists. I also enjoy when at the end of the movie the puzzle is solved. I still would like to know what happened to the large sum of the money.

This film is not one of those films so bad you get annoyed and mad because it seems to be saying, you know what? I’ve got nothing more to say. This movie isn’t a failure because it doesn’t make any profound point. It’s a failure if you’re just looking for a simple point that will get people to laugh. It’s a failure because this movie never gets to say anything, so that means you’ve wasted half an hour watching it. This movie is never really funny.

As is the case with many films of this ilk, my non Catholicism got in the way of my understanding it. The church has this mass of rules which have been put together over centuries. We have a short time to learn them and have to accept them at face value. Then, throw in some bad guys getting revenge for a long distant act against them, working under these rules and attempting to circumvent them, and you have this book and movie. I found myself thinking, "That's pretty cool. Why did they do that?"

My favourite movie of all time . This was a flawed piece of work by Coppola and seeing the documentary on its 50th anniversary i am glad i got to see this before my time on the other side . I am still haunted by the ending and still have a lot of feelings for it . Its one of those films i would recommend to any cinephile . The acting and the cinematography alone would be enough for me to recommend this one to anyone . I am still trying to figure out how to get out from under the movie .

Chris Morris ' Brass Eye TV series had always generated a large number of complaints , both from the audience and from his fellow cast members , about Morris' frequent use of excessive profanity . In his autobiography , " The Man who would be King ," Morris claims he got into trouble with the police on three separate occasions while working in Australia . In this first installment in a new series of his autobiographical novel, " Brass Eye , " Morris claims he was threatened with a long prison sentence in Australia if he did not shut down the production company he was involved with in Australia , and return to England .

I saw the movie on its North American premiere ( July 14 , 2004 ) at the Fantasia Festival . It was very interesting to compare the movie with the storyboard from the film. I was astonished by the quality of this film. I thought that the movie would be better than the original. But when I watched the movie I could not find any flaw of the film. I really like the performance of the actors. And I would like to know what was the reason for the film to be changed. Because I was very curious to know if there are any changes in the storyboard or not .

In watching this off and on for a few seasons, two things come to mind: One - wondering what kind of girl wants to be a "model" and two - run to the nearest ice cream store and have a low fat sundae.I tried to be a fan because I liked the idea of this reality show competition. No other "famous" model thought of this, and it is very admirable for Tyra Banks to do so. But as the series goes on and on I've come to the conclusion that this is a sorry lot of folks trying to make a mountain out of a molehill.

This is probably Wayne's poorest movie; at least the poorest in which he had a starring role. It's just incredibly bad. The editing is especially awful; it really appears that the editor (if there was one)literally picked up pieces of film off the floor and pasted them together. The opening has to be seen to be believed. John Wayne must have cringed every time it was mentioned! I know there are "B" films - but are there "H" films? If so, this one's an example. And I say this as a devoted JW fan.

When a group of escaped convicts manage to flee to a remote island , they soon find that their new home isn’t as idyllic as they’re prepared for. But as a group of misfits and misanthropes struggle to hold on to the small piece of land, they slowly come to realize that they are part of something much greater than they could have imagined: a hidden community, living in harmony with nature. The series, which was first aired in 2017, was followed by a spin-off film last year.

No pun intended. I'm not going to spoil anything about the story, but it's safe to assume that you already know, what kind of character the main actor portrays. And of course being a priest while being "naughty" exaggerates all that. Plus this is the most erotic movie from Park Chan Wook yet.If you have seen Wook's previous works/movies you know he is very visual (in a good way) and it shows again here. While it strays away from the vengeance theme of his prior movies on the surface, it still has quite some heat hidden underneath.

This movie is something horrible. I was laughing all the time. I was forced to stop in some scenes because my mom thought it's not polite to laugh when people are dying, but in this movie, even death looks ridiculous. Especially when Tornado Tommy is sucked into one tornado.Explosions of cars thrown onto buildings by the forces of wind look like ones from the old school side scroller game called R-Type. Dialogues are very bad and I am interested how they managed to persuade some of the actors to play in this movie.

This movie was really funny . The people that were expecting to see an Oscar worthy comedy , should get ready to be disappointed . For example , this film is the story of a family of three , one father , mother and two son . The first son is always getting into trouble , his mom is always worried about what to do . He is never able to get a decent job and the one that is working for the most part is not really making any profit . So , his mother , father and brother make a decision , they are going to buy a business .

If all movies had to be destroyed and only one could be spared , Death in Venice would have to be considered the first one. That is why it has to be a first movie that has to be destroyed and one that can be saved. And the one that can be saved would be one that has to be shot and edited. That means the movie has to be made out of scratch, it has to be shot by people who can not make a movie of this magnitude , and it also has to be edited by people who are not experienced in this kind of stuff.

There's something going on in this film directed by X-Files scribe John Shiban that has eluded me. You get that feeling as the film moves that everything is not what it seems, yet I feel the movie fails at giving you enough to go on to truly care afterward. It's about perception. There are characters the heroine Nicole(Jaimie Alexander)meets in the film that she talks to that up and vanish. This might seem like a spoiler, but it's something that really only inherits a wee bit of focus on the filmmakers' part.

Hitchcock's original classic benefited tremendously not only from the performance of, but also the 'look' of Anthony Perkins. He projected a kind of clean-cut innocence: a young teen-idol type of persona. He was not an actor who had portrayed baddies before this; nor was he physically suited to the role of what the public might have imagined a psychopath to look like, especially in the 50's when this ultra-chilling aspect of mental illness (split personality psychosis) was relatively unexplored in film. Which is exactly why the casting of him as Norman Bates was a slice of true Hitchcockian genius.

One of the best sitcoms to run on Indian television along with Dekh bhai dekh and Idhar udhar . Great for a night or a weekend night with friends. I like this show very much because its a funny show and has some nice and funny moments which gives a lot of satisfaction to me and my friends. I like this show to watch it while having a meal with friends, I feel like this is the best program for a night time when you have a lot of time to relax and have fun with the friends or with your family.

Have to agree that this movie and it's talented director do not receive the plaudits they deserve. Here's hoping that the DVD will do very well and bring both to the attention of a wider audience. The actors gave excellent performances and the plot is excellent. Perhaps overall the movie is a little long but May Miles Thomas seems to enjoy her actors when they are giving strong performances and therefore sometimes holds them in longer close ups than necessary. Good for the actors I am sure but sometimes as the audience you are ready to move on so to speak with the plot.

This movie is silly and very short of being a funny movie. Unhappy 'easterners' are not pleased with being out west; so they hire a drunk wagon master(John Candy)to lead them back east. Sight gags were just not funny enough to carry this one. And Richard Lewis gets on your nerves very quickly; but then I honestly don't like him at anything he does. Ed Lauter is hilarious as the bumbling villain.The movie was dedicated to Candy. He died from a massive heart attack ten days before the movie was completed.

Oh boy! Oh boy! On the cover of worn out VHS has a picture of Sandra Bullock and her name written on top. I think only reason they had chance to sell the movie in nineties, was because of Sandra Bullock's name. Bullock's fans don't have to disappoint. Sandra is only thing to watch in this movie and her performance is the only you can call acting. Rest of the movie It's fun to watch in first fifteen minutes because it's bad but after that it's going worse. Much worse. Directing is awful.

After the success of Star Wars, there was a boost in interest in Sci-Fi movies. This was one of those cheap attempts to cash in quickly.A group of survivors from a spaceship land on a planet inhabited by stop-motion dinosaurs, where half of them are systematically killed off (the people not the dinosaurs). Porn-movie level acting. Cheap special effects, even for the time, although it looks like a lot of effort was put into them.Costumes were pure 1970's, as were the hairstyles. Ahh, the 70's. I expected a disco to break out at any minute.Nothing to really recommend in this film.

This is by far the worst movie i have ever seen. Its been a few years since I saw it and nothing has come close since then and i doubt that there ever will be a movie produced that is as bad as this. It tries to make fun of a variety of different movies, for example 'Nell' (!) and instead of funny its just pathetic. Whatever you do, don't rent or by this garbage and if someone throws it at you....turn around and run the other way! !

Ed Wood rides again. The fact that this movie was made should give any youngaspiring film maker hope. Any screenplay you might have thought of using toline a litterbox or a birdcage should now not seem that bad. Do not watch this movie unless you have a healthy stash of Tylenol or Rolaids. Watching thismovie made me realize that Boa vs. Python was not that bad after all. It probably would have been better to do this movie in Claymation as at least that way no actor would have had to take credit for being in this film. It is understandable why this director has so many aliases.

River's edge is not a PLEASANT film to watch but it is an incredible one. Having viewed it many years ago I truly think it would still have the ability to shock were it to be re released or remade or something. Perhaps no movie ever made has captured the essense of young suburban inertia like this distrubing frightening movie. Given that this is based on a true story it is even more disturbing. Very well acted and just UNPLEASANT at many times to watch but also a little known masterpiece and a truely important film. Should be a mandatory to watch shown nationwide in all highschools.

I was totally surprised just how good this movie actually is because when I first saw it I was only about 30 minutes into it but I was so fascinated with the subject matter that I could not help myself from sitting there the whole time with a grin on my face. It is a must see film and in fact I would highly recommend it to anyone interested in finding out the true facts behind the paranormal activity taking place in modern society. The story is told through a documentary style approach and is very well done I must admit.

This is a horrific re-make of the French movie Ma Vie en Rose (http://imdb.com/title/tt0119590/). The only scenario that I can imagine in which anyone (Sinise?! Bates?! Butler?! What WERE they thinking!?!) agreed to be associated with it is MacLaine seeing the original, being rightly impressed, and enlisting a friend (with no writing credits -- or talent! -- to his name) to translate the themes for American audiences -- whom they both agreed are stupid, stupid, stupid.

Walker Texas Ranger is one of the worst shows produced in the past 10 years. The script for James 'Jimmy' Trivette, Walker's sidekick, is about as pathetically written of a part as Wesley Crusher on Star Trek TNG, and is played with about as much conviction.On this show, people don't respond the way people respond to things in real life--everyone is polarized--everyone is either a completely good guy or a completely bad guy (unless Walker himself has a 2 minute talk with them and then they change instantly). That's not how life works, that's not how people are.

The subject matter was good , direction was OK. Mohanlal was efficient in his role as a Major . The film was decent . The cast was superb . However the story was average . One can easily find films with a similar theme at reasonable price . The problem with this film is lack of screen time on Mohanlal as an action hero. This is not only his first film but this is his first film after a long gap of 16 years from his last acting venture . Hence it would be wise for the producers to get him some more roles to boost his career .

To put it simply , this was a pompous piece of canine poopie . Overly stagey and everyone being the butt of its joke , you have to marvel that it was even published . I mean , who writes with a straight face ? I’m guessing the author has no life . Anyway , it went on for pages of what could’ve been filler , I thought , as I was laughing so hard at myself and all the people who were laughing with me . It’s only after I finished that I realised this article was written by a dog .

This movie certainly is a weird one to say the least . The basic plot is 3 old business associates who want to buy the property of an old and wealthy woman who has a large collection of rare paintings that she wants to donate to the public museum. The old lady who lives in the old house refuses to sell, claiming that her life was better before. After many days of arguing and a lot of heated debates between the three old men, she finally decides to sell to them for a huge amount of money. But there is a catch.

A low budget may be an excuse for poor acting talent and pathetic looking fake gore. However, it is not an excuse for poor writing. It is a talent to be able to write dialog without making it sound forced and mechanical. The dialog in this movie was on par with most instructional videos shown to fast food staff in training.I also understand that one must make a few exceptions when it comes to acting talent when you only have 20 bucks to spend on it. With that being said, no serious director would have looked at these scenes and said to himself, "that was perfect".

I just finished watching Following and I thought it was great . I rated it 8 out of 10 . The story is really good and I can't wait to read the next books in the series . I would give the book 5 1/2 thumbs up , just because it is such a good read and has a very good ending . This is one of my favourite books of all time because of the good writing . I would rate it higher , if I had read the first book a few years ago and would rate it a 7 or a 8 .

This German horror film has to be one of the weirdest I have seen.I was not aware of any connection between child abuse and vampirism, but this is supposed based upon a true character.Our hero is deaf and mute as a result of repeated beatings at the hands of his father. he also has a doll fetish, but I cannot figure out where that came from. His co-workers find out and tease him terribly.During the day a mild-manner accountant, and at night he breaks into cemeteries and funeral homes and drinks the blood of dead girls.

I can envision the writers of this story thinking up this script:1.Let's make a serial killer movie like Se7en, Knight Moves, Copycat, and Silence of the Lambs. People like serial killer stuff. It'll sell... 2.The killer needs to adopt some sort of pattern. I know; he'll copy it out of a serial killer mystery novel. That hasn't been done yet, at least not exactly like that. 3.Now, we need some kind of way to make this movie unique; of course, the good guy can be bedridden like in Rear Window.

WOW!! Talk about a film that divides the audience! This is a real love it or loath it kinda movie. Personally I really enjoyed it. I noticed that other reviews are comparing it to Pitch Black - this is kinda dumb as the only thing they have in common is SAND! People can be real stupid. No, this film is far more in common with The Thing (how people fail to notice is amazing - they even have the same basic music) Lots of Carpenter touches are there, blue collar heroes, sharp humor, endless rolling landscapes full of death and things not understood.

I just saw this movie and all I can say is, where are the drive in's these days. This seems like it would have been a great 2nd feature at a drive in in 1977 (maybe playing with one of those Joan Collins movies), but it's only worth watching now if you're feeling nostalgic for the 70's. Silly plot that is full of holes, but it does remind one of the era it was made in. Interesting to see Melanie Griffith so young and Anne Lockhart is quite attractive, though not much of an actress.

I realize the line on my summary is not too polite.This film written & directed by Scott Caan & starring Giovanni Ribisi,Don Cheadle & himself runs a long 88 minutes.There is a dog in this puppy of a movie., he is cute.The movie opened in 2 U.S. theatres in late April 2007,for one week & grossed all of $ 914. It quickly went to DVD in early August 2007.We were only able to take about 40 minutes before we turned the DVD off.This was the type of movie that played on lower half of double bill.

A terrible deception: controversial film, winner of the Teddy in Berlin 2003, Mil nubes de paz turned out to be a fiasco. The actors are all reciting (well, they are not exactly actors); the film tried to be a high bet but ends up being a doubtful bet: it stays in the superficiality of two guys kissing and a guy whose lover is gone; it has no purpose: nothing to do with the homo-sexuality presented in other films (e.g. Before Night Falls (2000) by Julian Schnabel).

The 1980 's 'My Dinner with Andre , ' with Wallace Shawn and Andre Gregory , is essentially a dialog with his wife, but with a few additions from Wallace. The conversation between Wallace and Andre takes place at a restaurant in the early '90s, when Wallace, who had just started writing for a series of '80s sitcoms that would run for three seasons each , was trying to find his way as an actor , and when he was on the road with the NBC show , which was about a group of guys on a college campus , which was about to come to an end.

Like classic Hollywood musicals, the plot is just an excuse. A must see for those interested in French music hall (including a song by Édith Piaf) and for the wonderful 10 plus minute cancan finale. The dancing in the film is not at all like what usually passes for cancan.Some might object to the Technicolor costumes and the bright lighting, but it gives you a clear view of some grand costumes and sets.Consider it Jean Renoir's love letter to the Paris he grew up in. Certainly the Jean Renoir film for people who don't like his serious films or who only like his Hollywood productions.

ALERT: This review contains major SPOILERS. Do not read on if you plan to see this film.Judging from the amount of votes this got (my vote was the fifth one) very few people know or care who Mimi Lesseos is. Well, back in the late 1980s, professional wrestling was pretty decent. An all-woman's federation called the Ladies Professional Wrestling Association opened. It was a great league, and Mimi Lesseos was one of the names on the roster. I always thought she was one of the best people the LPWA had in terms of ring skill and acting ability.

When I first saw this movie back in the middle of January (2005) I didn't like it. I thought it was too weird and thought that some parts that the main star, Judith Light, acted were so unlike her. (Which of course is true) And then I watched bits of it the next day when it re-aired and I felt pretty much the same. Then I watched it again two Sundays ago (March 20th, 2005) and I began to really enjoy it and this time I taped the entire thing.

A real let down , the novel is such a brilliant stomach churning journey into madness but this made for a hard watch . I found the lack of a story line or characters a real let down and I found that the main character and her story lacked the emotional intensity of the previous novel . . . and the ending was so sad . I do like the ending but it doesn’t hold together and the reader is left wondering what has been going on since the ending of book one . It is very hard to read something that is so full of such intensity and emotion .

After all the hype I had heard about the Jane Austin novel and different film versions of the book I was not really expecting much as I had not actually read the book. Having read it once was enough to convince me of the beauty of the novel itself. It is very difficult to describe a book in such a way that people can understand what the author has done in writing. In the past few years, I had heard so much from so many people that had read the book that I had not understood what all they were talking about as I was reading the book.

Why are there no good reviews ? Because this film is hysterically bad.Set in a Japanese prison camp in World War 2, the prison has been overrun and overrun. The prisoners are being held in the prison for two days, and are told that they can go out to play if they like, or they can wait until their turn to be shot. So they wait, they wait and wait, they wait until their turn. That’s the plot, I swear! And that’s where things get interesting. It is very hard to describe in words, so here’s an image.

Everything everyone has said already pretty much rings true when it comes to 'The Prey ' . Endless nature footage of the creatures is always on the tip of everyone's minds, and while there's definitely something special about this episode, it did have its flaws. First and foremost, you're never really that sure what's going on with this episode compared to what's been said in the media. The way this story unfolds is so well written that you can almost predict what's going to transpire before it does. That being said, there are some scenes that were very interesting to watch.

I love these awful 80 's summer camp movies . The best part about `` Party Camp '' is the campy music. Here are some favorite tunes:

`` I Want to Hold Your Hand'' by Sam Cooke. `` The Girl I Love`` by Dionne Warwick. `` I Want You (She's Killing Me)`` by James Carr. `` This Guy's in Love with You`` by The Spinners. `` Dancing In the Street`` by The Supremes. `` I Just Can't Wait Till Tomorrow`` by Sam and Dave. `` Just A Little Talk With You`` by Ray Charles.

Right up (or down) there with Toys and Jurassic Park 2 and The Phantom Menace.The premise sounded cool, some of the commercials looked semi-promising, but alas, the entire movie had about 30 seconds of neat shot-ness, and that was shown on the small screen's 30 second slot.If you want amateur writing, second-rate effects, ridiculous costumes, and an all-around snoozefest by all means watch it. The plot is recycled sci-fi fodder. Too bad too, because coming in I thought it would be bad but held out hope. It may be the worst movie I have ever seen, and I have seen a lot.

Well I guess I know the answer to that question . For the MONEY ! We have been so bombarded with it over the past few years we don't give a sh1t.
