We have seen it, we've seen it again, it's like it's an epidemic out here, we can't shut our eyes to it, and then we get a call from a local business saying "hey we're doing great things here in our community so why don't you do the same thing?" It's like our whole community thinks we deserve it and we just take it as it comes.

The movie was very good. I'm an avid mystery fan and I usually figure out who is going to be killed and who did the killing. While I did figure out who was going to be killed I didn't figure out who did it. I wasn't happy with the portrayal of the Gerda character but given the year the movie was supposed to take place it is possible the woman would have been that 'cloying'. Please know that while these Poirot movies are good, they just don't have the same dynamic to them as the series does because they don't have Japp, Ms.

Once again , Doctor Who delivers the goods by the bucket load . It has humour ( `` You 're just going to end up in space? ' '' is a winner), romance ( `` I don't want to spoil anything. You'll have to watch the series to see. ' '' ) and, of course, action . There was also the opportunity for the Doctor to have a little fling in the middle of the story . He is in love with Clara Oswald and, despite having no idea about time or space , has a little fun with her in '' The Impossible Astronaut ''.

The director was probably still in his early learning stages when he tried his hand at westerns. Have a look at the outfits. Everybody looks well-scrubbed, well-brushed, well-dressed and well-ironed as though ready for church. Even the horses look well-groomed and shiny. This is a WESTERN, for crying out loud! It's supposed to look dusty, nasty and sweaty. And then there's the amateurish acting of the females in this bird. The whole lot, a dozen or so, all pretty and well-endowed, were just freshly raped and widowed, but hardly a tear flows.

"Eaten Alive" goes down much easier than Ruggero Deodato's "Cannibal Holocaust," but it's also a far more sillier film. I mean, at times it can be unintentionally hilarious, but the plot is so mind-numbingly idiotic that it was impossible for me not to lose all patience by the end. Tough guy Robert Kerman (Cannibal Holocaust) teams up with Janet Agren (The Gates of Hell; here with an intolerable accent) to search the jungles of New Guinea for Agren's sister, who's been brainwashed by the leader of a religious cult (Ivan Rassimov).

Never, ever, have I been as impressed by a film as this little piece about four groups of people, that faces a crisis, or many. In some ways a little like Short Cuts, but totally different, at the same time.There are a heap of lead characters, whom we all learn to know very well as their stories unfold, and they are, as persons show their good and their bad sides, their weaknesses and their strengths, with lots of drama and laughter.The closest equivalent in a US movie, I can think of, which then is far weaker in every respect, is the Royal Tenenbaums.

"Rififi" is a terrific heist movie, and one from which subsequent heist films have drawn ever since. Jules Dassin had a feel for the seedy underworld in which these thieves live---you will not find here the Hollywood glamour of "Ocean's Eleven." The robbers in "Rififi" don't rob for the thrill, and they're not playing a game. They rob to survive, to pay for their children's upbringing, to prove to themselves and others that they still have something to offer the world. The much-lauded heist scene is a nail biter, filmed in virtual silence.

I watched the this the other night on a local station because I did n't feel like watching tripe like that. I guess you can call it bad TV. We had a long talk with my dad about going back and living there, so we will know in a month or so if we should go back. My brother and his wife, who I haven't seen in seven years, also live there. It's an amazing place to live and it's a beautiful area. It's just hard to leave.

Movies aren't always suppose to be about deep, provolking thoughts. Sometimes they're simply meant to be escapes from reality. Out To Sea fits the bill perfectly. A light hearted "golden years" romantic comedy, Out To Sea may not be big budget, you might be able to easily tell when they were acting in front of a green screen, but it's still very much a movie worth watching. A sweet movie that needs to be given a break. This is just good, light hearted fun. It's not meant to be a deep movie.

I found this movie to be preachy and unrealistic . It tries to be a movie showing kids fighting against evil, but I don't think that that was the case . Instead of trying to show a real life scenario of a kid who was bullied in class , they used a bunch of bullies from their school who are making fun of him . I believe that there is real life bullying out there, but I think this movie was showing that a kid is trying to deal with it in a way that no one else wants to .

I went into this movie with an open mind. I had been too lazy to go to the video store to pick out a movie, and my friend returned with this. I promised him I wouldn't laugh at his choice, but within the first five minutes I told him I would have to take back my promise. We kept watching, just hoping it would get better, but no; a continual mind-rape followed.This "movie" was probably one of the worse ever committed to film, and surely deserves a place on the IMDb Bottom 100.

Roger Corman has enjoyed his shares of cinematic infamy in his illustrious low-budget career, spanning over 300 movies. While few (if any) would call him great, his films' obscure connections to underground culture (via reference, tribute, or influence) have ensured him a warped legacy of sorts. Throughout his career, he has also developed a bad habit of remaking his own films ("Piranha", "Humanoids from the Deep", "The Black Scorpion", etc. ), without improving on them in the slightest.

This is a romantic, albeit cheesy movie that is one of my all time favorites. It is one of the many CLASSICS of the 80's genre like "Pretty in Pink" or "Some kind of Wonderful".Nic plays the traditional punk guy in love with the traditional valley, preppy girl Julie. It is a heartwarming love story that makes you root for him to win the girl in the end.True, most of the acting sucks but ...I have been in love with Nic since seeing this in the theaters and have seen nearly every movie he's been in since.

There is really no way to compare this motion picture to any other movie because no one has ever made anything like it and no one ever will. And it really should be seen in a theater to be fully appreciated. At the very least it deserves to be seen with a great sound system.I saw this movie on the day it opened in 1968, my senior year in high school. I went because I like science-fiction and wanted to see a "space" movie. Remember this film was made before the first moon landing.There we sat, waiting for it to begin.

To think this film was made the year I was born. To think people are still having their constitutional rights taken away, now in the name of "homeland security". To think this movie was intentionally banned from the American public. PUNISHMENT PARK addresses the political divide in the United States better than any movie I've ever seen. Had it been more widely seen, would it have changed anything? A movie like this is so polarizing, it has the potential to cause riots. It shakes you up and forces you to take sides.

This movie is not worth anything . I mean , if you want to watch this kind of stuff , go and rent . If you want something better, go and watch it . It's like watching a movie where a kid plays with a toy for a day or two , but it's so boring that the kid thinks it's fun . It's a shame , because it's really pretty . I don't know if I want to put this on DVD . I think I would be disappointed by this . It's like a video game .

"Black Vengeance" is an alternate title for "Ying hung ho hon" AKA "Tragic Hero" (1987). I have just seen this on VHS, together with the first part of the story, "Gong woo ching" ("Rich and Famous"), also 1987. (The poster and 2 stills featured on the page are for a 4-DVD set of movies starring Rod Perry (The Black Gestapo), Fred Williamson (Black Cobra 2), Richard Lawson (Black Fist). The fourth movie is called "The Black Six").

Let me get this out of the way before I trash this film : I love Park Chan-Wook 's work. He made a lot of good, solid movies. Even if I don't think I've loved his last two as much as many people did, I will at least say I appreciate his past work more than most. His movies tend to be dark and intense with very few bright, sunny moments. That's not even the best part of his work, but I'll get to that in a moment. I think most people have an idea of how Park Chan-Wook sees the world in his films.

Jess Franco makes exploitation films, and he has made tons of them. Franco is responsible for some of the most shocking films in cinema history, and god bless him for it. Unfortunately, The Diamonds of Kilominjaro is a truly awful movie that is not up to his usual standards.Exploitation films should be judged on story, sex, and gore. What else is there? This film fails on most of those benchmarks. The plot is paper thin, placing a nubile young girl in the jungle among cannibals. We really don't get information on why she and her father were there in the first place.

This story had a good plot to it about four elderly men that share a deadly secret concerning a young woman that they met 50 years ago. After all this time, the young woman returns to seek revenge on the men. This story occasionally made me nod off during the movie in the middle of tiring elevator music and the ever so consistent thunder storms. But it is well worth the wait in the end when we find out just who the mystery woman is that keeps plaguing the old men in their dreams and interfering in a young man's life.

I think that would have been a more appropriate title for this film, since it is padded to hell and back with stock footage of various bugs and animals. I recently found The Prey in its original VHS 'big box' form and was very excited. I just LOVE finding old slasher films on VHS because the cover artwork is fantastic. Usually though, it turns out that the film itself is less than fantastic. The Prey is one of those films.To be fair, it started off OK, with the killer stalking the cliché teenagers in the woods.

this is film is probably one of the best i've seen so far. i would put it only second to All About Lily Chou-chou because it kind of gives me the same vibes....'9 souls' is about 9 prisoners who have just escaped prison to go and find some counterfeit money stored in a time capsule at Mount Fuji Primary School. they later find out that there wasn't much there and set off on their own ways. the first half of the movie is just a time for the characters to be introduced and for the main points to be stated.

I found West Point to be an agreeable film , although I doubt that I would watch it again . It's a lot of fun, but the film is long (over two hours) and it tries to be too many things. In the end the plot is not the most interesting part of the film. The action is the only interesting part. There are some good actors , and they deserve a better role in movies. And, for the sake of all those people who love to hate the army , it is a bit hard to hate the army , as it is not that bad .

Five guys who were in the cub scouts together reunite years later to go camping. Were they run into their childhood nemeses as well as escaped convicts in this supreme unfunny supposed comedy. Most of the cast are content to simply phone it in, and don't really seem to care about the film in the least. The writers were so lazy that the names of the characters are, for the most part, the name of the actors that respectively play them. Richard Lewis's shtick gets really old REALLY quick. Even the late great character actor, Brion James can't save this stinker.

Some sort of accolades must be given to `Hellraiser: Bloodline'. It's actually out Full-Mooned Full Moon. It bears all the marks of, say, your `Demonic Toys' or `Puppet Master' series, without their dopey, uh, charm? Full Moon can get away with silly product because they know it's silly. These Hellraiser things, man, do they ever take themselves seriously. This increasingly stupid franchise (though not nearly as stupid as I am for having watched it) once made up for its low budgets by being stylish.

this is only the second time i have been moved enough to write a review. unfortunately, both times they have been for movies that can be described with several 4 lettered words that can be defined as faeces or excrement. the other movie of such calibre was masked and anonymous.anywa, onto the review.. there are several key things wrong with this movie which i will describe below.1) steven has lost the plot (i.e. in all his other movies, family / friend gets killed. steven gets angry. steven kills people.

Yet again , director J. Lee Thompson unites with actor Charles Bronson for a violent and uncompromising action flick . This time, however, it's a more personal, psychological thriller with an underlying theme of guilt. In this case, guilt over an affair with a younger woman. The opening scene in which Bronson takes the blame for an unsolved double murder sets up the film to build to the climatic confrontation at the end of the film that leaves the audience guessing who is responsible for both murders (or is it one or the other?).

The Quick and the Undead is, finally, the first movie to actually render its own storyline null and void. It is, essentially, one gigantic plot hole.Aside from that, the acting was quite bad, character motivations nonexistent or unbelievable and there wasn't a single character worth hanging our hat on. The most interesting cast member (who had great potential to be a dark horse protagonist) got snuffed halfway through the proceedings.What the Quick and the Undead DOES serve as is an excellent example of how to do good color-timing.

1) Bad acting.2) For a bunch of castaways on an alien planet, it sure looked like home, especially with the houses and roads you can glimpse in the background.3) Terrible plot with stupid caracters making idiotic decisions and blithely losing precious survival equipment and clothing left, right and center.4) Cool 70's scifi jumpsuits (possibly the only good thing about this movie)5) Interesting ship at the beginning (this crew must have been watching Space 1999 a lot). Too bad it blows up so early. The escape ship also got sunk too fast.

I remember watching Police Squad! when it first came on ABC in 1982 and I thought it was a very funny show, thanks to the many sight gags, non sequitors and scripts filled with word play. In one episode, there was a line where a man named Once was shot twice. But unfortunately, ABC canceled the show after only six episodes. I felt it deserved a much longer run but a network executive thought the show demanded too much attention of the viewer because of all the sight gags in each episode.

While the prominent and over use of the play-like format is in total operation throughout the film , it is not until the third act that the film finally gets going in terms of the action. The third act may be the most boring of the film , it is however the most enjoyable. The plot of the third act is a bit of a puzzle , it doesn’t quite have a linear narrative but is rather a string of events and events and events that lead up to a very simple conclusion at the end .

"Strangers on a Train" was one of those film classics I had always heard about but somehow never gotten around to actually seeing. I finally watched it a few weeks ago and, as always with any Hitchcock movie, it not only stood up to the test of time, it far surpassed most thrillers being made today. You can see the inspiration for future action movies here - the climactic ending with the out-of-control merry-go-round and the two villains dueling each other reminded me of the big action sequence at the end of Jan de Bont's "Speed."

"Witchery" is a decent little Euro-Trash horror yarn! David Hasselhoff is pretty damn funny in this one and sadly, he's one of the better actors. Linda Blair is downright terrible and the lady who plays Hoff's wife...she is hilariously bad! The plot of this film is ridiculous too. It's got some holes, which you can't help but notice, but it remains entertaining throughout.The gore in "Witchery" is freaking outstanding. I loved the part where the old bag gets "sucked" into the trash chute and ends up in the chimney to roast!

I walked into Blockbuster , itchin ' to watch some good old fashion action movies . So i browsed around for a while and when i came across this one movie i decided to give it a try . And boy am i glad i did , Blockbuster has brought the best movies back to life . Blockbuster brings you all the classics that you may have completely forgotten . The movie is called Blockbuster . The movie starts with a young man who has the ability to make things move on his own . The young man lives with his mother and younger brother .

I had to write a review for this movie based on the ones that are saying gory, non stop action, great movie..These people were obviously watching a different movie. Killpoint honestly sucked from the word go!! I kept waiting and waiting for this film to get better and it was to no avail. Some said this movie was brutal and others said gory but I can't find either of those adjectives actually showing up in this, I mean hell there are so many scenes with people getting shot and there being no blood at all it's not even funny!!

This is possibility the worst and most disappointing film I have ever seen. I've spent four years at two universities and know that there must be a good film to be made about the experience. This isn't it. The "acting" is god awful and the plot non-existent.Here are a few incidents from my one year in halls of residence.1) A posh lad that unknowingly got off with a transvestite. 2) The best friend pairing of two girls - one with huge breasts and the other with the nickname "the brick". 3) A couple that shag too loudly.

Dolelemite ( 1975 ) is a cult classic . Starring Rudy Ray Moore as the pimp superhero out to wrongfully arrest an innocent man, it was originally released by Marvel Comics in 1974. Dolemite is the best selling black comic book character ever. The character was created by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby in the 1970s. Dolemite was one of many black characters created by Jack Kirby in the early 1980s; like many of the black characters in Marvel Comics, he was a character who did not become popular until later in the 1980s. In this article I will discuss the origins of this character and his development in comics.

Oh dear ! The BBC is not about to be knocked off its pedestal for absorbing period dramas by this one, so perhaps they're right and this one won't last for long. You see, this is what happens when you try to compete with the big boys of British television, the BBC. After all, this isn't television, it's a soap opera. (Which, as far as I know, is something you're not legally allowed to do). I'm sure they'll be back with a new soap this summer, and it will be a very good soap opera.

This is just one of those films which can not justify much of anything that happens . These people are a lot of people in the film . They make the story interesting but the plot and the acting is not very interesting . I am still not clear as to why this is made . The story in a way is interesting , but the people are so selfish and stupid . They do not really want to see what is happening in the film . It was a good effort at first . Now the film is a disappointment . It is not even worth watching .

Rita Hayworth as Rusty Parker is the COVER GIRL du jour--she's one of the dancing girls in Danny McGuire's club, the most special one according to Danny (Gene Kelly) and pretty much anyone who comes across her. Take for example, Vanity magazine magnate John Coudair (Otto Kruger): enchanted by Rusty's resemblance to her grandmother Maribelle (also played by Hayworth in flashbacks), whom he wooed devotedly when he fell in love with her, he tries to relive his youth by fixing what he thinks went wrong between himself and Maribelle.

Charlie Chaplin responds to open auditions at Lodestone Studios. Rival Ben Turpin arrives at the same studio, obviously another unemployed comedian! Turpin tries to horn in on Chaplin's action after the studio head hollers, "Next!" Chaplin manages to walk in over Turpin, however. Charlie amusingly manages to botch jobs as an actor and carpenter. In the end, he manages to get a big break, but will a star be born? There are a lot of jokes involving the buttocks. The initial scene involving slapstick from Chaplin and Turpin is a relative highlight.

This movie was *good* relatively during the first parts of it.We have a story, from 3 points of view. So let's find some clues and complete the story.Oh wait...none of that stuff matters because the FBI guys are the bad guys! Though that was a great twist...it was almost a terrible twist. I immediately downgraded the film from a 7 maybe 8 to 3 based on the last 10-15 minutes of it.Does anyone else not see why the twist is so bad? Yes, it's a good shock.

Review: Nunsploitation films. They've been around since forever. A few that pop to mind are the Mexican devil worshiping movie Alucarda, Night of the Demons 2, The Convent and of course Dante Tomasellis Desecration. Cant blame somebody for trying to exploit a religious/holy image and twisting it around to make it scary. If done right, it works. Here comes the most recent addition to the nunsploitation sub-genre simply titled The Nun.The story is about this group of girls that live in a Catholic school. In this school there's a Nun who is particularly cruel to one of the girls.

Everything you do in this world should make at least a little bit of sense . Unfortunately very little of it does, which is a pity because if you did, you’d have a much better time and a lot more money. ~Candyfloss (attributed)

I want to be an entrepreneur. I’ve read, and reread, countless books on the subject, all with varying degrees of success, and yet I have not been able to do it, which is why I’m asking: Why don’t I just go ahead and take the risk and start my own thing?

We have a character named Evie. Evie just wants to be a good person. She's nice, friendly, smiles often, but is strangely brutally honest. Evie also has a secret. Her idiot-savant sister has been reciting original poetry, which is getting the community excited about the sister writing. Unfortunately, it's Evie's poetry. While their mother starts being happy again and the boy next door shows his interest in Evie, Evie just tries to figure out what she really wants to do.What to keep in mind while watching this movie is who Evie really is.

This is one awful movie ! ! Some people told me that it was not that bad actually but I didn't give that movie any chance to get better than that. It doesn't matter how bad a movie gets, people are always going to come up with excuses to say that this is the worst movie. The worst movie I saw this year was The Last Stand and while that was not even as bad as this movie, the movie made me feel so sad about what the war was doing to people. This movie is so bad and yet so popular !

I've seen all 3 now. I just can't believe how bad Naqoyqatsi is. Not in comparison to the others, but simply on it's own merit, or lack of. I can't understand how the average rating for this movie is over 6 out of 10. I gave the first 2 movies 8 out of 10. They were thought provoking and beautifully done. I gave this movie a rating of 1. If a 0 or negative number was available, I would have given it that rating instead. What a total waste of time it was watching this movie.

A fairly interesting look at some characters from India 's burgeoning middle class . Although India is rapidly modernizing , India is still a society that has many of the elements of " the dark ages ". And one of the main problems with this, is the lack of a sense of class consciousness on the part of some members of India 's middle class. To be clear , the middle class, in India has nothing to do with being poor , or with being a poor middle class. To the contrary, India has become extremely wealthy and middle class over the past 40 years.

I found the Movie very interesting. I really enjoyed the film the actors were great. It was entertainment. Benny the uncle was wonderful He was real at his character. The ending took a wonderful twist. I would recommend you seeing it. Eddie Mores girlfriend reminded me a little of sandra bullock she was sharp as a nail. I also like the little girls acting in the movie she was very convincing. Benny reminded me of a friend of mine who really lives his life growing up in Brooklyn. I loved the scene where he tasted the sauce in the pot because thats how most people cook lol.

In the European TV industry , movies like this one are called `` stickers '' . TV stations buy them from the studios, the studios buy them from the distributors , and the distributors sell them to their subscribers. This is a good analogy. When the studios want to buy TV spots, they don't go directly to a TV station; instead they buy the packages of spots that are sent to them by their advertising agencies, which usually consist of six, eight, and sometimes twelve different TV stations. In the U.S.A. , a similar phenomenon exists.

A lumberman finds a young cougar in need of help . To young to be on his own the cat needs to start working for him. The first step is to teach him to hunt, a cat must learn to hunt from the prey he's chasing. The cougar is taught to hunt but he has a different idea of what a hunting experience should be. A cougar has to find an animal that will give him something to eat, after all a cougar is a wild animal. The cougar is not only a naturalist, he can make tools out of wood and hunt with a bow.

This movie is a mystery . It 's not scary , it 's spooky . You 'll probably jump at the ending , which is that the guy in the black cloak is going to take over the world . you may find it a little scary or a little boring . you may not like the ending or the way it was shot . but you should see it . you should definitely see it . this is the greatest film i 've seen in years . it has been nominated for an oscar , and has won a bunch , and won 't win a damn thing .

if u haven't seen Vijay in "Ghillli", "Gilly" or "Ghillie". go watch it. wow. its devastatingly hilarious. i don't know if Dharani (the brilliant director) was being serious or not. There are tons of hot guys in this one, look out for someone who calls Velu "Maacha". The one with the brilliant braids, devastatingly hot. His teeth are brilliant as well. Vijay rocks. Trisha cries every 5 seconds. It is very deep. Watch it, you won't regret it.

This is a story about a journey made by a man who once had a dream and guts . Donald J. Trump. But he is not who we thought, is not who we hoped, and is not who we voted for. But he did what he said and he did what the people told him he was supposed to do and he is here to stay. This is a story about how one man can have a dream and a vision, can have courage and will power to overcome many problems and many obstacles, and he does overcome all obstacles, and then he does achieve the dreams he had.

This is primarily about love in WWII , yet we must remember that it 's also a biopic for Dylan Thomas , and is also the true story of one of the most amazing women in my life , who has a lot to do with so many other women who helped me get to where I am in life. On a trip to Japan for a couple of weeks , one night a few of us had the idea to go out in a small bar on the way home from dinner to order some drinks. The waitress was cute , and we were all in a nice mood.

Jon Cryer reprises his role as a neurotic guy in Two and a Half Men , which he perfected in his first series appearance in 2002. His role on the show is now the butt of a lot of jokes, and he doesn’t always enjoy the attention or the adulation. Here’s how he reacts to being called the “best actor on The Big Bang Theory.” (Or how he reacts when he sees his name in lights at the Golden Globes or on the front page of Variety.) What are your career highlights?

I've seen worse films. This is bad but at least doesn't try to be good so it deserves a brief round of applause. It rest firmly in the realms of the low-budget B-movie sci-fi genre.It is a rubbish film but in a nice way and is certainly worth buying if it's in the bargain bin at your local supermarket. Awfully charming rather than just plain awful.The highlight for me is when Galaxina's lover goes to rescue her. Upon turning up she exclaims "Bunnyfluff!" which draws sniggers from his co-pilot.Sit back, get drunk, enjoy!

I loved the first movie , the second one was okay , disappointed John Cleese was n't jean bob anymore in the 3rd one which was ok . And I thought it was too slow at first , but it picked up later

Yes, its slow. The only thing that is slow in the movie is the first 15 minutes. Other than that its a very fast movie. Click to expand...

That was an exception, I've been noticing that it's actually getting faster in some of the parts that were slow in the earlier movies.

Have seen this movie today . Very disappointed and wondered how it could be in the Oscar shortlist . The story and performances of the cast do not stand out as Oscar material. There is something lacking here and the film does not seem to fit in to any of the major genres and categories . But it is a fun film . It is not a bad film , but not Oscar material at all . I was looking forward for the Oscar . It is a film , which is not Oscar material . I really did not like the film , though .

Dolemite may not have been the first black exploitation flick to come along but it certainly is one of the first to be widely recognized by the white world. By the time of the release of Dolemite, it was already the standard-bearer for what was to become known as the third phase of the black exploitation film. A genre that had begun to emerge as black artists were given more freedom to play and express themselves, even as their white audiences remained largely silent and uninvolved in the process. Black cinema in the wake of Dolemite could no longer be confined to the ghetto.

... but you probably have seen it or else you wouldn't be here. It's so obscure that you probably stumbled onto it like I did because this little known gem receives no word-of-mouth.From the very beginning you know how the storyline will shake out but watching as our innocent redheaded nurse puts the pieces of the puzzle together is high quality entertainment. Most horror films bombard viewers with graphic displays of torture but Don't Look in the Basement plays it subtle, which makes for superior suspense. Note to horror filmmakers: some of us do like subtlety!

For anyone who has ever sought happiness, "Half Empty" is a must-see. This original cross- cultural musical comedy has hilarious numbers, which make "The Producers" seem boringly staid. Writer Bob Patterson puts his soul into sharing his thoughts on life, wisdom and happiness, even scribbling inspirational comments on index cards as his girlfriend spills her heart out, ending their relationship. When his book on happiness, "North Star" finds zero success in the States, his publishers send him to Germany for a book signing tour.

I suppose I'm supposed to take something like this with a grain of salt. These laboratory movies (and, yes, they spend a lot of time in the laboratory), always fail in one dimension: there is an understanding that single people fooling around have uncovered secrets beyond the comprehension of anyone to this time. Of course, they pay a price because their experimenting has the same shortcomings that Dr. Frankenstein's did. There is always something they didn't anticipate. There are so many things from pure science to fashion for young ladies to outrageous cover ups that don't work here.

This movie really is that bad , and I 'm normally a sucker for bad movies , but this was just awful . you know that I was really rooting for this to be true , but as it was , this was one of those movies that will have a few people that have no idea what happened , but those are few and far between . the film is based on a story by a very well known author of vampire novels and has some interesting twists and turns , which is really what made this film so interesting .

This movie should have come with a disclaimer that it was akin to the Left Behind series. I did not know it would be a Bible-thumping movie. I expected it to truly be a movie about UFOs and alien abduction for entertainment's sake. As previous reviewer comments, it would be fine to show at a church, but not at a public theater, at least not without the consumer's prior knowledge of what the premise of the movie is about. I felt deceived out of my $$ spent for this movie, as nothing in the summary refers to its religious overtones.

i was one `` chosen '' to see this movie in a sneak preview.first you should know that this film was released as a single film, meaning that you get a cut of any money that the movie grosses and the distributor splits with you, so that you only have the movie for a month. the good thing about this film is that it is extremely short, because the studio is afraid that people will rush to the theater and it will be a big bomb, so that they can try and recoup some of the lost money.

Movies are n't always suppose to be about deep , provolking thoughts . Sometimes they 're simply meant to be a form of catharsis. Movies are often about the escapades of two people in their late teens. Often their lives are not stable , meaning that they have very little in common . They have one thing in common: their teenage years are a time when they try to find themselves. Most often they fail, because they don't know who they are. But even when they do, there is always hope because they have each other.

this movie gets a 10 because there is a lot of gore in it.who cares about the plot or the actors.i care because it’s gore.i know who i want to see get their head chopped off in this movie.and that is why i want a 10!i’m sorry i want gore but not that much.sorry to break this news but i don’t care.and you can go and find out more on gore.i’m sure you will be happy with it. The movie starts out pretty slow, and is actually quite boring.

This is probably one of the worst movies I have ever seen! The plot revolves around a man named Luther who wears metal dentures, bites people on the neck, and walks around clucking like a chicken without the flapping of the arms. He also thinks he's a chicken.Sounds bizarre right? Well, to me, the more bizarre and weird the person is, the better. The more gore, the better and so on.The movie starts out with the board deciding if they want to release this maniac from their institution. They mention that he has created some dentures in prison that he used to bite people on the neck.

Probably not the same version as most of the other reviewers because there`s no real hard core sex . What do people mean by hard core sex ? The sort of explicit hard core sex seen in films starring Traci Lords and " Big " John Holmes ? Well anyway this is really poor film , I doubt if I`ve ever seen so many big name actors wasted in a film . The script is really poor and plotless , the directing and cinematography is awful and the editing is non existant . It truly is an absolutely awful film.

The box to this movie totally misrepresents itself. The cover shows a view of legs & panties in a short skirt. The title is `Tart.' The synopsis on the back of the box made it seem as though Cat, the main character, was an outcast who became one of the popular students, but that popularity lead to a bizarre lifestyle that she could not escape from. Everything that the box built this movie up to was a horrible lie. I expected a sort of crappy, direct-to-video version of `Heathers' targeted at the teenagers of today.Let me tell you what `Tart' was really about.

I was rather disappointed . The first Tetsuo made me an INSTANT Tsukamoto fan , from the first 5 mins to the last 5 minutes , I love this movie. It is just a wonderful movie , a beautiful story which I would like to see . And I was surprised to see how much this film had to say . The ending , was just so good . And I also loved the sound . I think that is what made the film so great to watch . And all the actors . They all gave very good performances , especially Yuko. She was amazing .

I realize the line on my summary is not too polite.This film written & directed by Scott Caan & starring Steve Carrell as a young man who has had his life completely turned upside down by a very powerful woman and she is not letting it go until he does everything she wants to see in the next few years. He goes to college in the fall and falls in love with the professor’s beautiful teenage daughter. I saw this film in the cinema when it came out. I remember not being too impressed by the story itself.

John Knowles modern masterpiece , A Separate Peace , are one of many subtle , and subtly is the watchwords in the film. It is no wonder why they made such a long film . They have done a great job with their story telling , and have given a depth to the characters. The film is set in the late 1920s , and has a strong moral message about how power corrupts and destroys. It contains a lot of drama and suspense , but I did not feel it was intense enough. The ending was not that bad , and it does not seem as if they rushed the story to an end .

I'm not a big fan of musicals, but I was always enamored of Ms. Hayworth's looks, so I thought I'd give it a try.This may be the best showcase for the multi-talented Ms. Hayworth. She's never looked lovelier in a film (with the possible exception of 'Gilda', where she is sex symbol par excellence).Rita is more than ably assisted by Gene Kelly and Phil Silvers. The comedy may be dated, but it is still quite amusing. Kelly does one of his tour-de-force dances, dancing with the image of himself from a window.But Rita drives this whole movie.

Lame . Lame . Lame . Ultralame . Shall I go on ? There is one , I repeat *one* person who could do anything with a little time on their hands, and that person is Mika . It's so easy for her to be involved in a drama like this, so easy that sometimes I wonder if she's aware of the fact that this is really happening to her. She seems to be unaware of any of it, and even though she knows that she is being used to play the game with her friends, she doesn't seem to want to play any games at all.

You know sometimes you just gotta have it? That's how this movie is with me. I am almost embarrassed to admit that I like it, it is so goofy in some parts, but I find myself reaching for it when I'm down and just need a good laugh...and trust me, I am just not a "goofy movie" kinda guy.You can read the synopsis so I don't have to bore you with that, just rest assured, if you like Kelsey Grammer you will probably like this movie.One more thing, be SURE to watch the end credits.

To keep it as simple as possible . This is a very good show . That is well written , and the actors are awesome . This show does not try to make a "deep" issue with its subject matter . The story is told from the characters' point of view . It's about a group of people . They are very different in all aspects . This allows the storyline to flow through the characters . Every single character has a different side to them . There are characters who do the right thing . Some are good , others are evil .

This movie looked like it was rushed to release for some reason. Definitely not a well made movie. So unbelievable. The scenes where the President (Holbrook) were downtown and walking among the people were a farce. There would not be a chance for the common folk to be within 30 yards of the President in that situation in real life. If it wasn't for the blood and profanity, this was shot like a TV movie. It could have been decent if it was done differently. Holbrook's (President) talents were never realized in this movie.

It's another variation on the oft-told tale of two people getting married and having to share their brood of kids. WITH SIX YOU GET EGG ROLL is directed by Howard Morris (from television) and it shows, because it's the kind of tale that plays like a half-hour situation comedy padded out to feature film length--but with a scarcity of laughs, or to put it differently, only the number of laughs that would have been possible within the half-hour limits of a TV show.DORIS DAY decided to call it quits after this film--and it's rather easy to see why.

Finally ! Other people who have actually seen this show ! It is the funniest anime I have ever seen ! I have seen it over a 100 times and still get goosebumps ! I think it is the funniest thing that has ever been done ! And it is very very good ! I love the music and everything ! The show is so good ! I love the songs ! There is a whole lot of funny stuff ! I think it is great that it is still running so long after it was first aired ! It makes it even more special ! And the characters are all great !

I 'm surprised to read all the positive comments on this movie . Even my 4 and 6 year old boys love the movie . The movie starts with a lot of heart and romance . I just can't find a negative side . I was a bit worried about it but after seeing it I'm happy I saw it. I loved the music . It was good . It's a great movie for both kids and adults. This was a great movie from start to finish!! I've had it on VHS since the 80s and was so excited to see it in theaters again.

This movie was a sicky sweet cutesy romantic comedy, just the kind of movie I usually dislike but this one was just cute enough to keep me interested. It was really funny in one moment (probably why I liked it) and then just as serious in the next. Plus, it had Ellen in it and I've always had a soft spot for her.Basically, the owner of a book store, Helen (Kate Capshaw) finds a love letter in one of the old couches in her store. She thinks it is for her and goes crazy trying to figure out who sent it.

This really is a cringe making exercise. Dressed up as a tribute to fire fighters it contain stupid scenes of "we're just a bunch of wacky guys" in the midst of the "my goodness this can be really dangerous" parts. Mostly it is just plain dumb. You couldn't believe for a single minute that real fire fighters act like this. It is so awful I couldn't bear to watch at times. If my daughter hadn't rented it and then insisted on seeing it through to the end I would have had no option but to turn it off.Thing is I'm a John Travolta fan.

When I bought 4 DVDs for £5.oo in a local shop it should have been warning enough that this movie has no real plot. I watched it on a Friday night. There was nothing else to do so I went out and had a good time with my mates. A couple of hours later and I had half an hour of sleep at home. I watched the DVD on Saturday morning and found the plot, characters and acting superb. This was a movie I didn’t expect to enjoy too much, although it was very entertaining.

well , what can i say . WHAT THE F * * K ? There really is n't much to say . This review has been very hard to write . I mean it , there is nothing to say about the film that i haven't already written about in detail in other places . This is a very well made and well made to watch film and it is also a well made movie . As you can imagine , there are some people out there who say the film should have been cut by half . I do not see this at all .

My grandad gave me this DVD . With friends like these . The front cover looked quite scary thought i had no idea how good they actually were! I got in my room and watched it . The first one I watched got me interested in watching this one too . They were both amazing . The movie wasn't bad either . There are not many horror movies out there that are like the one I have read about, or even seen in a theater . There is something that is just so special about it, but I will start off with what my mom always says .

This movie had very few moments of real drama. After the opening minutes the film descended in a spiral that didn't quite take us to hell and back - viewing was pure purgatory to say the least. The acting was more horrendous than the subject matter of the film and at times I couldn't stop laughing. The continuity between some of the scenes was dire - characters disappeared from scenes without explanation only to be replaced by other characters who minutes earlier had been some where else. Surely this was a spoof of The Exorcist.

Very odd , this seems like a very average movie to me , if not slightly less . It is still not bad , but it is not really that good . It seems to come and go , it does not hold up in many parts , but is still a very good film . It is not a complete mess , there is no way it should have been this bad . I don’t want to give it too much more praise , but this is still one of my favorite horror films of all time .

This movie has some good performances , as others have pointed out , but suffers ( as others have pointed out ) because of one thing:

The plot is too simple. The movie should be set in the early 60s and center on a group of men and women who are all in their late teens, early teens, early 20’s or early 30’s. But this movie is set just in time for them to be teenagers, and we get to hear about it, but we are only allowed to see and hear about a few things about their lives.

A rather mild horror movie ; if not for a couple of sex scenes , it could easily have been made for family viewing ; there's a very good plot , too, and a lot of sex ; it could have been written for the stage . and it would have been a winner if it had been . . . or not . . . the horror of the movie is all the more frightening because of the quality of the sex . when the sex scenes were shot , director john leonhardt and his camera man , steve jonas , decided to get the real thing .

Ten years before `` The Matrix '' and hot on the heals of `` They Live '' came this brilliant sci fi novel that was so well ahead of its time and has spawned a movie adaptation that's currently playing in cinemas in the United States and elsewhere. The Matrix, or The Matrix Reloaded as it's more commonly known, was published in 1993 and is the first book in James Sallis' Matrix trilogy. The book was written after Sallis had completed the screenplay for The Matrix, which was based on the original script by William Gibson and Larry Frain and starred Laurence Fishburne.

This movie is on cable sporadically, and I never really watched it, thinking it would be similar to the Bruce Willis film "Ïn America", with the usual trite story about American freedom, etc. But it was not; it was so much more!.Of course, Martin Sheen is excellent; (I have never seen him in a movie I haven't loved, even if the script is bad, because he is so talented). Kathy Bates is the overbearing mom, and does a great job.

Dear reader , Watch out ! This movie is not really a movie , though its creators have the impertinence to try to make it look like a good movie. The movie will only entertain you to a certain degree , so you should watch it with a sense of humour, and remember it is a drama, not a film ! There are only two people who know the truth. One who knows the truth has already lost her life, and the other does not know what she is doing, she has no idea about life as we know it.

I consider myself a big fan of low budget horror movies . The more bizarre and imaginative the film , the more fun I have in watching it. However, I would not want to watch a horror movie that I know will be too bizarre for my family to enjoy as well . So in an effort to keep my horror movie recommendations a bit more normal and entertaining , I will bring you a collection of horror movie suggestions that fit within the general horror movie category. If you like these horror movie suggestions , I would like to hear from you !

cool flick . enjoyable to watch . hope to see more from Fred Carpenter soon . i really like the music and the acting . a good story line with a good villain and a fun plot overall . i recommend it ! The story was fun to follow, I liked it and was waiting for the next one to be released. The ending was great! It was a great way to finish out the series. If you are a fan of horror and gore films, this is a great series. The ending was amazing and I couldnt stop laughing. This is a must have!

in his descriptions of CAA, platinum card lunches in Hollywood, psychoanalysis, a vacation in Provincetown he never took, and free trips to Nicaragua, financed by Columbia pictures.It sounds narcissistic, but Spalding Gray (possibly because of his unusual personality) ropes the audience in, laughs at himself (perhaps because he did not take the Hollywood thing oh-so-seriously) and gets us to care.This monologue is not just about "The Killing Fields", or "Swimming to Cambodia"; it is more a pastiche of events, as he sees them.

This is the last film of Krzysztof Kieslowski - one of the greatest directors in the history of cinema. He intended to retire after this film, so in a way it is his artistic testament. He died a couple of years after making the film, and though it is said that he intended to return to directing, Destiny decided that this was indeed his last. And what a film! 'Rouge' the last film in the three colors French trilogy is actually a very Swiss film. Set in Geneva, one of the two main characters is a Swiss retired judge, and Durenmatt immediately comes to mind.

In 1968, Stanley Kubrick made this historic film masterpiece base on a book written by Arthur C. Clark. It was such an early effort to make a science fiction movie combined with scientific facts. His style of movie making is still fresh and intact.I have seen this movie more that half a dozen times and I even have a VHS copy of the movie in my library. CS3 class made me to see the movie again with another perspective: Who is HAL and what is he thinking?I enjoyed watching the movie again and tried to focus of HAL's dialogues throughout the second episode of the movie.

I do n't care what anyone else says , this movie is the worst piece of trash committed on film by any filmmaker in the last ten years. it is awful . i have no doubt this was the last film to ever make it to the screen before the digital revolution took it away. it is a movie so horrible in every aspect , i don't know if there has ever been a movie made with so much contempt for the audience and how people will react to it , you could tell it was the final nail in the coffin.

Nothing really unpredictable in this movie , but a solid flick in all respects . Everything from acting to cinematography is of an extremely high caliber . The actors are great to watch , they have chemistry , and most of all , the acting is not over done . The movie has many of the usual ingredients such as humor, action and romance but it also has a lot of heart. The movie focuses mainly on the relationship between two teenage lovers who have had a falling out. It also focuses a fair bit of the drama which is brought forth between them by their mother.

It was only a matter of time that a spoof would be made of sports movies ! And there are a lot to choose from ! Let’s take a trip back to the 1980s, which were a very different time for sports movies in general and for the hockey genre in particular. We’d all heard about the “80s”, and we all knew that they had been quite a few great films in that decade: The Breakfast Club, The Natural, Star Wars, Rocky, and so on… And then there were some less-known gems too.

What a dreadful movie. The effects were poor, especially by todays standards, but that was forgivable. What was unforgivable was the terrible rehashing of every flood/dam breaks disaster movie ever made into this piece of trash. The acting was awful and I mean AWFUL. The point in the story where Michelle Green stops to rescue a dog from the approaching torrent was hilarious. They see the water approaching and run for their lives. (By the way they had to find a very old fat dog so as to not make Ms Green look to unfit).

When you see Barry Corbin in the cast of a movie , you can never be sure if it will be the movie he’s in. He is so versatile in that way – he’s in so many films and he seems to have a lot of work to do. And yet, when he does get the chance to be in a film , he makes it a joy to watch. He plays so many different characters and there is always a story behind the character, and you get the feeling that he wants you to see him in whatever he is playing.

Man, what an awful film. As with many terrible films, the structure of its awfulness lies in the script. This is such a pathetic attempt at a psychological thriller that it gives the entire genre a bad name. Okay, here's one major problem: Sandra Bullock's character is abducted by Jeff Bridges in his car at a busy convenience store in broad daylight. Somehow, her boyfriend Kiefer Sutherland doesn't find a single witness to this act and subsequently spends most of the movie completely clueless as to her whereabouts. Come on!

I had expected a fairly straightforward R-rated graphic, sexual, crude teen-comedy when I sat down to see this... it turned out to be fairly accurate... only it was far more sick and disgusting than I would have thought. I don't know if the director/writer Gregory Poirier is sick or deeply messed up sexually, but I doubt that a normal person could have made a movie like this. I could probably have taken it if it was just that, if the only thing that was wrong was it was that it required a tough stomach... but it isn't.

8/2008 . When I originally wrote my comments , shortly after first seeing this film , I took a critical approach. In the end, I feel that even though the movie is too long, I will still rate the movie a 7.5/10, simply because it was a very entertaining and entertaining film . The action sequences were awesome , the cast was outstanding , and the overall film was well worth watching . If you are in the mood for a mindless fun film , give this one a watch , and maybe even a few drinks along the way . Thanks for reading my review .

Although this has to be the nadir of season six , this schmaltzy episode is n't badly written or acted

We've all been there. This isn't an episode in the usual sense of "the worst episode ever," because this was not a bad episode for its own sake. It's just that, as much as it tries, it fails to provide anything particularly interesting or surprising. This was a good episode of a good show, one that's worth watching when it's on, and one worth watching in spite of its shortcomings.

Citizen Kane....The Godfather Part II....D'Urville Martin's Dolemite. This is the single greatest piece of celluloid ever created and unleashed upon humanity. Rudy Ray Moore, in a role that transcends Academy Awards stars as Dolemite, the baddest cat in the universe. He clearly does not take any jive from no turkey (I myself am unfortunately a turkey) and proves it with his powers of rapping, pimping, and karate chopping. This is blaxploitation at its absolute finest, a shining example of the genre with its low budget, continuity errors, and hatred for rat-soup eating honkey expletive expletive.

Sci-Fi channel thinks this IS Sci-Fi; it's a shame. Big Bugs, Snakes, Mythical Beasties, on and on, they persist.Some one at Universal had the brains to include BattleStar Galactica (the new, good one) and Firefly for a brief moment in their line up. I know they know they difference between total garbage and extremely high quality sci-fi.A few years back they were on about how they were going all high and mighty, making productions that were not just for us mere, lame-o Trekkies. Thanks so much, Sci-Fi!

I cant go for long describing this tittle , simply because I do not feel strong about it . I am a very emotional person and I dont like to draw things and write about the things that are not in my head . Its like my head is full with what i am thinking and feeling about a thing . I dont know why , I just feel like its better this way . I dont know if this was true or not . I also have some bad memories . So i think the thing I am describing is just a thing I saw .

Having endured this film last night , I turned off the DVD player with a sense of deserving a medal. Not only did the film have a very strong sense of atmosphere, it had an almost documentary style to it. You don’t think about a film like this because you don’t think of it. In a sense it’s like watching something on television. That is to say that I’m glad that I watched it because of how much I thought about the characters. But more importantly, how I thought about the film as a whole .

In "Red Letters", Coyote is at the vortex of as a college professor who writes to a female prison inmate and gets more than he bargained for. There are two reasons to watch this flick...Kinski is one and Piven the other although it's difficult for their sparks to shine in such a complete directorial disaster. Everything is wrong with "Red Letters"...convoluted, lousy screenplay, camera, editing, and most of all acting which is subpar for Coyote, etc. Battersby has taken a story with potential and turned it into a seriously flawed and amateurish flick not worth the time.

If you're a fan of the original series, do NOT see this movie.I should have been skeptical from the previews when Aeon expresses her motives for murder. In the series Aeon had no family and no motive for her adventures save selfish interests. Obviously the chimp-writer in charge felt the movie needed to cater to the "bad grrl" demographic by making the character deadly, but have a good reason to kill people.You wouldn't have thought it possible, but the movie is more two dimensional than the cartoon. The characters are all portrayed as inherently good with some conflict of interest that eventually gets resolved.

Ninja Hunter (AKA Wu Tang vs Ninja) is pure entertainment from start to finish due to its outrageous characters, nonsensical plot and lack of any pretensions whatsoever. The makers of this film have given us a truly OTT masterpiece which has to be seen to be believed.The plot centres around Wu Tang villain, Abbot White, who wants to destroy the Shaolin monks and become supreme martial artist. In order to do so, he teams up with a clan of Ninjas, led by three masters  gold lamé ninja, white mustachioed ninja and black ninja  and succeeds in destroying the Shaolin temple and most of its inhabitants.

Just what the world needed-another superficial cookie-cutter Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen movie . This movie gives out horrible messages to women about what they should and shouldn't do on social media. Not to mention, it was just plain weird and creepy. I'm sorry but I can't even explain why this movie was so wrong. I will just say that it doesn't even make sense. I thought it was great the first time I saw it. The thing about the movie is that the actors have gotten to this point in their lives.

Dolemite is awesome . Rudy Ray Moore 's rhymin kung fu pimp with horrible choreographed action sequences is about as good as it gets. I'm surprised they had the courage to put a movie in the theater with a guy who has less than 1/2 the intelligence and talent of an 8th grader! It's really a shame you don't have a lot of free time to watch it . . . because it is an awesome movie! The only thing I would like to see is a scene or two with Dolemite in the background singing . . . something . . . .

I saw the world premiere at the Toronto International Film Fest, this is a great film.Real-life husband and wife Paul Bettany and Jennifer Connelly star as Charles and Emma Darwin in the midst of their struggle through the writing of and decision to publish "Origin of Species". Their consideration of the ramifications it may have for their family and the future of humankind are conveyed in such a manner that one suspects only an off-screen couple could achieve.Jon Amiel (who gave a heart-felt introduction) and John Collee do and excellent job of bringing Randal Keynes' biography to life.

What i hate most in this garbage is the arrogant attitude of the film makers and network execs who foist on the public this movie. They all think it is ok and acceptable that they can use the people’s image, and money, for their selfish and greedy purposes. The people who run Hollywood and big media, have the power, money and control to do anything they want to these poor people. They should get off of their butts and wake up, before they do irreparable harm to themselves, the world and the people with whom they share their wealth.

`` The Apartment Complex '' is a campy comedy full of kookie characters created in lieu of a real story. In short, a family of four, consisting of father and daughter (a lesbian couple), and the son (an openly gay woman), lives at The Apartment Complex, a campy vacation home owned by a self-help guru. In order to save money to afford the trip of a lifetime, all members of the family work at the resort, including the daughter's boss. The Apartment Complex was originally released in 1995. It was distributed on VHS and DVD.

WARNING - POSSIBLE SPOILERS ! 'Rock Star ' is one of the solid rock movies I have ever seen . The movie was created in the UK and was shot in the US . It was directed by Peter Weir and stars Richard Dreyfuss . The movie was released on December 11 , 2008 . Here is the synopsis . After an incident on a mountain road, Rock Star's driver is paralyzed from the waist down. When the doctors discover that he has a rare form of muscular dystrophy, he escapes the hospital, but soon finds that he has become a criminal in a town run by thugs.

I think Hollywood should seriously consider NEVER doing another "Biblical" film again, if Noah's Ark is going to be the norm. Aside from the horrible, completely uninspired acting from the whole cast (Voight and Steenburgen undoubtedly rue the day the agreed to do this film), the time line has been completely rearranged. I also missed the part in Genesis about the pirate fight on the deck of the ark or the traveling salesman coming by on his paddle boat. Hello? EVERYONE else was dead except for Noah and his family according to scripture.

New guy at an armored car company gets talked into becoming involved in an armored car heist by his fellow drivers in order to score some quick cash. The problem is that they really don't have much of a plan and when complications arise things turn deadly.Fast moving popcorn action film has a great deal going with it. First off the film is under 90 minutes so the film doesn't really have the time to bog down in plot. It cranks everything up and just goes. Next the film has some great action sequences so one moves towards the edge of ones seat.

Rabbit Fever is a mockumentary collection of sketches , each one of them focussing on a female personal device that has no other purpose than the creation of art. There are three main female characters. The first and the only female character of the first episode was a fashion model who uses various art materials to decorate herself. She uses a variety of materials to make her own clothes and accessories and decorates herself with various arts. The second character is a high school girl. She is always on the lookout for the latest fashion.

If you can stomach the campiness , this movie should make you laugh out loud several times . It did , and you should check out its IMDB listing for details on how it got into this position. What’s it about? It’s an adaptation of a short story by Arthur C. Clarke, in which the main character is the last human on Earth, and he is fighting a battle to prevent an alien invasion of our planet. In other words , the movie is basically an homage to the Star Trek series , except that it takes place many years after the events in the original television series.

This movie is a great film. The movie shows so many themes all in one amazing film. Driving Lessons centers around Ben (Rupert Grint) a shy 17 year old who is coming of age. The movie goes on about how Ben is sick of his dominating mother and how he just wants to be himself. Ben then meets Evie, who he makes a very special bond with. The two take a journey and in the process Ben finds himself and what a relationship that he and Evie share. This is the movie that you watch by yourself, or with someone else.

i was very impressed with this production on likely all levels; from production to plot and character development.this definitely fall under the "realism" genre, since there is nothing going on here that makes use of creative imagination, twists, or manipulating audience in how a viewer shall feel, think and asses.the actors are great, especially the "little" ones. the chemistry between the brother and the sister is mind blowing, maybe not even as common as should be in real life. it is a movie excellent to literally watch while visualizing it.

This movie narrate the story of John Belushi,based of his biography `Wired' , wrote by Bob Woodward.All of movie is narrate on flashback without a chronological order , where after the death of John Belushi we see one angel accompany Belushi during few points of his life.Michael Chicklis in the character of John Belushi is enough credible , but entirely devoid of the devastate force of Belushi ,and his play stay only a pale animation.The director,on more,not succeed to give continuate on the story , that for who not knows the book is very confused.

As a fan of Henriksen ( I liked him in the `` Millennium '' series ) and of course Lorenzo Lamas , I would say that it`s an overrated piece of trash. It`s just not his stuff. It`s really not his thing. It`s his first work. It`s almost an experiment in his career. He should have left the project. He should have walked away. He should have given his rights back. I think that this was the wrong choice. But I guess that was his only choice.

Badly shot, badly edited, clumsy dialogue, flat characters, unsuccessful adaption of a novel. It doesn't really get much worse. Decent acting and good popcorn saved me for this hour and a half - felt more like three hours - of boredom. Occasional good one-liners.David is a dim-witted young man, who has never recovered from losing his brother at an early age. He puts his faith in a Chinese philosophy mumbo jumbo video, although that doesn't seem to help him much in real life. David is a member of a debt-collectors gang, where every member has an IQ below sea level.

After watching this movie on a boring Saturday afternoon, I couldn't quite figure out why so many people liked it. It wasn't "heartwarming" or "clever"; it was merely an amalgam of every other "mismatched people coming together during a holiday and despite their ideological differences learning something about each other" movie ever made.The characters are a stereotype bouillabaisse -- We have the Blacks, the Hispanics, The Jews, The Asians, and the Homosexuals -- and they never do anything except what everyone expects characters in a movie like this to do.

Oh dear! What can I say about Half Past Dead? I was really disappointed in it. I was thinking....A Steven Seagal movie! Cool! We'll get to see him kick people and flip people and break bones. We might even get to see him have a stick fight with somebody! Excellent!However, I was in for a rude awakening. This film can be summed up as follows:Take an episode of the A-Team, remove the lovable and roguish characters such as Murdoch, Hannibal, Mr T and Face.

This thing , directed by french sensation Patrick Sebastien , is worst than all the turkeys that you may have ever eaten. It is not a turkey; it is not even a turkey of any kind. It may not even be a turkey. It is, in fact, nothing. It may not exist at all. It may not even have been there in the first place , or even ever. It may just be an impossible hallucination, a nightmare that we’ve been living and dreaming. This thing exists, and has existed since before our ancestors could remember.

Oh dear! The BBC is not about to be knocked off its pedestal for absorbing period dramas by this one. I agree this novel of Jane Austens is the difficult to portray particularly to a modern audience, the heroine is hardly a Elizabeth Bennet, even Edmund is not calculated to cause female hearts to skip a beat. However I must say I was hoping for an improvement on the last and was sadly disappointed. The basic story was preserved, but the dialogue was so altered that all that was Jane Austen's tone, manner, feeling, wit, depth, was diluted if not lost.

Fair and nifty little science fiction/horror fantasy thriller about a well-known video game designer , Allegra Geller ( Jennifer Jason Leigh ), who travels to Seattle to attend a convention called Game Developers Live, hoping to find a new job and possibly even get her old job back, but when the world she lives in crashes into the future, she finds that not everything is as she left it behind. She’ll learn that the people she thought were her friends turned out to be aliens and that even the ones who were supposed to be her enemies are looking out for her.

I enjoyed the Mr. Magoo cartoons I saw while growing up . And I enjoy Leslie Nielson 's comic skills. (She drew The Adventures of Wacky Races in a more sophisticated way). I like her work. I like Leslie 's sense of humor in her cartoons. She's got a good imagination, she can think outside the box and I enjoy her sense of humour. And I'm sure she loves to laugh. But what Leslie Nielson did that is beyond me, she made a cartoon about the life of a little kid.

The basic idea behind `` Dungeon of Harrow '' is n't all bad . The acting , however , is awful . The plot itself is so incredibly cliche it's hard to believe this movie actually came from the minds of actual writers . ``Harrow'' is a comedy-drama about a young man ( Ryan Gosling ) who finds his way out of his deadbeat family and into an adventure to find his father's buried treasure . As they travel across the wild and unpredictable American South , the treasure hunt becomes a search for the father who abandoned his family .

ExCUSE me , but my tongue was TOO in my cheek when we filmed this piece o ' poop . I had to make it up , because if I had done a piece like this , I might have to be put away in a straitjacket and fed to the sharks . You know who doesn't like poop ? People who take drugs and eat feces and/or feces-laden foods. I do not know of a single human being on the planet who doesn't like poop. And you know who is scared of it? Children. Because the poop is really, really gross.

First of all , before I start my review , I just read every review for 'The Muppet Movie ' and I must say that the first movie is not as bad as we were told in many of reviews. I will give you a brief explanation. I have been watching this movie for the past 3 years and the movie was released in the first half of January, so I must say that it was a late release. I am not going to waste any time , but what is the point of going through all reviews that are already made about the movie.

Look , do n't get me wrong I love independent films but COME ON ! I could barely sit through "Crocodile Dundee" and here you are saying it is the best one you have seen. But then come on and try and compare that to "Jurassic" and try and compare "Star Wars". I just think they both suck. It's like you have a bunch of movies from your childhood you want to watch but you can't find time to sit down and watch them and you tell yourself "well I've seen them before and I know you will like it" .

I remember seeing a clip of this movie on HBO when I was a kid and it scared the ever living crap out of me. When I found it, I watched it. I wish I hadn't. The movie wasn't scary.The plot revolves around an old woman running the castle. She feeds this horribly disfigured person in the cellar of a 12 century castle. She continuously beats the poor guy every day and feeds him. Well, that day, she dies. Then, a few months later, a family moves in. A father, a mother, and their blind daughter.

I concur with the other users comment . Hard to believe that this movie actually came out in 1994 because it is so far away from what has happened over the past 25 yrs . This movie was an amazing movie . It is also one of the best Sci Fi movies out there . This was a movie I wanted to like, but after watching all the other reviews on this page, I thought it was just bad. I'm glad I went in blind! The film is really good. The animation is awesome. The music is great. The story is actually quite interesting.

This film takes a lot of liberties with the known historical facts.Even little things like Flynn licking one stamp after another, when he almost certainly would have used a moistened sponge, is one of the annoying things. Flynn was never tried of manslaughter or murder. He is not known to have caught his mother making love to another man, and is not known to have had an homosexual relationship with anybody, and he did not end up on skid row in Sydney. He did not get his twopenny-halfpenny role in In the Wake of the Bounty by imposture and this role did not turn him into a well-dressed film star.

This movie is supposed to take place in Milford NJ. I know the house that it is based on as well as the person. As you see at the end of themovie, she was killed in the world trade center incident. I know that, because I was one of the police officers that helped with the identification of her remains. (She was the only one in our area lost). The nudity in the movie went a bit far. I am not a prude but the actors could have filmed the scene with the two woman without actually showing the whole thing.

In Fassbinder 's earlier films , his ideas sometimes surpased his ability to execute them . He was always a good, if limited, director, but this was a good film with a difficult problem to solve . Not only was it to do with Fassbinder's own problems, but also that of Germany in the middle of the century , and the collapse of the German Democratic Republic , when people were looking for a way out, and not just any way. In Fassbinder's film the question was where to go next , to the West , in a country that was about to fall apart.

I saw this piece of pseudo-intellectual crap a couple of years ago, and it is now making a comeback at the local film club. It uses every cliché in the Intellectual Movie Makers Handbook (Beginners Edition) in order to appear as intellectual as the director probably imagines himself to be. You get your run-of-the-mill slow-motion tempo, brown color scale, slow pans through bombed-out environments, blank, suffering facial expressions, over-symbolic imagery, and the requisite miserable ending.It is a complete failure, an unintentional perfect caricature of the typical Russian art movie.

i have lost count as to how many times i have watched this movie. i've never grown tired of it since this is a movie that can be enjoyed and interpreted on so many levels. they just don't make movies like this anymore.after recently finally watching the riveting documentary on the making of this film (Hearts of Darkness:a filmmakers journey into madness), i'm even more amazed that this film even got finished, yet alone turn out so great.the fact that they actually filmed this movie in the jungles of the Phillipines is the film's greatest asset.

If you were enjoyed by watching `` Guinea Pig '' - then you 'll like this movie to ! ``. It is a movie for everyone and it has a wonderful plot which is full of romance, action and funny scenes. This movie is worth watching even if you are not familiar with the movie genre which is full of action, adventure, comedy, romance and drama and if you want to give this movie a good review, then make sure you watch the movie first of all and then go back to see the review of this movie.

Jim Henson's The Muppet Movie is a charming, funny and brilliant film that can be watched AND enjoyed by adults and kids. I feel this is my favorite childhood film because it combines great characters, great story, and great wit that it is irresistable. The plot involves Kermit the frog (puppeteered and voiced by Henson) in his odyssey across America to follow his dream in Hollywood. Along the way, he meets Fozzie Bear, The Great Gonzo (my favorite), Miss Piggy, Rolf, and DR. Teeth and the electric mayhem.This film has so many good things I can't even say them.

UK-born Australian helmer Alex Frayne calls for attention with his strange, necessitating a meticulous read, visually stunning Modern Love (2006). Following the steps of a man incapable of controlling a drastic personality change spurred by the death of a close relative pic offers a fascinating examination of human psychology. Distributed by Accent Film-Australia.John (Mark Constable), his wife Emily (Victoria Hill), and their son Edward (William Traeger) arrive in a small Southern town to take care of his deceased uncle's (Don Barker) property.

Drawn by Pain is easily one of the best pieces of cinema I have ever seen. Here are my reviews of the episodes released so far: Episode one was even better than I expected and from everything I had heard about it, I expected quite a lot. I am very impressed with the actors already. The father was creepy and played perfectly. The little girl is so expressive, she uses her eyes to convey such emotion. The animation was superb. The cinematography was amazing, each camera angle capturing the feeling of the scene perfectly.

I found this film completely and utterly incomprehensible . I knew some of he facts about Caravagggio , but here they were presented as if they were real facts . I can't say I was totally uninterested , but I didn't have any sympathy for the poor man who made them up . I can't say it was as bad as L'Esprit n' le Monde , which was a much worse work of literature . The film was made to entertain the Italian people in the hope that the people of France would be moved to a desire to help Italy .

Since I'd bought the DVD, I watched as much of this as I did out of a sense of obligation to my wallet.The plot has Kirk Douglas as a successful first novelist who hired Laraine Day as a secretary, falls in love, and marries her. Complications ensue.Douglas is usually thought of as an intense actor, given to heavily dramatic roles, sometimes hero, sometimes rat. He's not bad in this thoroughly comic part. The problem is that the part isn't particularly comic and neither is anything else.The plot rambles on.

Admirable but weak James Bond film mainly because both the hero (Bond) and villain (Blofeld) were seriously miscast. Lazenby is too big and innocent looking to play Bond. He looks and acts more like the good-natured but dim-witted sidekick in a police action movie. The director and writer try to establish his credibility, but his saying of lines like "Royal Baluga, North of the ..." just aren't effective in establishing him as this worldly and suave rogue. Savalas doesn't do a bad job, but his characterization and behavior is more fitting of a mob gangster.

In London , the Venetian Carla Borin ( Yuliya Mayarchuk ) is searching an apartment to share with her beloved friend. The apartment is on the top of her building, the top floor of a tall building.
