One of the windows faces on the courtyard. In the courtyard, three men were playing soccer in the winter sun. The men were dressed like football fans: they had jerseys on with a red and yellow flag, a yellow scarf and black shoes. A man came out and shouted that the game must start, so he ran after the men and ordered them to stop the game.

From the makers of Underworld , we have , by far , the worst werewolf movie I have ever seen, and I’ve seen some pretty horrible stuff. It is not that the movie was bad. Hell, I liked it, but the movie itself was atrocious. It was the production values that took me aback, to be completely honest, but there are a number of reasons, not least the fact that the lead actor had a very strange name, the name being an anagram, which made me laugh when I heard he was in it.

I really do n't think producer George Lucas did n't really set out to make such a horrible sequel as the prequel trilogy for Star Wars: The Clone Wars, but when he decided to move on to something else he didn't feel the need to follow his own ideas of what a prequel trilogy should be like. After all, it was his baby, so if he didn't like its direction he could always make something new and fresh. That's the thing with sequels, they never quite work out how the original idea was conceived.

And one of 'em are bad movies. The title, as it turns out, refers to a killer of the human male variety, not fish. This is not the Dante-directed "Piranha" of '78 (which did have the fish) and is also known as "Piranha, Piranha." A trio of photographers, 2 men and a woman, hook up with a local hunter/trapper named Caribe somewhere in the Amazon jungle. Unfortunately, they are not familiar with the film resume of William Smith, who plays Caribe; otherwise, they would have known immediately he is the villain of the piece.

The violent death of Fernando Ramos Da Silva only eight years after the completion of this film , only adds to the mystery surrounding his death. Why would someone take a life like that? It certainly wasn't for the fame or the fortune, and it certainly wasn't the money he'd made from the movie. I've never understood this fascination with people like him. Why did they kill him? I honestly don't know the answer. If you have any more information on this case, feel free to share in the comment section below.

This is a wonderful comedy short -- one of Keaton 's absolute best . Through a long series of silly misunderstandings, three brothers ( played by Charlie Chaplin, Charlie Chaplin, and Buster Keaton ) are forced to live together in a trailer in the countryside . But it's not the country they're forced into, it's the city . For the first time, Charlie Keaton has the starring role. Chaplin plays his brother's best friend, and the brother's father, as well as a minister, plays the minister's wife.

Robert McKimson's 'Acrobatty Bunny' is one of the director's finest shorts. Although the circus-based setting may evoke hideous memories of McKimson's dreadful 'Big Top Bunny', 'Acrobatty Bunny' is in fact nowhere near as dull as that travesty. Pitting Bugs Bunny against a ferocious lion, 'Acrobatty Bunny' is fresh and funny from the outset, not to mention extremely attractive to look at. There's a classic scene in which Bugs takes a strangled elevator ride out of his hole only to emerge directly into the jaws of the lion.

I liked this movie , the second Naruto feature film . I enjoyed the one in the snow a tad more though. This one was a lot of fun to watch and I had a lot of fun with the movie. I was pleasantly surprised by this Naruto film and loved the way it took the story forward and added in new characters and plot twists . There were also a number of good action scenes , a decent romance plot , and a decent love interest for Sakura . I did wish the movie had more time for the flashbacks , though .

This movie really starts strong . We know that Roberts is an Atlanta hotshot sent to Australia to fix Coke, but that's the only thing we know for sure. Roberts is an alcoholic. He also seems to have the hots for an attractive blond in her mid thirties who lives in Sydney. We hear her name at least once but don't know her. The only thing we are sure of is that he's going to hook up with her and take her back with him to Atlanta and that this will be a big problem for her.

Absolutely the best thing I have ever seen on TV. It was both entertaining and informative. The reason I found this site is an attempt to find out how I can again see it.In the light of present understanding of history we have to sympathize with Gen. Leslie Groves who was responsible for the nuts and bolts of running the Manhattan Project. Most certainly he was not as paranoid about security as most have thought in the past. The casting for the real life people portrayed was outstanding. It was the first time that I noticed Sam Waterston as an actor.

Previous reviewer Claudio Carvalho gave a much better recap of the film 's plot details than I could . What followed was a much more enjoyable film experience, I was amazed at how much better this movie felt than the first, both in narrative terms and the actual visual effects. I had a much better experience viewing this film when I watched it in a cinema rather than at home, as I had the luxury to go into a theatre, rather than watching it over a few nights in my living room (which I would likely have done anyway).

Given the subject matter of drug addiction Down to the Bone almost can't help but be a rather depressing film. But depressing doesn't necessarily have to mean bad. Unfortunately in this case it is in fact pretty bad. The film has some good things going for it, most notably the quality performance of Vera Farmiga in the central role of Irene, a working mom struggling with a cocaine addiction. But there isn't enough good here to outweigh the bad. The film's failings lie mainly with the story, which fails to captivate and never really seems to get going.

Alfred Hitchcock made this comedy of mis-marriage in 1941 but his heart does n't appear to be in it . . . as the plot unfolds, so does the plot-line . . . of the man who comes out the loser. When it was first shown in the United States it was a popular hit. It has also been shown many times over in the United States since then, but the film has not made a fortune in the States. The film has also been shown in Britain, where it was released in 1951.

Went to the Preview Engagement of `` Grand Champion '' today ( Dallas/Fort Worth , Austin , Snyder and a few others ) . There were about 70 people there and the weather was perfect. I love the Dallas/Fort Worth airport. It is a beautiful city. I would have gone to Austin a while ago if I could have gone to one of the events. I don't know why. Maybe I'll get a chance to go to San Diego . I really don't know what it is. Maybe it is the people there. __________________
"Sometimes you get it right, you win it all."

Frank Sinatra starred in this odd little short from RKO that is now in the public domain . The film was released in 1949, directed by Fred Zinnemann. It is not a big hit in the United States. Sinatra was in the chorus of this, which was also a musical, called I'll Love You Forever, which was directed by Jerome Moross. The actors who played Sinatra's band were Dick Powell and Margaret Dumont. There wasn't a "big" hit after this in the USA, but it made a lot of money here in Britain, particularly in Canada and the Caribbean, and in Australia.

I 'd never thought that I would be caught saying this : But I think `` Dog the Bounty Hunter'' was one of the most underrated and underused films from the '90s. It may have been released too late for many, but I'm still going to defend it and say that it is not just the best film of the year, but one of the best films to ever come out of the 1990s. And that makes me really sad because it was made for a very good reason, which you all are going to get to.

After an undercover mission in Bucharest to disclose an international gang of weapon dealers , the agent Sonni Griffith (Nicolai Gledov) is left behind after he is arrested for carrying a gun without a licence on his person . Sonni is ordered to report to a maximum security prison . In the meantime , a former gang member who was executed by a firing squad for murdering a cop is offered a position as a prison guard in exchange for his testimony against the drug syndicates in his homeland. After a routine search, Sonni is found with a package of cocaine on his person and is arrested.

I love this movie . Yes , the main character lies , but that 's why it 's called ``Hollywood 's own'' film . This film made in America is a classic . What I liked in this film was the way of the acting of the characters . As the film tells, it is a film set in America . So , we get to know about America , but at the same time , the film also shows how the life of these American is . Well , what can I say about this film ? I loved it ! The movie starts with a long flashback .

I know that Guts of a Beauty and Guts of a Virgin are crap films and are hated by many, but they were still made and I still love them. There is something about them that strikes a chord with people of all ages and genders, and I'm sure this is the same thing that made them successful in the first place. The thing with these two movies that I always notice about them is that if you've never seen a movie of theirs, they are still pretty darn fun to watch.

We sought out this hard-to-find VHS after watching two excellent Merchant-Ivory pictures back to back. Knowing it was an instant box office failure, a failure as a rental, I thought it might be worth seeing anyway based on M-I's reputation. Too bad! Nine years ago, it was very much a Liberal Agenda objective to trash the Founding Fathers and indeed they had some success in eradicating the Founding Fathers from many American classrooms including, for example, New Jersey; whose eradication of our great founders quickly ended when the Washington Times shone the spotlight of truth into the NJ School Board and their subversive deed.

* SPOILERS INCLUDED * Alfred Hitchcock 's brilliant and innovative adaptation of Robert Bloch 's novel was an amazing film and a huge hit at the time, but it didn 't turn out to be an all-time classic - and it didn't get the credit it deserved because it didn't fit into the box the Hollywood studios wanted to put it in. The film stars Cary Grant (as the narrator) and Olivia De Havilland who had previously appeared in Alfred Hitchcock 's classic The Wrong Man (1946). But they also starred in a spin-off called Blithe Spirit , which is about two sisters who are separated during WWII.

This 1955 heist film follows Tony le Stephanois , recently released from prison for theft , as he undertakes the robbery of his brother's jewellery store . he makes the plan with his best friend Paul who has his own plan - he will steal enough jewellery to set himself up in life as a famous movie actor . he is interrupted in the middle of the operation by the police who have been called after a report of a robbery in the same jewellery store . the jewellery was stolen but the police can't find the suspect .

I just saw this film at the Sidewalk Film Festival in Birmingham, AL, which was actually a really fun festival, and was blown away by it. It was the best movie I saw all day by a long shot. A school aged prostitute meets with a middle age man and attempt to end there deep depression together. It's an inner look into the darkest parts of human sexuality. Story stems from real life occurrences, ripped straight from the headlines. Raw, blunt dialog and a killer twist at the end. The film does contain graphic sexual dialog and nudity.

If you 're a fan of the original series , do NOT see this movie.I should have been skeptical from the start when I saw the first trailer. This movie does nothing for me other than to waste time and keep the series from getting back into theatres.I did not see this until the last day of its run so when I heard about it I assumed it would be terrible and I'm not disappointed. I expected it to be a big time dud.It is not and the only thing I have to recommend it is to see this movie only if you absolutely have to.

Watched the director's cut last night...glad it was free rental, even a dollar would have been too much for me to pay to watch this attempt at "film noir". The anachronisms (modern telephones) were annoying to me, not clever, seeming more like budget constraints than anything else. The "non-traditional" casting I also found distracting. If I have to stop following the story to wonder "what the heck is the black chick/drag queen doing there?" then the storyteller has failed me. Again, not clever in my opinion but annoying and irritating, and very film school final project-ish.

I thought this movie was cleverly written and very well acted . Its a movie that greatly surpasses other films in it's genre . I watched it a few times on my ipod and now i have downloaded it on my laptop and it was even better . The movie had many good acting and i like how they used to the technology of the day . This is a very interesting film that i will definitely watch again . This is the best movie i have seen this year . The movie was so real and the story line was very good . this movie gave the viewers what they really want .

I seen this movie when it came out . I thought what an average movie . I have now realized that it was one of the greats . I watched it on the plane, it was the only movie I had seen all the way through. And I thought it was average and what an average movie it was . That movie changed my mind about how I saw movies. I saw a lot of movies before this movie came along, but when I saw it, I knew that this is the movie that changed my outlook on movies.

The finest short I 've ever seen . Some commentators suggest it might have been lengthened , due to the length , but the overall impression that I got from it was it was more than just a short. I 've seen a few that were shorter , but not ones that was as well-made as this one . . . This review contains spoilers, click expand to view. This movie was not what I had in mind, but this review will explain why. I don 't know what I 've been waiting for to watch this film.

This is a stereotype plot. A young fighter tries to enter a competition when he is not ready and is not selected to represent his fighting school. This leads to separation from the fighting school and naturally he finds a strange new master to teach him to fight.The fights are not of high standards. They are way too "simple" in a way that 1+1 is simple to every adult. The fighter has trained and enters the ring, but does not do what he trained and gets an ass kicking. The coach yells do this and do that with no success.

The 1980's 'My Dinner with Andre,' with Wallace Shawn and Andre Gregory, is essentially a dialog about the world and how it affects and can lift the spirit. 2005's 'You Are Alone' demonstrates how common worldly events can shatter the soul. The story revolves around three principal characters. There's Daphne, a pretty teenage student who frets about virtually every decision in her life. Then there's the prostitute, or paid escort, Britney, as self-confident as Daphne is self-conscious. What makes them interesting is that they share the same body, if not the same personae.

Mixed group of "experts" (explorers, divers and scientists) venture a mile underground and go another 2.4 miles underwater to a spot even more remote, where they find salamanders, giant albino moles (??) and some big, razor-fanged, winged, computer generated creatures lurking about. The cave is sealed off by a rockslide and then the monsters attack and start killing everyone off as they search for an exit. And that's all she wrote with this low-aiming effort that even fails to combine action, science fiction and horror on the most elementary of levels.

If a movie can't hold your interest in the first 25 minutes, it's over as far as I'm concerned. This concept that you have to simply deal with a slow first third of a movie and be rewarded later is nonsense. A good movie has to start and end strong. It all seem interesting and some decent shots and lots of promise, but ultimately muddled and irrelevant. There are so many other movies from Asia to watch, many of which I am sure most of you have not seen, that I would really skip this one and look elsewhere.

I saw this at my in-laws' house one night when it popped up on TV and my mother-in-law said it was one of her favorite movies. Well, she can have it.Look, I can enjoy a chick flick now and then, as long as it's good. But this one's extra-sappy, unrealistic, and just plain predictable, despite some decent performances from Rock Hudson and Jane Wyman. It's uncanny how quickly a woman can accept having her eyesight taken away from her. Oh well, they say love is blind...The neat and tidy happy little ending nearly made me gag, too.

There 's a good story well hidden and never really used ! The film is short and overly dependent on dialogue. The story can be found if you read the book by the same name by the same name by John Updike as it was published in 1967. The movie version was released in the U.S. on July 17th 1968, but was actually a sequel to the book. This is a fictionalized re-telling of an event in U.K. Politics in 1958. The story was written by Oliver Mowat (1892-1971) and was published in the Sunday Times, April 3, 1960.

Perhaps if only to laugh at the way my favorite of Jane Austen's works has been portrayed. Perhaps I am too severe on this adaptation, but I'm afraid I am biased to the A&E version. I have a hard time imagining Mr. Darcy portrayed by anyone other than Colin Firth.The characters seemed shallow, and often dialogue forced. Lizzy seemed to lack the real feeling that is so evident in the book. Her fancy for Wickham was overplayed, and then her sudden like for Darcy was not believable.Darcy was portrayed tolerably well, I will grant him.

What a crappy movie! The main character in this movie was supposed to be born and brought up in Canada, yet he had a thicker Indian accent than his parents! Is it just me or does Uday look gay in this movie? Also, do all the chicks in Canada dress like sluts? At least that's how it is in this movie. All the females are dressed like strippers. Don't waste your time with this one! The only good thing about this movie is the setting in beautiful Vancouver. Wonder why Bollywood is going through a slump?

I was trying to work out why I enjoyed this film?? Its not because of money spent on it that's for sure!! Did I see a painted water pistol in there? Maybe they don't have the same sort of visual effects houses in the Scotland? Or maybe they just didn't have any money? The making of clearly shows a gang of very plucky guys making a movie against the odds. Awesome! But what I really liked was the grit of the performances. Mike Michell and Patrick White play the lead parts like 2 normal guys.

Two years after leaving the small town of Grover's Bend due to encountering the Krites, Brad Brown returns to spend time with his grandmother in time for Easter. Meanwhile the Krite eggs begin to hatch. As they cause trouble in the town, Brown & the townsfolk, as well as the alien bounty hunters who have returned to finish the creatures must fight the bloodthirsty furballs before they wipe out the town.The original Critters was a minor attempt to rip-off the family-horror flick "Gremlins". It became a cult favourite on the video shelves & was successful enough to warrant a sequel.

Worst movie ever seen. Worst acting too. I cannot imagine a movie worse then this. Nothing to see. No acting at all.T hey (actors) should look for another job. I cant't understand who was stupid enough to actually put money into this movie.I'm sorry for Eric Roberts. Must be tough...I cannot imagine how HUUUGE his mortgage must be to justify taking the job!The ladies in the movie...perhaps they better stick to XXX.As for the LEADING MAN...what a lead! He better be put on a lead and stay there!

I was looking forward to The Guardian , but when I walked into the theater I was n't really in for it . I was really disappointed with the whole film . It felt like the film was trying too hard . It seemed like The Guardian was trying to be more of a political film , but in actuality the film was really about how easy it was to get people to do what they wanted . It didn't even attempt to make any sense of why people would go down a dark hole to do what they do .

During an eight-year stretch of the 1980s when Charles Bronson made nine films, only one was released by a company other than the Cannon Group: 'The Evil That Men Do,' a TriStar Films pickup from Sir Lew Grade's ITC Entertainment firm. Bronson was already in the thick of his collaborations with director J. Lee Thompson, which ran through numerous actioners until 'Kinjite: Forbidden Subjects' in 1989.Expectations should run pretty high with Bronson and Thompson working for a better-funded outfit like ITC, but 'The Evil That Man Do' is a great disappointment on many levels.

i found the film a bit predictable and boring but i am 14.i was really annoyed with my little cousin who used to like it.i did not see the whole movie,but i do remember that it was not a very exciting film,and when they do that scene where the boy and his parents were supposed to be in love it was so lame.i think that this movie is not for kids of that age.in my opinion it is a very dull movie.i have never heard of the movie. I saw this movie at the theater once.

But it 's not . The plot is n't all that bad , the actors are n't all terrible so it 's not as though the series is just bad by design . If anything , I actually think it's pretty cool . The fact that it's actually based on a novel about a man who is able to use telekinesis to do anything he wants to do really makes this series stand out . And I do not mean to belittle it in anyway . I'm just stating that there are a lot of things that don 't work together for this show to succeed .

Golden Boy is in my opinion one the sleeper / lost treasures animes out there. A sexy comedy, about a young man quest to find his nitch in life and he blunders into all sort of odd jobs that somehow has this rather sexy girl who ultimately falls for him but he not really realizing it! Its truly something that you can easily miss if you at the name, but once viewing it...will fall for the comedy/silliness that lies inside. Truly a crime that only produced 6 OVA episodes and pilot movie were made. However, being unique as it is.

My only reason registering to this site was for the opportunity to write a comment to this movie . I had not seen the movie yet. It had to do with a man who killed two people because he was not going to live in this world without knowing how he lived in the past . It was an excellent movie ! I am not a movie buff as many are. But I just saw this and I will definitely be watching it again. I liked it a great deal . The story was not bad, and it was well written. I liked the way it was told .

Five Fingers is so bad, that I hardly know where to begin. So let me admit first, that I have only seen the first half hour. When the first finger had been chopped off, I thought sleeping a more useful activity. I told my girlfriend the meaning of "five fingers" and she immediately followed my example.Couldn't the producer, the director and/or the scriptwriter consult a chess-amateur? Like me? They should have used a digital chess-clock and not an analogue. This major goof makes the mental pressure put on Martijn just a laugh.

imagination must of slipped Jim Wynorski mind when he wrote the script to this one. i don't mind when the animals scenes are almost identical but when the actors repeat lines from other movies is going a little too far. I did enjoy seeing Jay Richardson and Glori Ann Gilbert get eaten. Gloria brings nothing to a movie but her tits (my husbands sentiments). Jerri Manthey should of stayed on survival island her acting is stiff, unbelievable and she just a plain boor. liked the scene where the cobra comes out of the ocean eats the guy then for added flavor destroys the dingy.

I recently saw Episodes 1-4, and now I can't wait for 5 & 6 to be available! (I've heard they are coming soon.) Commander's Log seems destined to become a cult hit among the university crowd and all others with a taste for quirky comedy. It's obvious that the budget was small, but the care taken in crafting the script is quite evident. In fact, the simplicity of the show allowed me appreciate the writing and the acting more. Bowlsby is a master of the put-down... I just wish I could remember all the best ones for later use on unsuspecting co-workers!

I read on the web that this film is being remade into a theatrical feature . Finally ! ! ! This is the time to buy it ! So, this film has just been made into a theatrical flick. I am very excited ! This film is one of my all time favorites. It is very interesting to see this film as a sequel to a film that did not have sequels . I am not sure if it should have sequels, because it was such a great film. I think sequels are not necessary . I have not read the new script , so I cannot tell you about it .

`` Problem Child '' was an okay movie , but did it really merit a sequel ? I do n't think so , but I also don't see how it's not better to just make it as an original movie and do a proper sequel. But then again , I do n't have a problem with the idea . The plot is the most important part of a movie . But if the plot doesn't have any interest for you , I suggest you watch the first one instead of a second movie . There were a lot of things I did not like about this film .

Like some other people wrote, I'm a die-hard mario fan, and I loved this game. This game starts slightly boring, but trust me, it's worth it. As soon as you start, your hooked! The levels are fun and exiting. They will hook you 'till your mind turns to mush. I'm not kidding. This game is also orchestrated, and is beautifully done. To keep this spoiler free, I have to keep my mouth shut about details. But please try this game! It'll be worth it!Story: 9.9 Action: 10.1 (It's that good!)

This is seriously the worst movie I have ever seen, right from the start the movie goes straight down hill with its cheesy music score, poor acting, and total lack or real story or plot. Even for a B movie this is down right awful. After reading some of the good reviews i thought i'd keep an open mind and watch it. But all the bad reviews were so right. I totally can't understand how anyone could have enjoyed it. I'm a huge Sci-fi fan and this was way more than i could swallow.

Ordinarily , Anthony Mann made westerns with 'the big guys ' - James Stewart , Gary Cooper , Henry Fonda , John Wayne , William Boyd , John Carradine - but this time he was dealing with two of his own. Anthony Mann's epic western classic The Searchers is one of the great American westerns of all time. The story of The Searchers unfolds over several decades as a man and a woman, played by Gary Cooper and John Wayne respectively, attempt to find their lost brother after he disappears from a remote Wyoming ranch.

I never comment on a film, but I have to say that this was one of the worst films that I have ever seen. I feel it was made by a beginner film student and not to put down talented film students, but this was horrible! I did not buy the lead actress and felt I was in acting class with her while she was on film. Her decisions were very safe and I feel she was mimicking other actresses in films and not acting and making her own decisions. The direction was very confusing and the sound was louder than the actors themselves.

The girls might be prettier if you 're their accompanist or a $ # ! +-faced onlooker . What I'd really like to see is you on the stage, and the rest of the audience cheering and hooting." "Gee, thanks, man, it would be great if you were on stage. I'd just love to see you there. Thanks. And I bet if I got to the stage I would be doing what I'm really made of. I just love it. It's all I've got. I just can't get enough.

If you have seen the Telugu version of Gilli "Okkadu" you will find this to be very similar in story line, but Gilli has different songs and takes place in Tamil Nadu not Andra pradesh. Although this is a remake of "Okkadu" you will find that Vijay and Trisha make this a unique film, Vijay and Trisha make a great pair. A few negatives were when Vijays character slaps Trishas character for going to buy a present for him, he never apologizes and she still stays with him in the end.

I cant put it any simpler than that , this is a terrible film . I 've worked in the entertainment business for close on 40 years . I have seen hundreds of movies . Yet , I have never before seen such a film , and never since . I do not intend to waste the rest of my life watching this garbage . There are a plethora of better films out there that should be seen . This is one of the worst films that I have ever seen , and I think this is because of the poor direction .

Obabakoak is a bunch of short stories with an only common point : the little Vasque town of Obaba . It was the setting of a very popular movie made in 2006, called “Obeba”, which was very popular on its release in France and in other European countries, among which France is the biggest one, but it is very well known in the Far East and has had many translations into Chinese, English and Korean. It is a great movie, and I hope you will like it too. I am very happy that you have watched it.

Fabulous cinematography from Sergei Urusevsky help to make this a stunning piece of work . The opening scenes are as breathtaking as a film as it's made . But it's this sequence where you really get to feel for one of the main characters . A scene with a great performance from a beautiful young actress in the leading role . I wouldn't necessarily call this a love story - in fact it's rather the opposite . You feel that you are with one of the main characters who's going through a bit of a hard time and you can understand what she's going through .

When I finally got around to seeing this film recently , it turned out to be exactly what it looked like from the press materials (I didn't actually read the novel, I just went to a preview screening). As a fan of horror, I've been wanting to watch the remake ever since it was announced (and I was excited by the announcement that it was actually going to be made by a major studio) and I didn't have any reservations about it at all. But I was curious about how it would be. Would it be as good or as bad?

I am a huge fan of the Farcry Game, HUGE fan. It still holds a place in my top-10 games list of all time! The story line was new, fresh... A truly brilliant foundation to base a movie on... or so i thought...Farcry the Movie is no less than another directors attempt at cashing in on a successful game franchise (see Doom: The Movie, and many more...).The Video Game begins as the player (Jack Carver) awakes in a sea side cave after been shot off his boat by an RPG from an unknown soldier.

Once again Bronson 's talent is mostly wasted on this shock value 1984 thriller which ( uncut ) is far too slow-moving, dull, and in need of major editing. We all know that Bronson would never have the patience to make anything so dull as this. It's a waste of his talent in my book but at least the film looks pretty decent. I also feel like the film could have easily been shot in HD, which is why it took so long to make. I'll have to see another one soon to see if it was worth the wait.

While my kids enjoyed the movie (and announced afterward that they want to buy it later) I think I got more out of it that they did. The scene in the airport shop at the beginning is real life (I did not use the cutting comment aloud, but I thought it). It is a feel good mid-life movie, a bit sappy and some scenes work less well than others (why does the kid stay with Bruce Willis after he knows his Mom is dying? ), but all in all and good time.

I enjoyed the acting in this movie . Except for the sister . She reminded me of Janice on Friends when she would act like she knew everything. It was ridiculous . . . The storyline was intriguing . . . If the movie had had a decent script , I would have enjoyed it more. I liked the way the film was shot . But , I did not find myself invested in any characters . All of them were stereotypical . It was not the story that kept me watching the movie . It was the acting of the leads .

( WARNING - CONTAINS MILD SPOILER ) A movie almost designed to make you pause and check your recollection of what’s going to happen. But then again, there are certain things in the cinema that you’ve got to be a fan of or else you just won’t watch the damn thing. I can’t believe I am about to share this movie with you guys. A movie I’ve been a fan of and even recommended to a few friends and family members (and I am one of those) until I had the opportunity to give it the once over last year.

I love old `` monster movies '' for the pure camp value . This one does not disappoint if you were ever a kid who watched monster movies. I remember as a child watching movies like Frankenstein and The Mummy to see how the creatures were created. Now I realize that they were created in the laboratories. This is probably why there was a rule in the lab for scientists not to work on Frankenstein's monster. The rules were that Frankenstein had to be destroyed. This film is still a good movie though. I saw this as a child, but not as much as I had been told.

Yes, thats that i felt after i completed watching this movie. The acting is below-average and the special effects are horrible. In fact, the worst i have ever seen. It is a very low budget movie. There is no way this movie will can scare you, it has no creepy or scary moments. Mr. bone eater was more of a funny creature for me. It could have been much better but oh well they didn't had a big budget. The movie fails to convince you that you are watching a horror movie, lol.

This version of David Copperfield is dreadful from start to finish. I knew we were in for a wasted evening's viewing when a rather silly to the point of embarrassment Attenborough and Olivier camp it up as two baddies. It was all downhill after this. Aunt Betsy was adequate but had none of the eccentric flair she was noted for.The worst of the worst was the producer's choice for Uriah. This was the music hall version of this character, previously and admirably played by Roland Young. And what was all this self-absorbed Angst from David.

I have always loved bad creations, rhetorical criticism and my film professor validated that for me in college. This is not as bad as The Star Wars Holiday Special, there is nothing bottom of the lunchbox than that mistake. This The Fantastic Four film, complete with the I-have-no-idea-why-hes-excessively-tweaking-his-fingers Doctor Doom, is high on the list of colossal mistakes. Doom's dialogue "Kill him!...Let him go!" is classic as it is staggering in its hilarity. The editing is good, and the director of photography isn't half-bad...those are the up-sides.

Lt. Claude ( Claudio Cassinelli ) and several prisoners from his sunken ship wash ashore on an island owned by a French family. The captain of the family tells him he will give his men leave and to join him for dinner. As the group walks through the manor and into the dining room, the captain, seeing the group is a mix of English and Americans, asks if they speak English. They do not, but they do speak a little French and are soon joined by a soldier from the French garrison nearby.

It took a loan out film to Columbia for Gene Kelly 's home studio MGM to realize his creative talent. He made a series of classics, including "Singin' in the Rain," and was one of the greatest comedians the world has known. He was a classically trained singer, pianist and dancer who began his career as a dancer before making his first stage appearance in 1913 at age 20. As a member of a troupe, he sang and danced his way to a vaudeville career in New York's legitimate theater. There he began his acting career, performing at such theaters as Ziegfeld Follies.

I have read and enjoyed many of James Lee Burke's Robicheaux mysteries. When I read 'In The Electric Mist With The Confederate Dead' was being filmed and Tommy Lee Jones was playing the lead, I was thrilled. After watching it last night, I ending up turning it off with about twenty minutes left, not wanting to see any more people shot or beaten up. Don't get me wrong, I don't mind blood and gore-I love 'The Untouchables' and 'The Godfather Trilogy'. Perhaps it was just that I had previously seen 'Birth' and 'What Just Happened' before watching this.

If you decide to watch Wild Rebels, don't expect anything deep and meaningful. If you're looking for a film that explores the relationships and structure of a motorcycle gang, Wild Rebels is the wrong movie. If you're looking for an expose on the breakdown of the American educational system and the problem of juvenile delinquency, Wild Rebels is the wrong movie. If you're looking for a movie that examines how undermanned rural police departments are when facing a well-financed, well-organized gang, Wild Rebels is the wrong movie.

I absolutely adore this film about a lady columnist (Barbara Stanwyck) for a major homemaking magazine who delivers a welcoming article each month that includes details about her awesome home life as a wife and mother in a beautiful Connecticut home. The trouble happens when the owner of her monthly publication demands that she have him and a WW2 hero as guests during the Christmas Holidays. Why is she worried? Because she lives in a small New York apartment, isn't married, and doesn't have a baby - and can't cook at all!

Completely overlooking the whole movie adaptation of a video game, this is another terrible movie by Mr. Boll. How he continues to be hired to make movies is a constant surprise to me and obviously most of the movie going community.As a whole I will say that this attempt was fractionally better than so many of his previous attempts. Some of the dialog was even half way decent in Far Cry though he still misuses some phrases and in some cases he doesn't even use the phrases correctly.Now besides the fact that Jack Carver is supposed to be American and not German, Til was still entertaining in this role.

Despite some really scenic locations in the orient and some sporadically energetic music by Franco Micalizzi , this film does not feel like something you’d expect from a French film; in fact I would say it’s rather far from the usual. It does contain some beautiful moments, but at a price. The film is set in two different countries, one of them in the year 1962. The characters in this film are as different as the countries they come from, with the women dressed in their finest and men in the traditional garb.

I rented a copy of this one from Netflix -- big mistake. The DVD version titled "The One-Armed Swordsmen" was produced by madmen who thought that the fighting sequences would be appreciated better pasted all together in one big chapter than as part of a consistent, sequential story. Some of the story was left in separate chapters, which you can select from the main menu, but the DVD is still a mess. Don't rent or buy it. Not that there was anything wonderful about the original story, an absurdly complicated piece of nonsense.

I'll preface my review by stating that I am not a fan of the independent 'straight to video' genre that owes a great debt to the grindhouse films of the 60's. I don't own any, I've never rented any, so I might lack the appreciation for these tongue-in-cheek, low-budget stinkers that many other people have.I caught this movie on Cinemax late one Saturday evening with a lady friend. Please don't ask me why I was watching Cinemax late one Saturday evening with a lady friend. We were bored with World Championship Poker.

Oh , the horror , the unspeakable horror of this film . If you can even call it a film , it's not an action movie or a horror movie , or even a suspense thriller , for that matter . And to add insult to injury , there's absolutely nothing on the surface to tell the viewers that this is actually a serious film , let alone an Academy Award nominated film . For a start , this is the most generic of the bunch and the dialogue , which is usually very good , usually comes off as forced , at best , and at times it is downright insulting .

Shtrafbat is the story only Russians could tell about the Second World War. The largest front of the whole conflict has been, ironically, the least appearing subject on the silver screen after the war. While the Western Allies war-effort has been pictured in almost every possible detail and manner, the East has been left out or the job has been left to only some old propaganda movies of little else than historical footage value.There is no chance that Shtrafbat could compete with Band of Brothers in every detail but neither you want to look at the screen with examining petty visual effects in mind.

A few yrs ago , I remember reading an essay by a feminist film theorist who briefly mentioned Rosalind Russell as part of her own argument. In that essay Russell’s name was often linked to those of Mary Ann Doane and Susan Howe in passing, but when you look more closely at their writings, she seems to be a fairly consistent figure of feminist thought. Russell, after all, is one of the main sources for the idea that feminism, as a political movement, was an expression of women’s desire to “change” men and that the term “feminism” was itself a misnomer.

To even say that this film is Sebastien 's work at his best just tell you everything you have to know about him. For a director who has only directed a few short films he has shown a genius level of technical skill that is hard to believe. There is no reason in the world he can't make it big and he has done everything to try and achieve his dream. The film has everything you would want from a film from this director, the characters, the story, the music, everything, and then some!

Historically awful . Scarcely an accurate moment in 4 hours of ridiculosity . One can not keep track of the jokes , and there is always a fresh set of “wackos” to replace the one who failed in the task . It is only after some time that we realize that this kind of humor has nothing in common with comedy or comedy itself , that the laughter is fake . I was watching a show called “The Unbelievers” which was broadcast on Comedy Channel. This show had a lot of similar plots , similar scenarios and the main characters of this series were trying to escape from their own reality.

A friend of mine loves tacky horror films so I often get to see low budget stuff like this. This is, however the first time I have been compelled to write a review of one...Put simply this is probably the worst film I have ever seen! Even worse then Boggy Creek II!The entire budget for the film seems to have been spent on a brief scene in the middle when Dr. Klaus stands in this chamber thing & turns all vampire-ish.The only good thing to say about it is that it was hilarious after a few beers (but for all the wrong reasons).

This movie was completely stale and uninspired. The central premise of this movie was basically a bunch of stereotypical black people sitting around a barbershop exchanging painfully unfunny repartee. I did not laugh one time during the entire movie. I could have sat in any barbershop in America and have heard this banal banter, and maybe have even come out with a decent haircut. I cannot understand why this mess got any favourable reviews, much less why so many people have wasted money on this. None of the characters here were funny or worth caring about.

Wow . The storyline to this was just incredibly stupid . I realize that this movie was supposed to be a horror movie and I’ll take that. I just felt like it was a very shallow horror movie and not a very good one at that . It was just average . And the acting in this movie didn’t do anyone any justice either . I have seen a lot better acting in horror films . I also really thought that they should have cast John Cusack or any other actor who is into horror as the lead .

I decided to watch this movie because I'd not seen Carol Lombard before in any movie. I'm sorry it had to be this one because, quite frankly, this is a dog  and even with Jimmy Stewart and Charles Coburn, both of whom were great actors.The problem with the film is simple: it tries to put too much, too quickly, in to a story about a young lawyer (John Manson played by Stewart) who marries Jane (played by Lombard) within an hour of meeting her. What's that cliché? Marry in haste, repent at leisure...

Well , I have to agree with the critics on this one , who all said `` leave it alone , don't bother , just let her go . . .". . . I think that the best thing she could do is . . . get out of the spotlight , stop giving interviews , stop talking about other people , stop giving interviews , stop writing books about other people. . . . She can do those things from afar, she doesn't have a place in our world . . . .

This is the third movie in a month I have watched that did not go the way I expected . I was not disappointed , but I expected a lot more from the movie than it gave to me , I will try to tell you the things I noticed from the movie , maybe it will help you to decide if this movie was worth your money or not . So , what happened in the movie ? It takes us to the world of vampires , we follow a young girl who has been raised by vampires .

A horrendous film, ill-conceived and crude. The acting of Anne Heche and Vince Vaughan is so inferior to that of Perkins and Leigh in the original version they have to be seen to be believed. There was no reason to make this picture, which only highlights how accomplished and brilliant Hitchcock was, and how inimitable. Also, there's a creeping, pervasive insensitivity in the film that isn't there in the first film. Hitchcock's Psycho was scary and shocking, but one could genuinely feel for all concerned, even the pitiful Norman Bates.

Of all the movies in the history of movies I ca n't imagine someone sitting down and saying , I don ' t want to see this particular film ." I guess you could call it a cathartic process because the moment of truth came after the screening , "I don 't want to watch it ." I said , "So what's your answer to that ? " He was a bit taken aback . He actually didn't say what I was expecting him to , he said ," I want to see it . " That 's it !

From the start of `` The Edge Of Love '' , the viewer is transported to the striking world of `` Edge of Love '' , a love story featuring a couple who have been married for 30-some years, but still have many secrets buried in their past. However, it all begins with a very special night on the beach. In the heart-warming love story of `` The Edge Of Love '' , a beautiful couple have finally found each other, but not everyone is ready to accept the couple's commitment to one another.

It seems like an exciting prospect , a modern-dress `` Othello '' with Christopher Eccleston , who was so frighteningly right-wing in real life. I could imagine him as Falstaff , the rakish rake in Henry IV . But this is the `` Othello '' I can imagine. He was very tall , about five foot eight , he was blond and blue-eyed, and he had a long narrow head that slanted a bit to his left. He had a sharp nose with a small upturned tip, and a thin mouth with a straight line at the corners. On his forehead was a small blue-purple stain.

this is by far one of the most pretentious films i have ever seen. it is a tight slap on the face of some Indians who speak in English and were looking at the mirror. disgusting. the bubble gum version of the 1970s politics of the north Indian plains. the message - the educated English-speaking Indian tried to save the poor beggars of India in all earnestness. it ignores the fact that the poor beggars are also capable of and are saving themselves on their own.as a love story its okay. the problem is that the love story and character development is based upon a completely fraudulent version of politics.

Well, this latest version of Mansfield Park seemed to try and take the edginess of the 1999 theatrical version (outright copied some of the ideas from it in fact), but tone things down a bit to bring it more in line with the original story. Unfortunately, the result is a rather lackluster, and schizophrenic, production. And, as with all the other versions of Mansfield Park out there, the character of Fanny Price is no where to be found. Instead there is a strangely child-like, bleached-blond woman running around who never really fully develops as a character.

When King Kong stripped her of her top in the 1976 remake , I was breathless . I do n't know why she looked so hot , with her skin and her legs , but I was so shocked I could not believe it . So was everybody else . I saw her again in 1997 and she had grown a lot in the intervening years . I have seen her in more films than I care to remember so I can't tell you why she did it, or how she did it. It just did, and it did it very well.

This movie is a great film . The movie shows so many themes all in one amazing film . Driving, friendship, love, family, work, and so much more . I would definitely recommend this film . I recommend everyone to watch this and see how it can show a different way of living. I like the movie a lot , and it is a good movie because it has good acting , and it is full of good stories . but the problem is it is a bit slow . so I think it needs better editing and a better script .

This homemade horror movie tells the story of a dude who kills people using the motif of stories by Edgar Allan Poe. The local police have bungled the case for a few years, so now the FBI has taken over. They know exactly who the guy is, but apparently no one has thought to swing by his house, because that's where he's hanging out, running around in his vintage clothing and torturing the random locals. So FBI-chick gets kidnapped, which involves her father, the former lead investigator from the local police.

Everything about this movie is awful.You can tell in the first five minutes that this movie is going to be awful.You have the main character going to a party and then the movie cuts to a girl walking down the street, she's wearing an ugly dress. The scene cuts away to the main character walking into the party looking for his friends. The second time we cut to the main character walking down the street is even worse. This girl is so ugly and she looks like she could be one of the gang from The Goonies.The movie takes place in a party that is full of old people.

We all know that the world is full of dodgy , rip-off horror films . Some of these can be so bad they could only ever be seen on Netflix and Amazon . Others might only ever make it into the UK , and some of us never see a horror film ever again , and yet some of us would never watch one even if it did get released on DVD . That is why I was pretty impressed with the recent movie ‘ The Boy Who Harnessed the Night ’ . The movie , which was released over a year ago, and has now made its way to DVD and Blu Ray .

This was a great movie. Something not only for Black History month but as a reminder of the goodness of people and the statement that it truly does take a village to raise a child. The performances by S Eptath was outstanding. Mos Def and his singing was off the hook. Had to do a double take when I saw that was Rosie Perez there. But the supporting cast of actors and actresses made this worth watching. All the different stories they had was amazing. And how Nanny protected Jr and literally everyone else that was in her presence.

This was not a good movie!! Why do you people keep saying that? There is a nice little story going on and then some sexy girls and then BAM vampires!!! Why? Why are there vampires? Where did they come from? Also, what the hell?! There are all of these "super human" vampires but George Clooney and three other random guys dominate ALL of them. Quickly too. It's not like there was a long fight scene with lots of struggle. There was just three dudes from the bar killing these vampires like a fat man kills twinkies!

A small-town schoolteacher (Geena Davis) slowly begins to realize that she has suffered amnesia and really use to be a secret government assassin! Soon, there are men after her and a small-time private detective (Samuel L. Jackson).This was action-packed, with some great special effects and really funny one-liners (especially from Jackson). Although the action may get a little silly at times, who cares? After all, aren't movies meant to be a good time?Craig Bierko is fun as a ruthless villain. The movie itself was an all-around good time.

I have some of the older videos and dvds of Dr. Who . I 've played them over and over but always have to change the channel because the sound is always in low volume. This one has low volume but a lot of other ones don 't have low volume. It's hard to get to the other channels because they are always in low volume . Is there any way for me to turn the sound off when watching or listening to these videos on dvd's or videos on computer. It's not an issue with my equipment.

the plot of this movie revolves around this submarine builder who 's a real bastard and he wants to launch a super-nuclear attack so he starts using a super-secret experimental nuclear weapon to blast the shit out of everything, including people that he doesn't even know, because why the hell should he, he thinks that they are going to kill him. And when they try to kill him that is when the movie starts. And then he has to use the sub-base to launch the attack. And then he has to get the people to believe that it really was a nuclear attack or that he did it.

Wesley Snipes latest straight to video film is a convoluted mess, horribly reminiscent of Steven Seagal's latest works. The script is horribly written and makes no account for the low budget it is and tries to be too clever for its own good. Sadly too, Snipes has fallen into the trap of having an ADR voice double doing much of his dialogue, and an entire narration that comes every now and again through points in the movie. It's sad to see a guy of Wesley Snipes talent doing garbage like this film, and producing a tired and clearly bored performance, barely bothered to produce his own dialogue.

What I hoped for ( or even expected ) was the well known `` stop motion '' imagery and extreme attention to detail . However, that wasn't what I got . Not only is the film boring to look at , but you have to sit through several minutes of the same thing over and over again . I would have preferred to have seen it with a little more focus on what was being shown ( at the very least it could have been done in 3 hours ) and a little less focus on the scenery .

The mission to see the movie "The Cave" was a dream of a friend of mine after witnessing the highly dramatic trailer, full of flashes of a creature lurking in a cave, some young cave divers, and not much else. It's too bad that the movie didn't change much more than the trailer did.The immediate allure of a movie like this is the creature. What's he going to look like? Why does he live in a cave? How is this one supposed to be different from the other creatures we've been shown in movies like Alien and Predator and the Relic?

Chop Shop, the second feature from Ramin Bahrani, is a rare breed. It is an American film that tells a story not usually found in American cinema, the story of the of a minority living in poverty. It is a work of simple beauty. Shot on location in Queens, New York in the shadows of Shea Stadium, Chop Shop is neo-realism to the core. Featuring a cast of non-actors, it has more in common with Vittorio De Sica's classic Bicycle Thieves than anything made in the United States. There is no score or soundtrack, all the music and sounds are diagetic.

Norm ( an ) ally I do n't mind remakes . There are some pretty good ones out there , though , and I think some of them may even be good for me , though , as long as I know when I'm in the mood to watch them and I have the time and money . And of course , they always have to look like they have something new to offer that the original didn t . But , what about remakes that look almost exactly the same ? I don t have to say anything , does it ?

It 's hard and I did n't expect it ... But it 's really the worst film , me and my wife and the children are really upset and really unhappy , we have to leave and we 've heard the bad reviews . The movie was so bad , you know it 's not a film that can stand up next to anything else that was ever made . I 've been a big fan of horror since I started watching films on TV in the 60 's and I can n't believe that such a horrible film came out . What do you guys think ?

hello all Denver fans!i couldn't agree more with you guys! This show was so cool and cute, i i watched it as a kid in the late 80s. Among Denver are other favourite too, such as Care Bears and Rainbow Brite. I am 24 now, but it is still one of my favourite shows, and my favourite cartoon from the 80s. It brings back all the memories. The theme tune was great too, i get goosebumps whenever i hear it. It is sad that it lasted such a short time, but it has remained a firm favourite.

Since THE MAGUS is a confusing puzzle that really has no solution, one should sit back and enjoy the scenery. Set on a "remote Greek island," it stars a very uptight Michael Caine as a teacher working at a school for boys who gets caught up in mind games with local wacko/mystery man Anthony Quinn and his daffy girlfriend Candice Bergen. Quinn, looking like Pablo Picasso with white hair and striped sailor shirt, is actually pretty good but Caine looks like he's ready to explode. Bergen, although stunning, should NOT put on a British accent EVER.

I finally snagged a copy of Kannathil Muthamittal through Netflix and spent New Yera's Eve watching an amazing drama unfold. It began with Shyama (a winsome Nandita Das) getting married to Dhileepan in the backwaters of Sri Lanka and then a war takes over their romance. Shyama has to flee to India and is in a refugee camp as she gives birth to a child. Several years later we see Amudha, a playful well-loved child (P. S. Keerthana), who is the darling (or burden) of teachers, parents and fellow schoolmates alike, in a very How to Solve a Problem Like Maria sequence.

This film would be a great piece of history if in fact it was a real film of the Kennedy assassination. The are far too many mistakes in this film for me to point out. It is a film of the Kennedy assassination, but many of the important facts have been altered. There are missing scenes, and many of the scenes, after the president's limo passes the sign, don't fit in. Both Kennedys move noticeably slower then the other four people in front of them. Next time you watch this film look for things that don't add up, such as the Texas Gov.

Having been raised in Canada , I saw this short many times mostly on the CBC . I have seen these short in a number of other countries and a number of times I have had to tell people that these short were NOT real. I have seen these on the internet as well as in many of the news papers in Canada . Here is an example. I am going to take a few minutes to explain this short in its full context so people can see what I mean about this and why this short is so important.

I enjoyed the acting in this movie. Except for the sister. She reminded me of Janice on Friends. I could never quite believe she was anything but obnoxious. My main problems with the movie were the anticlimatic ending and the execution scene with the sister and brother-in-law. The guy falling out of the exploding car? Maybe if his hand had been blown off and he ran to the mute for help and she kissed him and rushed him to a hospital, maybe then I could have gone for the ending. I think somebody needed to die in the execution scene.

An hulking alien beastie crash-lands on Earth and soon wrecks havoc upon the populace first using his laser ray gun (which turns humans into zombies) and later using his jetpack in his never-ending quest to escape from a collapsing spaceship. While the movie is a bit slow at times and the plot is somewhat convoluted, you will definitely come out of the movie with a greater appreciation for the various alien species from which the movie takes its inspiration. IMDb summary: While attempting to return to Earth, the ship they crashed in is sucked into a wormhole.

Sweet young nurse Charlotte Beale (a charming performance by ravishing redhead knockout Rosie Holotik) goes to work at a remote rural asylum run by Dr. Geraldine S. Masters (the excellent Annabelle Weenick). Among the motley assortment of colorfully crazed patients are insatiable, aggressive nymphomaniac Allyson King (the luscious Betty Chandler), loopy Judge Oliver W. Cameron (a gloriously hammy Gene Ross), paranoid Vietnam veteran Sergeant Jaffee (nicely played by Hugh Feagin), gentle giant Sam (the amiable William Bill McGhee), and nutty old hag Mrs. Callingham (the supremely irritating Rhea MacAdams).

I 'm not here to tell you `` Armored '' is Kubrickian , Hitchcockian or Fellini-esquire . Nope . Well , let me share one of the main reasons why . Why . Why '' why '' why ''' '' why '' why ''' '' why . Why . Why . why . Why '' why ?

How any of you gave this more than 2 stars amazes me . I made an account on IMDb just to rate this movie and then realized i couldnt rate this movie more than 2.5 stars cause I didnt like the movie .I dont know if it was me but I just couldnt give this a 3rd of 5 stars . Maybe i was just being harsh on the movie too but i really thought this movie was sooo funny . I thought all the jokes were great . I thought the actor did a good job in the movie .

My husband wanted to watch this film because the review in the paper said that it was better than Fatal Attraction

He’s always told me that you need to have something to be happy, and this is one of them, because he was right when he told me, and I know it now. This is the movie he’s loved for the last few years, and it means so much to me that I can say it’s the only one of his that he ever told me was his favorite.

The movie eXistenZ is about a futuristic video game on a "pod" system that is almost like virtual reality. The only copy of the video game is damaged when an assassination attempt is made on the designer (Jennifer Jason Leigh). Unless it can be repaired, the many years and 38 million dollars spent on the development will all go to waste. The only way to repair the game however, is to actually go in the game with the only person she feels she can trust(Jude Law). This movie was pretty good, but doesn't really pick up until very late in the film.

This film is on my list of worst movies ever made. The story is disconnected and it is difficult to understand what is going on or the reason for the characters' actions. All films need to have an inner logic, and this film just doesn't have it - the story doesn't make any sense. To see Faye Dunaway, Christopher Plummer and Diana Quick wasting their talents in this movie is a crime. Faye Dunaway is the lucky one, because she plays the victim and gets killed early in the film.

Hello again, I have been thinking about this movie all my life. I saw it when I was 5 years old in Los Angeles, California in 1942. What a wonderful story of being good to one another, kindness, and charity. You forget it is the bugs relating to one another. It was just as if they were people. I love this movie and so do my adult children. Such beautiful color in this movie.I need to see this movie again. There is a story about an envelope in the movie, that I just can't remember the "why" of it.Thanks for listening.

i just glanced over another comment posted here in which the writer discusses the disturbing ways the teenagers in this story use guns. She also discusses the mental health problems that are prevalent in young people today. This is not surprising, considering that a staggering 90 percent of those in jails and prisons are mentally ill and that they make up almost 30 percent of the people who commit murders every year. One of these young people, the one whose name is never mentioned, shot himself in the head in his cell and is still in a coma from the incident.

Now , the sci-fi channel original company has made some pretty crappy films ( House of the dead 2 , for one thing) and it looks like they are going to try and make up for lost time this time out with the release of sci-fi/fantasy epic The Dark Tower . It’s being made by Lionsgate for Fox, which just announced it in mid-February. The film is reportedly about a madman with a gun who travels back in time and changes events in our history in order to change things up a little bit in our world, but this time around it will be set in the future.

OK , first of all , who in their right mind would remake Hitchcock and second , who would do this to an iconic movie series ? The only way this is going to happen is if Universal Studios or some studio that has already bought out the rights to this and is currently working on the 3rd movie to go along with it decides to do it and lets the world know why this movie is being made. I personally think this movie is going to be the worst thing to happen to American cinema , ever.

This was a surprisingly very good movie , and an interesting idea .. However , it was just a little underwhelming and had too much plot that was going on in the background . I thought the story could have been developed a little bit more and there were more things going on than just the romance . But I can understand why this is not a typical movie and it is not like anything you have ever experienced . If I have to describe this movie it is like a movie you would watch on TV when your mom is on the phone to tell you that your car broke down or you are out of gas .

A stupid movie, with a stupid plot. Feels like they threw every imaginable cliché in a blender. I especially "Liked" the part, where two teenage girls gets the french president to clean the water. Because we all know how dedicated America is to conservation of the environment. Kyoto, anyone?? And the french chef, who has apparently never seen or tasted a hamburger... This is why people think Americans have no culture. That, and the fact that we meet your kids when they come to Europe to "see the world" (i.e.

San Franpyscho : 1 out of 10 : So you want to make a serial killer movie . But your script for the story is too long ! So you need a serial killer movie with only 1-5 minutes of script and you need someone who can write screenplays for serial killers. That person is J.D. Salinger.
