It beats me how anyone can rate this film very highly. It is no understatement to call it far fetched. How the guy managed in such a short space of time to construct a wooden maze of underground rooms is quite ridiculous or maybe he was the greatest carpenter since Jesus. The obese sheriff played by Hoyt Axton looked like a refugee from the Jerry Springer show and I found the blonde female lead Jennifer Jason Leigh rather plain. We have an expression here in the U.K. 'mutton done up as lamb' which suits her perfectly.

I have had more boring stretches of 80 minutes in my life, but none are coming to mind right now. Hell Ride is based on the retro cult 70s theme that Tarantino brought back, and did right, in movies like Pulp Fiction and Reservoir Dogs. The problem with Hell Ride is, unlike PF and RD, the story is garbage and so is character development. How many movies does Bishop think he can blatantly steal from? The brief case in Pulp Fiction, the air gun in No Country, etc. etc. Speaking of Bishop what the hell is he doing acting in this movie?

Well , some people might go to see this to watch a trashy rubber and pvc clad bisexual vampire assassin. To be honest I have never seen one of these before. Some people would probably be turned off but it’s not the first time I’d seen someone get turned. And I am glad to say that they have made a nice film. I have to say I really enjoyed it. And it was really nice to finally see a film with a diverse cast. The whole film reminded me a bit of The Wolf Man.

Story involves ancient demon being released upon a small town on Halloween night . In all my life I have never heard of such a thing and the town's residents will not speak about it unless you are brave enough to venture into their home and find it for them. I'm not a brave man. I just like this book! This is the third book in a paranormal series that I love! I have not read any of the other books. I don't understand them either but I am looking forward to finding out why they are so different and how they tie in with the other two.

So I decided to watch the entire Puppet Master series , and had just watched parts 1-3 , which I really like , so now I decided to watch the 4th part , and of course it's pretty good , however, it did make me think that the movie has no logic whatsoever , from the ending , I expected more , but it was kind of predictable , it was like watching the movie by watching the script . Part 4 was quite a good one , although it was a little slow in the middle , so it was more interesting , but overall a very good one .

Age of Steel follows up the previous episode, Rise of the Cybermen, which was excellent in some respects, lacking in others. RotC had some positive elements, the most important being Tennant's excellent portrayal of the Doctor. Indeed, his sort of daft giddiness bears, to this writer, the shadow of Tom Baker's Doctor, with his sort of subconscious asides (as when ticking off time periods when Mickey is holding down the button in the Tardis), yet brings his own aloof superiority a la McCoy's Doctor as he lets events coalesce around him.

Would it be too trite of me to create a review of just me saying the word "STUPID" over and over again? Probably.This is arguably the worst movie I've ever seen. Seriously. There are better movies on Mystery Science Theater 3000. I saw this movie for the first time at a friend's birthday party when it was still in theaters. Even though it was actually *with friends* and at one of their *birthday parties,* I had to leave. I actually had to leave. I just excused myself and walked out.

This fantasy was utter garbage. I thought Michael Moore cornered the market on ridiculous anti-government movies, but this one was far worse than anything he ever did. No wonder critics of the British media complain it's driven by tabloid journalism. This movie is a left-wing loony's greatest fantasy come to life on the big screen. Anyone even slightly to the right of such rabid Bush-bashers should be appalled it ever got funding to be made. I'm sure it will do well in Syria, Iran, Pakistan, and North Korea, though.

"The Racketeer" stars Carol (deprived of the "e" that usually appeared at the end of her first name) Lombard as a woman thrown out of society because she left her husband for a concert violinist (Roland Drew) who has since become a down-and-out alcoholic, and torn between her love for him and the interest of New York crime kingpin Robert Armstrong (top-billed). It's virtually a compendium of what was wrong with the earliest talkies: stiff direction, immobile cameras, stagy acting and ridiculously slow-paced delivery of lines.

I'm not one of those folks who bemoans everytime a film based on an old TV show comes out. Rather, I usually run out and see it (If I had watched the show) and try to get nostalgic. But if anyone feels like running down films based on old shows, this is exhibit A (So you can actually say something more than just "McHale's Navy"). "Mod Squad" is dreary, tiring, and lethargic. At least the original series was angst riddled long before anyone knew teens could be so glum, making it groundbreaking.

With a cast like this , I knew the acting would be amazing . Still , I was cautious , but I did not see any major mistakes . Even the small things worked perfectly , and they played them perfectly too . My favorite moment of all is the last scene , when we see all the kids running and crying , with all their toys . I was happy with the acting too . The only thing I could say about this movie was that the actors should have done more research on this subject , and should have done it before they did the movie .

This movie is very disappointing for one who has read the book. As written by Rafael Sabatini, this was a clean cut tale of piracy in the Caribbean, and it would have made a grand motion . Also, it would have been very simple to make. All the action takes place aboard ship and on a deserted island. Unfortunately, the screen writers took the title from Sabatini then threw the rest of the book away. Even the name of the main character was changed, and his screen personality was completely different from that of the individual described in the novel.

Thomas Mann's controversial novel is the basis for the film "A Death in Venice. " Although in the book, the hero is an author, in the film the director Luchino Visconti who also wrote the screenplay, transforms him into a Composer. As such, the Author/Composer, Gustav Von Aschebach (Dirk Bogarde) on the verge of mental exhaustion is a burned-out artisan. After a long and successful career now seeks the peace and tranquility of a less hectic life. He decides to go on vacation to Venice where he hopes to rejuvenate his dwindling ambition.

Well, great costumes and a wonderful `feel' for Pre WWII Italy. But what happened here? Great actors...Kristin Scott Thomas, Sean Penn, Anne Bancroft, James Fox, Derek Jacobi ...if you can't get memorable performances out of this `A List' then the problem with this movie must be blamed on pitiful direction and an inadequate script. I rented this on DVD after having liked "Angels & Insects" (1995) also directed by Philip Haas. Yipes! I can hardly believe how dull this thing was.

This has to be the worst movie i 've seen this year .. and i watch a lot of cable movies . the plot was a total joke . the lead girl was a dumb bitch with no talent . i think you have to admit that that movie was not original or funny or any of that crap . you know what i mean . i think it was dumb , too . the movie was an average movie . not as good as the first season of south park or the first movie . but i think i can watch this one with the kids , since it's not supposed to be good .

Is there a fire fighter cliché that is NOT used in this film ? From the opening line `` I think I saw a shooting star,'' through the opening sequence and all the way through the second half of the film, `` the hero is the same man'' or in the words of Benji's dad `` the hero always wins''. There are a few exceptions. There is a fire truck at the beginning and then at the end of the film, but it is not used in a fire scene.

The back of the DVD for this movie raves, "Chey is the Quentin Tarantino of Christian Films." This isn't so much an insult to Quentin as it is to Christian films. This film is poorly written, stiffly acted and edited with a purposeless intensity. The scenes play out in a confusing and unrealistic way and are interspersed with some nice time-lapse photography. Flashbacks, fades to grey, freeze frames to tell the time (unimportant in the story) are all done with out any apparent reason other than to give the movie more cinematic credibility.

Cheap, gloriously bad cheese from the 80's, the decade of cheese. I watched this one first uncut and un-MST3K'ed, and it was pretty much laugh out loud funny even without the comments.The plot(such as it is) revolves around a post-apocalyptic world in which the AI robots revolted(sound familiar?) and destroyed pretty much everything, leaving a world in ruins with air so bad no one can breathe it. The few humans that are left act as slaves to an enigmatic being called the Dark One, which seems to be part computer and part organic being.

Imagine yourself trapped inside a museum of the dark middle Ages and a resurrected vampire and his maniacal sidekick are waiting on the other end of your phone to get you back. The game, being developed by a small London-based development studio, is being described as a mix of The Walking Dead and The Wolf of Wall Street and it's due to be released in October. We got a sneak preview of the Kickstarter project back in February and will tell you more about it later on, but you can see it for yourself in the videos below.

this is by far one of the most pretentious films i have ever seen . it is a tight slapstick film that takes itself far more serious than is needed and makes you feel dumb for laughing at it . it has to be the worst comedy ever made . it starts out with an extremely silly story about a cat who gets a fish . the cat has the fish in its mouth so as to save it from being attacked by a hungry fish and so it gives it to the cat who immediately throws it out in the ocean .

Do n't get me wrong this was fun to watch . It has some nice animation with exception of an early part which had to do with the characters and was rather disappointing. It does look like a pretty solid movie after the first 20 minutes but as I mentioned above there are some pretty big problems with the pacing. I also have to say that while it is a fun and entertaining ride I don't care for the character designs. There is nothing in particular about the characters that looks like a "cartoon" look, and it makes the movie feel a bit cheap.

It was September 2003 that I heard the BBC were going to resurrect DOCTOR WHO and make it `` Bigger and Better than ever before . . . `` The plan was to launch Doctor Who in America by 2005 and then move to London. This meant there was no time to lose and so we set about putting together the cast and scripts. It was the last chance to do something really special for children and the Doctor's friends. We needed to make something that could really be an adventure to be proud of. We needed to make a series that had a real sense of adventure .

Are we allowed to interfere with our fellowmen's everyday's life? Is it possible to intrude upon their intimacy, to penetrate the inwardness of their thoughts violating the privacy of their own home without being blamed? The director raises some doubts about these apparently solvable questions, almost sympathetic towards judge Jean Luis' destabilizing decision of coming to terms with his own inducted self-seclusion by means of fragments of lives embezzled by him. "Trois couleurs: Rouge" is based on the concept of "UNIVERSAL COMMUNICATION CONCEIVED AS THE HUMAN DESIRE OF AN OPEN WINDOW ON THE WORLD".

The first time I saw a commercial for this show was when my sisters were watching the Kim Possible movie, which came out a year ago. And I remember thinking, "Wow! That's awesome that there's another show based on a kid's TV show! It's so original!" Then I got to see it! And... I don't even know what to say! If you want to watch a really great show about robots, it's a great show, and this one's really fun! There are a lot of amazing things going on!

From the beginning of this film , with it 's `` The Lost boys '' rip off opening sequence , it's obvious there was never going to be a love story here. If anything, this story was always going to have a story that was going to have a love story to it, it's just that the filmmakers wanted to be able to put it in the film and make it feel fresh and new. This movie had all it needed for a successful movie, and it had all it needed for it to be an absolute success.

Gordon Scott with his well coiffed hair, hourglass figure and weird pidgin English has to be the worst of all the Tarzans. As for the other actors in this mess, they're on a par with any 4th grade elementary school drama class. I've seen Used Car Dealers in TV commercials who can act better. They make Clayton Moore look like Laurence Olivier! And where does Jane (the dull Eve Brent) get her lipstick and eyebrow pencils in the jungle? I realize these were made for kids but Wow! The plot line seemed OK but the director should have required more from his actors.

Watched this when it was first screened and then missed it when it disappeared of British screens. It showed a different side of Old Australia that we need to see more of. Good juxtaposition of old hand and young turk. Then the realism of the hard out back was fantastic. It was sadly missed. This show was a cold look at the old way of looking at Australia. Hard living and hard working. The young idealist clashing with the old practical head. Real Politicka fighting with the young upstarts of New Labour.

What a crappy movie ! The main character in this movie was supposed to be born and brought up in the middle of nowhere. But he has to leave his home to go to the big city for work. He has to live there for two years and he will go through a lot of troubles and problems. Then he will get married and live in the city for a year or two. Then he has to leave home to go back to his village. And this movie is made for all those people who have been waiting to see the movie with their family and friends.

"Mr. Bean", starring the legendary Rowan Atkinson, was a huge hit during its run in the 1990s, and I probably first saw it when I was around ten, shortly after it ended, so I was seeing reruns. I certainly wasn't much of a fan at the time, and didn't see too many episodes. I didn't really get into the show until my late teens, just a few years ago, which was when I finally watched every episode. Unlike before, it made me laugh many times, and since then, that has always been the case during repeat viewings of episodes!

After a meteorite lands in "Boston" (really somewhere in the Isle of Man), a hideous, fanged alien monster is released and is on the loose in a local girl's school, causing mayhem and turning the students into zombie-like creatures. This film is apparently a loose (and I stress loose) remake of the 1986 film with the same name, as it features the same monster but a different plot. Both films are terrible, but to the credit of the 1986 version, it was watchable. This isn't.

Maybe the target audience of this Disney Channel TV-movie will be pleased with it , but if any parents are surprised by the fact that their children will see what amounts to an assault on religion on the Disney Channel, they'll find this explanation on the Disney website: "The movie was meant to show that there's a lot more to life than what's on the surface, including the true power of faith in the human heart." Well, we can't say we're pleased by that, but that's the sort of thing that a good-hearted parent would say.

Barbara Stanwyck is a sheer delight in this wartime comedy , about a sailor invited to spend Christmas with a family in the country and forced to deal with the problems that result from an unexpected visitor. There are some lovely moments where you can just imagine her and the kids at Christmas, with the snow and mist. There's not much dialogue, but the scenes of family are lovely and Stanwyck is a joy in her role. This is a film that takes a lot of risks. There is a scene, early in the film, when the family dog dies.

This one is a hilarious diamond in the rough . The acting and plot are n't that impressive , but it will be one of those films which makes you go 'huh ?' in a good way. I really enjoyed this one and will go out of my mind to watch it at some point when I can catch it on DVD . First off , i'd like to say that this movie has a few flaws but not that big of them. It has some interesting ideas in it that could have gone in a number of ways.

What could have been an excellent hostage movie was totally ruined by what apparently looks like a bored director ... there were so many directions that the movie could have taken ... a vampire slash-fest was not one of these!!! The last 45 mins. or so results in the movie being an absolutely ridiculous waste of time. ...and sex machine?? ... you gotta be kidding me! The acting talents of the likes of Juliette Lewis and Harvey Keitel (not to mention George Clooney) are completely wasted in this nonsensical movie.

This is one of L&H's shorts most frequently cited as the first "real" L&H teaming and perhaps one of their best silent features. J. Piedmont Mumblethunder (Ollie) is a millionaire who has come to the docks to greet his nephew Philip, whom he's never seen. At first Ollie is laughing it up with everyone when this strange little man unboards and draws a great deal of attention to himself by the way he's behaving during his medical exam, but is quite humiliated when it turns out that this is the fellow he's supposed to be greeting.

i watched the longer version and could not take my eyes off the screen. 219 minutes passed and yet it seemed like only an hour had gone by. the characters were very believable and entertaining, and the photography was excellent. the story pulled me in and held my attention. i will definitely watch this again and again. this true story telling at it's best... not Hollywoods usual cheap thrills and skin deep glitz. i've seen a quite a lot of reviews on this movie. most seem to pan the film or give it faint praise.

Rachel and Chuck Yoman ( Valerie Harper , Gerald McRaney ) , decided the city is too busy and dangerous for their family of four. The Yoman family had just arrived from Chicago and didn’t have a lot of time to shop for a home, but they also didn’t know the city. And they don’t know it as well as Valerie Harper ( Rachel), who had come to Los Angeles to find work and a home. So the Yomas found an apartment in Hollywood. Rachel and Chuck decided to take the bus into L.A. in their car.

This film , also known as `` do n't look in the basement '' is actually not bad . It has some interesting moments and a few nice scenes , but it really just doesn't give anything of real interest . the film was made , as far as i understand , for the purpose of telling the story of how an american inventor , joseph zucker , and his son joe , developed a new type of air-conditioning which used to be called `` hot '' air '' . in the film there is a scene where the father and son go to see the inventor .

You know you 're watching softcore with the wrong attitude when the poor dubbing bothers you . I 'm okay. I don't think I watch softcore with the right attitude because I know it's stupid but I like to pretend to think I do because it makes me feel good. I also have a little crush on one of the actors in this movie. His name is Ryan Reynolds. I think he looks hot in this movie. I mean I really think he does, you can tell when I watch him and that's the same with the girl who plays his love interest .

If you and your friends find as much humor and enjoyment from horrible acting, jokes, props, and overall film making as me and my friends, you need to rent this.From simply reading the tag line and seeing how not funny it is, you should assume more not funny, poor quality, great, hilarious content through out. Its a tale of some of kids who defy every law of physics and reality and fly back in time through a modern day big screen TV to a world of dinosaurs who eventually become their friends.

Yah . I know . It has the name `` Sinatra '' in the title , so how bad can it be, right ? I love Sinatra ! It's just a great, simple, easy to use language for building RESTful Web-APIs. A little bit of OOP here and there is enough for the most seasoned programmer. I know that most programmers are more comfortable in Ruby (and there are quite a few Ruby projects coming from Sinatra). But you know what? I'm not! I'm more comfortable working in a language that was designed with OOP in mind.

With great expectations I went to see this film, Spain's contribution to the Oscar-race this year. Part from being completely pointless, banal, pathetic, badly written, edited, acted and directed, the movie is too long. It fails in delivering the "message" it tries to give, fails in its storytelling, clumsy historical settings and above all in its rhythm. There are some so extreme misfires I haven't seen in a movie in a long time (the story of Lucas whose dead sister lives in his head, the divine revelations, all that lizard nonsense).

Just when I thought nothing could be as offensive and/or irritating as a Billy Mays infomercial, I had the intellectually shattering experience of renting this piece of garbage. Peter Barnes and John Irvin should be brought up on criminal charges for smuggling this script into the public venue. The actors need to be charged as accomplices, serving no less than a lifetime away from the public eye.This production offers the disclaimer, "For dramatic effect, we have taken poetic license with certain facts", or some such inadequate statement to fully brace you for the absolute repugnant rewrite of a Bible story which needed no drama added.

Countenance ! Antoine Monot , in a copycat impersonation of Kevin Smith 's Silent Bob , keeps asking for it, but the audience keeps handing it to him. The first two episodes of The Last Man on Earth , which are about a man on a mission to find his sister in a land without people, have left us with more questions than answers. Now we're left with this:

Do we care? Will the show find itself with a cult following when it returns in January? And, for the first time in as long as any of us can remember, does this show make us care?

Whoa . I mean , whoa . I mean , whoa whoa.I saw this movie , waaay back when I was a little boy . I don’t remember the exact words , but I know the gist. Louis Gossett Jr returns to the well one more time as Chappy Sinclair who goes to Doug Masters ( Played by Stephen Root) and tells him about his father. Chappy is going to see Doug because Doug has told him that he's not there yet and also because Chappy doesn't believe Doug and tells him that he thinks Doug would never come back but that Doug will. Chappy tells Doug that he has to get back to work because he doesn't believe what Doug said and tells Doug that he thinks Doug might be going to hell.

The St. Francisville Experiment claims `` this ai n't no walk in the woods '' , a direct slap in the face to the men and women who've labored tirelessly over decades to bring St. Francis to the city, a place where so much good has come from their sweat and blood, and that's a real loss for those who still believe in the old ways. The St. Francisville Experiment, as you might expect, has a lot to do with money, and a lot to do with the people who make money from it, and the two don't go hand in hand.

At least for me. I have been following the career of Mr. Almdovar since the beginning and I was not crazy about this film. I think Penelope Cruz was miscast, the type of woman she is portraying does not look that good, she makes the character unbelievable. Also, the singing scene was just weird. I do not get the point and the lip-sync was awful.As Spaniard, another thing that drove me nuts are the accents. Why people coming from the same place have such a different accent? The difference between the two sisters is notable and makes no sense.

I love this movie . At first , I did n't expect much of this movie since I did n't expect much from this movie . In fact , I liked this movie and I think this movie is must see . If you are interested to watch this movie , this movie might be a better than your expectation . Now I must say I liked this movie . The movie is great . I must say I must say . I would have been about 11 years old when this movie was first released. All these years later at 37 and I had no qualms hiring it on DVD. Great entertainment for all ages. And what about the song The Rainbow Connection? See:Why are there so many songs about rainbows And what's on the other side? Rainbows are visions, but only illusions, And rainbows have nothing to hide. So we've been told and some choose to believe it I know they're wrong, wait and see.

This is a poor, poor movie. Full of clichés, unrealistic moments: punching the air in celebration after putting a fire out, never mind that someone's lost their home and possessions! !, announcing a pregnancy in a bar along with all your mates before telling you in private first, walking on the roof of a burning building for no apparent reason, the stereotypical funerals and strained relationships, the very dodgy, cheesy music at the end, the unrealistic treatment of the girl who was rescued from her apartment, the very unrealistic explosion from that same apartment!!

If you can stomach the campiness, this movie should make you laugh out loud several times. It did for me, at least. I'll only mention one of my favorite elements: the "underwater shots" of the "fish" "swimming". The sound which accompanies those shots is great too.One last note: William Katt is actually a pretty decent actor. I hope he gets another day in the sun; watching him as "The Greatest American Hero" was a fun part of my childhood a couple of decades ago, and he hasn't been very visible since.

It seems at least vaguely possible that this movie provided a bit of inspiration for `` The Sopranos , '' '' '' a series about a fictional New Jersey crime family, '' although I don't know much about it other than that it was released in the late-1990s. I do know that there are some real-life Mafia families in America who are very similar to those in `` The Sopranos ;'' they don't even have to wear wigs in public. But, as a practical matter, it's not an exact parallel.

Well , this is about as good as they come . There are arguments about whether Hitchcock was only a film-maker to a small group of fans , but that is a debate for a different book . What can be asserted is that Hitchcock was a very great director , and a master at conveying emotions . We all love to hate Hitchcock, but in fact he was a genius at conveying human feeling in the way that only he could . He was always at the top of his form . And I love him for that . I think he is a great master , and a much better artist than most directors .

Bog Creatures shows exactly what can happen when very enthusiastic people get together with a little cash, some knowledge of movie making, a mixed bag of aspiring actors, and a lot of determination, yet all without the necessary knowledge and skills to pull off anything more than a fairly poor looking After School Special (in a bad way, not a nostalgic good way). I mean this is so-so quality home movie / student film stuff if you want to pass it around to family and friends for free. Thankfully, I found it in a discount bin somewhere.

OK, so this is horror? I get horror - but I don't get horrific. Black & white is artistic but too much black is overkill.....enough said about the lighting. The story - a serial killer ....... lot's of these around. It's been done in the past and yes, it will continue to be done.....but I hope not. My question is , when will the audience tire of reliving this maddening dilemma? I guess the director thought he would do something different - portray killing children. Well that's been done before too.

`Rock star' is not on its way to any `stairway to heaven' category as one of the best rock films of all time, but it does make you `jump' from time to time because of its high-level energy. The film's theme is on a die-hard rock group fanatic who actually becomes the lead singer of his favorite band. The story is based upon the true story on what happened to the heavy metal band Judas Priest. If you think this movie is filled with a witty screenplay and intellect direction- then you got `another thing coming'.

If anyone tells you this picture is just terrific they probably have something to do with either making it or profiting from it. This film is a real loser and it copies situations from big budget horror movies and not to mention soundtracks to. I wouldn't recommend this one to my worst enemy. It is a low budget movie with amateur actors. It looks like it was filmed for a film contest. The acting is terrible and it wouldn't surprise me if the script was written by a Hee Haw script writer. My family laughed at it. A Grade ZZZZZZZZZZZZZ all the way.

- Contains 1 spoiler , market with : * * * * * -Not presenting itself as yet another remake or remake/reimagined/remastered version of a game that was first released in the early 90s, or even in the 80s, this is a game that seems to be taking its cues from the Japanese games that it draws from, but without any direct influence. * * * * * - I think that the game does it well, and I think that the gameplay itself is fun. It's just that I really do wish it would have made the story and characters a little more interesting.

There are very few films that are able to tell such a complicated story on so many levels as well-made American horror film, The Devil's Double. The story of a family's descent into the sinister realm of satanism and blood-letting through the eyes of one of the central characters, is a tale filled with religious imagery, demonic possession, and a whole lot of darkness. It is also a story that can be told from several perspectives. In The Devil's Double (1926) director Jacques Feyder tells the story of a mysterious family who move from the suburbs of Pittsburgh to a small cabin in the forest.

Oh , there are many worse Wayne movies . This movie is edited poorly but it has a campy element that has always been there. This movie is still entertaining, even though the editing has some problems. The music was fine . The dialogue is funny and the acting is aces. I give it 9.8/10

The problem with Wayne is his over-the-top nature, and the way that he doesn't take criticism from anyone but himself , especially from himself . He always wants to tell us what the movie he's doing is about, but in reality he has no idea, he just likes to be right .

This is another of Robert Altman's underrated films(let's be honest, the only movie he's made that really didn't work was Ready to Wear), and Sandy Dennis gives a spellbinding performance in it.She is far better here than she was in "The Out of Towners". The material, I will admit, is beneath the great director Altman and the extraordinary actress Dennis, but that hardly matters anyway.As long as there allowed to do their thing and do it well, just about any story will do.

A group of young filmmakers with virtually no budget set out to make something clever and original -- and while it was well-received at the Sundance Film Festival, the film has never been seen in the general public. Now, a new trailer of the film gives us an idea of how far the story has come from it's origins, and the film has also gained a cult following since its release last year. The story centers around a group of friends at an unnamed university in the early-to-mid 2000s, all of whom are in their late 20's.

Why couldn't the end of the movie have been Sean Connery's men fighting the French instead of the Germans. Ever since the French had occupied Algeria in 1830, the tribes from Morocco and those of Algeria were making raids on the French military and civilian settlements. This movie could have been a continuous of that historical aspect where the French had seize the Rasuadli so his followers would not be raiding Algeria, and then his followers would have attacked the French to free him.The movie is still stereotypical of shootouts between the Germans and the Americans.

There's a good story well hidden and never really used! The film is short and overly dependent on action and thematic photography; somehow, character and story development have been forgotten. What is left is muddled and superficial.Turn off your brain and watchyou will probably find that the time goes quickly enough, but unless you are the sort of person that finds soaps deep and meaningful, you are going to get no real satisfaction from this film.Watch only if you have nothing better to do and then only if someone else pays for the video rental.

The film begins in Latvia just after WWI. Being a history teacher, I knew that multinational troops occupied much of Russia during this time. There was serious concern about the spread of Bolshevism and the troops were there ostensibly to protect their nations' interests. However, some times they flew missions or had armed conflicts with the Communist army, as the nations involved really wanted to see the so-called "Whites" win. However, the Whites were deeply factionalized--some wanting the return of a czar, some wanting a republic and some wanting something in between.

This movie was beyond awful, it was a pimple on the a*s of the movie industry. It may be, although there are still two or three I've missed. This film constructs an interesting nocturnal cityscape, reminiscent of so many foggy scenes from Sherlock Holmes movies, and populates it with sinister, Kafka-esque characters. Into their midst, the movie drops Mia Farrow, who sounds like she's still playing Hannah, and Woody Allen, who seems to be reprising his nebbish role from Play It Again Sam. Are we supposed to laugh at his stammering and hand-wringing? I suppose I would, if the rest of the movie were clearly a comedy, but it's not.

Personally, I have no problem with the acting, nor the script. I do have a problem with the giant bird. It was simply AWFUL. Plain and simple.One's first impulse is the roll around laughing when one sees it. What were they thinking!? Budget be damned. The monster bird was a monstrous joke.Of course, in my opinion if the producers could obtain actors such as Ankrum, Corday and Morrow, then they would have the special effect people come up with a much better beast. Oh well. What is done is done.

When I was five years old , it was my favorite television show . I remembered it was on channel 5, but I couldn’t remember its name. It’s a British series which follows a family during the 1970s. One of the episodes, I think, was about a woman, who was in love with my dad.

I must admit I wasn't expecting much on this movie. I was surprised I truly enjoyed it as much as I did. The script wasn't oscar material, but it wasn't horrible either. The acting was great by Mark Wahlberg. Jennifer Aniston had a great supporting role, and looked lovely as ever. What made this movie for me was the music. If you do not like 80's glam metal or hair bands, then you probably wont like this movie. Its all about being a rockstar. Some cliche's were present, but didn't bring down the movie at all.

I can envision the writers of this story thinking up this script:1.Let 's make a serial killer movie like Se7en!2.Let 's make the movie a romantic comedy like Say Anything!3.Let 's have an old lady in a nursing home kill the hero.4.Let 's make the movie where the killer goes on a killing spree, but that doesn't matter, he'll be the only character and everyone will like him.5.In the last scene, the killer goes back to his normal life, so the audience won't realize it's him who killed the hero, but it's really him the whole movie.

A gaggle of unpleasant city dwellers descend on Le Touquet for a week 's holiday . Stories intertwine , characters cross paths , and relationships are tested to the extreme . When the guests first arrived , they quickly realized they had landed in "the wrong place" . . . for a holiday . . . Le Touquet ! Le Touquet is the most beautiful island in the world. It is located at the northernmost tip of the Mediterranean Sea , and its white houses, olive trees, gardens and beaches are a dream come true for all lovers of beauty.

I just got back from "AGS". After seeing it, I'm convinced that no matter how much it's written how he extensively researched the film, Stone NEVER has watched an NFL game in his life. Great cinematography ? Give me a break. The game montages were almost unviewable and 90% of the other shots in the film were close-ups. Was there ANYTHING in this movie that wasn't brought up in "North Dallas Forty" ?Aging star player ... check. Young hot shot .... check. Painkillers .... check. Owner who doesn't "get it" .... check.

I had to watch this movie for a film class , I suffered the whole time through . I am sorry for this review as i really liked this movie but i would like to know how much of the plot was true or if it was just for entertainment . I give it 6.5/10 as it does not fit the movie genre and it is not even a horror movie . If you can like this movie then go watch it. This is not a bad movie . Sweet , rich valley girl develops crush on a punk from the alley and when her snobby friends disapprove of him she goes out to meet him for sex, and he falls for her too. The trouble is that he has to take his clothes off before he has any chance with her. The next morning, as they walk to town, the girl is still trying to convince the boy to give her a chance. He takes her home to his place where he gets naked and takes a bath while the girl watches.

MINOR SPOILERSMisunderstood classic remains one of Henson's finest and most personal films. It may seem funny to call a movie as beloved as this one 'misunderstood,' but people do seem to remember this one mostly for Jerry Juhl's snappy screenplay and Paul Williams's knockout songs. Now while these things are admittedly great, as is the movie's formal playfulness (screenplay-within-the-screenplay, film break, etc. ), what distinguishes 'The Muppet Movie' from the other Muppet films is the serious, wistful thread that runs through the picture.

Two years after leaving the small town of Grover 's Bend due to encountering the Krites , Brad Brown returns to his former home to find his wife has disappeared. However, before he can seek her assistance, he must find his way out of the village without being noticed. After a day of trying to return home, he is spotted by the locals, and Brad's only chance of getting back to his home is to hide. While in hiding he meets a girl named Jodie and begins to discover secrets of his past and why he is being sought.

When moviegoers hear two popular villains/characters will be fighting , they flock to the theaters to see how the battle will unfold. What’s different this time? Well, there is a lot more than the usual fight to be seen this time and you should be prepared to be overwhelmed by all the action, drama and drama that unfolds. The two leading heroes in the film will be the two biggest baddies ever in the movie world. Dwayne Johnson and Vin Diesel, who has been in action films for over 100 movies, have been making the most entertaining movies for audiences.

The wind and the lion is a marvelous sweeping motion picture . It is a monument to what filmmaking once was and what the world can be. The wind and the lion is a sweeping motion picture. It is a monument to what filmmaking once was and what the world can be. But it is also a movie about a young boy and his father, his grandfather, and his grandpa and his grandfather, and his great grandfather who all lived together on an old farmhouse on the Mississippi River for a long time.

I hardly know where to begin in writing about this gem, except to say that it represents young Buster Keaton at the peak of his powers and must certainly rank with the half-dozen best short comedies ever made. THE GOAT is twenty minutes of smoothly paced, expertly photographed, beautifully executed gags; two reels of non-stop comic invention driven by an unmistakable undercurrent of paranoia and yet somehow leading to a happy ending -- which wasn't always the way with Buster's comedies. (See COPS for one case where Fatalism ultimately got the better of him, or ONE WEEK for the victory of Defeatism.)

If you 're in the middle of a ferocious war and it 's still not clear that you 're going to win, you 're going to lose. " - General David Petraeus

Thursday, August 06, 2007

The American people have been waiting with bated breath for some time now to know who and what was behind the attacks on September the 11th, 2001 in the US. There was no evidence that Al Qaeda operatives had carried out the attacks; nor was there any evidence to indicate they had anything to do with the bombings at the Twin Towers and The Pentagon.

I saw this turkey in the theater , but I had a good time . The special effects are n't too good but they work . And I like the music . But the movie is very boring . I don't get what they are trying to say . It should be fun . It is just not. I do not recommend it for children . They are not mature enough for a movie like this . For adult viewers . Go to the movies . Just don't come home. You can find it at Blockbuster or any other Video Store . Or buy it for a dollar .

I love Ustinov 's distinctive , literate narration . And the photography is quiet nice . We put the film on our top-five lists. But we have to admit that we are a little disappointed by it . The plot is not so interesting. I think the film will lose in the public eye , it is too long and boring. But Ustinov is very powerful . I know that Ustinov had been suffering from diabetes for a very long time , but the story of how he did not give up even when he fell from the cliff is truly inspirational .

River 's Edge is an excellent film and it 's a shame that it has n't made more of a splash. When it came to the screening of this, I was really pleased to see the audience response. They cheered the ending of the film, especially when the last words of the film were given. And they cheered for their favourite character too. We had a good response, and I'd like to thank all of you. I'm pleased that the film is getting such a good response and I look forward to hearing your comments and thoughts about the film.

It´s all my fault. They all told me I should avoid seeing this movie because I´m a huge fan of the old TV-series. They were right. While production values are good and the actors themselves (including "don´t look now") Julie Christie aren´t that bad, the whole film displays a cheekiness and self-conciousness that clearly is without any justification. A comparison between the Karloff "Mummy" and "The Mummy Returns 2000" comes to my mind. In fact Belphegore 2000 owes much more to the new Mummy films than to the old series.

I have had the opportunity to catch this independent film and was impressed with it , despite the lack of budget. I will not be giving any of my reviews out but will leave them here because they will be good , I have a few of these as gifts for my daughter and I think I am going to give them a test run. It is good to know it is being released on DVD as well. I think it will be worth the rental if you can get a copy. The trailer looks very good. I will have to see the movie when released.

I can only think of one reason this movie was released. To capitalize off the upcoming fame of Guy Pearce. This movie has no merit at all and needlessly trashes Errol Flynn's memory. The homosexual encounter was pure speculation. The disdain shown for Flynn in this movie is palpable. An easy way to slander an actor who died years ago. Horrible and embarrassing. Very disappointing. Don't waste your time on this utter trash. Watch My Wicked wicked ways if you want to learn about this fine actor or read his autobiography. This movie is NOT the way.

* * * * * I reveal two 'twists ' at the end of the film . Do not read what follows with the expectation that anything will happen. * * * I have to warn you, the plot of the film is so complicated, and the story so complicated, that there is no way I can reveal it fully here. Suffice it to say that what is done in this film is not what I had planned or expected to do; in fact, it is very far removed from the kind of films I usually work on.

Zachary Scott does what he does best, i.e., plays a worm, in "Danger Signal," a 1945 B movie also starring Faye Emerson, Mona Freeman, and Rosemary DeCamp. Scott plays a writer who kills women after he gets their money. On the lam from his last murder, he rents a room in the home owned by the Fenchurch family, Hilda (Emerson) and her mother (Mary Servoss). Scott throws himself at Emerson, and she's dazzled. Mid-romance, her younger sister Anne (Freeman) comes home from a medical treatment.

A film by Almodovar- sends a tingle down my spine every time . The capitalized print which opens the Spanish version has been dubbed in English, but it still has a hypnotic effect on me. The story of how a young boy becomes the first person to be teleported from one time to another is pretty much an adaptation of the Stephen King novel The Stand. This movie was made in 1985 in Spain. I am not sure how long this movie was shown to the American public, but I know it was shown in theaters in the US a couple of times in 1986 before it faded into oblivion.

Like all of the very earliest films, this "movie" is very, very short--lasting about one minute! So, because of its brevity, it's not really possible to compare it to more modern films. But, for its time, it's actually a very remarkable film. Much of this is because the prints were hand painted--making Annabelle appear red and other colors as she does her amazing dance. I've actually seen two different versions--one where she is red and another where she changes color throughout.

The positives: It's shot pretty well. Has some interesting peripheral characters. Likable main character (albeit weak).The bad: Plot/story. Editing. Characters wasted. Jessica Alba.I'm a fan of sappy movies, but this movie is cringe-inducingly bad. I don't understand how anyone can hand over $12M to this Guy Jenkin. And before I go any further, I just want to say that I don't dislike Jessica Alba--I really wanted to like her in this film. However, Jessica Alba in her fake accent and her model poses made me miserable.

I watched this film mistakenly thinking that it was that other radio station zombie flick. The shonky production values and low-rent cast soon gave away that this was another one of the those cheap sci-fi channel style knock offs.The central performance from Bill Moseley is initially quite engaging as the dubious radio shock jock but as the film goes on becomes less and less convincing as he is actually required to act. The rest of the cast have little to do other than look concerned and have no depth whatsoever.The cinematography is dull, flat and completely uninspired, like so many of these kind of films.

Altioklar's populist approach manifests itself in all his titles, from the worst to the best. He doesn't care (or has no clue) about art, all he cares is to make people think they've got a kick in the groin by watching his movies. The problem is, the effort is way too evident, and as events unfold with all the senseless exaggeration kneaded into them, the effort fails badly.On this "Turkish" movie (who knows where the original or originals were made, since it felt extremely Hollywoodish to me), Altioklar is trying to be some sort of Tarantino.

What can I say?? This movie has it all...Romance, break-ups, rich kids, punks and preps. This is my all time favorite movie that I can recite line for line....I remember when it first came out, I was 14 and couldn't get in....so finally got to see it on cable... I was hooked! Wanted to move to California and be a Valley Girl.. (Hey, I even remember the song by Moon Zappa, do you?) Tried in vain for years to get the never produced soundtrack...now you can find it on rhino records....

I watched this film with a sort of dangerous fascination, like a hedgehog trapped in the headlights. There is no doubt that (even if you enjoyed it) it's a bad movie, but the important question is why? It has a good cast; it's lively; it's prepared to tackle sex head on, with some of the characters actually getting some of it here and there, which is unusual for a British comedy. It also has Johnny Vegas and Mackenzie Crook, Marmite performers agreed but they've have had their moments in the past.What it's principally lacking is charm.

I saw this film on 19SEP2009 at the Cambridge Film Festival. The Beagle's only in a couple of short flashbacks, the whole thing is about Darwin's life from 1841 to 1859, when he was ensconced in Kent with his growing family, 200+ pages of Origin had already been drafted and he was wondering whether to complete the book. The script is based on Randal Keynes's book Annie's Box (Annie, Charles's daughter, died when she was 10). It is mostly a family drama, but does include sex scenes - however, the participants are married, both on and off screen.

It´s long time that I and my wife didn´t see such a boring thriller . It´s definitively NOT a gripping and exciting story, but for me, it´s a good opportunity to get out of a dull and boring story. As a result, it´s very disappointing and disappointing me. If you want to have something different and different from what´s on the surface, this is an excellent choice. But don´t waste your money, it won´t become your favorite story, but something else . I'm sorry, but for me, this story lacks of a certain something.

There really is only one reason to watch this barely adequate and utterly predictable movie about an uptight chef Kate Armstrong (Catherine Zeta Jones) whose life changes when she inherits her orphaned niece Zoe (Abigail Breslin) after her sister is killed in a car wreck. And that reason is to watch Aaron Eckhart (Nick) who, with his floppy haircut and appealingly laddish attitude, looks good enough to slap between two slices of organic Pannini and eat with an olive oil and balsamic vinaigrette dip and a few finely diced sun dried tomatoes. He reminds me of Sean Bean.

If you haven't read Tolkien's masterpiece; prepare yourself for maybe the best movie experience ever! If you have however... After having read the books several times, over many years, I have come to love the characters and story, and feel I Know it intimately. I have my own personal vision of The Shire, Hobbiton and the character-gallery. Thus for me the movie was a disappointment. Why? It dictates the appearance of the characters (unavoidably), it changes events, it removes important storyline, it removes not-so-important storyline.

I had enjoyed the Masters of Horror Series until I came upon this infantile dung heap . This anti-Bush propaganda piece has to be the stupidest attack on GWB ever produced on any network. I can't say I agree with everything this program did or said; but it was certainly the dumbest attack on the US Government and the American public from a non-US government source. It's not like the government is doing anything worth mentioning. It's the American public that are being attacked: the Bush administration and all of its minions. This program didn't do anything, it attacked the United States.

It 's hard to write 10 lines of copy about this so-so film noir . There just is n't a lot of atmosphere, or even a mood. And the whole plot isn't particularly interesting either. But all that really matters is that the film is enjoyable to me because of the cast and the way they work. That is the real problem with 'Tango & Cash' . It has to be one of the most boring films I have ever seen , yet the casting is good . I have to wonder if that is why it 's such a failure.

Hey what a great idea to open a film - show someone`s home movie . Drama schools must be full of idiots ! , there they are taking drama lessons hoping to become the next big thing in Hollywood when all you have to do is send a home movie to a studio . Hey I think I`ll send in the video of my wedding and call it THE GREATEST ROMANCE EVER SEEN or send in a tape of my honeymoon and call it THE GREATEST SEX EVER SEEN . Oh hold on I`m not married and I`ve never been on honeymoon !

... when we all know, no one does it like the BBC.Being an avid fan of this sort of Sunday night watching, i was quite looking forward to this. How disappointed was I! In the first thirty seconds I didn't think it was looking promising and after two minutes i was finding it hard to watch.However me and my friends persisted only to find bad acting and a complete misunderstanding of half of the characters. The plot was hurried to the extreme and the make up and costumes gaudy and very 21st century in a 'bbc robin hood' style.

This is by far probably the worst film Al Pacino could have starred in. The movie had no real plot. It kind of careens into 24 different directions. It seems that the target audience for this film are people from gambler's anonymous.Mat Mcconaughey's character is not believable enough to be Pacino's protégé'. So he won a few bets for some degenerate clients as a sideline to a shitty job recording on a 900 service. Does that automatically supposed to convince an audience of his skills? It was just plain stupid to think of.

This is one of the best action films I have seen. Geena's portrayal of the tough as nails, 'Charly'/gentle mother 'Sam', was superb and Samuel L Jackson just keeps you laughing all the way through, with his classic one liners. Sure, there were a few holes in the actual story, but this fast-paced flick keeps you on the edge of your seat to the end.I felt Geena was a perfect choice for the role of Sam/Charly and her versatility as an actress is evident for her role as the mother in the recent movie 'Stuart Little'.

This movie makes `` Glitter '' look like `` Schindler 's List . '' Tarantino and the Weinsteins really need no introduction. The film was a critical smash last year, the year after their '' Kill Bill '' film, and its box office take has kept the Weinsteins going for the past six years, making the film worth more than $1 billion worldwide, and more than $20 million for each of the pair. This latest installment in the Tarantino-Weinstein series has the blood and thunder of Robert Downey Jr. and Samuel L. Jackson.

I was actually fairly surprised to find out a movie based on the Far Cry game had been created. The story here is not something I would consider to be a strong point in the game universe. No worries though as in typical Boll fashion the story in the movie has very little to do with the game it is based on. Now I understand that certain liberties need to be taken to make a transfer from one form of media to another but it seems like he really just doesn't even try to make a connection.

Are you kidding me ? This is quite possibly the worst , amateur movie I 've ever seen . The only good thing about the movie is the special effects, the rest was awful . The acting sucks , the plot is too short , and there 's a lot of plot holes that I 'm sure they could have filled in more detail. I 'm pretty sure you mean "The Thing". I just saw it. It was awesome. It was pretty funny too. I don 't really think it is that bad. It's the best one in the series.

This is a totally awesome movie ! If you have n't seen it yet , you damn well should . The acting is pretty good as well, and it is really a very good fantasy film to watch . In fact , I think that this is the greatest fantasy film ever made , the greatest film ever made . I loved it , and I cannot wait for the movie to be released . I can't really say much about this movie . In fact , if you have not seen it yet , then I can not say anything , but , if you have , then you should probably see it .

This owes a great deal to the plot of CAPTAINS COURAGEOUS. Although he is quite grown up, it is partly the story of a wealthy lad who is shanghaied as a crew member aboard a cargo vessel and becomes a man in the process. Moran of the title is a boyish young woman also brought up on a vessel owned by her father. When the cargo burns, she and crew members are evacuated to our lad's ship. However, the captain has smuggling on his mind and his intentions are not honorable where Moran is concerned.

I love pop culture, but I was a little apprehensive when I first heard about this. Then, I seen an episode, and I LOVE IT! I was a little upset when I found out that Christopher Eccelson would no longer be playing Doctor Who. He was probably the best one they've had. He fits the character so well. It's sad to see him go. I really don't think that the new guy is going to pull off the doctor as well as Eccelson.I think everyone can overlook the cheesy effects in some spots and the creatures, such as the darleks.

I believe the reason this movie did not get the recognition it deserves is because of the many misconceptions of the story. The story of this movie is, in fact, based on a true story which happened a few years into the 21st century. It has nothing to do with aliens invading and taking over the planet. It has to do with a man who went to work every day for many years with little to no sleep. He was one of the millions of Americans who work in an extremely stressful job for many years, never knowing what to expect in the future.

Who doesn't love the muppets?! Impossible it is to watch them without getting some kind of warm, fuzzy feeling inside. So, I guess what's important is that this movie seemed to very successfully capture what makes the muppets so special. I don't remember much about the details of the plot but the various moments and characters in the film I recall quite fondly. In fact, there was quite a nostalgic atmosphere to the whole movie but without being self-conscious in any bad way. Refreshing for someone who possibly gets too hung up on meticulous details and technique; the "magic" transcends all that other stuff.

This movie is a haunting telling of the life of the author and poet, Mishima. It jumps around through his past, through his last day, and through some of his stories but is expertly constructed as it moves from section to section. It captures the flavor of the man, his work and of his times...the difficult 1960s.I think the most wonderful parts (literally, full of "wonder") are the excerpts from his works. The sets (especially designed to work with the camera) are amazing....stylized, beautiful and effective.

Even my five year old was bored.Very predictable, and overacted. This movie couldn't make up it's mind as to whether it was slapstick, or wry commentary on the state of "pee -wee" sports.Characters were underdeveloped, could have done more with the connection between father and son both coming from an orphanage.Did not like the reference regarding the goalie slipping the laxative to his teammate...very mean spirited for a kid's movie.Typical "Mafia" behavior was boring and stereotypical.The dog, however, was so darn cute!!! !

If you 're a long-time fan of the Doctor and you cringed when you heard they were making another series of The Doctor Who series and that it would start in 2011, the good news is you're still in the majority. We're told by the show's head, Steven Moffat, that there will be seven new episodes in all. They will be released on DVD every year. There will be an anniversary special as well. There are no details as to what this will be like as of yet. Moffat recently revealed that he believes there should be more Doctor Who in Doctor Who.

I saw this film at the tender age of 18 with a group of friends . Its reputation had preceded it and I had been raised with a high expectation of what it could accomplish. It had everything a movie can have: good acting, a compelling plot, and heart-wrenching emotional depth. I have seen the movie over 25 times since I was a child and every time it left me feeling the same emotion. There are no other movies in my memory that I have been able to connect to as intensely. The only other film that has the ability to make me feel this strongly is my first kiss.

It's clear that for this film they wanted to have the story line driven by the characters. But immediately the story line causes you to dislike the new main characters. The fly-over of the island and dinosaurs below lacked any impact at all and almost looked like a cartoon. The all action entrance to the island is merely a rehash of parts from JP 1 and 2. The story-line is predictable to the point of annoyance and it's entirely unsatisfying end left me feeling cheated. This gave me with no option but to award the film 3/10!

No doubt that the indie flick Eddie Monroe is one of the better independent films I 've seen in a long time and one that should be required viewing for any fans of independent cinema. At only a little over 50 minutes long it is also the best short film I've seen since the short film that premiered at the Sundance Film Festival in 1999, "Diary of a Wimpy Kid." Eddie Monroe, a low budget, low budget film, has the power to put a smile on anyone's face and make them forget just how crappy the movies are these days and take them for what they are.

Ah, another movie with motorcycles, hell's angels posse and Steve A-Lame-o as the not-so-cool car driver. This movie does not rely on story but lots of drinking, pot smoking, and lots of moronic acts. Steve's rendition of a dying cat during his "I love what I know" serenade had me vomiting for hours. Bike chick Linda (rrrr) makes out with everyone! Fats did the best acting since he just grunts and makes sounds. I also dare you to try to make out what Banjo is saying. "You messin' wit private stock."

Inappropriate . The PG rating that this movie gets is yet another huge misstep by the MPAA . Whale Rider should be banned from theaters because this is not an educational film as far as I know . What they did to this movie shows that they are completely incompetent and have no clue how to do ratings . It's so bad that the MPAA thinks they can ban this movie and that they are the only one to do so . What they've done to this movie is absolutely disgraceful . There is no way this film should get an 8 rating , let alone a PG-13 rating .

I watched this movie and all I can say is this...I am not a film student, nor am I some artsy intellect who tries to look for a deeper meaning into everything that I don't understand. However, IF I were to do that with this film, my thoughts would be...Yep! He's on drugs and I can picture it now...he was tripping one night and sat around with his buddies laughing and saying stuff like, hey...wouldn't it be funny if nuns really could fly?

I am writing this review simply because I am a huge fan of the book , Prozac Nation , and it really caught my eye when I read through the book and I was really intrigued. It was the book that made me go in and dig for the answer as to why some people are able to overcome their depression. And after reading the book I felt that the answers that were provided were not completely satisfying. I had to read more to find out what was the real answer and why is the answer not the answer. And I found the answer.

Creepy facemasks and slasher movies have gone together like cheese and chives throughout the lengthy lifespan of the cycle . I've seen so many horror films I can't remember if it's been made in the last 20 years, but at least half the movies I've seen are horror films. I know many who feel the same, but that doesn't mean that there are not horror films and slashers out there worth watching. It is my personal belief that the only reason people go to see slashers and horror movies is that they want to know if they're real or fake.

2005 will go down in 'Dr.Who' history as its most incredible year. Everything seemed to click; a first-rate new Doctor and companion, big audiences ( 10 million for the first episode and Christmas special ), major awards, critical acclaim and those idiots who spent years giggling at the Daleks' seeming inability to negotiate stairs were well and truly silenced. But then Christopher Eccleston dropped a bombshell, quitting after just one series. It looked like the honeymoon was over. Luckily, the public appears to have embraced his successor, the excellent David Tennant.

This movie was bad on so many levels . The writing was horrible so even the best actors could not act well. Then there is the acting from the cast. They just dont have the acting ability needed to act well for this story. The only acting that I can enjoy is the acting of the director. Even he could not portray his character well . I know he is a talented director and I am not going to say anything about the acting of other actors. This movie had so many things that could make you laugh.

Don't get me wrong, I assumed this movie would be stupid, I honestly did, I gave it an incredibly low standard to meet. The only reason I even saw it was because there were a bunch of girls going (different story for a different time). As I began watching I noticed something, this film was terrible. Now there are two types of terrible, there's Freddy vs. Jason terrible, where you and your friends sit back and laugh and joke about how terrible it is, and then there is a movie like this.

Scarecrow Gone Wild starts as high school teenager Mike (David Zelina) & his mates decide to to give a 'hazing' to wimpish diabetic Sam (Caleb Roehrig) as an initiation of some sort. Mike & his mate decide to take Sam to a corn field, tie him to a cross next to a freaky looking scarecrow & leave him there all night, sounds like fun right? Well, things backfire when Sam goes into a diabetic coma after suffering from a hypo & the vengeful spirit of Sam passes into the scarecrow which comes to life & starts to hunt down the kids responsible for Sam's unfortunate life-threatening predicament.

If the following sounds tempting , then by all means rush down to your local Blockbuster and rent this movie from your local bookstore. But I wouldn't even bother with that since it's so ridiculous, but I'm not sure I'd recommend the film anyway. And I don't recommend seeing the movie in a movie theater either. The plot, plot points and characters are ridiculous to the point where it becomes boring after a half-hour or so and I'm not sure why the people doing the filming decided to make this movie.

The Love Letter (1999): Starring Kate Capshaw, Tom Everett Scott, Tom Selleck, Ellen De Generes, Gloria Stuart, Blythe Danner, Jessica Capshaw, Alice Drummond, Bill Buell, Erik Jensen, Margaret Ann Brady, Walter Covell, Patrick Donnelly, Lucas Hall, Christian Harmony, Christopher Nee, Breanne Smith, Marilyn Rockafellow, Sasha Spielberg, Jack Black.....Director Peter Chan, Screenplay Maria Maggenti.Based on the novel "The Love Letter" by Cathleen Schine, Director Peter Chan's film version, released in 1999, was not a big box-office draw, not even for a romantic movie with some comedy elements.

Significant Spoilers! This is a sick, disturbing movie... just like the sick, twisted director, Jennifer Chambers Lynch who also wrote it. I don't even know why I gave this movie a rating of 2. It is not the fault of the actors for sure. The cast certainly portrayed their roles well. It is the way this movie was written and the way the characters were written which was the benchmark of a truly sick mind.I do know that I will never, ever watch another movie which has been written or directed by Jennifer Chambers Lynch.

After five years in prison , Tony le Stéphanois ( Jean Servais ) meets his dearest friends Jo ( Carlotta O'Callaghan ) and Jacques ( Jean-Francois Villon ) on the prison bus, with a little surprise waiting for him on the way . But before they can start their friendship, Tony gets a phone call telling him that his father will be released and they have a new mission: To find out how the man who was sentenced to death, who is now on the run, managed to escape from a maximum-security French prison. The story is set in Paris during the French Revolution.

Reba sucks . It sucks hard . It 's about this awful country singer attempting comedy . They might as well make it for real. I have nothing to say . Just watch the movie and be sad . I've got nothing to say . Just watch the movie and be sad . There isn't anything good in it . I'm not a bad person . This is a terrible movie . There's nothing interesting in it . There's no plot in it . And you know what else? There isn't anything in it .

This is a difficult movie to watch, and would have been even more difficult had I known then that the actor playing the protagonist was in fact killed in his home by police at age 19. Pixote (PeeWee) is a street kid in Sao Paulo who is caught in a roundup triggered by a murder in which he had no involvement. He is committed to a juvenile prison where he witnesses brutality and exploitation that ordinary citizens try very hard to believe doesn't exist. When finally he escapes, he and three comrades survive by the only means they know, which is crime.

This isn't "so bad it's good"--It's "so bad, it violates the Geneva Convention's prohibition on cruel and unusual punishment"! Only by reading the Synopsis can you even figure out the "plot" of this Straight to Video disaster. It's a hodge-podge of grainy stock footage spliced together with some of the all-time worst acting you'll ever have the misfortune to see. Comparing this incompetent, turgid, humorless mess to "Dead Men Don't Wear Plaid" is like saying that "Gigli" is like "Citizen Kane".

"Rouge" is part of a trilogy, but very much stands on its own. It isn't a sequel of any sort. The very end, which I won't divulge, ties the three films together, but not seeing the other two doesn't make it too confusing. This film amazes me because it is so spare, so subtle and simple, but is as effective, emotionally and intellectually, as any big-budget spectacle or all-star melodrama. Kieslowski here investigates the phenomena of chance and destiny. Both themes are loosely woven together in the story.

Whatever the producer was going for , he missed entirely . The Lone Ranger is not camp , but ``it'' has a definite charm . What it lacks in plot and tension , it more than makes up for in humor , which is one of the most enjoyable aspects of every story . And the cast , in particular , is superb . Not a bad cast , for a story that tries to go for camp , then tries to be realistic . The Lone Ranger was made in a time when Hollywood was making movies for adults in their early twenties .

Well, I've watched this movie for over 25 years now and it's still almost as interesting as when I first saw it. It is definitely one of the most unique films ever made.I still think Martin Sheen got "dissed" big-time in the billing, too. He dominates the film yet gets lesser billing than Marlon Brando, who only appears in the last 30 minutes of this 2 hours, 17 minutes film (theatrical version). How unfair is that?Sheen is fantastic in here, especially his narration, which runs throughout.

Incident on and off a Mountain Road is Don Coscarelli 's entry in Mick Garris ' Masters of Horror series of ebooks. I can't recommend it highly enough. There are a lot of really clever ideas going on, and I mean REALLY smart, that I wish Coscarelli would take to more than just his website. I was really surprised by Coscarelli's writing, I think a lot of his short stories are on the level of something you'd find on Locus or elsewhere, and I hope this book finds a home.

Personally , I have no problem with the acting , nor the script . I do have a problem with the direction of the movie .I mean , how did they find the right actor for this movie? . How was he casted? . He has been casted in his first movie and is very good , but he has no experience in acting. I mean, he can do it, but I want him to do it the right way, or at least he can do it the easy way. I really want him to do it right , I just want him to do it the easy way.

You might think that a show about regular teens with superpowers would be interesting, but it's far from that. Take the concept for example: the main character(s) have a big secret that they hide from they're peers. It's just like Hannah Montana and That's So Raven. Next, the acting is just average. Selena Gomez seems to be half asleep through many scenes. Lastly, the jokes are either cliché or boring. If they're not using they're colorful, yet strange dialog to make us "laugh", they are throwing various props around the room.

What can I say ? After having read Herbert 's books and loving Lynch 's movie version , I was very intrigued. I had to see it in real life , and boy was I right . I was not disappointed . On a personal note , I will say I thought it could have been better , but there was also a lot of things that worked well in this movie . There was a lot of action , and there were some really cool fight scenes . It had all the action I would expect , and a lot of great dialogue .

I can see what this film was intending to do. Unfortunately it just never quite completes the deal. The "reality crime" aspect works fine and the shots are all first rate. In fact quite a few of the scenes are incredibly evocative in a moody sort of way. Notably the silhouette of the detective talking to the beat up woman, the scene of the detectives going through the garbage, and the father tying flies. On occasion s few scenes bog down in too much dialog. Instead of showing the viewer the writer treats it too much like a book.

My grandad gave me this DVD. With friends like these. The front cover looked quite scary thought i'd watch it. What a bloody mistake.Basically the film follows three people on a bus and what happens to them involving friends.The first one is about a guy who buys a car that talks to him. The second is a about a guy who wakes up to find a cassarole clone in his fridge. And the third is about a woman who does online dating but it turns out he has a robotic arm.The DVD case rated this film 18 but even a 5 year old can watch this and not be scard or entertained.

There was a time when not all animation was Disney or Pixar . Its so nice to see this wonderful movie made into an animated series. Now, to be clear, this show has nothing in common with either of the two most famous animation franchises. (Sorry, Disney, but you're the reason I've been putting off writing this review for the last four weeks. Now I'm just glad this show is on and that I'll have time to enjoy it more in the future.) And it's worth mentioning that this series does have a distinctively Disney flavor.

WOW ! ! Talk about a film that divides the audience ! This is a real love it or loath it film. For some it is an easy goer with a few great moments. For some it is one of the most original films to come out in a while and will be one of my favorites as long as I have a projector to see it in. I guess I have one of the most open minds about films and I have to say it was this one that I really fell for. I was pleasantly surprised with the writing, the music, the performances and most of all the visuals.

Everything Is Illuminated A young Jewish American searches for the woman that helped his grandfather escape Nazi persecution while embarking on a cross-European tour with some unlikely associates.Liev Schreiber makes his directorial debut with a playful angst usually associated with his acting ethos. When successful actors decide to sit in the director's chair, we usually get a biographical glimpse at the souls beneath the acting mask- Check. We usually get a mishmash of genres- Check. But what we normally do not get is an insightful original film which is credible, intelligent and moving.Elijah Wood plays Jonathan, an inquisitive young boy who collects pieces of life as he goes.

I first saw this movie at least thirty years ago, and it remains one of my all-time faves! It's a classic - the intriguing plot, great characters, suspense and shocking twist ending (all set against the backdrop of the gorgeous Monterey/Big Sur coast) never get old. Roy Thinnes portrays Johnny Brant, a captivating character that grows more mysterious as his true identity unfolds. The acting is great and believable; viewers get caught up in the web that develops between the workaholic husband, disenchanted wife and the alluring stranger (Thinnes as Brant).

I usually spend almost as much time writing my reviews as I do watching the film, but with Today You Die, I feel that doing so would be a criminal waste of my time.So here is a five minute rant about how bad this film is.There was a time in the mid-80s when a single look from Steven Seagal was enough to crack your ribs; a full on scowl could knock you off your feet. If he actually got a hold of you, he would snap you like a twig.These days, although he is still capable of doing considerable damage, he no longer looks the part.

Check out the first 20 minutes even though the suspense hasn't yet kicked in. We get a pretty good look at super-secret Los Alamos just a few years after the big bomb test that helped end WWII. Except for the tight security, it looks unthreatening enough. Note how it's a TV repairman, an obvious regular guy, who takes us through security. Once through, it's like any-town-USA, nice homes, quiet streets, kids going to school, and a family TV on the blink. Later on we see little Tommy and little Peggy frolicking along streets lined with impressive looking facilities separated by locked gates.

Arnold fans will holler in joy, fans of brainless action will holler in astonishment, and Catholics will just holler.Illogically written by Andrew W. Marlowe and ham-handedly directed by Peter Hyams, *End of Days* gets The Terminator out of his open-backed hospital gown (Arnold Schwarzenegger's return to the big screen after his heart operation), whilst blowing things up in Mysterious Ways and blaspheming Biblical verse to give Catholics something more to whine about.It is 1999 and doom-sayers the world over live in trepidation of their computers going fritz and losing their downloaded porn.

I saw this turkey in the theater, but I had a good time. The special effects aren't worthy of a grade school production. A toy boat, representing a freighter, moving at speedboat velocity on flat waters while wind driven fog blows in the opposite direction. The red and blue flood lamps add that extra dramatic touch. Whatever cache Vincent Price was supposed to bring as narrator is completely overshadowed by dreadful production work. Calling this a documentary is like calling Britney Spears a musician. About 20 minutes into this, something struck me as very funny.

Having just seen Walt Disney 's The Skeleton Dance on the Saturday Morning Blog as linked from YouTube , I thought I'd do my own take on it and show you what I have found out about the story so far. Now I'm going to have to warn you here that this blog will be long. It will be quite long, but you won't need to use all the links to find out what I have found out because I have done a lot of digging for you and have put all the sources I could find on that page for you.
