Characters start spouting this movies whole reason for existence to other characters who didn't ask for the information on extremely flimsy premises. They also fall into some stereotypical behavior because that must be what's expected in this genre of movie. It's really pretty sad because this movie could have been so much more.I was really hoping this would be a good movie.

I must say I thought the show Greek would be really ridiculous and stupid . Since I am part of a church that doesn't believe in anything I wouldn't go near it. However, the church I was attending is not very liberal so I can't expect a good experience. There are too many Christians out there like me. If you're a Christian go to a Christian church not a church that doesn't believe in anything. It's really not a bad show, just a bit on the weird side.

The plot: Michael Linnett Connors has done everything in films but direct, and is looking for his 1st big chance. He discovers Molly in a play and at once knows she will be a big film star. He signs her to a contract with the stipulation that he must direct. The producer agrees and their big time careers are under way. What follows is a recreation of the silent film era and early sound movies with great emphasis on comedy. And, oh yes, there's romance, and a little sadness too. The performances by Don Ameche and Alice Fay are top notch.

'The Shining ' has wit , visual flair and an iconic performance by Jack Nicholson . 'Ausentes , ' however, can't quite live up to its predecessor. The film has an overbearing plot that, like so many of David Lynch's films, doesn't quite make much sense. The film also doesn't have an effective score (by Angelo Badalamenti ), and there are far too many characters in 'The Shining.' It's difficult to justify spending over three hours to watch just one man and one woman, and one man and a little girl, who are clearly the film's two most memorable characters.

I rented this movie because I am a huge Dudikoff fan. I figured it couldn't be that bad. Boy was I wrong! At the 15 minute mark , I was begiing the others to let me rip the DVD out and fling it back to the rental store, but they refused. They swore it had to get better.They were wrong! This movie was lacking everything. The actors delivered their lines with as much emotion as a comatose rock! The plot was ridiculous and I was offended that Hollywood assumed people were dumb enough to enjoy it.

I caught this movie late night on TV , and was expecting a low-budget campy `` masterpiece '' , I was not wrong. I liked it well enough on first view , but I felt as though there were a couple of issues with it and I didn't quite trust what was going on , but I was going to try to find out more from the critics and then from my own opinion. I don't think I did that well , because it was really too confusing , I just didn't know how to feel and it didn't seem as though they were really trying to do anything.

Well , here we have a zombie movie that perhaps is n't even being much of a zombie movie . and that was the first film I saw about the undead . and what struck me as I saw the credits was that the director and the script supervisor were white . that was about the only real surprise . the rest of the movies that are being released and the ones that are being released in this month of february are mostly black and white movies . it's like the horror genre in general is in the last 10 or 15 years . . . . .

I watched 5% of this movie tonight and you may tell me that I need to see the whole movie to understand it, but frankly I don't think so.What the hell is the story in this movie? I saw a lot of people running around in a factory, shooting at everything around them.Where to start? Okay..1) They were shooting around the place as if it was the Terminator or something they were trying to kill. The entire place is made of metal, but not a single bullet sparked on the metallic surfaces.2) No ricochet.

I'm not even going to comment on what piece of trash this film is since that has already been established. However, watching this with my friends we all laughed out loud when the lead girl made a Shelley Hack reference while on the phone. We sat there trying to figure out why the writer would throw her into the mix. We can only assume he had a Charlie's Angels fixation at one time. Based on that reference, we assumed this film must have been made around her Charlie's Angels run in 1979 or 1980, but from what I've read here it was made around 1987.

I thought this movie 'd be totally different than just another teen-slasher . Well I was totally wrong . There was a lot more depth in the characters that I thought that this movie was lacking . I would definitely suggest this movie to anyone who wants something that is different in a movie . I loved it . It was the perfect combination of suspense and horror that I wanted . I can't wait for the next installment of the series . If I was in a high school I would be so scared to go to class. The killer is so terrifying!

I saw this movie once a long time ago , just once , and I did n't know where it was from ,but now I remember , it was so good and funny ! I hope you like this , its the last part , and i hope you have a nice weekend ! And you have to see this movie , it is very good , it is one of the greatest movies that have ever come out . I think i have only seen it once on TV . So you should see it , and yes ,it is in German, but its worth it !

Normally , I do not review online , but it 's Saturday and I 'm trapped in my room , so I 've to do a little review on my favorite mobile game to pass the time . There are a lot of mobile games , but I 've to say , this game is awesome . It was a lot of fun to play , very interesting and funny , and the graphics are very nice . I really enjoyed playing this game , so if you have a couple of minutes and you can't do something else , I 've to say that you should spend this time and give it a try .

We 've all seen bad movies , well this one takes the cake . I 've seen that Junior movie , ' The Manchurian Candidate '. This is about a Russian spy who , in his attempt to become a spy , kills some spies , which is why the film is now banned in Russia and has to be dubbed . The manchurian-candidate , played by Tom Cruise is a master at being a spy . I 'd say the movie is his best , but you have to admit that you get the feeling , that Cruise plays the role to a tee .

I think that a lot of friends of people who acted in this thing must 've come on and rated me. I didn't understand how bad it was until I looked at this thread. And it wasn't that bad. I have some friends who were there. They weren't on the bus, but they were close to the bus. At the time I was driving my car, I think. Anyway, some of them I don't know. Some of my friends weren't with me. I don't think that I ever told them.

I suppose I like this film as well as any I know ; it is not perfect , but understated and realistic enough for its time ( I think ). That's what makes it a masterpiece. It captures the real feel of living as one of us. I do not think it's an American film though ( it is a German movie ). This is a movie with great music ( I am still listening to it today) and great story lines. The characters, the music and the story line make up a masterpiece.

I recently got the movie and all I can say it is a good movie. There's a lot of famous Rome monuments and historical locations.It is from the same writer and director from The Da Vinci Code. Tom Hanks stars along with Ewan McGregor and Ayelet Zurer. The movie starts out with the space and time experiment in Sweden until one of the canisters is stolen by the church's most hated enemy the Illuminati. The plot is hard to discuss about without spoiling anything. Its a race all of Rome following the Illuminati trail to get to the Illuminati secret meeting place.

Rachel and Chuck Yoman (Valerie Harper, Gerald McRaney), decided the city is too busy and dangerous for their family, so they packed up their reluctant son (Gregory Togel) and daughter (Tammy Lauren) and moved back to a lake like the one Rachel lived at as a child.They say you can not go home again but this is an ideal rural home with what at first seems like a Mayberry feel. Later the residence seems to be more like the people in Deliverance. Soon bodies start turning up and everybody looks suspect with the exception of a few friendly faces.

Sometimes, things should just not be made. And while the set-up seemed good enough, it proceeds to only make the audience gasp in horror. But the problem is, its not another Saw film. Its just so bad you wish you were receiving punishment from Jason Voorhees.I lost track of how many sports movies and spoofs it incorporated into the film. And generally, it flopped in its attempts. True, telling his team they should fail every subject to be true players was somewhat funny at first, but that grew tiring to watch.

Rabbit Fever is one of those film oddities . It 's an enjoyable 90 minutes , demands little of the audience , and yet has very little to do with the two films which preceded it. The film is a remake of the 1971 horror film The Changeling , which itself was a film remake of an Italian horror film of the same name. It is also the tale of a pair of sisters, both beautiful and mysterious , who share the same blood type, and who happen upon a mysterious house in their town.

I gave this 2 stars out of a possible 10.I went into this not realizing what it was - and discovered it is apparently some kind of African musical - since people break into song every few minutes.None of the songs rhyme, most of them aren't really saying anything sensible, and they all have the same non-existent tune - if you could call it a "tune. "Karmen is a tall, spectacularly built young woman, with the longest braids I've ever seen. [The actress looks as if she has probably done some modeling.

I love Umberto Lenzi 's cop movies -- ROME ARMED TO THE TEETH is my favorite -- and his DESERT DOGS is one of his very best. But this is the first Lenzi movie I've seen with a villain that is actually scary and not just cartoonish. As a movie, it is very entertaining. It is also pretty much the best movie I've seen so far in terms of storytelling. I didn't really know much about this film and now I am completely intrigued. I saw this film on a very cold day in February in the mountains in the southern Italian countryside.

This is most likely the best picture not many will see . It presented a culture in a real unhollywoodized way that will inspire us to be more creative to make the best work possible and be a part of the change of this country.It was made by a team of great directors that have a history of working with great artists. The people that worked on it had a goal and that was to give us their vision of what should be on the screen. It took them 10 years to make that movie and they all put their heart in it. The script was really great as well.

The Soap is an interesting movie and very brilliant at parts. You must watch it for its strong characterisation and the risks the plot about two troubled individuals falling in love takes. You must know the story through various other reviews, so lets speak about what is brilliant about this movie.Firstly, the two protagonists are so real and such intriguing personalities. The first being a woman who has opted out of a four year relationship and is angry enough to sleep with anyone coming her way. The second being a man who has always wanted to be a woman, whose pain and loneliness is shown with so much sensitivity and brilliance.

As a fan of author Gipharts lightheaded and humorous books ( of which Ik Ook van Jou is not the last) it was an honour when I came across the one and only novel of a writer who was not afraid to tackle the subjects he loved with wit and intelligence. I have read Ik Ook van Jou several times and I always learn new things from his characters. It is a very funny book but not only for me and for my children as I found out that the book had a big influence on a little boy.

Ok, when I rented this several years ago I had the worst expectations. Yes, the acting isn't great, and the picture itself looks dated, but as I sat there, a strange thing happened. I started to like it. The action is great and there are few scenes that make you jump. Brion James, maybe one of the greatest B-grade actors next to Bruce Campbell, is great as always. The story isn't bad either. Now I wouldn't rush out and buy it, but you won't waste your time at least watching this good b-grade post apocalyptic western.

If you're looking for a movie that's fun to watch simply because you can make jokes about the not so great acting, cheesy "special" effects, and typical sci-fi plot...then this is the movie for you! Not at the acting was bad, in fact, a few actors were actually fairly decent. The special effects weren't the greatest (to say the least); the animals looked completely computer animated. There was an annoying squawking to cover up the swearing and there was only one song played over and over again throughout the entire movie.

I suppose you could say this film has a grain of potential, but nothing more, because boy did the filmmakers botch it. The plot is practically incomprehensible, the pacing is lethargic and the acting is pathetic. And what the hell is a trade rat? Worst of all, though, this movie's climax is the anticlimax of all anticlimaxes; plus the title doesn't seem even remotely accurate. The only redeeming feature of this film is the pretty dark-haired woman... well, the blond girl was pretty too, but she was annoying and not as good looking as the brunette.

A brash , self-centered Army cadet arrives at WEST POINT with a dangerous wise guy attitude towards the Corps.In a clash of cultures and personal beliefs, he is drawn into the lives of two different cadets, both of whom are very different from him.When a young cadet dies from an accidental overdose, and his best friend goes missing on an assignment, the two become entangled in a web of danger and lies that threaten to tear apart both their lives.This story is about a cadet in training and his relationship with the Corps he is training to defend and serve in.

This extraordinary pseudo-documentary, made in 1971, perfectly captures the zeitgeist of America today...which makes it all the more scary and relevant. "subversives" (college students, hippies, black activists, academics) are being rounded up by the government and given lengthy prison terms for what amount to thought crimes and social protest. As an alternative to life in prison, these convicted "criminals" are offered three days in "Punishment Park". Their objective inside the park is to make their way to the American flag where freedom awaits them. Not surprisingly, the Punishment Park option is a dirty lie.

This is the essence of the early eighties ! The malls , the credit card machines , the food , all the things of the world of consumer culture . You can hear it on all the radios and music videos you can buy . The mall is a mall is a shopping mall . It has all the good stuff . In this way it has a meaning for people , because it has become what it is . A place where you see the world as a mall. “ The mall was designed to make us feel less alone ‘ The mall is a place of connection .

A couple of years before SCREAM spoofed the slasher/horror genre with savvy , self-conscious young things knowing every trick in the book and trying to get away with it, a writer named Richard Matheson did something very close to a spoof of SCREAM. In his classic 1967 horror film adaptation of Stephen King's novel, "It" (starring Richard Kiel), it's a story in which a high school girl (Dee Wallace) goes home to investigate the mysterious deaths of her classmates in the middle of a horror movie playing on TV at her school.

There are bad movies and then there are movies which are even worst. Saw is just that.The movie is simply bad on all points. The plot, the acting, the camera work, the music and everything else is absolutely terrible and I cannot begin to comprehend how such trash made it to the big screen.The simple fact is that Saw is riddled with plot holes. The beginning is enticing and leaves much to be expected but it does not hold up and the plot becomes absolutely ridiculous and absurd. The film is not creative and will not leave you with a single bit of credibility.

***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS*** There's not much that can be said about this early-talkie era flick. (I'm hesitant to call "Cimarron" a "film", because I feel that the word is too esoteric.) But what can be said about it...mainly speaks against it.Take, for example, the overuse of portraying Indians as bad folk. In one scene, the little boy of the flick's lead character--an overbearing and over-ambitious family man who wants to set up a newspaper business-- is playing just outside of his father's office.

When I stepped into the theater, I thought this was going to be a great movie. And I was not disappointed one bit. WOW! This movie is brilliant! The emotions felt through out the whole movie are extraordinary! Great acting by Madhavan and Simran. Beautiful music by A.R. Rahman. This might most probably be the best Tamil movie I've seen in ages. Mani Ratnam has yet again proved that he is the best in making meaningful and heartfelt movies.This movie is basically about a young girl (P.S.

Wealthy horse ranchers in Buenos Aires have a long-standing no-trading policy with the Crawfords of Manhattan , but what happens if you find yourself on the other side of the world from them? This week we hear from a man who has been trading horses for more than a decade. In this week's podcast we discuss:

- The advantages of horse trading

- Horses for the rich

- Why he doesn't sell horses to the rich



This week's podcast is live - get on-board for the next edition. You can listen to the full podcast on iTunes or you can subscribe via iTunes, or download the MP3 file directly.

Fans of Euro-horror flicks - Portland's video/DVD store Movie Madness has a whole section devoted to this genre - can't afford to miss Sergio Martino's gut-busting "L'isola degli uomini pesce" (called "Screamers" in the United States). Here's the lowdown: some shipwreck survivors land on an uncharted Caribbean island in 1891. The island is inhabited by a landowner, a scientist (Joseph Cotten) and his daughter (Barbara Bach). Sure enough, it turns out that the landowner is making the scientist create a race of fish-men.

We all know what Chan-wook Park can do. If you haven't seen Oldboy(or the sympathy trilogy for that matter) you are missing out on some of the best films made this century. But i'm not here to talk about them. I'm here to talk about thirst.This movie is not what you would expect. Yes it is a vampire movie, but at the same time it is also a very twisted tale of romance between a priest and a young girl. I wont get into the synopsis(you can read that above) but instead tell you what this movie has to offer.

How many movies are there that you can think of when you see a movie like this ? I ca n t think of any. Even the ones I like least. I have to admit I like it a lot, but I also think there is no such thing as a great movie like this, and that there is no single good movie. Maybe the ones that we do not talk about in the press, because they are just not good enough. I like the ones that everyone thinks are the best, and the ones we don’t think of as great.

This movie strayed too far from Straub 's novel for me to enjoy . Barely made it to the middle but it would be better if you didn't know anything about the film . I had no problem believing in the movie and its premise, but it didn't really fit. I'm not going to rewatch the film to confirm my thoughts on it because, frankly, I don't want to spoil anything. I'll say this: this is one of those movies that is so bad that it doesn't really deserve the credit it got.

I have never been as surprised by a film that was this old . Only `` The Treasure of the Sierra Madre '' is this old . It is not a story , it is a poem . It is about a man who sets out to find a gold mine , it is a story about how he discovers the treasure . It is a classic that is very good . It is a wonderful film . This is a film that is almost as old as it was in the film world , which means it could be done by someone who has seen it before .

Overall, I give this film a decent 7.6. To start I'll say I love how the character was portrayed and adapted on to the screen. If you read comics occasionally or simply watch DVD extras you'll see the Blade character is drastically different from the one we see in the film. Among the changes, Blade is now most importantly half vampire, therefore acquiring "all of their strengths, but none of their weaknesses." The credit for this goes obviously to David Goyer, a fellow fan of the darker genre of comic books.

Watching the first few moments , you realize it 's going to be a parody - and certainly it *was* at the very beginning, but there are elements of the movie that make it more than just that . there 's no real story to speak of - the main story is what you'd expect . the movie revolves around the adventures of a young girl named i ( haley joel ) who 's always on the road with her father who 's a librarian. she's always travelling from place to place and it's a mystery to what she's been up to .

For those viewers who thought the 1979 film "Alien" the first to depict a male Earthling being impregnated by a malevolent extraterrestrial, "Night of the Blood Beast," made 21 years earlier, may come as something of a surprise. In this film, America's first man in space crashlands back on Earth and, after examination, is thought to be dead. He later comes to again, only with a half dozen or so alien seahorse thingies growing in his abdomen. The mama (?) alien also pops up to terrify the small band of scientists who are observing our gravid hero, and she (?)

The recent DVD release of Good Humor Man labels the film as comedy . It 's hardly a comedy , however , and it can also be very funny . I think it's easy to see how the film would play as a comedy , and how it might play a comedy , too, in the hands of a talented and funny filmmaker . But, I think it's a comedy , even though it's not, and it's hard to see any film that could play that way for comedy's sake . So, what's the deal with it?

This was a disgrace to the game FarCry i had much expectations but all ended up in a nightmare. Besides the bad acting the visual effects, stunts the plot even the humor used in the movie was an absolute flop. The movie is not worth watching at all. The funniest part was when the girl comes and kiss Jack in order to give him the key to the cuffs. Guess the she got the keys to handcuffs all the time. I hope some good director will make a remake of this fantastic game into a movie someday.

This is an interesting movie. I think it's very humorous, although the humor is very black. Fulci is good and funny acting himself, it's a really funny and truly crazy "self-portrait" of an artist ("I make horror films. If I would make love films, no-one would buy tickets..."). And it's really SEXY movie also: Almost all the time there is some "action" or tension going on; and many sexy girls/women... Maybe it goes to the core of why anyone starts to do movies/art in the first place...

I understand the purpose of the director to tell stories that are n't stories , but the way he tried to describe it in a way I understand was that this was the truth. It may not seem like it, but that's what I felt. I also find it hard to believe anyone could be so cruel in a movie. There was no way to stop it. I can only say that I hope that the director takes the next movie seriously and tries to improve on his last movie. It was a sad and dark movie, full of despair.

Part of the BBC filming of all of Shakespeare's classic plays, this version of Hamlet does nothing to dispel my particular impression that it is one of Shakespeare's most over-rated plays and Hamlet himself a not particularly moving and tragic character. I feel no sympathy for him, and I didn't after watching this.Even when you have great actors like the great Derek Jacobi in the role of the Dane, and Patrick Stewart as Claudius and Jonathan Hyde as Rosencrantz, it cannot disguise the lack of passion in the storyline. And when a good actor like Jacobi injects passion into it, he renders the entire role incomprehensible.

The original Female Convict Scorpion is an all time masterpiece . The first sequel , Jailhouse 41 , was not as good as the original but was still an epic film . The third was not as good as its predecessor but it still holds up to this day . With all these amazing films there was only one that really stood out from the rest . That was the female convict Scorpion . It was not a good film by any means . There was no plot or story development . It was just a typical female convict thriller .

Even though he only made his debut film in Australia and left for Great Britain and then America to continue his career, Australians will tell you that the greatest film star they ever produced was Errol Flynn. I'm not sure he ever even went back to Australia after his breakout success in Captain Blood. Still I attribute this film to the well known Aussie irreverence for trashing the reputation of one of their own.Part of the problem in telling Errol Flynn's life story was that he told enough tall tales in his life right up to the very end in his memoir, My Wicked Wicked Ways.

Matt Cvetic is a loyal communist in a Pittsburgh steel mill who works to recruit workers into the party, even though this isolates himself from his son, family, and neighbors. What makes this even more difficult is that Cvetic is actually an FBI agent posing as a Communist in order to obtain information about party activities. The party is trying to create a strike at the mill, whereby the pro-strike movement will lead the workers into a wave of propaganda. Cvetic also has to contend with beautiful Eve Merrick, a party member and teacher at his son's school who finds the fact that Cvetic is a double agent.

The TV show was slow moving and the 'offbeat ' characters were sometimes irritating . Only through the miracle of internet streaming and youtube could I binge watch all the episodes in a matter of weeks. The second season is currently airing with episodes being posted every Thursday and Friday and will resume the show on May 5th with a new episode. What I really liked about this show is the actors who made it so funny and enjoyable in the first season. This season's cast seems to bring in some new faces to the main cast as well as some interesting guest stars.

This is really one of the worst movies i have seen in a while . It 's not funny at all , it's not scary at all and its pretty boring . I was really disappointed in this movie and I was wondering , if there is really no one to give me any kind of justice , because it seems like this movie is really boring to me . I don't know but when you think of horror films this one is a must-see . You'll think twice if you won't watch this before going out , it'll give you chills just thinking about it .

You may not believe this , but when the credits to this movie rolled , I looked for the director to have his hand in the directing of the first one. So I was really happy to find that he has. I am not sure how it is going for his career but it does not matter. Its a very nice film and I believe the director has a very good story line in his head. I saw this last weekend, and I must say I quite enjoyed it, despite the bad acting and plot.

This was absolutely one of the best movies I've seen. Excellent performances from a marvelous A-List cast that will move you from smiles to laughter to tears and back.I couldn't help but care about the characters. Ms. Merkerson will blow you away, as will the young man playing the young lead.I also thought that the set design was top-rate. The viewer is really placed inside each era as it's presented. The music is a blast, too. Nice selections to represent mood, time and place. The blind blues man is stereotypic but he delivers some great songs.

Low budget , but still creepy enough to hold your interest in another take off on the familiar Frankenstein story. Also, you may want to see how they managed to shoot this as if in 3D. I do think the special effects were quite good for this type of film, but the 3D is a tad over done for the type of films this was. Still I do have a fondness for the Frankenstein story and this is as close as we're going to get to it for now anyway. The cast was quite good and I'm glad there was a bit of diversity in the cast here.

`` Strangers on a Train '' was one of those film classics I had always heard about but somehow never thought I would ever find the courage to actually see. But the more I look at it the more I realize how much it influenced me. Strangers on a Train is a film about three different people who meet and form an unlikely friendship. I think this movie is just so much more than that simple story, and I think it speaks to the human experience. It's the story of a man who realizes that he just wants to be near someone for a while.

So many of us who are devoted to the "art" of the motion picture will disregard or forget that movies are also business ventures. Most of the time, they are far too costly to produce to be anything else. In light of this, it often seems a miracle to me that really great ones do get made every now and then. Once in a while, the film-makers will go so far over budget in producing a film that the businessmen responsible for funding the enterprise will be badly hurt financially and will of course become very angry about this.

How anyone can praise this crude film version after seeing the marvelous WATERLOO BRIDGE with Vivien Leigh and Robert Taylor, is beyond comprehension.MAE CLARKE's Myra is a far cry from the role as played by VIVIEN LEIGH in the remake. She plays a common American girl with a Brooklyn accent and the "Yeah" responses are a bit jarring when one is expecting a less coarse character. DOUGLASS MONTGOMERY (billed in final credits as KENT DOUGLASS) is wildly improbable as a soldier smitten with her no matter how many times she lets him down.

It is truly saddening to see a once-great director such as Deodato delivering such a second-rate giallo such as this. I’ve only ever seen one film from him but it was always in a cinema, and that was “Tenebrae“, which I think is an even worse adaptation of “The Man with a Violin”, in which Deodato plays an art dealer who is a member of the Nazi party. I really doubt that the film is even in Italian, it’s obviously a parody, but a good one!

This is one of my three all-time favorite movies . My only quibble is that the director , Peter Yates , is not credited for his work . Yates has been nominated three times for an Oscar , winning once , and this is his first nomination . The script is by William Goldman and Ernest Lehman . It was filmed in 1981 in Miami and in 1982 in New Jersey . The music for the soundtrack is by Lalo Schifrin . The film is by Peter Yates . The plot concerns a New York lawyer who wins a $100 million wrongful death verdict for his client, whose body was stolen during a murder trial.

Gene Roddenberry never let his fans down. His death ended Sci-Fi legacy that will never be matched. Earth: The Final Conflict was proof! His pilot film and the first 2 Seasons were well written and meticulously produced, but somewhere along the way the Roddenberry touch was lost. The loss of lead, Kevin Kilner (William Boone) definitely hurt the series as he was a vital part of what made it work. The story involves the human race being visited by the Taelons, an extra-terrestrial race who dub themselves 'The Companions'.

The plot is somewhat original , and all the actors did their job pretty well . There is a plenty of action , but its all pretty non-event . It is well shot , especially in the closeups of the actors . It is not very good , but it is still good . There are a few scenes where I was a bit annoyed (e.g., a scene where a helicopter lands on a boat , and I had no problem paying to see what was happening ) . I am glad that the plot was left alone, and that there was some action .

Thomas Mann 's controversial novel is the basis for the film `` A Death in Venice. `` Although in the film the protagonist is a woman, she is a lesbian. The movie, based on the 1943 novel by Thomas Mann, opens with a scene that takes place on the island of Elba, in Italy. This was the setting for a lesbian love triangle and the film's title refers to the three women. Mann has said that he intended the lesbian love affair to have a romantic edge, and it does have that.

I 'd heard about this movie , but did n't see it until my daughter , who saw it on the cinema , loved the film and asked to see it again. She said "You should have seen this movie , this film is sooo good , I liked it ". I guess it is a film I will never forget and will remember for many years to come

The film is based on a real-life story, written by William S. Burroughs and his wife, the late Susan Sontag, and published as a short story in 1964 as part of their book, Howl and Other Stories.

I love Japanese movies -- having seen at least 100-200 . So it 's obvious I am not afraid of the subtitles, but how do they look? Is Japanese cinema as different from the US cinema as Americans tend to think? Does the language have a certain charm? Do I have to watch all movies in a certain style, if I want a certain feeling from a movie? I 'm a Japanese person, and i love the Japanese movies too, but most of them have been dubbed into English by Hollywood studios. It 's very disappointing.

the movie is complete disaster . i do n't know who write scripts for movies like this one , but whoever it was should never ever be employed in this business . this is a disaster in every way . if it were up to me , i would leave this movie right here in the parking lot at my local theater , and never return to it , ever , again . but i am forced to watch it anyway . if you were to ask me what i think of the movie right at the beginning of this review , i would say that this is the worst film i have ever seen .

Camp Blood is an absolutely atrocious slasher film. We're mixing Friday The 13th with the Blair Witch Project and adding....a killer in a clown mask.The budget for this film must have been very low, some of the actors played multiple parts and the camera used produced a picture equal to the colourised version of the original Night Of The Living Dead, which if anybody has watched that version will back me up that it is poor.This film was just so bad. There is nothing in the film even worth watching. The very fact I watched this all the way through stunned me.

Robert McKimson 's 'Acrobatty Bunny ' is one of the director 's finest shorts . Although the circus-based setting may not have caught on with the general public until the 1970s, it would be a very strange world indeed if it weren 't for the talent of this Australian film maker. He has directed two other feature films before this one , but as far as his short films were concerned, he has only been able to make one that really stands out. In fact, 'Acrobatty Bunny ' is a true masterpiece of cinema.

"First Snow" has an intriguing beginning. A traveling salesman has his fortune told by an old man, who's predictions turn out to be amazingly correct. From this point on the movie plays out like a bloated "Twilight Zone" episode. I mean nothing but car trips, phone calls and paranoia. William Fichtner gives his usual interesting performance, but Guy Pierce is anything but a sympathetic character, disregarding other people's well being for the sake of his own paranoia. The ending is especially weak, with absolutely no payoff for the long suffering audience.

I think Shane Black is one of the all time greatest action screenwriters ever! He gave us the awesome (at it's time)Lethal Weapon, shooting Mel Gibson to super stardom. Then followed that up with the second best movie Bruce Willis has ever been in (The Last Boyscout).Stumbled a bit with The Last Action Hero, but redeemed himself with this one, The Long Kiss Goodnight.If you're a fan of action films, this has it all...Action, Comedy, Thrills, then tops it of with more Action, Comedy and Thrills.

It was so disjointed - it seemed to jump from place to place - and the `` thief '' was the first one to make a joke about a woman who was kidnapped, then had her clothes taken away. But then it went on, in all seriousness, about a woman who was being held hostage in a bank in a small country town. And then there was a long, rambling speech from a woman who said that she knew that people `` were trying to get something on her, so she had a plan '' but she didn't know how it was going to be done.

OK, if you are a fan of Mystery Science Theater 3000 and love to mock movies, then you will have a lot of fun with this. Otherwise, it may really be TOO painful to see.Plot: Obsessed cryptozoologist sneaks a huge crate containing a Chupacabra onto a cruise ship (apparently not having to declare it at customs, or even mention that he's bringing aboard a live animal -"no really, it's research equipment, the air holes are just an accident"). Some dipsticks he hired to lade it open the crate, figuring he paid bunches of money, maybe there's something to steal.

Story of an ex-Navy Seal who is now a combat medical officer assigned to a state of the art Russian hospital near the frontline. In a world that is rapidly transforming from a high-tech, high-security battlefield to a war of the body. Sunday, March 30, 2014

I wrote a letter in November to the editor of the Chicago Sun-Times. The story I wrote and published in my letter has not been printed. I have asked the editor to publish it. I will post my letter on my website and on my Facebook page. My letter is no longer available.

Everything that made the original so much fun seems to absent here. This is simply a "run of the mill demons on the loose wrecking havoc" slasher, but without the passion that graced the original.There's nothing new in the story, in fact it seems like they ignore the first one altogether. Here, the demons run loose in a high security apartment building and, naturally, kill most of the residents in grisly fashion. The makeup effects actually seem less convincing here than the first time around. Although the actors weren't exactly brilliant in Demons, in Demons 2 they're actually a lot worse.

What can I say ... not much to this one at all . Pretty dull and uninteresting.The actors performances are not that impressive.I think they're all pretty much the same, I'm not the best with the English accent so I wouldn't know for sure.I saw it a year after it's release so it doesn't have a special effect. The only reason why I give it 1 star is because it's so boring that I couldn't finish it. In fact I didn't read any of the words and I only really watched the opening and a couple of other parts.

a great movie, with a rather unclear political message. it´s shot in a theatrical style, i.c. most of the action takes place inside. mayor surov and diana ashcroft seem equally suspicious of each other. emotions run high since the western tourists and business-people seem unwilling and unable to yield to the eastern-russian charm of the mayor, although he makes every effort to understand their point of view. the two opposite world-views are made pointedly clear, but the movie also shows that human emotions cannot be controlled by politics. its powerfully acted and has a high emotional impact for a 50s movie.

As a kid , this movie scared me green . As an adult , I could n't stop laughing.I have watched it again and again and again and again, and I still laugh . This is a beautiful tale that will make you cry but also laugh. It is very well written.I am going to be very blunt here , this movie makes me teary eyed and I am crying and laughing at this movie. The only thing that keeps you from enjoying the movie is the fact that you might not like the movie as much as others .

I own a copy of this film and have always loved it. I comment here, however, because I saw the PBS presentation of a concert version of Sweeney Todd earlier this week. That production was put on by the San Francisco Opera and starred George Hearn and Patti LuPone. In the early '80s Hearn replaced Len Cariou as Sweeney (Cariou had won the Tony for his performance). I saw Hearn and Angela Lansbury (who also won the Tony for her performance as Mrs. Lovett) perform Sweeney on broadway. They must have made the film at about the time I saw the show.

I should have realized that any two-video set being sold for only $ 6 would be bad . I even went a few weeks with a $ 6 set before I figured out it was a scam .. Here is an example of the type of people who buy this stuff:
http://www.google.com/search?sourceid=chrome-instant&ie=UTF-8&q=how+do+i+make+money&aq=&aqi=&aql=&aql=&aql=&gs_nocheck=1&source=lnms&sa=1

I want to point out that this is a scam. That’s because it’s such a scam that the manufacturer is still charging the full $ 6.

As a fan of C.J . 's earlier movie , Latter Days , I really wanted to like this film.The problem was it was a complete rip-off of a couple of books I had previously read, in order to fit it in. In the original book, these characters are just as quirky as those in this film. That's fine. I understand that's what the story is about. It just doesn't add up to what we've seen from this film. We meet four college kids in their 20s as they go on an art tour of Italy.

Oh boy. Films like this really bother me. If this movie is supposed to close to truth, then I assume that Rommel knew Hitler for a time before WWII started. In the movie, Rommel mentions how Hitler had changed from before. Well I can't imagine that Rommel wouldn't have known something about Hitler's government policies so Rommel must share some guilt for the German atrocities. With that in mind, I have a problem with a movie that makes Rommel's life at the end a tragic one. He made his choices and we have to feel bad for him?

"A research scientist is experimenting with human DNA in an attempt to create the perfect human being. His work has made it to the point where he can take a human fetus and accelerate its growth to that of an adult within a few days. His latest creation is a (spoiler omitted), but side effects from the process (spoiler omitted)," according to the DVD sleeve's synopsis. "Embryo" opens by promising: "The film you are about to see is not all science fiction. It is based upon medical technology which currently exists for fetal growth outside the womb.

THANK GOD YOU'RE HERE is painful, positively painful. The title is apt, in a sense, if aimed at the large studio audience paid to laugh like they were watching the second coming of the Marx Brothers. And trust me, they are paid.As creatively barren as the entertainment industry has become, I refuse to believe that NBC brass really have faith in this turkey. Rather, I think THANK GOD YOU'RE HERE is what all of you get who didn't watch, or didn't appreciate STUDIO 60, which previously graced the peacock network's Monday night lineup.

This movie has an outstanding acting, by Marilia Pêra, and a stunning dicretcion by the argentine Hector Babenco. This is, in my opinion, the best Brazilian movie ever made. The movie was filmed with child from the 'favelas' , the brazilian ghetos. The children weren't actors and were casted by Babenco in the city of Rio de Janeiro. The story is about the criminal children that are arrested in the correctional prison, that looks much worse than Alcatraz. The children are constantly raped and beaten by the policeman. Unfortunately this is not purely fiction, in Brazil it does happen till today.

( Spoilers more than likely ... nothing really important you could n't have figured out yourselves ) Yeah , it was a good read . It made me think a little , and it was also nice to have someone to bounce things off of and talk to . I had a great time . Thanks so much . Keep writing and keep reading ... I'll keep reading . Just a few more of these and your writing will not be worth the paper it was printed on anymore , I'm guessing . Thanks again . Keep up the great work .

I am an avid Julie Andrews fan and I just watched this for the first time on DVD -- the Director's Cut version. I was very surprised that it was rated G. How did they get bedroom scenes, a seduction story line, two strip tease acts, and war/shooting/blood into a G rating? Weird. I would rate it PG-13.Other than that I thoroughly enjoyed the movie. It was a beautiful showcase of Andrew's voice and talent. The acting was great. The storyline was a little weak, leaving gaps that could have been filled with some good dialogue.

For an indy film this is probably a bit better than a 3 out of 10 , but in general indy films can be hard to rate, they have their own rules and style. I'll try to keep them as similar as I can in this, as I've always thought they were pretty good movies. It's still one of my favourite indies and I've seen all of it. It has its faults, but it does stand the test of time and deserves to be in this poll. I have to disagree with one point, though.

Hello all! I went to this movie without any expectation though I knew Maniratnam would've given an excellent film! I was stunned!! The backdrop is the struggle between the tamils settled in Sri Lanka and the government. The story is about how an young girl Amudha who lives with her foster parents at Chennai, India leaves to Sri Lanka in search of her real mother. The high points of the film are the performances of every actor and actress and ofcourse, the cinematography, editing and all other technical details. Full marks to the cast and crew.

in his descriptions of CAA , platinum card lunches in Hollywood , psychoanalysis , a vacation in Provincetown he never took and, most notably, writing about his first sexual relationship. If you’re interested in how I got where I am or, in this case, what I do today, you might be interested in this blog entry from the previous summer. I recently read a new book, “The Grown Up Brain, How To Think & Feel Like An Adult, How To Be An Adult & How To Stop Being One,” by Daniel J. Siegel, Ph.D.

When I was a little girl , I absolutely adored The Swan Princess , it was reliving the same fairy tales I’d read over and over, and I always loved it for its “happy” ending. When I watched it as a kid it always hit me right in the heart and I loved it when it was sad, it made me remember how I was feeling at the time and I loved it for that, because I felt like I’d won and I was happy with the win. It was only once I became an adult, I realized what a load of rubbish it was .

I found it hard to care about these characters, who were either annoying or insipid, all living their fabulously hilariously urban lives.The dialogue was excruiciating at times, and at other times the narrative seemed hard to follow - was it me or were entire scenes deleted?It felt like a poor sitcom somehow turned into a film. The stereotypes and jokes about "men's groups" would perhaps have been funny in the early 90s. As it is, this is where much of the humour of the film comes from - and boy, does it get old fast.Apart from the attractive Irish man - this film was a dud.

Absolutely one of the worst movies I've ever seen! "The Beginning" was not the greatest either but better than this one. This is not a good way to lead up to the original movie. It's just simply awful! The CGI hyenas were so fake looking in both movies! Why not use real animals? I enjoyed the old Sinbad movies better than this. I was royally disappointed! The only good thing I can say about this waste of film is the cinematography and clothes which really captured that era well. I understand why this movie was redone as "The Beginning".

Warner Brothers produced this 3D extravaganza that was the biggest commercial success for westerns in 1953 . Guy Madison leads a team of cowboys against a force of Sioux Indians in a showdown for a lost gold shipment at the Little Bighorn . The film would be the last western to be produced at Paramount Pictures and would be the last production made by Lew Landers after he left to work at Walt Disney Studio. It was a film that would influence a generation of westerns and be the first of its kind to have an African-American cast for a lead.

I went to see this on the strength of Albert Finney alone. He's one of my favorite actors and he rarely fails to deliver. I'm not sure if the plot is interesting or just silly: it's about a little boy who is about to be born, but as his mother goes into labor, he refuses to come out! This sends God and the whole human being factory into a crisis and Albert Finney is called out of purgatory to try and convince the boy to change his mind and decide to want to be born.

At Beaverview Cheerleading Camp, the goody-goody two shows Lucky Ducks cheerleading team must get in cahoots with the 'tough' bad girl cheerleading team of The Demons to beat the dastardly Falcon team who always seems to win at this camp I guess. This being a typical clichéd '80's teen (lame) sex comedy who do you think will win? But what the film lacks in originality it more than makes up for it sheer bloody awfulness. Oh and insanely bad dance numbers and the obligatory Japenese businessmen who want to buy the camp (on the condition that male cheerleader, Tommy Hamilton, stays with the camp of course).

In defense of this movie I must repeat what I had stated previously . The movie is called Arachina , I have never seen any of the movies you mentioned, I was born in May of the year , so I am just a child when I watch this movie . That's what I like , to see a movie for a new experience for me . The movie is a fantasy , so it has no moral and no story . It's just a story that is told by the movie maker , who has no idea what he's doing .

this really is an `` okay '' series .. everyone in it is pretty good . but i just caon't figure out which is which .. so i'm just gonna have to let you know in advance. first up is the show i've been waiting for the longest and in a sense this one is even worse than a lot of others that have come and gone. and this one is the worst because the only good thing about it is that i finally can stop waiting to see it . but the bad thing is that i can't wait until it's over.

This is a VERY good movie . I give it a 10.It 's very different in that it 's kind of an allegory about the dangers of living in a society where the rich are always right and everyone else is wrong and no one can get ahead and you have to do what you're told without question.The movie is very well acted and the story very entertaining. I 'm sure you 'll see this movie again if you have the chance. I 'm going to buy it at the theater when it comes out in December.

This film is supposedly about three young idealistic people, two of whom join the Naxalite movement and blah blah. It is really just another film about some beautiful, rich people trying to decide who they should bed next; the peasants and naxalites and the political struggles of the era merely serve as a picturesque backdrop. Literally, as we don't hear the villagers say a word, never mind learn anyone's name, thus they occupy the same 'role' as the 'natives' in old Hollywood films. The movie is also dull, and the story does not actually get us anywhere - except to various bedrooms.

Now before I tell you the synopsis this is a non-spoiler review. Bone Eater hits its mark for being the worst movie of the year. I don't know how these movies even get onto DVD. If I saw this in theaters I would get extremely upset. Bone Eater is about these people who dig up an ancient burial ground and find some bones. It's the 'Bone eater' and the more bones he eats the more powerful he gets.First of all I thought okay well the DVD artwork looks creepy and it sounds creepy. When I rented it and looked at the DVD label it looked scary.

I went into this movie hoping for an imaginative twist on the Second Coming . Boy , was I ever disappointed . Let's just look at the big picture . What is the Bible about ? A few thousand years ago humans lived on a planet populated with many other species of animals . We lived alongside them but did not co-mingle with them . The only species on our planet that were truly close were the primates . The others lived far away in the rain forests of the rainforests . All the rest of them lived way out in the open .

I like the shepherd! Sure the acting wasn't good but the fight scenes were nice. Van damme throws some nice kicks and so does adkins. The story was average. A Texas cop battles smugglers. This movie did everything a van damme movie should do which is martial arts and action. Van damme was never a good actor. I think this movie is better than van dammmes last 2. If you're looking for an Oscar winning performance you're not gonna get it here but if you're looking for action and martial arts then this movie is for you.

I love movies ... and rarely do I see a movie that I hate ... but this was the worst, most repugnant movie I saw in 2010. I had read reviews on the internet of it but decided I would give it a try. On opening night, it was advertised in the cinema and I did not attend, but the next day it was there and I could not believe what I had seen! As I began to watch, it was hard to tell what was going on or what was happening.

Two actors play rival gangsters in three films, the final of which is a sci-fi film, that nods strangely to William S. Burroughs, Philip K. Dick, and anime all at once. The robots are actually called "replicants", a reference to Dicks Blade Runner(several visual allusions to the film can be found as well) and the bad guy is a psychotic gay mayor obsessed with limiting procreation through use of a compulsory drug for "heterosexual love is fleeting, and homosexual love is eternal"....martial arts fights ensue, a first for the dead or alive films.

I must admit , ashamed though I am , that as an impressionable young teenager this below par horror-chiller was one of my favorite films. It is one of the few horror-comics that I did not have to buy. It came to me at a time that was so close to the end of the film-making phase of my career. I had not yet gone the direction that would lead to my first full-length feature and would only get to do a couple of more short films before turning the camera back to the script and camera to complete the script, camera and the film.

I acquired this film a couple of years ago and on trying to find some info about it I found that even the mighty IMDb didn't have it listed. That should have been all I needed to know.With Friends Like These is an anthology that plays like a collection of second rate Twilight Zone / Outer Limits episodes all linked together by a bus journey that never really seems to tie in with the rest of the film. Of the three stories, the only one that I gleaned any entertainment value from was the second episode in which a man (of sorts) grows out of the bacteria in a guys fridge.

This is a spin off of Pulp Fiction. I thought that it would be good for a few decent laughs. Well it turns out that this movie really was terrible. The whole plot doesn't follow on the Pulp Fiction plot. It turns to other movie like Forrest Gump and more. Some laughs came out of this movie, but all and all it totally took 90 minutes of my life away from me. If you are thinking of renting this movie, please don't it will waste 90 minutes of your life. Reconsider renting this and go on and find a movie that actually makes sense.

This version of `` The Magic Flute '' is not only the worst production of Mozart 's great opera that has ever been performed by a major theatre company in England, but it also is the only one of Mozart 's works to which all three of Britain 's leading opera companies have chosen to premiere. The production, designed and directed by the late Sir John Dexter, was a shambolic mess. Dexter, in addition to being Mozart 's most respected and admired stage director, has also been the artistic director of The Royal Opera since 1996.

Move over Manos. Back off Boogens. It doesn't take a Baby Genius to know that Malibu Beach Vampires (MBV for the rest of this tome) is now and always will be (unless someone makes a sequel to Zarkorr The Invader) the worst film ever. The only horror in this thing is watching it. I wonder if this was an attempt for someone to meet babes by casting a movie. If this was the case, the babes ain't babes just like this ain't a movie. It's dreck. No wait. I dishonor the word dreck by calling it dreck.

Pot-seeking pre-teen Joshua Miller ( as Tim ) throws his sister 's doll into the river while Daniel Roebuck ( as Mr Beech ) helps out by fetching her doll. At the same time Mr Beech is looking around the house, looking for the doll that his sister left. Plot

The doll that Daniel is looking for is a Barbie Doll. Joshua Miller (Tim), his sister, is playing with the doll on the floor when she tells him to throw the doll into a river as it is a Barbie. Joshua says that he will do it and takes the doll into the bathroom.

I had seen this movie when I was a boy ( Before WWII ) and was surprised that the local cinema in St. Petersburg played it. Never saw the movie again and thought it was a silly story. Now that you mention it, I just saw the movie for the first time recently ( in Russia ). I thought the story was very well written with great cinematografic quality. Maybe the story isn't that great but the story itself is very interesting, and the way the whole thing ended made me very interested in seeing it for the first time.

I have a 4yr old daughter, and before this movie she was all about the Disney princesses, now she watched this movie and all she can talk about is Princess Genevieve, and all her sisters. I definitely recommend this movie for all young girls. This movie is one of the best from the Barbie collection. It shows all the good values that any mother would love to encourage on there little girls. With the great songs and dance moves, it gets my daughter up and trying to mimic the moves. The extras are also good, one even works on how good your memory is.

The Kid is a really good family movie about a stuffy image consultant , Russ Duritz , who has lots to deal with during his day-job. Like most of his day-work, he has no idea of how to do it well, and as he begins to figure out, he slowly but surely comes to grips with what he does and how to do it properly. There are some pretty great bits of dialogue like the one between Russ and his wife in which he complains about his boring job. And as he gets into this, you begin to understand how Russ sees the world and how he lives his life.

This movie was made on a relatively small budget (10-20 million dollars?) with almost no promotion at all from its distributors. I only knew about it because I am a long time Jean-Claude Van Damme fan and I always check out his latest films in hope that they will be at least watchable and aside from some real turkeys (Derailed, Second In Command), they are. This movie has an easy enough plot to follow and Van Damme gives a good, humorous performance through out but the movie owes all of its credit to the fight scenes involving Van Damme, Scott Adkins and the final one of them together.

Note : After writing this review I see that this listing is indeed about the TV series and not the film, but as I was about to put up the TV list I just remembered that it is actually a movie, so after the movie review I shall add it to the TV review as that is much better and much longer. I also will add a few pics of the movie review as I believe they deserve their own post, as well as an extra movie list as I have to add a lot of films that I have not seen.

In the 1980s in wrestling the world was simple . Hulk Hogan would take on Roddy Piper , or Bobby Eaton , or Steve Austin , etc. in a battle of strength and determination. In the 1990s the world has grown and grown, and in my opinion is now complex . It has gone past the simple of one man in a ring against another man in the ring, and into a realm of science, technology, business, politics, entertainment, and many other facets of life that make up modern-day life. In wrestling, however, it is just another game.

This film started off really tense when a poor young boy is set upon by a pack of savage dogs. After a tense chase he is saved by said grandpa with magic whip.We are then introduced to a string of annoying house mates, including one tart who is always half dressed. During this stage the film heightens tension with strange "plinky plinky" background noises that had me on the edge of my seat.I stopped paying attention for a while but when I looked back on the screen there where weird creature type things going around grunting and killing.

Distributor : GOODTIMES home video Plot : A pretty high school student is marked for unrelenting terror in this suspenseful thriller, adapted from the popular series of books by Joe Lansdale, and starring Jaimz Woolvett (Kurt Russell). A young man on the cusp of adulthood is struck by a tragic event that forever changes him and his family. In trying to cope with the aftermath of this devastating event, the family finds itself on the path to a shocking new chapter in their lives, in this first-person perspective thriller from one of horror's most popular authors and directors."

I saw the movie while I was in a class a few years back in high school. I thought it was a thought provoking movie that made you want to look into the power behind riddles. I think the type of people that wouldn't like this movie would be those who don't like solving things, or those who get frustrated when they can't solve riddles. its a good movie, based on a true story that happened in my home town of Toronto, Ontario. so if u want a real record of the things that happen in the alleys there, watch this movie.

Oh what the heck , I 'll reveal the secret : this movie stinks ! Yeah there are some nifty plot twists, but there is no real reason to watch the movie. It is just a boring movie, full of so much plot twists that it becomes impossible to understand the movie. I really enjoyed the movie and am really disappointed in how bad this movie really is. Don't bother with this movie if you don't want to waste your time in watching something that just doesn't deserve your attention. I saw this movie in the cinema.

There are only a few movies which can be called ` must see ' and SHEPHERED is one of those movies. I really want to add this to my list and I am glad I did not have to go through the pains of paying for viewing. I had read a lot about the movie but I still did not know when I would end up watching it. I just knew that the moment I would end up in this movie. The movie has its flaws but overall this movie has been one of the best movies in a long long time and I highly recommend you watch it.

Who really wants to see that? Disgusting violence, disgusting sex, for such a long time. I do not want to, but I always stayed true to my philosophy to watch any movie as bad as it may be. This was the hardest (right after "Next Friday").It's basically just crap. How can you possibly call it anything else? The story of a Roman emperor as an excuse for gore and T&A. Yeah, yeah, "Hey, it's realistic, they have been like this." Fine, but why bother us with it?

This is one of the best martial art ( Kung-fu ) movies of all time . if u love martial arts , then this movie will definitely give you a great sense of thrill and excitement . This is a very good action movie . In this movie , u will enjoy a good fight with lots of action and fights . There are some very good actors in this movie , who played the role of good actors , but unfortunately , their acting is not very good . I do not like bad acting . If u have any suggestion , please tell me .

Did people expect "Jurassic Park 3" to be full of surprises? Not one moment of it is worth it. Many elements could easily scare people out of the movies...and it's not the dinos! Tea Leoni...I think she's a great actress, but I'm sorry to say that this time she reached the bottom line. I wonder if she happened to strain a vocal chord while shooting the movie....Laura Dern...she's ok, but why not be more noticeable in the movie, maybe exchange smart dialogs with Sam Neil.

I just saw this movie for the second time . I first saw it back in the mid-90 's as a teenager . I was hooked the minute it came on . It was so very, very, very entertaining . So I went back to see it again recently and was not disappointed . I loved it as a kid . I loved it as a teen . I love the humor , the dialogue , the action , the story and just everything about it . I just could not believe it . I could not have written a review better .

This Is one of those classic American made for TV movies that are just made for watching on a rainy Sunday afternoon. It’s a story that doesn’t have a ton of action scenes, but just the right amount that make you laugh and feel the drama of the story. This Is The End is one of the best American movies to make in the last 15 years. I recommend it as a great movie for any time of your life, and even if you are not a movie buff, you will enjoy it too because of its clever use of comedy and drama.

I must say: out of all modern korean martial arts movies this one is worth checking out. It wasn't as epic as Musa-The Warriors and didn't develop the characters as well, but it had many nice ideas. Simple story: a elite soldier thought dead, returns after years to end the reign of the Japanese in Korea in medieval days. His counterpart was formerly the best friend he had and now he is out to stop him. The fight scenes are all with sword or different weapons and very entertaining to watch. The motives of the figures are discovered first near to the end.

* * * * Contains Spoilers * * * * As a fan of Rachael Leigh Cook , I watched her first season of Pretty Little Liars. Now that the show is in its final two seasons , I am a huge fan of Rachael Leigh Cook's writing and portrayal of the character Hanna Marin. The show has come a long way from it's first season , where Hanna was not a very big name in the show. Now she is a major name in the show and she has grown in power and popularity as an actress.

One of the worst theatrical movies of the year , if not all time . Anthony Hopkins belittles himself by being on the screen , and this film , in my opinion , made him look like the fool . I will admit , the acting is decent , and the dialog is witty . But the film is a train wreck of an idea . And the idea , that is the best thing about this film , is to make the audience believe they know the world of the characters , because we see them , and they know we are there .

I was expecting a lot more of this film than what I actually got. The acting was just awful from everyone and the story was far from impressive. It took a lot of something I don't to even follow what was going because it was so jumpy. An example of the acting is when Paxton's character, Vann, is upset the South Vietnamese colonel for so he throws some of the sand from the "sand map". It was impossible to get any idea of what he was feeling and his actions were robotic.

Korea 's answer to `` I Know What You Did Last Summer '' follows a similar story route to its predecessor, but in a different way, and with a very different tone and outcome. And yet it's only a prequel to what will surely be an action-packed final chapter to this most ambitious and most ambitious Korean movie franchise. When this first arrived, it looked like it was just another story from the ever-growing Korean film library, and it was, but the fact that it was set in America made it very interesting, at least compared to many other films of this type.

I 've tried watching it twice , though I have n't been able to make through either episode . For those that haven't seen it, the basic concept of the film is as follows (and is very much worth seeing for this reason alone): There's an army that's been sent up against an alien invasion of earth, and what the army has discovered is that they're being held prisoner by another race. A small group of the survivors, including the father of the girl kidnapped by the invading force, attempt an escape, but they're being pursued by the enemy.

I know my summary sounds very harsh, but this film has very limited appeal. The average Joe out there would have a hard time sticking with this film. The entire film consists of animated loggers doing their jobs and dancing on floating logs. This is all done with very splashy and artsy colors and the film might be great to show to patrons in an art museum. However, unless you really love this sort of art or are a Canadian who loves films about your native land, then this is probably going to be next to impossible to finish.

Allegedly the "true story" of Juana de Castilla, the eldest daughter of the Catholic Queen Isabella (yes, the same who funded Columbus's expedition), the film charts the progress and degeneration of her morbid obsession with her husband, the Archduke Philip of Austria, known as "The Handsome" (and played in a rather unispired manner by Italian hunk Daniele Liotti, at his most buttery and beefy here). This is a groan-inducingly familiar story of late 15th c., early 16th c. intrigue, betrayal and bodice-ripping. It drips destructive lust from start to finish.

I usually spend almost as much time writing my reviews as I do watching the film , but with Today I feel I will need to spend some of my time on my phone. I haven't seen this film yet , and was hoping that it might not be as bad as it sounds. I thought the script was a bit long and confusing, and there is a lot to go through . I don't believe in any god , but I have been thinking a lot , and I think we would all like to have the power to see into our future.

Thank God I didn't buy this movie myself! I borrowed it from a friend who bought it out of sheer curiosity and of course after viewing it feel they should be reimbursed! This has got to be one of THE worse movies I've EVER seen! I do realize they couldn't have had much of a budget but I swear I could make a better movie than this staring my pets! The acting was horrible, so was the editing, the dialogue, EVERYTHING! It was so bad that it was seriously making me angry as I watched it!

This could have been a really good movie if someone would just have known how to finish the film.The story starts out ok but just after a little while it's like the author just stopped and didn't get any further and it's all done in the most unbelievable way. I don't want to give anything away but there is a really good reason to believe that they wanted to put the story down in the last page. I'm not sure why they did it. I'm willing to give it a 9/10 on that but the whole movie was terrible.

It 's a puzzle to me how this turd of a film ever got distribution.Sure , it 's horror and all, and all that, it's got a story and it's fun, and I get that. But I've been around the film industry a good long time now, and I've only seen one film this year which I actually cared about in the least. It's an awful movie. I hope the film industry goes belly-up in my lifetime, or I will be one of the one-and-only movie fans to see this film in a theater on opening weekend.

Jack Lemmon was one of the finest actors that had ever graced the screen. He could effortlessly switch from dramatic roles to comedic with ease, making most of his peers green with envy. While his performance in "Save The Tiger" is Oscar-worthy, I feel it was given to him as he had missed out on his other opportunities to win the award due to other, better roles that had preceded this current one.This is also one of those pretentious movies that comes out to basically showcase the talent of the cast, or in this case, one particular member.

Jim Brown stars and produces a tale set in the Philippines just after the Japanese invasion. The story has the Japanese taking several navy men prisoner including some divers, who they use to retrieve the gold that MacArthur had dumped into the Manila bay.It's a messy movie aiming to make a statement about war and racism (The film uses Edwin McCain's War in a not so subtle montage). The performances are just adequate at best. Jim Brown is okay, but he doesn't really show any sort of range in a performance that just has him standing there looking annoyed.

A savage, undisciplined lion has been put behind bars for a circus carnival. He suddenly notices a hole on the floor of his cell, then sticks his nose into this hole to snuff it. At first he thinks Bugs Bunny's home is belong to a camel; yet when he wakes Bugs up from his sleep hoisting him up to the ground, there he meets with Bugs, his next trainer. If you ever wonder how Bugs would turn a savage lion into a Hawaiian hula dancer with traditional skirts on, you should watch this cartoon.

Lackawanna Blues is a moving story about a boy who is raised in a house by some pretty unusual people. It's editing and soundtrack really pulls you in to the story and lets you experience the film the way the writer really meant for it to be seen.The music really tied into the story, which made the characters come to life. The editing made the story more progressive and captivating. I was also surprised by some of the performances of the cast, most notably S. Epatha Merkerson's.I can't wait to see the one man show featuring this films writer, Ruben Santiago-Hudson.

If You can watch a film without worrying about the plot, or corny acting, then Backdraft is definitely the one.However, if, like me, you like watching films that you can believe, then Backdraft has some serious flaws. It doesn't offer anything new, and there are hundreds of 90's action films that follow identical formulas, whilst not being quite as clunky.After two firefights, i'm thinking, this has got to go somewhere else, i mean, how many big fires are there in one city? Surely firemen do other things, such as getting cats out of trees?

An expedition party made up of constantly bickering and obnoxious jerks go trekking into the dangerous African jungle in search of a long-lost village. You’d think that by now, I’d be over my obsession with “Lost.”

I mean, the entire series of movies and the books they were based on have been about people trying to find a village in the rain forest in Southeast Asia. In my head, I googled, read books, watched TV shows, watched episodes of the TV series in my entirety.

This is an OK adaptation of the breath taking book of Dan Brown . I ca n't say it is any better. I just can't figure out how they think they made it work as well as they did. The author and the illustrator both did a wonderful job and I thought it was a fine book. There are two characters: Dan and Jack, both are good guys, and there are plenty of other good guys to boot, and bad guys. The action takes place in a time period of the 20th century. It is not really about the 20th century, which makes sense.

Walt was particularly fond of quality . So how come the producers at Disney would release such a terribly edited version? While Disney may have been in a rush to make the movie work, it seems they were also in the process of making the movie work for themselves. One of the first scenes is when we first hear the voice-over explaining how the characters look like they were carved out of a block of wood. This is not the sort of scene you'd want in the middle of the film, where the characters are talking to their friends.

This movie and several other movies from the 1950s with a religious overtone, such as The Robe, Quo Vadis, and Samson and Delilah, unfortunately depict all pagans or anybody who isn't a Jew or Christian as morally depraved and decadent. The focus is only on biblical-related stories that ignore the world outside the Bible. As far as they are concerned, nothing good came from pagan Egypt, Greece or Rome.Any movie that preaches about the "one true god" gives a short shift to freedom of religion. The movies ignore the fact that ancient Judea's lack of religious freedom made it a fertile ground for religious extremism.

This is a snuff movie. I'm shocked it is even considered to be in the IMDb library. And, Bill, Julia, and all other "professional" actors involved should be ashamed to be part of this sick flick. I thought I was going to view a somewhat classic horror film with a creative end that writers like to invent....that usually make no sense when writing a horror film, but as a viewer, we try to rationalize and understand. This ending was not creative. It was sick and has all the earmarks of a snuff movie.

Yes, maybe there are parts of this film which require suspending belief a little but that doesn't take anything away from the film's charm and wonder. It was shown as part of our town's youth film festival and was the organising committee's favourite. Which is not surprising. The subject matter - coming together in a race-torn, though post-apartheid South Africa is highly topical and the treatment of the theme is inspirational. Of course, as the previous comment mentions the film does have its shortcomings, but the realism of the setting and the way the director treats his subject matter belies these shortcomings.

I have to admit that I absolutely loved this movie . Of course as I 'm sure you know that most of my comments are subjective I am going to use my own personal experiences with this movie as I am not going to comment on others thoughts and opinions about it. From the very beginning this film was a treat. As a teenager I had no idea what a good movie was. I had watched many movies on TV before this one and I have to say those were not good movies to me and I had not the patience to sit through an entire movie to finish the story.

This is another of Robert Altman 's underrated films ( let 's be honest , the only movie he 's ever made worth watching ) and I 've actually had to go back and re-watch it more than a few times because it's so damn funny. Altman plays a TV producer ( Richard Benjamin ) who has an idea about a reality TV show where the hosts have to be interviewed and then judged on how they talk, dress, etc. The problem? The host doesn't want to be on the show, but they're being forced.

This is one of the most unoriginal , cliche-ridden movies I have ever seen . Even if you did n't see this , you still might think it's great . This was one of my favorite movies of all time . The way the characters react and interact during the movie is so touching that I still can think about it after all these years . It is also a very important movie because it's the one movie that I watched with my father when I was about 3 or 4 . It's a story about family , brotherly love and friendship .

A great performance by Emily Grace! I stumbled upon this movie while browsing my satellite listings and was curious by the summary of the plot giving by my satellite service provider. I was high entertained and had much compassion for the character "Alice" played by Emily Grace. The story had me guessing in what would happen to Alice and was not predicable.
