The overall story was refreshing and had some great twists to the supporting characters. The ending of the story ended on a rather fair way. I will purchase this DVD to add to my library.

Ever watched something so awful you just have to keep watching to be sure it really is as bad as it looks? This is one of those films. It was slammed by the critics on it's release, not least for the way it was funded. I caught it on TV last night and gave in to curiosity.In the event, it is what it says on the box, no more nor less: low level humour, crudity, very much in the 'Carry On...' vein but with 'adult' language.

See Three Colors: Blue and Three Colors: White. They are both wonderful films and will give an added dimension to the finale Three Colors: Red. Red is a fantastic film. It can be enjoyed in a single viewing, and indeed, the climax of the film is very powerful in that first viewing. But, watch it again. Once you understand the use of symbolism and character parallels in this movie, you will see new things with each viewing. With the first viewing you understand that the film is the work of a brilliant mind.

When all we have anymore is pretty much reality TV shows with people making fools of themselves for whatever reason they happen to have. What is reality TV if not making fools of yourselves? I'm sure there's a few people who find the whole concept of making fools of themselves entertaining so why not give them a place to do so? I'm sure there are other people who find making fools of themselves funny so there must be people making fools of themselves out there somewhere and you just have to go and see them, right? Right.

I seriously don´t know why this movie got such a hostile reception when it was first released . Sure , the plot has a lot of violence in it (as does almost any horror movie) and there are some graphic scenes and even some sex (which is always great for shock value!) . But the film is very much worth watching . The story is based on an old legend from the gothic age and is actually quite well written . And the acting and direction is superb . It´s a great piece of cinema and worth watching on a big screen and with a lot of people .

Seriously ! You 've just got to see this movie to understand everything that is wrong with it . It's a very emotional movie . This is why people will go see it . The main character is one of the most likeable guys you ever meet . I 'd like to see how the movie would be with some more characters in it . I really think it's a great film . I 'll post it up here to share my views with you . This is a must go watch . The most likeable guy you ever meet? If it was a woman I would agree with you.

... I ca n't believe there are actually people here who recommend this movie ... This is such a slow-moving movie, and I'm sure they didn't do it on purpose. It really takes a lot to drag out a movie like this. I think they should have sped things up if they weren't trying to tell the story that way. It would be better to slow it down, but there are certain scenes in this movie where it is very hard to take in the dialogue. This is such an amazing movie. I am not even sure where to begin with this amazing film.

Oh yes, I admit I have made myself guilty of the crime of seeing this piece of trash. I can't say I was forced by aliens who pointed a gun at my head, tied me to a chair and made it impossible for me to close my eyes and then turned this awful excuse for a movie on. No I did it with free will. I deliberately tortured myself. Let's go through the fact here folks. - The acting is an insult to humanity. - The plot (if it exists) is ridiculous.

This film has recently been televised by Turner Classic Movies . It may have been considered racy in its time, but its subject matter is still relevant in modern-day society. The film

The film is based on the real-life story of a 17 year old boy who went to a party and shot and killed 13 people with an automatic pistol. While this may sound shocking today, the murder of 13 young people by a young man who was upset over the breakup of his relationship with his girlfriend is still an issue that continues to be discussed and debated in public.

I have just seen Today You Die. It is bad, almost very bad.1) The direction and editing are awful, just awful. Almost made me turn off the movie, Fauntleroy (the director) has no idea what he is doing, he seems to be filming things at random and some scenes don't make sense at all. Also, I hate it when the same scene is used again in the same movie, in this movie some scenes were used 3 or 4 times. Pretty bad.2) The dialogue is sometimes good, sometimes awful.

I have to agree with the previous reviewer . Although the Kristin Erikson did a great job of playing the role, I have to disagree with the other reviewer . I think she played her character very well . She did well with her character and gave the viewers an insight of what was going through her mind . I love how she interacted with her husband. I enjoyed the first two episodes very much and found the third one to be the best . In the end I have to say I was quite satisfied and I did not get bored at any point .

Andy McDermott ( Tom Everett Scott ) is a shy American teenager spending vacation in Paris with his friends Brad ( Nick Robinson) and Rachel ( Mckenna Fitzpatrick ). The group are on holiday when they come across two men who want to kill them, one with a deadly knife. This is the first movie in the action thriller franchise of The Host , the first two installments of which have won the Oscar for Best Picture. The movie was also the first film to win the Golden Raspberry for Worst Picture ever, and was also banned from being shown in the UK.

Although this was the first Hunter S. Thompson documentary I have seen it was average at best despite the involvement of some of his best friends including Hunter Hayes, who did some interviews, but it would be fair to give it a passing grade. It was really the story that had me hooked and while I was not surprised by some of the revelations, there was very little that I hadn't known before that. I found the whole thing interesting though, so I watched another one the same time called The Last Great Shot.

When the Legends Die is a powerful , moving story of an orphaned Ute Indian who goes on to become the last full-blood Ute in the territory. And, it is the true story of his quest to free a band of Ute Indian warriors from white man’s tyranny. “For a young boy who never knew his father, he had a keen sense of duty, and that is what he wanted to do for a living.”







You’ve probably seen the story “I’m a Legend,” but this is not that story.

Mankind 's Self awakening is the theme of `` 2001 : A Space Odyssey '' , a process that unfolds over the course of seven hundred years of human evolution and is represented as an evolutionary cycle of consciousness development. As part of that evolution, ``2001'' begins with the discovery of the spaceship, the crew, and their mysterious purpose. This story is about how the crew's search to learn about their destination leads them into an epic journey that they will never forget. This movie is rated PG for intense sequences of violence and brief language.

This is the ultimate Kung Fu movie! This is the only Kung Fu movie! This is the only Kung Fu movie I have ever seen! I am giving this movie way too much credit! My best guess for the reason for making this movie is that someone wanted to show off someone else's martial arts abilities, but realized that you can't just film a guy fighting another guy and have people watch it, so he put a story behind the fighting... and people still didn't watch it.This movie's story line was onion skin thin.

I thought the movie was sub-par. The acting was good but not great, the story was funny but did not come out that way. The director dropped the ball on this movie. It was not James (jim) or Tea. IMHO it was the music that killed it. There is a scene where things go down hill and Jonny Cash music is playing - man was that depressing (not funny) killed my mood. After that the movie could not recover. The deportation scene had potential funny situation, good acting good set up - I even smirked but the music again was unsuited to the scene.

Despite the fact that he worked for the worst government of the 20th century , Erwin Rommel is generally well-regarded by military historians. Rommel's reputation is due, in large measure, to his ability to survive the German Army's retreat in the final days of the Battle of France and its subsequent surrender on the Elbe River on May 22, 1945, which resulted in the unconditional surrender of Nazi Germany to the Allies. Rommel was able to continue to work for the new West German government, and he continued to lead his army, which was fighting against Soviet forces in Italy.

I watched this movie a couple of weeks ago and must say: I was not impressed, not at all. I do side with the other posters when it comes to the fine performances, but some good performances do not make a good movie.On the discussion board, I found a review by an anonymous poster that captured some of the main points. It says: "'Deed Poll' is a movie that raises many questions but hardly answers even a few; a movie that is disturbing and above every attempt at categorizing; an experiment and a very conventional sexual drama despite some shocking scenes.

This movie's only redeeming factor was the fact that it was on TV for free, and that it probably helped the Romanian economy. Other than that, Hallmark needs to re-evaluate this division of their empire, and maybe keep their movies more oriented towards bizarre love affairs between cancer-stricken hemophiliacs in Mississippi. To go into details about how mindless this movie is would give credit to it for being memorable. It wasn't. I remember the act of watching it, there being vampires (some of them teenage) and some very bad dubbing.

`` 2001 : A Space Odyssey '' is set in 2001 and the main character is HAL . A computer program written by Stanley Kubrick and directed by Stanley Kubrick had a role in the creation of the movie '' 2001 and it is considered a landmark and a masterwork in the science and the film industry. It's a real masterpiece, and it has changed the film industry. The screenplay for the movie '' 2001 : A Space Odyssey '' was written in 1962. The movie had a good budget of $5 million and it has cost $250 million in the making.

Almost missed it . While visiting friends in Philadelphia sometime in the early 1980 ` s , I was channel surfing . In between the commercials for the Phillies , I happened upon a show called The Mike Douglas Interviews . I watched it repeatedly for a few months , and I still remember the first thing that happened . I must have watched a few hundred shows before the Mike Douglas Interviews , but the very first show I saw was the first one I can remember , and I don't remember the show name . I just remember seeing it .

Mean spirited , and down right degrading adaptation to the classic children 's tale not only lacks the charm of the original animated film, but the animated film makes you laugh. It's a terrible film for people that don't get jokes. This film is not a good one. It is an okay film, just not great. It is not as good as the classic film and it definitely isn't as good as the sequel. The classic film is just as funny, but it had a bit more of a heart.

Watching this odd little adventure movie , it 's hard to believe that it was directed by the same man behind the cult comedy . The same man who wrote the script for The Goonies and The Last Airbender has also made a film about a little girl with a magical sword , and the girl who uses the sword is a little boy with a bow and arrows . The plot is a simple one , a little girl named Tiana ( Emma Stone ) has a magical sword and she goes off with her brother to the village of her grandmother 's house , while her father goes to find his girlfriend in the city .

I read on the web that this film is being remade into a theatrical feature. Finally!!!!! It's about time Hollywood got their act together. The big Studios always frown at edgy material, with Oscar written all over it. Go figure! !JERICHO MILE was made ahead of it's time. It's a masterpiece.Michael Mann, a true visionary, found a way to engage an audience without overindulgence. Peter Strauss' Emmy award performance is probably the best character role I've seen in my film-viewing lifetime.

A team varied between Scully and Mulder, two other scientists, a pilot, and the guy who plays Bana on Seinfeld, go up to an Arctic research post where all members have died off by either killing each other or killing themselves. They discover there's a worm- a virus- that is parasitic to the point of madness and death. The problem is, after a certain dog lashes out, anyone could be infected, but who? This is not just my favorite episode of season 1, but also one of my favorites from the show.

I agree with the guy above , It is so funny I understand it all , but my friends just laugh at how dumb this thread is. If I had to give them advice they would just laugh at me. They keep saying "oh you got lucky" and that's why this is so much fun. I have never seen so many replies so fast. I guess I just have to ignore all this. Oh, it's true. We all say this, but that's part of what makes it so much fun.

This must be one of the most horribly titled films of all time . The kind of title that ruins a movie so completely , it becomes impossible to find the ending. It's like trying to figure out where you are if you've fallen in the ocean for four hours and can't see a thing. The opening scene is so discombobulating it should be considered the movie's centerpiece . There are three characters, all of whom you know from other films, all playing their parts in this one. Even if you've seen the opening , you'll be asking yourself the question "How could this be?"

`` Mr. Bean '' , starring the legendary Rowan Atkinson , was a huge hit during its run in the U.S., and it was considered one of the most beloved TV comedies in decades, winning the Emmy for Outstanding Television Series for Children. In Australia, the show's second season was met with a lukewarm critical response and was not renewed for an American run. But the British version is getting a second life. In the U.S., the show has been picked up to be aired on Netflix, and its first season is scheduled to arrive there in July.

An absolute classic of 80 's scare flix . This one is n't like any other as it pits pint-size pterodactyl hunters against the flying monsters . It's like the perfect blend of The Lost Boys, The Texas Chain Saw Massacre and the first film in Alien vs. Predator . It's a must-have for any action fan . This film has never been out in the US and was never even released in France . However, it was made available on videodiscs around Europe . It's currently in circulation and can be ordered from here . I believe there's a copy available in the UK as well .

The many other comments about the film say it all - just like to add that we showed it last week to around 30 at our Community Cinema, and it got an overall average score of 8.6. We'd 100% recommend it, then, for today's audiences, especially if they can see it on a real cinema screen, and can talk about it with others afterwards, as our audience did.The sheer power of the acting performances by the whole troupe was incredible and quite spellbinding. Of course, Finney and Courtenay were truly the stars. but everybody was thoroughly well cast.

This film was a huge surprise to me while i watched it at Cinequest in the big California Theatre in San Jose. It's a musical, which normally I don't like, but I have to say this one was different. Robert Peters, who directed the film and stared in it, did such a wonderful job. During his Q & A he told the audience that he only had two other people for his crew! Most of the dialouge was made up on the fly and he actually made the film while attending another film festival in Germany!

Seriously engaging , intelligent and thought provoking drama at its very best . Mean , gripping , moody and captivating story , and one of those rare occasions where it is not easy to pin down the exact reason . I liked this film so much when i was in university. I think it's a really good movie. But i didn't really understand the story or even what's going on in this movie. There's a few times I felt that the story was too predictable and it dragged on too much. I just couldn't understand what's actually happening.

Yesterday was one of those days we decided to go to the movies. We picked "Ik ook van Jou" more or less at random, but we were interested to see the state of current Dutch filmmaking.The film is based on a book by Ronald Giphart, and I must confess straight away that he is not exactly one of my favorites. The film features actors that are best known in the netherlands for their appearances in soap-operas and/or afternoon talk shows. At least one of them (Kamerling) has done some fairly decent stuff after leaving the soap world.

I enjoyed the prequels , and found the relationship between Tucker and Chan previously hilarious . RH3 , however , was just so-so . . . In fact , the movie seemed to take a lot of the lightheartedness away from TPTB . And that's what's sad . . . it doesn't have the emotional weight of the original film . In fact , you have to go back as far as the 1980s in order for it to feel like something from that period . . . and it didn't feel dated . . .

This is n't `` so bad it 's good '' -- It 's `` so bad , it violates the rules of the universe that you need to ask why the universe exists . (And if you have a better question to ask, you need to ask it better.) It 's so bad that it 's good, it means you have to ask why it 's so bad that it 's good. I have no idea. I 'm sure there's a good reason for it and I'm sure there isn't one.

One of Bolls better attempts. Just shows that if you do something long enough you have to improve just by chance. It is still not good but it is at least watchable which is an improvement over the bloodrayne. The main difference between Bloodrayne and FarCry really is that the story from Farcry wasn't the games strong point whereas Bloodrayne had a strong story and thus Boll had more chance to mess it up.The action in this movie is actually fairly good. Occasionally a touch overdone but in a good way and worth a watch just for that.Acting wise it was pretty decent.

I found this an awfully disappointing experience ! But I have appended a better option of similar style at the end of my blog. I hope it helps you. Thank you, I am glad this helped you to decide to not go down this same path. I have a great feeling you won't have any regrets after you have made up your mind... You will find that if you go down this path you'll end up doing more good than anyone could ever ask you to do. I know this because I am doing it.

Nothing will ever top KOMODO with the lovely Jill Hennessey as a shrink ( ! ) , but KvC ai is a much more interesting show, and I don’t think I’ll ever get all the way through it this way. And I’m not going to give away the name of this show because I’ll never get to the end, but I thought you might like to know it’s on Netflix. If you’ve never watched it, I strongly recommend it—it’s so much better than a lot of shows out there.

This TV show is possibly the most pathetic display of crap on TV today . Horribly predictable , obscene usage , ridiculous characterizations . And yet it has gained a massive cult following . This show will always be remembered as one of the very worst shows on American television. As a diehard fan of the series, I can safely say that I don't even watch it once a week, but I will watch it at least once a year just to watch the commercials. Why? So I can complain about how stupid this show is . You know what?

From the crash of the opening theme , `` The Man With the Golden Arm '' is classic 1950 's screwball comedy . It is a classic that was made by a master director and writer who would go on to create such classic films as `` A Night at the Opera '' , `` Guess Who's Coming to Dinner '' , and, more recently, `` A League of Their Own . '' Indeed, `` The Man With the Golden Arm '' is the very definition of a screwball comedy . It is not only a masterpiece of comedy and film , but a milestone in classic movie making.

Childish storyline ripped off of a lame Hollywood movie, terrible acting, cheesy dialogue, and not quite "up-to-par" sex scenes. That's right another great softcore parody! I enjoyed this film greatly! Sure the acting is terrible, but that part of the fun! The storyline is ludicrous, but some things must be sacrificed when the story has to revolve around girl-on-girl sex scenes. And because it's only softcore (no penetration) the sex scenes were a little bland. But it's like the great god of softcore smut Russ Meyers said "who really cares what goes down beneath the waist."

This movie , I would like to say , was completely great . I can see how many people would like to watch it , even though it was terrible . The plot was really good . The only problem with the movie , and I would like to say this was my only complaint , was that the movie could have used some more time and energy , and I think it was supposed to be about two days , but the two days was so short . I would definitely recommend this movie to everybody , but I do not think this is worth a movie .

First the premise stinks...little boy likes to dress in girls clothes. It reminded me of Norman Bates in PSYCHO or Ed Wood in ED WOOD. The jokes are lame and old, You've seen 'em in a dozen 50's & 60's films. The whole cast is wasted. I bet people signed on just to be in a Shirley MacLaine vehicle. Please, Would somebody tell Shirley she did her best comedy in TWO MULES FOR SISTER SARA. See it...if there's no reruns of Andy Griffith on.

If you have never heard of Jane Austen , seen the original movie or the 1995 BBC adaptation , or read a story by her, you will never get it. Her books have been so heavily edited and transformed into TV miniseries, stage plays and film scripts that they are now impossible to understand. And that's fine. A modern Jane Austen isn't going to be like Jane Austen. She will be a modern version. But the problem is that modern Jane Austen is the very last thing Austen would have written.

Yet another in the long line of `` Do n't '' films of the late 70 's and early 80's. As a movie about a gay man growing up in the 80's it was in no way offensive, but it had some problems. The film starts out in the early 80's in a small town in New York where there are not a lot of gay people. One of the main characters is a high-school sweet hearted kid named Andy who falls for a boy from the local football team. He ends up getting in a car crash where he gets very sick.

An art teacher comes across an antique wooden bed made from gingko trees and puts it in his apartment , where it promptly begins to decay until he finally has to get rid of it. While he’s working on the project, he is asked by his friends if he will donate the bed to a local museum . The museum staff decides to ask him if he wants to have a competition to see who could make the most beautiful and functional piece out of the decaying artifact. They award him with $500, and he immediately decides to have the bed reconstructed in his living room.

This is a great little movie, full of interesting characters and situations. While not in the same class as some of the better-known movies of its time, it is still extremely watchable and memorable. The scene where Zachary Scott, sitting on a bus, casually steals the airman pin from the lapel of a coat thrown over the seat next to him, is terrific. It defines his character beautifully -- a guy who's so low, he'll purloin something of inestimable value to a war veteran, to use as a prop in his various charades.

A genuinely creepy ghost story , full of chills and sensuality , this movie just falls short of what it tries to do. The movie is great and has a very interesting premise, but as for the actual acting , it's a let down with the lack of chemistry in the main characters, especially when it comes to Nick Cage, and not being able to control the way he is supposed to look in the movie (he looks like an angry zombie in the beginning and in a couple of scenes later on).

This movie is terrible , it was so difficult to believe that Katie became a heartfelt teenager with the power to turn into an evil killer. This movie ruined my life, I was hoping the movie would make up for what I thought I had missed in the past. Katie Holmes as a character is interesting, though, I guess she can't help but get into trouble. I don't have a problem with that, I know it's going to lead to something great in the end, but it just didn't make any sense in the beginning.

Zachary Scott does what he does best , i.e. , plays a worm , in `` Danger Signal , '' the first of the three new Star Trek series on CBS. We'll meet Kirk, Uhura and the rest of the Enterprise crew as the ship and its crew take on a mysterious new menace . In a galaxy that's in turmoil, it's up to Spock (Zachary Scott) to save the day . With a script by J. J. Abrams, an episode directed by Bryan Burk and a cast that includes Chris Pine and Zachary Quinto , Danger Signal will premiere in May.

I went to see this movie at the theater and paid money thinking it would be at least mildly entertaining. The only thing I enjoyed about it was when Robin Williams crashes into the car at the bottom of the hill, and the end, when he seems to get killed. Glenn Close was obnoxious, and she obviously did not seem old enough to be Garp's mother. A mother like Garp's would have had her kids taken away by the Department of Children and Families. Robin Williams and his glazed donut look of benign goodness is just too sweet and smarmy for me.

This movie was * good * relatively during the first parts of it.We have a story , from 3 points of view . First: the story of a boy who is in love with a girl. Second: the story of a father who is in love and married to a very beautiful girl . Last: the story of his son who is about to get married to a very beautiful girl , he does not like her. The first part is beautiful and emotional . The second part is more interesting because it has a few things that are not completely true and a lot of things that are really strange .

2005 was one of the best year for movies. We had so many wonderful movies, like Batman Begins, Sin City, Corpse Bride, A History of Violence.....Coming up we also got Brokeback Mountain, King Kong....But if this year the only great movie that came out was Everything Is Illuminated, then we wouldn't miss all this year has brought. The first movie as a director of the talented Liev Schreiber is a delightful, heart-warming, touching drama that also brings one of Elijah Wood's best roles.

I am a Talent Manager . I have been for 15 years now . I have discovered some wonderful talent in a short span of time which is why I have been doing this job for that long . I have worked in this industry for close to 20 years now so you can count me and my team as veterans in the game . This industry has seen a lot of changes in past few years . If you want to know about us and what we can offer you then please read our website . It is filled with useful info and information for all types of Talent managers in Nigeria .

To start with , I have done some further research on the film . Firslty , Jules Dassin directed and produced it and starred with Robert Mitchum . Mitchum , who was also the star of the classic film of The Maltese Falcon , also appeared in several westerns that were made in this time frame . Mitchum would also do several westerns , and they were the type of films he was known to have been in, and it was his style of western that appealed to Dassin when he began the film with Mitchum in the lead role . I found an interesting article on what Jules Dassin did not want for the film .

In a world full of films -- like `` You Got Served '' -- that blow your mind with its sheer amount of ideas, ideas like this one seem to be the most creative. But these ideas seem to be popping up from nowhere. Why is this? Why do they seem to appear out of thin air? And how, when you stop to consider what they are actually saying, do we ever come up with them, ourselves? We want to know, so we asked ourselves, and the answer is this.

I bought this video on a throw-out table at the video store expecting a good cast in what was touted as an award-winning Brit sex comedy. I guess I should have read the finer print. I rarely write a panning review, but here goes.These actors in gay roles really play games with your memories of a lot of far more worthy films. This comedy was a very cruel joke at the expense of the actors, the theatre-going public and of all the nice films that have contributed to their reputations.I repeat: is the joke about trashing the actors' other highly respectable on-screen personae with this scurrilously trashy flick?

This is , per se , an above average film but why in the name of Bog was it made ? The answer is easy , it's because it's just not good enough to make it as an above average film ? It's not good enough to be taken seriously enough to warrant being made in the same league as other films ? If it is not taken seriously enough (by the masses ) , why is it even made ? There are better films out there to fill the same shoes that " A Hijra " has.

The first time I ever saw this movie was when I was four years old . I remember loving it because it was really funny . I also remember how much I liked it , but it was a bit long . Thats why I remember it , as I found it a bit boring at the time , but today , having watched it again as a grown up , this time as a teenager , I’ve realised that this is a very entertaining movie , if you are the type of person who like funny movies .

Fortunately, I haven't seen this film in a movie, big screen, just on a small screen on video. I doubt that I would have been able to sit through the film in a cinema and watch all the violence present in the film. After watching the first 30 minutes, I became both disappointed and curious.Disappointed because of the hard to follow story line, the hardly understandable screens, the huge amount of aggression - I still don't know why I had been shown the Daesu (main character) pulling out raw the teeth of another person, his beastliness on women, him cutting out his tongue.

...and I Bought A Vampire Motorcycle staggers all over that line like a drunk with his shoelaces tied together. Some 'bad' films are quite enjoyable (like Norman J.Warren's Inseminoid), some 'bad' films are just bad (like Kent Bateman's Headless Eyes), but 'bad' films that try and do the post-modernist thing of being knowingly bad should always be approached with extreme caution. A lot of people think Troma's Terror Firmer is a bad-taste masterpiece, for example, but I'm guessing anyone over the age of nineteen will shrug it off as worthless dreck.

The animal-eating (geek) scenes were not as bad as you would think. After having watched Mondo Cane and Mondo Magic, these scenes are average. The grossest one was when the guy ate the head off the mouse. But they were so fast and few that they didn't bother me.Otherwise, the film was just sort of interesting. I always like hearing the silly voice-overs. They never sound like what you think the actor/actress would sound like in real life. I liked the bright colors worn by the princesses. The shots of weird looking bugs were cool too.

Doctor Who is amazing. It is everyones 'cup of tea'. It must be. The boys will like the monsters and the action and adventure and the girls will like the emotion and feelings that go around. Billie Piper was extraordinary as Rose Tyler. She was so emotional and made Rose so real.David Tennant is also so witty and funny and it is so enjoyable to watch.But now Billie has left and Rose is stuck on a parallel universe with her on-off boyfriend Mickey and her mother and father (he died when Rose was a baby but this Pete Tyler is from the Parallel universe).

This is a great movie for first time ninjas who are dating . If you 're trying to impress some one on the first date they might ask for a copy of this film. The film's narrative is unique in that it is the story of a female ninja (Mikie Fazekas) who is forced to retire from the ninja ranks. In order to pay for her retirement she works as a waitress in a small town bar. While waiting on customers and waiting for her car to be serviced she gets a call from her mother.

Anyone that is looking for an episode of `` Law and Order '' or `` CSI '' would have to be blind not to see or read or listen to them for years. What many of us have not yet heard is the true story of John Bresciani. John Bresciani is the man who wrote ``Law and Order: Crime and Punishment,'' which was originally broadcast on March 6, 1987, and was the longest running drama in network television history (and at the time the most popular drama in network television history) with more than 12 million viewers a night.

Mickey Rourke is enjoying a renaissance at the moment ... and fair play to him . I always liked his work, both in and out of the ring, but had never seen him do this kind of thing for long stretches. He needs to start doing stuff like this more in the future, and I hope he continues to do them. He looks to the future with confidence. It's good to see a fighter who is taking things as they come, rather than waiting on things to hit him from a long distance ... and when they do, he makes them count.

What a terrible misfire . Not only the title but the idea is the same as that Jane Fonda , who is still in her prime . She had the right idea but she chose not to go for it . It's not about the title it's the message . This movie will never make it . What a shame . I'm really disappointed . I will never watch this flick again . It's a huge let down . I really don't have much to say other than I really don't understand how anyone thinks this is a good movie.

**Possible Spoilers Ahead**Whenever fans of bad movies congregate for more than a few minutes, a name that invariably comes up is that of Larry Buchanan. This amazing director has given us remakes of other turkeys (ZONTAR THE THING FROM VENUS), cheap-jack crime dramas like A BULLET FOR PRETTY BOY, and tawdry conspiracy flicks like DOWN ON US and GOODBYE NORMA JEAN. THE LOCH NESS HORROR is a humdinger to say the least. Overlooking the fact that Loch Ness is extremely long and narrow, Larry filmed this howler on a wide and round California lake.

Oh, dear! This has to be one of the worst films I have ever seen. It's unbelievably repetitive; every scene seems to consist of people being gunned down, running round screaming, or being kicked in the face, which quickly becomes very dull. I wouldn't mind if the combat was even any good, but it isn't; the main character Phillips pushes the various goons over with ridiculous ease, and no matter how often he stands in full view of the Tracker, he never gets hit, even though extras and minor characters are being shot and blown up all around him.

This movie was extremely disappointing, I thought it would be another 'marijuana comedy' but don't be mislead, it's not at all. There are barely any weed-related jokes that come to mind, I don't even think they smoke any weed in this movie. The marijuana field is merely a plot device.My impression after seeing this film was that four friends were bored one summer and decided to write up a script full of (their idea of) witty dialog and make a movie. The product is bland dialog supported by mediocre acting, to say this movie has no 'hook' is a huge understatement.

Lil Pimp is the story of a little boy who becomes a pimp . The animation and voice acting were done by Atsuhiro Nakamura. The story is based off of the book written and illustrated by Yoko Ogawa . It takes place in Tokyo. In the series, he starts out by selling cigarettes. Soon, he will be able to take money for sex. He then has a change in heart, deciding he is better off helping women and selling them cigarettes instead. This would make his life a little easier. Soon he would be making a fortune selling women cigarettes.

Korine 's established himself , by now , as a talented and impressive image-maker . The promotional posters for Mister No , the manga about a man who dreams of becoming a video game designer , are the perfect examples . The first thing you notice about the series , and the first thing you may have noticed if you had paid attention to it , was the artwork . This was the first manga to be animated by Production I.G 's Production I.G , and it is now considered one of the most remarkable anime to this day ( in my opinion .

This movie was beyond awful , it was a pimple on the a * s of the movie industry . This movie is just a lame attempt to make more cash from the same tired tired ideas and to try to exploit the same old tired characters in a movie that has already been done . I would much rather see a good movie , but this is a great waste of time . I give this movie the worst rating I can give it , and it's not very good at all . The music is not very good and it's a very disappointing movie .

Two little girls strike a friendship . One tries to convince the other she 's a witch . The other tries to get the girl to be her friend . But is this the right way to make friends? In a small town, there are three sisters who all have two little sisters. One sister says to her other sister that her sister is a witch. The other sister says to the other sister that she isn't, that she only has two little sisters and they will both grow up and be grown up women . The girls become good friends.

Maybe we Aussies just have a totally different sense of humour and therein my lie the only problem here. I have a database of all the DVDs I own (including those received as gifts - which this was) and so, when entering a new one, I always refer to IMDb for such info as genre, runtime, director, leads etc. When entering this, I noted that it was a comedy and so I decided to watch it at a time when I wanted something light and a good laugh. Well, it was neither!

I finally snagged a copy of Kannathil Muthamittal through Netflix and spent New Yera 's Eve watching an amazing drama. After reading about the series in the recent issue of The Times of India, I thought to myself, what could it possibly mean to me? That was my first thought. To this day, I still don't have a clue. But then, like most people, there are those times that we come up with ideas. This is one of those times. This drama was a complete shock. And it has stayed in my mind even though I didn't watch it.

This movie tries to be more than it is. First of all, the acting is horrible. You have to get past the incredibly bad delivering of lines and terrible emoting. The plot is quite interesting. A shipwreck occurs (apparently because it was made out of strings and balsa wood), and a couple of guys find themselves on shore. If this weren't bad enough, some guy named Count de Sade is living there as well. He lives in fear of pirates and has gone utterly insane. Anyway, he has a large slave, a young woman, and some dogs.

The setup for "Nature of the Beast" is ingeniously simple, and fraught with limitless potential for suspense: harried salesman Jack (a very domesticated Lance Henriksen) picks up trouble in the form of hitchhiker Adrian (Eric Roberts), who seems to be in possession of incriminating information against Jack. Oh, and over a million dollars has been stolen from a casino and someone dubbed 'Hatchet Man' is dismembering people in the desert. Sounds great, right? Sort of like "The Hitcher" meets "Psycho." One or both of these men has a secret, and nothing is as it seems!

For connoisseurs of bad movies, Galaxina is a true gem. With truly horrid dialog, acting, and directing, it's no choice for people seeking a proper movie. But as one of the most unintentionally hilarious movies of its genre, it's priceless for a good laugh. In particular, the scenes involving the Harley Davidson-worshiping motorcycle cult are especially good, and many other scenes present an opportunity for a cheap laugh.Sadly, the scenes with Dorothy Stratten really fail to deliver, but since she's playing an android, I suppose one can excuse her for wooden acting.Bad movie-lovers, don't pass this one up!

I saw this movie on the shelf at Blockbuster and thought it looked cool . The DVD case touted so much that I figured it was worth $5.99. It didn't cost $5.99! It cost 3 cents. You can find it today for free on Amazon, but you better hurry because it's on sale for only $1.99 at this writing. I was thrilled to find that this great movie is available for a buck, but I was even more surprised that I have the DVD case, and that my wife has the movie for free.

Christian Propaganda...Lots of fear mongering...This is not SciFi, this is ChriFi (Christian fiction).The movie started out OK but took a sharp Christian right turn. From then on it was all about god, jc, the holy bible and the devil . The ufo's are really just demonic deception to fool people in to believing that there is other intelligent life in the universe. Satan's idea is to trick you in to thinking that there could be more to life than what is in the bible.The abductions could be used to explain away the rapture.

When a movie 's claim to fame is that Martin Sheen 's younger , less known brother stars in it , it's important to know who that actor really is. The son of Martin Sheen and Joan Collins , the child of movie royalty , the boy actor has always been about as good as it gets. There is no actor in Hollywood better known for the role of a young adult who's lost everything. In fact , the only actor in the world as universally recognized for playing such a troubled character is Robert Downey, Jr 's character in ' A Christmas Story .

In order to pull off a job like this caper in Rififi ( e.g . The Score and its opines ), one would probably need to be very talented, have lots of contacts, be willing to do any kind of risky or dangerous thing , have a large amount of cash, be in touch with the right people , etc. In other words one would need to be at the top of the class. But that is no way to run a government. Here I have a small sample of the sort of things I am referring to:

1.

When a friend and I saw this in the recent releases , we decided to get it despite the fact that it did not work. This is really disappointing. I hope they can fix this issue. Please let me know in case anyone knows how to use this

This app is awesome but unfortunately it is impossible for me to use it for more than 1 phone. The only way to use it is with a single phone. I want this app for my two phones. Can anyone please fix this problem and give me a solution.

THE QUICKIE (1 outta 5 stars)Pretty poor movie... an old-as-the-hills story about a high-ranking gangster who wants to quit, passing on his empire to his inept son. Of course, it's not going to be easy for someone in that line or work to just quit... so a contract is put out on his life. After throwing a big party an exterminator (Jennifer Jason Leigh, who I guess is *never* going to act in anything other than TV movies or low budget direct-to-video trash ever again) is called to the scene.

Whilst this is most definitely a well crafted piece of film-making , it 's thoroughly without any entertainment value whatsoever.If you have to watch a film, then watch a film. There are far better choices in terms of films available for viewing at the cinema. That said , if you enjoy this type of material , then I believe there is some merit to it. The film really is not bad, in fact it's very good. However it's nothing special in comparison with other films made of the time period.It would have been interesting to see a film such as this in the 70s/80s but not in the 90s.

Even with only 6,000 bucks and a cast of part-time actors, Christopher Nolan was a master. Nolan is in my opinion, the next great and our first taste of Nolan doesn't contradict that.None of the problems that constantly plaque and discredit the low budget independent picture haunt Nolan and crew. Our actors are inexperienced and young but they deliver and engage us in this story. In all honesty I think Following is Nolan's best screenplay because it is the one he had the most control over. It's a beautifully imagined film. It takes us into a world where we don't feel limited by the constraints of budget.

I'm really surprised seeing all these positive reviews for this movie. Don't get me wrong, it's not that I don't like 'these kind of movies'.While I very well can enjoy a good mindless Hollywood action blockbuster like Die Hard 4.0, I like the 'dogma' kind of movies, or 'real-life-as-it-is'-movies just as much, IF they are well made.A good example is Festen (1998): no music, no dramatic camera angles, no special fx, no fancy locations. Just a good story combined with excellent acting and the result is an excellent movie.Is Nine Lives devoid of dramatic camera angles, special fx and fancy locations?

Formulaic to the max. Neither title reflects the serial's actual content, "Fighting Nazis in Morocco," (actually, the Iverson ranch). The plot is just to fill in the lulls between fistfights. The packaging claims over 40 'fistic encounters' in 15 chapters. That's at least three a chapter! Aside from seeing Duncan Renaldo cast as a Spanish accented Frenchman, watching how much furniture is overturned, smashed, thrown, burned or blown up is what this serial is really all about. When the protagonists start fighting, you can bet that everything in the room will be in it, too.

In 1895, in a small village in Japan, the wife of the litter carrier Gisaburo (Takahiro Tamura), Seki (Kazuko Yoshiyuki), has an affair with a man twenty-six years younger, Toyiji (Tatsuya Fuji). Toyiji becomes jealous of Gisaburo and plots with Seki to kill him. They strangle Gisaburo and dump his body inside a well in the woods, and Seki tells the locals that Gisaburo moved to Tokyo to work. Three years later, the locals gossip about the fate of Gisaburo, and Seki is haunted by his ghost.

This is one of the movies one has to start watching with an open mind. One knows it's going to about a mute, one could look forward to or be afraid for a lot of sentiment.Well, forget it. The movie starts with a little black humour, and then gets started. From then on its takes you on an ever frightening ride through the dark centers of Moscow. All right, it must be said: the unexpected twists are expected, and the mute is mainly used as a plot tool or fear builder.

I saw this movie with my girlfriend. It was a total disaster. You can really see it was cheaply made. Badly scripted and with very bad acting. I have read several versions of the book by different authors and also listened to one version on audio book. We couldn't take the movie seriously because of the lacking elements it should have contained. The experience of watching this was like The Blair Witch visits Green Acres. Then there were parts that were vulgar. They show this little boy using a bed pan and they actually show the contents of it.

Is there a fire fighter cliché that is NOT used in this film? From the opening line "I'm getting too old for this" through the "antics" of the firemen, to the "worrisome wife" the loss of his best friend in the firehouse, to the final funeral for the fallen brethren, this film looks and sounds like it was written by the marketing department at Disney ("Our studies show that audiences really like it when..." and then they stuck it in).There is nothing original here.

It's difficult to decide who or what is the target audience for this film. Jean-Pierre Limousin presumably had the chance to explore the problems of amnesia on a serious level and opted instead to use it as an excuse to make a soft-porn movie. Having seen, loved, admired and respected Se Souvenir des belles choses which explores memory loss - albeit as the result of Alzheimer's - in a profound and heartbreaking way, not least in the luminous performance of Isabelle Carre I find that Novo is an insult to Se Souvenirs.

And obviously I didn't see it! But looking at the cast and seeing that Doug Masters is back from the dead, I know now to avoid this like the plague! I hate it when Hollywood, producers, writers, directors or all of the above think that audiences are stupid that they're not going to catch continuity errors. A supposedly dead Doug Masters returning is a big giant one, won't you say?And I can't believe that someone like Louis Gossett, Jr. would return for something like that.Did Jason Gedrick really decline this?

This could have been a really good movie if someone would just have known how to finish the film.The story was going along just fine and heading towards that point in every movie like this where the "gray" characters turn "good" and the "bad" guys get their just desserts and *boom* ... it's like they ran out of script and the cast just started to make things up.Which wouldn't have been so bad ... if the cast had just continued with the character development they had already put in place.

This is not exactly what I would call a Mad Max film, after seeing Road Warrior and experiencing the excellence of that film, I felt somewhat disappointed after seeing this. It supposedly started out as some kind of kids in the wilderness film, and was merged with the Mad Max franchise(bad idea). The casting was not exactly the best, I mean come on Tina Turner? One of the main problems with this film is that there are no good villains. No Wez, no Humungus, not even a decent Toecutter!

Scarecrow Gone Wild starts as high school teenager Mike ( David Zelina ) & his mates decide to to give it one more go at beating their highschool bullies. What seems to be an ordinary day for Mike quickly turns sour when his friend Sam ( Alex Pettyfer ) turns his back on him and the group goes on the hunt to settle the score. They soon find they're not the only ones who are hunting their bullies, and soon find that things are only going to get more insane as they all become hunted in the most bizarre way.

whomever thought of having sequels to Iron Eagle must be shot. In this case once was enough. Iron Eagle was a good movie to watch. Even though it is unrealistic, it is still entertaining. Iron Eagle II has a senseless plot and can be used to as a cure to insomnia. I didn't even bother to watch Iron Eagle III, but from looking at the R rating, I assume it's more violent than the past 2 movies. Well, Iron Eagle IV is probably the most inane sequel. Lou Gossett Jr. returns as the always delightful "Chappy" Sinclair.

Another winner from that 50s , 60s era that I love so much for the comedic value they give with each viewing these days .Corman never lets you down with these films , they take themselves seriously and they have very low budgets , a recipe for good watching for sure . Ed Nelson a very competent actor got started with Corman as well as many other favorites who show up in Superman and many of the westerns of the day . The costume is pretty bad and the sound of the alien speaking , well the reverb was a little off but thats the beauty of it .

I , like many this evening braved the frigid winter and long lines to see what I had anticipated to be a small, dark, and drearier screening. Instead, I found a film that I can’t get enough of as I wait for my copy to arrive for review. For the past couple of months, I have been waiting for the opportunity to revisit this movie. I had only seen the movie once a long time ago and I knew that I would have to sit through the entire movie in order to do so.

This rendition of `` Noah 's Ark '' has set Hallmark 's ( and Turner 's ) reputation back about 20 years. It is, in my view, far superior to the '60s version, and it is one of the most visually striking shows that they have put together in many years - at least at Hallmark. I loved it, and so did several of my family, so I am posting it on my blog. And, because I love it too much to let it go unmentioned, I am offering a free download of it in .avi format.

This has to be the worst movie i've seen this year.. and i watch a lot of cable. The plot is just ridiculous, the scenes are just thrown at you with no action, no start or ending of any scene.. it's just random idiots with make-up that scream in some plane.. The "special effects" ( Spielberg would laugh his ass off ) are horrible, the yellow eye contact lenses are cute though.. I have to admin that i couldn't bear to watch it to the end.

Seems to me that Joe Estevez spends most of his time hidden under the shadow of his rather successful brother and appearing in really bad movies. Joe spends most his time walking around dressed in black and looking quite moody. He takes orders from a puffy faced angel of death, who you might recognize as the puffy faced villain from Tango & Cash and as the puffy faced cyborg from Future War. Well, Joe and Puffy have a job to do and it involves taking some souls of some kids in a big car being driven by a dumb galloot who questions Led Zeppelin.

Brett Piper again makes a very good film that is trashed by the so called film `` experts . '' and this one is no exception. Piper is the best of the best and if you have watched his other films you will be amazed how well he captures the emotions of the characters. He gets the best performances from the cast as well. But this film is one of his worst. I have never been a fan of his work and his films are always the best. This film is one of them.

`` Cat In The Brain '' is a series of extremely violent sequences knitted together by a plot that feels more like the work of a film script than that of a film. The series has had a number of filmmakers working on the scripts, many of them with varying degrees of success. It has been described by director Paul Haggis as one of the most violent films of all time and by writer/director David O. Russell in a New York Times review of ''Bad Lieutenant'' as being his '''most horrifying'' film'.

One of the worst theatrical movies of the year, if not all time. Anthony Hopkins belittles himself by even appearing in this joke. I can't believe David Mamet and Ridley Scott's name appear on this travesty. The best career move Jody Foster ever made was turning this one down. Julianne Moore was as emotionless throughout as a female Keanu Reeves. Gary Oldman was of course, his brilliant self. He is a crippled victim of Hannibal and the make-up is so good, I didn't know it was Gary until the final credits. but eaten by trained boars???

Dark and bleak sets, thrilling music that cuts through your spin like aknife (or razor) a perfect cast lead by Broadway greats Hearn and Lansbury. This is exciting theatre flawlessly transferred to the small screen. Sondheim is the most talented songwriter of our age and Todd is his Masterpiece, from the Brechtian opening ballad to the darkly humorous Act I finale- "A Little Priest" where Lovett and Todd fantasize about the victims that will wind up in their meat pies , this play never ceases to thrill,excite and satisfy.

I can name only a few movies that I have seen which were this bad. This movie has terrible everything: The dialog is corny and cliché', the acting is poor for the most part with a few exceptions, the cinematography is nothing to cheer about, and the plot is silly (A fat woman stalks a suburban family because her daughter didn't make the soccer team). This is so bad, it's funny to watch. If you can catch this on lifetime, I'd recommend it highly as a comedy.

Ineffectual , molly-coddled , self-pitying , lousy provider Jimmy Stewart is having a bad marriage to Carole Lombard . After losing both of his babies in a car crash, he’s on a quest to prove the world wrong about the evils of contraception, abortion and the evil of marriage, all while raising his three children with the help of her two nannies. And just in case he doesn’t win the Nobel peace prize by the time he gets his Ph.D., she does it all with a smile on her lips . . . or is it a smiley face?

So what is one to do if you are a porno star with fading looks ? I know , become a prostitute and get paid to be fucked. Unfortunately, there are very few good looking people out there with good money to spare. One of the reasons for that is all the good looking women out there that are married and pregnant.

I must have been in a good mood to give this shameful , predictable , embarrassing movie even a 3-star review (and it was just given a 1-star rating for the bad acting, which makes me think they gave it the lowest rating out of all their reviews) . I'll just leave it at that. If you want more on the movie, check out the film's IMDB listing. I do not care for this movie at all but I have to give credit where it is deserved. I have to give credit where it's due.

John Knowles modern masterpiece, A Separate Peace, are one of many subtle, and subtly is the watch word, themes of love, hate, jealously, denial and regret. The 1972 version does attempt to address this style and what the book is - A love story with war looming in the background. The 2004 version does not use subtly at all but overtness in the portrayal of the story. What is staring you in the face when you read the novel - is a love story, and yes maybe it is arguable, a gay love story.

For a TV movie this was definately worth seeing. All the acting was very well done and the story itself had a touching universal theme. I have not read/seen the original and as a rule I can't stand Shakespeare, but I enjoyed this movie(the civil war setting was very well done as well). Dont expect to see an epic, however you should find it moving enough to enjoy. By the way (on a side note) don't compare this (or any other movie for that matter) to the original work.

This movie is terrible, it was so difficult to believe that Katie became a heartfelt teenager with the power to save the pity Chinese people, the movie didn't show any convincing argument to prove that. And the rest of the plot didn't make any effort to show us more than a cheap common sense... The plot is ridiculous and the only thing we can extract from it is that it demonstrate how arrogant a human can be. Katie must have inherited her arrogance from her mother, the most annoying character I have seen for a long time.

I 've seen various Hamlets , and I 've taught the play . As I watch Jacobi , I 'm thinking of one line in one play of Hamlet 's , which is spoken by the Prince before his murder. The line says , "What was I doing when you first took me in your arms ?" It is a difficult line , and it might seem strange to most of us . But to Shakespeare , it is a line of love , and it is a line that I think of often , because it is such a wonderful play .

OK....so, by minute 15 in the film, there's still no dialogue.This film arrived to me in a padded sack from Down Under, with Sharpie encrypted info on the front. I am a programmer from a North American fest, and MOD LOVE was sent thru to me by our chief as a potential starter having preem'd at the far-away Moscow/Karlovy Vary interface.Straight away I thought "this film is not for us" (no dialogue by minute 15??) but kept watching anyway. Well, well, well.

(Possible ?? spoilers included, but nothing critical given away. )I just watched this classic low budget movie on video, and was knocked out by the level of energy present on screen. All the actors do themselves proud, especially John Daniels, must see another of his films. Not only does this movie boast great performances, but manages stylish sequences, like when the baron throws someone out of a window and we see shards of glass falling into a swimming pool which erupts from the impact of the fallen man, i love the way slow-motion photography was used in 70's cinema, dreamy and hypnotic.

As a child I was never in a situation where I could be introduced to Dr Who and though I had heard of the series in passing, I never really realized exactly what it was. It was, then, with some hesitation that i sat down to watch the ninth Doctor and his antics having be told that he was something like Arthur Dent (from the Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy) but cooler. I can't believe what I've been missing out on, seriously, why had no one told me about this before?

Ham-handed homage to honest hacking . Felt good in a soft-core way about equivalent to its mild pornography , until it came up to the surface , and started to show its teeth . Maybe because it got a lot more explicit , and then a lot heavier . Then it got more explicit still , and so did its heart , and that really scared the hell out of me . Then when it got really explicit , and started to show it's face , I felt the pain of the death of an innocence , because you can tell that it had been dead for too long .

Okay , so I love silly movies . If you enjoy silly sci-fi movies , over the top movies , and comedy movies you are in for a treat. So here is a list of a few great silly sci-fi movies that are not only funny but thought provoking as well. This is a list of some of my top 10 favorites and most memorable silly movies. Let me know if you guys have some of your favorites as well or any you would like to share . These movies make me think about what is important in life and what really matters in life.

Overall, a well done movie. There were the parts that made me wince, and there were the parts that I threw my hands up at, but I came away with something more than I gone in with.I think the movie suffers from some serious excess ambition. Without spoiling it, let me say that the obvious references to the trial by fire in Ramayana, is way beyond what this movie stands for. The Ramayana is an epic. Not a 200 page book that puts down women in India. The movie is about two girls married into a very distinctive Indian family.

this film explores if not creates a whole new genre with perfect imperfection -- - hilarity , truth , fun and above all humanity -- it's a love story of two women that are in the process of changing the world and have come to their own personal understanding of their true feelings for one another . This film is a work of fiction based on their true life . This film is an amalgam of two stories :
One is the story of two young women who come from two different backgrounds and come from two completely different cultures .

this is one of the worst movies ever There is a scene where they are supposed to be underwater and they can only see 3-4 feet of space. It's like they were filming underwater and they didn't have enough actors. It's ridiculous

This is the worst of the toxie series by far . The acting in Tokyo is horrible and you can feel like you're watching a play or movie . It starts out promising and goes down hill . We are in a small town, a homely widow (Ida Lupino) hires a handyman (Robert Ryan) to look after her house. She soon starts to regret it as Ryan grows erratic by the hour, it appears that she is host to a dangerous schizophrenic, and now she is unable to escape her house.Beware, My Lovely is adapted from Mel Dinelli's {The Spiral Staircase} story and play called "The Man". Pretty much a one set movie and a two character driven piece, the film boasts two great central performances and offers up an interesting take on mental illness.

One of the movies i just DID N'T want to see . I got it in the sneak-preview , but thought I would wait til i got the dvd release to see it . What a let down . I thought this movie would be great , it would have been perfect with it being in a time period in the 1960's ,but instead this movie has been trashed by all the critics . The plot for Black Mama White Mama , revolves around two female inmates , at a women 's prison in the U.K. . Their first encounter leads to a romantic liaison , that quickly turns into a violent sexual altercation . The second encounter results in a fist fight . The two women end up imprisoned at the prison , in separate cells . They have only one thing in common . Black Mama White Mama is set in a prison for women in the United Kingdom , where two women are housed in separate cells . Each of the women have one thing that links them , and that's a common enemy .

within about 5 minutes in to the film the first fight scene i was watching i just could help but think something was very strange but then when i went to see the actual film the scene i mentioned was actually very much like the scenes in the film the film started with them having a good time and then a very long fight scene and then it cuts to the end and then i just thought it was odd they would have so many fights scenes if it was like that in the film at all. I agree. I've read the same things.

As a fan of author Gipharts lightheaded and humorous books (of which Ik Ook van Jou is not the best one), I was looking forward to see this film. I didn't catch it in cinema though, and after seeing it on to tv I'm terribly happy I resisted buying it on video. Out of a good book, they managed to make one of the worst movies in Dutch film history. All the good parts have been left out, the story is changed, not to its benefits. All humour has been cut out.

This movie is funny if you 're the gentleman who was sitting about three rows behind me ( repeating every line) who was actually a woman who sat in a man's seat! I loved the movie and would highly recommend it. Now, I know that I said this is one of the movies that we don't really need to worry about spoilers but I will say this: if you want to know what happens, you need to go and see this movie because the rest of this movie is spoiler filled.

The most die-hard worshippers of John Wayne will cringe when they watch The Lawless Frontier . Even for a poverty-ridden town of the Dust Bowl era, it's not hard to tell how little there was to warrant the presence of a charismatic Hollywood star. What you'll find when you head to The Lawless Frontier are dozens of old Westerns, but this isn't the kind of Western where cowboys ride into town on horseback, or shoot people in the town square. There are no cowboys in town. No horses in town.

As we are well aware , movies are not set out to be a direct incorporation of history , but they should at least have some relation to it . Movies are also a reflection of the society around them, which are not always very clear about what was actually happening in the last century or even 100 years earlier , especially if they are not a part of the public eye . But even if all of the facts are lost , movies can still give an impression of the past . And that impression has a very direct and real influence on the way we remember it .

One of the reviewers here wrote: "Good acting, good special effects, greatlocation. Even better ending. " All I can say is, "Ugh." This movie was painful to watch. Let me start by saying this: I am a Christian- considered extremely conservative by many people I know. So, what I am about to say is not biased by the"Christian content" of the film. I'm not gonna bash it because it's Christian. I am gonna give it a 2/10 because it's a horrible movie.

`` Driving Lessons '' sees two middle class quintessential British families meet head on , when Grint 's character comes to stay at the family mansion, only to be horrified when he discovers there's more going on at home than meets the eye.

'' A Walk to Remember is the story of the extraordinary relationship between the Duke of Clarence and Queen Elizabeth I, and is a moving testament to the importance of faith in the lives of two people who loved each other so deeply. ''' A Walk to Remember 's author, Andrew Motion, was also the subject of a recent BBC Radio 4 programme.

There is no reason to watch this film.Why ? Many reasons . First up , the acting is awful . I really cannot say this is bad or great acting but it is a lot to ask for . It would have been better if the actors were playing their own parts and did not take over the roles that the director and the writers assigned to them . They have to make the decisions and it is their duty to make it look believable . They also have to understand that you are watching a film with no stars and that if you have stars the audience may not believe the film is going to happen .

I work at Memorial Hermann Hospital (TMC) and was also working at Texas Children's Hospital, Women's Hospital, and West Houston, during Allison. First the shots of the hospital are sadly suburban. The Texas Medical Center has a daytime population density similar to Wall Street!! There are huge skyscraper professional buildings and hospitals. TCH was the largest Children's Hospital before it doubled in size, TWICE! Methodist, with its 1500 beds is one of the largest hospital in world. The Texas Medical Center skyline is bigger than that of Memphis.

First of all, I believe that this movie is much more appreciated by viewers who have actually read Joseph Conrad's "Heart Of Darkness", the book that was the literary basis for the movie. With that said, I believe that this movie is astounding. It is an excellent war film that doesn't so much concentrate on the gore and brutality of the Vietnam Conflict, but more the psychological toll that it took on the young, inexperienced "kids" who were sent to fight it. Coppola showed real genius in the art of film-making, using many visuals to help tell the story.

Everyone has their choice for "worst movie they've ever seen." Some like to pick on Gigli or Battlefield Earth. Some pick on classics like Plan 9 From Outer Space. Ever since I was 14 I have been very vocal in saying that to me, it is Problem Child 2, and 9 years later, I feel the exact same way. It's not "one of the worst," it's not just an expression. It is THE ACTUAL worst movie I have ever seen.How much farting, pooping, peeing, and puking can you put in a single movie?

Another decent offering from the pen of Vince Gilligan.A pre- '' Malcolm in the Middle '' Bryan Cranston plays Patrick Jane, a detective who is on a case with a very strong moral and ethical code. But, as is his wont, he fails to live up to that standard. This is not only an interesting story about a flawed human being, but an interesting show as well. Cranston has been around for long enough now that he should probably be in his 50's (or 60's, if he wants to be), which is about where he's been the last decade or so.

I cannot stress how bad this movie is. This director took every cheap little unintelligent shot at making these people look so "distressed". Why are their clothes so dirty? Why on earth would you get the new clark kent to play a crack head? You should be banned from motion pictures for the rest of your life Buddy Giovinazzo.I take serious offense to this fool wanting to cast real actors as thugs and lowlifes as some kind of clever joke. Why would you ask Clark Kent to play a crackhead? Why are they yelling so much? Why is everyone so mean?

Sorry , after watching the credits , I thought this would at least be a decent homage to retiring SF. I had a lot more expectations of the show before seeing it , but I think it’s actually a very good series. It started well , and has some great stuff in it . And to think , after watching it , I almost feel that there are still more stories left to come from the universe of SF. I hope it will get more love from people that haven’t watched it yet . And I really hope that the show will not end , but will be continued .

THANK GOD YOU 'RE HERE is painful , positively painful . The title is apt , in a sense , as it has to do with what is said to the audience in the show , as opposed to what is on the record with the cast . There's no easy way around it , as this is just the sort of thing I would like to hear . If it were for the audience only , I would say I love it . But this is the public , this is for the critics , as well . This is one of my favorite episodes in the series .

Incredibly , `` Vampire Assassin '' is significantly worse than such atrocities as `` Tequila Body Shots '' and `` Vampires Don't Eat Lunch ''. This is true whether it comes to the very first episode, or to any episode after it. Even with the first episode, the story is at best one dimensional and at worst two-dimensional . The story has virtually no characterization , which is surprising, considering that it was created by one of the most acclaimed and most beloved writers in recent years , Joss Whedon. But this is not surprising, as the plot is essentially one big plot device.

Red Skelton plays a radio detective known as "The Fox" in "Whistling in the Dark," also starring Ann Rutherford, Conrad Veidt, Eve Arden, Virgina Grey and Rags Ragland. Wally Benton, aka "The Fox" finds his plans to marry his fiancé Carol (Rutherford) thwarted when he's kidnapped by a the leader of a sham cult (Veidt). Joseph Jones (Veidt) has just learned that his cult, The Silver Haven, is not getting a promised inheritance because of the existence of the old woman's nephew, who is going to be living off of the interest.

I feel that this movie is different from so many others in that it shows a family of girls who actually care about each other. They may have faults, but bitterness and put-downs have no place with these girls. Try to find that on TV or in the usual movies. It is a breath of fresh air to see girls being feminine--wearing beautiful, feminine dresses and shoes. Contrast that with the apparel in stores today, i.e. raggedy and faded jeans and jackets, etc. The story line has an evil thread running through but that is what makes it more realistic and interesting.

Lackawanna Blues is a drama through and through. It details the life of a strong woman by the name of Rachel Crosby (S. Epatha Merkerson). Rachel is referred to as Nanny by all who know her, but she could have just as easily been called Wonder Woman. She epitomized strength, will power, confidence and resolve. She owned a home that she used to house just about every type of person that society would reject. Her tenants consisted of a lesbian, a psychotic war veteran, an amputee, and a host of other vagrants that made the home miles away from ordinary.

This film brought a whole new meaning to that well-worn phrase 'like watching paint dry' because this was 'like watching paint dry in the middle of a monsoon'.I was attracted to the film by its location on the west coast of Portugal which I have visited. It is a ruggedly beautiful place and the black-and-white introduced a whole new dimension to the beauty. That was the only good thing. The story was appallingly banal and frankly you have to have some story.A film crew runs out of film and the entire crew then have to wait. Well, a wait is a wait.

Dreamland started out moderately interesting but never went anywhere except Tedium city . A low rent affair with no name and nothing to draw you in to it other than the premise and the idea that you can get a good steak for a good price and get to see the sun set in the west. That may or may not sound like a great deal of fun. For most people, that's not really a reason to come out. But for people who are attracted to a place like that and like to stay there, that is definitely a compelling reason.

Who does n't love the muppets ? ! Impossible it is to watch them without getting some kind of warm and fuzzies about life, even if you have only just started. There's nothing better in the world than to sit down to watch "Muppet Babies" and have your mind transported back to the good old days when life was simpler, more innocent and more...well, you know. Nowadays, everything seems too complicated, but if you look back to when things were easier, then you'll never know anything else.

A scientist ( George Zucco ) wants to create wolf men out of American soldiers to fight the Nazis , but the project falls apart when they discover they are inbred and genetically identical. The scientist ( Michael Biehn ), who is the only one who is aware of the true nature of the project, leaves town, taking a young man along. The two are then picked up by a military man who says he is a Nazi agent , and on their way to Munich where they will fight the Nazis . They eventually get lost in a snowstorm on the road and have to travel by sled dog team.

Part of the BBC filming of all of Shakespeare 's classic plays , this version of Hamlet does nothing to upstage that great work of art. If anything, I'd prefer it to be directed by Sam Mendes and written by Andrew Davies. For some reason I have a weird relationship with this particular play, I have seen it in the last few years and it always makes me smile. For the first time ever it has a happy ending so it makes me happy too. For that reason I would love this to be done by Ben Wheatley or Sam Mendes.

Abderrahmane Sissako may have known what he was doing when he made "Bamako," but the rest of us can just sit back in mystification and confusion trying to figure out what that purpose might have been.The nominal "plot" involves a young African singer who's planning on leaving her unemployed husband to find work in the city. But far more of the screen time is taken up with what the publicists for the film describe as "a mock trial against key financial institutions" dealing "with the overwhelming economic hardships of Africa."

You might think that a show about regular teens with superpowers would be interesting , but it 's far from that. Instead, it's like The Flash or Arrow on steroids. Instead of a super hero, they 're all super teens who are outcasts and in search of a place to belong, or to be part of something. It's a pretty good show but the problem is that you need to know what to look for to really enjoy the show. While it has the usual super heroes, it 's all about the teenagers in search of their own destiny.

From a perspective that it is possible to make movies that are not offensive to people with strong moral values, this one is definitely worthwhile. This is the second Bruce Willis film in a row that manages to tell its story with no nudity, off-color humor, profanity, or gratuitous violence. (I refer of course to The Sixth Sense.) Both movies are engaging on more than one level. This one is appropriate for children as well, although as others have pointed out, it isn't a flick FOR kids.

When I first saw Stella on comedy central I thought "god, this is horrible!" But I loved Wet Hot American Summer. So I knew something didn't make sense. There was nothing left for me to do but search out for the Stella shorts which I had heard contained more dildos than any other comedy troupe out there. When I found them not only were my dildo expectations met, but I found probably the greatest comedy scenes I've seen in years. The set of twenty odd short films put me on the edge of my seat with water running down my legs.

Visconti's Death in Venice qualifies as one of the most beautiful films ever made. While watching, we acknowledge we are in the hands of a visionary genius. Endlessly opulent Death in Venice surely is; but in other important ways, it's an unsatisfying film. Thomas Mann writes with contempt and from a distance of von Aschenbach's literary career and output; of his imperious manner, his layer-upon-layer of programmed, self-conscious behavior. When Tadzio appears and obsession arises, it's evident that Aschenbach hasn't the slightest idea who he is beneath his Gilded-Age trappings and carefully lived life.
