I would recommend this to a friend, and I will be watching it again and again. This movie is great and it will keep you on the edge of your seat.

Now out of all the shark movies I've seen, this one takes the cake! The plot of the movie was good, but the excitement factor sort of took a nosedive afterwards. Antonio Sobato, Jr. does an excellent role as a son who seeks the shark who killed his father. A megaldon is one of the biggest sharks of all and the most dangerous one as well. The view of the shark was indeed scary in some angles, but the effects were a blur, and the scenes were a little weak in some places.

Apparently the writer and director of this direct-to-DVD slasher movie is a fan of Friday 13th and other summer camp horror movies, a fact he acknowledges on the DVD extras menu, right before mentioning that the movie is rated R.

As is the case with most horror movies of the '00s, though, this one is really no slasher. The main problem is that it's got an un-scary and uninteresting premise. There are two campers staying in a cabin, one of whom is missing. The two teens in the cabin — a boy and a girl — start to investigate.

`` Mr. and Mrs. Smith '' is one of the not too well known early American Hitchcock 's movie . . . ''' The movie opens in an old house in the country, with a couple seated in an old armchair in the front, reading a book and talking. Suddenly an old woman in a white apron appears and begins to work on them. After a time the woman returns to the chair and resumes talking, as if nothing had happened. Finally the old man turns around and leaves the house. We see him sitting quietly on the steps, smoking a cigarette.

Actually, Son of the Mask did make me laugh a few times...mostly due to the cartoonish jokes that made Bugs Bunny and Roadrunner so funny. The CGI is very impressive and is used extensively in this movie. Garfield, for example, is no where on par for CGI, but I would give it the same vote.Everyone knows the story...which wasn't that bad for a KIDS movie. Yes, it is a KIDS movie...and therefore should be treated as such. Jamie Kennedy is not very good in his role.

Emilio Estevez takes the wonderful play HOMEFRONT and makes it into an engaging movie.THE WAR AT HOME has an exceptionally talented director with a great deal to say. I can’t believe I am saying that after seeing so many mediocre movies in recent weeks. Homefront is the story of a bunch of men who are trying to survive after a devastating event at home. One of the men is a young Marine who is a reluctant leader. We follow him during the chaos of the post-traumatic phase of his life that includes his wife and young son. Homefront is about a lot of things.

This story had a good plot to it about four elderly men that share a deadly secret concerning a young girl. They are all old friends, and each one has something to teach the others, but each one does not want to be the one that finds out that their friend was murdered by the young girl’s lover. The secrets were revealed over the course of several months, as the four men tried to figure out why the girl’s love was so important to her. The story had a lot to say about life, death, and friendship.

When i went to see this i thought, i liked the first two and thought that they were very suspenseful so this one should be good also. WRONG! There was NO suspense and they don't explain about the new dinosaurs! When i was done watching this i had lost all respect for Steven Spielberg and Michael Crichton but then it turned out that it wasn't directed by Spielberg or written by Michael Crichton! This movie was going through "the motions." i thought that this movie had absolutely no plot and i thought that no one should waste their money to see it.

Although this series and the mini film in particular were very important at the time of release , I feel it missed the mark by a country mile and I am not alone in thinking this . There is very little to commend it. I think the plot is very poorly constructed, there are too many plot twists and too many times you get the impression that things are going to come to some kind of conclusion that the film has no desire to do. In short, it is a disaster of a movie and a poor example of the kind of film being made at the time.

If you want to waste a small portion of your life sit in front of this predictable zombie film. It fails at the first post by not being scary OR funny. It is a dull grey movie that I guess went straight to video. Hammy and tongue in cheek acting leave a sour taste in the mouth. If you want to watch a poor but still watchable recent zombie film watch Diary of the Dead. Poor special effects, school level script. Zombie films work if they have a moral point or even a political point . This movie has nothing, there is no worthy point that zombification underscores.

This episode of Charmed changed everything ! The show is about to end it 's third season , and all this has been a long time coming. So, what does it mean for Charmed to wrap up the show? How will we know the end is here? Is there any end? Will we see any more? What will happen when the last episode rolls out? Will the show still be on in a few years? Will Charmed go off the air for good? And, if you're like me, what was the best part about the show?

Sometimes you ignore that little voice in your head that says "stay away from this movie". We should all pay more attention to that little voice. This may be the worst movie I've ever had the non-pleasure of sitting through, or it may be the best reason to remember that your DVD player has a fast-forward button. Made on a budget somewhere in the vicinity of $1.99, "The Cavern" is obviously a quick cheapie made to piggyback on the current bunch of scary cave-lots of darkness-claustrophobic spelunkers-unknown menace flicks like "The Cave" and "The Descent".

Previous reviewer Claudio Carvalho gave a much better recap of the film's plot details than I could. What I recall mostly is that it was just so beautiful, in every sense - emotionally, visually, editorially - just gorgeous.If you like movies that are wonderful to look at, and also have emotional content to which that beauty is relevant, I think you will be glad to have seen this extraordinary and unusual work of art.On a scale of 1 to 10, I'd give it about an 8.75. The only reason I shy away from 9 is that it is a mood piece.

I just cannot emphasize enough what a lovely movie this is. Justthe memory of this movie right now enchants me. If you want tosee a sweeping epic of a movie, with wonderful actors in vividscenery, with great dialogue, reminding you of what early Americacould have been like [what the world could have been like backthen]...well...I highly recommend this movie. Especially during atime of war and conflict in Iraq...when our American image is not atall what it used to be...this movie takes you back to a time when wewere just starting out.

I saw this movie on the shelf at Blockbuster and thought it looked cool. The DVD case touted so many great actors and I wondered to myself, "Why have I never heard of this movie?" Then I turned over the case and saw the director, Lee Tamahori, and thus the answer began to explain itself. First of all I want to defeat the idea that a great cast equals a great movie, but more importantly, I think I should explain why this movie is so terrible. Okay, the script is awful and full of one dimensional characters.

Unreal ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! . After reading the initial reviews posted by alleged reviewers , I was very surprised to see what a positive response I was getting from this book ! It is really a masterpiece ! ! I must add that I would not even call it a “pastiche”, it really is a “book that will be loved and enjoyed by all who reads it. It’s funny, it makes one laugh and it makes you think about how much we can learn from life. It makes one realize how lucky we are.

I think this is one of the best tamil movies i've seen in a while. i love the fact that it doesn't revolve around a guy and girl falling in love and they made the movie brilliantly. The cast did a great job and i especially congratulate the litte girl. She was brilliant and really brought out the feeling of an adopted child searching for her real mother. Best of all are the songs, beautiful music and moving lyrics. There are some great songs in this move ya'll! especially 'Kannathil Mutthamittal' and 'Velai Pookal'.

Having read the books and seen the 1982 Anthony Andrews/JaneSeymour version , I have to say that this is not a movie I'd want to see again . this is a movie that I hope they don't remake , if you haven't seen it you're missing one of the greatest movies ever . but , since the book is still going strong , it may be time for an updated remake . and with that in mind , I watched the new version , which opens on the date of this movie's release , September 28 , 1983 .

There is a LOT of repetitive dialogue in this movie about `` cold spots '' ( signaling the presence of enemy aircrafts ) and `` radar contacts. ' '

`` I have been through this before. I have flown many, many different aircraft, and this is the first time I have flown one in such a cold spot, with radar contacts, in such a manner that I have been asked to go back to an aircraft which I have already flown in a cold spot,'' he told The New York Times . But this is no ordinary flying, as it turns out.

28 years before 9/11, there was another 9/11 which represented a key date in the history of Chile, South America and the whole world. This was the date in 1973 when a bloody coup in Chile deposed Salvador Allende the first Marxist president elected democratically anywhere in the world and put an end to the Chilean experiment of a democratic transition from capitalism to socialism. Allende committed suicide when the armed forces attacked the presidential palace.Unfortunately this film is too biased and too nostalgic towards the time of Allende's rule to be an objective rendition of the man and of his place in history.

To paraphrase Thora Birch: "I kind of like this movie. It's the exact opposite of everything I hate in a film".This obscure film was too low key and intelligent to get a theatrical release, any chance for success would have needed a costly promotional campaign. And a coming of age story where nothing spectacular happens - where instead the focus is on character development, has a limited target audience. Whoever heard of a mature teen movie?But if you have an opportunity to see this or if you can part with a few bucks for the DVD, you could do a lot worse.

Whenever Ida Lupino appeared or directed a film in the 30's,40's and 50's, you were guaranteed great entertainment even if the picture was black and white. Ida was able to capture audiences and keep them spellbound until the very end of her pictures. In this film as Mrs. Helen Gordon,"High Sierra",'41 along with Robert Ryan,(Howard Wilton),"Golden Gloves",'40 she keeps you guessing just how the relationship is going to turn out and just how poor Mrs. Gordon will be able to have a normal and happy marriage with love and real affection.

`` Lets swap Murders- your wife , my father '' - seemingly innocent conversation between two strangers - Bruno Anthony (Kelley Quinn) who is the former boss of the local mobster - Bobby "The Snake" Spade (Jason Patric) - a criminal who is currently on the lam. Bruno Anthony who is an ex-cop turned mob boss and is being hunted by his own boss Bobby "The Snake" - Spade Murders a drug-dealing criminal. Bruno Anthony (Kelley Quinn) - Bruno Anthony is the former boss of the local mob family - Murders a drug dealer.

The first time I saw this film I was a kid. I was ten years old when it was released but since my family never went to movie theaters I saw it on Network TV. I remember watching it aloneand crying afterward. It was only the second film to illicit that response (Rocky was the first) and there haven't been many since. I can't say why exactly; Larry "Rain" Murphy didn't deserve to win any more that Rocky Balboa or anyone else. I know I admired Murphy, not so much for what he did, but for the way he did his time.

I am currently watching this movie and I have absolutely no hesitation in reviewing it now . The acting is excellent as all three of the main leads do a good job . This movie is truly an experience to the entire family . I highly recommend this one to those who like movies that are not cheesy . If you haven't seen it yet it is a great movie all around . It's got great action , adventure , and adventure stories . The music and cinematography are top notch . The acting is great . I don't know if the movie is any good but I am sure it is a good one .

Stephanie Meyer is going to be so ticked ! Now , her book `` Breaking Dawn '' will not be the best selling book of all time . It will be one of the most popular books of all time !!!! You have to be a very smart woman and you have to do some very hard math to understand that Stephanie Meyer is not the only one who will make money off the success of Breaking Dawn . In fact you will find more and more books and movies coming out that will make money on this movie.

A total and absolute waste of time . Bad acting . Bad story . Predictable . Simple . Pathetic . Just when you think that the movie couldn’t sink any lower it sinks it’s proverbial head right through the floor . It’s not often that one of the most loved and critically acclaimed films of all-time gets a bad review but when it does it really hits home. “Django Unchained” is a bad movie. A movie with an amazing cast and director(s), it’s a true testament to the power of movies and film in general.

I knew it was going to be awful but not this awful! !, as it's one of the most boring movies i have ever seen, not a damn thing happens!. All the characters are dull, and the story is stupid and incredibly boring!,plus The ending is especially lame!. The only reason i rented this piece of crap because i am a big fan of Michael Dudikoff, however he is wasted here, and looks extremely bored and shows no emotion what so ever!, plus i cheered out loud when the movie was over!.

What a wonderful film, filled with eccentric, unique characters who are wonderfully realized by a great ensemble cast. The director also did a great job keeping the story held together, getting those wonderful performances (on not messing with them) and using music (and what wonderful music it is) to great effect. S. Epatha in the lead role is great. I had always heard what a brilliant stage actor she is, and although I have enjoyed her on Law and Order, this really shows what she can do with a filled out, complex role.

I 'm a Christian , and I have watched pretty of Christian movies , but this one is too bad. It has nothing to offer. I mean , I don't think it was written with any sense of humor in mind , nor it was written to be entertaining . I could not take any entertainment value , because I don't think I would enjoy it . The plot is so dull. Why the author doesn't use his imagination ? . The story is so lame and the characters so dumb and dumb. It is so lame and so lame .

`` Nicodemus '' is almost a copy of `` Red '' in the odd behavior sense , but this episode isn't about him. to:

* Red is almost the same as '' in the episode sense , but this episode isn't about him. * '' is almost a copy of '' in the episode sense , but this episode isn't about him. * [[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homer_Horn_and_the_Cat_and_the_Mouse The Homer in Hell]] '' is a copy of '' in the Odd Behavior sense but this episode isn't about him. * '' is almost a copy of '' in the episode sense .

I was laying in bed , flicking through the channels ... and boy do I have channels ... 500 of them ... to the point I can't see the whole picture. So you know what I was thinking? I was thinking about how much fun I could have with that kind of bandwidth. And then the idea struck me. I've talked about it a couple of times before in the past few months but I thought it would be nice to share it with you. And if you can think of something better, please feel free to tell me.

Although Embryo could have been a potentially thought provoking examination of bioethics , it degenerates into a stereotypical Frankenstein parable. While it does provide insight into a couple of very interesting areas of life, it fails miserably at being a fair representation of all the issues involved. The most important problem facing a new parent is not that their child will be born to them, but it will be raised in their culture and environment. This is an extremely sensitive subject and can be an issue for both parents and child alike, but for those not from a particular culture it’s even more important.

I just can not emphasize enough what a lovely movie this is . Justthe memory of this movie right now makes me want to buy the book and make my own tribute to the film . Just one last thing I have to mention about how the film is filmed and shot . It has been my honor and privilege to watch the actual filming for this movie . It was done on 16mm film . I can tell you that was a labor of love , I am still trying to figure out if that is what I was paid .

I have watched two episodes so far, I really like it. Even though I am no longer in college, it makes me miss the wonderful college life. I wish that I spent a little more time socializing. I kind of identify myself with rusty. When I was rushing a fraternity, my big brother was not like Cappie at all, I wish that I had a big brother like him. So if a show like this can actually make people to identify themselves with the characters, then it is a pretty good show.It is more realistic than American pie with less explicit sex jokes.

I watched this film last night, i though i would rent a horror/scary film from blockbusters and i got this one out. The opening scenes were so long winded, the conversations between characters seemed not to lead anywhere. The story line seemed so poor to me, she gave him HIV and then she goes to meet someone else but she is killed by the man she infected ( i think she may have been doing it for a long time to different people) Then when he dumps the body it just happened to be the man she was going to meet, was in the forest and saw him dumping the body.

Rock Star is a "nice" movie. Everyone is nice. Even the guys who aren't supposed to be nice, really are nice. Chris is a nice guy, who learns a lesson in life. He goes back to his girlfriend Emily, who is also nice. It's a good movie, despite all the niceness. Maybe I'm just used to all the angst of the X Gen music. In some ways the film was a caricature of Rock Stars and not hard edged enough to be believable.Mark Wahlberg's acting is quite good.

`` The Man From Utah '' opens with a singing cowboy strumming a guitar on horseback . This is how the film began in the film's opening credits: ''L. Frank Baum, the famous creator of 'The Wizard of Oz', has died, and he has been given a great deal of credit for the story in which his characters live and suffer in a fictional land called Oz. But how much of it really is real?'' As the film progresses, the cowboy, who claims to be a friend of the characters, gets more information and reveals that he is actually an outsider from another land.

I would n't recommend this to anyone , except cinema-goers who like to laugh at a film , not with the film itself. It's so bad I can hardly read it, but if you don't find that funny , please find someone who does and let them read this. I just can't understand the people who actually find this film to be funny or enjoy it. Its not funny or enjoyable , the film itself is awful , but the people who enjoy it have no idea of the film , its one big joke , that makes the film so funny .

The Girl in Lovers Lane is one strange little low-budget film . On its surface , the movie tells the story of a boy named Peter, who is in love with a girl who lives just up the street . But that's not all the story has to tell. It's also a love story of sorts between a lonely boy and his mysterious neighbor. And while that last part might sound familiar to some, what we get here is an unusual blend of a documentary and a rom com. It's a film about a girl falling for the neighbor boy in a very strange way.

Go to the video store and get the original. I do not understand why Hollywood has that need to take a perfect foreign movie and remake it. "Mostly Martha" or "Bella Martha" has a much better cast. Beginning with the heroine Martina Gedeck, who convinced me much more in the role of the work-obsessed perfectionist than the more famous Catherine Zeta Jones, to the Italian cook and the niece suddenly deprived of her mother and forced to live with an aunt, not fit for child-rearing. In many ways, the American version of the movie is a copy of the German original.

Some people are born with mourning souls with their song sung singularly until they encounter another soul as tortured and/or wounded as themselves, and then their song transforms. This happens to me all of the time. I’m one of those people. And I have a way of knowing what a song is about when I hear or experience it – I feel it. That’s what makes the difference. But it is not just people like me. Many of you have been in my place – at least once.

This is primarily about love in WWII, yet we must remember that it's also a biopic for Dylan Thomas and those around him at this particular stage in his life.The movie's timing is just great. It really captures what I think would have been the spirit during those times; smiling and hoping you're not going to get bombed. While it may prove boring to some, the movie does have a particularly dangerous edge to it.At one point, my heart was racing towards the end as the movie hits its climax. It really does feature some poignant moments that are handled with skill by the four main actors.

This is one awful movie!! Some people told me that it was not that bad actually but I sure disagree! The monster is amazingly cheap (and funny) looking but this is something we all knew I guess. In addition to that, the dialogs are awful and the writing is just plain terrible.As bad as it is, this movie as the quality of being entertaining. Not always for the good reasons but it's a good "so bad that it's fun" flick.By the way, there's no such thing as "La Castagne".

I attended a screening of 'The Cooler' at the Toronto Film Festival this year. While the other reviews I've read seem to be generally (and mystifyingly) positive, I must tell you without any kind of axe to grind that this film is unimaginably, unspeakably bad. The very brave and candid performances by William H. Macy and Maria Bello have been horribly misspent on what is probably the least polished, most clichéd script to have received the green light in years. I don't know how bad The Brown Bunny was, but I'm certain it couldn't have attained the Dante-style depths that this one did.

A genuinely creepy ghost story, full of chills and sensuality, this movie just falls short of what it promises. It is apparently based on an old ghost story, and perhaps relies a little too much on a simple premise. For most of the way, its imaginative and genuinely gripping, but at the end its almost like Oshima just lost interest in it, and brought it to a rapid ending.The story is simple - a woman and her younger lover kill her husband so that they can be together. But their failure of nerve and his returning ghost condemn them to madness.

This movie has some good performances, as others have pointed out, but suffers (as others have pointed out, except for the people who apparently are either friends of the filmmaker or the cast to otherwise explain why they would deem this a "10") from some self-conscious and self-absorbed film school padding and excess plots. This is the type of plot that Sex In The City could handle in a half hour episode, so there was no reason for it to be even an 88 minute movie. A perfect example of wasted footage is the fast forwarding montage in the first third of the movie.

The movie is apparently based on a popular French horror novel , by Arthur Bernède , from 1927 . Not a very scary book , and the original film , in 1932 , is pretty much the same. It is now available on DVD , though the story and the characters of Bernède are rather different from the movie . Bernède wrote one other novel , and made two other films , one of which is now known to be lost . Sci Fi channel had a show on the film in May , which is now available on Hulu and the various streaming services .

David Cronenberg movies are easily identifiable, or at least elements within the movie stand out as his trademarks. Fetishism, the blurring between the organic and inorganic, squishy throbbing things that shouldn't be squishy and throbbing. "eXistenZ" is classic Cronenberg. Briefly, it's about a future generation of computer games, but instead of a video monitor, visuals are supplied by your mind. The game plugs directly into a 'bio port' in the base of your spine and while the game is running, the player can't tell reality from game.

I 've lost count of the times I have seen this movie , but I love it and find it really well made . this movie is very well acted . it is a family movie , and the whole family , even the mom is great . the family is going on a trip to another country and this is their first trip . the family is going to the city , the dad has a friend . the dad's dad , who is a captain is going on the trip , and the captain's friend is going with them , so the trip is split in 2 .

This film tries to skewer the studio era in Hollywood and the morals of the 1950s . Guy Stone is an actor who makes a living acting on TV and in plays. In an attempt to pay for the bills, he takes on low-paying work, such as driving a truck. One day at the end of a particularly hot day, he is trapped in his truck for hours as it idles outside a warehouse in the middle of the desert. Just when he’s beginning to suspect he’s been trapped for days, the owner comes in to collect the money owed.

I 've been strangely attracted to this film since I saw it on Showtime sometime in the early 80 's and have always wondered what was so interesting and interesting to me about it. Well, for one it was about a man that had been through a number of trials and tribulations throughout his short life and who now found himself at the end of his road and looking back at some of what he had endured. It seemed like a film about what it is to live one's life as a man. He was not perfect, he had his own flaws and faults.

Many experienced and excellent actors mixed together in an ongoing plot of an untold part of world war II on the western front. I would highly recommend to any of you who is into these types of stories, you will have a great read. A little bit of history about this film, in case you don’t care about that, and because I want it on this review page, and also because you might like it! The film was a big box office success and earned $40.6 Million at the domestic box office.

It 's hard to work up any enthusiasm for this awful cartoon-like epic that for some reason has become a big hit, not just here in Canada but across the English-speaking world where it continues to sell many thousands of tickets per day. What a terrible movie, what a horrible script. The basic plot goes as follows: it's the summer of 1945 in England, World War II is in the past, Britain and the U.S. are both allied with the Soviets, the French government is friendly with the Germans and the Germans hate Britain as much as they hate France.

My mistake for thinking this was a serious war-is-hell movie prior to seeing it. That all ended seconds into the film when the "MTV" logo appeared. It might as well been called "National Lampoon's Sexy-N-Loose." And it did play to the "MTV" crowd; the movie that followed those comical first few seconds played like the music videos they used to play 40+ years ago. At least Disney was smart enough to ship its Rated R stuff over to Touchtone and allowed us to take it seriously. Okay, I'm being harsh; it wasn't that bad of a film.

The film starts out with a narration of the protagonist explaining certain crimes occurring all over the city and then we get to know that the hero is a cop who is either suspended or has probably retired. I did not have the patience or the interest to verify the above before commenting. If there is a stereotype for narrators to have a deep, sleep-inducing voice then, it is high time to put an end to it. I seriously fell asleep and did not bother to shut the movie down either. Am still trying to figure out what the movie was all about and why there were no outdoor shootings.

Whenever Ida Lupino appeared or directed a film in the 30's,40 's and 50 's , you were guaranteed great entertainment. She's got a unique gift as a storyteller and it's no secret that she was a pioneer in the medium of the moving picture. Her filmography spans nearly three decades and includes over 75 movies. If you were to compile the list of her all time favorite films you would find that she has chosen a handful of her best works. But there's something more to consider than just what films she chose as her personal favorites.

I caught this during a brief run in a Philadelphia theater . Despite its local provenance ( and its relation to The Philadelphia Story in some way , even though this film is an adaptation), I've always found myself looking back on this as one of my least-favorite films , not least because it has the misfortune of being released a mere twenty years after The Philadelphia Story . It was released in theaters on a Saturday , but it was shown at 6:00 PM in my area, and I had to make an early departure at 7:00 PM to catch the first show of the night .

I am very open minded. I watch all kinds of programs to the end...good or bad...just to give them a chance and learn from the good aspects and bad ones. This show had potential to be good. But my god, what were the writers, casting director, and director thinking? The cast of actors are terrible...with the slightest exception of Meryl (Mimi Rogers), and Darcy (Joy Osmanski) being given occasional good lines with the best execution of the lot.The rest of the cast kill the show. It is the same story line in every episode.

Three American lads are backpacking their way around Europe, challenging each other to accumulate as many daredevil stunts and Hot babe lays as they can, But Andy seeks true love. He finds this during their bungee-jump attempt on the Eiffel Tower, when he comes across and breathtakingly saves a suicidal and heart-burstingly beautiful Julie Delpy. His attempts to find this girl and the secret he uncovers lead he and his friends into an fast paced adventure full of action, romance, gore, and inspired humor, without ever taking itself to seriously, or striving to be anything other than a wildly entertaining 90 minute ride.

Why do people make bad movies ? Did n't anyone working on the picture know that what they were making was shit ? No. No one could know because they did not want to. And that is why people are pissed off at people for making bad movies and for being people who make movies . People do not go see movies. People go to the movies. People go to the theater. The only thing movies are to people is a way out of boredom and entertainment. People go see the movie. And that is it. Movies do not even have the slightest effect on people.

I saw it last night and I was laughing out loud for the whole second half of the movie. The whole audience was. Bruce Campbell has made a damn funny movie! I don't want to give anything away, but when the film turns and gets wacky, it gets really wacky. Just one funny scene after another. My hats of to Mr. Campbell and crew for pulling this off on such a tiny budget. Bruce was there to introduce the film and do a Q and A, which was a treat.

First of all I dunno if I was supposed to use my imagination in this film or the director was trying to save money or low on budget! Here we go....Basically there were so many years and gaps that I don't understand, its like the movie was jumping from 9 years to 20 years to 30 and so much gaps that makes you ask questions how the hell did this happen? and why? I think this is a big flow. Forget the reviews who keeps whining about the history , this movie doesn't have only history facts issues, but also has so many flaws.

I ca n't say if `` The Cavern '' is a ripoff of `` The Cave '' because I have never read them both and have not seen the movie, so I cannot know for sure if they are connected in any way, but I will say if they are they are very good ripoffs that I am very proud of, I mean just look at the art and the story and the dialogues and everything it has. I'm pretty sure there is a connection here, I'm not sure where it would be.

Everyone knows that late night movies are n't Oscar contenders . Fine . I mean I 'll admit that I 'd seen "American Hustle" just a month ago. But now, with "Argo," we 've seen the Oscars. I 'm here to give my thoughts on "Argo," which, as of writing, has won three Oscars: Best Picture, Director, Adapted Screenplay, and Best Cinematography. While I don't agree with every vote, I will try to address some of my issues and hopefully give the film more of a chance.

I 'm a huge fan of zombie movies and this is just a pathetic attempt at one . I find the concept of the zombie very fascinating so I wanted to know more and came to this website for more information . I have watched the first two films and now want to see the third one as well . From the trailer it seems like a really fun and engaging film. The characters are interesting and they seem to know what they are doing and it seems there is a lot of action so it should be worth watching . However , the zombie part of it scares me .

One thing that came across to me in watching this film is that it was fun/exciting for the cast and crew; I could sense that they were going up against the budget constraint with enthusiasm & dedication because they apparently liked the people involved. I tend to like B movies that are original and have heart, and I think this is one such work. The actors seem to me to be putting there hearts in it more than usual, maybe because of some good direction from the lead actress/director, and they evidently were clear enough in their parts of the story to make a coherent, watchable piece of art.

This movie is supposed to take place in Milford NJ . I know the house that it is based on because I have seen the news report on it. The movie will focus on a group of teens in Milford, NJ and how they dealt with a rape, and their reactions to it. This is a good movie for teens to see about rape and it is definitely worth it to see it on the big screen. This is also a movie that is very emotional. The movie is about a group of teen girls who have been raped and need help dealing with this.

Though it's a Christmas movie, "Christmas in Connecticut" could have been done any time of year, as it's the story of a soldier who spends what is to be an idyllic time with a Martha Stewart type. That's what he thinks. In reality, the lady in question, portrayed by Barbara Stanwyck, has a popular magazine column about life on a farm with her husband and baby. She has no farm, no husband, and no baby, nor are the many recipes she publishes hers. They belong to the restaurant owner nearby.

The main attraction of Anywhere but Here is the superb performance of Natalie Portman . She gave her rather thankless performance as the lead female character in Black Swan. She did so with ease and with grace and we were impressed by the performance. But the movie’s story is one of a kind. This is not a typical Hollywood movie. There are no romantic scenes in the film and we were also left with no real answers about the character’s motives for acting like a psychopathic maniac. So what was it about Natalie? Well she did have a great performance.

I watched the this the other night on a local station because I didn't feel like watching tripe like 'American Idol'. Peter Strauss gives a great performance as a convict named 'Rain' Murphy who keeps to himself. He admits to his crime and makes no bones that he feels no shame for it. His cell is bare of any comforts that other inmates have like books and pictures. The only time he feels in another zone is in running. He does it often and can run a mile in under four minutes.

***SPOILERS*** Feeling alone and needing companionship as well as love Frances Austen, Sandy Dennis, keeps all these emotions inside as she goes through life as a popular young single lady who has many high class friends. But for reasons of her own deep insecurity she keeps them at arms length. As for Frances male friends non are anywhere near her age so that she won't have any reason to have any romantic involvement with them. One early evening as Frances was entertaining some of her friends she spots outside her apartment window a young man, Michael Burns, sitting alone in the cold pouring rain.

When I first saw this show i thought to my self " What is this!!!!!?" Its one of those shows where there is a perfect fake high school world with stupid problems that are considered "huge". Then there's Sadie. This complete misfit for her friends and well her family. Shes completely obsessed with nature not that thats a bad thing but she compares high school students to animals! like what is that!? also they made her another Lizzie Miguire clone ( yeah because the world definitely needs another one of those!)

George Sluizer 's remake of his own - superior - film is a complete waste of time . Why was this remake made at all , and how is it that the people making it are still alive ? I am tired of seeing people who were not involved in the actual filming who are now complaining about how pointless it all is . Just because it was done in England doesn't mean it's not pointless . I saw it in London and thought it was pointless . It was not an original film . I saw this film at a time in my life when I was trying to make life better for myself .

For the first time in reviewing films , I found myself immediately uninterested in this story . I do n't know why I didn't take interest in this story because I have n't see the movie and I can judge it for myself . It is all about the characters . I have read the reviews before this one but I didn't understand why I should not be interested to read the reviews and then judge the movie . Well , I did . If I didn't want to see a movie this time , I won't see one .

A lot of 'alternative' comedy in Britain in the 1980s was insular, misguided, overly-political, and unfunny, and the worst of the Comic Strip Presents... stuff fell into this category. But this is at the other end - a remarkable film that works on different intellectual levels. Is Dennis a criminal mastermind or is he lying? Is he telling the truth, bluffing, double-bluffing, counter-doubly-bubbly-bluffingwhatever? I've probably watched Supergrass 20 or 30 times, and I still can't decide 100%. That's the wonderful thing.

There 's lots of ketchup but not a whole lot of sense in the supposedly explanatory third sequel , which, again and again, gets stuck in an infinite loop of "why is it here when there's no more?" It's as if the game's makers have come up with all the answers but never bothered to make people use them in the game itself. If you don't know, or care, then you might think you're reading an actual game review. But the only thing that's actually reviewed is the thing that you're playing.

I have recently found this film on one of my husband 's VHS tapes ( the blank variety which he has since long discontinued ). I just recently found this on YouTube and I was surprised to find it is only 2 hours long so I decided to see if anyone here has ever seen it. I am an elementary school teacher and my husband is in the US Air Force so I decided to look at the reviews on Amazon or other similar sites. I found some reviews that are in French so I will have to watch this at my own time.

This is a beautiful, yet simple movie about one man, driven to find an answer, an answer he doesn't necessarily need but has structured his whole life around. It is heartrending, it is hilarious, it is glorious, it is tormenting, it is delicate and dynamic, I say it's genius.I have read Jonathan Safran Foer's book Everything is Illuminated (mainly because I heard Elijah Wood was starring in the movie adaptation), and I was just enraptured by the characters. I laughed out loud more than once.

Way back at the dawn of human civilization cavemen sat around and made lame jokes , hit each other over the head with a stick for not being able to hit a rock and laughed at the stupid things the women did. Then they started to build things . The invention of the plow and the spinning wheel and the wheelbarrow were some of the most important and life changing innovations of our civilization. Yet, as important as they were to our survival as a culture they were also to the extinction of all other life forms on the planet .

Largely forgettable tale in which mercenary Kerman & employer Agren travel into the jungle in search of Agren's missing sister.Despite its connection to the cannibal movie family, this film is more of an extreme version of Rene Cardona's "Guyana - Crime of the Century". Lenzi clearly aims to exploit the (at that time) topical Jonestown massacre, by depicting a rogue, self righteous zealot with a penchant for bigamy and just a hint of megalomania (played with ruthless intensity by Ivan Rassimov) leading his motley crew flock into self inflicted oblivion.

What a crap that movie is . The script is simply non existent . The movie at times seems like it has been made specifically for the purpose of ruining it. Not only do you get to see a lot of scenes that you didn't see in the previous movie but some of the plot twists are just downright stupid . This movie looks like it could be awesome but it just seems like the actors are just having as much fun as possible and are trying to be funny as opposed to being serious. I just wish it was a little closer to the first film .

While watching BLACKWATER VALLEY EXORCISM, I encountered scenarios and dialog so incredibly bad that I was convinced that this was supposed to be a comedy. A few choice bits of dialog worthy of a belly laugh: "I ate a rabbit." "I TOLD you she was possessed!" "Are you telling me the Devil is in my daughter?! "There are many, many more, but you must discover these for yourself - if you dare.The story goes off into all sorts of directions and things happen that probably shouldn't and everyone seems to be a perv or psycho of some sort (even the Priest).

Secret Service agent Jay Killion (Charles Bronson) has been assigned to protect the President-elect's wife, the new First Lady (Jill Ireland). She is a very difficult woman and Killion has his hands full. She is the victim of numerous assassination attempts, all directed by the President's Chief of Staff, who wants the First Lady dead. This movie insults your intelligence with not only the story line, but also with the lack of realistic locations. For example, in the scene depicting the Inaugural Parade, the First Lady is in a Rolls Royce convertible with agent Killion and without the President.

Countenance! Antoine Monot, in a copycat impersonation of Kevin Smith's Silent Bob, keeps asking for it, but writer/director Christian Zübert never listens. Zübert just can't say no to a joke, no matter how cheap. The best thing about this movie is its soundtrack. Of course, Joey Burns of Calexico and the divine Jonathan Richman, understated old-school bard of "There's something about Mary" fame, would grace any small-town dropout story. In visual allure, Stefan (Lukas Gregorowicz) looks cool enough riding his tan six-series BMW two-door, wearing aviator shades, going nowhere.

Alfred Hitchcock made this comedy of mis-marriage in 1941 but his heart doesn't appear to be in it. Carole Lombard and Robert Montgomery are the couple who discover they were never legally married and spend the movie bickering their way back to true love. It doesn't have much of a reputation and it is easy to see why. The jokes are familiar from better films but here they don't gel. And the leads are uncharismatic. Lombard's performance is clipped and starchy and it's doubly sad to think she was dead only a year later.

I was sitting at home and flipping channels when I ran across what potentially sounded like an interesting film . I had never heard of it and it turned out to be an animated feature for children . It was a story about a family that had been adopted . There was a big part in it where the family was on a beach and there was a tsunami. And they were about to take the kids and go on a boat trip. And then a tsunami hit. And the waves just went right over it . And they were so scared because they could see right through the waves.

The main problems of 'Saw' are related to the tremendous script mistakes that only a uncritical spectator will just obviate. The main question is what's is the purpose of the killer in his lying in the middle of the floor? The film tries to show that the killer's aim is to cause evil and destruction in his victims, he loves to play with the lives of other people and to feel control over their the fears and debilities. So why does he just pretend to be dead between the two main characters?

Oh yeah , this one is definitely a strong contender to win the questionable award of `` worst 80 's film'' . There are other good movies that could have made this list but they either weren't made or aren't quite as good, or are missing from this list, like, oh, you don't want to know... The movie opens up with a guy and a girl on a boat. The guy gets in and the girl gets out. After about 20 minutes, the girl jumps out of the boat and is seen walking away from the scene.

As other posters have commented this was a very very bad movie (keeping it kid friendly) FX was low class, they should of spent the $1 on a coke. As is typical with these D movies most victims die and leave a mystery except for one lucky soul and of course the lead. Hope the money was worth it for Boxleitner, really really big step down from Babylon 5. Nice to see what happened to Buck Rogers but damn this was low even for him. ' It was so bad and on the older actors you could even seem to tell that they thought it was bad also.

I love this movie! It has everything! Bonnie Hunt did a fantastic job co-writing, directing and co-starring in this film. David Duchovny is just plain hot. and Minnie Driver is as cute as ever. combine all that talent with David Allen Grier, Carol O'Connor, Robert Loggia, Joley Richardson, and Jim Belushi you have a Oscar worthy movie! I'm surprised they didn't get one. if you haven't seen it, go rent the DVD, watch it once then put directors commentary on...Bonnie Hunt is Fabulous!

I loved this movie . My daughter is 3 1/2 and a country girl at heart . There are not many things she can’t do at home . We had an outdoor birthday party in our backyard . The kids were out of town . And our party was in the afternoon . So I knew I wanted to make a picnic and get the party going . I thought of using our old outdoor table . It had 4 legs , a bench and it was easy to clean . It also had four sides , so that was pretty convenient . The table was in our backyard .

Pot-seeking pre-teen Joshua Miller (as Tim) throws his sister's doll into the river while Daniel Roebuck (as Samson) howls and smokes a cigarette, after killing Danyi Deats (as Jamie). The doll washes away, but the naked young woman stays by the "River's Edge", for any passerby to see. Viewing the dead body are a group of twenty-something teenagers, mostly classmates of the naked corpse. Stoners Keanu Reeves (as Matt) and Crispin Glover (as Layne) are found most camera-worthy.

Lovely Candace Bergen as the widow Perdicaris are kidnapped and held for ransom by the Sheik Raisuli played by one of the most powerful and dangerous actors in the business. Raisuli is responsible for a number of murders. The kidnappers will not release the ladies until a large amount of gold are paid to the kidnappers for their safekeeping. Beautiful actress Candace Bergen is in the film playing the title role. Her beauty is apparent in all her performances, whether it is a role as a child bride, a young adult or a young woman.

Rivalry between brothers leads to main story line. Navy Commander Chuck Prescott(Marshall Thompson)has developed the Y12 aircraft to test how far man can go up in the atmosphere. His brother, Lt. Dan Prescott(Bill Edwards), seems to be the best test pilot around and is chosen to go up in the Y12. Dan of course has a problem with taking orders and is also an over confident dare devil. On Dan's second flight, he hits over the 300 miles up comfort zone and his craft passes through a meteor dust storm.

Ohhhh MAN this movie is awful! !This kind of tripe is what gives Canadian Cinema a bad name, or no name. Well, to be fair, I guess most Canadian movies give Canadian Cinema a bad name.Next to the characters (there's a couple that are the most grating in movie history), the most annoying thing is the editing and pace of the movie. It's like a drunken snail making its way to die.Thank goodness Melanie Doane is nice to look at. She's the only thing that kept me watching.

This is a Laurel & Hardy comedy short with some great and funny moments but overall the movie relies a bit too much on just one comical premise.The comical premise this movie mostly relies on is very simple; Stan Laurel not wearing any pants. Laurel plays a Scottish naive young person who arrives in America in full kilt. For some reason he gets the center of attention because of this and his uncle played by Oliver Hardy thinks because of this that its time to put some pants on Philip.Its humor is well executed but the main premise also gets a bit tiresome after a while.

I had the dubious opportunity to view this movie on TV . It 's the perfect example of how to be stupid in a way that makes you feel you are smarter then you are. I never read the original novel. All I knew was that this was a movie adaptation. I'm sure you're not the first person to say this but I would think that the main problem with making an adaptation of a beloved novel into a movie is that you're not really taking the story of the novel but just putting it into a film or a television show.

This Christmas gift arrived courtesy of TCM. We had never seen the film, even though we have seen most of the films of Barbara Stanwyck. This comedy made us laugh so much, that at times, we had to restrain ourselves, in order to hear the dialog.This is a movie that should be seen by people suffering from stressful situations, especially around Christmas. It would certainly lift one's spirits by just letting go. The movie would make a perfect gift in the form of a DVD, or a VHS tape.

This film follows the life of a great guitar player , who wants to make it big but acts irresponsibly. The story of a guitar teacher who is willing to do anything for her students . The main character is an extremely gifted guitarist who takes on many of life's challenges. I would describe this film as realistic, because I think it reflects the reality of many young people who want to succeed but fail. I would describe the film's message to children as a very positive one . You can tell that the main character wants to be an adult who makes her life work.

There was n't much thought put into the story line on many fronts . This is a good action movie with decent action, good fighting, and good story. The acting is better than I expected but not perfect. It has good chemistry between the actors. I was happy with it and I will see it again. I thought that it had more action than most movies these days, but unfortunately it falls short of my expectations because of that. I don't think it will ever reach the heights of some of these action films because it just didn't have anything to offer.

As one of the victims of the whole Enron scandal, my mother forced me to watch this movie with her. How many times can I say awful? The script was so weak, using cliche after cliche. It seems as though the writers pieced this story together with a few articles on Enron. Watching the movie, we honestly were able to complete about half of the one-dimensional characters' lines and thoughts. I realize this was supposedly adapted from a book, but was the book this bad? I don't know what to say. Just terrible.

All the criticisms of this movie are quite valid! It is pretty boring, and filled with all kinds of pointless ridiculous stuff. A couple exchanging nods over their "good grub." A medium shot of a desk as a phone rings until someone finally comes, sits down, and answers it at a pretty leisurely pace. Quadruple-takes or more when people look at things. Solitary banjo-tuning and playing, taking a break for a beer. Telling a joke to a fawn, about a big-mouthed frog trying to learn what to feed its babies, complete with many big-mouthed expressions (which are needed for the weak punchline).

I just saw a terrible film called The Sleeping Dictionary . One reviewer on Four Word Film Review ( www.fwfr.com ) described it as: "Not worth watching if you do not already know the definition of the title word." I thought that this is an overstatement but I did watch it anyway. It was a very disappointing movie. It's not so much that it is bad and not worth watching if you already know the meaning of the word it's more like: "It's bad but you might not know what the word really means, and therefore you might miss out on a good movie."

I 'm an action movie fan but until today I 've never seen a preview or an ad for this one. That's because I only have a VHS player and an 8-track recorder at the moment, and the tape I've got is of the '70s, so this will have to make it to the record store. So I'm looking for suggestions on how to review a movie I like, or at least how to start off. My first thought was to review it as a movie fan, but I'm not familiar with movie reviewing.

As Jennifer Denuccio used to say on Square Pegs, "Gag me out the door." I would definitely vote this movie on IMDB's Worst movie list.Dennis Christopher plays T.T., a guy from Chicago who goes to California peddling his brother's jazz records. He is supposed to be a barney placed in the locals-only surfing community. But he acts more like he is new to civilization (just try to get through his sex scene without squirming). There are also the on-going adventures of the rest of the local population that the viewer must endure.

As one of the victims of the whole Enron scandal , my mother forced me to watch this movie with her. She was a single mother in a small town. Her job was teaching school. My mom was a very beautiful woman, slim and strong. So, when you think about her being forced to watch something like this, do you see a similarity between Enron and my mother ? Both women were strong, smart, and independent. But the movie didn't give a damn about these women as they had no role in it.

I'm originally from Brazil... the sad thing about this movie was the exploitation that was done to that boy. They told his life story and he never got one "centavo" (Brazilian cent) of that movie. Fernando is not the first and will not be the last to go through that life style in Brazil. Sad... but that is the world we live in. It's about making money not saving lives. Question is: Where is Fernando today? Most probably... dead. We tend to want to live in this "Disney filled fantasy bubbled life".

Reba is a very dumb show . You can predict pretty much anything that 's about to happen . Barbra Streisand is always great at what she does . It's like watching a play where the main character has to act like Barbra Streisand . She can be very funny and clever and sometimes she does some dumb things . It also seems to have a lot in common with a lot of movies and shows . I love that this show is not dumb . I think that it's smart but I don't take that to mean that it's smart in a bad way .

This was the first Chan film made by Monogram . What a come down from Fox values and standards ! As a result of this movie we were exposed to some very interesting new actors, who in turn helped bring in some new and exciting faces to the screen. It is such a shame that we have lost this film. There are a few things about it that are worth remembering, which is that it was shot on black and white and in an extremely limited time frame. The lighting, acting and sound were all very poor.

The `` silver screen '' gets freshly polished with this beautiful film about aging happily and enjoying life 's rainbows and sunshine. In "The Golden Years'' a group of young people come together one day in an old house with an intriguing history and discover that they are all aging differently and that they are part of an important experiment about the nature of life. ''The Golden Years'' is one of four feature-length dramas from writer/director Brian Currie that debuted in theaters in 2014 and 2015 at the Cannes Film Festival and at the Venice Film Festival.

In Thailand, the Americans Connor (Colin Egglesfield) and his girlfriend Amanda (Meredith Monroe) quarrel in a Muay-Thai fight, and Amanda leaves Connor alone. She asks the direction of the hotel to a stranger, indeed the mean vampire Niran (Don Hetrakul), and she is bitten and kidnapped by his gang of evil vampires in motorcycles. Connor joins to a clan of "good" vampires leaded by Sang (Stephanie Chao), trying to save Amanda from the claws of Niran.I expected that "Vampires: The Turning" were a good movie.

In my analysis of "Trois couleurs: Blanc" I wrote that its tone is much lighter than the tone of "Trois couleurs: Bleu". I think it's the same with this film. This time it's not because of a tragic comedy-element, but much more because of the main character Valentine. Although her boyfriend is living abroad and is ridiculously jealous, she manages her life with lightness and optimism, it seems to me that she might be Kieslowski's image for a carefree youth. The opposite seems to be the judge, who is very pessimistic, a grumpy old man, who experiences big loneliness.

Even if you 're not a `` theatre person , '' I highly recommend that you see this . Based on true events it is the gripping account of one man's attempt to save his community from one of the worst calamities of its history." "A powerful and often moving account of the life and work of the author, who, as the first black mayor of New York and the city's chief administrative officer, is considered one of the 20th century's most progressive public officials." - Publisher's Weekly

"This is an unforgettable account of a very important moment in the fight for racial justice.

I enjoyed Ramin Bahrani's Man Push Cart, and this film is equally good. This slice of life is almost a documentary about how life on the edges is lived.Alejandro Polanco and Isamar Gonzales do an excellent job as a 12-year-old brother and a 16-year-old sister who live in a small room over an auto shop. There are no parents; they are on their own surviving. Ali supplements his income by stealing auto parts, selling bootleg DVDs and selling candy on the subway. Izzie supplements her income working a food truck by selling herself.

Veteran TV director Ted Post treats us to a plodding , confused and ultimately pointless story lifted from Column B. To be honest, I don’t have much faith in Column B‘s story. But this week, it took on an even weightier significance. On Tuesday, we lost a great writer. And, I felt like I lost another friend. As a reader, you know that one of our biggest strengths, if not our primary reason for being, is the people we get to know and care about. They go to our graduations, weddings, and funerals, and they become family.

When I bought 4 DVDs for £5.oo in a local shop it should have been warning enough that this movie was not up to the usual standard of David Selznick Productions. With a cast containing such names as James Stewart and Carole Lombard I was looking forward to a real treat. As many other commentators have said it is an odd mixture of plot and scenes that doesn't quite convince. HOWEVER, I am so glad that I did view this film as I now have the memorable saying 'Never let the seeds stop you from enjoying the watermelon.' to live by.

Boy Oh Boy, does this movie stink. This movie is one of the worst pieces of trash I have ever seen in my whole entire life. Please, even if your life depends on it, DO NOT, and I repeat: DO NOT under any circumstances, view this horrid piece of garbage. Only watch this thing when it comes on as a MST 3000 Episode. That was the only way I could sit through the whole thing. If I had to watch it without that show, I would've stopped watching it before it was over.

I didn't know what to expect from this hugely popular (and hilarious) Swedish comedy & satire team, as they released their first feature film. More broad satire? Well, we do get four contemporary, exceptionally memorable tales of family pains, generation gaps and fatherhood, in particular. But it's drama, thankfully, and what drama! Epic in its scope, as each episode is from carefully picked, geographically different parts of Sweden. But each story could seriously carry a whole movie, if expanded separately.It's dark, twisted, harrowing, yet massively entertaining and breathtakingly executed.

Somehow, I really thought that I was going to enjoy this film because I love pictures with mountain climbing and a great mystery in the plot. I must say that the photography was fantastic and there was some scary scenes that captured my attention. I thought that Nicole Eggert,(Diana Pennington),"Thank You, Good Night",'01 played a very convincing role as a young girl who had a tragic loss in her life and meets up with some characters who want her to guide them up the mountain.

STMD! is one of the most fun and enjoyable low-budget films I've seen in quite some time. Director Jeff Smith (who also served as co-writer, cinematographer and editor) definitely shows his love of under-appreciated 80's horror films with this movie! Anyone who loves the cheesiness, preposterous situations, wacky and stereotypical characters of 80's horror movies will definitely love this very tongue-in-cheek homage to the past.STMD! definitely lives up to the qualities described in the poster and then some. It has all the "excessive violence" and "gratuitous nudity" that is reminiscent of those entertaining 80's horror movies we all love.

I like `` Hack . '' Think the `` Lone Ranger '' reincarnated as a 2000s cab driver , a role that's in vogue at the moment. If you don't take a cab at all, there's a good chance you don't remember the Lone Ranger, or that he ever even existed. In the same vein, I never thought I'd use the term hack, but then it turns out that was a deliberate choice -- it's a word that came up as part of an email message I received while writing a column about the dangers of texting while driving.

As a fan of C.J. 's earlier movie, Latter Days, I really wanted to like this film.The nicest thing I can say, however, is that it's NOT an awful film. There are some good performances, and a few funny scenes. In particular, Tori Spelling has a couple of great scenes where she's talking to her fiancé's ex-boyfriend.Overall, though, it's pretty week. The script falls back on weird coincidences and clichéd movie moments way too often. (The main character went to Stanford on a golf scholarship, and his high school buddy doesn't even know that he plays the game?)

Tumbling Doll of Flesh (aka Niku daruma and Psycho: The Snuff Reels) This was on my want list for quite a while, and then I finally scored a copy on Ebay a while back. It's never been on DVD, and what I got from Ebay was a very good quality DVD-R, which I'm quite satisfied with. The movie is I believe the most extreme example of torture porn, with an emphasis on porn. A woman responds to an ad for a porn movie and goes with the producer to a place where it is filmed.

I 've been writing hardboiled crime fiction for a number of years now . When a writer develops a story idea he likes so much he decides to pursue it by writing a novel of the same title. When it becomes popular enough it is released as a novel in its own right. Most of the time when this occurs it's the writer who writes the novel who then develops the story concept for a second book of the same title. This is a way to take the risk of taking a concept which has been successful once and then making it better and more popular.

So me and my friend are carousing our local movie rental store and are looking for something to pick up to go along with Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, so why not pick up the third installment in the Scarecrow series!?! Keep in mind that this is not just Scarecrow Three; this is, Scarecrow: Gone Wild. Now both of us had seen to the first two Scarecrows so we felt obligated to finish the job. Let's start with the cover of the DVD first. First we notice a picture of Ken Shamrock ("The World's Most Dangerous Man") on the cover.

Before seeing the sneak preview today of Angels & Demons , I cleared my mind of any uncertainties that might arise from reading about the show, and I figured it would be a pleasant and relaxing way to spend Sunday evening. I didn’t make it very far, however, because the episode was not quite what I had expected. I didn’t expect the show to end with this, but rather with an ending so abrupt and unexpected that I was not even prepared for it; I thought the episode would have at least hinted at a resolution, if not an end.

I was amazed at the quality of this film, particularly after seeing pictures of the barely adult director - all 140(?) lbs of him! Truly, a boy directing a movie about a boy. I look forward to seeing more Luke Eberl films.I did think this one was a bit too long. There was too much time spent showing Connor being unsuccessful (and unwilling) to make a move on Owen. Caleb didn't try hard enough. Owen, being so young, could have easily become closer to Caleb and later decided it wasn't his preference.

Most awful casting I 've ever seen . Clark Kent as a crack head , a very feminine looking woman with a terrible accent ( not his voice , but she was using his voice and mannerisms to give herself an edge ) as Superman , with the voice of Burt Reynolds playing Batman. That was pretty terrible as well. I always like Clark Kent as a superman because it makes the movie feel less like a Superman movie, and more like it's a movie where the entire story is being told through Clark Kent's experiences, so he could play Clark Kent.

This is a pretty obscure , dumb horror movie set in the 1970s Everglades . It is really stupid and not worth discussing but it's fun to pretend to like something you hate . The movie opens by showing a group of people who have gathered to discuss an island where a creature is attacking people . There is a huge lake with a mysterious hole in it . When they arrive they find an abandoned house with a door on the lake . They all decide that they should go to the house to investigate and that they shouldn't wait for the creature to attack.

I went to see this movie at a book signing in Lexington, Ky last night. After a wonderful night that consisted of a few brief words with Mr. Bruce Campbell (you have to say it all, not just Bruce or Mr. Campbell ;D), friends while the books were being signed, and a QnA session with our favorite deadite killer the lights dimmed.So as not to spoil anything, I wont go into detail...but I loved the movie! Mr. Bruce Campbell did a wonderful job keeping the classic b-movie feel.

I ca n't believe the amount of reviewers who praise this as realistic . I 'm a million miles from this situation and have no doubt that what is portrayed is what happened.I would not expect a single parent with a large family of kids to have enough cash to make a down payment on a place like the one described here. I do expect a person who is struggling with money or trying to save money for a home down payment to be able to do so.I would have thought it was more realistic to show a down payment at least on the same level as the rent in a first-timer's situation.

I have always loved the ironic symbolism and brilliant cinematography of Coppola's masterpiece. I was lucky enough to meet Martin Sheen outside the Santa Monica Civic Auditorium one night in 1981, as he waited for Charlie and Emilio to leave a concert. He was very humble about the praise I shared with him for this work of art, especially his portrayal of the young Captain. This is, without a doubt, a must see, a complete 10 and an important part of American Film History. "Charlie Don't Surf".

I love this movie , first and foremost because of Mark Wahlberg is in it and secondly because the end. Wahlberg is the man in the film . He is my all-time fave and I can watch a movie without him in it any day. He is the reason this movie is worth watching . He and Jennifer Love Hewitt had an incredible chemistry on screen . And when they were apart , it was as though Jennifer was my friend instead of a sex object . Mark Wahlberg is the man. I just loved it all. Mark and Jennifer together, the chemistry between them, and Mark being so funny.

When the Legends Die is a powerful, moving story of an orphaned Ute Indian who goes on to become Tom Black Bull, a champion bronc rider. Raised in the old ways, Tom is given a white man's name and must adopt the language and ways of the white man to live in that world. Bitter about the role he has been forced into, Tom finds fulfillment doing one thing, busting horses, riding them to death, in the rodeo. The movie has Richard Widmark in the role of Red, the man who befriends Tom and acts as his manager.

As a geology student this movie depicts the ignorance of Hollywood. In the scene where the dog grabs the bone from inside of the burning house, it is less then a foot from lava which has an average temperature of 1,750 degrees Fahrenheit. This stupidity is witnessed again when "Stan" goes to save subway 4. His shoes are melting to the floor of the subway while the rest of the team is standing just feet away from the flowing lava. And to finish off this monstrosity of a film, they come up with the most illogical solution, stopping a lava flow with cement K rails.

Firstly , I am a huge fan of crap films . B grade is always good for a laugh . Now let's get to the point . This movie is bad , but that's a bad way to look at it . I think it deserves some respect , because it is actually very funny , and it is a movie that I would see again, without fail, with any film that I saw , in any format . And that's the problem , because I really don't see it as a bad movie. I think it is one of the best comedies I've ever seen .

All I can do is laugh. Wow. I like Jim Wynorski's movies, I really do. I mean, Chopping Mall is a classic. But this, what happened to this guy? He used to make funny horror movies, that tried to be good. But this was hardly even funny...I mean, I guess it was, because I laughed. The villain is incredible. I mean, horrible CGI. It looks...terrible. And the movie has no gore, and no nudity as redeeming qualities. It is rated PG-13.

I thought this movie was cleverly written and very well acted. Its a movie that greatly surpasses other films in terms of originality and enjoyment.Rupert Grint played the part marvelously, and has a general knack for the acting business. The almost obsessive mother added quite a lot to the plot, and was a character one could almost instantly loathe. This reminded me, in a way, of the Divine Secrets of the Ya-Ya Sisterhood. Not by means of actual content of the film, but the premises, and overall tone to the film itself.

I saw this superb documentary at the Santa Barbara Int ' l Film Festival . It is extremely absorbing and informative . It's not a documentary but a short film made by someone who was there and knows the whole story. You will get a feeling of what really happened during the war. If you do like documentaries and like to see good ones , you must see this film. This is a great film to introduce your child to the horrors and horrors of war. It tells the story of an extraordinary man, one who gave his life for his country and another one who was murdered for his cause.

I bought this DVD from Walmart for cheap, thinking it would be a typical, crap straight-to-video monster junk, but it turned out much better than expected. There isn't really any criticism to say about it... it's obviously low budget, but that just adds to the cheesy old fashioned fun. It's very cool and entertaining.There's everything: horror, sex, a great plane crash and good characters. And I'd say it's pretty original, cuz it really doesn't come off as any other movie I've seen.

Last night, I saw A PECK ON THE CHEEK (KANNATHIL MUTHAMITTAL with English subtitles). Oddly, it was 137 minutes long--slightly longer than the time listed on IMDb.At first, I found myself losing interest in this film because the rather confusing style of filming really lost me. The context for what was occurring was missing and I am glad I stuck with it. At the beginning, a young couple is married and shortly after the wedding, war breaks out in their native Sri Lanka and the lovers are separated. Months later, the wife is very pregnant and on board a refugee vessel heading to India.

Rivalry between brothers leads to main story line . Navy Commander Chuck Prescott ( Marshall Thompson ) has developed the ultimate super weapon: an atomic reactor, capable of powering an entire city. When a nuclear explosion goes horribly wrong, he finds himself trapped, surrounded, and outnumbered. Luckily, he discovers a mysterious woman who can see him as he is now. As a result, he's given a life sentence, but when the woman he loves becomes a prisoner in his own cell, she can change his mind about what he's capable of and give him hope.

I 'm not going to say the story of the movie as some people do . I 'm pretty sure it 's true , and it 's pretty interesting , but it is not going to be in here . Anyway , the thing that you need to be aware of it that this story does not end here . It does end here , but it doesn 't because there is a different end . The story continues . In fact, there are multiple endings , but I'm going to keep this short and simple . I think you should go see the movie to know the story , but you should also know it .

It 's nice to see a romantic comedy that does not have the prissy man lead , this has solid characters and chemistry that you will not find in any romcom where the man leads, I would have to say it is my favorite so far in the series and would give it 5 out of 5. I really enjoyed this movie! It has a great romantic scene that is funny, and it's interesting how different the relationships between the characters are, you get to meet them all, which is just so fun.

The first thing you should know about `` Zipperface '' is that it was shot on video , so it looks as if it has been cut from a film or something, and you can easily tell it wasn't shot on film because there are no film stocks used in its production. And that is one reason why the special effects in the film look really good, and the other reason is because the director and his team did not need any special effects because he used video footage instead of film to create Zipperface . That said, there is something that I found strange about Zipperface .

The good things first : I agree with another viewer who said that Gene Raymond has a marvelous drunk scene in this episode, and that I think the scene is a perfect example of Ray Harryhausen's master craft. "I know exactly what you feel," she said softly, taking my hand. We were in a room with high, arched windows. She looked at my face, then at my body and then my hands. "You like me," she said. I didn't answer. I was too embarrassed. "It's not about what you say.

In the mid 1800s, Irishman Dennis Hopper (as Daniel Morgan) emigrates to Australia, seeking a share of the continent's gold. Instead, Mr. Hopper finds himself branded, and thrown in a torturous prison; there, he is gang-raped. Upon release, Hopper hooks up with aborigine David Gulpilil (as Billy), with whom he seeks revenge upon sadistic Bill Hunter (as Sergeant Smith), Jack Thompson (as Detective Mainwaring), and others. Eventually, vengeance becomes heroism; Hopper is admired and assisted by the common people, and hunted by corrupt and powerful authorities.

Great acting, great production values, good direction.But the script starts out with great pacing and interest in the first half and then falls apart in the second half. We're clear on character and motivation for the first half but then the second half leaves many questions unanswered.The conflicts raised are compelling but the follow-through is weak. For instance, we're very clear that Rudyard Kipling is pro-war but we don't know if that philosophical stance changes through the course of the film.This is the sort of picture that makes me want to look up the facts in history books.

While not as bad as some movies ( like the horrible `` Atomic Twister '' ) , `` Meltdown '' is pretty terrible. A group of people are trapped inside a giant tank of molten metal. They are unable to leave, no matter how they feel. A man tells them the truth about the situation and the consequences they are facing, but it doesn''t really matter because he tells them to do what they will to escape. They can''t really leave, so they do what they will to survive. There are some good parts and some decent scenes.

Drawn by Pain is easily one of the best pieces of cinema I have ever seen . Here are my thoughts on it . Story :- The story is very basic. A teacher goes to an island with his family. There they learn how the island is, but there is no one on that island. When the teacher arrives on the island the island dies. The teacher leaves the island, the island dies, then the teacher comes back, and the island grows up. Cinematography :- The cinematography was incredible. I think the movie was in black and white.

Just want to inform you guys that this movie was actually pretty good ! ! ! Thought it was a pretty cool movie and I think a very good adaptation of the book !! The movie is good, but the script was really bad. And the movie was not at all as good as the book. Although I liked the novel better. I didn't understand the ending, but the movie was very enjoyable. It took me back to my high school days, which are probably the only good moments in my young life. So, I give this movie 1 out of 4 stars.

Shame Shame Shame on UA/DW for what you do! I was appalled. Do NOT take kids to see this movie. The humor is totally inappropriate for children - plus they'll be bored and disappointed. Certainly *we all* have read Theo's wonderful children book and certainly we have expectations...but this is pure trash. Dr. Seuss would be ashamed and certainly would've never given his "thumbs up" at such a dastardly attempt to capitalize on a classic.What a pity. Spend your money on the book. If you own a copy, then buy the book and donate it to a Toys for Tots program.
