Michener's epic novel. Well, the time period covered was one chapter, but I don't remember many of the situations actually occurring in the book.

I 'd like to point out these excellent points in favor of this movie : # 1 Angelina Jolie sex scenes with Brad Pitt in this movie would have been more intense than what we saw in movies before and after it. Not because Angelina Jolie did anything different in the film, but because this was the first time Brad Pitt ever had sex with a woman who looked more like the woman he wanted to date than a super model! #2 It is a movie made by directors who worked with great actors and actresses.

Death in Venice is a movie I need to see once every ten years . It is always different , and always worth the time and money. For one thing , they never make movies the same way twice , and they don’t make a movie the way they made it a decade earlier. That is why there are always things that make me wonder if I am watching a movie, or some sort of movie that I should not be seeing. But for a while when I saw this, it looked like it was trying to do that.

This movie is not worth anything. I mean, if you want to watch this kind of stuff, flip to Hollywood movies! This totally is a disgrace to the Bollywood name. Neal N Nikki seriously sucked! Never watch this movie. As for the actors, it appears the acting genes skipped a generation. Tanisha couldn't have worn less and Uday Chopra obviously was just picked because he was the director's spoiled son. (All of that Halla Re was amazingly stupid) The songs are eh, and I hope the director did not spend to much money on it...... Bottom line, I hated the movie.

It is terrible ! It is like somebody gave a kid a faulty video camera and $ 30 and told him to go play football ! The kid thought it would be fun to take a snap and send it back to his father. The kid took a snap and didn't even tell his father that it was a shot of the football, he took it to his mom and sent a email to daddy that he made it, he made it to the 50 yard line. He sent the snap back to his mother, and she took a look at it, and said "oh no !

I watched this episode a lot of times because I didn't get how Prue died. This is what happened. Prue, Piper, and Phoebe try and save their innocent,A Doctor, because Shax wants to kill him. Phoebe goes upstairs to look in The Book Of Shadows while Prue and Piper are protecting their innocent. Shax appears while Phoebe is still upstairs, so Shax throw an energy ball at the doctor but Prue pushes him out of the way and Prue get hit in the chest with it and smashes against the wall, same with Piper.

Imagine yourself trapped inside a museum of the dark middle Ages and a resurrected vampire and his maniacal sidekick are chasing you. Where is the absolute last place you want to hide? I'd say inside the uncanny Virgin of Nuremberg torture device, because there's a good risk you'll get brutally spiked to death. And yet, the elderly lady in this film stupidly runs into her spiked coffin. "The Vampire's Coffin" is a rather disappointing sequel, as director Fernando Méndez doesn't re-create the Gothic atmosphere of the 1957-original but puts the emphasis on comical situations and dialogs.

The sort of `` little '' film which studios used to excel at but seldom make anymore . Sort of a throwaway type of thing for kids that you would be more interested in if it was a cartoon, but since there's nothing else on it it might as well make money . it has some nice moments and some not so nice moments . . . but as far as a throwaway film it just doesn't measure up to other movies made today . i'm not sure i'm actually enjoying it at all , i'm just going along for the ride and hoping i'll be entertained .

I was a guest at the Sept. 30th screening of Eddie Monroe and was pleasantly surprised with the story, the great acting and the talented directing. I found it hard to believe that all this talent can be found in an independent film. Powerful performances by Vario, (Uncle Benny), Sara, (Jessica Tsunis), and Morris, (Eddie Monroe). The supporting cast was chock full of colorful and amusing characters. This film reminds me of one of those movies that you will look back on in 20 years and discover that it launched many actors into stardom.

Jeff Fahey has such alert eyes and a smudgy, insidious smile that every character he plays seems villainous; therefore, it doesn't really work to cast him as the good guy of the piece, the audience is just waiting for his character to crack and start blowing people away. Drew Barrymore, fresh off her acclaimed role as "Poison Ivy", must have done this film simply as a favor to director Phedon Papamichael (he was the cinematographer on "Ivy"); playing a character named Daisy Drew (!

`` My Blue Heaven '' is boring . The plot is insipid ; the characterizations and dialogue stink ; the setting is uninspiring ; and the ending is predictable. The movie has the feel of a film made by someone who was too immature and inexperienced to think of what would work as an interesting story ; yet, he was unable to do anything about it, and so the film exists only in the past. He does get one thing right ; he did make one of the greatest movies ever made . . . .

A severe backwards step for the puppets in this mainly dull and tedious outing . Guy Rolfe , so fantastic in The Avengers, turns in a less than impressive job here . But it's too little too late as his character has now become more of an afterthought with each sequel . It was hoped that this would improve the story by adding new twists and new characters but instead we get the same old plot and the same old story . And we get some of the worst villainy you could possibly imagine in The Dark Knight Rises .

eXistenZ is an exploration of reality and virtual reality , wherein characters run from realm to realm , landscape to landscape , in order to escape the world that they have found themselves trapped in, and ultimately escape their own limitations. In this way, each character will learn the meaning of freedom and the power of not being in control. As characters run and try to discover themselves, they will find themselves on a path of discovery. One path will lead to the world that they have created for themselves in the virtual realm . But there will also be a path that can lead them to a different place.

The subject is World War II and Robert Ryan is a rejected soldier whom Lupino hires as handyman . She does not know the real story of his service in the U.S. armed forces, but the stories she tells him are interesting. She lives with her son in a trailer home on the south side of Chicago and she works as a maid to supplement her income, so Ryan works for her when he can. One day when she is out on the job she spots a young man walking across the lot. It seems that he has trouble getting around because he is disabled.

As a big Dostoyevsky fan, I had always been disappointed with Hollywood's halfhearted attempts to get into the Russian romantic aesthetic -- case in point, Yul Brynner as Dmitri Karamazov. I had thought the whole problem was a poor casting decisions, but then I saw Yul as Major Surov and changed my mind. When given an intelligent script to work with, he suddenly came alive and was as noble, sexy, and conflicted as you could ever want a Neurotic Russian Officer to be! So he was a better Dmitri as Major Surov than he was as Dmitri.

This movie was a disappointment. The story is essentially The Shining with a castle (or a very cheap set masquerading as a castle, to be specific) substituting as the hotel and a monster instead of the ghosts. The budget is the same you'd see from a Cinemax softcore porn, as is the photography, sets, lighting, and video it was shot on. The story is a failed attempt at sincerity: there's no easier way to make your audience feel sympathetic for your characters than to show them experiencing emotional trauma. And the trauma in this movie is pretty trite.

I LOVE THIS MOVIE ! ! ! This beautiful , charming love story drew me in immediately with its lovable characters and charming romance story. I have a few favorite parts, like when the two main characters are having a conversation on the porch of a lovely home on the hill in the mountains. There are also a number of wonderful scenes that are set in the mountains on a hot summer’s day with the sound of water dripping into a small stream and then the sight of a lovely waterfall and beautiful flowers. There is also the moment when you see these two lovely people falling in love.

This series is formulaic and boring . The episodes are the same thing every week , simply with slightly varied plot-lines and characters. I can’t help but think that the producers knew that they would not be getting a lot of subscribers. I am not going to see this series for as long as they keep this format because it just makes me bored to no end. If you have watched the first 5 episodes , you know the plot line . I have already watched the first 2 episodes of the second . If you like this format , give the second a shot .

First of all, let me say that I am in no way denying the importance of the subject - quite the opposite. I am Polish and I have been aware of the Katyn massacre for quite a long time (in fact, two of my family members died there), so I was looking forward to this film. Unfortunately, I was disappointed.I think the main problem lies with the script, which encompasses too many subplots and characters, none of which are properly developed. The characters are painfully one-dimensional; their stories are intertwined, but lack overall meaning.

There 's something strange about the antisocial sentiment you can find in some Cheech And Chong material . One of the things you find in " Cheech & Chong: The Very Best of Cheech & Chong ," and indeed, in the film as a whole is the fact that the two comedians (or at least Cheech, as it seems to me) seem to have developed a sort of mutual contempt for each other. The two comedians have never met in the flesh but they share a sense of the other's shortcomings and weaknesses.

Writer/director John Milius takes a little-known incident from American history and extrapolates wildly in all the right ways . The film is so much fun, one might almost forgive the liberties taken in adapting it into film. It's only after watching it for a while that I began to see a pattern in all the liberties taken. This is one movie that will be remembered, not for its story, but for the movie of the week, or for the movies that will be made based on it. If you want to watch this movie, don't let me tell you how to run your life.

I have always loved The Muppets . Though most children 's entertainment then was n't that likable , The Muppet Show has always been something special . And I always remember when I got to meet and spend some magic time with some of The Muppet Gangsters . So I am really excited to see the latest Muppet movie . And I am also really excited for this Muppet film which will come out on June 20 . If you have been waiting for the film , you might find it on your Netflix . But you should know , The Muppet Movie was actually the very first film of Muppet films .

Started watching this but did n't believe in any of the characters . In particular the relationship between the bakery owner and his grandson. I was expecting something more serious but that just seemed to be a love triangle at best. There were some funny moments but not many. I really enjoyed the opening. I had a hard time believing that he would ever get to the point where he would kill himself and go out in a way where he would leave a family that would have no one left. Even though I knew he was going to do that.

What to say about `` Dead End Road '' ... Lets just say that Edgar Allen Poe would have been proud. Wednesday, June 14, 2009

The U.S. government has spent a fortune and a few hundred thousand in taxpayer dollars on its latest attempt to bring back the Confederate Battle Flag. So much for the flag's historical value being used only by the Confederates! And as far as history is concerned, this is nothing but a new low in government's pathetic attempts to get back at the Union by rewriting history. I have a few things to say in favor of the Confederate flag and its supporters.

I enjoyed the Mr. Magoo cartoons I saw while growing up. And I enjoy Leslie Nielson's comic skills. So, I thought, this marriage must produce a funny child.I couldn't have been more wrong.This movie was just awful. I don't recall a single funny moment. This is one of the two or three times (in hundreds of films over the years) I've wanted my money back. You will leave this film dejected because you won't ever have that time back to use in a better way. In a comedy, the plot must draw in the viewer and serve as a framework for gags.

The Brighton has a traumatic drama in the breast of their family: the twenty years old Emily Brighton (Taylor Roberts) is retarded due to a fall when she was one, and her overprotective mother Martha Brighton (Amy Madigan) blames her negligence for the accident. The seventeen years old Evie Brighton (Lauren Ambrose) loves her sister and reads poems and stories for Emily. Their father Harry Brighton (John Savage), a bank investor, lives in the basement with his models of trains and railroads. Evie mysteriously sabotages her interviews for different universities being rejected, and teaches the poetries of her own to Emily.

I do n't understand why some of you ( or many ) have given this film upward of 8 stars. I don't find it very well done either. If you have watched it and thought "yeah, that's the best film of all time, that's why I can't give this movie a full review " then just wait until you watch it, I mean it's not my thing but it is a fantastic film and it deserves some kind of recognition. As far as I'm concerned there are only 2 people who deserve a full review on this movie - Robert Duvall, and Jack Nicholson.

I can not believe I let myself rent that piece of garbage ! The acting was so poor , my daughter was crying and I didn't have my phone on me to take a picture or call her or I would have asked them to hold the phone and then I wouldn't have known what was happening . I am glad I called and got them to take it off my hands . They didn't do what I thought they would do, and I paid for the whole thing . I am glad it was done and I don't intend to do anything like it ever again .

In the ever growing film genre of comic book adaptations, Blade is by far one of the best realised, and most faithful (overall) to the source material.... given that the character has almost 30 years of history in the comics since his debut as a back up figure in Marvel's Tomb of Dracula, the writer took almost ALL of the characters and plot elements from the comic's history. While changes were inevitably made, the finer points of the film steamroll right over any criticisms. Don't let any of you friends tell you different: Blade is one fine film.

Closet Land is an amazing, terrifying piece of cinema. It features only two actors in a single set, but never loses your attention. The set design is imaginative and troubling, the staging of scenes maintains your attention, while adding to your own sense of confusion and terror. The acting is outstanding, with Alan Rickman and Madeleine Stowe having the duty of carrying every scene.I first saw this film in 1991, soon after it came out on video. It didn't play in theaters where I lived; not surprising, given its political content. It should be seen, though.

OK , this movie seems to have been pretty well covered by earlier comments , but there are a couple of things to keep in mind about the movie. We’ll go into that later . For now, I’ll just talk about the movie itself , since that’s my focus . And that’s what I’ll say about the movie . I’ll add some additional thoughts on it later in the thread . First, the plot is really good for a movie like this . But the movie is also well made , as is it’s execution .

MASTER PLAN: have the winning team in a deadly tournament. One of several martial arts action pictures that attempted to capture the flavor of the famous "Enter the Dragon" from '73, this one is an effort from South Africa. The villain's stronghold is a bit different, appearing as a white castle-like fortress in the middle of the desert from a distance. The villain himself, a Baron or general, is a slightly more perverse version of the "Dr.No" or Han mold of master villainy, having strange flashbacks to the glory days of Nazi Germany.

I loved the film "Eddie Monroe". The film had all the components that kept me interested while watching it. I especially loved the plot twists along the way and the surprising ending. Craig Morris has Brad Pitt potential both in looks and talent. His blue eyes reminded me of Paul Newman's. Fred Carpenter took this movie to a new level.I loved the cast. The music score, cinematography, talent, locations and script were awesome. I loved seeing some of my favorite actors in Eddie Monroe. Fred Carpenter is an incredibly talented and gifted director.

After their star cross-country runner dies after a race, the members of a track team are stalked and killed by a mysterious masked murderer seeking vengeance for the girl's death.From the beginning of this film, it was quite obvious it was not going to be very good (at least as far as true quality goes). The 'dramatic' track race at the end of the introduction scene was one of the least believable sporting events I've ever seen in a film. It would seem that the winner of the race had never actually run before in her entire life.

Cruddy, innocent..no smoking, drinking or bikers, but Jeremy Slate (good actor) and Jocelyn Lane (good actress) make this moronically feasible for a bad biker flick, post-biker (exploit) time. They knew it, we knew it...Adam Roarke and Slate are wasted..but they lived on.A 3 out of 10. Best performance = Jocelyn Lane. Lane is the ONLY really to catch the final exploit biker film after RUN, ANGEL, RUN (which also has good actors - like Don Stroud, etc.). It was over. They knew it.

Not good. Mostly because you don't give a damn about what happens to all these people. Some comments : 1. I am tired of seeing governesses who never talk to their pupils, never teach them anything and take a tired and annoyed look whenever the said pupil, who of course has been won over in the space of 4 seconds, says something 2. Fine, so Rosina has a father complex and therefore is attracted to her employer. But Charles is completely different in all aspects from her father - if anything Henry is much closer as a sensual, exalted person 3.

This one was truly awful . Watching with fascinated horror , I kept on asking `` why have they done that?'' , `` why did they choose this scene?'' ( I really don't know but it was a very strange one . It just was , I couldn't make it out )

I have only seen this once, and it was quite good . In my opinion, the most important scene was the very beginning of the film , where the child is taken away from his mother , and taken to his new school.

I watched this film a few nights ago and it was awful! Awfully long - even though they managed to skip through the majority of his life!Awfully boring - the parts they included were long-winded, and for some reason the director chose to cut away from some of the action and left huge parts of the film unexplained! Awfully inaccurate - the whole'mystical' side to this film was a joke, and last time I checked Ghengis Khan wasn't exactly a nice guy! Awfully acted - I found several of the characters hard to believe, they were very two-dimensional and lacked and kind of depth!

I HATE MOVIES THAT END LIKE THIS!!! !This 16mm disaster is full of clichés, stereotypical characters, a generic, over done "plot" and terrible dialog.In this "Movie" we have the Aggressive Black Guy, The Black Guys Girlfriend, The Blonde Bitch, The Possible Lesbian "hacker chick", the Pedophilic teacher...Blah, Blah, Blah....And then the Pumpkin Man. "Do you think someone is taking the legend too far?" This question is asked towards the end of the film.

Went with some friends and one of my friends mom , thinking it would be a good way to start my journey, so I asked him how it went and what she said to me was that it was the best decision I've ever made. My heart was filled with joy, my body felt so relaxed, and I felt that I was on top of my game! I know that sounds funny, but believe me it did. About a week and a half after joining the class, I was able to walk without any pain in my hips and knees and with ease.

This for one has nothing to do with the absolutely fantastic first flick. And of course us Americans just have to remake everything successful into English, because man reading subtitles is SOOOOO Hard isn't it! From what I've see in the new trailers with the adorable now pregnant Jessica Alba (well that sure ruins every teenage boys fantasy everywhere doesn't it!) It looks EXACTLY the same but probably w/double the budget. I thought the original was one of the best horror/suspense/mystery flicks I have seen in any language in quite a long while.

This production of Hamlet , Prince of Denmark is by far the best that I have seen . Although it is still early days , this new version is definitely the most promising , and certainly the best I have seen at this time . I thought the story was very good and it made sense to the point where you have to get up and get a glass of water to calm the nerves before the show starts because you know something that will happen is going to happen. There is nothing like watching Hamlet as a live play, and seeing it in a theater is a great experience .

I was forced to watch this film for my World Reigonal Geography class . This film is what is wrong with Hollywood . We need to wake up from the delusion that if a film is good and does not violate any moral laws, that there is no reason to object to it . If you want to know what was happening during WW2 in the Eastern Front, this is a pretty good video to get an impression of. We can not just say that this video is wrong. This is because there were many different opinions during WWII.

Perhaps I missed something , but I found GOYA 'S GHOSTS to be a tedious costume melodrama . As to the story, it was just a rehashing of the classic ' Ghost of the Chancel , ' with the main difference that there was no ghost , and that the chancel-warden played a minor role , while the ghost played a major one . The only new thing was that there are two female protagonists . The heroine was a beautiful woman, who could not understand why people were treating her so coldly . She is the daughter of a noble and wealthy merchant who died when his wife became pregnant with another man's baby .

I 've been studying Brazilian cinema since 2004 , when I stumbled onto `` Cidade de Deus / City of God,'' a documentary about poverty in the favelas. This was followed by three documentaries about the drug wars in Rio, as well as documentaries on drug trafficking and organized crime in Rio and in the country. And then I started working on an anthology of fiction and nonfiction about Brazil, and that led to my most ambitious project yet , the project I am most proud of and that will be published next year by the Folio Society: `` Brazil in the Making: Stories of Change.''

Although i don't like cricket at all and i have seen this movie 13 years ago, I still think it is one of the best coming-of-age movies ..i remember the day i returned home from my school and sat down to have my lunch, I saw the opening titles of that movie and then....i was so immersed in it that i felt i was there, it really affected me personally. i still remember how i felt when i first saw it ,i felt that the poor boy was a friend of mine, going through the same adolescent experience we were having in those days.

I think this is one of the best tamil movies i 've seen in a while . i love the actors . all the actors have a superb acting ability . i have seen some good movie but nothing compare with tamil movie 's . i recommend everyone to go watch tamil movie 's . Watch this movie if you want to see full Tamil movie . I liked the movie as it was . A very good movie . I am really impressed with the acting and the performance of the cast . It is really good movie and I would recommend it to any Tamil movie lover .

Imagine the most cliche ridden b-movie horror plot you can . Add more plot holes than plot . Have it make no damn sense at all. Just go with it and have it happen. That’s pretty much how it’s done with this one. It’s the worst of them all in my opinion. The plot is pretty much the worst of them all, there’s not even a thread of logic that’s going on. The characters are flat and there are a few too many of them which is kind of lame.

Just saw this at the cinema. I haven't read the books. There is nothing new about this film at all. the bad guys seem to die with a couple of slashes no matter how many times our hero has been stabbed with a big sword he keeps on going looking the same (ish)! There are several action scenes but they are very fake. filmmakers seem to be under the impression that whenever they cant be bothered to choreograph a fight scene they just move the camera up close, move fast and turn the music up.........

This is a fascinating documentary about a 15 year old black lad who is accused of murdering a tourist in the South African city of Durban. What makes this tale even more remarkable is the fact that, at this exact time in history, apartheid is finally being dismantled. Watch this documentary and see how people in different parts of the world, at the very same point in history, were fighting for equal rights and against racial discrimination in one way or another, and now we are all watching it together, with our eyes wide open. It makes you want to do something!

I 've never written a comment on IMDb before , but this movie was so bad it left me little to say . I am sure the people who loved this movie are the same type of people who say movies are for kids . But that's ok . I didn't like this movie because it's not for anyone . It's just a kids movie and it doesn't do kids a lot of favours in this case . I hope you enjoy it , and don't ever say it was good , because if it wasn't for the kids in this movie , it never would have made money .

A great performance by Emily Grace ! I stumbled upon this movie while browsing my satellite listings and was curious about it. Emily Grace is an actress and model, and this is her first movie. It is quite a good movie to watch and I recommend it for people who have not seen it. After watching it, I think it was really good and worth watching again for a second viewing. The only negative thing I could find is that it took way longer than it needed to be. I believe that it took about 10 hours to complete. That is very slow.

UP AT THE VILLA (2000) **1/2WARNING: YOU MAY FIND SOME SPOILERS AHEADIt's hard to know what is the point in UP AT THE VILLA, a gorgeous but shallow period piece, one of those made with the only objective of earning Oscar nominations for best costume design and art-set direction (one for cinematography and another for score are also welcome). It has the same basic idea of thousands of period pieces produced every year: a good-looking, intelligent woman trying to find love in a strange place to her.

I was expecting a lot from this movie, and I can say I haven't been disappointed. First of all, this movie, as a world tour of wine making, let the spectator enjoy beautiful places. The people interviewed are really interesting and funny too, in particular Hubert de Montille. The shooting may be confusing, the camera always being unsteady and often focusing on secondary elements in the backgrounds. You may not like it, but I don't consider it as a defect.The themes raised in the movie may be kind of confusing as well, since globalization isn't the only issue discussed.

Based on what little i have seen of this show I don't think I will ever watch it again. Its not even remotely believable and frankly the Derek character just makes me angry.Sorry but seeing such a spoiled brat get his way time and again? Why would i want to watch that?!? No thanks, there are plenty of other shows that involve devious characters (Phil of the Future's Pim for example) where the evil one doesn't win or if they do not in the way they though.Not to mention that I think this is a terrible picture to paint about living with step-siblings.

There must have been a lot of background info that was left out of the movie. In fact, in the film, the girl, Lizzy, didn't even appear depressed. She just seemed like a girl that went out of control when she finally got to college, mainly from doing drugs and drinking alcohol. That seemed to be her problem, not mental illness. Sure, she had emotional problems because her dad left and she barely saw him as a child, and her mom seemed a little out there.

Before you watch this movie - clean your ears, take away the make-up from your eyes and tell your girlfriend to stop kissing you. She doesn't have to. This picture will give you both warmth enough to keep your relationship life-long enough. If you're Jew/Russian/Ukrainian/immigrant - yes, what popular-movie-minority so ever - laugh within your memories. If you're something else or whatever your are anyway - laugh for the bittersweet memory of importance of friendship and family. It this movie, nothing will seem strange how ever strange it may seem.

I can't knock this film too terribly, because it's obvious midway through the the watching of it that they were trying to make it bad, or 'campy' if you prefer. Anyway, many of the parts they tried to make funny actually are, but often simply for the cheese factor. Watch the 'space invaders' game, actually played as real-life! Scratch your head at the bumbling robots...oh, the wackyness! And watch the whole thing go way over the top near the end with the 'time warp'!

`` River 's Edge '' was one of the most disturbing films of 1986 , and for a year that would be the height of the horror film, with a slew of gory hits, most notably ''The Wicker Man'', ''The Texas Chain Saw Massacre'' and ''The Texas Chainsaw Massacre''. But the film wasn't just for shock value. It had a very realistic plot which was interesting to watch, and it was a film that had the guts to have a female lead. In fact it was only in 1990 that a female lead got her own film.

The story of a Volcano erupting downtown L.A. sounds like a nice plot for a disaster movie . This one, though, could be more accurately called a disaster novel. The story was written by one of California's most popular science fiction writers. A few years ago, he wrote a story featuring an asteroid crashing into downtown L.A., causing the entire city to be incinerated. The story is called, "The Asteroid Strikes," and was published in Locus Magazine, the online literary magazine run by the legendary Hugo award-winning author and editor, John Joseph Adams.

A paranoid scientist creates a wolfman by transfusing wolf blood into a meek , quiet , but very large gardener. A man is found dead in the snow, and the police start investigating his death as a suicide. A mysterious young man enters the school to attend the same day. One of the teachers in the school is found to have been murdered, and the police have to find his killer before it can happen to any other member. A man takes a girl for a romantic weekend, only to come back to discover that she is actually a werewolf!

I haven't laughed this much in a long time - or seen a film so ineptly made! Talk about so bad it made me laugh!Firstly, I estimate that for about 40 percent of the film's length, I couldn't tell what was happening, or indeed even what I was seeing. I can only describe the camera work as frenetic meets LSD. There are whole segments, minutes long, where all you can see are blurred flashes and fragments of cave wall, people and various other unidentifiable stuff.

The Hollow is a wonderful murder mystery that provides all you can expect from Agatha Christie and of course Poirot is a wonderful narrator and a great voice of the book as well. He does a great job and makes the reader feel like they are right there with him as he narrates everything from the first person to the third person through out. He also does a wonderful job with the voice over narration. I do not own the movie but if you want to go see the movie you can easily find it at Amazon and iTunes.

This great film never showed up in my town , so actually I did n't have any opportunity to watch it ( I did not know if it was available in my city or n't). So I decided to go online for help. And here is what i found out about the film. I will try to make this post as concise and clear as possible and will also try to list all available information as well as any other info that i could find. The film is based on a True life Story.

Most of other reactions by subscribers to this service were very apt , although that some found it slow or too much trouble to register for it , so I'm going to add a feature that allows anyone to add their name to a list so that I know who's subscribed, so that I can add them to a mailing list to get their attention if they're not already in a list that I'm already on, etc. The only problem is that I want the list to be as private as possible, or I lose money, and that's a problem.

A couple of friends and myself visited the video shop a few years back and we were in one of those moods to rent some cheesy non seen flicks. My friend grabbed Head of the Family and we were greeted by a head sitting in a wheelchair. Well that set us off laughing and we decided to have a bet to see who would be the one who had to go to the desk and pay for the movie. Well you guessed it, it was me!!!!!!!! I have never been so embarrised in all my life.

Red Skelton (in his first starring role) plays Wally Benton who plays 'The Fox' on a radio show. He writes the murder mysteries and as 'The Fox' solves them. Joseph Jones (Conrad Veidt) is trying to figure out how to perform the perfect murder on someone. He kidnaps Benton, his girlfriend (Ann Rutherford) and another girlfriend (Virginia Grey). He tells Benton to write out the perfect murder...or his girlfriends get it...Very funny and enjoyable movie. Fast-moving (it's only 77 minutes), a good script and perfect casting really puts this across.

Wow ! It 's hard to put into words my feelings for this episode . Ice is one of the best characters ever created . I was actually surprised to see the last episode so close . It 's not easy to get so emotionally involved with a game . I was hoping for some sort of closure for the playerbase . It was good seeing so many familiar faces as well as some people I just know . I have to give a big thankyou to the devs and the team . I am still amazed at how well the series has been run so far .

This gem captures early 80 's life brilliantly . As a grad '83 boymyself , I must say that Valley Forge was a special place . We grew up in such a tight knit group that everyone looked out for each other . In fact we would do anything for anyone in our group , including running away . We played games , went swimming , had parties , and lived life at its finest . There was so much freedom to do what you would want to do . Being a grad student was also like having a family with all of you .

Never having read or seen the Bard 's original work , I ca n't begin to compare this work to it . It is different . For one, the narrator is much less intrusive than his predecessor . I would have thought he would be more intrusive than he is . Also , the way the narrative is told does not seem to reflect the Bard's original intentions . I am reminded of Shakespeare's " Hamlet , " a play that is now considered by many to be perfect . I was not disappointed . It is a great play , as Shakespeare himself would have hoped .

The Camals Are Coming is a rather disappointing British comedy from 1934. I purchased this because I like desert adventures and states on the box that it is a drama. It certainly isn't.It is about a couple who head for Egypt to capture some desert drug smugglers.This would have been much better if it had been done as a drama instead of a comedy, which lets it down a lot. It is quite silly in parts. Depsite this, there are some good action and location scenes.The cast is lead by Jack Hulbert with Anna Lee as the love interest.One viewing is enough for this movie.

This telecast of the classic musical "Sweeney Todd" does not do the production justice, but is still quite enthralling.Firstly, the most enjoyable aspect of this version is the production design, from the wheeling multi-set to the startling trapdoor. Then, the staging is excellent, right down to the slashing.The main failing here is in the performances people give. Oh, they're believable, all right-- but it is quite frustrating when nobody seems to be hitting their cues on time in a song as fast-paced as, say, "Kiss Me."

OK, well, no one in their right mind(s) would pick up a movie titled "The Man with the Screaming Brain" and expect it to be serious. This is an outrageous b-movie, and that means a truly hokey plot, strange characters, clichés, over-the-top action, and oh-so-cheesy one liners. For that odd segment of the population (including myself) that gets a kick out of that kind of thing, this is a gem.The acting is better than expected. Stacy Keach is embedded in his character. Bruce Campbell brings a spirited, convincing performance.

Yesterday I watched this tv production, and I was very disappointed.I didn't have big expectations when it was a tv production, but the complete movie was pain with no ending. I felt it lasted for 3 hours, but it was just me who was bored to death. Every minute was a long struggle and I really fought hard to stay away from the "turn off"-switch.The movie is about a doctor (Dr. Verghese) who gets a lot of AIDS-patients, and most of them die during the movie. It is hard for Verghese to live with, so his family gets punished with his frustrations.

Rather than go on location and make a realistic film about drug addiction in the Windy City, contrarian director Otto Preminger decided to go the opposite way and make his movie appear as artificial as possible, thus flying in the face of the fashion set by men like Kazan, Huston and Zinnemann, who were making their pictures all over the world. Nelson Algren, on whose novel the movie is based, went on record as despising it. What, one wonders, was Preminger up to, and why did he do the movie this way?The sets in the film are so minimal as to suggest a Mr. Magoo cartoon.

A low budget may be an excuse for poor acting talent and pathetic looking fake gore . However , it has a lot of other things which are not good as well . As a result , it has an average to low-average score which is too low for me. It’s very disappointing to see a mediocre movie in this budget range . In general , the action scenes are average , they are nothing to write home about but the characters and the cast are the ones who make the movie . They are pretty good but unfortunately , we can’t see them on screen because of poor performances .

The best so-bad-it's-good movie ever made . Rudy Ray Moore is my personal hero . Whether dealing with day to day problems in his own life or in the world of the film industry he has shown us that life is made more difficult by doing the same thing over and over. I am very happy that i got to watch this movie . It has a great storyline . I am not a film critic but it does have its moments . But it also gives you a good time watching it . It has a great twist . You watch it . You laugh . You enjoy .

I have had the opportunity to catch this independent film and was impressed with it, despite the lack of excitement in the plot. The acting was very good by everyone involved. Amy Madigan played the part of a guilt ridden mother who is tired, yet well intentioned and determined to make up for her younger daughter's condition. Yet, in the process, she has neglected her older sister, who is more interested in playing with her savant-syndrome sibling and living in a world of escapism.The men in the movie are very powerful in their secondary roles.

This film is much the same as Cannibal Holocaust. If it weren't for the needless animal killing in the name of 'shock' ("Ooh look at us, we're hardcore, we've added real death to our films") these films would make their way onto my dusty classics shelf - I'm a huge fan of cannibal films and zombies. But as it stands, it's another example of shock horror clutching at the last straws of the pile in a desperate effort to make a poor film generate more hype. To sum up, a crusty gore flick with limited appeal.

Let's face it.This movie is incredibly cliché, as Korean romance dramas and movies go. First of all, there's a pair of long-lost siblings, one of which falls in love with the other. Second, there's a not-so-popular girl and two gorgeous, popular guys who fall for and fight over her. Third, one of the characters suffers from a tragic disease, which, eventually, takes his life.Still, I like this movie.Without the right actors, this movie would probably have disappointed fans of the novel. But because the actors fit the roles perfectly, the movie is engrossing--I honestly couldn't stop watching.

This is another Sci-Fi channel original movie staring Rhys Davies where its hard to decide whats worse, the acting, or the writing/directing/producing (John Sheppherd helms all three. )Basic story: obsessed exobiologist captures chubacabra monster,smuggles it in a cargo container aboard a cruise ship it escapes and the blood bath begins. Clichéd sci fi cast of the sturdy captain with the beautiful daughter, handsome hero and mad scientist. Captian calls in a terrorist alert for the ship (since of course wouldn't believe a monster story. )No dramatic Helicopter drop of the Navy Seals here.

One of the more prominent/popular episodes, but clearly one of the worst. A red-shirt female falls for Khan (instead of dropping dead - for a change) and then proceeds to betray Kirk and the Enterprise as if loyalty were a non-existent character trait on the ship. Makes one wonder what kind of psychology tests this supposedly brilliant Starfleet uses to test people when hiring. We have the same kind of absurd lack of loyalty in "Wink Of An Eye", when a red-shirt male takes the enemy's side just because he falls in love! Same as in SS.

I saw this movie yesterday and thought it was awful ; it was pointless and just plain stupid . the only good thing about it was that i was laughing out loud at the time . i think it has a good chance of doing well . i think i saw it with someone who thought it was the best movie of the year . we didn't get to see as much of it . maybe if we had , this would be a better movie . i think the only bad thing was i had to sit through an entire scene where a woman was screaming for a baby to be placed in her vagina .

Oh Gawd . I want to time travel back to Monogram Studios and throttle someone in their 2 room front apartment. Just sayin'. Thursday, April 15, 2010

Well . . . . here's the update . . . It has been about 5 months of being out of work, which makes me wonder why I am doing this . . . But, I can tell ya . . . . there are some good people out there who really want to see the end of me as an illustrator, and they are really trying hard to get a job for me.

This is another of those films I can remember from when I was a kid and I recently managed to acquire it off ebay - 20 years on, it's nowhere near as good as I remember it being.The story is 'vaguely' kick started, by a 'cosmic event' (there's another extra film-crew member in the credits for 'weak story development') which makes collective ants become super intelligent. Ant species who used to war with each other have ceased rivalries and are now working together. The thing I wanted to know throughout was, TO DO WHAT EXACTLY?

A group of young filmmakers with virtually no budget set out to make something clever and original -- and while there is a bit of originality and some skilled drawing in this slacker puppet show take on "Dante's Inferno," there is nothing especially clever. Dante's "Divine Comedy" was a brilliant piece of social commentary. This film is a vaguely moralistic student film with pretensions to High Art.I suspect those who loved this film were those readily amused by the sophomoric pokes at some icons of the political and/or religious right, and that those who hated it took offense at seeing their favored icons poked.

I very much enjoyed this movie and I think most fans of Lauren Ambrose will too . Her character is an absolute hottie in this movie and when we meet her in the preview we can see just how good her acting chops are. It is not often that we get to see what Lauren Ambrose looks like in person so this was definitely cool to get to know her on screen and I can tell you that I am very much looking forward to her return to the big screen next year. Overall I would give it a 6.3/10.

Don't get me wrong this was fun to watch. It has some nice animation with exception of an odd looking Bugs, and some nice music. And the standout scene was definitely Elmer, Bugs and Daffy's dance on the floor, that was such a nice and fun touch. As a matter of fact, the whole cartoon is nice to watch, but all in all it is not what I call exceptional like Carrotblanca. There are some very nice gags, but they have been used before I feel, and there wasn't much that I would deem hilarious.

I do not like Himesh Reshamiya. I do not like his singing too. But his songs are a craze in India, especially among commoners. Now when he ventured to become an actor  that was a big joke! What guts he has to reap as much as he can in his prime time. I did never want to see this movie. But one thing changed it. The movie becoming a super-duper hit! After 2 weeks, Aap Ka Saroor has raked box office collection of 14 crores  compared to Apne that has collected 7 crores in the same 2 weeks.

This movie has all the ingredients of a great horror story and loses it in the last half. Few movies can actually give me chill bumps. This one did. Few horror movie give me a sense of dread. This one did. It kept me guessing. I cared about the story. I cared about the characters. The acting was decent. Unfortunately, about half way through the movie, the story just doesn't have many good directions it can go. It becomes evident that everything cool about the plot is going to self-destruct. It does.

The first few minutes of this movie don't do it justice!For me, its not funny until they board the sub and those hilarious characters begin to gel. I was born and raised in Norfolk Virginia and met my share of "different" sailors- I even married one! Most of my favorite movies are just funny, not topical, not dependent on sex or violence and funny every time I see them. Groundhog Day, Bruce Almighty and Down Periscope are still funny even after I know the dialog by heart. Kelsey Grammar with his "God I LOVE this job!

I cannot believe I let myself rent that piece of garbage! The acting was so poor, my Grandmother could have done better. The punches thrown in the movies were nowhere near the character the Scarecrow was knocking to the floor. The movie became a chore to watch! So this group of baseball jocks decide to go hazing, even after they weren't supposed to in orders form there coach under consequences. So, naturally, they go anyway. They decide to tie a loser to a post with the so called "Scarecrow."

Imagine an exploitive remake of The Defiant Ones with a black chick and a white chick attached to each other by rope. The white chick says to the black chick, “Do you want to die?” The black chick replies, “Fuck you,” and then the white chick is strangled to death by the black one. Now imagine that the girl with the rope is also white, and the white girl sees her black friend hanging from a beam. The white chick says, “Get the fuck up, you bitch.

To my eternal shame , I 've never seen a silent movie - not even the mother of all vampire movies, "Scent of a Woman." But I've read a dozen books about vampires. Most were good, several were awful, a few were downright terrible. So, what do I know about this subject - except for what I've read in books? A lot. And I learned a lot from that. Here's my list:

1) Vampires suck blood, so there's no way they could survive if they were never exposed to sunlight.

The cinematography is the film's shining feature. Park really knows his stuff when it comes to shooting memorable scenes from behind a camera. Every shot is filled with vibrant colors that leap off of the screen. Every frame of the film seems to tell a story all on its own. I hope there's a Blu-ray release of this film because it will look fantastic. It's rather intriguing to see which elements of the vampire mythology Park used for his vision. Sang-hyeon has to drink blood to survive and to stay looking flawless, has incredible strength, and is vulnerable to sunlight.

I love movies...and rarely do I see a movie that I hate...but this was the worst movie I have ever seen, or at least close to it. Any movie that ends with a rape scene is awful. Hands down... I cant believe I wasted 2 hours of my life watching this movie. I'm really mad, I want my money back and my time back. AWFUL! Do not go to see it, the cinematography is awful, the plot is awful, the ending is awful.

It seems to me that a lot of people do n't know that Blade is actually a superhero movie on the same footing as any other. In my opinion it is a movie for all the same people that watch the X-men movies or Spider-Man or Batman. What I am trying to say is that we have a superhero movie in the making and it does not look that different from the other ones. There is just the name. I agree with that. But the only way to get to know him, and to get a glimpse of why he fights, is to follow him on his journey.

When I was younger I saw the end of HAIR on TV. I just watched the last 5 minutes of the film. And I was really impressed by it. I got goose pimples and I said to myself that I HAD to watch this film.And I did, and I've to say: This film is amazing. The songs are great, the actors are very good and the message... The message of this film is one of the most important ones: "Make love, no war". This film is a real masterpiece.

When HOPPITY GOES TO TOWN he discovers nothing but bad news for his little insect neighbors in the Lowlands . things just seem to be getting more and more difficult for them , and this time , things may well have gone too far . one day , haggis finds the house where haggis had lived as a baby and now lives as an adult , an old friend of haggis' father . . since haggis had been living there , he was known as " the haggis kid " . when he sees haggis , however , he's not expecting what he finds . he's found a corpse !

This film is good in it's genre and that genre is naturally action with a little/average budget. Looks like Van Damme delivers greatly better performances when he has a good director guiding him. There is your basic bar brawl, alley scene and mostly a lot of gun fighting. Some basic drama, but nothing too deep. Isaac Florentine directs an OK action flick if you ignore the weak plot and the holes in it. But the person who steals the show is: Scott Adkins. How come this guy isn't a massive Arnold Schwarzenegger caliber action star that I don't know.

Audrey , I know you truly cherish your husband Ted 's memory but PLEASE do his legacy justice and heed the message he is sending to all Americans today. He was truly a great statesman who gave all Americans the benefit of his wisdom . I have been thinking about this for a long time and I wanted to give my own take on it. I am not a big Ted Cruz fan by any stretch. He has a lot of views that I have not yet endorsed and I have to say, I don't really think they are all that much of an improvement.

This movie was a major bait and switch. I rented it because of Rebecca St. James, a popular Christian singer. I have met her and wondered what she would be doing in a UFO movie. Well.......I think that she starred in this movie to help out a friend, or a friend of a friend. My first clue that this movie wasn't what it was supposed to be was when I witnessed the special effects of the UFO encounters. Cheesy! As the movie progressed, I noticed how plastic the actors were. It was funny how almost everyone in the movie wore solid colors.

`` Ghost Son '' is Lamberto Bava 's best film and , at the same time , also his worst film . Bava 's film is , for all intents and purposes , a comedy . Bava , in the course of two years , managed to write and produce one film after the other - and this time around he succeeded in the production of one of his very best films '' and '' one of his best comedies . The film is about the life of a young man who is forced to go through a painful period when his mother commits suicide .

If anyone has any doubts about the talent of Liev Schrieber , just a look at his new film , "Schindlers List" will make it perfectly clear. To begin with , Schindlers List is yet another example of how Schindlers List has become one of the very best known movies of the past year . With the new movie coming from Schindler's great grandson, David , a film that will certainly be appreciated by not only old school fans , but many of today's younger generation who have not seen the original yet , it is definitely a good time to see this as well .

This is my first `` awful '' rating ever on IMDb and I could n't think of a more deserving candidate to do so. It has to do with the story and the acting but also the script and the director. The film is a true story told in the form of a documentary about the life and loves of Marilyn Monroe, who at the time of her death from an overdose of sleeping pills on July 5, 1962, had become one of the world most famous and most beloved women of the 20th century. Marilyn Monroe is, by all accounts, an extremely private person.

Film critics of the world, I apologize. It is your job to give advice to the moviegoing public so that they can wisely choose what to spend money on. But I ignored your advice and I have been deeply hurt. However, my decision to see "The Cat in the Hat" wasn't made haphazardly. You see, three years ago all of you critics said that we should all avoid the "calamity" known as "How the Grinch Stole Christmas". Then some friends of mine took me to see it and it turned out to be a colorful, funny and almost hypnotic yuletide treat.

It is difficult to compete against classic greatness, but once you make that choice and the decision is in play, you need find the best and brightest resources to keep your product top drawer, and on the cutting edge of quality. If your intention is to aim for second or third (or fourth) best, why even try? It is with that, I wonder why this version of the Ten Commandments was written, produced, and aired. I would ask the producers, "What were you thinking? Were you endeavoring to create a projected deficit?"

A woman in love with her husband (he's suicidal) decides to have a baby to save his life. She's been to a fertility clinic - as has the lover she takes - so both know how artificial insemination works; but, instead of using the method thousands of people use every year around the world (the $5 turkey baster), they engage in coitus. We also are to believe that although the immigrant is in love with his fiancée, he doesn't suggest the obvious alternative to intercourse.

Anyone that is looking for an episode of "Law and Order" or "CSI" would have to look elsewhere as the most basic elements of police or forensics work were totally ignored in this case.A murder took place, and all the police did was to grab a 15-year-old boy off the street and take him to the only witness - a 65-year-old man - and say is this the guy who did it? Sure, the old man thought that the kid in the back of the police car had to be guilty. never mind that he looked nothing like the real killer and was dressed completely differently.

Imagine if you will : four teen students have an assignment to spend the night in a haunted house in the middle of the woods. But one of them is gay. What would happen? Would the other three of them decide to stay the night as well? Would they have to hide in a closet as the rest of the group is in the house? Would they become heroes or villains? How long would this last for them? Would they ever have another night to spend in a house or would they have to find another haunted house to hide from?

I really couldn't get into this movie. The plot is some old woman has been torturing someone so long that he is deformed. She dies and he is left in the basement to starve. Months must pass and a family moves in. The daughter is blind because of an accident caused by the father. Well anyway this guy in the basement, who for all rights should be long dead is still around. He eats a cat and now is superhuman. He now wants to eat people and have sex. And when a hooker dies father gets the blame.

"Scientists at a remote lab experiment on (insert scaly creature here) and create out of control monsters. In the meantime a crack military team/the scientist's daughter/bank robbers find their way to the remote place and are menaced by the giant critters. One by one they're eaten, all during an "exciting" race to not be blown up by the forces who initially created the monsters..." The sad thing is that this sounds like about a dozen movies which have appeared on the Sci-Fi Channel. I have to wonder just what is going on? Sure...

Sometimes you ignore that little voice in your head that says `` stay away from this movie '' . We have done our best to keep this one away from you and we hope you enjoy it as much as we enjoyed working on it. Enjoy the video. We have worked hard to bring you this one, but its only available for a few weeks. If you want it, you have to be willing to wait. It's going to cost you some extra money, but you will be able to buy it on DVD or Blu-Ray.

I first remember bumping into this zaniness from the Zucker brothers and Jim Abrahams , back in the early days of Nirvana . As they began to build the band into something more substantial and serious, this weirdness took the place of what they were already doing with the band . There was nothing to suggest that the band was really a bunch of goofball musicians goofing around with guitars , or that it had any other real purpose beyond just making music and having a good time . But now, it had become apparent that these guys were on their way to becoming a very important band .

"What Alice Found" is the greatest movie that nobody's ever heard of! I underestimated it when I heard of it, and I though that it would all sex, no plot, and just really stupid, but in reality, it was really good. They say all indie movies suck, but this one, and "Napoleon Dynamite" didn't suck. I asked my friend, who'd seen it before I did, and she said that Alice has all these three-ways, and you see all this nudity, but no, there is no three-way that I remember, and little nudity.

There is only one reason this movie is watchable. Till Schweiger. He is such a good actor the movie isn't completely terrible. Uwe Boll please take up another career. The special effects and action are acceptable. All other aspects were very disappointing. All I can say is that Kevin Smith (An evening with...) talked about Tim Burton not ever reading the Batman comics and it showed. Uwe Boll must not have ever played the video games that he keeps making movies about. If you two ever want to know how it is done go see Andrzej Bartkowiak.

To put it simply, this was a pompous piece of canine poopie. Overly stagey and everyone being the total melodramatic drama queen at every single moment. After a while, i was starting to wish that every character in the movie wasn't such a stuffed-up anal retentive.And, this movie has another one of those truly annoying things that has recently come into vogue and shouldn't have: all the scenes are in a sort of washed-out, blue-steel-greyishness. Hmmm, the last time i checked, candles and torches are quite capable of putting a fairly wide spectrum of colors.

One of the worst films I have ever seen! After watching it i walk out like, what happened? I am confused to this day, can someone explain that movie to me please? both the acting and picture quality are so bad ,you'll think you're watching someone's school project made with a home camcorder. First,I can not believe that how some people could give 10 star to this movie.Because,.it's unbelievably bad movie! This movie isn't scary at all! There is even no Typical horror clichés,too. The plot and acting of This movie was terrible.

Taken the idea out of a true diplomatic incident `` The Wind and the Lion '' is a very good movie that should have been a lot more widely seen, even by people who've read it. I saw it once and I have no idea why, but it sucked me in and I don't regret it at all. The movie takes place in a fictional African kingdom. The movie's central character is The Prince, whose real-life name is Prince Faisal. His father was the King of the country and he lived a normal life with his mother, a queen.

Art imitates life imitates art . Atticus Finch is reincarnated into the D.A . in this tragic and suspenseful gripping adaptation from acclaimed author of the bestselling novel. In an instant, everything changes: the D.A. is forced to defend a murder suspect. He doesn't have much choice. The suspect claims he killed the prosecutor's husband and that he doesn't remember shooting his wife and children. But he does remember being shot by a police officer. And he did it to prove he was innocent. As he defends himself he is forced to confront the fact that he himself has killed the prosecutor's children.

Filmmaker Bryan Forbes, who once displayed a light, sardonic touch with beguiling material such as "Whistle Down the Wind" and the original "Stepford Wives", completely bottoms out here. Not only is his direction inept, he also sloppily adapted Sidney Sheldon's early novel; the results are atrocious. Roger Moore plays a psychiatrist framed for the murder of one of his patients; Rod Steiger, chewing the scenery, is a hot-under-the-collar cop (it's easily his most embarrassing performance). The only actor here to exhibit some life is Elliott Gould, who knows a thing or two about enlivening a bum script.

I ca n't quite explain why I find this so alluring and `` The Leopard '' not ; it may have to do with the fact that I'm in my 20s and have a very limited knowledge of literature (or at least what I've read), yet I have never had this feeling about any book ever. If I had, though, then I might be able to explain myself better. In any case, if you've got any theories you think might be the reason why I feel drawn to a book, please tell them.

I'm a big horror film buff, particularly of the 1980's subgenres. Name one  I've probably seen it. Last year, a new little horror movie that seemed to slip under mainstream radar called "Saw" was about to hit theaters. I was moderately excited. Having not heard anything about it, I thought it looked quite promising judging by the previews and posters (well, except the back and white ones with the severed hands and feet...those just looked terrible!) I saw the film on opening night. It was one of the worst experiences of my life.

It 's hard to believe that a movie this bad could actually be released . The dialog was unnatural . I mean it could not even be a movie from this period . It 's the first movie that I've seen like it . I don't know what's the problem with it . It has nothing to do with the actors , the script , the direction or the cinematography . The plot is very lame , the acting is terrible and the cinematography is so bad that it's almost impossible to believe that this movie actually made it to the movie theaters .

Real-life husband and wife Paul Bettany and Jennifer Connelly star in Creation , which recounts the period of Charles Darwin's early life, and is written by James McBride. The film follows Darwin as he studies at home and as he writes and publishes a series of letters. The film was filmed in New Zealand, where it is based. The filmmakers shot the movie over several months in 2006. According to McBride, “We shot the film back to back with some other documentaries, so we did get a lot more footage than we normally get for movies. So it was really good.

First of all , let me just say that after watching this movie I felt like I 'd been sold an Iphone for my birthday and I got the iPhone 4S . I also have no regrets about the money I spent on it . This is the best phone I've ever used and I have no intention of getting anything else . The only thing I will say about the phone is that it is the most amazing phone I've ever seen . This phone is the best phone you can get , you don't have to wait for anything and you have to wait for them to make a phone like it .

Certainly this film is not for everybody---but for anyone with a sense of humor and love of period film Ð buy this immediately! Where else can you get a run down of 70Õs fashion, a period vocabulary primer, karate trained hookers, crime, a rap about the TitanicÕs sinking, shoot outs, and a co-star named Queen Bee (watch for her moving crying scene early on in the wardens office!) With a filming style thatÕs a cross between a porno movie/Dawn of The Dead/ and Car Wash, you cannot go wrong.

I enjoy science-fiction just as much as the next man but what the hell was that ? Apparently shot over a century ago. This was the work of the Russian author Anton Chekhov. The scene he refers to is a very common one that is seen on the screen all the time. It is one of those that you think it’s fiction when you see it on the screen. This is the moment when Sherlock Holmes says “I wish to God you had been here to see this”. It is also a moment that you think to yourself “I wonder if this is real?”.

I watched this expecting to see the usual British stiff upper lip stereotypes and was surprised to find the dialogue remarkably natural and tinged with black humour. It was more like Eastenders Goes to Sea than In Which We Serve. The scenes during the approach and attack are remarkably realistic in their depiction of a fighting ship and the stuff ups and banter among the ship's company (well at least based on my service in the 1970s). Some of the throwaway lines are very witty ("I'm not joining the Band of Hope just to please some greasy fish fryer!).

I missed the full four hour version when it was originally released in theaters because it played one week . . . before my daughter turned one. So when I saw this new trailer for the film and I was reminded to check it out I did and it really was one of the most enjoyable films I’ve seen this year. This movie is about a little girl named Mina who is living in a slum in India who finds a little bird who has lost all its feathers. She takes it in and grows it back. But the little bird is stolen from her.

This movie really is that bad, and I'm normally a sucker for bad movies, but this was too much. Seeing this is like OD'ing on pure SUCK. Now, you may think you've seen the bottom of the barrel. You may have waded through every title from Full Moon and Troma, all the movies of Edward D. Wood Jr, Uwe Boll, Albert Pyun and direct to DVD-flicks from faded men-of-action. You may even have seen Death Tunnel, Ghost Lake and a vast array of the movies that MST3K covered, but in their original form.

This is a beautiful , yet simple movie about one man , driven to find an answer , an answer he can't find himself. He finds a little girl and takes her to live with him in the mountains . . I was amazed at the beauty of this film. The setting is beautiful, and the storyline is simple , but it's not so simple that it leaves you wondering about the characters , but so beautiful that you can't take your eyes off of it . Beautiful. You know what I really love about movies ?

I grew up in Winnipeg and saw the treatment of the natives almost everyday . There are good and bad sides to any culture, and this has always been the case with Native Canadians. At some level it is always difficult to judge any culture. This may also be the reason why so much attention is given to the aboriginal experience in this country – because it is hard to say what one should like. Native Americans

The history of North American natives is interesting. It’s really hard to say what it all means.

This is a very modest , very lovely movie with a great score by Hoagy Carmichael and Frank Loesser with some great musical numbers. The film has nothing to do with Hollywood at all--it is about two very young people in a small California town discovering the meaning of life. They go through a series of experiences in the hopes of finding out what they are going to do with their lives. Like in any real life, it takes time. And the film is very touching as well. I had a good feeling about this film when I read the book in high school and saw the film in college.

This failed exercise in satire or commentary on the human condition easily earned a place as one of the 10 most egregious pieces of writing to ever come out of the USA. And it did so on the same day, May 19, 2001 that, according to the National Association of Broadcasters, "one of the worst days in radio history." At the time of the paper's release on the newsstand, NPR had to issue a statement to say it was, in fact, not a satire. But that statement, like everything else, didn't really mean much to us.

As horror films go , `` Rest Stop '' , could have been better in many levels . Director/writer John Carpenter, who won the Oscar for best director for `` The Thing , ' ' ''s sequel, has made five more films as director, all of which can be summed up as one of the worst . But they all had something good and something good alone. ``The Thing ''s sequel, ``The Thing From Another World,'' wasn't good. And ``The Thing,'' with its poor direction, was very, very not good.

The untold origin of the Lone Ranger . It shows who he was and how and why he became the iconic character he is. As the story begins, his father is the owner of a cattle ranch near Fort Worth, Texas. In addition to his cattle business, Dad is a successful businessman, having become the wealthiest man in the small town. But he’s a man with a big family, and he spends most of his free time working with his wife and five children. He also spends quite a few nights in jail.

Well every scene so perfectly presented . Never before had I seen such a movie that has meaning in almost every second. I can see that I’m supposed to love every second of this movie. It’s a perfect blend of all that’s in me and I am going to start watching it everyday. Thanks for this great movie . I really do hope this movie gets more recognition as the movie you made. It’s such a beautiful movie with a beautiful story. I just love it so much and I want to watch it all the time.

Its a very sensitive portrayal of life with unquenched or constrained desires . What does one do with desire in this day and age? What do you do with this desire? How does society view it? Can it ever be truly quenched in our world of instant gratification, short-sighted consumerism, and materialistic values? How about a desire for love, spirituality, and the pursuit of God in our world? For some, the pursuit of God can be a long process, and I understand that well. How does one discover God in our modern day life? What do you do?

I cant put it any simpler than that, this is a terrible film. I've worked in the industry and made several (short) films myself, so okay my standard is pretty high but seriously, i absolutely hate this film. I haven't made a comment on IMDb before but i hated this film so much i literally had to come and warn others. It is a piece of sh*t. The writer/director is an idiot who just has no idea how to make/write a good film and has the writing skills of an adolescent teenager.

Comparisons to the original series are inevitable. It's a shame Diana Rigg left the original show in the 1960's due to mistreatment on the part of the producers, and MacNee probably regretted this as much as any fan - there's no telling how long the show might have lasted otherwise. Linda Thorson was OK as a replacement and her episodes still retained almost all of the quality and aspects of the Rigg episodes - only the Rigg/Macnee chemistry was lacking. The New Avengers should have been left on the shelf - a declining Macnee, an annoying Purdey, and a who the hell is this guy Gambit.

WAIT until you 've watched most of all other films ever released , wait a year , then watch this. I don't think there's anyone alive who can take you all the way from the start of all the other films ever released, to the end, in under two hours. (And, yes, that includes the end credits)
It is the first film ever to use an entire film, from start to finish, as a film within a film within a film. Friday, February 21, 2006

I have just begun to look into the subject of this blog.

This movie totally sucked ! ! ! Do n't even rent it ! You 'll hate it ! The plot is absolutely horrible !! The actors are even worse !! They just didn't seem to care ! ! You have no idea , what a terrible movie ! ! The plot is completely unbelievable !!!!!!!!!!!! You can't help wondering , if the story is really true !! The story is ridiculous !!!!!!!! I don't believe it ! ! This is one of my worst ever movies !

The Evil Below starts on 'The Straits of San Sebastian 1683' as the 17th century treasure ship the El Diablo sinks in a violent thunderstorm. Jump to 'The Straits of San Sebastian Present Day' where two divers are exploring the beautiful underwater coral reefs that are rich in wildlife, the come across the sunken wreck of the El Diablo & explore it but are attacked & killed by something that looks like a vicious eel. Captain Max Cash (Wayne Crawford) owns & runs a boat-for-hire named the 'Vagrant Viking' which caters for tourists who want to fish, dive & generally explore the islands.

This film was great ! Tangi Miller and Flex did a great job . They both look good together and they both have great skills . The only thing that is missing is more kissing but that could have been done better . The other actors are good aswell and it is a great film so I give 5 stars ! This is my favorite of the 3 films. The action and fights are great. Flex is still the best fighter by far, and she has a great smile that can melt your heart. This film is perfect in all aspects and i am glad to have this film in my collection.

I ca n't get over the quality of the score , the book , and the performances . This is one of the greatest achievements in film I have seen so far , I can't imagine what else you have left in you to do it all in one film . This is a very nice movie with some strong acting by the supporting cast . It is a shame the story doesn't go to any of the good ending , but at least you got some really nice moments . This movie is really a great piece of work .

Just about everything in this movie is wrong, wrong, wrong. Take Mike Myers, for example. He's reached the point where you realize that his shtick hasn't changed since his SNL days, over ten years ago. He's doing the same cutesy stream-of-consciousness jokes and the same voices. His Cat is painfully unfunny. He tries way to hard. He's some weird Type A comedian, not the cool cat he's supposed to be. The rest of the movie is just as bad. The sets are unbelievably ugly --- and clearly a waste of millions of dollars.

Hope the summary line wo n't irritate you that much ( it 's a little homage to the Chappelle Show/Charlie Brooker thing )! It's interesting how you have such a strong opinion about what should be or what is and what isn't. You have to admit that there are some pretty funny bits in this one ( I think the bits that are most memorable ) and it would be a shame if you stopped watching it. If I may be blunt: There's only so much you can do with people who are just doing what they do, and I like it when people do what they like.

**Spoiler* It gives away the very irrelevant ending**At the beginning of this movie, there was a brief intro to the world of gore by the master of gore movies, H.G. Lewis. He talked about how this movie was lost, and then found years after the director's death. He also talked about how gore movies were measured by the amount of stage blood used in it. Blood Feast was a 2 galloner, 10,000 Maniacs was a 5 galloner. But, then he goes and claims that Dr. Gore was a 15 galloner.

I mostly rented this movie to see Shannon Elizabeth . She played well in this movie , but the plot was boring to me . You would have to be very bored to watch this film. The movie was a total letdown. I don't really see what the fuss is about. I don't even want to watch this type of film. I wish they had done it with better actors. The acting is very poor and it seems the story is very lame. There's just no way you can relate to any of these characters.

This movie begins with a man who appears to be some sort of sports driver. He meets up with a gang which contains an arrogant boss, an obvious idiot, a fat boy who never speaks, and a woman who rotates between the three of them. The group which is called Satan's Angels, wants Rod, the driver, as their personal driver. He says no but then says yes after the authorities make him a spy to check on them. They rob a weapon shop in a ridiculously plot-missing scene.

So im not a big fan of Boll's work but then again not many are. I enjoyed his movie Postal (maybe im the only one). Boll apparently bought the rights to use Far Cry long ago even before the game itself was even finsished. People who have enjoyed killing mercs and infiltrating secret research labs located on a tropical island should be warned, that this is not Far Cry... This is something Mr Boll have schemed together along with his legion of schmucks.. Feeling loneley on the set Mr Boll invites three of his countrymen to play with.

I was lucky enough to have seen this film at it's Seattle Film Fest screening, and was blown away by how great it was. This is without a doubt one of the best music documentaries I've ever seen, (and I've seen a lot!) This is a loving look back at the life and times, music and relationships of one of music's true legends. Harry Nilsson deserves to be up there with the likes of Gershwin, Cole Porter, and all the other great song writers of 20th century standards.

First of all , since I 'm one of the people who never saw the MST3K chopped up version of Sesame Street, I have to admit that I don't even know how that show started. I don't even know what the title is, if it is a show at all. If I do know anything about the show, it's that MST3K did a cut of the show, so it's a new show. If I remember correctly, one or two characters from the show were made into characters in this version of the show.

The Kid - At 39 years old Russel Duritz has a life that most men would envy - he has a great job, is respected (and feared), has a beautiful house and makes buckets of money. But everything comes at a cost, in this case no social life, no conscience and a fear of spending the rest of his life alone.
