`` Chupacabra Terror '' is saved from a ' 1 '' by the presence of Canadian cutie Chelan Simmons as she is about to be devoured. Simmons takes the role of a cheerleader who runs into the arms of a ' 1 '' who appears to have been attacked by her boyfriend. While she is holding her attacker, she has her eyes closed, giving Simmons the idea to start the cheer. She does a great job acting as if she has been attacked. Simmons had her first child during the shoot of '' 2 '' and was pregnant with her second during the production of '' 3 .

Barbara Stanwyck is a sheer delight in this wartime comedy, about a sailor invited to spend Christmas with a popular magazine writer's family, at her farm in Connecticut. The problem is she has no husband, baby, or farm, as she writes about in her column, and she can't even cook; her wonderful recipes being provided for her by her good friend " Uncle" Felix, owner of a Hungarian restaurant in New York City.Things get even more complicated when her strict publisher boss invites himself along for Christmas.

I ca n't believe I even tried to watch this filth . As an avid B-Horror movie fan , I have a lot of favorites. The first time I saw it ,I was pretty sure I had to have it , but it never happened , so I had to go to the DVD and rent it . I watched it a couple of different times , and it never seemed to get any better , I still don't understand why it didn't just get remade in 3D , but I'll let you find out for yourself ! This is definitely a "classic" horror film .

As kids movie it is great . For the family it just sucks . I was truly hoping for something like this and it did not happen . It is a shame because they do not need the money they just had to have it . I was very much hoping for a film that is a little different . That is a shame for the family and people who like to spend money for a movie like this . What a ripoff! You should watch it with your children. They will see the potential in this story and you will find out they are better than you at it!

Badly shot , badly edited , clumsy dialogue , flat characters , unsuccessful adaption of a novel . It does not hold up on its own , and it would not have held up on its own were it not for its high concept premise. In the hands of someone who understood it, it is a brilliant satire . Unfortunately, this is the type of thing that happens in Hollywood and is too common nowadays to shock the masses . It takes a brave writer to do something like this. And it takes an even worse director to go with it.

I do n't know how this film went unnoticed for so long.I saw this film on TV , i was young and i saw it when it came out.It was a very dark film,but with some interesting ideas.I can't recommend it highly enough! I did not like it, and I'm ashamed to say that this was the first film I watched.I watched it on TV and was so impressed I had to rent it and then saw it in the theater and was so shocked I couldn't sit through it. I left early.

Well,this movie is really "PLUMPED" HAHA Get it? Thats kinda like the attitude of this movie. The plot is just a copy of Pulp Fiction,okay thats acceptable,but to make this piece if "PLUMP" (haha)! is really unbelievable.The storyline is so pathetic,and the whole thing only gathered a few laughs. It did try making a few jokes from various other movies,and it failed most of the times. I mean,i do have a sense of humor,but this isnt really the way to go to get a laugh.

2001: A Space Odyssey Is it a sermon? An account of the history of mankind? An exploration of man's futile attempts to advance technology only to have technology destroy him? Is it about the fragile balance of time and space? A lesson in evolution? Or is it just a spectacular effects show; a film Kubrick made only to show us the limitless possibilities of the motion picture and present to us the truth that images are exceedingly more powerful than words? 2001: A Space Odyssey is all of these things.

This was absolutely one of the best movies I 've seen . Excellent performances from a marvelous A-List cast that will bring tears of joy to most of them . This movie will make many happy people . This movie has the potential to change your view on life . There is nothing else you could ask for that would make your life better . The movie also have its share of issues . "One day I saw him. He was there all the time; and he would never leave me . . . The only light in a world that was all dark; a light I could not see.

I watched 40 minutes and could n't bear it any longer  the television went off and I returned to the living room, where I found the family in deep discussion. It is the best television show of the season so far  or maybe ever. I love the characters  the kids, the mom and dad, the little brother and sister. And there has been much good writing  it is not just dialogue. The characters have been written in the most natural way  I didn't feel that was forced writing. I don't even mind the sex, it's natural and real.

As I sat in the theater almost crying to myself in dismay over the atrocity Ron Howard and Tom Hanks call the Da Vinci Code, I could not see the light at the end of the tunnel that is Angels and Demons.Hanks and Company are back for the Sequel-Prequel Angels and Demons, and they have learned their lesson.Acting wise everyone is much better. Aylet Zurer is very good as Vittoria Vetra, and better than the girl who played Sophie Neveau. Tom Hanks is very good as always, he is better in this though, because he works harder at giving the movie the feeling that it is a thriller.

...now please move on because that's getting on my nerves.Seriously, the man behind brilliant pieces like "My Own Private Idaho" and "To Die For" (and others not so brilliant movies, i.e. the unnecessary "Psycho" remake) started an experimental phase with "Gerry", which reached its peak with the thought-provoking "Elephant". "Last Days" had some interesting aspects but was very uneven, while "Paranoid Park", his new film, also has good-looking 15 year-olds walking around... and not much else.

Oh dear ! What can I say about Half Past Dead ? I was really disappointed in it . I thought the plot was really weak and unoriginal . I was a little confused on what exactly was going on . The ending was good but was anticlimactic . I don't think the acting was great . I don't think the songs were great . It just wasn't a very good movie for me. I just don't know what to say . It just didn't work for me . I thought it had some potential and could have become a great movie .

A MUST SEE documentary. -- -- -This movie had so many things to consider while watching it . It was very interesting. -- -- -It shows how different cultures have treated women in different ways. They all have good points and also many of them had flaws. The women in the movie are given equal roles to play, and they all have different styles. It was an interesting watch. -- -- -If you watch the movie you will realize how important it is. -- -- -- -This movie is an eye-opener for people who are not familiar with history, women and culture of women.

`` Ahh ... I did n't order no amazing hit show '' ..... '' We 'll you got one '' I did!'' '' No I did!'' How about that!'' You've got one!'' But I didn't do it, did I?'' But it's not what you think, I swear!'' What I want to know is did I?'' Well, of course I did!'' Yes I did!'' Why else would you tell me?'' No, no!'' No no, I did not order a hit show!''

Although its plot is taken from the history of ancient Rome , 'Caligula ' is not made in the style of a classic Roman play , and there is not the slightest suggestion in the dialogue or the actions that he (or they) have read anything of Plautus , nor indeed that he has heard of Seneca 's Discourses or of Plautus himself. Nor has he seen anything of the plays of Shakespeare. But he is a man who has learnt to think and act and speak in accordance with the traditions of the past.

I wanted to like this one - the situation was rich , and the setting unusual and interesting . But the central character was a very weak one. We were told that his past was tragic and his present had not changed much. He is a simpleton who has no idea what he wants. In fact, when his past comes back into focus , it has not changed much, and is more of an excuse for not being able to do anything constructive with his life. This is what the author is trying to create with him , and we are supposed to buy into it .

To tell you the truth , I do not speak Tamil , and I did not understand the film . So I would like to hear it in Malayalam , with Malayalam subtitles :)

The movie is really interesting. It has good content and the actors are well cast. I loved how they have made this film in a short span. It looks good and was made in a very good manner . I love these kind of movies , it is a very rare type to see them . I think we should see it all over the place .

One of Bolls better attempts . Just shows that if you do something long enough you have to improve just as much as you did from the beginning , it just takes more time , and more effort to get there , and more money , or whatever , so if it takes longer it just shows that the problem is more complicated , and needs more time to get fixed . I don't think any one of those are the root of the problem. The root of the problem is the people that bought the idea that you can buy your way out of debt.

Gracie ( Minnie Driver ) , a woman in her late twenties , is on a waiting list for a kidney transplant. When her wait gets longer than she could bear she is forced to make tough decisions. Will she give up her life in New York to be with a man who may never love her and who has lost his wife ? Will she decide to live in the small apartment she has been given in an inner city Chicago neighborhood where the streets are not always safe and where she is not sure whether or not she really wants to become a nurse?

It's one of the imponderables of low-budget independent film-making that so many with so little in the way of real talent fancy themselves frightmeisters. The paucity of talent evinced by these wonky wannabees is there for all the world to see. Case in point: FLIGHT OF THE LIVING DEAD (or, as I quickly came to know it, SHITE OF THE LIVING DEAD). There's nothing wrong with paying homage to one's heroes. I've done it many times over the years, myself, in many different ways.

Of all the directors ever to sit behind a camera Wellman could break your heart quicker than anyone . Even if he hadn ' t directed the most famous and beloved movie in history there would always be the question, "What would he do next?" It was no surprise to anyone who knew him. But what a way to go. Wellman died just two weeks before the first of his two-hour documentary "A Prairie Home Companion" is released. In his short life Wellman was loved by many for many different reasons, but most of all because he loved.

There is a running thread in film comedy that all the great comics are just falling short of the law or on going to jail. Think of that conman's conman W.C.Fields in THE OLD FASHIONED WAY, or the Marx Brothers in A NIGHT AT THE OPERA, or Chaplin in THE ADVENTURER, of Mae West in SHE DONE HIM WRONG. The skirting of the law is inevitable, and when they end up on the side of the law the results are actually still hostile between the forces of law and order and the comic.

Pointless and pretty silly film that is just basically a compilation of clips from horror, science fiction and suspense films. There are unnecessary shots to an audience watching the clips and Donald Pleasance and Nancy Allen are among audience members who turn to the camera and explain why we love horror films. Not a bad idea but all the explanations are obvious ("movie horror helps us deal with real horror", "you are at the mercy of the filmmaker in a theatre") and pretty trite. Also the clips are shown very quickly and the changes are kind of jarring.

"Lackawanna Blues'is so emotionally powerful in its portrayal of urban Blacks during the 50s and early 60s. A culture of joy and sadness specific to working class Blacks that existed outside the mainstream culture. The characters of Santiago-Hudson's play depicted Black individuals who lived imperfect lives but maintained strong positive values of love,loyalty and honor. Although the characters moved away from those values at times, they did not deny the importance of the values. Instead they recognized and accepted their own imperfection and those of the other characters, without judgment, that passed through the life of "nanny".

I see that C. Thomas Howell has appeared in many movies since his heyday in the 80s as an accomplished young actor.I bought this DVD because it was cheap and in part for the internet-related plot and to see how much older C. Thomas Howell is; I do not recall seeing him in any movies since the 1980s.In just a few words: what a very big disappointment. I give some low budget movies a chance, but this one started out lame. Within the first 15 minutes of the movie, this elusive woman is chatting with an Asian guy in a chatroom.

Koyaanisquatsi is simply the best film I've ever seen. It's a masterpiece where everything is at the right place. Some scenes are not "nice" or "beautiful", but the camera never peeks or intrudes. This is exactly what's happening here. The camera is used to intrude, to disgrace and to ridicule. There is no magic flow here, no sense of greatness or respect. Instead some scenes are cobbled together without greater purpose or plan. The music is disturbing. Just as I rated Koyaanisquatsi the best film ever made, this one is the worst.

Hilarious and low-budget comedy at it 's best . This set of unique individual sketches with extensive self-referential humor is a treat for fans of great '80s and '70s comedy. In addition to the original sketches, you'll get an extra-special bonus set of jokes that will make your head explode. You'll laugh so hard you'll think you've wet yourself. You're welcome. You can laugh it up. -

The original set of jokes here will blow your mind

-

There are more than 30 minutes of funny comedy here. There is more than one way to skin a cat!

No matter what other people have said you can't review this movie without comparing it to the original, if it existed on it's own it would be a 2-3 out of 5 film but it is a remake of a 4-5 out of 5 film and so has standards to live up to and we need to see if it reached those standards. If the film was a re-working or, as in Planet of the Apes, a re-imagining of the original you would be able to look at the film in it's own right, only referencing the original.

I saw this in a preview screening and have to say that this documentary style movie is the biggest load on my mind. It seems like it will be a very long movie. The acting is pretty good, but the story line seems way off. You can see how the story is not true. I would give it 4 stars. I am giving this 4 stars. There is one thing that is important. This was the only movie at the theater with a popcorn box. This is one of the most interesting films that we have seen in a long time.

Negative numbers are not available to convey how bad this movie is ! Wooden acting coupled with a story line that’s boring and unfocussed just doesn’t cut the mustard for a horror film. And then there’s the score. There’s only one way to say it. It is boring. If you’re reading this, I’m pretty sure you know exactly where I’m coming from. And so what’s a horror fan without a soundtrack? Well, we got it. You see, the soundtrack of The Descent was released as the B-Side of the album.

I was looking forward to watching this film and was therefore extremely disappointed when I found it to be complete and utter rubbish. Akerman's direction is both heavy handed and cliched (how much more cliched can you get than Paris at night?). The male cast seems to have been chosen entirely for their resemberlance to Egon Schiele's angst ridden self portraits. Yet the themes of jealousy and betrayal which should have been the primary focus of a film of this type are left virtually unexplored. What is left is a turgid melodrama which takes an age to get started and even longer to finish.

After seeing this film I felt sick to my stomach and if I had seen one more minute I would have had to rush to the bathroom and vomit til dawn. A sick film that was NOT funny and was NOT worth the money, any money at all. If anybody ever wants to see this movie don't! Your kids will never forgive you and will claim sickness for a week. So if you value your child's education and want to stimulate your child's mind please don't see this movie. I beg of you, DON'T!

This film stinks more than limburger cheese! If you find this at a garage sale, LEAVE IT THERE! I love Sandra Bullock and yet HATE THIS MOVIE... Although ashamed, I do own a copy, and the studio has changed the cover to play on the fact that Sandra Bullock is in this at all. They play it up to be "A Sandra Bullock Movie". She only has a small part in the whole movie and she does her best with that, but she is young and had not learned her talent yet. Well everyone has to start somewhere...

Killer Flood: The Day the Damn Broke: 1/10: Finally a movie whose title is spoiler proof. Even by the low standards of disaster movies, excuse me allow me to correct myself, even by the low standards of made for TV disaster movies this is truly awful. Where do I begin? The dam modeler may have once seen a photo of a dam but I doubt it. Most dams, especially large ones that generate electricity have oh I don't know a power plant nearby, some sluice gates for water to run through, heck even a high tension electrical wire or two.

A brash, self-centered Army cadet arrives at WEST POINT with a dangerous wise guy attitude towards the Corps.In a role obviously tailor-made for him, William Haines shines in this highly enjoyable tale of honor & friendship. A grade-A scene stealer, Haines during the first half of the film is up to his usual Silly Billy behavior, which under normal circumstances should have gotten him confined to the guardhouse. The last half, however, becomes very serious, leading up to Haines' moral redemption and giving him a fine opportunity to exhibit his acting talents.

With its rerelease by ADV Films, I've had a chance to watch "The Giant Majin" for the first time without the deep cuts and unkind words of a late night Horror Chiller Theaters. Guess what? It's a pretty damn good movie!The sets are authentic, the acting in subdued and believable, and the giant Majin is stately, powerful, and unstopable. I loved the subtle fantasy touches (the enchanted wood, luck charm, etc), and the potrayal of the god as a little less than 'good'.This movie is begging for a remake in the new century!

Lame. Lame. Lame. Ultralame. Shall I go on? There is one, I repeat *one* funny scene in this entire, drawn-out, anti-amusing Amateur Hour Special of a film: Fares Fares' fat father knocking someone over with his beer gut. That's it. The rest of this shockingly mediocre pile of nothingness consists of the usual trademark bored-looking Swedish "actors" delivering dialogue which goes into one ear and out of the other, a banal story, sloppy direction and, well, little else worth mentioning.

One should have the right to expect from people who make a film about the Second Coming and the Third Testament, that they had read the other two, or at least knew a little more about them than miracles and Judgement Day. This film contains absolutely nothing of relevance for viewers who are interested in Jesus, religion or philosophy -- there is only the standard British social realism with guttural dialects and plump characters in pubs.Actually, good candidates for a real Third Testament have been published several times - like "A Course in Miracles" or "Conversations with God".

This movie reminds me of 'Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind ' and 'Garden State ' not because of content but because of the chemistry between these actors and the way they portrayed these characters. And the fact it was a success is thanks to great actors, the great story, and a great director that knows how to get actors to connect. This film has its pros and cons, but overall a very successful and fun movie. I enjoyed it very much and I'm very curious to see the next one, and also I would recommend it to my friends.

This movie twists the facts of Anne and Mary's lives into something unrecognizable. To make Mary Boleyn, who in fact was a rather dim and foolish creature, and make her the "good" sister is just silly. It is Anne who was in fact the far more interesting character, and that is why it is her life, and not Mary's, that has been told so often.In response to an earlier review, I fail to see how Anne's life was so "criminal"... to me it's Henry who was the real criminal.

As a child I was never in a situation where I could be introduced to Dr Who and though I’m no expert, I think I know the basics. I think I can explain. I don’t think that there is any need for an introduction. They have already met. They have talked and shared memories. I think the main reason they met was to see if he would be interested in taking on the role of Doctor Who. I think that that is how they know to have met. They have talked. They have sat together.

Hilary was great as julie , and Pat was once again magnificent as Mr. Miyagi , but there should have been more of you in the play to keep things moving forward and keep things lively. This play is a good play, but there are far too many plot devices and far too many characters for just one play. Overall, I enjoyed this play, it was a good and interesting play that kept me engaged to its end. It had a good beginning, middle, and an end to make it a good play that kept my interest throughout.

I enjoyed Ramin Bahrani 's Man Push Cart , and this film is equally good . This slice of life comedy centers on a family where each member struggles to put the family business aside for a moment to enjoy a life of love and laughter . This film has its moments , and while most of the time it is amusing , there are a few stretches where the comedy falls flat because of poor scripting . For instance , one moment in the movie where Rami and Giorgia are arguing over who has to buy a new vacuum cleaner for their family business is one of those moments .

Fortunately , I have n't seen this film in a movie , big screen , just on a small screen or small tv , but still the movie is great to me . no matter what the size of the screen we have to put on the picture , to have the effect to make us think , and see the story . it is so great , a movie for everybody , and you will be amazed what you have to do . now i have seen many movies , but still this is the very best , my favorite movie in the whole history .

A woman finds herself caught up in an apparently inexplicable rash of suicides . Then again , are these really suicides? Or is there something much more sinister to these deaths that go unrevealed . The answers lie in a little town in Illinois that has seen a rise in suicides and mysterious deaths for over a month . And with the recent death of an influential local family, things are getting worse . When the bodies of two women are found and autopsied , authorities are shocked to discover that one had died of a self-inflicted death and another had committed suicide.

This is the best work i have ever seen on television . The story is compelling -- all the more so because it is so hard to take seriously. However, it's also not so hard to believe. I found myself thinking, "Of course this is real." And yet, as with many of us here at The Moth, the more I think about the whole thing the more incredulous I am. There are some things in this that are just plain not credible, but, at the same time, most of the details are not in dispute.

Have seen this movie today. Very disappointed and wondered how it could be in the Oscar shortlist. The most sad things are:1. It's very slow. 2. How Ghengis-khan, cruel and mighty emperor of Asia can be played by a kind, good actor with warm and lovely eyes - during all the movie except one scene? 3. Lot of holes in the plot: there's nothing about how he became the emperor; nothing about where he spend 20 years between his childhood and mature age. We see an ex-slave without money, power, friends or home.

As a nice anecdote to one of the above comments: In was in Mumbai about two weeks before the release of this movie, I was approached -being white- to dub some of the lines of this movie in a recording studio.While I speak German as well, i was kindly asked to do all dubbing scenes in English, otherwise it would be too confusing for the Indian audience... So therefore, all Germans in this movie actually speak English! funny enough i did multiple characters, so if you would want to actually spoil some time by watching the movie again, listen carefully; all non-Indian characters are only done by 4 voices!

It 's 2005 , my friends ... a time of amazing special effects and an age of technology . So it seems only natural that you'll be going to see an amazing time-lapse film of New York City . You're probably going to be amazed at how well this film does what it sets out to achieve. You'll notice how much it captures the atmosphere in the city . You've come to see what it was like in the mid-twentieth century . And by that , of course , I mean the era of the film, not the century .

I unwittingly walked into this `` trap '' of a movie.If I could turn back time or simply get a refund, I know I would do so. But I can only hope that no one else saw it. If it was so awful, why would they waste their time? The movie is not awful, but it is just bad. There are some fine performances. However, much of it is filled with what I like to call plot holes. First, we are introduced to the "hero" who saves the day at the expense of losing a leg.

Disclaimer: During my ventures into foreign cinema, I have taken a liking to a wide variety of movies that span different genres that include horror, action, drama, comedy, and romance, to name a few. Thus, I have enjoyed the thoughtful, serious tone of dramas as well as the mindless, popcorn fun of action films. With a wide array of Chinese, Japanese, and Korean movies under my belt, I am confident in my ability to recognize bright spots in movies to appreciate and complement. Unfortunately, Ashes of Time has nothing to recognize.

Whoever likened this one to RAIDERS OF THE LOST ARK certainly knew whereof he spoke . He might , as he himself has said, have been better than me . But that is all right . I know I have my weaknesses and that is the best way to overcome them . I have a good life as a writer. I know that my readers would not have been satisfied if the book was only half good , half bad . So I take the best of each part and then put it all together. That is what you should do too .

Get the CD instead . The show is tame , and the editing sucks . The crowd gets way too involved in the comedy . That is the reason I bought it . Not for the music or the sound . But because of the talent . That show would make you want to have a career in stand up . Just for the talent , and the comedy . Dude, how the hell are you gonna get the people who are trying to find this concert on their home computer from your home computer? You must have the whole thing recorded somewhere.

Well, I didn't know what to expect from 555. Matter of fact, I had never even heard of it until a few months ago. But, being a collector of just about all types of horror I figured I would go ahead and grab this obscure 80's slasher.Basically the storyline has to do with a killer that kills every 5 years for 5 nights in a row. What the third 5 in the title means... nobody knows. Anyway, the killings start as the killer searches for young teenagers fooling around in obscure places. He decapitates the men and brutally knifes the woman to death.

Watching this film today I got the feeling this thing was missing about 10 to 15 minutes or so from the beginning of the story. John Wayne rides up on this trading post/saloon out in the middle of nowhere to meet with the owner about some robberies. All he sees is the signs of a massacre, some dead bodies, signs of a fight and no one alive in sight. That's because the owner's daughter is hidden in a secret room, the kind you find in old English murder mysteries.The reason you find those hidden rooms in those kind of stories is that they were formerly priestholes.

I think "Rosemary's Baby" is the most overrated horror film out there. Not scary, interesting or much of anything. It's reasonably well-directed and Ruth Gordon was wonderful but that's about it. But this sequel makes it look like "Gone With the Wind"!I caught this on TV back when I was 14. Unfortunately, I still remember it. From what I remember Rosemary's baby Andrew is now grown up and the coven wants him to start taking over (the world that is).

Not as bad as "Billy Bathgate" but close. Try as he might, Warren Beatty just could not be believed as Bugsy. Whenever he flipped out, instead of being shocked by the violence, I found it pretty embarrassing because it was so phony. The other actors don't fare as well either. Annette Bening just doesn't have what it takes to play seductive women, she is better off with safe characters. As many have noted, Joe Mantegna would have fared better if the script had him as a more believable George Raft.

I rented this movie, because I noticed the cover in the video rental store. I saw Nolte, Connely, Madsen, 40's time setting, and thought "hmm, can't be too bad." Unfortunately, after watching it, my impression was "not too good".Its kind of a Chinatown ripoff, but the worst part is that other than Nolte, the other members of the squad didn't get enough screen time. But its a decent movie to see once I guess. And Melanie's role was small enough that she wasn't given a chance to be a nuisance.

I watched this movie tonight and I do need to say that it is horrible! I expected it to be great, because you know, usually we don't have many movies about Asian vampires mixed with Asian culture; but already in the beginning it started in a bad way: the introduction of the movie seemed not to have an end! The plot is so weak and if you take the fights and the soundtrack off, you really don't have anything useful at all! The director of this film doesn't look to have some important notions about how much time to spend in introduction and flashbacks for example.

I readily admit that I watch a lot of really bad movies. But there are very few that I can think of that are quite as bad as When Women Had Tails. It's a stinker of epic proportions. What should have been a sexy comedy about a group of cavemen discovering a woman for the first time is instead a dull, lifeless affair without a single laugh to be had. The comedy is extremely weak. I suppose if you think bashing someone in the head is funny, you might find a laugh or two. The guys in this movie make the Three Stooges look like high art.

Krajobraz po bitwie like many films of Wajda is, perhaps, not understandable for the "rest of the world". Story based on the few short stories of Tadeusz Borowski, who during WWII was the prisoner of Oswiecim, Dachau and Dautmergen camps. Borowski in his books describes inhuman life in the Nazi camps from the point of view vorarbeiter Tadek - porte parole of author who also was on the privileged position among the prisoners. Borowski was merciless for the humanity and merciless for himself. He describes the human history as the endless chain of exploitation and humiliation.

When a loser teen is bitten by an insect, he becomes the superhero Dragonfly...Superhero Movie is the latest spoof movie to hit the screens. Sadly however, despite the presence of David Zucker (who was involved with Airplane!, Top Secret and The Naked Gun movies) it still suffers from the fault most recent spoofs have...mainly it's more dumb than fun! The fault mainly lies with the gags. It's simply not funny enough. Some of the jokes do work, such as the nail gun scene, but other parts simply fall flat.

I've read the positive comments on this movie. I assume people who were in this movie must've come to this site to give it some good press because this was one of the worst movies I have ever seen. I always watch the whole film despite the quality or lack there of which explains why I watched this whole movie, but I don't think I laughed even once during the duration of this film. The jokes were mostly very bad, but when the jokes had some promise, the delivery was off.

Stephanie Meyer is going to be so ticked! Now, her book "Breaking Dawn" will not be first with that title. Sorry, Twilight fans.Kelly Overton (The Ring Two) is medical student, Eve, who is assigned to interview psychotic Don (James Haven - Angelina Jolie's brother). I suspected the twist, and when she found out they both grew up in the same town, I was sure of it.She kept getting deeper and deeper with her patient to the point that I felt there was a shared delusion going on. At times, she even acted like she had PTSD.

What I got was something better.Just like many movies I 've commented on as of recently , I 'd been in a situation like this before. There was a moment of clarity, or maybe just an epiphany, and I decided what I wanted out of life and my relationship with her. I 'm not going to go into detail here, but what I will share is what I found and how I changed my life to be in the best interest of our relationship. It's very important that I tell you because there are some people out there that would be upset with me if I didn't.

A very , very , very slow-moving , aimless movie about a distressed , drifting young man . Not sure how I feel about it being called “a movie about a troubled man “, but it does get to the point that I find myself doing a bit of internal “cheating” to avoid the feeling that the movie is boring me . I mean, if I’m trying hard not to notice anything , then why would I notice it ? I mean , if it’s boring me , then it must be something that I don’t want too much .

I heard that after the first Oceans movie, the sequels begin to go downhill. I believe that this is not the case(at least not for this film). This movie is even better than the first film! The original crew returns three years after they successfully robbed Terry Benedict's casinos. Now, Benedict is visiting each one of them personally telling them to get the money back within two weeks. To do that, they must do a couple heists in Europe to get the money.The acting is very good. The all-star cast exceeded expectations.

"Prime Suspect 4" continues the exploits of the inscrutable and dogged seeker of truth and justice, Detective Superintendent Jane Tennison; the first of three miniseries (PS4, PS5, & PS6) with the notable absence of founding writer Lynda La Plante from the credits. Imbued with the same gritty reality of the first three series, the second three series pit Tennison against the forces of evil while coping with middle age, loneliness, indiscretions, a host of personal and professional problems, and resolutions which are sometimes less than ideal.

This film makes several nods to various science fiction films . The prologue reminds me of the one for the film, Star Wars, that opened the film's first chapter, Return of the Jedi . Star Wars also features several references to this film, including in the prologue, when Han Solo makes reference to the "Space Opera" genre. . There is also a lot of other nods to the film in the film's script, such as at one point, there is a reference to an old book from one of the aliens that was a gift to Han during a meeting with him.

Visconti 's Death in Venice qualifies as one of the most beautiful films ever made . While watching , we feel a bit of the same sorrow we felt when he was murdered. This film is set in Venice, Italy in the 15th century and was shot at the same time and in the same place as Piero di Cosimo 's (1563-1625) masterpiece The Lute Player. The movie has an interesting plot. It is about the tragic love story of two men who live in different social class, but they are both noble and rich, and both want a wife.

_The Wild Life_ has an obvious resemblance to _Fast Times At Ridgemont High_, and _The Wild Life_ comes up short.------------ Some other stan wrote the above comment. Of course The Wild Life is no Ridgemont. Ridgemont is the quintessential 80s flica. However, the Wild Life is enjoyable if you're not whiny about mindless movies being mindless movies (especially when you know it's supposed to be a mindless movie in the first place). The little Latino from Scarface is in this movie and he's straight disrespectful ("I got Visa...Masterrrrr Charrrrge!!")

Half Past Dead was unlike any Steven Segal film I've ever seen. Very little of Segal, himself in action and I agree with the last review I read, Nia Peeples steals the show.I saw nothing really new here, just the same old stuff from other flicks changed around a little. The best action scenes were Nia's as she once again kicked butt. It was interesting seeing her as the bad guy after watching her for two seasons on Walker, Texas Ranger, still kicking butt, but for the good guys.

I walked into Heart Of Gold thinking I was going to watch a documentary about Neil Young . Instead , I found out how to play golf and how to drive a Lamborghini . Now I want to go on an adventure to discover a new world . It will be a great time , I promise you . This article was first published in the October 2014 issue of ‘The New Internationalist’, a leading magazine in the global movement to bring an end to all forms of tyranny, and all forms of poverty, and to establish in their place an end to oppression, exploitation and all forms of discrimination.

Certain aspects of Punishment Park are less than perfect , specifically some of the acting . However I feel that there's something more to the film than just that. There's also the story and characters which I found very compelling. So overall, I think I'll be recommending this movie to anyone who is interested in this genre. What I liked:It's hard to know what to like about this movie. So much of it is a mess. I don't really want to nitpick about anything. But I will, and I will not.

RKO was trying to boost its starlet JOAN FONTAINE when they cast her as a flying nurse who is strong-willed, independent and stubborn. This isn't the first casting change the studio has had in the wake of the success of "Jurassic World" and its sequel, though RKO's recent moves have been more subtle than what you see here. "Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom" -- RKO's most recent movie, set to open on Sept. 24 -- also had a bit of a shakeup in that its cast featured several actresses whose filmography contained little more than small-screen appearances.

During the making of this movie I once caught a statement on television about it . Something like : ``What we are trying to do with this film, is to show the world what a real hero is.`` I was really pleased with this, because I wanted to see if such a thing existed. After I had found such a hero, there came the problem of finding the film, and with it such a man . The film was the ``The Man of Bronze,'' and the hero was an Australian who had lived for many years in London.

I know it's hard for you Americans to find European films on video/DVD, particularly from the 80's but please seek out the original version of the Vanishing - title Spoorloos (1988) - and you'll see why the Hollywood version of The Vanishing screws up bigtime, particularly at the finale.I really like Sandra Bullock, Kiefer Sutherland and particularly Jeff Bridges, but this is just so so lame compared with the original. What where they thinking? Can you imagine Seven with a happy ending with Gwyneth Paltrow running happily into the arms of Brad Pitt in the finale?

(This review does not necessarily expose the plot of the movie, however it may change one's expectations of the movie and thus make for a less enjoyable experience.) Ever rented a scary movie, expecting to be on the edge of your seat in fear, and instead ended up howling in laughter at each and every stupid turn of the plot? This movie had so many opportunities to impress and actually scare the viewer. It was cut poorly and jumped around too much; making references to the past seem more like excuses as to why the plot was heading in its particular direction.

The Comebacks is a spoof on inspirational sports movies, and let me just tell you-it is not a good one. Tom Brady (the director) probably found it hilarious that referencing sports films (from Gridiron Gang, Invincible and even Miracle! to The Longest Yard and Dodgeball-yes Dodgeball!) and tossing in a couple of sex jokes, would be the funniest thing since Airplane! Well, he was wrong. They did such a slipshod job, you'd thought it was written in a week. I have found it that if a director loves the genre, the movie will be good.

I am a big follower of Indian Movies especially Malayalam and Tamil.Shame on India for not sending this movie as it should have been in our country.I had seen few Indian Movies but never saw the same quality like here in India. The music is great and the cast and crew was excellent.The movie is awesome and will stay with you for life. This Movie had the best acting by Vijay Sethupathi. He did a lot of things in this movie to impress the audience but that was his acting. His performance was not in Bollywood but that was ok with me.

This movie contains the worst acting performance of all time . Spilsbury lacks energy to say the least . Energy was his trademark . The movie starts out well . It is not until the end of the film that the viewer sees that the movie starts out badly . The movie starts with a pretty decent story . This is the only good thing about this flick . The story begins with some good intentions . However, Spilsbury does not stick with it long enough to see what he wants to say . This is an extremely bad movie . The story and acting is completely horrible .

I first remember bumping into this zaniness from the Zucker brothers and Jim Abrahams, back in the early days at Comedy Central. Back in those days (the 90's) their programming consisted of Benny Hill reruns and the original MST3k, complete with bearded host.Capt. Frank Drebin (played by the stone-faced, dead-pan filibuster, Leslie Nielson) is a process created first from the amalgamation of various stereotypical police television show protagonists (think Dragnet meets Starsky & Hutch the Show), boiled in a flask full of well-known police television show plots and scenarios.

Rowan Atkinson 's Mr. Bean ranks right up there with Laurel & Hardy , Buster Keaton , the Marx Brothers , and Buster Keaton . When I was at an early age, Mr. Bean was my idol . I thought he was my favorite character, but after watching him perform in Mr. Bean , I must admit , he's my favorite comedy character as well . So I'm very pleased to finally meet him . In Mr. Bean , Mr. Bean is an English gentleman who lives on the island of Hogsmeade . Every year on his birthday , he is visited by Santa Claus .

I was expecting a lot more of this film than what I actually got . The acting was just awful for the majority of it, the writing was pretty bad, the direction was really bad, I really hated the film and would not recommend this to anyone . I felt that the only reason I bought this movie was to try and save my hard earned cash and that is exactly how I felt throughout the entire duration of the movie . I would have to say if you have the ability and money to do so do not waste your hard earned cash buying a movie of this caliber .

I watched this film with a sort of dangerous fascination , like a hedgehog trapped in the headlights . There are only three things that made it worth watching , a couple of people in the audience and my brother-in-law who I can only assume watched it with the same intensity of interest as me. I know some people won’t agree with this assessment, but for me, a film that takes a serious stance on something is something worth recommending, no matter what the stance is, and that’s what I found myself enjoying about this film.

THE OTHER is a supposed "horror" movie made during the 1970s. It is not to be confused with the similarly titled THE OTHERS, which starred Nicole Kidman.The plot is as follows - a woman with strange supernatural powers teaches her twin grandsons something referred to simply as "the game". One of these twin boys - Niles - is supposed to be "good". The other one - Holland - is supposed to be evil.The idea sounds interesting enough as an abstract concept and the movie was adapted from a novel.

When I first saw this movie back in the middle of January ( 2005 ) I did n't like it, it was not for everyone. In fact it wasn't even for me at that time. I was too young to remember the 80s in the way that it did back then, but I knew what was great and what wasn't at that time. That's why I didn't like it then. The story, the dialogue and the acting were terrible back then, I guess. I hated it.

This film really used its locations well with some amazing shots , dark and disturbing the film moves very slowly but its so well done it does not give the viewer time to become bored . The ending was very good and shocking at the same time , its very sad but at the same time the film leaves you wanting more . It was a very hard watching of the film with the constant sound effect and sounds in the room . The acting was brilliant in all departments . It's just too bad that director David Fincher doesn't seem to have a good sense of what makes an effective horror film.

This film is the most impressing turkish film that I have ever seen . Probably `` Okul '' is the best comedy ever made in the history of Turkish Cinema. I must say this is an excellent film for those who love Turkish Cinema. I recommend it to all and sundry , even to the foreigners who appreciate the best Turkish films. This movie is a must have for everyone, especially those who love Turkish Film. I love Turkey and I have been to Istanbul and seen many movies. This film is very interesting. This film is the best movie I have ever seen in the whole world.

One of my favorites non-MGM musicals , it 's a classic ! > Rita Hayworth is in top form , as usual, - she does a great Marilyn in her final years , her voice is incredible. > It's so easy to see how the movie would go, it's so funny! > The ending was the funniest thing ever I've seen on a movie screen , too funny! > I don't think I have seen any other movie like this one ! The music is amazing, it's great. The movie is great fun !

Let's get things straight. I was raised Catholic, and in a very religious family, and spent as much time at church and talking to priests as at home. That was useful for two things: to make a convinced Atheist out of me, and to give me deep, insightful knowledge about the Church and its dogmas. And I say: if a Catholic priest witnesses a murder, and clearly sees the face of the killer, he CAN report it to the police, even if the murderer has confessed to him afterwards.

The makers ask for a huge suspension of disbelief, you grant them it in the hope that given a little time they'll convince you it's possible. Alas, with TV movies it seems as though they specifically set out to make cheap Cosmo questionnaire films. With a small budget and big claims you should spend every penny on the details to convince the audience. Not here though. The film gets a few points for the good performance the two leading ladies give against the odds, but unfortunately it's not enough to save the day. oh, and the less said about the ending the better.

A 1957 Roger Corman non epic in which a sundry bunch of characters end up in a lead lined valley (sic) just as stock footage thermo nuclear heck is unleashed. It's the end of the world. *****I reveal two 'twists' at the end of the film. Do not read if you want to watch this movie for some reason*****Oh my, this is bad. And for some reason, Sean Bean, one of the greatest present day actors, has sold his soul and appears in it. The only consolation is that the scriptwriters must have realised that someone as ultimately pathetic as Steve Guttenberg could never in his life aspire to kill someone as cool as Sean Bean.

The main problems of 'Saw ' are related to the tremendous script mistakes that only a uncritical spectator will just see and miss (I have the feeling that some of the mistakes that make the most impression to me are not really in the script as such, but are there simply to increase the effect, and not in the film itself). In fact it seems to me that there's a very close relationship between the mistakes that are made in the script, and what I call the "plotting" errors (the problems I found most frequently).

For all those bewildered by the length and pace of this film ( `` like , why does he show so much , how does he know so much stuff ? ''), I can only say that this film was made in such a way that it took years to do a single scene. So what it was made was a time-lapse in the life of this one man's life. You have a film that runs for around 5 hours, and every time the scene ends it takes another 5 to go back to that point, so it starts again from scratch and ends up with a completely different life story.

Aaran is one of the movies where you find the loop holes in Indian Cinema. Here is one good example to show how excellent writers, directors and actors succumb to the producers. Here is one of the most wonderful actors, Mohanlal, acting in a movie about a real story in Kashmir. The seriousness of the film is slaughtered with sub standard comic scenes and songs. There is this character, Havaldar Jaykumar, who in reality, is the son of the producer of the film. Hence, he doesn't have a hair cut despite his officer asking him to do so.

Formulaic to the max . Neither title reflects the serial 's actual content , `` Fighting Nazis in Morocco ,'', which ran from 1942 until 1943. The title's 's final words were deleted when the British censor objected to any reference to Nazism. In an early version of this essay, I expressed doubt about the very existence of Nazi collaborators. I based my doubts, and my skepticism, on research that is not yet in final shape. However, when I have time to write my analysis, I am sure I will come to a more definitive answer to that question.

When I first heard about `` Greek , '' I figured I would watch it because it sounded ridiculous . And I thought I'd see if I could ever learn Greek , and see if it could make my life less boring . Well , I watched a lot of movies about Greek history and I'm glad I did , because it made me interested in learning the language , and eventually, helped me learn enough Greek to make my life more interesting . But after watching it , you'd never guess I knew anything about Greek . In a way . . .

Very good film . Very good documentary.Very good to see those vermin detectives humiliated and found out as the bigoted people they are. Very good . Thank you. I loved this movie so much, my friend and I watched it in 3 days. He said it was his first documentary and I thought so too, as he has a degree in anthropology, I had to remind him that he didn't have an education, but a BA. I am so happy we were able to watch this movie. Thank you for allowing us in on the adventure. Very good film.Very good.

I saw this title again on Shemaroo . I also asked my nephew who was 17 to watch the same video at his house and the same conclusion was reached as mine . He also said he could not believe what he heard from his father and other family members who had not seen the film themselves but heard about it from his friends. He was shocked and saddened. If you’re a person of color, an activist, or one who has any interest in women’s issues in the US, there’s a new movie you’ve never seen on Netflix titled The Invisible War.

The first feature-length adventure of Jim Henson's beloved muppet characters is a very competent musical comedy vehicle as Kermit The Frog leaves his carefree, swampy surroundings for the bright lights (egged on by stranded Hollywood agent Dom DeLuise who overheard him singing); on the way, he meets Fozzie Bear (a pitiful stand-up comedian at James Coburn's El Sleazo Café who has Telly Savalas for a bouncer and Madeline Kahn a patron! ), the piano-playing dog Rowlf, bestial drummer Animal and his laid-back, funky band, egomaniacal beauty queen Miss Piggy (in a ceremony presided over by Elliott Gould and Edgar Bergen), etc.

A potentially good idea gets completely let down by a weak script which throws all credibility out the window leaving the actors very little to work with. Roth covers it up as best he can by being all mouth; Hurt has about as much menace as a fluffy bunny and Stamp can't seem to decide whether he's playing an ex-London crook or some toff straight off the playing fields at Eton. As for poor Laura del Sol she does what she can but her character is no more than every northern European's idea of the stereotypical Latino woman who's all pouts and hot temperament.

This film is truly a sorry excuse for film making . The pacing is poor , the budget must have been very high and the photography is bland . And the last half hour has the worst ending that i have come across in a lot of films . This film will probably make a few fans who love kannada but that's it. The film makers have made a film with just 2 songs and some background music but the film itself is a huge disappointment. This film was a film which could have done better in making a story.

There are very few films that are able to tell such a complicated story on so many levels as well as Mishima: A Life in Four Chapters. One of the most difficult aspects of story telling is the ability to flashback and forward without losing the pace of the film. This film not only flashes back and fourth with the greatest of easy, but it also flows through some of Yukio Mishima greatest stories. This film exceeds in every aspect and is a joy to watch. Not to mention the incredible Philip Glass Soundtrack.

The inspiration for the "Naked Gun" movies casts Leslie Nielsen - who had only recently started doing comedy* - as the incompetent but heroic Frank Drebin, always having to solve an absurd case. Like "Airplane!" and the movies based on the series, the humor relies on Mel Brooks-style spot gags and silly comments (namely the "yes it is" remarks), along with the fact that Nielsen remains very serious despite the nonsense around him. And of course, the final frame, in which something keeps moving.It's too bad that the show only had six episodes.

I really like this film because of all the stars and the dancing and the story that goes along with it. We are treated to some really good performances as you can tell by the names that are written on some of the cards. I will not say all names as it would give the wrong impression. Anyway, my point is, the film has a good plot, and good characters and some great acting that I really like. This film also does have a lot of violence, but I do like it in a way that I can appreciate and I like the story line.

I like Steve Buscemi. I like his work very much, both as an actor and a director. You could say that I am -into- Steve Buscemi. A Steve Buscemi freak. I lurv Steve Buscemi.I remember when I first saw Buscemi's full length directorial debut, "Trees Lounge." I enjoyed the movie, although it wasn't as good as it could have been. It was -almost- there. It -almost- scratched that itch, the itch of wanting to see "small" movies about "small" people in "small" bars that are in "small" towns.

It looked cool from the movie sleeve , but after five minutes we were n't sure if it was a gimmick. But it turns out, it is not. It is real , and so are you . And if you think this is cool, you will never be cool alone. The world is not as cool as you think It's true. But you, you're a cool person. There is no better way to find your inner cool than to find yourself alone. You don't have to seek the cool-out, it's already on you.

This movie was completely stale and uninspired . The central premise of this movie was basically a bunch of stereotypical characters going on a journey to get together in India and have sex. I don't see what the problem is. Why is it bad that these characters are going to do what they're doing? Why is it wrong? There is no reason why these characters are trying to do something that isn't in their culture or why they are doing this. In other words, they are going around doing something that they do, and in India, that isn't abnormal for them.

This junk bore as much resemblance to the novel as a pickle slice does to a cucumber. The film makers took the Alamo section out of the book, made it into a movie, and said it was based on the book. Hah! Wonder what they did to induce Mr. Michener to endorse this piece of fluff? It was just another Davy Crockett, flintlock rifle, Santa Ana, 13 days of glory collection of poppycock. I almost started rooting for the mexicans, just to get the damn thing to end.

`` Valley Girl '' launched Nicolas Cage 's career and was an 80 's version of `` Romeo and Juliet'' starring Cameron Mitchell . She has also been played by many other well known actors including Julia Roberts and Jennifer Love Hewitt . In 1997, '' Valley Girl '' won its own series on MTV , and in 2003, the TV series was made into an actual movie starring Cameron Mitchell . It is currently the highest-rated film of all time on IMDB, with over 5 million ratings . -- '' '' '' Valley girl '' is the title of several books by James M. Cain.

Slow-moving ponderous movie with terrible acting on the whole - but lovely locations & clothes to admire , and , as well, the story , the story is good - it does not take itself too seriously - in fact it has a light touch to it. The acting is great, the love interest is nice, but I really don't care much about the male lead - I've seen it before, and it was pretty good. "A man is only as good as his intentions, and only as bad as his means"

I agree with the previous posters here, this movie is a terrible mess.

This movie is a must see for any war movie buff . One of the greatest movies of all time. I highly recommend this film to people who like action movies with good special effects. The story is very good , the special effects are fantastic. One of the best movies you'll find on this site. You'll love it. If you like it , rent it. It's also a great movie for the kids . It's a great family film. This movie will stick in your mind for a long time. It has everything you want in an action movie.

This is a pretty obscure, dumb horror movie set in the 1970s Everglades. It is really stupid and lame for the first half, then it actually starts to get good for the last half. There is a scene with the hero running to save his friends interspersed with shots of a church group singing, I don't know. It is mesmerizing. I was impressed with the night time scenes, because it actually looked like night, unlike most low budget horror films where it still looks like daytime. I feel like the director was really talented but was working with a miniscule budget and a tough schedule.

This is a strong recommendation to anyone who reads this review who has never seen the film Total Reality, don't waste your time and money renting this poor excuse for a film. This is, without peer, the single worst movie that I have ever seen in my life. I had nightmares of this movie ever since I saw it. The acting was terrible, and any amateur film maker could make a more decent film. The film blatently rips off far superior sci-fi films, such as TimeCop or Total Recall (where the title seems to have been derived from).

Ridiculous, nauseating doggerel with terrible acting; ineptly, superficially, and condescendingly trawling all the most banal clichés about Tuscany and Italy, divorce and midlife. The main actor nervously grimaces her way through the film, struggling to portray the appropriate level of smug, self-congratulatory self-pity the worthless character and script call for. I'm sure the book was bad, but it can't have been this bad! The camera is permanently fitted with a vomit-yellow "Tuscan" lense filter (perhaps the Tuscan sun wasn't Tuscan enough? ), which they forgot to remove when the scene shifts to Rome and (how imaginative!)

This film was a wonderful romp , intelligent , playful , mysterious , full of surprises , with humor in spades. If you've ever watched a film in this genre and found yourself laughing out loud at one point during the movie , you've got a good idea of what it takes to make an excellent comedy. As for the film itself . . . well , what more can be said . . . . The story is well-structured , cleverly conceived . . . . There are plenty of twists and turns in this film, and each one of them left me chuckling , smiling , and wondering .

As Muppet movies go, this is easily and clearly the best. It features loads of cameos by big named comedic stars of the age, a solid script, and some great Disneyesque songs, and blends them together in a culmination of the best display of Henson's talent. The story is basic, and the jokes are many-leveled in order to amuse both the adults and the kids to which this was marketed, without exposing them to ideologies their parents may not find desirable.This is simply fun, but it is also a well made, well written, beautifully endearing classic.It rates an 8.9/10 from...the Fiend :.

Definition of documentary : A work , such as a film or television program , presenting political , social , economic , cultural and other opinions and information concerning a group or class of people in the context of its times and surroundings . : : : from documentary to documentary film : documentary film ( n. , from documentary film , a term for the motion-picture method of filmmaking used by the French in the 1930s) : from documentary film or documentary film noire to documentary film ( n. ) , a film containing newsreels or documentary footage intended for educational and political purposes.

I have been an avid Jane Austen fan for many years. I had never seen this adaptation, so when I had heard of it, I came here and read all the excellent reviews. On that basis I eagerly ordered it from Netflix. What a cruel disappointment! They have taken one of the most subtle and bright comic novels and made it dull. Each character seems to have been dealt a single facial expression, a single tone upon which to base their flat characters. Although this adaptation seems to have used every word that Jane Austen wrote, they appear to have been passed around to characters in a random fashion.

A girl named Isobel becomes possessed by a demon. The local priest (who formerly dated Isobel's sister) must try to save her, but the bigger problems are with the family's suspicions of each other rather than the demon in their daughter.This film is directed by Ethan Wiley, the writer of "House" and the writer/director of "House II". I loved the first film and liked the second one even better, so you would think this would be a winner. Alas, this one looks like it was thrown together by first-year film students.

This movie is truly unbelievable , in every sense of the word . I could n't believe what I was seeing, but it was true. This movie has got to be the best in the world, not only for the story it tells , but for everything that goes into its making . This movie has got it all and more , including a great cast, beautiful photography , a truly unique soundtrack , and the best use of color . I have to say that I had to see this movie twice , to really appreciate everything it had to offer, and I still cannot believe I did it .

My mistake for thinking this was a serious war-is-hell movie prior to seeing it . That all ended seconds into it. It's actually quite a fun flick, but you really need a lot of tolerance to get through the film. I just don't think I am capable of dealing with it. Yeah, I can't believe I didn't think of that before. This is why I'm always so critical of the movies I love. There's so much going on, and it can go so fast, and you never know what the ending might be, and I don't want to ruin the surprise.

Low-budget murder mystery about a Public Defender trying to clear his client of a murder the man had been convicted of 12 years previously. Complicating things is the fact that he escaped custody after his conviction, but the PD believes the man to be innocent of the murder and works to find the real killer. Gig Young as the PD is okay, and James Anderson as the convicted killer is actually pretty good, but the picture as a whole just rambles along with little suspense, and despite some good character actors in the cast, the performances are generally below par.

I ordered this movie on the Internet as it is very difficult to get Turkish movies where we live . It took me a week to get it and I am very happy with my purchase as I had never seen any Turkish movie before. My wife and son loved this movie. I recommend this movie to you if you want a wonderful movie and I hope it will be a big hit. I am glad I bought it. It is funny. My wife loved it. When she saw it she was very happy. I enjoyed watching this movie.

I just watched this movie last night. Within 30 minutes of the start, I was hoping it would end.It had a promising beginning; the first 10 minutes. He does kiss her somewhere along the way, and she feels Ohh, so terrible about it. Very little substance to grab your interest. The acting just does not hold up. He is very passive.

This is a really silly job of miscasting -- about as bad as Hepburn playing a Chinese woman in DRAGON BALL. Still, that's one movie I want to see in its own movie, just to see how that would have turned out. I don't want to re-watch those three movies, but there's a good chance that they'd be interesting in some form or fashion to somebody. I think I'd even pay to see them again, but then I'd have to buy a new TV set for my bedroom. So for now I'll just watch them in my head.

Loosely based on actual events, "River's Edge" is a film, much in the style of David Lynch, about a group of teenagers who are aware of a murder committed by one of their friends, but no one does anything about it for a long time. With top notch acting by Crispin Glover and Dennis Hopper, we are able to forgive the average acting by everyone else in the film.The film begins with a young boy, Tim (Joshua John Miller), dropping a doll off of a bridge (murder #1).

The Kid - At 39 years old Russel Duritz has a life that most men would envy - he has a wife and son, he can sing, play guitar, run marathons and he can write. He can do anything, but it would be a lie to say he has everything. He has lost a good deal of weight, and he has a bad back that can be an issue. His eyesight is limited and he has difficulty reading the road. Russel is an avid reader, as are most men his age, but there is one book he is reluctant to read in.

The basic plot is good and can be engaging . The music is so great that it became the theme song to the drama. The director is a genius. And the film has been adapted from a book so well I almost cried. I cried because the movie made me realize I’ve been hiding in shame about my weight. And because of the way the film made me feel, and the fact I’ve had my heart broken by several people before, I had to know the secret. It made me realize I was the type to keep things to myself.

This movie was everything but boring . It deals with reality . To the people who think this movie was not realistic, I assure you that after watching this , you will definitely believe that everything is possible. I just want to recommend it to everyone who has not watched this movie . Don't believe the critics who say that this movie was not true . It is the best movie for everyone .

I have to say this is one of the best movie i have seen so far for naruto . the story is really good . the music is good , and it does it justice. this is a first class film , and i have to say , i liked it , and recommend it for all naruto fans. and for me , i can see it in 4 . Mikael

this movie is amazing . the story line is so epic and it had a great twist at the end that makes the story even better . this is an epic movie , and a good one at that .

This is supposedly a story in which a GROWN MAN tells a story about his youth. Yet, you see things like personal computers, e-mails, faxes, etc, which are items used in the late 20th Century and early 21st. So when is this guy supposed to be telling this story - in 2020. Gee, I wonder how advanced we are then. How about telling us that.Also, there are several legal issues which also make no sense. In the courtroom scene, the story falls into the usual pratfalls of surprise evidence, which is inadmissible in any real court of law in this country.

This was an interesting movie . I could have done without the bathroom scene and the seduction scene - EWWWWW - but this was an interesting story and the performances by all of the leads were very good. The movie had a great sense of humor. I liked the way the director kept some things to a low key and kept others on the screen. You had to see it because the actors were good! If you are a "fan" of romantic comedies you'll love this one, I promise. It was funny, the plot and characters were well-written, and very well cast.

^^contains spoilers^^This movie is utter crap. Do not watch.There is no one in this movie to root for, or even like, except for the wife, and she wins by default. Everyone is selfish, and many things happen that make no sense.The acting is mediocre at best and everyone breathes too heavily about everything. No one can even cry believably.If you leave the room for even a second, then something totally out of left field will happen, and it will make NO SENSE WHATSOEVER.For example, I left the room for a second, while Jennie Garth's character was sleeping with her manager.

I watched this movie tonight and I do need to say that it is horrible ! I expected it to be soooo boring and stupid ! I didn’t like this movie at all ! Now let’s get to how the movie ended ! I'm sorry but I just honestly cannot see why anyone would actually like this. It's stereotypical and REAL homeschoolers are NOTHING like they were on this show!! Personally I'm glad it got canceled after the first few episodes. I mean, this kind of show would certainly be alright if everyone knew that homeschoolers weren't really like this, and the whole story was just for the show, but unfortunately not everyone is aware of this. If anyone out there that watched this actually believed this is what goes on in the life of a homeschooler, then I honestly feel sorry for them.

Reba sucks. It sucks hard. It's about this awful country singer attempting comedy. They might as well call this show "Generic", because that's what it is. It's dumb and generic. I am sick of series with young and clueless people, talking about their "problems" all the time, self centered, boring and absolutely annoying (Popular; Dawson's Creek; Beverly Hills; etc). "Hack" is a breath of fresh air, with a great actor (David Morse), a completely different plot, credible people with REAL problems (thank God !!) and very, very good histories. I just love it!! I hope "Hack" will go on for a long time, because it is a great television series for grown up people, for a change.

Good old Jess Franco ! The always-reliable choice of director in case you 're looking for undemanding sleaze , shamelessly self-serving trash, or just good old fun. This time out , we get to see him in a movie that's an old friend of his, with a twist: a story about the death of a teenage boy, and how his mother was trying to make her way on her own, in the aftermath. It's another of those films where a lot of people are going to be surprised when they see what they get.

We all enjoyed the movie . It is a very charming family film with many fun cameos . It was also an entertaining movie that is hard to describe . I found it very hard to sit through the 2 hours that it took , but i guess it has to be because there were so many things going on that i had to pay close attention to . But after all it was worth the wait . The story had everything that you could ever want in a story line . It was very unique and original . The script and direction was also very creative and entertaining .

The reason why this movie sucks , have these people even read a bible ? Everything in the movie was scripted and made up. I'm sorry to say that it wasn't well done . I don't watch movies much, so I didn't give it much thought . It was alright in my opinion and I was bored . If you can't do anything right, then don't waste your time. That's what I do when I watch films. Just read the book... You just need to know that I was not impressed with the movie.

Eh. This is a popcorn movie, nothing more. I watched this with a bunch of friends (and though that might NOT be the best way to view a horror movie...) and most of the dialogue and action was laughable.It left me yearning for a real film. :)The main problem is the lack of tension in the film. It keeps flashing back to 'explanation' scenes, which dissipates any discernible tension.And the character relationship 'twists'? Yeah, they suck. I won't say what they are, but they just don't add anything to the film/storyline.

They say that it is always better in horror movies to leave things to the imagination of the viewer- to leave it to the imagination to guess what will happen. This is something I believe strongly in when I’m watching films. There is no way that the audience can know in advance the answer to everything. So why would we, as filmmakers, choose to leave that opportunity open and allow the audience to guess the ending to the story? I think that, as a director, you do not want to have the audience guessing the ending.

Who said it had to be believable ? Do yourself a favor and turn off your ration before you sit down to write this article. It doesn't need to be the whole truth. The problem is this: It is impossible to know what would happen if Trump got elected. It could get very ugly. The world would be plunged into the worst nuclear war the world has seen since 1945, with hundreds of millions dead to start with, and then more millions more to come in the years ahead to come.

The only reason i didn't delete this movie after 20 min is because we already wasted 20 minutes on it...the only and i repeat the ONLY effect that they used is a weird kapoera (from India?) jump on a half meter wall/trash cans, i mean, effects doesn't make a movie but... sheesh.... me and my friend hoped the entire movie for some real effect (a huge wolf?! something!?>!?!) but noooooooooooooooo... all we got is a jump! on a 0.5 meter wall + they used pharmacy's ..... and they found guns?!

Rowan Atkinson delivers an unforgettable performance as the clueless Mr. Bean who never goes far without his Teddy Bear . it is a performance that has won the heart and soul of the entire audience. the story of an old man who never goes a day without his teddy bear is a timeless classic that has become a part of every family's life. Mr. Bean is truly a timeless classic. in the movie, he meets an attractive young woman who offers to teach him how to live a better life. the movie stars an old man who is not sure what the future holds.

I lay the blame for The Comebacks on anyone who enjoyed Date Movie and Epic Movie. You people encouraged the Fox studio to keep on churning out desperate parody films, and now we're faced with what just may be the laziest and most desperate one of them all. The Comebacks barely qualifies as a parody. Heck, it barely qualifies as a movie. This is a comedy in theory, but not in execution. No one, not even the people involved with this mess, could have possibly fooled themselves into thinking they were making a funny movie.

I had heard good things about `` States of Grace '' and came in with an open mind . I didn't have any expectations at this point; so when I first opened the book, I got to page 6. I did not expect much from page 6 onward. As I went through the first few chapters, I was impressed with how realistic and realistic-looking was the book . It had a realistic look; there were pictures . There were realistic people and realistic scenes . It really seemed that there was something to be excited about and something to be depressed about.

I loved it. In fact, I watched it over and over and over, and I could watch it again. This movie doesn't get boring.The vampire concept is revolutionized in this movie. It's a job well done, great for today's generation.Wesley Snipes was born for this role. Stephen Dorff was an ideal vampire. Arly Jover, mmmm mmm, she can bite me any time she wants and what a sexy accent she has. Donal Logue provides great comical relief.This vampire movie is like no other. I can't wait for Blade 2.

One of the worse gay-related movies I have ever seen. Since these are not characters in this story it's hard to comment on the actual film. Therefore, since Colton Ford (aka Glen) laid his life open for all to see, I guess he's fair game to criticize. And that's not hard to do. Here goes. 50 something Glen is a big time porn star who wants fame and fortune as a big time singer. (I guess 11 films makes him a "star") Being gay and forty, I have seen porno and I did not recognize him or his lover.

Like in a circle the movie leads back to its point of departure, the image of the cranes that are crossing a Muscovite sky. They represent the freedom to realize your life as you wish, in order to aspire the greatest possible fulfilment.In the beginning Veronica and Boris experience such a promise of happiness, and their eyes follow the path of the cranes in exhilaration. It seems as if they might be able to live according to their dreams.But Man is not a bird. Life draws up its own rules, from which no human can escape and which we cannot change - not even by making a supreme effort.

I swear if I did ever tried cocaine I'd be able to relate to this film perfectly. Its pace, as well as the dialog, churns out at speeds that some viewers might need to stop and relax their heads.There are great little elements that pop up through out the film, like how Rob Lowe's character seems to always be loosing a shoe, or how some characters keep running spirals around his zigzagged path. The story was put together extremely well and the direction seems flawless.The movie reeks of clumsy and cuteness. This is one I think most could enjoy.

RKO was trying to boost its starlet JOAN FONTAINE when they cast her as a flying nurse who is strong-willed enough to make a doctor (JOHN BEAL) come to terms with running away from responsibilities in this little programmer. TCM aired it as a stepping-stone in the career of Joan Fontaine.Fontaine is earnest and does an acceptable job, nothing more, and John Beal is okay as her love interest. But it's obvious that PHILIP HUSTON (who has the appearance and cocky manners of a young James Garner) is the actor who should have shared top billing with Fontaine.
