Hearkening back to those `` Good Old Days '' of 1971 , we can vividly recall when we were treated like gods . Our cars were like spaceships that flew into the windshield , while we looked out of our windows like space-walkers . And what about our clothes? We wore a whole lot more than just some old T-shirts. We had suits , shirts , dresses , and suits that had pockets and pants with zippers on the fly . That was the way you dressed in the 60 s , and that's how you dressed for the 70 s too.

What a shocker . For starters , I could n't stand the constant screaming and noisy panicking all the time . But even worse , what I noticed after a few years was that, I can't hear well. A spaceship in some unspecified future where human beings are equipped for space travel and have laser guns for weapons, crash lands on a strange young planet where dinosaurs are coincidentally also evolved and only on this world, have not gone extinct...yet. 'Blade' would be an extremely above-average comic-book, vampire-hunter action/horror if it weren't for two minor flaws. #1 I loved seeing the all-but invincible Blade/Snipes do his slicing and dicing, but the whole "Yes!" fist/punch was literally a letdown. #2 Bad, no make that horrible, CGI  even for 1998 standards. Journalist Bob Woodward's blistering, scattershot and sometimes suspect account of actor John Belushi's rise and fall becomes a wholly misjudged movie, a nebulous "fantasy" directed by Larry Peerce as if he were doing something edgy and vital. Michael Chiklis (years before his breakthrough on "The Shield") is put in the unenviable position of portraying Belushi, taking a post-mortem trip through his life, recreating those "Saturday Night Live" skits which are now part of TV history. It's like watching someone try to out-Lucy Lucille Ball--it can't be done.

While the prominent and over use of the play-like format is in total operation throughout the film, it is not however this that lets this picture down. Rather it is the unconvincing female performances and rather tedious script that the film so obviously relied on a little too much. With an idea that had potential, the simple plot is diminished still by Graham's failure to truly express the devastation her character so adamantly claims to experience. The use of improvised scenes by all the actors would not be such a bad idea if only the two leading ladies could take advantage of this privilege.

I watched this movie with big expectations. The blurb on the back indicated that this was going to be a nasty one. But it was pretty tame and a little unsatisfying. The violence was nothing I haven't seen a thousand times before, the gore level was only average (mind you there was probably more than what has been seen in Hollywood in the last 5 years - perhaps more), and at no stage was I even feeling uneasy let along frightened. Again a CAT 3 movie with big wraps, has not lived up to its hype.Sure hire this movie, but don't go in with any expectations.

I think Walter Pidgeon was badly miscast in this film . Just not believable in the role . Barbara Eden is a much better actor than him . She did a beautiful job . I loved this movie . At the time of this writing ( January 25 , 2006 ) , I am saddened to hear of the murder of the Palestinian journalist Jamal Halawa, who was killed for daring to write about the Palestinian cause in a foreign language. His murder is yet another blow to the cause of Palestinian unity and solidarity. I am even further saddened to know that the murderers of the Palestinian journalist are from the same Arab-Islamic State. Halawa was killed in the city of Gaza. He was known for his coverage of a daily newspaper on Gaza, which he edited for a number of years, before it closed down.

Superhero Movie ( 2008 ) is the most recent in the long line over `` parody '' movie movies which began in 1984 with Star Trek. The movie is based on the comic strip `` Star Wars ','' which has been one of the top-selling comic strips for decades, first by Dark Horse Comics in the late eighties and now by Lucasfilm Ltd, which produces all Star Wars movies. The movie is not so much a '' movie as a comic book movie,'' in that the scenes and dialogue are mostly drawn and narrated from a comic book.

I am a firm believer that a film , TV serial or any form of art should and would be more successful if it was written as well as it is filmed, and that it would be just as if someone wrote it, filmed it and put it online for the rest of us to enjoy. So with this film I have aimed to deliver exactly that - to provide you, the viewer , with an authentic and real film experience, which is why I have put all my love, enthusiasm, belief and hard work into making the story come to life and make your viewing experience as enjoyable as possible.

Very enjoyable 50's Western. I have it in my collection and recommend it to Western fans.Mostly Victor Mature's movie and quite well done in my estimation.He's a trapper who joins a frontier post as a scout. Red Cloud caught three of them on their land and took their possessions. They all joined as scouts after their loss.Victor has set his eye's on the Colonel's wife and lives life on the post without much regards to regulations.Action done quite convincingly but no great depth or much feeling to other characters.50's Westerns are my favorites and this slides easily to a satisfaction.

The plot involves a new , hipper franchise barbershop that is moving across the street from Calvin 's barbershop . It turns out it's not just the new franchise, but the entire street has been renamed to honor one of the barbershops in town, the original. This is where the plot's first major twist happens. When the " original " (as they're now called in Calvin's shop ) is forced to leave town after Calvin's brother dies, it leaves Calvin and his brother alone with no place to live.

I watched the movie with tears and smiles alternatively. Anger surged in me to see the ruin of Hanoi after the 12-day bombard. There are only a few movies which can be called `must see' and SHEPHERED is one of those films. In many ways it was ahead of it's time (and you can tell it was a source of inspiration for several better-known films) Copied by many, equaled by none, this truly is one great movie.The story is complex but unfolds itself as a taut yet frequently amusing thriller and highly thought provoking exploration of the nature of humanity. The story takes place in a post-apocalyptic world where people must live underground and chaos reigns.

Susan Sarandon and Natalie Portman play Adele and Ann August, a single mother who's the working definition of the word "dreamer" and her solemn, pragmatic daughter. Adele, wanting to make a fresh start in a big city, moves them from Wisconsin to California.Decent, if not exceptional or particularly memorable, with some serious and sad moments. It pushes some emotional buttons, that's for sure. Best thing it offers is a solid cast, and Sarandon and Portman are quite good in the leads - even if their characters are one-dimensional at times.Could be better, could be worse.I gave this one seven out of ten.

I was sorely disappointed in this movie. Twice I was temped to walk out because segments of the movie were so demoralizing and depressing. The movie has elements that allude to all the seamy things in life (pornography, murder, suicide, fornication, hatred, gang warfare). The graphic nature of the violence in this movie was particularly disturbing.And Richard Dutcher does a great disservice to the LDS Church in portraying missionary attitudes, commitment, spirituality, and obedience as unfocused and lackadaisical.My biggest objection to this movie, however, was that it is the exact opposite of a feel-good movie.Dutcher's God's Army One was okay.

It's astonishing that some people saw this as art. We saw it as a poorly filmed (shaky hand-held camera and all), (generally) badly acted, unscripted mess that seemed more like a high school film project with the kids experimenting in black & white film making. Injecting mounds of poetry in place of a story does not an art film make. When we watched this in the theatre, people were starting to have fits of the giggles (us included) at the endless stupidity of this self-indulgent, meandering mess. And believe me, it does seem endless.

During the first minutes in the series the boy is hit by a car, during the last moments of the series, the same car appears.. Episodes had a touching and funny ending, specially last one.

This movie is on cable sporadically , and I never really watched it , thinking it would be similar to an episode of House or some such . The movie does have a lot in it that is similar in theme to an episode of House , which I was unaware of at the time , as House , the original series, did not come out on TV until after the original series. The basic premise is about a young man, played by Will Smith, who returns to his hometown after his parents died to take over his family's thriving business.

Last year was the 200th anniversary of Charles Darwin 's birth , and the 150th anniversary of the publication of the book that popularized his theories of evolution and human origins. In celebration , The New York Times has put together an exhibition called Darwin at the Edge of Evolution , which traces the evolution of Darwin's ideas through to their current form. The exhibition, which opens on Monday, takes a critical look at some of Darwin's most popular theories about our origins — the idea that we are the product of "natural selection" in nature and the idea that we developed as a result of a process called evolution.

In my opinion the directing , editing , lighting , and acting ( minus Franco ) were very good . The script was good but needed more work . I thought the ending was a bit hard to swallow but I was wrong . I liked the music and the score ( although a tad overused at times ) was well done . The film is definitely a must see . I would recommend this flick to anybody . It’s a good flick with very good acting . This was my first time watching an American film and I was really happy . I recommend this one to anybody .

Definition of documentary: A work, such as a film or television program, presenting political, social, or historical subject matter in a factual and informative manner and often consisting of actual news films or interviews accompanied by narration. The key word here is informative. I love They Might Be Giants, and barely learned a thing about them.The interviews with all the celebrities were pretty much worthless. I don't care what Sarah Vowel thinks of anybody and Syd Straw was downright irritating. And is listening to people recite TMBG lyrics like they were supposed to be funny/interesting? It was neither.

This was one of the shows that I wanted to follow-up on. But, I'd just couldn't bring myself on devoting my time to this show. Rob Lowe was OK, but actors like Kyle Chandler just couldn't act (he was awful in "Early Edition"). It was a pain to sit through this show.

First off , I 'm not a firefighter , but I 'm in some kind of para-firefighting unit ( the guys I work with are not really firefighters , they are just doing it for the day )
I've got to say , I have to give them credit , they do it really well. I 'm also not a member of any other organization, but I have to say , I have gotten to know so many good firefighters , that I really think they are good people. They do a lot, but they never stop.

This is a semi fictional memoir of an `` international man '' who have witnessed various political upheavals in recent times.The first section is based on the author's experience of his life in the Indian Army. It describes how he became a part of the freedom movement. The next two sections is based on the author's experience at the forefront of the struggle for Indian Independence. The final part is a brief description of his life in the Indian army after the independence. In the first section, he narrates the events which shaped his personality and personality.

Yahoo Serious is like a $ 3 bottle of wine - had no substance to begin with and just gets better and better as it gets older. And then when the price comes down, there is not enough left over to fill my glass. They are the same with news. The news is no more news, they have no more substance to them. I agree with what you wrote. The quality of the news has gone down so far as to make it virtually worthless. There is simply too much crap and garbage out there.

I have to say this is better than most SyFy outings, but that isn't saying much.The plot is that someone buys a game that is made from the bones and skin of a dead witch from the Spanish Inquisition (and nobody ever expects the Spanish Inquisition!) He and his friends play the game, only to be interrupted halfway through when the friend who went on the beer run is killed in a way that the game predicted.What then follows are a series of kills that are typical for a movie like this, or any of the Final Destination movies.

As a non-theist Im not going to comment on the great mans theory which changed the world 150 years ago. Safe to say, science is based on evidence, religion is based on blind faith. Nuff said there then.The film was produced by the BBC, and to be honest, it could quite easily have been shown on television. While the acting is superb, the film itself isn't really worthy of a full blown cinema release. That said, if it reaches a wider audience this way, then so be it.

Almost a masterclass in how not to direct a movie. From the misjudged, often incomprehensible script onwards Dr Rey builds on a series of poor decisions that make the film an excruciating viewing experience. Sadly the film never rises beyond a kind of old fashioned, almost misogynistic gay camp in which women are over-wrought, OTT and middle aged and the men are young, vacuous and forever on the hunt for sex. The director was unable to pitch either the tone of the film or the level of the performances.There is certainly a great deal of 'acting' going on.

Idiots go camping and act like idiots before they finally die like idiots , yes Camp Blood ( or if they don't go to the camp you can see them there doing whatever the hell they want)

If this is too much for you then do yourself a favor and turn around and go back into your apartment and watch TV and not do anything at all. Go out to the club, go out to dinner with your girlfriend and then maybe you can get your act together and get back home and start your day in a decent way.

This one and the one prior "Toulon's Revenge" and the next one seem to be completely different from the first two movies where the puppets were not so nice. It is basically choose your series, the first two go together and paint the puppets as killers, while the next three are a series of them being the good guys. This one plays out to much like some cheesy television series episode to be as good as part three was and I never really had the urge to try and watch part five of the series.

As is the case with many films of this ilk , my non Catholicism got in the way of my appreciation of the final product. This isn’t a film, per se (though I really don’t know what that’s supposed to mean…), but a film that would be more than enough to get the non-believer of my acquaintance into the “faith” camp. The plot is pretty basic. A man goes to visit his girlfriend who lives in the country with her family. She’s married, but he sees her with another man.

Unless there 's some huge ironic conspiracy going on , my jaw dropped when I read the positive reviews of the new Star Wars trilogy. For the last seven years, I've been a loyal fan. In my opinion, there was no way the new trilogy would be any worse than the first two. So, why would anyone care to read a three-book collection of stories that don't do enough? If you've been following along with my review of The Force Awakens, then you know that I give it three and half stars.

A killer ( John Karlen ) with a penchant for really bad disguises ( afro wig on a white dude, for example) comes to town. But is he a real killer? Or just a bad actor trying to make a little money. And how do you make a good bad guy? And can a real-life serial killer be good in a movie? What is a serial killer really like? What makes them tick? These were all questions I had as a young child, but of course, the answers didn't make it into the movies I saw.

This is seriously the worst movie I have ever seen , right from the start the movie goes straight down hill from then on and never stops until the credits roll in. The acting is terrible by the way and the plot is uninteresting at best. The acting, the story line, the plot is all unoriginal. The music is the worst, very loud and annoying. There are a couple of decent songs in this movie and they aren't bad, but they aren't good either. All in all I give it 1 stars out of 10.

Great party movie , following the adventures of Bill & Tom , two high school buddies at opposite ends of the American socio-political spectrum, who discover that they share an unusual kinship that leads them both to discover something of the truth about the universe and to try to change their world for the better . Based on the best-selling memoir by Michael Lewis, the screenplay by David Franzoni , from the book by the same title by Michael Lewis. The story begins in late September of 1963 when Bill O’Reilly, a conservative columnist and talk radio host in Chicago, goes to work for the television program “ Firing Line.

Pretty lousy made-for-TV sequel to the Roman Polanski classic. Rosemary's son Adrian has grown up and is embodied by creepy Stephen McHattie. After eliminating Rosemary (here played by Patty Duke) a coven of witches, again led by Minnie & Roman Castevets, preps Satan's son for world domination. It's not really scary and light years less macabre than its predecessor. Instead, writer Anthony Wilson and director Sam O'Steen opt for a Satan-worshiping thriller full of a lot of chanting, plenty of candles, and Ruth Gordon trying to act daffy and nasty at the same time.

The odd thing about Galaxina is not that it is supremely bad, although it is. The odd thing is that in spite of being supremely bad, it is not funny. Supremely bad movies have their own particular brand of unintended humor--the secret of their success, you might say. But Galaxina is quite uniquely different--it is MST3K's worst nightmare, a bad movie in which the intentional *and* the unintentional humor alike fall flat.It is easy enough to figure out why the intentional jokes fail--and the reasons are quite varied.

A moderately interesting start , some pretty scenes in sixteenth-century Japan , and a promising idea . But the execution falls far short of what could have been a very entertaining film . It is worth seeing for the film, and not just to watch the Japanese film . And it might even be worth seeing again , with more time and maturity . I can't think why anyone else should see this , unless you want to see it for the first time (which is too bad ) . A moderately interesting film with some good characters , a surprising plot twist , and excellent acting .

Let's get one thing straight: I like much of Snipes' work. Unlike his other high-kicking contemporaries (Seagal and Van Damme) he can actually act. This film, however, does little to enhance his reputation; it's not exactly unwatchable - but I am not in any hurry to watch it again either. In fact, if I never saw it again it wouldn't bother me - there are just loads of better films out there to waste my on! It's a pity because with a bit of imagination and and some subtle changes this could have been a worthwhile film.

Four unhappy women leave dreary London to spend an ENCHANTED APRIL in a castle on the coast of Italy.Elizabeth von Bülow-Lüders is thrilled to be spending her honeymoon in a beautiful place, but she does not have enough money in the world to buy all the clothes that her husband, the Prince of Hohenzollern-Hechingen-Biebach, has sent her to buy. Her friends and relatives want her to buy more, but they don't have more money and they're afraid to ask her because she is so good-looking. As time goes on she finds she has more than enough money to buy her clothes.

I do n't even understand what they tried to accomplish with this movie , i mean really . You got rid of the romance , so why did they make the movie? . I mean i liked the rom-coms , so i was happy they were done . But the last movie was boring , it had a plot but the only reason it worked was the chemistry . I am so bored . You could make this movie with the rom-com plot and they would have a better result than this . I mean i hope that when it comes out it will make it way past the 15 million dollar mark .

Stay FAR AWAY from this film. The fact that you're reading reviews tells me you may have already been tainted by the awfulness it carrys. This is a truely horrid movie... so let's get down to the problems. Writing and Direction: It wouldnt surprise me if these were handled by a group of overactive gradeschoolers that watched 'scream' and 'I know what you did last summer' a few too many times. GIANT GAPING plot holes abound; while I can't congratulate them for this movie, its nice knowing they're finally potty trained.

The third film I got to watch at the philly film fest was this outstanding drama from Japan. After breaking out of prison nine escaped convicts plan to find the "key to the universe" that a tenth convict who didn't break out told them about. Along the way we get to know each of these men fairly well. Each has their own dreams. For much of the movie it seems to be mostly a comedy, but a shift takes place that the film ends up a tragedy. All of the actors give great performances.

Like a lot of films from the early sounds days, Cimarron must be viewed more for historical interest than as compelling entertainment. The hammy acting of lead Richard Dix, nominated for best actor, can be excused as a relic of the silent-film school of acting. However, even giving benefits of the doubt, Cimarron is a badly shaped piece of drama -- a bloated film that moves from unrelated sequence to unrelated sequence with little dramatic impact. Offically, the film is two hours and four minutes; it feels like four hours when you're watching it.

I have a hard time putting into words just how wonderful this was . Once in a while you see something in the news, and you have a chance to see it first hand, and in person. When I was asked to join a class that was training for a day long event, my first thought was, “Why the hell do I want to be in a class that would include such a thing?” And yet, because of the incredible support from my husband and family, this was the best event I’ve ever taken part in.

As a professional poker dealer for over 25 years I found this movie very hard to watch. Too unreal. It seems the producers of this movie either had done little or no research or just didn't care. The card tricks are something you never would see performed in a real poker game. Common sense right? Plus it was full of film cuts and such during the tricks. Who couldn't do that? The cheating was amateur stuff. Palming, marked cards, etc. Would you sit in a high limit game where they use opened deck cards?

This film was n't good at all . I was able to catch it at a film festival and did not want to watch it after . I believe it's because of the story , but I still had no idea what it was about . I don't understand it because of the movie , but I have to say I'm surprised that I liked it . The cast is all good , and the actors in this movie were really good . The plot was simple , but I think it still made for a good film . But I won't be watching it again because I thought it was really bad .

Honestly, how hard can it be to make a good remake? Obviously pretty hard! I was soooo excited to see this because I loved the original, and my friends go and see it and tell me it really sucks. Well, I finally see it and I was sooo disapointed. Ok, the shower scene was more realistic...that's why I gave it a 3. Otherwise, it did suck. Vince Vaughn does a terrible job playing Norman, he's just too dense or something. I don't know, it was just terrible. Don't see it!

In Brooklyn , the nightclub dancer Rusty Parker ( Rita Hayworth ) has a simple but happy life dancing in a Manhattan club on the arm of a wealthy businessman. Her life is turned upside down when he is murdered and she is found to have been the victim. In the Bronx , a young prostitute and singer is found shot to death at a party, and the police suspect the local mobster she works for for the murder. Her body, which had been drugged with drugs and alcohol, is found to be missing.

OK , I admit that I still associate Sophie Marceau with La Boum . That was the main reason I did not like this film. Why? Well because I felt that her character was one of the biggest problems for the film. There is only one Sophie in the film and when that Sophie is gone, the film is pretty good. In fact , I felt like I had seen the film before but I couldn't remember what the plot was. But what a great film this is . First of all let me say that the film is not a typical comedy .

With its few touches of surrealism, LWHTRB works as low-grade horror, but as a major follow-up statement to the original, it flounders miserably. Things begin somewhat promising during the telefilm's opening credits... We see and hear several interesting shots and sounds: The Baby's black crib with the overhanging, inverted cross; the kitchen knife Rosemary carried into the Castevette's apartment and dropped in shock (the utensil is shown sticking out of the hardwood floor); and the emptiness of the Bramford itself, without tenants or furniture (voice-overs can be heard here from the previous film's dialog).

Between the ages of 30 and 51, when he died of a brain tumour, Zachary Scott made 70 films. He was introduced in 1944 in Jean Negulesco's 'The Mask of Dimitrios', where he played Dimitrios. The next year, 1945, he made three films, of which this is one. He is best remembered by cineastes as the star of Jean Renoir's 'The Southerner', one of the 1945 films, where he had a sympathetic role. However, he often played creepy characters, and in this film he is a sociopathic killer of women for money.

If you thought this is the french The Mummy and if you 're hoping for another `` Vidocq '' ... well, sorry, I guess that's about it for now. It was really really cool, I enjoyed it and would like to add a few comments about it in the video:

The way it's made is pretty good for a movie with that sort of plot, and I'm really glad this is the first thing I've seen that was animated using cgi, but I have to say I thought it looked a bit odd - like there was a lot of green on the screen.

Another sequel! Why on earth do they keep making these? This has got to be the weakest 'franchise' ever, yet it is still being funded and spawning sequels. SCARECROW GONE WILD - which I only watched so I could officially trash the whole series - brings back the evil straw-man who, again, butchers up some college kids... That's basically it. The acting sucks (as usual), the death scenes are beyond pathetic, and don't be fooled by the title, this thing doesn't have as much nudity as you may think.

Our reviewer from Toronto told you what you need to know about this film (except note that it needs editing-the hand held technique gets really old, really fast). I saw this film last night in Menerbes, France-we are in the Luberon Valley, which is covered with vineyards and of course wine makers. They were all there in the Salle de Polyvalente for the showing-crammed in. Polite, patient, genial. Although my French is testy, I got the gist of the film but noted that the audience loved the "old" terror growers interviewed-esp.

Having enjoyed Koyaanisqatsi and Powaqatsi I was looking forward to this third part of the Qatsi trilogy and seeing what the new artist would bring to the series, but I was also looking forward to a little bit more from this series. What I’m getting from this third entry in the series is very similar to the previous two Qatsi books, and is much better than the previous two installments. But the book is definitely not perfect and I think the reason is because this book didn’t really try to develop any new elements of the story.

This new movie by Jeskid is awesome! Check it out and you'll be amazed. The story of Emily Waters, once a girl from a broken home, whose only means of escape from an abusive father was through her sketchbook. Until one night her drawings manifested into reality and saved her, and now using this power she fights against those who would do evil. Both live action film and hand drawn animation blend together to create a unique and original experience that will shake your soul and blow you away. The music is incredible as well, it really intesifies the emotional experience and draws you deep into the conflict.

This is a very strange series with Dean Learner. I really didn't understand the guests. I knew they weren't serious but whether they were really them was unclear because...i guess i'm just that stupid. I don't know if this classes as a spoiler but the guests aren't real like in Ali g or anything they're played by one man or so i believe. I love the serious look that he's got going on. Its like that programme that was on on a Sunday morning that i forget the name of lol.

I appeared as an extra and was on location as a journalist covering "The Dain Curse". My involvement was during the segments of this film shot in Jim Thorpe, Pa. (Jim Thorpe was also one of the locations of the 1969 film "The Molly Maguires"). I reported the 'action' in the Emmaus Free Press newspaper where I was editor 1978-80 (the paper ceased publication int he 1990s). I recall the excellent attention to detail of the period costumes, automobiles, etc. The modern asphalted streets of Jim Thorpe were covered with gravel to mimic a 1920s rural town of the south.

Wow. Just wow. Never before have i seen a horror movie in which it seemed like a bad self insert fanfic that somebody wrote one day in 20 minutes. And then i happened to come upon "Lady Frankenstein". This movie takes everything you know about Frankenstein and turns it completely upside down... and not in a good way. If you've seen this movie you either stumbled across it on Italian TV, or you have the dubbed version on the 50 Chilling Classics Box set like i have, as number 24. And lets just say there's a reason why these movies are here.

As was mentioned by others , could there be any other reason to see this film other than to see the actors in the roles they have played in other films ? I can only guess that I am just being overly picky. I was hoping if there was a chance that the film would be any good. I am looking forward to seeing the actors again in a better capacity than I have ever seen in their previous movies. The best way I know to review a movie before seeing it is to see it.

Oh man , this movie was toe-cringing bad . Bad look , awful story ... the list of good things goes on and on . there's no happy ending , of course . in a way , i can think of at least a few more happy endings for the characters . but here's the problem with happy endings for this film . it's not a happy ending , it's an ending . a lot of movies have ended with a happy ending , even if the characters are miserable . it's just easier . but here the story ends with the characters at a point they haven't reached in their relationship .

There 's not a dull moment in Francois Ozon 's `` Robe d'Ete '' . It 's surprising how much is left out. There are no subtitles here. There are no credits on the end credits, either. It makes it feel like a documentary that you don 't know what's coming next, though you have the idea it will lead into the second half of the film that will be a series of photos. It does, but the pictures are very different from what you 're expecting and they aren 't what you thought at first.

HOW MANY MOVIES ARE THERE GOING TO BE IN WHICH AGAINST ALL ODDS , A RAGTAG TEAM BEATS THE BIG BLOODY HOUNDS? 1. We are all familiar with one-on-one fights. But what if it were a team fight? Where there were several people fighting, each one taking on another, each with a different weapon? 2. In this team-fighting scene, there is more than just two fighters. There is more than just fists. 3. There are knives, chains, guns, swords, spears, and even chainsaws. And all are used in a coordinated manner.

I completely understand WHY this movie was made. Silence of the Lambs was an incredible film - a gruesome thriller with a superb story and high jump-factor....What I don't understand is why THIS movie was made... and why Anthony Hopkins agreed to reprise his role as Hannibal the Cannibal in this terrible and dissatisfying film.There's no possible way to spoil the movie any further than going to see it could, but for those of you who prefer to waste your money, DON't READ ON. The film is absolutely horrible. It's so bad that the transition from Jodie Foster to Julianne Moore becomes a non-issue.

After the success of Star Wars , there was a boost in interest in Sci-Fi movies . This was one of the major factors that helped the Star Wars franchise reach a wider audience. Some of these movies were made into successful movies like the “ Clone Wars “ series . But other than these, the only other sci-fi movies that came close to becoming a hit were James Cameron‘s “ Avatar “ and the “ Transformers “ series . And the reason these movies didn’t became a massive hit is that audiences were expecting something different from the two movies , especially in the way that Cameron handled the CGI .

I usually don't categorize a moving as boring. I am not big on action flicks and my senses do not need to be stimulated during a movie. In fact I enjoy a good rational logical dialogue and story line. Unfortunately, this movie has none of those characteristics. Diane Lane is the only saving grace in this movie and even her beauty cannot save it. Terrible overbearing music equals the moronic dialogue and acting. None of the actors actually connect with each other and as a result the movie does not connect with the audience.

The plot was not good.The special effects weren't.The acting was ... not very good at all.Like others , I felt like I wasn't seeing things, or that I was missing things (the dialogue, for example) from the original version, which I didn't really understand until much later.This was also the first time I had seen the original Star Wars trilogy (Episode IV-V) and didn't quite like any of them (in that order). This was probably due to the fact that I didn't know the original story. I watched it all in the order of the trilogy (i.e.

The only thing it has to offer is the interesting opposites of Tru and Jack, their choices and viewpoints, and the philosophical questions that it raises. Tru feels that she is helping people who aren't supposed to die, and Jack feels that they are supposed to die, and she is messing with fate's plan, or the universe's plan, or such-whatnot.But she is obviously able to change things, so there is obviously no such thing as fate in the series' metaphysics. Jack has no basis for believing that there is. And very conveniently, Tru never asks him the right questions.

This was one of the few Norwegian movies I actually looked forward too see. It started of as a few commercials with a motley bunch at football matches. Then they made a movie out of it. The leads are not pros (and you can see that) but they still do a very good job and the movie all in all blew me away.Norway is known for making crappy movies (no offense)but I had a good feeling about this one. Even thou I'm not interested in football I wanted 2 see it. the story is a lot better than expected and the laughs just keep piling up.

SPOILERS A Jewish Frodo ? Yep , that 'll be Elijah Wood again.Ever since the concluding part of `` Lord of the Rings ' ', all of Middle-Earth have had the chance to find out what happens to the Ring when Frodo finds out its true power. And they've found out . I'm talking about the movie version of Tolkien's novel. The one with Daniel Craig, who is the best thing that has happened to this book since Peter Jackson. You know what ? It doesn't feel like a fantasy movie, and that's not because it tries to do too much.

1 . I 've seen Branaghs Hamlet : Branagh is too old , speaks frequently with a high pitched voice and doesn't know who is speaking , I think it is a very good production, although it's too bad there is not one more scene in which one could hear some Shakespeare, or a film that would show us the world in the light of Shakespeare 's words. I really liked this film, it's not a bad film , it's just not really the kind of film I want to see as a viewer .

This movie was Flippin Awful....I wanted those hours of my life back. For god's sake, -stay far away from this awful crumb ball movie at all costs. Its not worth mentioning the title, but the ratings on this movie are pretty generous for a vomit scum movie like this. And where do I begin? The dumb A** kids in the movie.....The zero plot or story?...the garden-variety college/frat boy-esquire scenes of towel slapping? Or the VERY bad acted, teen angst innuendo? $$$#@%@!

It may be hard to explain how, but this film is a masterpiece. Perhaps, because i never imagined that a plot like this or a film with so few words would convey all this poetry. The true poetry and aristocracy of human passions and obsession. Bogard is amazing and needless to say that Venice is utilised as a perfect scenery: dark, sinking and dreary just like Bogard's soul. And classical music is more that a simple background escort to human feelings. In my opinion, a classic masterpiece of european film-making.

I 've seen a few bad action movies in my days , but this one 's just plain awful . When I heard the title , I thought , what is this about ? and what's the point of having a story with bad action ? . Then I read the tag line of the movie , The Good, The Bad, & The Ugly . So, I sat down and watched the movie and was amazed at how it really was a good, bad and the ugly at the same time , which made it even worse . It was very hard to watch , and very ,very boring .

Oh boy ! Oh boy ! On the cover of worn out VHS has a picture of Sandra Bullock and Tom Cruise . Not only that but there is the tag line:

'When the Bullocks meet the Cruisees, they'll change their life forever.' I could not believe my eyes, until I saw it on the news today. I had to take a second look to see what all the fuss was about - and to see what it meant to me. I read this and thought, oh Lord, that would be wonderful for Sandra Bullock if Tom Cruise was her boyfriend.

I 'm not a movie snob . I 've liked lots of movies that critics hate , and I 've also liked some critics who I thought were just too kind. I don't really have a set list of critics who I like. But I like some critics who I like more than any others. I want the movies I like most of the time but I don't want to feel that I 'm missing something that might be a better movie. I don't want to miss something that will make me feel that I 'm missing something I want to see when I have a chance.

This is the first porn I've ever tried to review. It demands a different approach than usual, since the allegory will not reward dissection. "I'm American. I'm a prudish virgin." "We are European. We are cultured and sex-mad." "It is nice when we all screw each other." Lots to talk about! Well, there kind of is in fact, relative to your average 60s topless volleyball number anyway. And the enervating patina of 'class' at least delivers clean, detailed compositions.

I 'm a big fan of Patricia Hodge and Mariam Margolyes , so I watched this show when it came out in 2007, because I was desperate to see something new and different. To me, Patricia is a brilliant character with an intriguing mind, but it can be a frustrating one too. I thought this was a great show, because it was so different from the rest of the BBC shows at the time. I think it has a wonderful blend of mystery, magic and the occult, combined with a very witty and quirky main character.

The plot has something about white hunters captured by a tribe of white women in the African jungle/ plains.Its a classic of the genre. Its also a classic of Hollywood’s attempt to use the best of Hollywood’s art of the silent era. This film is from 1931. The action begins in Africa where a tribe is attacked by the White hunters, who capture some of their members, but they later return to kill them, thus, making the entire tribe flee. The film opens with the white hunter and a beautiful woman in the African jungle.

Monster of Mexico I do agree is the weakest of the modern Scooby Doo movies, mainly because of the weak plot and how predictable it all was. Loch Ness Monster however, is a considerable improvement, with gorgeous animation, honestly Scotland looked beautiful. The music is good, and the plot is well thought out. Plus, there is some great dialogue, and the voice acting was fabulous, with Casey Kasem a consistent delight as Shaggy, and the beautiful Scottish singer Sheena Easten a pleasant surprise in a guest starring role.

Man with the Screaming Brain certainly is n't a perfect movie , but I 'm pretty sure it was never meant to be perfect. It is a movie that has its own identity, and its own flaws. It has its own voice. There 's just no denying that. You have to see this, even if it is not your kind of style. If you 're looking for good horror, well, this could be the one to take a look at. I'm glad that it 's available for a rental, and I hope you 're the same way.

I almost laughed out loud when during the commentary the director said this movie is original with a strong plot twist. Well, it's original in its plot, but the twist doesn't come until the movie's end. That was one of the worst things about this movie, it was supposed to have a strong plot twist, and it just sort of fell into an ending that was predictable even to fans. The cast was also decent, and some decent action scenes, even though I don't have high expectations for these.

In a Morocco completely invaded by Europeans and Americans , in the beginning of the Twentieth Century , the Moroccan king, Mohammed V, , decided to try to stop it, as he had no choice but to do because he did not want to lose his independence, since the French and the British had just annexed his country to their empires. Mohammed V , who was named Mohammed VI in 1884, saw how the French army was occupying Morocco , and he sent an army of 12,000 soldiers to attack the foreigners. He had a plan to do that, and he started to do it in 1872.

Cowboys and Indians is an excellent film . The writing , acting , directing could not have been better . This was one of the best made films . The script , direction was fantastic . The action was good , the characters were believable . The acting , direction , music , cinematography . The music was superb . A very good film . I thought it was brilliant . I did not understand a lot of what they were saying but I did get a good feeling about the film . I also thought it did a very good job of showing how people could be so different yet still so similar .

Well , I 'm an Italian horror big fan and I love movies from directors such Argento , Fulci , Argento , D'Amato , De Luca , Spinella , Tarkovski , Vanni , Fulci , Fulvio , Fulci , Spinella and many others that I can mention but, for now, here 's an old classic Italian Horror movie from my childhood, "La Vita dell'anima" from the 70's . You see , I love Italian Horror movies in general , that is, anything from the 50's to today , but this movie really got my attention and I really liked it .

I awarded this presentation 4 stars. They are all for the script, which has been butchered beyond recognition in places. What can possibly be said? They took one of the finest plays written in the last century and methodically robbed it of its heart, humor and humanity. I don't really blame the actors, who are probably doing their best with shoddy direction and incomplete characters (because the very complete characters of the stage version have had their insides -- and insights -- ripped out). I do very much blame the director, who seems to strain to find ways to undermine the script.

This movie clearly has an agenda, which could be summed up like this: Never, never cross the border (either physical or metaphorical). Let's shun everything that's on the other side with a wall or a fence or something else, let's pretend all "gringos" are evil, satanic, or drug dealers. All that is outside one's country's border (and specially US borders) is dangerous, malevolent and people there will hate you, or envy you or try to steal you or something else.

This movie takes the psychological thriller to new depths. Well written by Shane Black, the film is executed phenomenally by the cast under the watchful eye of Director Jack Swanstrom. Clearly, Swanstrom is a director that we should look out for in the future. His strength lies in his adaptation of personal experiences both on screen and in the classroom.This thought-provoking film is a must see for anyone who can appreciate action, drama, suspense, and mystery. As with all good films, the viewer goes on a journey of their own to find their individual interpretation of the movie.

While my kids enjoyed the movie ( and announced afterward that they want to buy it later ) I think it might not have had the impact on them that it could have had on someone who has not been exposed to it before. For instance, I think I would have taken to the movie more enthusiastically had I heard it all the way through as an adult, since it deals so directly with my experiences in the first world. It could have had a huge impact on me and my perspective on my own life, not just my life as a dad.

Well , I 've just seen Buster Keaton 's film debut in Fatty Arbuckle 's The Butcher Boy and-despite the fact that it is one of my favorite movies , I am struggling to explain to my family and friends how I can say it is the best film I have ever seen in my life . What do you do when the movie you love comes out , especially a silent film , and you don't understand what is happening on the screen ? Here are some of the words and phrases you can use when speaking about silent film at a dinner party.

Peter Strauss, by nature of appearing in mini-series and made-for-TV films, often gets an unfairly high proportion of bad reviews - Usually from casual observers who saw ten minutes of the film, having channel-hopped into it half-way through. Well, I've just read all the other 20 reviews for this film and am delighted to see not a single bad word said about The Jericho Mile - That should be enough to have you blasting out to buy this film! !Peter Strauss won an Emmy for his role in this film and watching it even once will show you why he deserved it so much....

The VHS cover for The Evil Below makes it look like a cool underwater horror flick . Sadly it 's more of a horror spoof and not actually scary as the title implies . The movie follows a high school history teacher who is convinced that he has been abducted by the " evil beneath the surface ." But he soon finds out that he has been living under an underwater volcano . The movie was directed by David Fincher who also directed the hit film Fight Club . This movie is pretty much like a combination of those two films , but a little less dark .

Now before I tell you the synopsis this is a non-spoiler review . Bone Eater hits its mark for being one of the best books I have ever read. You would have to read it yourself to see what it can do. I just finished it for the first time this morning and I cannot express how much I enjoyed this story. If you haven't read this, then you need to give it a try. I don't know about you, but I can't put it down. If you like horror, then you will truly enjoy this book and you'll want to read it again.

`` Escape from Hell '' is not made with enough artistry to disguise what it is : crass exploitation . the story itself is not terrible . the only bad thing is that some of the characters are rather stereotyped and predictable . if the movie is as bad as some of the criticism states , i can see that there would be some criticism . this movie does have one redeeming quality , and it's one of its greatest strengths : the acting . and that brings me to a new topic , the acting . here's the problem : it's terrible , and i've noticed it for a while .

The Bridge At Remagen contains some of the most preposterous war time screenplay I've ever seen. Aside from the acting, which is wooden, no tank commander attacks with his tanks parked in nice neat rows, up the middle of roads, and with troops bunched all together with their arms not at the ready. The constant suicidal behavior set off my "tilt switch" so often I found it impossible to enjoy the movie. Apparently the screen writers and director have never been through actual warfare and never bothered to bring in an expert who had.

The Toxic Avenger... The idea of this movie is that a person that the common population would call this person a looser and then after being thrown into a barrel of toxic waste, mutated into a superhero that is completely disfigured sounded OK even for 1985. This movie is listed as a horror... I even have read of a cult following with this series.... Now this movie even given when it was made was so bad that I couldn't stop watching... the acting is horrible even for an independent film that I think was to be the horror part of this movie...drug dealing, sumo, Godzilla entrance....

The producers of this picture are Hungarians. It's not by crazy artistic momentum that X and Z are capitalized in the titles considering that the word 'isten' means 'god' in Hungarian. - By the way, David, Isten is the word for God in Hungarian... - Hum... Is that so ? Let's consider this movie as 'A History Of Violence' science-fictional sibling. Both films have in common the strength of blowing up respective genres ; thriller and drama in the 2005 one and 'none FX-ed as hell' science fiction in the one we're looking at right now.

After some quite OK Dutch action flicks, like Lek and Van God Los, Gerrard Verhage wants to make a movie about the life of a Dutch mobster. Well, mobster is a big word for Klaas Bruinsma. He isn't a real international big guy like George Jung (Blow) or Pablo Escobar. He is just an Amsterdam lowlife who made some money by selling soft-drugs. Things are often blown up in the Netherlands, and this movie is just an other example. But even then, the movie could be very nice if the story was okay told.

Larry Bishop , the Writer/Actor/Director , focuses too heavily on the camera , music , and visuals . The film is in no way autobiographical , yet it feels more like an artistic tribute than any other work I’ve ever seen. The film has a dreamlike quality to it, one that I’ve rarely heard other films attempt. There are many reasons that I enjoyed the film , most of which are very personal. I had a difficult childhood which I’m very close to sharing with my characters. My father was very protective of my family , and he was not happy when I left home.

First of all , the entire script is mostly improv , adding to the fantastic illusion that what we are seeing on screen has a real story behind it...

And it is one of the most hilarious films ever made, that’s what really makes it so amazing. This is one of those movies that will bring tears to your eyes, and also make you laugh until you feel like crying. You’ll laugh till you’re about to pee your pants, just because you can't help yourself from laughing. It’s funny , and it makes me laugh like a madman.

With actors like Depardieu and Richard it is really a hard task to make a dull movie. But Weber is a master in setting a slow pace and making supposedly funny scenes without any wits and depth. This movie is high on story but low on character. You never get to know any of the characters except for superficial slapstick. Unfortunately Weber has no idea what slapstick is all about. His style could be described at hit and miss. Of course some people laugh when they see someone slip on a banana peel. Weber directs his humor at this lot.

Somehow , I really thought that I was going to enjoy this film because I love pictures with mountain climbing scenes , and I am a huge fan of climbing movies ( which are mostly about the mountains , I have to say ! ) I was wrong. For some reason , I just didn’t want to go on this trip, even the first time. I had no idea what was happening, I had no clue what I would be looking at, and that’s the way I want to feel when going on trips with my family.

With the war not going well for the Soviet Union, Stalin accepted volunteers from the prisons and used the prisoners as shock troops. This is the story of one such battalion. There are petty crooks, political prisoners, soldiers kicked out of other units, gray-haired veterans of the White Army plus some dangerous criminals.They are thrown into battle ill-equipped, untrained and face the threat of the NKVD if they show signs of cowardice or failure.The special effects are rudimentary and many of the minor characters are one-dimensional, but the overall story is very human and riveting.I have not seen a version with subtitles or dubbing.

... '' Flight of the Living Dead '' sports production values that belie the substandard script from director Scott ``Zombie'' Zarnick, and the film feels like a cheap, throwaway imitation of Romero’s film ''Dawn of the Dead,'' which it bears some resemblance to. But it’s got enough of a sense of style that the film can’t completely fall apart in the editing, and the acting is good. But it does fall flat in some areas of execution, such as the way the zombie scenes are staged.

This is an excellent documentary about a story I had n't heard about before . The first solo , non-stop flight in history by a man without wings , it is also the first man without arms or legs to fly. The film tells a story that few people know or remember, and I am sure the many people who have seen the film will tell you of how the story should have ended. I am not one of the people who know this story and I am very glad I got to see the film.

What is this!! its so bad. The animation looks so terrible , it looks like a ps1 type game. The actors are awful, they just cannot act to save their lives. I sat through all of this film an then at the end I was annoyed when I realised I had wasted 3 hours of my life. I've not heard of this film, did it ever actually come out in the cinema or did it go straight to DVD? A girl got shot?! What is up with that, it was just a stupid film.

Rififi is a great film that is overlooked . It 's a crime drama where a man gets out of prison after being falsely convicted for killing a drug dealer. He has a young son that he lost to a drug dealer. In doing so, he leaves his family for good. In his search for revenge he finds his way into a new life. This is one of the better films of the genre. The acting by all the main actors are top notch and there are so many things going on. There is one thing that sticks out the most from Rififi and this is that it 's the soundtrack.

Aside from the fact that this movie was filmed mostly in Rockport MA , which is a beautiful town where it seems like everyone knows your name…

The first time I heard of the “Rockport Massacre”, I thought that I’d misheard a phrase I’d heard. I thought it was just a name that was mentioned in a movie, or a song. However, I later found out that it was a real-life crime that occurred in Rockport. It’s also worth noting that Rockport was a “crime-free” town. I was shocked but not surprised.

I am 17 , and a biased Muppet fan , and while I love Treasure Island , Christmas Carol and Peter and the Starcatcher , I don't think I have ever liked The Muppet Movie in the way I do the Muppet Christmas Carol, or even the Muppet Show . So I was really glad to hear that this Muppet Christmas Carol has a Muppets spin off . I don't know why, but it's something of an oddity in the Muppet world, since they usually have their own spin off, their own movie , their own comic , or at least their own book .

The final part of Kieslowski 's trilogy based on the colors of the French flag finds the director at peace, in love and at work. This time he looks at France, where he was born and brought up in the small town of Grenthe, outside of Paris. He also works for a while at a company called H.U.N.T.R.I.M., where he is, as he says in the film, "a bit of a cowboy." As he walks in the early morning hours along the boulevard of his childhood, we see him from the side and he stops at the spot where he grew up.

Despite the all-star cast, this attempt at epic fails. It comes across as a set of flat cartoon stereotypes strung together by an all too, too clever social commentary. It's as if with every bit of dialogue and introduction to a new character the writer peeks out and says "Isn't that clever? Am I not smart? Isn't that biting social commentary?" And,sadly, the answer is always "Ummmm...no." Wearying self-absorbing stuff that is more like soap opera (in the worst sense of the term) than a movie...and an obvious attempt at television immortality.

Disney-like entertainment with some un-Disney-like moments of graphic violence and sexual references. Lousy comedy alongside cliché-ridden moralizing. Noah as Abraham, Lot as his wicked buddy. Laughable special effects. Overdone acting with bad timing. Sodom and Gommorah were destroyed before the Flood? Strange twists and too many sub-plots the Bible doesn't mention. God as a doubting father who just needs to be entertained by whistling before deciding the world has to be saved from disaster.B-movie wannabee director John Irvin adds another failure to his worthless list of poorly-directed movies that seriously lack plot and direction.

I saw this movie when I was very young living in Houston, Texas. I really enjoyed this movie, and I wrote to Jean Peters in Hollywood, and I told her how much I enjoyed seeing her in this movie. She sent me an autographed photo. This movie was directed by Jacques Tourneur, and besides Jean Peters in the starring role. It also stars Louis Jourdan, Debra Paget, and Herbert Marshall. It was released in 1951 in color and is 81 minutes long. Jean Peters was married to Howard Hughes.

I have read and enjoyed many of James Lee Burke 's Robicheaux mysteries . When I read 'In The Electric Room' the other day I wondered why the main character was such a bad person . I decided that it would have been better to have had him have a character trait that was much worse . I decided to look up some information on 's character, and saw that he was a former boxer. I had never known this fact when I first started reading 's books , but as I read through them it became obvious . He was also a member of the Communist party.

Van damme has done some great films over the years and this one hits a big ten in my books. From the setting of Mexico to the five star fight scenes, this movie was amazing. The film is all about border patrol officers protecting there territory which is the border of Mexico. Ex navy seals are smuggling drugs out of Mexico into the united states of America (USA), Van damme and Scott Atkins give stunning performances as the cop and the villain. Although this film wasn't as good as until death but it still gave the action,acting and the film a five star look.

I just watched the DVD of this award winning film . One Life Stand is a stark drama that through the words of a simple young boy , has given hope to the world . I strongly believe this is the story of the power of a life to change a life . I think it's very true to say I've had the power to change so many lives . The way you look at your life is what makes it so hard and what makes it so easy , this is a great quote by Dr Wayne Dyer and I believe this is what makes the world a very hard place .

First I must confess that A Separate Peace is my favorite book. So of course, I have some bias against any attempt at adapting it for a feature film or television movie. But as I began to watch this film, I was more than willing to give it the benefit of the doubt. The original version from the early 1970s, though shot at Phillips Exeter Academy where the book's author attended school, and though it stayed as faithful as it could to the book, lacked any real depth of feeling and failed to capture the essence of the characters.

Sam O'Steen, the film editor on the superlative suspense flick "Rosemary's Baby" from 1968, here directs a quickie TV-made sequel, one in which Rosemary Woodhouse (Patty Duke Astin, in for Mia Farrow) is shunted off early--and inexplicably--presumably to help flesh out the more ghoulish aspects of this flaccid story about Satan's son on Earth. Most interesting is the return of Ruth Gordon to her Oscar-winning role as Minnie Castevet (with Ray Milland well-cast as her husband, Roman), but she isn't given much to do--and looks terribly uncomfortable at being involved anyway.

After an undercover mission in Bucharest to disclose an international gang of weapon dealers, the agent Sonni Griffith (Wesley Snipes) is assigned to protect the Romanian Nadia Kaminski (Silvia Colloca), the widow of an accountant of the Romanian Mafia. However, the CIA safe house is broken in by the criminals, and Sonni realizes that the information was leaked from inside the Agency. Alone, trusting only in his friend Michael Shepard (William Hope), Sonni fights to survive and protect Nadia.The career of Wesley Snipes is downhill.

I have to hold my hand up and say that I was one of the first (and probably the last!!!) to see this film. Where do I start, it's a complete mess. The main attraction of course was the soundtrack. Which goes without saying is brilliant - it's what Himesh does best. But as they say, don't give up your day job - HR definitely shouldn't.HR's acting is plain and simply awful. Even if the film had a plot, the thing that baffles you most is why this man is up on screen and what the hell is doing there.

Such pain! Pain in the shape that it had promise in its central idea, but it never fully recognised it and goes on to blow a lot sand in your face. I wouldn't say this straight-to-video South African/Canadian/UK horror flick is awful, but its just too bland, predictable and there's just very little memorable about it. It's a guarantee you'll forget it, not too long after watching it. I tried watching it last night, but had to finish it during the morning, as I couldn't keep my eyes open.

Down at the Movie Gallery, I saw a flick I just had to see. It looked like a fun low-budget horror/action/western that I could get into. Yeah, I knew it would suck, but I rented it anyway hoping for laughs. Only a few laughs were to be found. This was an extremely stupid movie. It begins with a bounty hunter, our protagonist, who is possibly the weakest main character in the history of film. He looks/acts like he could take on Chuck Norris, but he can't. His dialogue sucks too.

The appeal of this film has to be the artsy Euro style , because there 's absolutely no substance . the film takes place in the mid 1980s and is set in a hospital , where two people are brought in by a woman who is having an affair with the husband . then , after the first patient dies , it is revealed that the husband is actually the second patient and he is going to kill them . this is the plot and you're just left wondering how a couple of people can get so messed up . well , you just have to watch it and see .

Incredibly, "Vampire Assassin" is significantly worse than such atrocities as "Tequila Body Shots" and "Zombie Nation" - and those movies are TERRIBLE. Writer/director/star Ron Hall is devoid of both charisma and acting ability, and is also clearly incapable of the most basic directorial concepts. Possibly the worst camera-work, editing, lighting, sound, visual effects, music and fight choreography I have ever seen in a movie. Rarely do two shots cut together, nor can you see much in the beyond-dim lighting. The terrible dialogue is spoken extremely slowly by a supremely untalented cast, stretching the movie to a near-deadly 87 minutes.

An enjoyable movie, without a doubt, and very evocative of both its era and that very particular stage in any boy's 'rites of passage'. But I have to say that having read the very positive comments here, I was a bit disappointed. The period was captured, but the plot was desperately thin. The whole thing revolves around the most egregious bit of miscasting in the history of school plays. The idea that quack quack would ever be chosen to play not only one of only three star turns, but a philanderer, is risible. And without that, nada.

Really ? Is this necessary ? How can somebody make such a film ? Disgusting ! ! ! Seteven Seagal's "The Patriot" had a similar plot line where the plot was about a group of soldiers fighting against a group of terrorists who had killed their own brother to become a god in their religion.The soldiers had to fight this god to defend the country against terrorists. But then there is another group of soldiers fighting against these terrorists. And the third group of soldiers who are also fighting the terrorist's god is also against a terrorist group but in the same way.

I'm not a big musical fan, but this is one of the few I really love. Unlike many other musicals, such as "The Sound of Music," none of the songs are about gratuitous stuff. Each song is social commentary, acumen on war, sexuality, recalcitrance, spirituality, and freedom. Especially amazing songs are "Easy To Be Hard," "Age of Aquarius," "Hair," "Flesh Failures/3-5-0-0," "Walking In Space," and "Hare Krishna." Totally revolutionary and wonderful. I can't wait to someday see it live!

This was a very good PPV, but like Wrestlemania XX some 14 years later, the WWE crammed so many matches on it, some of the matches were useless. I'm not going to go through every match on the card because it would take forever to do.However major highlights included the HUGE pop for Demolition winning the tag team belts from Haku and Andre the Giant, The first ever mixed tag match featuring Randy Savage and Sensational Queen Sherri vs Dusty Rhodes and the late Sapphire and the first ever clash between The Ultimate Warrior and Hulk Hogan.Some matches were a complete waste of time.

If a copy of this movie fell into the wrong hands , the world would be in grave danger . . . Now, I don’t think this movie really is that bad. It’s certainly not a bad movie. I saw it on Netflix last night, after spending the weekend watching a lot of movies, and I’ve never been more proud of myself as a film buff than I was watching The Dark Tower. I’m not really a fan of horror movies, which is strange because they are the best genre on the planet.

Mount Godwin-Austin ( otherwise known as K2 ) is the world 's second highest mountain , and if the evidence is to be believed it also the highest. It is the highest of the British Isles and the highest mountain in Europe outside of Norway . The mountain is located on the Isle of Man. The summit is accessible on foot through a route that is relatively easy, although the ascent requires very good weather and a bit of luck . The climb is the most popular day-hike in Scotland. The mountain is a popular destination for hikers who like to camp, and there are many well-equipped, self-catering camp sites.

This is such a fun and funny movie. Highly entertaining at all angles. It features an outlandish array of memorable, psychotic but lovable nuts. We got; the judge, the Sargent, the kid, the creepy old lady, the slut, the clown. And unfortunately they all live in a big house that doesn't have any locks and is understaffed. So for our enjoyment we get to see them run around, play games, and be dangerous. We also learn a lesson along the way... never give your patient an ax! This was before Cukkos Nest, AND surpasses it.

This for one has nothing to do with the absolutely fantastic first flick . And of course us Americans just love our cowboy heroes, right? Well, the point is, I don't even know where to start. And I can't find a link to a trailer on youtube. And I've seen the first movie (the first I've ever seen, mind you) twice. And the movie I saw with my family, was one I've never seen. And yes, we loved it. My brother and I even cried during the movie.

I'D BUY THAT FOR A DOLLAR!! !I did buy this film for a dollar and I've seen much worse for much more! !This is a Scottish sci-fi film from Mark Stirton and according to the Making of (hysterical by the way) the production only cost $8000. Eight grand!!! That wouldn't pay for half a minute in Hollywood!! Nevertheless ---- This is top fun film making. If you like things gritty then you're in for a treat. These are some rough character with rough voices and harsh swearing.

The most obvious flaw...horrible, horrible script. This movie had a potentially good story, but it was ruined with bad dialogue, continuity problems, things that were never explained, gaping plotholes, sub-plots that went nowhere, and just plain stupidity. Not to mention the awful, cliched directing of Sandra Locke. Not even two great performances could've saved this movie. So it didn't matter that Devon Gummersall and Rosanna Arquette give horrific performances. The thing is, they're better actors than this movie would have you believe.

Frank Falenczyk: It isn't that I'm sorry I killed them; it's that I'm sorry I killed them badly.Wow! Talk about a swing and a miss. You have a great cast and a great plot with endless possibilties...how do you f_ck that up?! Well, apparently John Dahl has found a way. With an atrocious screenplay featuring jokes about as funny as a malaria epidemic and dialogue so painfully dry it makes none of the characters likable, 'You Kill Me' might be the biggest cinematic failure of 2007.

This movie looked like it was rushed to release for some reason . Definitely not a well made movie . I would not buy this to watch it if i had to buy it . The plot was okay , but there were times where it got to a point where you would want to quit . There are no good parts of the movie. I would give it a 0/10, but would not recommend it if you like bad movies . I did enjoy the movie because the story was very good and I thought it was pretty good .

I do n't care what anyone says , this movie is hilarious ! It combines the bleak seriousness of Threads, with the irreverence of Zardoz , and then mixes them with an amazing musical score that will have you and your friends jumping up and down laughing. The acting and directing is superb ! I can't praise this film enough ! One of the greatest films out there ! It will be my favorite from this year. The movie is so good that I don't know how they managed to screw it up. It is the first time I felt I had heard a movie soundtrack by the movie itself.

Yumiko (Wakana Sakai), the pretty adopted daughter of a recently-deceased Japanese businessman, inherits control of her father's company; her uncle Kazuo (Shun Sugata), miffed that he wasn't left the business to run, orders a hit on his niece. When jug-eared chef Kensuke (Takashi Okamura) enters the wrong hotel room by mistake and knocks out hit-man Invincible (Jung Yuen), he is mistaken for the killer and sent to kill Yumiko. Instead, he falls for the pretty heiress and ends up vowing to protect her.

This movie was made on a relatively small budget ( 10-20 million dollars ? ) with almost no promotion at all. That is a pity, since the plot and acting are excellent. The plot of the film revolves around a girl who gets married to an actor and has to look after her husband after he has to leave to film some scenes for a new movie. This is an interesting film and worth a watch if you like romantic comedy films. The acting is not perfect by any means, especially in the lead roles , but it's still good to watch it.

Computer savvy John Light (as John Elias) goes from Stanford drop-out to successful young Dotcom-era tycoon. But, Mr. Light's sneering success could be short-lived, with partners like ambitious Jeffrey Donovan (as Robert Jennings). Mr. Donovan used to bed down with Light's girlfriend, Megan Dodds (as Lisa Forrester). Donovan wants Light to know that binge drinking and casual sex don't have to end in college. After reading a naughty Internet sex session, Ms. Dodds shines Light on. He may lose is "Digital Dreams" Internet empire, too!

I just watched this, an early Harold Lloyd short film that featured his "glasses" character on Kino Video's DVD of "The Harold Lloyd Collection". He's actually a con man with Snub Pollard as his partner who gets discovered by Bebe Daniels who herself performs fake séances. What she discovers is that Lloyd and Pollard bilk many customers by dropping fake rings that are "lost". I'll stop there and just say this was quite funny especially when Harold and Snub enter the place Bebe works and encounter some creepy contraptions and put on costumes like Snub trying one of Bebe's outfits.

*****Spoiler or two, not that is matters******Two things stand out about this movie. First is it's been titled both "Bruno" and "The Dress Code," and if you've seen this movie you'll catch the irony in that.Second is it's addressing issues completely off the wall. The adventures of a grade school cross dresser isn't something that there was a crying need for a movie about, nor a topic that I think most people would be interested in.

Everybody seems to compare this to The Matrix and The 13th Floor, and when I first saw it I would have agreed -- I was expecting The Matrix and was a little disappointed. But upon repeated viewings my respect for this movie has grown immensely.The thing to keep in mind is that The Matrix is a great action movie with some philosophical mumbo-jumbo thrown in. The 13th Floor is a passable action movie with some slightly more interesting philosophical mumbo-jumbo thrown in. Existenz is not an action movie at all, and is not (as many seem to believe) about "reality" or any such "deep" concept.

I went to see this movie to kill some time. I remember Cole Hauser in "Tigerland", and although his acting is wooden, he does portray a tough "leader" character. Same here. This movie was about a bunch of young, hot scientists and divers exploring a cave in Romania that one has to dive to see. The beginning scene was very interesting, with a bunch of Romanian or Russian men exploring the cave in search of booty. Flash forward 30 years, and we have a team of divers called in by some scientist and his crew to explore some cave for some unknown scientific purpose.

Sorry about that . But if you have seen this `` epic '' , you will obviously know of the great work that my team and myself have been involved in building over the years. As well as a huge variety of different characters from the world of MMO's, I am very proud to have worked with the wonderful people at CCP and CCP Studios to have made a game that is as diverse as the world that they live in today . I would like to take this time and thank everyone, both past and present, for making this game a reality and allowing me to make my dreams come true .

There were nice characters in here, played by pleasant-looking actors and actresses, plus it had a famous band and some famous dancers.....yet the film just didn't work. By the time this was almost over, I was bored to death. The dialog was dumb, the humor (mainly Milton Berle's) was downright stupid and the music was just not up my alley.I've never been a big-band fan, anyway, and if I hear "In The Mood" one more time I'll puke.This was my first look at famous skater-actor Sonja Henie and I have no complaints about her.

Who really wants to see that ? Disgusting violence , disgusting sex , for such a long time . I hate that . I mean that . And you know why ? It is because the people in that film , the people in that movie did it all with the eyes closed and they were dreaming of it all in their eyes , when they had it . It was like they made that film with a dream and they were looking for that movie in the movie theater or in their bed room or wherever that movie was playing .

I found this movie to be a big disappointment , especially considering the cast . The characters are not believable , and the plot is predictable . This movie is not the type of movie that you can simply sit and enjoy while you watch . It is not a film that will take your breath away , but it does provide enough thrills so that you won’t be able to put it down . This movie is more like a horror film , which can’t be avoided . I really wanted to like this movie , but I just didn’t .

This is another Alien imitation and not a very good one at that.Replace outer space with the South African desert,throw in the same ingredients,a group of people stranded in an inhospitable landscape, have them hunted down by an alien creature and you have the same old story of a very ordinary film trying to ape a classic film. A group of miners and scientists go on a hunt for some missing colleagues and find their bones in the desert stripped clean of flesh.Their vehicle breaks down and they head for civilisation while being stalked by the monster.

Warner Brothers produced this 3D extravaganza that was the biggest commercial success for westerns in 1953. Guy Madison leads a band of guardhouse soldiers and misfits to rescue two white women being held by Indians, which essentially all there is to this film. The 3D format was in its early stages as a Hollywood gimmick to compete with the growing popularity of home television, and the effects work very well here. The rescuers make off with the ladies and are pursued by the Indians until the white men make their stand at an island in a creek bed.

Wow, Stella Shorts are great! Lots of patrons from The State and Stella, the TV show. I never knew that Stella could have gotten any better then they were on the TV show Stella or even Comedy Central Presents: Stella. I also never knew short comedies could be any good. My favorite ones were Pizza, Racking Leaves, The Woods and David arranges to a meeting with his long lost cousin Greg. I think over all that David was the funniest one. Its funny when he doesn't make sense. I like the music in the shorts.

The interaction between Portman and Sarandon was quite interesting, and I was really sold on the mother-daughter relationship. It is a family story that isn't dulled down by frills and special effects; a story of how it really is. I couldn't help but give of a sigh at the end of this movie for alas it is a well told bittersweet tale of growing up and relating with family and friends. The acting was quite exquisite and I hope we'll be seeing both Portman and Sarandon in familiar roles down the road...

Barely came trough the whole movie ... Acting is bad , dialogs are even worse . Felt kinda st00pid 4 it . I know it wasnt the best movie but I still enjoyed it , I thought it would be interesting and fun but the acting was not in any way great , the dialogs are horrible and there is no chemistry at all between the characters , also I really didn't like the main character , he was really boring to me and I wasn't in it for at least 5 hours . I would have given it 4/5 . There's nothing special about the plot or the direction of this film.
